english_text: a man’s enemies will be the members of his own household.’

ibani_text: Amịna daa anịgha amịna nyingiḅọ ḅẹlẹma i nẹngịḅọ, n ḅo ḅụgbẹ́gha ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ sọọ, amịna owitụ́wọ tụwọ anịgha amịna ọrụḅọtụ́wọ ḅẹlẹma i nẹngịḅọ ine ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ sọbịgha.
english_text: “Anyone who loves their father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; anyone who loves their son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

ibani_text: Amịna mgbẹsẹ sị́ akị sị i duagha ḅọ, ine ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ sọbịgha.
english_text: Whoever does not take up their cross and follow me is not worthy of me.

ibani_text: Amịna duma warị dọghụapụ anị famabẹm kụ́ma amịna duma famapụ i sịbị go anị dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm.
english_text: Whoever finds their life will lose it, and whoever loses their life for my sake will find it.

ibani_text: Ọ dakóróma ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i dakórómam, pịghị i dakóróma ḅo fịnịfịnị Tamuno ma dakórómam.
english_text: “Anyone who welcomes you welcomes me, and anyone who welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me.

ibani_text: Ikiakoroḅọ dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ ikiakoroḅọ gosi, ikiakoroḅọ gbẹ́nyẹ nyánáḅobẹm, pịghị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ tumḅọ dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ tumḅọ gosi pịghị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ gbẹ́nyẹ nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: Whoever welcomes a prophet as a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward, and whoever welcomes a righteous person as a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ oḅuu mingi ọmọngọ pa mịná káláapụ ma pịrịbẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ gosi, a karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, n ḅọ gbẹ́nyẹ n ḅọ gbarịbịgha.
english_text: And if anyone gives even a cup of cold water to one of these little ones who is my disciple, truly I tell you, that person will certainly not lose their reward.”

ibani_text: Jizọs bịpị pa ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ pịrị fama sáá, ori anị ngaa saghị ḅọ́rọ́ muu nyẹ́diem pịghị oku ma dugho wásámáa Galili sẹ bie fịnị ama ama ḅụ.
english_text: After Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in the towns of Galilee.

ibani_text: Jọn ikóliwarịbie náa sáá Krais mịẹarịnyẹ, ori ọria ọḅụduaapụ fịrịmam sị
english_text: When John, who was in prison, heard about the deeds of the Messiah, he sent his disciples

ibani_text: nnị muu ọ gbíla, Ịrị anịị ḅoarịḅọ ma, anịgha wa tọ́rụ́ pa jụghọ dighi bẹ?
english_text: to ask him, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Pịghịma so muu dugho Jọn pịrị ọmịnị náa sị pịghị árịnyẹ:
english_text: Jesus replied,“Go back and report to John what you hear and see:

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ nna tọ́rụ́ nyẹ́ arịm, ikúléapụ saghị nwángịm, ḅụkọ-obii kọọapụ ori nnị gwọm, biripụuapụ biri nyẹ́ naam, fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghị duma bie sọm, n pịghị ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa igonyiapụ pịrịm.
english_text: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those who have leprosyare cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is proclaimed to the poor.

ibani_text: Nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị bieoḅubịghaḅọ i sịbị gosi.
english_text: Blessed is anyone who does not stumble on account of me.”

ibani_text: Jọn ọḅụduaapụ soarị sáá, Jizọs warị saghị Jọn gbolomanyẹ dugho túminị́ kpo ma pịrị: Elesiri ḅụ ọ pághá muu tẹ́ dighi? Ányị́nyá ḅẹ́lẹ̄, fọ́rụ́ ofuro n dama nyẹ?
english_text: As John’s disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John:“What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ anịgha sáá, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mú tẹ́ dighi? Anịị fíafía bịtẹ sua owitụ́wọ? Ọkọ fịnịgha, fíafía bịtẹ suaapụ ámányánáapụ wárị anịị ị nna árị bẹ ngaa.
english_text: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear fine clothes are in kings’ palaces.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọ pághá muu tẹ́ dighi? Ikiakoroḅọ? Innh, a dugho ọ pịrịm pịghị ikiakoroḅọ nẹngịḅọ.
english_text: Then what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

ibani_text: Jọn anị Tọ́ndiri ma o gbolomanyẹ gịẹ kórómaḅọ ma:  A ị́yẹ́ oku muḅọ fịrịmabẹm si ọ parị ḅoo, ori ị́yẹ́ asọ tẹ́lẹ́mabẹm.
english_text: This is the one about whom it is written: “ ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm: ẹ́rẹ́ yiiapụ mamgba ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ na pághá ḅogha sị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ nẹ́ngị; anịsọ sobie ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ ịrụḅaḅọ dụḅa Jọn nẹngịm.
english_text: Truly I tell you, among those born of women there has not risen anyone greater than John the Baptist; yet whoever is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

ibani_text: Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ saghị oku ma dugho wásáma sáá akị muu mị́sa ma láa, sobie ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma kụrọ ḅara pa yii kamaarị, tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánápụ ngéré anị ine anị bie sọarịapụ.
english_text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has been subjected to violence,and violent people have been raiding it.

ibani_text: Akị muu Jọn ḅoo sáá láa, ikiakoroapụ mamgba na Mosis ologho ma ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gbólómanyẹ dughom.
english_text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ nna oku ma minini dọghụ, Jọn anịị ḅo ḅẹ́ Elaija ma ọ dọghụḅọ ma ḅẹẹ o ḅoo.
english_text: And if you are willing to accept it, he is the Elijah who was to come.

ibani_text: Biri nyanaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ anị náa.
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅụọ sáapụ ma a tẹ́ pa nnị na tọ́ma bẹ? Nnị fẹ́siri kpọrọfịnị awọ kịkam sị n jẹ́ awọ sịarị,
english_text: “To what can I compare this generation? They are like children sitting in the marketplaces and calling out to others:

ibani_text: Wamịnị ẹ́rẹ́yáa akwa farị ọ pịrịmam sọ, o mini seghịgha; wa dụadipi núme suu ọ pịrịmam sọ o mini duadugha.
english_text: “ ‘We played the pipe for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not mourn.’

ibani_text: Jọn ḅom nyẹ́fịgha, nyẹ́ḅugha, n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ sitẹ́mẹ́ ọ ḅụ imi.
english_text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅom nyẹ́fịarị, nyẹ́ḅụarị, n warị pịghị ḅẹẹ, Mịnga anịị opu furo fịḅo na pịghị iru ḅuu tọ́rụ́ ḅa ḅo. So ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii daapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ nangwọ. Kụ́ma Tamuno níminyẹ anị ḅụ diem ḅẹ́ anị karakáram anị nwángịarị fịrị gosi.
english_text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners.’ But wisdom is proved right by her deeds.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị ama mamgba dughosima tegó n mini sii ḅụ pịghịgha.
english_text: Then Jesus began to denounce the towns in which most of his miracles had been performed, because they did not repent.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹ́, Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm Korasin! Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm Bẹtịsaida! Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna bie nnị nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nnị anị nwángịm Taya na Sidọn ḅụ, nnị ḅọlọmaa sáá ḅụ sii ḅụ pịghịmam akpa bịtẹ sua sị fọọ pa nna sịbị sara.
english_text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ a dugho ọ pịrịm Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná Taya na Sidọn pịrị ọ nẹ́ngịbẹm ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

ibani_text: Pịghị ịrị Kapanọm nnị ị dighi sóghóloma muu so láa bẹ? Ọkọ fịnịgha, ị téré kóró ẹ́kpẹ́duaama muubẹm. Ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ị bie nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nnị anị nwángịm Sodom ḅụ, Sodom mị́sa sọ pa imibẹm.
english_text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to the heavens? No, you will go down to Hades.For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụrụụ́ nyáná Sodom pịrị ọ nẹ́ngịbẹm ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: But I tell you that it will be more bearable for Sodom on the day of judgment than for you.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Jizọs ḅẹm, A ị túminim, so na kiri na tẹ́mẹ́ Daḅọ, tegó ị mịnanyẹ ma pa nyẹ́nimiapụ na diridawọapụ ḅoghumamam, sị anị pa dọghụdọghụ awọ diemam.
english_text: At that time Jesus said,“I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children.

ibani_text: Innh Daḅọ, mịị anị ị ḅụ́ḅẹlẹḅara.
english_text: Yes, Father, for this is what you were pleased to do.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i Daá ma saghị i ḅarabie suamam. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so Tụwọ ma nimigha Daḅọ ma sima, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ Daḅọ ma nimigha Tụwọ ma sima na pịghị Tụwọ ma biiapụ sị Daḅọ ma pa n die.
english_text: “All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị i damaḅo ọmịnị ịnyọ faá sị pịghị nyẹ́ pụ́nụ́maapụ a pịghị ịnyọ́sárá pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.

ibani_text: Iyẹ kọ́ngọ sua sị ma sua, sị i ḅara nyẹ dáwọ, ḅẹẹ a diin pịghị ḅụ sitéréma tẹ́mẹ́ nyánam, ọ pịghị ịnyọ́sárá nyáná ḅo ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ iyẹ kọ́ngọ sua sị ḅụdaghaa, iyẹ dighinyẹ sọ sárásárám.
english_text: For my yoke is easy and my burden is light.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, Jizọs sịmgbọ́lụ dua ma ḅụ nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị Juuapụ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ. Fị́nyẹ ori ọḅụduaapụ tárịm, nnị warị saghị witi, ọrọsị kịka sịmgbọlụ kiẹnị sị tẹ́ndẹ fịị.
english_text: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry and began to pick some heads of grain and eat them.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma mịma árị sáá, nnị ọ ḅẹm, Dighi ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ nnị ólóghó ma na kuragha nyẹ mịẹarị Juuapụ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, “Look! Your disciples are doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Ori n pagharam, Na ọ gogha Deviti mịẹnyẹ ori na oria túminị́, fị́nyẹ ọ tarị sáá?
english_text: He answered,“Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno warị ma sọm ori na oria túminị́ sị tọ́n ḅụ fịnị fịtúrú ma fịị, ólóghó na karakáragha nyẹ sị n mịẹ, kụ́ma igwagwaapụ ma ngéré.
english_text: He entered the house of God, and he and his companions ate the consecrated bread—which was not lawful for them to do, but only for the priests.

ibani_text: Na ọ gogha ólóghó diri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Juu Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịrịnwangịarịapụ ine Ịnyọ́sárá Éne ólóghó ma kaabẹm anịsọ nnị ólóghó kórógha?
english_text: Or haven’t you read in the Law that the priests on Sabbath duty in the temple desecrate the Sabbath and yet are innocent?

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ mịnga dụḅa Tamunoopuwarị ma nẹngịḅọ imim.
english_text: I tell you that something greater than the temple is here.

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹkórómam Tọ́ndiri ma bie, Tamuno dugho angaá ḅẹẹ, A tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ bim, igwagwaghaa. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mịná dughonyẹ ma akanyaḅo ólóghó kóróghapụ ọ mịnị n ḅadumgha.
english_text: If you had known what these words mean, ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice,’you would not have condemned the innocent.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ori anịị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma Nyánáḅọ.
english_text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Anị ngaa saghị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ nna Juu kobiri yọ ma sọm,
english_text: Going on from that place, he went into their synagogue,

ibani_text: anị ngaa ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ikúléḅọ arịm. Juuapụ ma asọ dọghụarị nnị pa ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị gbánā bẹ ḅara, n warị o gbíla, Anị karakárá ḅẹẹ nnị kị́nị́ gwọọ Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: and a man with a shriveled hand was there. Looking for a reason to bring charges against Jesus, they asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna bie ánáná nyánáḅọ imii, ánáná ma warị sóghóró póghóló kiribie sọ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ, ọ ḅara sụụma anị ku pághámaḅobịgha?
english_text: He said to them,“If any of you has a sheep and it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will you not take hold of it and lift it out?

ibani_text: Tumḅọ, n ḅọ nyẹ́laa ánáná nẹngịgha? Anịgosi anị ólóghó na kuram ḅẹẹ tumḅọ ibinyẹ mịẹ Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: How much more valuable is a person than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, I ḅara sụụma. Ọ warị anị sụụma, ọ warị árị ḅẹẹ anị káara ḅara pa gwọmam, isi nganyẹ ma fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Then he said to the man,“Stretch out your hand.”So he stretched it out and it was completely restored, just as sound as the other.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Farisiiapụ pághá nụ́ngọ múm sị muu bia n ḅara warị Jizọs ḅáa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: But the Pharisees went out and plotted how they might kill Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs nna sii kóróma nimi ḅoo sáá, ọ warị ọ ḅụ si akị anị ngaa ma ḅụ. Tọghaapụ ọ duam, ọ warị pịghị nna obiapụ mamgba gwọfama,
english_text: Aware of this, Jesus withdrew from that place. A large crowd followed him, and he healed all who were ill.

ibani_text: n biri nụ́nụ́arị ḅẹẹ n dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma ḅẹ́ ori anịị nwọfịnịḅọ.
english_text: He warned them not to tell others about him.

ibani_text: Mịma anị mịẹnyẹ sị ikiakoro Aizaya dughonyẹ ma ḅoo karakárányẹ sọ:
english_text: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

ibani_text: Mịị ngaa anịị iyẹ fịrịnwangịḅọ a sẹ́lẹ́akịmáaḅọ, a ḅẹlẹma ḅo, a ọ dighi bieḅẹlẹm; a i Tẹ́mẹ́ pa ọ ḅụ suabẹm ọ pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ dugho wásámabẹm sẹ sẹ sẹ ḅụ.
english_text: “Here is my servant whom I have chosen, the one I love, in whom I delight; I will put my Spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.

ibani_text: Ọ kam kóróbịgha anịgha owu pághámá; gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ọ pụghọ naabịgha asọogbo.
english_text: He will not quarrel or cry out; no one will hear his voice in the streets.

ibani_text: Ọ penge ányị́nyá ḅẹ́lẹ̄ anyịmabịghaa anịgha ḅidụmaarị tọndọ bima, ọ ḅụọ kụ́rọ́mabẹm kiriakị muu ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ngámángba láa sáá láa.
english_text: A bruised reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out, till he has brought justice through to victory.

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ anịị sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā bẹnyẹ.
english_text: In his name the nations will put their hope.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa nnị warị tọ́rụ́pụụ́ pịghị oḅuu ọlọ sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnịḅọ pa ọ damaḅo, Jizọs warị ọ gwọọ, ọ warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pịghị nyẹ arịị.
english_text: Then they brought him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute, and Jesus healed him, so that he could both talk and see.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma anị n ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépumam Jizọs nwángị fịrị ma ḅụ, warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị ḅọ ma ọ sị ḅẹẹ ori Deviti Tụwọ?
english_text: All the people were astonished and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Farisiiapụ ma mịma náa sáá, n dughom ḅẹẹ, Bẹlizibọlụ sitẹ́mẹ́ sịbịdáḅọ kụrọ ngéré ḅụ anịị ọ pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị nyẹ.
english_text: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul, the prince of demons, that this fellow drives out demons.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nna kóróma nimim warị n ḅẹẹ, Amịna ḅụ die ogbo ogbo pịrị ásẹ́mẹ́kiri gulugulubẹm pịghị amịna ḅụ die ogbo ogbo pịrị opu ama anịgha ḅurusuapụ ine sẹbịgha.
english_text: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them,“Every kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Satanị, Satanị deesiarị ori ọḅụ die ogbo ogbo pịrịmam, ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiri tọ́rọ́ pa sẹ́ bẹ?
english_text: If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then can his kingdom stand?

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ Bẹlizibọlụ kụrọ pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị, ọmịna túminị́ n tẹ́ kụrọ pa sitẹ́mẹ́ ma deesi? Anịgo nnị ọmịna ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ dighibẹm.
english_text: And if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your people drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.

ibani_text: Kụma a ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesi, anịsáa Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ọ dámáḅómam.
english_text: But if it is by the Spirit of God that I drive out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

ibani_text: Anịgha jẹ́nyẹ, tumḅọ tọ́rọ́pa kụrọ tumḅọ warị sọ bẹ sị ori ngọ taa akị, ọ parị kụrọ tumḅọ ma kpọbẹm. Anịsáa ori ine ọ warị furubẹm.
english_text: “Or again, how can anyone enter a strong man’s house and carry off his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can plunder his house.

ibani_text: Iju fịnịgha ḅọ anịị ị́yẹ́ iruonaḅọ, pịghị i nana kobirighaḅọ gálágálámaarị.
english_text: “Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.

ibani_text: Anịgo a dugho ọ pịrịm, tumḅọ mịẹ siinyẹ na n pa Tamuno dughosima siinyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pa siḅụḅarasi n ḅọ pịrịbẹm, kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dughosima ḅọ siiḅụḅarasi nyánábịgha.
english_text: And so I tell you, every kind of sin and slander can be forgiven, but blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.

ibani_text: Sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma pịrị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị siiḅụḅarasi n ḅo pịrịbẹm, kụma sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịḅọ nnị siḅụḅarasi n ḅọ pịrịbịgha, mị tuminikiri ma ḅụ na pịghị ḅọ bẹnyẹ ma ḅụ.
english_text: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.

ibani_text: Sị ma mịẹ ibima anịsáa anị sịmgbọlụ sọ ibibẹm, anịgha sị́ mịẹ sima anịsáa anị sịmgbọlụ sọ sibẹm, ḅẹ́ sị́ nnị anị lighilighim anị suarị sịmgbọlụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: “Make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad, for a tree is recognized by its fruit.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sii ododó awọ, ọmịnị siiapụ tegó sị ibinyẹ dugho bẹ́? Ḅẹẹ, nyẹ kúkúbie ma bie bi wásámāmam n ḅẹḅẹ bịpị ma anị dugho pághámam.
english_text: You brood of vipers, how can you who are evil say anything good? For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of.

ibani_text: Ibi tumḅọ ma ibinyẹ akuoarị n ḅọ bie n ḅọ kokowarị ibi nyẹ ma ḅụ, sịị tumḅọ pịghị siinyẹ akuoarị n ḅọ bie n ḅọ kokowarị siinyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: A good man brings good things out of the good stored up in him, and an evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in him.

ibani_text: Kuma a dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné túminị́ dughobẹm nnị nwangikọ ḅara, n papa kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: But I tell you that everyone will have to give account on the day of judgment for every empty word they have spoken.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị anị nnị pa ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹnyẹ ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ólóghókóró na ịrị ólóghó kórógha na.
english_text: For by your words you will be acquitted, and by your words you will be condemned.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, jẹa Farisiiapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ wa ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma bim ị ḅara.
english_text: Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law said to him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pagharam, Mị tuminikiriapụ ma ọ tọ́rọ́fịnị sii túminị́ na pịghị Tamuno nímighaapụ, sị ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma biarị, kụma n gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa nnị pịrịbịgha, Jona ikiakoroḅọ ma ilíghíma siima.
english_text: He answered,“A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a sign! But none will be given it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

ibani_text: Jona tẹ́rẹ́ éné na tẹ́rẹ́ a dii pa opu nji ma furobie fịnị ḅara, anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma tẹ́rẹ́ a éné na tẹ́rẹ́ a dii pa kiribie fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of a huge fish, so the Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma, Niniveapụ saghịbẹm sị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ́ sịbị gbánā, tegó nnị Jona dugho págháma oku ma náa sáá, nnị nna, sii ḅụ pighim. Ḅẹẹ mị́sa Jona nẹngịḅọ mịnga imii.
english_text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and now something greater than Jonah is here.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma Seba ámányáná ọ́rụ́ḅọ saghị sẹbẹm sị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị gbánā, tegó árị ara ama warịsom sị árụ́ ḅụlọ ḅo ámányánáḅọ Solomọn nyẹ nimi dienyẹ ma pughu, ḅẹẹ mị́sa Solomọn nẹngịḅọ mịnga imii.
english_text: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon’s wisdom, and now something greater than Solomon is here.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ tumḅọ oju bie saghị págháḅomaẹrẹ anị sámụ́nọ ngá muu ikélekélem ịnyọsára ngaa dọghụarị, sị anị dọghụḅogha ḅogha,
english_text: “When an impure spirit comes out of a person, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it.

ibani_text: anịsáa, anị ḅẹbẹm, A pịghịma a saghị ḅo wárị ma muubẹm. Anị anị ngaa láa sáá, anị dọghụ pághámaḅom ḅẹẹ, kị́nị́ warị ma ḅụ ofori sị nnị anị ofịm sị anị tẹ́lẹ́ma kóróma.
english_text: Then it says, ‘I will return to the house I left.’ When it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept clean and put in order.

ibani_text: Anịsáa anị muubẹm sị mú jẹ́ Sọ́nọ́ma sitẹ́mẹ́ akị anị ḅụ sua, sisịbịbie nyáná anị nẹngị nyẹ, n warị muubẹm sị muu anị ngá ngaa, Kunemaá anị tumḅọ ma fịnị ḅara sii parị ma nẹ́ngịbẹm. Anịị anị fịnị mị sịbịkụ́rọ ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then it goes and takes with it seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that person is worse than the first. That is how it will be with this wicked generation.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ túminị́ kpo ma pịrịarị sáá, o nyingi na ori amịna owiapụ nụ́ngọbie sẹm kúruarị nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọ ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: While Jesus was still talking to the crowd, his mother and brothers stood outside, wanting to speak to him.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ warị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, I nyingi na ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ nụ́ngọbie sẹ́fịnịarị asọ dọghụarị nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ ị pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: Someone told him, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to speak to you.”

ibani_text: Ori ọ pagharam, I nyingi tụọ, tụọ pịghị ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ?
english_text: He replied to him,“Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”

ibani_text: Ḅara pa ori ọḅụduaapụ tụ́ụ́maarị, ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Mịị ịyẹa nyingi pịghị ịyẹa mịna owiapụ.
english_text: Pointing to his disciples, he said,“Here are my mother and my brothers.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ i Daá sobie fịnịḅọ ma ḅụḅẹ́lẹ́nyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị tumḅọ ma anịị ị́yẹ́ amịna owiḅọ, ị́yẹ́ amịna ọ́rụ́ḅọ na pịghị ị́yẹ́ nyingiḅọ.
english_text: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ma, Jizọs wárị warịsom sị pághá muu tọ́rụ́ ma ngaa kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.

ibani_text: O gbiri ikelekelé túminị́ ma opuma dụḅam gosi ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ árụ́ ḅụlọm sị anị bie kpọrọfịnị, túminị́ mamgba warị posie aka ma ḅụ sẹ́fịnị.
english_text: Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it, while all the people stood on the shore.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị tọgha nyẹ dugho n pịrị kaḅụ ḅụ dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́ dụadipiḅọ pághá muu ori sịmgbọ́lụ dipim.
english_text: Then he told them many things in parables, saying:“A farmer went out to sow his seed.

ibani_text: Ọ sịmgbọ́lụ ma gbi gálágálámaarị sáá, jẹa nyẹ asọogbo sóghórókórom, fíní warị ḅo sị anị gbọfị fama.
english_text: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ kpókpókiri ḅụ korom, anị ibima lịka nyanagha ngaa. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri anị sẹ́nị págháḅom lịka ma póghólógha gosi.
english_text: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrụa ma págháḅo sáá, anị dipi nyẹ ma dọghụmam tegó anị kune nyanagha gosi anị sámụ́nọm.
english_text: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ a sịmgbọlụ nangi bie sóghórókórom, nangi ma sẹ́nị págháḅom sị saghị dipi nyẹ ma timi.
english_text: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ pa ibikiri ḅụ sóóró kóróm, anị sọ́nọ́ a si kiri, tẹ́rẹ́ a si kiri anịgha sue kiri sua pághámaḅo ngaa n dipi nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Still other seed fell on good soil, where it produced a crop—a hundred, sixty or thirty times what was sown.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ, n ḅọ náa.
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear.”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma warị ọ damaḅo sị ọ gbíla, I tegó kaḅụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ túminị́ ma pịrịarị?
english_text: The disciples came to him and asked, “Why do you speak to the people in parables?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, So ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅọghunyẹ ma níminyẹ n pa ọ pịrịmam, kụ́ma n pa nnị pịrịgha.
english_text: He replied,“Because the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven has been given to you, but not to them.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n jẹ́nyẹ pa n ḅọ pịrịbẹm, anịḅọ ma pịghị mánámāná nyẹ nyánábẹm. Nyẹ́ nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n ḅọ nyáná kálányẹ ma sọ nnị n ḅọ ḅarabie anị ákịbẹm.
english_text: Whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.

ibani_text: Mịma go anị a go kaḅụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ n pịrịarịnyẹ: Nnị dighiarị kụ́ma nyẹ arịgha; nnị pughuarị kụma naagha anịgha akanyaḅo.
english_text: This is why I speak to them in parables: “Though seeing, they do not see; though hearing, they do not hear or understand.

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma ḅụ anịị Aizaya koro íkia ma ḅo kiriakịnyẹ:  Ọ naábẹm kụ́ma akanyaḅobịgha, ọmịnị árịbẹm kụ́ma ibima arịḅogha.
english_text: In them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah: “ ‘You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.

ibani_text: Tegó nna tẹ́mẹ́bie mịnị álála nyẹ akanyaḅogha gosi; nna biri sọ mịnị pịghị nyẹ naagha n pịghị nna tọ́rụ́ gbẹmam. Anị ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ fịnịgha nnị ine nna tọ́rụ́ pa nyẹ árịbẹm, pịghị nna biri pa nyẹ náa, pịghị nna tẹ́mẹ́bie pa nyẹ akanyaḅo sị pịghịma ḅoo a pịghị nna gwọbẹm.
english_text: For this people’s heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n karịibimanyẹ anịị ọmịna tọ́rụ́ tegó nnị nyẹ́ arịarị na pịghị ọmịna biri tegó n nyẹ́ naarị.
english_text: But blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ a karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, tọgha ikiakoroapụ na karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ túminị́ dọghụarị nnị ọmịnị arịarị nyẹ ma árị, kụ́ma ine arịgha, sị pịghị ọ naarị nyẹ ma náa, kụma ine anị naagha.
english_text: For truly I tell you, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.

ibani_text: Anịsáa pughu, mịị dụadipiḅọ kaḅụ ma dughoarị nyẹ:
english_text: “Listen then to what the parable of the sower means:

ibani_text: Asọogbo sóórókoro sịmgbọ́lụ ma sẹ́pịrịnyẹ anịị ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ibi oku naapụ, kụma akanyaḅogha, sii tumḅọ ma warị ḅoo nna tẹ́mẹ́bie n dipi sịmgbọ́lụ ma pughọakị.
english_text: When anyone hears the message about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in their heart. This is the seed sown along the path.

ibani_text: Kpókpókiri ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọ́lụ ma anịị bieḅẹlẹ pa oku ma daakịapụ nnị anị náa gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: The seed falling on rocky ground refers to someone who hears the word and at once receives it with joy.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị nna bie kune nyanagha, kálá sáá ngéré anịị anị pa fịnịarị nyẹ. Ḅụḅáláḅálá anịgha tọ́rụ́siarị ḅomaẹrẹ oku ma gosi, n ḅọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri bịghị korom.
english_text: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.

ibani_text: Nangi ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọ́lụ ma anịị oku ma naapụ, kụ́ma mịị tuminikiri ma ḅụḅáláḅálá ma pịghị ngọ oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị, anị kpepumam, mịẹsị anị ine sịmgbọ́lụ suagha.
english_text: The seed falling among the thorns refers to someone who hears the word, but the worries of this life and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word, making it unfruitful.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ibikiri ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọ́lụ ma anịị oku ma naapụ sị anị akanyaḅo: sịmgbọ́lụ sua, jẹa nyẹ sọ́nọ́ a si kiri, jẹa nyẹ tẹ́rẹ́ si kiri, jẹa nyẹ sue kiri.
english_text: But the seed falling on good soil refers to someone who hears the word and understands it. This is the one who produces a crop, yielding a hundred, sixty or thirty times what was sown.”

ibani_text: Jizọs jẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, So ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ibi sịmgbọ́lụ dipiḅọ ori duakiri.
english_text: Jesus told them another parable:“The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kị́nị́mamgba múnoarị sáá, ori iruonaḅọ ḅom sị owi osuka dipi witi, ọrọsị kịka sịmgbọ́lụ ama ogbobie sị nwángị sọọ.
english_text: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.

ibani_text: Witi, ọrọsị kịka sịmgbọlụ ma sẹ́nị págháḅo sịmgbọ́lụ sua sáá, túminị́ warị saghị owi osuka ma sọ arịị.
english_text: When the wheat sprouted and formed heads, then the weeds also appeared.

ibani_text: Dua ma nyáná fịrịnwangịḅọ ọ damaḅom sị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ, ị ibi sịmgbọ́lụ dipigha ị́yẹ́ duakiri ḅụ? Owi osuka ma anị tẹ́ angaá saghị ḅo?
english_text: “The owner’s servants came to him and said, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where then did the weeds come from?’

ibani_text: Ọ warị págháraa, Iruonaḅọ mịma mịẹm. Fịrịnwangịḅọ ma warị ọ gbíla, I bii mọ ḅẹ́ wa muu anị wọrọ si?
english_text: “ ‘An enemy did this,’ he replied. “The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull them up?’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ págháraa, Errnh-errnh, tegó ị́ owi osuka ma wọrọ sịarị sáá ị́ ine nimigha pa witi, ọrọsị kịka sịmgbọlụ ma sọ wọrọsibẹm.
english_text: “ ‘No,’ he answered, ‘because while you are pulling the weeds, you may uproot the wheat with them.

ibani_text: Wáriso nnị mmẹapụ ma sẹ́nị págháḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá akị muu duasughu sáá ma láa. Anịsáa ma ḅụ a dugho dua sughuapụ ma pịrịbẹm; parị owi osuka ma ikolokolo ḅo sị nkáká púghú púghú ḅụ sị nnị n dọ́ghụ́ma bẹ ḅara; anịsáa witi, ọrọsị kịka sịmgbọlụ ma kobiri sị anị akuoo ị́yẹ́ dua ḅụ n sughu nyẹ koko koko angaá.
english_text: Let both grow together until the harvest. At that time I will tell the harvesters: First collect the weeds and tie them in bundles to be burned; then gather the wheat and bring it into my barn.’ ”

ibani_text: Ọ jẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ n pịrịm: So Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma mọstad sịmgbọ́lụ anị anịị kịkanyẹ, tumḅọ akị sị pa dipi nyẹ n ḅọ duakiri.
english_text: He told them another parable:“The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field.

ibani_text: Anị ọmịna ḅụ ịrụḅa sịmgbọ́lụ n ḅẹ sọ, anịsọ anị sẹnị maẹrẹ, anị anịị dụḅaḅá duakiri sịmgbọlụ dighim sị ḅo opu sị sọọ, sị fọ́rụ bie fighiarị fíní ḅo anị ḅụ gbana gbana anị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: Though it is the smallest of all seeds, yet when it grows, it is the largest of garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds come and perch in its branches.”

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị jẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ n pịrịm ḅẹẹ: So ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma, mịị anị fịnị ḅara, gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ jẹa yisti akịm sị pa ólóló a mmẹẹ́ si bi bẹ filawa na gwaa, mị kálá yisti ma warị mịná mánámāná filawa ma sụghụma.
english_text: He told them still another parable:“The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about sixty poundsof flour until it worked all through the dough.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnanyẹ mamgba dugho túminị́ ma pịrịm kaḅụ ḅụ; ọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ dughogha kaḅụ kọgha pa.
english_text: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd in parables; he did not say anything to them without using a parable.

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma anị ikiakoroḅọ ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅo kiriakị ḅara: A kaḅụ kọọ n pịrịbẹm, n saghị tuminikiri tẹ́mẹ́ sa éné éné a ḅọghunyẹ dugho pághámabẹm.
english_text: So was fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet: “I will open my mouth in parables, I will utter things hidden since the creation of the world.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị túminị́ kpo ma wárịso sị warị sọọ, ori ọḅụduaapụ warị ọ damaḅo sị dugho ḅẹẹ, Dughofindi wa pịrị owi osuka fịnị duakiri kaḅụ.
english_text: Then he left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him and said, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Ibi sịmgbọlụ dipiḅọ ma anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ.
english_text: He answered,“The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Duakiri ma anịị tuminikiri ma, ibi sịmgbọ́lụ ma anịị ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma awọ, owi osuka ma anịị sii tumḅọ ma awọ,
english_text: The field is the world, and the good seed stands for the people of the kingdom. The weeds are the people of the evil one,

ibani_text: pịghị nnị dipi iruonaḅọ ma anịị ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma. Duasughu ma anịị sáá ma kunema, pịghị dua ma suu bẹapụ anịị sookumuapụ ma.
english_text: and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the harvesters are angels.

ibani_text: Nnị owi osuka ma nụ́nụ́si sị anị dọ́ghụ́ma ḅara fịnịbie, anịị anị fịnị ḅẹ́ ḅara tuminikiri ma kunema.
english_text: “As the weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ori sookumuapụ fịrịma pághámabẹm, nnị pịghị ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ siinyẹ mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na pịghị siinyẹ mịẹarịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ isé si.
english_text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil.

ibani_text: Nnị n pa opu kọrịfịnị bie gbi suabẹm, nnị owu sị pịghị aka túrú bẹ angaá.
english_text: They will throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ibani_text: Anịsáa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma warị ịrụa bia ḅara pa biabẹm nna Daá ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ. Biri nyanaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa.
english_text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears, let them hear.

ibani_text: Sọ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị fịnị ḅara sọ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị pa duakiri ḅụ ḅọghu warị ngọ, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ anị dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá, ọ sima anị pa ḅọghum, anịsáa ori bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ muu ọ nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrị sị anị duakiri ma fẹ́.
english_text: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again, and then in his joy went and sold all he had and bought that field.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ nyẹ, so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri anị fịnị ḅara anịị fíafía nyẹ́la onwo mgbọ́lụ dọghụarị tụ́ḅonaḅọ.
english_text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant looking for fine pearls.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅoo opuma nyẹ́la nyẹ dọghụ ḅo sáá, ọ sọm sị ọ nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrịm sị anị fẹ́.
english_text: When he found one of great value, he went away and sold everything he had and bought it.

ibani_text: Pịghị jẹ́nyẹ, so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri anị fịnị ḅara anịị n kọ́rọ́ma ịgbọ tọ́rụ́bie sị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nji kuu.
english_text: “Once again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was let down into the lake and caught all kinds of fish.

ibani_text: Nji ịgbọ ma bi sáá, nnị anị nụnụkiri ḅom. Anịsáa n warị kpọrọfịnị sị ibi nji ma sẹ́lẹ́ nkanabie sua, kụ́ma sị nji ma gbi ḅuuma.
english_text: When it was full, the fishermen pulled it up on the shore. Then they sat down and collected the good fish in baskets, but threw the bad away.

ibani_text: Mịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara sáá ma kunema. Sookumuapụ ma ḅobẹm sị siiapụ ma fófóoma ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma ḅụ.
english_text: This is how it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come and separate the wicked from the righteous

ibani_text: Sị n gbi pa opu kọrịfịnị ma bie sua, owu na ákáturu na kiriakị bẹ angaá.
english_text: and throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị gbíla, Mịnanyẹ mamgba ọmịnị anị akanyaḅo ma? Nnị warị págháraa Innh.
english_text: “Have you understood all these things?”Jesus asked. “Yes,” they replied.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ólóghó ma nyẹ́dieḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, nnị so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gbolomanyẹ pa diemaaḅọ, n ḅọ kịkanyẹ anịị warị nyánáḅọ ori ngọ koko koko yọ ḅụ ịwọ ngọ na pịghị olom ngọ pághámaḅom.
english_text: He said to them,“Therefore every teacher of the law who has become a disciple in the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house who brings out of his storeroom new treasures as well as old.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịná kaḅụ ma kọọ fama sáá, ori anị ngaa ma warisom.
english_text: When Jesus had finished these parables, he moved on from there.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅoo ori ama láa sáá, ọ saghị nyẹ pa túminị́ ma diem nna kobiri yọ ḅụ, anị warị n tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị. Nnị warị gbíla, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tẹ́ angaá mị níminyẹ ma na mị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nyáná ḅo?
english_text: Coming to his hometown, he began teaching the people in their synagogue, and they were amazed. “Where did this man get this wisdom and these miraculous powers?” they asked.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅọ ma ori akanịḅọ ma tụ́wọgha, o nyingi ẹ́rẹ́ Merigha ori mịná owiapụ Jems, Josẹf, Saimọn na Judasigha?
english_text: “Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother’s name Mary, and aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and Judas?

ibani_text: Ori mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ mamgba nnị wamịnị na mịnga ofori? Mị owitụ́wọ ma, ọ tẹ́ angaá mịnanyẹ mamgba nyáná?
english_text: Aren’t all his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all these things?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị bieoḅu ọ pịrị, kụ́ma Jizọs n ḅẹm, Ikiakoroḅọ, ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ kuusọm, kụma ori ama na ọ wárịbie anịị o kuu sọgha nyẹ.
english_text: And they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them,“A prophet is not without honor except in his own town and in his own home.”

ibani_text: Ọ tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangịgha anị ngaa tegó nnị minini nyanagha gosi.
english_text: And he did not do many miracles there because of their lack of faith.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, Hẹrọd Galili táarịḅọ Jizọs gbolomanyẹ nam.
english_text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the reports about Jesus,

ibani_text: Ọ warị ori a fịrịnwangịapụ ḅẹẹ, Mịị ḅọ ma anịị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ ma, ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam! Anịị ọ go mị kụrọ ma nyáná sị pa ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịarị nyẹ.
english_text: and he said to his attendants, “This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead! That is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

ibani_text: Na mị́sa ma laagha sáá, Hẹrọd Jọn kuumam sị ịkóli pa ọ ḅárásua sị ọ pa ikólibie sua, Herodias gosi ọ numboru owitụ́wọ Filipụ taa.
english_text: Now Herod had arrested John and bound him and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,

ibani_text: Jọn pa dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹẹ: Anị ólóghó na karakáragha ḅẹẹ ịrị a yaa.
english_text: for John had been saying to him: “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

ibani_text: Hẹrọd asọ dọ́ghụm ọ Jọn ḅáa, kụ́ma ọ túminị́ ma dighi ḅáláfaarị, tegó n mininim ḅẹẹ Jọn ori ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: Herod wanted to kill John, but he was afraid of the people, because they considered John a prophet.

ibani_text: Nnị Hẹrọd yii éné pa biekórómáarị sáá, Herodias ndụ́ḅa sẹ́ghị n pịrịm sị anị opuma Hẹrọd tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́mam,
english_text: On Herod’s birthday the daughter of Herodias danced for the guests and pleased Herod so much

ibani_text: sị ọ warị nyẹ kuḅufị a pịrị ḅẹẹ a binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ mịẹ a pịrịbẹm.
english_text: that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.

ibani_text: A nyingi bi ḅara ḅụ a warị ḅẹẹ, Ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ bie mịnga Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ sịbị pa i pịrịị.
english_text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptist.”

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ ma tẹ́mẹ́ ḅo sim, kụ́ma ọ kuḅufị nyẹ ma gosi na pịghị ori ḅupiri fị́nyẹ igoniapụ gosi, ọ bịpị pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị a binyẹ pa a pịrị,
english_text: The king was distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he ordered that her request be granted

ibani_text: n warị Jọn sịbị pẹ́lẹ́ ikóliwarị ma bie.
english_text: and had John beheaded in the prison.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ sịbị akuom ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ bie sị pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ ma pịrị, a warị anị dighi muu a nyingi pịrị.
english_text: His head was brought in on a platter and given to the girl, who carried it to her mother.

ibani_text: Jọn ọḅụduaapụ ḅom sị ori dua dighiákị muu dipi. Anịsáa nnị warị muu dugho Jizọs pịrị.
english_text: John’s disciples came and took his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs pághá nyẹ ma náa sáá, ori árụ́ ḅụlọm sị muu túminị́ ngaagha angaá ḅụ fịnị ori ma ngéré. Túminị́ kpo ma mịma náa sáá, n warị ámá ma ḅụ saghị ḅụọ pa o dua.
english_text: When Jesus heard what had happened, he withdrew by boat privately to a solitary place. Hearing of this, the crowds followed him on foot from the towns.

ibani_text: Jizọs láa sị tọgha túminị́ kpo árị sáá, ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná n pịrịm sị nna túminị́ ḅụ obiapụ ma gwọọ.
english_text: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

ibani_text: Éné ḅupiri sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ọ damaḅom sị ḅẹẹ, Mịnga ma anịị túminị́ ngaagha ngá, éné pịghị diarị. Túminị́ ma fịrịma sị n soo, sị nnị ine káláma ma muu sị fị́nyẹ fẹ nna ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: As evening approached, the disciples came to him and said, “This is a remote place, and it’s already getting late. Send the crowds away, so they can go to the villages and buy themselves some food.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Nnị soo na ibighaa ọ fị́nyẹ dọghụ n pịrị sị nnị fị.
english_text: Jesus replied,“They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị págháraa, Mịnga wá nyánányẹ anịị sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo na mmẹẹ́ a nji.
english_text: “We have here only five loaves of bread and two fish,” they answered.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Akuoo ḅo i pịrị mịnga.
english_text: “Bring them here to me,”he said.

ibani_text: Ọ warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹẹ túminị́ ma osuka ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnị. Ori sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo ma na mmẹẹ́ a nji ma akịm sị tọ́rụ́ saghị so dighi sị imiẹḅa ḅẹm sị fịtúrú ma pughu. Anịsáa ọ warị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị, ori ọḅụduaapụ warị pa túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: And he directed the people to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba fị fúrōbimam ori ọḅụduaapụ warị oyi mmẹẹ́ nkana findi tụ́tụ́rụ ḅo, mpara mpara fịtúrú kọnyẹ́ ma ḅụ.
english_text: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

ibani_text: Fị́nyẹ ma fị túminị́ kịẹbịpị owiapụ oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si, ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na awọamaapụ anị bie ofori.
english_text: The number of those who ate was about five thousand men, besides women and children.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma fị́nyẹ ma fị́fáma gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ mịẹm si nnị pịghịma muu árụ́ ḅụlọ sị parị ọ ḅụ sáḅá kóró isi párángáa muu tọ́rụ́ ma ḅụ, ori warị túminị́ kpo ma fịrịma sọọ.
english_text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd.

ibani_text: Ori n fịrịma so fama sáá, ori ọ ḅara na tụ́ndụ́ ọ́gọ́nọ tándịm sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara. Éné ḅupiri sáá ori ngéré anịị anị ngaa fịnịnyẹ.
english_text: After he had dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. Later that night, he was there alone,

ibani_text: Anịsa ma ḅụ, árụ́ ma ḅọlọ angaá ḅụ imi kiri bịpị ḅụ, dinọngụ pịghị ibima árụ́ ma fommam tegó árụ́ ma fọ́rụ ma na kuragha.
english_text: and the boat was already a considerable distance from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ biri dii bie, Jizọs nnị damamum, nwángịarị dappa ma ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Shortly before dawn Jesus went out to them, walking on the lake.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ori árị sáá, mingi ma ọ́gọ́nọ nwángịarị, ḅáláfa nna ḅụ bie sọm, n warị ḅáláfa ḅụ ilúghú owu ḅẹẹ, Mịị tẹ́mẹ́.
english_text: When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. “It’s a ghost,” they said, and cried out in fear.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́mẹ́kụrọ nyáná! Ọ́ irịị, ọ ḅáláfama.
english_text: But Jesus immediately said to them:“Take courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”

ibani_text: Pita warị pagharaa, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị nbẹ ḅẹẹ, i ḅẹẹ sị a ị damaḅo mingi ma ọgọnọ.
english_text: “Lord, if it’s you,” Peter replied, “tell me to come to you on the water.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅoo. Anịsáa, Pita warị árụ́ ma bie koro mingi ma ọgọnọ sị nwángị Jizọs fịnị ngaa múuarị.
english_text: “Come,”he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ fọ́rụ ma árị sáá, ḅáláfa ori oju bie sọm, ọ warị saghị bile, ọ warị owu págháma ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma!
english_text: But when he saw the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, “Lord, save me!”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri Jizọs ḅara sụghụmam sị o kuu, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị minini ịrụḅọ, i tẹ́mẹ́ tegó mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹ?
english_text: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him.“You of little faith,”he said,“why did you doubt?”

ibani_text: Nnị pịghịma árụ́ ma ḅụlọ sáá, fọ́rụ ma mịnị fieghaa.
english_text: And when they climbed into the boat, the wind died down.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, árụ́ ma bie fịnịapụ warị susi ọ pịrị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Karakárányẹ, ịrị Tamuno Tụ́wọ.
english_text: Then those who were in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”

ibani_text: Nnị sáḅá kóró sáá, nnị ḅo Genazarẹtị ḅụ sọmam.
english_text: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret.

ibani_text: Anị ámá ma túminị́ Jizọs lighilighiḅo sáá n bịpị fịrịma nnị na kikia ama gbọrụ pịrịm. Túminị́ warị nna obiapụ mamgba pa ọ damaḅoo,
english_text: And when the men of that place recognized Jesus, they sent word to all the surrounding country. People brought all their sick to him

ibani_text: sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ọ wáriso sị nna obiapụ ḅara pa ọ sua koro bịtẹ ḅụọsughu lama, ḅara pa ọlamaapụ mamgba nna ḅụ pịghị gwọm.
english_text: and begged him to let the sick just touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ Jerusalem wárịso Jizọs damaḅom sị gbíla,
english_text: Then some Pharisees and teachers of the law came to Jesus from Jerusalem and asked,

ibani_text: Tegó sị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ wámịna sẹ́nịapụ nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ma dua nyẹ́miẹgha nyẹ? Nnị nna ḅara sịrị sịrịgha n nyẹ́fị bẹ sáá!
english_text: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? They don’t wash their hands before they eat!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịnị o tegó Tamuno ologho ma kaarị ọmịna nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara gosi?
english_text: Jesus replied,“And why do you break the command of God for the sake of your tradition?

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno ḅẹm ḅẹ́, Kuu pa ị nyingi na ị daa pịrị, amịna daaḅọ anịgha amịna nyingiḅọ wiri ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅo ḅáabẹm.
english_text: For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother’and ‘Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ nyẹ nyánam n ḅọ pa daḅọ anịgha nyingiḅọ pa ḅárásua n ḅọ pịrịbẹnyẹ n ḅọ warị nyingiḅọ anịgha daḅọ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ mịị nyẹ ma anị fịnị Tamuno pịrịm,
english_text: But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is ‘devoted to God,’

ibani_text: anịgo n ḅọ kuu pa amịna daḅọ pịrị naibigha. Mị ḅara ma ọmịnị ọmịna nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ Tamuno ólóghó ma pa papanyẹ mịẹm.
english_text: they are not to ‘honor their father or mother’ with it. Thus you nullify the word of God for the sake of your tradition.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingi! Aizaya karakáram ori o gboloma íkia koro sáá ḅẹẹ:
english_text: You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:

ibani_text: Mịná túminị́ ma ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅụ anịị nnị kuu pa i pịrịnyẹ kụ́ma nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ịḅụ ḅọlọanga ḅụ imi.
english_text: “ ‘These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

ibani_text: Papa anịị nnị susi i pịrịarịnyẹ; n diearịnyẹ ma anịị túminị́ tọ́ọ kórómanyẹ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ anịma anịị ị́yẹ́ ólóghó.
english_text: They worship me in vain; their teachings are merely human rules.’”

ibani_text: Jizọs túminị́ ma sị ọ ḅụ pịrịm sị ḅẹẹ, Pughu sị akanyaḅo.
english_text: Jesus called the crowd to him and said,“Listen and understand.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ bịpịbie sọọ nyẹ mịẹbịgha n ḅọ pile kụma bịpị ma bie saghị págháḅo nyẹ anịị mịẹsị tumḅọ pilearị nyẹ.
english_text: What goes into someone’s mouth does not defile them, but what comes out of their mouth, that is what defiles them.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọḅụduaapụ ma ọ damaḅom si gbíla, Ị nimi ḅẹẹ Farisiiapụ ma anị nnị igánimam nnị ị dughonyẹ ma náa sáá?
english_text: Then the disciples came to him and asked, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Iyẹ Daá sobie fịnịḅọ dipigha nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, kune ḅụ anịị nnị anị sughu si bẹnyẹ.
english_text: He replied,“Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be pulled up by the roots.

ibani_text: Nnị wáriso nnị anịị tọ́rụ́pụụ́ si asọ pa tọ́rụ́ pụụapụ diearịapụ. Ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́ puuḅọ asọ pa tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ diearị nnị mmẹapụ ma sóórókoro olulu bie sọbẹm.
english_text: Leave them; they are blind guides.If the blind lead the blind, both will fall into a pit.”

ibani_text: Pita warị ḅẹẹ, Mị kaḅụ ma dughofindi wa pịrị.
english_text: Peter said, “Explain the parable to us.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n gbíla, Ọ pa na akanyaḅo nyánágha?
english_text: “Are you still so dull?”Jesus asked them.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị arịgha ḅẹ́ bịpị ma bie sọ́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ furo ma bie ḅọ́rọ́ sọsọm sị oju ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pághá?
english_text: “Don’t you see that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and then out of the body?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tumḅọ bịpịbie págháḅo nyẹ ma tẹ́mẹ́ ma bie saghịḅom mịnanyẹ ma anịị pịghị tumḅọ pilemaarị nyẹ.
english_text: But the things that come out of a person’s mouth come from the heart, and these defile them.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ tẹ́mẹ́ ma bie anịị sii kóróma, kị́nị́ḅáa, amadọghụ, yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị, fúrú, iruo onyẹ́sẹ, kị́nị́ dughosima.
english_text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts—murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma anịị tumḅọ, Pilemaarị nyẹ. Kụma ḅara sịrịgha sị nyẹ́fị mịẹgha sị n ḅọ pile!
english_text: These are what defile a person; but eating with unwashed hands does not defile them.”

ibani_text: Jizọs anị ngaa ma wáriso sáá, ori ọ ḅụ nụ́nụ́akị pa Taya na Sidọn ḅẹrẹtọ angaá múm.
english_text: Leaving that place, Jesus withdrew to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Kenan ọ́rụ́ḅọ anị párángáa ma ḅụ ḅoḅọ ọ damaḅom, owu pághámaarị ḅẹ́, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Deviti Tụwọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrị! Iyẹ ndụ́ḅa sitẹ́mẹ́ kóróarị ḅọ opuma tọ́rụ́siarịarị.
english_text: A Canaanite woman from that vicinity came to him, crying out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter is demon-possessed and suffering terribly.”

ibani_text: Jizọs gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pagharagha. Anịgo ori ọḅụduaapụ warị sághị ọ suma ḅẹẹ, ori a fịrịma so, ḅẹẹ a pa owu owu si wa duarị.
english_text: Jesus did not answer a word. So his disciples came to him and urged him, “Send her away, for she keeps crying out after us.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pagharaa, Nnị ị fịrịmam Izirẹlị bie faá ánáná ma gosi.
english_text: He answered,“I was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma warị ḅo ọ tórúku ẹkpẹrẹkị si ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅárásua i pịrịị!
english_text: The woman came and knelt before him. “Lord, help me!” she said.

ibani_text: Ọ warị pagharaa, Anị karakáragha sị awọamaapụ ma fịtúrú akị sị anị gbi pa obiri pịrị.
english_text: He replied,“It is not right to take the children’s bread and toss it to the dogs.”

ibani_text: A warị ḅẹẹ, Innh, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, kụ́ma obiri ma sọ nna nyánáḅọ ịkasị ọ́gọ́nọ sóghóóró kórónyẹ ma sọ fịfịm.
english_text: “Yes it is, Lord,” she said. “Even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their master’s table.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị pagharaa, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ị opu minini nyánam! Anị ọkọ fịnị ị pịrị ị bi ḅara. Árị ndụ́ḅa warị gwọọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then Jesus said to her,“Woman, you have great faith! Your request is granted.”And her daughter was healed at that moment.

ibani_text: Jizọs anị ngaa ma warịsom si Galili tọ́rụ́ angaá ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Anịsáa ọ warị tụ́ndụ́ ngása tándị sị kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: Jesus left there and went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a mountainside and sat down.

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ kpo ọ damaḅom ikúléapụ na Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ na ikirịarịapụ na oḅu ọlọapụ na pịghị tọgha jẹapụ sị n pa ọ ḅụọ angaá warị, ọ warị n gwọọ.
english_text: Great crowds came to him, bringing the lame, the blind, the crippled, the mute and many others, and laid them at his feet; and he healed them.

ibani_text: Anị túminị́ ma ḅụ́gbérépumam nnị árị sáá ḅẹẹ ọḅụ ọlọapụ saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá, ikirịarịapụ nna ḅụ mịẹ ibima, ikúléapụ nwángịarị, Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ nyẹ árịarị. Nnị warị Izirẹlị Tamuno ma túmíní.
english_text: The people were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled made well, the lame walking and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.

ibani_text: Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ sị ọ ḅụ pịrịm sị ḅẹẹ, Mịná túminị́ ma a n dighi tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́arị, n tẹ́rẹ́ adi pa ịrị na fịnịmam ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ fịgha pa. A biigha ḅẹẹ a ḅurutarị ḅụ n fịrịma soo, anịgha nnị ine sóórókóróbẹm asọogbo.
english_text: Jesus called his disciples to him and said,“I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, or they may collapse on the way.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ pagharam, Wa tẹ́ angaá mịná túminị́ fúrōbi bẹ fịtúrú nyáná ḅo bẹ mị ḅọlọ angaá ma ḅụ sị pa mị túminị́ kpo ma siḅe?
english_text: His disciples answered, “Where could we get enough bread in this remote place to feed such a crowd?”

ibani_text: Jizọs gbilam, Ọmịnị ndẹẹ́ fịtúrú kpo nyáná? Nnị pagharam, Sọ́nọ́ma kpo, na pịghị dụḅagha kálá nji.
english_text: “How many loaves do you have?”Jesus asked. “Seven,” they replied, “and a few small fish.”

ibani_text: Ọ dugho túminị́ kpo ma pịrịm ḅẹ́ n kiri kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị sọ́nọ́ma fịtúrú kpo ma na nji akị, ori imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹ́ fama sáá, ori anị puum si anị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị nnị warị anị pa túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, and when he had given thanks, he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and they in turn to the people.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịm sị anị n fúrobi. Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ sọ́nọ́ma nkana mpara mpara fịtúrú gbálaḅom n fịkọma nyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: They all ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

ibani_text: Mị fịtúrú ma fịapụ kịẹbịpị anịị owiapụ túminị́ oyia ndẹ́ẹ, mịma ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na Káláawọ anị bie ofori.
english_text: The number of those who ate was four thousand men, besides women and children.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs túminị́ ma fịrịma sọm, sị sima árụ́ ma ḅụlọ sị so Magadan párángáa muu.
english_text: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat and went to the vicinity of Magadan.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ na Sadusiiapụ Jizọs damaḅom sị ọ daádighi ḅẹ́ ọ sobie saghị ḅo ilíghíma pa n die.
english_text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus and tested him by asking him to show them a sign from heaven.

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Éné ḅupiri sáá, so tọ́rụ́ ma saghị áwụ biarị sáá ọ ḅẹẹbẹm ḅẹẹ éné ma ibibẹm.
english_text: He replied,“When evening comes, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red,’

ibani_text: Dedebie, so tọ́rụ́ áwụ biamaẹrẹ warị oḅuto sua ọ ḅẹẹbẹm, irisé fiebẹm. Ọ nimim sọ tọ́rụ́ ma fịnị ḅara dughofindi. Kụ́ma sáá ma ilíghíma ọmịnị ine anị dugho findigha.
english_text: and in the morning, ‘Today it will be stormy, for the sky is red and overcast.’ You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.

ibani_text: Tamuno nimigha silálá sii tuminikiriapụ ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma biiarị, kụ́ma n gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa n diebịgha Jona ilíghíma ma siima. Jizọs warị anịsáa n wárịso sị soo.
english_text: A wicked and adulterous generation looks for a sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah.”Jesus then left them and went away.

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma tọ́rụ́ ma sáḅá koro sáá ma ḅụ, nnị biekórómaḅogha sị fịtúrú akị.
english_text: When they went across the lake, the disciples forgot to take bread.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọ tọ́rụ diinma, ọ ḅụẹbị Farisiiapụ ma na Sadusiiapụ ma yisti pịrị.
english_text: “Be careful,”Jesus said to them.“Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

ibani_text: Nnị bịpị ḅụ mịma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam nnị ogbobie sị ḅẹẹ, Mịma anịị wa gbẹ́rẹ́ fịtúrú sọ akuogha gosi.
english_text: They discussed this among themselves and said, “It is because we didn’t bring any bread.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị dughoarị nyẹ nimim warị gbíla, O tegó ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọ ḅụ pịrịarị ḅẹẹ ọ fịtúrú nyánágha? Ọmịnị minini ịrụapụ,
english_text: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked,“You of little faith, why are you talking among yourselves about having no bread?

ibani_text: na ọ pa akanyaḅo nyanagha? Oḅiekórómagha sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo pa túminị́ oyi mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si pịrị fịị, ndẹẹ́ a nkana ọ gbálā ḅo sị kọnyẹ́.
english_text: Do you still not understand? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many basketfuls you gathered?

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị biekórómagha a sọ́nọ́ma fịtúrú kpo pa oyia ndẹ́ẹ pịrị fị na pịghị kọọ sị ọ gbálā ḅo ndẹẹa nkana.
english_text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many basketfuls you gathered?

ibani_text: Anị tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị ine akanyaḅogha ḅẹẹ a fịtúrú gbólómanyẹ dugho ọ pịrịgha, Kụ́ma ọmịnị ọ ḅụẹbị Farisiiapụ ma na Sadusiiapụ ma yisti pịrị.
english_text: How is it you don’t understand that I was not talking to you about bread? But be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa anị n ḅo akanyaḅo nyẹ ḅẹẹ ori ḅẹgha ḅẹẹ nnị nna ḅụẹbị nnị pa fịtúrú mịẹarị yisti ma pịrị, kụ́ma n ḅụẹbị Farisiiapụ na Sadusiiapụ dienyẹ ma pịrị.
english_text: Then they understood that he was not telling them to guard against the yeast used in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo Sizariya Filipai párángáa láa sáá, ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ gbilam, Túminị́ n dugho ḅẹẹ tụọ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma?
english_text: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples,“Who do people say the Son of Man is?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Jẹapụ ḅẹm Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ; isiapụ ḅẹm Elaija, isi jẹ́apụ ḅẹm Jerimaya anịgha ikiakoroapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọmịnị ọ tẹ́ dugho, ọ ḅẹẹ ịrị tụọ?
english_text: “But what about you?”he asked.“Who do you say I am?”

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita pagharam, Ịrị anịị Krais ma, dumafịnị Tamuno ma Tụwọ.
english_text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị ịrị, Saimọn Jona tụwọ, tegó tumḅọ mịma pa i diegha kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ sobie fịnị Daḅọ anị pa i dieḅọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by flesh and blood, but by my Father in heaven.

ibani_text: A dugho ị pịrịm ḅẹ́ ịrị anịị Pita (anịị okpo dapịrị pa siinyẹ), mịị okpo dapịrị ma ḅụ anịị a pịghị ị́yẹ́ sọsị nama bẹnyẹ, fịị kụrọmamgba opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma sọ pịghị anị sọḅabịgha.
english_text: And I tell you that you are Peter,and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hadeswill not overcome it.

ibani_text: A so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri igodo findinyẹ ma pa ị pịrịbẹm; sị ọkaka nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tuminikiri, sobie sọ nnị pịghị anị kakábẹm. Ọ pịghị fiima nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị pịghị anị fiimabẹm sobie.
english_text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; whatever you bind on earth will bebound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will beloosed in heaven.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị ori ọḅụduaapụ birinụ́nụ́ ḅẹẹ nnị dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma ḅẹẹ ori anịị Krais ma.
english_text: Then he ordered his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ saghị Jizọs warị saghị dughofindi ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹ́ ọ Jerusalem muu nyánam sị tọgha tọ́rụ́siarị árị sẹ́nịapụ ma na igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ḅara, n pịghị ọ ḅaabẹm sị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá éné ọ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.

ibani_text: Pita ọ pa angaá ḅọ́rọ́m sị sághị igani ọ pịrị. Warị ḅẹẹ, Jẹ́ ene jẹ́ ene, Kịnịyánáḅọ! Tamuno minima. Mịma ịḅụ pághábịgha!
english_text: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ́ pighim sị Pita ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ọḅụju sọọ, Satanị! Ịrị asọ mgbẹsẹ dapịrị sọ ị pịrịm; ḅẹẹ ịrị Tamuno ju ofori, kụ́ma túminị́ ju.
english_text: Jesus turned and said to Peter,“Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị, Ḅọ́rọ́ i dua bẹḅọ fịnịfịnị, anịḅọ ma n ḅọ ḅụ pighibẹm sị n ḅọ mgbẹsẹ sị́ dighi akị sị i dua.
english_text: Then Jesus said to his disciples,“Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, amịna duma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ḅuumabẹm, kụ́ma amịna duma ḅuumaḅọ i sịbị gosi, anị dọghụḅobẹm.
english_text: For whoever wants to save their lifewill lose it, but whoever loses their life for me will find it.

ibani_text: Anị tẹ́ sọ́nyẹ so tumḅọ pịrịbẹ ḅọ́rọ́ n ḅo tuminikiri gbọrụ ma nyánaḅom, kụ́ma n ḅo tẹ́mẹ́ ḅuumam? Anịgha tumḅọ tẹ́ pa n ḅo tẹ́mẹ́ na dima bẹ?
english_text: What good will it be for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul? Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ọ ḅobẹm ọ Daa ma ipine ḅụ na ori sookumuapụ na, anịsáa ori ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́bẹm n ḅo nwángịmáa fịrị láa ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: For the Son of Man is going to come in his Father’s glory with his angels, and then he will reward each person according to what they have done.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, jẹapụ mịnga sẹ́fịnịarịapụ fịịbịgha akị muu n Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma árị ḅoarị ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ.
english_text: “Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”

ibani_text: Súéné a dii ḅọ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs Pita na Jems na pịghị Jọn, Jems numboru owitụ́wọ akịm sị nnị na sóghóló tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ tándị.
english_text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James and John the brother of James, and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa anịị ọ dimakoro nyẹ nna tórúku, ọ tórúku ịrụa bia ḅara biam, ọ suabịtẹ pịghị baá pị́na ḅara pa pị́nam.
english_text: There he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ, Mosis na Elaija págháḅom nna tórúku, sị Jizọs na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị.
english_text: Just then there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, talking with Jesus.

ibani_text: Pita warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, anị ibim ḅẹ́ wa mịnga fịnị, i ḅọ́rọ́ dọghụ a tẹ́rẹ́ kálá warị namabẹm, ịrị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ, Mosis gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pịghị Elaija.
english_text: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.”

ibani_text: Ọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọarị sáá, fíafía oḅuto mgbeakịm, gbẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ warị oḅuto ma ḅụ saghị koro ḅẹẹ, Mịị ị Tụwọ, a ḅẹlẹma ḅọ; ori na, a opuma bieḅẹlẹm, ọmịnị ọ pughu!
english_text: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud covered them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma mịma náa sáá, n sóórókórom kiri sị n tọ́rụ́ iḅoma ḅáláfa ḅụ.
english_text: When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown to the ground, terrified.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ḅo ḅara pa n láamam warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ saghị sẹ, ọ ḅáláfama.
english_text: But Jesus came and touched them.“Get up,”he said.“Don’t be afraid.”

ibani_text: Nnị tọ́rụ saghị sáá n jụghọ arịgha Jizọs siima.
english_text: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị tụ́ndụ ma ọ́gọ́nọ kóróḅoarị sáá, Jizọs bịpị pa n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma ọmịnị arịmáa nyẹ, akị muu Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma n fịị ḅụ ọ saghị ma sáá láa.
english_text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them,“Don’t tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma ọ gbilam, Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma n tegó dugho ḅẹ́ Elaija parị ḅo nyánam?
english_text: The disciples asked him, “Why then do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Elaija karakáráma parị ḅobẹm sị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ karakáráma warị.
english_text: Jesus replied,“To be sure, Elijah comes and will restore all things.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a dugho ọ pịrịm, Elaija ḅo ḅọ́rọ́mam n pịghị o lighilighiḅogha, kụma nnị n ḅụḅẹlẹ ḅara pa ori na ngam. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma tọ́rụ́siarị ḅẹ́ ḅara nna ḅarabie.
english_text: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him everything they wished. In the same way the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, anịị ọḅụduaapụ ma akanyaḅo nyẹ ḅẹẹ Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ gbolomanyẹ anịị ọ dugho nnị pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: Then the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ túminị́ kpo ma damaḅo sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Jizọs damaḅom sị ọ tórúku ẹkpẹrẹkị.
english_text: When they came to the crowd, a man approached Jesus and knelt before him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána iyẹ owitụ́wọ tụ́wọ pịrị. Ọ nụ́nụ́obi kọarị ọ pịghị opuma tọ́rụ́siarịarị. Jẹa sáá anị o dighi fịnịbie soarị anịgha jẹ́ sáá mingi bie.
english_text: “Lord, have mercy on my son,” he said. “He has seizures and is suffering greatly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.

ibani_text: A ọ pa ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ damaḅom kụ́ma nnị ine ọ gwọghaa.
english_text: I brought him to your disciples, but they could not heal him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịnị minini nyanagha silálá sii tuminikiriapụ, a ọmịnị na fịnị tẹ́ sáá láa ḅẹ́? A mịma inema mú tẹ́ sáá láa ḅẹ́? Tụwọ ma akuoo i pịrị.
english_text: “You unbelieving and perverse generation,”Jesus replied,“how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me.”

ibani_text: Jizọs igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm, anị warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅụbie págháḅo anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ tụwọ ma gwọm.
english_text: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy, and he was healed at that moment.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọḅụduaapụ ma warị Jizọs damaḅo kị́nị́ ori na ófórigha sáá sị gbíla, Wa tegó ine anị deesighaa?
english_text: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịna minini opuma ịrụm gosi. A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ḅọ́rọ́ o minini nyánam mọstad sịmgbọlụ ma ịrụ ḅara pa ịrụ nyẹ, i ine dugho mị tụ́ndụ ma pịrịbẹm, Mịnga saghị nwángị anị ngaa muu anị pịghị nwángị muubẹm. Opuma ọ ḅụ nẹ́ngịma bẹnyẹ ofori. [
english_text: He replied,“Because you have so little faith. Truly I tell you, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”

ibani_text: Kuma mị ḅara nyẹ ma papa págháḅo págháḅogha tẹ́ghẹ̄ na ḅurukụ́ma ngéré ḅụ.]
english_text: but, this kind of evil spirit can only be driven out by prayer and fasting.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ kubiri sáá Galili ḅụ, ọ dugho nnị pịrịm, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma nnị ọ dẹrịfị pa túminị́ ḅarabie suabẹm.
english_text: When they came together in Galilee, he said to them,“The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ ḅáabẹm, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá éné ọ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm. Ọḅụduaapụ ma tẹ́mẹ́ warị ḅo opuma sii.
english_text: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised to life.”And the disciples were filled with grief.

ibani_text: Jizọs náa ori ọḅụduaapụ Kapanọm láa fama sáá, Tamunoopuwarị ósó igbii ma daarịḅọ Pita damaḅom sị gbíla, Ị́yẹ́ nyẹ́dieḅọ ọ Tamunoopuwárị ósó igbii ma gbẹ́bịgha?
english_text: After Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two-drachma temple tax came to Peter and asked, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”

ibani_text: Pita pagharam, Innh, ọ gbẹgbẹm. Pita ḅo wárị láa sáá, Jizọs anịị parị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ, ọ warị Saimọn gbíla, Ndẹẹ́ i kóróma ḅara? Tuminikiri ámányánáapụ n tẹ́apụ ḅara ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii na jẹ́ a igbii daá daa? Nna owiapụ awọ ḅara múno sị jẹ́apụ ḅara?
english_text: “Yes, he does,” he replied. When Peter came into the house, Jesus was the first to speak.“What do you think, Simon?”he asked.“From whom do the kings of the earth collect duty and taxes—from their own children or from others?”

ibani_text: Pita pagharam, Jẹ́apụ ḅara. Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Anịsáa mịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ ámáfuroawọ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ na ibighaa.
english_text: “From others,” Peter answered. “Then the children are exempt,”Jesus said to him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wamịnị nnị iganịmabịgha ḅara tọ́rụ́ ma muu sị ị́yẹ́ árị kóróma i kuu parị nji ma akị, anị bịpị findi i pịghị ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ kárámá bẹ igbii árịbẹm. Igbii ma akị sị pa irị na ị́yẹ́ angaá ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: “But so that we may not cause offense, go to the lake and throw out your line. Take the first fish you catch; open its mouth and you will find a four-drachma coin. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ ọḅụduaapụ ma Jizọs damaḅom sị gbíla, ḅẹẹ, Tụọ dụḅaḅá so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ?
english_text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who, then, is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”

ibani_text: Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ kálátụwọ sịm ḅẹẹ ọ sẹ nna tórúku.
english_text: He called a little child to him, and placed the child among them.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị ọ dimagha sị dọghụdọghụ awọ fịnị ḅara fịnị ọ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ine so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọbịgha.
english_text: And he said:“Truly I tell you, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, n ḅo ḅụ siterema ḅo mị tụwọ ma fịnị ḅara fịnị, n ḅo anịị dụḅaḅá ḅo so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, whoever takes the lowly position of this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

ibani_text: Pịghị nwọfịnị kálátụwọ dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, i dakórómam.
english_text: And whoever welcomes one such child in my name welcomes me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ i ḅụ minini dọghụdọghụ awọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mịẹsị n siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ, anị ibiḅaabẹm ḅẹẹ nnị opu nyẹ́gbẹ́ dapịrị pa n ḅo kọngọ kpọ sị n ḅọ bilema tọ́rụ́ ogbo.
english_text: “If anyone causes one of these little ones—those who believe in me—to stumble, it would be better for them to have a large millstone hung around their neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sị ọ pịrịbẹm tuminikiriapụ tegó anị bie fịnị sị túminị́ mịẹarịnyẹ sị n siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ! Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ḅo nyánam, kụ́ma tọ́rụ́siarị fịnị anị ḅara sághị ḅoḅọ ma pịrị!
english_text: Woe to the world because of the things that cause people to stumble! Such things must come, but woe to the person through whom they come!

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ị ḅara anịgha i ḅụọ mịẹsị i siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ, anị pẹ́lẹ́ ḅuuma. Anị ibiḅam ḅẹẹ i ḅara nyanagha anịgha i ḅụọ nyanagha anịgha i ikúlé sị duma gbámásó nyáná, tụ́ma i mmẹẹ́ a ḅara anịgha mmẹẹ́ a ḅụọ nyáná sị nnị i pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama kọrịbibịgha fịnị ma bie gbi sua.
english_text: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life maimed or crippled than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ i tọ́rụ́ pịghị ị mịẹsị ị siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ anị sọghụ si, sị anị ḅuuma. Anị ibiḅam ḅẹẹ i gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ nyáná sị duma gbámásó nyáná tụ́ma mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ nyáná sị nnị i pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama ma kọrịfịnị bie gbi sua.
english_text: And if your eye causes you to stumble, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.

ibani_text: Árị ḅẹẹ i mị dọghụdọghụ awọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dighisimagha. Ḅẹẹ a dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ nna sookumuapụ sámámgba i Daa ma tórúku arịarị sobie. [
english_text: “See that you do not despise one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.

ibani_text: Irị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅom sị a faaapụ ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.]
english_text: For the Son of Man came to save people who are lost.

ibani_text: I tọ́rọ́pa kóróma ḅo? Ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ánáná sọ́nọ́ a si nyánam, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ warị asọ ịrị faá, ori ngịẹ faá sọ́nọ́ a si ma warịsobịgha tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ sị muu asọ irifa nyẹ ma dọghụ?
english_text: “What do you think? If a man owns a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go to look for the one that wandered off?

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm ọ ḅọ́rọ́ anị dọghụ pághámaḅo ḅo, ori opuma bieḅẹlẹ nyáná anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ánáná tụ́wọ ma pịrị asọ irigha ngịẹ faá sọ́nọ́ a si ánáná, awọ ma pịrịbẹm.
english_text: And if he finds it, truly I tell you, he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that did not wander off.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọmịna Daa sobie fịnịḅọ ọ tẹ́mẹ́ sọ tẹ́mẹ́gha ḅẹẹ mịnaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ faá.
english_text: In the same way your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should perish.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ mịná owitụ́wọ i miẹsimam, muu ọ mịẹ isima nyẹ ma pa o die, ọmịnị mmẹapụ ogbobie ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị pughu pughu ị́ ị numboru owitụ́wọ nyanaḅomam.
english_text: “If your brother or sistersins,go and point out their fault, just between the two of you. If they listen to you, you have won them over.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ o mini ị puughugha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ na mmẹapụ akị ịḅụ sua, sị túminị́ ine ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma karakárá nimi ḅẹ́ ḅara mmẹapụ na tẹ́rẹ́apụ na dugho págháma bẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: But if they will not listen, take one or two others along, so that ‘every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.’

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mini n pughugha, dugho pa sọsị ma pịrị, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị mini sị sọsị ma sọ pughugha anịsáa Tamunonimighaḅo ḅara anịgha ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii daa ḅo ḅara pa n ḅo na mịẹ.
english_text: If they still refuse to listen, tell it to the church; and if they refuse to listen even to the church, treat them as you would a pagan or a tax collector.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ḅẹẹ mị tuminikiri ọ káká nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sobie sọ nnị anị kakábẹm, ọ pịghị fiima nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mị tuminikiri sobie sọ nnị anị fiimabẹm.
english_text: “Truly I tell you, whatever you bind on earth will bebound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will beloosed in heaven.

ibani_text: Pịghị jẹ́ pa, a dugho ọ pịrịm: ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri ọmịnị mmẹapụ bịpị pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ḅụ sua binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, i Daá sobie fịnịḅọ ma anị mịẹ ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “Again, truly I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about anything they ask for, it will be done for them by my Father in heaven.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mmẹapụ na tẹ́rẹ́apụ na kubiri sáá ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, anị ngaa a nnị na imi.
english_text: For where two or three gather in my name, there am I with them.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Pita warị Jizọs damaḅo sị ọ gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, a ndẹa sáá pa siiḅụḅarasi i numboru owitụ́wọ pịrịbẹ, ori i miẹsima sáá? Akị muu sọ́nọ́ma sáá láa?
english_text: Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, how many times shall I forgive my brother or sister who sins against me? Up to seven times?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharám, A sọ́nọ́ma sáá dugho ị pịrịgha, kụma tẹ́rẹ́ si oyi findi, muu sọ́nọ́ma ngá láa.
english_text: Jesus answered,“I tell you, not seven times, but seventy-seven times.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị fịnị ḅara anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ ámányánáḅọ ori fịrịnwangịapụ sị kobiri ḅo sị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ ḅara ḅọlọ igbii láa ḅara nimi.
english_text: “Therefore, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.

ibani_text: Ọ nyẹ pa ọrụtọ mịẹnyẹ ma saghị sáá, n warị ọ ḅarabie tọgha tọgha igbii akpa ọlọ ḅo pa ọ damaḅo.
english_text: As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand bags of goldwas brought to him.

ibani_text: Ori ine gbẹẹgha sáá, ọ nyánáḅọ bịpị pịrịm ḅẹẹ ori na ọ taa, ori awọ na pịghị o nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị dẹrị sị pa sáá ma gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: Since he was not able to pay, the master ordered that he and his wife and his children and all that he had be sold to repay the debt.

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịḅọ ma ọ ḅụ́ọ́sịbị ḅụ sóórókórom ọ tórúku sị ḅẹẹ, A ị tẹ́ghẹ̄m kẹ́lẹ́ sáá pa i pịrị a pịghị nyẹ́mámgba pa i gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: “At this the servant fell on his knees before him. ‘Be patient with me,’ he begged, ‘and I will pay back everything.’

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịḅọ ma nyánáḅọ warị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ọ pịrị sị ori ọlọ sáá ma gịẹ si, sị ọ wáriso ọ soo.
english_text: The servant’s master took pity on him, canceled the debt and let him go.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị fịrịnwangịḅọ ma nụ́ngọ pághá sáá ọ ḅo ọ jẹa fịrịnwangịḅọ arịm ọ ḅara kálá igbii nyẹ ọlọḅọ, ine pa fịrịnwangịḅọ tẹ́rẹ́ a akalụ́ igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹnyẹ. Ori o kum sị saghị ọ pụghọ pọnjị, sị ọ ḅara bi ḅẹẹ, Ị́ i ḅara ọlọ sáá gbẹ́ẹ̄!
english_text: “But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred silver coins.He grabbed him and began to choke him. ‘Pay back what you owe me!’ he demanded.

ibani_text: Ọ jẹ́ a fịrịnwangịḅọ ḅụ́ọ́sịbị pa kiri sóórókoro sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, Kẹ́lẹ́ sáá pa i pịrị, a pịghị pa i gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: “His fellow servant fell to his knees and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay it back.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o minigha, anịmanakaragha ori ọrẹ akị pa ikóliwarịbie gbi suam akị muu ori ine sáá ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹ sáá láa.
english_text: “But he refused. Instead, he went off and had the man thrown into prison until he could pay the debt.

ibani_text: Isi fịrịnwangịapụ pághányẹ ma árị sáá, anị opuma nna ḅụ akụmam, nnị warị dugho nna nyánáḅọ pịrị pághányẹ mamgba.
english_text: When the other servants saw what had happened, they were outraged and went and told their master everything that had happened.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị fịrịnwangịḅọ ma sị wárị suu, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị silálá sii fịrịnwangịḅọ i ḅarabie ịrị ọlọ sáá mamgba a gịẹ si ị pịrịm ị i tẹ́ghẹ̄m gosi.
