english_text: “Then the master called the servant in. ‘You wicked servant,’ he said, ‘I canceled all that debt of yours because you begged me to.

ibani_text: Ị́ ine tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána ị jẹa fịrịnwangịḅọ pịrịgha a nyáná ị pịrị ḅara?
english_text: Shouldn’t you have had mercy on your fellow servant just as I had on you?’

ibani_text: Bieoḅu ḅụ ọ nyánáḅọ ma warị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma ịkóli warị fịrịnwangịarịapụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị ọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma akị muu ori ọlọnyẹ mamgba gbẹ́fama.
english_text: In anger his master handed him over to the jailers to be tortured, until he should pay back all he owed.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anị ị́yẹ́ sobie Daḅọ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mịẹbẹ ḅara ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie siiḅụḅarasi amịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ pịrịgha.
english_text: “This is how my heavenly Father will treat each of you unless you forgive your brother or sister from your heart.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnanyẹ dugho faá ma sáá, ọ Galili warisom sị Judiya sẹ párángáa muu anịị isi párángáa Jọdan tọ́rụ ma ḅụ.
english_text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went into the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan.

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ kpo ọ duam, ọ warị n gwọọ anị ngaa.
english_text: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ ọ damaḅom sị ọ daádighi. Nnị ọ gbilam ḅẹẹ, Anị karakárá mọ ḅẹ owitụ́wọ ọ taa sịghị, ḅẹẹ mị ọ pa ḅara ọlọnyẹ?
english_text: Some Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n pagharaa, Na o gogha, ḅẹẹ párị párị ma Tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ma n tẹmẹm owi na ẹ́rẹ́ na,
english_text: “Haven’t you read,”he replied,“that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’

ibani_text: sị ḅẹẹ, Mịma go owitụ́wọ ọ daa na ọ nyingi wárịsóbẹm sị muu ọ taa na gboloma nnị mmẹapụ ma ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ mẹnị suapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?

ibani_text: Nnị ma mịnị mmẹapugha, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ. Anịgosi Tamuno pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹmáa nyẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ anị fófóoma ma.
english_text: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị gbíla, Anịsáa Mosis ọ tẹ́ go tọ́ọ n pịrị ḅẹ owitụ́wọ ma sịghị ábálálá gịẹ táaḅọ ma pịrị sị pa a fịrịma soo?
english_text: “Why then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Mosis ọ warisom sị ọmịnị ọmịna taa sịghị ọ nyáná kụrọkúkúbie gosi. Kụma anị ọkọ fịnịgha parị parị ma ḅụ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm amịna taa sịghịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, tegó a jụghọ na munom gosi sị mú jụghọ yaa, amadọghụm.
english_text: I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ mị anịị anị fịnị deeḅọ na táaḅọ pịrị ḅara anị ibiḅam tumḅọ yaa sọ yaagha.
english_text: The disciples said to him, “If this is the situation between a husband and wife, it is better not to marry.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Kị́nị́mamgbagha ine mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma daakị bẹnyẹ, kụ́ma nnị anị pa pịrịmáapụ ngéré.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Not everyone can accept this word, but only those to whom it has been given.

ibani_text: Jẹapụ kụkọ-pooapụ tegó anịị nnị n yii ḅara; isiapụ túminị́ ọkọ pa nnị mịẹm, isi ngaapụ yaa sịghịmam so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gosi. Ine mịma daa bẹḅọ anị daa.
english_text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way, and there are eunuchs who have been made eunuchs by others—and there are those who choose to live like eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who can accept this should accept it.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa n warị dọghụdọghụ awọ pa Jizọs fịnị ngaa ḅo ḅẹ́ ọ ḅara pa n ḅụ gbánā sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ n pịrị kụ́ma ori ọḅụduaapụ igani awọ ma akuoapụ pịrịm.
english_text: Then people brought little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples rebuked them.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Dọghụdọghụ awọ ma wárịso sị nnị ị damaḅo, pịghị n kikima, tegó so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị nwọfịnịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: Jesus said,“Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”

ibani_text: Ọ ḅara pa nna sịbị gbánā fama sáá, ọ warị anịsáa ḅọ́rọ́ so.
english_text: When he had placed his hands on them, he went on from there.

ibani_text: Mị́sa gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ọ damaḅom sị gbíla, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a tẹ́ ibinyẹ mịẹ nyáná sị gbámásó duma nyáná?
english_text: Just then a man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ị tẹ́ go ibinyẹ gbólómanyẹ pa i gbíla? Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ngéré anịị ibiḅọ ị ḅọ́rọ́ duma sọ bi, ólóghó ma koko.
english_text: “Why do you ask me about what is good?”Jesus replied.“There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ gbilaḅom, Tẹ́ angaá nyẹ? Jizọs pagharam, Kị́nị́ ḅáma, amadọghụma, fúrúma, iruo onyẹ́sẹ ma.
english_text: “Which ones?” he inquired. Jesus replied,“ ‘You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony,

ibani_text: I daá na ị nyingi osii pịghị ị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara pa ịrị na kikia ngaa ngá ḅo ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: honor your father and mother,’and ‘love your neighbor as yourself.’”

ibani_text: Ásátụ́wọ ma ḅẹm, Mịná ólóghó mamgba a koko wárịm, tẹ́ pighi ịḅụ kọọ?
english_text: “All these I have kept,” the young man said. “What do I still lack?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, I ḅọ́rọ́ kpain dọghụ muu i nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrị sị pa igonyiapụ pịrị, anịsáa i ngọ nyánábẹm sobie. Anịsáa ḅoo sị i dua.
english_text: Jesus answered,“If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”

ibani_text: Ásátụ́wọ ma mịma náa, sáá ọ tẹ́mẹ́ si pa sọm, tegó ori opuma ngọ nyánam.
english_text: When the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, anị ḅụdam sị ngọ nyánáḅọ so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọọ.
english_text: Then Jesus said to his disciples,“Truly I tell you, it is hard for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of heaven.

ibani_text: A pịghị jẹ́ pa dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ anị sárásáráḅa kameli pa sị nama ma pịrịm anị alaga tọ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tụ́ma ngọ nyánáḅọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọ bẹ nakaragha.
english_text: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma mịma náa sáá, anị opuma nna ḅụ́gbérépumam sị n warị gbíla, Anịsáa tụọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ?
english_text: When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ́ pa n dighim sị dugho ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ na mịma jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ine kiri ákị́bịghaa, kụ́ma Tamuno na nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sárásárám.
english_text: Jesus looked at them and said,“With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

ibani_text: Pita ọ pagharam, Wa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ warịsomam sị ị dua! Tẹ́ anịsáa fịnị wa pịrị ḅẹ́?
english_text: Peter answered him, “We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, n nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ ịwọma bẹ sáá, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma kpọrọfịnị sáá ori ipine imine ọ́gọ́nọ, ọmịnị i duamáapụ pịghị oyi mmẹa imine ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnịbẹm, sị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ Izirẹlị oyi mmẹẹ́ a túminị́ ọrụ ma pịrị.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Truly I tell you, at the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ibani_text: Pịghị warị warịsomáaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịgha mịná owiapụ anịgha ẹ́rẹ́mịnaapụ anịgha daapụ anịgha nyingiapụ anịgha awọ anịgha duakiri i sịbị gosi, sọ́nọ́a si kiri pa anị nẹ́ngị nyẹ nyánábẹm sị pịghị gbámásó duma nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wifeor children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọghaapụ mị́sa tórúku sọapụ, kunema ḅụ fịnịbẹm, tọghaapụ pịghị kunema ḅụ fịnịapụ ḅo tórúku sọbẹm.
english_text: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.

ibani_text: So ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị ḅara anịị kirinyánáḅọ fịnị ḅara, dede dédé págháḅo sị mú fịrịnaapụ dọghụ ḅẹẹ n ḅo fịrịnwangị ori vainị duakiri.
english_text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

ibani_text: Ori nnị na mininim ḅẹẹ ori éné igbii ma pa n gbẹ́bẹm anịị denarịosi, sị n pa vainị duakiri ma fịrịma.
english_text: He agreed to pay them a denariusfor the day and sent them into his vineyard.

ibani_text: Ésénie énékịẹnyẹ dedebie ọ fẹ́ dẹ́rị ngá múm sị mú jẹ́ a túminị́ arịm sẹ́fịnị sị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha.
english_text: “About nine in the morning he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị, Ọmịnị sọ ọ muu ị́yẹ́ vainị duakiri ḅụ fịrịnwangị, a pịghị ọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ na ibinyẹ pa ọ gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: He told them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.’

ibani_text: Nnị warị muu. Ọ pịghị sima pághám mú éné ógbóo biri na pịghị tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ biri éné baá sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹm.
english_text: So they went. “He went out again about noon and about three in the afternoon and did the same thing.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ a énékịẹnyẹ ḅupiri biri, ọ pịghị pághám si pịghị jẹ́apụ árị pa sẹ́fịnịarị. Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọ tẹ́ go pa mịnga sẹ́fịnịarị éné gbọrụ ḅụ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha?
english_text: About five in the afternoon he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, ‘Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?’

ibani_text: Nnị warị págháraa ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ fịrị ḅụ wámịna akịịghaa, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị sọ o muu ị́yẹ́ vainị duakiri ḅụ fịrịnwangị.
english_text: “ ‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. “He said to them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard.’

ibani_text: Éné ḅo ḅupiri sáá, vainị duakiri ma nyánáḅọ ma ori fịrịnaapụ sịbịdaḅọ ḅẹm, Fịrịnaapụ ma sị kubiri sị nna igbii pa nna gbẹ́ẹ̄, kunema a fịrị ḅụ ákị́ḅọ muu parị fịrị ḅụ a ákị́ḅọ láa.
english_text: “When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.’

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ énékịẹnyẹ biri n fịrị ḅụ ákịapụ ḅom fịnịḅọ fịnịḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ denarịosi nyánaḅom.
english_text: “The workers who were hired about five in the afternoon came and each received a denarius.

ibani_text: Nnị parị fịrị ḅụ ákịapụ ma ḅoo sáá ḅẹẹ nnị nna igbii daakị, n sịm ḅẹẹ nna igbii isiapụ nyẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm, kụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ denarịosi nyánaḅom.
english_text: So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.

ibani_text: Nnị anị nyáná ḅo sáá, nnị warị saghị suna suna duakiri nyánáḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Ọḅụkụ́nọma nnị ákịapụ fịrị ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ anị n pa fịrịnwangị nyẹ, ị pịghị mịẹmam sị n wa nnị na gbasi wamịnị fịrị ma iku dighiapụ ọfịrị ịrụa ma bie.
english_text: ‘These who were hired last worked only one hour,’ they said, ‘and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pagharam ḅẹẹ, Inangwọọ, a ị́yẹ́ inomagha, í irị na mininigha ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ denarịosi gbẹ́rẹ́ éné bie fịrị?
english_text: “But he answered one of them, ‘I am not being unfair to you, friend. Didn’t you agree to work for a denarius?

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ igbii akị si sọọ, a bim ḅẹ́ a kunema ákị́ḅọ ma igbii pa ọ pịrị, a pa ọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma.
english_text: Take your pay and go. I want to give the one who was hired last the same as I gave you.

ibani_text: A kụrọ nyanagha ị́yẹ́ igbii pa a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ mịẹ? Anịgha anị ọ ḅụ akụmaarị ḅẹ́ i ḅara sárásárám gosi igbii ḅụ.
english_text: Don’t I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?’

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara, kunema ḅo, tórúku sọ ḅẹm parị ḅo pịghị ọḅụkụnọmaḅo sọbẹm.
english_text: “So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jizọs Jerusalem muarị ḅara ma, ori ọrẹ oyi mmẹapụ findi ma sị angaá pịrịm sị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Now Jesus was going up to Jerusalem. On the way, he took the Twelve aside and said to them,

ibani_text: Wa Jerusalem muarị, n pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma Dẹrịfị́bẹm igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ḅara, n pịghị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pẹ́lẹ́bẹm ọ sịbị.
english_text: “We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death

ibani_text: Sị pịghị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma Juughaapụ pịrị sị nnị okombo pịghị ọ fom pịghị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ ọ ḅaupálị. Tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá éné ọ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm!
english_text: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Zebidi awọ nyingi árị awọ pa Jizọs damaḅom, ẹkpẹrẹkị sị ọ ḅarabie nyẹ gbíla.
english_text: Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị a gbíla, Ọ tẹ́ nyẹ́ ị́ binyẹ! A warị ḅẹẹ, Mịẹ ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ mmẹẹ́ awọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ị́yẹ́ ámáḅara ngá, isiḅọ ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ.
english_text: “What is it you want?”he asked. She said, “Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, Ọ nimigha ọ biarị nyẹ. Ọmịnị ine a ḅuu dumaarị tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọ́ngọ ma ḅuu ḅẹ́? Nnị pagharam, Wamịnị inebẹm.
english_text: “You don’t know what you are asking,”Jesus said to them.“Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?” “We can,” they answered.

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, Ọ gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ ị́yẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọngọ ma bie ḅuubẹm, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ amaḅara ngá na ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ngá kpọrọfịnị ma i ḅarabie ofori. Mịná kiri ma anị fịnị i Daá tẹ́lẹ́ma warị pịrịmáapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”

ibani_text: Oyia ọḅụaduaapụ ma mịma náa sáá, n bieoḅu mịná mméa owiminaapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.

ibani_text: Jizọs n sị kubirim sị ḅẹẹ, O nimim ḅẹẹ Juughaapụ ma táarịapụ nna bie kụrọ nyanam nna ḅụ, sịbịdaapụ ma pịghị káara kụrọ nyánam nna ḅụ.
english_text: Jesus called them together and said,“You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.

ibani_text: Anị ọkọfịnịbịgha ọmịna ḅụ. Anịmanakaragha ọmịna bie opu tumḅọ sọ biḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅo ọmịna fịrịnwangịḅọ sọọ.
english_text: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

ibani_text: Pịghị tórúku tarị dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ ọmịna ómóniḅọ sọọ.
english_text: and whoever wants to be first must be your slave—

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma ḅogha ḅẹ nnị fịrịnwangị ọ pịrị, kụ́ma ori fịrịnwangị kị́nị́ pịrị sị ori duma pa tọghaapụ sịbị sáá gbẹm.
english_text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ Jeriko warịsoarị sáá tọgha túminị́ kpo ọ duam.
english_text: As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ a Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ asọogbo angaá ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnịarị, n pịghị náa sáá ḅẹẹ Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́arị, nnị ilúghum, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Deviti Tụwọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná wa pịrị!
english_text: Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma igani nnị pịrịm ḅẹ n bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄, kụma n pụghọ sághị ilúghum, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Deviti Tụwọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná wa pịrị!
english_text: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị sẹ sị nnị gbíla, Ọ dọghụ ḅẹ a tẹ́ mịẹ ọ pịrị?
english_text: Jesus stopped and called them.“What do you want me to do for you?”he asked.

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, wa nyẹ́ árị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: “Lord,” they answered, “we want our sight.”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná n pịrịm sị ḅara pa nna tọ́rụ́ lama. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri nna tọ́rụ́ saghị nyẹ arịm nnị warị ọ dua.
english_text: Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.

ibani_text: Nnị Jerusalem na kikia sị ḅo Bẹtịfegi láa sáá Olivu Tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ ḅụ Jizọs nyẹ pa ori oyi mmẹẹ́ a ọḅụduaapụ fịrịmam.
english_text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,

ibani_text: Dugho n pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, O tórúku fịnị káláma ma muu, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọ nyẹ dighi dighi ásụ árịbẹm n kpọwarị nyẹ, anị tụwọ anị ngaa sa, n fiima sị nna akuoo i pịrị.
english_text: saying to them,“Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ o gbíla gbíla, dugho n ḅo pịrị ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nna bim, ọ pịghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anị fịrịmabẹm.
english_text: If anyone says anything to you, say that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.”

ibani_text: Mịma kiriakịm ikiakoroḅọ ma dughonyẹ karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ,
english_text: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:

ibani_text: Dugho Jerusalemapụ pịrị, Dighi ọmịna ámányánáḅọ ọ dámáḅoarị, ḅụ́sitéréma ḅara ḅụ pịghị nyẹ dighi dighi ásụ dọghụarị, owi nyẹ́ dighi dighi ásụ tụ́wọ ọgọnọ.
english_text: “Say to Daughter Zion, ‘See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma sọm sị muu Jizọs dugho n pịrị ḅara mịẹ.
english_text: The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.

ibani_text: Nnị nyẹ́ dighi dighi ásụ akuom na anị tụwọ na, sị nna opu suabịtẹ pa anị ọgọnọ isé, Jizọs warị nna ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: They brought the donkey and the colt and placed their cloaks on them for Jesus to sit on.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọgha túminị́ kpo nna opu suabịtẹ pa asọogbo ma ḅụ isém, jẹapụ warị sị ḅara anyịma pa asọogbo ma ḅụ isé.
english_text: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

ibani_text: Tórúku sọ ọ pịrị túminị́ kpo ma na pịghị ọ duarịapụ ma bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ ilúghuarị, Hozana fịnị Deviti Tụwọ pịrị! Nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị ori, Gbámásóḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅoarịḅọ! Sóghólóḅa so ma bie fịnị Tamuno túmíní!
english_text: The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, “Hosannato the Son of David!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Hosannain the highest heaven!”

ibani_text: Jizọs Jerusalem sọ sáá, ámá gbọrụ ma warị jighe sị gbíla, Mị tụọ mọ?
english_text: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, “Who is this?”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma pagharam, Mịị anịị Jizọs Nazarẹtị ikiakoroḅọ, Galili sẹ bie fịnị ama.
english_text: The crowds answered, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Tamunoopuwarị ma angaá sọm sị fẹ́tuḅoarịapụ mamgba deesi, igbii dimaarịapụ ma opuịkasị ọ sághị iḅomam na elesia dẹrịarịapụ nangwọ ịkasị.
english_text: Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị ḅẹẹ, Nnị gịẹkórómámam, tẹ́ghẹ̄ warị anị n pa i warị ma sị bẹnyẹ kụ́ma ọmịnị fúrúapụ ḅoghuḅoghu ngaa pa anị mịẹarị!
english_text: “It is written,”he said to them,“ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’but you are making it ‘a den of robbers.’”

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ na ikúléapụ ọ damaḅom Tamunoopuwarị ma ḅụ, ọ pịghị nnị gwọm.
english_text: The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma árị sáá ọ nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị na pịghị ilúghuarị awọ ma Tamunoopuwarị ma párángáa ḅẹẹ, Hozana fịnị Deviti Tụwọ ma pịrịị. Anị n bieoḅumam.
english_text: But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple courts, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were indignant.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ gbíla, I náa mịị awọ ma dughoarị nyẹ? Jizọs pagharam, Innh, jẹ́ sáá na ọ gogha ḅẹẹ,  Awọamaapụ na dọghụdọghụ awọ bịpịbie i diemam sị n kpain túmíní pa ị pịrị?
english_text: “Do you hear what these children are saying?” they asked him. “Yes,”replied Jesus,“have you never read, “ ‘From the lips of children and infants you, Lord, have called forth your praise’?”

ibani_text: Ori n warịsom sị opu ama ma bie pághá Bẹtani muu, ọ múno énéḅama ngaa.
english_text: And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ ọ pịghịma sọ opu ama ma muarị sáá, fị́nyẹ ḅo ọ tárịm.
english_text: Early in the morning, as Jesus was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.

ibani_text: O fịgị sị árị ḅara ma asọogbo ma ḅụ, ori anị fịnịngaa múm, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ sịmgbọlụ sọ arịgha anị ḅụ ányị́nyá sima. Anịsáa ọ warị anị ḅẹẹ, Mịnị jẹ́ pa sịmgbọlụ suama! Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri sị ma sámụ́nọm.
english_text: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it,“May you never bear fruit again!”Immediately the tree withered.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ mịma árị sáá anị n ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépumam. Nnị warị gbíla, Fịgị sị ma anị tegósi álála sámụ́nọ.
english_text: When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?” they asked.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ minini nyáná sị tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹgha, mị fịgị sị ma la nyẹ ngéréghaa ọmịnị ine mịẹbẹnyẹ, kụ́ma ọ pịghị ine mị tụ́ndụ ma ḅẹbẹm, So, ịḅụ pa tọ́rụ́ ma bie gbi anị pịghị ọkọ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Truly I tell you, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and it will be done.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ minini minini ọ binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅụ ọ nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sọm, ọ pịghị nyẹ́diearị sáá, igwagwaalaapụ ma na túminị́ ma sẹ́nịapụ ọ damaḅom sị gbíla ḅẹẹ, I tẹ́ kụrọ nyána sị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarị? Tụọ pịghị mị kụ́rọ ma pa ị pịrị?
english_text: Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you this authority?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Irịsọ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pa ọ gbilabẹm. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị págháraa págháraa, a dugho ọ pịrịbẹm a pa mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarị kụ́rọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

ibani_text: Jọn pa mingi saraarị kụ́rọ ma, anị tẹ́ ngaa sághị ḅo? Sobie saghị ḅo múno sị anị túminị́ ḅara saghị ḅo? Nnị warị nna bie anị ḅẹlẹma sị ḅẹẹ, Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ sobie saghịḅom, o gbilabẹm ḅẹẹ, Anịsáa ọ tegó ọ mininigha?
english_text: John’s baptism—where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or of human origin?” They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ ḅara. Anịma karakáragha tegó wa túminị́ ma dighi ḅáláfaarị, nnị kị́nị́mamgba mininim ḅẹẹ Jọn ori ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: But if we say, ‘Of human origin’—we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi nnị Jizọs pagharam, Wa nimigha. Anịsáa ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Irịsọ a dugho ọ pịrịbịgha a pa mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarị kụ́rọ.
english_text: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then he said,“Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rọ́pa anị arịị? Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi mmẹẹ́ owiapụ awọ nyánáḅọ. Ọ párịḅọ ma dámámum ḅẹẹ, I tụ́wọ muu ị́yẹ́ vainị duakiri ḅụ fịrịnwangị.
english_text: “What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam ḅẹẹ, A muubịgha, kụ́ma sáá muu sa ori ọ tẹ́mẹ́ diman sị muu.
english_text: “ ‘I will not,’ he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.

ibani_text: Anịsáa daḅọ ma warị isi tụ́wọ ma dámámuu sị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dugho. O pagharam ḅẹẹ, A muubẹm, i daa, kụ́ma ọ mugha.
english_text: “Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but he did not go.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ mmẹapụ ma ḅụ tụọ daḅọ ma binyẹ mịẹ? Nnị pagharam, Párịḅọ ma, Jizọs warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii daapụ na sẹfịapụ parị ọmịna ḅụ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọarị.
english_text: “Which of the two did what his father wanted?” “The first,” they answered. Jesus said to them,“Truly I tell you, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Jọn ọ damaḅom ḅẹẹ ọ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ asọ ma pa o die, ọ pighi o mininigha, kụ́ma ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó igbii daapụ na sẹfịapụ o mininim. Ọ mịma árị fama sáá sọ ọ mini sii ḅụ pịghịgha sị ọ minini.
english_text: For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.

ibani_text: Ọ jẹ́ kaḅụ pughu: gbẹ́rẹ́kiri nyánáḅọ imi grepụ dipiḅọ. Ori anị gbiri ikélekélem, iru inwima ngaa sughu anị ḅụ sị kúrúapụ ọgọnọ wárị nama. Ọ warị vainị duakiri ma pa ọkọ ḅụ pa duadipiapụ pịrị sị so nyẹ muu.
english_text: “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.

ibani_text: Duasughu sáá ma kikia sáá, ori ọrẹ fịrịnwangịapụ fịrịmam ḅẹẹ n muu ọkọapụ ma ḅara ori sịmgbọlụ daa ḅoo.
english_text: When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.

ibani_text: Ọkọapụ ori fịrịnwangịapụ kukórómam gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ fom, isiḅọ ḅáa, mgbọ́lụ pa tẹ́rẹ́ kárámáḅọ gbi.
english_text: “The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị jẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ fịrịma, parị sáá ma nẹ́ngịapụ, ọkọapụ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma pa nna mịẹm.
english_text: Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.

ibani_text: Kunema ori ọ tụ́wọ pa n fịrịmam ḅẹẹ, Nnị i tụwọ osibẹm.
english_text: Last of all, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọkọapụ ma tụ́wọ ma árị sáá, n dugho jụghọ jụghọ pịrịm, Mị ori ngọ ma nyánáakị bẹḅọ ma. O ḅoo wamịnị ọ ḅá sị ọ nyánákị bẹ ngọ ma akịị.
english_text: “But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and take his inheritance.’

ibani_text: Nnị warị ori akịị ọ gbi págháma vainị duakiri ma ḅụ sị ọ ḅá.
english_text: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ma, duakiri ma nyánáḅọ ma ḅoo sáá, ọ tẹ́ pa mịị ọkọapụ ma mịẹbẹ?
english_text: “Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Ọ gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ anị sii túminị́ ma ḅabẹm, sị vainị duakiri ma pa jẹ́ ọkọapụ pịrị ori diekiri pa ọ pịrịbẹapụ duasughu sáá ma ḅụ.
english_text: “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,” they replied, “and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, Jẹ́ sáá na ọ gogha Tọ́ndiri ma bie:  Wárị námáapụ ma sịghị dapịrị ma anịị mị́sa wárị ma dighi sẹ́ma dapịrị; Gbámásóḅọ ma anịị mịma mịẹnyẹ, anị pịghị ḅụ́gbérépumam wámịna tọ́rụ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Have you never read in the Scriptures: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

ibani_text: Anịgosi a dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma nnị ọmịna ḅárabie anị ákịbẹm sị pa karakárá sịmgbọlụ sua bẹ túminị́ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

ibani_text: Mị dapịrị ma ḅụ sóghóró kóróḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ puu kọ́sịbẹm, anị pịghị ḅụ kóróḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị n ḅọ gbẹkọsimabẹm.
english_text: Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.”

ibani_text: Igwagwaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma Jizọs kaḅụ náa sáá, n nimiḅom ḅẹẹ nnị anịị ọ ḅẹarịapụ.
english_text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus’ parables, they knew he was talking about them.

ibani_text: Nnị asọ dọ́ghụm nnị oku bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma n túminị́ kpo ma dighi ḅáláfam tegó túminị́ ma mininim ḅẹẹ Jizọs ori ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.

ibani_text: Jizọs sima kaḅụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ n pịrịm dughoarị ḅẹẹ:
english_text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:

ibani_text: So ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị fịnị ḅara anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ámányánáḅọ ẹ́rẹ́yáa fị na ḅụ ti kóróma ọ tụ́wọ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ fịrịnwangịapụ fịrịmam ḅẹẹ, n muu nnị oku fịrịma sị igoniapụ ma sịị, kụ́ma n mini ḅogha.
english_text: He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the banquet to tell them to come, but they refused to come.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ ḅo jẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ fịrịmam sị ḅẹẹ, Dugho a oku pa fịrịma sị igoniapụ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ a ị́yẹ́ ti na ḅụ na fị́nyẹ mịẹ karakárámamam: ị́yẹ́ owi kọ́rọ́náma tụwọ na ḅẹ́lẹ́kị sua kọ́rọ́náma nnị anị kiẹnịsomam, nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị tẹ́lẹ́mamam. Ẹ́rẹ́yáa ti fị na ḅụ na ma ḅoo.
english_text: “Then he sent some more servants and said, ‘Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner: My oxen and fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n mini o pughugha sị nwángị som gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori duakiri múm, jụghọ ori fịrị muu.
english_text: “But they paid no attention and went off—one to his field, another to his business.

ibani_text: Kọapụ ori fịrịnwangịapụ kukóróma, nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarị ma sị pịghị nnị ḅáa.
english_text: The rest seized his servants, mistreated them and killed them.

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ ma opuma bieoḅum. Ori ọrẹ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ fịrịmam ḅẹẹ n muu mịná kị́nị́ ḅáapụ ma ḅáa sị fịnị pa nna opu ama ma dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị dugho ori fịrịnwangịapụ pịrị, Ẹrẹ yaa fị na ḅụ na ti ma anị tẹ́lẹ́mamam, kụ́ma a oku fịrịma sịapụ nnị ḅo gbẹ́gha.
english_text: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited did not deserve to come.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị asọ jẹ́ asọ saḅa anga muu sị túminị́ kubiri angaá ọmịnị árị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị pa ẹ́rẹ́yáa fị na ḅụ na ti ma ḅoo.
english_text: So go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.’

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịapụ ma warị asọ mamgba sọ si nnị árịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kobiri, ibiapụ na siiapụ na igoniapụ warị ḅo ẹ́rẹ́yáa wárị ma bii.
english_text: So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, the bad as well as the good, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ámányánáḅọ ma sọ ḅọ sị igoniapụ ma árị sáá, ori arịḅom ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi ẹ́rẹ́yáa bịtẹ suaghaḅọ
english_text: “But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ gbíla, I nangwọ, i tọ́rọ pa mịnga sọ ḅọ ẹ́rẹ́yáa bịtẹ suagha pa? Owitụ́wọ ma ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha.
english_text: He asked, ‘How did you get in here without wedding clothes, friend?’ The man was speechless.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ámányánáḅọ ma warị dugho fịrịnwangịapụ ma pịrị, Ọ ḅụọ na ọ ḅara kpọ sị ọ gbi pa kánákáná ma bie sua, owu na aka túrú fịnị angaá.
english_text: “Then the king told the attendants, ‘Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ n tọghaapụ sim, kụ́ma n sẹlẹakịapụ dụḅagha.
english_text: “For many are invited, but few are chosen.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Farisiiapụ ma warị pághá mú nyẹ pa ọrụtọ sị nnị Jizọs bịpị págháḅo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa dia pa oku bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then the Pharisees went out and laid plans to trap him in his words.

ibani_text: Nnị nna ọḅụduaapụ fịrịma ọ damamum na pịghị Hẹrọd ogboapụ warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa nimim ḅẹẹ ịrị anịị karakárá nyẹ́ dugho dughoḅọ, ḅẹẹ i pịghị Tamuno asọ ma diearị anị karakárá ḅụ, ịrị anị túminị́ suma n bi ngá bi ngá muu muughaḅọ tegó i sáá nyáná túminị́ láa nyẹ pịrịgha.
english_text: They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know that you are a man of integrity and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You aren’t swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are.

ibani_text: Anịsáa dugho wa pịrị, ịrị ị tọ́rọ pa anị kóróma ḅoo? Anị karakárá ḅẹ wa ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ósó gbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ Siza pịrị anịgha wa gbẹma?
english_text: Tell us then, what is your opinion? Is it right to pay the imperial taxto Caesar or not?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ori nna tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ nimim, n pa dia pa o kuu bẹ ḅara warị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ kingi, ọ tẹ́ go dia pa iku dọghụ?
english_text: But Jesus, knowing their evil intent, said,“You hypocrites, why are you trying to trap me?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ pa kọnsịn ósó igbii gbẹarị igbii pa i die. Nnị warị gbẹ́rẹ́ denarịosi igbii akuoo o die.
english_text: Show me the coin used for paying the tax.”They brought him a denarius,

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Mị ọ tụọ mọ n tẹ́mẹ́ ḅo? Pịghị tụọ ẹ́rẹ́?
english_text: and he asked them,“Whose image is this? And whose inscription?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị págháraa, Siza nganyẹ. Anịsáa ọ warị dugho nnị pịrị, Siza ngaa nyẹ pa Siza pịrị sị pịghị Tamuno nyẹ pa Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: “Caesar’s,” they replied. Then he said to them,“So give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”

ibani_text: Nnị mịma náa sáá nnị ḅụgbérépum sị nnị warị ọ wáriso sị soo.
english_text: When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ma ḅụ Sadusiiapụ ma dughoapụ ḅẹẹ fịị ḅụ saghị ofori gbẹ́rẹ́ gbíla nyẹ pa Jizọs damaḅom.
english_text: That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, Mosis dugho wa pịrịm ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ fịịfịị awọ yiigha pa, ọ numboru owitụ́wọ deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma yáabẹm sị awọ yii ọ pịrị.
english_text: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses told us that if a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and raise up offspring for him.

ibani_text: Mị́sa sọ́nọ́ma owi mịnaapụ imi wamịnị ogboku bie. Parị ngaaḅọ taa yaam sị fịị ori awọ yiigha ḅara ma ọ táaḅọ ma wáriso ọ numboru owitụ́wọ pịrịm.
english_text: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma mmẹẹ́ kárámáḅọ na tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá ḅo ḅụ pághám akị muu sọ́nọ́ma kárámáḅọ láa.
english_text: The same thing happened to the second and third brother, right on down to the seventh.

ibani_text: Kunema ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma fịm.
english_text: Finally, the woman died.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, fịị ḅụ saghị ma ḅụ a tụọ táa sọ bẹ sọ́nọ́maapụ ma bie, nnị kị́nị́mamgba árị na yaa ḅara ma?
english_text: Now then, at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since all of them were married to her?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịnị irima irimam tegó ọmịnị Tọ́ndiri ma nimigha anịgha Tamuno ma kụrọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“You are in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.

ibani_text: Fịị ḅụ saghịma ḅụ n taa yaabịgha anịgha ẹ́rẹ́ pa yaa pịrị, sobie sookumuapụ fịnị ḅara anịị n fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: At the resurrection people will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma fịị ḅụ saghị ma gbolomanyẹ na ọ gogha Tamuno dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ,
english_text: But about the resurrection of the dead—have you not read what God said to you,

ibani_text: Ịrị anịị Ebraham Tamuno ma, Aizik Tamuno na pịghị Jekọpụ Tamuno? Ori fịịapụ ma Tamunogha kụ́ma dumaapụ ma Tamuno.
english_text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma mịma náa sáá ori dienyẹ ma nna ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépumam.
english_text: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma náa sáá ḅẹẹ Jizọs Sadusiiapụ ma yaghumamam n ḅo kobirim.
english_text: Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ opuma ólóghó ma nimiḅọ mị gbíla nyẹ ma pa Jizọs daádighim.
english_text: One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:

ibani_text: Nyẹ́dieḅọ, tẹ́ ngaa ólóghó dụḅaḅá ólóghó ma bie?
english_text: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam,  Ikúkúbie gbọrụ pa Gbámásó Tamuno ma ḅẹlẹma na pịghị i biebẹ duma gbọrụ na pịghị ị́yẹ́ kóróma gbọrụ.
english_text: Jesus replied:“ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’

ibani_text: Mịma anị parị pịghị dụḅaḅá ólóghó ma.
english_text: This is the first and greatest commandment.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá nyẹ ma anị kịkam: Ịrị na kikiama ngaaḅọ ḅẹlẹma ị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara!
english_text: And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma na ikiakoroapụ dienyẹ ma mịná mmẹẹ́ ólóghó mamgba ḅụ gbánam.
english_text: All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ ḅo kobiri sáá, Jizọs n gbilam.
english_text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ kórómarị mị Krais Nnị warị pagharaa, Deviti tụwọ.
english_text: “What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he?” “The son of David,” they replied.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Anịsáa, Deviti Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá ọ tegó Inyanaḅọ pa ọ sị? Ḅẹẹ o dughom ḅẹẹ,
english_text: He said to them,“How is it then that David, speaking by the Spirit, calls him ‘Lord’? For he says,

ibani_text: Gbámásóḅọ ma Inyanaḅọ ḅẹm: Ị́yẹ́ amaḅara ngaa kpọrọfịnị akị muu a ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ pa ị ḅụọ sughu sua sá láa.
english_text: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ anịsáa Deviti Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pa ọ sịm, ọ tọ́rọ pa ọ tụwọ sọọ ḅẹ́?
english_text: If then David calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ pa pagharagha, pịghị anị éné ma ḅụ saghị bịpị muu gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mịnị bịpị findi sị jẹ́ gbíla nyẹ pa ọ gbilagha.
english_text: No one could say a word in reply, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ kpo ma na ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị.
english_text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ ma anịị n kụrọ pa pịrịapụ sị nnị Mosis ólóghó ma dughofindi.
english_text: “The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị n bịpị pughu nyánam sị nnị dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ, kụ́ma ọmịnị n daa n mịẹnyẹ mịẹma tegó nnị n diearịnyẹ ma mịẹgha.
english_text: So you must be careful to do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.

ibani_text: Nnị ikúnyẹ káká pa túminị́ abana gbánām kụ́ma nnị ḅụ gbọrụ dọghụgha nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara tụmgbọlụ saghị pa anị dighi.
english_text: They tie up heavy, cumbersome loads and put them on other people’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.

ibani_text: Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma bie fịnị kálá igbe nna angaá nyẹ duḅaḅam, nna bịtẹ bịpịkpọ árị́dírí ma nna angaá nyẹ nángwọḅam.
english_text: “Everything they do is done for people to see: They make their phylacterieswide and the tassels on their garments long;

ibani_text: Fị na ḅụ kiri nnị ịkasị sịbị ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, nna kobiri yọ, tórúku fịnị ịkasị ḅụ anịị n fịnị dọghọdọghụ nyẹ.
english_text: they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;

ibani_text: N dọghụbẹm túminị́ osigha ḅara pa sịbịpị pa nna si fẹ́siri ḅụ sị pịghị n sị Nyẹ́dieḅọ.
english_text: they love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces and to be called ‘Rabbi’ by others.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o minima túminị́ Nyẹ́dieḅọ pa ọ sịị tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ Nyẹ́dieḅọ ngéré anịị ọ nyánáḅọ, ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịghị owi mịnaapụ.
english_text: “But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher, and you are all brothers.

ibani_text: Pịghị Daḅọ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ sị ma tuminikiri, ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ Daḅọ anịị ọ nyánányẹ ọ pịghị sobie imi.
english_text: And do not call anyone on earth ‘father,’ for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.

ibani_text: Anịgha Nyẹ́dieḅọ pa ọ sị bẹ, ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ Nyẹ́dieḅọ anịị ọ nyanaḅọ ori anịị Krais ma.
english_text: Nor are you to be called instructors, for you have one Instructor, the Messiah.

ibani_text: Dụḅaḅá ḅọ ọmịnị ogboku bie anịị ọmịna fịrịnwangịḅọ sọọ bẹḅọ.
english_text: The greatest among you will be your servant.

ibani_text: Amịna ḅụ dighi saghị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅọ sitérémabẹm, pịghị ọ ḅụ sitérémaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅo saghị sóghólomabẹm.
english_text: For those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.

ibani_text: Anị opuma si ọ pịrịbẹm ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ, ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ kingiapụ! Ọ so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ́pọ́ ma ịkasị sọ dọghụapụ pịrịm, kụ́ma ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ mini sọgha, anịgha sọ dọghụapụ wáriso sị n sọọ! [
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the door of the kingdom of heaven in people’s faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm, Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ oḅori pa kịnịsịapụ! Ḅẹẹ ọ fúrú ḅara pa dee fịịmáa ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ wárị akịm sị epele ḅara ḅụ nangwọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ, mịma gosi ọmịna tọ́rụ́siarị ma siḅabẹm.]
english_text: What sorrow awaits you, you religious scholars and Pharisees! Hypocrites! You cheat and steal from widows, then pretend to be righteous by saying long prayers in public. Because of this, you will receive the greater judgment.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ, ọmịnị oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịapụ mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ kingiapụ! Ọ tọ́rụ́ saḅam pịghị ama ama muu ọ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ nyánáḅọ sị n ḅọ ọmịnị dua, ọmịnị ọ nyánáḅomaẹrẹ ọmịnị ọ mịẹsị ori mmẹẹ́ a kiri pa sii ọ nẹ́ngị, warị mịẹsị ori ẹ́kpẹ́duaama ḅọ sọọ ọmịnị fịnị ḅara ma.
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when you have succeeded, you make them twice as much a child of hell as you are.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm ọmịnị asọ pa jẹ́apụ diearị Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ! O diearị ḅẹẹ ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ Tamunoopuwarị ma kuḅufị anị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịnị odoḅala kuḅu fịfịị anị n ḅoo ọlọbẹm.
english_text: “Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gold of the temple is bound by that oath.’

ibani_text: Ọmịnị tọ́rụ́pụ oḅoriapụ! Tẹ́ ngaa nyẹ nyẹ́la ḅa: odoḅala ma anịgha Tamunoopuwarị ma, odoḅala ma mịẹsị anị tọ́ntọ́ nyẹ sọọ?
english_text: You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dughom ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ ẹ́bẹ ma kuḅufị anị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹgha, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ anị ọgọnọ fịnị diepịrịnyẹ ma kuḅu fịfịị n ḅọ fịị ọḅọọ ma n ḅọ kubẹm.
english_text: You also say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gift on the altar is bound by that oath.’

ibani_text: Ọmịnị tọ́rụ́pụ owiapụ! Tẹ́ ngaa nyẹ nyẹ́la ḅa: dienyẹ ma anịgha ẹ́bẹ ma dienyẹ ma mịẹsị anị tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

ibani_text: Anịgosi ẹ́bẹ ma kuḅu fịḅo, anị na anị ọ́gọ́nọ fịnịnyẹ mamgba kuḅufịm.
english_text: Therefore, anyone who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwarị ma kuḅufịḅọ, Tamunoopuwárị ma kuḅufịm na pịghị Tamuno anị bie ngaa ḅọ.
english_text: And anyone who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.

ibani_text: Pịghị so kuḅufịḅọ, Tamuno imine ma kuḅufịm na pịghị anị ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma kuḅufịm!
english_text: And anyone who swears by heaven swears by God’s throne and by the one who sits on it.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm ọmịnị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ Farisiiapụ na mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ! Ọ pa fulosọ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị pẹdiri pa oyia ngaa die ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ngá pa Tamuno pịrịm anịị minti, dilli na kummini. Kụ́ma kụrọ ḅa nyẹ ólóghó ma ḅụ ọmịnị anị kokogha, anịị ibi ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na kụ́rọ sẹ. Mịná ọḅụkụ́nọma nyẹ ma anịị ọ mịẹ na ibi nyẹ parị ngaa nyẹ ma dighisimagha pa.
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices—mint, dill and cumin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law—justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị asọ pa jẹ́apụ diearị Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ! Ọmịnị ọmọmọ ẹ́kẹ́masim ọmịna iru ḅụ, kụ́ma kameli pa sị nama ma mẹnị.
english_text: You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm ọmịnị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ, ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ! Ọmịnị ọmọngọ oju ma na ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ ma oju sịrịm, kụ́ma biebẹ tọ́rụ kpọ na opu tọ́rụ́ pa nyánáḅonyẹ anịị anị bie binyẹ.
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Farisiiapụ, Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ! Parị ọmọngọ ma na ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ ma bie sịrị fiafiama, anịsáa oju ma so fiafiabẹm.
english_text: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sị ọ pịrịbẹm ọmịnị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ, mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ! Ọ fịnị ḅara anịị n sịrịarị pị́na agbā pa taa dupu tọ́rụ́ ḅụ fíafía nyẹ, kụ́ma sughubie fịịmaapụ mgbe na tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ịlọ́lị nyẹ.
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma túminị́ toruku ọmịnị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ kịkam kụma ọmịna bie siiamịẹnyẹ na mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ anị ọ ḅụ binyẹ.
english_text: In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii ọ pịrịbẹm ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ, mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ ọ dupu dapịrị tẹ́mẹ ikiakoroapụ ma pịrịm sị pịghị ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma dupu dapịrị ma birima.
english_text: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ wa duma ọkụ́ma wa mịná tádọ́apụ sa biri, wamịnị n mịẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha, muu ikiakoroapụ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ ọsụụ.
english_text: And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọ ḅụ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sum ḅẹẹ, ọmịna daapụ anịị ikiakoroapụ ma ḅáapụ.
english_text: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

ibani_text: Anịsa ọ mịẹ tórúku muu sii mịẹ kárámá ọmịna daapụ sághị nyẹ!
english_text: Go ahead, then, and complete what your ancestors started!

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ododó na pịghị sii ododó awọ! Ọ tọ́rọ pa kóróma ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ẹ́kpẹ́duaama ma bie ọ sọbịgha?
english_text: “You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?

ibani_text: Mịma gosi a ikiakoroapụ na nyẹ́nimiapụ pa ọ fịrịmaarị na pịghị nyẹ́dieapụ. Jẹ́apụ ọmịnị n ḅabẹm pịghị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ nnị ḅaupálị, isiapụ ọmịnị n fombẹm ọmịna kobiri yọ sị pịghị n deesi ọmịna ama bie.
english_text: Therefore I am sending you prophets and sages and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.

ibani_text: Anịgosi tuminikiri nnị ọ sụụ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ọmbịnyẹ́ ọmịna sịbị gbánabẹm karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ Ebẹl ọmbịnyẹ́ akị muu Zakaraya Ḅẹrẹkaya tụwọ ọmbịnyẹ́ ọ ḅáapụ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, ẹ́bẹ ma na tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma ogboku.
english_text: And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm mịnanyẹ mamgba mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma ḅụ pághábẹm.
english_text: Truly I tell you, all this will come on this generation.

ibani_text: Yei, ọmịnị Jerusalemapụ! Jerusalem, ọmịnị ikiakoroapụ ma ḅáapụ pịghị mgbọ́lụ pa n pa ọfịrịmaapụ ma gbii! A ndẹa sáá pa dọ́ghụ́ma, a ọmịna awọ kubiri gboloma ọbịọ amịna dọghụdọghụ awọ kubiri ḅara anị pamba bie, kụ́ma ọ minigha.
english_text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.

ibani_text: Dighi ọmịna Tamunoopuwarị ma n wáriso ọ pịrịbẹm túminị́ bie ófórigha nyẹ.
english_text: Look, your house is left to you desolate.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ a dugho ọ pịrịm, ọmịnị jẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha akị muu o dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, Nnị karịibimaḅọ anị ori Gbámásóḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅoarịḅọ.
english_text: For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’”

ibani_text: Jizọs Tamunoopuwarị ma wáriso sị nwángị soarị sáá anịị ori ọḅụduaapụ ọ damaḅo nyẹ sị Tamunoopuwarị mamgba tụ́ghụ́ma ọ die.
english_text: Jesus left the temple and was walking away when his disciples came up to him to call his attention to its buildings.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọ mịnga sẹ warị mamgba arịị? A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọmịnị arịbịgha gbẹ́rẹ́ dapịrị jẹ́ ọ́gọ́nọ gbánā ngaa, n nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ suma gbibẹm.
english_text: “Do you see all these things?”he asked.“Truly I tell you, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Olivu Tụ́ndụ́ ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnịarị sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅọghu ḅara pa ọ damaḅom. Nnị warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Dugho wa pịrị, mịma tẹ́ sa kiriakị bẹ tẹ́ pịghị ị́yẹ́ ḅo bẹ sáá ilíghíma na pịghị sáá ma kunema?
english_text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam: Tọ́rụ́ kịsịma sị árị ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ oḅori pa ị sịgha.
english_text: Jesus answered:“Watch out that no one deceives you.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ tọghaapụ ḅobẹm ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Irị anị Krais ma, sị pịghị oḅori pa tọghaapụ sịịbẹm.
english_text: For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Messiah,’ and will deceive many.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ́mụ́ gboloma ḅẹ́rẹ́ naábẹm pịghị ọ́mụ́gbi ọwụ náa, kụ́ma omini ma si anị ḅáláfa dighi ọ pịrị ọkọfịnị nyẹ kiriakị nyánam, kụ́ma kunema ma na laagha.
english_text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.

ibani_text: Sẹ sághị anị jẹ́ sẹ na ọmụ́gbibẹm, amadakiri saghị anị jẹ́ amadakiri na ọmụ́gbibẹm. Ḅuruḅa ḅobẹm na pịghị tuminikiri jighe tọgha ngá ḅụ.
english_text: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba anịị tọ́rụ́siarị saghị, yii ọlọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅara.
english_text: All these are the beginning of birth pains.

ibani_text: Anịsáa nnị ọ saghị pịrịbẹm sị nnị ọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma sị pịghị ọ ḅáa, sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ọ tarịgháapụ sọbẹm i sịbị gosi.
english_text: “Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ tọghaapụ minini ma wárịsóbẹm si jụghọ jụghọ dẹrịfị sị pịghị jụghọ jụghọ tarịbịgha.
english_text: At that time many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other,

ibani_text: Tọgha epele ikiakoroapụ págháḅobẹm sị pịghị oḅori pa tọghaapụ sịbẹm.
english_text: and many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ siiamịẹnyẹ dụḅa wásámabẹm go, tọghaapụ ḅẹlẹma mịnị kụrọbịgha.
english_text: Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sẹ kụrọ muu kunema láa ḅo dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm.
english_text: but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mị ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ibi oku ma nnị anị dugho wásámabẹm tuminikiri gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ sị anị onyẹ́sẹ sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrị, anịsáa kunema ma ḅobẹm.
english_text: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọmịnị árị sị anị sẹ́fịnịarị sáá tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma ḅụ, Tumḅọ tọ́rụ́ pa árị na ibighaa siinyẹ pilemaarị nyẹ, nnị ikiakoro Danịẹlị pa dughonyẹ (goo ḅo ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma akanyaḅo),
english_text: “So when you see standing in the holy place ‘the abomination that causes desolation,’spoken of through the prophet Daniel—let the reader understand—

ibani_text: Anịsáa Judiya ḅụ fịnịapụ mangị tụ́ndụ ma ọgọnọ tándị.
english_text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

ibani_text: Amịna wárị osu ḅụ fịnịḅọ kóróḅo ma ḅẹẹ n ḅo ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ akị dọ́ghụm n ḅo wárịbie.
english_text: Let no one on the housetop go down to take anything out of the house.

ibani_text: Dua ḅụ fịnịḅọ pịghịma sọ ḅo ma ḅẹẹ n ḅọ amịna sua opu bịtẹ akị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.

ibani_text: Anị tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅáláfama nyẹ dighi bẹ fúraapụ na ndo pịrịarị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ḅụ ánị éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ọmịna mangị kiriakịbịgha oḅuu sáá anịgha Juu Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma anịị opu tọ́rụ́siarị sáá, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné túminị́ na arịgha nyẹ tuminikiri saghị sáá éné éné ḅo mị́sa ma láa pịghị anị na gbasi bẹnyẹ ofori.
english_text: For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now—and never to be equaled again.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́siarị sáá ma gbulumagha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dumabịgha, kụ́ma Tamuno anị gbulumabẹm ọ sẹlẹakịapụ ma gosi.
english_text: “If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ dugho ị́ pịrịḅọ fịnịfịnị ḅẹẹ, Dighi mịị Krais ma! anịgha ḅẹẹ, Ori anị ngaa imii! anị mini akịma.
english_text: At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah!’ or, ‘There he is!’ do not believe it.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ epele Krais na epele ikiakoroapụ págháḅobẹm sị opu ilíghíma na ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị pa oḅori pa n sẹlẹakịapụ ma sị, ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ine bẹ.
english_text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.

ibani_text: Dighi, a dugho ọ pịrịmam sáá ma na laagha sáá.
english_text: See, I have told you ahead of time.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, tumḅọ dugho ọ pịrị pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ori aningáa imii elesiri ma bie, pághá muu ma, anịgha ḅẹẹ, Mịnga ori imii, biebẹ wárị ma bie, nnị mini akịma!
english_text: “So if anyone tells you, ‘There he is, out in the wilderness,’ do not go out; or, ‘Here he is, in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ịrụa saghị saghị ngaa ḅoarị so kọrịfịnị ma arịarị ḅara na ịrụa ma tughu tughu ngaa, anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ḅoo ma fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Duá fịnị ngaa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị ẹ́dẹlẹ kobiri ḅẹ́ ngaa.
english_text: Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.

ibani_text: Anịsáa tọ́rụ́siarị ma ḅọ́rọ́fáma gbẹ́rẹ́kiri  Ịrụa ma ḅo kánákánábẹm, akalụ́ sọ mịnị biabịgha; ḅálōló ma sobie saghị sóghóróbẹm, baá pa sotọ́rụ ma pịrịarịnyẹ jighebẹm.
english_text: “Immediately after the distress of those days “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ilíghíma págháḅobẹm sobie, tuminikiri sẹ ma kúrúkúrúbẹm. Nnị tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma árịbẹm ọ ḅoarị sáá kụ́rọ na opu ipine ḅụ sobie oḅuto ḅụ.
english_text: “Then will appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then all the peoples of the earthwill mourn when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven, with power and great glory.

ibani_text: Ori opuma fiearị ọdụ pa ori sookumuapụ na fịrịmabẹm, sị nnị ori n sẹlẹakịapụ ma kubiri tuminikiri ínia ọkọlọbị ḅụ, so ma kunema gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa akị mú jẹ́ láa.
english_text: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.

ibani_text: Mị́sa o fịgị sị ma pa nyẹ dawọ: sị bịpị ma lọghụmaẹrẹ sị áyá ányị́nyá ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma saghị págháḅo, o nimim ḅẹẹ ẹ́rẹ́kụra kikiamam.
english_text: “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọmịna nyẹ mamgba árị sáá, o nimim ḅẹẹ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅoo kikiamam, kikia ḅụ́pọ́ kundu lámam.
english_text: Even so, when you see all these things, you know that itis near, right at the door.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma n gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́sobịgha akị mú mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakị sáá, láa.
english_text: Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

ibani_text: So na kiri ḅọ́rọ́sobẹm, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ jẹ́ éné ḅọ́rọ́sobịgha.
english_text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ éné ma anịgha énékịẹnyẹ ma nimigha, sobie fịnị sookumuapụ ma sọ nimigha, Tụwọ ma sọ nimigha, kụ́ma Daḅọ ma ngéré.
english_text: “But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son,but only the Father.

ibani_text: Nuwa éné anị fịnị ḅara anịị anị pịghị fịnị bẹ ḅara Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅo ḅẹ́ sáá.
english_text: As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Opu mingi ma na ḅogha éné biri ma ḅụ túminị́ fị́ na ḅu ḅụ imi, túminị́ ẹ́rẹ́ yaarị pịghị ẹ́rẹ́ pa dee pịrịarị, akị muu Nuwa árụ́ ma ḅụlọ sáá láa;
english_text: For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị pághá bẹnyẹ nimigha akị muu opu mingi ma nnị kị́nị́mamgba kpọọrọ so. Anịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅoo bẹ sáá.
english_text: and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ owiapụ duakiri ḅụ imibẹm fịrịnwangịarị n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ákịbẹm sị isi ngaaḅọ wáriso.
english_text: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ nyẹ́gbẹ́dápịrị pa nyẹ́gbẹ́arị sáá; n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ákịbẹm sị isi ngaaḅọ wáriso.
english_text: Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ tọ́rụ́ kiima, tegó o nimigha ọmịna nyánáḅọ ḅoo ḅẹ́ éné.
english_text: “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma akanyaḅo: ḅọ́rọ́ wárị nyánáḅọ ma nimim fúrúḅọ ma ḅo ḅẹ́ sáá dii ma bie, nwọfịnị ọ dii kurubẹm sị minibịgha sị nnị ọ wárị ḅaufindi.
english_text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.

ibani_text: Anịgo ịrịsọ tẹ́lẹ́ma nyána tegó Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅobẹm ọ tọ́rụ́ pa ọ dighigha sáá.
english_text: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.

ibani_text: Tụọ mị́sa nyẹ́nimi pịghị sẹ́kụrọ fịrịnwangịḅọ, amịna nyánáḅọ pa sịbịdáḅọ mịẹḅọ amịna wárị bie sị n ḅọ fị́nyẹ pa ori fịrịnwangịapụ ma pịrị anị karakárá sáá?
english_text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?

ibani_text: Anị ibi anị fịrịnwangịḅọ ma pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ ori nyánáḅọ sọḅo sa ori, ori árịbẹm ori fịrịkiri ḅụ.
english_text: It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm ori ọrẹ nyánányẹ mamgba pa ọ ḅara suabẹm.
english_text: Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ anị fịrịnwangiaḅọ ma ọ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo, sị warị ọ ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ Nyánáḅọ álála ḅobịgha,
english_text: But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’

ibani_text: sị warị saghị ọ jẹa fịrịnwangịapụ fom sị iru ḅuu tọ́rụ́ḅámaapụ ma na fị pịghị ḅuu.
english_text: and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.

ibani_text: Anị fịrịnwangịḅọ ma nyánáḅọ ḅobẹm ori ọ tọ́rụ́ dighigha sáá na pịghị ọ nimigha énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.

ibani_text: Ori ọ pa opuma tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm sị o deepágháma gbeere ngaa ma muu ori na mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingiapụ, túminị́ owu sị pịghị aka túrú bẹ angaá.
english_text: He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị ḅẹ́ ḅara anịị na owiapụ nimigha oyia ẹ́rẹ́awọ nna tọndọ ákịapụ sị muu ẹ́rẹ́ yaaḅọ ma na dona.
english_text: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ sọ́nọ́apụ oḅorisọm, sọ́nọ́apụ pịghị nyẹ́nimim.
english_text: Five of them were foolish and five were wise.

ibani_text: Oḅorisọ sọ́nọ́apụ ma pulo akị nna tọndọ pịrịgha.
english_text: The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara, nyẹ́nimiapụ ma nna tọndọ na jẹ́ pulo akịm pulo suanyẹ bie.
english_text: The wise ones, however, took oil in jars along with their lamps.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ yaaḅọ ma álálaḅogha gosi nnị kị́nị́mamgba singim sị kóró múno.
english_text: The bridegroom was a long time in coming, and they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

ibani_text: Dii ogbo n pụghọ nam ilúghuarịnyẹ; Dighi ẹ́rẹyáaḅọ ma ḅoarị! Págháḅo ori na dona!
english_text: “At midnight the cry rang out: ‘Here’s the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’

ibani_text: Anịsáa na owiapụ nimigha ẹ́rẹ́awọ mamgba warị saghị sị nna tọndọ pịghị saghị.
english_text: “Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.

ibani_text: Oḅoriapụ ma nyẹ́nimiapụ ma ḅẹ́m, Ọ kẹ́lẹ́ ọmịna pulo pa wa pịrị, wámịna tọndọ biarị.
english_text: The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.’

ibani_text: Nnị warị n págháraa, Errnh-errnh, wa nyáná pulo ma wa kara sị ọ láa bẹnyẹ ofori. Anịmanakaragha ọ muu pulo dẹrịarịapụ ḅara pulo fẹ ọ ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: “ ‘No,’ they replied, ‘there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma asọogbo nnị muu pulo ma fẹ́ dọghụ yọ, ẹ́rẹ́yáa ḅọ ma ḅo lam. Tẹ́lẹ́ma sị owiapụ nimigha ẹ́rẹ́awọ ma ori na fị́ na ḅụ na wárị ma sọmum. Ḅụ́pọ́ ma warị ịkasị.
english_text: “But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the bridegroom arrived. The virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.

ibani_text: Sáá kẹ́lẹ́ mú sáá, isiapụ ma ḅom warị ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Ḅụ́pọ́ findi wa pịrị!
english_text: “Later the others also came. ‘Lord, Lord,’ they said, ‘open the door for us!’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori n pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, a ọ nimigha.
english_text: “But he replied, ‘Truly I tell you, I don’t know you.’

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ tọ́rụ́ pa asọ dighi tegó ọmịnị éné ma anịgha sáá ma nimigha.
english_text: “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.

ibani_text: Pịghị jẹ́nyẹ, so ama ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị fịnị bẹ ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ́muarị owiḅọ warị ori fịrịnwangịapụ sị́, sị ori ngọ saghị nna ḅarabie sua.
english_text: “Again, it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted his wealth to them.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori sọ́nọ́ a igbii akpa pa n ḅo pịrịm, jụghọ mmẹẹ́ igbii akpa, jẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii akpa, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n ḅo ịnyọ láa ḅara. Anịsáa ọ warị ori muunyẹ muu.
english_text: To one he gave five bags of gold, to another two bags, and to another one bag,each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́a igbii akpa nyáná ḅo owitụ́wọ ma muu anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri igbii ma pa tụ́ḅokọm sị jẹ́ sọ́nọ́ a akpa nyánáḅoo.
english_text: The man who had received five bags of gold went at once and put his money to work and gained five bags more.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị nnị mmẹẹ́ a igbii akpa pa pịrịḅọ ma jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ igbii akpa nyáná ḅo ḅara.
english_text: So also, the one with two bags of gold gained two more.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii akpa nyánáḅọ ma som, olulu sughu kiri sị ọ nyánáḅọ igbii ma pa ḅọghu.
english_text: But the man who had received one bag went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money.

ibani_text: Sáá opuma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, fịrịnwangịapụ ma nyánáḅọ sọḅom sị nnị igbii gboloma nyẹ pa ọrụtọ.
english_text: “After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ a igbii akpa nyánáḅọ ḅo jẹ́ sọ́nọ́ a igbii akpa akuom, warị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ i sọ́nọ́ a igbii akpa pa i ḅarabie suam. Dighi, a jẹ́ sọ́nọ́ a akpa nyanaḅomam.
english_text: The man who had received five bags of gold brought the other five. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with five bags of gold. See, I have gained five more.’

ibani_text: Ọ nyánáḅọ pagharam, Ị mịẹlamam ịrị ibi pịghị sẹ kụ́rọ fịrịnwngiḅọ! Dụḅagha nyẹ ḅụ i sẹ kụrọmam. A tọgha nyẹ pa i ḅarabie suabẹm. Sọḅo sị ḅo ị nyánáḅọ na bieḅẹlẹ!
english_text: “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master’s happiness!’

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹẹ́ a igbii akpa pa pịrịḅọ ma sọ ḅom. Ọ dughom ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ, ị mmẹẹ́ igbii akpa pa i ḅarabie suam; dighi a jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ nyanaḅomam.
english_text: “The man with two bags of gold also came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with two bags of gold; see, I have gained two more.’

ibani_text: Ọ nyánáḅọ pagharam, I mịẹlamam, ịrị ibi pịghị sẹkụrọ fịrịnwangịḅọ! Kálányẹ ḅụ i sẹkụ́rọmam. A tọgha nyẹ pa i ḅarabie suabẹm. Sọḅo si ḅo Ịnyanaḅọ na bieḅẹlẹ.
english_text: “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master’s happiness!’

ibani_text: Anịsáa gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii akpa nyanaḅọ ma warị ḅo sí dugho, Inyanaḅọ, a ị nimim ḅẹẹ ịrị ḅụ́da tumḅọ, ị dipigha ngaa ḅụ nyẹ sughu sughuḅo. Sịmgbọlụ ta kubirịarị, i gálágálámagha ngaa.
english_text: “Then the man who had received one bag of gold came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.

ibani_text: I ḅáláfam anịgo a muu ị́yẹ́ igbii pa kiribie ḅọghum. Dighi, mịnga anị ị́yẹ́ nyẹ!
english_text: So I was afraid and went out and hid your gold in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.’

ibani_text: Ọ nyánáḅọ pagharam, ịrị siiamịẹnyẹ na ịnyọ ófórigha fịrịnwangịḅọ! I nimim ḅẹẹ a dua sughum a nyẹ dipigha ngaa pịghị sịmgbọlụ kobiri a sịmgbọlụ galagalamagha ngaa?
english_text: “His master replied, ‘You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?

ibani_text: Anị ọkọfịnị sáá, i kọkọ ị́yẹ́ igbii pa igbii koko kokowarị ḅụ sua kóróma ḅẹ́, sị a sọḅo sáá a anị nyánáḅobẹm pịghị anị ọgọnọ gbananyẹ nyáná.
english_text: Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅárábie igbii akpa ma daakị sị pa oyia igbii akpa nyánáḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: “ ‘So take the bag of gold from him and give it to the one who has ten bags.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pịghị jẹ́ pa n ḅọ pịrịbẹm, sị n ḅo tọgha tọgha nyẹ nyánábẹm, nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅo nyáná kálányẹ ma nnị n ḅo ḅarabie anị ákịbẹm.
english_text: For whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.

ibani_text: Ọ nyẹ ḅụ ófórigha fịrịnwangịḅọ ma gbi nụ́ngọbie págháma, kánákáná ma bie owu na aka túrú fịnị ngaa.
english_text: And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅoo ḅẹ́ sáá ori ipine ḅụ, ori na ori sookumuapụ na, ori ọrẹ imine ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ kpọrọfịnịbẹm so ama ipine ḅụ.
english_text: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.

ibani_text: Sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kobirịbẹm ọ tórúku si ọ túminị́ ma pa mmẹẹ́ ngá diemabẹm ánánákúrúḅọ ánáná ma fófóoma ḅara oḅori ma ḅụ.
english_text: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

ibani_text: Ori ánáná ma pa ori amaḅara ngaa warịbẹm sị oḅori ma pa ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ngaa.
english_text: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ámányánáḅọ ma ori amaḅara ḅụ fịnịapụ ma ḅẹẹbẹm, Ọ ḅoo ọmịnị i Daá karịibimamáapụ ọmịnị ọla diekiri akị tuminikiri saghị sa éné éné nnị tẹ́lẹ́ma warị ọ pịrị amadakiri.
english_text: “Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ḅuru i tárịm ọmịnị nyẹ́ pa i pịrịm sị a fị, i pụghọ sámụ́nọ́m ọ pịghị nyẹ́ pa i pịrịm sị a ḅuu, irị kọkọ igoniḅọ ọ pịghị i daa warị sum.
english_text: For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,

ibani_text: A suabịtẹ dọ́ghụm, ọ pịghị suabịtẹ pa i suam, a obim, ọ pịghị i dighidighim, a kọkọ i ịkóli bie imi, ọ pịghị ḅo i dighim!
english_text: I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma i pághárabẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, wa tẹ́ sa ị́yẹ́ árị ḅurutarị ḅụ si fị́nyẹ pa ị pịrị, anịgha ị pụghọ sámụ́nọ sị nyẹ pa ị pịrị sị i ḅuu?
english_text: “Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́ sa igoniḅọ ḅara ḅụ ị́yẹ́ árị sị ị sị warị suu? Anịgha suabịtẹ dọghụarị sị suabịtẹ pa ị sua?
english_text: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́ sa ị́yẹ́ árị obiarị anịgha ịkóli bie imi sị ḅo i dighi?
english_text: When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?’

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ ma nnị pagharabẹm, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm. Ọ mịẹ mịnga ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ ma ḅụ ịrụḅaḅọ pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọ mịẹ i pịrịm!
english_text: “The King will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa o dugho ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ḅụ fịnịapụ ma pịrịbẹm, I tórúku ọ sọọ, ọmịnị n sii fị́lā pa pịrịmáapụ, sị ọ gbámásó kọrịfịnị ma bie sọọ, n tẹ́lẹ́ma warị ẹ́kpẹ́dua na ori sookumuapụ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ḅuru i tárịm ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa i pịrịgha, i pụghọ sámụ́nọm ọ pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa i pịrịgha a ḅuu.
english_text: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,

ibani_text: Irị kọkọ igoniḅọ, ọ pịghị ị́yẹ́ akị wárị sugha. A suabịtẹ dọ́ghụm ọ pịghị suabịtẹ pa i suaghaa. A obim pịghị ịkóli muu ọ pịghị ḅo i dighigha.
english_text: I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.’

ibani_text: Nnị sọ pagharabẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, wa tẹ́ sáá ị́yẹ́ árị ḅurutarị ḅụ anịgha pụghọ sámụ́nọ ḅụ anịgha igoniḅọ ḅara anịgha suabịtẹ dọghụarị anịgha obi anịgha ịkóli bie imi, sị ḅárásua ị pịrịgha?
english_text: “They also will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?’

ibani_text: Ọ pagharabẹm, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ mịẹ mịnga fịnịapụ ma ḅụ ịrụḅaḅọ ma pịrịgha nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọ mịẹ i pịrịgha!
english_text: “He will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa, n pághá sọ́bẹm sị gbámásó tọ́rụ́siarị bie sọọ, kụ́ma ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma duma gbámásó.
english_text: “Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnanyẹ mamgba dugho fama sa, ọ dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrịm ḅẹẹ.
english_text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,

ibani_text: O nimiḅara ḅụ, mmẹẹ́ a dii kọm Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kiriakị, nnị pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma saghị ḅọ́rọ́mabẹm ḅẹ́ nnị ọ ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: “As you know, the Passover is two days away—and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma kobiri nyẹ Kayafas pa sị opu igwagwaḅọ áláwarị.
english_text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

ibani_text: Nnị warị tọ ḅẹ́ nnị ḅọghu ḅara pa Jizọs kuubẹm sị ọ ḅáa.
english_text: and they schemed to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị dughoarị ḅẹ́ álálị ma biegha, anịgha túminị́ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighibẹm.
english_text: “But not during the festival,” they said, “or there may be a riot among the people.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Saimọn ḅụkọ obi kọmaá ḅọ wárị fịnịarị sáá Bẹtani ḅụ,
english_text: While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of Simon the Leper,

ibani_text: gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ damaḅom sị opuma nyẹ́la alabasita kụ́nụ́ pulo akuoo kálá ojongo bie, a pa ọ sịbị saram ori opu ịkasị ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnịarị sáá.
english_text: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma mịma árị sáá, anị opuma nna bieoḅumam, nnị warị gbíla, Mị tẹ́ nyẹ igoma?
english_text: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. “Why this waste?” they asked.

ibani_text: Mị kụ́nụ́ pulo ma nnị ine dẹrịbẹm sị igbii ma pa igonyiapụ pịrị.
english_text: “This perfume could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma nimitẹ́lẹ́ma ḅara ma, Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ go ḅụḅáláḅálá pa mị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pịrịarị? A fíafía nyẹ mịẹ i pịrịmam.
english_text: Aware of this, Jesus said to them,“Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

ibani_text: Igonyiapụ ma sáá mamgba nnị ọmịnị na imii kụ́ma irị sámámgbagha ọmịnị i nyáná ḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The poor you will always have with you,but you will not always have me.

ibani_text: A mịị kụ́nụ́ pulo ma pa ị́yẹ́ oju sara sáá árị i tẹ́lẹ́ma warị ị́yẹ́ dipi sáá pịrịm.
english_text: When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, nnị mịị ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa ngaa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tuminikiri gbọrụ, a mịẹnyẹ ma nnị anị dughobẹm sị pa a pa biekóróma.
english_text: Truly I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa oyi mmẹapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Judas Isịkarọtị pa sịḅọ, opu igwagwaaḅọ ma damamum.
english_text: Then one of the Twelve—the one called Judas Iscariot—went to the chief priests

ibani_text: Si ọ gbíla, Ọmịnị tẹ́ pa i pịrịbẹ ḅọ́rọ́ a ọ saghị ọ ḅarabie sua? Nnị warị pị́naḅala igbii sue kịẹ ọ pịrị.
english_text: and asked, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver him over to you?” So they counted out for him thirty pieces of silver.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ saghị tórúku mú, Judas warị asọ dọghụ ọ ḅara warị ọ saghị nna ḅárábie sua bẹ ḅara.
english_text: From then on Judas watched for an opportunity to hand him over.

ibani_text: Yisti Bie Ofori Fịturu Álálị ma parị éné ọḅụduaapụ ma Jizọs damaḅom sị gbíla, I dọghụ ḅẹẹ wa tẹ́ ngaa mịẹ karakáráma ị pịrị i Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị fị́nyẹ ma fị bẹ ngaa?
english_text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Opu ama ma sọọ, aningáa i gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ na donabẹm dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma ḅẹm: nnị pẹ́lẹ́ i pịrị sáá kikiamam. Ị wárị anịị irị na ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị fị́nyẹ ma fị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: He replied,“Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says: My appointed time is near. I am going to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.’ ”

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma warị Jizọs tọ́ma nnị pịrị ḅara mịẹsị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma tẹ́lẹ́má warị.
