english_text: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.

ibani_text: Ḅupiri láa sáá, Jizọs opu ịkasị ma ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnịarị ori na ori oyi mmẹapụ findi.
english_text: When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị nyẹ́fịarị sáá, ori n ḅẹm, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ i Dẹrịfị́bẹm.
english_text: And while they were eating, he said,“Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me.”

ibani_text: Nna bie opuma sim, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị saghị ọ ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, karakárányẹ ḅụ irịgha?
english_text: They were very sad and began to say to him one after the other, “Surely you don’t mean me, Lord?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Irị na gbẹ́rẹ́ bọlị bie ḅara suuarịḅọ anịị i dẹrịfị bẹḅọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma muubẹm ọ gboloma sị n gịẹ ḅara ma; kụ́ma anị opuma sii ọ dẹrịfị bẹḅọ ma pịrịbẹm! Anị ibiḅaa anị tumḅọ ma pịrịbẹm ḅọ́rọ́ nnị n ḅọ yiigha.
english_text: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Judas ọ dẹrịfị bẹḅọ ma warị ḅẹẹ Nyẹ́dieḅọ, karakárányẹ irịgha? Jizọs pagharam, Innh, ịrị i bịpị pa dughomam.
english_text: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, “Surely you don’t mean me, Rabbi?” Jesus answered,“You have said so.”

ibani_text: Nnị nyẹ́fịarị sáá, Jizọs fịtúrú akịm, imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ sị anị puu sị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị akị fị; mịị ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị ma.
english_text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying,“Take and eat; this is my body.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ pịghị iru ma bie fịnị ọmọngọ ma akịm sị imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ sị pa nnị pịrị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba anị bie ḅuu.
english_text: Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, saying,“Drink from it, all of you.

ibani_text: Mịị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ma, nnị pa Tamuno na ori a túminị́ na fị ọḅọọ ma mịẹ kárámá nyẹ, nnị ọsụ sara tọghaapụ pịrịm sị n pa siiḅụḅarasipịrị nyáná.
english_text: This is my blood of thecovenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm, a mịnị jẹ́ pa mịị grepụ iru ma ḅuubịgha akị mú a ịwọma ọmịnị na anị ḅuu sáá láa i Daa ma ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ.
english_text: I tell you, I will not drink from this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”

ibani_text: Nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ boma núme suu fama sáá, nnị Olivu Tụ́ndụ ma fịnị ngaa múm.
english_text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị anịsáa dugho n pịrị, Mịị dii ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba i wáriso sị mangị sọbẹm, ḅẹẹ n gịẹ kórómamam ḅẹẹ,  A ánánákúrúḅọ ma ḅáabẹm, anịsáa ánáná kpo ma bie fịnị ánáná galagalabẹm.
english_text: Then Jesus told them,“This very night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a fịị ḅụ saghị fama sa a parị ọ ḅụ saghị ḅọ́rọ́ sọ Galili muubẹm.
english_text: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”

ibani_text: Pita pagharam Ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́mamgba i wárịso mangị sọ, irị a i wárịso mangịbịgha.
english_text: Peter replied, “Even if all fall away on account of you, I never will.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm mị gbẹ́rẹ́ dii ọbịọ ma na pághá pa ị tẹ́rẹ́a sáá pa i pighibẹm.
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”Jesus answered,“this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita dugho pághámam, Ḅọ́rọ́ a ịrị na fịị bẹ sọ! A jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ị pighibịgha. Isi ọḅụduaapụ ma sọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dughom.
english_text: But Peter declared, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the other disciples said the same.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ na Gatsimeni pa sị ngá muu, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ mịnga kpọrọfịnị sị a isi párángáa muu sị tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them,“Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

ibani_text: Ọ Pita na Zebidi mmẹẹ́ awọ akị múm sị biesii na tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá warị ọ ḅụ ḅoo.
english_text: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị dugho n pịrị, Opu biesi ibie bim akị mú fịịfịịḅara lámam. Ọ mịnga fịnị sị i nana dii ma kúru.
english_text: Then he said to them,“My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”

ibani_text: Ọ kẹ́lẹ́ tórúku muu sa ori ọ tórúku ḅụ bịghịkoro kirilam sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, I Daá, ḅọ́rọ́ ine mịẹbẹnyẹ, wáriso sị mịị tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọngọ nnị anị síí a fịnị ngaa. Kụ́ma a tọ́ọ ḅáragha kụ́ma ịrị tọ́nyẹ.
english_text: Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed,“My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ pịghịma ḅọ ori ọḅụduaapụ árị sáá nnị múnoarị ọ warị Pita gbíla, Ọmịnị mị owiapụ ọmịnị ine gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ pa i nana dii ma kurugha?
english_text: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping.“Couldn’t you men keep watch with me for one hour?”he asked Peter.

ibani_text: Ọ dii ma kúru sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị ọ daádighi bie sóghóró sọbịgha ḅara. Nna tẹ́mẹ́ dọghụarị, kụ́ma nna oju ine daagha.
english_text: “Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

ibani_text: Ori mmẹẹ́ kárámá sáá pa nnị warisom sị muu tẹ́ghẹ̄, I Daá, ḅọ́rọ́ mị ọmọ́ngọ ma nnị ine anị sibịgha ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ a anị ḅugha ḅugha, ị tọ́ọ nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: He went away a second time and prayed,“My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done.”

ibani_text: O pịghịma ḅo sáá, o sima nna arịm múnoarị, tegó nna tọ́rụ́ ikum.
english_text: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị jẹ́ pa nnị wáriso sị muu tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá pa tẹ́ghẹ̄, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dughoarị.
english_text: So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị pịghịma ori ọḅụduaapụ damaḅo sị nnị ḅẹẹ, Ọ pa múno sị ịnyọsáráarị? Dighi sáá ma kikiamam n pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma dẹrịfị siiamịẹnyẹapụ ma ḅarabie.
english_text: Then he returned to the disciples and said to them,“Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

ibani_text: Ọ saghị sị wa sọọ! Mịị i dẹrịfịarịḅọ ma!
english_text: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”

ibani_text: Ọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá, Judas oyi mmẹapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅo lam. Tọghaapụ ori na imi áláápụ́-ágidi na sị ikiḅa ọlọapụ, igwagwaalaapụ ma na ámá sẹ́nịapụ ma fịrịmaapụ.
english_text: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.

ibani_text: Kịnịdẹrịfịḅọ ma ilíghíma pa n pịrịmam: A ku pa ḅoloḅọ ma anị ori, ọmịnị o kuu.
english_text: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.”

ibani_text: Judas dada Jizọs damamum sị sịbịpị pa ọ si, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, sị ku pa o ḅolo.
english_text: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, I nangwọ, i go ḅo nyẹ mịẹ. Túminị́ ma warị sọma tórúku muu ọ kpesi sị ọ kuuakị.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Do what you came for, friend.” Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.

ibani_text: Jizọs na fịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori áláápụ́-ágidi nụ́nụ́akị sị opu igwagwaḅọ ma omoni ḅo biri pẹ́lẹ́si.
english_text: With that, one of Jesus’ companions reached for his sword, drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ áláápụ́ agidi pa anị fịnị ngaa sua, ḅẹẹ áláápụ́-ágidi nụnụapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị áláápụ́-ágidi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fị́ị́bẹm.
english_text: “Put your sword back in its place,”Jesus said to him,“for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

ibani_text: Ọ sị ḅẹ a ine i Daá sịbịgha sị ori anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri sobie ọ́mụ́gbi sookumuapụ ogbo ogbo oyi mmẹẹ́ findi ogbo fị́rịmabịgha?
english_text: Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anịsáa, Tọ́ndiri ma anị tọ́rọ́pa ḅo karakárányẹ sọ bẹ dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, mịị ḅara ma anịị anị pághá bẹ ḅara?
english_text: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Jizọs dugho túminị́ kpo ma pịrịm, Irị alágbā dighi fúrúḅọ ọ go áláápụ́-ágidi na sị ikiḅa dighi págháḅo ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ikuu? Éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ a Tamunoopuwarị ma bie kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ pa ọ diearị ọ pighi ikugha.
english_text: In that hour Jesus said to the crowd,“Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị mamgba kiriakịmam sị ikiakoroapụ ma gịẹnyẹ karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara. Anịsáa ọḅụduaapụ mamgba warị ọ wáriso sị mangị.
english_text: But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.”Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.

ibani_text: Jizọs kuapụ ma ọ pa Kayafas opu igwagwaḅọ warị ḅom, ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma kobiri ngaa.
english_text: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita ḅọlọ ngaa ḅụ fịnị sị ọ duam akị ḅo opu igwagwaḅọ ma warị nụ́ngọ láa, ọ warị ma sọm sị kpọrọfịnị ori na kúrúapụ ma sị ọ pághá bẹnyẹ ma árị.
english_text: But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ na pịghị Juuamaapụ ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ mamgba dọghụarị n pa ḅara ọlọ sị Jizọs ḅáa bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ arịgha, tọgha epele onyésẹapụ págháḅom m bẹ sọ. Kunema mmẹapụ págháḅom
english_text: But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward

ibani_text: sị dugho págháma, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma dughom ḅẹẹ, A ine Tamunoopuwárị ma nụ́nụ́kábẹm si tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅụ sima anị nama.
english_text: and declared, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’ ”

ibani_text: Anịsáa opu igwagwaḅọ ma saghị sẹm sị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, I pághárabịgha? Mịnaapụ ma dugho ị sịbị gbánāarị nyẹ ma?
english_text: Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pa bifiegha. Opu igwagwaḅọ ma warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, A dumafịnị Tamuno ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ i ḅara bim: dugho wa pịrị ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị anị Krais ma, Tamuno Tụwọ ma.
english_text: But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Innh, O dugho ḅara anịị anị fịnị ḅara kụ́ma a dugho ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm: mị́sa ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ọmịnị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma árịbẹm kpọrọfịnịarị Kụrọmamgba Nyána Tamuno amaḅara ngaa sị sobie oḅuto ḅụ ḅoarị.
english_text: “You have said so,”Jesus replied.“But I say to all of you: From now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa opu igwagwaḅọ ma warị ori suabịtẹ kaá si ḅẹẹ, Ọ Tamuno dughosimamam! Wa tẹ́ go jẹ́ onyésẹapụ dọghụ bẹ? Dighi mị́sa ọ kọkọ náa ma Tamuno dughosima ma.
english_text: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rọ pa anị kóróma ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie? Nnị pagharam Ọ fịị na ḅụ́gbẹm.
english_text: What do you think?” “He is worthy of death,” they answered.

ibani_text: Anịsáa n warị fị́lā pa ọ sara ọ toruku sị ḅara pa o fom, jẹ́apụ ọ ḅụrọm,
english_text: Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him

ibani_text: sị ḅẹẹ, Krais ikiakoro wa pịrị. Tụọ i fom?
english_text: and said, “Prophesy to us, Messiah. Who hit you?”

ibani_text: Pita pa kpọrọfịnịarị sá wárị ma nụ́ngọ ma ḅụ fịrịnwangị gbẹ́rẹ́ ọrụḅọtụ́wọ ọ damaḅom, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị so kọkọ Jizọs, Galili ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma na imi.
english_text: Now Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came to him. “You also were with Jesus of Galilee,” she said.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ pighim nnị kị́nị́mamgba toruku, warị ḅẹẹ, A nimigha ọ dughoarị nyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ.
english_text: But he denied it before them all. “I don’t know what you’re talking about,” he said.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọ warị opu ḅụ́pọ́ angaá ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ págháḅo, jẹ́ ọrụḅọtụ́wọ warị ori arịị sị dugho túminị́ ma pịrị ḅẹ́, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma, Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma na imim.
english_text: Then he went out to the gateway, where another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, “This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.”

ibani_text: Ọ sima pighim sị nyẹ kuḅufị, A owitụ́wọ ma nimigha!
english_text: He denied it again, with an oath: “I don’t know the man!”

ibani_text: Kálá sáá ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, anị ngaa sẹ́fịnịapụ ma Pita damamum sị dugho ḅẹẹ, Karakárányẹ ḅụ ịrị nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ. Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ i dẹrịfịm.
english_text: After a little while, those standing there went up to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of them; your accent gives you away.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị saghị nyẹ gbo ọ ḅụ pịrị pịghị nyẹ kuḅufị n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Owitụ́wọ ma a o nimigha! Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọbịọ pághám.
english_text: Then he began to call down curses, and he swore to them, “I don’t know the man!” Immediately a rooster crowed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Pita warị Jizọs kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa biekóróma: Ọbịọ ma na págháa sáá i tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá pa i pighibẹm. Ọ warị pághá nụ́ngọbie muu sị ibima owu.
english_text: Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken:“Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.”And he went outside and wept bitterly.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ, igwagwaalaapụ mamgba na pịghị túminị́ ma sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅo dugho pẹ́lẹ́m ḅẹẹ n Jizọs ḅabẹm.
english_text: Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people made their plans how to have Jesus executed.

ibani_text: Nnị ọfịnam, sị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma págháma sị ọ saghị Paileti Rom Ḅẹrẹtọḅọ ma ḅarabie sua.
english_text: So they bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate the governor.

ibani_text: Judas ọ dẹrịfịḅọ ma árị sáá ḅẹẹ n fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́mam ọ sịbị, ọ tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́si pa ọ pịrịm ọ warị sue pị́naḅala igbii ma pa muu igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma pịrị.
english_text: When Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was seized with remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho, A siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹmam, ḅẹẹ a sii ḅụ ófórigha ọmbịnyẹ́ dẹ́rịfịmam. Nnị ọ pagharam, Anịma wámịna ḅụ tẹ́ nyẹ? Anịma anịị ị ḅẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: “I have sinned,” he said, “for I have betrayed innocent blood.” “What is that to us?” they replied. “That’s your responsibility.”

ibani_text: Judas warị igbii ma gbi pa Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sua sị so mú ọ ḅụ nụ́nụ́ḅáa.
english_text: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma igbii ma tụ́tụ́rụ akịm sị ḅẹẹ, Anị ólóghó ma na karakáragha sị mị igbii ma n pa Tamunoopuwarị igbii koko a ngaa bie sua, anị ọmbịnyẹ́ igbii ḅara ma.
english_text: The chief priests picked up the coins and said, “It is against the law to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo bịpị pa ogbo sua sáá, nnị igbii ma pa dupu yọ fẹm nnị pa igoniapụ dipi ḅẹ́ ngaa.
english_text: So they decided to use the money to buy the potter’s field as a burial place for foreigners.

ibani_text: Anịị n go anị sịị nyẹ, Ọmbịnyẹ́ Kiri akị ḅo mịmgba éné láa.
english_text: That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.

ibani_text: Anịsáa n Jerimaya bịpị pa koro íkia ma ḅo kiriakịm: Nnị sue pị́naḅala igbii ma akịm, Izirẹlịawọ pa ọ túḅo igbii bịpị,
english_text: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price set on him by the people of Israel,

ibani_text: n warị igbii ma pa dupu yọ fẹ́ẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma tọ́ọ ị pịrị ḅara.
english_text: and they used them to buy the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, Jizọs Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma tórúku sẹm, Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma warị ọ gbíla, Ịrị anịị Juuapụ Ámányánáḅọ ma? Jizọs pagharam, Innh, i dugho ḅara anịị anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” “You have said so,”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị gbánā sáá, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pagharagha.
english_text: When he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he gave no answer.

ibani_text: Paileti warị anịsáa ọ gbíla, I naagha nnị pa ḅo i sịbị gbánāarị nyẹ?
english_text: Then Pilate asked him, “Don’t you hear the testimony they are bringing against you?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs mịnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa nnị pagharagha mịẹsị anị Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị nyẹ.
english_text: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge—to the great amazement of the governor.

ibani_text: Mị́sa anị Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ Saḅaḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma bie ọ túminị́ ma bi ikólinaḅọ wárịsóbẹm n ḅo sọọ.
english_text: Now it was the governor’s custom at the festival to release a prisoner chosen by the crowd.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ túminị́ siiamịẹnyẹ go opuma nimi ikólinaḅọ imii, n Jizọs Barabas pa sịḅọ.
english_text: At that time they had a well-known prisoner whose name was JesusBarabbas.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma ḅo kobiri sáá, Paileti n gbilam, Ọ dọghụ ḅẹ́ a tụọ wárịso ọ pịrị si n ḅo soo: Barabas anịgha Jizọs nnị Krais pa si ḅo?
english_text: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, “Which one do you want me to release to you: Jesus Barabbas, or Jesus who is called the Messiah?”

ibani_text: Tegó ọ nimim ḅẹ́ tọ́rụ́akụ ḅụ anịị n go Jizọs saghị ọ ḅara sua nyẹ.
english_text: For he knew it was out of self-interest that they had handed Jesus over to him.

ibani_text: Paileti pa kpọrọfịnịarị sa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ịkasị ma ọ́gọ́nọ, ọ taa mị oku ma pa ọ fịrịmam: Árị ḅẹẹ sii ḅụ ofori owitụ́wọ ma ị́yẹ́ ori na ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyanagha, ḅẹẹ dáwọ́ju dii bie a opuma tọ́rụ́siarị arịm ọ sịbị gosi.
english_text: While Pilate was sitting on the judge’s seat, his wife sent him this message: “Don’t have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma túminị́ kpo ma sumam ḅẹẹ nnị bi ḅẹẹ, nnị Barabas wárịso o soo sị n Jizọs ḅaupálị.
english_text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma warị nnị gbíla, Mmẹapụ ma ḅụ ọ dọghụ ḅẹẹ a tụọ wárịso ọ pịrị? Nnị pagharam, Barabas!
english_text: “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” asked the governor. “Barabbas,” they answered.

ibani_text: Paileti warị gbíla, Anịsáa Jizọs n pa Krais sịḅọ ma a ọ pa tẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́? Nnị kị́nị́mamgba pagharam, Ọ ḅaupálị!
english_text: “What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called the Messiah?” Pilate asked. They all answered, “Crucify him!”

ibani_text: Paileti gbilam, Tegó? Ọ tẹ́ siinyẹ mịẹma? Kụ́ma nnị ilúghú anị ḅara nẹngịmam, Ọ ḅaupálị!
english_text: “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”

ibani_text: Paileti árị sáá ḅẹẹ mị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ori ine kọọ mú sịbị laamabịgha kụ́ma opu ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅoarị, ọ mingi akịm sị pa ọ ḅara sịrị túminị́ kpo ma tórúku, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, A níminyẹ ofori mị owitụ́wọ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅụ, anị ọmịna sịbị gbánā!
english_text: When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. “I am innocent of this man’s blood,” he said. “It is your responsibility!”

ibani_text: Túminị́ mamgba pagharam, Wáriso ori ọmbịnyẹ́ wámịna sịbị na wámịna awọ sịbị gbánā!
english_text: All the people answered, “His blood is on us and on our children!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị Barabas wárịso nnị pịrị kụ́ma ọ Jizọs fom, sị ọ saghị ḅọ́rọ́ma n pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị ọ ḅaupálị.
english_text: Then he released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Paileti ọ́mụ́gbiapụ Jizọs akị pa Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma áláwárị sọọ, sị warị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ gbọrụ ma pa ọ gbiriikélékélé.
english_text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.

ibani_text: Nnị ori áláápụ́ koro bịtẹ siim sị áwụ bia ḅara bia opu bịtẹ pa ọ sua.
english_text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him,

ibani_text: Nnị warị nangi nangi ogunu mịẹ pa ọ sịbị sua, warị ála agbara pa ori amaḅara ḅụ sua, sị ẹkpẹrẹkị ọ tórúku sị okombo dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Nangwọ dumafịnị Juu ámányánáḅọ ma pịrị!
english_text: and then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand. Then they knelt in front of him and mocked him. “Hail, king of the Jews!” they said.

ibani_text: Nnị fị́lā pa ọ saram sị agbara ma akị pa ọ sịbị o fom so o fom ḅarị.
english_text: They spit on him, and took the staff and struck him on the head again and again.

ibani_text: Nnị okombofáma sáá, nnị áwụ áwụ bịtẹ ma siim sị ori ngaa bịtẹ pa ọ sua. Nnị warị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma so muu ḅaupálị.
english_text: After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ págháarị sáá, nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ Sirini ḅụ saghị ḅo owitụ́wọ na donam Saimọn pa sịḅọ, n warị kụrọ tọ́rụ́ ḅụ ọ mịẹsị ori mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma dighi.
english_text: As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Goligota pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa lam (anịị sịbị okporongbo ngaa)
english_text: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).

ibani_text: Anị ngaa nnị iru pa Jizọs pịrịm ḅẹẹ ọ ḅuu nnị ákụ nyẹ pa gwanyẹ, kụ́ma ọ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa anị lama fama sáá ọ mịnị anị ḅugha.
english_text: There they offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ ḅaupálị fama sáá nnị okoḅa gbim sị ori suabịtẹ ma die n ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: When they had crucified him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

ibani_text: Nnị warị kpọrọfịnị sị anị ngaa o kúru.
english_text: And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.

ibani_text: Ọ sịbị ọgọnọ n warị n pa ọ sịbị gbánā ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma gịẹ kóróma:
english_text: Above his head they placed the written charge against him:this is jesus, the king of the jews.

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹẹ́ furuapụ na ori na ḅaupálịm gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori amaḅara ngaa isiḅọ ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ngaa.
english_text: Two rebels were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́arịapụ, sịbị jighem sị wiri núme pa ọ wiri.
english_text: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads

ibani_text: Dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị dughoḅọ ḅẹẹ i Tamuoopuwarị ma nụ́nụ́kábẹm sị tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅụ anị nama, ịḅụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma! Kóróḅo mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọ́gọ́nọ ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno Tụwọ!
english_text: and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! Come down from the cross, if you are the Son of God!”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị igwagwaalaapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na sẹ́nịapụ ma ọ kombo ḅara.
english_text: In the same way the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders mocked him.

ibani_text: Nnị dughom ḅẹẹ, Ọ jẹ́apụ duaḅọ́rọ́mam, kụ́ma ori ine ọ ḅụ duaḅọ́rọ́magha! Ori anịị Izirẹlị ámányánáḅọ! Ọ kóróḅo mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọ́gọ́nọ anịsáa wamịnị ọ ḅụ mininibẹm.
english_text: “He saved others,” they said, “but he can’t save himself! He’s the king of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọ nyánam, ọ pịghị dughoarị ḅẹẹ ori Tamuno Tụ́wọ. Wa dighi nị ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno mị́sa ọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma dọ́ghụm!
english_text: He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma nnị ori na ḅaupálị furuapụ ma sọ bịpị sua wirinumo pa ọ wirim.
english_text: In the same way the rebels who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.

ibani_text: Éné ogbo saghị, sẹ gbọrụ ma kánákáná ḅo anị gbẹm, mị kánákáná ma tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ lam.
english_text: From noon until three in the afternoon darkness came over all the land.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ Jizọs owu pụghọ pa ilúghú pághámam, Eloi, Eloi lama sabasi tani? Dughoarị ḅẹẹ, I Tamuno, i Tamuno ị tegó sị i wáriso ma?
english_text: About three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice,“Eli, Eli,lema sabachthani?”(which means“My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”).

ibani_text: Anị ngaa sẹ́fịnị jẹ́apụ mịma náa sáá, n dughom ḅẹẹ, Ori Elaija sịarị.
english_text: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “He’s calling Elijah.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri n ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mangị muu sapo akuom sị pa viniga iru bie taḅụ sị pa sị ọgọnọ gbánā pa Jizọs pịrị ọ ḅuu.
english_text: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge. He filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink.

ibani_text: Kọapụ ma ḅẹm, Ọmịnị ọ wáriso mị́sa, wa dighi ḅọ́rọ́ Elaija ḅo ọ dụapághámaḅo bẹ?
english_text: The rest said, “Now leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to save him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs sima opu pụghọ pa owu págháma fama sáá, ori ịnyọ bimam.
english_text: And when Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ, Tamunoopuwarị ḅiebegbe bịtẹ ma mmẹẹ́ angaá pa puum sịbị ḅụ akị mú kiri láa. Tuminikiri ma jighem, okpo dapịrị ma warị mmẹẹ́ ngá diema.
english_text: At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, the rocks split

ibani_text: Dupu puu findim tọ́ntọ́ sị fịịmaapụ sághịm sị duma bie sọ.
english_text: and the tombs broke open. The bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.

ibani_text: N dupu bie sághị págháḅom, Jizọs fịị ḅụ saghị fama sáá nnị tọ́ntọ́ opu ama ma sọm sị n ḅụ pa tọghaapụ die.
english_text: They came out of the tombs after Jesus’ resurrection andwent into the holy city and appeared to many people.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ a sị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ sịbịdáḅọ na ori na fịnị sị Jizọs kúruarịapụ tuminikiri jighe ma árị sáá, na pịghị pághányẹ mamgba, ḅáláfa nna ḅụbie sọm, n warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Karakáráma ori anịị Tamuno ma Tụ́wọ!
english_text: When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified, and exclaimed, “Surely he was the Son of God!”

ibani_text: Tọgha ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ anị ngaa imii ḅọlọ ngaa fịnị sị págháarị nyẹ ma dighiarịapụ. Nnị Galili ḅụ saghị Jizọs duam sị nnị ine ọ binyẹ pa ọ pịrị ḅẹ́ ḅara.
english_text: Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.

ibani_text: Nna bie anịị Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, Meri Jems na Joses nyingi na pịghị Zebidi owiapụ awọ nyingi.
english_text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph,and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

ibani_text: Éné ḅupiri sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ Arimatiya ngọ nyáná owitụ́wọ Josẹf pa sịḅọ ḅom. Ori ma sọ Jizọs ọḅụduaḅọ sọmam.
english_text: As evening approached, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.

ibani_text: Ọ Paileti damamum sị Jizọs dua ma bi, Paileti warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị dua ma pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus’ body, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

ibani_text: Josẹf dua ma akịm, sị fíafía pị́na bịtẹ pa anị fịna,
english_text: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

ibani_text: sị anị pa ori ngaa ịwọ dupu biekóróma ori okpo dapịrịbie sughu pághámaḅo nyẹ. Ori opu dapịrị suma pa dupu ma ḅụ́pọ́ gbẹm si soo.
english_text: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and went away.

ibani_text: Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ na isi Meri kpọrọfịnịm si tọ́rụ pa dupu ma daa.
english_text: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá éné, tẹ́lẹ́ma éné ma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma Paileti damamum,
english_text: The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.

ibani_text: sị ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ, wa biekórómam mịị oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịḅọ ma pa duma sáá, ọ dughom ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́ sa a pịghị fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: “Sir,” they said, “we remember that while he was still alive that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’

ibani_text: Anịgo bịpị pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị ibiḅara pa ibima dupu ma kúru akị mú tẹ́rẹ́ dii ma láa, anịgha ori ọḅụduaapụ ine muu dua ma furuakịbẹm sị dugho túminị́ pịrị ḅẹẹ ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam. Mịị ọḅụkọ oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị ma siḅa parị ngaa nyẹ ma nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may come and steal the body and tell the people that he has been raised from the dead. This last deception will be worse than the first.”

ibani_text: Paileti pagharam, Ọ sọọ sị muu gbẹ́rẹ́ kuruḅọ akị sị muu dupu ma kúru ọmịnị ine ḅara.
english_text: “Take a guard,” Pilate answered. “Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị soo sị muu ibiḅara pa dupu ma kúru, nnị warị ilíghíma sua dapịrị ma ḅụ sị kúrúapụ ma wáriso n pa kúruarị.
english_text: So they went and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and posting the guard.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, dedebie éné ma ḅụ parị éné, Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ na isi Meri ma dupu ma múm.
english_text: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.

ibani_text: Kụrọ kirijighe kiriakịm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sookumuḅọ sobie kóróḅom sị dapịrị ma suma ọḅụdaa sị anị ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: There was a violent earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled back the stone and sat on it.

ibani_text: So kọrịfịnị fịnị ḅara anịị ori fịnị ḅara, ori suabịtẹ pị́na so bia ḅara anịị anị biarị ḅara.
english_text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

ibani_text: Kúrúapụ ma opuma ọ dighi ḅáláfam sị jighe jighe, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ fịịmaá túminị́.
english_text: The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma dugho ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma pịrịm Ọ ḅáláfama, a nimim ḅẹẹ Jizọs nnị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ ḅaupálịḅọ ma anịị ọ dọghụarịḅọ.
english_text: The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnga ofori; ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam ọ dugho ḅara ma, ḅo nnị o kóróma ngaa ma dighi.
english_text: He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.

ibani_text: Anịsáa álála muu sị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam ọ pịghị ọmịna ḅụ tarị Galili mumam. Anị ngaa anịị ọmịnị ori árị bẹnyẹ. Mị́sa a dugho ọ pịrịmam.
english_text: Then go quickly and tell his disciples: ‘He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him.’ Now I have told you.”

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri dupu ma wáriso soo, ḅáláfa nna bie imi sọ, kụ́ma opu bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ n mangị muu dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrịm.
english_text: So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.

ibani_text: Buapághá ḅara ḅụ Jizọs nnị na donam warị sịbịpị pa n sị. Nnị warị mangị ọ damaḅo ọ ḅụọ ku sị susi ọ pịrị.
english_text: Suddenly Jesus met them.“Greetings,”he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị dugho n pịrị, Ọ ḅáláfama. Ọ muu dugho ị́yẹ́ mịná owiapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị Galili muu; anị ngaa anịị nnị ị́yẹ́ árị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me.”

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma nna muunyẹ muarị sáá, kúrúapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ opu ama bie ma sọm sị muu dugho igwagwaalaapụ ma pịrịm pághányẹ mamgba.
english_text: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma na donafáma sáá sị bịpị pa ogbo sua, nnị opu igbii pa ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma pịrịm
english_text: When the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,

ibani_text: dugho nnị pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, O dughobẹm ḅẹẹ ori ọḅụduaapụ dibie ḅo ofuruakim o múnoarị sáá!
english_text: telling them, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma muu Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma biri láa láa, wa mịẹbẹm sị ori anị miniakị ḅẹẹ, ọ mịẹnyẹ ofori, wa minibịgha sị ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma warị igbii ma daakị si mịẹ n dugho ḅara. Mịị lụghụ ma nnị anị dugho wásámam Juuapụ ma ogbobie ḅoo mịmgba éné ma láa.
english_text: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.

ibani_text: Anịsáa oyi ngịẹ ọḅụduaapụ ma warị Galili mú sị Jizọs dugho n pịrị tụ́ndụ ma fịnị ngaa muu.
english_text: Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.

ibani_text: Nnị ori árị sáá, nnị susi ọ pịrịm, kụ́ma jẹ́apụ tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ nyánam.
english_text: When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị n damaḅo si ḅẹẹ, Kụ́rọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sobie na kiribie nnị pa i pịrịmam.
english_text: Then Jesus came to them and said,“All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ muu sị nnị pa ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ mịẹ, mingi pa n saraarị Daḅọ ma ẹ́rẹẹ́ ḅụ, na pịghị Tụwọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Pịghị a tọ́ọ ọ pịrịmaá nyẹ mamgba pa n diearị. Karakárányẹ, a pịghị ọmịnị na imi sámámgba, akị muu tuminikiri ma kunema sáá.
english_text: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.”

ibani_text: Mịị anịị Jizọs Krais Tamuno Tụ́wọ gboloma ibi oku.
english_text: The beginning of the good news about Jesus the Messiah,the Son of God,

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara ikiakoro Aizaya diri ḅụ, ḅẹẹ, Dighi a tarị tarị ị́yẹ́ oku muḅọ fịrịmaarị ị́yẹ́ asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma bẹḅọ.
english_text: as it is written in Isaiah the prophet: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way”—

ibani_text: A pụghọ naam ilúghuarịnyẹ elesiri ḅụ, ḅẹẹ, Asọ ma tẹ́lẹ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị, gbụ́nụ́nụ́ asọ mịẹ ọ pịrịị.
english_text: “a voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.’ ”

ibani_text: Jọn elesiri ma ḅụ saghị págháḅo sị mingi saraarị pịghị dugho wásámaarị ḅẹẹ, Ọ sii ḅụ pịghị sị mingi sara, anịsáa Tamuno ọ mịẹ sii warịsó ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

ibani_text: Tọghaapụ Judiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ na pịghị Jerusalem opu ama ḅụ págháḅo Jọn pughum. Nnị nna sii kiẹm, ọ warị pịghị mingi pa nnị sara Jọdan Tọ́rụ ḅụ.
english_text: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

ibani_text: Jọn suabịtẹ anịị nnị kameli pa sị nama osuka pa dori bịtẹ, ọ pịghị nnị nama apara pa mịẹ fanti nyanam ọ pa ọ kundu kpọ nyẹ, ori fị́nyẹ anịị ápịrịgbánị na ịwọ akamapulo.
english_text: John wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

ibani_text: O dugho wásáma túminị́ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ ọḅụdụ ḅo bẹ owitụ́wọ ma ori opuma dụḅa i nẹngịm. A laagha sị tughu ọ sua agbaa fị́ma.
english_text: And this was his message: “After me comes the one more powerful than I, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.

ibani_text: Irị mingi anịị a pa ọ sárá nyẹ, kụ́ma ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa mingi pa ọ sárábẹm.
english_text: I baptize you withwater, but he will baptize you withthe Holy Spirit.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ. Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghịḅom Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnịngaa nyẹ. Jọn warị mingi pa ọ sara, Jọdan tọ́rụ́ ma ḅụ.
english_text: At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

ibani_text: Jizọs mingi ma bie saghị págháḅo gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, o so arịm anị findi sáá sị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma arịị anị ọ ḅụ ḅo gbánāarị elesia ḅara ma.
english_text: Just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ warị sobie saghị kóróḅo, ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị a ḅẹlẹma Tụ́wọ ma, a ị dighi bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị o dighi elesiri sọọ,
english_text: At once the Spirit sent him out into the wilderness,

ibani_text: Ọ warị anị angaá dii a mmẹẹ́ si fịnị, Satanị warị ọ daádighi. Pirinama sọ anị angaá ma ḅụ imi, kụ́ma sookumuapụ so, ḅom sị ḅárásua ọ pịrịm.
english_text: and he was in the wilderness forty days, being temptedby Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.

ibani_text: Nnị Jọn pa ịkóli bie sua fama sáá, Jizọs Galili muum sị Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo ibi oku ma dugho wásámam.
english_text: After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Sáá ma láamam, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma kikiamam! Ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ pịghị sị ibi oku ma minini!
english_text: “The time has come,”he said.“The kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe the good news!”

ibani_text: Jizọs Galili posie aka ḅụ nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị sáá, o ḅoo mmẹẹ́ nji ḅáapụ arịm, Saimọn na o numboru owitụ́wọ Anduru, ịgbọ pa nji kuuarị.
english_text: As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị i dua, a ọ diebẹm ọ ḅára warị túminị́ kuu bẹ ḅara.
english_text: “Come, follow me,”Jesus said,“and I will send you out to fish for people.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri nnị nna ịgbọ warisom sị o duam.
english_text: At once they left their nets and followed him.

ibani_text: O ḅo kẹ́lẹ́ tórúku muu sáá, o ḅoo jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ amịna owiapụ arịm Jems na Jọn, Zebidi awọ. Nnị náa árụ́ bie imii ịgbọ tẹ́lẹ́maarị.
english_text: When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.

ibani_text: Jizọs nna árị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, ori n sịịm n warị nna daa Zebidi na nnị ọkọ fịrịnwangịapụ ma wáriso árụ́ ma bie warị Jizọs dua.
english_text: Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ Kapanọm ama sọḅom warị mmẹẹ́ kárámá Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅụ nna kobiri yọ ma sọm sị saghị nyẹ́die.
english_text: They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅára warị nyẹ ma die ḅara ma túminị́ ma tọ́rụ nẹngịm, ori nna ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ kịkagha kụ́ma kụ́rọ nyánáḅọ ḅara ma, anị ọ pa nyẹ́die nyẹẹ.
english_text: The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnịḅọ Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọm sị otume kpasị ilúghú ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out,

ibani_text: Jizọs, Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, ị wámịna ḅụ tẹ́ dọghụ? I ḅo wa guluguluma go ḅoo? A i nimim, ịrị anịị Tamuno tọ́ntọ́ oku muuḅọ!
english_text: “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Yaghúu fịnị, sị ori oju bie saghị págháḅo!
english_text: “Be quiet!”said Jesus sternly.“Come out of him!”

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị owitụ́wọ ma kuu sị kụ́rọ ma o jighe warị otume kpasị ibima ilúghú, warị owitụ́wọ ma bie págháḅom.
english_text: The impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.

ibani_text: Mịẹnyẹ túminị́ mamgba tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm n warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, Mị tẹ́ nyẹ mọ? Mị anị jẹ́ ịwọ die nyẹ? Mị owitụ́wọ ma ọ kụ́rọ nyáná sị igani sitẹ́mẹ́ pịrịm sị n pịghị o bịpị pughum!
english_text: The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching—and with authority! He even gives orders to impure spirits and they obey him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs gboloma ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma, warị kaa wásáma Galili ḅẹrẹtọ angaá mamgba bi.
english_text: News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ na pịghị Jems na Jọn Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma warisom sị gbẹ́rẹ́sa nwángị Saimọn na Anduru warị sọọ.
english_text: As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.

ibani_text: Saimọn taa nyingi ḅụ ibighaa owi ọfịrị á kum sị a múnonyẹ ọgọnọ ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị, Jizọs anị angaá láa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, nnị a gbólómanyẹ dugho ọ pịrịm.
english_text: Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they immediately told Jesus about her.

ibani_text: Ọ warị sọma a fịnị angaá mú, warị ḅara pa árị ọlọ saghị ma, ọfịrị ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri a warisom, a warị igoni pa nnị kọọ.
english_text: So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.

ibani_text: Anị ḅupiri láamam, ịrụa ma sọ bimam, túminị́ warị obiarịapụ mamgba taa Jizọs fịnị angaá ḅoo, na pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ oju bie fịnịapụ.
english_text: That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.

ibani_text: Ama bieapụ mamgba warị wárị ma tórúku kobiri.
english_text: The whole town gathered at the door,

ibani_text: Jizọs warị tọgha kirikiri obi kọọapụ gwọọ, sị pịghị tọgha sitẹ́mẹ́ deesi. Ọmịnị sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịghaa sị nnị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ dugho, tegó nnị ibima o nimim.
english_text: and Jesus healed many who had various diseases. He also drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné baá, dedefụfụ ḅụ éné ma náa findi sọ findigha sáá, Jizọs warị saghị sị wárị ma wáriso. Ori ámá bie ma warisom sị kị́nị́ ófórigha angaá múm o muu tẹ́ghẹ̄ angaá.
english_text: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Saimọn náa ọ nana anị angaá fịnịapụ pághá mú ọ dọghụarị,
english_text: Simon and his companions went to look for him,

ibani_text: n ḅoo ori árị sáá, n dughom ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́mamgba i dọghụarị.
english_text: and when they found him, they exclaimed: “Everyone is looking for you!”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs n pagharam ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị wánáná kikia jẹ́ jẹ́ kálá ámá ma muubẹm sị a ine anị ngaa sọ ibi oku ma dugho wásáma, tegó, anịị a go ḅoo nyẹ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Let us go somewhere else—to the nearby villages—so I can preach there also. That is why I have come.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị Galili ama ama gbọrụ ma mú ikelema, nna kobiri yọ ma ḅụ ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị sị pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị.
english_text: So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfáma oju apara obi kọọarị owitụ́wọ Jizọs damaḅom, warị ẹkpẹrẹkị sị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ, ọ ḅárásua ọ pịrịị, ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị ḅọ́rọ́ mini bẹ, ị ine mịẹbẹm sị a fíafía.
english_text: A man with leprosycame to him and begged him on his knees, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅo opuma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ọ pịrị, warị ḅara sụghụma ọ láama ḅẹẹ, A minim, ị́yẹ́ oju fiafiaa.
english_text: Jesus was indignant.He reached out his hand and touched the man.“I am willing,”he said.“Be clean!”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri obi ma owitụ́wọ ma warisom, ori oju warị fíafía
english_text: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị kụrọma o birinụ́nụ́, warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ọ fịrịma soo,
english_text: Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:

ibani_text: ọ dugho ọ pịrị fama sáá, ḅẹẹ, Pughu, árị ḅẹẹ, ị dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịgha. Kụ́ma dada igwagwaḅọ ma dámámuu, sị ori ị péghéle dighi; kị́nị́mamgba nimi bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ ị gwọmam, sị Mosis tọ́ọ kóróma ọ pịrị igwa ma gwáa.
english_text: “See that you don’t tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ma sọm sị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho gálágálámam ngaa mamgba ḅụ. Ori opuma Jizọs ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámám sị Jizọs mịnị ine ámá ma sọgha ḅọghugha pa. Tụ́ma, ọ kị́nị́ ófórigha angaá ḅụ fịnịm, túminị́ warị pịghị ọ damaḅo ngaa mamgba.
english_text: Instead he went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet the people still came to him from everywhere.

ibani_text: Dii ḅoo kẹ́lẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs pịghịma Kapanọm ḅom, dughonyẹ ma warị kaa wasa ḅẹ́ Jizọs wárị imii.
english_text: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.

ibani_text: Tọghaapụ ḅo kobirim sị ḅụọ kóróma angaá mịnị ofori, ḅụ́pọ́ ma tórúku ḅụ sọ Jizọs ibi oku ma dugho wásáma n pịrịarị.
english_text: They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them.

ibani_text: Ínia owiapụ awọ, ḅara na ḅụọ fịị owitụ́wọ dighi Jizọs damaḅom.
english_text: Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma gosi, nnị ine owitụ́wọ ma pa ọ fịnị angaá laagha. Nnị warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa fooma osu ma ọgọnọ Jizọs dada kpọrọfịnị ngaa ma, nnị fóo angaá miẹpágháma ḅoo sáá, nnị warị owitụ́wọ ma kóróma ọ ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị angaá ori múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on.

ibani_text: Jizọs nna minini láa ḅara árị sáá, Jizọs ḅụọ na ḅara fịịḅọ ma ḅẹm, I tụ́wọ nnị ị́yẹ́ siiḅụḅarasi ị pịrịmam.
english_text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man,“Son, your sins are forgiven.”

ibani_text: Anị ngaa kpọrọfịnị fịnị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ warị saghị sịbịbie kịẹ anị pịrị,
english_text: Now some teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,

ibani_text: O tegó sị nwọfịnị ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarị? Mịma anịị wiri núme pa Tamuno wiri! Tamuno ngéré anị ine siiḅụḅarasi kị́nị́ pịrịbẹḅọ!
english_text: “Why does this fellow talk like that? He’s blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri Jizọs nimim tẹ́mẹ́bie nnị kórómaarị nyẹ, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegó ọkọfịnịnyẹ kórómaarị?
english_text: Immediately Jesus knew in his spirit that this was what they were thinking in their hearts, and he said to them,“Why are you thinking these things?

ibani_text: Tẹ́ sárásáráḅa, ḅụọ fịị, ḅara fịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹ ḅẹẹ, Nnị ị́yẹ́ sii wáriso ị pịrịmam anịgha ḅẹẹ, Saghị, ị́yẹ́ ibila iko akị si, nwángịị?
english_text: Which is easier: to say to this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your mat and walk’?

ibani_text: A mịẹbẹm sị ị akanyaḅo ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma, kụ́rọ nyanam tuminikiri sị, siiḅụḅarasi túminị́ pịrị. Ọ warị ḅụọ fịị ḅára fịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ,
english_text: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.”So he said to the man,

ibani_text: A dugho ị pịrịm, saghịị, ị́yẹ́ ibila saghị akị sị soo warị muu!
english_text: “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba dighiarị sáá, owitụ́wọ ma saghịm, ori ibila saghị akị, warị álála nwángị soo. Nnị kị́nị́mamgba nnị árịnyẹ n tọ́rụ nẹngịm, n warị Tamuno túmíní ḅẹẹ, Jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné, na wa mị nyẹ ḅara arịgha!
english_text: He got up, took his mat and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”

ibani_text: Jizọs sima Galili posie aka ma múm. Túminị́ kpo warị ọ damaḅoo, ọ warị saghị nyẹ pa n die.
english_text: Once again Jesus went out beside the lake. A large crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.

ibani_text: O nwángịma muarị sa, o ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ ósó igbii biiḅọ na donam, Livai, Alịfịyọs tụ́wọ okpọrọfịnịarị ọrẹ fịrịnwangị wárị ḅụ. Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, I dua. Livai warị saghị ọ dua.
english_text: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s booth.“Follow me,”Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo kẹ́lẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs nyẹ́fịarị Livai warị ḅụ. Tọgha tọgha ósó igbii biiapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ Jizọs duarị, nna ḅụ tọghaapụ na ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ, o dua nyẹ ma fịịm.
english_text: While Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma nyẹ́dieapụ ma, nna ḅụ Farisiiapụ ma ḅo arịm ḅẹ́ Jizọs siiamịẹnyẹapụ ma na ósó igbii biiapụ ma na nyẹ́fịarị, n warị ori ọḅụduaapụ gbíla, ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegó mịnaapụ ma dua nyẹ́fịarị?
english_text: When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

ibani_text: Jizọs naam warị n págháraa ḅẹẹ, Oju kụrọapụ bịrịḅọ dọghụgha, kụ́ma obiapụ ngéré. A ḅoo ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sịghaa kụ́ma siiamịẹnyẹapụ.
english_text: On hearing this, Jesus said to them,“It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri Jọn dua nwángịapụ na Farisiiapụ ma ḅurukumáarị. Jẹ́apụ warị Jizọs damaḅoo sị o gbíla ḅẹ́, O tegó sị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ na pịghị Farisiiapụ ma duaarịapụ ma ḅurukụ́ma, kuma ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma mini ḅurukụmagha?
english_text: Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and asked Jesus, “How is it that John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees are fasting, but yours are not?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, O bii ḅẹẹ ọmịna igoniapụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa ma ḅụ papa furo pa soo? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori! Ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaaḅọ ma nnị na fịnị sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị ḅurukụ́ma na ibighaa.
english_text: Jesus answered,“How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma éné ḅoobẹm nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaaḅọ sịịakị bẹ sáá n ḅárabie, anịsáa, nnị ḅurukụ́mabẹm.
english_text: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ iwọbịtẹ pa olom bịtẹ na tịrọ tịrọgha, tegó ịwọ bịtẹ ma ḅo kpándubẹm sị kẹ́lẹ́ jẹ́ a olom bịtẹ ma kaakị sị mịẹsị kaa angaá ma ḅoo opuma fịoḅaa.
english_text: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.

ibani_text: Anịgha nnị ịwọ iru pa olom iru ólóló bie sua sua? Tegó iru ma ólóló ma ḅaabẹm, anịsáa iru ma na ólóló ma na ḅo papáfam. Tụ́ma, ịwọ iru pa ịwọ ólóló bie sua.
english_text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Ịnyọsára Éné Jizọs n pa fịtúrú mịẹarị sịmgbọlụ dua ḅụ nwangịḅọ́rọ́arị. Ori ọḅụduaapụ ọ nana mị nwángị ma kọọarị sáá, n warị saghị fịtúrú ma sịmgbọlụ ma sịbị kiẹnị.
english_text: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Dighi anị wamịna ólóghó na karakáragha ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ mịị nyẹ ma mịẹm Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ!
english_text: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Na ọ naagha Deviti mịẹnyẹ, fị́nyẹ ọ tarị sáá, ori na ori a túminị́ na,
english_text: He answered,“Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?

ibani_text: ọ Tamuno wárị ma sọmum sị nnị saghị Tamuno pịrị fịtúrú ma fịm. Mịẹnyẹ ma kiriakịm Abiata opu igwagwaḅọ kiri ḅụ fịnị sáá. Wamịna ólóghó ma fịnị ḅara ḅụ igwagwaapụ ma ngéré anịị ine mị fịtúrú ma fị bẹapụ kụ́ma Deviti anị fịm warị pịghị jẹa nyẹ pa ori a túminị́ pịrị.
english_text: In the days of Abiathar the high priest, he entered the house of God and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị anị dugho kunema, Dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma túminị́ ibi goo anịị n goo anị mịẹnyẹ; n túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma pịrịgha.
english_text: Then he said to them,“The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

ibani_text: Anịgo Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma ori sịbịdaa Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma pịrịm.
english_text: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara fịbịrịmaa owitụ́wọ fịnịngaa.
english_text: Another time Jesus went into the synagogue, and a man with a shriveled hand was there.

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ anị ngaa imii Jizọs dughosima dọghụapụ ḅẹẹ o siinyẹ mịẹm; nnị warị kikiafịnị sị ọ dighi, ḅọ́rọ́ ori ọ gwọọ bẹ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: Some of them were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath.

ibani_text: Jizọs owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́m, Saghị tórúku ḅo.
english_text: Jesus said to the man with the shriveled hand,“Stand up in front of everyone.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị túminị́ ma gbíla, Wamịnị ólóghó ma anị mini ḅẹ́ wa tẹ́ mịẹ Ịnyọsára Éné ma? Ḅárásua tumḅọ pịrị anịgha nyẹ pa kịnịlama? Tumḅọ duma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma anịgha anị guluguluma? Kụ́ma nnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ dughogha.
english_text: Then Jesus asked them,“Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?”But they remained silent.

ibani_text: Jizọs bie akụm, ọ tọ́rụ pịghị n dighi ḅara ḅụ, kụ́ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ ọ pịghị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụrụụ́ nyána n pịrịm, tegó nna sịbịbie opuma kụrọm pịghị irima irimam. Anịsáa ọ warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, Ị ḅara sughuu paghamaa. Ori ọ ḅara ma sụghụma pághámam, ọ ḅara ma warị gwọọ.
english_text: He looked around at them in anger and, deeply distressed at their stubborn hearts, said to the man,“Stretch out your hand.”He stretched it out, and his hand was completely restored.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị kobiri yọ ma wáriso warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri Hẹrọd ogbo bẹ jẹ́apụ na dona, nnị warị ọrụtọ nnị Jizọs ḅáa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then the Pharisees went out and began to plot with the Herodians how they might kill Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ warị soo Galili dappa ma ḅoo tọgha túminị́ kpo warị pịghị o duam, Nnị Galili na Judiya
english_text: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed.

ibani_text: na Jerusalem, Idumia parangáa, na pịghị Jọdan tọ́rụ ma amaḅara ngaa fịnị ama gbọrụ na pịghị Taya na Sidọn opu ama párángáa ḅụ saghịḅom. Mịná túminị́ mamgba Jizọs damaḅom, tegó nnị naam ọ nwángịarị fịrị láa ḅara.
english_text: When they heard about all he was doing, many people came to him from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, and the regions across the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma opuma dụḅam, Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹ́ nnị árụ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ pịrị, sị túminị́ ma o nánga ḅábịgha ḅara.
english_text: Because of the crowd he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him, to keep the people from crowding him.

ibani_text: Ọ tọgha tọghaapụ gwọọmam, obiapụ mamgba sọ pa nna suma mú ofịnịnga láa sị n ḅara pa ọ lama bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ nyánáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nna oju bie nnị ori árị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, nnị sóghórókorobẹm ọ toruku sị otume kpasị ilúghú, Ịrị anị Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma!
english_text: Whenever the impure spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị kụrọma n ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, n mịẹma sị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ o nimi.
english_text: But he gave them strict orders not to tell others about him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs gbẹ́rẹ́ tụ́ndụ́ tándịm warị sịị ọ ḅụ pịrị o dọghụ owiapụ. Nnị warị o damaḅoo.
english_text: Jesus went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị nna bie oyi mmẹapụ findi sẹ́lẹ́, mịnaapụ ma anịị ori nfịrịmaapụ pa sịapụ. O warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, A ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm ḅẹ́ ọmịnị i nana fịnịị. A pịghị ọ fịrịma pághámabẹm sị o mú ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa,
english_text: He appointed twelvethat they might be with him and that he might send them out to preach

ibani_text: Ọ́ pịghị kụ́rọ nyánábẹm sị pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ deesi.
english_text: and to have authority to drive out demons.

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ọ sẹlẹakị oyi mmẹapụ findi ma: Saimọn (Jizọs Pita pa o siim);
english_text: These are the twelve he appointed: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter),

ibani_text: Jems na o numboru Jọn, anị Zebidi awọ, (Jizọs Boanejis pa nnị sịịm, mịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ nnị Soalagba Awọ);
english_text: James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the nameBoanerges, which means “sons of thunder”),

ibani_text: Anduru, Filipụ, Batolomi, Matiu, Tọmọs, Jems Alịfịyọs tụ́wọ, Tadiyọs, Saimọn Ámáibidọghụḅọ
english_text: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot

ibani_text: na Judas Isịkarọtị Jizọs dẹrịfịḅọ.
english_text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Jizọs warị soo wárị ḅoo jẹ́ túminị́ kpo warị kobiri ọ pịrị sị ori na ori asọduaapụ ine asọ arịgha sị nyẹ́fịị.
english_text: Then Jesus entered a house, and again a crowd gathered, so that he and his disciples were not even able to eat.

ibani_text: O wárịapụ mịma náa sáá, n saghịm ḅẹẹ n mú ọ kuuḅo, tegó, túminị́ dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Ọ saghị nọmụma!
english_text: When his familyheard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”

ibani_text: Jẹa ólóghó ma nyẹ́dieapụ, Jerusalem ḅụ saghị ḅoapụ dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Bẹlizibọl ọḅuu imi! Sitẹ́mẹ́ sịbịdaḅọ anị kụrọ ma pa ọ pịrị sị o pa ine n deesiarị nyẹ.
english_text: And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebul! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n sị ọ ḅụ pịrị ḅẹẹ: Satanị tọrọ́ pa Satanị deepágháma bẹ?
english_text: So Jesus called them over to him and began to speak to them in parables:“How can Satan drive out Satan?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ sẹ anị ḅụ diegálágáláma sị amịna ḅụ na owusọ, anị ama ma gbẹ́rẹ́sa bịghị korobẹm.
english_text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ wárịapụ amịna ḅụ diegálágáláma sị owu pa jụghọ jụghọ págháma, anị warị ma gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá bịghịkóróbẹm
english_text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

ibani_text: Anịgo ḅọ́rọ́ Satanị amadakiri anị ḅụ die gálágáláma ọkụ́ ma, anị ine fịnị ḅọlọbịgha kụ́ma bịghị korobẹm sị ḅo kunema láa.
english_text: And if Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine kụrọ tumḅọ wárị ḅághúfindibịgha sị ọrẹ ngọ akị, tụ́ma ọ parị kụ́rọ tumḅọ ma kpọwarịbẹm; anịsáa ori ine o warị fọọbẹm.
english_text: In fact, no one can enter a strong man’s house without first tying him up. Then he can plunder the strong man’s house.

ibani_text: A dughoarị o nimi ḅẹ́, túminị́ siiḅụḅarasi nyánábẹm n mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, na pịghị n dugho bẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Truly I tell you, people can be forgiven all their sins and every slander they utter,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma siinyẹ dugho ḅo Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma sịbị, siiḅụḅarasi nyánábịgha, tegó n ḅo gbámásó siinyẹ mịẹmam. (
english_text: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; they are guilty of an eternal sin.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dughom tegó jẹ́apụ dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Sitẹ́mẹ́ o ḅụbie imi.)
english_text: He said this because they were saying, “He has an impure spirit.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs nyingi na ori amịna owiapụ ḅoo lam, nụ́ngọbie anịị nnị sẹ nyẹ si oku muḅọ fịrịma sị ọ sịị.
english_text: Then Jesus’ mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo kpọrọfịnị sị o gbiri ikélekélem, n warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Dighi ị nyingi na ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ na ị́yẹ́ amịna ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ nụ́ngọbie imi, nnị ị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, “Your mother and brothers are outside looking for you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị pagharam, I nyingi tụọ? Tẹ́apụ ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ?
english_text: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”he asked.

ibani_text: Ọ warị tọ́rụ pa kpọrọfịnị o gbiri ikélékeleapụ ma dighi, warị ḅẹẹ, Dighi! Mịnaapụ ma anịị ị́yẹ́ nyingiapụ pịghị ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ!
english_text: Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said,“Here are my mother and my brothers!

ibani_text: I daa ma binyẹ mịẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n ḅo anịị ị́yẹ́ mịná owiḅọ na ị́yẹ́ amịna ọ́rụ́ḅọ na pịghị ị́yẹ́ nyingiḅọ.
english_text: Whoever does God’s will is my brother and sister and mother.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị jẹ́ pa saghị nyẹ́die Galili dappa ma ngása, o gbiri túminị́ kpo ma opuma dụḅam gosi, ori árụ́ ḅụ́lọm sị anị bie kpọrọfịnị. Árụ́ ma kẹ́lẹ́ fofoom mingi aka ma ḅụ, túminị́ kpo ma warị mingi aka ma ḅụ sẹ.
english_text: Again Jesus began to teach by the lake. The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the lake, while all the people were along the shore at the water’s edge.

ibani_text: Ọ warị kaḅụ pa tọgha nyẹ pa n die, dughoarị ḅẹ́:
english_text: He taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said:

ibani_text: O pughu! Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ pághá mú sịmgbọlụ dipim.
english_text: “Listen! A farmer went out to sow his seed.

ibani_text: Ori sịmgbọlụ ma gbi gálágálá ma sáá jẹa nyẹ asọogbo sóórókórom, fíní warị ḅoo anị gbọfị.
english_text: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ kụ́rọ kiri ḅụ kóróm, anị kálá lịka nyẹ nyána angaá. Sịmgbọlụ ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri sópágham, lịka ma póghóló bie sọọgha gosi.
english_text: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ịrụa ḅo pághá sáá, anị ịwọ ányị́nyá ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma dọghụmam; nnị kune ma na póghóló kiri sọọgha gosi, ányị́nyá ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri sámụ́nọ fịm.
english_text: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.

ibani_text: Jẹa sịmgbọlụ nangi nyána sị ọgọnọ sóghórokorom, nangi ma warị sẹnị págháḅo sị anị timi, anịgosi anị mgbọ́lụ suagha.
english_text: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so that they did not bear grain.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa sịmgbọlụ ibikiri ḅụ sóórókórom, mgbọ́lụ ma sópághá, sẹnị sịmgbọ́lụ sua: jẹa nyẹ sue sịmgbọlụ suam, jẹa nyẹ mgbọ́lụ tẹ́rẹ́ a si, jẹa nyẹ pịghị mgbọ́lụ sọ́nọ́ a si.
english_text: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up, grew and produced a crop, some multiplying thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kunema ḅẹẹ, O pughu, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ biri nyána nḅẹḅẹ́!
english_text: Then Jesus said,“Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ngéré fịnị sáá, o pughuapụ ma ḅụ jẹapụ, o damaḅom nnị na oyi mmẹapụ findi nfịrịmaapụ na, n warị o gbíla ḅẹ́ ori lụghụ ma puu findi.
english_text: When he was alone, the Twelve and the others around him asked him about the parables.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Nnị mịẹmam sị ọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅọghunyẹ ma nimi, kụ́ma isiapụ ma, nụ́ngọbie fịnịapụ, lụghụ ḅụ anịị nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ naarị angaá.
english_text: He told them,“The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside everything is said in parables

ibani_text: Anịgosi,  Nnị tọ́rụ pa dighibẹm kụ́ma ine arịbịgha; nnị biri pa pughubẹm, kụ́ma ine akanyaḅobịgha. Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ árị árị, pughu, pịghị akanyaḅo, n pịghị sị Tamuno dámáḅobẹm, ọ pịghị siiḅụḅarasi nyána nnị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: so that, “ ‘they may be ever seeing but never perceiving, and ever hearing but never understanding; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!’”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị n gbíla, Ọ mịị lụghụ ma akanyaḅogha? Anịsáa ọ tọ́rọ́ pa jẹ́ lụghụ akanyaḅo bẹ?
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“Don’t you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?

ibani_text: Dụadipiḅọ ma Tamuno oku ma dipim.
english_text: The farmer sows the word.

ibani_text: Jẹapụ fịnị ḅara anịị asọogbo sóórókoro sịmgbọlụ fịnị ḅara; nnị oku ma náa gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, Satanị ḅom sị anị saghị akị.
english_text: Some people are like seed along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.

ibani_text: Isiapụ n fịnị ḅara anịị kụrọkiri ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọlụ ma, Nnị oku ma náa gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri nnị bieḅẹlẹ ḅara pa anị nyána akịm.
english_text: Others, like seed sown on rocky places, hear the word and at once receive it with joy.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị nna bie kune nyanagha gosi anị pịghị dii laagha. Anịgosi ḅụḅáláḅálá anịgha kị́nị́ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma, ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́kiri oku ma gosi nnị sáá ngúmágha pa bịghị korom.
english_text: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ kịkanyẹ anịị nangi bie nnị dipi sịmgbọlụ. Mịnaapụ ma anịị oku ma naapụ;
english_text: Still others, like seed sown among thorns, hear the word;

ibani_text: kụ́ma tuminikiri ḅụḅáláḅálá na ngọ ḅẹlẹma na pịghị pụghọ tarịarị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nyẹ ḅo oku ma pụ́nụ́mam anịgosi anị mgbọ́lụ suagha.
english_text: but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹapụ fịnị ḅara anịị nnị ibikiri ḅụ dipi sịmgbọlụ. Nnị oku ma naam, anị daákịm warị mgbọ́lụ sua jẹa nyẹ sue, jẹa nyẹ tẹ́si, jẹa nyẹ sọ́nọ́ a si.
english_text: Others, like seed sown on good soil, hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop—some thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times what was sown.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, warị ḅẹ́, Tumḅọ tọndọ akuoo akuoo sị anị pa bọlị sughubie anịgha múnonyẹ sughubie sua? Nnị anị pa tọndọ gbánānyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ gbánaá na ibighaa?
english_text: He said to them,“Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a bowl or a bed? Instead, don’t you put it on its stand?

ibani_text: Nnị pa ḅọghu ḅuuma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị pághámaḅobẹm ekeke siri ogbo ḅụ, gbẹ́ẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị findibẹm.
english_text: For whatever is hidden is meant to be disclosed, and whatever is concealed is meant to be brought out into the open.

ibani_text: Anịgo, Pughu, ọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ biri nyána nyána!
english_text: If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear.”

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅụ kiẹma ọ náanyẹ pịrị! Ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ jẹ́apụ pịrị ḅara ma, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị Tamuno ḅọ́rọ́ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ. Kụ́ma kụ́rọ mịị ḅara nẹ́ngịma nyẹ.
english_text: “Consider carefully what you hear,”he continued.“With the measure you use, it will be measured to you—and even more.

ibani_text: Nyẹ nyánáapụ pịghị jẹ́nyẹ nyánáḅobẹm. Nyẹ́ nyánágháapụ, n nyáná kálányẹ ma n pịghị n ḅara anị daákịbẹm.
english_text: Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị ḅara. Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ sịmgbọlụ gbi gálágálámam ori duakiri ḅụ.
english_text: He also said,“This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.

ibani_text: Dii na ḅáa na, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ muno-o, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ saghị-o, sịmgbọlụ ma sópághá sị sẹnịarị, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ ọ nimigha anị ḅara warị nwángị kọọ ḅara
english_text: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.

ibani_text: Lịka ma anị mịẹsị sịmgbọ́lụ ma sẹnị sịmgbọ́lụ suarị nyẹ; parị ịwọ ányị́nyá ḅẹlẹma, anịsáa sịbị ma, Kunemaá mgbọ́lụ ḅụụ bii sịbị.
english_text: All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.

ibani_text: Mgbọ́lụ ma ḅoo bia sáá, ori mgbọ́lụ kịẹnyẹ ma pa árị ḅụ sua, tegó duasughu sáá ma láamam.
english_text: As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.”

ibani_text: Jizọs gbilam ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma wa pa tẹ́ kịkama bẹ? Wa tẹ́ lụghụ pa anị puu findi bẹ?
english_text: Again he said,“What shall we say the kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?

ibani_text: Mị anị fịnị ḅara, Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ mọstad sịmgbọlụ akịm, tuminikiri ịrụḅa sịmgbọlụ, warị anị pa kiribie dipi.
english_text: It is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds on earth.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo kẹ́lẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ sa anị sẹ́nịm sị ḅo dụḅaḅá sị sọọ. Anị ḅo dụḅa dụḅa ḅárasuam sị fíní ḅo anị ḅụ nna warị namam.
english_text: Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds can perch in its shade.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ori oku ma dugho wásámáa túminị́ pịrịm, mịma kịkama jẹ́ tọgha tọgha lụghụ; o dugho n pịrịm nnị ine akanyaḅo bẹ ḅara.
english_text: With many similar parables Jesus spoke the word to them, as much as they could understand.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ dugho nnị pịrịbịgha lụghụ gba n pịrịgha pa, kụ́ma ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ na ngéré fịnị sáá, o nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dughofindi nnị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: He did not say anything to them without using a parable. But when he was alone with his own disciples, he explained everything.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma ḅupiri Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm, Nnị ḅoo sị n dappa ma saḅakóró isi párángáa muu.
english_text: That day when evening came, he said to his disciples,“Let us go over to the other side.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị túminị́ kpo ma wáriso; ori ọḅụduaapụ warị Jizọs ḅụlọ sị kpọrọfịnịmáa árụ́ ma ḅụlọ, n warị ori na múu. Jẹ́ árụ́ sọ pịghị aningáa imii.
english_text: Leaving the crowd behind, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ pa dighigha biri ḅụ, kụ́rọ fọ́rụ warị saghị fie, dinọngụ warị saghị árụ́ ma bie sọọ kálányẹ kọm sị mingi árụ́ ma biléma.
english_text: A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.

ibani_text: Jizọs árụ́ ma nune angaá imii, ọ sịbị pa sịbị saghị nyẹ ọgọnọ gbánā sị múnoarị. Ori ọḅụduaapụ ọ sị saghịmam, warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ ị balagha ḅẹ́, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịfama dọghụarị?
english_text: Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care if we drown?”

ibani_text: Jizọs saghịm warị igani kụ́rọ fọ́rụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Diin fịnị! Ọ warị pịghị dinọngụ ma ḅẹẹ, Yaghúu fịnị! Fọ́rụ ma warị bii angaá mamgba warị ḅo opuma yaghúu.
english_text: He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves,“Quiet! Be still!”Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ḅo ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegó ḅáláfaarị? Na ọ pa minini nyanagha mọ?
english_text: He said to his disciples,“Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma opu ḅáláfa nna ḅụbie imii n warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mịị ọ tọ́rọ́fịnịị owitụ́wọ? Ḅẹẹ fọ́rụ na dinọngụ ori osiim!
english_text: They were terrified and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅo Galili dappa ma ḅụ isi posie aka ma ḅụ sọ́mam anịị Gerasa ámá angaá.
english_text: They went across the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.

ibani_text: Jizọs árụ́ ma bie kóróḅo gbẹ́rẹ́kiri dupu yọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅo ori na donam. Mịị owitụ́wọ ma Sitẹ́mẹ́ ọḅụ imii.
english_text: When Jesus got out of the boat, a man with an impure spirit came from the tombs to meet him.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dupu ma bie ngam. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mịnị ine árị́dírí pa ọ kpọkórómagha.
english_text: This man lived in the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.

ibani_text: Tọgha sáá nnị ọ ḅụọ na o ḅara kákámam, kụ́ma sámámgba ori ikúlélu árị́dírí ma nụ́nụ́ pẹ́lẹ́bẹm sị, ọ ḅụọ fịnị ikúlélu ma pẹ́lẹ́ kọ́sịma. Ori opuma kụrọm sị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine oku kiri kórómagha.
english_text: For he had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.

ibani_text: Dii na ḅáa na ori ikelekelearị dupu yọ ma ḅụ, na pịghị tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ, otume kpasị ilúghuarị pịghị dapịrị pa ọ ḅụ pẹ́lẹ́ kọsiarị.
english_text: Night and day among the tombs and in the hills he would cry out and cut himself with stones.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọ angaá anịị ọ fịnị Jizọs árịnyẹ ọ warị mangị muu Jizọs toruku ẹkpẹrẹkị,
english_text: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell on his knees in front of him.

ibani_text: warị otume kpasị opuma ilúghú ḅẹẹ, Jizọs, sóghólóḅa Tamuno ma Tụ́wọ! Ị ịḅụ tẹ́ dọghụ? Tamuno ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, a ị tẹ́ghẹ̄m, i pa tọ́rụ́siarịma ma! (
english_text: He shouted at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God’s name don’t torture me!”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dughom tegó, Jizọs dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Sitẹ́mẹ́ mịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ págháḅo!)
english_text: For Jesus had said to him,“Come out of this man, you impure spirit!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị o gbíla, Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́ nyẹ? Owitụ́wọ ma pagharam, Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ anịị Mánámánáapụ wa mịnga biim!
english_text: Then Jesus asked him,“What is your name?” “My name is Legion,” he replied, “for we are many.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pa Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅẹẹ ori mịná sitẹ́mẹ́ ma deesi ma anị párángáa ma ḅụ.
english_text: And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.

ibani_text: Anị párángáa ma ḅụ tọgha oporopo imii, nyẹ́kọ fịarịapụ tụ́ndụ ma ọgọnọ angaá.
english_text: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.

ibani_text: Mịná tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Wa fịrịma sị, wamịnị oporopo ma bie sọọ.
english_text: The demons begged Jesus, “Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n wáriso, sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị owitụ́wọ ma wáriso sị oporopo ma ḅụ sọọ, oporopo gbọrụ ma, sọ́nọ́ a pughu láanyẹ mị mamgba tụ́ndụ ma gbisiri párángáa ḅụ mangị ḅọ́rọ́ dappa ma bie koro sị bilefam.
english_text: He gave them permission, and the impure spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.

ibani_text: Oporopo ma didighiarị owiapụ ma mangisom sị muu pághányẹ ma dugho wásámáa opu ama ma bie na pịghị nna káláama bie. Túminị́ warị págháḅo ḅo pághá nyẹ ma arịị.
english_text: Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs damaḅo sáá, n ḅo mánámana sitẹ́mẹ́ parị ḅụ fịnị owitụ́wọ ma arịm ọ bịtẹ sua sị kpọrọọfịnịarị ori karakárá sịbị bie ḅu, ḅáláfa warị ḅo nnị kị́nị́mamgba oju bie sọọ.
english_text: When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

ibani_text: Nyẹ ma arịapụ ma dugho árịghaapụ ma pịrịm sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnị owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ pághányẹ na pịghị oporopo ma ḅụ.
english_text: Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man—and told about the pigs as well.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma warị saghị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ ori nna ámá angaá warisoo.
english_text: Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.

ibani_text: Jizọs árụ́ ma ḅụlọ dọghụ sáá, sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ págháḅo owitụ́wọ ma warị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́, I wáriso a ịrị na sọọ!
english_text: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs mini ọ pịrịgha. Tụ́ma ori ọ ḅẹ́m, Pịghịma ị warị mú si mú dugho n pịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma mịẹ ị pịrịnyẹ láa ḅara ọ pịghị ị ḅẹlẹma láa biri.
english_text: Jesus did not let him, but said,“Go home to your own people and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma warị sọọ Dekapolis gbọrụ ma ikelekele ma dugho n pịrịarị Jizọs mịẹ ọ pịrịmaá nyẹ, ọ naapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyẹ ma ḅo n tọ́rụ nẹngịm.
english_text: So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolishow much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghịma Galili dappa ma sáḅá kóró isi angaá ma ḅom. Anị ngaa dappa ma ḅụ tọgha túminị́ kpo kobiri o gbiri ikélekélem
english_text: When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.

ibani_text: Jairọs, kobiri yọ ma ḅụ táarịapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅo laam, o ḅoo Jizọs árị sáá, ori ọḅụ saghị gbim ọ tórúku
english_text: Then one of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.

ibani_text: warị ibima ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ kálá ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ opuma obiarị. Páisisi ḅoo sị ḅara pa á láma sị árị oju ibi bẹ ḅara sị a duma!
english_text: He pleaded earnestly with him, “My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị o dua. Tọghaapụ Jizọs dua múuarị sị warị ọ pụ́nụ́maarị ngaámamgba ḅụ.
english_text: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around him.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imii, opuma tọ́rụ́siarị árịmáaḅọ a ḅụ opuma págharị ọmbịnyẹ́ gosi mị oyi mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá findi ḅụ.
english_text: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ tọgha tọgha bịrịapụ a gwọmam. A pịghị a nyáná igbii mamgba ḅuumamam, tụ́ma árị oju ma ibi bẹ nakaragha siḅaá anịị anị siḅaarị nyẹ sámámgba.
english_text: She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.

ibani_text: A Jizọs gbólómanyẹ naamam, a warị túminị́ kpo ma bie ḅoo, ori ọḅụdụ,
english_text: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,

ibani_text: warị a ḅụ ḅẹarị, A pa ine ḅara pa ori bịtẹ lama bẹ, ịḅụ ibibẹm.
english_text: because she thought, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
