ibani_text: A warị ḅara pa ori bịtẹ lama anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị árị ọmbịnyẹ́ ma kunema nyẹ; a ḅụbie a ḅo nimiḅom ḅẹ́ a gwọmam árị ḅụḅáláḅálá ḅụ.
english_text: Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri Jizọs nimim ḅẹ́ ịnyọ ọ ḅụ saghị pághám. Ọ warị pịghị sị túminị́ ogbo ma gbíla ḅẹ́, Tụọ ḅara pa ị́yẹ́ bịtẹ lama?
english_text: At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked,“Who touched my clothes?”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ pagharam, I kọkọ árị túminị́ ma igbiriarị ḅara; i tegó gbilaarị ḅẹ́ tụọ ḅara pa ị lama?
english_text: “You see the people crowding against you,” his disciples answered, “and yet you can ask,‘Who touched me?’”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pa dọghụarị ori árị bẹ ḅara nyẹ ma mịẹḅọ.
english_text: But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅo nimiḅom a ḅụ mịẹmáa nyẹ, a warị o tórúku ḅoo jighe jighearị ḅáláfa ḅụ, warị ọ toruku ẹkpẹrẹkị, warị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị karakárá mamgba dugho ọ pịrị.
english_text: Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.

ibani_text: Jizọs a ḅẹm, Iyẹ ndụ́ḅa ị́yẹ́ minini ị gwọmam. Diin na sọọ sị ị́yẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá ḅụ gwọọ.
english_text: He said to her,“Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa mịma dughoarị sáá, jẹ́ oku múuapụ Jairọs wárị ḅụ saghịḅom sị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ndụ́ḅa fịịmam ị tegó pa ḅụḅáláḅálá pa Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma pịrịarị?
english_text: While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. “Your daughter is dead,” they said. “Why bother the teacher anymore?”

ibani_text: Jizọs sáá nyáná n dughonyẹ ma pịrịgha kụ́ma dugho owitụ́wọ ma pịrịm, Ḅáláfama, pa minini.
english_text: Overhearingwhat they said, Jesus told him,“Don’t be afraid; just believe.”

ibani_text: O minigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ o dua, tụ́ma Pita na Jems na pịghị o numboru owitụ́wọ Jọn ngéré.
english_text: He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Jairọs wárị lam, Jizọs, warị galagala ma árị, túminị́ síle owuarị
english_text: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.

ibani_text: Ọ sọmum sị warị n ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́ mịị galagala ma dighiarị? O tegó owuarị? Tụ́wọ ma na a fịịgha múno anịị a múnoarị nyẹ!
english_text: He went in and said to them,“Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị o dẹrịị, ọ warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba suma págháma, warị tụ́wọ ma daaḅọ na nyingiḅọ na pịghị ori tẹ́rẹ́ a ọḅụduaapụ sị akị tụwọ ma ḅụlọlọ fịnị warị bie ma sọọ.
english_text: But they laughed at him. After he put them all out, he took the child’s father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.

ibani_text: Warị ḅara ḅụ a saghị akị warị a ḅẹ́, Talita koum! (mịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Kálá ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ a ḅẹm saghị!).
english_text: He took her by the hand and said to her,“Talitha koum!”(which means“Little girl, I say to you, get up!”).

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri a saghị sẹm sị warị nwángị ikelekele (oyi mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá findi anịị a láa maá nyẹ) Mịma ḅoo kiriakị sáá, nyẹ ma nnị kị́nị́mamgba tọ́rụ biim,
english_text: Immediately the girl stood up and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs kụrọma nna biri nụ́nụ́m ḅẹẹ nnị dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma, Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ fị́nyẹ dọghụ a pịrị a fịị.
english_text: He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.

ibani_text: Jizọs anị ngaa ma warisom sị sóó ori ama muu, ori ọḅụduaapụ sọ o duam.
english_text: Jesus left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma, ọ saghị nyẹ́diem nna kobiri yọ ma bie. Tọghaapụ anị ngaa imii; nnị ọ dughoarị nyẹ náa sáá, anị n tọ́rụ nẹngịm, nnị warị gbíla ḅẹ́, Ọ tẹ́ angaá mịị nyẹ mamgba daḅoo? Mịị tọ́rọ́fịnị opu níminyẹ ọ nyána nyẹ? Ọ tọ́rọ́ pa ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịarị?
english_text: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. “Where did this man get these things?” they asked. “What’s this wisdom that has been given him? What are these remarkable miracles he is performing?

ibani_text: Akanịkọḅọ ma origha? Meri tarị owitụ́wọ, Jems, Josẹf, Judas na Saimọn numboru owitụ́wọ? Ori a minaẹrẹ mịnga wamịnị na ngagha? Anịgo nnị ọ sịghịm
english_text: Isn’t this the carpenter? Isn’t this Mary’s son and the brother of James, Joseph,Judas and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Ikiakoroapụ nnị osigha pa n pịrịm ngaamamgba ḅụ, nna ama ḅụ na nna mịnaapụ na nna págháapụ ogbobie anịị nnị osigha nyánágha nyẹ.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“A prophet is not without honor except in his own town, among his relatives and in his own home.”

ibani_text: Ori ine tọgha opu ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ mịẹgha boghaapụ ḅụ ngéré anịị ọ ḅụ ḅara gbánáapụ sị nna obi gwọọ.
english_text: He could not do any miracles there, except lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.

ibani_text: Anị opuma ọ tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm ḅẹ́ túminị́ ma minini nyanagha. Anịsáa Jizọs warị nna káláama angaá ma muu sị nyẹ́ pa túminị́ ma diearị.
english_text: He was amazed at their lack of faith. Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ oyi mmẹapụ findi ma sị kubirim sị n fịrịma págháma mmẹapụ mmẹapụ ọ kụ́rọ pa n pịrịm sitẹ́mẹ́ nẹ́ngịma kụ́rọ,
english_text: Calling the Twelve to him, he began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over impure spirits.

ibani_text: warị ḅẹrẹtọ n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ akịma o múuarị nyẹ ma ḅụ, kụ́ma agbara ngéré, ọ fịtúrú akịị ma, ọ nyẹ biiapụ akpa sọ akịma ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii sọ akịị ma ọmịna akpa bie.
english_text: These were his instructions:“Take nothing for the journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in your belts.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị agbaa sua, kụ́ma ọ jẹ́ suabịtẹ akịị ma.
english_text: Wear sandals but not an extra shirt.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Nnị ọ datéréma ngaa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọmịnị anị ngá fịnị mú ọmịnị anị angaá wáriso bẹ sa láa.
english_text: Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ ọ datérémagha ama ḅoo ḅoo anịgha túminị́ o pughubịgha angaá ḅoo ḅoo, ama ma wáriso sị ọ ḅụọ sughu fịnị onwo ma gugu kóróma. Anịma birinụ́nụ́ akuoo nnị pịrịbẹm!
english_text: And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, leave that place and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị pághá muu ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa ḅẹẹ túminị́ pịghị nna siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: They went out and preached that people should repent.

ibani_text: Nnị tọgha sitẹ́mẹ́ deesim, warị pịghị olivu pulo pa tọgha obiapụ taa sị pịghị nna gwọọ.
english_text: They drove out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Ámányánáḅọ Hẹrọd mịị nyẹ mamgba naam tegó Jizọs ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ngaamamgba wásámam. Jẹ́apụ ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ, Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ pịghịma tuminikiri ḅomam! Anịị o go mịị kụ́rọ ma nyána sị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịarị nyẹ.
english_text: King Herod heard about this, for Jesus’ name had become well known. Some were saying,“John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ pa ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Ori Elaija. Jẹ́apụ ḅẹ́m, Ori anịị olom sáá ḅụ ikiakoroapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Others said, “He is Elijah.” And still others claimed, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of long ago.”

ibani_text: Hẹrọd náa sáá, ọ ḅẹm, Ori anịị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ ma! A kọkọ ọ sịbị pẹ́lẹ́si, kụ́ma ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam.
english_text: But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!”

ibani_text: Hẹrọd ọ ḅụgbọrụ bịpị pịrịmam ḅẹẹ nnị Jọn kuu, sị ọ káká pa ịkóli bie sua Hẹrọd mịma mịẹm Herodias gosi, o yamáa ḅọ, nimitẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹ́ árị anịị o numboru owitụ́wọ Filipụ taa.
english_text: For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, whom he had married.

ibani_text: Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ pa dugho Hẹrọd pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, Anị karakáragha ḅẹ́ ịrị ị numboru owitụ́wọ taa yaa.
english_text: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi Herodias warị sitẹ́mẹ́ sua Jọn pịrị, sị warị asọ dọghụ árị o ḅá bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma árị inegha Hẹrọd gosi.
english_text: So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to,

ibani_text: Hẹrọd Jọn dighi ḅáláfaarị tegó, o nimim ḅẹ́ Jọn ibi tumḅọ pịghị tọ́ntọ́ tumḅọ anịgosi ori ibima o koko wárim. Sáá mamgba ori ọ náa dọghụ dọ́ghụm, tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́, ori ọ náa sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie opuma ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịpịrịm.
english_text: because Herod feared John and protected him, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard John, he was greatly puzzled; yet he liked to listen to him.

ibani_text: Kunema, Herodias ḅoo asọ arịm. Anịị Hẹrọd yii éné álálị ḅụ ọ nyẹ sọọ opu kọnsịn fịrịnaapụ na ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaapụ na pịghị sịbịdaapụ mamgba pịrị Galili ḅụ.
english_text: Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.

ibani_text: Herodias ndụ́ḅa warị sọọ ḅọ sị ibima sẹghị sị Hẹrọd na ori igoniapụ mamgba tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma, Ámányánáḅọ ma warị tụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́, I dọghụ ḅẹ́ a tẹ́ mịẹ ị pịrị. Ị binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a mịẹ ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: When the daughter ofHerodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I’ll give it to you.”

ibani_text: Tọgha tọgha nyẹ o mini a pịrịnyẹ, A nyẹ karịfịm ḅẹ́, ị binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a ị pịrịbẹm akị mú ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma pa mmẹẹ́ angaá die!
english_text: And he promised her with an oath, “Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”

ibani_text: Tụ́wọ ma warị pághá mú a nyingi gbíla, ḅẹ́, A ọ ḅara tẹ́ bii bẹ? A warị a págháraa ḅẹẹ, Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ ma sịbị.
english_text: She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?” “The head of John the Baptist,” she answered.

ibani_text: Ọrụḅọtụ́wọ ma warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri pịghịma ámányánáḅọ ma dámámuu ḅẹẹ, A bim ḅẹ́ a sẹ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ma ḅụ ị Jọn Mingisaraḅo ma sịbị pa i pịrị Ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ bie!
english_text: At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”

ibani_text: Mịma warị ḅoo ámányánáḅọ ma tẹ́mẹ́ sima kụ́ma ori ine errnh errnh ḅẹ́ bẹ ḅara ofori ori igoniapụ mamgba tórúku o minini nyẹ ma gosi.
english_text: The king was greatly distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ori wárị kuru gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiḅọ fịrịma ḅẹ́ o muu Jọn sịbị akuoo. Ọ́mụ́gbi ḅo warị ịkóli wárị ma mú sị Jọn sịbị pẹlẹsii, ọ warị anị akuoo Ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ bie sị pa ẹ́rẹ́ḅọ tụ́wọ ma pịrị, árị warị ḅọ́rọ́ma pa a nyingi pịrị.
english_text: So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John’s head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,

ibani_text: Jọn ọḅụduaapụ mịma náa sáá, n ḅom sị ori dua dighiákị mú dipim.
english_text: and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.

ibani_text: Jọn ọḅụduaapụ mịma gbólómanyẹ náa sáá, nnị ḅo ori dua ma dighiákị mú dipim.
english_text: On hearing of this, John’s disciples came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma pịghịma ḅoo Jizọs na donam sị dugho ọ pịrị nnị mịẹnyẹ na pịghị nnị dienyẹ mamgba.
english_text: The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọghaapụ, jẹapụ ḅoarị jẹapụ soarị anịgosi Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ ine sáá nyána sị nyẹ́fịgha. O warị n ḅẹ́, O ḅoo wamịnị wámịna ḅara na soo yaghúu ngaa muu sị ọ kẹ́lẹ́ ịnyọ́sárá.
english_text: Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them,“Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị n ḅara na árụ́ ḅụlọ sị dọghụ túminị́ ófórigha ngá muu.
english_text: So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọghaapụ nnị árịapụ nnị soarị sáá, n lilighiḅom, warị n pẹ́lẹ́ma, sị ḅụọ pa mangị muu, ámá ámá mamgbabie sị parị mú nna ḅụ láa.
english_text: But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅoo kiri láa sị mánámāná túminị́ kpo ma árị sáá, ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná n pịrịm tegó nnị ánáná dighiḅọ nyánágha ánáná fịnị ḅara ma anịị n fịnị ḅara ọ warị saghị tọgha nyẹ pa n die.
english_text: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.

ibani_text: Mị́sa biri ma sáá múumam éné ma bie ori ọḅụduaapụ warị ọ damaḅo bẹ, Mịnga ma anị túminị́ ófórigha angaá.
english_text: By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. “This is a remote place,” they said, “and it’s already very late.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma fịrịma sị n soo, sị nnị ine kikia angaá fịnị duakiri na kikia angaá fịnị káláama ma bie n fị bẹnyẹ fẹ́ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Send the people away so that they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịnị nyẹ dọghụ n pịrị nnị fịị. Nnị o gbilam, I bii mọ ḅẹ́ wa pị́naḅala igbii oyia si findi fama sị pa ine fịtúrú fẹ́ n pịrị?
english_text: But he answered,“You give them something to eat.” They said to him, “That would take more than half a year’s wages! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n gbíla ḅẹ́, Ọ nyána fịtúrú tọ́rọ láa? O muu dighi. Nnị muu dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá, n dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́, Sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú na mmẹẹ́ a nji.
english_text: “How many loaves do you have?”he asked.“Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five—and two fish.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị túminị́ ma die ogbo ogbo ḅụ warị sị nnị mịẹsị nnị osuka ma ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma sọ́nọ́ a si, sọ́nọ́ a si na mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi na mmẹsi oyi findi ogbo ogbo na biri biri ḅụ kpọrọfịnịm.
english_text: So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo ma na mmẹẹ́ nji ma akị, tọ́rụ pa so dighi warị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ, o fịtúrú ma puum warị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị sị n die túminị́ ma pịrị, ọ pịghị mmẹẹ́ a nji ma so die nnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm
english_text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba fịịm warị pịghị kọnyẹ́ nyána.
english_text: They all ate and were satisfied,

ibani_text: Anịsáa ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị oyi mmẹẹ́ a nkana gbalaḅo n fịkọma fịtúrú na nji ma ḅụ.
english_text: and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.

ibani_text: Nnị fị́nyẹ pa pịrị owiapụ gbọrụ anịị oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si.
english_text: The number of the men who had eaten was five thousand.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri Jizọs mịẹm ori ọḅụduaapụ árụ́ ḅụlọ sị parị ọ ḅụ muu Bẹtịsaida láa, isi párángáa dappa ma ḅụ. O warị túminị́ ma fịrịma sị n sọọ.
english_text: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.

ibani_text: Ori ibima muu pa túminị́ ma ḅẹ́ faá ma sa, ọ tụ́ndụ tándịm sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.

ibani_text: Éné ḅo ḅupiri sáá, árụ́ dappa ma ogboku imi, Jizọs ori pa kiri ọgọ́nọ́ fịnịarị sáá.
english_text: Later that night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.

ibani_text: Ori arịm ḅẹ́ ori ọḅụduaapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị fiearị fọ́rụ ma gosi, anịgosi ḅáāsó biri tẹ́rẹ́ na suene énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ, ori n damaḅom mingi ọgọnọ nwángịarị. Ori n ḅọ́rọ́ dọ́ghụm,
english_text: He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,

ibani_text: kụ́ma nnị ori arịm mingi ọgọnọ nwángịarị, n warị ọkọ kóróma sị otume kpasị ilúghú ḅẹ́, Mịị tẹ́mẹ́!
english_text: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba opu ḅáláfa nna oju bie sọm nnị ori árị sáá. Jizọs dugho n pịrịm anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ ọlọ, Ọ́ ịrị, ọ ḅáláfama.
english_text: because they all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke to them and said,“Take courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị na árụ́ ma ḅụlọ, fọ́rụ ma warị yaghú anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, ori ọḅụduaapụ ma nyẹ́ ma warị ḅoo n tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá.
english_text: Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,

ibani_text: Tegó nnị ine na akanyaḅogha fị́nyẹ pa owiapụ oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ na sọ́nọ́ a si pịrịma dughoarị nyẹ, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ine anị nimiḅogha.
english_text: for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.

ibani_text: Nnị dappa ma saḅa korom sị ḅo kiri láa Genazarẹtị ḅụ nnị árụ́ ma kpọwarị ngaa.
english_text: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.

ibani_text: Nnị árụ́ ma wáriso sáá, túminị́ Jizọs lighilighiḅom anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.

ibani_text: Anịgo n mangị ámá gbọrụ ngaamamgba ịkélémam, n muu angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ ori imi, nnị obiapụ ma akuobẹm nna ibila ḅụ ḅụlọlọarịapụ.
english_text: They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.

ibani_text: Jizọs muu angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, káláma o opu ama o anịgha duakiri, túminị́ nna obiapụ pa fẹ́siri muubẹm sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ o pa wáriso sị obiapụ ma ḅara pa ọ́gọ́nọ ọ suabịtẹ ma láama. Ḅara ma pa ọlamaapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nna oju ḅoo ibim.
english_text: And wherever he went—into villages, towns or countryside—they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ na ólóghó ma nyẹ́dieapụ, Jerusalem ḅụ sághị ḅoapụ ḅoo Jizọs kobirim.
english_text: The Pharisees and some of the teachers of the law who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo arịḅom ḅẹ́ ori ọḅụdua jẹapụ pile ḅara pa nyẹ́fịarị mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́, nịị nnị anị sịrịgha Farisiiapụ ma ólóghó dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ túminị́ ḅara sịrịbẹm.
english_text: and saw some of his disciples eating food with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.

ibani_text: (Ḅẹẹ Farisiiapụ ma na pịghị kọọ Juuapụ ma nna tádọ́apụ ḅara nnị daḅo dienyẹ ma duarị. Nnị nyẹ́fịbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ nnị nna ḅara sịrịgha karakárá ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: (The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị fẹ́siri saghị ḅo nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịbịghaa tarị anị sịrịgha pa. Nnị pịghị tọgha tọgha ólóghó duarị n daḅo maá nyẹ, mịma anị n mingi ḅuu ọmọngọ sịrị na ibiḅara, nyẹ sọọ ḅẹ́lẹ, nyẹ́fị bọlị na múnonyẹ ọgọnọ siri siri karakárá ḅara.)
english_text: When they come from the marketplace they do not eat unless they wash. And they observe many other traditions, such as the washing of cups, pitchers and kettles.)

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma warị Jizọs gbíla ḅẹẹ, Tegó ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ goo wámịna tádọ́apụ ḅara wa daḅo dienyẹ ma duagha, kụ́ma pile ḅara pa nyẹ́fịarị?
english_text: So the Pharisees and teachers of the law asked Jesus, “Why don’t your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders instead of eating their food with defiled hands?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam ḅẹ́, Dighi Aizaya karakáram, ori ikiakoro sáá ọmịna sịbị, ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ agidi, ọ karakáráma gịẹ ḅara, Tamuno dughom ḅẹẹ,  Mịnaapụ ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ḅụ kuu pa i pịrịm, kụ́ma nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ịḅụ, ḅọlọ angaá imii.
english_text: He replied,“Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: “ ‘These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

ibani_text: Anị sọ́nyẹ ḅụ ofori ḅẹ́ nnị susi ị pịrịarị tegó túminị́ ólóghó anị nnị diearịnyẹ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ ólóghó!
english_text: They worship me in vain; their teachings are merely human rules.’

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno ólóghó ma pa ngaa pịrịm sị tuminikiriapụ dienyẹ ma osii.
english_text: You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to human traditions.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị o nimim, ọ Tamuno ólóghó ma sịghị sịghị ḅara sị ọmịna ngaa dienyẹ ma ẹ́résoo.
english_text: And he continued,“You have a fine way of setting aside the commands of God in order to observeyour own traditions!

ibani_text: Mosis ólóghó pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ị daá na i nyingi osii, i ḅọ́rọ́ i daá anịgha i nyingi wiri wiri, i ḅá anịị nnị ị ḅá bẹnyẹ.
english_text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’and, ‘Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị diearị ḅẹ́, ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ pa ḅárásua nna daa anịgha nna nyingi pịrịbẹnyẹ nyána, kụ́ma warị ḅẹ́, Mịma anịị Koban (mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́, n saghị pa Tamuno pịrịm).
english_text: But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is Corban (that is, devoted to God)—

ibani_text: Nnị n kịẹ sim ḅẹ́ nnị ḅárásua nna daá anịgha nna nyingi pịrịbịgha.
english_text: then you no longer let them do anything for their father or mother.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma ọ pa jẹ́apụ diearị dienyẹ ma Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma na kuragha. Nwọfịnị tọgha jẹa nyẹ imi ọ mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị sima túminị́ kpo ma sị ọ ḅụ pịrịị warị n ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ọmịnị i pughu sị akanyaḅo.
english_text: Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said,“Listen to me, everyone, and understand this.

ibani_text: Nụ́ngọ ḅụ saghị i furobie sọ ḅẹnyẹ ofori mịẹbẹnyẹ si i ịlọlịḅọ sọọ. Tụ́ma ịḅụ págháḅo nyẹ anịị mịẹarịnyẹ si í ịlọ́lị.
english_text: Nothing outside a person can defile them by going into them. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles them.”

ibani_text: O túminị́ kpo ma wáriso sáá sị wárị muu, ori ọḅụduaapụ o gbilam ḅẹẹ ọ mịị dughonyẹ ma dughofindi.
english_text: After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ nyẹ nimi isiapụ ma nẹngịgha. Ọmịnị akanyaḅogha? Ḅẹẹ ọfụrobie saghị sọọ nyẹ ofori sị ine ọmịnị ịlọlịma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Are you so dull?”he asked.“Don’t you see that nothing that enters a person from the outside can defile them?

ibani_text: Tegó anị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie sọgha kụ́ma ọmịna furobie warị oju ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pághá. (Ọ mịma dughoarị sáá, Jizọs dugho wásámam ḅẹẹ fị́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ibim sị tumḅọ anị fịị.)
english_text: For it doesn’t go into their heart but into their stomach, and then out of the body.”(In saying this, Jesus declared all foods clean.)

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị dugho ḅẹ́, Ibie saghị págháḅo nyẹ anịị mịẹsị ị ịlọlịarị nyẹ.
english_text: He went on:“What comes out of a person is what defiles them.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ị bie, anịị ị tẹ́mẹ́bie anịị sikóróma ḅoarị nyẹ mịẹsị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọ, fúrú, kị́nị́ḅáa,
english_text: For it is from within, out of a person’s heart, that evil thoughts come—sexual immorality, theft, murder,

ibani_text: amadọghụ, oputọrụ na pịghị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ siinyẹ mịẹ, oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị, ịlọ́lị nyẹ mịẹ, jụghọ nyẹ mọnị kị́nị́ dughosima, opuamịẹnyẹ, na oḅorịsọọ,
english_text: adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba ibie saghị págháḅom sị mịẹsị ị ịlọ́lị.
english_text: All these evils come from inside and defile a person.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị anị ngaa ma wáriso sị Taya na kikia ámá parangáa muu. Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ wárị sọm, kụ́ma minigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nimi ḅẹ́ ori anị ngaa imii kụ́ma ori ine ḅọghu fịnịgha.
english_text: Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre.He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imi, árị ndụ́ḅa sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnịḅọ Jizọs gbólómanyẹ ma naam, warị ọ damaḅo anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri warị ọ ḅụọ sughu sóórókoro.
english_text: In fact, as soon as she heard about him, a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an impure spirit came and fell at his feet.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma, árị Juughaḅọ, kụ́ma nnị ayim Fonisiya ḅụ Siriya bie fịnị ngaa nyẹ. A Jizọs tẹ́ghẹm ḅẹ́ o sitẹ́mẹ́ ma deesi árị ndụ́ḅa ma ḅụ.
english_text: The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Wa tarị fị́nyẹ pa awọamaapụ ma pịrị. Anị karakáragha sị wa awọamaapụ ma fị́nyẹ saghị akị sị anị gbi pa obiri pịrị.
english_text: “First let the children eat all they want,”he told her,“for it is not right to take the children’s bread and toss it to the dogs.”

ibani_text: A warị pagharaa ḅẹ́, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, nyẹ́fị opu ịkasị ma sughu fịnị obiri ma koko awọ ma ḅara sóórókoro ngaa nyẹ ma fịfịị.
english_text: “Lord,” she replied, “even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị a ḅẹẹ, Ị pa i págháraa nyẹ ma gosi, pịghịma warị muu, ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm ḅẹ́ sitẹ́mẹ́ ma ị́yẹ́ ndụ́ḅa warịsomam!
english_text: Then he told her,“For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.”

ibani_text: A pịghịma wárị muum sị a tụ́wọ árị a ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị ngaa múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ; sitẹ́mẹ́ ma karakáráma a tụ́wọ ma ḅụ somam.
english_text: She went home and found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị Taya ama párángáa ma wáriso warị Sidọn párángáa ḅọ́rọ́ Galili Dappa ma láa, Dekapolis
english_text: Then Jesus left the vicinity of Tyre and went through Sidon, down to the Sea of Galilee and into the region of the Decapolis.

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ akuoo o damaḅom biri pụḅọ na pịghị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ghaḅo n warị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ ọ ḅara pa ọ ḅụ gbánaá.
english_text: There some people brought to him a man who was deaf and could hardly talk, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị owitụ́wọ ma ngéré sị darama túminị́ kpo ma fịnị angaá, warị ọ ḅárátụ́mgbọlụ pa owitụ́wọ ma biri sua pịghị fị́lā sara pa owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́lẹ̄ láama.
english_text: After he took him aside, away from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers into the man’s ears. Then he spit and touched the man’s tongue.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị tọ́rụ saghị so daá wárị iku ịnyọ́sárá, warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, Ephphatha, dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Findii!
english_text: He looked up to heaven and with a deep sigh said to him,“Ephphatha!”(which means“Be opened!”).

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri owitụ́wọ ma saghị nyẹ́ naam, ọ ḅẹ́lẹ kpepuma nyẹ́ sọ pẹ́lẹ́som, ọ warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pịrịgha pa.
english_text: At this, the man’s ears were opened, his tongue was loosened and he began to speak plainly.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị tọ́ọ n pịrị ḅẹẹ n dugho bẹḅọ bẹḅọ pịrịma, kụ́ma o dughoarị ḅara ma ḅẹ́ n dugho kị́nị́ pịrịma, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị n dugho wásámaarị ḅara.
english_text: Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more they kept talking about it.

ibani_text: Naapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá nna tọ́rụ daam nnị warị ilúghú, Ọ tọ́rọ́pa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ tẹ́lẹ́maarị ḅara! Ọ pịghị biri pụụapụ mịẹm sị nnị nyẹ náa pịghị oḅu ọlọapụ mịẹsị nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: People were overwhelmed with amazement. “He has done everything well,” they said. “He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́, ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ, jẹ́ mánámāná túminị́ ḅo kobirim. Nnị ma mịnị ḅẹ́ fị́nyẹ ḅẹ́ fị́nyẹ nyanagha sáá, Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ sịị ọ ḅụ pịrịm sị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,

ibani_text: A tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána mịnaapụ ma pịrịarị tegó, mịị tẹ́rẹ́ a dii nnị irị na fịnịmam, sị mị́sa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyanagha n fị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: “I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ n fịrịma so so, fị́nyẹ pa n pịrịgha pa, n fụmbẹm asọogbo, tegó nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ ḅọlọ angaá saghịḅom.
english_text: If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, because some of them have come a long distance.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ o gbilam, Mịị elesiri ma ḅụ tumḅọ tọrọ́ pa ine mịnaapụ ma fúrōbii bẹ fịtúrú fẹ ḅo bẹ?
english_text: His disciples answered, “But where in this remote place can anyone get enough bread to feed them?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n gbíla? Ọ nyáná fịtúrú tọ́rọ láa. Nnị paghram, Sọ́nọ́ma fịtúrú kpo.
english_text: “How many loaves do you have?”Jesus asked. “Seven,” they replied.

ibani_text: Ọ warị túminị́ ma mịẹsị n kiri kpọrọfịnị. Anịsáa ọ warị sọ́nọ́má fịtúrú kpo ma saghị akị warị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ́, warị anị puu, pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị si nnị anị die túminị́ ma pịrị; ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị pịghị ọkọ mịẹ.
english_text: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. When he had taken the seven loaves and given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people, and they did so.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị kálá nji nyẹ nyánam, Jizọs mịma ḅụ sọ ịmịẹḅam ḅẹm, warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ nnị anị die túminị́ ma pịrịị.
english_text: They had a few small fish as well; he gave thanks for them also and told the disciples to distribute them.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba fị fúrōbimam jẹa nyẹ pịghị kọọ, anị ngaa fịnị owiapụ ma oyia ndẹ́ẹ lam.
english_text: The people ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị sọ́nọ́ma nkana bi fịtúrú gbalaḅo kọnyẹ́ ḅụ. Jizọs túminị́ ma fịrịmam sị n soo
english_text: About four thousand were present. After he had sent them away,

ibani_text: warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri árụ́ ḅụlọ ori na ori ọḅụduaapụ warị Dalimanuta ama párángáa muu.
english_text: he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ Jizọs damaḅom, warị saghị ori na ḅẹ́rẹ́fangalama. Nnị dia tuú ọ pịrị dọ́ghụm sị o koro, anịgo nnị ọ ḅẹm ḅẹ́ ọ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị pa die ḅẹẹ, o mịẹarịnyẹ ma Tamuno ḅụḅẹ́lẹm.
english_text: The Pharisees came and began to question Jesus. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị iku ịnyọ́sárá, warị ḅẹẹ, O tegó ọmịnị mị éné bẹapụ ma ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ gbilaarị? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ́ ofori a dugho ọ pịrịm mịnaapụ ma n gbẹ́rẹ́ ilíghíma nyẹ sọ arịbịghaa.
english_text: He sighed deeply and said,“Why does this generation ask for a sign? Truly I tell you, no sign will be given to it.”

ibani_text: Ori n warisom, sima árụ́ ma ḅụlọ warị sáḅá kóró isi párángáa muu dappa ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then he left them, got back into the boat and crossed to the other side.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ bieḅárámam sị kara bẹ fịtúrú akịịghaa, gbẹ́rẹ́ fịtúrú kpo ngéré anịị n nyánányẹ árụ́ ma bie.
english_text: The disciples had forgotten to bring bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ ẹbị, ọ pịghị ọ tọ́rụ findi warị Farisiiapụ ma fịtúrú sughumaarị nyẹ na Hẹrọd fịtúrú sughumaarị nyẹ pịrị.
english_text: “Be careful,”Jesus warned them.“Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and that of Herod.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị n ḅụ na bịpịḅẹ́lẹ́ma ḅẹẹ, O go mịma dughoarị nyẹ ọ́ ḅẹ́ wa gbẹ́rẹ́ fịtúrú sọ nyanagha gosi.
english_text: They discussed this with one another and said, “It is because we have no bread.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nimim n dughoarị nyẹ, warị n gbíla, Ọ tegó fịtúrú nyanagha bịpị ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị? O nimigha, na ọ pịghị akanyaḅogha? Ọmịnị ọkọ pa itila ọmịna kóróma ḅụ?
english_text: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked them:“Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your hearts hardened?

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ́ nyánam, ọmịnị ine nyẹ arịgha? O biri nyánam, ọmịnị ine nyẹ naagha? Ọ pịghị nyẹ pa biekórómaḅogha.
english_text: Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear? And don’t you remember?

ibani_text: A sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo ma puu túminị́ oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi ma pịrị sáá, ọmịnị ndẹ́ẹ a nkana táa bimaa kọnyẹ́ ḅụ? Nnị ọ pagharam ḅẹẹ, Oyi mmẹẹ́ findi.
english_text: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” “Twelve,” they replied.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị jẹ́ pa n gbilam, A Sọ́nọ́ma fịtúrú kpo ma puu túminị́ oyia ndẹ́ẹ pịrị sáá, ọmịnị ndẹẹ́ a nkana taa bima kọnyẹ́ ḅụ? Nnị pagharam Sọ́nọ́ma.
english_text: “And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” They answered, “Seven.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Na ọ pa akanyaḅogha?
english_text: He said to them,“Do you still not understand?”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Bẹtịsaida lam, túminị́ warị anị ngaa gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́pụ owitụ́wọ akuoo Jizọs pịrị, warị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, o ḅara pa ọ lamaa.
english_text: They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅara ḅụ tọ́rụ́pụụ́ owitụ́wọ ma akịm sị ọ pa kẹ́lẹ́ ama ma ḅụ darịmam. Ori fị́lā pa ọ tọ́rụ́mgbọlụ sara fama sáá ọ́ ḅara pa owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ gbánām warị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ine ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ arịị.
english_text: He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. When he had spit on the man’s eyes and put his hands on him, Jesus asked,“Do you see anything?”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma tọ́rụ́ saghị ọgọnọ dighim warị ḅẹẹ, A ine túminị́ árịarị kụ́ma nnị sị́ kịkam sị nwángịma ḅọ́rọ́arị.
english_text: He looked up and said, “I see people; they look like trees walking around.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị mmẹẹ́ kárámá ma sa ḅara pa owitụ́wọ ma tọ́rụ́mgbọlụ lámam. Mị́sa ngaa nyẹ ma owitụ́wọ ma kpọma dighim warị saghị nyẹ árị, ọ pịghị ibiḅara pa nyẹ mamgba arịm.
english_text: Once more Jesus put his hands on the man’s eyes. Then his eyes were opened, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ fịrịma sọm warị ólóghó sua ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịnị jẹ́ pa anị káláma ma muu ma.
english_text: Jesus sent him home, saying,“Don’t even go intothe village.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ warị sọọ Sizariya Filipai ḅụ fịnị káláama mamgba múm. Asọogbo ori n gbilam ḅẹẹ, O dugho i pịrị, túminị́ dugho ḅẹ́ ịrị tụọ?
english_text: Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked them,“Who do people say I am?”

ibani_text: Nnị o pagharam ḅẹẹ, Jẹ́apụ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ ịrị anịị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ. Jẹ́apụ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, ịrị anịị Elaija, jẹ́apụ pịghị ḅẹm, ịrị ikiakoroapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, one of the prophets.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla ḅẹ́, ọmịnị Ọ ḅẹ́ mọ bẹ irị tụọ? Pita pagharam, ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anị Mesaya ma.
english_text: “But what about you?”he asked.“Who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Messiah.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ólóghó sua n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị i gbólómanyẹ dugho bẹḅọ bẹḅọ pịrịma.
english_text: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị saghị nyẹ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ die ḅẹẹ: Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma opuma tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm, sẹ́nịapụ na igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma ọ sịghịbẹm. Nnị ọ́ ḅaabẹm, kụ́ma ọ pịghị fịị ḅụ saghị sị dumabẹm tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́ sáá.
english_text: He then began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and after three days rise again.

ibani_text: Ọ mịma mịẹm sị anị nna ḅụ kóró, Pita Jizọs sị angaá pịrịm warị saghị igani ọ pịrịị.
english_text: He spoke plainly about this, and Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pịghịm sị tọ́rụ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ dighim, warị igani Pita pịrịị ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ọ ḅụ ḅọrọọ Satanị! Ị́yẹ́ kóróma Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅogha kụma túminị́ ojumẹnị!
english_text: But when Jesus turned and looked at his disciples, he rebuked Peter.“Get behind me, Satan!”he said.“You do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị túminị́ kpo ma na ori ọḅụduaapụ sị ọ ḅụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị ịrị na asọ nwángị bi, ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ pa bieḅárámabẹm, ọmịna mgbẹsẹ sị dighiákị sị ị dua.
english_text: Then he called the crowd to him along with his disciples and said:“Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.

ibani_text: Amịna duma dụapághámaḅo dọghụḅọ anị famabẹm, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ị ị́yẹ́ duma fama i sịbị goo na ibi oku ma goo, ị anị dụapághámaḅobẹm.
english_text: For whoever wants to save their lifewill lose it, but whoever loses their life for me and for the gospel will save it.

ibani_text: I tẹ́ sọnyẹ nyána bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ i tuminikiri gbọrụ ma nyána, kụ́ma, ị́yẹ́ duma fama? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ibighaa.
english_text: What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul?

ibani_text: Ị pa pịrịbẹnyẹ ofori sị pa ị́yẹ́ duma dima akị
english_text: Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?

ibani_text: I ḅọ́rọ́ i dighi ḅụ́gịrịrị na pịghị ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma dighi ḅụ́gịrịrị, mị Tamuno nimigha na pịghị sisịbịbie éné ma ḅụ, anịsáa Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma sọ i dighi ḅụgịrịrịbẹm ọ ḅoo bẹ sáá ọ Daa ma ipine ḅụ ori na ori tọ́ntọ́ sookumuapụ.
english_text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father’s glory with the holy angels.”

ibani_text: O warị nnị ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm jẹapụ mịịnga imii fịịbịghaapụ akị muu nnị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma árị anị kụ́rọ pa ḅo bẹ sa láa.
english_text: And he said to them,“Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see that the kingdom of God has come with power.”

ibani_text: Suene a dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs Pita na Jems na pịghị Jọn sịakịm, warị nnị pa sóghóló tụ́ndụ ọ́gọ́nọ tándịm, nnị ngéré fịnịngaa. Nnị pa ọ dighiarị sáá anị Jizọs dimakoro nyẹ.
english_text: After six days Jesus took Peter, James and John with him and led them up a high mountain, where they were all alone. There he was transfigured before them.

ibani_text: Ọrẹ bịtẹ warị saghị pị́na sanị sanịarị, mị tuminikiri tumḅọ sịghịrị sị ọkọ pa pị́na bẹnyẹ ofori.
english_text: His clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone in the world could bleach them.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ori tẹ́rẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma warị Elaija na Mosis arịị nnị Jizọs na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị.
english_text: And there appeared before them Elijah and Moses, who were talking with Jesus.

ibani_text: Pita warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ anị ibibẹm ḅẹẹ wa mịngáá fịnị! Wa bịtẹ pa tẹ́rẹ́ a warị bie pie, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ịnyee, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ Mosis nyẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pighi Elaija nyẹ.
english_text: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.”

ibani_text: Ori na isi ngaapụ ma na opu ḅáláfa nna oju bie sọm, sị ọ mịnị nimigha o dugho bẹnyẹ.
english_text: (He did not know what to say, they were so frightened.)

ibani_text: Oḅuto kóró nnị gbẹm, pụghọ warị oḅuto ma ḅụ saghị kóró ḅẹẹ, Mịị a ḅẹlẹma ibi Tụ́wọ ọmịnị o pughuu!
english_text: Then a cloud appeared and covered them, and a voice came from the cloud: “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri n tọ́rụ́ ikelema dighim, kụ́ma n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ arịgha, Jizọs ngéré anịị nnị na anị ngaa fịnịḅọ.
english_text: Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị tụ́ndụ ma ọgọnọ kóróḅo sáá, Jizọs warị ólóghó sua n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Nnị dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma nnị árịnyẹ, akị mú Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ fịị ḅụ saghị sáá láa.
english_text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus gave them orders not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

ibani_text: Nnị ori ólóghó bịpị warịm kụ́ma nnị ogboku bie nnị saghị anị gbolomanyẹ dughom ḅẹ́, Mịị fịị ḅụ saghị ma anị tẹ́ dughoarị?
english_text: They kept the matter to themselves, discussing what “rising from the dead” meant.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Jizọs gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma n dugho ḅẹ́ Elaija parị ḅoo ma?
english_text: And they asked him, “Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Karakárányẹ, Elaija tarị ḅoarị sị ọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma warị. Anịsáa, Tọ́ntọ́ diri ma anị tẹ́ go dugho ḅẹ́, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma opuma tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm ḅẹ́ n pịghị o sịghịbẹm?
english_text: Jesus replied,“To be sure, Elijah does come first, and restores all things. Why then is it written that the Son of Man must suffer much and be rejected?

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ anị fịnị ḅara fịnị ḅara Elaija tarị ḅomam, túminị́ pịghị n dọghụ ḅara pa ọ mịẹmam, Tọ́ntọ́ diri ma o gbolomanyẹ dugho ḅara.
english_text: But I tell you, Elijah has come, and they have done to him everything they wished, just as it is written about him.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo ori ọḅụduaapụ kọọapụ ma na gboloma sáá, n ḅoo tọgha túminị́ arịm nnị gbiri ikélékeleapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ nnị na ḅẹ́rẹ́fángálámáarị.
english_text: When they came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and the teachers of the law arguing with them.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma ḅo Jizọs árị sáá anị opuma nna tọ́rụ dam n warị mangị o dama mú si sịbịpị pa o sịị.
english_text: As soon as all the people saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with wonder and ran to greet him.

ibani_text: Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ gbilam, Ọmịnị nnị na tẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́fángálámáarị?
english_text: “What are you arguing with them about?”he asked.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ túminị́ ogbo ma bie ọ pagharam ḅẹ́, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a i tụ́wọ akuoo pa ị dámáḅom sitẹ́mẹ́ ọ ḅụ imii gosi ọ pịghị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha.
english_text: A man in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma okusáa okusáa anị ọ pa kiri gbigbim ọ́ kọ́kọ́ warị saghị ọ bịpị dari, ọ pịghị saghị aka túrú, ori oju gbọrụ warị ḅo kụ́rọ gịgị. A ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, nnị sitẹ́mẹ́ ma deesi, kụ́ma nnị inegha.
english_text: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.”

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Dighi ọ minini nyánágha ḅara! A ọmịnị na fịnị muu tẹ́ sáá láa bẹ? Tụ́wọ ma akuoo i pịrịị!
english_text: “You unbelieving generation,”Jesus replied,“how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”

ibani_text: Nnị tụ́wọ ma akuoo Jizọs pịrịm. Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma Jizọs árị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, anị nụ́nụ́obi pa tụ́wọ ma gbim, ọ warị bịghịkoro kiri warị saghị ọ pa kiri mgbepẹlẹ ọ́kọ́kọ ọ bịpị dárịarị.
english_text: So they brought him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.

ibani_text: Jizọs tụ́wọ ma daa gbilam ḅẹẹ, Anị ḅọlọ tẹ́ sáá láama, ọ saghị mị ḅara fịnị sáá? Daḅọ ma pagharam, Saghị ori ịrụ sáá éné éné.
english_text: Jesus asked the boy’s father,“How long has he been like this?” “From childhood,” he answered.

ibani_text: Tọgha sáá sitẹ́mẹ́ ma asọ dọghụmam anị ọ ḅáa, anị o suma mú fịnịbie sua na pịghị o suma muu mingi bie sua. Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána wa pịrị sị ḅárásua wa pịrịị, ḅọ́rọ́ ị ine bẹ!
english_text: “It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us.”

ibani_text: Jizọs, innh ḅẹm, Ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ḅụgbọrụ ine bẹ! Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine kiriakịbẹm minini nyánáḅọ ḅụ.
english_text: “ ‘If you can’?”said Jesus.“Everything is possible for one who believes.”

ibani_text: Tụ́wọ ma daa anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ilúghum, A minini nyánam, kụ́ma dụḅagha, ḅárásua i pịrị sị ị́yẹ́ minini dụḅa.
english_text: Immediately the boy’s father exclaimed, “I do believe; help me overcome my unbelief!”

ibani_text: Jizọs árị ḅo sáá ḅẹ́ kubiri ogbo ma nnị na kikiamam, ori igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm ḅẹ́, Biri inighi na oḅu tẹ́mẹ́, a kụrọ́ ma dugho i pịrịarị tụ́wọ ma ḅụ págháḅo sị mịnị jẹ́ pa ọ ḅụ sọma!
english_text: When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit.“You deaf and mute spirit,”he said,“I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma ilúghum warị tụ́wọ ma gbi pa sii nụ́nụ́obi ḅụ sua, warị ọ ḅụ págháḅo. Tụ́wọ ma fịị dua kịkam, kị́nị́mamgba warị dugho ḅẹ́, Ọ fịịmam!
english_text: The spirit shrieked, convulsed him violently and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, “He’s dead.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs tụ́wọ ma saghị akịm ḅara ḅụ, sị ḅárásua ọ pịrị sị ọ sẹ, o warị saghị sẹ.
english_text: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him to his feet, and he stood up.

ibani_text: Jizọs wárị sọọ fama sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ warị ọ sị, sị ḅọghu ḅara ḅụ gbíla, ḅẹ́ Tegó wamịnị ine sitẹ́mẹ́ ma deesighaa?
english_text: After Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́ghẹ̄ ngéré anịị mịị ngaa nyẹ ma deesi bẹnyẹ, jẹ́nyẹ ofori.
english_text: He replied,“This kind can come out only by prayer.”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ Galili sẹ́ ma párángáa ḅọ́rọ́m. Jizọs dọghụgha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nimi ọ fịnịngaa.
english_text: They left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus did not want anyone to know where they were,

ibani_text: Tegó ọ nyẹ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ diearị: Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma nnị ọ saghị pa ọ ḅáa bẹapụ ḅárabie suabẹm. Anị mḅẹ́sọ, tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ọ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: because he was teaching his disciples. He said to them,“The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.”

ibani_text: Mị dienyẹ ma anị dughoarị nyẹ nnị akanyaḅogha, n pịghị ḅáláfaarị nyẹ pa ọ gbíla.
english_text: But they did not understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him about it.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅoo Kapanọm láa sáá, sị wárị sọọ, Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ gbilam ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́fángálámáarị asọogbo ma ḅụ?
english_text: They came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them,“What were you arguing about on the road?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ine ọ pagharagha, tegó asọogbo n ḅẹ́rẹ́fángálámáarị nna bie tụọọ dụḅaḅáa
english_text: But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.

ibani_text: Jizọs kpọrọfịnịm warị, oyi mmẹapụ findi ma sịị, warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịna bie bịpịsụ dọghụḅọ fịnịfịnị, n ḅo amịna ḅụ pa kị́nị́mamgba ọḅụju wárii n pịghị kị́nị́mamgba ómóniḅọ sọọ.
english_text: Sitting down, Jesus called the Twelve and said,“Anyone who wants to be first must be the very last, and the servant of all.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị gbẹ́rẹ́ kálátụwọ akuoo pa nna toruku kórómaa. Ori ọ ḅara pa tụ́wọ ma fangala ikélémam warị n ḅẹẹ,
english_text: He took a little child whom he placed among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ mịnaawọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ daákịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, i daákịm; pighi i daákịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ irị ngéré daákịgha kụ́ma ị fịrịma ḅọ ma daákịm.
english_text: “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.”

ibani_text: Jọn ọ ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ wa gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ arịm, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sitẹ́mẹ́ desiariḅọ, wamịnị okikim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị mịẹma, tegó ori wámịna ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha.
english_text: “Teacher,” said John, “we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we told him to stop, because he was not one of us.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, asọ dọ́ghụ́ma sị okiki, tegó ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangịḅọ kálá sáá tụ́wọ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ine ịḅụ siinyẹ dughobịgha.
english_text: “Do not stop him,”Jesus said.“For no one who does a miracle in my name can in the next moment say anything bad about me,

ibani_text: Tegó wá dughosimaghaḅọ wamịnị na imii.
english_text: for whoever is not against us is for us.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ mingi ọmọ́ngọ sua ọ pịrị ḅo ḅẹ́ ọmịnị i nyẹẹ ẹrẹ́sị amịna gbẹ́nyẹ n ḅọ gbarịbịgha.
english_text: Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you a cup of water in my name because you belong to the Messiah will certainly not lose their reward.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ bẹḅọ bẹḅọ mị káláapụ ma mịẹbẹm sị n mịnị ịḅụ minini nyánáma, anị ibiḅaabẹm n ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ opu dapịrị pa n ḅọ kọ́ngọ kpọ sị n ḅọ pa tọ́rụ́bie gbii.
english_text: “If anyone causes one of these little ones—those who believe in me—to stumble, it would be better for them if a large millstone were hung around their neck and they were thrown into the sea.

ibani_text: Anịma gosi ḅọ́rọ́ ị ḅara mịẹbẹ sị ị siinyẹ mịẹ anị pẹ́lẹ́si anị ibiḅaabẹm ḅẹẹ ị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa duma ma sọọ, tụ́ma i mmẹẹ́ a ḅara nyáná sị ẹ́kpẹ́duaama ma sọ muu, bibigha kọ́rịfịnị ma bie sọọ.
english_text: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, where the fire never goes out.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa ma ḅụ nna kiriododo fịịfịịgha fịnị ma sọ bibịẹgha.
english_text: where the worms that eat them never die, and the fire is never quenched.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅụọ i mịẹbẹ sị i siinyẹ mịẹ, ḅụọ ma pẹ́lẹ́si! Anị ibiḅaabẹm ḅẹẹ ị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa duma ma bie sọọ tụ́ma i mmẹẹ́ a ḅụọ nyáná sị nnị ị pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama ḅụ gbi sua.
english_text: And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.

ibani_text: Nna kiriododo ma fịịfịịgha ngaa, fịnị ma sọ bibịẹgha ngaa.
english_text: where the worms that eat them never die, and the fire is never quenched.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ i tọ́rụ́ mịẹbẹ sị ị siinyẹ mịẹ anị sọghụ si, anị ibiḅaabẹm ḅẹ́ ị gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́ nyáná sị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọm, tụ́ma mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ nyáná sị nnị ị pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama yọ ma ḅụ gbi sua.
english_text: And if your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,

ibani_text: Anị ngaa  Nnị pẹ́arị kiriododo ma fịịfịịgha, n dọ́ghụ́maarị fịnị ma sọ bibịẹgha!
english_text: where “ ‘the worms that eat them do not die, and the fire is not quenched.’

ibani_text: Fịnị anịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ dọ́ghụ́ma fiafiama bẹnyẹ, nnị fụ́ pa igwa ma siri fiafiamaarị ḅara.
english_text: Everyone will be salted with fire.

ibani_text: Fụ́ ibim, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ fụ́ anị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅuumamam, ị tọ́rọ pa anị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ náa bẹ? Nangwọapụ fụ́ ma nyána, si jụghọ jụghọ na diin ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: “Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with each other.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs anị ngaa ma warisom warị Judiya párángáa ḅọ́rọ́ akị mú Jọdan tọ́rụ ma sáḅá. Tọgha túminị́ pịghị sima ọ damaḅom ọ warị nyẹ pa n die ori mịẹmịẹnyẹ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Jesus then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ dia tuú pa ọ pịrịm, warị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Dugho wa pịrị, ólóghó ma anị mini ḅẹ́ owitụ́wọ amịna taa sịghị?
english_text: Some Pharisees came and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị pịghị gbíla nyẹ pa n págháraa ḅẹẹ, Mosis ọ tẹ́ ólóghó pa ọ pịrị?
english_text: “What did Moses command you?”he replied.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam ḅẹ, Mosis ólóghó pịrịm ḅẹ́ n yaasịghị birinụ́nụ́ ábálálá gịẹ ọ taa pịrị sị a fịrịma págháma.
english_text: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Mosis mị ólóghó ma gịẹ ọ pịrịm, tegó ọmịnị opuma ḅụdam nyẹ pa ọ die ḅụ.
english_text: “It was because your hearts were hard that Moses wrote you this law,”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma parị parị sáá, n tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́ sáá, Tamuno owi na ẹ́rẹ́ na ḅụ n tẹmẹm Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara.
english_text: “But at the beginning of creation God ‘made them male and female.’

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị owitụ́wọ ọ daa na o nyingi wárịsóbẹm sị ọ táa na gboloma
english_text: ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,

ibani_text: nnị mmẹapụ ma ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ́bẹm; anịgoo nnị mịnị mmẹapụgha, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: and the two will become one flesh.’So they are no longer two, but one flesh.

ibani_text: Tamuno mịẹ gboloma maá nyẹ, tumḅọ anị puuama dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”

ibani_text: Nnị pịghịma warị muu sáá ọḅụduaapụ ma mị ḅẹ́rẹ́ gbolomanyẹ pa Jizọs gbilam o dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ,
english_text: When they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.

ibani_text: Amịna táa sịghịḅọ sị muu jẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa, amadọghụ siinyẹ mịẹ ọ táa ma pụ́nụ́mam.
english_text: He answered,“Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma a dee sịghị ọ́rụ́ḅọ sị jẹ́ owiḅọ yaa amadọghụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ sọm.
english_text: And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.”

ibani_text: Jẹapụ awọ akuoo ḅoo Jizọs pịrịm ḅẹ́ ọ ḅara pa nna lama, kụ́ma ori, ọḅụduaapụ ma igani túminị́ ma pịrịm.
english_text: People were bringing little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them, but the disciples rebuked them.

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma árị ḅo sáá anị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ igánimam, ọ warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Awọamaapụ ma wáriso sị nnị i damaḅo ọmịnị n kikima tegó Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị nwọfịnịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them,“Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ḅẹ́ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma daákịghaḅọ kálátụwọ ḅara ine jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné anị bie sọbịgha.
english_text: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị awọamaapụ ma akị ọ ḅarabie, ọ ḅara pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅụ gbánā warị n karịibima.
english_text: And he took the children in his arms, placed his hands on them and blessed them.

ibani_text: Jizọs saghị jẹ́ pa nwángị sáá gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ mangị ọ damaḅom, warị o tọ́rụ́kuu ẹkpẹrẹkị sị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ibi Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a tẹ́ mịẹbẹ sị duma gbámásó nyáná?
english_text: As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ pagharam, Ị tegó ibiḅọ pa i sịị? Ibiḅọ ofori Tamuno siima.
english_text: “Why do you call me good?”Jesus answered.“No one is good—except God alone.

ibani_text: I kọkọ ólóghó mamgba nimi: Kị́nị́ ḅáama; amadọghụma; fúrúma; tumḅọ nimigha nyẹ pa n ḅo sịbị gbánāma; kị́nị́ inómámá; osigha pa i daá na i nyingi pịrịị.
english_text: You know the commandments: ‘You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not defraud, honor your father and mother.’”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, saghị a ịrụ sáá éné éné, amịna ólóghó mamgba kokom.
english_text: “Teacher,” he declared, “all these I have kept since I was a boy.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹlẹma tọ́rụ́ pa dada o dighim, warị ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ngéré kọọm. Muu ị nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrị sị igbii ma pa igonyiapụ pịrịị, anịsáa anịị i sobie ngọ ma nyáná bẹnyẹ; anịsáa ḅo sị i duaa.
english_text: Jesus looked at him and loved him.“One thing you lack,”he said.“Go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma mịma náa sáá, ọ tọ́rụ́fụ́rụ́mam, ọ warị tẹ́mẹ́sii pa soo, tegó ori opuma ngọ kọm.
english_text: At this the man’s face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.

ibani_text: Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ ma dighi ikélémam warị n ḅẹẹ, Anị kpọma ḅụdábẹm ngọ nyánáapụ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọọ!
english_text: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples,“How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ma kpọma ori ọḅụduaapụ ma jighemam, kụma Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị warị ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ awọ, anị ḅụ́da ḅara sị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọọ.
english_text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again,“Children, how hard it isto enter the kingdom of God!

ibani_text: Anị ḅụdaḅaa ngọ nyánáḅọ pịrịm sị ọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọọ, anịmanakaragha anị sárásáráḅa kameli pa sị nama ma pịrịm si anị alaga tọ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ori ọḅụduaapụ ma tọ́rụ́ bulubulumam nnị warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ gbíla, Anịsáa tụọ ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyána bẹ?
english_text: The disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, “Who then can be saved?”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ pa nnị ọgọnọ gbánām warị págháraa ḅẹ́, Mịma túminị́ ḅụ, anịị ine mịẹbịgha nyẹ, kụ́ma Tamuno ḅugha, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno ḅụ anị sárásárám.
english_text: Jesus looked at them and said,“With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Pita warị pụghọ saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́, Dighi wa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ warisomam sị ị dua!
english_text: Then Peter spoke up, “We have left everything to follow you!”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Karakárányẹ, a pịghị dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́, ọmịna ḅụ wárị warisoapụ anịgha minaowiapụ wáriso anịgha mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ warisoapụ anịgha nyingiapụ anịgha daapụ anịgha awọamaapụ anịgha duakiri, i sịbị go na ibi oku ma gosi
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”Jesus replied,“no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel

ibani_text: mịma nẹ́ngị nyẹ nyánábẹm, mịị tuminikiri ma ḅụ. Nnị sọ́nọ́ a si kiri nyánábẹm, warịị mịná owiapụ, mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ, nyingiapụ awọamaapụ na duakiri na pịghị tọ́rụ́siarị; mịị tuminikiri, pịghị ḅoarị tuminikiri nnị duma gbámásó nyánábẹm.
english_text: will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come eternal life.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọghaapụ mị́sa bịpịsuapụ ọḅụkọọbẹm, tọghaapụ mị́sa oḅụkọapụ bịpịsụbẹm.
english_text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ mị́sa asọogbo imii, nwángị Jerusalem muarị. Jizọs nna ḅụ tórúku dam, ori ọḅụduaapụ ma anị n tọ́rụ bulubulumam; anịsáa oduarịapụ ma nna ḅáláfam. Jizọs warị pịghị jẹ́ pa ori ọḅụduarị oyi mmẹapụ findi ma sị angaá pịrị warị ọ ḅụ pághá bẹnyẹ dugho n pịrị.
english_text: They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, O pughu, wa iwóo Jerusalem múuarị, nnị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma saghị sịbịdaa igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ḅárásua bẹnyẹ. Nnị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri kọọ o pịrịbẹm, sị ọ saghị Juughaapụ ma ḅarabie suabẹm,
english_text: “We are going up to Jerusalem,”he said,“and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles,

ibani_text: nnị ọ pa dẹrịnyẹ mịẹbẹm, n fị́lā pa ọ sárábẹm, o fomu, si pịghị ọ ḅá, kụ́ma tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ọ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: who will mock him and spit on him, flog him and kill him. Three days later he will rise.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jems na Jọn, Zebidi awọ Jizọs damaḅom warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, nyẹ imim wa bi sị ị mịẹ wa pịrị.
english_text: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị gbilam, Anị tẹ́ nyẹ?
english_text: “What do you want me to do for you?”he asked.

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Ị ị́yẹ́ imine ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnị sáá ị́yẹ́ ipine ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ wa bim ḅẹ́ wa ịrị na kpọrọfịnị, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ị́yẹ́ ámáḅara ngaa, isiḅọ ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ngaa.
english_text: They replied, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Ọmịnị o biiarị nyẹ nimigha. Ọmịnị ine a bie tọ́rụ́siarị mingi ḅuu ọmọngọ ma bie mingi ḅụ bẹ? Ọmịnị ine n pa i sara mingi sara bẹ?
english_text: “You don’t know what you are asking,”Jesus said.“Can you drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Wamịnị inebẹm. Jizọs n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị karakáráma a ḅuu ọmọngọ ma ḅuubẹm ọ pịghị mingi sárábẹm n mingi pa i sara ḅara,
english_text: “We can,” they answered. Jesus said to them,“You will drink the cup I drink and be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with,

ibani_text: kụ́ma a kụ́rọ nyanagha sẹ́lẹ́ ị́yẹ́ ámáḅara anịgha ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara kpọrọfịnị bẹḅọ Tamuno anịị mị kiri ma pa o tẹ́lẹ́ma pịrịapụ pịrịbẹḅọ.
english_text: but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”

ibani_text: Isi oyi ọḅụduaapụ anị gbolomanyẹ náa sáá, nnị warị Jems na Jọn dighi bieoḅu.
english_text: When the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba sịị ọ ḅụ pịrị warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹ́ n pa táarịapụ ma siiapụ ma kụ́rọ nyánam n táarị Juughaapụ ma ḅụ, nna sịbịdaapụ pịghị kụ́rọ mamgba nyánam.
english_text: Jesus called them together and said,“You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.

ibani_text: Mịma anị ọkọfịnị ḅara ọkọfịnị ḅara anị ọkọ fịnịgha ọmịnị ogboku bie ọmịna bie dụḅa dọghụḅọ fịnịfịnị, n ḅo kọọapụ ma ómóniḅọ sọọ.
english_text: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna bie bịpịsụ dọghụḅọ fịnị fịnịị kị́nị́mamgba omoniḅọ dighibẹm
english_text: and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma sọ ḅogha ḅẹẹ túminị́ fịrịnwangị ọ pịrị, o ḅoo fịrịnwangị túminị́ pịrịm, pịghị ori duma pa pịrị sị túminị́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

ibani_text: Nnị Jeriko ḅom, Jizọs na ori ọḅụduarịapụ na tọgha túminị́ soarị sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́pụ nyẹ biiḅọ Batimiyọs pa sịḅọ, Timiyọs tụ́wọ kpọrọfịnịarị asọogbo ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (which means “son of Timaeus”), was sitting by the roadside begging.

ibani_text: O ḅo náa sáá ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́arị ḅo anịị Jizọs Krais Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, ọ saghị ilúghum, Jizọs! Deviti tụwọ! Lolomakúkúbie nyáná i pịrịị!
english_text: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”

ibani_text: Tọghaapụ igani ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ọ bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄, kụ́ma anịsáa, anịị ọ pịghị pụghọ saghị ilúghuḅa nyẹ, Deviti tụ́wọ, lolomakúkúbie nyáná i pịrị!
english_text: Many rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

ibani_text: Jizọs biasẹm, warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ sịị. Nnị warị tọ́rụ́pụ owitụ́wọ ma sịị, ḅẹẹ, Bieḅẹlẹ! Saghị sẹ! Ori ị sịịarị.
english_text: Jesus stopped and said,“Call him.” So they called to the blind man, “Cheer up! On your feet! He’s calling you.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ pa ḅụ gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ ma gbi ḅuuma sị dosi muu Jizọs damaḅo.
english_text: Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs o gbilam, I dọghụ mọ ḅẹ́ a tẹ́ mịẹ ị pịrịị? Tọ́rụ́pụ owitụ́wọ ma warị ọ págháraa, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a pịghị sima nyẹ́arị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: “What do you want me to do for you?”Jesus asked him. The blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to see.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, Soo, ị́yẹ́ minini ị gwọmam. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ori ine nyẹ́ arịm sị Jizọs dua nwángị asọogbo ma ḅụ.
english_text: “Go,”said Jesus,“your faith has healed you.”Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Jerusalem na kikia sáá, sị ḅo Bẹtịfegi na Bẹtani láa Olivu Tụ́ndụ ma ọgọnọ, Jizọs ori mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ fịrịmam.
english_text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples,

ibani_text: Nnị ḅẹarị ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị tórúku ju fịnị káláama ma muu, ọmịnị anị ngaa láa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá ásụ tụ́wọ árịbẹm n kpọwarị nyẹ, jẹ́ éné tumḅọ na tándigha nyẹ. Anị fiima sị anị pa mịnga ḅoo.
english_text: saying to them,“Go to the village ahead of you, and just as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́ pịghị i gbíla gbíla ḅẹẹ, i tegó ọkọ mịẹarị, dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma anị bim, ọ pịghị mị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anị fịrịma ḅoobẹm.
english_text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here shortly.’ ”

ibani_text: Nnị warị muu asọogbo ásụ tụ́wọ árị n kpọwarị nyẹ ḅụ́pọ́ ḅụ. Nnị anị fiimaarị sáá,
english_text: They went and found a colt outside in the street, tied at a doorway. As they untied it,

ibani_text: anị ngaa sẹ́fịnị jẹ́apụ o gbilam, Ọ tẹ́ mịẹarị, ásụ tụ́wọ ma fiimaarị?
english_text: some people standing there asked, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam Jizọs dugho n pịrịị ḅara ma, túminị́ kpo ma warị n wáriso.
english_text: They answered as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them go.

ibani_text: Nnị ásụ tụ́wọ ma akuoo Jizọs pịrịm warị nna ḅụ gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ pa nama ma ọgọnọ isé, Jizọs warị anị ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnị,
english_text: When they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, he sat on it.

ibani_text: Tọghaapụ nna bịtẹ pa asọogbo ma ḅụ isém, jẹ́apụ warị sị ḅara pẹ́lẹ́ duakiri ḅụ sị pa asọogbo ma ḅụ isé.
english_text: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread branches they had cut in the fields.

ibani_text: Tórúku fịnị túminị́ na pịghị ọḅụju n duaarịapụ warị saghị ilúghú, Hozana! Boma fịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅoarị ḅo pịrị.
english_text: Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted, “Hosanna!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!”

ibani_text: Tamuno ḅoarị wámịna daa Deviti ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma karịibima! Hozana sóghólóḅa angaá!
english_text: “Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!” “Hosanna in the highest heaven!”

ibani_text: Jizọs Jerusalem sọm, warị Tamunoopuwarị ma sọọ muu, warị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dighi ikelekele. Kụ́ma sáá muu ma ḅara ma ọ pághá so Bẹtani múm ori na ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.

ibani_text: Énéḅa, nnị Bẹtani ḅụ saghị ḅoarị sáá ḅuru Jizọs tárịm.
english_text: The next day as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọanga ḅụ ọ fịgị sị ma arịm, ányị́nyá sịbị bii nyẹ, o warị muu ḅẹ́ ọ fịgị sịmgbọ́lụ árịbeotuo anị ọgọnọ, kụ́ma o ḅo anị láa sáá, ányị́nyá ányị́nyá ngéré anịị ori árịnyẹ tegó fịgị sịmgbọlụ sa na laagha.
english_text: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to find out if it had any fruit. When he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.

ibani_text: Jizọs fịgị sị ma ḅẹm, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mịnị jẹ́ pa ị sịbị fịgị fịbịghaa! Ori ọḅụduaapụ ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naam.
english_text: Then he said to the tree,“May no one ever eat fruit from you again.”And his disciples heard him say it.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo Jerusalem láa sáá, o Tamuno warị ma sọọ múm warị anị bie túḅo kọọarịapụ mamgba deesi, igbii dimaarịapụ ma ịkasị ọ saghị iḅomam, na elesia dẹrịarịapụ ma ịkasị saghị iḅomam,
english_text: On reaching Jerusalem, Jesus entered the temple courts and began driving out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves,

ibani_text: ọ pịghị minibịgha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ dighi ḅọ́rọ́ Tamunoopuwarị ma nụ́ngọ.
english_text: and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.

ibani_text: Ọ warị anịsáa, túminị́ ma die, bẹ, Nnị gịẹ kórómam Tọ́ndiri ma bie, Tamuno dugho ngaa ḅẹ́,  I warị ma tuminikiri gbọrụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ warị anịị n pa anị sịị bẹnyẹ. Kụ́ma ọmịnị anị pa furuapụ ḅoghuḅoghu angaá mịẹmam!
english_text: And as he taught them, he said,“Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’”

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma, mịma naam, n warị saghị asọ dọghụ nnị Jizọs ḅá bẹ ḅara. Nnị ọ dighi ḅáláfam tegó túminị́ kpo ma anị n tọ́rụ bulubulumaarị ori dienyẹ ma.
english_text: The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.

ibani_text: Éné ḅo ḅupiri sáá, Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ opu ama ma warisom.
english_text: When evening came, Jesus and his discipleswent out of the city.

ibani_text: Dede dédé, anị ḅụ éné ḅa, nnị asọogbo ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́arị sáá, nnị fịgị sị ma arịm. Anị fịịmam akị mú anị kune láa.
english_text: In the morning, as they went along, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.

ibani_text: Pita pághányẹ pa biekórómam, warị Jizọs ḅẹ́, Dighi, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, ị gbóoó fịgị sị ma fịịmam!
english_text: Peter remembered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered!”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Ọ Tamuno ḅụ minini nyánáa.
english_text: “Have faith in God,”Jesus answered.

ibani_text: A tụ́manyẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, mịị tụ́ndụ ma ḅẹ́ bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ ịḅụ si akị mú tọ́rụ́ ogbo koro, n ḅo tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹgha kụ́ma mininim ḅẹ́ n ḅo dughonyẹ mịẹbẹm, anị pịghị ọkọfịnị n ḅo pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “TrulyI tell you, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and does not doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen, it will be done for them.

ibani_text: Mịma gosi, a dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị nyẹ́ biiarị sáá, minini ḅẹ́ ọ nyanaḅomam, ọ pịghị o binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyánábẹm.
english_text: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.

ibani_text: Ị sẹ́fịnị sị tẹ́ghẹ́arị sáá, tumḅọ pa ị mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sii wáriso n ḅọ pịrị, ị́yẹ́ sobie Daḅọ so ị́yẹ́ sii wáriso i pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.”

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị sima Jerusalem ḅụ árụ́ sọmam, Jizọs Tamunoopuwarị ma bie nwángịarị sáá, igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na sẹ́nịapụ ma ọ damaḅom.
english_text: They arrived again in Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders came to him.

ibani_text: Warị o gbíla, I tẹ́ kụ́rọ nyána sị ị mịẹarịnyẹ ma mịẹ? Tụọ anị kụ́rọ ma pa ị pịrịị?
english_text: “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you authority to do this?”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị pagharam, A kálá gbẹ́rẹ́ gbíla nyẹ pa ọ gbilabẹm, ọmịnị i págháraa págháraa, a dugho ọ pịrịbẹm a nyáná kụ́rọ sị a mịẹarịnyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

ibani_text: O dugho i pịrị, Jọn ọ pa mingi saraarị kụ́rọ ma anị tẹ́ angaá saghị ḅo? Anị Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo anịgha túminị́ ḅara?
english_text: John’s baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin? Tell me!”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị nụná nna ogboku bie, Wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Wa pagharaa pagharaa ḅẹ́ Anị Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom, ọ ḅẹbẹm bẹ, O tegó Jọn mininigha?
english_text: They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ ḅẹ́ túminị́ ḅara, (nnị túminị́ ma dighi ḅáláfaarị, tegó kị́nị́mamgba mininim ḅẹ́ Jọn ori anịị ikiakoroḅọ).
english_text: But if we say, ‘Of human origin’ …” (They feared the people, for everyone held that John really was a prophet.)

ibani_text: Anịgoo n Jizọs pagharam ḅẹ́, Wa nimigha. Jizọs warị n ḅẹ́, Irịsọ a dugho ọ pịrịbịgha a ḅọ́rọ́ pa mị fịrị ma nwángịarị kụ́rọ.
english_text: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said,“Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị lụghụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ n pịrị ḅẹẹ; Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imii vainị duakiri nyánáḅọ sị onu gbiri anị ikelema, olulu sughuu nnị sịmgbọlụ iru pọnjị pọnjị pághámaḅo angaá ma pịrị warị pịghị diikuruḅọ warị nama. Anịsáa ọ warị vainị duakiri ma pa ọkọ pịrị pa anị bie angaá biapụ pịrị sị sọ nyẹ́ mú.
english_text: Jesus then began to speak to them in parables:“A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.

ibani_text: Sịmgbọlụ ma kobiri sáá ḅo láa sáá, ori omoniḅọ fịrịma ọkọapụ damamum sị nnị ori diekiri pa ọ pịrịị.
english_text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.

ibani_text: Ọkọapụ ma ómóniḅọ ma kum, ibima o fomtẹ́lẹ́ma warị pápáḅara pa ọfịrị ma soo.
english_text: But they seized him, beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa dua nyánáḅọ ma warị pịghị jẹ́ ómóniḅọ fịrịma, ọkọapụ mingaḅọ fomtẹ́lẹ́mam ọ sịbị, warị ibiḅara pa ọ ḅụ́gịrịrịma.
english_text: Then he sent another servant to them; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully.

ibani_text: Dua nyánáḅọ ma jẹ́ ómóniḅọ fịrịmam nnị ọ ḅám warị pịghị mị ḅara pa tọgha jẹ́ ómóniapụ mịẹ, jẹ́apụ fom, jẹ́apụ ḅáa.
english_text: He sent still another, and that one they killed. He sent many others; some of them they beat, others they killed.

ibani_text: Kọọ ḅọ ngéré ọ fịrịma, anịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹlẹma ibi tụwọ. Kị́nị́mamgba ḅụ kunema ọ warị ọ tụ́wọ fịrịma, dughoarị ḅẹ́, I tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọm ḅẹ́ nnị i tụ́wọ osibẹm.
english_text: “He had one left to send, a son, whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị ọkọapụ ma jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹm, Mịị dua nyánáḅọ ma tụ́wọ, o ḅo wamịnị ọ ḅá ori ngọ wámịna nyẹ sọọ bẹ ḅara!
english_text: “But the tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

ibani_text: Nnị warị tụ́wọ ma kuu sị ọ ḅá warị ori dua gbi págháma vainị duakiri ma ḅụ.
english_text: So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, duakiri ma nyánáḅọ ma ọ tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? O ḅobẹm sị vainị duakiri ma ọkọapụ ma ḅá, sị duakiri ma saghị jẹ́apụ pịrị.
english_text: “What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ mị tọ́ndiri ma goo ma:  Wárinámáapụ sịghị dapịrị ma anịị mị́sa warị ma dighi sẹ́ma dapịrị;
english_text: Haven’t you read this passage of Scripture: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone;

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ anịị mịị nyẹ ma mịẹḅọ, anị pịghị kpọma ḅụ́gbérépumam!
english_text: the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

ibani_text: Juuapụ sịbịdaapụ asọ dọ́ghụm nnị Jizọs kuu bẹ ḅara, tegó n ninim ḅẹ́ o mị lụghụ ma gba pa npụ́nụ́mam. Kụ́ma nnị túminị́ kpo ma dighi ḅáláfam gosi nnị o warisom sị nwángị sọọ.
english_text: Then the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them. But they were afraid of the crowd; so they left him and went away.

ibani_text: Nnị jẹa Farisiiapụ na pịghị jẹa Hẹrọd ogboapụ fịrịma sị nnị mú gbíla nyẹ pa dia tuú Jizọs pịrị.
english_text: Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ damaḅom warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa nimim ḅẹ́ i karakárányẹ ma dugho dughom, túminị́ kórómaarị nyẹ balagha pa. I sáá nyána túminị́ láa kiri pịrịgha kụ́ma karakárányẹ ma diearị, Tamuno bii nyẹ túminị́ mịẹ. Dugho wa pịrị, anị wámịna ólóghó kaá bẹ wa oso igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ Rom ḅụ táarịḅọ ma pịrịị? Wa gbẹ́ẹ̄ múno sị wa gbẹ́ẹ̄ ma?
english_text: They came to him and said, “Teacher, we know that you are a man of integrity. You aren’t swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay the imperial taxto Caesar or not?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs n tiiarị epele arịm warị pagharam ḅẹẹ, O tegó dia tuú i pịrịarị? Gbẹ́rẹ́ pị́naḅala igbii akuoo sị a dighi.
english_text: Should we pay or shouldn’t we?” But Jesus knew their hypocrisy.“Why are you trying to trap me?”he asked.“Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ akuoo ọ pịrị, ọ warị gbíla, Mịma o tụọ tórúku na pịghị tụọ ẹ́rẹ́? Nnị pagharam, Táarịḅọ ma.
english_text: They brought the coin, and he asked them,“Whose image is this? And whose inscription?” “Caesar’s,” they replied.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹ́, Gbẹ́ẹ̄ Táarịḅọ ma pịrị ọ láa nyẹ, pịghị gbẹ́ẹ̄ Tamuno pịrị ọ láa nyẹ.
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“Give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s and to God what is God’s.” And they were amazed at him.

ibani_text: Jizọs n págháraa ḅara ma warị túminị́ ma tọ́rụ nẹ́ngị. Anịsáa, jẹa Sadusiiapụ, ḅẹapụ ḅẹ́ túminị́ fịị ḅụ saghịbịgha, Jizọs damaḅom sị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́dieḅọ, Mosis mị ólóghó ma gịẹ wa pịrịm: Ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ fịịfịị sị ọ táa wáriso awọ nna ogboku bie ófórigha pa, fịịḅọ ma mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ táaḅọ ma yáabẹm si nnị awọ yii fịịḅọ ma pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri, sọ́nọ́ma owi mịnaapụ imi; nna ḅụ sẹ́nịḅaḅọ ma ọrụḅọyam sị fịị tụ́wọ yiigha pa.
english_text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died without leaving any children.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámáḅọ ma warị a yaa, ori sọ pịghị fịịm awọ yiigha pa. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma tẹ́rẹ́ kárámáḅọ ma ḅụ pághám.
english_text: The second one married the widow, but he also died, leaving no child. It was the same with the third.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, akị mú nnị sọ́nọ́máapụ mamgba ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma yaam sị fịịm árị na awọ yiigha pa. Kunema ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma sọ ḅo fịịm.
english_text: In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.

ibani_text: Mị́sa fịịapụ mamgba saghị bẹ éné, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma a tụọ táa sọọ bẹ? Sọ́nọ́maapụ mamgba árị na yaa ḅara ma.
english_text: At the resurrectionwhose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”
