ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam ḅẹẹ, Dighi ọ mịnị irima ḅara! O tegó mị irima ma irima, anịị ọ Tọ́ndiri ma nimigha anịgha Tamuno ma kụ́rọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghị sáá, sobie fịnị sookumuapụ fịnị ḅara anịị n fịnị bẹ ḅara n táa yaabịgha.
english_text: When the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.

ibani_text: Mị́sa fịịapụ ma sághị gbolomanyẹ, na o googha Mosis gịẹ diri ḅụ, dọghụarị piri gbolomanyẹ? Anị angaá n gịẹm ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Mosis ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Irị anị Ebraham Tamuno ma, Aizik Tamuno ma, na pịghị Jekọpụ Tamuno.
english_text: Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

ibani_text: Ori anị dumaapụ Tamuno ma, fịịmaapụ Tamunogha. Ọmịnị karakáráma irimam!
english_text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma nyẹ́die gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ anị ngaa ma ḅụ imi sị kóró ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mamgba nam. Ori arịm ḅẹ́ Jizọs ibiḅara pa Sadusiiapụ ma pịrịmam, ọ warị gbẹ́rẹ́ gbíla nyẹ pa ọ damaḅoo ḅẹẹ: Ólóghó mamgba ḅụ tẹ́ ngaa nyẹ ḅụ́palịma ḅá?
english_text: One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating. Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer, he asked him, “Of all the commandments, which is the most important?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam ḅẹ́, Ḅụ́palịma ḅa ólóghó ma mịị anị: O pughu Izirẹlị! Wa Nyáná Tamuno ma, ori ngéré anịị Wányánáḅọ ma.
english_text: “The most important one,”answered Jesus,“is this: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.

ibani_text: Ikúkúbie mamgba pa ị Nyáná Tamuno ma ḅẹlẹma na pịghị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ mamgba.
english_text: Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá sị opuma ḅụ́palịma ḅáa ólóghó mịị anị: Ịrị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara pa ịrị na kikiama ngaa ḅọ ḅẹlẹma. Mịị mmẹẹ́ ólóghó ma nẹ́ngị nyẹ ofori.
english_text: The second is this: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’There is no commandment greater than these.”

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieḅọ warị Jizọs ḅẹ́, Ịrị ibiḅara pa pagharam, Nyẹ́dieḅọ! Anị tụ́manyẹ i dugho ḅara ma ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ngéré anị Tamuno ḅẹ́, jẹ́ Tamuno pịghị ofori ori sighima.
english_text: “Well said, teacher,” the man replied. “You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him.

ibani_text: I pịghị ị kúkúbie gbọrụ na ị́yẹ́ kóróma na pịghị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ mamgba pa ị Nyáná Tamuno ḅẹlẹma, pighi ịrị na kikiama ngaaḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, ọmịna bie gbọrụ na pịghị ọmịna ịnyọ mamgba; ị pịghị ịrị na kikia angaá ngaaḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm ị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara. Mịná mmẹẹ́ ólóghó ma koko, anị ibiḅaa ẹ́bẹ ọgọnọ nama ḅáa igwagwaá Tamuno pịrị nẹngịm.
english_text: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

ibani_text: Jizọs árị sáá, ọ sịbịbie pa págháraarị ḅara, o dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ ịrị anị ḅụ ḅọlọanga oforii. Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine jẹ́ pa nyẹ pa Jizọs gbilagha.
english_text: When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him,“You are not far from the kingdom of God.”And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions.

ibani_text: Jizọs nyẹ́diearị sáá, Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, ọ mịị gbíla nyẹ ma gbilam, Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma n tẹ́ go dugho ḅẹ́, Mesaya ma Deviti furo anịị ọ saghị ḅo bẹnyẹ?
english_text: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he asked,“Why do the teachers of the law say that the Messiah is the son of David?

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma Deviti mịẹm sị o dugho ḅẹ́:  Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma Inyanaḅọ ḅẹm: Mịnga iyẹ amaḅaranga kpọrọfịnị akị mú a ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ pa ị ḅụọ sughu sua.
english_text: David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’

ibani_text: Deviti ọ ḅụgbọrụ Inyanaḅọ pa ọ sịm anịsáa, Mesaya ma ọ tọ́rọ́ pa Deviti furobie saghị págháḅo bẹ? Kobiri ogbo ma bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ Jizọs kọọ n pịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pughuarị.
english_text: David himself calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?” The large crowd listened to him with delight.

ibani_text: Ori n diearị sáá warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieapụ ma ḅụ, ọmịnị ọḅụ ẹbị nangwọ bịtẹ sua sị nwángịma ḅọ́rọ́ dọghụapụ, dọghụarịapụ ḅẹ́ túminị́ fẹ́siri osigha ḅara pa sịbịpị pa n sịị,
english_text: As he taught, Jesus said,“Watch out for the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted with respect in the marketplaces,

ibani_text: Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma bie n sẹlẹ sighima ịkasị ḅụ, anịị n fịnị dọghụ ngaa, nyẹ́fị kiri n pịghị ibikiri ḅụ fịnị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

ibani_text: Nnị deefịị ẹ́rẹ́ inomam warị nna warị fúrú n ḅarabie, oḅori pa kị́nị́ si ḅụ nángwọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ. Nna gbẹfịnyẹ kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm!
english_text: They devour widows’ houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Tamunoopuwarị igbii koko angaá ma ḅụ kikiama kpọrọfịnị sáá, ọ túminị́ ma dighim n ḅara warị nna igbii ma suarị ḅara. Tọgha igbii nyánáapụ tọgha igbii suam;
english_text: Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts.

ibani_text: Anịsáa gbẹ́rẹ́ ịgónyí deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ warị ḅoo mmẹẹ́ kálá afụ igbii gbi suam.
english_text: But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a few cents.

ibani_text: Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ sị kobirim, warị n ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ mị ịgónyí deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma dụḅaḅáa igbii sua kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịmam igbii daá igbe ma bie.
english_text: Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said,“Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, isiapụ suam nna nyánányẹ ḅụ kọọ nyẹ; kụ́ma árị, árị ịgónyí láa ḅara ḅụ, a nyánányẹ mamgba anị a pịrịnyẹ. A fị sị pa duma bẹnyẹ mamgba anịị a pa pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Tamunoopuwárị ma warịsoarị sáá ori gbẹ́rẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ dughom, Dighi Nyẹ́dieḅọ! Mịị tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅụ́gbérépuma dapịrị na pịghị tọ́rọ fịnị wárị!
english_text: As Jesus was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher! What massive stones! What magnificent buildings!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ọ kọkọ mị opuma dụḅa wárị ma árị? Gbẹ́rẹ́ dapịrị sọ kiri kọọbịgha anị parị fịnịkiri; n nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ suma gbibẹm.
english_text: “Do you see all these great buildings?”replied Jesus.“Not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Olivu Tụ́ndụ ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnịarị sa Tamunoopuwarị ma na dama dama ngaa anịị Pita Jems Jọn na Anduru ḅọghu ḅara pa ọ damaḅo nyẹ.
english_text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John and Andrew asked him privately,

ibani_text: Si ọ ḅẹ́, Dugho wa pịrị, Mịma tẹ́ sáá kiriakị bẹ? Pịghị dugho wa pịrị pághá bẹnyẹ si die ḅẹ sáá ma lámam mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakị bẹ sáá.
english_text: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Ọ ḅụ ẹbị, ọ pịghị minima sị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ oḅori pa ọ sị.
english_text: Jesus said to them:“Watch out that no one deceives you.

ibani_text: Tọghaapụ ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅobẹm, ḅẹẹ bẹapụ ḅẹ́, Irị anịị ori, nnị pịghị oḅori pa tọghaapụ sịbẹm.
english_text: Many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and will deceive many.

ibani_text: Ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ ḅụ pịrịma, ọ saghị ọmụ́ ọwụ náa bẹ sa kikia angaá na pịghị ọ́mụ́ gbolomanyẹ náa ḅọlọ́nga ḅụ. Mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakịbẹm mịma dughogha ḅẹ́ kunema ma lámam.
english_text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sẹ owu pa jẹ́ sẹ pághámabẹm, gbẹ́rẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri owu pa jẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri pághámabẹm. Tuminikiri ma jighebẹm ngaamamgba ḅụ, ḅuruḅa pịghị fịnịbẹm. Mịma anịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụ́wọ yii ḅụakụ ḅụ fịnị ḅara anịị anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sọ, ọmịnị ọ ḅụ ẹbị. Nnị okubẹm sị ọ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ sịrị mubẹm. Nnị o fombẹm nna kobiri yọ ḅụ, nnị o mịẹbẹm sị ọ sẹ táarịapụ na ámányánáapụ tórúku i sịbị go, sị ọmịnị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: “You must be on your guard. You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues. On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ parị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma kị́nị́mamgba pịrịbẹm, anịsáa anịị kunema ma ḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.

ibani_text: Nnị oku si ọ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri mú sáá, ọ báláma sị saghị kóróma parị ọ dugho bẹnyẹ; sáá ma láa maẹrẹ ọ bịpịbie sọọnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dugho, ọ kọọ bẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma ọmịnị angaá nyẹ́gha; Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅara anịị anị saghị ḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Mịná owiapụ nna jẹ́ mịná owiapụ dẹrịfị pa fịị bie suabẹm, daapụ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma pa nna awọ mịẹbẹm. Awọamaapụ tọ́rụ pịghị nna daapụ na nna nyingiapụ dáabẹm si árị ḅẹ́ nnị n ḅáa.
english_text: “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba o dighi ḅụ akụbẹm i sịbị gosi. Kụ́ma inema nyána mú kunema láa ḅo anịị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyána bẹḅọ.
english_text: Everyone will hate you because of me, but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.

ibani_text: Ọ saghị túminị́ Árị na ibighaa nyẹ ma árị sáá anị fịnị na ibighaa angaá (goo ḅo ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma akanyaḅo) Anịsáa Judiya ḅụ fịnịapụ mangị tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ muu.
english_text: “When you see ‘the abomination that causes desolation’standing where itdoes not belong—let the reader understand—then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

ibani_text: Wárị osu ḅụ fịnịḅọ sáá ngúmá ma ḅẹ́ n ḅọ kóró muunyẹ biibẹm n ḅo pa muu bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Let no one on the housetop go down or enter the house to take anything out.

ibani_text: Duakiri ḅụ fịnịḅọ wárị ḅoo ma ḅẹ́ n ḅọ gbẹbịtẹ akị́dọghum.
english_text: Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anị tọ́rọ fịnị ḅáláfáma nyẹ dighi fura ẹ́rẹ́ na káláawọ ọlọ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ pịrịbẹ!
english_text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, mịnanyẹ ma kiriakịbịgha fọ́ngụ bie!
english_text: Pray that this will not take place in winter,

ibani_text: Anịsáa biri ma ḅụḅáláḅálá siḅaá Tamuno tuminikiri tẹ́mẹ́ sa éné éné anị árị ma ḅụḅáláḅálá nẹ́ngịbẹm, akị muu anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma láa. Ọkọfịnị jẹ́nyẹ mịnị jẹ́ pa kiriakịbịgha.
english_text: because those will be days of distress unequaled from the beginning, when God created the world, until now—and never to be equaled again.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ anị éné ma mịẹ gbulumamam, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ mịẹgha, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábịgha, ọ sẹ́lẹ́ ọ ḅụ pịrịapụ ma gosi anị fịnị ḅara fịnị ḅara ori éné ma mịẹ gbulumamam.
english_text: “If the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened them.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ i ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Dighi, mịị Mesaya ma! Anịgha, Dighi, ori anị angaá imii! Minini ma.
english_text: At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.

ibani_text: Tegó iruo Messaya na iruo ikiakoroapụ págháḅobẹm. Nnị tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịbẹm sị n pa oḅori pa Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma sị ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ine inee.
english_text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ karakáráma, a tórúku ḅoarị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dugho ọ pịrịmam.
english_text: So be on your guard; I have told you everything ahead of time.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfámáarị éné ma ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá,  ịrụa ma ḅoo kánákánábẹm, akalụ́ sọ mịnị biabịgha,
english_text: “But in those days, following that distress, “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light;

ibani_text: ḅálōló sọ sobie saghị sóórókóróbẹm ọgọnọ bie fịnị kụ́rọ nyẹ ma nnị anị deesibẹm nna kiri ḅụ.
english_text: the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma ọ ḅụ diebẹm oḅuto ma bie saghị ḅoarị opu kụ́rọ na opu ipine ḅụ.
english_text: “At that time people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

ibani_text: Ori sookumuapụ ma fịrịma tuminikiri ínia ọkọlọbị ma muubẹm, sị n muu Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma kobiri tuminikiri ma gbẹ́rẹ́ kunema ngaa akị mú jẹ́ kunema ngaa láa.
english_text: And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens.

ibani_text: Kúru sị ma nyẹ pa o die, kúru sị ma biamaẹrẹ o nimim ḅẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́kụra kikiamam.
english_text: “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọ mịị nyẹ ma árị si anị kiriakịarị sáá, o nimi ḅẹ́ sáá ma kikiamam, anị saghị bẹ sáá.
english_text: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that itis near, right at the door.

ibani_text: A tụ́manyẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma fịịfamabịgha akị mú mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakị sáá láa.
english_text: Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

ibani_text: So na kiri na ḅọ́rọ́ famabẹm, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ḅọ́rọ́bịgha.
english_text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nimigha anị éné ma anịgha sáá ma ḅoo bẹ sáá sobie fịnị sookumuapụ ma sọ nimigha, Tụ́wọ ma sọ nimigha; Daḅọ ma ngéré anịị nimiḅọ.
english_text: “But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ findi kúru ḅụ fịnị, tẹ́lẹ́ma kuruu, tegó o nimigha sáá ma láa bẹ sáá.
english_text: Be on guard! Be alert! You do not know when that time will come.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị bẹ ḅara anịị warị wáriso sị nyẹ muu owitụ́wọ sị wárị kóróma ori ómóniapụ pịrị, anịị ọ fịrị pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrị so máare, n ḅọ mịẹbẹnyẹ, pịghị ḅụ́pọ́ kuruḅọ ma ḅẹẹ ọ ḅụ́pọ́ kuruu.
english_text: It’s like a man going away: He leaves his house and puts his servants in charge, each with their assigned task, and tells the one at the door to keep watch.

ibani_text: Anịgo kuruu, tegó ị nimigha wárị nyánáḅọ ma ḅoo bẹ sáá, ori ine ḅupiri ḅoobẹm anịgha dii ogbo anịgha ḅáásó anịgha dedefụfụ.
english_text: “Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back—whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or at dawn.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụnimigha ḅụ ḅoo ḅo, minima si ori ị́yẹ́ arịị ḅẹẹ, ị múnoarị.
english_text: If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ, anịsáa a dugho kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm, ọ tọ́rụ findi si kuruu!
english_text: What I say to you, I say to everyone: ‘Watch!’ ”

ibani_text: 4Mmẹẹ́ a dii kọm anị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ na Sughumanyẹ ófórigha Fịturu Álálị ma láa. Igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ asọ dọghụarị n ḅọghu ḅara pa Jizọs kuu ḅá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Now the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread were only two days away, and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were scheming to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Wa mịẹbịgha álálị ma bie anịgha túminị́ ma ine ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighibẹm.
english_text: “But not during the festival,” they said, “or the people may riot.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Bẹtani ḅụ imim Saimọn wárị, ḅụkọ-obii kọọmáa ḅọ, Jizọs aningáa nyẹ́fịarị sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ kpọma igbii láa karakárá nad pulo alabasita ólóló binyẹ pa sọḅom. Árị ólóló ma ḅám warị kụ́nụ́ pulo ma pa Jizọs sịbị sara.
english_text: While he was in Bethany, reclining at the table in the home of Simon the Leper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa fịnị jẹ́ a túminị́ saghị bieoḅum warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, N tegósi papa mị kụ́nụ́ pulo ma gulugulumaarị?
english_text: Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another, “Why this waste of perfume?

ibani_text: Nnị ine pa pị́naḅala igbii jie a si dẹrịbẹm sị igbii ma pa igonyiapụ pịrị! Nnị warị ḅụgbẹ́gha ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: It could have been sold for more than a year’s wagesand the money given to the poor.” And they rebuked her harshly.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị a wáriso! O tẹ́ go ḅụḅáláḅálá pa a pịrịarị? A kpọma ibi na ḅụ́gbẹ́ nyẹ mịẹ i pịrịmam.
english_text: “Leave her alone,”said Jesus.“Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

ibani_text: Igonyiapụ sámamgba ọmịnị na imii ọ pịghị ḅárásua n pịrị bi sá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmịnị ine ḅárásua n pịrịbẹm kụ́ma irị ọmịnị inyanabịgha sámámgba.
english_text: The poor you will always have with you,and you can help them any time you want. But you will not always have me.

ibani_text: Árị árị ine nyẹ mịẹm; a kụ́nụ́ pulo pa ị́yẹ́ oju ḅụ saram pa anị tẹ́lẹ́ma warị anị dipi sáá pịrị.
english_text: She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial.

ibani_text: Mị́sa a ibima dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ nnị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ngaa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ, a mịẹnyẹ ma nnị anịgoo pa a pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Truly I tell you, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Judas Isịkarọtị, oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị saghị sị igwagwaalaapụ ma damamum sị ọ Jizọs dẹrịfị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.

ibani_text: O dugho n pịrị dọghụnyẹ ma nna bieḅẹ́lẹ́mam, n warị pịghị igbii minini ọ pịrị. Judas warị saghị asọ dọghụ ọ ḅara warị Jizọs saghị n ḅarabie sua bẹ ḅara.
english_text: They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money. So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over.

ibani_text: Nnị n Fịtúrú Sughumanyẹ suagha Álálị ma parị éné, nnị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ ánáná ma ḅá ḅá éné ma, Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ o gbilam, I dọghụ mọ ḅẹ́, wa tẹ́ angaá muu Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma tẹ́lẹ́ma i pịrị?
english_text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb, Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Jizọs warị bịpị pa mmẹapụ pịrị n mịẹ ḅẹnyẹ: Ọmịnị opu ama ma sọọ, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ na donabẹm ngu pa mingi dighiḅọ, ọmịnị o dua
english_text: So he sent two of his disciples, telling them,“Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.

ibani_text: ọ sọọ wárị sọọ sị dugho warị nyánáḅọ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ: Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma ḅẹm ḅẹ́, bie ma tẹ́ angaá imii irị na ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ fịnị sị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma fị?
english_text: Say to the owner of the house he enters, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ bie pa o diebẹm ọgọnọ wárị ḅụ nnị anị bie ịkasị tẹ́lẹ́mamam, anị ngaa ọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma wa pịrịbẹm.
english_text: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ warị soo ama ma muu, sị dọghụ pághámaḅo bẹ́ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Jizọs dugho ḅara anịị anị pághá ḅara: n warị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: The disciples left, went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

ibani_text: Éné ḅo ḅupiri sáá Jizọs na ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅom.
english_text: When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.

ibani_text: Nnị fị́nyẹ fị opu ịkasị ma ḅụ fịnị nyẹ́fịarị sáá, Jizọs ḅẹm, A dugho ọ pịrịm ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ i Dẹrịfị́bẹm ịrị na nyẹ́fịarịḅọ.
english_text: While they were reclining at the table eating, he said,“Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me—one who is eating with me.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma anị nnị igánimam, nnị warị saghị ọ gbíla, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, A sịgha ḅẹ́ ị́ ị ḅẹm, ọkọ fịnịgha?
english_text: They were saddened, and one by one they said to him, “Surely you don’t mean me?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ oyi mmẹapụ findi ma ḅụ, irị na gbẹ́rẹ́ bolibie fịtúrú suu fị ḅọ.
english_text: “It is one of the Twelve,”he replied,“one who dips bread into the bowl with me.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma fị́ị́bẹm Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅụ; kụ́ma anị opuma ḅáláfá nyẹ dighi Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma dẹrịfịḅọ ma pịrịbẹm! Anị kọkọ ibiḅaa ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ anịḅọ ma yiigha!
english_text: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”

ibani_text: Nnị nyẹ́fịarị sáá, Jizọs kálá fịtúrú mpara puuakim, ịmịẹḅaa tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ, warị anị puu sị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị. Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Anị ákịị; mịị ị́yẹ́ oju ma.
english_text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying,“Take it; this is my body.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị ọmọ́ngọ ma saghị akị, ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ, warị saḅama n pịrị, nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị anị bie ḅuu.
english_text: Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹm, Mịị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ma nnị osu pa tọghaapụ pịrịnyẹ ma, ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ma Tamuno ọ ḅoo ma gbẹpalị nyẹ.
english_text: “This is my blood of thecovenant, which is poured out for many,”he said to them.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm a mịnị jẹ́ pa mịị iru ma ḅuubịgha akị muu a ịwọ iru ma ḅụ sáá Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅụ.
english_text: “Truly I tell you, I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị gbẹ́rẹ́ boma núme suu si Olivu Tụ́ndụ ma muu.
english_text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba i wáriso mangịbẹm, ḅẹ́ Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ,  Tamuno ánánákúrúḅọ ma ḅabẹm, anịsáa ánáná ma galagalabẹm!
english_text: “You will all fall away,”Jesus told them,“for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a fịị ḅụ saghịmaẹrẹ, a tarị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Galili muubẹm.
english_text: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”

ibani_text: Pita pagharam, A jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ị warịsobịgha, ḅọ́rọ́ isiapụ mamgba ị wáriso sọ!
english_text: Peter declared, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Pita ḅẹm, Ọbịọ mmẹẹ́ sáá pa pághábịgha mị dii, ị́ tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá pa ị pighibẹm ḅẹẹ ị inimigha.
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”Jesus answered,“today—yes, tonight—before the rooster crows twiceyou yourself will disown me three times.”

ibani_text: Pita kụ́rọ ḅara pa ọ pagharam, ḅẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori, a ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị na fịị bẹ so! Isi ọḅụduaapụ mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma dughom.
english_text: But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the others said the same.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Gatsimeni pa si ngaa lam, Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, Ọ mịnga fịnị sị a tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: They went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples,“Sit here while I pray.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị Pita, Jems na Jọn sị ọ ḅụ sua tẹ́mẹ́ si na opu tọ́rụ́siarị ḅoo ọ ḅụ kóróm.
english_text: He took Peter, James and John along with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị ḅẹẹ, Ikúkúbie fịnị tẹ́mẹ́sii anị kpọma dụḅam, kálányẹ kọm anị ịgbẹ kọ́sịma. O mịnga fịnị sị dii ma kúru.
english_text: “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death,”he said to them.“Stay here and keep watch.”

ibani_text: Ọ kẹ́lẹ́ tórúku mum sị ọ ḅụ pa kiri gbii sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́, ḅọ́rọ́ anị ine mịẹbẹ mịị tọ́rụ́siarị sáá ma ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ọ́.
english_text: Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m Daa, i Daa! Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ịḅụ sárásárám. Mịị tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọngọ ma si a fịnị angaá. Anị n ḅẹ́sọ, irị dọghụ nyẹ́gha, kụ́ma ịrị dọghụnyẹ.
english_text: “Abba,Father,”he said,“everything is possible for you. Take this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ pịghịma ḅom sị ḅo ori tẹ́rẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma arịị n múnoarị. Ọ warị Pita ḅẹẹ, Saimọn ị múno ma? Ị ine pa kẹ́lẹ́ tọ́rụ findigha gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ?
english_text: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping.“Simon,”he said to Peter,“are you asleep? Couldn’t you keep watch for one hour?

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị n ḅẹ́, O dii ma kúru sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ọmịnị daádighi bie sọbịgha ḅara. Anị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma tarịarị, kụ́ma ojumẹnị ma ḅụ ịnyọ ofori.
english_text: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

ibani_text: O sima sọm sị pịghị jẹ́ pa tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọarị.
english_text: Once more he went away and prayed the same thing.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma damaḅoo sị nna árị n múnoarị angaá nnị ine nna tọ́rụ́ findigha. Nnị pịghị nimigha n pa ọ ḅẹ́ bẹnyẹ.
english_text: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to him.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá pa ḅoo sáá, ori n ḅẹm, Ọ pa múno sị ịnyọsáráarị? Ibimam! Sáá ma lámam! Dighi, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma nnị ọ saghị pa siiamịẹnyẹapụ kụ́rọ pịrịm.
english_text: Returning the third time, he said to them,“Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

ibani_text: Ọ saghị sị wa sọọ. Dighi, mịị anị i dẹrịfịarịḅọ ma!
english_text: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, anị Judas oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅoo láa sáá. Ori na, anịị tọgha túminị́ áláápụ́-ágidi na sị ikiḅa dighiapụ, sịbịdaa Tamuno opu igwagwaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na sẹ́nịapụ ma fịrịmaapụ.
english_text: Just as he was speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, appeared. With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders.

ibani_text: Iruonaḅọ ma ilíghíma pa túminị́ kpo ma diemam, A ku pa ḅoloḅọ ma, ori anịị ọ dọghụḅọ ma. Ọmịnị okuu sị kúrúapụ pa ori na sọọ.
english_text: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.”

ibani_text: Judas ḅoo láa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, o Jizọs damamum warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ! warị bịpị pa ọ bịpị timi.
english_text: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Jizọs kuu sị ori ọlọ kụ́rọ́ma.
english_text: The men seized Jesus and arrested him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị angaá sẹ́fịnịarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori áláápụ́-ágidi nụ́nụ́m sị Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ómóniḅọ gbogbom warị ọ biri pẹ́lẹ́si.
english_text: Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pághámam, warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị áláápụ́-ágidi na sị ikiḅa akuoo na ibi sị pa ikuu, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ólóghó kaa ḅo?
english_text: “Am I leading a rebellion,”said Jesus,“that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?

ibani_text: Éné bie akị mú éné láa a ọmịnị na imi nyẹ́diearị Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, ọmịnị i kuugha. Kụ́ma Tọ́ndiri ma karakárányẹ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: Every day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ mamgba warị o wáriso sị mangị sọ.
english_text: Then everyone deserted him and fled.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ásátụ́wọ, pị́na bịtẹ ngéré anịị ọ suanyẹ Jizọs duaarị. Nnị asọ dọ́ghụm nnị o kuu bẹ ḅara
english_text: A young man, wearing nothing but a linen garment, was following Jesus. When they seized him,

ibani_text: kụ́ma ori n ḅárápẹ́lẹ́ma papa ḅụ pa mangisom, ori bịtẹ wáriso.
english_text: he fled naked, leaving his garment behind.

ibani_text: Anịsáa n warị Jizọs akị pa Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ warị ḅoo, igwagwaalaapụ na sẹ́nịapụ ma ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ kubiri angaá.
english_text: They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders and the teachers of the law came together.

ibani_text: Pita ḅọlọanga ḅụ n duam nna Ọḅụju muu Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ma wárị nụ́ngọbie sọọ. Anị angaá anịị ọ kúrúapụ ma na kpọrọfịnị nyẹ sị fịnị timi.
english_text: Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ na táarịapụ kubiri ogbo ma n pa ḅara ọlọ bẹnyẹ dọ́ghụm sị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Jizọs ḅá, kụ́ma nnị ine gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ dọghụḅogha
english_text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find any.

ibani_text: Tọgha onyésẹapụ iruonyẹ dughom Jizọs sịbị ọgọnọ, kụ́ma nna dughonyẹ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara muugha.
english_text: Many testified falsely against him, but their statements did not agree.

ibani_text: Anịsáa jẹa owiapụ warị saghị sị mịị iruonyẹ ma dugho Jizọs sịbị ọgọ́nọ́,
english_text: Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:

ibani_text: Wamịnị ọ nam, o dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, A mịị Tamunoopuwarị ma nụ́nụ́kábẹm túminị́ ḅara pa nama nyẹ ma, tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá a túminị́ ḅara pa namaghaa nganyẹ namabẹm!
english_text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with human hands and in three days will build another, not made with hands.’ ”

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara, nnị ma so, nna dughonyẹ ma sọ kuragha.
english_text: Yet even then their testimony did not agree.

ibani_text: Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ma sẹ́fịnịn nnị kị́nị́mamgba toruku warị nyẹ pa Jizọs gbíla ḅẹẹ, I págháraa nyẹ nyanagha n pa i sịbị sẹ nyẹ mamgba?
english_text: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ikpuru suam, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ dughogha. Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ma pighi jẹ́ pa o gbilam ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị Mesaya ma, n boma Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma?
english_text: But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Anịị Ịrị. Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma árịbẹm ọ kpọrọfịnị angaá Kụrọmamgba Nyánáḅọ amaḅaranga sị sobie oḅuto na kóróḅoarị!
english_text: “I am,”said Jesus.“And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

ibani_text: Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ma ọgọ́nọ́ o suabịtẹ ma kam sị ḅẹẹ, Wa mịnị jẹ́ onyésẹapụ dọghụgha!
english_text: The high priest tore his clothes. “Why do we need any more witnesses?” he asked.

ibani_text: Ọ náa maá ọ Tamuno fiesima ḅara, o tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Nnị kị́nị́mamgba dughom ḅẹẹ ólóghó ma ọ kuum anịgo nnị ọ ḅá.
english_text: “You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?” They all condemned him as worthy of death.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ warị saghị fị́lā pa Jizọs sara, n pịghị bịtẹ pa o tọ́rụ́ káká sị ọ ḅaghum. Nnị ọ ḅẹ́m, Dugho i ine ine i ḅaghu ḅo! Kúrúapụ ma warị ori akị sị ọ ḅụrọọ.
english_text: Then some began to spit at him; they blindfolded him, struck him with their fists, and said, “Prophesy!” And the guards took him and beat him.

ibani_text: Pita pa warị ma nụ́ngọbie fịnịarị sáá anịị Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ omoni ọ́rụ́ḅọ anị ngaa ḅo nyẹ́.
english_text: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came by.

ibani_text: A Pita árị sị ọ fịnị timiarị sáá, a tọ́rụ́ pa dada o dighim warị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị so, i koko Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma na imii.
english_text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him. “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus,” she said.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori anị pighim, warị págháraa ḅẹẹ a nimigha anịgha a akanyaḅo ị dughoarị nyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ ori ọkọ dughom sị warị bie asọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pághá. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ anịị ọbịọ págháa nyẹ.
english_text: But he denied it. “I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about,” he said, and went out into the entryway.

ibani_text: Omoni ọrụḅọtụ́wọ ma ori arịm anị angaá warị saghị dugho anị ngaa sẹ́fịnịapụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịị ḅọ ma ori nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ!
english_text: When the servant girl saw him there, she said again to those standing around, “This fellow is one of them.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita sima anị pighim. Kálá sáátụọ ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, anị ngaa sẹ́fịnịnapụ ma saghị Pita sịbị sẹ́m ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ine pighibịgha ḅẹ́, ịrị n ḅụ bẹ gbẹrẹḅọgha tegó ịrị so Galili ḅụ saghịḅom.
english_text: Again he denied it. After a little while, those standing near said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Pita warị nyẹ kuḅufị ḅẹ́, Tamuno i pa tọ́rụ́siarịma ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ a o dughoarị owitụ́wọ ma nimi nimi!
english_text: He began to call down curses, and he swore to them, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, mmẹẹ́ kárámá ọbịọ ḅo pághám, Pita warị pa biekóróma Jizọs dugho o pịrị ḅara ḅẹẹ, Ọbịọ ma mmẹẹ́ sáá pa pághá bẹ sáá ị tẹ́rẹ́ a sa pa ị pịghịmam ḅẹ́ ị inimigha. Ọ warị sóghórókoro owuú.
english_text: Immediately the rooster crowed the second time.Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him:“Before the rooster crows twiceyou will disown me three times.”And he broke down and wept.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ, sịbịda igwagwaalaapụ na sẹ́nịapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma na Táarị ogboapụ mamgba álála donam warị bịpị akịị. Nnị ịkóli pa Jizọs ḅara suam, sị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma pa Paileti ḅárabie sua.
english_text: Very early in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin, made their plans. So they bound Jesus, led him away and handed him over to Pilate.

ibani_text: Paileti Jizọs gbilam, Ịrị anịị Juuapụ ma ámányánáḅọ? Jizọs pagharam, Anịị ị dugho ḅara.
english_text: “Are you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate. “You have said so,”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma tọgha nyẹ pa osịbịsẹ́arị,
english_text: The chief priests accused him of many things.

ibani_text: anịị Paileti sima ogbila nyẹ, Ị pághárabịgha? Pughuu n pa i bịpị pụ́nụ́maarị nyẹ mamgba!
english_text: So again Pilate asked him, “Aren’t you going to answer? See how many things they are accusing you of.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnị jẹ́ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ so kọọgha anị warị Paileti tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị.
english_text: But Jesus still made no reply, and Pilate was amazed.

ibani_text: Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, Paileti anịị ori mịẹmịẹnyẹ ḅẹ́, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ikólinaḅọ wárịsóbẹm n ḅo sọọ, anịị túminị́ ma ọ ḅara bii ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: Now it was the custom at the festival to release a prisoner whom the people requested.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ Barabas pa sịḅọ ikólibie imi, ori na táarịapụ ma osighaapụ sị kị́nị́ ḅáapụ ḅẹ́rẹ́dighi ma ḅụ.
english_text: A man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the uprising.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ogbo ma kobiri sáá ḅẹ́ Paileti ọ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ma mịẹ.
english_text: The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did.

ibani_text: Ori n gbilam ḅẹ́, O bii mọ ḅẹ́ a Juuapụ ámányánáḅọ ma wáriso ọ pịrị?
english_text: “Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate,

ibani_text: Ori ibima nimim ḅẹ́, igwagwaalaapụ ma Jizọs saghị ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ pịrịmam tọ́rụ́akụ gosi.
english_text: knowing it was out of self-interest that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma igwagwaalaapụ ma túminị́ ma timi saghịm warị tụ́ma bii ḅẹ́, n Barabas wáriso n pịrị.
english_text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have Pilate release Barabbas instead.

ibani_text: Paileti sima ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ ogbo ma pịrịm, Ọ pịghị tẹ́ dọghụ ḅẹ́, a tọ́rọ pa Juu ámányánáḅọ ma na mịẹ?
english_text: “What shall I do, then, with the one you call the king of the Jews?” Pilate asked them.

ibani_text: Nnị ilúghú ọ pagharam, Ọ ḅaupálị!
english_text: “Crucify him!” they shouted.

ibani_text: Paileti gbilam, Kụ́ma ọ tẹ́ siinyẹ mịẹ? Nnị pụghọ saghị silem, Ọ ḅaupálịị!
english_text: “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”

ibani_text: Paileti bim ḅẹ́ o túminị́ ogbo ma tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́maa, anịgo ọ warị Barabas wáriso n pịrị. Anịsáa ó warị Jizọs fom warị ọ saghị n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị ọ ḅaupálịị.
english_text: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma Jizọs akị pa Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma áláwarị ngaa ma bie sọm, warị nna ogboapụ ma sị kubiri.
english_text: The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium) and called together the whole company of soldiers.

ibani_text: Nnị ẹ́pẹ́ bịtẹ pa Jizọs suam warị nangi nangi nangi aga pa ogunu mịẹsị pa ọ sịbị sua.
english_text: They put a purple robe on him, then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him.

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị sịbịpị pa ọ sịị: Juuapụ Ámányánáḅọ nangwọ duma.
english_text: And they began to call out to him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”

ibani_text: Nnị sịị pa ọ sịbị o fom, fị́lā pa ọ sara, nna ḅụ́ọ́sịbị pa sóórókoro ẹkpẹrẹkị si sịbị tughu ọ pịrị.
english_text: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Falling on their knees, they paid homage to him.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pa dẹrịnyẹ mịẹ fama sáá nnị ẹ́pẹ́ bịtẹ ma sim warị sima ori bịtẹ pa o sua. Nnị warị o daá pághá mú ḅaupálị.
english_text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.

ibani_text: Asọogbo nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Saimọn pa sịḅọ na donam, sẹ ma ḅụ saghị opu ama ma sọarịḅọ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma warị kụrọḅara pa ori ọlọ ḅẹ́ ọ Jizọs mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma dighi (Mịị Saimọn ma Sirini ḅụ anịị ọ saghị ḅo nyẹ ori anịị Alegizanda na Rufọs daa.)
english_text: A certain man from Cyrene, Simon, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was passing by on his way in from the country, and they forced him to carry the cross.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs akị pa n Goligota sị ngaa múm mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́, Sịbị Okporongbo angaá.
english_text: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).

ibani_text: Anị ngaa n ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma iru pa ọ pịrịm, nnị maya diri pa gwanyẹ, kụ́ma Jizọs mịnị anị ḅuugha.
english_text: Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ ḅaupálịm, warị ori bịtẹ ma die pa nna ḅụ pịrị, warị okoḅa sara sị nimi tụọ tẹ́ angaá bịtẹ mpara nyánáḅọ bẹ.
english_text: And they crucified him. Dividing up his clothes, they cast lots to see what each would get.

ibani_text: Dede ésẹ́nie énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ anịị nnị o ḅaupálị nyẹ.
english_text: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ pa ọ sịbị sẹ nyẹ mị anị dughonyẹ
english_text: The written notice of the charge against him read:the king of the jews.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ furuapụ na Jizọs ḅaupálịm gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori ámáḅara ngaa isiḅọ ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara angaá.
english_text: They crucified two rebels with him, one on his right and one on his left.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma ḅo kiriakịm dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Nnị siiapụ kịẹbịpị ḅụ ọ kịẹ suam.
english_text: So the Scripture was fulfilled that says, "He was counted among the rebels."

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́arị túminị́ sịbị gánágánámam warị Jizọs gbọọ sị ḅẹẹ, E-enrrh! Ịrị bẹḅọ ḅẹẹ ị Tamunoopuwárị ma nụ́nụ́kábẹm sị sima nama tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅụ!
english_text: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, “So! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days,

ibani_text: Mị́sa kóróḅo mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọgọnọ sị ịḅụ dụaḅọ́rọ́maa!
english_text: come down from the cross and save yourself!”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ, Jizọs pa dẹrịnyẹ mịẹm sị dugho jụghọ jụghọ pịrịarị, Ọ jẹ́apụ duaḅọ́rọ́mam kụ́ma ori ine ọ ḅụ duaḅọ́rọ́magha!
english_text: In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves. “He saved others,” they said, “but he can’t save himself!

ibani_text: Mịị Mesaya ma, Izirẹlị ámányánáḅọ ma, mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ḅụ saghị kóróḅo mị́sa, anịsáa wamịnị ọ ḅụ mininibẹm! Nnị ori na ḅaupálị gboloma mmẹapụ ma sọ Jizọs wirim.
english_text: Let this Messiah, this king of Israel, come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.

ibani_text: Énéḅa so ogbo ogbo kánákáná sẹ́ gbọrụ ma gbẹm, mị kánákáná ma fịnị wárii mú tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ lam.
english_text: At noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ Jizọs owu pụghọ pa ilúghú pághámam ḅẹ́, Eloi, Eloi Lema Sabaktani? Dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ị Tamuno, i Tamuno, ị tegósi i dighi tọ́rụ́si?
english_text: And at three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice,“Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?”(which means“My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”).

ibani_text: Anị ngaa fịnị jẹ́apụ ọ nam warị ḅẹ́, O pughu, ori Elaija sịarị!
english_text: When some of those standing near heard this, they said, “Listen, he’s calling Elijah.”

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mangị ọgọnọ múm warị sapo pa angị iru bie taḅụ sị pa sị sịbịju gbánā. Anịsáa ọ warị anị ọlọ saghị Jizọs ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ọgọnọ, warị ḅẹ́, Kuruu, wa dighi ḅọ́rọ́ Elaija mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọgọnọ o dighi kóróma bẹ?
english_text: Someone ran, filled a sponge with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink. “Now leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down,” he said.

ibani_text: Opu owu pụghọ pa Jizọs ịnyọ biimam.
english_text: With a loud cry, Jesus breathed his last.

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịnị kikibịtẹ ma mmẹẹ́ angaá pa pughum, sịbị ḅụ akị mú kiri láa.
english_text: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma tórúku sẹ́fịnị ọmụgbiḅọ arịm Jizọs ḅara warị fịị ḅara, ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ori karakáráma Tamuno Tụ́wọ!
english_text: And when the centurion, who stood there in front of Jesus, saw how he died,he said, “Surely this man was the Son of God!”

ibani_text: Jẹ́ a ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ anị ngaa imi ḅọlọanga fịnị sị dighiarịapụ. Nna bie Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ imi, na Meri kálá Jems na Josẹf na Salomi nyingi.
english_text: Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph,and Salome.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs duamam ọ saghị Galili ḅụ fịnị sáá éné éné nnị pịghị ḅárásua ọ pịrịmam. Tọgha jẹ́ a ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ Jerusalem ḅomaapụ sọ anị ngaa ma ḅụ imi.
english_text: In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anịị tẹ́lẹ́ma éné (anị ḅụ énéḅa anịị Juuapụ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné). Éné ḅupiriarị sáá,
english_text: It was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath). So as evening approached,

ibani_text: Josẹf Arimatiya ḅụ saghị ḅooḅọ, ori anịị Juu ámátáapụ ma kubiri ogbo ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, nnị opu osigha pa pịrịarịḅọ, ọ pịghị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅoo kuruarị. Ọ ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Paileti tórúku múm sị ọ ḅara Jizọs dua ma bii.
english_text: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body.

ibani_text: Anị Paileti tọ́rụ bulubulumam ọ náa sáá ḅẹ́ Jizọs fịị ḅọ́rọ́mam. Ori ọmụgbiḅọ ma sịm warị o gbíla ḅẹ́, Jizọs ọ fịị sáá ḅọlọmaa.
english_text: Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him if Jesus had already died.

ibani_text: Ori ọmụgbiḅọ ma dughonyẹ náa fama sáá, Paileti dugho Josẹf pịrịm ḅẹ́ ori ine Jizọs dua ma ákịbẹm.
english_text: When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he gave the body to Joseph.

ibani_text: Josẹf alo bịtẹ fẹm, sị dua ma si kóróma warị bịtẹ ma pa anị fịna, warị anị pa dapịrịbie n sughu págháma dupu biekóróma. Ọ warị opu dapịrị suma pa dupu ma ḅụ́pọ́ mgbẹsẹ.
english_text: So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.

ibani_text: Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ na Meri Josẹf nyingi tọ́rụ́ pa dighiarị, n warị árị n Jizọs dua ma kóróma ngaa.
english_text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where he was laid.

ibani_text: Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, Meri Jems nyingi na Salomi opuma kụ́nụ́ pulo fẹm sị n pa mú Jizọs oju ma ḅụ sara.
english_text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus’ body.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ Tamunoéné ma ḅụ, ịrụa saghị bia bẹ sáá, nnị dupu yọ ma múm.
english_text: Very early on the first day of the week, just after sunrise, they were on their way to the tomb

ibani_text: Asọogbo nnị muarị sáá, n warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, Tụọ dapịrị ma sumasi wa pịrịbẹ dupu ma ḅụ?
english_text: and they asked each other, “Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb?”

ibani_text: Nnị tọ́rụ́ saghị dighi sáá nnị árịm ḅẹ́ dapịrị ma nnị anị suma ọḅụdamam (tegó anịị opuma dụḅa dapịrị.)
english_text: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.

ibani_text: Nnị warị dupu ma sọọ, warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ásátụ́wọ arịị kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ amaḅaranga, sị pị́na bịtẹ sua, ḅáláfa warị nna ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅáláfama, a nimim ḅẹ́ ọ Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma dọghụarị, nnị ḅaupálịḅọ. Ọ mịnga oforii ọ saghịmam! Dighi, mịnga anịị nnị ọ kórómanyẹ.
english_text: “Don’t be alarmed,” he said. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.

ibani_text: Mị́sa o muu sị mịị oku ma pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị na Pita na: ori ọmịna ḅụ tarị Galili muarị; anị angaá ọmịnị ori árịbẹm, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ dugho ọ pịrị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’ ”

ibani_text: Nnị warị págháḅo sị dúpú ma ḅụ mangịị tegó tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain na ḅáláfa nna ḅụ sọ́mam. Nnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ dugho ḅẹ ḅo ḅẹ ḅọ pịrịgha ḅáláfa gosi.
english_text: Trembling and bewildered, the women went out and fled from the tomb. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid. [The earliest manuscripts and some other ancient witnesses do not have verses 9–20.]

ibani_text: Jizọs fịị ḅụ saghị fama sáá, Tamunoéné ma tarị éné ḅụ dedebie, ọ tarị ọ ḅụ pa Meri Magdala saghị ḅoḅọ diem, ọḅụụ sọ́nọ́ma sitẹ́mẹ́ deeḅọ.
english_text: When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.

ibani_text: Árị ma muu dugho ori ogboapụ pịrịm nnị dua duu sị pịghị owuarị.
english_text: She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping.

ibani_text: Nnị a bịpị náa sị a dugho sáá ḅẹ́, Jizọs dumam ḅẹ́ árị ori árịmam, nnị árị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mininigha.
english_text: When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they did not believe it.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, Jizọs jẹ́ ḅara pa ọ ḅụ pa mmẹapụ ma diem asọogbo nnị nwángị sẹ ma soarị sáá.
english_text: Afterward Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghịma ḅom sị dugho isiapụ ma pịrị, kụma mịnaapụ ma anị mininigha.
english_text: These returned and reported it to the rest; but they did not believe them either.

ibani_text: Kunemaá, Jizọs ọ ḅụ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ oyingieapụ findi ma diem, nnị nyẹ́fịarị angaá. Ori igani n pịrịm tegó n minini nyanagha, n sịbịbie sọ opuma kụrọm, ḅẹ́ ori árịapụ ma ḅẹẹ o dumam nnị n mininigha.
english_text: Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

ibani_text: Ori nnị ḅẹ́m, Tuminikiri gbọrụ mamgba muu sị ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa kị́nị́mamgba pịrị.
english_text: He said to them,“Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.

ibani_text: Mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị pịghị mingi sara, dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm mininighaḅọ nnị n gulugulumabẹm,
english_text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ nnị kụ́rọ pa nnị pịrịbẹm n pa ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị: nnị sitẹ́mẹ́ deesibẹm, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ: n jẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm.
english_text: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new tongues;

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ ododó saghị akị sọ anịgha arịị ḅụụ sọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa n mịẹbịgha nnị ḅara pa obiapụ ḅụ gbánabẹm, nna obi sọ gwọbẹm.
english_text: they will pick up snakes with their hands; and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them at all; they will place their hands on sick people, and they will get well.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs nnị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ fama sáá, nnị ori akị sobie múm, sị muu Tamuno amaḅaranga kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma muu ngaamamgba ḅụ oku ma dugho wásámám, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma sọ nnị na fịrịma nwángịm pịghị diepágháma ḅẹ́ n kọọ wásámáa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma tụ́mányẹẹ, ọ nwángị tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere, and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ opu Tiofilọs, kuu ḅụgbẹḅọ, tọghaapụ nna ịnyọ la ḅara mịẹmam sị nyẹ gịẹ diri bie sua, mịẹmáa nyẹ wámịna ogboku bie.
english_text: Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the things that have been fulfilledamong us,

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma gịẹapụ ma gịẹnyẹ, anịị nyẹ ma árịapụ anị saghị sa dugho wa pịrịnyẹ, nnị anịị pịghị mịnanyẹ ma dugho wásámáarịapụ.
english_text: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eyewitnesses and servants of the word.

ibani_text: Anịma gosi, Ị́yẹ́ Opu, Tiofilọs, a tọ́rụ́ kịsịma mịị nyẹ mamgba dáwọ́mam anị saghị sa, a sịịm ḅẹ́ anị ḅụ́gbẹm a gbụ́nụ́nụ́ ḅara pa nyẹ mamgba gịẹ pághámá ị pịrị anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: With this in mind, since I myself have carefully investigated everything from the beginning, I too decided to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,

ibani_text: A mịma mịẹm ị karakárányẹ mamgba nimi ḅẹ́ ḅara, nnị dugho ị pịrịmaá nyẹ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ Hẹrọd Judiya táarị sa, gbẹ́rẹ́ igwagwaḅọ imii Zakaraya pa sịḅọ, Abija igwagwaá ogboḅọ, Elizabeti anịị ọ taa ẹ́rẹ, árị sọọ Erọn furotụ́wọ.
english_text: In the time of Herod king of Judea there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah; his wife Elizabeth was also a descendant of Aaron.

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹapụ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ nyánam Tamuno tórúku, pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ólóghó mamgba kokom.
english_text: Both of them were righteous in the sight of God, observing all the Lord’s commands and decrees blamelessly.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị awọ nyanagha, Elizabeti yiigha gosi, árị na Zakaraya pịghị kpọma olommam.
english_text: But they were childless because Elizabeth was not able to conceive, and they were both very old.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Zakaraya ogboapụ fịrị ḅụ fịnị sáá, Zakaraya sọ fịrịnwangịarị ori fịrịkiri Tamuno igwagwaḅọ ḅara Tamunoopuwarị bie.
english_text: Once when Zechariah’s division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God,

ibani_text: Igwagwaapụ ma nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ, nnị ókóḅa gbim, anị warị koro ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Tamunoopuwárị ma bie sọmu sị Insẹnsị tọndi ẹ́bẹ ma ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

ibani_text: Insẹnsị dọghụma dọghụma sa ma láa sa, túminị́ kpo ma nụ́ngọbie imi tẹ́ghẹ̄arị.
english_text: And when the time for the burning of incense came, all the assembled worshipers were praying outside.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sookumuḅọ Insẹnsị tọndi ẹ́bẹ amaḅaranga, sẹ́fịnịm sị ọ ḅụ pa ọ die.
english_text: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.

ibani_text: Zakaraya ori árị sa ọ ḅụgbérépum, ḅáláfa warị ḅoo ọ ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and was gripped with fear.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sookumuḅọ ma dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́, Zakaraya, ḅáláfama Tamuno ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ namam, ị táa Elizabeti owitụ́wọ yii ị pịrịbẹm, Jọn anịị i pa ọ sị bẹ ẹ́rẹ.
english_text: But the angel said to him: “Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to call him John.

ibani_text: Ọ mịẹbẹm sị ọ kpọma bieḅẹlẹ, tọghaapụ pịghị o dua bieḅẹlẹbẹm ori yii ḅụ,
english_text: He will be a joy and delight to you, and many will rejoice because of his birth,

ibani_text: tegó ori opu tumḅọ sọọbẹm Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ toruku. Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ọfịrị iru anịgha kụrọ iru sọ ḅuubịgha. O nyingi furobie saghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọ ḅụ sọọbẹm,
english_text: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He is never to take wine or other fermented drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit even before he is born.

ibani_text: ọ tọgha Izirẹlịawọ tẹ́mẹ́ pịghị sị nnị Gbámásóḅọ ma, nna Tamuno dua nwángị nwángịapụ sọbẹm.
english_text: He will bring back many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ ori tarị ḅobẹm, Elaija nyáná tẹ́mẹ́ na kụrọ na anịị ọ pa ḅo bẹnyẹ, ọ pịghị daapụ na nna awọ akuoo gbolomabẹm, ọ pịghị bịpị pughughaapụ mịẹbẹm sị n karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ kóróma nyáná, ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ túminị́ mịẹbẹm n tẹ́lẹ́ma ori ḅoo pịrị.
english_text: And he will go on before the Lord, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the parents to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous—to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”

ibani_text: Zakaraya sookumuḅọ ma gbilam, A tọ́rọ́pa nimi bẹ? A olommam i táa sọ pịghị olommam.
english_text: Zechariah asked the angel, “How can I be sure of this? I am an old man and my wife is well along in years.”

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ ẹrẹ, anịị Gebrẹlị Tamuno ma tórúku anịị a sẹ nyẹ, ori i fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a mịị ibi oku ma akuoo ị pịrị.
english_text: The angel said to him, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to tell you this good news.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị iyẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma minini akịịghaa gosi, kiriakị bẹnyẹ anị karakárá sáá. Ịrị oḅuu sọ́bẹm sị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bịgha akị muu n tụwọ ma yii sáá láa.
english_text: And now you will be silent and not able to speak until the day this happens, because you did not believe my words, which will come true at their appointed time.”

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba mịẹarị sa, kubiri ogbo ma pa Zakaraya tọ́rụ dighiarị, kórómaarị, tẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ ori ọlọ ḅọ́lọ́ma Tamunoopuwarị ma bie.
english_text: Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the temple.

ibani_text: Ọ págháḅo sa ori ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ nnị pịrịgha, túminị́ ma warị akanyaḅo ḅẹ́, múnogha dáwọ ḅụ ọ nyẹ árịmam Tamunoopuwárị ma bie, ori ine gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ sọ kọọgha, ḅára anị ọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ n pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: When he came out, he could not speak to them. They realized he had seen a vision in the temple, for he kept making signs to them but remained unable to speak.

ibani_text: Ọrẹ fịrịnwangị éné kara sáá, ọ warị soo ọ wárị mú.
english_text: When his time of service was completed, he returned home.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha kálá sáá ḅụ, Elizabeti, Zakaraya táa warị fura, árị ọkọ pá a ḅụ arịḅo sáá, a warị sọ́nọ́ akalụ́ pá a ḅụ ḅọghum.
english_text: After this his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and for five months remained in seclusion.

ibani_text: Elizabeti warị ḅẹẹ, Gbámásóḅọ ma mịma mịẹ i pịrịmam, ọrẹ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ, ori ị́yẹ́ ḅụ́gịrịrị simám túminị́ ogbobie.
english_text: “The Lord has done this for me,” she said. “In these days he has shown his favor and taken away my disgrace among the people.”

ibani_text: Fura ma ḅụ súéné ákalụ́, Tamuno warị sookumuḅọ Gebrẹlị fịrịma Nazarẹtị ama muu, Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ.
english_text: In the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ fịrịma, na owitụ́wọ nimigha ọrụḅọtụ́wọ Meri fịnịnga múm, Josẹf pa sị owitụ́wọ, Deviti furo tụwọ a sịbị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọlọnyẹ mịẹmam.
english_text: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma a dámáḅom warị a ḅẹ́, Diin ị nana fịnị, Gbámásóḅọ ma ị nana imi, ọ pịghị opuma ị karịibimamam.
english_text: The angel went to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you.”

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma pa Meri sị sịbịpị ma, warị a tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅáláḅáláma a warị sághị kóróma nyáná a ḅụ pịrị sị ḅẹ́, mịị sịbịpị ma anị tẹ́ fiearị mọ.
english_text: Mary was greatly troubled at his words and wondered what kind of greeting this might be.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị a ḅẹẹ, Meri ḅáláfama, Tamuno opuma ị ḅẹ́lẹ́mamam.
english_text: But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary; you have found favor with God.

ibani_text: Ị fura sị owitụ́wọ yiibẹm. Jizọs anịị ị pa ọ sị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to call him Jesus.

ibani_text: Ọ kpọma gborogborobẹm, n pịghị Sóghólóḅa Tamuno ma Tụ́wọ pa ọ sịbẹm. Gbámásó Tamuno ma pịghị, ọ daa Deviti imine ma pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David,

ibani_text: Ori ámányánáḅọ sọọ Jekọpụ furoawọ ma pịrị gbámásó lábẹm, ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiri kunema nyánábịgha!
english_text: and he will reign over Jacob’s descendants forever; his kingdom will never end.”

ibani_text: Meri sookumuḅọ ma gbilam, Mịma tọrọ́ pa kiriakị bẹ, na a owitụ́wọ nimigha sáá?
english_text: “How will this be,” Mary asked the angel, “since I am a virgin?”

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị a págháraa ḅẹẹ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ịḅụ sọ́bẹm, Sóghóloḅa Tamuno opu kụrọ ma ḅo igbẹbẹm anịma gosi mị Tọ́ntọ́ Tụwọ ma Tamuno Tụ́wọ anịị n pa ọ sị ḅẹnyẹ.
english_text: The angel answered, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. So the holy one to be born will be calledthe Son of God.

ibani_text: Ị mịnaḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ Elizabeti pa biekóróma, n bẹḅọ ma ḅẹẹ árị ine awọ yiibịgha, ḅẹ́ mị́sa árị sọ, suene akalụ́ fura a ḅụ imi, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ árị opuma olommam.
english_text: Even Elizabeth your relative is going to have a child in her old age, and she who was said to be unable to conceive is in her sixth month.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno ma nẹ́ngịnyẹ́ ofori.
english_text: For no word from God will ever fail.”

ibani_text: Meri warị pagharaa, Irị Gbámásóḅọ ma ómóniḅọ, i dugho ḅara anị ọkọ pa ịḅụ mịẹ. Sookumuḅọ ma warị a wáriso.
english_text: “I am the Lord’s servant,” Mary answered. “May your word to me be fulfilled.” Then the angel left her.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha sa ḅụ Meri warị álála tẹ́lẹ́ma sị tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ fịnị ama muu Judiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ.
english_text: At that time Mary got ready and hurried to a town in the hill country of Judea,

ibani_text: Mịnga anịị Zakaraya na Elizabeti ngaa ama. A warị mú Zakaraya warị sọọ sị sịbịpị pa Elizabeti sị.
english_text: where she entered Zechariah’s home and greeted Elizabeth.

ibani_text: Elizabeti Meri sịbịpị ma náa sáá, tụwọ ma saghị tiim a furobie. Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Elizabeti koro.
english_text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: A warị pụghọ saghị dugho ḅẹẹ, Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ mamgba ḅụ ịrị anịị nnị opuma karịibimaḅọ, nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị furobie ị yii bẹ tụ́wọ ma!
english_text: In a loud voice she exclaimed: “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child you will bear!

ibani_text: Mị opunyẹ ma tegó ịḅụ mịẹbẹ ḅẹẹ Inyanaḅọ nyingi ḅo i dighim.
english_text: But why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ a ị́yẹ́ sịbịpị ma náa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, i furobie fịnị tụwọ ma bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ dosim.
english_text: As soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.

ibani_text: Nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị ịrị, minini ḅo ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dughonyẹ ma ori anị mịẹbẹm!
english_text: Blessed is she who has believed that the Lord would fulfill his promises to her!”

ibani_text: Meri warị ḅẹ́: I biebẹ duma Gbámásóḅọ ma túmíní.
english_text: And Mary said: “My soul glorifies the Lord

ibani_text: I tẹ́mẹ́ pịghị Tamuno ḅụ dụrụkụarị ị́yẹ́ Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ.
english_text: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ ori i pa biekórómámám ọrẹ ịgónyí fịrịnwangịḅọ. Ḅẹẹ mị́sa sághị, ḅụ́ọ́ ḅụ́ọ́ ḅụ akị mú jẹ́ ḅụ́ọ́ la nnị karịibimaḅọ pa i sịịbẹm.
english_text: for he has been mindful of the humble state of his servant. From now on all generations will call me blessed,

ibani_text: Tegó opu Tamuno ma mịẹ i pịrịmaá opunyẹ gosi, tọ́ntọ́ fịnị ori ẹ́rẹ pịrị.
english_text: for the Mighty One has done great things for me— holy is his name.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ ḅụọ ḅụọ ḅụ akị mú jẹ́ ḅụọ la ori ọrẹ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ pa kuu pa ọ pịrịapụ diem.
english_text: His mercy extends to those who fear him, from generation to generation.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ ḅara pa opu fịrị nwángịmam ori opuamịẹnyẹ kórómáarịapụ ma dee gálágálámamám.
english_text: He has performed mighty deeds with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in their inmost thoughts.

ibani_text: Ori ámányáná opuapụ sikórómaarị nna imine ọgọnọ ḅụ, sị pịghị ḅụ sitérémaapụ ma saghị iwoma.
english_text: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.

ibani_text: Ori ibinyẹ pa fị́nyẹ pụghọ tárịapụ ma pịrịbimamam, sị papa ḅara pa ngọ nyánáapụ ma fịrịma so.
english_text: He has filled the hungry with good things but has sent the rich away empty.

ibani_text: O minini wamịna tádọ́apụ pịrịnyẹ ma ori anị mịẹmam, sị ḅoo ḅárásua nyána ọrẹ a fịrịnwangịḅọ Izirẹlị pịrịmam.
english_text: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering to be merciful

ibani_text: O minini wámịna tádọ́apụ pịrịm, Ebraham na ori awọ ḅẹ́ ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná n pịrịbẹm mú gbámásó láa.
english_text: to Abraham and his descendants forever, just as he promised our ancestors.”

ibani_text: Meri, Elizabeti na tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ la nyẹ fịnịm, sị ḅo so a fịnịanga mú.
english_text: Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.

ibani_text: Elizabeti sáá kara sa yii ḅụ, a warị owitụ́wọ yii.
english_text: When it was time for Elizabeth to have her baby, she gave birth to a son.

ibani_text: Árẹ amịnáapụ na ánáná kikiama ngaapụ náa sa, Gbámásó Tamuno ma nyáná a pịrị lolomakúkúbie, nnị a dua bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they shared her joy.

ibani_text: Tụ́wọ ma inine a dii la sa, n ḅo ọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́m, sị warị ọ daa ẹ́rẹ́ Zakaraya pa ọ sị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to name him after his father Zechariah,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nyingiḅọ ḅẹm ḅẹ́, Ọkọgha Jọn anịị ori ẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: but his mother spoke up and said, “No! He is to be called John.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị a ḅẹẹ bẹ, Ọmịna mịnaapụ ḅụ ọkọfịnị ẹ́rẹ́ fịarị gbẹ́rẹ́ mịnaḅọ sọ ofori.
english_text: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who has that name.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ daḅọ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ tụ́wọ ma ọ tẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ fị ḅẹ́.
english_text: Then they made signs to his father, to find out what he would like to name the child.

ibani_text: Zakaraya warị nyẹ́gie dụpọ gbíla, warị anị ọgọnọ gịẹ ḅẹ́ Ori ẹ́rẹ́ ọ́ Jọn. Mịma warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị.
english_text: He asked for a writing tablet, and to everyone’s astonishment he wrote, “His name is John.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ma ḅụ ọ bịpị warị findi, ọ warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ sị túmíní pa Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue set free, and he began to speak, praising God.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfa warị ḅo nnị ná kikiama ngaapụ ma tẹ́mẹ́bie sọọ, túminị́ warị pághányẹ ma dugho wásámáa Judiya tụ́ndụ ḅụ fịnị ámá gbọrụ ma pịrị.
english_text: All the neighbors were filled with awe, and throughout the hill country of Judea people were talking about all these things.

ibani_text: Anị náaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, sịbịbie kịẹ anị pịrịm sị warị gbilaarị ḅẹẹ, Mị tụ́wọ ma ọ tọ́rọ fịnị tumḅọ sọọ ḅẹ́? Tegó, kị́nị́mamgba arịm ḅẹ́ Gbámásóḅọ ma ḅara ori na imi.
english_text: Everyone who heard this wondered about it, asking, “What then is this child going to be?” For the Lord’s hand was with him.

ibani_text: Jọn daa Zakaraya, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma okorom ọ warị ikiakoro ḅẹẹ,
english_text: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:

ibani_text: Túmíní fịnị Gbámásóḅọ ma pịrị, Izirẹlị Tamuno! O ḅo ḅárásua ọrẹ a túminị́ pịrịmam sị pịghị n parapághámaḅomam.
english_text: “Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to his people and redeemed them.

ibani_text: Ori opu Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ pa wa pịrịmam ọrẹ fịrịnwangịḅọ Deviti furotụ́wọ,
english_text: He has raised up a hornof salvation for us in the house of his servant David

ibani_text: Ḅọlọmaa sáá o minini nyẹ ori tọ́ntọ́ ikiakoroapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ,
english_text: (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago),

ibani_text: ọ wa duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm wamịna iruonaapụ ḅarabie na pịghị wa dighi tọ́rụ́akụarịapụ ma ḅarabie.
english_text: salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us—

ibani_text: Ọ ḅẹm ḅẹ́ ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná wámịna tádọ́apụ pịrịbẹm sị pịghị ọrẹ tọ́ntọ́ ọḅọọ pa biekóróma.
english_text: to show mercy to our ancestors and to remember his holy covenant,

ibani_text: Ọ karịfị wamịna tádóḅọ Ebraham pịrịnyẹ,
english_text: the oath he swore to our father Abraham:

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ ọ wa duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm wamịna iruonaapụ ḅarabie sị wamịnị ine susi ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara ḅáláfagha ḅụ.
english_text: to rescue us from the hand of our enemies, and to enable us to serve him without fear

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ na pịghị karakárá mịẹnyẹ ḅụ fịnị ọ tórúku wámịna duma éné mamgba.
english_text: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.

ibani_text: Ịrị, i tụwọ ma, nnị sóghólóḅa Tamuno ma ikiakoroḅọ pa ị sịịbẹm. Ị tórúku daá Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrịbẹm sị mú asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ pịrị.
english_text: And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him,

ibani_text: I dugho ọrẹ a túminị́ pịrịbẹm n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm siiḅụ́ḅarásipịrị ḅụ.
english_text: to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins,

ibani_text: Wamịna Tamuno ori lolomakúkúbie ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ pa wa pịrịbẹm, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ sobie sághị kóróḅo baá, wamịna ọ́gọ́nọ biarị
english_text: because of the tender mercy of our God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven

ibani_text: anị bia kánákánábie fịnịapụ pịrịbẹm, fịị ḅarabie fịnịapụ, sị wamịna ḅụọ daa pa diin yọ ḅụ suu.
english_text: to shine on those living in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the path of peace.”

ibani_text: Tụ́wọ ma warị sẹ́nị oju ḅụ na pịghị tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ. Elesiri ḅụ anị ori ngaa wárii sị o ḅo ọ ḅụ pa Izirẹlị amaapụ die sa láa nyẹ.
english_text: And the child grew and became strong in spirit; and he lived in the wilderness until he appeared publicly to Israel.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, Siza ma, Ọgọstọs ólóghó pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị kị́nị́mamgba ẹ́rẹ́ pa diri bie sua, anịị Rom sughubie fịnị sẹ mamgba.
english_text: In those days Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken of the entire Roman world.

ibani_text: Mịma anị parị kiriakị ẹ́rẹ pa diri bie sua, anịsáa Kwirinọs anị Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Siriya sẹ ḅụ.
english_text: (This was the first census that took place whileQuirinius was governor of Syria.)

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba warị mú nna ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹ diri bie sua fịnịḅọ fịnịḅọ amịna ama ḅụ.
english_text: And everyone went to their own town to register.

ibani_text: Josẹf Nazarẹtị warisom, Galili bie fịnị ama sị soo Bẹtịlịhẹm Judiya bie fịnị ama muu, anịị ámányánáḅọ Deviti ama, tegó ori Deviti furobie saghị págháḅom.
english_text: So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to Bethlehem the town of David, because he belonged to the house and line of David.

ibani_text: Ori na Meri ọ yaa pa ọlọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ muum, sị nnị mú ẹ́rẹ́ pa diri bie sua. Anịsa ma ḅụ Meri furam.
english_text: He went there to register with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him and was expecting a child.

ibani_text: Nnị pa Bẹtịlịhẹm ḅụ fịnịarị sa, árị akalụ́ ḅo káaram a yii bẹ sa.
english_text: While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born,

ibani_text: A warị árị parị tụwọ yii, owitụ́wọ, warị awọamaapụ bịtẹ pa ọ fịna sị ọ pa Ánánáfịnyẹ suanyẹ bie ọ kóróma asọ ófórigha go igonikọọ warị ma bie.
english_text: and she gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a manger, because there was no guest room available for them.

ibani_text: Anị ama parangáa ma ḅụ ánánákúrúapụ imi dii kúru nna ánáná na nna oḅori pịrịarịapụ.
english_text: And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night.

ibani_text: Gbámásóḅọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ warị ḅo ọ ḅụ pa n die, Gbámásóḅọ ma ipine warị ngaamamgba kánáma opu ḅáláfa warị ḅo nna bie, sọọ.
english_text: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅáláfama, a kị́nị́mamgba bieḅẹlẹma bẹ ibi oku akuoo ọ pịrịm.
english_text: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people.

ibani_text: Mịmgba gbẹ́rẹ́ éné, Deviti ama bie, nnị Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ, yii ọ pịrịmam, ori anịị Krais Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ.
english_text: Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord.

ibani_text: Mịị anị ọ pa nimibẹnyẹ ọmịnị nnị ịwọma yii tụ́wọ árịbẹm nnị awọamaapụ fịna fịna bịtẹ pa ọ fịna angaá sị ọḅụlọlọma warị Ánánáfịnyẹ suanyẹ bie.
english_text: This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger.”

ibani_text: Buapághá ḅụ tọgha sookumuapụ ḅoo ori na sẹm, n warị núme suu sị Tamuno ma túminíarị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,

ibani_text: Boma fịnị Tamuno pịrị sobie, sóghólóḅa yọ, diin fịnị tuminikiri ọ ḅẹlẹmaapụ pịrị.
english_text: “Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace to those on whom his favor rests.”

ibani_text: Sookumuapụ ma n wáriso sị iwóo so mú sáá, ánánákúrúapụ ma warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, O ḅo wa Bẹtịlịhẹm mú sị mú págháma nyẹ ma árị, Gbámásóḅọ ma dugho wa pịrịmaá nyẹ ma.
english_text: When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has told us about.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị álála mú sị ḅoo Meri na Josẹf árị pịghị nnị ịwọma yii tụwọ ma árị ọ ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị angaá Ánánáfịnyẹ suanyẹ ma bie.
english_text: So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.

ibani_text: Ánánákúrúapụ ma tụwọ ma árị sáá, n warị dugho n pịrị, sookumuḅọ ma tụwọ ma gboloma sị o dughonyẹ.
english_text: When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about this child,

ibani_text: Ánánákúrúapụ ma dughonyẹ naaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụgbérépum.
english_text: and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them.

ibani_text: Meri mịnanyẹ mamgba pa biekórómam sị tụ́ma kóróma nyáná anị pịrị.
english_text: But Mary treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart.

ibani_text: Ánánákúrúapụ ma pịghịma sọm sị boma na túminí pa Tamuno pịrịarị n namaa nyẹ, na pịghị nnị arịmáa nyẹ, sookumuḅọ ma dugho n pịrị ḅara anịị anị pághá ḅara.
english_text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told.

ibani_text: Inine a dii éné, nnị tụ́wọ ma ḅụ pẹ́lẹ́doghu sáá, nnị warị Jizọs pa ọ si, mị anịị sookumuḅọ ma pa ọ sị ẹ́rẹ́, ná nna ori fura kọgha sáá.
english_text: On the eighth day, when it was time to circumcise the child, he was named Jesus, the name the angel had given him before he was conceived.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo kara sa ojusiri igwaa ma gwaa ḅụ, anịị Mosis tọ́ọ n pịrị ḅara ólóghó bịpị ma ḅụ Josẹf na Meri warị tụwọ ma saghị pa Jerusalem muu sị ọ saghị Gbámásóḅọ ma pịrị, (
english_text: When the time came for the purification rites required by the Law of Moses, Joseph and Mary took him to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord

ibani_text: nnị anị gịẹ kóróma ḅara Gbámásóḅọ ma ólóghó diri bie ḅẹẹ, Furofindi tarị owitụ́wọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pa Gbámásóḅọ ma pịrịbẹm.)
english_text: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male is to be consecrated to the Lord”),

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị muu mmẹẹ́ a kpálákuku anịgha mmẹẹ́ ịwọma n tẹ́ndẹ elesia pa agbaa mịẹbẹm, Gbámásóḅọ ma ólóghó bi ḅara.
english_text: and to offer a sacrifice in keeping with what is said in the Law of the Lord: “a pair of doves or two young pigeons.”

ibani_text: Anị sáá ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi nnị Simion, pa sịḅọ, Jerusalem ḅụ ori ngam ori ọ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ tumḅọ, Tamuno ḅẹlẹma nyẹ́ mịẹarịḅọ ọ pịghị Izirẹlị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ma kuruarị, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma so ọ nana imi.
english_text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem called Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.

ibani_text: N pịghị pa o diemam ḅẹ́ ọ fịịbịgha sị ọ tọ́rụ pa Gbámásóḅọ ma minini Krais ma árị sáá láa.
english_text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Messiah.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Simion daa Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sọọ, Meri na Josẹf Jizọs okuoo Tamunoopuwarị ma sọḅo sa, sị nnị n mịẹmịẹ ḅara ma mịẹ ólóghó ma bi ḅara.
english_text: Moved by the Spirit, he went into the temple courts. When the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what the custom of the Law required,

ibani_text: Simion tụwọ ma dighiakịm ọ ḅarabie sị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ:
english_text: Simeon took him in his arms and praised God, saying:

ibani_text: Mị́sa, Gbámásóḅọ ị minini nyẹ ị mịẹmam, ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ wáriso diin ḅụ soo.
english_text: “Sovereign Lord, as you have promised, you may now dismissyour servant in peace.

ibani_text: A i tọ́rụ́ pa ị́yẹ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma árịmam,
english_text: For my eyes have seen your salvation,

ibani_text: ị tẹ́lẹ́ma kórómanyẹ túminị́ mamgba tórúku,
english_text: which you have prepared in the sight of all nations:

ibani_text: mịẹsị Juughaapụ ma baá árị, sị pịghị kuu akuoo ị́yẹ́ túminị́ Izirẹlị pịrị.
english_text: a light for revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of your people Israel.”

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma na nyingiḅọ na, tụ́wọ ma gbólómanyẹ náa sáá, Simion dugho ḅara, anị n ḅụ́gbérépumam.
english_text: The child’s father and mother marveled at what was said about him.

ibani_text: Simion warị n karịibima warị dugho o nyingi Meri pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịị tụwọ ma nnị ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịmam sị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, nnị tọghaapụ gulugulumabẹm pịghị tọghaapụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma Izirẹlị ḅụ. Ori anịị Tamuno ḅarabie ḅoarị ilíghíma, túminị́ pịghị anị ḅụ sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọbẹm.
english_text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother: “This child is destined to cause the falling and rising of many in Israel, and to be a sign that will be spoken against,

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nna kóróma anị ḅụ diepághámabẹm. Kụrụrụ óḅū afaragada ḅara pa ị́yẹ́ biebẹ duma timitúlúbẹm.
english_text: so that the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed. And a sword will pierce your own soul too.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoro ọ́rụ́ḅọ imi Ana anịị árị ẹ́rẹ́, Fanueli ndụ́ḅa, árị Asaha túminị́ ọrụ ḅụ saghịḅom. Árị opuma olommam, a sọ́nọ́ma kụ́rá pa a dee na yaamam,
english_text: There was also a prophet, Anna, the daughter of Penuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old; she had lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,

ibani_text: sị ḅo dee fịịḅọ sọ, mị́sa kụ́rá ínia si na ínia kụ́rá a sịbị ḅọ́rọ́mam. Á Tamunoopuwarị ma warisogha dii na ḅáa na, kụ́ma árị ọ tẹ́ghẹarị, ḅurukụ́ma na tẹ́ghẹ̄ na ḅụ.
english_text: and then was a widow until she was eighty-four.She never left the temple but worshiped night and day, fasting and praying.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma anịị a ḅo láanyẹ sị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ sị tụ́wọ ma gbólómanyẹ dugho tọ́rụ́ pa dighiarịapụ pịrị, Tamuno Jerusalem dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ sáá.
english_text: Coming up to them at that very moment, she gave thanks to God and spoke about the child to all who were looking forward to the redemption of Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Josẹf na Meri na Gbámásóḅọ ma ólóghó ma binyẹ mịẹ so faá ma sáá, n pịghịma so nna ama Nazarẹtị muum, Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ.
english_text: When Joseph and Mary had done everything required by the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth.

ibani_text: Tụ́wọ ma sẹnịm sị kụrọ oju ḅụ sị pịghị opuma nyẹ́nimi, Tamuno pịghị ọ karịibimam asọ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: And the child grew and became strong; he was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was on him.

ibani_text: Kụ́rá mamgba Jizọs nyingiḅọ na daḅọ na Jerusalem mú muum Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma gosi.
english_text: Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Festival of the Passover.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo oyi mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá findi láa sáá, n ḅo álálị ma muum nna mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: When he was twelve years old, they went up to the festival, according to the custom.

ibani_text: Nnị álálị ma fị so sáá, nyingiḅọ na daaḅọ na soo nna ama muarị, kụ́ma ásátụ́wọ Jizọs ọḅukọọm Jerusalem ḅụ kụ́ma nyingiḅọ na daḅọ na mịma nimigha.
english_text: After the festival was over, while his parents were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but they were unaware of it.

ibani_text: Nnị sịịm ḅẹẹ ọ túminị́ ma ogbobie imi, nnị warị anị éné gbọrụ ḅụ asọ nwángịm sị ḅo saghị ọ dọghụ mịnaapụ na nangwọapụ ogbobie.
english_text: Thinking he was in their company, they traveled on for a day. Then they began looking for him among their relatives and friends.

ibani_text: Nnị ine ọ dọghụḅogha, anịgo n pịghịma so Jerusalem muum, pa ọ dọghụarị.
english_text: When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.
