ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá éné, n ḅo ori arịm Tamunoopuwarị ma bie ori na Juu nyẹ́dieapụ na kpọrọfịnị sị nnị pughu, pịghị nyẹ́ pa n gbilaarị.
english_text: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.

ibani_text: Ọ naapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, anị nna ḅụ́gbérépumam ori akanyaḅo, na pịghị ọ nyẹ nimiḅara pa nnị págháraarị ḅara.
english_text: Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and his answers.

ibani_text: Nyingiḅọ na daaḅọ na, nnị ori árị sáá anị n tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm o nyingi warị ọ ḅẹẹ, I tụ́wọ ị tegó mị nyẹ ma pa wa mịẹ. I daa na í nana wa opu ḅụḅáláḅálá pa wa ḅụ pịrịmam i dọghụarị.
english_text: When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n págháraa, O tegó i dọghụ bẹ? Na o nimigha ḅẹ́ a i Daa wárịbie imibẹm.
english_text: “Why were you searching for me?”he asked.“Didn’t you know I had to be in my Father’s house?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ọ pagharaa nyẹ ma akanyaḅogha.
english_text: But they did not understand what he was saying to them.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị nnị ná soo Nazarẹtị mú, sị n bịpị pughu. Nyingiḅọ mịnanyẹ mamgba pa a tẹ́mẹ́bie wárim.
english_text: Then he went down to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. But his mother treasured all these things in her heart.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị sẹ́nị oju ḅụ, na pịghị níminyẹ ḅụ Tamuno na túminị́ na o dighi bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and man.

ibani_text: Jie a kụ́rá lámam Tiberios, Siza sọọ sáá, anịsa ma ḅụ Pọntiyọs Paileti anịị Judiya ḅụ Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ, Hẹrọd pịghị Galili Amadaḅọ ó numboru owi Filipụ sọ pịghị Ituriya na Trakonitisi káláma táarị, Lisanịyas pịghị Abịlene ámátáarị,
english_text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar—when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene—

ibani_text: Anas na Kayafas anịị igwagwaapụ, nna ḅụọ sá ḅụ anịị Tamuno warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Jọn, Zakaraya tụ́wọ pịrịnyẹ elesiri ḅụ.
english_text: during the high-priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the wilderness.

ibani_text: Jọn warị nwángị Jọdan okolo ḅụ fịnị́ ama mamgba ikéléma Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámaarị ḅẹẹ, O sii ḅụ pịghị sị mingi sara, anịsáa, Tamuno siiḅụḅarasi ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: He went into all the country around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara ikiakoro Aizaya diri bie, Gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ ilúghuarị elesiri ḅụ. Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma, asọ mamgba mịẹ gbụ́nụ́nụ́ma ọ pịrị.
english_text: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: “A voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.

ibani_text: Póghóló kiri mamgba gbẹ́ẹ̄, opu tụ́ndụ na kálá tụ́ndụ mamgba mịẹ terema, penge asọ mịẹ gbụ́nụ́nụ́ma, gbasịgha asọ mamgba mịẹ mụ́nụ́mụ́nụ́ma.
english_text: Every valley shall be filled in, every mountain and hill made low. The crooked roads shall become straight, the rough ways smooth.

ibani_text: Tuminikiriapụ mamgba Tamuno dụaḅọ́rọ́ma árịbẹm.
english_text: And all people will see God’s salvation.’ ”

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ Jọn damaḅom ḅẹẹ ọ mingi pa n sara. Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị sii ododó kpo! Tụọ dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ine mangịsobẹm Tamuno fịrịma ḅo ḅẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị ma ḅụ?
english_text: John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

ibani_text: Nyẹ mịẹ, diebẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ, ọmịna sii ḅụ ọ pịghịmam, ọmịnị pịghị sághị dugho ma ọmịna ogboku bie ḅẹ́ Ebraham anịị ọmịna tádóḅọ. A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ Tamuno ine mị mgbọ́lụ ma ḅụ túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́bẹm sị nnị Ebraham furoawọ sọọ.
english_text: Produce fruit in keeping with repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.

ibani_text: Nnị kumḅu wárịmam sị ma kundu, ibi sịmgbọlụ suagha sị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pẹ́lẹ́gbibẹm sị, pa fịnịbie gbi sua.
english_text: The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma wárị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Anịsa, wa tẹ́ mịẹbẹ?
english_text: “What should we do then?” the crowd asked.

ibani_text: Ọ wárị n pagharaa ḅẹ́, Mmẹẹ́ suabịtẹ nyáná ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pa nyánághaḅọ pịrịbẹm, fị́nyẹ nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị anị nyanagha ḅọ na die.
english_text: John answered, “Anyone who has two shirts should share with the one who has none, and anyone who has food should do the same.”

ibani_text: Kọnsịn ósó igbii biiapụ sọ ḅoom ḅẹẹ n mingi sara dọ́ghụm, n warị o gbíla, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa tẹ́ nyẹ mịẹbẹ?
english_text: Even tax collectors came to be baptized. “Teacher,” they asked, “what should we do?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị ólóghó ma dugho igbii bịpị daa, ọmịnị anị nẹ́ngị nyẹ daa ma.
english_text: “Don’t collect any more than you are required to,” he told them.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ sọ ḅo o gbilam ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị, wa tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? Ọ warị n pagharaa Kụrọ tọ́rụ́ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅara sọ igbii akịma, iruonyẹ pa kị́nị́ sịbị sẹ́ ma, n pa i gbẹarị akalụ́ igbii i tọ́rụ́ bi.
english_text: Then some soldiers asked him, “And what should we do?” He replied, “Don’t extort money and don’t accuse people falsely—be content with your pay.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba Krais ma tọ́rụ́dighiarị ḅẹ́ ori álála ḅobẹm, anịgosi n nimidoghum ḅọ́rọ́ Jọn ma ori anịị Krais ma o tụọ.
english_text: The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might possibly be the Messiah.

ibani_text: Jọn warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Irị a mingi pa ọ saraarị, kụ́ma, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅoarị, opuma i nẹngịḅọ ọ sua agbaa dii fiima sọ alagha. Ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ na fịnị na, mingi pa ọ sárábẹm.
english_text: John answered them all, “I baptize you withwater. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you withthe Holy Spirit and fire.

ibani_text: Ori o ḅarabie opu ḅurugbọ ḅala ọlọm ọ pá apara ma sẹ́lẹ́si sịmgbọlụ ma ḅụ, sị fịtúrú sịmgbọlụ ma kobiri nnị anị koko koko yọ sua sị apara ma dọ́ghụ́ma kọrịbibịgha fịnịbie.
english_text: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅara ḅụ Jọn ibi oku ma dugho n pịrịm, sị dugho kụ́rọ́ma n pịrị sị nnị nna mịẹnyẹ dima.
english_text: And with many other words John exhorted the people and proclaimed the good news to them.

ibani_text: Jọn kpọma igani Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Hẹrọd pịrịm tegó, o mú o numboru owi Herodias taa akị yaam, ọ pịghị tọgha tọgha siinyẹ mịẹmam.
english_text: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of his marriage to Herodias, his brother’s wife, and all the other evil things he had done,

ibani_text: Mịma go Hẹrọd Jọn pa ikóliwarịbie suam, mịma pa ọ mịẹ mánámāná sii ḅụ sua.
english_text: Herod added this to them all: He locked John up in prison.

ibani_text: Túminị́ mamgba mingi sara so sa, Jizọs sọ mingi saram. Ọ tẹ́ghẹarị sa, so ma warị findi.
english_text: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma elesia ḅara ḅụ koro ḅo ọ ḅụ soom. Pụghọ warị sobie sághị kóró ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị i Tụwọ, a i ḅẹlẹmam. A i dighi bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ori fịrị saghị sáá, ọ kụ́rá sue lámam, túminị́ kóróma ḅara ḅẹẹ ori Josẹf tụwọ, Josẹf Heli tụwọ,
english_text: Now Jesus himself was about thirty years old when he began his ministry. He was the son, so it was thought, of Joseph, the son of Heli,

ibani_text: Heli Matati tụwọ, Matati Livai tụwọ, Livai Melki tụ́wọ, Melki Junai tụwọ, Junai Josẹf tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melki, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

ibani_text: Josẹf Matatayas tụwọ, Matatayas Emọs tụwọ, Emọs Nahum tụwọ, Nahum Esli tụwọ, Esli Nagai tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

ibani_text: Nagai Maati tụwọ, Maati Matatayas tụwọ, Matatayas Semeini tụwọ, Semeini Josẹki tụwọ, Josẹki Joda tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josek, the son of Joda,

ibani_text: Joda Joanan tụwọ, Joanan Resa tụwọ, Resa Zerubabeli tụwọ, Zerubabeli Seliteli tụwọ, Seliteli Neri tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

ibani_text: Neri Meliki tụwọ, Meliki Adi tụwọ, Adi Kosam tụwọ, Kosam Elimadam tụwọ, Elimadam Ẹ́rẹ tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Melki, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ Jọsụwa tụwọ, Jọsụwa Elieza tụwọ, Elieza Jorimi tụwọ, Jorimi Matati tụwọ, Matati Livai tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

ibani_text: Livai Simion tụwọ, Simion Juda tụwọ, Juda Josẹf tụwọ, Josẹf Jonam tụwọ, Jonam Eliakim tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,

ibani_text: Eliakim Meleya tụwọ, Maleya Mena tụwọ, Mena Matata tụwọ, Matata Natan tụwọ, Natan Deviti tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

ibani_text: Deviti Jesi tụwọ, Jesi Obedi tụwọ, Obedi Bowazi tụwọ, Bowazi Salimọni tụwọ, Salimọni Nasọni tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon,the son of Nahshon,

ibani_text: Nasiọnị Aminadabu tụwọ, Aminadabu Adimini tụwọ, Adimini Aanị tụwọ, Aanị Hẹzịrọn tụwọ, Hẹzịrọn Pẹrẹzi tụwọ, Pẹrẹzi Juda tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

ibani_text: Juda Jekọpụ tụwọ, Jekọpụ Aizik tụwọ, Aizik Ebraham tụwọ, Ebraham Tẹ́ra tụwọ, Tẹ́ra Nahọ tụwọ
english_text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

ibani_text: Nahọ Serug tụwọ, Serug Rewu tụwọ, Rewu Peleg tụwọ, Peleg Eba tụwọ Eba Sela tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

ibani_text: Sela Kainam tụwọ, Kainam Afekizadi tụwọ, Afekizadi Sẹ́m tụwọ, Sẹ́m Nuwa tụwọ, Nuwa Lameki tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

ibani_text: Lameki Metusela tụwọ, Metusela Enọkụ tụwọ, Enọkụ Jaredi tụwọ, Jaredi Mahalaleli tụwọ, Mahalaleli Kenam tụwọ,
english_text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,

ibani_text: Kenam Enọsi tụwọ, Enọsi Seti tụwọ, Seti Adam tụwọ, Adam Tamuno tụwọ.
english_text: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

ibani_text: Jizọs, Jọdan okolo ḅụ sọḅom, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ori oju bim sị o dighi pa elesiri bie sọọ,
english_text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, left the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,

ibani_text: anị angaá ẹ́kpẹ́dua dii a mmẹẹ́ si pa o daádighim. Mịị dii a mmẹẹ́ si ma ḅụ ọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ fịgha, anị kunema, fị́nyẹ ọ tárịm.
english_text: where for forty days he was temptedby the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and at the end of them he was hungry.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ ịrị Tamuno Tụwọ dugho mịná mgbọ́lụ ma pịrị anị pịghị fịtúrú sọọ.
english_text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹ́ tumḅọ fịtúrú ngéré fị sị dumabịghaa.
english_text: Jesus answered,“It is written: ‘Man shall not live on bread alone.’”

ibani_text: Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ọ daa sóghóló yọ múm sị tuminikiri sẹ mamgba pa ó die anị gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá sáá.
english_text: The devil led him up to a high place and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.

ibani_text: Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma warị ó ḅẹẹ, A kụrọ pa ị pịrịbẹm ị pa mịị amadakiri mamgba taa, pịghị kụrọ nyáná nna ngọ mamgba ḅụ, tegó nnị saghị i ḅarabie suamam, a pịghị ine pa a pịrị biḅọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: And he said to him, “I will give you all their authority and splendor; it has been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I want to.

ibani_text: Mịị mamgba ị nyẹ sọ́bẹm ḅọ́rọ́ i susi i pịrị.
english_text: If you worship me, it will all be yours.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Tọ́ndiri ma dughom, Susi Gbámásóḅọ ma, ị́yẹ́ Tamuno ma pịrị, sị pịghị fịrịnwangị ori ma ngéré pịrị!
english_text: Jesus answered,“It is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God and serve him only.’”

ibani_text: Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma warị ọ daa Jerusalem múm warị ọ pa sóghóloḅa Tamunoopuwarị osu ọ́gọ́nọ sẹ, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno Tụwọ mịnga sághị dosi koro.
english_text: The devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómamam:  Ori ọrẹ sookumuapụ fịrịmabẹm sị nnị ibiḅara pa i koko.
english_text: For it is written: “ ‘He will command his angels concerning you to guard you carefully;

ibani_text: Nnị nna ḅarabie ị́yẹ́ ọlọ sẹ́mabẹm, Ịrị ị ḅụọ pa dapịrị tẹ́bịgha ḅara.
english_text: they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ pagharam ḅẹ́ tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ, Ịrị Gbámásóḅọ ma, ị́yẹ́ Tamuno ma daádighi ma.
english_text: Jesus answered,“It is said: ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’”

ibani_text: Ẹ́kpẹ́dua mịná daádighi pa Jizọs daádighi fama sa ori ọ warisom akị mú ọ jẹ́ asọ árị sáá láa.
english_text: When the devil had finished all this tempting, he left him until an opportune time.

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghịma soo Galili muum Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụrọ pịghị ọ nana imi, o gboloma ibioku ma warị wásáma Galili ama mamgba ikélémam.
english_text: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through the whole countryside.

ibani_text: Ori Juuapụ kobiri yọ mamgbabie nyẹ diem, kị́nị́mamgba warị o túminí.
english_text: He was teaching in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị soo Nazarẹtị muu nnị o dighi pághámaḅo angaá, ori mịẹ mịẹnyẹ fịnị ḅara ọ Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọm Juuapụ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ, warị saghị sẹ sị Tọ́ndiri ma goo bẹ ḅara.
english_text: He went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and on the Sabbath day he went into the synagogue, as was his custom. He stood up to read,

ibani_text: Nnị warị ikiakoro Aizaya diri saghị ọ ḅárabie sua, ọ warị anị findi sị dọghụ pághámá ḅo n gịẹ angaá ḅẹẹ,
english_text: and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling it, he found the place where it is written:

ibani_text: Gbámásóḅọ ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ikoromam tegó ori i sẹ́lẹ́akịmam ḅẹ́ a ibi oku ma dugho igonyiapụ ma pịrịị. Ori i fịrịmamam ḅẹẹ a ḅo dugho ikóliwarịbie nnị ikasịapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị n warisomam. Dugho Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, nnị ine nyẹ árịbẹm, Dugho n pụ́nụ́maapụ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị n warisomam,
english_text: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to set the oppressed free,

ibani_text: Sị pịghị dugho págháma ḅẹẹ, Gbámásóḅọ ma ori a túminị́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ sa lámam.
english_text: to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị diri ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ sị anị pa anị angaá fịrịnwangịarịḅọ pịrị sị kpọrọfịnị. Juu kobiri yọ ma ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba warị tọ́rụ́ sághị ọ ḅụ gbánā,
english_text: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him.

ibani_text: ọ warị sághị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịmgba éné Tọ́ndiri ma ḅụ n gịẹnyẹ ma, n goo sị ọ náanyẹ ma kiriakịmam.
english_text: He began by saying to them,“Today this scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba ọ ḅụ ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọm anị pịghị n tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngim ọ bịpịbie págháḅoarị tụ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ, n warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị Josẹf tụ́wọgha?
english_text: All spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his lips. “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?” they asked.

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị ḅẹẹ, A nimim ḅẹ́ ọ mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ i pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ, Bịrịḅọ ịḅụ gwọọ. A nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị i ḅẹbẹm ọ náa sị a mịẹnyẹ Kapanọm ḅụ, a ị́yẹ́ ama bie anị mịẹ.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Surely you will quote this proverb to me: ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ And you will tell me, ‘Do here in your hometown what we have heard that you did in Capernaum.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, A mịma dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, ikiakoroapụ nnị n daa susugha nna ama bie.
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”he continued,“no prophet is accepted in his hometown.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị i pughu, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ, Elaija sáá, tọgha deefịị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ bim Izirẹlị ḅụ, iti kórógha tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá na mpara, ḅuruḅa sẹ gbọrụ ofịso dọ́ghụm.
english_text: I assure you that there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s time, when the sky was shut for three and a half years and there was a severe famine throughout the land.

ibani_text: Nnị Elaija fịrị ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịgha Izirẹlị ḅụ, kụ́ma ọ́ mị deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma Zarafat ḅụ ngaa ḅọ, anịị Sidọn ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ.
english_text: Yet Elijah was not sent to any of them, but to a widow in Zarephath in the region of Sidon.

ibani_text: Tọgha ḅụkọ-obii kọ́arịapụ imi ikiakoro Elaisa sáá Izirẹlị ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nna oju gwọ nyánaḅogha, kụma Naáman Siriya ḅọ ngéré.
english_text: And there were many in Israel with leprosyin the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed—only Naaman the Syrian.”

ibani_text: Juu kobiri yọ ma bie fịnịapụ mamgba ḅoo opuma bieoḅum nnị mịnanyẹ mamgba náa sáá.
english_text: All the people in the synagogue were furious when they heard this.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ pa saghị Jizọs nụnụ ama ma bie pághá sị ọ pa nnị ama ma nama tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ áká ma muu sị nnị o suma gbi bẹ ḅara tándị ma ọgọnọ.
english_text: They got up, drove him out of the town, and took him to the brow of the hill on which the town was built, in order to throw him off the cliff.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori nna ogboku ḅọ́rọ́ so o muarịnyẹ múm.
english_text: But he walked right through the crowd and went on his way.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ Kapanọm múm Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnị ama. Aningáa ọ nyẹ pa n diem Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma bie Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he taught the people.

ibani_text: Ori nyẹ́die n tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngim tegó ọ kụrọ nyáná ḅo ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹkọm.
english_text: They were amazed at his teaching, because his words had authority.

ibani_text: Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma bie sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnị ḅo imii, ọ warị kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghum.
english_text: In the synagogue there was a man possessed by a demon, an impure spirit. He cried out at the top of his voice,

ibani_text: Jizọs Nazarẹtịḅọ, ị wámịna ḅara tẹ́ dọghụ, ị ḅo sị wa guluguluma dọghụ. A ị́yẹ́ tumḅọ ḅara nimim, ịrị anịị Tamuno Tọ́ntọ́ Tumḅọ.
english_text: “Go away! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrị, Ị bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ sị ori oju bie págháḅo. Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị owitụ́wọ ma suma kiri gbi, nyẹ pa o lamagha pa kị́nị́mamgba tórúku sị ọ ḅụ pághá ḅom.
english_text: “Be quiet!”Jesus said sternly.“Come out of him!”Then the demon threw the man down before them all and came out without injuring him.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma, nnị árịnyẹ n tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm, nnị warị saghị, jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, Mịị tọ́rọ fịnị nyẹ́die, ḅẹ́ kụrọ nyánáḅọ ḅara ọ ḅẹrẹtọ, sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm, sị anị pịghị págháḅom.
english_text: All the people were amazed and said to each other, “What words these are! With authority and power he gives orders to impure spirits and they come out!”

ibani_text: Jizọs gboloma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma warị kaa wásáma ngámámgba bi anị párángáa.
english_text: And the news about him spread throughout the surrounding area.

ibani_text: Jizọs Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma warisom sị Saimọn warị mú. Saimọn taa nyingi obiarị owi ọfịrị akuari, n warị a gbolomanyẹ dugho Jizọs pịrị ḅẹẹ ọ ḅárásua a pịrị.
english_text: Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.

ibani_text: Ọ warị árị múnonyẹ angaá sẹ, warị igani owi ọfịrị ma pịrị ḅẹẹ anị soo, ọfịrị ma warị a wáriso, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri a saghịm sị fị́nyẹ mịẹ nnị pịrị.
english_text: So he bent over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began to wait on them.

ibani_text: Ịrụa ḅo diin sáá, obiapụ nyánáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, kịrịkị́rị́ obi kọọarịapụ n pa Jizọs damaḅom, ọ warị ḅara pa nnị kị́nị́mamgba ọgọnọ gbánā sị nnị gwọfama.
english_text: At sunset, the people brought to Jesus all who had various kinds of sickness, and laying his hands on each one, he healed them.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ tọghaapụ bie págháḅom, ilúghuarị Ịrị anịị Tamuno Tụwọ ma. Jizọs warị igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrị o minigha sị nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ tegó n nimim ḅẹẹ ori anị Krais ma.
english_text: Moreover, demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Messiah.

ibani_text: Ene ḅá, dedefụfụ Jizọs ama ma warịsom sị so yaghúu angaá mú, túminị́ ma warị sághị o dọghụ, nnị ḅo ori árị sáá nnị dọghụgha sị o soo.
english_text: At daybreak, Jesus went out to a solitary place. The people were looking for him and when they came to where he was, they tried to keep him from leaving them.

ibani_text: Kuma ori n ḅẹẹm ḅẹẹ, A ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho pághámabẹm jẹ́ ama ḅụ so, tegó anị Tamuno go i fịrịma ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: But he said,“I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because that is why I was sent.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị Tamunoẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma dugho wásáma Juu kobiri yọ mamgba ḅụ Judiya bie.
english_text: And he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs sẹ́fịnịarị Genazarẹtị opu dappa áká ḅụ, túminị́ ma warị suma suma ḅo ọ fịnị angaá láa sị n Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma náa ḅẹ́ ḅara.
english_text: One day as Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret,the people were crowding around him and listening to the word of God.

ibani_text: Ọ warị mmẹẹ́ árụ́ árị dọghụ sọma nyẹ dappa áká ma ḅụ, nji ḅáapụ ma anị biekórómam nna ịgbọ sịrịarị.
english_text: He saw at the water’s edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị árụ́ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ḅụlọ, Saimọn nganyẹ, ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ kẹ́lẹ́ árụ́ ma suma pághámá. Jizọs warị árụ́ ma bie kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ pa túminị́ ma die.
english_text: He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ fama sa, ọ warị Saimọn ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọmịna árụ́ suma pághámá póghóló yọ muu ọmịna ịgbọ kóróma sị nji ḅáa.
english_text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon,“Put out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.”

ibani_text: Saimọn ọ pagharam, Inyanaḅọ, dii gbọ́rụ́ wa ibima lighilighim, kụ́ma wa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ kubọgha, kụ́ma ịrị ọkọ ḅẹm gosi a ịgbọ ma kọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Simon answered, “Master, we’ve worked hard all night and haven’t caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.”

ibani_text: Nnị ịgbọ ma kóróma sị kuu mánámāná nji kálányẹ kọm ịgbọ ma kaa.
english_text: When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.

ibani_text: Nnị warị nna jẹa nji ḅáapụ jẹ́ árụ́ bie fịnịapụ fọngụma ḅẹẹ nnị ḅo ḅárásua n pịrị, nnị ḅo nyẹ ma nnị nji sẹ́ mmẹẹ́ árụ́ ma bimam, kálányẹ kọm árụ́ ma bile.
english_text: So they signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita pághá nyẹ ma árị sáá, ọ Jizọs ḅụ́ọ́sịbị sóórókórom warị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ a fịnị angaá soo! Irị sii tumḅọ!
english_text: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus’ knees and said, “Go away from me, Lord; I am a sinful man!”

ibani_text: Ori na ọ nana anị angaá fịnịapụ, n kuu mánámāná nji ma ḅo nna ḅụ́gbérépumam.
english_text: For he and all his companions were astonished at the catch of fish they had taken,

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị Saimọn arụ́naapụ Jems na Jọn Zebidi awọ anị nna ḅụ́gbérépuma ḅara. Jizọs dugho Saimọn pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ḅáláfama, mị́sa sághị bịpị muu ị sághị túminị́ kuubẹm.
english_text: and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon’s partners. Then Jesus said to Simon,“Don’t be afraid; from now on you will fish for people.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị árụ́ ma dọghụ mú sọma kiri ọgọnọ, warị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ wáriso sị Jizọs dua.
english_text: So they pulled their boats up on shore, left everything and followed him.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri Jizọs gbẹ́rẹ́ ama ḅụ imi, anị párángáa, ámá ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi, ḅụkọ-obii kọarịḅọ. O Jizọs árị sáá, ori ẹkpẹrẹkịm sị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ i ḅọ́rọ́ mịnị ḅẹ́ ị ine i gwọbẹm sị ị́yẹ́ oju fíafía.
english_text: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along who was covered with leprosy.When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅara sụghụma ọ lama, warị ḅẹẹ, A minim ị́yẹ́ oju fíafía anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri obi ma tumḅọ ma warisom.
english_text: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man.“I am willing,”he said.“Be clean!”And immediately the leprosy left him.

ibani_text: Jizọs kụrọ pụghọ pa ọ ḅẹm, Dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá mú ịḅụ pa igwagwaḅọ ma die sị ori ị péghéle dighi, pịghị Mosis tọ́ọ ọ pịrị igwa ma gwaa, pa dugho pághámá ḅẹẹ nnị igwọmam ḅụkọ-obii ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then Jesus ordered him,“Don’t tell anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs gboloma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kaá wásámam opuma, tọgha túminị́ warị pịghị ḅo o pughu sị pịghị gwọọ nna obi ḅụ.
english_text: Yet the news about him spread all the more, so that crowds of people came to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọgha sa ọ yaghúu angaá muubẹm sị mú tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: But Jesus often withdrew to lonely places and prayed.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs nyẹ́diearị sáá jẹa Farisiiapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ anị ngaa kpọrọfịnịarị, Galili na Judiya na pịghị Jerusalem ḅụ fịnị ama gbọrụ ma ḅụ saghị ḅoapụ. Gbámásóḅọ ma sọ kụrọ pa Jizọs pịrịm sị ọ pa obi gwọọ.
english_text: One day Jesus was teaching, and Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there. They had come from every village of Galilee and from Judea and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was with Jesus to heal the sick.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ a túminị́ warị gbẹ́rẹ́ oju fịị owitụ́wọ dighiḅọ múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ n warị asọ dọghụ sị nnị ọ dighi wárị ma sọọ sị ọ pa Jizọs tórúku kóróma ḅẹ́ ḅara.
english_text: Some men came carrying a paralyzed man on a mat and tried to take him into the house to lay him before Jesus.

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ ma go nnị ine asọ árị sị ọ pa sọḅogha, nnị warị o dighi pa wárị osu ma tándị, warị asọ mịẹ osu ma ḅụ sị ọ pa kóróma múnonyẹ ma ọ nána túminị́ ma ogboku bie Jizọs tórúku.
english_text: When they could not find a way to do this because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him on his mat through the tiles into the middle of the crowd, right in front of Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs nna minini láa ḅara árị sáá, ọ warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, Owitụ́wọ ị́yẹ́ sii n wáriso ị pịrịmam.
english_text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said,“Friend, your sins are forgiven.”

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ na, warị saghị nna ḅụ gbíla, ḅẹẹ, Mịị tọ́rọ́fịnị owitụ́wọ Tamuno osigha ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọarịḅọ. Tamuno ngéré anị ine siiḅụḅarasi kị́nị́ pịrịbẹḅọ!
english_text: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law began thinking to themselves, “Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

ibani_text: Jizọs nna kóróma nimim, warị n gbíla, O tẹ́ go ọkọfịnị kọ́rọ́ma kórómaarị?
english_text: Jesus knew what they were thinking and asked,“Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?

ibani_text: Tẹ́ sárásáráḅa, Sị dugho, ị́yẹ́ sii n ḅárási ị pịrịmam, anịgha dugho ḅẹẹ, Sághị sị nwángịị?
english_text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

ibani_text: A mịẹbẹm sị o nimi ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma kụrọ nyánam tuminikiri sị, siiḅụḅarasi túminị́ pịrị. Ọ warị oju fịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, A dugho ị pịrịm, sághị sẹ, ị́yẹ́ múnonyẹ sághị akị sị soo ị warị muu.
english_text: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.”So he said to the paralyzed man,“I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri owitụ́wọ ma sághị sẹm nnị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, sị ọ ḅụlọlọ fịnị múnonyẹ ma iko akị sị sọm, sị Tamuno túminíarị.
english_text: Immediately he stood up in front of them, took what he had been lying on and went home praising God.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa fịnịapụ mamgba anị n ḅụ́gbérépumam, ḅáláfa warị ḅo nna bie bi n warị sághị boma pa Tamuno pịrị ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ wamịnị arịmáa nyẹ mịmgba éné!
english_text: Everyone was amazed and gave praise to God. They were filled with awe and said, “We have seen remarkable things today.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Jizọs nụ́ngọ pághám sị gbẹ́rẹ́ kọnsịn ósó igbii daaḅọ árị, n Livai pa sịḅọ kpọrọfịnịarị sa ọrẹ fịrịkiri. Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹ́, I dua.
english_text: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector by the name of Levi sitting at his tax booth.“Follow me,”Jesus said to him,

ibani_text: Livai saghịm, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ wáriso sị Jizọs duam.
english_text: and Levi got up, left everything and followed him.

ibani_text: Livai warị opu fị na ḅụ tii kóróma Jizọs pịrị ọ wárị, igoniapụ ma ogbobie tọgha kọnsịn ósó igbii daapụ na pịghị jẹ́apụ imii.
english_text: Then Levi held a great banquet for Jesus at his house, and a large crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ a Farisiiapụ na jẹa ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ, nnị sọ Farisiiapụ warị sághị ḅẹ́rẹ́ dugho Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ suama ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegó kọnsịn ósó igbii daapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ na fị pịghị nnị na ḅụarị?
english_text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law who belonged to their sect complained to his disciples, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam ḅẹẹ, Oju kụrọapụ bịrịḅọ bigha, kụ́ma obiarịapụ ngéré.
english_text: Jesus answered them,“It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.

ibani_text: A ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sịgha ḅẹ́ nnị sii ḅụ pịghị kụ́ma siiamịẹnyẹapụ.
english_text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Jọn ọḅụduaapụ, ḅurukụ́ma sị tẹ́ghẹ́arị sámámgba, Farisiiapụ ọḅụduaapụ sọ, gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹm, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ nyẹ́fịarị pịghị nyẹ́ḅụarị.
english_text: They said to him, “John’s disciples often fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours go on eating and drinking.”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Ọmịnị ine mịẹbẹ sị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa go ḅoo igoniapụ ḅurukụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaaḅọ ma nnị na imi sáá?
english_text: Jesus answered,“Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is with them?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sáá ma ḅobẹm, nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaaḅọ ma sịakịbẹm n ḅarabie anị sáá, nnị ḅurukụ́mabẹm.
english_text: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; in those days they will fast.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mị kaḅụ kọọ nnị pịrị ḅẹẹ, Nnị iwọbịtẹ kaa akị pa olom bịtẹ tịrọ tịrọgha, ị́yẹ́ ọkọ mịẹmịẹ anịị ị́ ịwọ bịtẹ ma kabẹm, ịwọ bịtẹ mpara ma sọ olom nyẹ ma na kurabịgha.
english_text: He told them this parable:“No one tears a piece out of a new garment to patch an old one. Otherwise, they will have torn the new garment, and the patch from the new will not match the old.

ibani_text: Nnị ịwọ iru sara pa olom iru suanyẹ bie sua suagha, ịwọ iru ma iru suanyẹ ma ḅabẹm, iru ma warị ọsụ faá, anịsa ị́ iru suanyẹ ma igomamam.
english_text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins; the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma nnị ịwọ iru pa ịwọ iru suanyẹ bie suabẹm.
english_text: No, new wine must be poured into new wineskins.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịghị ịwọ iru dọghụbịgha n ḅọ parị olom iru ḅusomaẹrẹ. Ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Olom nyẹ ma ibiḅam.
english_text: And no one after drinking old wine wants the new, for they say, ‘The old is better.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị witi dipi kiri Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ. Ori ọḅụduaapụ warị saghị witi ma kiẹnị warị anị sịsịghị nna ḅarabie sịịmgbọ́lụ ma fị.
english_text: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to pick some heads of grain, rub them in their hands and eat the kernels.

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ warị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, I tegó ólóghó ma dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, tumḅọ mịẹma, mịẹarị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ?
english_text: Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why are you doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị pagharam ḅẹẹ, Jẹ́ éné na o gogha Deviti na ori fịrịnwangịapụ mịẹnyẹ ḅuru n tarị sáá?
english_text: Jesus answered them,“Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

ibani_text: Ọ Tamunoopuwarị soo ḅara sị n pa agbaa mịẹ Tamuno pịrị fịtúrú ma fị, pịghị jẹa nyẹ pa ori a fịrịnwangịapụ pịrị. Mịma pịghị wamịna ólóghó bịpị ḅụ imii ḅẹẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine mị fịtúrú ma fịbịghaa igwagwaḅọ ma sima.
english_text: He entered the house of God, and taking the consecrated bread, he ate what is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho kunema ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma, ori anịị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma Nyánáḅọ.
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Jẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné Jizọs Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọm sị nyẹ́die. Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ anị ngaa imi amaḅara fịịḅọ.
english_text: On another Sabbath he went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there whose right hand was shriveled.

ibani_text: Jẹa ologho nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ ma dọghụarị nnị pa ḅara ọlọ sị pa ọ sịbị gbánā ḅẹẹ mịị ọ mịẹ siinyẹ, nnị warị ibima ọ dighi nnị ḅọ́rọ́ árị bẹ ori obi gwọọ ḅẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma bie.
english_text: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs nna kọ́rọ́ma nimim warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́, Sághị sẹ tórúku ḅo. Owitụ́wọ ma warị saghị tórúku muu sị anị ngaa sẹ.
english_text: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to the man with the shriveled hand,“Get up and stand in front of everyone.”So he got up and stood there.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, A o gbilam, wámịna ólóghó anị, mini sii wa tẹ́ mịẹ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ: ibinyẹ mịẹ anịgha siinyẹ mịẹ, tumḅọ duma dụapághámaḅo, anịgha tumḅọ duma guluguluma?
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị tọ́rụ́ pa n dighi ikéléma; warị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹẹ, I ḅara sụghụma. Ori ọkọ mịẹm, ọ ḅara warị ḅo karakárá ḅara fịnị.
english_text: He looked around at them all, and then said to the man,“Stretch out your hand.”He did so, and his hand was completely restored.

ibani_text: Anị warị n tẹ́mẹ́ igánimam, n warị sághị bia nna ogbobie nnị ine pa Jizọs mịẹbẹnyẹ.
english_text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were furious and began to discuss with one another what they might do to Jesus.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Jizọs gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá tụ́ndụ tándịm warị dii gbọrụ fámá tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: One of those days Jesus went out to a mountainside to pray, and spent the night praying to God.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáa sáá, ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ sịị ọ ḅụ pịrịm warị n ḅụ oyi mmẹapụ sẹlẹakị mịnaapụ ma anịị ọ pa nfịrịmaapụ sịapụ:
english_text: When morning came, he called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he also designated apostles:

ibani_text: Saimọn ọ pịghị Pita pa sịị ḅọ na pịghị ọ numboru owi Anduru na Jems na pịghị Jọn, na Filipụ na pịghị Batolomi.
english_text: Simon (whom he named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,

ibani_text: Matiu na Tọmọs, Jems Alịfịyọs tụwọ na pịghị Saimọn (nnị ama ibi dọghụḅọ pa sịḅọ)
english_text: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,

ibani_text: Judas, Jems tụwọ na Judas Isịkarọtị ọḅụkụ́nọma ọ dẹrịfị ḅo.
english_text: Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

ibani_text: Jizọs nfịrịmaapụ ma na kóróḅo sáá kálá tụ́ndụ́ ọ́gọ́nọ ma ḅụ, ọ warị téré gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅụ sẹ, ori na tọghaapụ ori ọḅụduaapụ. Anị ngaa ma ḅụ tọgha túminị́ bim, Judiya, Jerusalem na pịghị Taya na Sidọn tọ́rụ́aka ḅụ fịnị ama.
english_text: He went down with them and stood on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples was there and a great number of people from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the coastal region around Tyre and Sidon,

ibani_text: Nnị ḅom sị nnị o pughu bẹ ḅara sị ọ pịghị nna obi gwọọ, sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa pịrịarịpụ sọ ḅom, nnị sọ nna obi gwọm.
english_text: who had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. Those troubled by impure spirits were cured,

ibani_text: Túminị́ mamgba asọ dọ́ghụm n ḅara pa ọ́ lama bẹ ḅara, tegó kụ́rọ ori oju bie pághá sị nnị kị́nị́mamgba gwọarị.
english_text: and the people all tried to touch him, because power was coming from him and healing them all.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị tọ́rụ́ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ dighi warị ḅẹẹ: Karịiḅi fịnị ọ pịrị, ọmịnị igonyiapụ, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ọmịna nyẹ!
english_text: Looking at his disciples, he said: “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị ọ pịrị mị́sa ọ minabie ḅụrụtarịarịapụ, ọ fị fúrōbimabẹm! Karịiḅi fịnị ọ pịrị mị́sa owuarịapụ, ḅẹẹ o dẹrịbẹm!
english_text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị ọ pịrị túminị́ ọ dighi tọ́rụ́akụ sáá, sị o kịẹ sị, pịghị okombo pịghị o wiri ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị sii túminị́ tegó ọmịnị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma duam gosi.
english_text: Blessed are you when people hate you, when they exclude you and insult you and reject your name as evil, because of the Son of Man.

ibani_text: O dụrụkụ anị éné ma ḅụ pịghị bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ dosi, tegó opu gbẹ́ẹnyẹ fịnị o kuruarị sobie. Pịghị biekóróma ḅẹẹ nna tádọ́apụ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma pa olom ikiakoroapụ ma mịẹm.
english_text: “Rejoice in that day and leap for joy, because great is your reward in heaven. For that is how their ancestors treated the prophets.

ibani_text: Opu kụrụrụ fịnị ọmịnị ngọ nyánápụ ma kuruarị tegó mị tuminikiri ọmịnị ọmịna tuminikiri ibi fịmam.
english_text: “But woe to you who are rich, for you have already received your comfort.

ibani_text: Opu kụrụrụ fịnị ọ pịrị ọmịnị mị́sa fị fúrōbimamaapụ, tegó opu ḅuruḅa o kuruarị. Opu kụrụrụ fịnị o kuruarị ọmịnị mị́sa dẹrịarịapụ, tegó ọmịna dẹrị pịghị dụadu na kụrụrụ sọbẹm.
english_text: Woe to you who are well fed now, for you will go hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

ibani_text: Opu kụrụrụ fịnị o kuruarị ọmịnị túminị́ mị́sa túminiariapụ, tegó anịị nna tádọ́apụ ma sọ iruo na ikiakoroapụ ma túminí ḅara.
english_text: Woe to you when everyone speaks well of you, for that is how their ancestors treated the false prophets.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a dugho ọmịnị i naarịapụ pịrịm: ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ ḅẹlẹma, ibi mịẹ ị dighi tọ́rụ́akụapụ pịrị.
english_text: “But to you who are listening I say: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

ibani_text: I gbooapụ karịibima, tẹ́ghẹ̄ siinyẹ pa imiẹapụ pịrị.
english_text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ lughu angaá ḅụ i ḅụ́rọ́ ḅụ́rọ́, isi angaá lughu pịghị pa ọ pịrị ọ ḅụ́rọ́; tumḅọ i sua jọmpa akị akị, n ḅo pịghị ị́yẹ́ biefuru bịtẹ akịị.
english_text: If someone slaps you on one cheek, turn to them the other also. If someone takes your coat, do not withhold your shirt from them.

ibani_text: Nyẹ pa i ḅara nyẹ bííapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrị tumḅọ ị́yẹ́ nyẹ akịkị, dugho ọ pịrịma ḅẹẹ ori anị pịghịma ḅo ị pịrị.
english_text: Give to everyone who asks you, and if anyone takes what belongs to you, do not demand it back.

ibani_text: Mịẹ jẹ́apụ pịrị, ịrị dọghụnyẹ n mịẹ ị pịrị.
english_text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.

ibani_text: I ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅẹlẹmaapụ ngéré ḅẹlẹma, anị tẹ́ sọọ nyẹ sọọ i pịrịbẹ? Siiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ n ḅẹlẹmaapụ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners love those who love them.

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị ibi nyẹ mịẹ, ị binyẹ mịẹ ị pịrịapụ ngéré pịrị, anị tẹ́ sọnyẹ mịẹ ị pịrịbẹ? Siiamịẹnyẹapụ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara mịẹm.
english_text: And if you do good to those who are good to you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do that.

ibani_text: I ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ pa ị́ nimi sị ine igbe bẹapụ ngéré ḅọlọ ḅọlọ anị tẹ́ sọnyẹ mịẹ ị pịrị ḅẹ́? Siiamịẹnyẹapụ kọkọ nyẹ pa nna ḅụ ḅọlọ ḅọlọ sị dọghụ nnị n gbẹ́ẹ̄ kárámá.
english_text: And if you lend to those from whom you expect repayment, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, expecting to be repaid in full.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ ḅẹlẹma, ibinyẹ mịẹ n pịrị, igbii pa n ḅọlọ, tọ́rụ́ pa ị́ n ḅarabie nyáná ḅo ḅẹnyẹ dighigha pa. Anịsáa, anịị ọmịnị opu gbẹ́ẹnyẹ nyáná bẹnyẹ ọ pịghị sóghólóḅa Tamuno awọ ma sọọ bẹnyẹ tegó ọ ḅẹlẹma nyáná, nyẹ tọ́rụ́ sọghaapụ ma pịrịm na pịghị sii túminị́ na.
english_text: But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without expecting to get anything back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná, ị́yẹ́ Daḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ḅara.
english_text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ma, Tamuno sọ i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha ḅara. Ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa kị́nị́ ḅarasima ma, Tamuno so ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa i ḅara simabịgha ḅara. Sii wáriso, Tamuno sọ sii wáriso ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

ibani_text: Nyẹ pa jẹ́apụ pịrị, Tamuno sọ nyẹ pa i pịrịbẹm. Ibima tọ́ọ nyẹ, pụnụ téréma, jighe gboloma, bi wasa sị osu saraarị, anịị n tọ́ọ ị ḅarabie sara bẹnyẹ. Ḅẹẹ i tọ́ọ jụghọ pịrị ḅara anị ḅara ma anịị n pa pịghị tọ́ọ ị pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị gbẹ́rẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ n pịrị ḅẹẹ: Tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ ine asọ pa jẹ́ tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ die bẹ? Ori ọkọ mịẹmịẹ, nnị mmẹapụ sóghóró olulu bie sọbịgha?
english_text: He also told them this parable:“Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into a pit?

ibani_text: Diri dawọarị awọ ma ine nyẹ́dieḅọ ma nẹngịbịgha. Kụ́ma nyẹ dawọ́arịapụ ma nnị nna dáwọnyẹ dáwọ karamamaẹrẹ nnị nna nyẹ́dieḅọ fịnị ḅara fịnịbẹm.
english_text: The student is not above the teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will be like their teacher.

ibani_text: I tegó ị numboru tọ́rụ́ ḅụ fịnị kálá ẹ́pẹ ma dighiarị, kụ́ma ị tọ́rụ́ fịnị sị ikiḅa ma ị́ anị arịgha.
english_text: “Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother’s eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?

ibani_text: Ị tọrọ́ pa dugho i numboru pịrị ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ; Páisisi kúru a i tọ́rụ́ fịnị kálá ẹ́pẹ ma si, kụ́ma ị tọ́rụ́ fịnị sị ikiḅa ma í ine anị arịgha? Ịrị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ kingi! Parị i tọ́rụ́ fịnị sị ikiḅa ma dighi si anịsáa, ị́ ibima nyẹ árịbẹm sị ine kálá ẹ́pẹ ma si i numboru owitụ́wọ tọ́rụ́.
english_text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when you yourself fail to see the plank in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.

ibani_text: Ibi sị sii sịmgbọlụ sua suagha, sii sị ibi sịmgbọlụ sua suagha.
english_text: “No good tree bears bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.

ibani_text: Sị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị nimim anị suaarị sịmgbọlụ gosi. Ị fịgị taḅobịgha nangi sị ọ́gọ́nọ anịgha grepụ kịẹ ḅo akpe sị ọgọnọ.
english_text: Each tree is recognized by its own fruit. People do not pick figs from thornbushes, or grapes from briers.

ibani_text: Ibi tumḅọ n ḅọ tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnị ibi kóróma ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ibi nyẹ mịẹarị, sii tumḅọ sọ pịghị n ḅo tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnị sii kóróma ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ siinyẹ mịẹarị. Nyẹ kúkúbie ma biimaẹrẹ, bịpị ma anị dugho pághámá pághámam.
english_text: A good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart, and an evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart. For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ go Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pa i sịarị, kụ́ma o mini a dughonyẹ mịẹghaa.
english_text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?

ibani_text: Ị damaḅo ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pughu sị pịghị anị mịẹ, a n ḅo kịkanyẹ pa ọ diebẹm.
english_text: As for everyone who comes to me and hears my words and puts them into practice, I will show you what they are like.

ibani_text: N ḅọ wárị námáarị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ kịkam, tarị kiri sughu póghólóma sị wárị suu isé okpo dapịrị ọgọnọ. Opu mingi siri ḅo sáá, dinọngụ wárị ma fom sa, wárị ma jighegha tegó nnị ibima anị namam.
english_text: They are like a man building a house, who dug down deep and laid the foundation on rock. When a flood came, the torrent struck that house but could not shake it, because it was well built.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma náa sị anị mịẹgha ḅọ n ḅọ kịkanyẹ anịị suuisegha sị warị namaḅọ, opu mingi ḅo anị na bia ma sáá, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri anị bịghịm; dighii anị sii ḅara pa bịghị ḅara.
english_text: But the one who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. The moment the torrent struck that house, it collapsed and its destruction was complete.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnanyẹ mamgba dugho túminị́ ma pịrị faá ma sáá, ọ warị Kapanọm muu.
english_text: When Jesus had finished saying all this to the people who were listening, he entered Capernaum.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa sọ́nọ́ a si ọ́mụ́gbiapụ sịbịdá gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, ómóniḅọ nyánam, ọ ḅụ opuma nyẹ́ lááḅo ḅụ ibighaa sị fịịfịịḅara fịnịm.
english_text: There a centurion’s servant, whom his master valued highly, was sick and about to die.

ibani_text: Mị sọ́nọ́ a si ọ́mụ́gbiapụ sịbịdáḅọ ma Jizọs gbólómanyẹ náa sáá, ọ jẹa Juuapụ sẹ́nịapụ fịrịmam sị n muu dugho Jizọs pịrị ḅẹ́ o ḅo ori fịrịnwangịḅọ gwọọ.
english_text: The centurion heard of Jesus and sent some elders of the Jews to him, asking him to come and heal his servant.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Jizọs fịnị angaá ḅo warị ibima ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma i ḅárásua ọ pịrị na ibim.
english_text: When they came to Jesus, they pleaded earnestly with him, “This man deserves to have you do this,

ibani_text: Ọ wamịnị amaapụ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam ọ pịghị kobiri yọ námá wa pịrịm.
english_text: because he loves our nation and has built our synagogue.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n dua. Ọ wárị ma na kikiamam ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma ori nángwọ́apụ fịrịma sáá ḅẹ́ n dugho ọ pịrị, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ịḅụ pịrịma, a laagha ḅẹẹ ị́ i wárị sọọ.
english_text: So Jesus went with them. He was not far from the house when the centurion sent friends to say to him: “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.

ibani_text: A pịghị ịḅụ arịm ḅẹẹ a laagha i toruku ḅoo, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ, ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ oju ibibẹm.
english_text: That is why I did not even consider myself worthy to come to you. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.

ibani_text: Ịrịsọ ịḅụ sịbịdáḅọ nyánam, pịghị i sughubie fịnị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ nyánam. A ḅẹrẹtọ mịnga ḅo pịrị ḅẹẹ, Muu! O mú, a mịnga ḅọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅoo! Ọ ḅo, a pịghị ị́yẹ́ ómóniḅọ ḅẹẹ, mịma mịẹ ori anị mịẹ.
english_text: For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and that one, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma náa sáá, anị ọ tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngim: ọ warị pịghị sị o dua nwángịarị túminị́ kpo ma ḅẹẹ, Na a jẹ́ éné ọkọfịnị minini nyánáḅọ arịgha, Izirẹlị bie sọ oforii.
english_text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him, and turning to the crowd following him, he said,“I tell you, I have not found such great faith even in Israel.”

ibani_text: Oku muapụ ma pịghịma sọḅom sị árị ḅẹẹ ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma ómóniḅọ oju ibimam.
english_text: Then the men who had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá sáá ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́ Nayin pa sị ama múm, ori ọḅụduaapụ na tọgha túminị́ o duam.
english_text: Soon afterward, Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went along with him.

ibani_text: O ḅo ámá ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ láa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri dua ḅọrọmaapụ págháḅo ọ nana donam. Ori, anịị o nyingi ma kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ tụwọ, nyingiḅọ ma pịghị dee fịịmaá ọ́rụ́ḅọ. Ama ma bie saghị ḅo tọgha túminị́ pịghị ánáná imi.
english_text: As he approached the town gate, a dead person was being carried out—the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the town was with her.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ árị arị́ sáá ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná a pịrịm, ọ warị a ḅẹẹ, Mịnị owuma.
english_text: When the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her and he said,“Don’t cry.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅọ́rọ́ muu ḅara pa dua igbe ma lama, anị dighiapụ ma warị sẹ, Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ásátụ́wọ a i ḅẹm saghịị!
english_text: Then he went up and touched the bier they were carrying him on, and the bearers stood still. He said,“Young man, I say to you, get up!”

ibani_text: Fịị owitụ́wọ ma warị saghị kpọrọfịnị sị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́, Jizọs warị ọ saghị pa o nyingi pịrị.
english_text: The dead man sat up and began to talk, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfá warị ḅo nnị kị́nị́mamgba tẹ́mẹ́bie sọọ, sị Tamuno túminim, n warị ḅẹẹ, Opu ikiakoroḅọ wámịna ogboku bie págháḅomam. Tamuno ḅomam sị ori a túminị́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma!
english_text: They were all filled with awe and praised God. “A great prophet has appeared among us,” they said. “God has come to help his people.”

ibani_text: Mị Jizọs gboloma dughonyẹ ma Judiya gbọrụ ma ikélémam na pịghị anị na kikia angaá mamgba.
english_text: This news about Jesus spread throughout Judea and the surrounding country.

ibani_text: Jọn ọḅụduaapụ mịnanyẹ mamgba dugho Jọn pịrị sáá, ori n ḅụ mmẹẹ́ nwángịapụ siim,
english_text: John’s disciples told him about all these things. Calling two of them,

ibani_text: sị n muu Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị ikiakoroapụ ḅẹ́ sị ḅoo bẹḅọ ma? Anịgha, wa tọ́rụ́ pa jụghọ dighi?
english_text: he sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?”

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs damaḅo sa, nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ wa fịrịmam ḅẹẹ, wamịnị ị gbíla, Ịrị anịị ikiakoroapụ ḅẹẹ sị ḅo bẹḅọ ma, anịgha wa tọ́rụ́ pa jụghọ dighi bẹ?
english_text: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?’ ”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́sa ma ḅụ Jizọs tọghaapụ gwọm n kọarị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ obi ḅụ na pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅarabie, ọ pịghị tọ́rụ́ pụụapụ mịẹm nnị nyẹarịị.
english_text: At that very time Jesus cured many who had diseases, sicknesses and evil spirits, and gave sight to many who were blind.

ibani_text: Ọ Jọn oku muapụ ma pagharam ḅẹẹ, Ọ pịghịma soo sị mú dugho Jọn pịrị, ọmịnị árị sị pịghị náa maá nyẹ: Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ ine nyẹ arịm, ikúléapụ ine nwángịm, ḅụkọ-obii kọọapụ nna oju ḅo fiafiam, biri iniiapụ saghị nyẹ́nam, fịịapụ fị ḅụ saghịm, ibi oku ma nnị pịghị anị dugho wásáma siminiapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: So he replied to the messengers,“Go back and report to John what you have seen and heard: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those who have leprosyare cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is proclaimed to the poor.

ibani_text: Nnị karịibimaḅọ anịị tumḅọ ma kúkúbie mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ miẹghaḅọ a fịnị angaá ḅụ.
english_text: Blessed is anyone who does not stumble on account of me.”

ibani_text: Jọn oku múuapụ soo sáá, Jizọs warị saghị Jọn ḅẹ́rẹ́ dugho kubiri ogbo ma pịrị o mú Jọn dighi sáá elesiri ḅụ, Ọ si ḅẹẹ ọ tẹ́ árị bẹ? Ọ sị ḅẹ́ ọ fọ́rụ ofuro sị jighe jighearị sóghóló osuka árị bẹ́?
english_text: After John’s messengers left, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John:“What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

ibani_text: Anịị ofori, ọ pághá mú tẹ́ árị? Tụ́ma bịtẹ suaḅọ? Ọkọfịnị bịtẹ suaapụ sị fị na ḅụ na duma kọ́arịapụ, ámányánáapụ warị anịị nnị nna arịrị nyẹ.
english_text: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear expensive clothes and indulge in luxury are in palaces.

ibani_text: Dugho i pịrị, o mú tẹ́ arịị? Gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroḅọ, kụ́ma a dugho ọ pịrịm, ọmịnị ikiakoroḅọ nẹngịḅọ arịm.
english_text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

ibani_text: Jọn anị Tọ́ndiri ma ḅẹ́ ḅo,  Tamuno dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, A ị́yẹ́ oku muḅọ fịrịmabẹm tarị ịḅụ ḅoo bẹḅọ, ori anịị asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma ị pịrịbẹḅọ.
english_text: This is the one about whom it is written: “ ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sị ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ́rụ́ḅọ yiiapụ mamgba dụḅa Jọn nẹngịḅọ ofori; anịsọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma bie ịrụḅa ḅo dụḅa Jọn nẹngịm.
english_text: I tell you, among those born of women there is no one greater than John; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”

ibani_text: (Kị́nị́mamgba, na pịghị kọnsịn ósó igbii daapụ ma mịma náa sáá, n mininim ḅẹẹ Tamuno asọ ma karakáram, tegó mịnaapụ ma anịị Jọn pịghị mingi pa saramáapụ.
english_text: (All the people, even the tax collectors, when they heard Jesus’ words, acknowledged that God’s way was right, because they had been baptized by John.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Farisiiapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma ọḅụ pa Tamuno karakárá asọ ma gbim, sị minigha sị Jọn mingi pa n sara.)
english_text: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law rejected God’s purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.)

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị ḅẹẹ, A tẹ́ pa mị tuminikiriapụ ma na tọ́ma bẹ? Nnị tẹ́ kịka?
english_text: Jesus went on to say,“To what, then, can I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?

ibani_text: Fẹ́siri ḅụ kpọrọfịnị awọamaapụ anịị n kịkanyẹ. Gbẹ́rẹ́apụ ilúghú isiapụ pịrịm, ḅẹẹ, Wa ẹ́rẹ yaa akwa farị ọ pịrịm, kụ́ma o mini sẹghịgha! Wa dụadu núme suu ọ pịrịm, kụ́ma o mini owugha!
english_text: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling out to each other: “ ‘We played the pipe for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not cry.’

ibani_text: Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ ḅom, o ḅurukụmam pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ ọfịrị iru sọ ḅugha kụ́ma ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Sitẹ́mẹ́ ọ ḅụ imii!
english_text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅom, ọ nyẹ ḅuum pịghị nyẹ fịịm, ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma dighi! Ori opu furo fị́ị́ ḅọ, pịghị iru ḅu ḅu ḅo, kọnsịn ósó igbii daapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ nangwọ!
english_text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners.’

ibani_text: Tamuno níminyẹ ma daakịapụ diepághámamam ḅẹẹ Tamuno níminyẹ ma anị karakáram.
english_text: But wisdom is proved right by all her children.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Farisiiḅọ, dugho Jizọs pịrịm ḅẹẹ o ḅoo ọ nana ḅupiri fị́nyẹ fịị, Jizọs warị ọ wárị muu sị kpọrọfịnị ọ nyẹ fịị ḅẹ́ ḅara nyẹ́fị opu ịkasị ọgọ́nọ́.
english_text: When one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him, he went to the Pharisee’s house and reclined at the table.

ibani_text: Anị ama ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imim, sẹfị duma kọọ maá ḅo. A naam ḅẹẹ Jizọs Farisiiḅọ warị nyẹ́fịarị, a warị alabasita ólóló bie fịnị kụ́nụ́ pulo akuoo,
english_text: A woman in that town who lived a sinful life learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house, so she came there with an alabaster jar of perfume.

ibani_text: a warị Jizọs ọḅụju sẹ ọ ḅụọ angaá, árị owúm sị árị owu mingi ma pa ọ ḅụ́ọ́pisima, warị a sịbịnumo ma pa ọ ḅụọ ọgọ́nọ́ ma si, bịpị pa ọ ḅụọ ọ́gọ́nọ ma nọnju sị kụ́nụ́ pulo ma pa ọ ḅụọ ọgọnọ sara.
english_text: As she stood behind him at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. Then she wiped them with her hair, kissed them and poured perfume on them.

ibani_text: Farisiiḅọ ma mịma árị sáá, ọ warị ọ ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ mị owitụ́wọ ma karakárá ikiakoroḅọ ọ ḅara pa ọ lamaarị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma nimibẹm, ḅẹ́ árị sii tumḅọ.
english_text: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who is touching him and what kind of woman she is—that she is a sinner.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Saimọn a nyẹ nyánam a dugho ị pịrịbẹnyẹ. Ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Innh Nyẹ́dieḅọ dugho ị pịrịị.
english_text: Jesus answered him,“Simon, I have something to tell you.” “Tell me, teacher,” he said.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Mmẹẹ́ owiapụ imi, gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii ḅọlọḅọ ḅara igbii ḅọlọapụ. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ọ ḅara pị́naḅala igbii ndẹ́ẹ na sọ́nọ́ a si findi ọlọm. Í sịḅọ mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi ọlọm.
english_text: “Two people owed money to a certain moneylender. One owed him five hundred denarii,and the other fifty.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine n ḅọ ọlọ sáá ma gbẹẹgha, ọ warị sáá ma wáriso nnị pịrị. Mịná mmẹapụ ma bie tụ́wọ ọ ḅẹlẹma baá bẹ?
english_text: Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he forgave the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”

ibani_text: Saimọn warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ, A sịm ḅẹẹ ọ́ ọ dụḅa ḅá igbii wáriso pịrịḅọ ma. Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị karakáram.
english_text: Simon replied, “I suppose the one who had the bigger debt forgiven.” “You have judged correctly,”Jesus said.

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma daa, warị Saimọn ḅẹẹ, I mịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma arịị? A ị warị sọḅom, mingi sọ ị pa ị pịrịgha a pa i ḅụọ siri, kụ́ma árị owu mingi pa i ḅụọ sị́rị́mam pịghị a sịbịnumo pa ị́ ḅụọ si.
english_text: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon,“Do you see this woman? I came into your house. You did not give me any water for my feet, but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.

ibani_text: A ḅo sáá, ị i ḅologha sị i daá téréma, kụ́ma árị sághị a ḅo sa éné éné árị i ḅụọ nọnjum pịghị ị ḅụọ nọnju ḅarị.
english_text: You did not give me a kiss, but this woman, from the time I entered, has not stopped kissing my feet.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị pulo pa i sịbị saragha kụ́ma árị opuma kụ́nụ́ pulo pa i ḅụọ ọgọnọ saramam.
english_text: You did not put oil on my head, but she has poured perfume on my feet.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ a diepágháma maá ḅẹlẹma ma diearị ḅẹẹ árị tọgha sii ma ḅụ a siiḅụḅarasipịrị nyánámam. Nnị kálá siiḅụḅarasi pịrịḅọ kálá ḅara pa ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven—as her great love has shown. But whoever has been forgiven little loves little.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ sii n ḅárási ị pịrịmam.
english_text: Then Jesus said to her,“Your sins are forgiven.”

ibani_text: Isiapụ ọnánaá nyẹ́fịarịapụ ịkasị ọ́gọ́nọ warị sághị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mị, ọ tụọ mọ, pịghị siiḅụḅarasi kị́nị́ pịrịarịḅọ?
english_text: The other guests began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs dugho ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ minini i ḅọ́rọ́mamam; diin na soo.
english_text: Jesus said to the woman,“Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sa, Jizọs opu ama na káláama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ múm, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ibioku ma dugho pághámaarị. Ori ọḅụdua oyi mmẹapụ findi ma pịghị ó nana muum,
english_text: After this, Jesus traveled about from one town and village to another, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The Twelve were with him,

ibani_text: anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị jẹa ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ, n ḅụ sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiapụ na nna ḅụ obi gwọapụ o dua ḅara. Nna ẹ́rẹ anịị, Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, n ḅụ sọ́nọ́ma sitẹ́mẹ́ deesi ḅọ;
english_text: and also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (called Magdalene) from whom seven demons had come out;

ibani_text: Joana, Kuza taa, Hẹrọd wárị fịrịnwangịapụ sịbịdaḅọ; Suzana, na pịghị jẹ́ tọgha ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ, mịnaapụ ma anịị nna nyánányẹ pa ḅárásua Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrịarịapụ.
english_text: Joanna the wife of Chuza, the manager of Herod’s household; Susanna; and many others. These women were helping to support them out of their own means.

ibani_text: Túminị́ pa Jizọs damaḅoarị ama ama ama ḅụ, tọgha túminị́ kobiri sáá, ọ warị mị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị:
english_text: While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from town after town, he told this parable:

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ dụadipiḅọ, pághá mú sịmgbọlụ dipim, ọ sịmgbọlụ ma gbi gálágálá ma sáá, jẹa nyẹ asọogbo sóóró korom, túminị́ anị nangam sị fíní warị anị gbọfị.
english_text: “A farmer went out to sow his seed. As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path; it was trampled on, and the birds ate it up.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ dapịrị kiri ḅụ kóróm, mgbọ́lụ ma sópághá gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anị saghị sámụ́nọm, mingi ófórigha gosi kiri ma bie.
english_text: Some fell on rocky ground, and when it came up, the plants withered because they had no moisture.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ nangi nangi piri bie sóóró korom anị nangi ma na sópághá nyẹ ma nangi ma warị anị kpepuma.
english_text: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up with it and choked the plants.

ibani_text: Jẹa sịmgbọlụ warị ibikiri ḅụ sóórókoro. Anị warị sẹnị págháḅo sị sọ́nọ́ a si ḅara nẹ́ngị nyẹ pa sịmgbọlụ sua. Jizọs mịma dugho fama sa ọ warị ḅẹẹ: Biri nyanaḅọ náa.
english_text: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up and yielded a crop, a hundred times more than was sown.” When he said this, he called out,“Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ warị o gbíla ḅẹ́ mị kaḅụ ma anị tẹ́ dughoarị?
english_text: His disciples asked him what this parable meant.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n págháraa ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅọghunyẹ n mịẹmam sị ọmịnị anị níminyẹ sọ. Kụ́ma isiapụ kaḅụ anị a pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ n pịrịarịnyẹ, ḅẹẹ,  Nnị arịarị kụ́ma arịgha, Nnị naarị kụ́ma akanyaḅogha.
english_text: He said,“The knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God has been given to you, but to others I speak in parables, so that, “ ‘though seeing, they may not see; though hearing, they may not understand.’

ibani_text: Mịị anị kaḅụ ma dughoarị nyẹ, sịmgbọlụ ma anị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma.
english_text: “This is the meaning of the parable: The seed is the word of God.

ibani_text: Asọogbo sóórókoro mgbọ́lụ ma, sẹ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naapụ pịrịm, kụ́ma ẹ́kpẹ́dua ḅo ḅom sị n náa oku ma sịakịm nna tẹ́mẹ́bie, n mininibịgha ḅara sị ḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná.
english_text: Those along the path are the ones who hear, and then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.

ibani_text: Dapịrị kiri ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọlụ ma sẹ oku ma naapụ ma pịrịm, bieḅẹlẹ ḅara pa anị akị kụ́ma anị kune nyanagha go, nna minini fịnị ḅọlọgha, kụ́ma daádighi ḅọ sáá n bịghị korom.
english_text: Those on the rocky ground are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in the time of testing they fall away.

ibani_text: Nangi ḅụ sóórókoro sịmgbọlụ ma sẹ oku ma naáapụ pịrịm, kụ́ma tuminikiri ḅụḅáláḅálá, ngọ na tuminikiri ḅẹ́lẹ̄, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma kpepumam anịgo nna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ sẹnị sị kpọgha.
english_text: The seed that fell among thorns stands for those who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by life’s worries, riches and pleasures, and they do not mature.

ibani_text: Ibikiri ḅụ kóró sịmgbọlụ ma sẹ oku ma naapụ pịrịm sị ibi na pịghị bịpị osii tẹ́mẹ́bie pa anị kokom, anị warị ngịrịma nyáná wárii sị ḅo sịmgbọlụ suam.
english_text: But the seed on good soil stands for those with a noble and good heart, who hear the word, retain it, and by persevering produce a crop.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ tọndọ tọ́ndigha sị bọlị pa anị gbẹ́ẹ̄ anịgha pa múnonyẹ sughu sua. Tụ́ma nnị anị pa tọndọ gbananyẹ ḅụ gbánā gbánām sị túminị́ baá ma árị bẹ ḅara n sọḅo sáá.
english_text: “No one lights a lamp and hides it in a clay jar or puts it under a bed. Instead, they put it on a stand, so that those who come in can see the light.

ibani_text: Ḅọghunyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị mịẹ findibẹm sị kị́nị́mamgba anị árị, n gbẹ́ẹ̄ wárịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị akuo baá bẹ kọ́rọ́mabẹm,
english_text: For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed, and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open.

ibani_text: Anịgo tọ́rụ́ pa kiri lama ị nyẹ naarị ḅara. Nyẹ nyáná ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa jẹ́ nyánábẹm. Kụ́ma nyẹ nyánághaḅọ, n ḅo sị ḅẹ́ n ḅọ nyáná kálányẹ ma sọ nnị nna ḅara anị daákịbẹm.
english_text: Therefore consider carefully how you listen. Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they think they have will be taken from them.”

ibani_text: Jizọs o nyingi na ọrẹ numboru owiapụ o damaḅom, kụ́ma nnị ine sọma ọ fịnị angaá mugha túminị́ ma opuma dụḅam gosi.
english_text: Now Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him, but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́ warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Ị nyingi na ịyẹa mịnáowiapụ nụ́ngọbie sẹ́fịnị sị ị́yẹ́ árị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: Someone told him, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ, I nyingi na ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ anịị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naapụ pịghị anị dughonyẹ mịẹarịapụ.
english_text: He replied,“My mother and brothers are those who hear God’s word and put it into practice.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs árụ́ ḅụlọm ori na ori ọḅụduaapụ na, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, O ḅo wa tọ́rụ́ ma saḅa koro isi párángáa muu. Anịị n dọghụpágháma nyẹ.
english_text: One day Jesus said to his disciples,“Let us go over to the other side of the lake.”So they got into a boat and set out.

ibani_text: Nnị munyẹ ma muarị sa múno warị, Jizọs dighi akị. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri kụrọ fọ́rụ warị sághị tọ́rụ́ ma bie ofuro, mingi warị sághị árụ́ ma bie sọọ, nna duma warị ḅo ḅụḅáláḅálá ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: As they sailed, he fell asleep. A squall came down on the lake, so that the boat was being swamped, and they were in great danger.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ mú o sị saghịmam ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ, Wányánáḅọ, Wányánáḅọ, wa biledumaarị! Jizọs warị sághị igani fọ́rụ ma na darịma pịrị, irisé ma warị diin, ngaa mamgba warị ḅo yaghúu.
english_text: The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Master, Master, we’re going to drown!” He got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waters; the storm subsided, and all was calm.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, Ọmịna minini tẹ́ angaá imi? Kụ́ma ḅụgbérépu na ḅáláfa nna ḅụ imi, n warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tụọ? Ḅẹ́ ọ ḅẹrẹtọ fọ́rụ na dinọngụ pịrịarị sị n pịghị ọ bịpị pughum.
english_text: “Where is your faith?”he asked his disciples. In fear and amazement they asked one another, “Who is this? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ sua pághá muu Gerasa ḅẹrẹtọ yọ lam, anịị Galili tọ́rụ́ ma saḅa koro.
english_text: They sailed to the region of the Gerasenes,which is across the lake from Galilee.

ibani_text: Jizọs árụ́ ma bie koro ḅo sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ámá ma bie ḅo ori na donam, sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnịḅọ, mị owitụ́wọ ma ḅọlọmaa sa mịnị bịtẹ sua suagha, ọ pịghị wárị fịnịbịgha, kụ́ma dupu yọ ḅụ anịị ọ fịnịarị nyẹ.
english_text: When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town. For a long time this man had not worn clothes or lived in a house, but had lived in the tombs.

ibani_text: O Jizọs árị sáá ori opuma ilúghum sị ọ ḅụ pa ọ ḅụọ angaá gbi sị ilúghú, Jizọs, Sóghólóḅa Tamuno Tụwọ ị i ḅara tẹ́ dọghụ? A ị tẹ́ghẹ̄m i pa tọ́rụ́siarịma ma.
english_text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell at his feet, shouting at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torture me!”

ibani_text: O mịma dughom tegó Jizọs igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịmam bẹ nnị ori oju bie págháḅo. Tọgha sáá anị oku kórómamam, anịsọnị ḅẹẹ, nnị ịkóli pa ọ ḅụọ na ọ ḅara suam, sị tọ́rụ pa ọ ḅụ warị, ori ịkóli ma pẹ́lẹ́bẹm, sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị o daa pa mú elesiri ḅụ suabẹm.
english_text: For Jesus had commanded the impure spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had seized him, and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard, he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places.

ibani_text: Jizọs o gbilam, Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́ nyẹ́? Ọ warị pagharaa, Iyẹ ẹ́rẹ anị mánámánáapụ. Tegó tọgha sitẹ́mẹ́ ori oju bie sọmam.
english_text: Jesus asked him,“What is your name?” “Legion,” he replied, because many demons had gone into him.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ ori nde pa kunema nyanagha póghóló kiri bie suama.
english_text: And they begged Jesus repeatedly not to order them to go into the Abyss.

ibani_text: Tụ́ndụ́ ma angásá tọgha oporopo imi, fị́nyẹ dọghụ fịarịnyẹ. Sitẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ori nnị wáriso sị nnị oporopo ma bie sọọ, ọ warị nnị warịsó.
english_text: A large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs, and he gave them permission.

ibani_text: Nnị owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ págháḅom sị oporopo ma bie sọọ, oporopo ogbo ma warị mangị koro tụ́ndụ ma ḅụ sị mú tọ́rụ́ ma bie sọ sị sombi fịịm.
english_text: When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.

ibani_text: Oporopo ma didighiarịapụ ma árị sáá pághányẹ nnị mangị pághá opu ama bie ma múm na pịghị anị ikelema káláama mamgba mú sị pághányẹ ma dugho wásáma.
english_text: When those tending the pigs saw what had happened, they ran off and reported this in the town and countryside,

ibani_text: Túminị́ pághá mú pághá maá nyẹ ma arịm, n Jizọs damaḅo sáá, nnị oju bie sitẹ́mẹ́ soo owitụ́wọ ma arịm kpọrọfịnịarị ngá Jizọs ḅụọ anga, ọ bịtẹ suam pịghị ori karakárá tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ imi, ḅáláfa warị ḅo nnị kị́nị́mamgba bie sọọ.
english_text: and the people went out to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus, they found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ma árịapụ ma dugho túminị́ ma pịrịm, ọ ḅara warị gwọ ḅara.
english_text: Those who had seen it told the people how the demon-possessed man had been cured.

ibani_text: Gerasa ḅẹrẹtọ yọ sághị ḅoapụ mamgba warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, o soo tegó opu ḅáláfá nna tẹ́mẹ́bie imi. Jizọs warị árụ́ ḅụlọ sị som.
english_text: Then all the people of the region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, because they were overcome with fear. So he got into the boat and left.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ oju bie pághá owitụ́wọ ma Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, ori ọ wáriso sị ori ọ́ nana sọọ. Kụ́ma Jizọs ọ fịrịma sọm; ḅẹẹ,
english_text: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

ibani_text: Soo wárị muu sị mú dugho Tamuno mịẹ i pịrịmaá nyẹ. Owitụ́wọ ma warị ámá ḅọ́rọ́ dugho n pịrịarị Jizọs mịẹ ọ pịrịmaá nyẹ.
english_text: “Return home and tell how much God has done for you.”So the man went away and told all over town how much Jesus had done for him.

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghịma isi tọ́rụ́aka ma ḅoo sáá, túminị́ ma warị ọ datéréma tegó? Nnị kị́nị́mamgba o kurufịnim.
english_text: Now when Jesus returned, a crowd welcomed him, for they were all expecting him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jairọs pa sịḅọ warị ḅo láa, ori sọ pịghị sịbịdaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ nna kobiri yọ ma ḅụ. Ori warị ọ ḅụ saghị Jizọs ḅụọ angaá gbi warị o tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ori ọ wárị ḅoo
english_text: Then a man named Jairus, a synagogue leader, came and fell at Jesus’ feet, pleading with him to come to his house

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ ori Kpọ́kpọ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ oyi mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá findi lámaaḅọ fịịarị. Jizọs pa múuarị sa tọgha túminị́ warị o gbiriikélékélé ngámámgba ḅụ.
english_text: because his only daughter, a girl of about twelve, was dying. As Jesus was on his way, the crowds almost crushed him.

ibani_text: Nna bie gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imi ḅọ́rọ́maa oyi mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá ḅụ, ḅoo anịsáa ma la, ọmbịnyẹ́ opuma a ḅụ págháarị. Árị nyánányẹ mamgba a famamam bịrịapụ ḅarabie, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine a gwọgha.
english_text: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years,but no one could heal her.

ibani_text: A warị túminị́ kpo ma ogbobie ḅọ́rọ́ mú Jizọs ọḅụju ḅara pa ọ suabịtẹ bịpị lama, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ọmbịnyẹ́ ma sẹm mịnị saragha.
english_text: She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak, and immediately her bleeding stopped.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị gbíla, Tụọ ḅara pa i lama? Kị́nị́mamgba pighim, Pita warị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ túminị́ ma n koko ị gbiri ikelekelé ngámámgba ḅụ sị pụ́nụ́ma pụ́nụ́maarị.
english_text: “Who touched me?”Jesus asked. When they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the people are crowding and pressing against you.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs pa ḅẹm, Kị́nị́ ḅara pa i lámam, a nimim kụrọ ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pághá sa.
english_text: But Jesus said,“Someone touched me; I know that power has gone out from me.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma arịm ḅẹẹ a mịnị ine ḅọghugha, a warị jighe ma jighe ma págháḅo sị a ḅụ pa Jizọs ḅụọ angaá gbii. Anị ngaa kị́nị́mamgba tórúku a warị dugho a go ḅara pa ọ lámányẹ, árị oju pịghị ḅara warị gwọ ḅara anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: Then the woman, seeing that she could not go unnoticed, came trembling and fell at his feet. In the presence of all the people, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị a ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ ndụ́ḅa ị́yẹ́ minini ị gwọmam. Diin ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: Then he said to her,“Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dughoarị sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ oku muḅọ mangị ḅomam Jairọs wárị, dugho Jairọs pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ndụ́ḅa fịịmam. Mịnị ḅụḅáláḅálá pa Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma pịrịma.
english_text: While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. “Your daughter is dead,” he said. “Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs nyẹ ma naam warị Jairọs ḅẹẹ, Ḅáláfáma, pa minini, árị oju ibibẹm.
english_text: Hearing this, Jesus said to Jairus,“Don’t be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed.”

ibani_text: O ḅo Jairọs warị ma láa sáá, o minigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ọ nana wárị ma sọọ mú, kụ́ma Pita, Jọn na Jems na pịghị tụwọ ma daa na nyingiḅọ ngéré.
english_text: When he arrived at the house of Jairus, he did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John and James, and the child’s father and mother.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa fịnịapụ mamgba owuarị pịghị dụadu tụwọ ma pịrịarị. Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, O mịnị owuma, tụwọ ma na a fịịgha, a papa múnoarị.
english_text: Meanwhile, all the people were wailing and mourning for her.“Stop wailing,”Jesus said.“She is not dead but asleep.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma warị ọ dẹrị, tegó, n nimim ḅẹẹ a fịịmam.
english_text: They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ḅara ḅụ árị ọlọm warị a ḅẹẹ, I tụwọ saghị.
english_text: But he took her by the hand and said,“My child, get up!”

ibani_text: Árị duma warị pịghịma ḅo a ḅụ sọọ, a warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri saghị sẹ. Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ ọ fị́nyẹ pa a pịrị a fị.
english_text: Her spirit returned, and at once she stood up. Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat.

ibani_text: Nyingiḅọ na daaḅọ na, mịnyẹ ma nna ḅụ́gbérépumam kụ́ma Jizọs tọ́ọ n pịrịm ḅẹẹ n dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma pághá nyẹ.
english_text: Her parents were astonished, but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.

ibani_text: Jizọs ọrẹ oyi mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma sị kubirim sị ịnyọ na kụrọ pa n pịrị sị n pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesi, sị pịghị obi gwọọ.
english_text: When Jesus had called the Twelve together, he gave them power and authority to drive out all demons and to cure diseases,

ibani_text: Ọ warị n fịrịma ḅẹẹ, n muu Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gbólómanyẹ dugho wásámáa, sị pịghị obiapụ gwọọ.
english_text: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

ibani_text: O dugho n pịrịm, Nnị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ akịma nnị muarịnyẹ ma, agbara akịma, nyẹ mú akpa akịma, fị́nyẹ akịma, igbii akịma, ḅụdima bịtẹ sọ akịma.
english_text: He told them:“Take nothing for the journey—no staff, no bag, no bread, no money, no extra shirt.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ dakóróma wárị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmịnị anị ngá fịnị sị ọmịnị ama ma wáriso bẹ sa láa.
english_text: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave that town.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ daákịgha ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọmịnị ámá ma wáriso, sị ọmịna ḅụọ sughu onwo gugu sara n pịrị, pa die ḅẹẹ, anị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma nna sịbị gbánam. Tamuno igani n kuruarị.
english_text: If people do not welcome you, leave their town and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”

ibani_text: Ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ ma warị kálá ámá ámá muu ikéléma, ibi ọkụ́ ma dugho wásámaarị pịghị obiapụ gwọarị ngá mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: So they set out and went from village to village, proclaiming the good news and healing people everywhere.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd Galili táarịḅọ pághárịnyẹ mamgba náa sáá, ọ sịbị ḅo opuma galagalam, tegó jẹ́apụ dughoarị ḅẹẹ Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ fị ḅụ saghịmam.
english_text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was going on. And he was perplexed because some were saying that John had been raised from the dead,

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ḅẹẹarị ḅẹẹ Elaija pịghịma ḅomam, jẹ́apụ ḅẹarị ḅẹ olom sáá ikiakoroapụ ḅụ bẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pịghị saghịmam.
english_text: others that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had come back to life.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd ḅẹẹm ḅẹẹ, A Jọn sịbị pẹ́lẹ́mam, mịị tụọ mọ, a ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ naarịḅọ? Ọ warị saghị asọ dọghụ ọ Jizọs árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: But Herod said, “I beheaded John. Who, then, is this I hear such things about?” And he tried to see him.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma pịghịma ḅom sị dugho Jizọs pịrị n mịẹmáa nyẹ mamgba. Ori nnị akịm, nnị ngéré warị nwángị so Bẹtịsaida pa sị ama muu.
english_text: When the apostles returned, they reported to Jesus what they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew by themselves to a town called Bethsaida,

ibani_text: Túminị́ ogbo ma anị gbólómanyẹ náa sáá, nnị o duam ọ warị n dakóróma warị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri gbolomanyẹ dugho n pịrị pịghị obiapụ gwọọ.
english_text: but the crowds learned about it and followed him. He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who needed healing.
