ibani_text: Ịrụa ma terearị sáá, oyi mmẹẹ́ a ọḅụduaapụ ma ọ damaḅom warị ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ ma fịrịma sị nnị soo, sị nnị ine káláama ámá ámá muu ikéléma sị fị́nyẹ na múno ngaa dọghụ n ḅụ pịrị, tegó mịnga ma anịị túminị́ ngagha ngá.
english_text: Late in the afternoon the Twelve came to him and said, “Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and countryside and find food and lodging, because we are in a remote place here.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Ọ mịnị ọ ḅara na, fị́nyẹ dọghụ nnị pịrị. Nnị warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Mịnga wa nyánányẹ mamgba anịị sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo na mmẹẹ́ a nji mgbọ́lụ. I dọghụ ḅẹ́ wa mú fị́nyẹ fẹ mị túminị́ kpo ma pịrị?
english_text: He replied,“You give them something to eat.” They answered, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish—unless we go and buy food for all this crowd.”

ibani_text: (Aningáa fịnị owiapụ anịị túminị́ oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi.) Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm, Túminị́ ma mịẹsị n kpọrọfịnị túminị́ a mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi, túminị́ mmẹsi oyi findi, gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa.
english_text: (About five thousand men were there.) But he said to his disciples,“Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ọkọ miẹfamam, kị́nị́mamgba warị kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: The disciples did so, and everyone sat down.

ibani_text: Jizọs sọ́nọ́ a fịtúrú kpo ma na mmẹẹ́ nji ma saghị akịm, tọ́rụ́ pa so daa, ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ warị anị puu sị pa ori ọḅụduaapụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ n die ikelema túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke them. Then he gave them to the disciples to distribute to the people.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịfama sị pịghị kọọ nyẹ nyáná, ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị oyi mmẹẹ́ nkana findi taa ḅo nnị fịkọma nyẹ.
english_text: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs ngéré fịnị tẹ́ghẹ̄arị sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ sọ ori na imi, ọ warị n gbíla ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ ḅẹẹ mọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị tụọ?
english_text: Once when Jesus was praying in private and his disciples were with him, he asked them,“Who do the crowds say I am?”

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam, Jẹ́apụ ḅẹm ḅẹ́, ịrị Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ, jẹ́apụ ḅẹm ḅẹ, ịrị Elaija, jẹ́apụ pịghị ḅẹm ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ olom sáá ikiakoroḅọ pịghịma ḅomam.
english_text: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, that one of the prophets of long ago has come back to life.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọmịnị ọ tẹ́ dugho? Ọ ḅẹẹ Irị tụọ? Pita warị pagharaa ḅẹ́, Ịrị anị Tamuno Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ sị fịrịma ḅoo.
english_text: “But what about you?”he asked.“Who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “God’s Messiah.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅoo birinụ́nụ́ ḅara pa dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ n dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma.
english_text: Jesus strictly warned them not to tell this to anyone.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dugho n pịrịm, ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma tọgha tọ́rụ́siarị árịbẹm, sẹ́nịapụ ma, na pịghị igwagwaalaapụ ma, na pịghị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma ḅarabie, n pịghị ọ sịghịbẹm. Nnị ọ ḅaabẹm, kụ́ma tẹ́rẹ́ a dii kárámá bẹ éné o fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: And he said,“The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅẹẹ, I dua bẹḅọ fịnịfịnị n ḅọ amịna ḅụ pa bieḅárámá, n ḅo mgbẹsẹ sị́ dighi akị sị ị dua éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ bie.
english_text: Then he said to them all:“Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me.

ibani_text: Amịna duma dua bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ḅuumabẹm, kụ́ma amịna duma ḅuumaḅọ i sịbị gosi anị dụapághámaḅobẹm.
english_text: For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me will save it.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ tẹ́ sọnyẹ nyáná ḅo bẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ n ḅọ tuminikiri gbọrụ nyánaḅom, kụ́ma n ḅo ḅụgbọrụ fama?
english_text: What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit their very self?

ibani_text: Tumḅọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị dighi ḅụ́gịrịrị pịghị ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma dighi ḅụ́gịrịrị, anịsáa, irị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma so n ḅo dighi ḅụgịrịrịbẹm, ọ ḅo sáá ori ipine ḅụ, na pịghị Daḅọ ma ipine, pịghị tọ́ntọ́ sookumuapụ ma ipine ḅụ.
english_text: Whoever is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ ọmịna bie mịnga sẹ́fịnịarị jẹ́apụ imi fịịbịghaapụ sị mú Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma árị sa láa.
english_text: “Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Inine a dii ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá ọ mịị nyẹ ma dughonyẹ, Jizọs warị Pita na Jọn na pịghị Jems si akị pa gbẹ́rẹ́ tụ́ndụ́ tándị sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: About eight days after Jesus said this, he took Peter, John and James with him and went up onto a mountain to pray.

ibani_text: O tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma kọarị sáá, ọ tórúku warị ḅo dima anị fịnị ḅara ḅụ, o suabịtẹ anị pị́na, tọ́rụ́pụma ḅara anịị anị pa biarị ḅara.
english_text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri mmẹẹ́ owiapụ warị saghị ọ nana ẹ́gẹ́rẹ, mịnaapụ ma ọ́ Mosis na Elaija.
english_text: Two men, Moses and Elijah, appeared in glorious splendor, talking with Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị sobie ipine na ḅom sị Jizọs na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ori fịị gbolomanyẹ kiriakị bẹnyẹ Jerusalem ḅụ.
english_text: They spoke about his departure,which he was about to bring to fulfillment at Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Pita na ọ nana fịnịapụ opu múnobie imi, kụ́ma n múno ḅụ saghị sị Jizọs ipine arịm na mmẹẹ́ owiapụ ọ nana sẹ́fịnịapụ.
english_text: Peter and his companions were very sleepy, but when they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.

ibani_text: Owiapụ ma Jizọs warịsoarị sáá, Pita warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ anị ibim wa mịnga fịnị, wa tẹ́rẹ́ ákáinyi wárị namabẹm ịrị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ nyáná, Mosis gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ na Elaija gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ. (Ori ibima nimigha o dughoarị nyẹ.)
english_text: As the men were leaving Jesus, Peter said to him, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.” (He did not know what he was saying.)

ibani_text: O pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ma kọarị sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ oḅuto warị ḅo mgbẹẹ; ḅáláfa warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma bie soo, oḅuto ma ḅo mgbẹẹ ḅara ma.
english_text: While he was speaking, a cloud appeared and covered them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ pụghọ warị oḅuto ma bie koro, ḅẹẹ, Mịị i Tụwọ, a sẹlẹakị máaḅọ ọmịnị ọ bịpị pughu.
english_text: A voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I have chosen; listen to him.”

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ pụghọ ma ḅo kunema, sáá, Jizọs ngéré anịị anị ngaa sẹ́fịnịarịḅọ. Ọḅụduaapụ ma ikpurusua mịnanyẹ mamgba pịrịm, sị pịghị mịnị dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so pịrịgha anịsáa ma ḅụ.
english_text: When the voice had spoken, they found that Jesus was alone. The disciples kept this to themselves and did not tell anyone at that time what they had seen.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáa Jizọs na ori tẹ́rẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma warị koro ḅo tụ́ndụ ma ọgọnọ tọgha túminị́ warị ḅo ọ nana dona.
english_text: The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ warị ilúghú túminị́ ogbo ma bie, ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ a i tẹ́ghẹ̄m, i tụwọ dighi, ị́yẹ́ kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ tụwọ.
english_text: A man in the crowd called out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sitẹ́mẹ́ o dighi nwángị ikélekélem, mịẹsị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ori ilúghuarịnyẹ, anị ọ nụ́nụ́bẹm sị o dighi kiri gbi ọ bịpị warị saghị ọkọ́kọ́ pághámaḅo, anịị anị nyẹ pa ọ lama bẹ ḅara sị pịghị minigha sị ori ịnyọ́sárá.
english_text: A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth. It scarcely ever leaves him and is destroying him.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ nnị anị dee sị kụ́ma nnị inegha.
english_text: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they could not.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ pagharam, Yei ọmịnị mị ḅụọsaa irima, irimapụ a ngịrịma nyáná ọ pịrị muu tẹ́ sa láa bẹ? I tụ́wọ pa mịnga ḅoo.
english_text: “You unbelieving and perverse generation,”Jesus replied,“how long shall I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma ḅoarị sáá sitẹ́mẹ́ ma o fom kiri gbim sị ọ nụ́nụ́obi koro. Kụ́ma Jizọs igani sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm, sị tụwọ ma gwọọ, sị ọ saghị daḅọ pịrị.
english_text: Even while the boy was coming, the demon threw him to the ground in a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the impure spirit, healed the boy and gave him back to his father.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma opu kụrọ warị túminị́ mamgba ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépuma. Kị́nị́mamgba sịbịbie kịẹ Jizọs nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma pịrịarị sáá, ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm,
english_text: And they were all amazed at the greatness of God. While everyone was marveling at all that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,

ibani_text: O birifama a dugho ọ pịrị dọghụnyẹ ma pịrị: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma nnị ọ Dẹrịfị́bẹm túminị́ ḅarabie.
english_text: “Listen carefully to what I am about to tell you: The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma dughoarị nyẹ nnị akanyaḅogha. Nnị anị pa n ḅọghumam anịgo nnị anị akanyaḅogha, ḅáláfa go n pịghị ine anị gbolomanyẹ pa o gbilagha.
english_text: But they did not understand what this meant. It was hidden from them, so that they did not grasp it, and they were afraid to ask him about it.

ibani_text: Nụna nụ́ná warị nna ogbobie saghị nna ḅụ géléḅa bẹḅọ.
english_text: An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest.

ibani_text: Jizọs nna kóróma nimitẹ́lẹ́mam warị gbẹ́rẹ́ kálátụwọ akuoo ḅo ori angásá sẹ ma warị.
english_text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, took a little child and had him stand beside him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Mịná Káláawọ ma dakóróma ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ i daa kórómam pịghị i dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i fịrịma ḅọ ma dakórómam. Ḅẹẹ ọmịna ḅụ ịrụḅaḅọ anịị géléḅa ḅọ.
english_text: Then he said to them,“Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. For it is the one who is least among you all who is the greatest.”

ibani_text: Jọn warị ḅẹẹ, Wányánáḅọ, wa gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ arịm sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị ḅọ ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ ḅụ, wa warị asọ dọghụ sị okiki, ori wámịna ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha gosi.
english_text: “Master,” said John, “we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him, because he is not one of us.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, O kikima, ḅụọ mgbẹsẹ ọ pịrịghaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmịna ju imi.
english_text: “Do not stop him,”Jesus said,“for whoever is not against you is for you.”

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo kikia sa ḅẹẹ, n Jizọs akị sobie muu, ori ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ miẹkụ́rọ́mam sị Jerusalem muu.
english_text: As the time approached for him to be taken up to heaven, Jesus resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Ọ warị parị túminị́ fịrịma Sameriya káláama muu, sị n nyẹ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara;
english_text: And he sent messengers on ahead, who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him;

ibani_text: kụ́ma aningáa fịnịapụ ma mini ọ dakórómagha, tegó ọ tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹẹ o Jerusalem muarị.
english_text: but the people there did not welcome him, because he was heading for Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Ọḅụdua Jems na Jọn mịma árị sáá, n gbilam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i dọghụ ḅẹẹ wa sobie fịnị fọngụma ḅoo n dọ́ghụ́ma?
english_text: When the disciples James and John saw this, they asked, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs tọ́rụ́ pighim sị igani n pịrị,
english_text: But Jesus turned and rebuked them.

ibani_text: n warị so jẹ́ káláama muu.
english_text: Then he and his disciples went to another village.

ibani_text: Nnị nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị sáá asọogbo, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ọ ḅẹm, A ị duabẹm i mú angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Pụnụ nna olulu nyánam, fọ́rụ bie fiigharị fíní wárị nyánam, kụ́ma Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma sịbị kọ́rọ́ma bẹ angaá nyanagha.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho jụghọ pịrị, I dua. Kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ma pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ i wáriso sị a mú parị i daa dipi.
english_text: He said to another man,“Follow me.” But he replied, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, Wáriso sị fịịapụ nna fịịapụ dipi, kụ́ma ịrị muu Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gbólómanyẹ dugho págháma.
english_text: Jesus said to him,“Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Jụghọ warị pịghị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, a i duabẹm, kụ́ma parị i wáriso sị a mú ibima fịnị pa ị wárịapụ ḅẹẹ.
english_text: Still another said, “I will follow you, Lord; but first let me go back and say goodbye to my family.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Duakiri sughupịghị ḅala ma ọ́lọ́máa ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị pịghị ọḅụ dighi, anị ḅụgbẹ́gha ọkọfịnịḅọ́ fịrịnwangị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma pịrị.
english_text: Jesus replied,“No one who puts a hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma jẹ́ túminị́ tẹ́si oyi findi na mmẹẹ́ sẹ́lẹ́akịm warị mmẹapụ mmẹapụ pa n fịrịma págháma, ḅẹ n tarị ọ ḅụ ámá na yọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ muu, ori ma muu dọghụ ngaa mamgba.
english_text: After this the Lord appointed seventy-twoothers and sent them two by two ahead of him to every town and place where he was about to go.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Opu duasughu imi, kụ́ma fịrịnaapụ ma dụḅagha. Tẹ́ghẹ̄ẹ̄ ḅẹẹ duasughu ma Nyánáḅọ ma fịrịnaapụ fịrịma sị n sughu nyẹ ma kobiri.
english_text: He told them,“The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, muu! A ánáná ḅara pa ọ fịrịmaarị túú ogbobie.
english_text: Go! I am sending you out like lambs among wolves.

ibani_text: Igbii suanyẹ akịma, anịgha nyẹ muu akpa, anịgha agbaa, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ kule ma asọogbo.
english_text: Do not take a purse or bag or sandals; and do not greet anyone on the road.

ibani_text: Ọ́ sọọ warị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, parị dugho ḅẹẹ, Diin mị warị ma na fịnị.
english_text: “When you enter a house, first say, ‘Peace to this house.’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ diin ḅẹlẹma ḅọ anị ngaa nganga, ị́yẹ́ diin kule ma anịḅọ ma ọ́gọ́nọ fịnịbẹm, anịgha nḅẹḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ diin kule ma pịghịma ḅo ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: If someone who promotes peace is there, your peace will rest on them; if not, it will return to you.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ warị ma ḅụ fịnị sị nnị ị pịrịnyẹ fị si pịghị nnị ị pịrịnyẹ ḅuu, tegó fịrịnwangịapụ nna gbẹ́ẹnyẹ nyáná na ḅụ́gbẹm, nwángị ikelekele ma gbẹ́rẹ́ warị ḅụ akị mú jẹ́ la.
english_text: Stay there, eating and drinking whatever they give you, for the worker deserves his wages. Do not move around from house to house.

ibani_text: Ịrị ámá sọ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị nnị i dakórómam, n gbánā ị pịrị fị́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịị.
english_text: “When you enter a town and are welcomed, eat what is offered to you.

ibani_text: Anị ámá bie fịnị obiapụ gwọọ, dugho anị ngaa fịnịapụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị kikia ọ dámáḅómam.
english_text: Heal the sick who are there and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị muu sị nnị ị daakórómagha ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ págháa asọogbo muu sị dugho ḅẹẹ,
english_text: But when you enter a town and are not welcomed, go into its streets and say,

ibani_text: Ọmịna ámá, wa ḅụọ ḅolo onwo sọọ wamịnị anị gugu sárá ọ pịrịm pa die ḅẹ́ anị ḅụḅáláḅálá ọmịna sịbị gbánabẹm. Kụ́ma o biekóróma ḅẹẹ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma kikia ọ fịnịngaa ḅomam.
english_text: ‘Even the dust of your town we wipe from our feet as a warning to you. Yet be sure of this: The kingdom of God has come near.’

ibani_text: A tẹ́mẹ́kụrọ ḅara pa dugho o pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ éné ma ḅụ ọmịna tọ́rụ́siarị Sodom angaá nyẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town.

ibani_text: Anị ịḅụ siḅaabẹm Korasin! Anị pịghị ịḅụ siḅaabẹm Bẹtịsaida. Ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ibie nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nnị anị nwángịm Taya na Sidọn ḅụ, túminị́ ma ḅolo sáá duadubịtẹ sua sị fọọ taa n sịbị sara sị diepágháma ḅẹẹ nnị nna sii ḅụ pịghịmam.
english_text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

ibani_text: Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma ḅụ ọmịna tọ́rụ́siarị Taya na Sidọn nganyẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.

ibani_text: Ịrị Kapanọm, ị́ ịḅụ saghị iwó muu sobie láa bẹ? Nnị i saghị duama gbi suabẹm.
english_text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to the heavens? No, you will go down to Hades.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, O pughuḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị i pughum; ọ́ sịghịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị i sịghịm, i sịghịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị i fịrịmaḅọ ma sịghịm.
english_text: “Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́si oyi findi na mmẹẹ́ owiapụ ma pịghịma ḅom opu bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ sị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sitẹ́mẹ́ sọ wa mịná bịpị osim wamịnị igani n pịrị sa ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ ḅụ.
english_text: The seventy-two returned with joy and said, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, A Satanị arịm sobie saghị sóghórókoro sofịnị ḅara ma,
english_text: He replied,“I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.

ibani_text: o pughuu, a kụ́rọ pa ọ pịrịmam sị ọ mịnị ododó ọ́gọ́nọ nwángịbẹm na pịghị ododobiriḅọ ọ́gọ́nọ, sị pịghị iruonaḅọ kụ́rọ mamgba nẹ́ngịma, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pịghị ọ labịgha.
english_text: I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o bieḅẹlẹma ḅẹẹ sitẹ́mẹ́ ọmịna bịpị osim, tụ́ma o bieḅẹlẹ ḅẹẹ sobie nnị ọmịna ẹ́rẹ gịẹmam.
english_text: However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị ḅo Jizọs bieḅẹlẹma, Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Daa, so na tuminikiri Nyanaḅọ, a ịmịẹḅam pa i ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, i mịnyẹ ma pa nyẹ́nimiapụ na dirinimiapụ ma ḅọghumam, kụ́ma ịrị anị pa dọghụdọghụ awọ diemam. I Daa, mịị anịị ị dọghụ ḅara sị anị ọkọ pághá.
english_text: At that time Jesus, full of joy through the Holy Spirit, said,“I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this is what you were pleased to do.

ibani_text: I Daa, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ị pịrịmam. Tụwọ ma nimiḅọ ofori, Daḅọ ma sima, pịghị Daḅọ ma nimiḅọ ofori, Tụwọ ma sima na pịghị Tụ́wọ ma bi sị ọ Daḅọ ma pa n diebiapụ.
english_text: “All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị anị ngaa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọmịna tọ́rụ́ pa mịnanyẹ ma árịarịapụ Tamuno ibima ọ karịibimam.
english_text: Then he turned to his disciples and said privately,“Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm, tọgha ikiakoroapụ na ámányánáapụ dọ́ghụm ḅẹẹ nnị ọmịnị árịarị nyẹ ma arị, kụ́ma nnị inegha n pịghị náa dọ́ghụm ọ naarị nyẹ, kụ́ma pịghị inegha.
english_text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ólóghó nyẹ́dieḅọ Jizọs damaḅom sị diatughu Jizọs pịrị ọ warị ḅẹẹ nyẹ́dieḅọ, A tẹ́ mịẹbẹ sị gbámásó duma nyáná?
english_text: On one occasion an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. “Teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị o pagharaa, Tọ́ndiri ma anị tẹ́ dugho? Í tọ́rọ́pa anị dugho findiarị?
english_text: “What is written in the Law?”he replied.“How do you read it?”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ,  Ibie mamgba pa Gbámásóḅọ ma ị́yẹ́ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma, na pịghị ị biebẹ duma mamgba pịghị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ mamgba, na pịghị ị bie mamgba. Pịghị, Ị nana kikiama ngaa ḅọ ḅẹlẹma ị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara.
english_text: He answered, “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind’; and, ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, I karakáram, mịma mịẹ anịsáa i dumabẹm.
english_text: “You have answered correctly,”Jesus replied.“Do this and you will live.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ólóghó nyẹ́dieḅọ ma, o dọ́ghụm túminị́ toruku nnị ori árị ḅẹẹ ọ karakáram, warị Jizọs gbíla, Tụọ i nana kikiama ngaaḅọ.
english_text: But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ pagharaa, ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi Jerusalem ḅụ sághị Jeriko muarịḅọ, furuapụ warị okiekoro, ọ ḅụ bịtẹ si, sị ibima o fom sị ọfịfị ḅara fịnịm sị ọ wáriso.
english_text: In reply Jesus said:“A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, when he was attacked by robbers. They stripped him of his clothes, beat him and went away, leaving him half dead.

ibani_text: Anị ḅo pághá ḅara, gbẹ́rẹ́ igwagwaḅọ anị asọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́arị si o ḅọ mị owitụ́wọ ma árị sáá, ọ sáḅá isi angaá ḅọ́rọ́m.
english_text: A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Livai furotụ́wọ anị ngaa ma ḅom sị owitụ́wọ ma arịm sị sáḅá isi angaá ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: So too, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ Sameriyaḅọ anị asọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́arịḅọ ḅọ owitụ́wọ ma arịm, ori ọrẹ árị sáá, ori ọ tọ́rụ́kụ́rụ́kụ́rụ́mám.
english_text: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ fịnịnga muu sị pulo na iru na pa n pa ọ lama nyẹ ma ḅụ sárá warị bịtẹ mpara pa anị káká sị ọ saghị pa ori ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ nama ọ́gọ́nọ gbánā sị ori akuoo igoniapụ fịnịfịnịwarị ma biekóróma, sị o didighi.
english_text: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he put the man on his own donkey, brought him to an inn and took care of him.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáanyẹ ma ori mmẹẹ́ pị́naḅala igbii pághámá ḅom, sị pa igoniapụ fịnịfịnịwarị ma kuruḅọ ma pịrị, ọ warị igoniapụ fịnịfịnịwarị ma kuruḅọ ma ḅẹẹ, Ibima o didighi, ḅẹẹ a pịghịma mị párángáa ḅo bẹ jẹ́ sáá ị fama jẹ́ igbii gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ ḅụ, a pa ị gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: The next day he took out two denariiand gave them to the innkeeper. ‘Look after him,’ he said, ‘and when I return, I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have.’

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kunema ḅẹẹ, Ịḅụ mị tẹ́rẹ́apụ ma ḅụ tụọ ọrẹ kikiama ngaaḅọ ḅara pa nyẹ́ mịẹ? Furuapụ kiẹkoro owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ?
english_text: “Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of robbers?”

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieḅọ ma pagharam ḅẹẹ, Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ọ pịrịḅọ ma. Jizọs warị ọ págháraa, Ịrịsọ soo sị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹ.
english_text: The expert in the law replied, “The one who had mercy on him.” Jesus told him,“Go and do likewise.”

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ nna asọ nwángịarị sáá, o ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ káláama laam, Mata pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ o dakórómam a wárịbie.
english_text: As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.

ibani_text: A gbẹ́rẹ́ mị́naḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ nyánam Meri pa sịḅọ, Jizọs ḅụọ angaá kpọrọfịnị sị ọrẹ dienyẹ pughuarịḅọ.
english_text: She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord’s feet listening to what he said.

ibani_text: Mata a tọ́rụ́ sẹgha a fị́nyẹ mịẹ n pịrịbẹ ḅara gosi, a warị ḅo ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ anị ibi ḅẹẹ, i numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ i wáriso sị ịrị ngéré nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹarị? Dugho a pịrị sị a ḅo ḅárásua i pịrị.
english_text: But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị a págháraa ḅẹẹ, Mata, Mata, ị tọgha nyẹ pa ịḅụ ḅáláḅálámáarị.
english_text: “Martha, Martha,”the Lord answered,“you are worried and upset about many things,

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ngéré anịị ị binyẹ. Meri karakárányẹ ma sẹ́lẹ́akịmam, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịghị ine a ḅara anị daákịbịgha.
english_text: but few things are needed—or indeed only one.Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ́arị gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa. O tẹ́ghẹ̄ faáma sáá, ori ọḅụdua gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, wa die, wa tẹ́ghẹ̄, Jọn sọ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ die ḅara.
english_text: One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ sáá, mị ḅara ḅẹẹ,  Daa, Ị́yẹ́ Ẹ́rẹ Tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnị, Ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ḅoo.
english_text: He said to them,“When you pray, say: “ ‘Father, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come.

ibani_text: Éné, éné ḅụ wa bi fị́nyẹ pa wa pịrị.
english_text: Give us each day our daily bread.

ibani_text: Wamịna sii ḅụ ḅárási wa pịrị. Wamịnị sọ siiḅụḅarasi siinyẹ pa wa mịẹapụ pịrịarị ḅara. Wa daa pa daádighi bie suama.
english_text: Forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And lead us not into temptation.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ amịna nángwọ warị múm dii ogbo warị ḅẹẹ i nángwọ, A ị ḅara tẹ́rẹ́ a fịtúrú kpo ḅọlọ,
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“Suppose you have a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread;

ibani_text: ḅẹ i nángwọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ nyẹ muuḅọ i wárị ḅom a pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ fị́nyẹ mgbọ́lụ nyanagha a pa ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have no food to offer him.’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ị nángwọ ma biebẹ saghị ị pagharaa ọkụ́ma ḅẹẹ, Ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ị pịrịma. Ḅụ́pọ́ ikasịmam, ịrị na ị́yẹ́ awọ sọ wa múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ tándịmam. A ine saghị sị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa ị pịrịbịgha.
english_text: And suppose the one inside answers, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I can’t get up and give you anything.’

ibani_text: A dugho ị pịrịm, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ, ọ mini saghị sị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa ọ pịrịbịgha ḅẹẹ nnị mmẹapụ ọ nángwọ́apụ gosi, kụ́ma ọ saghị sị o binyẹ mamgba pa ọ pịrịbẹm, tegó ọ ḅụgịrịrịgha o gbíla, pịghị o gbíla ḅarị gbíla ma ḅụ.
english_text: I tell you, even though he will not get up and give you the bread because of friendship, yet because of your shameless audacityhe will surely get up and give you as much as you need.

ibani_text: Anịgosi a i ḅẹm: gbíla, ị pịghị nyánáḅobẹm; dọghụ, ị pịghị dọghụḅobẹm; gbolo, ḅụ́pọ́ ma findi ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

ibani_text: Gbilaḅọ nyánáḅobẹm; dọghụḅọ pịghị dọghụḅobẹm; ḅụ́pọ́ ma pịghị findi gboloḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie gbẹ́rẹ́ Daḅọ imii ododó pa amịna tụwọ pịrịbẹḅọ tụwọ ma nji bi ngaa?
english_text: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks fora fish, will give him a snake instead?

ibani_text: Anịgha ododobiriḅọ pa ọ pịrị ori anyị bi ngaa.
english_text: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị sii láa ḅara pa siiapụ nimim ọ mịnị ibinyẹ pa ọmịnị awọ pịrị ḅara, ọmịna sobie Daḅọ ma anịị ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa ọ ḅara biapụ pịrịbịgha ḅọ?
english_text: If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá, Jizọs oḅuu sitẹ́mẹ́ deesim gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅụ, sitẹ́mẹ́ ma ọ ḅụ soo sáá, ọ warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́. Anị warị ḅo túminị́ kpo ma ḅụ́gbérépuma.
english_text: Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹ́apụ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Bẹlizibọlụ, sitẹ́mẹ́ sịbịdáḅọ anịị kụrọ́ ma pa ọ pịrị sị ori ine pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị nyẹ.
english_text: But some of them said, “By Beelzebul, the prince of demons, he is driving out demons.”

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ọ daádighim sị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, o sobie saghị ḅo ilíghíma pa n die.
english_text: Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs nimim n koromáarịnyẹ, ọ warị n ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Puama nyáná sẹ́kiri ine sẹbịgha, puama fịnị wárịbie bịghịkoro korobẹm.
english_text: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them:“Any kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and a house divided against itself will fall.

ibani_text: Anịgo ḅọ́rọ́ Satanị amadakiri ma puama nyánam, anị tọ́rọ́pa sẹ bẹ? A mịma dughom tegó ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Bẹlizibọlụ kụ́rọ anị a pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị nyẹ.
english_text: If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? I say this because you claim that I drive out demons by Beelzebul.

ibani_text: Mị́sa a ḅọ́rọ́ Bẹlizibọlụ kụ́rọ pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị, ọmịna ọḅụduaapụ n tụwọ pa anị deesiarị? Anịgo nnị ọmịna ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your followers drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno kụ́rọ anịị a pa sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarị nyẹ, mịma pịghị dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅoo ọ fịnịnga lámam.
english_text: But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

ibani_text: Kụ́rọ tumḅọ ori ọmụ́nányẹ mamgba pa ọ warị kúru sáá ori ngọ kokobẹm.
english_text: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kụrọ ọ nẹngịḅọ ḅọ owu pa ọ pághámá sị o sọḅamaẹrẹ ori obie kụ́rọ́máarị ọmụ́nányẹ mamgba taaki sọ́bẹm, sị ori ngọ akị sị anị die gálágáláma.
english_text: But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him, he takes away the armor in which the man trusted and divides up his plunder.

ibani_text: Iju ḅụ oforighaḅọ ọ́ ị́yẹ́ iruonaḅọ; ḅárásua i pịrị sị kubirighaḅọ, n ḅọ karakáráma gálágaláarị.
english_text: “Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ kị́nị́ ḅụ warịsomaẹrẹ anị sámụ́nọ́ ngá ḅụ ikelekelebẹm ịnyọ́sárá angaá dọghụ. Anị ine dọghụḅogha ḅogha, anị anị ḅụ ḅẹbẹm, A sima sọọ a sághị ḅọ warị muubẹm.
english_text: “When an impure spirit comes out of a person, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it. Then it says, ‘I will return to the house I left.’

ibani_text: Anị ḅo sáá, anị warị ma árịbẹm nnị anị ọfị fiafiama ḅara pịghị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma warị.
english_text: When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.

ibani_text: Anị anịsáa soobẹm sị muu jẹ́ sọ́nọ́ma sitẹ́mẹ́ akị anị ḅụ suabẹm, sịbịkụ́rọ anị nẹngịnyẹ́, nnị ḅo anịḅọ ma bie ngáabẹm, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ so sa, tumḅọ ma fịnị ḅara mị́sa siḅa parị ma nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that person is worse than the first.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dugho sáá, anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ túminị́ kpo ma bie ilúghú págháma nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Karịiḅi fịnị i yii sị pịghị ndo pa ị pịrị nyingiḅọ pịrị.
english_text: As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out, “Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam ḅẹẹ, Tụ́ma Karịiḅi fịnị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma náa sị pịghị anị dughonyẹ mịẹapụ pịrị.
english_text: He replied,“Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma Jizọs gbiriikélékele ḅara, ọ warị ḅo saghị dugho ḅẹẹ, Dighi mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma sii ḅara, n ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma nyẹ bim, kụ́ma n gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa n pịrịbịgha, tụ́ma Jona ilíghíma nyẹ anịị n nyáná bẹnyẹ.
english_text: As the crowds increased, Jesus said,“This is a wicked generation. It asks for a sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah.

ibani_text: Jona ilíghíma sọọ Niniveapụ pịrị ḅara anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma pịghị ilíghíma sọọ mịị ḅụ́ọ́apụ pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so also will the Son of Man be to this generation.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma, Seba Ámányáná ọ́rụ́ḅọ saghịbẹm sị onyẹ́sẹ mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma pịrịbẹm, sị pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa nna ḅarasima, tegó árị árẹ ama opuma ḅọlọanga ḅụ saghịḅom, ḅẹẹ a ḅo Solomọn níminyẹ ma pughu. A dugho ọ pịrịm mịnga Solomọn nẹngịḅọ imii.
english_text: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon’s wisdom; and now something greater than Solomon is here.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma ḅụ Niniveapụ saghịbẹm sị onyẹsẹ́ mị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma pịrịbẹm, sị pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa nna ḅarasima, tegó, nnị n Jona dugho págháma Tamunoẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa sáá nnị nna sii ḅụ pighim, kụ́ma a kụ́rọ́ma dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ mịnga Jona nẹngịḅọ imii.
english_text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and now something greater than Jonah is here.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ tọndọ tọndi tọ́ndigha sị anị pa ḅọghu angaá warị anịgha anị pa bọlị sughubie warị, tụ́ma n pa tọndọ gbana gbananyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ gbánabẹm sị túminị́ anị árị bẹ ḅara n somumaẹrẹ.
english_text: “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a place where it will be hidden, or under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, so that those who come in may see the light.

ibani_text: Ọmịna tọ́rụ́ anịị ọmịna oju ma tọndọ, ị tọ́rụ ḅuruḅurugha nḅẹḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ oju gbọrụ baá anị ḅụ bim, kụ́ma, ḅọ́rọ́ ị tọ́rụ́ ḅuruḅuru nḅẹḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ oju gbọ́rụ́ kánákáná ḅụ fịnịbẹm.
english_text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eyes are healthy,your whole body also is full of light. But when they are unhealthy,your body also is full of darkness.

ibani_text: Árị ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ oju fịnị baá ma kánákáná sọgha.
english_text: See to it, then, that the light within you is not darkness.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ baá ị́yẹ́ oju gbọrụ ḅụ bim, sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa sọ kánákáná ḅụ ofori, anịsáa baá biabẹm ngámámgba ḅụ, n tọndọ tọndi sị anị baá pa ngámámgba pịrị pịrị ḅara ị́yẹ́ oju gbọrụ ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, if your whole body is full of light, and no part of it dark, it will be just as full of light as when a lamp shines its light on you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ fama sa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, Farisiiḅọ ọ sịm ḅẹ́ o ḅo ọ wárị nyẹ́fị, o warị somuu kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ́fịdọghum.
english_text: When Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat with him; so he went in and reclined at the table.

ibani_text: Farisiiḅọ ma anị ọ ḅụ́gbérépumam ḅẹẹ Jizọs na ḅara sịrịgha pa nyẹ́fịdọghum.
english_text: But the Pharisee was surprised when he noticed that Jesus did not first wash before the meal.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa ọ mịnị Farisiiapụ ọmịna mingi ḅụ ọmọngọ kuku na nyẹ́fị ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ kuku sịrịbẹm kụ́ma ọmịna bie opu tọ́rụ na siiamịẹnyẹ anịị bii nyẹ.
english_text: Then the Lord said to him,“Now then, you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.

ibani_text: Oḅoriapụ! Kuku ma tẹ́mẹ́ Tamuno ori sọ pịghị bie ma tẹ́mẹ́gha?
english_text: You foolish people! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ọmọngọ na ị́yẹ́ Ẹ́fẹ́rẹ́ bie fịnịnyẹ pa igonyiapụ pịrị, anịsa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno toruku fíafía ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: But now as for what is inside you—be generous to the poor, and everything will be clean for you.

ibani_text: Anị siḅaá ọ pịrịbẹm, ọmịnị Farisiiapụ, ọ pa Tamuno pịrịm oyia ngaa die, gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ọ pa fụlọ sọ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị pẹdiri, minti na pịghị rue na pịghị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ pẹdiri, kụ́ma ọ karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ dighi tọ́rụ́sim, na pịghị Tamun ḅẹlẹma, anịmanakaragha ọ karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ, Tamuno ḅẹlẹma, ọ nyánányẹ pa oyia ngaa die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá pa Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: “Woe to you Pharisees, because you give God a tenth of your mint, rue and all other kinds of garden herbs, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You should have practiced the latter without leaving the former undone.

ibani_text: Anị siḅaá ọ pịrịbẹm Farisiiapụ! Ọ toruku n warị ịkasị ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ, pịghị dọghụ ḅẹ́ nnị osigha ḅara pa o kule fẹ́siri ḅụ.
english_text: “Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the most important seats in the synagogues and respectful greetings in the marketplaces.

ibani_text: Anị siḅaá ọ pịrịbẹm, ilíghíma suagha dupu fịnị ḅara anịị ọ fịnị ḅara túminị́ nimigha pa nánga ḅọ́rọ́arị.
english_text: “Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, which people walk over without knowing it.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ólóghó Nyẹ́dieḅọ, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ ị mịma dugho sa i wamịnị sọ wọlọarị.
english_text: One of the experts in the law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us also.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ pagharam, ḅẹẹ, Anị siḅáá ọ pịrịbẹm ólóghó ma diearịapụ. O nyẹ pa túminị́ kuku gbánāarị, opuma iku sị nnị ine dighibịgha nyẹ, kụma ọmịnị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara tụmgbọlụ sọ pámáḅobịgha sị pa ḅárásua n pịrị.
english_text: Jesus replied,“And you experts in the law, woe to you, because you load people down with burdens they can hardly carry, and you yourselves will not lift one finger to help them.

ibani_text: Anị si ḅá ọ pịrịbẹm, o fíafía dupu mịẹ ikiakoroapụ ma pịrịm ọmịna tádọ́apụ ḅá gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroapụ ma.
english_text: “Woe to you, because you build tombs for the prophets, and it was your ancestors who killed them.

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma, ọmịnị sọ kọkọ miniakị ḅẹẹ ọmịna tádọ́apụ mịẹnyẹ ma anị ọ ḅụ ḅẹlẹm; nnị ikiakoroapụ ma ḅám, ọ warị dupu tẹ́mẹ́ n pịrị.
english_text: So you testify that you approve of what your ancestors did; they killed the prophets, and you build their tombs.

ibani_text: Mịma go Tamuno ori níminyẹ ḅụ dughom ḅẹẹ, A ikiakoroapụ na nfịrịmaapụ pa n nfịrịmabẹm, n jẹ́apụ ḅaabẹm pịghị jẹ́apụ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma.
english_text: Because of this, God in his wisdom said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and others they will persecute.’

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị mị́sa ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma ikiakoroapụ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ nnị ọsụụ nyẹ ma tuminikiri saghị sáá éné éné ḅoo mịmgba éné láa, n pa ọmịna sịbị sẹ́bẹm.
english_text: Therefore this generation will be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,

ibani_text: Ebẹl n ḅáḅọ akị muu Zakaraya láa, n ḅáḅọ agba mịẹ yọ ma na Tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma ogboku. Innh, a dugho ọ pịrịm, mịsaapụ ma anị tọ́rụ́siarị mamgba árịbẹm.
english_text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be held responsible for it all.

ibani_text: Anị siḅaá ọ pịrịbẹm, ọmịnị ólóghó ma dieapụ, o níminyẹ wárị ḅụ́pọ́ igodo findinyẹ ma ọlọm, kụ́ma ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ o somubịgha, ọ pịghị sọbiapụ daa sẹ́mam.
english_text: “Woe to you experts in the law, because you have taken away the key to knowledge. You yourselves have not entered, and you have hindered those who were entering.”

ibani_text: Jizọs anị angaá ma warị so sáá, ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na Farisiiapụ warị saghị bieakụ ḅara pa ọ daa pághám, warị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nyẹ pa o gbíla,
english_text: When Jesus went outside, the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to oppose him fiercely and to besiege him with questions,

ibani_text: si pa diatughu ọ pịrị si okóró, si nnị anịma pa ḅara ọlọ ḅẹẹ, mịị o dugho irima nyẹ.
english_text: waiting to catch him in something he might say.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, tọgha túminị́ ḅó kobirịarị sị pịghị jụghọ jụghọ nángáarị anịị Jizọs parị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị nyẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọ́ḅụ ẹḅịị Farisiiapụ ma fịtúrú sughumaarị mịẹnyẹ ḅụ anịị dughonyẹ kịrị mịẹnyẹ kịrị.
english_text: Meanwhile, when a crowd of many thousands had gathered, so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, saying:“Beon your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

ibani_text: Túminị́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ wárịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n findibẹm ḅọghunyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅo pághábẹm.
english_text: There is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.

ibani_text: Anị gó ị́ kánákáná ḅụ dughonyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ baá ḅụ nnị anị naábẹm. Wárịbie ị́ kálá pụghọ pá dughonyẹ mamgbá, wárị ósú ọ́gọ́nọ nnị anị pa ilúghubẹm.
english_text: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed from the roofs.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ị́yẹ́ nángwọ́apụ ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ojumẹnị ḅáapụ ma dighi ḅáláfáma, ine anị nẹ́ngị nyẹ miẹbịghaapụ anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa.
english_text: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do no more.

ibani_text: A pa o diebẹm o dighi ḅáláfa bẹḅọ: anịḅọ ma dighi ḅáláfa, ori ojumẹnị ma ḅáfáma sa ọ pịghị kụrọ nyánam sị o gbi pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama bie sua. Innh, a dugho ọ pịrịm, o dighi ḅáláfaa.
english_text: But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear him who, after your body has been killed, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him.

ibani_text: Nnị koko sọ́nọ́á ẹ́kpẹ́ngbe káláfịnị pá mmẹẹ́ pẹ́nị dẹrịarị, kụ́ma Tamuno gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ́ pá bieḅárámá ḅárámágha.
english_text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.

ibani_text: I sịbị fịnị sịbị numo sọ nnị anị kịẹ fámam. Anị gó ḅáláfama! Ọ nyẹ́la tọgha ẹ́kpẹ́ngbe káláfịnị nẹngịm.
english_text: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Don’t be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.

ibani_text: Dighi a dugho kụ́rọ́ma ọ́ pịrị, túminị́ ogbo i dugho pághámaḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹẹ ori i juu ímii, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ pịghị Tamuno sookumuapụ fịnị ngaa anị ḅoo gbólómanyẹ dughobẹm.
english_text: “I tell you, whoever publicly acknowledges me before others, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before the angels of God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma túminị́ ogbo ị sịghị ḅọ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ pịghị Tamuno sookumuapụ fịnị ngaa anị ḅoo sịghịbẹm.
english_text: But whoever disowns me before others will be disowned before the angels of God.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma fie íríma ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, nnị anị warịsó n ḅọ pịribẹm, kụ́ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma fiesima ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị sii wáriso n ḅọ pịrịbịgha.
english_text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ́ táa pá Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma muu nḅẹḅẹ́ anịgha ḅẹ́rẹ́tọapụ ma ná ámátáapụ má ógbóo, ọ́ ḅáláfáma ọ́ tọ́rọ́ pá ḅụ fọ́nyá bẹ́ anịgha ọ́ tọrọ́ pá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bẹ́,
english_text: “When you are brought before synagogues, rulers and authorities, do not worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say,

ibani_text: anịsáa ma ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọ́ dugho bẹ́ nyẹ́ pá ọ́ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ warị túminị́ ma ógbo bie Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, páisisi dugho ịnumboru owitụ́wọ pịrịị ḅẹẹ, wámịna daá wáriso wa pịrị ngọ sị fịị, ori anị ḅụ ị́yẹ́ diekiri pá i pịrịị.
english_text: Someone in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ́ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, I nángwọ, tụọ kụrọ pá i pịrị ḅẹẹ a ḅó ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ sọọ ọmịna ogbobie? Anịgha ngọ dieḅọ ọmịnị ogbobie.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Man, who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị túminị́ ma ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị ọ tọ́rụ findi! Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ ẹbị ngéré fị duma pịrị, tumḅọ duma ma n pa anị mịẹnyẹ tumḅọ nyáná ngọ mamgbagha.
english_text: Then he said to them,“Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; life does not consist in an abundance of possessions.”

ibani_text: Anịị Jizọs mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ nnị pịrịnyẹẹ: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ópu tumḅọ duakiri kiri tọgha fị́nyẹ suam.
english_text: And he told them this parable:“The ground of a certain rich man yielded an abundant harvest.

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma warị dugho ọ ḅụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Sọm a mịẹbẹ ḅárá? A yọ nyánágha a dua ḅụ ḅo nyẹ warị bẹ angaá.
english_text: He thought to himself, ‘What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.’

ibani_text: Mị́sa a nimim a mịẹbẹnyẹ ori ọkọ dugho ọ ḅụ pịrịm, A iyẹ fị́nyẹ kokowarị ma kabẹm sị dụḅa anị nẹngịnyẹ́ namabẹm anịma bie anịị a iyẹ sịmgbọlụ mamgba koko bẹnyẹ na pịghị iyẹ jẹa ngọ.
english_text: “Then he said, ‘This is what I’ll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store my surplus grain.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ịḅụ ḅẹbẹm ḅẹ́: Í mánámāná fị́nyẹ kokowarị ị́ ḅụ pịrịmam ine tọgha kụ́rá ḅụ ị́yẹ́ akịị ḅẹnyẹ anịgo ịnyọ́sárá, saghị fị́nyẹ fị, iru ḅuu sị ḅụ tii.
english_text: And I’ll say to myself, “You have plenty of grain laid up for many years. Take life easy; eat, drink and be merry.” ’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹ́ oḅoriḅọ! Mịị dii ị́yẹ́ duma kunemabẹm. Tụwọ warị ị koko ịḅụ pịrịnyẹ mamgba nyáná bẹ?
english_text: “But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?’

ibani_text: Mịị anị fịnị ngọ koko nna ḅụ pịrịarịapụ fịnị ḅara kụ́ma Tamuno toruku n ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyanagha.
english_text: “This is how it will be with whoever stores up things for themselves but is not rich toward God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọmịna duma pịrịma, ḅẹẹ a tẹ́ fị bẹ, anịgha ọmịna oju gbolomanyẹ ḅẹẹ, a tẹ́ bịtẹ sua ḅẹ́?
english_text: Then Jesus said to his disciples:“Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.

ibani_text: Duma ma nyẹ́la fị́nyẹ nẹngịm oju ma pịghị nyẹ́la bịtẹ nẹngịm.
english_text: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.

ibani_text: O fíní ḅụ nyẹ́ dáwọ́ọ: nnị duakiri nyẹ́ dipighaa, pịghị súghúghá, nnị pịghị dua ḅụ ḅọ fị́nyẹ na jẹ́ fị́nyẹ kokowarị nyánágha kụ́ma Tamuno nnị siḅearị. Ọ kpọma nyẹ́la fíní nẹngịm!
english_text: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!

ibani_text: Tụọ ine gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá sáátụọ ḅụ amịna duma nángwọ́ma bẹ, ḅụḅáláḅálá pa n ḅọ ḅụ pịrịarị angaá.
english_text: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to your life?

ibani_text: Ị́ ine mịị gbẹ́rẹ́ ịrụ nyẹ ma mịẹbịgha sáá, ị tẹ́ gó ḅụḅáláḅálá pá ị́ ḅụ pịrịarị jẹ́ nyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Since you cannot do this very little thing, why do you worry about the rest?

ibani_text: Ngóngó ma dighi, dighi anị sẹ́nịarị ḅara. N fịrịnwangịgha, n bịtẹ dorigha. Kụ́ma a dugho ọ́ pịrịarị ḅẹẹ Ámányáná Solomọn sọ́ nyáná ngọ mamgba ḅụ, ine ḅụ́birimaghaa gbẹ́rẹ́ ngóngó ma ḅụ́birima ḅara.
english_text: “Consider how the wild flowers grow. They do not labor or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ mịị ḅara ma anịị Tamuno nụ́ngọbie fịnị osuka ma birimaarị ḅara, mịmgba ọmịnị anị arịm, ḅáā ọmịnị anị pa fịnịbie gbi suam, ọ sịgha ḅẹẹ o mịma nẹ́ngịma ḅara pa o birimabẹm. Ọmịnị minini ịrụapụ.
english_text: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today, and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, how much more will he clothe you—you of little faith!

ibani_text: Mịnị sámámgba i fịị bẹnyẹ na ị ḅuu bẹnyẹ kura kọọma. Anị ḅáláḅálá pá ị́ ḅụ pịrịma.
english_text: And do not set your heart on what you will eat or drink; do not worry about it.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị Tamuno nímighaapụ ḅụ ḅá pịrịarị. Kụ́ma ọmịna Daa nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịna nyẹ ma biim.
english_text: For the pagan world runs after all such things, and your Father knows that you need them.

ibani_text: Anịị go parị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma dọghụ, anịsáa mịnanyẹ mamgba ọmịna nyẹ soobẹm.
english_text: But seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị kálá ogbo ánáná, o ḅáláfáma Daḅọ ma, anị ọ ḅụḅẹ́lẹm ḅẹẹ ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: “Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.

ibani_text: Ọmịna nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrị sị igbii ma pa igonyiapụ pịrị, ọmịnị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ olombịgha igbii sua akpa nyáná ọ ḅụ pịrị, pịghị sobie fabịgha ngọ nyáná bẹ ḅara, furuapụ anịgha ọbịọ fị́nyẹ kikia ḅobịghaa ngaa.
english_text: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will never fail, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.

ibani_text: Tegó ị́yẹ́ ngọ fịnị ngá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị ị́ kúkúbie sọ fịnị bẹ ngaa.
english_text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

ibani_text: Bịtẹ sua sị ḅụ karakáráma fịrị pịrịị sị mịẹsị ị́yẹ́ tọndọ sáá mamgba kọrị,
english_text: “Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,

ibani_text: sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ fịnị nna nyánáḅọ kuruarị ómóniapụ ọ yaa siri sọḅoarịị sáá o gbolo kirikiri n findi ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.

ibani_text: Anị ibi anị ómóniapụ ma pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ nna nyánáḅọ ḅo sáá ori nnị árịbẹm ḅẹẹ, nnị ḅụ karakáráma o kuruarị. A karakárányẹ dugho ọ́ pịrịarị nna nyánáḅọ ma ọḅụ dimabẹm, n mịẹsị nnị nyẹ́fị ịkasị ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnị si ọ fị́nyẹ pa n pịrị.
english_text: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes. Truly I tell you, he will dress himself to serve, will have them recline at the table and will come and wait on them.

ibani_text: Anị kpọma ibi omoniapụ ma pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ nna nyánáḅọ ḅọ́ sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, dii anịgha ḅáá sọ́, ori nnị árịbẹm ḅẹ́ nnị kuruarị.
english_text: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them ready, even if he comes in the middle of the night or toward daybreak.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma akanyaḅo: ḅọ́rọ́ warị nyánáḅọ nimi fúrúḅọ ma ḅo bẹ sáá ori asọ pụmabẹm sị minibịgha ori o warị fomká sị anị sọọ.
english_text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị so tẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, tegó Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma ḅobẹm ọ tọ́rụ́ pa o dighigha sáá.
english_text: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.”

ibani_text: Pita warị ọ gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mịị kaḅụ ma, i kọọ wamịnị ngéré pịrịarị múno sị ị kọọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrịarị?
english_text: Peter asked, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everyone?”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pagharam ḅẹẹ, Tụwọ mị́sa nyẹ pa nyẹ́sị pịghị nyẹ́nimi ọrụtọḅọ, amịna nyánáḅọ ómóniapụ ma pa ḅárásua bẹḅọ, sị anị karakárá sáá, ori n la diekiri fị́nyẹ pa n pịrị?
english_text: The Lord answered,“Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị ómóniḅọ ma pịrịm, amịna nyánáḅọ ḅọ láa sáá ori n ḅo arịm amịna fịrị nwángịarị.
english_text: It will be good for that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ori nyánáḅọ ori nyánányẹ mamgba pa ọ ḅarabie suabẹm.
english_text: Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma omoniḅọ ma warị dugho ọ ḅụ pị́rị́ ọkụ́ma ḅẹ, ọ nyánáḅọ álála ḅobighaa, warị sághị ọ jẹa ómóniapụ owiapụ ná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma kuu fómú, warị pịghị sághị fị́nyẹ fị pịghị iru ḅuu tọ́rụ́ḅáma,
english_text: But suppose the servant says to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time in coming,’ and he then begins to beat the other servants, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.

ibani_text: anịsáa ọ nyanaḅọ ma tọ́rụ́ dighigha éné ḅụ buapághá ḅara pá ḅobẹm, ómóniḅọ ma sọ́ nimibịghaa sa ḅụ. Anịsáa ma ḅụ nnị tụ́ma ḅárá pá omoniḅọ ma pẹ́lẹ́kọsịmabẹm sị diekiri pa ọ pịrị minighaapụ ma ogbobie.
english_text: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of. He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers.

ibani_text: Nimi ómóniḅọ fịnị fịnịị ḅẹẹ mịị ọ nyánáḅọ dọghụ nyẹẹ si o mịẹ, kụ́ma ḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị anị mịẹgha ḅoo, anịgha ori nyánáḅọ dọghụnyẹ mịẹgha nnị tọgha kụrọ ḅara pa anị ḅoo ma fomubẹm.
english_text: “The servant who knows the master’s will and does not get ready or does not do what the master wants will be beaten with many blows.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nimigha ómóniḅọ ḅẹẹ mịị ọ nyanaḅọ dọghụ nyẹẹ sị ọ mịẹ, sị pịghị fomu ḅara gbẹ́ẹnyẹ mịẹ ḅọ́ ma, nnị kálá ḅara pa ọ fomubẹm. Nnị opunyẹ pa pịrị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anịḅọ ḅara opunyẹ biibẹm; nnị pịghị mánámāná nyẹ pa pịrịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anịḅọ ḅara mánámāná nyẹ biibẹm.
english_text: But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.

ibani_text: A ḅo mịị tuminikiri fịnị tọndi dọ́ghụm; anị i bieḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm ḅọ́rọ́ anị saghị kọrịmam!
english_text: “I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!

ibani_text: A gbẹ́rẹ́ mingi sara nyánam a sara bẹnyẹ, anịgo a anịị pụ́nụ́ma ḅara pá akụ ma dabẹm sị anị ḅo ḅọ́rọ́!
english_text: But I have a baptism to undergo, and what constraint I am under until it is completed!

ibani_text: Ọ́ sii ḅẹẹ a diin pa tuminikiri ma ḅom. Ofori anị ọkọ fịnịghaa, kụ́ma puama anịị a pa ḅonyẹẹ.
english_text: Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but division.

ibani_text: Mị́sa saghị bịpịmú, sọ́nọ́apụ gbẹ́rẹ́ warị bie fịnịbẹm kụ́ma nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ bịpị fiebieghaa. Tẹ́rẹ́apụ gbẹ́rẹ́ kundu fịnịbẹm sị mmẹapụ na kamụ koro mmẹapụ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ kundu fịnịbẹm sị tẹ́rẹ́apụ na kamụ koro.
english_text: From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other, three against two and two against three.

ibani_text: Puama nnị ogboku bie fịnịbẹm, daḅọ na ori owitụ́wọ, owitụ́wọ na daḅọ, nyingiḅọ na árị ndụ́ḅa, ndụ́ḅa na nyingiḅọ, nyingiḅọ na a tụwọ taa, táaḅọ na deeḅọ nyingiḅọ ma pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ bịpị fiebieghaa.
english_text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị pịghị dugho túminị́ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ọ́ tọ́rụ́ saghị so tọ́rụ́ ma dighi sị anị suamaẹrẹ ịrụa ma tere koro koro angaá, ó nimim ḅẹẹ iti korobẹm anị warị pịghị korom.
english_text: He said to the crowd:“When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, ‘It’s going to rain,’ and it does.

ibani_text: Ọḅụ tọ́rụ́ fọ́rụ ma fie maẹrẹ ọ pịghị dughom ḅẹẹ anị ofịrịbẹm anị warị pịghị ọkọ fị́nị.
english_text: And when the south wind blows, you say, ‘It’s going to be hot,’ and it is.

ibani_text: Ọ́ mini mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ́ agidi ọmịnị ine tọ́rụ́ pa so na kiri na dighibẹm sị nimi pághá bẹnyẹ kụ́ma ọ tegó sị mị́sa págháarị nyẹ ma nimigha?
english_text: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky. How is it that you don’t know how to interpret this present time?

ibani_text: Ọ tegó ọ ḅụ na dighigha sị karakárányẹ ma nimi?
english_text: “Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?

ibani_text: Ịrị ị nana ḅẹ́rẹ́ mịẹarịḅọ na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ́wárị muarị sáá, árị ḅẹẹ, ịrị álála ọ nana ḅẹ́rẹ́fámam asọogbo, anịgha ori ị pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma dámáḅobẹm, ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma warị ị saghị ólóghó kuruḅọ ma ḅárásua, ị pa ikóliwarị ma bie gbi sua bẹḅọ.
english_text: As you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, try hard to be reconciled on the way, or your adversary may drag you off to the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

ibani_text: A dugho ị pịrịm aningáa anịị ị́ fịnị bẹnyẹ sị ị́ ọ́lọ́ sáá ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ fama.
english_text: I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, jẹa túminị́ anị ngaa ma ḅụ imi dugho Jizọs pịrịapụ, Paileti ḅáa Galiliapụ, nnị agbaa mịẹ Tamuno pịrịarị sáá.
english_text: Now there were some present at that time who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Nnị ọkọ ḅọ́rọ́ Galiliapụ ma ḅám gosi, ọ sị ḅẹẹ nna sii jẹ́ Galiliapụ nẹ́ngị?
english_text: Jesus answered,“Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered this way?

ibani_text: Anị ọkọ fịnịgha! A pịghị dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ pịghịgha pịghịgha ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ fị́ị́bẹm, nnị sọ nna sii ḅụ fị́ị́ ḅara ma.
english_text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.

ibani_text: Isi mmẹẹ́ faá sikim Siloam ḅụ fịnịapụ sóghóló ḅáa osu ma sóórókoro pụ́nụ́ma sị ḅáapụ, ọ sị ḅẹ́ mịnaapụ ma sii dụḅa Jerusalem ḅụ fịnịapụ ma sii nẹ́ngị?
english_text: Or those eighteen who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them—do you think they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem?

ibani_text: Anị ọkọfị́nị́gha. A pa dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ pịghịgha pịghịgha, ọmịnị n fị́ị́ ḅara ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fị́ị́bẹm.
english_text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi fịgị sịịmgbọlụ nyánáḅọ sẹnịarị nyẹ ori vainị duakiri ḅụ, sámamgba ọ mú sịmgbọlụ dọ́ghụm anị ọ́gọ́nọ kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ arịgha.
english_text: Then he told this parable:“A man had a fig tree growing in his vineyard, and he went to look for fruit on it but did not find any.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọrẹ dụatẹlẹmaḅọ ma ḅẹ́, ḅẹẹ, Dighi mị tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá a ḅo mị fịgị sị ma ḅụ sịịmgbọlụ dọghụmam kụ́ma a gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ arịgha. Anị pẹ́lẹ́ gbii! Anị tegósi pa kiri ma ibi fị́fámaarị?
english_text: So he said to the man who took care of the vineyard, ‘For three years now I’ve been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and haven’t found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up the soil?’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma dụatẹlẹmaḅọ ma pagharam ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ pa anị wáriso mị gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rá ma ḅụ; a anị sughu ikelekelebẹm sị fọ́rụ anị bie sọọ, sị lịka pa anị pịrị.
english_text: “ ‘Sir,’ the man replied, ‘leave it alone for one more year, and I’ll dig around it and fertilize it.

ibani_text: Anị ḅọ́rọ́ fịgị sịịmgbọlụ sua sua jẹ́ kụ́rá anịma kọkọ ibi bẹ, anị ine nyẹ suagha suagha i ine anị pẹ́lẹ́gbibẹm!
english_text: If it bears fruit next year, fine! If not, then cut it down.’ ”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Juuapụ Ịnyọsára Éné, Jizọs nyẹ́diearị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma bie,
english_text: On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,

ibani_text: gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imi sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa pị́rị́máaḅọ mị mmẹẹ́ faá sị kụ́rá ḅụ, anị mịẹmam sị árị ikoo sị ine tụ́ghụ́ sẹgha.
english_text: and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.

ibani_text: Jizọs árị arịị sáá, o warị a sị ọ ḅụ pịrị sị ḅẹẹ, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ, ị́yẹ́ ọlọ obi ị warisomam.
english_text: When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her,“Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ ḅara pa árị ọ́gọ́nọ gbánā, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị a tụ́ghụ́ sẹ nyẹ sị túminí pa Tamuno pị́rị́.
english_text: Then he put his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.

ibani_text: Kobiri yọ ma ḅụ sịbịdáḅọ saghị iganim ḅẹẹ Jizọs obi gwọm Juuapụ Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅụ ọ warị pụghọ saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ ma pị́rị́ ḅẹẹ, Suéné a dii imi wamịnị ine fịrịnwangị bẹnyẹ: anịgo, o ḅoo mịná suene dii ma ḅụ, sị nnị ọmịna obi gwọọ, kụ́ma Ịnyọsára Éné ma ḅụghaa.
english_text: Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, the synagogue leader said to the people, “There are six days for work. So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ agidi, ọmịna bie gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ amịna kọ́rọ́náma anịgha ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ nama fiima fimagha nnị anị kpọ angaá sị mú mingi pa anị pị́rị́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ?
english_text: The Lord answered him,“You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?

ibani_text: Mị́sa, mịị Ebraham furo tụwọ ẹ́kpẹ́dua mị mmẹẹ́ faá si kụ́rá ḅụ pa ịkóli bie suamaa ḅo, a tẹ́ go a pághámá ḅobịgha Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ?
english_text: Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharaa ḅara ma warị ḅụ́gịrịrị pa ori iruonaapụ tọ́rụ́ sua, túminị́ ma warị bieḅẹlẹ ọ mịẹ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: When he said this, all his opponents were humiliated, but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị gbíla, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị tẹ́ kịka? A tẹ́ pa anị na tọ́ma bẹ?
english_text: Then Jesus asked,“What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to?

ibani_text: Mịị anị fị́nị́ ḅara, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ mọstad sịmgbọlụ akịm sị mú ori duakiri bie dipi. Sịịmgbọlụ ma sẹnị pághám sị ḅo opu sị dighi, fíní warị ḅo saghị anị warị nama anị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds perched in its branches.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị sima gbilam, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma a tẹ́ pa anị na tọ́ma bẹ?
english_text: Again he asked,“What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara anịị yisti akị sị pa mánámāná filawa na gwaa gboloma ḅo, akị wárii nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅo sughu sáá láa.
english_text: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about sixty poundsof flour until it worked all through the dough.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị opu ama na káláama ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, nyẹ́diearị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ Jerusalem muarị sáá.
english_text: Then Jesus went through the towns and villages, teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị o gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, boghaapụ ngéré anịị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹapụ? Ori n pagharam,
english_text: Someone asked him, “Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?” He said to them,

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị kpápụ́ ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tegó tọghaapụ asọ dọghụ sị kpápụ́ ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́bẹm kụ́ma inebịgha.
english_text: “Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.

ibani_text: Wárị nyánáḅọ ma saghị sị ḅụ́pọ́ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ị nụ́ngọbie fịnị ḅụ́pọ́ ma gbolo sị tẹ́ghẹ̄bẹm, Ḅụ́pọ́ findi wa pịrị, Wányánáḅọ! Kụ́ma ọ paghrabẹm, A nimigha ọ saghị ḅo angaá.
english_text: Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you will stand outside knocking and pleading, ‘Sir, open the door for us.’ “But he will answer, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọmịnị ọ pagharabẹm, Wamịnị i duafịm pịghị i dua ḅụ, ị pịghị wamịna ama bie nyẹ́diem.
english_text: “Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ pagharabẹm, A o nimigha anịgha ọ saghị ḅo angaá. Ọmịnị a fị́nị́ angaá soo ọmịnị siiamịẹnyẹapụ!
english_text: “But he will reply, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from. Away from me, all you evildoers!’

ibani_text: Anị angaá owu na ákáturu kiriakịbẹm ọmịnị Ebraham, Aizik, Jekọpụ na ikiakoroapụ ma árị bẹ sáá Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅụ, kụ́ma ọmịnị n warị o gbi págháma.
english_text: “There will be weeping there, and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ịrụa saghị saghị angaá na anị tere tere angaá saghị ḅobẹm, túminị́ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara na amaḅara angaá saghị ḅobẹm sị nna kiriakị fị́ na ḅụ ma ḅụ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri.
english_text: People will come from east and west and north and south, and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, mị́sa ọḅụju kụ́nẹ́maapụ ḅo tórúku tárịapụ sọbẹm, anịsáa mị́sa tórúku ḅụ fịnịapụ ḅo ọḅụju kụ́nẹ́maapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: Indeed there are those who are last who will be first, and first who will be last.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ jẹa Farisiiapụ Jizọs damaḅom sị dugho ọ pị́rị́ ḅẹẹ, Mịnga ma wáriso si jẹ́ angaá muu, tegó, Hẹrọd i ḅá dọ́ghụm.
english_text: At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him, “Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you.”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Mú dugho pụ́nụ́ma pịrị, ḅẹẹ, Mịmgba na ḅáa éné a sitẹ́mẹ́ deesibẹm, obiapụ gwọọ, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá éné a ị́yẹ́ fịrị nwángịfámábẹm.
english_text: He replied,“Go tell that fox, ‘I will keep on driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.’

ibani_text: Anịsọ, mịmgba, ḅá na bẹ éné bẹ éné a a muarịnyẹ mubẹm, tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroḅọ sọ jẹ́ angaá fịbịghaa, Jerusalem sima.
english_text: In any case, I must press on today and tomorrow and the next day—for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem!

ibani_text: Jerusalem Jerusalem! Ọmịnị ikiakoroapụ ma ḅám, Tamuno pa ọ fịrịma oku muapụ ma ọmịnị mgbọ́lụ pa nna gbim, tọgha sáá a dọghụmam a ọmịna túminị́ taa kubiri ọbịọ amịna awọ taa kubiri biri ḅara anị pamba bie, kụ́ma ọmịnị asọ pa i pịrịgha!
english_text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịna Tamuno warị ma anị bie tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹapụ nyánábịgha. A dugho kụrọma ọ pịrịm, ọ mịnị jẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha akị mú o dugho bẹ sáá ḅẹẹ, Karịiḅi fịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́rẹ ma ḅụ ḅoarịḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné, Jizọs múm ḅẹẹ ọ nyẹ́fị gbẹ́rẹ́ opu Farisiiḅọ wárịbie, túminị́ ma warị tọ́rụ́kịsịma sị fịnị o dighiarị.
english_text: One Sabbath, when Jesus went to eat in the house of a prominent Pharisee, he was being carefully watched.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ, ḅụọ na ḅara na fịịḅọ Jizọs damaḅom.
english_text: There in front of him was a man suffering from abnormal swelling of his body.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma gbíla, Wamịnị ologho anị mini si tumḅọ kị́nị́ gwọọ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ mụ́nọ sị anị minigha?
english_text: Jesus asked the Pharisees and experts in the law,“Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị bịpị fieghaa. Jizọs warị ḅara pa owitụ́wọ ma láma, ọ gwọọ sị ọ fịrịma soo.
english_text: But they remained silent. So taking hold of the man, he healed him and sent him on his way.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ tụwọ nyánam anịgha amịna kọ́rọ́náma siḅe bie sóóró korom Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ ọmịnị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri nụ́nụ́ pághámaḅobịgha Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ?
english_text: Then he asked them,“If one of you has a childor an ox that falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not immediately pull it out?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ine mịma pagharagha.
english_text: And they had nothing to say.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo arịm igoniapụ ma ibiḅaa angaá ma sẹ́lẹ́arị ḅara opu ịkasị ọ́gọ́nọ, ọ warị mị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị:
english_text: When he noticed how the guests picked the places of honor at the table, he told them this parable:

ibani_text: Tumḅọ ị sị pa amịna ẹ́rẹ́yáa ḅo ḅo, bima ḅẹẹ ị́ ibiḅaa angaá ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnị. Anị ine ọkọpaghabẹm ḅẹẹ nnị ịnẹ́ngi opu tumḅọ sọ, sị mị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yáá ma ḅom.
english_text: “When someone invites you to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, for a person more distinguished than you may have been invited.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ị sị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa ma ḅoḅọ ma warị ị ḅẹẹ, Anị ngaa saghị ọ pịrị. Anịsáa ị ḅụ́gịrịrị pa pápáapụ fịnị angaá mú kpọrọfịnịbẹm.
english_text: If so, the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, ‘Give this person your seat.’ Then, humiliated, you will have to take the least important place.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma nnị ị sị ḅoo maẹrẹ, mú pápáapụ yọ ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnị, si ị sịḅọ ma warị ḅo i ḅẹbẹm, I nangwọ, saghị mịị ibiḅaa angaá ma ḅoo. Mịma warị kuu akuoo ị pịrịbẹm igoniapụ mamgba tórúku.
english_text: But when you are invited, take the lowest place, so that when your host comes, he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up to a better place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all the other guests.

ibani_text: Amịna ḅụ saghị iwoma ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅo siteremabẹm, amịna ḅụ siteremaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅo saghị ịwọmabẹm.
english_text: For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ wárị igoni sọ pịrịapụ ma ḅẹ́, I túminị́ sị sá ḅẹẹ n ḅoo nyẹ́fị anịgha fị na ḅuu na ḅoo, ị́yẹ́ nángwọ́apụ anịgha ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ anịgha ị́yẹ́ jẹ́ mịnaapụ anịgha i nana kikiama ngaa igbii nyánáapụ sị ma, tegó nnị sọ pịghị nna sáá ḅụ i sịịbẹm, mị ḅara ma ị nwángị fịrị gbẹ́ẹ̄ fị́nyẹ ma í anị nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: Then Jesus said to his host,“When you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or sisters, your relatives, or your rich neighbors; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị fị na ḅụ ti kóróma nḅẹḅẹ́, igonyiapụ ma sị, oju karagha nwángịapụ ma na ikúléapụ na pịghị Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ ma sịị,
english_text: But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,

ibani_text: mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ị karịibimabẹm, tegó mịnaapụ ma nnị ine sima igbẹbịgha. Tamuno sima igbẹbẹm ibiapụ ma fịị ḅụ saghị bẹ éné ma.
english_text: and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”

ibani_text: Nnị na opuịkasị ọgọnọ fịnị sị nyẹ́fịarị gbẹ́rẹ́ igoniḅọ mịma náa sáá, ọ warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Karịiḅi fịnị anị tumḅọ ma pịrị Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fị na ḅụ na ma ḅụ nyẹ́fị bẹḅọ.
english_text: When one of those at the table with him heard this, he said to Jesus, “Blessed is the one who will eat at the feast in the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi, opu fị na ḅuu ti kóróma ḅọ sị tọghaapụ sị kubiri.
english_text: Jesus replied:“A certain man was preparing a great banquet and invited many guests.

ibani_text: Fị́ na ḅụ sa ma láa sáá, ori ọrẹ ómóniapụ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ n mú dugho ori igoniapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, O ḅoo, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́mamam!
english_text: At the time of the banquet he sent his servant to tell those who had been invited, ‘Come, for everything is now ready.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị saghị ḅara pa ọlọ bẹnyẹ dọghụ. Párịḅọ ma ómóniḅọ ma ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Mị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri a kiri fẹm, ibim ḅẹ́ a mú kiri ma dighi, páisisi iganima.
english_text: “But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said, ‘I have just bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please excuse me.’

ibani_text: Jụghọ dughom ḅẹẹ, A n pa kiri sughu dụadipi oyia a kọ́rọ́náma fẹm a mú dighi dọ́ghụm n fịnị ḅara, páisisi iganima.
english_text: “Another said, ‘I have just bought five yoke of oxen, and I’m on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.’

ibani_text: Jụghọ pịghị dughom ḅẹẹ, A ịwọma ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaam anịma go ine ḅobịgha.
english_text: “Still another said, ‘I just got married, so I can’t come.’

ibani_text: Ómóniḅọ ma pịghịma ḅom sị warị mịnanyẹ mamgba dugho o nyánáḅọ pịrị. Wárị nyánáḅọ ma ḅo opuma iganim warị ori ómóniḅọ ma ḅẹẹ, Álála asọogbo na ọḅụju asọ mamgba mú ámá ma bie sị igonyiapụ na, ikirịarịapụ na, na pịghị Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ na pịghị ikúléapụ ma sị ḅoo.
english_text: “The servant came back and reported this to his master. Then the owner of the house became angry and ordered his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind and the lame.’

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ ómóniḅọ ma ḅo dughomam ḅẹẹ, I dugho ḅara a ọkọ mịẹmam. Kụ́ma mịnaapụ ma n warị ma bịghịbịegha.
english_text: “ ‘Sir,’ the servant said, ‘what you ordered has been done, but there is still room.’

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ama bie ma sọọ sị ámá asọ na pịghị ọḅụju asọ ḅụ túminị́ sị, sị wárị ma bii bẹ ḅara.
english_text: “Then the master told his servant, ‘Go out to the roads and country lanes and compel them to come in, so that my house will be full.

ibani_text: A dugho ị pịrịm ḅẹẹ a oku fịrịma sịapụ mamgba, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅẹlẹ pa a kóróma fị na ḅuu na ma lámábịgha!
english_text: I tell you, not one of those who were invited will get a taste of my banquet.’ ”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá tọgha túminị́ Jizọs duaarị sáá ọ pighim sị warị n ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and turning to them he said:

ibani_text: I damaḅo ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine ị́yẹ́ asọduaḅọ sọbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ n ḅọ i ḅẹlẹma nna nyingi na nna daa nẹ́ngịgha, na pịghị nna taa, na nna awọ, na nna mịná owiapụ, pịghị nna mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na pịghị nna ḅụgbọrụ.
english_text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters—yes, even their own life—such a person cannot be my disciple.

ibani_text: N ḅọ mgbẹsẹ sị́ saghị akị sị ine i duaghaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine ị́yẹ́ asọduaḅọ sọbịghaa.
english_text: And whoever does not carry their cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie tọarị ḅo imi ḅẹẹ, n ḅọ sóghólóḅa yọ namabim, sị parị kpọrọfịnị sị anị la bẹ igbii bịpị kịẹbịgha sị nimi n ḅo igbii ine anị nama kárámá bẹ?
english_text: “Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Won’t you first sit down and estimate the cost to see if you have enough money to complete it?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ o sughu isé fámam sị mịnị ine anị nama fámágha, anị árị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ saghị o kombobẹm ḅẹẹ,
english_text: For if you lay the foundation and are not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule you,

ibani_text: Mịị owitụ́wọ ma saghị warị namam, kụ́ma ị́ ine anị nama kárámagha.
english_text: saying, ‘This person began to build and wasn’t able to finish.’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ ámányánáḅọ ọ́mụ́ pa ọ jẹ́ a ámányánáḅọ gbi dọ́ghụm. Ọ tarị kpọrọfịnịbịgha sị ọ ḅụ dighi, ḅọ́rọ́ ori a túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ pughu na sọ́nọ́ a ndẹ́ẹ ma ine túminị́ a mmẹẹ́ pughu na oyia ndẹ́ẹ ma daa ḅẹ́?
english_text: “Or suppose a king is about to go to war against another king. Won’t he first sit down and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ inebịgha nḅẹḅẹ́, ori oku muapụ fịrịma isi ámányánáḅọ ma pịrịbẹm n ḅara warị diin kọọ bẹ ḅara isiḅọ na kikia ḅogha sáá.
english_text: If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine ị́yẹ́ asọ duabịgha n ḅọ, n ḅọ nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sịghịgha nḅẹḅẹ́.
english_text: In the same way, those of you who do not give up everything you have cannot be my disciples.

ibani_text: Fụụ ibim, kụ́ma anịị anị ḅẹlẹ ḅuma ma nḅẹḅẹ́, tumḅọ tọ́rọ pa sima anị pa fụụ mịẹ ḅẹ́?
english_text: “Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?

ibani_text: Anị ibikiri ma pịrịgha, anị pighi ibi ịlọ́lị ḅúma yọ sọ pịrịgha, ḅuma anị túminị́ anị pa ḅúmaarị nyẹ. Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa.
english_text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile; it is thrown out. “Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ósó igbii daapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ ḅom ḅẹẹ nnị ọ pughu.
english_text: Now the tax collectors and sinners were all gathering around to hear Jesus.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma warị saghị gụnụgụnụ ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma siiamịẹnyẹapụ dakórómáarị pịghị nnị na nyẹ́fịarị.
english_text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law muttered, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị:
english_text: Then Jesus told them this parable:

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ánáná sọ́nọ́ a sị nyánam, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ warị faá. Ọ tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? Ori ngịẹ fa sọ́nọ́ a si ma warịsobịgha elesiri ḅụ sị mú faá gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dọghụ sị ori anị dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá láa?
english_text: “Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it?

ibani_text: Ori anị dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá, o bieḅẹlẹbẹm sị anị dighi ori abana gbánā
english_text: And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders

ibani_text: si dighi wárị ḅo. Ọ warị ọ nana kikiama ngaapụ na ori nángwọ́apụ sị kubiri sị warị n ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ánáná faá nyẹ ma a anị dọghụ pághámaḅomam o ḅo wa bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụ.
english_text: and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.’

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, a dugho ọ pịrịm mịma nẹ́ngị bieḅẹlẹ anịị sobie fịnị bẹnyẹ, sii ḅụ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo sịbị, mịị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ma sịbị go ḅoo bẹ bieḅẹlẹ anị túminị́ ngịẹ faá sọ́nọ́ a si ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sịbị go ḅoo bẹ bieḅẹlẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm, sii ḅụ pịghị bighaapụ.
english_text: I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent.

ibani_text: Anịgha ḅọ́rọ́ oyia pị́naḅala igbii nyáná ọ́rụ́ḅọ anị ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ḅumam, a tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? A tọndọ tọndịbịgha sị tọ́rụ́ terema angaá mamgba ọ fịị si, dọghụ wárii árị faá igbii ma árị sáá láa?
english_text: “Or suppose a woman has ten silver coinsand loses one. Doesn’t she light a lamp, sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?

ibani_text: Árị anị dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá, árị árẹ nángwọ́apụ na árị na kikiama ngaapụ sịị kubiribẹm, sị warị n ḅẹẹ, A opuma bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ igbii faá nyẹ ma a anị árịmam, o ḅo i nana bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụ.
english_text: And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Rejoice with me; I have found my lost coin.’

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma a dugho ọ pịrịm, Tamuno sookumuapụ ma bieḅẹlẹm sii ḅụ pịghị sii tumḅọ sịbị ọgọnọ.
english_text: In the same way, I tell you, there is rejoicing in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, warị ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imii, mmẹẹ́ owiapụ awọ nyánáḅọ.
english_text: Jesus continued:“There was a man who had two sons.

ibani_text: Ịrụḅaḅọ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, I daa, mị́sa ị́yẹ́ ngọ ma ḅụ iyẹ diekiri pa i pịrị. Daḅọ ma warị ori ngọ die ori mmẹẹ́ awọ ma pịrị.
english_text: The younger one said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of the estate.’ So he divided his property between them.

ibani_text: Dii kẹ́lẹ́ ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ịrụḅaḅọ ma warị ọrẹ ngọ dẹrị sị igbii pa akpa bie sua sị ámá warisom, ọ warị so ḅọlọ ama bie muu, ori igbii ma pa ḅẹ́lẹ̄ bịpị fị́fámaá.
english_text: “Not long after that, the younger son got together all he had, set off for a distant country and there squandered his wealth in wild living.
