ibani_text: Ori ọnyana igbii mamgba fẹ ḅúmam. Ḅuru ḅá warị ámá ma bie koro, anịsáa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịnị o ḅara ofori.
english_text: After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.

ibani_text: Ọ warị mú fịrịnwangị ámá ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pịrị, ọ pa ori duakiri fịrịma ḅọ ḅẹẹ o muu ori oporopo didighi.
english_text: So he went and hired himself out to a citizen of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa ọ pịrị fịịgha sáá, anị ọ tárịm ḅẹẹ, ori oporopo fị́nyẹ ma fị pa o furo bima.
english_text: He longed to fill his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.

ibani_text: O ḅoo ọ ḅụ nyánáḅoo sáá, ọ warị ḅẹẹ, I daa ómóniapụ mamgba fị́fị́nyẹ nyánam, n fịị kọma sị pa ine jẹ́apụ pịrịbẹnyẹ, a warị mịnga ḅuruḅa ḅụ fịịdumaarị!
english_text: “When he came to his senses, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have food to spare, and here I am starving to death!

ibani_text: A saghị i daá dámámubẹm sị ọ ḅẹẹ a siinyẹ mịẹmam Tamuno toruku pịghị i toruku.
english_text: I will set out and go back to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

ibani_text: Anị mịnị ḅụgbẹ́gha ḅẹẹ ị́ ị tụwọ pa i sị, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ akị ị́yẹ́ ómóniapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; make me like one of your hired servants.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị saghị ọ daa dámámuu. Ọ pa asọogbo ḅọlọ ngaa ḅụ imi, daḅọ ma ori árị sáá sị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ọ pịrị, sị mangị ọ dámámuu warị ḅara pa ori abana gbánā sị ọ ḅọlọ.
english_text: So he got up and went to his father. “But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him.

ibani_text: Daa, tụwọ ma warị ḅẹẹ, A siinyẹ mịẹmam Tamuno tórúku na pịghị i tórúku anị mịnị ḅụgbẹ́gha túminị́ ị tụwọ pa i sị.
english_text: “The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma daḅọ ma ori ómóniapụ sịịm, warị nnị ḅẹẹ, O fíafía ḅa bịtẹ ma akuoo ọ sua. Ọ pịghị ḅárasuanyẹ pa ọ ḅara tụ́mgbọlụ ḅụ sua, pịghị agbaa pa ọ ḅụọ ḅụ sua.
english_text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

ibani_text: Ọ mú wa kokowarị sị ḅẹ́lẹ́kị suamaa kọ́rọ́náma ma ḅá sị wa fị na ḅụ ti kóróma sị bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụ.
english_text: Bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let’s have a feast and celebrate.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mị i tụwọ ma párị ọ fịịm, kụ́ma mị́sa o dumamam, o fam kụ́ma mị́sa nnị o dọghụ pághámaḅomam. Bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụ ti ma warị saghị.
english_text: For this son of mine was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ So they began to celebrate.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ ọ toruku sẹnịḅọ piri bie imi, ọ pịghịma ḅo sị ḅo wárị na kikia sáá, o ḅo akwa na núme na sẹ́ghị naam.
english_text: “Meanwhile, the older son was in the field. When he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ómóniḅọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́ págharị?
english_text: So he called one of the servants and asked him what was going on.

ibani_text: Ómóniḅọ ma warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Ị numboru owi pịghịma ḅomam, ị daa pịghị wa kokowarị ḅẹ́lẹ́kị suamaa kọ́rọ́náma ma ḅá ọ pịrịmam tegó ori oju kụ́rọ na duma ḅụ ḅoo lam.
english_text: ‘Your brother has come,’ he replied, ‘and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.’

ibani_text: Sẹnịḅọ ma warị opuma igani sị mini wárị sọgha; daḅọ ma warị pághá mú sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m.
english_text: “The older brother became angry and refused to go in. So his father went out and pleaded with him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ daa pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Dighi mịná tọgha kụ́rá ḅụ a fịrị nwángị ị pịrịmam ómóniḅọ ḅara, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné na a pịghị ị bịpị pa kiri sirigha. Jẹ́ éné i tẹ́ pa i pịrịma, gbẹ́rẹ́ oḅori sọ na ị pa i pịrịgha ḅẹẹ a pa ịyẹa nángwọ́apụ na bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụ!
english_text: But he answered his father, ‘Look! All these years I’ve been slaving for you and never disobeyed your orders. Yet you never gave me even a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịị ị tụwọ ma ị́yẹ́ ngọ gulugulumam sẹ́fiere ḅụ, ọ pịghịma ḅo sáá, ị pịghị wa kokowarị sị ḅẹ́lẹ́kị suamaa kọ́rọ́náma ma ḅá ọ pịrịị.
english_text: But when this son of yours who has squandered your property with prostitutes comes home, you kill the fattened calf for him!’

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma warị ọ pagharaa, I tụwọ, sámámgba ị mịnga i nana imi, a nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ị nyẹẹ.
english_text: “ ‘My son,’ the father said, ‘you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa dụrụkụ ti na ibim sị bieḅẹlẹ, tegó ị numboru owitụ́wọ ọ fịịm, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ dumamam, párị o fam kụ́ma mị́sa nnị ọ dọghụ pághámaḅomam.
english_text: But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri, gbẹ́rẹ́ ngọ nyánáḅọ imi, ori ómóniḅọ nyánam ori ngọ ma pa ọrụtọarịḅọ. N dugho ngọ nyánáḅọ ma pịrịm ḅẹ́ ọrụtọḅọ ma ori igbii gulugulumaarị.
english_text: Jesus told his disciples:“There was a rich man whose manager was accused of wasting his possessions.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ sịị sị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Mịị tẹ́ nyẹ a ịḅụ naarị nyẹ? Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ gịẹ findi, i ḅara warị ị́ ị́yẹ́ ngọ ma pa ọrụ́tọ́arị ḅara tegó, ị mịnị ị́yẹ́ ọrụtọḅọ sọbịgha.
english_text: So he called him in and asked him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you cannot be manager any longer.’

ibani_text: Ọrụtọḅọ ma warị ọ ḅụ ḅẹẹ, I nyánáḅọ ma ori i deesi dumaarị ị́yẹ́ fịrị ḅụ, mị́sa a tẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́? A ịnyọ nyanagha a pa kiri sughu bẹnyẹ, ịḅụ sọ gịrịrịarị nyẹ́bi ḅụ.
english_text: “The manager said to himself, ‘What shall I do now? My master is taking away my job. I’m not strong enough to dig, and I’m ashamed to beg—

ibani_text: Mị́sa a nimim a mịẹbẹnyẹ. Anịị ị́yẹ́ fịrị i ḅara faá sáá, a nangwọapụ nyánábẹm i dakóróma nna wárịbie suu bẹ nwángịapụ.
english_text: I know what I’ll do so that, when I lose my job here, people will welcome me into their houses.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ori nyánáḅọ ḅara sá ọ́lọ́apụ mamgba kobiri. Ọ warị parị ngaḅọ gbíla, ị́yẹ́ nyánáḅọ ḅara ị́ ndẹẹ́ a igbii ọlọ?
english_text: “So he called in each one of his master’s debtors. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ pagharaa, Pulo galọn mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ, mị ị́yẹ́ sá fịnị ḅara diri bie. Ọrụtọḅọ ma ọ ḅẹm, Kpọrọfịnị sị galọn ndẹ́ẹ gịẹ.
english_text: “ ‘Nine hundred gallonsof olive oil,’ he replied. “The manager told him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and make it four hundred and fifty.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị jụghọ gbíla, Ịrị ị́ ndẹẹ́ ọlọ? Ọ warị ọ pagharaa, Witi sịmgbọlụ buseli mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si. Ọrụtọḅọ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Sáá diri ma akị sị mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ gịẹ kóróma.
english_text: “Then he asked the second, ‘And how much do you owe?’ “ ‘A thousand bushelsof wheat,’ he replied. “He told him, ‘Take your bill and make it eight hundred.’

ibani_text: Mịma go, duma gbụ́nụ́nụ́gha ọrụtọḅọ ma nyánáḅọ warị ọ túminí ḅẹẹ ọ nwọfịnị sịbịbie nyánam; tegó mịị tuminikiribieapụ ma n sịbịbie nyáná baá bie fịnịapụ ma nẹngịm nnị nna duma kọarị ḅara.
english_text: “The master commended the dishonest manager because he had acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the people of the light.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ọ tuminikiri ngọ ma pa nángwọ mịẹ ọ ḅụ pịrị, sị mịma mịnị ófórigha sáá nnị ine o daá kóróma gbámásó fịnị yọ ḅụ kóróma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I tell you, use worldly wealth to gain friends for yourselves, so that when it is gone, you will be welcomed into eternal dwellings.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ịḅụ biegbáná nyáná nyáná kálányẹ ḅụ, n pịghị ịḅụ biegbáná nyánábẹm opunyẹ ḅụ, ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ ịḅụ biegbána nyanagha kálányẹ ḅụ n pịghị ịḅụ biegbáná nyánábịgha opunyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: “Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with much, and whoever is dishonest with very little will also be dishonest with much.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri ngọ ma ọrụtọ ḅụ nnị ịḅụ biegbáná nyanagha, tụwọ karakárá ngọ ma ọrụtọ pa ị ḅárábie sua bẹ?
english_text: So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ jụghọ ngọ ḅụ nnị ịḅụ biegbáná nyanagha, tụọ ị́yẹ́ angaá ngọ pa ị pịrịbẹ?
english_text: And if you have not been trustworthy with someone else’s property, who will give you property of your own?

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ine fịrịnwangị mmẹẹ́ kị́nị́nyánáapụ pịrịbẹ ómóniḅọ ofori. Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm sị tarịgha ḅụ ị siḅọ na fịnị, anịgha ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ osibẹm si isi angáḅọ dighisima. Ịrị ine fịrịnwangị Tamuno na igbii pịrịbịgha gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá.
english_text: “No one can serve two masters. Either you will hate the one and love the other, or you will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.”

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma mịma náa sáá, n saghị Jizọs kombom nnị igbii ḅẹ́lẹ́mam gosi.
english_text: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were sneering at Jesus.

ibani_text: O warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị anịị ọḅụ diearịnyẹ ḅẹẹ ọmịnị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ túminị́ tórúku ḅụ, kụ́ma Tamuno ọmịna kúkúbie nimim. Túminị́ pa opuma nyẹ́sị nyẹ anị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori Tamuno tórúku.
english_text: He said to them,“You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of others, but God knows your hearts. What people value highly is detestable in God’s sight.

ibani_text: Mosis ologho ma na Ikiakoroapụ ma gịẹnyẹ kiriakịm akị mú Jọn Mingi Saraḅọ sáá láa. Anịsáa ma ḅụ saghị bịpị muu ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ibi oku ma n dugho wásámaarị, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịghị amịna ḅụ suma anị bie suuarị.
english_text: “The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since that time, the good news of the kingdom of God is being preached, and everyone is forcing their way into it.

ibani_text: Anị sárásáráḅabẹm sị so ma na kiri ma ẹmẹẹfáa, tụ́ma ólóghó ma ḅụ ịrụḅa nyẹ anị kụrọ ḅuma.
english_text: It is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the least stroke of a pen to drop out of the Law.

ibani_text: Amịna táḅọ sịghịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị jẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa amadọghụm, pịghị n sịghị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma yaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ amadọghụm.
english_text: “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ngọ́nyáná owitụ́wọ imi opuma nyẹ́la áláápụ́ bịtẹ suasuaḅọ pịghị ḅẹlẹḅịpị fị́fị́ḅọ éné mamgba.
english_text: “There was a rich man who was dressed in purple and fine linen and lived in luxury every day.

ibani_text: Ori warị onu ḅụ́pọ́ kundu gbẹ́rẹ́ igonyiḅọ ḅụlọlọ fịnịm Lazarọs pa sịḅọ ịnọ nyánáḅọ ori oju gbọrụ ḅụ
english_text: At his gate was laid a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores

ibani_text: o biarị ḅẹẹ ori áláḅọ ma opuịkasị ḅụ sóórókoro nyẹ ma tụ́tụ́rụ fị. Obiri pịghị ḅo ḅom sị ori ịnọ ma táḅa.
english_text: and longing to eat what fell from the rich man’s table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo láa sáá igonyiḅọ ma fịịm sookumuapụ ma warị ọ dighi pa Ebraham angásá kóróma. Áláḅọ ma sọ fịịm n warị o dipi.
english_text: “The time came when the beggar died and the angels carried him to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.

ibani_text: Duaama, ọ ḅụakụ ḅụ fịnị angaá, ọ tọ́rụ́ saghịm sị ḅọlọanga ḅụ Ebraham árị, na pịghị Lazarọs ori angásá.
english_text: In Hades, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus by his side.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ilúghú ọ sịị, Daa Ebraham, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrị sị Lazarọs fịrịma sị ọ ḅara pa mingi gbọ i ḅẹlẹ lama, tegó a ḅụakụ ḅụ imi mịị a fịnị fị́nị́ ma bie.
english_text: So he called to him, ‘Father Abraham, have pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Ebraham pagharam, I tụwọ biekóróma ḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ duma sáá ịrị ibinyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyánaḅom, Lazarọs warị siinyẹ nyánáḅọ, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ ḅụ diin nyánámam ịrị warị ḅụakụ ḅụ sọ.
english_text: “But Abraham replied, ‘Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, while Lazarus received bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in agony.

ibani_text: Mịmámgba pa ngapịrị, wamịnị ogboku bie opu póghóló kiri imi, anịgosi mịnga saghị anị ngá ḅo biapụ inegha, aningáa saghị mịnga ḅo dọghụapụ sọ inegha.
english_text: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been set in place, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.’

ibani_text: Áláḅọ ma warị ḅẹẹ, Daa Ebraham, a ị tẹ́ghẹm, Lazarọs fịrịma i daa warị mú,
english_text: “He answered, ‘Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my family,

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ a sọ́nọ́a mịna owiapụ nyánam. Ori n birinụ́nụ́, sị nnị mị tọ́rụ́siarị angaá ma ḅobịgha ḅara.
english_text: for I have five brothers. Let him warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.’

ibani_text: Ebraham pagharam, Mosis ologho na ikiakoroapụ ma dienyẹ nnị na imi, nnị anị pughu.
english_text: “Abraham replied, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets; let them listen to them.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Ọkọgha daa Ebraham, ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ fịị ḅụ saghị n dámámuu n sii ḅụ pighibẹm.
english_text: “ ‘No, father Abraham,’ he said, ‘but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’

ibani_text: Ebraham warị ọ pagharaa, Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ Mosis ologho na ikiakoroapụ ma puughugha n mininibịgha ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ fịị ḅụ saghị n dámámuu.
english_text: “He said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ mịẹsị sii ḅụ bịghịkoro mịẹmịẹ nyánam, kụ́ma anị siḅáá anị ḅara sághị ḅo bẹḅọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus said to his disciples:“Things that cause people to stumble are bound to come, but woe to anyone through whom they come.

ibani_text: Anị ibiḅaabẹm ḅẹ nnị opu nyẹ́gbẹ́ dapịrị pa ọ kọ́ngọ kpọ sị ọ pa tọ́rụ́bie gbi su, tụ́ma ọ mịẹsị mị káláapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ siinyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: It would be better for them to be thrown into the sea with a millstone tied around their neck than to cause one of these little ones to stumble.

ibani_text: Anịgo tọ́rụ́ diinma i mịẹarịnyẹ mịẹ! Ḅọ́rọ́ i numboru owitụ́wọ siinyẹ mịẹmịẹ, igani ọ pịrị, o sii ma ḅụ pịghị pịghị, sii wáriso ọ pịrị.
english_text: So watch yourselves. “If your brother or sistersins against you, rebuke them; and if they repent, forgive them.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ éné bie sọ́nọ́ma sa pa siinyẹ pa ị mịẹmịẹ, ọ pịghị mị siiamịẹnyẹ ma miẹsa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori ị dámáḅoarị sị ḅẹẹ, A sii ḅụ pịghịmam, ị siiḅụḅárási ọ pịrị nyánam.
english_text: Even if they sin against you seven times in a day and seven times come back to you saying ‘I repent,’ you must forgive them.”

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma dugho Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Mịẹsị wámịna minini gborogboroḅáa!
english_text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pagharam ḅẹẹ, Ị ḅọ́rọ́ minini nyáná ịrụ mọstad sịmgbọ́lụ na gbasịnyẹ, ị ine dugho mulberi sịị ma pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ kune ḅụ wọrọ so, sị muu ịḅụ dipi tọ́rụ́bie, anị pịghị ị dugho ḅara mịẹbẹm.
english_text: He replied,“If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it will obey you.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ómóniḅọ nyánam duakiri sughupịghị ọ pịrịarịḅọ, anịgha ánáná didighi ọ pịrịarịḅọ. O dua ḅụ saghị ḅo ḅo, warị ọ ḅẹẹ, I ḅoma, ị́yẹ́ fị́nyẹ opuịkasị ọgọ́nọ́ imi. Sọḅo kpọrọfịnị sị ị́yẹ́ fị́nyẹ fịị.
english_text: “Suppose one of you has a servant plowing or looking after the sheep. Will he say to the servant when he comes in from the field, ‘Come along now and sit down to eat’?

ibani_text: Anị ọkọ fịnịgha! Tụ́ma ịrị ọ ḅẹẹbẹm, álála ị́yẹ́ ḅupiri fị́nyẹ mịẹ warị, si muu ịḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị ḅo i didighi a nyẹ́fị, ị mịma mịẹ fama sa ị ine mú ị́yẹ́ anganyẹ fịbẹm sị pịghị ị́yẹ́ angaá nyẹ ḅụ?
english_text: Won’t he rather say, ‘Prepare my supper, get yourself ready and wait on me while I eat and drink; after that you may eat and drink’?

ibani_text: Ómóniḅọ ma nnị ịmịẹḅam pa ọ ḅẹ na ibi ḅẹẹ ori n tọ́ọ ọ pịrị fịrị nwángịm gosi, anị ọkọ fịnịgha?
english_text: Will he thank the servant because he did what he was told to do?

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị anị fịnị ọ pịrị ḅara ị n dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ ma mịẹ so sáá, ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị papa ómóniapụ wamịnị wámịna fịrị nwángịmam.
english_text: So you also, when you have done everything you were told to do, should say, ‘We are unworthy servants; we have only done our duty.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọrẹ asọ dọghụ Jerusalem muarị sa, Sameriya na Galili ónú ilíghíma angaá ḅọ́rọ́m.
english_text: Now on his way to Jerusalem, Jesus traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

ibani_text: Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ káláama soarị sa oyi owiapụ ma, ḅụkọ-obii kọọarịapụ ọ nana donam, n warị ḅọlọ angaá ḅụ sẹ́ sị
english_text: As he was going into a village, ten men who had leprosymet him. They stood at a distance

ibani_text: ilúghú, Jizọs Wányánáḅọ! Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná wa pịrị!
english_text: and called out in a loud voice, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us!”

ibani_text: Jizọs nna arịm, warị n ḅẹẹ, O muu sị ọmịna ḅụ pa igwagwaapụ ma die. Nnị muarị sa asọogbo, anịị nna ḅụ ḅo gwọnyẹ.
english_text: When he saw them, he said,“Go, show yourselves to the priests.”And as they went, they were cleansed.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ árị sa ḅẹẹ, ọ gwọmam, ọ pịghịma ḅom, ilúghú pụghọ pa Tamuno bomaarị.
english_text: One of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ ḅụ dighi kiri gbi Jizọs ḅụọ angaá sị ịmịẹḅam pa ọ ḅẹẹ, owitụ́wọ ma ori Sameriyaḅọ.
english_text: He threw himself at Jesus’ feet and thanked him—and he was a Samaritan.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Oyiapugha gwọapụ isi ésénieapụ n tẹ́ angaá imi?
english_text: Jesus asked,“Were not all ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?

ibani_text: Tegó sị mị igoniḅọ ma ngéré anịị pịghịma ḅo sị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno pịrịḅọ.
english_text: Has no one returned to give praise to God except this foreigner?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Saghị sị soo, ị́yẹ́ minini mịẹmam sị ị́yẹ́ oju kụ́rọ.
english_text: Then he said to him,“Rise and go; your faith has made you well.”

ibani_text: Jẹa Farisiiapụ Jizọs gbilam, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅoo bẹ sa. Ọ warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅo ḅogha túminị́ anị árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Once, on being asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, Jesus replied,“The coming of the kingdom of God is not something that can be observed,

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dughobịgha ḅẹẹ, Dighi mị anị, anịgha ḅẹẹ, Anị aningáa imi, tegó Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ị ḅụbie imi.
english_text: nor will people say, ‘Here it is,’ or ‘There it is,’ because the kingdom of God is in your midst.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọ warị ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Sáá ḅoobẹm o dọghụ bẹ sa ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ine Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ éné árị, kụ́ma ọ mịnị anị arịbịgha.
english_text: Then he said to his disciples,“The time is coming when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ḅẹẹbẹm, Anị angaá ori imii, anịgha Mịị angaá ori imii. Kụ́ma pághá muu ma ḅẹẹ, ị nnị dọghụarị.
english_text: People will tell you, ‘There he is!’ or ‘Here he is!’ Do not go running off after them.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ḅoo bẹ éné fịnị bẹ ḅara, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ sofịnị kọrị bẹnyẹ si baá pa so tọ́rụ́ ma pịrị, gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá akị mú isi angaá láa.
english_text: For the Son of Man in his daywill be like the lightning, which flashes and lights up the sky from one end to the other.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma parị ori opuma tọ́rụ́siarị árịbẹm, mịị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma pịghị ọ sịghịbẹm.
english_text: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara Nuwa sáá, anịị anị pịghị fịnị bẹ ḅara Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: “Just as it was in the days of Noah, so also will it be in the days of the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba fịịarị, pịghị ḅuuarị, ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na owiapụ na yaarị akị muu Nuwa árụ́ ma ḅụlọ éné láa. Opu mingi ma warị ḅo nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅa fama.
english_text: People were eating, drinking, marrying and being given in marriage up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.

ibani_text: Lọti sa anị fịnị ḅara anịị anị pịghị fịnị bẹ ḅara. Kị́nị́mamgba fịarị pịghị ḅuuarị, nyẹ́fẹarị pịghị nyẹ dẹrịarị, nyẹ dipiarị pịghị warị námáarị.
english_text: “It was the same in the days of Lot. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.

ibani_text: Lọti Sodom wáriso éné fịnị na ọpọli ḅuruma kóróḅom sị, nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅa faá ma.
english_text: But the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.

ibani_text: Anịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara n Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ pa diepágháma bẹ éné.
english_text: “It will be just like this on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

ibani_text: Anị éné warị osu ḅụ fịnịḅọ kóró warị ma sọḅo ma sị muu n ḅọ nyánányẹ akị, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma duakiri fịnịḅọ pịghịma warị ḅo ma.
english_text: On that day no one who is on the housetop, with possessions inside, should go down to get them. Likewise, no one in the field should go back for anything.

ibani_text: Lọti taa pa biekóróma!
english_text: Remember Lot’s wife!

ibani_text: Ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma amịna duma ḅọrọma bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ḅumabẹm amịna duma ḅuma bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Whoever tries to keep their life will lose it, and whoever loses their life will preserve it.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm, anị dii mmẹapụ mụ́nọbẹm gbẹ́rẹ́ múnonyẹ ọgọ́nọ́, n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sị ákịbẹm sị isi angáḅọ wáriso.
english_text: I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ nyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄ gbólomaarị, n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịakịbẹm, nnị isi angáḅọ wárịsóbẹm. [
english_text: Two women will be grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left.”

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ owiapụ fịrịnwangị angaá gbẹ́rẹ́ duakiri, n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ákịbẹm sị isiḅọ wáriso.]
english_text: Two men will be working in the field; one will be taken, and the other will be left.

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ma warị ọ gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tẹ́ angaá? Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Fịị dua fịnị angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ẹ́dẹlẹ aningáa kobirịbẹm.
english_text: “Where, Lord?” they asked. He replied,“Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.”

ibani_text: Anịsa Jizọs warị gbẹ́rẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ sámámgba n tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị minima sị ịnyọ nna ḅụ faá.
english_text: Then Jesus told his disciples a parable to show them that they should always pray and not give up.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ama bie gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ imi ọ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfagha anịgha kị́nị́ osii.
english_text: He said:“In a certain town there was a judge who neither feared God nor cared what people thought.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ sọ ama ma bie imi arị karakárá ḅụ sẹ sị ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịarịḅọ biiarị ḅọ ḅẹẹ, Ọ karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ a pịrị, arị iruonaḅọ gosi.
english_text: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, ‘Grant me justice against my adversary.’

ibani_text: Ḅọlọ sáá ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma, ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha. Kụ́ma kunema ọ ḅoo ọ ḅụ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ a Tamuno dighi ḅáláfagha anịgha kị́nị́ osii.
english_text: “For some time he refused. But finally he said to himself, ‘Even though I don’t fear God or care what people think,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pa i pịrịarị ḅụḅáláḅálá gosi, a árịbẹm ḅẹẹ árị karakárá a ḅara lam a ọkọ mịẹgha mịẹgha árị iḅụḅáláḅáláma wárii árị ịḅụ ịnyọ fámá sa lábẹm!
english_text: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will see that she gets justice, so that she won’t eventually come and attack me!’ ”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Ọ pughu mịị sị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma dughonyẹ.
english_text: And the Lord said,“Listen to what the unjust judge says.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mịma, Tamuno ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ibima oria túminị́ pịrịbịgha, owu ọ pịrịarịapụ dii na ḅá na, ḅẹ́ ọ ḅárásua n pịrị? Ọ sáá ngúmá bẹ ḅárásua n pịrị ḅụ?
english_text: And will not God bring about justice for his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he keep putting them off?

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm, Tamuno ori n ḅara ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ibimabẹm pịghị álála ḅara, kụ́ma Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma o ḅoo bẹ sa, o minini nyánáapụ árị bẹ tuminikiri?
english_text: I tell you, he will see that they get justice, and quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ nna ḅárákū ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánáapụ pịrịm, warị isiapụ mamgba dighi álịmagha.
english_text: To some who were confident of their own righteousness and looked down on everyone else, Jesus told this parable:

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá mmẹẹ́ owiapụ imi Tamunoopuwárị muu nwángịapụ sị n mú tẹ́ghẹ̄, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Farisiiḅọ, isiḅọ kọnsịn ósó igbii daa ḅo.
english_text: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.

ibani_text: Farisiiḅọ ma warị fofoo sẹ sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Tamuno a ịmịẹḅam pa ị ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, a isiapụ fịnị ḅara fịnịgha a ẹrẹma pa kị́nị́ ḅara nyẹ́ daákịgha, irị oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịḅọgha, anịgha amadọghụḅọ, kị́nị́mamgba mịẹarị ḅara ma. A imiẹḅa pa i ḅẹm ḅẹẹ a mịị kọnsịn ósó igbii daaḅọ ma fịnị ḅara fịnịgha.
english_text: The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.

ibani_text: A ḅurukumáarị mmẹẹ́ sa wiki bie, ị́yẹ́ igbii mamgba a pa oyia ngá die gbẹ́rẹ́ ngá pa ị pịrịm.
english_text: I fast twice a week and give a tenth of all I get.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kọnsịn ósó igbii biiḅọ ma ḅọlọanga ḅụ sẹm sị ine ọ tọ́rụ́ saghị sodagha, kụ́ma ḅara pa o kúkúbie gbolo sị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Tamuno, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrị, ịrị sii tumḅọ!
english_text: “But the tax collector stood at a distance. He would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, ‘God, have mercy on me, a sinner.’

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm Farisiiḅọ maagha, kụ́ma kọnsịn ósó igbii daa ḅọ ma, tẹ́mẹ́ Tamuno ḅụ karakáram o so ọ warị muu sáá. Ḅẹ́ nna ḅụ sághị sóghólómáapụ nnị n siteremabẹm, kụ́ma nna ḅụ siteremáapụ nnị n sághị sóghólómabẹm.
english_text: “I tell you that this man, rather than the other, went home justified before God. For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.”

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ nna dọghụdọghụ awọ pa Jizọs damaḅom ḅẹ́ ọ ḅara pa n sịbị gbánā. Ori ọḅụduaapụ nna arịm sị igani n pịrị anị sịbị go.
english_text: People were also bringing babies to Jesus for him to place his hands on them. When the disciples saw this, they rebuked them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs awọ ma sị ọ ḅụ pịrịm warị ḅẹẹ, Awọmáapụ ma wáriso sị nnị i damaḅoo n kikima, tegó Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma fịnị nnị fịnị ḅara fịnịapụ pịrịm.
english_text: But Jesus called the children to him and said,“Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, káláawọ ḅara pa Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ákịghaḅọ ine anị bie sọbịgha.
english_text: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Juu sịbịdáḅọ Jizọs gbilam, Ibi Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a tẹ́ mịẹsị gbámásó duma nyáná bẹ?
english_text: A certain ruler asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ gbíla, I tegó ibi tumḅọ pa i sịarị? Ibiḅọ ofori, Tamuno sighima.
english_text: “Why do you call me good?”Jesus answered.“No one is good—except God alone.

ibani_text: Ị kọkọ ólóghó ma nimi: dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Amadọghụma, kị́nị́ ḅáma, fúrúma, kị́nị́ bịpị pụ́nụ́mamá, i nyingi na ị daa osii.
english_text: You know the commandments: ‘You shall not commit adultery, you shall not murder, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ, A saghị ịrụ sa énéné amịna ologho ma kokomam.
english_text: “All these I have kept since I was a boy,” he said.

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma náa sáá, ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ kọm i mịẹna ibinyẹ, ị́yẹ́ nyánányẹ mamgba dẹrị sị pa igonyiapụ pịrị, i mịma miẹsa anịsáa, í ngọ nyánábẹm sobie, anịsáa ḅoo sị ị dua.
english_text: When Jesus heard this, he said to him,“You still lack one thing. Sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ma mịma náa sáá, anị ḅoo opuma ọ tẹ́mẹ́ simam tegó, ori opuma ngọ nyánam.
english_text: When he heard this, he became very sad, because he was very wealthy.

ibani_text: Jizọs arịm ḅẹ́ ọ tẹ́mẹ́ simam, warị ḅẹ́, Dighi Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma asọ ma ḅụ́da ngọ nyánáapụ pịrị ḅara.
english_text: Jesus looked at him and said,“How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!

ibani_text: Anị sárásáráḅa kameli pa sị nama pịrịm ḅẹẹ anị alaga tọ́rụ́ ḅụ túlúḅọrọ, tụ́ma ngọ nyánáḅọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma sọ nakaragha.
english_text: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Ọ naapụ ma warị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Anịsáa tụọ, ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ?
english_text: Those who heard this asked, “Who then can be saved?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Opuma ḅụdányẹ túminị́ ḅụ, Tamuno ḅụ anị sárásárám.
english_text: Jesus replied,“What is impossible with man is possible with God.”

ibani_text: Pita warị ḅẹẹ, Dighi! Wa wámịna warị warịsom si ị dua.
english_text: Peter said to him, “We have left all we had to follow you!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́máarị ḅẹẹ, amịna warị anịgha amịna táaḅọ anịgha amịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ anịgha nyingiapụ na daapụ anịgha awọ, wárịso ḅọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma gosi,
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”Jesus said to them,“no one who has left home or wife or brothers or sisters or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ mịị tuminikiri ḅụ nnị anịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ nyánábẹm, sị pịghị ḅoarị sáá ma ḅụ duma gbámásó.
english_text: will fail to receive many times as much in this age, and in the age to come eternal life.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori oyi mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma pa ngá ḅọ́rọ́, warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́, O pughu! Wa Jerusalem muarị wamịnị anị ngá la sa, ikiakoroapụ ma Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma gboloma sị n gịẹnyẹ mamgba ḅo kiriakịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus took the Twelve aside and told them,“We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.

ibani_text: Nnị o sághị Juughaapụ ma ḅarabie suabẹm, ọ kpọti bẹapụ, núme pa o wiri sị pịghị fị́lā pa ọ sara.
english_text: He will be delivered over to the Gentiles. They will mock him, insult him and spit on him;

ibani_text: Nnị fom nyẹ pa o fombẹm n pịghị ọ ḅabẹm kụ́ma tẹ́rẹ́ a dii éné ọ pịghị saghịbẹm fịị ḅụ.
english_text: they will flog him and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọḅụduaapụ ma mịnanyẹ mamgba ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ akanyaḅogha, mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma dughoarị nyẹ ma n pa nna ḅọghumam, anịgo n nimigha Jizọs dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: The disciples did not understand any of this. Its meaning was hidden from them, and they did not know what he was talking about.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo Jeriko na kikia sáá gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́pụ owitụ́wọ imi asọogbo ma ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ sị nyẹ́biiarị.
english_text: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.

ibani_text: O kubiri ogbo ma náa sị n ḅọ́rọ́arị sáá, ọ warị gbíla, ḅẹ́, mịị tẹ́ nyẹ mọ?
english_text: When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.

ibani_text: Nnị warị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹ́, Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ sághị ḅoḅọ ḅọ́rọ́arị.
english_text: They told him, “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pụghọ saghị owu, ḅẹ́, Jizọs Deviti tụwọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrị.
english_text: He called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”

ibani_text: Toruku fịnịapụ ma warị igani ọ pịrị ḅẹ́ ọ bịpịgbe, kụ́ma anịsáa anịị ọ pụghọ saghị opuma ilúghú nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Deviti tụwọ! Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrị!
english_text: Those who led the way rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

ibani_text: Jizọs sẹ́fịnịm warị fịrịma ḅẹẹ nnị tọ́rụ́pụḅọ ma akuoo ọ fịnị angaá, o ḅo kikia sáá, Jizọs warị ọ gbíla
english_text: Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ, I dọghụ ḅẹ́ a tẹ́ nyẹ mịẹ ị pịrịị? Ọ warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ, a dọ́ghụm i tọ́rụ́ nyẹ arịị.
english_text: “What do you want me to do for you?” “Lord, I want to see,” he replied.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị tọ́rụ́ nyẹ arịị! Ị́yẹ́ minini ị gwọ́mám.
english_text: Jesus said to him,“Receive your sight; your faith has healed you.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, ori ine nyẹ arịm warị saghị Jizọs dua, sị saghị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ. Túminị́ ogbo ma árị sáá, nnị kị́nị́mamgba Tamuno túmininim.
english_text: Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they also praised God.

ibani_text: Jizọs nwángị Jeriko sọm, sị anị bie nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị.
english_text: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.

ibani_text: Anị angaá gbẹ́rẹ́ kọnsịn ósó igbii daarịapụ sịbịdáḅọ imi ori ẹ́rẹ anịị Zakịosị ori opuma ngọ nyánam.
english_text: A man was there by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector and was wealthy.

ibani_text: Ọ warị asọ dọghụ sị ọ Jizọs pa sịḅọ árị bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma ori opuma gbuluḅọ gosi, ori ine Jizọs arịgha túminị́ kpo ma gosi.
english_text: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but because he was short he could not see over the crowd.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ warị mangị tórúku muu túminị́ kpo ma ḅụ, warị muu gbẹ́rẹ́ sikamo sị tándị ọ Jizọs árị bẹ ḅara, anị párángáa ḅoarị ḅo.
english_text: So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore-fig tree to see him, since Jesus was coming that way.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo anị angaá láa sáá, o tọ́rụ́ saghịm warị Zakịosị ḅẹẹ, Álála mịẹsị kóróḅo, Zakịosị, tegó mịmgba ị wárịbie a ị́yẹ́ igoniḅọ sọbẹm.
english_text: When Jesus reached the spot, he looked up and said to him,“Zacchaeus, come down immediately. I must stay at your house today.”

ibani_text: Zakịosị warị álála kóróḅo, sị opu bieḅẹlẹ pa ọ dakóróma ọ warịị.
english_text: So he came down at once and welcomed him gladly.

ibani_text: Nyẹ ma árịapụ mamgba warị saghị gunugunu ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ori igoni mumam siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo warị!
english_text: All the people saw this and began to mutter, “He has gone to be the guest of a sinner.”

ibani_text: Zakịosị warị saghị sẹ, sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ pughu a ị́yẹ́ nyánányẹ ma ḅụ a mpara pa igonyiapụ pịrịbẹm a ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị kị́nị́ pụ́nụ́mámám nḅẹḅẹ́, a anị ḅụ ínia angaá gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: But Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord! Here and now I give half of my possessions to the poor, and if I have cheated anybody out of anything, I will pay back four times the amount.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị, ọ ḅẹẹ, Mịmgba dụaḅọ́rọ́ma mị warị sóḅomam, ḅẹẹ mị owitụ́wọ ma ori sọ Ebraham furotụ́wọ.
english_text: Jesus said to him,“Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma, o ḅom ḅẹẹ, o ḅo faapụ ma dọghụ pághámaḅo sị n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma mịma pughuarị sáá, Jizọs warị saghị gbẹ́rẹ́ kaḅụ kọọ n pịrị. Mị́sa ma ḅụ ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá Jerusalem na kikiamam, túminị́ ma pịghị sịm ḅẹẹ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị ḅụ diepághámabẹm anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: While they were listening to this, he went on to tell them a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and the people thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear at once.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri gbẹ́rẹ́ opu kiri ḅụ fịnị owitụ́wọ imii, ḅọlọ ama muarịḅọ ḅẹẹ, nnị ámányánáḅọ pa ọ mịẹ, mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá ọ pịghịma ḅobẹm.
english_text: He said:“A man of noble birth went to a distant country to have himself appointed king and then to return.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, na omugha sáá, ori ọrẹ oyia ómóniapụ sị kubirim warị gbẹ́rẹ́ odoḅala igbii pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrị, warị n ḅẹẹ, O dighi ọmịnị anị pa ine miẹpágháma ḅo ḅẹnyẹ a ófórigha sáá.
english_text: So he called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas.‘Put this money to work,’ he said, ‘until I come back.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori amaapụ o tarịgha, warị oku muapụ fịrịma ḅẹẹ, Wa bigha mị owitụ́wọ wámịna ámányánáḅọ sọọ.
english_text: “But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him to say, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ma nnị ámányánáḅọ pa ọ mịẹm, ọ warị anịsa pịghịma ḅoo. Anị kirikiri, ọ warị n sị kubiri sị o nimi bẹ ḅara ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ nyánáḅomáa sọnyẹ.
english_text: “He was made king, however, and returned home. Then he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money, in order to find out what they had gained with it.

ibani_text: Párịḅọ ma ḅom, warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ ị pa ị pịrị igbii a pa oyia odoḅala igbii sọnyẹ miẹpágháma ḅomam!
english_text: “The first one came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has earned ten more.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị owitụ́wọ, ịrị ibi ómóniḅọ! Ị kálá fịrịnyẹ pa nyẹ́sị sáá, a ị pa oyia ama ḅụ sịbịdabẹm.
english_text: “ ‘Well done, my good servant!’ his master replied. ‘Because you have been trustworthy in a very small matter, take charge of ten cities.’

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá ómóniḅọ ḅom, sị warị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ, ị pa i pịrị igbii ma a pa sọ́nọ́ odoḅala igbii sọnyẹ mịẹmam!
english_text: “The second came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has earned five more.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị mịị ḅọ ma ḅẹẹ, Ịrị sọ́nọ́ ama ḅụ sịbịdabẹm.
english_text: “His master answered, ‘You take charge of five cities.’

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ómóniḅọ warị ḅoo, sị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ mịị ị́yẹ́ odoḅala igbii; a anị pa ákịsị sịbị kpọ wárịm.
english_text: “Then another servant came and said, ‘Sir, here is your mina; I have kept it laid away in a piece of cloth.

ibani_text: A ị dighi ḅáláfam, tegó ịrị kọ́kọ́ ḅụ́da tumḅọ. I nyẹ suagha angaá anịị ị nyẹ akịkị angaá ị pịghị nyẹ dipigha angaá ḅụ sughu sughum.
english_text: I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You take out what you did not put in and reap what you did not sow.’

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị silálá si ómóniḅọ! Ị bịpị kóró ẹ́gẹ́rẹ anị a pa ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ị sịbị sẹ ḅẹnyẹ! Ị kọ́kọ́ nimi ḅẹẹ, irị ḅụ́da tumḅọ, pịghị a nyẹ́suaghaa angaá nyẹakịkịḅọ, pịghị a dipigha angaá nyẹ sughuarịḅọ.
english_text: “His master replied, ‘I will judge you by your own words, you wicked servant! You knew, did you, that I am a hard man, taking out what I did not put in, and reaping what I did not sow?

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ị tegó ị́yẹ́ igbii pa igbii koko angaá ḅụ sua warịgha? Sị n nyẹ pa igbii sịbị ma ḅụ sua bẹ ḅara a sọḅo bẹ sáá!
english_text: Why then didn’t you put my money on deposit, so that when I came back, I could have collected it with interest?’

ibani_text: Ọ warị anị angaá ḅụ sẹ́fịnịapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅara odoḅala igbii ma daakị sị pa oyia odoḅala igbii mịẹḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: “Then he said to those standing by, ‘Take his mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ kọkọ oyia odoḅala igbii nyáná!
english_text: “ ‘Sir,’ they said, ‘he already has ten!’

ibani_text: Ọ warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ nyánáapụ n pịghị jẹ́ jẹ́nyẹ pa n pịrịbẹm. Kụ́ma nyẹ nyánágháapụ, n nyáná kálányẹ ma n pịghị nna ḅarabie anị daákịbẹm.
english_text: “He replied, ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but as for the one who has nothing, even what they have will be taken away.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mị́sa, ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ ma, minighaapụ ma ḅẹẹ a nna ámányánáḅọ soo, nna akuoo mịnga ḅo, si n ḅáa i tórúku!
english_text: But those enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them—bring them here and kill them in front of me.’ ”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dugho fama sáá, ọ warị toruku daa n pịrị Jerusalem muu asọ ma ḅụ.
english_text: After Jesus had said this, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: O ḅo Bẹtịfegi na Bẹtani na kikia sáá Olivu Tụ́ndụ́ ma ọ́gọ́nọ, ori mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ fịrịma toruku múm.
english_text: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany at the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, saying to them,

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ọ pa n pịrị bịpị: Ọmịnị ọmịna toruku fịnị kálá ámá ma muu ọmịnị ámá ma somaẹrẹ, ọmịnị ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ nama tụ́wọ árịbẹm, nnị kpọ warị nyẹ, tumḅọ sọ jẹ́ éné na tándigha nyẹ. Anị fiima sị anị akuoo mịnga.
english_text: “Go to the village ahead of you, and as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́ ọ gbíla gbíla ḅẹẹ ọ tegó anị fiimaarị, o dugho n ḅo pịrị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma anị bim.
english_text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”

ibani_text: Nnị muu sáá, nnị arịḅom ḅẹ́ Jizọs dugho n pịrị ḅara anịị anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Those who were sent ahead went and found it just as he had told them.

ibani_text: Nnị ikúnyẹ dighiarị ásụ nama tụ́wọ ma fiimaarị sáá, anị nyánáapụ nnị gbilam ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegó anị fimaarị?
english_text: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma anị biim.
english_text: They replied, “The Lord needs it.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ nama tụwọ ma akuoo Jizọs pịrị. Nnị warị ọgọ́nọ́ n sua opu bịtẹ pa nama ma oju isé, warị Jizọs pa anị ọ́gọ́nọ gbánā.
english_text: They brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt and put Jesus on it.

ibani_text: Nama ma o dighi nwángịarị sáá, túminị́ nna oju gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ sí, sị pa asọ ma ḅụ isé ọ pịrịm.
english_text: As he went along, people spread their cloaks on the road.

ibani_text: O ḅo Jerusalem na kikia sáá, asọ ma téré koro olivu tụ́ndụ́ ma daa angaá ma ḅụ, ori ọḅụdua tọgha túminị́ ma saghị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹm, sị pịghị pụghọ saghị Tamuno túminí nnị árị sị o mịẹ maá opu fịrị mamgba:
english_text: When he came near the place where the road goes down the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began joyfully to praise God in loud voices for all the miracles they had seen:

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị Ámányánáḅọ ma pịrị Gbámásóḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ ḅụ ḅoarịḅọ! Boma fịnị Tamuno pịrị sobie sóghólóḅa angaá!
english_text: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, túminị́ ogbo ma bie fịnị jẹ́ Farisiiapụ warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ Jizọs pịrị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, dugho ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị yaghufịnị!
english_text: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm, ḅẹẹ, n ḅọ́rọ́ yaghúu fịnịfịnị, dapịrị ma ḅụgbọrụ saghị ilúghubẹm.
english_text: “I tell you,”he replied,“if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out.”

ibani_text: Ọ kikia Jerusalem láa sáá, sị ámá ma árị, ori owu anị pịrịm,
english_text: As he approached Jerusalem and saw the city, he wept over it

ibani_text: Ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mịmgba éné nimi mịẹsị diin fịnị bẹnyẹ! Kụ́ma mị́sa ọmịnị ine anị arịbịgha!
english_text: and said,“If you, even you, had only known on this day what would bring you peace—but now it is hidden from your eyes.

ibani_text: Sáá, ma ḅobẹm, ọmịna iruonaapụ o gbiri ikelekelebẹm, okiki pịghị ọkpasima sị angaá mamgba ḅụ ọmịnị ikelema.
english_text: The days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and encircle you and hem you in on every side.

ibani_text: Nnị ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba gulugulumabẹm, pịghị o pa ḅụ gbiriikélékélé dapịrị ḅụ fịnị awọamaapụ so guluguluma, n gbẹ́rẹ́ dapịrị sọ warịsobịgha jẹ́ ọ́gọ́nọ tegó ọmịnị ine lighlighaa Tamuno ḅo ọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma dọghụ sáá!
english_text: They will dash you to the ground, you and the children within your walls. They will not leave one stone on another, because you did not recognize the time of God’s coming to you.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị Tamunoopuwárị ma soo warị tuḅokọariapụ ma deesi,
english_text: When Jesus entered the temple courts, he began to drive out those who were selling.

ibani_text: dugho n pịrịarị ḅẹ́, N gịẹ kórómamam tọ́ndiri ma bie. Tamun dughom ḅẹẹ, I warị ma ọ́ n tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọ bẹ wárị. Kụ́ma ọmịnị anị pa furuapụ pa mangị ḅoghuḅoghu angaá mịẹmam!
english_text: “It is written,”he said to them,“ ‘My house will be a house of prayer’; but you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’”

ibani_text: Éné gbọrụ gbọrụ Jizọs nyẹ́diem Tamunoopuwárị ma bie. Igwagwaalaapụ, ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na túminị́ ma sịbịdaapụ asọ dọ́ghụm nnị ọ baá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Every day he was teaching at the temple. But the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the leaders among the people were trying to kill him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ine asọ arịgha, tegó túminị́ mamgba birifama o pughuarị, nnị bigha gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọ nnị gbarị.
english_text: Yet they could not find any way to do it, because all the people hung on his words.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Jizọs Tamunoopuwárị ma bie fịnị nyẹ́diearị sáá, pịghị ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị, igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ, na sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅo ḅom.
english_text: One day as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaiming the good news, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, together with the elders, came up to him.

ibani_text: Si warị ọ ḅẹ ḅẹẹ, Dugho wa pịrị i tẹ́ kụrọ nyáná sị pa mị fịrị mamgba nwángịarị? Tụọ anị kụ́rọ ma pa ị pịrị?
english_text: “Tell us by what authority you are doing these things,” they said. “Who gave you this authority?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa kúru a gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pa o gbíla. Dugho i pịrị,
english_text: He replied,“I will also ask you a question. Tell me:

ibani_text: Jọn ọ pa mingi saraarị kụ́rọ ma anị Tamuno ḅara ḅo, anịgha anị túminị́ ḅarabie ḅo?
english_text: John’s baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị anị bịpị ḅẹlẹma ḅẹẹ, Wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ ḅẹẹ Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom; o dughobẹm ḅẹ́, Tegó, ọmịnị Jọn mininigha?
english_text: They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ ḅara saghịḅom, mịná túminị́ mamgba mgbọ́lụ pa wa gbibẹm, tegó nna ḅụ korom ḅẹẹ, Jọn ori ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: But if we say, ‘Of human origin,’ all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Wa nimigha anị sághị ḅọ angaá.
english_text: So they answered, “We don’t know where it was from.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Irị sọ a dugho ọ pịrịbịgha a pa mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarị kụ́rọ.
english_text: Jesus said,“Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị: Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi vainị dụadipi ḅo, warị anị pa ọkọ pịrị, warị soo ḅọlọ angaá muu sị anị sẹ ma ḅụ tọgha kụ́rá fịnị.
english_text: He went on to tell the people this parable:“A man planted a vineyard, rented it to some farmers and went away for a long time.

ibani_text: Duasughu sáá, ḅo láa sáá ori ọrẹ ómóniḅọ fịrịma ọ ḅara dua ọkọapụ ma dámámum, ḅẹẹ nnị ori diekiri pa ọ pịrị, kụ́ma nnị ori ómóniḅọ ma fomtẹ́lẹ́mam warị o wáriso gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ so pa ọ pịrịgha.
english_text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

ibani_text: Ọ warị jẹ́ ómóniḅọ fịrịma; kụ́ma mịị dua ọkọapụ ma pịghị mịị jẹ́ ómóniḅọ ma fomtẹ́lẹ́mam ọ ḅụ́gịrịrịma, sị ọ fịrịma so, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa ọ pịrịgha.
english_text: He sent another servant, but that one also they beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.

ibani_text: Ọ warị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá ómóniḅọ fịrịma; dua ọkọapụ ma nyẹ pa olamam; warị o gbi págháma.
english_text: He sent still a third, and they wounded him and threw him out.

ibani_text: Vainị duakiri ma nyánáḅọ ma warị ḅẹẹ, A pịghị tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? A ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma tụwọ fịrịmabẹm, mịnga ḅọ ma nnị ori osibẹm.
english_text: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love; perhaps they will respect him.’

ibani_text: Kụ́ma dua ma ḅụ nnị ọkọapụ ma ori árị sáá, nnị warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mịị duakiri ma nyánáakị bẹḅọ. O ḅoo wamịnị ọ ḅá sị duakiri ma wámịna nyẹ sọọ!
english_text: “But when the tenants saw him, they talked the matter over. ‘This is the heir,’ they said. ‘Let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ gbi págháma vainị duakiri ma bie, sị pịghị ọ ḅá. Jizọs warị n gbíla, Vainị duakiri ma nyánáḅọ ma ọ pịghị mị́sa tẹ́ pa duakiri ma ọkọapụ ma mịẹbẹ?
english_text: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. “What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

ibani_text: O ḅo anị owiapụ ma ḅaabẹm sị vainị duakiri ma ḅọ́rọ́ma jẹ́ ọkọapụ pịrị. Túminị́ ma mịma náa sáá, n dughom ḅẹẹ, Tamuno minima!
english_text: He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” When the people heard this, they said, “God forbid!”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ́ ḅọ́rọ́ma n dighim sị gbíla, Anịsáa, mị tọ́ndiri ma anị tẹ́ dughoarị? Wárinámáapụ ma sịghị dapịrị ma ḅẹ́ anị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori anịị ḅo mị́sa warị ma dighi sẹ́ma nyẹ!
english_text: Jesus looked directly at them and asked,“Then what is the meaning of that which is written: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone’?

ibani_text: Anị dapịrị ma ḅụ sóghóró kóróḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dapịrị ma n ḅo pẹlẹ kọsịmabẹm, dapịrị ma ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ḅụ koro koro anị n ḅo gbẹ́ẹ̄ fọọ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.”

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ na igwagwaalaapụ asọ dọ́ghụm n Jizọs kuu bẹ ḅara anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, tegó nnị akanyaḅom ḅẹẹ, mịị kaḅụ ma ọ kọọ nna sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ gbánām; kụ́ma n túminị́ ma dighi ḅáláfam.
english_text: The teachers of the law and the chief priests looked for a way to arrest him immediately, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ ḅụ tọ́rụ pa kiri lama, sị ámáfúrúapụ fịrịma ḅẹẹ n muu akati ḅẹẹ, jẹ́ epele nyẹ nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ofori nnị gbilaarị nyẹ ma. Nnị mịma mịẹarị n pa oku bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ mịị o dughonyẹ sị nnị ọ saghị táarị ḅo na pịghị Rom ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma ḅarabie sua.
english_text: Keeping a close watch on him, they sent spies, who pretended to be sincere. They hoped to catch Jesus in something he said, so that they might hand him over to the power and authority of the governor.

ibani_text: Mịị ámáfúrúapụ ma Jizọs ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa nimim ḅẹẹ i dughonyẹ na i die nyẹ karakáram. Wa pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ i sa nyáná tumḅọ la nyẹ pịrịgha. Kụ́ma karakárányẹ ma anịị ị diearịnyẹ Tamuno bii ḅara tumḅọ duma kọọ.
english_text: So the spies questioned him: “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and that you do not show partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.

ibani_text: Dugho wa pịrị, anị karakárá ḅẹẹ wa kọnsịn ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ Siza pịrị, mụ́nọ sị wa gbẹ́ẹma?
english_text: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs arịm n tiarị epele warị nnị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: He saw through their duplicity and said to them,

ibani_text: Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ Romapụ pị́naḅala igbii pa i die, Tụọ tórúku na tụọ ẹ́rẹ anị ḅụ imii? Nnị warị pagharaa, Siza ma.
english_text: “Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?” “Caesar’s,” they replied.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Siza nyẹ pa Siza pịrị, pịghị Tamuno nyẹ pa Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: He said to them,“Then give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”

ibani_text: Anị ngá túminị́ ma toruku n gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ nyánágha n go pa oku ḅẹnyẹ, ọ pịghị ḅara warị n pa o gbíla nyẹ págháraarị ḅara ma nna tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm, n warị nna bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: They were unable to trap him in what he had said there in public. And astonished by his answer, they became silent.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, jẹa Sadusiiapụ, ḅẹapụ ḅẹẹ, túminị́ fịị ḅụ saghịbịgha, Jizọs damaḅom sị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Some of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Jesus with a question.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́dieḅọ, Mosis mịị ologho gịẹ wa pịrịm ḅẹẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ owitụ́wọ fịịfịị sị taa wáriso, awọ nna bie ofori ofori, fịịḅọ ma mị́naḅọ ọ taa ma yaa ḅẹm sị awọ yii fịịmaá mị́naḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri, sọ́nọ́ma mịnaapụ imii; nna ḅụ sẹ́nịḅaḅọ ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaam sị awọ yiigha pa fịị.
english_text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died childless.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámáḅọ ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma yaam, sị fịị tụwọ yiigha pa,
english_text: The second

ibani_text: tẹ́rẹ́ kárámáḅọ ḅo pịghị, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara mịẹ. Mị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma nnị sọ́nọ́maápụ mamgba ḅụ pághám nnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịm awọ yiigha pa.
english_text: and then the third married her, and in the same way the seven died, leaving no children.

ibani_text: Nyẹ mamgba kunema, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma sọ pịghị fịm.
english_text: Finally, the woman died too.

ibani_text: Mị́sa, fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghị bẹ sáá ma ḅụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma, a tụ́ọ taa sọọ bẹ? Nnị sọ́nọ́maápụ mamgba a yáamáa sáá.
english_text: Now then, at the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa, Mịị tuminikiriapụ ma yaarị pịghị nna awọ pa yaa pịrịarị
english_text: Jesus replied,“The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma fịị ḅụ saghị bẹ owiapụ na ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ dumafịnị bẹapụ ḅoarị sa ma ḅụ nnị dee anịgha taa yaabịgha.
english_text: But those who are considered worthy of taking part in the age to come and in the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage,

ibani_text: Sookumuapụ ma fịnị ḅara anịị n fịnị bẹ ḅara, nnị ine fịịbịgha, nnị anịị Tamuno awọ, tegó, nnị fịị ḅụ saghịmam.
english_text: and they can no longer die; for they are like the angels. They are God’s children, since they are children of the resurrection.

ibani_text: Mosis tọ́rụ́ bulubulumagha ḅara ḅụ diepághámam ḅẹẹ, fịịapụ saghịbẹm fịị ḅụ. Nnị dọghụmarị piri ma gbólómanyẹ gịẹ angaá ma ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma, ori anịị Ebraham Tamuno, Aizik Tamuno na pịghị, Jekọpụ Tamuno.
english_text: But in the account of the burning bush, even Moses showed that the dead rise, for he calls the Lord ‘the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

ibani_text: Ori anịị fịịmaapụ ma Tamungha, kụ́ma dumaapụ ma Tamuno, ḅẹẹ ọ toruku kị́nị́mamgba dumam.
english_text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for to him all are alive.”

ibani_text: Ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma jẹ́apụ warị pụghọ saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, mị ibima pagharaa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: Some of the teachers of the law responded, “Well said, teacher!”

ibani_text: Nnị mịnị ine jẹ́nyẹ pa o gbilagha.
english_text: And no one dared to ask him any more questions.

ibani_text: Jizọs gbilam, ḅẹẹ, Nnị tọrọ́ pa anị dugho bẹ ḅẹẹ, Krais ma ori Deviti furobie saghị págháḅo bẹḅọ?
english_text: Then Jesus said to them,“Why is it said that the Messiah is the son of David?

ibani_text: Deviti ọ ḅụgbọrụ dughom Núme diri ma bie ḅẹẹ,  Dúmagbámásó ḅọ ma, i nyánáḅọ ḅẹm, Mịnga ị́yẹ́ amaḅaranga kpọrọfịnị
english_text: David himself declares in the Book of Psalms: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand

ibani_text: akị mú a ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ pa ị́yẹ́ Ḅụọ gbananyẹ mịẹ, i ḅụọ sughu!
english_text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.” ’

ibani_text: Deviti Inyanaḅọ pa ọ sim. Anịsáa Krais ma ọ tọ́rọ́ pa ḅo Deviti furotụ́wọ sọọ bẹ?
english_text: David calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba o pughuarị sáá, Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹẹ.
english_text: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma ẹbị. Nnị sámámgba koro bịtẹ sua dọ́ghụm sị nwángị ikelekelé ḅẹlẹmaapụ ḅẹẹ túminị́ nna osii ḅara pa sịbịpị pa n sịị fẹ́siri, kobiri yọ ma ḅụ n kị́rị́ma warị ịkasị ḅẹlẹmaapụ n pịghị opuapụ kiri ḅẹ́lẹ́mam fị na ḅụ yọ.
english_text: “Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

ibani_text: Nnị deefịị ẹ́rẹ mbásịm sị nna warị daakị n ḅarabie, sị oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị, sị nángwọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ! Nna gbẹ́ẹfịnyẹ siḅaabẹm.
english_text: They devour widows’ houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ́ saghị dighim, warị ngọ nyánáapụ ma árị nnị nna igbii suarị sáá Tamunoopuwarị ma igbii daa igbe bie.
english_text: As Jesus looked up, he saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị opuma ịgónyí gbẹ́rẹ́ deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ arịm, árị árẹ mmẹẹ́ a pẹ́nị pa suarị sáá,
english_text: He also saw a poor widow put in two very small copper coins.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrịm, mịị ịgónyí deefịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma dụḅaḅá nyẹ sua kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịmam.
english_text: “Truly I tell you,”he said,“this poor widow has put in more than all the others.

ibani_text: Isiapụ pịrịm n nyánányẹ ḅụ kọnyẹ́, kụ́ma árị árẹ ịgónyí láa ḅara ḅụ árị árẹ nyánányẹ mamgba pịrịm.
english_text: All these people gave their gifts out of their wealth; but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụdua jẹ́apụ Tamunoopuwárị ma gbólómanyẹ dughoarị, anị fíafía ḅara na pịghị n pa anị nama fíafía dapịrị, n pa Tamuno pịrị sị n pa anị birima nyẹ, Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Some of his disciples were remarking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and with gifts dedicated to God. But Jesus said,

ibani_text: Ọmịnị árịarị nyẹ mamgba, sáá ḅoarị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ dapịrị sọ arịbịgha jẹ́nyẹ ọgọ́nọ́, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị anị ká gálágálámabẹm.
english_text: “As for what you see here, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another; every one of them will be thrown down.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ́ gbíla, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, mịma tẹ́ sáá kiriakị bẹ? Tẹ́ págháa bẹ diebẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ, sáá ma lámam?
english_text: “Teacher,” they asked, “when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ tọ́rụ́ pa kiri lama, o minima kị́nị́ oḅori pa ọ sị, tọghaapụ ḅẹarịapụ ḅẹẹ nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ i pịrịarị, n ḅobẹm ḅo dugho ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị ori! Sị pịghị dugho ḅẹẹ, Sáá ma kikiamam! Ọmịnị n dua ma.
english_text: He replied:“Watch out that you are not deceived. For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅáláfama ọ saghị ọ́mụ́ ọwụ namaẹrẹ na pịghị túminị́ sághị táarịapụ ma na ḅẹ́rẹ́miearị sáá, mịnanyẹ ma parị kiriakịbẹm, kụ́ma anị dughogha ḅẹẹ kunema ma kiriakịbẹm anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: When you hear of wars and uprisings, do not be frightened. These things must happen first, but the end will not come right away.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pa saghị dugho ḅẹẹ, Sẹ na jẹ́ sẹ na owusọbẹm; amadakiri na amadakiri jụghọ jụghọ na ọmụ́gbibẹm.
english_text: Then he said to them:“Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

ibani_text: Kiri opuma jighebẹm, ḅuruḅa, sii obi ngaa mamgba, tọ́rụ pa dighigha pịghị ḅáláfáma nyẹ so tọ́rụ́ ḅụ saghị ḅobẹm.
english_text: There will be great earthquakes, famines and pestilences in various places, and fearful events and great signs from heaven.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba na kiriakịgha sáá, n tarị ọmịnị kuubẹm, pịghị ọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma, nnị ọ saghị Juuapụ kobiri yọ pịrịbẹm sị n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ọmịna sịbị sị ọ pa ikólibie sua; nnị ọmịnị akuoo ámányánáapụ na táarịapụ tórúku ḅobẹm i sịbị go.
english_text: “But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you. They will hand you over to synagogues and put you in prison, and you will be brought before kings and governors, and all on account of my name.

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ọ nyáná asọ sị ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa.
english_text: And so you will bear testimony to me.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ibi sáá ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ kụ́rọ ma ọ balabịgha ḅara ọmịna ḅụ dua ḅụ.
english_text: But make up your mind not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.

ibani_text: Tegó a kịrị níminyẹ na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ pịrịbẹm sị ọmịna iruonaapụ ine dabịgha nyẹ anịgha pịghị anị pa epele nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.

ibani_text: Ọmịna nyingiapụ na ọmịna daapụ na pịghị ọmịna owiapụ mịná ọmịna mịnaapụ na pịghị ọmịna nángwọ́apụ ọ saghị n pịrịbẹm n pịghị ọmịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ, ḅaabẹm.
english_text: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers and sisters, relatives and friends, and they will put some of you to death.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba, o dighi ḅụ akụbẹm i sịbị go.
english_text: Everyone will hate you because of me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịna sịbị gbẹ́rẹ́ núme mgbọ́lụ sọ fabịgha.
english_text: But not a hair of your head will perish.

ibani_text: Sẹ́ kụ́rọ, anịsáa ị ịḅụ duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Stand firm, and you will win life.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ árị sị nnị Jerusalem gbiriikélékélé ma sáá, anịsáa o nimi ḅẹẹ ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ nnị anị gulugulumabẹm.
english_text: “When you see Jerusalem being surrounded by armies, you will know that its desolation is near.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Judiya ḅụ fịnịapụ mangị tụ́ndụ́ ọ́gọ́nọ tándị, ama bie fịnịapụ mangị pághá, anịsáa ámá bie oforiapụ asọ dọ́ghụ́ma ḅẹẹ nnị ámá bie sọọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those in the city get out, and let those in the country not enter the city.

ibani_text: Tegó mịị anịị tọ́rụ́siarị sáá ma, kiriakị bẹnyẹ sị Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ mamgba ḅo karakárányẹ sọọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For this is the time of punishment in fulfillment of all that has been written.

ibani_text: Anị éné biri ma anị opuma ḅáláfa dighi fura ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ pịrịbẹm, na pịghị ndomaẹ́rẹ́! Opu tọ́rụ́siarị ama ma ḅụ kóróbẹm, Tamuno igani pịghị mịná túminị́ ma ḅụ korobẹm.
english_text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers! There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ nnị afaragada pa n pẹlẹ ḅaabẹm. Jẹ́apụ nnị n pa jẹ́ sẹ ḅụ ikólibie suabẹm; Juughaapụ ma ḅụọ pa Jerusalem nánga wárii sị nna sáá kara sáá lábẹm.
english_text: They will fall by the sword and will be taken as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ pa dighigha nyẹ anịị kiriakị bẹnyẹ ịrụa na akalụ́ na pịghị ḅálōló mamgba ḅụ. Tuminikiri sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ mangị na ḅáláfa ḅụ fịnịbẹm, dinọngụ tọ́rụ́bie opuma iganịarị ḅara álála nwángịarị mingi bie.
english_text: “There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars. On the earth, nations will be in anguish and perplexity at the roaring and tossing of the sea.

ibani_text: Túminị́ tuminikiri ḅụ págháarị nyẹ ma árị sáá, n fụmbẹm ḅáláfa ḅụ, tegó so tọ́rụ́ baá pịrịarịnyẹ ma jighebẹm sị anị fịnịkiri wáriso.
english_text: People will faint from terror, apprehensive of what is coming on the world, for the heavenly bodies will be shaken.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, anịị túminị́ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma árị bẹnyẹ, o ḅoarị angaá oḅuto bie, kụrọ na ori opu ipine ḅụ.
english_text: At that time they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

ibani_text: Mịị mamgba saghị kiriakị máare ọ saghị sẹ sị ọmịna sịbị saghị, tegó ọmịna dụaḅọ́rọ́ma kikiamam.
english_text: When these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrị, Ọ fịgị sị ma dighi pịghị jẹ́ jẹ́ sịịmgbọ́lụ.
english_text: He told them this parable:“Look at the fig tree and all the trees.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị árị sị anị ányị́nyá saghị págháḅoarị sáá, o nimim ḅẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́kụra kikiamam.
english_text: When they sprout leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is near.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọmịnị árị sị mịnanyẹ ma saghị kiriakị máare o nimibẹm ḅẹẹ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma anị ḅo bẹ sáá lámam.
english_text: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị, mị́sa dumafịnịapụ mamgbagha fịị bẹnyẹ, mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakị bẹ sáá.
english_text: “Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

ibani_text: So na kiri na ḅọ́rọ́ sọ́bẹm, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ḅọ́rọ́ sọbịgha.
english_text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ ẹbị sị minima opu fị na ḅụ na ọ dighi akị so, ọ pịghị minima sị tuminikiri ḅụḅáláḅálá opuma ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie bii sí ọ ḅáláḅálá ma anịgha éné ma ḅo ọ ḅụ koro tọ́rụ́ pa dighigha sáá, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ n tughu dia.
english_text: “Be careful, or your hearts will be weighed down with carousing, drunkenness and the anxieties of life, and that day will close on you suddenly like a trap.

ibani_text: Anịị anị tuminikiri ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba ḅụ kóró bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For it will come on all those who live on the face of the whole earth.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ́ findi kúru sị pịghị sáá mamgba ḅụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ịnyọ nyáná sị tulu ḅọ́rọ́bẹm págháarị nyẹ mamgba ḅụ, sị pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma tórúku sẹ́.
english_text: Be always on the watch, and pray that you may be able to escape all that is about to happen, and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, éné mamgba Jizọs sáá fámam nyẹ́diearị nna Tamunoopuwárị ma bie éné bie, éné dii sáá o mú Olivu Tụ́ndụ ọ́gọ́nọ fịnịbẹm dii gbọrụ.
english_text: Each day Jesus was teaching at the temple, and each evening he went out to spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives,

ibani_text: Dede gbọrụ, túminị́ Tamunoopuwárị ma muarị nnị mú o pughu bẹ ḅara.
english_text: and all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.

ibani_text: Sáá ma kikiamam n Yisti Suagha Fịtúrú Álálị ọlọ bẹ sáá, mịma anịị nnị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma pa sị nyẹ.
english_text: Now the Festival of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching,

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma túminị́ ma dighi ḅáláfaarị, anịgo nnị asọ dọghụarị n ḅọghu ḅara pa Jizọs ḅa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for some way to get rid of Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.

ibani_text: Ẹ́kpẹ́dua warị Judas Isịkarọtị pa sịḅọ bie sọọ, ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Then Satan entered Judas, called Iscariot, one of the Twelve.

ibani_text: Judas warị igwagwaalaapụ ma na pịghị sịbịdá Tamunoopuwárị ma kúruarịapụ ma na ḅẹ́rẹ́bia, o ḅara warị Jizọs dẹrị pa n ḅarabie sua bẹ ḅara.
english_text: And Judas went to the chief priests and the officers of the temple guard and discussed with them how he might betray Jesus.

ibani_text: Anị nna bieḅẹ́lẹ́mam nnị warị pẹlẹ ḅẹẹ nnị igbii pa ọgbẹbẹm.
english_text: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.

ibani_text: Judas mininim warị sághị ibi asọ dọghụ ọ ḅara warị Jizọs sághị n ḅarabie sua bẹ ḅara túminị́ nimigha pa.
english_text: He consented, and watched for an opportunity to hand Jesus over to them when no crowd was present.

ibani_text: Yisti Suagha Fịtúrú ma Álálị ma éné láa sáá, álálị ma bie nnị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma nama ma ḅá bi sáá.
english_text: Then came the day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị mị oku ma pa Pita na Jọn fịrịma ḅẹẹ, O muu Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma tẹ́lẹ́ma warị sị wa fị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying,“Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị o gbíla, Ị tẹ́ angaá dọghụ ḅẹẹ wamịnị anị tẹ́lẹ́ma warị?
english_text: “Where do you want us to prepare for it?” they asked.

ibani_text: Ọ warị pagharaa, I ámá ma soarị sáá, mingi ojongo dighi gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ i nana donabẹm. O dua ọ sọ wárị sọọ,
english_text: He replied,“As you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him to the house that he enters,

ibani_text: sị wárị ma nyánáḅọ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma ḅẹm a ị gbíla ḅẹẹ: tẹ́ angaá wárịbie ịrị na ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ i nana Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma fị bẹ?
english_text: and say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’

ibani_text: Ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ opu bie pa ọ diebẹm ọgọ́nọ́ ju nnị ibima tẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ, anị ngaa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma wárii.
english_text: He will show you a large room upstairs, all furnished. Make preparations there.”

ibani_text: Nnị múm warị mú nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ árị Jizọs dugho n pịrị ḅara. Nnị warị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma tẹ́lẹ́ma warị.
english_text: They left and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

ibani_text: Sáá ma láa sáá, Jizọs warị ori fịnị yọ akị opuịkasị ma ọ́gọ́nọ ori na nfịrịmaapụ ma na.
english_text: When the hour came, Jesus and his apostles reclined at the table.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Anị i tarịmam ḅẹẹ a ọ nana mịị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma fịị tẹrẹmẹ a mú tọ́rụ́siarị!
english_text: And he said to them,“I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, a mịnị jẹ́ pa ọ nana mị fị́nyẹ ma fịbịghaa akị mú Tamuno amadakiri ma ḅụ nnị karakárá kiri pa anị pịrị sa láa.
english_text: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it finds fulfillment in the kingdom of God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọmọngọ ma saghị akị, sị imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹ́ warị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị anị die akị ọmịna ogboku bie.
english_text: After taking the cup, he gave thanks and said,“Take this and divide it among you.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, mị́sa saghị bịpịmú, a mịnị jẹ́ pa n grepụ sịmgbọlụ pa mịẹ iru ma ḅubịgha akị mú Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅo sa láa.
english_text: For I tell you I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị fịtúrú mpara akị warị imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ, warị anị puu n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịị ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị ma n pa ọ pịrịnyẹ ma ọmịna sịbị goo. Ọ mịma mịẹsị i pa biekóróma.
english_text: And he took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying,“This is my body given for you; do this in remembrance of me.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ori ọmọngọ ma pa n pịrịm n ḅupiri fị́nyẹ ma fị́fáma sáá, ḅẹẹ, Mịị ọmọngọ ma anịị Tamuno ịwọ ọḅọọ nnị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ma pa kpọtẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ, nnị sara nyẹ ọmịna sịbị go.
english_text: In the same way, after the supper he took the cup, saying,“This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, dighi! Ị dẹrịfịarịḅọ ma ọ mịnga i nana nyẹ́fị ịkasị ma ọ́gọ́nọ imi!
english_text: But the hand of him who is going to betray me is with mine on the table.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ọ fị́ị́bẹm Tamuno tọ́ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma ḅara ḅụ, kụ́ma anị opuma sii dẹrịfịma ḅara saghị ḅoḅọ pịrịm!
english_text: The Son of Man will go as it has been decreed. But woe to that man who betrays him!”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị jụghọ jụghọ gbíla ḅẹẹ wámịna bie tụọ mị fịrị ma nwángị bẹ.
english_text: They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who would do this.

ibani_text: Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ ma ogbobie, nụná ḅo korom, n sị ḅo ḅẹẹ duḅaḅam.
english_text: A dispute also arose among them as to which of them was considered to be greatest.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị nnị ḅẹ́, Juughaapụ ma ámányánáapụ kụ́rọ nyánam nna túminị́ ḅụ, táarịapụ ma nna ḅụ sim Ibi mịẹapụ.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who exercise authority over them call themselves Benefactors.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, ọmịnị anị ọkọ pa ọ nana fịnị ma. Ọmịna bie géléḅa ḅọ ma ḅụ warịbẹm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ori ịrụ́ḅam, táarịḅọ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ fịrịnwangị n pịrịarịḅọ.
english_text: But you are not to be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the one who rules like the one who serves.

ibani_text: Tụọ dụḅaḅá, kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ́fịarịḅọ anịgha fị́nyẹ ma mịẹ jẹ́apụ pịrịarịḅọ? Karakárányẹ kpọrọfịnị sị n fị́nyẹ mịẹ pịrịarịḅọ ma. Kụ́ma irị a ọmịnị ogboku bie imii fị́nyẹ mịẹ ọ pịrịarị ḅo ḅara.
english_text: For who is greater, the one who is at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anịị i nana fịnịmaapụ ị́yẹ́ daádighi mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: You are those who have stood by me in my trials.

ibani_text: I Daá ma kụrọ́ pa i pịrịmaá ḅara ḅẹẹ a taa anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị a kụrọ́ pa ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: And I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred one on me,

ibani_text: Ọ fịbẹm pịghị ḅuubẹm ị́yẹ́ nyẹ́fị ịkasị ọgọnọ ị́yẹ́ amadakiri ọ pịghị imine ọgọ́nọ́ fịnị sị Izirẹlị oyi mmẹẹ́ ama findi ma taa.
english_text: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị Pita ḅẹ́, Saimọn, Saimọn! Satanị kụrọ nyanaḅomam ḅẹẹ ori i gugu, dụadipiḅọ apara ma gugu gugusi ḅara mgbọ́lụ ma ḅụ.
english_text: “Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to sift all of you as wheat.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, Saimọn, a tẹ́ghẹ̄ ị pịrịmam ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ minini bịghịbịgha ḅara. I pịghịma i damaḅo sa ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ kụrọma.
english_text: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”

ibani_text: Pita warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, a tẹ́lẹ́mamam i nana ịkóli muu pịghị i nana fịị!
english_text: But he replied, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, A dugho ị pịrịarị Pita, ḅẹẹ, mịị dii i tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá pa i pighibẹm ọbịọ ma na pághá sáá, ḅẹẹ ị́ inimigha.
english_text: Jesus answered,“I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori ọḅụduaapụ gbíla ḅẹẹ, Parị a ọ fịrịma pághámá sa ọmịnị igbii suanyẹ, akpa anịgha agbaa ọlọghaa sa ọ pálịma nyẹ imi? Nnị warị ọ págháraa ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ wa palịmagha.
english_text: Then Jesus asked them,“When I sent you without purse, bag or sandals, did you lack anything?” “Nothing,” they answered.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Kụ́ma mị́sa igbii suanyẹ anịgha akpa nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị akịị, afaragada nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ ḅụ́gbẹ́ bịtẹ dẹrị sị afaragada fẹ.
english_text: He said to them,“But now if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don’t have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, a dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, dugho Tọ́ndiri ma ḅẹẹ, O ḅo siiamịẹnyẹapụ na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara fịnịm, ḅo karakárányẹ sọ́bẹm ị́yẹ́ duma bie, tegó i gboloma sị n gịẹnyẹ ma ḅo sághị karakárányẹ sọmam.
english_text: It is written: ‘And he was numbered with the transgressors’; and I tell you that this must be fulfilled in me. Yes, what is written about me is reaching its fulfillment.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, dighi mịnga mmẹẹ́ afaragada imi. Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Mịma kárámam.
english_text: The disciples said, “See, Lord, here are two swords.” “That’s enough!”he replied.

ibani_text: Jizọs ama ma warịsom ori nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara warị Olivu Tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ ma tándị, ori ọḅụduaapụ sọ ọ nana múm.
english_text: Jesus went out as usual to the Mount of Olives, and his disciples followed him.

ibani_text: O mú anị angaá ma láa sáá, o dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị ọ daádighi bie sọbịgha ḅara.
english_text: On reaching the place, he said to them,“Pray that you will not fall into temptation.”

ibani_text: Ori n warịsom sị kẹ́lẹ́ toruku muu warị anị angaá ẹkpẹrẹkị tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed,

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Daá, ḅọ́rọ́ mị ị́ anịị i tọ ḅara mịị tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọngọ ma si ịḅụ. Kụ́ma a tọ ḅaragha, ị tọ́nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ warị sobie saghị ḅo sị ịnyọ pa ọ ḅụ sua.
english_text: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.

ibani_text: Opu akụ ḅụ ori ọ tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa tẹ́ghẹ̄m; ọ ḅụ págharị imoo warị kpọ koroarị ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅara.
english_text: And being in anguish, he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ kiri ma ḅụ saghị sáá, ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ dámámum sị nnị arịị n múnoarị angaá, tegó ịnyọ nna ḅụ famam kụrụrụ gosi.
english_text: When he rose from prayer and went back to the disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from sorrow.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ go múnoarị? Ọ saghị tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị ọmịnị daádighi bie sọbịgha ḅara.
english_text: “Why are you sleeping?”he asked them.“Get up and pray so that you will not fall into temptation.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá anị túminị́ kpo ma anị ngá ḅoo nyẹ, Judas oyi mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, anịị bịpịsụụ n pịrịḅọ, ọ warị Jizọs fịnị angaá ḅoo ḅẹẹ ọ bịpị pa o lughu timi.
english_text: While he was still speaking a crowd came up, and the man who was called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He approached Jesus to kiss him,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ḅẹm, ḅẹẹ, Judas bịpị pa i lughu timi ḅụ, anịị i pa Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma dẹrịfịịnyẹ?
english_text: but Jesus asked him,“Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”

ibani_text: Ọ nana fịnị ọḅụduaapụ pághá dọghụnyẹ ma árị sáá, n warị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ wa wámịna afaragada wọrọ pághámá ḅo.
english_text: When Jesus’ followers saw what was going to happen, they said, “Lord, should we strike with our swords?”

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị igwagwaalaḅọ ma fịrịnwangịḅọ amaḅara angaá biri pẹlẹsii.
english_text: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Mịma ibimam! Ọ warị ḅara pa owitụ́wọ ma biri lama sị ọ gwọọ.
english_text: But Jesus answered,“No more of this!”And he touched the man’s ear and healed him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị igwagwaalaapụ ma na Tamunoopuwárị ma kúruarịapụ ma sịbịdaapụ na pịghị sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅẹẹ, anị angaá ḅoo sị ḅo ọ ku dọghụapụ ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị afaragada na sị ikiḅa dighi i dua bi, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ḅẹ́rẹ́dighiḅọ?
english_text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders, who had come for him,“Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come with swords and clubs?

ibani_text: Éné gbọrụ gbọrụ a kọkọ ọ nana Tamunoopuwárị ma bie imi ọ mịnị asọ dọghụgha ọmịnị i kuu bẹ ḅara. Kụ́ma mịị ọmịna sáá, ọ nyẹ miẹnaibi sáá, kánákáná kánákáná kụrọ́ ma táarị sáá.
english_text: Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your hour—when darkness reigns.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma Jizọs kum, warị ọ pa opu igwagwaḅọ ma wárị muu Pita warị kẹ́lẹ́ tumbi pa n pịrị sị n dua.
english_text: Then seizing him, they led him away and took him into the house of the high priest. Peter followed at a distance.

ibani_text: Nnị fịnị tọ́nọm warị ma ẹpẹlẹ́ ogboku warị kpọrọfịnị anị ikelekele ma, Pita sọ nnị na kpọrọfịnịm.
