english_text: And when some there had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat down with them.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ warịtụwọ ori árị sáá fịnị ma timiarị, a warị dada o dighim warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ori sọ Jizọs ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: A servant girl saw him seated there in the firelight. She looked closely at him and said, “This man was with him.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, Pita pighim ḅẹẹ, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ a o nimi sọ nimigha.
english_text: But he denied it. “Woman, I don’t know him,” he said.

ibani_text: Anị kálá sáá tụwọ ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅo Pita arịm, warị ḅẹẹ, Ịrịsọ nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ! Kuma Pita ọ pagharam, Irị so ịrịgha!
english_text: A little later someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them.” “Man, I am not!” Peter replied.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅoo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, jẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅo kụrọ ma dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Muu sị ḅo ofori ḅẹẹ, mịị owitụ́wọ ma ori sọ Jizọs ọḅụduaḅọ tegó ori sọ Galiliḅọ!
english_text: About an hour later another asserted, “Certainly this fellow was with him, for he is a Galilean.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita pagharam ḅẹẹ, Owitụ́wọ a nimigha ị dughoarị nyẹ! Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ ọbịọ warị págháa.
english_text: Peter replied, “Man, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” Just as he was speaking, the rooster crowed.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị pịghị sị dada Pita dighi, Pita warị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ pa biekóróma ḅẹẹ, Mịmgba ọbịọ ma na págháa sáá ḅụ ị tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá pa i pighibẹm ḅẹẹ ị inimigha.
english_text: The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word the Lord had spoken to him:“Before the rooster crows today, you will disown me three times.”

ibani_text: Pita warị nụ́ngọbie págháa sị ibiḅara pa owúm.
english_text: And he went outside and wept bitterly.

ibani_text: Jizọs kuruarị owiapụ ma Jizọs kombom pịghị o fom.
english_text: The men who were guarding Jesus began mocking and beating him.

ibani_text: Nnị nyẹ pa ọ tọ́rụ gbẹm sị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Tụọ i fom? Dugho!
english_text: They blindfolded him and demanded, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị tọgha wiri núme pa o wiri.
english_text: And they said many other insulting things to him.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáa sáá, Juu ámátáapụ ma donam, sẹ́nịapụ mamgba; igwagwaalaapụ na pịghị ólóghó Nyẹ́dieapụ ma kobirim n warị Jizọs akuoo nna ogbobie.
english_text: At daybreak the council of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and the teachers of the law, met together, and Jesus was led before them.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Dugho wa pịrị, Ịrị anị Krais ma? Ọ warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, A dugho ọ pịrị pịrị ọmịnị ị mininibịgha.
english_text: “If you are the Messiah,” they said, “tell us.” Jesus answered,“If I tell you, you will not believe me,

ibani_text: A pịghị nyẹ pa o gbíla gbíla ọmịnị ị pagharabịgha.
english_text: and if I asked you, you would not answer.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa saghị bịpịmú Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma saghị kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno ma amaḅaranga kpọrọfịnịbẹm.
english_text: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God.”

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị ḅẹẹ, Anịsáa, Ịrị Tamuno Tụwọ? Ọ warị n pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọ kọḅẹm.
english_text: They all asked, “Are you then the Son of God?” He replied,“You say that I am.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Wa jẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ bigha! Wamịnị naamam ọ dughonyẹ!
english_text: Then they said, “Why do we need any more testimony? We have heard it from his own lips.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma warị saghị sẹ sị Jizọs akuoo Paileti tórúku.
english_text: Then the whole assembly rose and led him off to Pilate.

ibani_text: Nnị saghị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹ sáá, ḅẹẹ, Wa mị owitụ́wọ ma kuum, wámịna túminị́ daá irimaarị, dugho n pịrịarị ḅẹ́ n mịnị kọnsịn ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ Siza pịrịma, dughoarịḅo ḅẹẹ ori anịị Krais gbẹ́rẹ́, ámányánáḅọ.
english_text: And they began to accuse him, saying, “We have found this man subverting our nation. He opposes payment of taxes to Caesar and claims to be Messiah, a king.”

ibani_text: Paileti ọ gbilam ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anị Juu ámányánáḅọ ma? Jizọs warị ọ págháraa ḅẹẹ, Anịị i dugho ḅara.
english_text: So Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” “You have said so,”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Paileti warị dugho sịbịdaa igwagwaalaapụ na túminị́ kpo ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, A sịbị arịgha a go ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹnyẹ sị nnị mịị owitụ́wọ ma ḅá.
english_text: Then Pilate announced to the chief priests and the crowd, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n dugho kụ́rọ́máarị ḅẹẹ, Ori ọrẹ nyẹ́die pa túminị́ ma timi saghị saghịm sị n ḅẹ́rẹ́ mịẹ Judiya gbọrụ bie. Galili ḅụ anị ọ saghị nyẹ mị́sa ọ pịghị mịnga ḅomam.
english_text: But they insisted, “He stirs up the people all over Judea by his teaching. He started in Galilee and has come all the way here.”

ibani_text: Paileti mịma náa sáá, ọ gbilam ḅẹẹ, mị owitụ́wọ ma ori ọ Galiliḅọ?
english_text: On hearing this, Pilate asked if the man was a Galilean.

ibani_text: O ḅo nimiḅo sáá ḅẹẹ Jizọs saghị ḅo angaá anịị Hẹrọd ḅẹrẹtọ angaá, ori ọ fịrịma Hẹrọd damamum anịsáa ma ḅụ Jerusalem ḅụ fịnịḅọ.
english_text: When he learned that Jesus was under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd opuma bieḅẹlẹm ọ Jizọs árị sa, tegó ori o gbólómanyẹ námam, ọ pịghị asọ dọghụarị ḅọlọ sáá nene ori ọrẹ árị bẹ ḅara. Ọ pịghị biiarị ḅẹẹ ọ Jizọs arịị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángị.
english_text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was greatly pleased, because for a long time he had been wanting to see him. From what he had heard about him, he hoped to see him perform a sign of some sort.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd warị tọgha tọgha nyẹ pa Jizọs gbíla, kụ́ma Jizọs ọ pagharagha.
english_text: He plied him with many questions, but Jesus gave him no answer.

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ ma warị págháḅo sị nyẹ dugho kụrọma o bịpị pụ́nụ́ma.
english_text: The chief priests and the teachers of the law were standing there, vehemently accusing him.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd na ori ọ́mụ́gbiapụ okombom pịghị ọ dighisima. Anịsáa nnị warị fíafía bịtẹ pa o sua, sị ọ fịrịma so Paileti dámámuu.
english_text: Then Herod and his soldiers ridiculed and mocked him. Dressing him in an elegant robe, they sent him back to Pilate.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ma ḅụ Hẹrọd na Paileti na ḅoo nangwọ sọm. Ḅoo mị́sa ma la, nnị mmẹapụ iruonaapụ ḅụ imi.
english_text: That day Herod and Pilate became friends—before this they had been enemies.

ibani_text: Paileti igwagwaalaapụ ma na táarịapụ ma na pịghị túminị́ ma sị kobirim.
english_text: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers and the people,

ibani_text: Warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ mịị owitụ́wọ ma pa i toruku ḅom, ḅẹẹ o túminị́ ma daa irimaarị. Mị́sa a o pegheledighimam ọmịna toruku a pịghị arịgha ori irima angaá ọ pa ọ sịbị sẹ nyẹ mamgba.
english_text: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined him in your presence and have found no basis for your charges against him.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd sọ pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ arịgha ọ ḅụ anịgo sima ọ fịrịma ḅoo wa pịrịm. Ḅẹẹ mị owitụ́wọ ma ọ mịẹnyẹ ofori sị fịị na gbẹ́ẹnyẹ.
english_text: Neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us; as you can see, he has done nothing to deserve death.

ibani_text: Anịgo a fom nyẹ pa o fom ḅẹm sị ọ wáriso sị o soo. [
english_text: Therefore, I will punish him and then release him.”

ibani_text: Nna mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ, Saḅaḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma bie ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ikólinaḅọ pághámaḅo n pịrịbẹm.]
english_text: (For at every Passover celebration, Pilate was required to release one prisoner to the crowd.)

ibani_text: Túminị́ mamgba warị sileé ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅá! Sị Barabas warị soo.
english_text: But the whole crowd shouted, “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”

ibani_text: Nnị Barabas pa ikólibie suamam o dighi ḅẹrẹ gosi opu ama ma bie pịghị kị́nị́ḅáa ḅụ.
english_text: (Barabbas had been thrown into prison for an insurrection in the city, and for murder.)

ibani_text: Paileti dọ́ghụm ọ Jizọs wáriso sị o soo, anịgo o sima dugho túminị́ kpo ma pịrịm.
english_text: Wanting to release Jesus, Pilate appealed to them again.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ilúghum ọ sịbị ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅaupálị ọ ḅaupálị.
english_text: But they kept shouting, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

ibani_text: Paileti warị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá pa n gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ọ tẹ́ siinyẹ mịẹ? A arịgha ọ mịẹ siinyẹ si fịị na gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ, a fom nyẹ pa o fombẹm sị o wáriso sị o soo.
english_text: For the third time he spoke to them: “Why? What crime has this man committed? I have found in him no grounds for the death penalty. Therefore I will have him punished and then release him.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n pa otume kpasị ilúghuarị ḅẹẹ n Jizọs ḅaupálị, kunema nna ilúghú ma ḅo sọnyẹ mịẹ n pịrịm.
english_text: But with loud shouts they insistently demanded that he be crucified, and their shouts prevailed.

ibani_text: Paileti warị n biiarị ḅẹrẹ pẹlẹ Jizọs sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: So Pilate decided to grant their demand.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n biiḅọ ma wáriso sị o soo, n pa ikólibie sua ḅo ḅẹẹ, ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighim pịghị kị́nị́ḅáa, ọ warị Jizọs sághị n ḅárásua ḅẹẹ, nnị n ḅụḅẹlẹ ḅara pa o mịẹ.
english_text: He released the man who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, the one they asked for, and surrendered Jesus to their will.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma Jizọs akị sọm, nnị soarị sáá, n ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ Sirini amaḅọ, nnị Saimọn pa sịḅọ na donam kálá ámá ḅụ sághị Jerusalem soarị ḅọ. Nnị warị o kuu sị ori mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma pa ori ọgọnọ gbánā sị Jizọs dua.
english_text: As the soldiers led him away, they seized Simon from Cyrene, who was on his way in from the country, and put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ o duam, nna bie jẹa ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ilúghú sị owuarịapụ ọ sịbị go.
english_text: A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị n daam warị ḅẹẹ, Jerusalem ẹrẹawọ! Ọmịnị owu i pịrịma, kụ́ma ọ mịnị owu ọmịna ḅụ na ọmịna awọ pịrị.
english_text: Jesus turned and said to them,“Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ éné ḅoarị túminị́ ḅẹ́ bẹ sáá ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị anịị n karịibimaapụ, awọyiiapụ, furagha furo na pịghị ndo pịrịgha ndo!
english_text: For the time will come when you will say, ‘Blessed are the childless women, the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!’

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ  Anịị túminị́ opu tụ́ndụ́ ḅẹ́ bẹnyẹ, Bịghịị wamịnị ọgọnọ! Kálá tụ́ndụ́, Wa gbẹ́ẹ̄!
english_text: Then “ ‘they will say to the mountains, “Fall on us!” and to the hills, “Cover us!” ’

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ḅọ́rọ́ nwọfịnị nyẹ anịị mịẹarịnyẹ sị ma ẹ́lẹlẹ́ndẹ bia ḅára bia sáá, tẹ́ pághá bẹ sị ma sámụ́nọ́ sáá?
english_text: For if people do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

ibani_text: Jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ owiapụ, nnị mmẹapụ, opu ólóghó kóróapụ warị nnị na Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́ma sị nnị n ḅá gbolomaa.
english_text: Two other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá láa sa, anịị, Sịbị okporongbo, pa sị ngaa, warị anị angaá Jizọs ḅaupálị na pịghị isi opu ólóghókóróapụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori amaḅara ngaa isiḅọ ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ngaa.
english_text: When they came to the place called the Skull, they crucified him there, along with the criminals—one on his right, the other on his left.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Sii wáriso n pịrị, Daa, n nimigha nnị mịẹarịnyẹ. Nnị okoḅa gbi ori suabịtẹ pịrịm sị anị diema akị.
english_text: Jesus said,“Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.”And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma anị angaá sẹ sị dighiarị Juu sịbịdaapụ ma okomboarị sa, Ọ jẹ́apụ duaḅọ́rọ́mam; ori ọ ḅụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma, ḅọ́rọ́ ori anịị Krais ma, Tamuno sẹlẹakịḅọ ma.
english_text: The people stood watching, and the rulers even sneered at him. They said, “He saved others; let him save himself if he is God’s Messiah, the Chosen One.”

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma sọ okombom sị angị iru pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: The soldiers also came up and mocked him. They offered him wine vinegar

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ Juu ámányánáḅọ nḅẹḅẹ́ ịḅụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma!
english_text: and said, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself.”

ibani_text: Ọ sịbị ngaa nnị warị mị nyẹ ma gịẹ:
english_text: There was a written notice above him, which read:this is the king of the jews.

ibani_text: Opu ólóghó kóróapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ anị ọ́gọ́nọ ngaa sololo fịnịḅọ warị sághị wirinumo pa o wiri ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị Krais magha? Ịḅụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma, pịghị wamịnị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma!
english_text: One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: “Aren’t you the Messiah? Save yourself and us!”

ibani_text: Isiḅọ ma warị o dighi igani ḅẹẹ, Ị Tamuno dighi ḅáláfagha? Nnị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ọ pịrị ḅara, anịị n pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ị pịrị ḅara.
english_text: But the other criminal rebuked him. “Don’t you fear God,” he said, “since you are under the same sentence?

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ wámịna angaá nyẹ karakáram ḅẹẹ, wa wámịna fịrị ḅara gbẹ́ẹfịnyẹ nyánáarị, kụ́ma ori ọ miẹsima nyẹ ofori.
english_text: We are punished justly, for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, I pa biekóróma Jizọs, ịrị ị́yẹ́ amadakiri sọ ḅoo ḅẹ́ sáá.
english_text: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, A minini ị pịrịm ḅẹẹ, mịmgba ị i nana karakáráapụ ma fịnị yọ
english_text: Jesus answered him,“Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise.”

ibani_text: Anị oyi mmẹẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ findi lámam, ịrụa minibịgha, kánákáná sẹ gbọrụ gbẹmam, anịsáa ma ḅụ akị muu tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ láa.
english_text: It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,

ibani_text: Nnị pa tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ Tamunoopuwárị ma bie mmẹẹ́ mpara pa kaam.
english_text: for the sun stopped shining. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị kụrọ pụghọ pa owu ḅẹẹ, I Daá ị ḅarabie anịị a i tẹ́mẹ́ pa suanyẹ. O mịma dughom sị warị ịnyọ bima.
english_text: Jesus called out with a loud voice,“Father, into your hands I commit my spirit.”When he had said this, he breathed his last.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbi gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ arịm pághányẹ, ọ warị boma pa Tamuno pịrị ḅẹẹ, Mịị anịị karakárá tumḅọ!
english_text: The centurion, seeing what had happened, praised God and said, “Surely this was a righteous man.”

ibani_text: Anị angaá kobiriapụ ḅẹ́, n págháarị nyẹ árị dọ́ghụm árị sáá pághányẹ, nnị kị́nị́mamgba pịghịma sọm ḅara pa nna kúkúbie gbólóarị kụrụrụ ḅụ.
english_text: When all the people who had gathered to witness this sight saw what took place, they beat their breasts and went away.

ibani_text: Daada Jizọs nimiapụ mamgba, Galili ḅụ saghị ọḅụju o dua ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ mamgba ḅọlọ angaá ḅụ sẹ́m sị págháarị nyẹ dighi.
english_text: But all those who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ibi owitụ́wọ imi karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ Josẹf anịị ori ẹ́rẹ. Ori ma anịị Juu ámátáapụ kubiri ogbo ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ,
english_text: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and upright man,

ibani_text: kụ́ma ori Juu ámátáapụ kubiri ogbo ma na mininigha n kọọpẹlẹ sị pịghị mịẹnyẹ. Ori ma Arimatiya ḅụ saghịḅom Judiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, ọ Tamuno Ásẹ́mẹ́kiri ma ḅoo kuruarị.
english_text: who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea, and he himself was waiting for the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Ọ Paileti damamum ḅẹ́ ọ́ Jizọs oju ma pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus’ body.

ibani_text: Ọ warị oju ma sikóróma, warị asamịna alo pa ọ fịna warị ọ pa okpo dapịrịbie n sughu págháma ḅọ dupu bie dipi, jẹ́ éné na n kị́nị́ dipigha angaá.
english_text: Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth and placed it in a tomb cut in the rock, one in which no one had yet been laid.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anịị Tẹ́lẹ́ma Éné ma, kẹ́lẹ́ kọm Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma sághị.
english_text: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

ibani_text: Galili ḅụ sághị Jizọs dua ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma, Josẹf na múm sị mú dupu ma árị, n pịghị Jizọs oju kóróma ḅara anị bie.
english_text: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, anịị n pịghịma wárị muunyẹ warị fị́nyẹ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ na oju kụ́nụ́ma nyẹ gwagboloma n pa oju ma ọmbị bẹnyẹ. Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ nnị ịnyọ sárám ólóghó ḅụ n tọ n pịrị ḅara.
english_text: Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath in obedience to the commandment.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ Tamunoéné ma ḅụ, ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma mịẹ karakáráma kụ́nụ́ pulo ma pa dupu ma múm.
english_text: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women took the spices they had prepared and went to the tomb.

ibani_text: Nnị warị árị ḅẹẹ n pa dupu ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ dapịrị ma n suma simam.
english_text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,

ibani_text: Nnị pa warị ma sọmum kụ́ma nnị ine Kịnịnyáná Jizọs oju ma arịgha.
english_text: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị mịma kóróma kọarị sáá, buapághá ḅara ḅụ mmẹẹ́ owiapụ sofịnị kọrịarị ḅara pa kọrịarị suabịtẹ suaapụ warị anị kịrịkị́rị́ nna angásá sẹ́.
english_text: While they were wondering about this, suddenly two men in clothes that gleamed like lightning stood beside them.

ibani_text: Opu ḅáláfa go, ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma warị tọ́rụ́ i ḅo kiri owiapụ ma warị n ḅẹ, O tẹ́ go dumaḅọ dọghụarị fịmaapụ ogbobie?
english_text: In their fright the women bowed down with their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you look for the living among the dead?

ibani_text: Ọ mịnga ofori. Ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam. O biekóróma o dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ ọ pa ọmịnị na fịnị sa Galili ḅụ:
english_text: He is not here; he has risen! Remember how he told you, while he was still with you in Galilee:

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ n Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma saghị ḅọ́rọ́ma siiamịẹnyẹapụ pịrịbẹm, nnị ọ ḅaupálịbẹm, tẹ́rẹ́ a dii kárámá éné ọ pịghị fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: ‘The Son of Man must be delivered over to the hands of sinners, be crucified and on the third day be raised again.’”

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma warị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ pa biekóróma.
english_text: Then they remembered his words.

ibani_text: Nnị warị pịghịma ḅo dupu yọ ma ḅụ, warị mịị nyẹ mamgba dugho oyingieapụ findi ọḅụduaapụ ma na jẹ́apụ pịrị.
english_text: When they came back from the tomb, they told all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma anịị Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, Joana na pịghị Meri Jems nyingi nnị na jẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ anị mịnanyẹ ma dugho nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them who told this to the apostles.

ibani_text: Kuma nfịrịmaapụ ma sịịm ḅẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma dughonyẹ ma ọ́ papanyẹ anịgo nnị n mininigha.
english_text: But they did not believe the women, because their words seemed to them like nonsense.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita saghịm sị mangị dupu yọ ma muu, o tughum sị warị dụadipi bịtẹ ma ngéré arịm ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị, kuma dua anị bie ofori. Ọ warị so wárị muu, pághámáa nyẹ ma warị o ḅụ́gbérépuma.
english_text: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ma ḅụ, mmẹẹ́ Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ n pa Immaus sị gbẹ́rẹ́ káláma muarị, Jerusalem ḅụ akị mú anị angaá láa ọ́ sọ́nọ́ma maili.
english_text: Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven milesfrom Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị warị dugho jụghọ jụghọ pịrịarị pághámányẹ mamgba.
english_text: They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.

ibani_text: Nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ, pịghị bịpị ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị sa ori Jizọs warị kikiaḅọ sị saghị nnị na nwángị.
english_text: As they talked and discussed these things with each other, Jesus himself came up and walked along with them;

ibani_text: Nnị ori arịm kụ́ma anị fịnị ḅara, nnị ine o lighilighiḅogha.
english_text: but they were kept from recognizing him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ tẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ jụghọ jụghọ pịrịarị ọ nwángịma muarịnyẹ ma? Nnị warị sẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ ogboku tẹ́mẹ́sii na nna fụ́ḅárá ogbo.
english_text: He asked them,“What are you discussing together as you walk along?” They stood still, their faces downcast.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Kileopas pa sịḅọ, warị ọ gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ngéré biaḅọ Jerusalem ḅụ sị pághárịnyẹ nimighaḅọ mị ndẹa dii ḅụ?
english_text: One of them, named Cleopas, asked him, “Are you the only one visiting Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened there in these days?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Anị tẹ́ nyẹ? Nnị warị pagharaa, Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ḅụ pághányẹ. Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ori ikiakoroḅọ, ọ pịghị opuma kụrọm ọrẹ dughonyẹ ḅụ na ori mịẹnyẹ mamgba ḅụ Tamuno na túminị́ tórúku.
english_text: “What things?”he asked. “About Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “He was a prophet, powerful in word and deed before God and all the people.

ibani_text: Wámịna igwagwaalaapụ na wa táarịapụ ọ saghị pịrịm ḅẹẹ n fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ọ sịbị sị ọ ḅaupálị,
english_text: The chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him;

ibani_text: wa pịghị pa biekpọmaarị ḅẹẹ ori anịị ḅo Izirẹlị ḅọ́rọ́ma bẹḅọ ma. Mịị mamgba wáriso, mịngba anị tẹ́rẹ́ a dii mịnanyẹ ma kiriakị sáá.
english_text: but we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. And what is more, it is the third day since all this took place.

ibani_text: Jẹa ẹ́rẹ wámịna ogboapụ wa ḅụ́gbérépumam, n dupu yọ ma múm dede dede,
english_text: In addition, some of our women amazed us. They went to the tomb early this morning

ibani_text: kụ́ma ine ori oju arịgha. Nnị warị pịghịma ḅo ḅẹẹ n tẹ́mẹ́ju sookumuapụ árịmam, dugho n pịrịapụ ḅẹ́ o dumam.
english_text: but didn’t find his body. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.

ibani_text: Wámịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ dupu yọ ma múm warị mú anị árị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma. Kụ́ma nnị ori arịgha.
english_text: Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see Jesus.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ḅo nnị ḅẹẹ, Dighi ọ mịnị oḅori sọọ ḅara, dighi anịsa pa ọmịnị akịarị ḅara ikiakoroapụ ma dughonyẹ minini.
english_text: He said to them,“How foolish you are, and how slow to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

ibani_text: Anị karakáragha ḅẹẹ, Krais mị tọ́rụ́siarị mamgba árị sị ori ipine ḅụ sọọ?
english_text: Did not the Messiah have to suffer these things and then enter his glory?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị dughofindi nnị pịrị o gbólómanyẹ mamgba Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ, Mosis diri akị muu ikiakoroapụ ma gịẹnyẹ mamgba.
english_text: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo n múuarị káláma ma na kikia sáá, Jizọs warị pa toruku muu dọghụ ḅara pa nwángị kọm.
english_text: As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus continued on as if he were going farther.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ọ nụ́nụ́ ọḅụdaam ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị na fịnị; éné mumam, kánákáná sọ pịghị ḅoarị. Ọ warị somuu n nnị na fịnị.
english_text: But they urged him strongly, “Stay with us, for it is nearly evening; the day is almost over.” So he went in to stay with them.

ibani_text: Ọ kpọrọfịnịm ḅẹẹ ori n nnị na nyẹ́fị, ọ warị fịtúrú akị warị anị boma sị die n pịrị.
english_text: When he was at the table with them, he took bread, gave thanks, broke it and began to give it to them.

ibani_text: Anịsáa anịị nna tọ́rụ́ ḅo findinyẹ sị olighilighiḅo ọ warị ẹmẹẹfa nna tọ́rụ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.

ibani_text: Nnị warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Anị fịnị dọ́ghụ́ma ḅara pa wámịna bie dọghụmagha ọ wamịnị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sa sị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughofindi wa pịrị asọogbo ma ḅụ?
english_text: They asked each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri pịghịma Jerusalem mú nnị oyi ngịẹ ọḅụduaapụ ma árị angaá, nnị na jẹ́apụ na kobiri angaá.
english_text: They got up and returned at once to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, assembled together

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma karakáráma ọ fịị ḅụ saghịmam! Ori ọ ḅụ pa Saimọn diemam!
english_text: and saying, “It is true! The Lord has risen and has appeared to Simon.”

ibani_text: Mmẹapụ ma warị dugho nnị pịrị pághá nyẹ asọogbo sị n pịghị o lighilighiḅo ḅara o fịtúrú die n pịrịarị sáá.
english_text: Then the two told what had happened on the way, and how Jesus was recognized by them when he broke the bread.

ibani_text: Mịná mmẹapụ ma mịma dugho n pịrịarị sáá, n dighi bẹ sáá Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọ ḅụgbọrụ nna ogboku bie sẹ́mam, warị ḅẹẹ, Diin ọ nana fịnị.
english_text: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them,“Peace be with you.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅáláfaam, sịarị ḅẹ́ nnị ibadua árịmam.
english_text: They were startled and frightened, thinking they saw a ghost.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, O tẹ́ go ḅáláfaarị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ tegó mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹarị.
english_text: He said to them,“Why are you troubled, and why do doubts rise in your minds?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ị ḅárákū na ị ḅụọ dighi si árị ḅẹẹ ọ́ ịrị, ọ ḅara pa i lama sị arịị ḅẹẹ, ibadua ojumẹnị na mgbe nyanagha a nyáná ḅara.
english_text: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dughom warị ọ ḅara na o ḅụọ pa n die.
english_text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

ibani_text: Nnị pa ine mininigha, tegó bieḅẹlẹ na ḅụgbérépu nna tọ́rụ́ bim. Anịgo ọ warị n gbíla, Mịnga ọ fị bẹnyẹ nyáná?
english_text: And while they still did not believe it because of joy and amazement, he asked them,“Do you have anything here to eat?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị nnị sọọ nji mpara pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,

ibani_text: Ọ warị akị pẹẹ́ nna tórúku.
english_text: and he took it and ate it in their presence.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị ḅo n ḅẹẹ, Mịị anị a dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ ma a pa ọ nana fịnị sa ḅẹẹ, ị gboloma sị n gịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Mosis ologho diri na ikiakoroapụ ma diri na pịghị ibi Núme diri ma bie anị ḅoo kiri ákịbẹm.
english_text: He said to them,“This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọ warị n tẹ́mẹ́bie findi sị nnị Tamunoẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma akanyaḅo.
english_text: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

ibani_text: Warị n ḅẹẹ, Mị anị n gịẹnyẹ: ḅẹẹ Krais ma tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm, ọ pịghị fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm tẹ́rẹ́ a dii éné ḅọ́rọ́ sáá,
english_text: He told them,“This is what is written: The Messiah will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ ori ẹrẹ ḅụ sii ḅụ pịghị na siiḅụḅarasipịrị oku ma n dugho pághámabẹm sẹ́kiri mamgba ḅụ, Jerusalem ḅụ saghị.
english_text: and repentance for the forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị so pịghị onyẹ́sẹ mịnanyẹ mamgba pịrịm.
english_text: You are witnesses of these things.

ibani_text: I ḅụgbọrụ sọ pa ọ fịrịmabẹm i Daá minini ọ pịrịnyẹ. Kụ́ma o kurufịnịbẹm Jerusalem ḅụ sị sobie saghị ḅo kụ́rọ ma kóróḅo ọmịna ọgọ́nọ́.
english_text: I am going to send you what my Father has promised; but stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ori ọḅụduaapụ daa pághámaḅo opu ama ma bie, akị mú Bẹtani láa. Anị ngaa ọ warị ḅara saghị sị n karịibima.
english_text: When he had led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, he lifted up his hands and blessed them.

ibani_text: Ori n Karịibimaarị sa, ọ kẹ́lẹ́ n ḅụ fofoom, n warị o dighiákị sobie muu.
english_text: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up into heaven.

ibani_text: Nnị susi ọ pịrịm warị opu bieḅẹlẹ pa soo Jerusalem muu.
english_text: Then they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

ibani_text: Nnị warị nna sáá mamgba Tamunoopuwárị ma bie fịnị sị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: And they stayed continually at the temple, praising God.

ibani_text: Súghú sághị ma ḅụ Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma imii, Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma Tamuno na imi, Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pịghị Tamuno.
english_text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

ibani_text: Súghú sághị ma ḅụ ori na Tamuno na imi.
english_text: He was with God in the beginning.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị Tamuno ọ tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ; n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ofori sị ori tẹ́mẹ́gha nyẹ.
english_text: Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụbie anịị duma fịnịnyẹ, anị duma ma anịị túminị́ baá ma.
english_text: In him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind.

ibani_text: Baá ma biarị kánákánábie, kụ́ma kánákáná ma na ine anị akanyaḅogha.
english_text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcomeit.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori oku muḅọ fịrịmam, Jọn pa siḅọ.
english_text: There was a man sent from God whose name was John.

ibani_text: Ori onyésẹ̄ḅọ ḅara pa ḅom sị ọ baá ma gbólómanyẹ dugho págháma bẹ ḅara, sị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ mamgba minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: He came as a witness to testify concerning that light, so that through him all might believe.

ibani_text: Ori ma ḅụgbọrụ baá magha; o ḅom ḅẹẹ ori onyẹ́sẹ baá ma ngéré pịrị.
english_text: He himself was not the light; he came only as a witness to the light.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị karakárá baá, tuminikiri ḅo sị túminị́ mamgba ḅụ biarị nyẹ.
english_text: The true light that gives light to everyone was coming into the world.

ibani_text: O tuminikiri ma bie imi, ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ n bẹ sọ, tuminikiri ma o lighilighiḅogha.
english_text: He was in the world, and though the world was made through him, the world did not recognize him.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ sẹkiriapụ damaḅom, kụ́ma ori a túminị́ ọ daákịgha.
english_text: He came to that which was his own, but his own did not receive him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ daakịapụ mamgba, pịghị ori ẹrẹ ḅụ mininiapụ ọ kụrọ pa nnị pịrịm sị nnị Tamuno awọ sọọ.
english_text: Yet to all who did receive him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God—

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno awọ sọgha túminị́ nna nyingi na nna daa awọ sọ ḅara, anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ daa yii awọ kụ́ma ori Tamuno ma anịị nna Daa.
english_text: children born not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband’s will, but born of God.

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅo tumḅọ sọm sị wamịnị na ngaa. Wamịnị ori ipine árịmam, Daḅọ ma ḅara sághị ḅo Kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na karakárá ḅụ bi ḅo.
english_text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.

ibani_text: Jọn o gbólómanyẹ dugho pághámam, ori owu pághámam dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Mịị ori a o gbólómanyẹ ma dugho ḅọ ma, Ị́yẹ́ ọḅụju ḅoarịḅọ ma ori dụḅa i nẹngịm tẹ́ go na nnị i yiigha sa éné éné ḅụ ori imii.
english_text: (John testified concerning him. He cried out, saying, “This is the one I spoke about when I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.’ ”)

ibani_text: Ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ bi wasa ḅara gosi ọ wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba bomam, gbẹ́rẹ́ boma ḅụ akị mú jẹ́ la.
english_text: Out of his fullness we have all received grace in place of grace already given.

ibani_text: Tamuno ólóghó ma Mosis ḅara sághịḅom, kụ́ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na karakárá Jizọs Krais ḅara sághịḅom.
english_text: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ jẹ́ éné na Tamuno arịgha. Kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ tụ́wọ ma, ori na Tamuno na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma, ori ma pịghị Daḅọ ma ngása imi, ori ma pịghị mịẹmam sị wamịnị o nimi.
english_text: No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God andis in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị Jọn dugho págháma nyẹ, Jerusalem Juuapụ sịbịdaapụ Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ na Livai furoawọ fịrịma sáá ḅẹẹ n ḅo o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ịrị tụọ mọ?
english_text: Now this was John’s testimony when the Jewish leadersin Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him who he was.

ibani_text: Jọn anị pighigha ḅara ḅụ dughom, kụ́ma dughofindi n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ịrị Krais maagha.
english_text: He did not fail to confess, but confessed freely, “I am not the Messiah.”

ibani_text: Nnị o gbilam, Anịsáa Ịrị tụọ? Ịrị Elaija? Ori nnị pagharam, Irịgha. Túminị́ ma warị sima gbíla, Ịrị ikiakoroḅọ ma? Ori nnị pagharam, Irịgha.
english_text: They asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No.”

ibani_text: Kunema n dughom, Ịrị Tụọ? Wa págháraa, wa dughonyẹ nyáná wa fịrịmaapụ pịrịbẹ ḅara. Ị gbólómanyẹ ma ḅụ ị tẹ́ dugho?
english_text: Finally they said, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

ibani_text: Jọn pagharam nnị dugho warị ḅara ikiakoro Aizaya diri bie, Ịrị anịị owuarị pụghọ elesiri ḅụ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ ma mịẹ gbụ́nụ́nụ́ maá!
english_text: John replied in the words of Isaiah the prophet, “I am the voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way for the Lord.’ ”

ibani_text: Mị́sa jẹ́ Farisiiapụ, n fịrịmamaapụ
english_text: Now the Pharisees who had been sent

ibani_text: o gbilam, Ị tẹ́ go mingi sáráarị ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ Krais maagha, anịgha Elaija anịgha ikiakoroḅọ ma?
english_text: questioned him, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Messiah, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”

ibani_text: Jọn pagharam, A mingi pa túminị́ saram, kụ́ma ọmịnị ogboku bie sẹ́fịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ imi o nimighaḅọ.
english_text: “I baptize withwater,” John replied, “but among you stands one you do not know.

ibani_text: Ori anịị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụju ḅoarị ḅo, o sua agbaa a laagha sị tughu anị fiima.
english_text: He is the one who comes after me, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.”

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakịm Bẹtani ḅụ anịị ịrụa ma saghị saghị párángáa Jọdan tọ́rụ ma ḅụ, Jọn mingi saraarị ngá.
english_text: This all happened at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅa Jọn Jizọs arịm nwángị ọ fịnịnga ḅoarị warị ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ánáná ma dighi, tuminikiri gbọrụ sii dighiákị soarị ḅọ!
english_text: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

ibani_text: Mịị a ḅẹ́arịḅọ ma, a ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ị́yẹ́ ọḅụju ḅoarị kụ́ma o gélé i nẹngịm, tegó na nnị i yiigha sáá éné éné ori imii.
english_text: This is the one I meant when I said, ‘A man who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.’

ibani_text: Irị ḅụgbọrụ o nimigha, kụ́ma a go ḅo sị mingi pa túminị́ sararị nyẹ anịị ori ọ ḅụ pa Izirẹlị diepágháma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I myself did not know him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was that he might be revealed to Israel.”

ibani_text: Jọn mịị dugho págháma nyẹ ma nyánam: A Tẹ́mẹ́ ma arịm sobie saghị kóróḅo elesia ḅara ma sị ori ọgọnọ fịnịm.
english_text: Then John gave this testimony: “I saw the Spirit come down from heaven as a dove and remain on him.

ibani_text: A o nimiḅobịgha, kuma i fịrịma ḅọ ma ḅẹ́ a ḅoo mingi sara, dugho i pịrịm, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kóróḅo sị oju ḅụ gbánā fịnị owitụ́wọ ma ori ma anịị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa mingi pa ọ sara bẹḅọ.
english_text: And I myself did not know him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is the one who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’

ibani_text: A árịmam pịghị dugho págháma ḅẹẹ mịị Tamuno Tụwọ ma.
english_text: I have seen and I testify that this is God’s Chosen One.”

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅa, Jọn anị ngaa imii ori na ori mmẹẹ́ a ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.

ibani_text: O Jizọs arịm ọ ḅọ́rọ́arị sáá, warị ḅẹẹ, Tamuno Ánáná ma dighi!
english_text: When he saw Jesus passing by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ma Jọn náa sị mịma dugho sáá, nnị Jizọs duam.
english_text: When the two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ́ pịghị sáá, Jizọs nna arịm o duarị, sị n gbilam, Ọ tẹ́ dọghụ? Nnị pagharam, Rabbai
english_text: Turning around, Jesus saw them following and asked,“What do you want?” They said, “Rabbi” (which means “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Ḅoo, ọ pịghị árịbẹm. Nnị warị muu sị muu ọ fịnịarị ngá ma árị nnị warị anị ngá ọ nana fịnị anị éné ma ḅụ, mịma anịị ḅupiri ḅụ ínia énékịẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Come,”he replied,“and you will see.” So they went and saw where he was staying, and they spent that day with him. It was about four in the afternoon.

ibani_text: Anduru Saimọn Pita numboru owitụ́wọ anịị mmẹapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Jọn dughonyẹ naaḅọ sị pịghị Jizọs dua.
english_text: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who heard what John had said and who had followed Jesus.

ibani_text: Anduru parị mịẹnyẹ anịị ori o numboru owitụ́wọ dọghụ pághámaḅom sị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Wa Mesaya ma árịmam (anịị Krais ma)
english_text: The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and tell him, “We have found the Messiah” (that is, the Christ).

ibani_text: Ọ warị ọ pa Jizọs damaḅo. Jizọs tọ́rụ́ pịghị o dighim sị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị Saimọn Jọn tụ́wọ, Kefas. (Anịị n pa ị sị bẹnyẹ mịma anịị n pa Pita sị nyẹ.)
english_text: And he brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said,“You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas”(which, when translated, is Peter).

ibani_text: Jẹ́ éné ḅá sáá Jizọs ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie tọmam ḅẹẹ ọ Galili mubẹm. O ḅo Filipụ árị sáá ori ọ ḅẹm, I dua.
english_text: The next day Jesus decided to leave for Galilee. Finding Philip, he said to him,“Follow me.”

ibani_text: Filipụ Bẹtịsaida ḅụ saghịḅom, Anduru na Pita ngá ama.
english_text: Philip, like Andrew and Peter, was from the town of Bethsaida.

ibani_text: Filipụ Natanieli dọghụ pághámaḅom sị dugho o pịrị ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị o dọghụ pághámaḅomam, Mosis o gbólómanyẹ dughoḅọ ma ólóghó diri ma bie, na pịghị ikiakoroapụ ma o gbólómanyẹ dughoḅọ ma Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅo Josẹf tụ́wọ.
english_text: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and about whom the prophets also wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”

ibani_text: Natanieli gbilam, Nazarẹtị ḅụ anị bie págháḅo bẹ ibinyẹ imi? Filipụ pagharam Ḅo dighi.
english_text: “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael asked. “Come and see,” said Philip.

ibani_text: Jizọs Natanieli árị sị ọ ḅoarị sáá, mịị o gboloma sị o dughonyẹ, Mịị karakárá Izirẹlịḅọ, epele ḅụ oforighaḅọ.
english_text: When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said of him,“Here truly is an Israelite in whom there is no deceit.”

ibani_text: Natanieli gbilam, I tọ́rọ́ pa ị nimi? Jizọs pagharam, A ị́yẹ́ arịm i pa fịgị sịị ma suu fịnịarị sáá, Filipụ na ị sịgha sáá.
english_text: “How do you know me?” Nathanael asked. Jesus answered,“I saw you while you were still under the fig tree before Philip called you.”

ibani_text: Natanieli ọ pagharam Rabbai, ị́rị anịị Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma, ịrị anịị Izirẹlị Ámányánáḅọ ma.
english_text: Then Nathanael declared, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the king of Israel.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ị mininim tegó a dugho i pịrịm ḅẹ́ a ị́yẹ́ arịm fịgị sịị ma sughu. Ị mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ árịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus said,“You believebecause I told you I saw you under the fig tree. You will see greater things than that.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị jẹ́nyẹ dugho, A karakárányẹ ma dugho i pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm so ma findi ngaa sị Tamuno oku muapụ ma arịị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ḅụ tándị iwọarị pịghị ọ tándị kóróḅoarị.
english_text: He then added,“Very truly I tell you,youwill see ‘heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending on’the Son of Man.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii kárámá éné ma, ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa kiriakịm Kana ḅụ anịị Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, Jizọs nyingi sọ anị ngaa imii.
english_text: On the third day a wedding took place at Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ sim ḅẹẹ nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa ma ḅoo.
english_text: and Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.

ibani_text: Nna iru faá sáá, Jizọs nyingiḅọ ọ ḅẹm, Nnị mịnị jẹ́ iru nyanagha.
english_text: When the wine was gone, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no more wine.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, I dugho i pịrịbịgha a mịẹbẹnyẹ? I sáá na laagha.
english_text: “Woman,why do you involve me?”Jesus replied.“My hour has not yet come.”

ibani_text: O nyingi warị fịrịnwangịapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị o dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ.
english_text: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”

ibani_text: Suéné a ngu pịghị kikia ngá imi, dapịrịbie n kara pághámaḅo nyẹ, mịị anị Juuapụ ma pa ḅụọ na ḅara sịrị sịrị nyẹ, nyẹ́ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ ngu ine si galọn akị mú sue galọn ọlọm.
english_text: Nearby stood six stone water jars, the kind used by the Jews for ceremonial washing, each holding from twenty to thirty gallons.

ibani_text: Jizọs fịrịnwangịapụ ma ḅẹm, O mingi pa ngu ma sua bima. Nnị warị mingi ma sua lẹ́pụ lẹ́pụ ma.
english_text: Jesus said to the servants,“Fill the jars with water”; so they filled them to the brim.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị dugho nnị pịrị, Mị́sa ọ jẹa nyẹ du pa fị na ḅụ na ma sịbịdáḅọ pịrị. Nnị ọkọ mịẹm,
english_text: Then he told them,“Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet.” They did so,

ibani_text: Fị na ḅụ na ma sịbịdáḅọ warị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa n pịghị iru mịẹ mingi ma gbolo. Ori ine nimiḅogha anị sághị ḅo ngá, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ mingi ma duḅo fịrịnwangịapụ ma nimim. Anịsáa ọ warị ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaaḅọ ma sị ngásá pịrị
english_text: and the master of the banquet tasted the water that had been turned into wine. He did not realize where it had come from, though the servants who had drawn the water knew. Then he called the bridegroom aside

ibani_text: sị ḅẹẹ, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ parị ibiḅaa iru ma akuokuom igoniapụ ma iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ḅáma sáá, anịị nnị papa iru ma akuoakuo nyẹ, kụ́ma ịrị ị́ ibiḅaa iru ma keke ḅo mị́sa ma lam.
english_text: and said, “Everyone brings out the choice wine first and then the cheaper wine after the guests have had too much to drink; but you have saved the best till now.”

ibani_text: Mịị Jizọs mịẹ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma Kana ḅụ, anịị Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ. Anị ḅara ma ori ọrẹ ipine diepághámam, ori ọḅụduaapụ warị ọḅụ minini nyáná.
english_text: What Jesus did here in Cana of Galilee was the first of the signs through which he revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa o terékoro Kapanọm múm ori na o nyingi, ori owiapụ mịnaapụ, na pịghị ori ọḅụduaapụ. Anị ngá n kálá dii nyẹ fịnịm.
english_text: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother and brothers and his disciples. There they stayed for a few days.

ibani_text: Juuapụ Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma ḅo opuma kikia sáá, Jizọs iwo so Jerusalem múm.
english_text: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwarị ma bie ọ kị́nị́ arịm kọ́rọ́náma na, ánáná na elesia dẹrịapụ na jẹ́apụ ịkasị ọgọnọ fịnị sị igbii dimaarị.
english_text: In the temple courts he found people selling cattle, sheep and doves, and others sitting at tables exchanging money.

ibani_text: Ọ warị árị́dírí pa fomunyẹ́ mịẹsị nnị kị́nị́mamgba deesi Tamunoopuwarị ma párángáa, ánáná na kọ́rọ́náma na; ori igbii dimáapụ ma igbii tẹ́ gálágálá ma sị pịghị nna opu ịkasị ma pịghị ọgọnọ́dam.
english_text: So he made a whip out of cords, and drove all from the temple courts, both sheep and cattle; he scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.

ibani_text: Elesia dẹ́rịarịapụ ma ori n ḅẹm, Mịnanyẹ ma taási mịnga! O tegó i Daa warị ma pịghị pa fẹ́siri mịẹ!
english_text: To those who sold doves he said,“Get these out of here! Stop turning my Father’s house into a market!”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ warị pa biekóróma ḅẹ́ n gịẹ ḅọ́rọ́man tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ wárị fịrị ma ḅẹlẹma, ibie dọ́ghụ́maarị fịnị ḅara ma.
english_text: His disciples remembered that it is written: “Zeal for your house will consume me.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma warị ọ ḅara bi ḅẹ́, I tẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị bẹ sị pa wa die ḅẹ́ i kụrọ nyanam pa mịná fịrị mamgba nwángịarị?
english_text: The Jews then responded to him, “What sign can you show us to prove your authority to do all this?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Mịị Tamunoopuwárị ma nụ́nụ́ka tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅụ a sima anị namabẹm.
english_text: Jesus answered them,“Destroy this temple, and I will raise it again in three days.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma pagharam, Anị kụ́rá ini faá kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi ákịmam mịị Tamunoopuwárị ma nama ḅụ, ị tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅụ sima anị nama bẹ?
english_text: They replied, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and you are going to raise it in three days?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ḅẹarị Tamunoopuwárị ma anịị ori oju.
english_text: But the temple he had spoken of was his body.

ibani_text: Ọ fịị ḅụ saghị fama sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ pa biekórómaḅom o dughonyẹ. Anịsáa n warị tọ́ndiri ma minini na pịghị Jizọs kọọ maá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ.
english_text: After he was raised from the dead, his disciples recalled what he had said. Then they believed the scripture and the words that Jesus had spoken.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jizọs pa Jerusalem ḅụ imi sáá, Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma bie, tọghaapụ ọ nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma arịm sị ori ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ minini.
english_text: Now while he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Festival, many people saw the signs he was performing and believed in his name.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs ọ ḅụ sághị nna ḅarabie suabịgha, tegó o túminị́ mamgba nimim.
english_text: But Jesus would not entrust himself to them, for he knew all people.

ibani_text: Ọ kị́nị́ bigha sị n túminị́ gbolomanyẹ dugho ọ pịrị tegó ori ma nimim túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ.
english_text: He did not need any testimony about mankind, for he knew what was in each person.

ibani_text: Mị́sa gbẹ́rẹ́ Farisii owitụ́wọ imi Nikodimọs pa sịḅọ, táarị Juuapụ ma ogbobie gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Now there was a Pharisee, a man named Nicodemus who was a member of the Jewish ruling council.

ibani_text: O Jizọs damaḅom dii bie sị ḅẹẹ, Rabbai, wa nimim ḅẹ́ ịrị anị Tamuno ḅara sághị ḅo nyẹ́dieḅọ. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine i nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nwángịbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno nnị ḅo na ofori.
english_text: He came to Jesus at night and said, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the signs you are doing if God were not with him.”

ibani_text: Ori ọ págháraarị sáá, Jizọs dughom ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine Tamuno kọnsịn ma arịbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ nnị sima n ḅo yiigha yiigha.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Very truly I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless they are born again.”

ibani_text: Nikodimọs gbilam, Nnị tọ́rọ́pa owitụ́wọ yii bẹ n ḅo ọ́lọ́máa sáá? Karakárányẹ ori ine mmẹẹ́ kárámá sá pa o nyingi furobie sọbịgha sị n ḅo o yii!
english_text: “How can someone be born when they are old?” Nicodemus asked. “Surely they cannot enter a second time into their mother’s womb to be born!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine Tamuno kọnsịn ma sọbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ n mingi na Tẹ́mẹ́ pa n ḅo yiigha yiigha.
english_text: Jesus answered,“Very truly I tell you, no one can enter the kingdom of God unless they are born of water and the Spirit.

ibani_text: Ojumẹnị ojumẹnị yiim, kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma Tẹ́mẹ́ yiim.
english_text: Flesh gives birth to flesh, but the Spiritgives birth to spirit.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anị ịḅụ ḅụ́gbérépuma ma, Nnị sima ị yii nyánam.
english_text: You should not be surprised at my saying, ‘Youmust be born again.’

ibani_text: Fọ́rụ ma ofuro anị ḅụḅẹlẹ ngá daari. Ịrị anị ọwụ naarị, kụ́ma inimigha anị saghị ḅo angaá anịgha anị muarị ngá. Anị ḅara ma anịị nnị Tẹ́mẹ́ pa yiiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you cannot tell where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit.”

ibani_text: Nikodimọs gbilam, Mịma anị ḅọ́rọ́ tọrọ́ pa fịnị bẹ?
english_text: “How can this be?” Nicodemus asked.

ibani_text: Jizọs dughom, Ịrị kọkọ Izirẹlịapụ nyẹ́dieḅọ sị mịnanyẹ ma akanyaḅogha?
english_text: “You are Israel’s teacher,”said Jesus,“and do you not understand these things?

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm, wa níminyẹ ma anịị wa dughoarị nyẹ, wamịnị árịmaa nyẹ ma anịị wa dugho pághámaarị nyẹ kụ́ma ọmịnị wámịna dugho págháma nyẹ ma daákịgha.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, we speak of what we know, and we testify to what we have seen, but still you people do not accept our testimony.

ibani_text: A tuminikiri gbolomanyẹ dugho ị pịrịmam ị pa mininigha; anịsáa ị tọ́rọ́pa minini bẹ a so gbolomanyẹ dugho sáá?
english_text: I have spoken to you of earthly things and you do not believe; how then will you believe if I speak of heavenly things?

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ jẹ́ éné na sobie mugha, sobie saghị ḅoḅọ ma ngéré anịị Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma.
english_text: No one has ever gone into heaven except the one who came from heaven—the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Mosis elesiri ḅụ ododó ma saghị ọgọ́nọ́ daá ḅara ma, anị ḅara anịị nnị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma sághị ọ́gọ́nọ daá bẹ ḅara,
english_text: Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,

ibani_text: sị ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine duma gbámásó nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: that everyone who believes may have eternal life in him.”

ibani_text: Tamuno opuma tuminikiri ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam ẹrẹ́sị ori ọrẹ kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tụ́wọ ma pịrịm, sị ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịnị fịbịghaa kụ́ma duma gbámásó nyánábẹm.
english_text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ Tụ́wọ fịrịma tuminikiri ḅogha ḅẹ́ o ḅoo anị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ sọ, kụ́ma ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha n ḅọ sịbị, kụ́ma mininighaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ pẹ́lẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́mamam n ḅọ sịbị, tegó n ḅọ na Tamuno kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tụ́wọ ma ḅụ mininigha.
english_text: Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already because they have not believed in the name of God’s one and only Son.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ pẹ́lẹ́ma ḅẹẹ: Baá sọọ tuminikiri ma ḅomam, kụ́ma tuminikiriapụ baá ma nakaragha kánákáná ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam tegó nna mịẹnyẹ opuma sim.
english_text: This is the verdict: Light has come into the world, but people loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil.

ibani_text: Siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ baá ma ḅẹlẹmagha n ḅo pịghị baá ma dámáḅobịgha ḅáláfa go, ḅẹẹ baá ma mịẹbẹm sị kị́nị́mamgba n ḅọ fịrị arịị.
english_text: Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that their deeds will be exposed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma karakáráma pa ngáarị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ baá ma bie sọḅo sọḅom, sị kị́nị́mamgba árị bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́, n ḅo mịẹnyẹ ma Tamuno ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị n ḅo anị mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen plainly that what they have done has been done in the sight of God.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ gbẹ́rẹ́ Judiya kálá ámá múm sị anị ngá kẹ́lẹ́ dii fịnị sị pịghị mingi pa kị́nị́ sárá.
english_text: After this, Jesus and his disciples went out into the Judean countryside, where he spent some time with them, and baptized.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jọn sọ mingi sáráarị Aenon ḅụ anịị Salim na kikia ngá, tegó anị ngá mingi dụḅam túminị́ pịghị sámámgba anị ngá ma ḅoarị n mingi sára bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Now John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water, and people were coming and being baptized.

ibani_text: (Mị sáá ma, na nnị Jọn pa ịkóli bie suagha.)
english_text: (This was before John was put in prison.)

ibani_text: Jọn ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ warị saghị gbẹ́rẹ́ Juuḅọ na ḅẹ́rẹ́ nụná ḅụ́ọ́sịrị na ḅárásịrị mịẹ mịẹnyẹ ma gosi.
english_text: An argument developed between some of John’s disciples and a certain Jew over the matter of ceremonial washing.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Jọn dámámuu sị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, i biekórómagha ịrí na fịnị owitụ́wọ ma Jọdan tọ́rụ́ ma ḅụ (anịị ịrụa ma saghị saghị ngá ma ḅụ) ịrị o gbolomanyẹ dughoḅọ ma, dighi o mingi sáráarị kị́nị́mamgba pịghị o dámámụarị.
english_text: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan—the one you testified about—look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.”

ibani_text: Jọn warị mịma pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Tumḅọ ine bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ nyánáḅobịgha ḅọ́rọ́ sobie nnị saghị n ḅọ pịrịgha.
english_text: To this John replied, “A person can receive only what is given them from heaven.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sọ onyẹsẹ́ i pịrịbẹm ḅẹẹ, a dughom ḅẹ́, Irị Krais magha, kụ́ma nnị i fịrịmam ḅẹẹ a tarị ọ ḅụ ḅoo.
english_text: You yourselves can testify that I said, ‘I am not the Messiah but am sent ahead of him.’

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma fịnị ọrụḅọyaḅọ ma pịrịm kụ́ma ọrụḅọyaḅọ ma nángwọ fịrịnwangị ọ pịrịarịḅọ ma ngása sẹ sị o pughu pughum, sị bieḅẹlẹ ori ọrụḅọyaḅọ ma pụghọ náa sáá. Mịị ị́yẹ́ bieḅẹlẹ ma ḅo furo bi ḅara.
english_text: The bride belongs to the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom waits and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom’s voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.

ibani_text: Ori géléḅa nyánam; irị ịrụ nyánam.
english_text: He must become greater; I must become less.”

ibani_text: Sobie sághị ḅoḅọ ma kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịm; tuminikiri sághị ḅoḅọ ma fịnị tuminikiri pịrịm, sị pịghị tuminikiriḅọ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị, sobie sághị ḅoḅọ ma kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịm.
english_text: The one who comes from above is above all; the one who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks as one from the earth. The one who comes from heaven is above all.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ pa árị pịghị biri namaa nyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ anịị o dugho pághámaarị nyẹ, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ori dugho págháma nyẹ ma daákịgha.
english_text: He testifies to what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị daákịmáaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅara pụ́nụ́ anị pịrịmam ḅẹẹ Tamuno ori ma karakáram.
english_text: Whoever has accepted it has certified that God is truthful.

ibani_text: Tamuno fịrịmaḅọ ma Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma kọarị, ḅẹ́ Tamuno ẹ́kẹ́tọgha ḅara pa ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịarị.
english_text: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for Godgives the Spirit without limit.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma Tụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam sị pịghị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa o ḅárabie suamam.
english_text: The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ duma gbámásó nyánam, kụ́ma Tụ́wọ ma sịghịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ duma arịbịgha, ḅẹ́ Tamuno igani fịnị n ḅọ pịrịm.
english_text: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life, but whoever rejects the Son will not see life, for God’s wrath remains on them.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma nam ḅẹ́ Jizọs ọ tọgha ọḅụduaapụ nyánáḅoo Jọn nẹ́ngịarị ọ pịghị mingi pa nnị saraarị.
english_text: Now Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John—

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ ori ma Jizọs mingi pa nnị saragha, kụ́ma ori ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: although in fact it was not Jesus who baptized, but his disciples.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma mịma náa sáá, o Judiya ama warịsom sị pịghịma Galili mú.
english_text: So he left Judea and went back once more to Galilee.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ ọ pịghị Sameriya bie ḅọ́rọ́ nyánam.
english_text: Now he had to go through Samaria.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅo Saika pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ ámá láa Sameriya opu ama bie, anịị Jekọpụ pa ọ tụ́wọ Josẹf pịrị kiri ma na kikiam.
english_text: So he came to a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the plot of ground Jacob had given to his son Joseph.

ibani_text: Jekọpụ mingi du igbe ma aningáa imii, Jizọs, ịnyọ ọ ḅụ famam muunyẹ ma gosi, warị igbe ma ngása kpọrọfịnị. Anịsáa ma anịị éné ogbo.
english_text: Jacob’s well was there, and Jesus, tired as he was from the journey, sat down by the well. It was about noon.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Sameriya ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅom ḅẹ́ a mingi duu, Jizọs a ḅẹm, Mingi pa i pịrị a ḅuu.
english_text: When a Samaritan woman came to draw water, Jesus said to her,“Will you give me a drink?”

ibani_text: (Ori ọḅụduaapụ ama bie ma sọmam nnị fị́nyẹ fẹ́ bẹ ḅara.)
english_text: (His disciples had gone into the town to buy food.)

ibani_text: Sameriya ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ọ ḅẹm, Ịrị Juuḅọ irị Sameriya ọ́rụ́ḅọ. Ị tọ́rọ pa i ḅarabie ḅuu mingi biarị? (Ḅẹẹ Juuapụ na Sameriyaapụ mịẹgbólóma nyẹ nyanagha.)
english_text: The Samaritan woman said to him, “You are a Jew and I am a Samaritan woman. How can you ask me for a drink?” (For Jews do not associate with Samaritans.)

ibani_text: Jizọs a pagharam, I ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno dienyẹ ma nimim pịghị ị ḅara ḅuu mingi biarị ḅọ ma nimi. Nwọfịnị ịrị ọ ḅárabie bimam ọ pịghị duma mingi ma pa ị pịrị ḅọ́rọ́mamam.
english_text: Jesus answered her,“If you knew the gift of God and who it is that asks you for a drink, you would have asked him and he would have given you living water.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ọ ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, i mingi du nyẹ ọlọgha mingi du igbe ma sọ póghólóm. I tẹ́ angaá mịị duma mingi ma nyáná ḅo bẹ?
english_text: “Sir,” the woman said, “you have nothing to draw with and the well is deep. Where can you get this living water?

ibani_text: I wámịna tádóḅọ Jekọpụ nẹ́ngị mịị mingi ḅuu igbe ma pa wa pịrịḅọ, pịghị anị bie duu ḅuu ḅọ, ori awọ duu ḅuu, ori na ọri a nama?
english_text: Are you greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, as did also his sons and his livestock?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Mịị mingi ma ḅuu ḅo gonyẹ́ jẹ́ mingi n ḅo pụghọ tarịbẹm,
english_text: Jesus answered,“Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,

ibani_text: kụ́ma a pịrịbẹ mingi ma ḅuu ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅo pụghọ mịnị jẹ́ pa sámụ́nọbịgha. A pịrị ḅuu bẹ mingi karakáráma mingi du igbe dighibẹm n ḅo bie, sẹnị sị duma gbámásó pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: but whoever drinks the water I give them will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give them will become in them a spring of water welling up to eternal life.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, mịị mingi ma pa i pịrị i pụghọ mịnị jẹ́ pa sámụ́nọbịgha ḅara a pịghị jẹ́ pa mịnga ḅo mingi dubịgha ḅara.
english_text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water so that I won’t get thirsty and have to keep coming here to draw water.”

ibani_text: Jizọs a ḅẹ́m, Muu, i dee sịị, sị pịghịma ḅoo.
english_text: He told her,“Go, call your husband and come back.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pagharam, A dee nyanagha. Jizọs a ḅẹm, Ị karakáram i dugho sáá ḅẹẹ i dee nyanagha.
english_text: “I have no husband,” she replied. Jesus said to her,“You are right when you say you have no husband.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́ sịbị ma karakárá dughoarị ḅẹẹ i sọ́nọ́ a dee nyánámam, ḅẹ́ mị́sa ịrị na fịnịḅọ ma sọ i deegha mịị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri i dughonyẹ ma karakárányẹ.
english_text: The fact is, you have had five husbands, and the man you now have is not your husband. What you have just said is quite true.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅẹm, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a arịḅom ḅẹẹ ịrị ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: “Sir,” the woman said, “I can see that you are a prophet.

ibani_text: Wámịna tádọ́apụ mịị tụ́ndụ ma ḅụ susi Tamuno pịrịm, kụ́ma ọmịnị Juuapụ dughom ḅẹ́ Jerusalem ḅụ ngéré anịị tumḅọ ine susi Tamuno pịrịbẹ angaá.
english_text: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you Jews claim that the place where we must worship is in Jerusalem.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho pághámam, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ, I minini, sáá ma ḅoarị i mịnị mị tụ́ndụ́ ọ́gọ́nọ anịgha Jerusalem ḅụ susi Tamuno pịrịbịgha.
english_text: “Woman,”Jesus replied,“believe me, a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Sameriyaapụ susi o nimigha nyẹ pịrịm; wamịnị susi wa níminyẹ pịrịm, ḅẹ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ma Juuapụ ḅara anịị anị sághị ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: You Samaritans worship what you do not know; we worship what we do know, for salvation is from the Jews.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅoarị sáá ma pịghị lámam, karakárá ḅụ Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ ma Daḅọ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄bẹm tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị karakárá ḅụ, ḅẹ́ mịná Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄apụ ma anịị Daḅọ ma biarịapụ.
english_text: Yet a time is coming and has now come when the true worshipers will worship the Father in the Spirit and in truth, for they are the kind of worshipers the Father seeks.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori anịị Tẹ́mẹ́, o tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ pịghị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄bẹm Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị karakárá ḅụ.
english_text: God is spirit, and his worshipers must worship in the Spirit and in truth.”

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅẹm, A nimim ḅẹ́ Mesaya
english_text: The woman said, “I know that Messiah” (called Christ) “is coming. When he comes, he will explain everything to us.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị dugho pághámá ḅẹ́, Ịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ pịrịarịḅọ ma, irị anịị ori.
english_text: Then Jesus declared,“I, the one speaking to you—I am he.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ ori ọḅụduaapụ pịghịma ḅom, anị warị nna ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépuma nna árị sáá ḅẹẹ ori gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ gbilagha ḅẹ́, I tẹ́ dọghụ? Anịgha I tẹ́ go árị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị.
english_text: Just then his disciples returned and were surprised to find him talking with a woman. But no one asked, “What do you want?” or “Why are you talking with her?”

ibani_text: A warị árị mingi ngu wáriso, sị ámá bie ma sọ sị dugho túminị́ ma pịrị aningáa ḅẹ́,
english_text: Then, leaving her water jar, the woman went back to the town and said to the people,

ibani_text: O ḅo dighi a mịẹmáa nyẹ mamgba dugho i pịrịmaá ḅo. Mịị ḅọ ma ọ sị ḅẹẹ ori Krais magha?
english_text: “Come, see a man who told me everything I ever did. Could this be the Messiah?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ámá ma bie págháḅo Jizọs dámámuu.
english_text: They came out of the town and made their way toward him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ ori ọḅụduaapụ warị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, kálá fị́nyẹ nyẹ fịị.
english_text: Meanwhile his disciples urged him, “Rabbi, eat something.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori nnị ḅẹm, A fị́fị́nyẹ nyánam ọmịnị anị gbolomanyẹ nimigha nyẹ.
english_text: But he said to them,“I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Fị́nyẹ akuoo ọ pịrị ḅo imi?
english_text: Then his disciples said to each other, “Could someone have brought him food?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ fị́nyẹ anịị i fịrịmaḅọ ma binyẹ mịẹ sị pịghị ori fịrị ma nwángifama.
english_text: “My food,”said Jesus,“is to do the will of him who sent me and to finish his work.

ibani_text: I dughogha mọ ḅẹẹ, Ínia akalụ́ kọm, anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa duasughu? A dugho ọ pịrịm ọ tọ́rụ́ findi sị dua ma dighi nnị karakárámam duasughu ḅụ.
english_text: Don’t you have a saying, ‘It’s still four months until harvest’? I tell you, open your eyes and look at the fields! They are ripe for harvest.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ori duasughuarịḅọ ma gbẹ́nyẹ nyanaḅoarị, n ḅọ pịghị sịịmgbọlụ kobiri pa duma gbámásó pịrịarị, sị dụadipiḅọ na pịghị ori duasughuḅọ nnị mamgba bieḅẹlẹ dụrụkụbẹm.
english_text: Even now the one who reaps draws a wage and harvests a crop for eternal life, so that the sower and the reaper may be glad together.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anị dughonyẹ ma karakárányẹ sọ ḅara, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dipim jụghọ anị sughu.
english_text: Thus the saying ‘One sows and another reaps’ is true.

ibani_text: A ọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ ọ muu ọmịnị ịnyọfama fịrịnwangị pịrịgha ngá ḅụ sughu, o pịghị mú nna tọ́rụ́siarị sọọ nyẹ ma fịmam.
english_text: I sent you to reap what you have not worked for. Others have done the hard work, and you have reaped the benefits of their labor.”

ibani_text: Ámá ma bie fịnị tọgha Sameriyaapụ ḅo ọ ḅụ mininim ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma dugho págháma nyẹ gosi, A mịẹmáa nyẹ mamgba dugho i pị́rị́máaḅọ.
english_text: Many of the Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman’s testimony, “He told me everything I ever did.”

ibani_text: Sameriyaapụ ma ọ damaḅo sáá, nnị ọ ḅẹm ori nnị na fịnị, ọ warị nnị na mmẹẹ́ a dii fịnị.
english_text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they urged him to stay with them, and he stayed two days.

ibani_text: Ori oku ma gosi tọgha tọgha jẹ́apụ ḅo mininiapụ sọm.
english_text: And because of his words many more became believers.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma ḅẹ́m, Mị́sa wa mininim, ị dughonyẹ ma gosigha, kụ́ma wamịnị wa biri pa ọ namam, wa pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ ori anị karakáráma tuminikiri Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ ma.
english_text: They said to the woman, “We no longer believe just because of what you said; now we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this man really is the Savior of the world.”

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ a dii ma ḅọ́rọ́ sa o so Galili múm.
english_text: After the two days he left for Galilee.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jizọs ọ bịpị na dugho pághámamam ḅẹẹ, Ikiakoroḅọ ma osigha nyanagha ori ama bie.
english_text: (Now Jesus himself had pointed out that a prophet has no honor in his own country.)

ibani_text: O muu Galili láa sáá, túminị́ ma ọ datéréma sị igoni pa ori ọkọm, tegó nnị sọ Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma múm Jerusalem ḅụ nnị pịghị arịm ọ mịẹnyẹ mamgba álálị ma ḅụ.
english_text: When he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him. They had seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the Passover Festival, for they also had been there.

ibani_text: O sima Kana pa sị ama ma múm, anịị Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnịnyẹ, o mingi ma pịghị pa iru mịẹ ngá. Gbẹ́rẹ́ ámányánáḅọ wárị fịrịnwangịḅọ pịghị imi, ọ tụwọ obikiri ḅụ imi Kapanọm ḅụ.
english_text: Once more he visited Cana in Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. And there was a certain royal official whose son lay sick at Capernaum.

ibani_text: Mịị owitụ́wọ ma náa sáá bẹ Jizọs Judiya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Galili lámam, ori o damamum sị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ ọ ḅo ọ tụwọ gwọọ, fịfị ḅara fịnịḅọ.
english_text: When this man heard that Jesus had arrived in Galilee from Judea, he went to him and begged him to come and heal his son, who was close to death.

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma arịgha ẹrẹ́sị, ọ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné mininibịgha.
english_text: “Unless you people see signs and wonders,”Jesus told him,“you will never believe.”

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ fịrịwangiḅọ warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, kóróḅo i tụwọ ma na fịịgha sáá.
english_text: The royal official said, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ pagharam, Ịrị ine sọ́bẹm. Ị tụ́wọ dumabẹm. Owitụ́wọ ma Jizọs ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma minini akịm sị sọọ.
english_text: “Go,”Jesus replied,“your son will live.” The man took Jesus at his word and departed.

ibani_text: Ọ pa asọogbo ḅoarị sáá, ori fịrịnwangịapụ oku ma pa ori na donam ḅẹẹ ọ tụ́wọ dumafịnịarị.
english_text: While he was still on the way, his servants met him with the news that his boy was living.

ibani_text: O gbíla sáá bẹ tẹ́ sa biri tụwọ ma gwọnyẹ, Nnị dugho ọ pịrịm biaéné gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ éné ḅá.
english_text: When he inquired as to the time when his son got better, they said to him, “Yesterday, at one in the afternoon, the fever left him.”

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma warị kóróma ḅo ḅẹẹ, mịị Jizọs dugho ọ pịrị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma éné ḅẹẹ, I tụwọ dumabẹm. Ori na o warị gbọrụ warị mininii.
english_text: Then the father realized that this was the exact time at which Jesus had said to him,“Your son will live.”So he and his whole household believed.

ibani_text: Mịị mmẹẹ́ kárámá ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị Jizọs nwángị nyẹ, o Judiya ḅụ saghị ḅọ́rọ́ Galili muu fama sa éné éné.
english_text: This was the second sign Jesus performed after coming from Judea to Galilee.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Jizọs iwóo Jerusalem múm Juuapụ álálị ma go.
english_text: Some time later, Jesus went up to Jerusalem for one of the Jewish festivals.

ibani_text: Jerusalem bie ánáná opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma na kikia angaá, gbẹ́rẹ́ dappa imi anị sọ́nọ́a osu gbẹ́ẹ̄ asọ nyánam, Hiburu ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ Bẹtẹsda anịị nnị pa anị sị nyẹ.
english_text: Now there is in Jerusalem near the Sheep Gate a pool, which in Aramaic is called Bethesdaand which is surrounded by five covered colonnades.

ibani_text: Mịnga ma ḅụ tọgha tọgha ikúléapụ ḅụlọlọ ḅụlọlọm Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ, ikúléapụ na pịghị oju fịịapụ kuruarị mingi ma píiri bẹ sáá.
english_text: Here a great number of disabled people used to lie—the blind, the lame, the paralyzed.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ dappa ma kóróḅo kóróḅom sa ḅụ akị mú sáá láa, ine parị dosi dappa ma ḅụ sọ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sookumuḅọ ma mingi ma píirima sa n ḅo ḅụ fịnị obi gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gwọbẹm.
english_text: For an angel of the Lord would occasionally come down and stir up the water. The first person to step into the pool after this happened would be healed of whatever disease he had.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ anị ngá imii, mmẹẹ́ faá kụ́rá mmẹsi pa obikiri ḅụ fịnịmaa ḅọ.
english_text: One who was there had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.

ibani_text: Jizọs ori árị sị ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị ngá pịghị nimiḅo ḅẹ́ ḅọlọmaa sáá ḅụ mịẹ owitụ́wọ ma obikiri ma ḅụ imi, Jizọs o gbilam, I dọghụ ị́yẹ́ oju ibii?
english_text: When Jesus saw him lying there and learned that he had been in this condition for a long time, he asked him,“Do you want to get well?”

ibani_text: Obi ḅọ ma pagharam, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nyánágha ḅárásua ị pa dappa ma bie sua anị píirima maẹrẹ. A ḅụ́kọ́rọ́maarị sa ḅẹẹ a sọọ, jụghọ i toruku kánáma anị bie sọ́bẹm.
english_text: “Sir,” the invalid replied, “I have no one to help me into the pool when the water is stirred. While I am trying to get in, someone else goes down ahead of me.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Saghị sẹ́! Ị́yẹ́ ibila iko akị sị nwángị.
english_text: Then Jesus said to him,“Get up! Pick up your mat and walk.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri owitụ́wọ ma oju ḅo ibim, ori ọrẹ ibila iko akịm sị nwángịm. Mịnyẹ ma kiriakị éné anịị Juuapụ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma,
english_text: At once the man was cured; he picked up his mat and walked. The day on which this took place was a Sabbath,

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma warị oju gwọḅọ ma ḅẹ́, Mịị éné Ịnyọ́sárá Éné; ólóghó ma íkíkim ị́yẹ́ ibila iko so.
english_text: and so the Jewish leaders said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath; the law forbids you to carry your mat.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori nnị pagharam, I gwọọ owitụ́wọ ma dugho i pịrịm, Ị́yẹ́ ibila saghị akị sị nwángị.
english_text: But he replied, “The man who made me well said to me,‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”

ibani_text: Nnị o gbilam, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ọ́ tụọ ị ḅẹ́ ḅo ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ ibila iko akị sị nwángị?
english_text: So they asked him, “Who is this fellow who told you to pick it up and walk?”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅụ obi gwọọ owitụ́wọ ma nimigha ọ gwọḅọ tegó Jizọs ẹmẹẹ́fámam anị ngá fịnị túminị́ kpo ma bie.
english_text: The man who was healed had no idea who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Jizọs ori na donam Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sị warị ọ ḅẹ́, Dighi mị́sa ị́yẹ́ oju ibimam siinyẹ mịẹ kunema anịgha mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ i láabẹm.
english_text: Later Jesus found him at the temple and said to him,“See, you are well again. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma nwángị sọm sị mú dugho Juuapụ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ Jizọs anị mịẹsị ori oju ibimaa ḅọ.
english_text: The man went away and told the Jewish leaders that it was Jesus who had made him well.

ibani_text: Jizọs mịná fịrị mamgba nwángịarị gosi Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma Juuapụ ma warị sághị ọ pa tọ́rụ́siarị ma.
english_text: So, because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jewish leaders began to persecute him.

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, I Daá ma ọ fịrịnwangịarị akị ḅo mị́sa ma láa, irịsọ a pa fịrịnwangịarị.
english_text: In his defense Jesus said to them,“My Father is always at his work to this very day, and I too am working.”

ibani_text: Mịma gosi Juuapụ ma ịnyọsua asọ dọ́ghụm nnị ḅara warị ọ ḅáa bẹ ḅara; Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ólóghó ngéréghaa o kóró nyẹ, kụ́ma ọ pịghị ḅẹm Tamuno anịị ọ Daá, ọ ḅụ sághị Tamuno na gbasịarị.
english_text: For this reason they tried all the more to kill him; not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị pagharam: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, Tụ́wọ ma ọ ḅara na ine bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha, ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ, tegó Daḅọ ma mịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị Tụ́wọ ma sọ mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: Jesus gave them this answer:“Very truly I tell you, the Son can do nothing by himself; he can do only what he sees his Father doing, because whatever the Father does the Son also does.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma Tụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam sị pịghị ọ mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa Tụ́wọ ma diem. Innh anị ọmịna ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépúmabẹm ḅẹẹ ọ mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ pa o diebẹm.
english_text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him all he does. Yes, and he will show him even greater works than these, so that you will be amazed.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Daḅọ ma fịịapụ saghịmaarị ḅara sị duma pa nna pịrị, anị ḅara ma anị Tụ́wọ ma sọ duma pa ọ pịrị dọghụapụ pịrịarị ḅara.
english_text: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son gives life to whom he is pleased to give it.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịbị sọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọgha kụ́ma ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kụ́rọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa Tụ́wọ ma pịrịmam.
english_text: Moreover, the Father judges no one, but has entrusted all judgment to the Son,

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba kuu pa Tụ́wọ ma pịrị n pịghị kuu pa Daḅọ ma pịrịarị ḅara. Kuu pa Tụ́wọ ma pịrịghaḅọ pịghị kuu pa Daḅọ ma pịrịgha ọ fịrịma ḅooḅọ.
english_text: that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father, who sent him.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naakị sị i fịrịmaḅọ ma minini, gbámásó duma nyánam, nnị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ bieghaa n ḅọ sịbị, n ḅọ fịị saḅa ḅọ́rọ́ duma bie sọ́mam.
english_text: “Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, sá ḅoarị sáá ma pịghị lámam fịịapụ ma Tamuno ma Tụ́wọ pụghọ naábẹm sị naapụ ma dumabẹm.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, a time is coming and has now come when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God and those who hear will live.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Daḅọ ma ọ ḅụbie duma nyáná ḅara, anị ọ pịghị mịẹsị Tụ́wọ ma duma nyáná o ḅụbie.
english_text: For as the Father has life in himself, so he has granted the Son also to have life in himself.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kụ́rọ pa ọ pịrịmam tegó ori anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma.
english_text: And he has given him authority to judge because he is the Son of Man.

ibani_text: Mịma ọmịna ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépuma ma, sáá ma ḅoarị nna dupu bie fịnịapụ mamgba ọ pụghọ naábẹm
english_text: “Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice

ibani_text: sị págháḅo, ibi nyẹ miẹmaapụ sághị sị duma bie sọ́bẹm, sị pịghị siinyẹ miẹmaapụ saghịbẹm sị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ḅụ sọ.
english_text: and come out—those who have done what is good will rise to live, and those who have done what is evil will rise to be condemned.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ kụrọ ḅụ a ine ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha; a náaḅara anịị a ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị ḅara ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ pịghị karakáram, ḅẹẹ a asọ dọghụgha ḅẹẹ a ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ mịẹ, kụ́ma i fịrịma ḅọ ma bieḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear, and my judgment is just, for I seek not to please myself but him who sent me.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ ịḅụ gboloma dugho pághámá nyẹ dugho dugho, ị́yẹ́ dugho pághámá nyẹ ma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori.
english_text: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.

ibani_text: Jụghọ imi ị gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámaarịḅọ a pịghị nimim ḅẹẹ ị gboloma sị o dugho pághámaarị nyẹ ma karakárányẹ.
english_text: There is another who testifies in my favor, and I know that his testimony about me is true.

ibani_text: Jọn anịị ọmịnị okumuuapụ fịrịma dámámuu ḅọ, ọ pịghị sẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ karakárá ma pịrịm.
english_text: “You have sent to John and he has testified to the truth.

ibani_text: Ọkọgha ḅẹẹ, a túminị́ dugho págháma nyẹ daákịm; kụ́ma a anị dughom sị ọmịnị ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Not that I accept human testimony; but I mention it that you may be saved.

ibani_text: Jọn ori anịị kọrị sị pịghị biarị tọndọ ma, ọ pịghị dọghụarị ḅẹ́ kálá sáá tụwọ ḅụ ọmịnị tọndọ ma ḅẹlẹ fị́ị.
english_text: John was a lamp that burned and gave light, and you chose for a time to enjoy his light.

ibani_text: A dugho págháma nyẹ nyánam ikuḅa Jọn dugho pághámá nyẹ nẹ́ngị nyẹ. Ḅẹẹ i Daá pa i pịrịmaá fịrị ma ḅẹ́ a nwángị mú sịbị láama, a pa nwángịarị gbẹ́rẹ́ fịrị ma, dugho pághámaarị ḅẹẹ Daḅọ ma i fịrịmam.
english_text: “I have testimony weightier than that of John. For the works that the Father has given me to finish—the very works that I am doing—testify that the Father has sent me.

ibani_text: Pịghị i fịrịma Daḅọ ma ị gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámamam. Jẹ́ éné nịị ọmịnị ọ pụghọ naagha anịgha árị ọ fịnị ḅara,
english_text: And the Father who sent me has himself testified concerning me. You have never heard his voice nor seen his form,

ibani_text: ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ so ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ofori, ọ pịghị ọ fịrịmaḅọ ma ḅụ mininigha.
english_text: nor does his word dwell in you, for you do not believe the one he sent.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ịnyọsua Tọ́ndiri ma dáwọ, tegó o mininim ḅẹẹ anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ duma gbámásó nyánam. Mịná Tọ́ndiri ma anịị ị gbolomanyẹ dughopaghámáarị nyẹ,
english_text: You studythe Scriptures diligently because you think that in them you have eternal life. These are the very Scriptures that testify about me,

ibani_text: Anị so ọ pa mịnị i damaḅogha sị o duma nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: yet you refuse to come to me to have life.

ibani_text: A túminị́ ḅarabie túminí bigha,
english_text: “I do not accept glory from human beings,

ibani_text: kụ́ma a o nimim. A nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ofori.
english_text: but I know you. I know that you do not have the love of God in your hearts.

ibani_text: A i Daá ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅooman anịsọ ọ pa i daákịgha kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ jụghọ n ḅo ẹ́rẹ́ pa ḅo ọ mịnị n ḅo daákịbẹm.
english_text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me; but if someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rọ pa ine minini bẹ, o jụghọ jụghọ ḅara túminí biarị sáá, kụ́ma ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha sị Tamuno ma ngéré ḅara ḅoo túminí nyáná?
english_text: How can you believe since you accept glory from one another but do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ kóróma ma ḅẹ́ a ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹbẹm Daḅọ ma tórúku. Mosis anịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹ bẹḅọ. Ọ pịghị ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánáḅọ.
english_text: “But do not think I will accuse you before the Father. Your accuser is Moses, on whom your hopes are set.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ Mosis minini ọ pịghị i mininibẹm, ḅẹ́ ori ị gbolomanyẹ gịẹm.
