english_text: If you believed Moses, you would believe me, for he wrote about me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị o gịẹnyẹ ma mininigha sáá, ọ tọrọ́ pa a dughonyẹ ma minini bẹ?
english_text: But since you do not believe what he wrote, how are you going to believe what I say?”

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma ḅọ́rọ́ sa, Jizọs Galili tọ́rụ ma saḅa koro jẹ́ posie aka múm (anịị Tiberios tọ́rụ ma).
english_text: Some time after this, Jesus crossed to the far shore of the Sea of Galilee (that is, the Sea of Tiberias),

ibani_text: Tọgha túminị́ kpo pịghị o duam tegó nnị ori obiapụ ḅụ nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị arịm.
english_text: and a great crowd of people followed him because they saw the signs he had performed by healing the sick.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị tụ́ndụ tándị sị anị ngá ori ọḅụduaapụ na kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: Then Jesus went up on a mountainside and sat down with his disciples.

ibani_text: Juuapụ Saḅaḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kikiamam.
english_text: The Jewish Passover Festival was near.

ibani_text: Jizọs tọ́rụ sághị ọgọnọ dighi sáá sị tọgha túminị́ kpo árị ọ damaḅoarị, ọ dugho Filipụ pịrịm, Wa tẹ́ anga fịtúrú fẹ mịnaapụ ma pịrịbẹ sị n fị́ị?
english_text: When Jesus looked up and saw a great crowd coming toward him, he said to Philip,“Where shall we buy bread for these people to eat?”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma gbilam pa ọ daá dighi, ọ nimiwarịmam ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ.
english_text: He asked this only to test him, for he already had in mind what he was going to do.

ibani_text: Filipụ ọ pagharam ḅẹẹ, Inine akalụ́ igbii karabịgha sị pa fịtúrú fẹ́ sị kálá mpara ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ bịpị láa!
english_text: Philip answered him, “It would take more than half a year’s wagesto buy enough bread for each one to have a bite!”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụdua jụghọ, Anduru, Saimọn Pita numboru dughom,
english_text: Another of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, spoke up,

ibani_text: Mịnga gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá owitụ́wọ imi sọ́nọ́ baali fịtúrú kpo na kálá mmẹẹ́ nji ọlọ ḅo, kụ́ma mịma tẹ́ ngá láa bẹ tọgha túminị́ ogbo?
english_text: “Here is a boy with five small barley loaves and two small fish, but how far will they go among so many?”

ibani_text: Jizọs dughom, Mịẹsị túminị́ ma kpọrọfịnị. Tọgha osuka anị ngá ma ḅụ imi, túminị́ ma pịghị kpọrọfịnịm túminị́ oyi mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si.
english_text: Jesus said,“Have the people sit down.”There was plenty of grass in that place, and they sat down (about five thousand men were there).

ibani_text: Jizọs warị fịtúrú ma saghị akị, ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ sị anị die pa kpọrọfịnịapụ mamgba pịrị n fị dọghụ ḅara. Anị ḅara ma anị ọ pịghị nji ma die ḅara.
english_text: Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were seated as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba fị furo bima sáá, ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ ḅẹm, Kọọ mpara mpara ma gbálā kubiri. Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ guluguluma.
english_text: When they had all had enough to eat, he said to his disciples,“Gather the pieces that are left over. Let nothing be wasted.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị mpara mpara baali fịtúrú ma gbalam oyi mmẹẹ́ nkana bima anịị nnị fịkọma nyẹ ma ḅụ.
english_text: So they gathered them and filled twelve baskets with the pieces of the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma Jizọs nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị árị sáá, n warị saghị dugho ḅẹẹ, Karakáráma, mịị anịị tuminikiri ḅoo dọghụ ikiakoroḅọ ma.
english_text: After the people saw the sign Jesus performed, they began to say, “Surely this is the Prophet who is to come into the world.”

ibani_text: Jizọs nimi warị ḅara ma ḅẹẹ n kụ́rọ ḅara pa ámányánáḅọ pa ọ mịẹbẹm, ori ọ ḅụ si akịm sị sima tụ́ndụ ma tándịm.
english_text: Jesus, knowing that they intended to come and make him king by force, withdrew again to a mountain by himself.

ibani_text: Éné ḅupiri sáá, Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ teré tọ́rụ ma korom,
english_text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,

ibani_text: nnị árụ́ ḅụlọ ngá sị sima tọ́rụ ma sáḅá koro Kapanọm muu ngá. Mị́sa biri ma éné kánákánámam, Jizọs na pa ḅo n fịnịnga laagha.
english_text: where they got into a boat and set off across the lake for Capernaum. By now it was dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.

ibani_text: Kụ́rọ fọ́rụ fiearị dinọngu warị tọ́rụ ma sọ.
english_text: A strong wind was blowing and the waters grew rough.

ibani_text: Nnị ine árụ́ ma dọghụ tẹ́rẹ́ a maili na mpara láa sáá, n Jizọs arịm árụ́ ma dámáḅoarị mingi ma ọ́gọ́nọ nwángịarị, ḅáláfaa warị nna ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: When they had rowed about three or four miles,they saw Jesus approaching the boat, walking on the water; and they were frightened.

ibani_text: Kuma ori n ḅẹm, Ọ́ irị, ọ ḅáláfama.
english_text: But he said to them,“It is I; don’t be afraid.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa anịị n tẹ́mẹ́ ḅoo diin nyẹ ḅẹẹ, ori árụ́ ma ḅụlọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri árụ́ ma anị muarị kiri bịpị lam.
english_text: Then they were willing to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the shore where they were heading.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ éné ḅáa tọ́rụ́ ma na dama dama ngá ma ḅụ fịnị túminị́ kpo ma arịḅom ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ árụ́ ngéré anịị anị ngá fịnịnyẹ. Nnị nimiḅom ḅẹẹ Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ árụ́ ma ḅụlọgha, kụ́ma nnị nnị nnị ngéré sọm.
english_text: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the opposite shore of the lake realized that only one boat had been there, and that Jesus had not entered it with his disciples, but that they had gone away alone.

ibani_text: Anịsáa jẹ́ jẹ́ árụ́ Tiberios ḅụ saghị dọ́ghusọm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ imiẹḅa ḅẹ́ fama sị fịtúrú pa túminị́ ma pịrị sị n fị anga ma na kikia ngá.
english_text: Then some boats from Tiberias landed near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo nimi ḅoo sáá ḅẹẹ Jizọs anịgha ori ọḅụduaapụ anị ngá imi, n sima árụ́ ma ḅụlọm sị so Kapanọm muu Jizọs dọghụarị.
english_text: Once the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum in search of Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị o dọghụ pághámaḅo sáá isi párángáa tọ́rụ́ ma ḅụ, nnị o gbilam, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, i tẹ́ sáá ḅo mịnga láa?
english_text: When they found him on the other side of the lake, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ mịnị i dọghụarị ọmịnị árị ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma ma gosigha, kụ́ma ọ fị furo bima fịtúrú ma gosi.
english_text: Jesus answered,“Very truly I tell you, you are looking for me, not because you saw the signs I performed but because you ate the loaves and had your fill.

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangị síi bẹ fị́nyẹ ma pịrịma kụ́ma fịrịnwangị fịnị muu gbámásó duma láa bẹnyẹ pịrị, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma pa ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ, tegó ori ma anịị Tamuno Daḅọ ma ḅara pụnụ pịrịmaá ḅọ pa die ḅẹ́ ori anịị kụ́rọ pa ọ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For on him God the Father has placed his seal of approval.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa nnị warị o gbíla, Wa tẹ́ mịẹbẹ sị ine Tamuno bi sị wa nwángị na ibifịrị nwángị?
english_text: Then they asked him, “What must we do to do the works God requires?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Mịị Tamuno fịrị ma: anịị ọ fịrịmaḅọ ma ḅụ minini.
english_text: Jesus answered,“The work of God is this: to believe in the one he has sent.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị o gbíla, Anịsáa i tẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma pa wa pịrịbẹ wamịnị árị sị ị́ minini? I tẹ́ mịẹbẹ?
english_text: So they asked him, “What sign then will you give that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?

ibani_text: Wámịna tádọ́apụ mana pa sị fị́nyẹ ma fịm elesiri ḅụ; n gịẹ kóróma ḅara: O sobie sághị ḅo fịtúrú pa nnị pịrịm sị nnị fịị.
english_text: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, A karakárányẹ dugho ọ pịrịm, mosisgha sobie sághị ḅo fịtúrú ma pa ọ pịrịḅọ, kụ́ma i Daá ma anịị sobie sághị ḅo karakárá fịtúrú ma pa ọ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Very truly I tell you, it is not Moses who has given you the bread from heaven, but it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno fịtúrú ma anịị ori sobie sághị ḅoḅọ ma sị duma pa tuminikiri ma pịrị.
english_text: For the bread of God is the bread that comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, mị́sa sághị bịpị muu mị fịtúrú ma pa wa pịrị.
english_text: “Sir,” they said, “always give us this bread.”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị anịsáa dugho nnị pịrịbẹ, Ịrị anịị duma fịtúrú ma. I damaḅoo ḅọ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ḅuru n ḅo ḅábịgha, pịghị i ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné n ḅọ pụghọ sámụ́nọbịgha.
english_text: Then Jesus declared,“I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a dugho ọ pịrị ḅara ma, ọ mịnị ị́yẹ́ árịmam anịsọ ọ pa mininigha.
english_text: But as I told you, you have seen me and still you do not believe.

ibani_text: I Daá ma pa i pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i dámáḅobẹm, i damaḅo ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a pịghị jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné n ḅo deebịgha.
english_text: All those the Father gives me will come to me, and whoever comes to me I will never drive away.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ a sobie kóróḅomam, irị binyẹ mịẹ ḅugha kụ́ma i fịrịmaḅọ ma binyẹ.
english_text: For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of him who sent me.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị i fịrịmaḅọ ma pịghị binyẹ, ḅẹẹ ọ pa i pịrịmáapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅuumama. Kụ́ma nnị saghịma duma bie sua kunema éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: And this is the will of him who sent me, that I shall lose none of all those he has given me, but raise them up at the last day.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Daḅọ ma binyẹ anịị tọ́rụ pa Tụ́wọ ma dighiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị ọ minini duma gbámásó nyánábẹm, a pịghị n ḅọ saghịmabẹm kunema éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: For my Father’s will is that everyone who looks to the Son and believes in him shall have eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ ma warị saghị gunugunu ọ pịrị tegó o dughom ḅẹẹ, Ịrị anịị sobie sághị ḅo duma fịtúrú ma.
english_text: At this the Jews there began to grumble about him because he said,“I am the bread that came down from heaven.”

ibani_text: N dughom, Mịị ḅọ ma Jizọsigha, Josẹf tụwọ wa o yii nyingiḅọ na daḅọ nimiḅọ? Ọ tọ́rọ pa mị́sa dughoarị ḅẹ́, A sobie sághị kóróḅom?
english_text: They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say,‘I came down from heaven’?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n pagharaa, Ọmịnị gụnụgụnụ ma ọmịna ogbobie.
english_text: “Stop grumbling among yourselves,”Jesus answered.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine i dámáḅobịgha ḅọ́rọ́ i fịrịma Daḅọ ma n ḅọ nụnụ i pịrịgha, a pịghị n ḅo saghịmabẹm kunema éné ma.
english_text: “No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws them, and I will raise them up at the last day.

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kórómam ikiakoroapụ diri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Tamuno nyẹ pa kị́nị́mamgba diebẹm, Daḅọ ma naaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị o ḅarabie nyẹ dáwọ i dámáḅobẹm.
english_text: It is written in the Prophets: ‘They will all be taught by God.’Everyone who has heard the Father and learned from him comes to me.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ na Daḅọ ma arịgha, Tamuno ma ḅara saghị ḅoḅọ sima; ori ma ngéré anịị Daḅọ ma arịmáa ḅọ.
english_text: No one has seen the Father except the one who is from God; only he has seen the Father.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dúmagbámásó nyánam.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, the one who believes has eternal life.

ibani_text: Ịrị anịị dúma fịtúrú ma.
english_text: I am the bread of life.

ibani_text: Ọmịna tádọ́apụ manna pa sị fị́nyẹ ma fịm elesiri ḅụ, anịsọ n pa fịịm.
english_text: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, yet they died.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịnga anịị sobie sághị kóróḅo fịtúrú ma, tumḅọ ine fị sị mịnị fịbịghaa.
english_text: But here is the bread that comes down from heaven, which anyone may eat and not die.

ibani_text: Irị anị sobie sághị kóróḅo dúmafịnị fịtúrú ma. Mịị fịtúrú ma fị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, duma gbámásóbẹm. Mịị fịtúrú ma anịị ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị, a pịrị sị tuminikiri gbọrụ duma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Whoever eats this bread will live forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa igani na opu nụná warị Juuapụ ma ogbobie kóró, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tọ́rọ pa ori ojumẹnị pa wa pịrị sị fị bẹ?
english_text: Then the Jews began to argue sharply among themselves, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

ibani_text: Jizọs nnị ḅẹm, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọ Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ojumẹnị pẹẹ́gha sị pịghị ori ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅugha, ọ duma nyánágha ọmịna ḅụbie.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Very truly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị pẹẹ́ ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅuu duma gbámásó nyánam, a pịghị n ḅọ saghịmabẹm kunema éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị ma anịị tụ́ma fị́nyẹ, ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ pịghị tụ́ma iru.
english_text: For my flesh is real food and my blood is real drink.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị pẹẹ́ ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅuu iḅụbie fịnị fịnịm, irịsọ n ḅo ḅụbie fịnị.
english_text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in them.

ibani_text: Dumafịnị daḅọ ma i fịrịma ḅara ma, a pịghị dumam Daḅọ ma gosi. Anịma gosi i fị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ ma dumabẹm irị gosi.
english_text: Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will live because of me.

ibani_text: Mịị sobie sághị kóróḅo fịtúrú ma. Ọmịna tádọ́apụ mana pa sị fị́nyẹ ma fịm sị fịị, kụ́ma mịị fịtúrú ma fị ḅọ duma gbámásóbẹm.
english_text: This is the bread that came down from heaven. Your ancestors ate manna and died, but whoever feeds on this bread will live forever.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dughom ori nna kobiri yọ ma ḅụ nyẹ́diearị sáá Kapanọm ḅụ.
english_text: He said this while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.

ibani_text: Nnị anị náa sáá, ori ọḅụdua tọghaapụ dughom ḅẹẹ, Mịị kụ́rọ dienyẹ. Tụọ ine anị daakị bẹ?
english_text: On hearing it, many of his disciples said, “This is a hard teaching. Who can accept it?”

ibani_text: O nimitẹ́lẹ́ma sáá ḅẹẹ ori ọḅụduaapụ gụ́nụ́gụ́nụ́arị anịgosi, Jizọs n ḅẹ́m, Mịma anị ọmịnị igani ma?
english_text: Aware that his disciples were grumbling about this, Jesus said to them,“Does this offend you?

ibani_text: Tẹ́ nyẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ ọ Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma árị iwo ọ saghị ḅo angaá muarị!
english_text: Then what if you see the Son of Man ascend to where he was before!

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma duma pịrịm; ojumẹnị ma sọnyẹ pịrịgha. A kọọ ọ pịrịmaá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anịma anịị tẹ́mẹ́ nnị pịghị duma.
english_text: The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you—they are full of the Spiritand life.

ibani_text: Anịsọ, ọmịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ imim mininighaapụ. Ḅẹẹ Jizọs nimimam parị sáá éné éné nna ḅụ mininighaḅọ na pịghị ọ dẹrịfị bẹḅọ.
english_text: Yet there are some of you who do not believe.”For Jesus had known from the beginning which of them did not believe and who would betray him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅarị, ḅẹẹ, Mịị anị a go dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine i dámáḅobịgha ḅọ́rọ́ Daḅọ ma ịnyọ pa n ḅo pịrịgha.
english_text: He went on to say,“This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has enabled them.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa sághị bịpị muu ori tọgha ọḅụduaapụ ọḅụdam sị mịnị o duagha.
english_text: From this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ma gbíla, ọmịnị ma sọ, o so dọghụ?
english_text: “You do not want to leave too, do you?”Jesus asked the Twelve.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita ọ pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ wa soo tụọ dama mú bẹ? Ịrị koko duma pịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma nyáná.
english_text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

ibani_text: Wa mininim pịghị nimi ḅẹẹ ịrị anị Tamuno Tọ́ntọ́ Tumḅọ ma.
english_text: We have come to believe and to know that you are the Holy One of God.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị pagharaa, A ọmịnị oyi mmẹapụ sẹlẹakịgha? Anịsọ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori ẹ́kpẹ́dua!
english_text: Then Jesus replied,“Have I not chosen you, the Twelve? Yet one of you is a devil!”

ibani_text: (O ḅẹ́arịḅọ anịị Judas, Saimọn Isịkarọtị tụwọ karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ ori oyi mmẹapụ findi ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ kunema ọ dẹrịfị bẹḅọ.)
english_text: (He meant Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, who, though one of the Twelve, was later to betray him.)

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs nwángị Galili ikelemam o nimitẹ́lẹ́mam sị mịnị Judiya sọgha tegó anị ngá fịnị Juuapụ ma kúruarị nnị ọ ḅáa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After this, Jesus went around in Galilee. He did not wantto go about in Judea because the Jewish leaders there were looking for a way to kill him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Juuapụ ákáinyi wárị Álálị ma kikia sáá,
english_text: But when the Jewish Festival of Tabernacles was near,

ibani_text: Jizọs numboru owiapụ ọ ḅẹ́m, Ị mịnga wáriso sị Judiya muu na ibim, sị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ ị nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma arịị.
english_text: Jesus’ brothers said to him, “Leave Galilee and go to Judea, so that your disciples there may see the works you do.

ibani_text: Dọghụ ḅo ḅẹẹ túminị́ ibima n ḅọ nimi anị tumḅọ ma n ḅo mịẹarịnyẹ ḅoghumabiegha. Ị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarị ḅara ma, ịḅụ pa tuminikiri gbọrụ die.
english_text: No one who wants to become a public figure acts in secret. Since you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”

ibani_text: Ori amịna owiapụ ma mịma dughom nnị sọ ọ ḅụ mininigha gosi.
english_text: For even his own brothers did not believe in him.

ibani_text: Jizọs anịgo dugho nnị pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Tamuno tọ i pịrị sáá ma na laagha; ọmịnị sámámgba karakárá ọ pịrịm.
english_text: Therefore Jesus told them,“My time is not yet here; for you any time will do.

ibani_text: Tuminikiriapụ ma ine ọ tarịghaapụ sọbịgha, kụ́ma nnị i tarịgha tegó a dugho págháma n pịrịarị ḅẹẹ nnị mịẹarịnyẹ ma siinyẹ.
english_text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me because I testify that its works are evil.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị álálị ma muu; ịrị a mị́sa álálị ma mubịgha tegó irị ị́yẹ́ sáá ma karakárá na laagha.
english_text: You go to the festival. I am notgoing up to this festival, because my time has not yet fully come.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịnanyẹ ma dugho n pịrị fama sáá, ọ warị Galili ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: After he had said this, he stayed in Galilee.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, ori amịna owiapụ álálị ma mú famamaá sáá, ori sọ múm, túminị́ mamgba nimi bẹ ḅaragha kụ́ma ḅọghu ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: However, after his brothers had left for the festival, he went also, not publicly, but in secret.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Álálị ma ḅụ, Juuapụ ma ọ dọghụarị pịghị gbilaarị, Anị owitụ́wọ ma o tẹ́ anga imii?
english_text: Now at the festival the Jewish leaders were watching for Jesus and asking, “Where is he?”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma ogbobie, túminị́ pụghọ terema ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị ori gosi. Jẹ́apụ dughom ḅẹẹ, Ori ibi tumḅọ. Jẹ́apụ pagharam, Enrrh enrrh, ori oḅori pa túminị́ ma sịarị.
english_text: Among the crowds there was widespread whispering about him. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others replied, “No, he deceives the people.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine túminị́ ogbo ma ḅụ ọ gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámagha, Juuapụ ma ḅáláfa go.
english_text: But no one would say anything publicly about him for fear of the leaders.

ibani_text: Álálị ma muu ogbo biri láa sáá, Jizọs saghị Tamunoopuwárị ẹpẹlẹ́ ma sọm sị nyẹ die.
english_text: Not until halfway through the festival did Jesus go up to the temple courts and begin to teach.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma anị nna ḅụ ḅụ́gbérépumam nnị warị gbíla, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tọ́rọ pa mịnanyẹ mamgba nimii, nyẹ́ dawọgha pa?
english_text: The Jews there were amazed and asked, “How did this man get such learning without having been taught?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A diearịnyẹ ma i nyẹ́gha. Anị i fịrịmaḅọ ma ḅara saghịḅom.
english_text: Jesus answered,“My teaching is not my own. It comes from the one who sent me.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno binyẹ mịẹ dọghụḅọ fịnịfịnị n dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma Tamun ḅara saghị ḅo anịgha a ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ pa anị diearị.
english_text: Anyone who chooses to do the will of God will find out whether my teaching comes from God or whether I speak on my own.

ibani_text: Amịna kụ́rọ ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori boma dọghụarị, kụ́ma ọ fịrịmaḅọ ma boma dọghụarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị tumḅọ ma anị karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarịḅọ, iruonyẹ ọ ḅụ ofori.
english_text: Whoever speaks on their own does so to gain personal glory, but he who seeks the glory of the one who sent him is a man of truth; there is nothing false about him.

ibani_text: Mosis na ori ologho ma pa ọ pịrịgha? Anịsọ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ologho ma warị warịgha ọ tẹ́ go i ḅa dọghụ?
english_text: Has not Moses given you the law? Yet not one of you keeps the law. Why are you trying to kill me?”

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma pagharam, Sitẹ́mẹ́ ị kórómam, tụọ ị ḅa dọghụ?
english_text: “You are demon-possessed,” the crowd answered. “Who is trying to kill you?”

ibani_text: Jizọs n ḅẹm, A gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịm ọ ḅụ warị gbérépu.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“I did one miracle, and you are all amazed.

ibani_text: Mosis tọ́ọ ọ pịrịmam ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ọmịna owiapụ áwọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́, anịgo Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ ọmịnị ọmịna owiapụ awọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹm (karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ anị Mosis ḅara saghị ḅogha kụ́ma ọmịna tádọ́apụ ḅara).
english_text: Yet, because Moses gave you circumcision (though actually it did not come from Moses, but from the patriarchs), you circumcise a boy on the Sabbath.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ine kálátụwọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́bẹm Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ sị nnị Mosis ologho ma kóróbịgha ḅara, o tegó bieoḅu i pịrịarị ḅẹẹ a owitụ́wọ ḅụgbọrụ gwọm Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma?
english_text: Now if a boy can be circumcised on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, why are you angry with me for healing a man’s whole body on the Sabbath?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị tọ́rụ pa árịnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ma, kụ́ma ọ karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: Stop judging by mere appearances, but instead judge correctly.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ jẹa Jerusalemapụ saghị gbilam, Mịị n ḅa dọghụ owitụ́wọ magha?
english_text: At that point some of the people of Jerusalem began to ask, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?

ibani_text: Mịị ori túminị́ mamgba tórúku fịnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị, n pịghị ine gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọ pa o ḅẹgha. Sịbịdáapụ ma nnị ibima dugho pẹ́lẹ́ma ḅẹẹ ori anịị Krais ma?
english_text: Here he is, speaking publicly, and they are not saying a word to him. Have the authorities really concluded that he is the Messiah?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wánimim mịị owitụ́wọ ma saghị ḅo ngá; Krais ma ḅo bẹ sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nimibịghaa ọ sághị ḅo bẹ ngá.
english_text: But we know where this man is from; when the Messiah comes, no one will know where he is from.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Jizọs pa nyẹ́diearị sáá Tamunoopuwarị ẹpẹlẹ ma bie, ọ kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghú pághámam, Innh, ọmịnị ị nimim ọ pịghị nimim a saghị ḅo ngá. Kụ́ma a ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ pa mịnga fịnịgha, i fịrịmaḅọ ma ori anịị karakárányẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅọ. Ọmịnị o nimigha,
english_text: Then Jesus, still teaching in the temple courts, cried out,“Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. I am not here on my own authority, but he who sent me is true. You do not know him,

ibani_text: kụ́ma ịrị o nimim, tegó a ọ ḅara saghịḅom. Ori pịghị i fịrịmam.
english_text: but I know him because I am from him and he sent me.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị asọ dọghụ nnị oku bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine ḅara pa ọ lamagha tegó ori sáá na laagha.
english_text: At this they tried to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.

ibani_text: Anịsọ, tọghaapụ túminị́ kpo ma ḅụ nna minini pa ọ ḅụ gbánām. Nnị dughom ḅẹẹ, Krais ma ḅo sáá, o ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángị mịị owitụ́wọ ma nẹ́ngị bẹ?
english_text: Still, many in the crowd believed in him. They said, “When the Messiah comes, will he perform more signs than this man?”

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma túminị́ kpo ma nam n tere pụghọ pa Krais gbolomanyẹ dughoarị sáá. Anịsáa igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ warị Tamunoopuwarị kúrúapụ fịrịma ḅẹẹ nnị o kuu.
english_text: The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering such things about him. Then the chief priests and the Pharisees sent temple guards to arrest him.

ibani_text: Jizọs dughom, Kálá sáá tụwọ anịị a pa ọmịnị na fịnị bẹnyẹ, anịsáa a so i fịrịmaḅọ ma dámámubẹm.
english_text: Jesus said,“I am with you for only a short time, and then I am going to the one who sent me.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị i dọghụbẹm, kụ́ma ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha; a pịghị fịnị angaá ọmịnị ine ḅobịgha.
english_text: You will look for me, but you will not find me; and where I am, you cannot come.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹm, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tẹ́ angaá muu dọghụ, wamịnị ine ori arịbịghaa ngaa? O Giriki opu ama muu bẹ wámịna túminị́ ngá angaá sị nyẹ pa Girikiapụ ma die?
english_text: The Jews said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we cannot find him? Will he go where our people live scattered among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ dughoarị ọ ḅẹẹ sáá ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị i dọghụbẹm kụ́ma ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha, ḅẹẹ, a fịnịnga ọ pịghị ine ḅobịgha?
english_text: What did he mean when he said,‘You will look for me, but you will not find me,’and‘Where I am, you cannot come’?”

ibani_text: Álálị ma kunema éné pịghị dụḅaḅá éné ma, Jizọs sẹ́fịnịm sị opu pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́m, Pụghọ sámụ́nọ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, i damaḅo sị ḅuu.
english_text: On the last and greatest day of the festival, Jesus stood and said in a loud voice,“Let anyone who is thirsty come to me and drink.

ibani_text: Ịḅụ minini ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tọ́ndiri ma dugho maá ḅara ma, o ḅụbie ḅọ́rọ́ anịị duma pịrị okolo mingi saghị sara págháḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Whoever believes in me, as Scripture has said, rivers of living water will flow from within them.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anịị ọ ḅẹarị nyẹ ọ ḅụ mininiapụ ma nyáná ḅo bẹnyẹ ọḅụkụ́nọma. Akị ḅo anịsáa ma láa Tamuno na ori Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịgha tegó Jizọs na ori ipine bie sọgha.
english_text: By this he meant the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were later to receive. Up to that time the Spirit had not been given, since Jesus had not yet been glorified.

ibani_text: Nnị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ náa sáá, túminị́ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ dughom ḅẹ́, Karakárányẹ mịị owitụ́wọ ma ori anịị wa tọ́rụ́dighiarị ikiakoroḅọ ma.
english_text: On hearing his words, some of the people said, “Surely this man is the Prophet.”

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ḅẹm, Ori anịị Krais ma. Jẹ́apụ pịghị pa gbilam, Krais ma ọ tọ́rọ pa Galili ḅụ saghị ḅo bẹ?
english_text: Others said, “He is the Messiah.” Still others asked, “How can the Messiah come from Galilee?

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ diri ma anị dughogha mọ ḅẹẹ, Krais ma Deviti furo Bẹtịlịhẹm ḅụ anịị ọ saghị ḅo bẹnyẹ, Deviti ngá ama ama ḅụ.
english_text: Does not Scripture say that the Messiah will come from David’s descendants and from Bethlehem, the town where David lived?”

ibani_text: Puama warị ḅo túminị́ ma ogbobie sọ Jizọs gosi.
english_text: Thus the people were divided because of Jesus.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ dọ́ghụm nnị oku, kuma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅara pa ọ lamagha.
english_text: Some wanted to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him.

ibani_text: Kunema Tamunoopuwárị ma kúrúapụ pịghịma igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma dámámuu, n gbilaapụ ḅẹẹ, O tegó ori akuoo ḅogha?
english_text: Finally the temple guards went back to the chief priests and the Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn’t you bring him in?”

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwárị kúrúapụ ma warị dugho págháma, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ jẹ́ éné na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kogha mị owitụ́wọ ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅara.
english_text: “No one ever spoke the way this man does,” the guards replied.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị sima nnị gbíla, Ọmịnị ma ọ pịghị oḅori pa ọ sima?
english_text: “You mean he has deceived you also?” the Pharisees retorted.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ éné ọmịnị árị ma gbẹ́rẹ́ Farisiiḅọ anịgha táarịapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ọḅụ mịnị máaḅọ?
english_text: “Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed in him?

ibani_text: Errnh Errnh! Kụ́ma mịị túminị́ kpo ma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nímighaapụ Mosis ologho ma ḅụ si fị́lā nna sịbị gbánām.
english_text: No! But this mob that knows nothing of the law—there is a curse on them.”

ibani_text: Nikodimọs ori Farisiiapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, parị sáá Jizọs dámámuu máaḅọ, n ḅẹm.
english_text: Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus earlier and who was one of their own number, asked,

ibani_text: Wámịna ologho anị kị́nị́ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ bẹ na anị tarị n ḅọ bịpị naagha pa sị nimi ḅoo tumḅọ ma mịẹnyẹ?
english_text: “Does our law condemn a man without first hearing him to find out what he has been doing?”

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam, Ịrịsọ ị Galili ḅụ saghị ḅoo? Tọ́ndiri ma bie dighi ị pịghị dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm ḅẹẹ ikiakoroḅọ Galili ḅụ saghị págháḅobịgha.
english_text: They replied, “Are you from Galilee, too? Look into it, and you will find that a prophet does not come out of Galilee.” [The earliest manuscripts and many other ancient witnesses do not haveJohn 7:53—8:11. A few manuscripts include these verses, wholly or in part, afterJohn 7:36,John 21:25,Luke 21:38orLuke 24:53.]

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ wáriso nna wárị muu.
english_text: Then they all went home,

ibani_text: Jizọs warị so Olivu Tụ́ndụ ma tándịm.
english_text: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

ibani_text: Dede láa sáá o sima Tamunoopuwárị ma ẹpẹlẹ́ múm, túminị́ ma wárị o gbiriikélékélé ọ wárị kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ pa n die.
english_text: At dawn he appeared again in the temple courts, where all the people gathered around him, and he sat down to teach them.

ibani_text: Ologho Nyẹ́dieapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma wárị gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ akuoo, n kuuḅo amadọghụ ḅụ. Nnị warị a mịẹsị a túminị́ mamgba tórúku sẹ
english_text: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought in a woman caught in adultery. They made her stand before the group

ibani_text: nnị warị Jizọs ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa ḅara na mịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma kum amadọghụ ḅụ.
english_text: and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of adultery.

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma ḅụ Mosis tọ́ọ wa pịrịm ḅẹẹ ọkọfịnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ wamịnị mgbọ́lụ pa n ḅọ gbii. Mị́sa ịrị ị tẹ́ dugho?
english_text: In the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women. Now what do you say?”

ibani_text: Nnị mịma gbilam pa dia tughu ọ pịrị n pa ḅara ọlọ sị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị gbánā bẹnyẹ. Kụ́ma Jizọs tughum sị saghị ọ ḅara tụ́mgbọlụ pa kiri ma ḅụ nyẹ gịẹ.
english_text: They were using this question as a trap, in order to have a basis for accusing him. But Jesus bent down and started to write on the ground with his finger.

ibani_text: Nnị o gbíla so o gbíla ḅarịarị ḅara ma ọ tụ́ghụ́ saghịm sị n ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna bie sii ḅụ ófórigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ imi imi, n ḅo parị mgbọ́lụ ma saghị pa a gbii.
english_text: When they kept on questioning him, he straightened up and said to them, “Let any one of you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.”

ibani_text: O sima tughum sị kiri ma ḅụ nyẹ gịẹ.
english_text: Again he stooped down and wrote on the ground.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ náa sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, saghị ọ warị so sọm, parị sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅụ saghị, Jizọs ngéré ḅo kọọ, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma anị ngá pa sẹ́fịnịarị.
english_text: At this, those who heard began to go away one at a time, the older ones first, until only Jesus was left, with the woman still standing there.

ibani_text: Jizọs tụ́ghụ́ saghị sáá, ọ warị gbíla, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ, nnị tẹ́ anga imi? Ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa i ḅara simaḅọ ofori?
english_text: Jesus straightened up and asked her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one condemned you?”

ibani_text: Á warị pagharaa, Inyanaḅọ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ofori. Jizọs warị a ḅẹẹ, Irịsọ a ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ị ḅara simagha, sọ, kụ́ma mú jẹ́ siinyẹ mịẹma.
english_text: “No one, sir,” she said. “Then neither do I condemn you,” Jesus declared. “Go now and leave your life of sin.”

ibani_text: Jizọs sima ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ ma pịrị sáá, o dughom ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị tuminikiri baá ma. I dua ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kánákánábie asọ nwángịbịgha, kụ́ma n ḅọ duma pịrị baá ma nyánábẹm.
english_text: When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said,“I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị onyẹsẹ́ ịḅụ pịrịarị; ị́yẹ́ onyẹ́sẹ bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori.
english_text: The Pharisees challenged him, “Here you are, appearing as your own witness; your testimony is not valid.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ dii ḅẹẹ a onyẹ́sẹ ịḅụ pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ onyẹ́sẹ ma karakárányẹ, ḅẹẹ a nimim a saghị ḅo ngá na pịghị a muarị anga. Kụ́ma ọmịnị o nimigha a saghị ḅo anga na pịghị a muarị anga.
english_text: Jesus answered,“Even if I testify on my own behalf, my testimony is valid, for I know where I came from and where I am going. But you have no idea where I come from or where I am going.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ tuminikiriapụ ḅara pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm kụ́ma ịrị a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịbị sọ ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́gha.
english_text: You judge by human standards; I pass judgment on no one.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ kọọ ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ karakáram tẹ́ go irị ngéréghaa. A i fịrịma Daḅọ ma na sẹ́fịnịm.
english_text: But if I do judge, my decisions are true, because I am not alone. I stand with the Father, who sent me.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ologho ḅụ n gịẹ kórómam ḅẹẹ mmẹapụ sẹ sị dugho págháma nyẹ karakáram.
english_text: In your own Law it is written that the testimony of two witnesses is true.

ibani_text: Irị anịị ị gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámarịḅọ; i fịrịma Daḅọ ma anịị ị́yẹ́ jẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ.
english_text: I am one who testifies for myself; my other witness is the Father, who sent me.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, nnị warị ogbila, Ị daá ọ tẹ́ anga imii? Jizọs pagharam, Ọmịnị inimigha anịgha i Daá ma, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị nimi, ọmịnị i Daá ma sọ nimibẹm.
english_text: Then they asked him, “Where is your father?” “You do not know me or my Father,”Jesus replied.“If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọm ọ pa Tamunopuwárị ma párángáa nyẹ́diearị sáá, ósó igbii sua ngá ma na kikianyẹ. Anịsọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ okugha tegó ọ sáá na laagha.
english_text: He spoke these words while teaching in the temple courts near the place where the offerings were put. Yet no one seized him, because his hour had not yet come.

ibani_text: Jizọs sima dugho nnị pịrịm, A sọarị, ọ pịghị i dọghụbẹm, ọ pịghị ọmịna sii ḅụ fị́ị́bẹm. A muarị anga ọ mịnị ine ḅobịgha.
english_text: Once more Jesus said to them,“I am going away, and you will look for me, and you will die in your sin. Where I go, you cannot come.”

ibani_text: Mịma mịẹm sị Juuapụ ma gbíla, Ori ọ ḅụ ḅaá bẹ? Anị o go dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, A muarị anga ọmịnị ine ḅobịgha?
english_text: This made the Jews ask, “Will he kill himself? Is that why he says,‘Where I go, you cannot come’?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, Ọmịnị sughubie saghịḅom; irị ọ́gọ́nọ a saghịḅom. Ọmịnị anịị tuminikiri bẹapụ; irị mị tuminikiri bẹ ḅọgha.
english_text: But he continued,“You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ fị́ị́bẹm; ḅọ́rọ́ ọ mininigha ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị Irị Ma, ọ tụ́ma ḅara pa ọmịna sii ḅụ fị́ị́bẹm.
english_text: I told you that you would die in your sins; if you do not believe that I am he, you will indeed die in your sins.”

ibani_text: Nnị o gbilam, Ịrị tụọ? Jizọs pagharam, Saghị éné éné ị gboloma sị a dughoarị nyẹ ma.
english_text: “Who are you?” they asked. “Just what I have been telling you from the beginning,”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: A tọgha nyẹ nyánam a dugho bẹnyẹ sị pa ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ. Kụ́ma ọ karakáram i fịrịma ḅọ ma; a pịghị ọ bịpị náanyẹ anịị a dugho tuminikiri ma pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: “I have much to say in judgment of you. But he who sent me is trustworthy, and what I have heard from him I tell the world.”

ibani_text: Nnị ori akanyaḅogha ḅẹ́ ori o Daá ma gbolomanyẹ dugho nnị pịrịarị.
english_text: They did not understand that he was telling them about his Father.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma saghị sóghólóma maẹrẹ, anịsáa o nimibẹm ḅẹ́ Irị anịị Irị Ma, a pịghị ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ pa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha, kụ́ma Daḅọ ma pa i dienyẹ ngéré anịị a diearịnyẹ.
english_text: So Jesus said,“When you have lifted upthe Son of Man, then you will know that I am he and that I do nothing on my own but speak just what the Father has taught me.

ibani_text: I fịrịma ḅọ ma ori irị na imi; na ori i warịsogha sị irị ngéré papa fịnị, ọḅụ ḅẹ́lẹ́nyẹ ngéré anịị a mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: The one who sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, for I always do what pleases him.”

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma tọghaapụ nna minini pa ọ ḅụ gbánām.
english_text: Even as he spoke, many believed in him.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ọ ḅụ minini Juuapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma ọlọ ọlọ, ọmịnị anịị tụ́ma sị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: To the Jews who had believed him, Jesus said,“If you hold to my teaching, you are really my disciples.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọ karakárá ma nimibẹm karakárá ma pịghị ọ duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam, Wamịnị Ebraham furoawọ jẹ́ éné na wa pịghị jụghọ ómóniḅọ sọgha. I tọ́rọ pa dugho bẹ ḅẹẹ, nnị wa duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm?
english_text: They answered him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never been slaves of anyone. How can you say that we shall be set free?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n ḅọ anịị siiamịẹnyẹ ómóniḅọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Very truly I tell you, everyone who sins is a slave to sin.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ómóniḅọ ọ nyánáḅọ warị fịnị gbámásóbịgha, Kụ́ma n yii tụwọ anị ngá fịnị gbámásóbẹm.
english_text: Now a slave has no permanent place in the family, but a son belongs to it forever.

ibani_text: Anịgo ḅọ́rọ́ Tụ́wọ ma i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma, ị karakáráma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánam.
english_text: So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị Ebraham furoawọ. Anịsọ ọ pa i baá dọ́ghụm tegó ọ fịnịkiri nyáná ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pịrịgha.
english_text: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants. Yet you are looking for a way to kill me, because you have no room for my word.

ibani_text: A Daḅọ toruku a árịmaá nyẹ dugho ọ pịrịarị, ọmịnị sọ pịghị ọmịna daá bịpị náanyẹ mịẹm.
english_text: I am telling you what I have seen in the Father’s presence, and you are doing what you have heard from your father.”

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam, Ebraham anịị wámịna Daá. Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ḅọ́rọ́ Ebraham awọ, anịsáa Ebraham mịẹnyẹ anịị ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Abraham is our father,” they answered. “If you were Abraham’s children,”said Jesus,“then you woulddo what Abraham did.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ma, ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ọ tọ́ọ ḅọ́rọ́mamam ḅẹẹ ọmịnị i ḅáabẹm, irị Tamuno ḅara a náa karakárá ma dugho ọ pịrịmaá ḅo. Ebraham ọkọfịnị nyẹ mịẹgha.
english_text: As it is, you are looking for a way to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God. Abraham did not do such things.

ibani_text: Ọmịna daá mịẹnyẹ anịị ọ mịẹarịnyẹ. Nnị pagharam, Nnị amadọghụ ḅụ wa yiigha, Tamuno ngéré anịị wa nyáná Daḅọ.
english_text: You are doing the works of your own father.” “We are not illegitimate children,” they protested. “The only Father we have is God himself.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno anịị ọmịna Daá, ọmịnị i ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, ḅẹẹ a Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom a mịnga ma ḅụ imi mị́sa. A ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅogha; kụ́ma ori i fịrịmam.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“If God were your Father, you would love me, for I have come here from God. I have not come on my own; God sent me.

ibani_text: O tẹ́ go a dughoarị nyẹ ma akanyaḅogha anịị ọmịnị ine a dughoarị nyẹ naagha gosi.
english_text: Why is my language not clear to you? Because you are unable to hear what I say.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anịị ọmịna daá ẹ́kpẹ́dua awọ, ọ pịghị ọmịna daa binyẹ mịẹ dọ́ghụm. Parị sáá éné éné ori anịị kị́nị́ ḅá ḅáḅọ, karakárá ma ọlọgha pa, gbẹ́rẹ́ karakárá sọ ọ ḅụbie ofori. Ori iruonyẹ dughoarị sáá ori ọrẹ ama bịpị fiearị, ori anịị iruonyẹ dugho dugho ḅọ pịghị iruonyẹ ma daḅọ.
english_text: You belong to your father, the devil, and you want to carry out your father’s desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, not holding to the truth, for there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks his native language, for he is a liar and the father of lies.

ibani_text: Anịị a karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm ẹrẹ́sị, ọmịnị i mininigha!
english_text: Yet because I tell the truth, you do not believe me!

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie tụọ ḅẹrẹ pa i ḅarasima bẹ ḅẹẹ, mịị a mịẹ sii? A ḅọ́rọ́ karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị sáá ọ tẹ́ go i mininigha?
english_text: Can any of you prove me guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don’t you believe me?

ibani_text: Tamuno ju ḅọ ma, Tamuno dughonyẹ ma naánam. Ọmịnị Tamuno nyẹ́gha gosi anị o go ọ naagha nyẹ.
english_text: Whoever belongs to God hears what God says. The reason you do not hear is that you do not belong to God.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma ọ pagharam, ḅẹẹ, Wa karakáragha wa dugho sáá ḅẹẹ ịrị Sameriyaḅọ ḅẹẹ sitẹ́mẹ́ pịghị ịḅụ imii?
english_text: The Jews answered him, “Aren’t we right in saying that you are a Samaritan and demon-possessed?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Sitẹ́mẹ́ ịḅụ ofori, kụ́ma a kuu pa i Daá pịrịm kụ́ma ọmịnị kuu pa i pịrịgha.
english_text: “I am not possessed by a demon,”said Jesus,“but I honor my Father and you dishonor me.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ boma bigha; kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ imi anị biarị ḅo, ori anị pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma.
english_text: I am not seeking glory for myself; but there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ jẹ́ éné fịị arịbịgha.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, whoever obeys my word will never see death.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ ma warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa wa nimim ḅẹ́ Sitẹ́mẹ́ ị ḅụbie imi! Ebraham fịịm anịị ikiakoroapụ ma sọ fịị ḅara, anịsọ i pa dughoarị ḅẹ́, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ mịẹarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ jẹ́ éné fịị arịbịgha.
english_text: At this they exclaimed, “Now we know that you are demon-possessed! Abraham died and so did the prophets, yet you say that whoever obeys your word will never taste death.

ibani_text: Ị wámịna Daá Ebraham nẹ́ngị? Ọ fịịm ikiakoroapụ ma sọ fịịm. Ị si ḅẹ́ ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ tụ́ọ?
english_text: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A ḅọ́rọ́ ịḅụ boma ị́yẹ́ boma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori. I Daá ma, ọ ḅẹ ḅọ ma ḅẹ́ ori ọmịna Tamuno, ori ma anịị i bomaarịḅọ.
english_text: Jesus replied,“If I glorify myself, my glory means nothing. My Father, whom you claim as your God, is the one who glorifies me.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị o nimigha, ịrị o nimim. A ḅọ́rọ́ bẹ a o nimigha a iruonyẹ dugho ḅo sọ́bẹm ọmịnị fịnị ḅara ma. Kụ́ma a ibima o nimim pịghị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dughonyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: Though you do not know him, I know him. If I said I did not, I would be a liar like you, but I do know him and obey his word.

ibani_text: Ọmịna daá Ebraham dụrụkụ́m ḅẹẹ, ori ị́yẹ́ ḅo bẹ sáá árịbẹm; ori anị arịm pịghị bieḅẹlẹ.
english_text: Your father Abraham rejoiced at the thought of seeing my day; he saw it and was glad.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Na ị kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi laagha, ị pịghị Ebraham sọ árịmam!
english_text: “You are not yet fifty years old,” they said to him, “and you have seen Abraham!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, Na nnị Ebraham yiigha sa éné éné a imi!
english_text: “Very truly I tell you,”Jesus answered,“before Abraham was born, I am!”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị mgbọ́lụ saghị akịm nnị pa o gbi bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma Jizọs ọ ḅụ ḅọghum, sị Tamunopuwárị ma ẹpẹlẹ́ wáriso.
english_text: At this, they picked up stones to stone him, but Jesus hid himself, slipping away from the temple grounds.

ibani_text: Jizọs nwángịma muarị sáá, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ arịm tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ nnị oyi sáá éné éné.
english_text: As he went along, he saw a man blind from birth.

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ o gbilam, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, tụọ siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ, mịị owitụ́wọ ma mụ́nọ sị ori nyingiḅọ na daḅọ sị nnị o yii tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ?
english_text: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Mịị owitụ́wọ maagha anịgha ori nyingiḅọ na daḅọ, kụ́ma mịma kiriakịm sị n Tamuno fịrị ma diepágháma bẹ ḅara ori duma ḅụ.
english_text: “Neither this man nor his parents sinned,”said Jesus,“but this happened so that the works of God might be displayed in him.

ibani_text: Wa éné bie fịnịarị sáá, wa i fịrịma ḅọ ma fịrị nwángịbẹm. Dii ḅoarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine fịrị nwángịbịgha sáá.
english_text: As long as it is day, we must do the works of him who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.

ibani_text: A tuminikiri fịnị sáá ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, irị anịị tuminikiri ma baá.
english_text: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá, o kiri ḅụ fị́lā saram, sị fị́lā ma pa átụ́ma mịẹsị pa owitụ́wọ ma tọ́rụ́ gbánā.
english_text: After saying this, he spit on the ground, made some mud with the saliva, and put it on the man’s eyes.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho ọ pịrị, Muu, i toruku siri siloam mingi ma bie (mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughoarị nyẹ anịị fịrịma). Owitụ́wọ ma warị muu siri sị so wárị ḅo sị saghị nyẹ árị.
english_text: “Go,”he told him,“wash in the Pool of Siloam”(this word means “Sent”). So the man went and washed, and came home seeing.

ibani_text: Ori na kikiama ngaapụ na pịghị parị ori árịapụ nyẹ biarị gbilam, Mịị kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ bi bi owitụ́wọ ma origha?
english_text: His neighbors and those who had formerly seen him begging asked, “Isn’t this the same man who used to sit and beg?”

ibani_text: Jẹapụ ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ, Orii. I sịapụ ḅẹ́m, Origha, ḅẹẹ ọ papa ọkịkam. Kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ma ḅụgbọrụ dugho kụ́rọ́mam ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị owitụ́wọ ma.
english_text: Some claimed that he was. Others said, “No, he only looks like him.” But he himself insisted, “I am the man.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị o gbíla, Ị tọ́rụ ma anị tọ́rọ pa findi?
english_text: “How then were your eyes opened?” they asked.

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Nnị Jizọs pa sị owitụ́wọ ma kálá átụ́ma nyẹ mịẹm sị pa i tọ́rụ́ gbánā. Ori i ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ a siloam mingi muu sị ị tọ́rụ́ sịrị. A warị muu sị sịrị sị saghị nyẹ árị.
english_text: He replied, “The man they call Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes. He told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see.”

ibani_text: Nnị o gbilam, Anị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tẹ́ angaá imi? Ọ pagharam, A nimigha.
english_text: “Where is this man?” they asked him. “I don’t know,” he said.

ibani_text: Nnị parị sáá tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ ma akuom Farisiiapụ ma tórúku.
english_text: They brought to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jizọs átụ́ma mịẹsị tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ ma tọ́rụ findi éné anịị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma.
english_text: Now the day on which Jesus had made the mud and opened the man’s eyes was a Sabbath.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị owitụ́wọ ma gbíla ọ tọ́rụ́ ḅara warị findi ḅara. Ọ warị dugho n pịrị, Ori átụ́ma pa i tọ́rụ́ lámam, a warị i tọ́rụ́ sịrị, anịị mị́sa a saghị ine nyẹ́arị nyẹ.
english_text: Therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. “He put mud on my eyes,” the man replied, “and I washed, and now I see.”

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ, warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọ Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅogha, ḅẹ́ ori Ịnyọsára Éné ma ólóghó kokogha. Kụ́ma jẹ́apụ gbilam, Tọrọ́ fịnị siiamịẹnyẹ ḅọ mịị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nwángị bẹ? Puama warị nna ogbobie sọọ.
english_text: Some of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath.” But others asked, “How can a sinner perform such signs?” So they were divided.

ibani_text: Kunema n pịghị sima tọ́rụ́pụụ́ owitụ́wọ ma dam, Ị tẹ́ nyẹ nyáná ị dugho bẹnyẹ ọ ḅụ? Ị tọ́rụ anịị o findinyẹ. Owitụ́wọ ma pagharam, Ori ikiakoroḅọ.
english_text: Then they turned again to the blind man, “What have you to say about him? It was your eyes he opened.” The man replied, “He is a prophet.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma pa mininigha ḅẹ́ ori tarị sáá tọ́rụ́pụḅọ, kụ́ma mị́sa nyẹ árịarị akị mú n fịrịma ori nyingi na daḅọ sị sáá láa.
english_text: They still did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they sent for the man’s parents.

ibani_text: Nnị gbilam, Mịị ọmịna tụ́wọ? Mịị ọ bẹḅọ ḅẹẹ ọ tọ́rụ́ pụụm nnị o yii sáá? Ọ tọ́rọ pa ḅẹ́ mị́sa ori nyẹ arịarị?
english_text: “Is this your son?” they asked. “Is this the one you say was born blind? How is it that now he can see?”

ibani_text: Nyingiḅọ na daḅọ ma pagharam, Wa nimim ḅẹ́ ori wámịna tụ́wọ. Wa pịghị nimim ḅẹẹ wamịnị o yii sáá ọ tọ́rụ́ pụụm.
english_text: “We know he is our son,” the parents answered, “and we know he was born blind.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ ḅara warị mị́sa nyẹ árị ḅara anịgha ọ tọ́rụ findi ḅọ, wa nimigha o gbíla. Ori owitụ́wọ lámam; ori ọ bịpị na pághárabẹm.
english_text: But how he can see now, or who opened his eyes, we don’t know. Ask him. He is of age; he will speak for himself.”

ibani_text: Ori nyingi na daḅọ na mịma dughom nnị Juuapụ ma dighi ḅáláfaarị gosi. Juuapụ ma pịghị dughopẹ́lẹ́mam gosi ḅẹẹ, bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ mịị Jizọs ma ori anịị Krais ma, nnị n ḅo deesibẹm nna kobiri yọ.
english_text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, who already had decided that anyone who acknowledged that Jesus was the Messiah would be put out of the synagogue.

ibani_text: Anịị nyingiḅọ na daḅọ go dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ori owitụ́wọ lámam, ọmịnị o gbíla.
english_text: That was why his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá sáá n yii sị tọ́rụ́pụụ́ owitụ́wọ ma sị nna ogboku bie ḅom, sị ọ ḅẹẹ, Boma pa Tamuno pịrị, wa nimim bẹ mịị owitụ́wọ ma siiamịẹnyẹ ḅọ.
english_text: A second time they summoned the man who had been blind. “Give glory to God by telling the truth,” they said. “We know this man is a sinner.”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, Ori ḅọ́rọ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅọ, ori ḅọ́rọ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅọgha o, a nimigha. A nimi gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ. Gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri i tọ́rụ́ pụụm kụ́ma mị́sa a nyẹ árịarị!
english_text: He replied, “Whether he is a sinner or not, I don’t know. One thing I do know. I was blind but now I see!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa nnị warị o gbíla, Ọ tẹ́ pa ị mịẹ? Ọ tọ́rọ pa ị tọ́rụ findi?
english_text: Then they asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”

ibani_text: Ọ pagharam, A dugho ọ pịrịmam kụ́ma o pughugha. O tẹ́ go jẹ́ pa anị náa dọghụ? Ọmịnị sọ o dọghụ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ori ọḅụduaapụ sọ?
english_text: He answered, “I have told you already and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his disciples too?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị wirinumo pa o wiri sị ḅẹ́, Ịrị anịị mịị owitụ́wọ ma ọḅụduaḅọ. Wamịnị Mosis ọḅụduaapụ!
english_text: Then they hurled insults at him and said, “You are this fellow’s disciple! We are disciples of Moses!

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Mosis pịrịm, kụ́ma mịị owitụ́wọ ma, wa nimi sọ nimigha ọ saghị ḅo ngá.
english_text: We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this fellow, we don’t even know where he comes from.”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma warị n pagharaa ḅẹ́, Mịma anịị tumḅọ tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngịma nyẹ! Ḅẹẹ, mị owitụ́wọ ma ọmịnị ọ saghị ḅoo ngá nimigha, kụ́ma ọ mịẹm sị a nyẹ arịị.
english_text: The man answered, “Now that is remarkable! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno siiapụ náa nagha, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarịḅọ fịnịfịnị sị pịghị o binyẹ mịẹ, anịḅọ ma anịị ọ náarị ḅo.
english_text: We know that God does not listen to sinners. He listens to the godly person who does his will.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so jẹ́ éné na nagha ḅẹ́ n yii sị tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ nnị n ḅo tọ́rụ findim.
english_text: Nobody has ever heard of opening the eyes of a man born blind.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ mịị owitụ́wọ ma Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅogha, ori ine bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha.
english_text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”

ibani_text: Nnị wárị pagharaa, Nnị kọkọ sii ḅụ ị yii pịghị siinyẹ bie ị didighi pághámaḅo. Ịrị tọ́rọ pa ḅo nyẹ́ pa wa diearí. Nnị warị o gbi págháma nna kobiri yọ ḅụ.
english_text: To this they replied, “You were steeped in sin at birth; how dare you lecture us!” And they threw him out.

ibani_text: Jizọs nam ḅẹẹ nnị ọ tọ́rụ findi owitụ́wọ ma gbi pághámam, ori o dọghụḅọ sáá, ori ọ ḅẹ́m, Ị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma ḅụ minini?
english_text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when he found him, he said,“Do you believe in the Son of Man?”

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma gbilam, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, ori tụọ mọ. Dugho i pịrị a ine ọ ḅụ minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: “Who is he, sir?” the man asked. “Tell me so that I may believe in him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹm, Mị́sa ịrị ori árịmam, ori ma anịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ị pịrịarịḅọ ma.
english_text: Jesus said,“You have now seen him; in fact, he is the one speaking with you.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa owitụ́wọ ma warị ḅẹ́, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, a mininim, ọ warị susi ọ pịrị.
english_text: Then the man said, “Lord, I believe,” and he worshiped him.

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹm, A mị tuminikiri ma ḅom sị, túminị́ sii págháa bẹ ḅara, sị tọ́rụ pụghụapụ nyẹ árị bẹ ḅara sị tọ́rụ nyẹarịapụ tọ́rụpụghụ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Jesus said,“For judgment I have come into this world, so that the blind will see and those who see will become blind.”

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ ori na anị ngá fịnịapụ mịma nam ori anị dugho sáá sị gbilam, Tẹ́ nyẹ? Wamịnị sọ wa tọ́rụpụghụ?
english_text: Some Pharisees who were with him heard him say this and asked, “What? Are we blind too?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị pagharaa, Ọmịna tọ́rụ ḅọ́rọ́ pụghụ ọkụ́ma, n ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ ḅara simabịgha ḅẹ́ ọ siinyẹ mịẹm, kụ́ma ọ ḅẹ́ sa ḅẹẹ ọ nyẹ arịarị, ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ ḅárásim.
english_text: Jesus said,“If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin; but now that you claim you can see, your guilt remains.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị: ḅụ́pọ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ánáná warị ma sọghaḅọ, kụ́ma warị jẹ́ angaá ḅọ́rọ́ tándị sọ, anị tumḅọ ma fúrúḅọ pịghị kụrọ pa nyẹ fúrúḅọ.
english_text: “Very truly I tell you Pharisees, anyone who does not enter the sheep pen by the gate, but climbs in by some other way, is a thief and a robber.

ibani_text: Opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ánánáwárị ma soarịḅọ anịị ánánákúrúḅọ ma.
english_text: The one who enters by the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.

ibani_text: Ḅụ́pọ́ kúrúḅọ ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma findi ọ pịrịpịrịm, ánáná ma pịghị ọ pụghọ naánam. Ori ẹ́rẹ́ pa ori ánáná sịsịm sị n daá págháma.
english_text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ ánáná mamgba pághámaḅo fama sáá, ori tórúku sọ n pịrịm ánáná ma warị o dua, nnị ọ pụghọ nimim gosi.
english_text: When he has brought out all his own, he goes on ahead of them, and his sheep follow him because they know his voice.

ibani_text: Nnị igoniḅọ duabịgha; tụ́ma nnị ọ fịnịnga mangị sọbẹm tegó nnị igoniḅọ pụghọ lighilighiḅogha.
english_text: But they will never follow a stranger; in fact, they will run away from him because they do not recognize a stranger’s voice.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịị kaḅụ ma kọọ n pịrịm, kụ́ma nnị akanyaḅogha o dugho n pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: Jesus used this figure of speech, but the Pharisees did not understand what he was telling them.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị jẹ́ pa dugho ḅẹ́, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị. Ịrị anịị ánáná warị ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma.
english_text: Therefore Jesus said again,“Very truly I tell you, I am the gate for the sheep.

ibani_text: Parị parị ḅoapụ mamgba anịị furuapụ na pịghị kụrọ pa nyẹ furuapụ, kụ́ma ánáná ma n bịpị pughugha.
english_text: All who have come before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep have not listened to them.

ibani_text: Ịrị anịị opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma, ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sọḅo ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm. O sọḅobẹm pịghị saghị pághá, sị ịwọ osuka dọghụḅo.
english_text: I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved.They will come in and go out, and find pasture.

ibani_text: Fúrúḅọ ma go ḅo nyẹ ngéré anịị nyẹ fúrú kị́nị́ḅáa na pịghị nyẹ guluguluma. A ḅomam ḅẹ́ o duma nyána pịghị bii ḅara pa anị nyána.
english_text: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.

ibani_text: Irị anịị ibi Ánánákúrúḅọ ma. Ibi ánánákúrúḅọ ma ori duma pa kóróma ánáná ma pịrịpịrịm.
english_text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

ibani_text: Nnị ọkọḅọ ma, ori ánáná ma kúrúḅọgha, ọ pịghị ánáná ma nyánágha. Anịgo o tuú árị anị ḅoarị sa, ori ánáná ma kóróma mangisobẹm. Anịsáa tuú ma owu pa ánáná kpo ma pághámabẹm, sị n gálágáláma.
english_text: The hired hand is not the shepherd and does not own the sheep. So when he sees the wolf coming, he abandons the sheep and runs away. Then the wolf attacks the flock and scatters it.

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma mangị sọm tegó ori, ọkọ anịị nnị ori ọkọnyẹ ọ pịghị ánáná ma gbolomanyẹ balagha.
english_text: The man runs away because he is a hired hand and cares nothing for the sheep.

ibani_text: Irị anịị ibi ánánákúrúḅọ ma. A ị́yẹ́ ánáná nimim ị́yẹ́ ánáná pịghị i nimim.
english_text: “I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me—

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma ị nimiḅara anịị a Daḅọ ma nimiḅara a pịghị ị́yẹ́ duma saghị kóróma ánáná ma pịrịm.
english_text: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father—and I lay down my life for the sheep.

ibani_text: A jẹ́ jẹ́ ánáná nyánam mị ánánásiḅe yọ ma ḅụ gbẹrẹapụghaapụ. A pịghị nna akuoo nyánam. Nnị sọ ị pụghọ naabẹm, anịsáa gbẹ́rẹ́ ánáná kubiri ogbo na gbẹ́rẹ́ ánánákúrúḅọ anịị fịnị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: I have other sheep that are not of this sheep pen. I must bring them also. They too will listen to my voice, and there shall be one flock and one shepherd.

ibani_text: I Daa ma go i ḅẹlẹma nyẹ anịị a ị́yẹ́ duma saghị kórómam sị a pịghị ine anị saghị akị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: The reason my Father loves me is that I lay down my life—only to take it up again.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ i ḅarabie anị akịịghaa, kụ́ma a i ḅara na anị saghị kórómam. A kụrọ nyáná pa anị saghị kóróma pịghị kụrọ nyáná pa sima anị saghị akị. Mịị Daḅọ ma tọ́ọ i pịrịnyẹ sị a mịẹ.
english_text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have authority to lay it down and authority to take it up again. This command I received from my Father.”

ibani_text: Mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma sima puama dighiḅom Juuapụ ma ogbobie.
english_text: The Jews who heard these words were again divided.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ tọghaapụ ḅẹarị, Sitẹ́mẹ́ o ḅụbie imi ọ pịghị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ mịẹarị. O tẹ́ go o pughuu?
english_text: Many of them said, “He is demon-possessed and raving mad. Why listen to him?”

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ dughoarị, Mị sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnịḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅaraghaa. Sitẹ́mẹ́ ine tọ́rụ́pụụḅọ tọ́rụ findi bẹ?
english_text: But others said, “These are not the sayings of a man possessed by a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma sima Tamunoopuwárị ma Sịghịrị Álálị ma kiriakịm Jerusalem ḅụ; sáá ma anịị oḅuu sáá.
english_text: Then came the Festival of Dedicationat Jerusalem. It was winter,

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị Tamunoopuwárị ma párángáa nwángị ḅọ́rọ́arị Solomọn ẹ́bẹwarị pa sị ngá.
english_text: and Jesus was in the temple courts walking in Solomon’s Colonnade.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma o gbiri ịkélémam sị dughoarị, I pa wa ḅọghuma mú tẹ́ sáá láa bẹ? Ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ Krais ma, dugho págháma wa pịrịị.
english_text: The Jews who were there gathered around him, saying, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A dugho ọ pịrịm kụ́ma o mininigha. A i Daá ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma onyẹsẹ́ i pịrịm.
english_text: Jesus answered,“I did tell you, but you do not believe. The works I do in my Father’s name testify about me,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o mininigha tegó ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ánánagha.
english_text: but you do not believe because you are not my sheep.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ánáná i pụghọ pughu pughum; a n nimim, n pịghị i dua duam.
english_text: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

ibani_text: A duma gbámásó pa n pịrịm n pịghị jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné fịị faábịgha; gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine nnị pughoakịbịgha i ḅarabie.
english_text: I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one will snatch them out of my hand.

ibani_text: I Daá ánáná pa i pịrịḅọ ma gélé kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịm; gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine nnị pughoakịbịgha i Daá ma ḅárabie.
english_text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all; no one can snatch them out of my Father’s hand.

ibani_text: Irị na i Daá ma na wamịnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ.
english_text: I and the Father are one.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma sima mgbọ́lụ saghị akịm ḅẹẹ n pa o gbii,
english_text: Again his Jewish opponents picked up stones to stone him,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs nnị ḅẹm, A tọgha opu ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị pa o diemam Daḅọ ma ḅara. Ọ tẹ́ nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mgbọ́lụ pa igbiiarị?
english_text: but Jesus said to them,“I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma pagharam, Wa mịnanyẹ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ḅụ mgbọ́lụ pa igbigha, kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ Tamuno dughosima ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, tegó ịrị, papa tumḅọ ịḅụ pa Tamuno mịẹarị!
english_text: “We are not stoning you for any good work,” they replied, “but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Nnị gịẹ kórómagha ọmịna ólóghó diri bie, A dughomam ọmịnị tọgha tamuno.
english_text: Jesus answered them,“Is it not written in your Law, ‘I have said you are “gods” ’?

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ tọ́ndiri ma anị karakárányẹ sọ muu kunema lam, Tamuno tọgha tamuno pa nnị sim Tamuno oku ma ḅoo láapụ,
english_text: If he called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came—and Scripture cannot be set aside—

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị Daḅọ ma i sẹ́lẹ́akị ọ ḅụ pịrịm sị i pa tuminikiri ma fịrịma? Ị tọrọ́ pa dugho bẹ ḅẹẹ a Tamuno dughosima ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọm, anịị a dughom gosi ḅẹẹ Irị Tamuno Tụ́wọ?
english_text: what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world? Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ i Daá ma i fịrịma fịrị ma nwángịgha ọkụ́ma ọmịnị i minini ma.
english_text: Do not believe me unless I do the works of my Father.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a ḅọ́rọ́ anị mịẹarị nḅẹḅẹ́, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ i mininigha sọ, ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma minini, o nimi bẹ ḅara pịghị akanyaḅo ḅẹẹ Daḅọ ma ibie imi, irịsọ pịghị Daḅọ ma bie imii.
english_text: But if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, that you may know and understand that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị sima o kuu dọ́ghụm kụ́ma ori nna ḅara pẹ́lẹ́ma mangị sọm.
english_text: Again they tried to seize him, but he escaped their grasp.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs pịghịma mú Jọdan ma sáḅá koro sị Jọn mingi saraarị ngá ma muu áyá sáá ma ḅụ. Ori aningáa fịnịm,
english_text: Then Jesus went back across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing in the early days. There he stayed,

ibani_text: tọghaapụ warị ọ damaḅo. Nnị dughom ḅẹẹ, Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ Jọn gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị sọ nwángịgha, kụ́ma mịị owitụ́wọ ma gboloma sị o dughonyẹ mamgba karakárányẹ.
english_text: and many people came to him. They said, “Though John never performed a sign, all that John said about this man was true.”

ibani_text: Anị ngá ma ḅụ tọghaapụ pịghị Jizọs ḅụ mininim.
english_text: And in that place many believed in Jesus.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Lazarọs pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ obikorom. Bẹtani ḅụ anịị ọ saghị ḅo angaá, anịị Meri na Mata a numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ nna káláama.
english_text: Now a man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.

ibani_text: Mịị Meri ma, a numboru Lazarọs obikiri ḅụ fịnịḅọ, anịị kụ́nụ́ pulo pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅụọ sárá ḅọ sị árị sịbịnumo pa anị sii.
english_text: (This Mary, whose brother Lazarus now lay sick, was the same one who poured perfume on the Lord and wiped his feet with her hair.)

ibani_text: Árị mịna ẹrẹ ma, warị oku pa Jizọs fịrịma ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ obi kórómam.
english_text: So the sisters sent word to Jesus, “Lord, the one you love is sick.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma náa sáá o dughom ḅẹẹ, Mịị obi ma kunema, Lazarọs fịị dighiḅobịghaa, kụ́ma mịma kiriakịm sị anị boma akuoo Tamuno pịrịbẹ ḅara sị túminị́ pịghị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma boma.
english_text: When he heard this, Jesus said,“This sickness will not end in death. No, it is for God’s glory so that God’s Son may be glorified through it.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Mata na a numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ na Lazarọs ḅẹlẹmam.
english_text: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

ibani_text: Anịsọ ọ náa sáá ḅẹ́ lazarọs obikiri ḅụ imi ori ọ fịnịnga jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ a dii fịnịm.
english_text: So when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was two more days,

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ warị dugho ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị, Wa pịghịma Judiya muu.
english_text: and then he said to his disciples,“Let us go back to Judea.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori ọḅụduaapụ ma warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́maa kálá sáátụọ ḅụ Juuapụ ma mgbọ́lụ pa ị gbi dọ́ghụm, ị pịghị sima anị ngá ma muu bẹ?
english_text: “But Rabbi,” they said, “a short while ago the Jews there tried to stone you, and yet you are going back?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné bie wa kọkọ oyi mmẹẹ́ so findi pa baá nyána? Éné bie asọ nwángị owitụ́wọ ḅụọ iriimabịgha, tegó ọ mị tuminikiri baá ma pa nyẹ árịarị.
english_text: Jesus answered,“Are there not twelve hours of daylight? Anyone who walks in the daytime will not stumble, for they see by this world’s light.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o dii bie asọ nwángị nwángị ọ ḅụọ iriimabẹm tegó ọ baá nyanagha.
english_text: It is when a person walks at night that they stumble, for they have no light.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dugho n pịrị fama sáá, o ḅo dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Wámịna nángwọ Lazarọs munomam, kụ́ma a aningáa ma muarị a ọ sị saghịma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After he had said this, he went on to tell them,“Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep; but I am going there to wake him up.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọ ḅọ́rọ́ múno múno ori oju ibibẹm.
english_text: His disciples replied, “Lord, if he sleeps, he will get better.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Lazarọs fịị gbolomanyẹ dughoarị, kụ́ma nnị sim ḅẹẹ Jizọs dughoarị ḅẹẹ Lazarọs múnoarị.
english_text: Jesus had been speaking of his death, but his disciples thought he meant natural sleep.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị dughofindi n pịrị ḅẹẹ, Lazarọs fịịmam,
english_text: So then he told them plainly,“Lazarus is dead,

ibani_text: ọmịna sịbị go ị bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹ́ a aningáa ofori, sị ọmịnị ine minini bẹ ḅara. Kụ́ma wamịnị ọ dámámuu.
english_text: and for your sake I am glad I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Tọmọs (nnị Didimọs pa sịḅọ) ma warị isi ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Wamịnị sọ wa muu sị o dua fịị.
english_text: Then Thomas (also known as Didymus) said to the rest of the disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with him.”

ibani_text: O ḅo láa sáá, Jizọs arịḅom ḅẹẹ Lazarọs ínia dii pa dupu ma bie fịnịmam.
english_text: On his arrival, Jesus found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.

ibani_text: Bẹtani ḅụ akị muu Jerusalem láa mmẹẹ́ a maili laagha,
english_text: Now Bethany was less than two milesfrom Jerusalem,

ibani_text: tọgha Juuapụ pịghị Mata na Meri dámáḅómam sị n ḅoo nna bie diinma nna numboru owitụ́wọ ma fịị gosi.
english_text: and many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them in the loss of their brother.

ibani_text: Mata náa sáá ḅẹẹ Jizọs ḅoarị, a pághá sị muu ori na donam, kụ́ma Meri wárịbie fịnịm.
english_text: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed at home.

ibani_text: Mata Jizọs ḅẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị ḅọ́rọ́ mịnga imi ọkụ́ma i numboru owitụ́wọ mị fịị ma ọ fịịbịgha.
english_text: “Lord,” Martha said to Jesus, “if you had been here, my brother would not have died.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a nimim ḅẹ́ mị́sa sọ Tamuno ị binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: But I know that even now God will give you whatever you ask.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho a pịrịm, Ị numboru owitụ́wọ jẹ́ pa saghịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus said to her,“Your brother will rise again.”

ibani_text: Mata pagharam, A nimim ḅẹẹ o jẹ́ pa saghịbẹm fịị ḅụ saghị ma ḅụ kunema éné.
english_text: Martha answered, “I know he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho a pịrịm, Irị anịị fịị ḅụ saghị na pịghị duma ma. Ịḅụ mininiḅọ, n ḅọ fịị sọ pa dumabẹm;
english_text: Jesus said to her,“I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;

ibani_text: dumafịnị sị ịḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné fịịbịgha. Mịma ị minini?
english_text: and whoever lives by believing in me will never die. Do you believe this?”

ibani_text: A warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Innh Inyanaḅọ, a mininim ḅẹ́ ịrị anịị Krais Tamuno Tụ́wọ tuminikiri ma ḅoo bẹḅọ ma.
english_text: “Yes, Lord,” she replied, “I believe that you are the Messiah, the Son of God, who is to come into the world.”

ibani_text: A mịma dugho fama sáá, a pịghịma sọm sị a numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ Meri sị angaá pịrị warị a ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ ma mịnga imii, ọ pịghị ị gbilaarị.
english_text: After she had said this, she went back and called her sister Mary aside. “The Teacher is here,” she said, “and is asking for you.”

ibani_text: Meri mịma náa sáá a sáá ngúmágha ḅara pa saghị sẹm sị ọ dámámuu.
english_text: When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ Jizọs na káláama ma sọgha, kụ́ma ọ pa Mata ori na dona angaá ma ḅụ imi.
english_text: Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was still at the place where Martha had met him.

ibani_text: Saghị éné éné Meri na fịnị Juuapụ ma warị bie, ḅoo a bie diinmaarịapụ ma árị sáá a sáá ngúmágha ḅara pa saghị pághá ḅara, n warị a dua sịarị ḅẹ́ a dupu yọ ma muarị a muu owú bẹ ḅara.
english_text: When the Jews who had been with Mary in the house, comforting her, noticed how quickly she got up and went out, they followed her, supposing she was going to the tomb to mourn there.

ibani_text: Meri Jizọs fịnị angaá ma láa sáá sị ori arị sáá a sóghórokorom ọ ḅụọ anga warị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ i ḅọ́rọ́ mịnga ma ḅụ imi ọkụma i numboru owitụ́wọ mịị fịị ma ọ fịịbịgha.
english_text: When Mary reached the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”

ibani_text: Jizọs Meri árị sáá owuarị pịghị a dua ḅoo Juuapụ ma árị owuarị, nna owuú ma ọ tẹ́mẹ́ lam sị opuma ojighemam.
english_text: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who had come along with her also weeping, he was deeply moved in spirit and troubled.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọ tẹ́ angaá o dipi? Nnị pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅo dighi.
english_text: “Where have you laid him?”he asked. “Come and see, Lord,” they replied.

ibani_text: Jizọs owúm.
english_text: Jesus wept.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Juuapụ ma warị ḅẹẹ, Dighii ori ọ ḅẹlẹma ḅara!
english_text: Then the Jews said, “See how he loved him!”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ dughom ḅẹẹ, Ori tọ́rụ pụụapụ tọ́rụ findiarị ḅọ ma ori ine mịị owitụ́wọ ma kikibịgha sị fịịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: But some of them said, “Could not he who opened the eyes of the blind man have kept this man from dying?”

ibani_text: Fịị ma sima opuma Jizọs tẹ́mẹ́ lam, ọ warị dupu ma muu. Ọ́ dapịrịbie n kara pághámaḅo nyẹ, opu dapịrị imi nnị pa anị asọ mgbẹsẹ nyẹ.
english_text: Jesus, once more deeply moved, came to the tomb. It was a cave with a stone laid across the entrance.

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho nnị pịrịm, Opu dapịrị ma dighi si. Kụ́ma, Mata fịịḅọ ma numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ, dughom, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, mị́sa anị saghị si onu nyánámam, ḅẹẹ, ínia dii lámam ọ fịịnyẹ.
english_text: “Take away the stone,”he said. “But, Lord,” said Martha, the sister of the dead man, “by this time there is a bad odor, for he has been there four days.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs wárị ḅẹẹ, A dugho ị pịrịgha ḅẹ́ ị ḅọ́rọ́ minini minini, ị Tamuno ipine ma árịbẹm?
english_text: Then Jesus said,“Did I not tell you that if you believe, you will see the glory of God?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị dapịrị ma mgbẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ si. Jizọs warị tọ́rụ saghị so dighi sị ḅẹẹ, Daa, a ị miẹḅam pa ị ḅẹm ḅẹẹ ịrị ị náa nam.
english_text: So they took away the stone. Then Jesus looked up and said,“Father, I thank you that you have heard me.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹẹ sáá mamgba ịrị i náa nam, kụ́ma a mịma dughom mịnga sẹfịnịarịapụ ma gosi, nnị minini ḅẹ́ ḅara ḅẹẹ ịrị ị fịrịmam.
english_text: I knew that you always hear me, but I said this for the benefit of the people standing here, that they may believe that you sent me.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ fama sáá, ọ kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghum, Lazarọs págháḅoo!
english_text: When he had said this, Jesus called in a loud voice,“Lazarus, come out!”

ibani_text: Fịị owitụ́wọ ma págháḅom, nnị pa ọ fịna dụadipi alo, ọ ḅụọ na ọ ḅara na pa ọ ḅụ imi, na pịghị nnị pa ọ tọ́rụ fịna bịtẹ. Jizọs dugho nnị pịrịm, Dụadipi bịtẹ fiima ọ ḅụ sị o soo.
english_text: The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with strips of linen, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them,“Take off the grave clothes and let him go.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, tọgha Juuapụ ḅoo Meri dighiapụ ma sị Jizọs mịẹnyẹ ma árị, ḅoo ọ ḅụ mininim.
english_text: Therefore many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, believed in him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nna ḅụ bẹ jẹ́apụ Farisiiapụ ma damamum sị dugho nnị pịrị Jizọs mịẹmáa nyẹ.
english_text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.

ibani_text: Anịsáa igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma warị kụrọ ḅa ámátáarịapụ kobiri ma sịị. Nnị warị jụghọ jụghọ gbíla, Wa tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? Mịị tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangịarị owitụ́wọ ma.
english_text: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin. “What are we accomplishing?” they asked. “Here is this man performing many signs.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ọ warị so so sị ọ mịị fịrị ma nwángị tórúku muu, tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅoo ọ ḅụ mininibẹm. Anịsa Romapụ ma ḅobẹm sị wámịna Tamunoopuwárị ma guluguluma na pịghị wámịna sẹ.
english_text: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and then the Romans will come and take away both our temple and our nation.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, Kayafas pa sịḅọ, ori anịị opu igwagwaḅọ ma anị kụ́rá ma ḅụ, pụghọ saghị igani bẹ, Ị tọ́rọ pa nwọfịnị oḅori sọ bẹ?
english_text: Then one of them, named Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, spoke up, “You know nothing at all!

ibani_text: Ị nimigha ḅẹ́ anị ibiḅam gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ fịị túminị́ mamgba pịrị sẹ gbọrụ ma fịị nakaragha.
english_text: You do not realize that it is better for you that one man die for the people than that the whole nation perish.”

ibani_text: Mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ori kọ́rọ́ma ḅụ saghị ḅogha, kụ́ma opu igwagwaḅọ ḅara ma anị kụ́rá ma ḅụ, ori ikiakorom ḅẹẹ, Jizọs fịị Juu sẹ ma pịrịbẹm,
english_text: He did not say this on his own, but as high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the Jewish nation,

ibani_text: anị sẹ ma ngéréghaa, kụ́ma n gálágáláma warị Tamuno awọ ma, nna akuoo sị n pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: and not only for that nation but also for the scattered children of God, to bring them together and make them one.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma ḅụ saghị tórúku muu n ḅẹrẹ biam n ḅara warị ọ ḅá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: So from that day on they plotted to take his life.

ibani_text: Mịma mịẹm Jizọs mịnị ọkọ pa pághagha, kị́nị́mamgba nimi ḅẹ́ ḅara ọ fịnị angaá, anịị Juuapụ ma ogbobie. Anịmanakaragha ori ọ ḅụ nụ́nụ́akị so Ifremu pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ káláama múm, elesiri párángáa na kikianyẹ, aningáa ori ọrẹ ọḅụduaapụ ma na fịnịanga.
english_text: Therefore Jesus no longer moved about publicly among the people of Judea. Instead he withdrew to a region near the wilderness, to a village called Ephraim, where he stayed with his disciples.

ibani_text: Juuapụ Saḅaḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kikiamam, tọghaapụ elesiri angaá ma ḅụ saghị Jerusalem sọm sị nna ḅụ sịrị mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma mịẹ pa Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kúru.
english_text: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, many went up from the country to Jerusalem for their ceremonial cleansing before the Passover.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs dọghụarị, anịgo nnị Tamunoopuwarị ma angásá kobiri sáá nnị saghị jụghọ jụghọ gbilam, Ọ tọ́rọ pa anị arịị, ọ sị ḅẹ́ ọ mịị Álálị ma ḅoo bẹ?
english_text: They kept looking for Jesus, and as they stood in the temple courts they asked one another, “What do you think? Isn’t he coming to the festival at all?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ bịpị pịrịmam ḅẹ́ ọ fịnị angaá dọghụḅo ḅọ fịnịfịnị dugho sị nnị oku.
english_text: But the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who found out where Jesus was should report it so that they might arrest him.

ibani_text: Suéné a dii anị kọọ nyẹ Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kiriakị, Jizọs wárị ḅo Bẹtani láa, ọ fịị ḅụ saghịma Lazarọs ma ngaa ama.
english_text: Six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.

ibani_text: Aningáa nnị álálị fị́nyẹ pa Jizọs ọkọọm. Mata fịrịnwangị n pịrịm, Lazarọs anịị ori na ịkasị sịbị kpọrọfịnịapụ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Here a dinner was given in Jesus’ honor. Martha served, while Lazarus was among those reclining at the table with him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Meri warị nardi ḅụ n mịẹ pághámaḅo yóriyóri gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́nụ́ senti ololo akị, opuma igbii láanyẹ; a warị anị pa Jizọs ḅụọ ḅụ sara warị a sịbị núme paá anị sii. Senti ma kụ́nụ́ warị kụ́nụ́ warị gbọrụ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: Then Mary took about a pintof pure nard, an expensive perfume; she poured it on Jesus’ feet and wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Judas Isịkarọtị, kunema Jizọs dẹrịfị bẹḅọ warị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was later to betray him, objected,

ibani_text: Nnị tegó sị mịị senti ma dẹrịgha sị anị igbii pa igonyiapụ pịrị? Anịị pị́naḅala igbii jie a si
english_text: “Why wasn’t this perfume sold and the money given to the poor? It was worth a year’s wages.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dughogha ḅẹ́ ori igonyiapụ ma balam, kụ́ma ori fúrúḅọ gosi. Ori igbii akpa ma dighiarịḅọ ẹrẹ́sị, sa ḅụ akị muu sa láa ọ kálá igbii nyẹ ákịkịm pa ḅárásua ọ ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: He did not say this because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief; as keeper of the money bag, he used to help himself to what was put into it.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A wáriso! A mịma mịẹm pa tẹ́lẹ́ma ị́yẹ́ dipi kúru.
english_text: “Leave her alone,”Jesus replied.“It was intended that she should save this perfume for the day of my burial.

ibani_text: Igonyiapụ ma sámámgba ọmịnị nnị na fịnịbẹm, kụ́ma ịrị sámámgbagha a ọmịnị na fịnị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: You will always have the poor among you,but you will not always have me.”

ibani_text: Tọgha Juuapụ naam ḅẹ́ Jizọs Bẹtani ḅụ imi, anịgo nnị warị anịngáa muu, Jizọs ngéréghaa n go muunyẹ kụ́ma n pịghị Lazarọs árị ọ fịị ḅụ saghịma ḅọ.
english_text: Meanwhile a large crowd of Jews found out that Jesus was there and came, not only because of him but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
