ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma warị asọ dọghụ nnị Lazarọs na Jizọs baá bẹ ḅara gbẹ́rẹ́sa,
english_text: So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well,

ibani_text: Lazarọs gosi tọgha Juuapụ ma saghị nnị sịghịmam sị Jizọs ḅụ minini. Nnị nwọpa mịẹarị Lazarọs ḅụ pághá nyẹ gosi.
english_text: for on account of him many of the Jews were going over to Jesus and believing in him.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅa, Álálị ma ḅoo opu túminị́ kpo ma ḅọ naam ḅẹẹ Jizọs Jerusalem muarị.
english_text: The next day the great crowd that had come for the festival heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị warị dim ḅara pẹlẹ akị muu ori na dona ilúghuarị, Hozana! Karịiḅi fịnị́ Dúmagbámásóḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅoarịḅọ ma pịrịị! Karịiḅi fịnị́ Izirẹlị Ámányánáḅọ ma pịrịị!
english_text: They took palm branches and went out to meet him, shouting, “Hosanna!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Blessed is the king of Israel!”

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ tụ́wọ arịm sị anị ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnị, n gịẹ kóróma ḅara tọ́ndiri bie;
english_text: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, as it is written:

ibani_text: Ọ bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ dighi ḅáláfama, Zayọn opu ama; o dighi, ọmịna Ámányánáḅọ ḅoarị, ọ kpọrọfịnịm ikúnyẹ dighi ásụ tụ́wọ ọgọnọ.
english_text: “Do not be afraid, Daughter Zion; see, your king is coming, seated on a donkey’s colt.”

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma kiriakị sáá, ori ọḅụduaapụ akanyaḅogha anịgo ọkọ pághá nyẹ, kụ́ma nnị Jizọs saghịma sa Tamuno ma ipine bie, nnị biekórómam ḅẹ́ Tọ́n diri ma ọkọfịnị o gbolomanyẹ dughom ḅẹ́ nnị pịghị mịnanyẹ ma pa ọ mịẹm.
english_text: At first his disciples did not understand all this. Only after Jesus was glorified did they realize that these things had been written about him and that these things had been done to him.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Jizọs na fịnị túminị́ kpo ma ọ Lazarọs sị sáá dupu ma bie sị fịị ḅụ ọ saghịma, pa pághányẹ ma dugho wásámaarị.
english_text: Now the crowd that was with him when he called Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to spread the word.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma pághá muu Jizọs na donam tegó nnị naam ḅẹẹ ọ mịị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nwángịm.
english_text: Many people, because they had heard that he had performed this sign, went out to meet him.

ibani_text: Farisiiapụ ma warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹ́, Dighi, wa tọ́ọ sị mịẹ dọghụnyẹ ma sịbị nyanagha. Dighi tuminikiri gbọrụ mamgba o duarị ḅara!
english_text: So the Pharisees said to one another, “See, this is getting us nowhere. Look how the whole world has gone after him!”

ibani_text: Mị́sa muu susi Tamuno pịrịapụ ma bie Álálị ma ḅụ Girikiapụ sọ imim.
english_text: Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the festival.

ibani_text: Nnị Filipụ damaḅom Bẹtịsaida ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, warị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, wa Jizọs árị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, with a request. “Sir,” they said, “we would like to see Jesus.”

ibani_text: Filipụ muu dugho Anduru pịrịm; Anduru na Filipụ warị muu dugho Jizọs pịrị.
english_text: Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Sáá ma lámam nnị kuu pa Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma sọma.
english_text: Jesus replied,“The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, n kiribie mbiakpa mgbọ́lụ dipi nyánam. Anị fịịgha fịịgha anị ọkọfịnịbẹm, gbẹ́rẹ́ sịmgbọlụ ma. Kụ́ma anị fịịfịị anị tọgha sịịmgbọlụ pághámaḅobẹm.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, unless a kernel of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains only a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds.

ibani_text: Amịna duma ḅẹlẹma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị famabẹm, amịna duma ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ mị tuminikiri anị warị pa duma gbámásó pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Anyone who loves their life will lose it, while anyone who hates their life in this world will keep it for eternal life.

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangị i pịrịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i dua nyánam; a fịnị angaá anịị ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ fịnị ḅẹ́ angaá. I Daá ma kuu pa fịrịnwangị i pịrịarịḅọ ma suabẹm.
english_text: Whoever serves me must follow me; and where I am, my servant also will be. My Father will honor the one who serves me.

ibani_text: Mị́sa i tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅụ́ḅáláḅáláarị, a pịghị tẹ́ dugho bẹ? A dugho bẹ ḅẹẹ, Daá, i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma mị́sa i damaḅoarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma ḅụ? Enrrh enrrh, mịị ma go anị a go ḅo nyẹ mị́sa.
english_text: “Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this hour’? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour.

ibani_text: Daá, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ boma! Anịsáa, gbẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ warị sobie saghị koro, A anị bomamam, a pịghị sima anị bomabẹm.
english_text: Father, glorify your name!” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.”

ibani_text: Anị ngá sẹ́fịnịarị túminị́ kpo ma pụghọ ma naam warị ḅẹẹ soalagba fiemam; jẹ́apụ warị dugho ḅẹẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọ ọ pịrịm.
english_text: The crowd that was there and heard it said it had thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him.

ibani_text: Jizọs dughom, Mịị pụghọ ma i sịbị go kórógha kụ́ma ọmịna sịbị go.
english_text: Jesus said,“This voice was for your benefit, not mine.

ibani_text: Mị́sa anịị nnị mịị tuminikiri ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹnyẹ; mị́sa mịị tuminikiri táarịḅọ nnị o dee pághámabẹm.
english_text: Now is the time for judgment on this world; now the prince of this world will be driven out.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị nnị kiri i saghị sóghólóma sa, a kị́nị́mamgba nụ́nụ́akị ịḅụ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: And I, when I am lifted upfrom the earth, will draw all people to myself.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dughom pa die ọ kọọ bẹ fịị ḅara.
english_text: He said this to show the kind of death he was going to die.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma pagharam, Wámịna ologho dugho wa pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Krais ma fịnị muu gbámásó lábẹm, anịsáa ọ tẹ́ go dughoarị ḅẹ́, Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma nnị ọ saghị sóghólómabẹm? Mịị Tumḅọ yii Tụ́wọ ma, ori tụọ?
english_text: The crowd spoke up, “We have heard from the Law that the Messiah will remain forever, so how can you say,‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, Baá ma ọmịnị na fịnịbẹm ḅọlọgha kálá sa tụọ ḅụ. Asọ nwángị ọ pa baá árịarị sa, kánákáná na ḅogha sáá. Kánákánábie asọ nwángịarị ḅọ nimigha n ḅọ muarị angaá.
english_text: Then Jesus told them,“You are going to have the light just a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, before darkness overtakes you. Whoever walks in the dark does not know where they are going.

ibani_text: Baá ma ḅụ minini ịrị anị nyáná sáá, ọmịnị baá ma awọ sọ bẹ ḅara. Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọfáma sa, ori aningáa ma warịsom sị muu ọ ḅụ ḅọghu n fịnị angaá.
english_text: Believe in the light while you have the light, so that you may become children of light.”When he had finished speaking, Jesus left and hid himself from them.

ibani_text: Jizọs mịná ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nwángịmam nbẹsọ nna tórúku, anịsọ nnị pa ọ ḅụ mininigha.
english_text: Even after Jesus had performed so many signs in their presence, they still would not believe in him.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakịm ikiakoro Aizaya dughonyẹ ma ḅoo karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara: ḅẹẹ, Dúmagbámásóḅọ, tụọ wámịna oku ma minini ma Dúmagbámásóḅọ ma, ori ọrẹ kụ́rọ pa tụọ die ma?
english_text: This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet: “Lord, who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”

ibani_text: Mịma gosi nnị ine mininigha, tegó Aizaya dugho ḅara jẹ́ angaá:
english_text: For this reason they could not believe, because, as Isaiah says elsewhere:

ibani_text: Tamuno nna tọ́rụ́ pụụmamam pịghị fịịmaá kúkúbie pa n pịrị, anịgo nna tọ́rụ́ ine nyẹ arịgha, nna tẹ́mẹ́ sọ akanyaḅogha anịgha pịghị i damaḅo sị a nnị gwọọ.
english_text: “He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, so they can neither see with their eyes, nor understand with their hearts, nor turn—and I would heal them.”

ibani_text: Aizaya mịma dughom tegó o Jizọs ipine ma arịm sị o gbolomanyẹ dughom.
english_text: Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus’ glory and spoke about him.

ibani_text: Anịsọ tọghaapụ, sịbịdáapụ ma bie sọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́sa ma ḅụ Jizọs ḅụ mininim. Kụ́ma Farisiiapụ ma ḅáláfa gosi nnị mịnị nna minini ma gbólómanyẹ dugho pághámagha, nnị n deesibịgha ḅara nna kobiri yọ ḅụ;
english_text: Yet at the same time many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they would not openly acknowledge their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue;

ibani_text: tegó mịịapụ ma nnị túminị́ ḅara ḅoo túminí ḅẹlẹma Tamuno ḅara ḅo nyẹ nẹngịm.
english_text: for they loved human praise more than praise from God.

ibani_text: Jizọs kụ́rọ pụghọ pa ilúghum, Tumḅọ ịḅụ minini sáá, n ḅọ ịḅụ ngéré mininigha, kụ́ma i fịrịmaḅọ ma ḅụ.
english_text: Then Jesus cried out,“Whoever believes in me does not believe in me only, but in the one who sent me.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ árị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị i fịrịmaḅọ arịm.
english_text: The one who looks at me is seeing the one who sent me.

ibani_text: A tuminikiri ma ḅomam baá ḅara, sị ịḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịnị kánákánábie fịnịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ ị́yẹ́ oku ma naam sị mịnị anị dughonyẹ mịẹgha, a ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha nna sịbị. A tuminikiriapụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅogha, kụ́ma nnị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma anịị a go ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: “If anyone hears my words but does not keep them, I do not judge that person. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

ibani_text: I sịghịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị mịnị ị́yẹ́ oku mininiakịgha, nna sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹḅọ nyánam. A kọmaá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma nna sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm kunema éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: There is a judge for the one who rejects me and does not accept my words; the very words I have spoken will condemn them at the last day.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọgha, kụ́ma i fịrị ma Daḅọ ma tọ́ọ i pịrịmam a dugho bẹnyẹ na pịghị a dugho bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For I did not speak on my own, but the Father who sent me commanded me to say all that I have spoken.

ibani_text: Daḅọ tọ́ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma maá nyẹ ma tumḅọ daa muu duma gbámásó ḅụ súúarị. Anịgo a dughonyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị Daḅọ dugho i pịrịnyẹ sị a dugho.
english_text: I know that his command leads to eternal life. So whatever I say is just what the Father has told me to say.”

ibani_text: Éné ḅa anịị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma. Jizọs nimim ḅẹ́ sáá ma láamam ọ mịị tuminikiri ma wáriso sị Daḅọ ma dámámuu. Ori ọrẹ a túminị́, tuminikiri fịnịapụ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mamaá ḅara ma, ori n ḅẹlẹma muu kunema lam.
english_text: It was just before the Passover Festival. Jesus knew that the hour had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.

ibani_text: Jizọs na ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅupiri fị́nyẹ kiri ḅụ imi, ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma pịghị Judas, Saimọn Isịkarọtị tụwọ timi saghịmam ḅẹ́ ọ Jizọs dẹrịfị.
english_text: The evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already prompted Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus.

ibani_text: Jizọs nimim ḅẹ́ Daḅọ ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ saghị ọ ḅarabie suamam, ḅẹ́ ọ Tamuno ma ḅara saghịḅom ọ pịghị so Tamuno ma dámámụarị;
english_text: Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God;

ibani_text: ọ warị saghị sẹ́ fị́nyẹ kiri ma ḅụ, ọgọ́nọ́ ọ suabịtẹ ma síi, mingi biri bịtẹ pa o kundu kpọ.
english_text: so he got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.

ibani_text: Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, o mingi sara ọkọ bie suam sị ori ọḅụduaapụ ḅụọ sịrị, wárị ọ pa kundu kpọ mingi biri bịtẹ ma pa anị síi.
english_text: After that, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.

ibani_text: O ḅo Saimọn Pita láa sáá, Pita ọ ḅẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, í i ḅụọ siri bẹ?
english_text: He came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A mịẹarịnyẹ ị akanyaḅogha mị́sa, kụ́ma sa ma láa sa ịrị anị akanyaḅobẹm.
english_text: Jesus replied,“You do not realize now what I am doing, but later you will understand.”

ibani_text: Pita pagharam, Enrrh enrrh, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ịrị i ḅụọ sịrịbịgha. Jizọs pagharam, A ị ḅụọ sịrịgha nḅẹḅẹ́ ịrị na ị nana wa mịẹgbólóma nyẹ nyánágha.
english_text: “No,” said Peter, “you shall never wash my feet.” Jesus answered,“Unless I wash you, you have no part with me.”

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita warị pagharaa, Anịsáa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i ḅụọ ngéréghaa kụ́ma i ḅara na i sịbị na!
english_text: “Then, Lord,” Simon Peter replied, “not just my feet but my hands and my head as well!”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Mingi birimaa ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ oju fiafiam, n ḅọ ḅụọ ngéré anịị n ḅọ sịịrị bẹnyẹ. Ọ fiafiam, kụ́ma ọ mịnị kị́nị́mamgbagha.
english_text: Jesus answered,“Those who have had a bath need only to wash their feet; their whole body is clean. And you are clean, though not every one of you.”

ibani_text: Tegó Jizọs nimisomam ọ dẹrịfị bẹḅọ, anị ọ go dughonyẹ ḅẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba fiafiagha.
english_text: For he knew who was going to betray him, and that was why he said not every one was clean.

ibani_text: Ori nna ḅụọ ma sịrịfama sáá, ori ọrẹ bịtẹ suam sị pịghịma ori ịkasị fịnị angaá ḅom nyẹ́fị kiri ma ḅụ. Ọ warị n gbíla, Ọmịnị akanyaḅo mị́sa a ọ ḅụ mịẹnyẹ?
english_text: When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and returned to his place.“Do you understand what I have done for you?”he asked them.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Nyẹ́dieḅọ anịgha Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pa i sim, ọ karakáram, anịị a fịnị ḅara.
english_text: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ịrị ọmịna Nyánáḅọ na ọmịna Nyẹ́dieḅọ, ọmịna ḅụọ sịrịmam, ọmịnị sọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅụọ sịrị.
english_text: Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet.

ibani_text: A anị kịkamanyẹ mịẹ pa ọ diemam, ọmịnị sọ a mịẹ ọ pịrịmaá ḅara ma mịẹbẹ ḅara.
english_text: I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ómóniḅọ ma dụḅa ọ nyanaḅọ ma nẹngịgha, anịgha oku muḅọ ma dụḅa oku ma fịrịma ḅọ nẹ́ngị.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, no servant is greater than his master, nor is a messenger greater than the one who sent him.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọ mịnanyẹ ma nimimáa sáá, nnị ọ karịibimabẹm, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ anị mịẹmịẹ.
english_text: Now that you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.

ibani_text: A ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅẹgha; a nimim a sẹlẹakịmaapụ. Kụ́ma mịma anị pa mịẹsị tọ́ndiri ma ḅoo kiriakị bẹ ḅara: dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị na nyẹ́fị fị ḅọ ma pịghị ị́yẹ́ iruonaḅọ sọmam.
english_text: “I am not referring to all of you; I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill this passage of Scripture: ‘He who shared my bread has turnedagainst me.’

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịarị mị́sa na anị kiriakịgha sáá, anị kiriakị sáá, o mininibẹm ḅẹẹ, Ịrị Anịị Ịrị Ma.
english_text: “I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe that I am who I am.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị, a fịrịmaḅọ ma dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i dakórómam pịghị i dakóróma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i fịrịmaḅọ ma dakórómam.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, whoever accepts anyone I send accepts me; and whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dugho fama sáá, ọ tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịm ọ wárị dugho pághámá ḅẹẹ, A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ i Dẹrịfị́bẹm.
english_text: After he had said this, Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified,“Very truly I tell you, one of you is going to betray me.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ tọ́rụ pịghị jụghọ jụghọ dighim, kórómaarị ọ ḅẹ́arịḅọ.
english_text: His disciples stared at one another, at a loss to know which of them he meant.

ibani_text: Ọḅụduaapụ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Jizọs ḅẹlẹma ḅọ ma, kpọrọfịnịarị Jizọs angásá.
english_text: One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining next to him.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita warị ḅara pa mịị ọḅụduaḅọ ma mịẹ ḅẹẹ, O gbíla ọ ḅẹ́arịḅọ.
english_text: Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, “Ask him which one he means.”

ibani_text: Ori Jizọs ḅụ sẹrẹrẹm sị o gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, ọ tụọ i ḅẹ́arịḅọ?
english_text: Leaning back against Jesus, he asked him, “Lord, who is it?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A mịị fịtúrú ma pa pịrịbẹḅọ a anị suu sa bọlị bie. O fịtúrú ma suu sa, ori anị pa Judas Isịkarọtị, Saimọn tụ́wọ pịrịm.
english_text: Jesus answered,“It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it in the dish.”Then, dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

ibani_text: Judas fịtúrú ma daakị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, Satanị ori oju bie sọm. Jizọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị mịẹ dọghụnyẹ ma álála anị mịẹ.
english_text: As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him. So Jesus told him,“What you are about to do, do quickly.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nyẹ́fị kiri ma ḅụ fịnịapụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ akanyaḅogha Jizọs go mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pa ọ bẹnyẹ.
english_text: But no one at the meal understood why Jesus said this to him.

ibani_text: Judas ori igbii koko ḅọ gosi, jẹ́apụ kórómam ḅẹẹ Jizọs ọ ḅẹarị ḅẹ́ o muu fị na ḅụ na ma ḅụ n binyẹ fẹ, anịgha nyẹ pa igonyiapụ pịrị.
english_text: Since Judas had charge of the money, some thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the festival, or to give something to the poor.

ibani_text: Judas fịtúrú ma akị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, ọ nụ́ngọ pághám. Anịsáa ma ḅụ éné dimam.
english_text: As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.

ibani_text: Judas so fama sáá, Jizọs dughom, Mị́sa anịị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ipine anị ḅụ diepágháma nyẹ, mị́sa Tamuno ipine ma so anị ḅụ diem ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: When he was gone, Jesus said,“Now the Son of Man is glorified and God is glorified in him.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ipine ma ọ ḅụ anị ḅụ diem, anịsáa Tamun ọ ḅara na Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma ipine diebẹm ori Tamuno ma ḅụ, ọ pịghị anị mịẹbẹm anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri.
english_text: If God is glorified in him,God will glorify the Son in himself, and will glorify him at once.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ awọ kálá sáá tụwọ anịị a pa ọmịnị na fịnị bẹnyẹ. Ọmịnị ị dọghụbẹm, kụ́ma mị́sa a dugho ọ pịrịarị a dugho Juu sịbịdaapụ ma pịrịnyẹ, A muarị angaá ọmịnị ine ḅobịgha.
english_text: “My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so I tell you now: Where I am going, you cannot come.

ibani_text: Ịwọ ologho anịị a pa ọ pịrịnyẹ: ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma. A ọ ḅẹlẹma maá ḅara ma, ọmịnị sọ pịghị ọkọ pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹlẹma nyáná jụghọ jụghọ pịrị, kị́nị́mamgba nimibẹm ḅẹ́ ọmịnị anịị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.”

ibani_text: Anịsa Saimọn Pita warị o gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị tẹ́ angaá muarị? Jizọs pagharam, A muarị angaá ịné ị duabịgha mị́sa, kụ́ma ọḅụkụ́nọma ị́ i duabẹm.
english_text: Simon Peter asked him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus replied,“Where I am going, you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.”

ibani_text: Pita gbilam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, a tegó sị mị́sa ine ị duabịgha? A tẹ́lẹ́mamam sị ị́yẹ́ duma kóróma ị sịbị gosi.
english_text: Peter asked, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs pagharam, Ị ibima tẹ́lẹ́mama sị ị́yẹ́ duma kóróma bẹ i sịbị gosi? A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm, ọbịọ ma na pághá sá ị tẹ́rẹ́ a sa pa i pighibẹm!
english_text: Then Jesus answered,“Will you really lay down your life for me? Very truly I tell you, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times!

ibani_text: Ọ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie pịrịma. O kúkúbie pa Tamuno ḅụ gbánā; pịghị kúkúbie pa ịḅụ gbánā.
english_text: “Do not let your hearts be troubled. You believe in God; believe also in me.

ibani_text: I Daá ma wárị tọgha bie imi; anị ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ fịnịgha a dugho ọ pịrịmam. A anị ngá muarị sị a yọ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ pịrị
english_text: My Father’s house has many rooms; if that were not so, would I have told you that I am going there to prepare a place for you?

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ mú muu sị yọ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ pịrị, a pịghịma ḅobẹm sị ọmịnị akị ịḅụ pịrị, ọmịnị a fịnịnga fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me that you also may be where I am.

ibani_text: A muarị angaá ma daá mú asọ ọ kọkọ nimi.
english_text: You know the way to the place where I am going.”

ibani_text: Tọmọs ọ ḅẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, wa nimigha i muarị angaá, wa tọrọ́ pa asọ ma nimi bẹ?
english_text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Irị anịị asọ ma, karakáráma na pịghị duma ma. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine Daḅọ ma dámáḅobịgha ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́gha pa.
english_text: Jesus answered,“I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

ibani_text: Ọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ ibima ị nimi, ọ pịghị i Daá ma nimibẹm. Mị́sa saghị bịpị muu ọmịnị o nimim pịghị ori árịmam!
english_text: If you really know me, you will knowmy Father as well. From now on, you do know him and have seen him.”

ibani_text: Filipụ dughom, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Daḅọ ma pa wa die, anịsáa wa ḅụ diinbẹm.
english_text: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father and that will be enough for us.”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Filipụ, a mịị ḅọlọmaa sáá ma pa ọmịnị na fịnịmam, anị so, ọ pa inimigha? Ị́yẹ́ árịmaa ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Daḅọ ma árịmam. I tegósi dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Daḅọ ma pa wa die?
english_text: Jesus answered:“Don’t you know me, Philip, even after I have been among you such a long time? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

ibani_text: I mininigha ḅẹ́ a Daḅọ ma bie imi, Daḅọ ma sọ ibie imi? A kọọ ọ pịrịarị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha. Tụ́ma i biebẹ ngáarị Daḅọ ma ori anịị ori fịrịnwangịarịḅọ.
english_text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words I say to you I do not speak on my own authority. Rather, it is the Father, living in me, who is doing his work.

ibani_text: I minini a dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, a Daḅọ ma bie imi, Daḅọ ma sọ ibie imi; anịgha ị minini a nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma gosi.
english_text: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; or at least believe on the evidence of the works themselves.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm, ịḅụ minini nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a nwángịarị fịrị ma nwángịbẹm. Anịḅọ ma mịị ma nẹ́ngịma fịrị nwángịbẹm, tegó a Daḅọ ma dámámụarị.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, whoever believes in me will do the works I have been doing, and they will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.

ibani_text: A pịghị ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ o binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹm, Daḅọ ma ị ipine anị ḅụ diepágháma bẹ ḅara Tụwọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

ibani_text: Iyẹ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ o binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a anị mịẹbẹm.
english_text: You may ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅẹlẹma ḅẹlẹma, ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ologho ma kokobẹm.
english_text: “If you love me, keep my commands.

ibani_text: A pịghị Daḅọ ma ḅara biibẹm ọ pịghị jẹ́ ḅárásuaḅọ pa ọ pịrịbẹm, ọmịnị na fịnị muu gbámásó láa bẹḅọ.
english_text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another advocate to help you and be with you forever—

ibani_text: Mịị ḅárásuaḅọ ma ori anịị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma tụ́manyẹ ma pa túminị́ diearịḅọ. Tuminikiri ma ine ọ daa kórómabịgha tegó nnị ori arịgha anịgha o nimi. Kụ́ma ọmịnị o nimim ori ọmịnị na ngáarị gosi ọ pịghị ọmịna bie fịnịbẹm.
english_text: the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will bein you.

ibani_text: A ọ warịsobịgha daa na nyingi nyanagha awọ ḅara; a pịghịma ọ dámáḅobẹm.
english_text: I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha kálá sáátụọ ḅụ, tuminikiri ma mịnị jẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha, kụ́ma ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm. Tegó a dumafịnịm ọmịnị sọ duma fịnịbẹm.
english_text: Before long, the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma ḅụ onimiḅobẹm ḅẹẹ a i Daá ma bie imi, ọmịnị ma ibie imi, ịrị ma pịghị ọmịna bie imim.
english_text: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ologho ma daakị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị anị dughonyẹ mịẹ, anị tumḅọ ma anịị i ḅẹlẹma ḅọ. I ḅẹlẹma ḅọ i Daá ma n ḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, ịrịsọ n ḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm pịghị ịḅụ pa n ḅọ diebẹm.
english_text: Whoever has my commands and keeps them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love them and show myself to them.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Judas (Judas Isịkarọtị) dughom, Kụ́ma, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị tegósi ịḅụ pa wa die dọghụ sị ịḅụ pa tuminikiri gbọrụ ma die dọghụgha?
english_text: Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “But, Lord, why do you intend to show yourself to us and not to the world?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, I ḅẹlẹma ḅọ fịnịfịnị n ḅọ ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma dughonyẹ mịẹbẹm. I Daá ma n ḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, wamịnị n ḅọ dámáḅobẹm sị nnị na ngaa.
english_text: Jesus replied,“Anyone who loves me will obey my teaching. My Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.

ibani_text: I ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma dughonyẹ mịẹbịgha. Ọ pịghị náa maá dienyẹ ma ị́yẹ́ angaá nyẹ́gha, i fịrịma Daḅọ ma anịị anị nyánányẹ.
english_text: Anyone who does not love me will not obey my teaching. These words you hear are not my own; they belong to the Father who sent me.

ibani_text: A mịma dugho ọ pịrịarị mị́sa a pa ọmịnị na fịnịarị sáá.
english_text: “All this I have spoken while still with you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Ḅárásuaḅọ ma, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, Daḅọ ma fịrị ma bẹḅọ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa o diebẹm, pịghị a pa o diemaa nyẹ mamgba pa ọmịna biekórómabẹm.
english_text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and will remind you of everything I have said to you.

ibani_text: Diin anị a wáriso ọ pịrịnyẹ, a ị́yẹ́ diin pa ọ pịrịm. A pa ọ pịrịgha tuminikiriapụ pịrị pịrị ḅara. Ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅụḅáláḅálá ma ọ pịghị ḅáláfama.
english_text: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị i naam a dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, A soarị, a pịghị sima ḅoobẹm. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅẹlẹma, o bieḅẹlẹbẹm ḅẹẹ, a Daḅọ ma dámámụarị, Daḅọ ma dụḅa i nẹngịm.
english_text: “You heard me say, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịarị anị na kiriakịgha sáá, sị anị kiriakị sáá ọ minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe.

ibani_text: A mịnị ọ nana ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅọlọbịgha, tegó mịị tuminikiri ma táarịḅọ ḅoarị. Ọ kụ́rọ nyanagha ịḅụ,
english_text: I will not say much more to you, for the prince of this world is coming. He has no hold over me,

ibani_text: kụ́ma tuminikiri ma nimibẹm ḅẹẹ a Daḅọ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam a pịghị i Daá ma dada tọ́ọ i pịrị ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹarị. Ḅoo, wa so.
english_text: but he comes so that the world may learn that I love the Father and do exactly what my Father has commanded me. “Come now; let us leave.

ibani_text: Irị anịị karakárá grepụ árị́dii ma, i Daa ma anịị pịghị dụatẹlẹmaḅọ ma.
english_text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.

ibani_text: Ịḅụ fịnị sịịmgbọ́lụ suagha sị ḅara gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori anị pẹlẹsibẹm, sịịmgbọlụ sua sị ḅara gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori anị pẹlẹ gbulumabẹm sị anị jẹ́ jẹ́ mgbọ́lụ sua bẹ ḅara.
english_text: He cuts off every branch in me that bears no fruit, while every branch that does bear fruit he prunesso that it will be even more fruitful.

ibani_text: Ọ fíafía somam a kọọ ọ pịrịmaá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma gosi.
english_text: You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị iḅụbie fịnị, ịrị ma sọ ọmịna ḅụbie fịnị. Anị ḅụ ngéré mgbọ́lụ sua bẹ sị ḅara ofori; anị grepụ árị́dii ma ḅụ fịnịgha fịnịgha. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ọmịnị ine sịịmgbọlụ suabịgha ọ ḅọ́rọ́ iḅụbie fịnịgha.
english_text: Remain in me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me.

ibani_text: Irị anịị grepụ árị́dii ma; ọmịnị anịị sị ḅara ma. Ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ iḅụbie fịnị irịsọ nḅọ ḅụbie fịnị, nḅọ ma opuma sịịmgbọ́lụ suabẹm; ịrị ófórigha ọmịnị ine bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha.
english_text: “I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.

ibani_text: Iḅụbie fịnịgha ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, nḅọ fịnị ḅara anịị n gbii ḅuuma sị saghị sámụ́nọ́arị sị ḅara; ọkọfịnị sị ḅara n saghị fịnịbie gbi sua sị anị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: If you do not remain in me, you are like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ iḅụbie fịnị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma sọ ọmịna ḅụbie fịnị, ọmịnị ọ dọghụnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ bibẹm nnị pịghị anị pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara anịị boma ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo Daḅọ ma pịrịarị ḅara ḅẹ́ ọmịnị opuma sịịmgbọlụ suam, pịghị ọ ḅụ die ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ.
english_text: This is to my Father’s glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma i ḅẹ́lẹ́mamaá ḅara, anịị irịsọ pịghị ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mamaá ḅara. Mị́sa ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ḅụ fị́nị.
english_text: “As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Now remain in my love.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ ologho ma koko koko, ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ḅụ fịnịbẹm, ịrị ma sọ Daḅọ ma ologho koko sị ori ḅẹlẹma ḅụ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: If you keep my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commands and remain in his love.

ibani_text: A mịma dugho ọ pịrịmam sị iyẹ bieḅẹlẹ ọmịna bie fịnị bẹ ḅara, ọmịna bieḅẹlẹ pịghị bifụfụụ́.
english_text: I have told you this so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ị́yẹ́ ologho: ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma a ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mamaá ḅara.
english_text: My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.

ibani_text: Mịma nẹ́ngịma ḅẹlẹma nyánáḅọ ofori, ḅẹẹ ori ọrẹ duma kóróma ori nángwọ́apụ pịrịm.
english_text: Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anịị ị́yẹ́ nángwọ́apụ ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ ologho ma kokom.
english_text: You are my friends if you do what I command.

ibani_text: A mịnị fịrịnwangịapụ pa ọ sịgha, tegó fịrịnwangịapụ nimigha amịna nyánáḅọ mịẹarịnyẹ. Anịmanakaragha a nángwọ́apụ pa ọ sịmam, tegó i Daá ma ḅara a dawọḅo nyẹ mangba a pa o diemam.
english_text: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master’s business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị i sẹlẹakịgha, kụ́ma ịrị ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm sị tọ́ọ ọ pịrị ḅẹ́ o muu sịịmgbọlụ sua, anịị fịnị bẹ sịịmgbọlụ. Anịsáa ọ Daḅọ ma ḅara binyẹ binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ iyẹ ẹrẹ ḅụ, ori anị pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you so that you might go and bear fruit—fruit that will last—and so that whatever you ask in my name the Father will give you.

ibani_text: Mịị ị́yẹ́ ologho: ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: This is my command: Love each other.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiriapụ ma ọ tarịgha, o biekóróma ḅẹ́ nnị parị tarịghaḅọ pa i mịẹm.
english_text: “If the world hates you, keep in mind that it hated me first.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiriapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, nnị ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm nna ḅụ ḅọ ḅara. Anị fịnị ḅara ọmịnị tuminikiri ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́apụgha, kụ́ma tuminikiri ma bie a o sẹ́lẹ́akị pághámá ḅom. Anịị tuminikiri ma go ọ tarịgha nyẹ.
english_text: If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is, you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world. That is why the world hates you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị a kọọ ọ pịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma pa biekóróma: dughonyẹ ḅẹ́, Dụḅa amịna nyánáḅọ nẹ́ngị fịrịnwangịḅọ ofori. Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ i pa tọ́rụ́siarịma siarịma, nní pịghị ọmịnị sọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm. Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ iyẹ dienyẹ ma pughu pughu, nnị pịghị ọmịna dienyẹ ma pughubẹm.
english_text: Remember what I told you: ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also. If they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours also.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anịị n pa ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ma gosi, tegó nnị i fịrịma ḅọ ma nimigha.
english_text: They will treat you this way because of my name, for they do not know the one who sent me.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ n pịrịgha, siiamịẹnyẹ ḅẹrẹ nna ḅara sibịgha. Mị́sa anị fịnị ḅara ma n pa ḅara ọlọ bẹnyẹ ofori nna sii ḅụ.
english_text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

ibani_text: I nana tarịghaḅọ pịghị i Daa ma na tarịgha.
english_text: Whoever hates me hates my Father as well.

ibani_text: Nnị ólóghó kóróapụ sọbịgha a ḅọ́rọ́ nna ogboku bie mịẹgha jụghọ jẹ́ éné na mịẹgha nyẹ: anị fịnị ḅara ma, nnị mịná tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ ma árịmam a mịẹnyẹ n warị ịrị na i Daa ma na tarịgha ḅụ suu.
english_text: If I had not done among them the works no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. As it is, they have seen, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma kiriakị nyánam nna ologho diri ḅụ n gịẹnyẹ ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ, Nnị ḅara pa ọlọ bẹnyẹ nyanagha n go ịrị na tarịgha nyẹ.
english_text: But this is to fulfill what is written in their Law: ‘They hated me without reason.’

ibani_text: Ḅárásuaḅọ ma ḅo sáá, a pa ọ fịrịma bẹḅọ Daḅọ ma ḅara, tụ́manyẹ pa túminị́ diearị Tẹ́mẹ́, Daḅọ ma ḅara saghị ḅooḅọ, ori ma igbọloma nyẹ dugho pághámabẹm.
english_text: “When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father—the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father—he will testify about me.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sọ i gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámabẹm tegó ọmịnị ma ịrị na imi sughu saghị éné.
english_text: And you also must testify, for you have been with me from the beginning.

ibani_text: A mịma dugho ọ pịrịmam ọ bị́ghị́bịgha ḅara ọmịna minini ḅụ.
english_text: “All this I have told you so that you will not fall away.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ deesibẹm Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ; tụ́manyẹ ḅụ, sáá ḅoarị ọ ḅa ḅo fịnịfịnị sịbẹm ḅẹ́ n ḅọ fịrịnwangị Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: They will put you out of the synagogue; in fact, the time is coming when anyone who kills you will think they are offering a service to God.

ibani_text: Túminị́ mịnanyẹ ma pa ọ mịẹbẹm nnị Daḅọ ma anịgha irị nimigha gosi.
english_text: They will do such things because they have not known the Father or me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a mịma dugho ọ pịrịmam, sị sáá ma láa sị n saghị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹbẹ sáá, o biekórómabẹm ḅẹẹ a parị o biri nụ́nụ́mam. Parị ma a mịma dugho ọ pịrịgha a ọ mịnị na imii gosi.
english_text: I have told you this, so that when their time comes you will remember that I warned you about them. I did not tell you this from the beginning because I was with you,

ibani_text: Mị́sa a so i fịrịma ḅọ ma dama múuarị, anịsọ ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ igbilaghaa, I tẹ́ angaá muarị?
english_text: but now I am going to him who sent me. None of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

ibani_text: A mịná nyẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm gosi anị tẹ́mẹ́sii pa ọ pịrịmam.
english_text: Rather, you are filled with grief because I have said these things.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịm: ọmịna ibi go anịị a go soarị nyẹ. A ḅọ́rọ́ sogha sogha, Ḅárásuaḅọ ma ọ dámáḅobịgha: kụ́ma a so so a ori pa ọ fịrịmabẹm
english_text: But very truly I tell you, it is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.

ibani_text: Ori ma ḅo sáá ọ mịẹbẹm sị tuminikiriapụ nimi ḅẹ́ nna kóróma karakáragha siiamịẹnyẹ gbolomanyẹ, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ na.
english_text: When he comes, he will prove the world to be in the wrong about sin and righteousness and judgment:

ibani_text: Siiamịẹnyẹ gbolomanyẹ ḅụ, anịị o tuminikiriapụ mịẹbẹm sị nnị nimi ḅẹ́ n siinyẹ mịẹarị nnị ịḅụ mininigha gosi:
english_text: about sin, because people do not believe in me;

ibani_text: karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ gbolomanyẹ, ọ mịẹbẹm sị tuminikiriapụ nimi ḅẹẹ, irị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ a Daḅọ ma dámámụarị gosi ọmịnị mịnị jẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ arịbịghaa ngaa;
english_text: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father, where you can see me no longer;

ibani_text: pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ gbolomanyẹ, ọ mịẹbẹm sị tuminikiriapụ nimi ḅẹ́ nnị irimam, anịị tuminikiri ma táarịḅọ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ ọ ḅara simam gosi.
english_text: and about judgment, because the prince of this world now stands condemned.

ibani_text: A tọgha nyẹ nyanam a dugho ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ, kụ́ma ọmịnị ine anị dabịgha mị́sa.
english_text: “I have much more to say to you, more than you can now bear.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, karakárá ma pa túminị́ diearịḅọ ma ḅoo sáá, ọ karakárányẹ mamgba pa o diebẹm. Ori ọrẹ kụ́rọ ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọbịgha; ọ náanyẹ ma ngéré anịị o dugho bẹnyẹ, ọ pịghị tórúku ḅoarị nyẹ dugho ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.

ibani_text: Ori ị́yẹ́ ipine diepághámabẹm tegó i bịpị ọ náanyẹ anịị o dugho ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: He will glorify me because it is from me that he will receive what he will make known to you.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ị nyẹẹ; anịị a go dughonyẹ ḅẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma a dugho ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ ma pughubẹm sị anị pa dugho ọ́ pịrị.
english_text: All that belongs to the Father is mine. That is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what he will make known to you.”

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha kálá sáá tụ́wọ ḅụ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha, anịsáa ḅọlọgha kálá sáá tụwọ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus went on to say,“In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me.”

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ saghị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹm, Ọ tẹ́ dughoarị ọ ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ, Kálá sa tụ́wọ ḅụ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha, kálá sáá tụ́wọ ḅụ ọ pịghị ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm, mịma anịị a Daḅọ ma dámámụarị gosi?
english_text: At this, some of his disciples said to one another, “What does he mean by saying,‘In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me,’and‘Because I am going to the Father’?”

ibani_text: Nnị pa gbilaarị, Ọ tẹ́ dughoarị ọ ḅẹ́ sáá, Kálá sa tụ́wọ? Wamịnị akanyaḅogha o dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: They kept asking, “What does he mean by‘a little while’? We don’t understand what he is saying.”

ibani_text: Jizọs arịḅom bẹ n mịma gbolomanyẹ pa o gbíla dọ́ghụm, ọ warị nnị ḅẹ́, Ọ jụghọ jụghọ gbilaarị a dughonyẹ ma tẹ́ fie, a ḅẹ́ sáá, Kálá sa tụ́wọ ḅụ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha, anịsáa pịghị kálá sáá tụ́wọ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm?
english_text: Jesus saw that they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them,“Are you asking one another what I meant when I said, ‘In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me’?

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị, ọmịnị owubẹm pịghị dụadu tuminikiri anịsáa bieḅẹlẹbẹm. O biesiibẹm, kụ́ma ọmịna biesi ma pịghịma bieḅẹlẹ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, you will weep and mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief will turn to joy.

ibani_text: Yii ọlọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅụakụ nyánam tegó árị sáá láamam; kụ́ma a tụwọ ma yii fama sáá árị árẹ ḅụakụ pa bieḅárámam bieḅẹlẹ gosi ḅẹẹ, n tụ́wọ yiimam tuminikiri.
english_text: A woman giving birth to a child has pain because her time has come; but when her baby is born she forgets the anguish because of her joy that a child is born into the world.

ibani_text: Anịị anị ọmịnị na fịnị ḅara: mị́sa anịị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́sii sa, kụ́ma a jẹ́ pa ọmịnị árịbẹm ọ pịghị dụrụkụbẹm, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịghị ine ọmịna bieḅẹlẹ kikibịgha.
english_text: So with you: Now is your time of grief, but I will see you again and you will rejoice, and no one will take away your joy.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma láa sáá, ọmịnị i ḅarabie bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ gbílabịgha. A karakárányẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịarị, i Daa ma ḅara o binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ ori anị pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: In that day you will no longer ask me anything. Very truly I tell you, my Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.

ibani_text: Akị ḅoo mị́sa ma láa na ọmịnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ biiagha ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ. O bii ọ pịghị nyánáḅobẹm, ọmịna bieḅẹlẹ pịghị ḅifụfụubẹm.
english_text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, and your joy will be complete.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ a kaḅụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịarị, sáá ḅoarị a mịnị mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịbịgha, kụ́ma a i Daa gbólómanyẹ dughofindi ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “Though I have been speaking figuratively, a time is coming when I will no longer use this kind of language but will tell you plainly about my Father.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma láa sáá, ọmịnị nyẹ biibẹm ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ. A dughogha ḅẹ́ a Daḅọ ma ḅara nyẹ biibẹm ọmịna sịbị go.
english_text: In that day you will ask in my name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf.

ibani_text: Daḅọ ma ọ ḅụgbọrụ opuma ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam tegó ọmịnị i ḅẹ́lẹ́mam pịghị mininim ḅẹ́ a Tamun ḅara saghịḅom.
english_text: No, the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.

ibani_text: A Daḅọ ma ḅara saghị tuminikiri ḅom; mị́sa a tuminikiri ma wáriso sị pịghịma Daḅọ ma dámámụarị.
english_text: I came from the Father and entered the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa i gbụ́nụ́nụ́ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị kaḅụ kọgha pa.
english_text: Then Jesus’ disciples said, “Now you are speaking clearly and without figures of speech.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wamịnị arịḅom ḅẹ́ ị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nimim, ị biighaa kị́nị́ gbíla nyẹ pa i gbilaa. Mịma mịẹm wa minini ḅẹẹ ị Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom.
english_text: Now we can see that you know all things and that you do not even need to have anyone ask you questions. This makes us believe that you came from God.”

ibani_text: Jizọs n pagharam, Mị́sa o minini?
english_text: “Do you now believe?”Jesus replied.

ibani_text: Kụma sáá ḅoarị sáá ma pịghị lámam, nnị ọ gálágáláma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ama muu. Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba i wárịsóbẹm sị irị ngéré kọọ, kụ́ma irị ngéré kọgha, Daḅọ ma irị na imi.
english_text: “A time is coming and in fact has come when you will be scattered, each to your own home. You will leave me all alone. Yet I am not alone, for my Father is with me.

ibani_text: A mịná nyẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịmam, ọmịnị ịḅụ diin nyáná bẹ ḅara. Mịị tuminikiri ma ḅụ ọ ḅụḅáláḅálá nyánábẹm. Kuma ọ tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọ nyáná! A tuminikiri ma sọḅamam.
english_text: “I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịnanyẹ ma dugho fama sáá, ọ tọ́rụ saghị so dam sị tẹ́ghẹ̄: Daa, sáá ma lámam. I Tụ́wọ ma ipine diepágháma, Tụwọ ma sọ ị́yẹ́ ipine diepágháma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After Jesus said this, he looked toward heaven and prayed: “Father, the hour has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may glorify you.

ibani_text: I tuminikiri fịnịapụ mamgba pa o sughubie suam sị ọ gbámásó duma pa ị pa ọ pịrịapụ mamgba pịrị.
english_text: For you granted him authority over all people that he might give eternal life to all those you have given him.

ibani_text: Gbámásó duma ma nyáná bẹ ḅara, anịị ịnimii, ịrị ngéré karakárá Tamuno ma, na Jizọs Krais ị fịrịmaḅọ ma nimi.
english_text: Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

ibani_text: A tuminikiri ị́yẹ́ ipine diepághámamam a ị pa i pịrị fịrị ma nwángị sị nwángị kárámá ḅara.
english_text: I have brought you glory on earth by finishing the work you gave me to do.

ibani_text: Anịgo mị́sa Daa, kuu pa i sọma ị tórúku, wa nyáná gboloma kuu ma tuminikiri ma na saghịgha sáá.
english_text: And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri bie ị pa i pịrịapụ ma a mịẹmam sị nnị ị nimi. Nnị ịnyee; ịrị nnị pa i pịrịm nnị pịghị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ mịẹm.
english_text: “I have revealed youto those whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours; you gave them to me and they have obeyed your word.

ibani_text: Mị́sa n nimim ḅẹ́ i pa i pịrịnyẹ mamgba dada ị ḅarabie saghịḅom.
english_text: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.

ibani_text: I pa i pịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma a pa n pịrịm nnị pịghị anị daákịm. Nnị ibiḅara pa nimim ḅẹ́ a ị ḅara saghịḅom nnị pịghị mininim ḅẹẹ ịrị i fịrịmam.
english_text: For I gave them the words you gave me and they accepted them. They knew with certainty that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.

ibani_text: A tẹ́ghẹ̄ nnị pịrịm. A tẹ́ghẹ̄ tuminikiri ma pịrịgha kụ́ma a tẹ́ghẹ̄ ị pa i pịrịmáapụ ma pịrịm, nnị ma ịnyee gosi.
english_text: I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, for they are yours.

ibani_text: A nyánáapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ịnyee, ị pịghị nyánáapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ inyee. Nna ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ ipine anị ḅụ diepághámam.
english_text: All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to me through them.

ibani_text: A mịnị tuminikiri ma ḅụ fịnịbịgha, kụ́ma nnị tuminikiri ma ḅụ imi. A ị damaḅoarị Tọ́ntọ́ Daa, ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ fịnị kụ́rọ ma pa nnị koko, ị pa i pịrị ẹrẹ ma nnị ma gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ḅụ fịnị, wamịnị ma sọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ḅụ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: I will remain in the world no longer, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by the power ofyour name, the name you gave me, so that they may be one as we are one.

ibani_text: A nnị na fịnị sáá, a n koko wárim ị pa pịrị ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ma ḅụ. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nna bie faghaa, nnị guluguluma tọ́ọ pịrịḅọ ma sima sị Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ ḅoo kiriakịnyẹ sọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe bythat name you gave me. None has been lost except the one doomed to destruction so that Scripture would be fulfilled.

ibani_text: Mị́sa a ị damaḅoarị, kụ́ma a mịná nyẹ ma dughom a pa tuminikiri ma ḅụ fịnịarị sáá, nnị ị́yẹ́ bieḅẹlẹ nyánáakị bẹ ḅara bifụfụụ́ ḅara ḅụ nna bie.
english_text: “I am coming to you now, but I say these things while I am still in the world, so that they may have the full measure of my joy within them.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pa nnị pịrịmam tuminikiri ma warị n pa tarịgháapụ sọmam tegó nnị mịnị mịị tuminikiri bẹapugha, irịsọ mịnị mịị tuminikiri bẹ ḅọgha ḅara.
english_text: I have given them your word and the world has hated them, for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ a bigha ḅẹ́ ị́ n sịịakị tuminikiri ma ḅụ, kụ́ma ịrị nnị kokowarị sii tumḅọ ma ḅarabie.
english_text: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.

ibani_text: Nnị mịị tuminikiri bẹapugha, irịsọ mịị tuminikiri bẹ ḅọgha ḅara.
english_text: They are not of the world, even as I am not of it.

ibani_text: Nnị fófóoma ị́yẹ́ fịrị ma pịrị karakáráma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́; ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anịị karakárá.
english_text: Sanctify them bythe truth; your word is truth.

ibani_text: Ịrị i fịrịma tuminikiri ma ḅo ḅara anịị a n fịrịma tuminikiri ma ḅoo ḅara.
english_text: As you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.

ibani_text: Nna sịbị go a ịḅụ fófóoma ị́yẹ́ fịrịma pịrịmam, nnị sọ ibiḅara pa nna ḅụ fófóoma ị́yẹ́ fịrị pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: For them I sanctify myself, that they too may be truly sanctified.

ibani_text: A tẹ́ghẹ̄ nnị ngéré pịrịgha. Kụ́ma a tẹ́ghẹ̄ nna oku ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ịḅụ minini bẹapụ ma sọ pịrịm.
english_text: “My prayer is not for them alone. I pray also for those who will believe in me through their message,

ibani_text: Daa mịẹsị nnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnị, ịrị ibie fịnị ḅara, ịrị ma sọ ibie fịnị ḅara. Mịẹsị nnị wa bie fịnị, sị tuminikiri ma minini bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́ ịrị i fịrịmam.
english_text: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

ibani_text: Ị pa i pịrị ipine ma anịị a pa n pịrịnyẹ, ḅẹ́ n gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnị, wamịnị ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: I have given them the glory that you gave me, that they may be one as we are one—

ibani_text: Ịrị ibie fịnị ḅara ịrị ma sọ nna bie fịnịbẹm. Mịẹsị nnị ḅoo káara ḅara ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnị bẹ ḅara sị tuminikiri ma nimi bẹ ḅara bẹ ịrị i fịrịmam pịghị n ḅẹlẹmamam ịrị i ḅẹlẹmamaa ḅara.
english_text: I in them and you in me—so that they may be brought to complete unity. Then the world will know that you sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.

ibani_text: Daa, a bim ḅẹ́ ị pa i pịrịmáapụ ma nnị i nana fịnị a fịnịngaa, sị pịghị ị́yẹ́ ipine árị, i pa i pịrị ipine ma tegó tuminikiri ma na saghịgha sa ene ene ịrị i ḅẹlẹmamam.
english_text: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, and to see my glory, the glory you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.

ibani_text: Karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ Daḅọ, tuminikiri ma inimigha n ḅẹ́sọ, ịrị ị́ nimim nnị pịghị nimim ḅẹẹ ịrị i fịrịmam.
english_text: “Righteous Father, though the world does not know you, I know you, and they know that you have sent me.

ibani_text: A i pa n diemam, a pịghị pa n diema diema mubẹm sị ị nyáná i pịrị ḅẹlẹma ma nna bie fịnị bẹ ḅara, ịrị ma sọ nna bie fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I have made youknown to them, and will continue to make you known in order that the love you have for me may be in them and that I myself may be in them.”

ibani_text: Jizọs tẹ́ghẹ̄ fama sáá ori na ori ọḅụduaapụ saghị sị Kidrọn póghóló kiri ma saḅa korom. Isi párángáa ma ḅụ olivu gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá duakiri imi, ori na ori ọḅụduaapụ warị nwángị anị bie sọ.
english_text: When he had finished praying, Jesus left with his disciples and crossed the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Judas ọ dẹrịfịḅọ ma anị ngá ma nimim tegó Jizọs anị ngá tọgha sáá ori ọḅụduaapụ na kobirimam.
english_text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, because Jesus had often met there with his disciples.

ibani_text: Judas wárị kálá duakiri ma sọọ ori na Rom ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma ḅụ jẹapụ na pịghị igwagwaalaapụ ma na Farisiiapụ ma fịrịma Tamunoopuwarị kúrúapụ. Nnị ọ́mụ́gbinyẹ ọlọm na pịghị tọsị na tọndọ.
english_text: So Judas came to the garden, guiding a detachment of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and the Pharisees. They were carrying torches, lanterns and weapons.

ibani_text: Jizọs ọ ḅụ pághá bẹnyẹ mamgba nimitẹ́lẹ́ma ḅara ma, tórúku múm sị n gbíla, Ọ tụọ ọ dọghụarị ḅọ?
english_text: Jesus, knowing all that was going to happen to him, went out and asked them,“Who is it you want?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Jizọs Nazarẹtịḅọ ma. Jizọs pagharam, Ịrị anịị Jizọs. Judas ọ dẹrịfịḅọ ma nnị na anị ngá sẹ́fịnịarị.
english_text: “Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “I am he,”Jesus said. (And Judas the traitor was standing there with them.)

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho sáá ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị Jizọs, nnị ọ ḅụ pịrịm sị kiri bịghịkoro.
english_text: When Jesus said,“I am he,”they drew back and fell to the ground.

ibani_text: Ọ Pịghị sima nnị gbilam, Tụọ mọ ọ dọghụarị ḅọ? Nnị pagharam, Jizọs Nazarẹtịḅọ ma.
english_text: Again he asked them,“Who is it you want?” “Jesus of Nazareth,” they said.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam A kọkọ dugho ọ pịrịma ḅẹ́ ịrị anịị Jizọs. Ḅọ́rọ́ irị anịị ọ dọghụarị ḅọ, ọ mịnaapụ ma wáriso sị nnị soo.
english_text: Jesus answered,“I told you that I am he. If you are looking for me, then let these men go.”

ibani_text: Mịma kiriakịm sị ọ kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara, Ị pa i pịrịapụ mamgba a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅumagha.
english_text: This happened so that the words he had spoken would be fulfilled:“I have not lost one of those you gave me.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Saimọn Pita áláápụ́-ágidi ọlọḅọ anị nụ́nụ́ pa opu igwagwaḅọ ma fịrịnwangịḅọ amaḅara biri kịrị sim. Malikọs anịị fịrịnwangịḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, cutting off his right ear. (The servant’s name was Malchus.)

ibani_text: Jizọs igani Pita pịrịm, Ị́yẹ́ áláápụ́-ágidi pa anị akpa bie sua! Daḅọ ma pa i pịrị tọ́rụ́siarị ọmọngọ ma a anị bie ḅubịgha?
english_text: Jesus commanded Peter,“Put your sword away! Shall I not drink the cup the Father has given me?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Rom ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma na nna sịbịdáḅọ na pịghị Tamuowárị kúruarị Juuapụ ma Jizọs kuum. Nnị ọ kakám
english_text: Then the detachment of soldiers with its commander and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus. They bound him

ibani_text: wárị parị ọ pa Anas tórúku ḅoo, Anas anịị Kayafas taa ma daa, Kayafas ori anịị opu igwagwaḅọ anị kụ́rá ma ḅụ.
english_text: and brought him first to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.

ibani_text: Mịị Kayafas ma anịị againma pa Juuapụ ma pị́rị́máaḅọ ḅẹ́ anị ibibẹm ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ fịị túminị́ ma sịbị go.
english_text: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jewish leaders that it would be good if one man died for the people.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita na jẹ́ ọḅụduaḅọ Jizọs duarị. Mịị isi ọḅụduaḅọ ma opu igwagwaḅọ ma nimim gosi o Jizọs dua mú opu igwagwaḅọ ma ẹpẹlẹ́ bie sọm,
english_text: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. Because this disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard,

ibani_text: kụ́ma Pita nụ́ngọbie ḅụ́pọ́ ma angaá fịnị kurum. Isi ọḅụduaḅọ ma opu igwagwaḅọ ma nimiḅọ pịghịma ḅom sị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ ma pịrị sị Pita daa warị ma bie suu.
english_text: but Peter had to wait outside at the door. The other disciple, who was known to the high priest, came back, spoke to the servant girl on duty there and brought Peter in.

ibani_text: Fịrị ḅụ fịnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ ma, ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ Pita gbilam, Ịrị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha? Pita pagharam, Irịgha.
english_text: “You aren’t one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” she asked Peter. He replied, “I am not.”

ibani_text: Oḅuu imi, anịgo fịrịnwangịapụ ma na kúrúapụ ma anyị mgbọ́lụ fịnị tọ́nọm anị ikelekelema sị fịnị ma timiarị, Pita sọ nnị na sẹ sị fịnị ma timiarị.
english_text: It was cold, and the servants and officials stood around a fire they had made to keep warm. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, opu igwagwaḅọ ma Jizọs gbilam, ori ọḅụduaapụ na ori dienyẹ gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A bịpị ḅọghugha ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrịmam, sámámgba a nyẹ́diearị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ anịgha Tamuoopuwarị ma bie Juuapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kobirikobiri angaá. A ḅọghu angaá ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ dughogha.
english_text: “I have spoken openly to the world,”Jesus replied.“I always taught in synagogues or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret.

ibani_text: I tẹ́ go i gbilaarị? Biri pa ị naapụ ma gbíla. Nnị nimim a dughonyẹ.
english_text: Why question me? Ask those who heard me. Surely they know what I said.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dugho sáá, kúrúapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ o tórúku ọ ḅụrọm, sị o gbíla, Mịị anịị ị́ igwagwaḅọ ma págháraarị ḅara?
english_text: When Jesus said this, one of the officials nearby slapped him in the face. “Is this the way you answer the high priest?” he demanded.

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A ḅọ́rọ́ iruonyẹ dugho dugho, gbọ i tọ́rụ́ sua ḅẹ́ mịma karakáragha. Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ a karakárányẹ ma dughom ị tegó i ḅụ́rọ́?
english_text: “If I said something wrong,”Jesus replied,“testify as to what is wrong. But if I spoke the truth, why did you strike me?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Anas warị ọ fịrịma Kayafas opu igwagwaḅọ ma dámámuu ịkóli na ọ ḅara na.
english_text: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita sẹ sị fịnị ma timiarị sáá, nnị ọ gbilam, Ịrị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha? O pighim, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Irị nna ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha.
english_text: Meanwhile, Simon Peter was still standing there warming himself. So they asked him, “You aren’t one of his disciples too, are you?” He denied it, saying, “I am not.”

ibani_text: Opu igwagwaḅọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ómóniḅọ, Pita biri pẹ́lẹ́si ḅọ ma mị́naḅọ warị dugho kụ́rọ́ma ḅẹẹ, A kọkọ ịrị na ori na arịị olivu dua ma ḅụ.
english_text: One of the high priest’s servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him, “Didn’t I see you with him in the garden?”

ibani_text: Pita sima pighim, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri owi ọbịọ saghị pághám.
english_text: Again Peter denied it, and at that moment a rooster began to crow.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ Juuapụ ma warị Kayafas wárị Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́ma Rom ḅẹrẹtọḅọ ma áláwarị muu. Juuapụ ma áláwarị ma sọgha nnị nna pilemabịgha ḅara sị ine Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ ma fị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then the Jewish leaders took Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. By now it was early morning, and to avoid ceremonial uncleanness they did not enter the palace, because they wanted to be able to eat the Passover.

ibani_text: Paileti warị págháḅo nnị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅẹẹ mị owitụ́wọ ma tẹ́ mịẹ irima?
english_text: So Pilate came out to them and asked, “What charges are you bringing against this man?”

ibani_text: Nnị pagharam, Ori ḅọ́rọ́ opu ólóghó kóróḅogha wamịnị ọ saghị ị ḅarabie suabịgha.
english_text: “If he were not a criminal,” they replied, “we would not have handed him over to you.”

ibani_text: Paileti warị dugho nnị pịrị, Ọmịnị ori akị sị ọmịna ologho pa ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ. Kụ́ma Juu sịbịdaapụ ma pagharam, Wamịnị wa kụ́rọ nyanagha tumḅọ ḅá ḅụ.
english_text: Pilate said, “Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.” “But we have no right to execute anyone,” they objected.

ibani_text: Mịma kiriakịm Jizọs kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara diearịnyẹ ọ kọ bẹ fịị ḅara.
english_text: This took place to fulfill what Jesus had said about the kind of death he was going to die.

ibani_text: Paileti warị pịghịma áláwarị ma bie sọ sị Jizọs gbíla, Ịrị anịị Juuapụ ma ámányánáḅọ?
english_text: Pilate then went back inside the palace, summoned Jesus and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”

ibani_text: Jizọs o gbilam, Anịị ị kóróma ḅara, anịgha kị́nị́ ị gbolomanyẹ dugho ị pịrị?
english_text: “Is that your own idea,”Jesus asked,“or did others talk to you about me?”

ibani_text: Paileti pagharam, Ị sị ḅẹ́ ịrị Juuḅọ? Ị́yẹ́ a túminị́ na ị́yẹ́ igwagwaalaapụ anịị ị saghị i ḅarabie suaapụ. Ọ tẹ́ nyẹ ị mịẹnyẹ?
english_text: “Am I a Jew?” Pilate replied. “Your own people and chief priests handed you over to me. What is it you have done?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri mị tuminikiri nganyẹgha. Ḅọ́rọ́ mị tuminikiri nganyẹ, ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ Juuapụ ma na owusọbẹm sị nkiki nnị ikubịgha ḅara, Kụ́ma ị́yẹ́ ásẹ́mẹ́kiri mịị tuminikiri ngá nyẹ́gha.
english_text: Jesus said,“My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jewish leaders. But now my kingdom is from another place.”

ibani_text: Paileti warị ọ gbíla, Anịsáa, Ịrị ámányánáḅọ? Jizọs pagharam, Ị karakáram dughoarị ḅẹ́ irị ámányánáḅọ anịgo nnị i yiim, anịgo a tuminikiri ma ḅom sị a karakáráma dugho págháma. Karakáráma ḅụ sẹapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i pughu pughum.
english_text: “You are a king, then!” said Pilate. Jesus answered,“You say that I am a king. In fact, the reason I was born and came into the world is to testify to the truth. Everyone on the side of truth listens to me.”

ibani_text: Paileti gbilam, Karakáráma tẹ́ nyẹ? Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá ọ sima pághá si muu Juuapụ ma ḅẹm, A gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ arịgha a go fịị ḅẹrẹ pẹlẹ bẹnyẹ ọ sịbị.
english_text: “What is truth?” retorted Pilate. With this he went out again to the Jews gathered there and said, “I find no basis for a charge against him.

ibani_text: Ọmịna nyẹ́ mịẹmịẹ ḅara ḅụ sámámgba Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma bie a gbẹ́rẹ́ ikólinaḅọ wárịsósom o sóo. O dọghụ ḅẹ́ a Juuapụ ámányánáḅọ ma wáriso?
english_text: But it is your custom for me to release to you one prisoner at the time of the Passover. Do you want me to release ‘the king of the Jews’?”

ibani_text: Nnị wárii ilúghú dugho, Enrrh enrrh, origha! Barabas pa wa pịrị! Barabas ori ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹrẹ pa ama dọghụapụ ma ḅụ.
english_text: They shouted back, “No, not him! Give us Barabbas!” Now Barabbas had taken part in an uprising.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Paileti warị Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị o fom.
english_text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma warị nangi nangi nangi ogunu mịẹsị pa ọ sịbị sua, pịghị tọ́rụ sịrị áwụ́ bịtẹ bia ḅára bia áláápụ́ bịtẹ pa ọ sua.
english_text: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head. They clothed him in a purple robe

ibani_text: Nnị warị tọgha sáá pa ọ dama mú dughoarị, Nángwọ dumafịnị Juu Ámányánáḅọ Pịrịị! Nnị warị ọ ḅụ́rọ́ ọ tórúku.
english_text: and went up to him again and again, saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!” And they slapped him in the face.

ibani_text: Paileti pịghị sima págháḅo Juuapụ ma damaḅom sị n ḅẹẹ, Dighii, a ọ pághámaḅo ọ pịrịarị o nimi bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ ọ ḅụ a árị sị ọ mịẹ siinyẹ ofori.
english_text: Once more Pilate came out and said to the Jews gathered there, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs págháḅo sáá ori nangi nangi ogunu ma na tọ́rụ sịrị áwụ bịtẹ bia ḅara bia áláápụ́ bịtẹ ma suarị ori oju, Paileti dugho n pịrịm, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma!
english_text: When Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe, Pilate said to them, “Here is the man!”

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma na Tamunoopuwárị ma kúrúapụ ma ori árị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, nnị ilúghum, Ọ ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ! Ọ ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ! Kụ́ma Paileti pagharam, Ọmịnị ori akị sị ọ ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ. Ịrị a gbẹ́rẹ́ siinyẹ sọ arịgha ọ ḅụ.
english_text: As soon as the chief priests and their officials saw him, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify!” But Pilate answered, “You take him and crucify him. As for me, I find no basis for a charge against him.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma pagharam, Wamịnị ólóghó nyánam, wámịna ologho ḅara ḅụ, ọ fịị na ibim tegó ọ Tamuno Tụ́wọ pa ọ ḅụ sim.
english_text: The Jewish leaders insisted, “We have a law, and according to that law he must die, because he claimed to be the Son of God.”

ibani_text: Paileti mịma náa sáá, ori ḅáláfa ḅo párị ḅara ma nẹngịm,
english_text: When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid,

ibani_text: ọ warị pịghị sima áláwarị ma sọọ sị Jizọs gbíla, Itẹ angaá saghị ḅoo? Kụ́ma Jizọs ọ pagharagha.
english_text: and he went back inside the palace. “Where do you come from?” he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer.

ibani_text: Paileti wárị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ i pịrịdoghugha? Ị nimigha ḅẹ́ a kụ́rọ nyánam ị wárịso ị so anịgha ị ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ?
english_text: “Do you refuse to speak to me?” Pilate said. “Don’t you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, Ị kụ́rọ nyánábịgha ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị anị pa ị pịrịgha sobie. Anịgo i saghị pa ị ḅarabie suaḅọ ma ori ngá sii dụḅa kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: Jesus answered,“You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.”

ibani_text: Anịsa ma ḅụ saghị bịpị muu Paileti asọ dọ́ghụm ọ ḅara warị Jizọs dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma Juuapụ ma ilúghú dughoarị ḅẹẹ, I ḅọ́rọ́ mịị owitụ́wọ ma wárịso sị o so so, ịrị mịnị Siza nángwọ sọbịgha, dugho ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ anịị ámányánáḅọ, ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa Siza dọghụarị.
english_text: From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jewish leaders kept shouting, “If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.”

ibani_text: Paileti mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa sáá, o Jizọs pághámá nụ́ngọ ḅom sị muu kpọrọfịnị ori ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ịkasị ọgọ́nọ́ anịị nnị dapịrị pa mịẹ angaá (Hiburu ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ Gabata anịị nnị pa anị sị nyẹ.)
english_text: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge’s seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic is Gabbatha).

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anịị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị wiki ma tẹ́lẹ́ma éné, pịghị éné ogbo biri. Paileti wárị dugho Juuapụ ma pịrị, Mịị ọmịna ámányánáḅọ!
english_text: It was the day of Preparation of the Passover; it was about noon. “Here is your king,” Pilate said to the Jews.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ilúghum, Ori akị so! Ori akị so! O ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ! Paileti gbilam, A ọmịna ámányánáḅọ ḅaupálị bẹ mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ? Igwagwaalaapụ ma pagharam, Wa jẹ́ ámányánáḅọ nyanagha Siza siima.
english_text: But they shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!” “Shall I crucify your king?” Pilate asked. “We have no king but Caesar,” the chief priests answered.

ibani_text: Kunema Paileti Jizọs saghị n ḅarabie suam ḅẹ́ nnị ọ ḅaupálị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ḅụ. Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma wárị Jizọs akị so.
english_text: Finally Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified. So the soldiers took charge of Jesus.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ mgbẹsẹ sị́ dighim pa pághá mú sịbị okporongbo pa sị angaá láa (Hiburu ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ goligota anịị n pa anị sị nyẹ.)
english_text: Carrying his own cross, he went out to the place of the Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha).

ibani_text: Mịnga anịị nnị ọ ḅaupálị nyẹ, ori na jẹ́ mmẹapụ na, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ amaḅara isiḅọ ẹ́rẹ́ḅara, Jizọs nna ogboku bie.
english_text: There they crucified him, and with him two others—one on each side and Jesus in the middle.

ibani_text: Paileti ábálálá gịẹm ọ pa mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọgọnọ ḅolo nyẹ. Anị dughom:
english_text: Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross. It read:jesus of nazareth, the king of the jews.

ibani_text: Tọgha Juuapụ ọ gịẹnyẹ ma goom, tegó nnị Jizọs ḅaupálị angaá ma opu ama na kikiam, Hiburu, Latin na Giriki, bịpị anịị n pịghị pa anị gịẹnyẹ.
english_text: Many of the Jews read this sign, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Aramaic, Latin and Greek.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma igwagwaalaapụ dugho Paileti pịrịm ḅẹẹ, O Juu Ámányánáḅọ gịẹ ma, kụ́ma ọ gịẹ ḅẹẹ, mịị owitụ́wọ ma dughom ḅẹ́ ori anịị Juu Ámányánáḅọ.
english_text: The chief priests of the Jews protested to Pilate, “Do not write ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that this man claimed to be king of the Jews.”

ibani_text: Paileti pagharam, A gịẹ maá nyẹ ma, a gịẹ somam.
english_text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma Jizọs ḅaupálị sáá mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọgọnọ, nnị ori suaḅịtẹ́ akịm sị pa ínia ngaa die, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá, bie fúrú angaá nyẹ ma ngéré wárị kọọ. Mịị suaḅịtẹ́ ma nnị anị gbigha nnị anị dorim sịbị ḅụ akị muu sughu láa.
english_text: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes, dividing them into four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma dugho jụghọ jụghọ pịrịm, Wamịnị anị kaama, wamịnị okoḅa gbi pa nimi akị bẹḅọ. Mịma kiriakịm tọ́ndiri ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara, dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Nnị ị́yẹ́ suabịtẹ die nna ḅụ pịrịm pịghị okoḅa gbi ị́yẹ́ biefuru bịtẹ pịrị. Mịma anịị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Let’s not tear it,” they said to one another. “Let’s decide by lot who will get it.” This happened that the scripture might be fulfilled that said, “They divided my clothes among them and cast lots for my garment.” So this is what the soldiers did.

ibani_text: Ori mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma na kikia angaá anịị ọ nyingi na o nyingi mị́naḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ sẹ nyẹ, Meri Kiliyopasi táa na pịghị Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ.
english_text: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

ibani_text: Jizọs o nyingi na ọ ḅẹlẹma ọḅụduaḅọ ma árị sáá anị ngá ma ḅụ kikiama sẹ́fịnịarị, o dugho o nyingi pịrịm, Ibi ọ́rụ́ḅọ, ị tụwọ ḅara pa ori akị,
english_text: When Jesus saw his mother there, and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to her,“Woman,here is your son,”

ibani_text: ọ pịghị ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅẹm, Ọ nyingiḅọ ḅara pa árị akị. Anịsáa ma ḅụ saghị tórúku muu, mịị ọḅụduaḅọ ma árị ákịị ọ warị múm.
english_text: and to the disciple,“Here is your mother.”From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.

ibani_text: Anịsa ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, pịghị nimifama sáá ḅẹẹ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kárámam, tọ́ndiri ma ḅoo karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara, Jizọs dughom, I pụghọ sámụ́nọ́mam.
english_text: Later, knowing that everything had now been finished, and so that Scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said,“I am thirsty.”

ibani_text: Anị ngá ma ḅụ viniga pa sị iru ojongo imi, nnị warị mingi ọlọ dii sapo pa anị bie taḅụ, wárị sapo ma pa hisopu pa sị sịị ḅụ gbánā sị anị akị pa ọ bịpị lama.
english_text: A jar of wine vinegar was there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a stalk of the hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus’ lips.

ibani_text: Jizọs iru ma ḅuu sáá, ọ warị dugho ḅẹẹ, Anị kárámam. Ọ warị sịbị tughu sị ịnyọ bima.
english_text: When he had received the drink, Jesus said,“It is finished.”With that, he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anịị tẹ́lẹ́ma éné ma, éné ḅáa anịị kịrị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné. Juuapụ dọghụgha gosi ḅẹẹ dua mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ḅụ fịnị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ, nnị Paileti ḅara bim ḅẹẹ ọ kị́nị́ wáriso sị nnị túminị́ ma ḅụọ anyịma sị dua ma sikóróma.
english_text: Now it was the day of Preparation, and the next day was to be a special Sabbath. Because the Jewish leaders did not want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath, they asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken down.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma wárị nnị Jizọs na ḅaupálị párịḅọ ma ḅụọ anyịma anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ị siḅọ.
english_text: The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ḅoo Jizọs fịnị angaá láa sáá sị árị ḅẹ́ ọ fịị ḅọ́rọ́mam, nnị ọ ḅụọ anyịmaghaa.
english_text: But when they came to Jesus and found that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha, ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sụḅa pa Jizọs timim ori angásá, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọmbịnyẹ́ na mingi warị ọsụ pághá.
english_text: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced Jesus’ side with a spear, bringing a sudden flow of blood and water.

ibani_text: Pághányẹ ma arị owitụ́wọ, ori árịnyẹ dugho pághámamam, ori dugho págháma nyẹ ma pịghị karakáram. O nimim ḅẹ́ ọ karakárányẹ ma dugho dughom, o dughom sị ịrị ma sọ minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: The man who saw it has given testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, and he testifies so that you also may believe.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma kiriakịm tọ́ndiri ma karakárányẹ sọ bẹ ḅara dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ori gbẹ́rẹ́ mgbe sọ ányịbịghaa,
english_text: These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: “Not one of his bones will be broken,”

ibani_text: jẹ́ tọ́ndiri pịghị dugho ḅara, Túminị́ tọ́rụ pa n sụḅa pa timiḅọ ma dighibẹm.
english_text: and, as another scripture says, “They will look on the one they have pierced.”

ibani_text: Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Josẹf Arimatiya ama ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ Paileti ḅara dua ma bim. Mị́sa Josẹf ori ma anịị Jizọs ọḅụduaḅọ, kụ́ma o minigha sị kị́nị́ nimi Juuapụ ma ḅáláfa gosi. Paileti kụrọ pa ọ pịrịm ọ wárị Jizọs dua ma dighi si.
english_text: Later, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jewish leaders. With Pilate’s permission, he came and took the body away.

ibani_text: Dii bie Jizọs dámámuu owitụ́wọ ma Nikodimọs Josẹf na múm. Nikodimọs pulo ákịm nnị maya na alos pa mịẹnyẹ sị nnị pa ori duakii, anị iku kilogramu sue inifindi.
english_text: He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs dua ma sị kóróma sáá nnị mmẹapụ ma alo na kụ́nụ́ pulo ma pa anị fịna ikelema Juuapụ ma nyẹ́ mịẹmịẹ ḅara n dua tẹ́lẹ́ma dipi dọghụ sáá.
english_text: Taking Jesus’ body, the two of them wrapped it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs.

ibani_text: Nnị Jizọs ḅaupálị angaá ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ onu imii, anị bie gbẹ́rẹ́ ịwọ dupu imii n jẹ́ ene kị́nị́ kórómagha angaá.
english_text: At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one had ever been laid.

ibani_text: Anị éné ma anịị Juuapụ tẹ́lẹ́ma éné ma gosi, dupu ma pịghị kikia ḅara ma nnị Jizọs dua ma ḅụlọlọmam anị bie.
english_text: Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ wiki ma ḅụ tarị éné, éné ma na ḅafịndigha sáá, Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ dupu yọ ma múm sị arị ḅo ḅẹ́ nnị pa dupu ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ dapịrị ma nnị anị dighisimam.
english_text: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.

ibani_text: A warị mangị Saimọn Pita na isi ngá ọḅụduaḅọ ma damamum, anịị Jizọs ḅẹlẹma ḅọ ma, sị dugho ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nnị o si ákịmam dupu ma bie, wa pịghị nimigha nnị ọ kóróma angaá!
english_text: So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”

ibani_text: Pita na isi ọḅụduaḅọ wárị dupu yọ ma muu.
english_text: So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb.

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹapụ mangịarị kụ́ma isi ngaḅọ mangị Pita ḅọ́rọ́m sị muu tarị anị ngá láa.
english_text: Both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.

ibani_text: O tughu sị dupu bie ma dighim, warị alo ma arị ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị, kụ́ma anị bie sọ mugha.
english_text: He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but did not go in.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Saimọn Pita ori ọḅụju fịnịḅọ wárị ḅo láa sị dupu ma somuu. Ọ dua fịna alo ma arịm anị ngá ḅụlọlọ fịnịarị,
english_text: Then Simon Peter came along behind him and went straight into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there,

ibani_text: na pịghị n pa Jizọs sịbị fịna dụadipi bịtẹ ma sọ arịị. Dụadipi bịtẹ ma nnị anị iko simam nnị pa ọ fịna alo ma ḅụ.
english_text: as well as the cloth that had been wrapped around Jesus’ head. The cloth was still lying in its place, separate from the linen.

ibani_text: Kunema, tarị dupu ma láa maá ọḅụduaḅọ ma sọ dupu ma bie sọmum. Ori sọ arịm sị mininim.
english_text: Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.

ibani_text: Nnị pa ine tọ́ndiri ma akanyaḅogha dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, ọ fịị ḅụ saghị nyánam.
english_text: (They still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.)

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọḅụduaapụ ma wárị so nnị ama muu.
english_text: Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅooḅọ dupu angaá ma ḅụ sẹm sị owuarị. A pa owuarị sáá a tụ́ghụ́ dupu bie ma dighim
english_text: Now Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb

ibani_text: sị mmẹẹ́ sookumuapụ arịị pị́na bịtẹ suapụ Jizọs dua ma warị angaá kpọrọfịnịapụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịbị angaá isiḅọ ḅụọ angaá.
english_text: and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus’ body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.

ibani_text: Nnị wárị a gbíla, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ, ị tegó sị owuarị? Meri pagharam, Nnị Inyanaḅọ ma dighiakịmam, a pịghị nimigha nnị o kóróma angaá.
english_text: They asked her, “Woman, why are you crying?” “They have taken my Lord away,” she said, “and I don’t know where they have put him.”

ibani_text: A mịma dugho fama sáá, a pịghịm sị Jizọs arị anị ngá sẹ́fịnịarị kụ́ma árị ine nimiḅogha ḅẹ́ ori anịị Jizọs.
english_text: At this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.

ibani_text: Ọ wárị a ḅẹ́, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ, ị tegó sị owuarị? Tụọ ị dọghụarị ḅọ? Árị kóróma ḅụ ori anịị dua ma tẹ́lẹ́maarịḅọ, A wárị ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị o dighisim dugho i pịrị ịrị o kóróma angaá, a pịghị muu ori ákịbẹm.
english_text: He asked her,“Woman, why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?” Thinking he was the gardener, she said, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him.”

ibani_text: Jizọs wárị árị ẹrẹ pa a sịị, Meri. A wárị tọ́rụ pịghị ọ daá sị hiburu bịpị ḅụ ilúghú, Raboni! (mịma dughoarị, Nyẹ́dieḅọ).
english_text: Jesus said to her,“Mary.” She turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, “Rabboni!” (which means “Teacher”).

ibani_text: Jizọs a ḅẹm, Ị́yẹ́ ọlọsẹma ma, na a ị Daa fịnị angaá laagha. Anịmanakaragha muu dugho ị́yẹ́ amịna owiapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ, A pịghịma i Daa pịghị ọmịna Daa, i Tamuno pịghị ọmịna Tamuno ma dámámụarị.
english_text: Jesus said,“Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. Go instead to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’ ”

ibani_text: Meri Magdala ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ wárị mú oku ma dugho pa ori ọḅụduaapụ pịrị ḅẹẹ: A Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma árịmam! A warị dugho n pịrị o dugho a pịrịnyẹẹ.
english_text: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them that he had said these things to her.

ibani_text: Tárị éné ma wiki ma bie, anị ḅupiri, ọḅụduaapụ ma kobiri sáá, ḅụ́pọ́ ma pịghị ikasim Juuapụ ma ḅáláfa gosi, Jizọs ḅoo nna ogboku bie sẹm sị dugho, Diin ọmịnị na fịnịị.
english_text: On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jewish leaders, Jesus came and stood among them and said,“Peace be with you!”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá ori ọ ḅara na ori angásá pa nnị diem. Ọḅụduaapụ ma opuma bieḅẹlẹm nnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma árị sáá.
english_text: After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.

ibani_text: Jizọs sima n ḅẹm, Diin ọmịnị na fịnịị! Daḅọ ma i fịrị mamaá ḅara anịị, a ọ fịrịmaarị ḅara.
english_text: Again Jesus said,“Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá, ọ warị ọwụ ofuro nna ḅụ warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma daakị.
english_text: And with that he breathed on them and said,“Receive the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Ọ sii wáriso pịrịḅọ, nnị n ḅọ sii wáriso n ḅọ pịrịbẹm, o sii wáriso pịrịghaḅọ n sii wáriso n ḅo pịrịbịgha.
english_text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, their sins are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa Tọmọs (n Didimọs pa sịḅọ) oyi mmẹapụ findi ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ori ọḅụduaapụ ma na ofori Jizọs ḅo sáá.
