english_text: Now Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.

ibani_text: Isi angaá ọḅụduaapụ ma wárị dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ, Wa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma árịmam! Kụ́ma o dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ, A tulu ma ilíghíma ma arịgha ẹrẹ́sị ọ ḅara pịghị i ḅara tụ́mgbọlụ pa tulu ma tulu ngá ma ḅụ suagha ẹrẹ́sị pịghị ị ḅara pa ori angásá bie suagha, a mininibịgha.
english_text: So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ wiki ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Jizọs ọḅụduaapụ pịghị sima warị bie imi. Tọmọs sọ nnị na imim. Ḅụ́pọ́ ma ikasim n ḅẹ́sọ, Jizọs ḅo nnị ogboku bie sẹm sị dugho ḅẹẹ, Diin ọmịnị na fịnị!
english_text: A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said,“Peace be with you!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ọ wárị Tọmọs ḅẹẹ, Ị ḅara tụ́mgbọlụ pa mịnga sua; sị i ḅara dighi. Ị ḅara sụghụma ị́yẹ́ angaá sáá bie sua. Mịnị tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ nyáná ma, kụ́ma minini.
english_text: Then he said to Thomas,“Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.”

ibani_text: Tọmọs warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ pịghị i Tamuno.
english_text: Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs warị dugho ọ pịrị, Ị́ árịmam gosi i minimam. Karịiḅi fịnị arịgha, si mininiapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: Then Jesus told him,“Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”

ibani_text: Jizọs tọgha tọgha jẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịm ori ọḅụduaapụ ma tórúku mịị diri ma bie n gịẹ kórómagha nyẹ.
english_text: Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịná angaá nyẹ nnị anị gịẹm o minini bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ, Jizọs ori anịị Krais ma Tamuno Tụwọ ḅẹ́ i minini minini ine duma nyánábẹm ori ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: But these are written that you may believethat Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Jizọs sima ọ ḅụ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ diem Tiberios tọ́rụ́ angaá. Mịị anị kiriakị ḅara:
english_text: Afterward Jesus appeared again to his disciples, by the Sea of Galilee.It happened this way:

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita, na Tọmọs (n Didimọs pa sịḅọ) na Natanieli Kana ḅụ saghị ḅooḅọ Galili ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, na pịghị Zebidi owiapụ awọ na pịghị jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ ọḅụduaapụ, nnị mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá imi.
english_text: Simon Peter, Thomas (also known as Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were together.

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita dugho n pịrịm, A pághá ịgbọ muarị, nnị ọ pagharam, Wamịnị i nana muubẹm. Nnị wárị ori na muu árụ́ ma ḅụlọ, kụ́ma anị dii gbọrụ ma nnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ kuuḅogha.
english_text: “I’m going out to fish,” Simon Peter told them, and they said, “We’ll go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.

ibani_text: Dedefụfụ, Jizọs posie aka ma ḅụ sẹ́fịnịm, kụ́ma ori ọḅụduaapụ ma nimiḅogha ḅẹẹ, ori anịị Jizọs.
english_text: Early in the morning, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus.

ibani_text: Ọ wárị n gbíla, Nangwọapụ, ọmịnị nji nyáná? Nnị pagharam, Errnh, Errnh.
english_text: He called out to them,“Friends, haven’t you any fish?” “No,” they answered.

ibani_text: Jizọs wárị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ịgbọ ma waghi árụ́ ma ámáḅara angaá ọ pịghị nji kuubẹm. Nnị ọkọ mịẹ sáá nnị ine ịgbọ ma nụ́nụ́ árụ́ ma bie sẹgha anị kuu mánámāná nji gosi.
english_text: He said,“Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.”When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Jizọs ḅẹlẹma ọḅụduaḅọ ma wárị Pita ḅẹẹ, Ọ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma! Saimọn Pita náa gbẹ́rẹ́kirkiri ḅẹẹ, Ọ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma, Ori ọrẹ ọgọ́nọ́ suabịtẹ ma pa ori oju fịnam (tegó ori ọrẹ suabịtẹ sịmam) sị dosi mingi ma bie sọ.
english_text: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” As soon as Simon Peter heard him say, “It is the Lord,” he wrapped his outer garment around him (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the water.

ibani_text: Isi ọḅụduaapụ ma árụ́ ma dọghụ Pita duam sị nji bii ịgbọ ma fọ́nọ́ mú kiri ọ́gọ́nọ láa, tegó nnị kiri na kikiam ine yadi sọ́nọ́ a si láa nyẹ.
english_text: The other disciples followed in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about a hundred yards.

ibani_text: Nnị kiri ọ́gọ́nọ láa sáá, nnị kọrịarị fịnị ayịmgbọlụ arịm nji anị ọgọnọ imi, nnị pịghị fịturu arịm.
english_text: When they landed, they saw a fire of burning coals there with fish on it, and some bread.

ibani_text: Jizọs wárị n ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa o kuuḅo nji ma ọ jẹa nyẹ akuoo.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Bring some of the fish you have just caught.”

ibani_text: Saimọn Pita árụ́ ma ḅụlọm sị nji ḅụ bii ịgbọ ma nụ́nụ́ kiri ọgọnọ ḅoo. Tọgha opu nji anịị ịgbọ ma bii nyẹ, nji sọ́nọ́ma a si oyi findi na tẹ́rẹ́, ịgbọ ma mánámāná nji kum anịsọ ịgbọ ma kaagha.
english_text: So Simon Peter climbed back into the boat and dragged the net ashore. It was full of large fish, 153, but even with so many the net was not torn.

ibani_text: Jizọs dugho n pịrịm, O ḅoo dede fị́nyẹ fịị. Ori ọḅụduaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine gbilagha, Ịrị tụọ? Nnị nimim ḅẹẹ, ori anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma.
english_text: Jesus said to them,“Come and have breakfast.”None of the disciples dared ask him, “Who are you?” They knew it was the Lord.

ibani_text: Jizọs warị ḅo fịtúrú ma akị sị anị pa n pịrị, anịị ọ pịghị nji ma na mịẹḅara.
english_text: Jesus came, took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.

ibani_text: Mịị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá Jizọs ọ ḅụ pa ori ọḅụduaapụ die nyẹ ọ fịị ḅụ saghị fama sáá.
english_text: This was now the third time Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.

ibani_text: Nnị nyẹ́fị fama sáá, Jizọs, Saimọn Pita ḅẹm, Saimọn Jọn tụwọ ị́ i ḅẹlẹma mịnanyẹ mamgba nẹ́ngị? Pita pagharam, Innh Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i nimim ḅẹẹ a i ḅẹ́lẹ́mam. Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, Ị́yẹ́ ánáná siḅee.
english_text: When they had finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter,“Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?” “Yes, Lord,” he said, “you know that I love you.” Jesus said,“Feed my lambs.”

ibani_text: Jizọs sima ọ ḅẹm, Saimọn Jọn tụwọ i tụ́ma ḅara pa i ḅẹlẹma? Ọ pagharam, Innh Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị nimim ḅẹẹ, a ị ḅẹ́lẹ́mam. Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, Iyẹ ánáná siḅee.
english_text: Again Jesus said,“Simon son of John, do you love me?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said,“Take care of my sheep.”

ibani_text: Jizọs tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá pa ọ ḅẹm, Saimọn Jọn tụwọ, ị́ i ḅẹlẹma? Mịma Pita ḅụfịịm tegó ori tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá pa ọ gbilam ḅẹẹ, Ị́ i ḅẹlẹma? Ọ pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nimim, i nimim ḅẹẹ a i ḅẹ́lẹ́mam. Jizọs ọ ḅẹm, Iyẹ anana siḅee.
english_text: The third time he said to him,“Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time,“Do you love me?”He said, “Lord, you know all things; you know that I love you.” Jesus said,“Feed my sheep.

ibani_text: A karakárányẹ ma dugho ị pịrịm, ịrị ásátụ́wọ ḅụ fịnị sa i ḅara na bịtẹ pa ịḅụ suam pịghị i dọghụ angaá muu: kụ́ma ịrị olom sáá ị ḅara sụghụmabẹm sị jụghọ bịtẹ pa ị sua pịghị i daá i dọghụgha angaá muu.
english_text: Very truly I tell you, when you were younger you dressed yourself and went where you wanted; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mịma dughom pa die Pita kọọ bẹ fịị ḅara sị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ipine ma diepágháma. Anịsáa ó wárị dugho ọ pịrị, I dua!
english_text: Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. Then he said to him,“Follow me!”

ibani_text: Pita pịghịm sị árị ḅẹ́ Jizọs ḅẹlẹma ọḅụduaḅọ ma n duarị. (Mịị anị Jizọs ḅụ sẹrẹrẹ ḅọ ma ḅupiri fị́nyẹ ma kiri sị gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, tụọ muu ị dẹ́rịfị bẹ́?)
english_text: Peter turned and saw that the disciple whom Jesus loved was following them. (This was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and had said, “Lord, who is going to betray you?”)

ibani_text: Pita ori árị sáá, ọ gbilam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, mịị owitụ́wọ gbolomanyẹ i tẹ́ dugho bẹ?
english_text: When Peter saw him, he asked, “Lord, what about him?”

ibani_text: Jizọs pagharam, A ḅọ́rọ́ dọghụ sị o duma akị muu a pịghịma ḅo sáá láa, anịma anị ịḅụ tẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́? Ịrị i dua.
english_text: Jesus answered,“If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? You must follow me.”

ibani_text: Mịma gosi dughonyẹ ma kaa wásámam mịná ọḅụduaapụ ma ogbobie ḅẹẹ mịị ọḅụduaḅọ ma fịịbịgha. Kụ́ma Jizọs dughogha ḅẹ́ ọ fịịbịgha, ọ papa dughom ḅẹẹ, A ḅọ́rọ́ dọghụ ọkụ́ma ḅẹẹ o dumafịnị ákị muu a sima ḅoo sáá láa, anịma anị tẹ́ mịẹ ị pịrịbẹ?
english_text: Because of this, the rumor spread among the believers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say that he would not die; he only said,“If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?”

ibani_text: Mịị ọḅụduaḅọ ma anịị mịnanyẹ ma dugho págháma ḅọ, ori anịị pịghị anị gịẹ kóróma ḅọ. Wa nimim ḅẹẹ ori dugho págháma nyẹ ma karakárányẹ.
english_text: This is the disciple who testifies to these things and who wrote them down. We know that his testimony is true.

ibani_text: Jizọs pịghị tọgha jẹa nyẹ sọ mịẹm. Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ ọ mịẹnyẹ mamgba gịẹ kóróma, a sịm ḅẹẹ tuminikiri gbọrụ ine anị ákị́bịghaa.
english_text: Jesus did many other things as well. If every one of them were written down, I suppose that even the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.

ibani_text: Iyẹ iḅiminaḅọ Tiofilọs, iyẹ párị diri ḅụ, á Jizọs mịẹnyẹ mamgba na pịghị o dienyẹ mamgba gịẹ kórómam ori ọrẹ fịrị saghị sáá
english_text: In my former book, Theophilus, I wrote about all that Jesus began to do and to teach

ibani_text: akị muu ori iwóo sobie muu sáá láa. Na nnị ọ pa iwomagha sáá Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ bịpị pa ọ sẹlẹakịapụ ma pịrịm ḅẹ nnị anịị ọrẹ nfịrịmaapụ.
english_text: until the day he was taken up to heaven, after giving instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.

ibani_text: Dii a mmẹẹ́ si, ọ fịịfama sáá, ori ọḅụ pa nnị diem tọgha sa, na pịghị asọ kịrịkị́rị́ ḅụ, diearịnyẹ tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹgha ḅụ ḅẹ́ o dumam. Nnị ori arịm ọ pịghị nnị ná Tamuno amadakiri ma gbólómanyẹ dughom.
english_text: After his suffering, he presented himself to them and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo kobiri sáá, ọ warị kụrọma mị bịpị ma kóróma ḅẹẹ, Ọ Jerusalem warịsoma, kụ́ma ọ fịnị a dugho ọ pịrị dienyẹ ma kúru, i Daa minini ọ pịrịnyẹ ma.
english_text: On one occasion, while he was eating with them, he gave them this command:“Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift my Father promised, which you have heard me speak about.

ibani_text: Jọn mingi pa mingi saram, kụ́ma ḅọlọgha éné ḅụ ọ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ mingi sárábẹm.
english_text: For John baptized withwater, but in a few days you will be baptized withthe Holy Spirit.”

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma Jizọs na dona sáá, nnị o gbilam ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i ḅọ́rọ́ mị́sa amadakiri ma ḅọ́rọ́ma Izirẹlị pịrịbẹ?
english_text: Then they gathered around him and asked him, “Lord, are you at this time going to restore the kingdom to Israel?”

ibani_text: Jizọs warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịna kirigha nimi Daḅọ ma ori kụ́rọ ḅụ tọ́ọ warị sáá.
english_text: He said to them:“It is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọmịna ḅụ ḅomaẹrẹ nnị kụrọ pa ọmịna ḅụ suabẹm, sị ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ onyésẹapụ sọọbẹm Jerusalem ḅụ, Judiya gbọ́rụ́ na Sameriya na pịghị tuminikiri kunema anga mamgba.
english_text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá, nnị warị ori akị iwóo sobie múm, nnị pa dighiarị sáá, anịị oḅuto warị ọ gbẹ́ẹ̄, n mịnị ori arịgha.
english_text: After he said this, he was taken up before their very eyes, and a cloud hid him from their sight.

ibani_text: Nnị paá tọ́rụ́ pa so dighiarị sáá, ori iwóóarị sáá, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri mmẹẹ́ owiapụ pị́na bịtẹ suapụ ḅo nnị ngása sẹm.
english_text: They were looking intently up into the sky as he was going, when suddenly two men dressed in white stood beside them.

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Galiliapụ ọ tegó pa sẹ so ma dighiarị? Mịị nnị ọ ḅárabie akị iwóo so mú Jizọs ma pịghị pịghịma ḅoobẹm, ọ mịnị ori árị ḅara ma ori iwóóarị sáá.
english_text: “Men of Galilee,” they said, “why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa anịị nfịrịmaapụ ma pịghịma Jerusalem ḅo nyẹ Olivu Tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ, ama ma bie sághị ḅo, ine maili ikiḅa láa nyẹ.
english_text: Then the apostles returned to Jerusalem from the hill called the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day’s walkfrom the city.

ibani_text: Nnị ámá ma sọm warị tándị iwóo ọgọ́nọ́ fịnịbie ma sọọ nnị fịnịarị ngá. Pita, Jọn, Jems na Anduru, Filipụ na Tọmọs, Batolomi na Matiu, Jems Alịfịyọs tụ́wọ, Saimọn Ámáibidọghụḅọ, na Judas Jems tụ́wọ.
english_text: When they arrived, they went upstairs to the room where they were staying. Those present were Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew; James son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.

ibani_text: Ogboapụ ḅara n kobiri kobirim opuma sa ngúmágha pa, sị tẹ́ghẹ̄, nnị na ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma, na pịghị Meri Jizọs nyingi, na pịghị ori amịna owiapụ.
english_text: They all joined together constantly in prayer, along with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

ibani_text: Tọgha dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, mininiapụ ma kóbiri ogbo ḅo kiriakịm, anị ngaa fịnịapụ mamgba túminị́ suene a si, Pita warị sághị si ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ẹ́
english_text: In those days Peter stood up among the believers (a group numbering about a hundred and twenty)

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ, Iyẹ́a nángwọ́apụ, Tọ́ndiri ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọọbẹm, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anị Deviti bịpị pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarị sáá, pághá bẹnyẹ dughom Judas ḅụ, asọ pa Jizọs kuuapụ dieḅọ.
english_text: and said, “Brothers and sisters,the Scripture had to be fulfilled in which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus.

ibani_text: Judas ori wámịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, nnị ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm ḅẹ ori sọ diekiri nyáná wámịna fịrị ma ḅụ.
english_text: He was one of our number and shared in our ministry.”

ibani_text: (Ọ nyáná ḅo igbii ori sii fịrị ḅụ, anịị ọ pa kiri fẹ́ẹ nyẹ, anị ngaa anịị ọ pịghị sóghóro koro fịịnyẹ, o furobie ila pịghị wọrọ págháḅo.
english_text: (With the payment he received for his wickedness, Judas bought a field; there he fell headlong, his body burst open and all his intestines spilled out.

ibani_text: Jerusalem ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba anị naam, anịgoo nna ama bịpị ḅụ, nnị anị siim Akeldama kiri, mịma dughoarị Ọmbịnyẹ́ Kiri.)
english_text: Everyone in Jerusalem heard about this, so they called that field in their language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)

ibani_text: Nnị kọkọ gịẹ kóróma fíafía Núme diri bie ḅẹẹ,  Ọ wárị kị́nị́ ofori wárị sọọ; Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ anị bie ngaa ma. Nnị kọkọ pịghị gịẹ ḅẹẹ,  Jụghọ ọrẹ fịrịkiri akịị.
english_text: “For,” said Peter, “it is written in the Book of Psalms: “ ‘May his place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in it,’ and, “ ‘May another take his place of leadership.’

ibani_text: Anị karakáram ḅẹ sághị wa dua ikelekelearị owiapụ ma bie, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs wamịnị na koro na paghaárị sáá,
english_text: Therefore it is necessary to choose one of the men who have been with us the whole time the Lord Jesus was living among us,

ibani_text: Jọn mingi sara ḅụ akị ori iwóo sáá láa. Mịị ḅọ ma wamịnị na onyẹsẹ́ ori fịị ḅụ sághị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: beginning from John’s baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị mmẹẹ́ owiapụ goo: Josẹf nnị Basabas pa sịḅọ, nnị pịghị Jọstọs sọ pa ọ sim na pịghị Matayas.
english_text: So they nominated two men: Joseph called Barsabbas (also known as Justus) and Matthias.

ibani_text: Nnị warị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, i koko kị́nị́mamgba kóróma nimi, anịgo pa wa die mị mmẹapụ ma ḅụ i sẹlẹ́akị ḅọ ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know everyone’s heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen

ibani_text: nḅọ nfịrịmaḅọ sọọ Judas kiriakịị, wa wáriso ọ sághị ḅo ngaa muuḅọ.
english_text: to take over this apostolic ministry, which Judas left to go where he belongs.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị okoḅa gbii mmẹapụ ma ḅụ, nnị warị Matayas sẹlẹakị, ori anị nnị pa oyingieapụ ma kárámáḅọ.
english_text: Then they cast lots, and the lot fell to Matthias; so he was added to the eleven apostles.

ibani_text: Dii a mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi Ḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma ḅoo sáá, mininiapụ mamgba kobirim gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅụ.
english_text: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.

ibani_text: Ḅụnimigha sáá anịị nnị ọwụ náanyẹ sobie irisé fieḅára pa fiearị nyẹ, anị warị ngaamamgba sọ bii n kpọrọfịnị ngá.
english_text: Suddenly a sound like the blowing of a violent wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.

ibani_text: Nnị warị fịnịḅẹlẹ kịkanyẹ árị kaa galagala sị mú gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ọ́gọ́nọ gbánā.
english_text: They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nnị kị́nị́mamgba bie sọọ biim, nnị warị jẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nnị kụrọma ḅara.
english_text: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tonguesas the Spirit enabled them.

ibani_text: Juuapụ Jerusalem ḅụ ngaapụ imii, tụ́ma ólóghó kokoapụ tuminikiri gbọ́rụ́ saghị ḅooapụ.
english_text: Now there were staying in Jerusalem God-fearing Jews from every nation under heaven.

ibani_text: Nnị mịị ọwụ ma náa sa, tọgha túminị́ ogbo kobirim, nnị kị́nị́mamgba bieḅẹlẹarị ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ mininiapụ ma naam nnị nna ama ḅẹlẹ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarị.
english_text: When they heard this sound, a crowd came together in bewilderment, because each one heard their own language being spoken.

ibani_text: Árịnyẹ tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị na ḅụgbérépu ḅụ nnị warị ilúghú ḅẹẹ, Mịị túminị́ ma, mị ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarịapụ ma, nnị Galiliapụ.
english_text: Utterly amazed, they asked: “Aren’t all these who are speaking Galileans?

ibani_text: O tegósi wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba n naarị nnị wámịna ama bịpị fiearị sáá.
english_text: Then how is it that each of us hears them in our native language?

ibani_text: Wámịna bie jẹapụ Patiya, Mediya na Elam ḅụ saghịḅom, jẹapụ Mesopotamiya, Judiya na Kapadosiya, jẹapụ Pọntus na Esiya.
english_text: Parthians, Medes and Elamites; residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

ibani_text: Jẹapụ Frigiya na Pamfiliya, jẹapụ Ijipiti na pịghị Libiya mparanga Sirini na kikianyẹ, wámịna ḅụ jẹapụ, Rom ḅụ saghịḅom.
english_text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene; visitors from Rome

ibani_text: Juuapụ na Juughaapụ pịghịmaapụ sị saghị Juuapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara kọọ, na pịghị wámịna ḅụ jẹapụ Krete na Arebiya ḅụ sághị ḅoapụ wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba sọ biri pa naam wamịnị ámábịpị pa dughoarị Tamuno nwángịmáa opu fịrị!
english_text: (both Jews and converts to Judaism); Cretans and Arabs—we hear them declaring the wonders of God in our own tongues!”

ibani_text: Arị nyẹ tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị na sịbị galagala ḅụ n saghị jụghọ jụghọ gbilam ḅẹẹ, Mịma anị tẹ́ dughoarị?
english_text: Amazed and perplexed, they asked one another, “What does this mean?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹapụ kombo ḅara pa miniapụ ma ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Mịnaapụ ma nnị iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ ḅámaapụ.
english_text: Some, however, made fun of them and said, “They have had too much wine.”

ibani_text: Pita warị saghị sẹ, ori náa isi nfịrịmaapụ oyingieapụ findi ma na, warị opu pụghọ pa sághị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ ogbo ma pịrị ḅẹẹ: I jẹa Juuapụ, ọmịnị Jerusalem ḅụ ngaapụ mamgba, ọmịnị i pughu sị a dugho ọ pịrị mịnanyẹ ma dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice and addressed the crowd: “Fellow Jews and all of you who live in Jerusalem, let me explain this to you; listen carefully to what I say.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ ḅámaapụgha ọ sị ḅara, ọ́ kọ́kọ́ nimitẹ́lẹ́ma ḅẹẹ mị ọ dedebie ésẹ́nie énékịẹnyẹ.
english_text: These people are not drunk, as you suppose. It’s only nine in the morning!

ibani_text: Tụ́ma mịma anị ikiakoro Jowel dughonyẹ:
english_text: No, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:

ibani_text: Tamuno dughom ḅẹẹ, Mịma anịị a mịẹbẹnyẹ kunema éné biri. A i Tẹ́mẹ́ pa kị́nị́mamgba ḅụ sarabẹm ọmịna owiapụ awọ na ọmịna ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ awọ, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho wásámabẹm, ọmịna ásáawọ saghị múnogha dáwọ kọbẹm, ọmịna olomapụ dáwọbẹm.
english_text: “ ‘In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, your old men will dream dreams.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ ḅụ owiapụ na ẹrẹ na a iyẹ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa sárábẹm anị éné ma ḅụ, nnị pịghị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho wásámabẹm.
english_text: Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.

ibani_text: A ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ mịẹbẹm sotọrụ ḅụ, pịghị ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ mịẹ tuminikiri sughubie, ọmịnị ọmbịnyẹ́ na fịnị na pịghị kúrúkúrú onwi árịbẹm.
english_text: I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and billows of smoke.

ibani_text: Ịrụa mịnị biabịgha, akalụ́ sọ pịghị sághị áwụ biabẹm. Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ opu ipine éné ma ḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅárásua biiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm.
english_text: And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’

ibani_text: Ọ́ mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pughu i jẹa Izirẹlịawọ, Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ sághị ḅoḅọ ma ori anịị Tamuno ḅara pụ́nụ́ pịrị ḅo, Tamuno pịghị ọ pa nwángị tọgha tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị, ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ na diepágháma nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ nimim, tegó mịnanyẹ ma kiriakịm ọmịna ogboku bie.
english_text: “Fellow Israelites, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders and signs, which God did among you through him, as you yourselves know.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọrẹ nyẹ pa ọrụtọ ḅụ, tọ́ḅọ́rọ́mamám ḅẹẹ n Jizọs ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ́ ḅárábie suabẹm sị, siiapụ wárịso sị nnị ọ ḅaupálị.
english_text: This man was handed over to you by God’s deliberate plan and foreknowledge; and you, with the help of wicked men,put him to death by nailing him to the cross.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno fịị ḅụ ọ saghịmam, sị ọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma fịị kụrọ ḅụ, tegó anị ḅụdam ḅẹẹ fịị ọ pa ikólinaḅọ mịẹ.
english_text: But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.

ibani_text: Deviti o gbolomanyẹ dughom ḅẹẹ,  Sámámgba a Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma arịm i tórúku. Ori i nana kikiam gosi, a ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ịḅụ pịrịbịgha.
english_text: David said about him: “ ‘I saw the Lord always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

ibani_text: Anịgo bieḅẹlẹ i tẹ́mẹ́bie biim, bieḅẹlẹ pịghị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ biim. Irị, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ a fịị bẹ sọ ịnyọ́sárá ḅụ biekpọ nyánábẹm:
english_text: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest in hope,

ibani_text: Tegó ị́ i dighi tọ́rụ́sibịghaa fịịapụ tuminikiri. Ị minibịgha sị ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ ḅụrụ dupu bie.
english_text: because you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead, you will not let your holy one see decay.

ibani_text: Ị dúmá asọ ma pa i diemam a pịghị bieḅẹlẹbẹm ị tórúku.
english_text: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.’

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ nángwọ́apụ, a ákákikigha ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịbẹm wámịna ẹ́rẹ́so tádọ́ḅo Ámányánáḅọ Deviti gbolomanyẹ. Ọ fịịm n pịghị o dipim ori dupu so wamịnị na imi ḅo mị́sa laam.
english_text: “Fellow Israelites, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and his tomb is here to this day.

ibani_text: Ori ikiakoroḅọ, ọ pịghị nimim Tamuno mini ọ pịrịnyẹ. Tamuno nyẹ mịnị ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ori ámányánáḅọ pa o furobie pághá gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mịẹbẹm ọ Deviti mịẹḅara.
english_text: But he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him on oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne.

ibani_text: Deviti árịm Tamuno mịẹdọ́ghunyẹ tórúku, ọ warị nnị Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma fịị ḅụ sághị gbolomanyẹ dugho, o dugho sáá ḅẹẹ,  Nnị ọ warịsoghaa dua ama, ori ojumẹnị ḅụrụgha dupu bie.
english_text: Seeing what was to come, he spoke of the resurrection of the Messiah, that he was not abandoned to the realm of the dead, nor did his body see decay.

ibani_text: Tamuno mị gbẹ́rẹ́ Jizọs ma saghịmam fịị ḅụ, wámịnị sọ onyẹsẹ́ mị karakáráma pịrịm.
english_text: God has raised this Jesus to life, and we are all witnesses of it.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị ọ saghị Tamuno Daḅọ ma amaḅaranga wárịmam, ọ pịghị ọ ḅarabie Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma daḅomam o minini ḅara ḅụ. Mị́sa ọ mịnị árị pịghị náanyẹ ma ọ́ ori dienyẹ, ọ pa wámịna ḅụ saram.
english_text: Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear.

ibani_text: Deviti origha i iwóo so muu ḅọ; tụ́ma o dughom ḅẹẹ,  Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma Inyanaḅọ ḅẹm iyẹ amaḅara ngaa mịnga kpọrọfịnịị
english_text: For David did not ascend to heaven, and yet he said, “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand

ibani_text: sị a ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ pa ị́yẹ́ ḅụ́ọ́gbána ịkasị mịẹ ị ḅụọ sughu.
english_text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.” ’

ibani_text: Izirẹlịapụ mamgba, anịsáa nimibẹm karakáráma ḅẹẹ mịị ọ ḅaupálị Jizọs ma anịị Tamuno pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ na nnị Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ mịẹḅọ.
english_text: “Therefore let all Israel be assured of this: God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma mịma náa sáá, anị opuma ḅụḅáláḅálá pa nnị pịrịm, n warị Pita na isi nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Mịná owiapụ, wa tọrọ́ mịẹbẹ?
english_text: When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”

ibani_text: Pita warị nnị ḅẹẹ, Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna sii ḅụ pịghị sị mingi sara Jizọs Krais ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sị, siiḅụḅarasipịrị nyáná, anịsáa, ọ Tamuno dienyẹ ma nyánábẹm, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma.
english_text: Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno mini nyẹ ma, o mini ọmịnị na ọmịna awọ pịrịm, na pịghị ḅọlọ angaá fịnịapụ pịghị wámịna Nyáná Tamuno sị ọ ḅụ pịrịbẹapụ mamgba.
english_text: The promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off—for all whom the Lord our God will call.”

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị jẹ́nyẹ jẹ́nyẹ dughom pa nnị surumam ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ dụapághámaḅo, kụrọsịbịbẹapụ ḅụ koro bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị, ḅụ.
english_text: With many other words he warned them; and he pleaded with them, “Save yourselves from this corrupt generation.”

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ tọghaapụ ori oku ma mininim nnị warị pịghị mingi pa nnị sara, anị éné ma ḅụ túminị́ sọ́nọ́ma ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi anị túminị́ ogbo ma bie ḅo sọọ nyẹ.
english_text: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.

ibani_text: Nnị warị sáá ngúmá nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅárabie nyẹ dáwọ pịghị mịẹgbólóma nyáná nnị pịghị mịẹgbólóma nyánam fị́nyẹ ḅụ na tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅụ.
english_text: They devoted themselves to the apostles’ teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.

ibani_text: Tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị na ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ anịị kiriakịnyẹ nfịrịmaapụ ogboku, ḅáláfa na osigha ḅo túminị́ ma ḅụ sọm.
english_text: Everyone was filled with awe at the many wonders and signs performed by the apostles.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá fịnịm pịghị nna nyánányẹ pa jụghọ jụghọ na diem.
english_text: All the believers were together and had everything in common.

ibani_text: Nnị nna nyánányẹ dẹrịbẹm, sị igbii akuoo diegálágáláma kị́nị́mamgba pịrị, anị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅụ fịnị ḅára.
english_text: They sold property and possessions to give to anyone who had need.

ibani_text: Éné éné bie anịị nnị donaarị nyẹ ogboapụ ḅara Tamuoopuwarị ma bie, nnị pịghị nna fị́nyẹ fị gbólómam jụghọ jụghọ wárịbie bieḅẹlẹ kúkúbie na ḅụ siminima nna ḅụ,
english_text: Every day they continued to meet together in the temple courts. They broke bread in their homes and ate together with glad and sincere hearts,

ibani_text: boma pa Tamuno pịrịarị pịghị túminị́ mamgba ḅẹlẹma ḅẹlẹ fịarị. Éné mamgba Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pa nna bie suam dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánáarịapụ.
english_text: praising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Pita na Jọn na Tamunoopuwarị múm sị n muu tẹ́ghẹ̄ tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ éné ḅa, anịị tẹ́ghẹ̄ tẹ́ghẹ̄ sáá ma ḅụ.
english_text: One day Peter and John were going up to the temple at the time of prayer—at three in the afternoon.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa Fíafía opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ, nnị anị sị sị ḅara, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imii ikúléḅọ saghị nnị oyi sa ene ene. Éné gbọ́rụ́ gbọ́rụ́ nnị o dighi anị ngaa mú muum sị o mú nyẹ́bi Tamunoopuwarị ma muarịapụ ḅara.
english_text: Now a man who was lame from birth was being carried to the temple gate called Beautiful, where he was put every day to beg from those going into the temple courts.

ibani_text: O ḅo Pita na Jọn na árị sáá Tamunoopuwárị bie ma soarị, ọ warị bii ḅẹẹ nnị nyẹ́doghu ọ pịrịị.
english_text: When he saw Peter and John about to enter, he asked them for money.

ibani_text: Pita warị dadaa tọ́rụ́ pa ọ ḅụ gbánā Jọn sọ tọ́rụ́ pa ọ ḅụ gbánā ḅara, Pita warị ḅẹẹ, Tọ́rụ pa wa dighi!
english_text: Peter looked straight at him, as did John. Then Peter said, “Look at us!”

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị dighi, kúruarị ḅẹẹ ori nna ḅárábie nyẹ nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: So the man gave them his attention, expecting to get something from them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Pị́naḅala na odoḅala a nyanagha, kụ́ma a nyánányẹ a pa i pịrịbẹm, Jizọs Krais Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ saghị sị nwángị!
english_text: Then Peter said, “Silver or gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅara pa ori amaḅara ḅụ ori ọlọ sị ḅárásua ọ pịrị sị ọ saghị. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọ ḅụọ na ọ ḅara na ḅo ịnyọ nyanam.
english_text: Taking him by the right hand, he helped him up, and instantly the man’s feet and ankles became strong.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dosi sị ọ ḅụọ ḅụ sẹ, warị sághị nwángị ikelekelé. Anịsáa ọ warị nnị na Tamuoopuwarị ma sọọ, nwángịarị dosiarị sị boma pa Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: He jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising God.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa fịnịapụ ma ori arịm nwángịarị sị boma pa Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: When all the people saw him walking and praising God,

ibani_text: Nnị ḅoo o lighilighiḅo sáá ḅẹẹ ori anịị Fíafía opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ fịnịfịnị nyẹ́bibiḅọ ma, nyẹ́ma n tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngim mị owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ pághányẹ.
english_text: they recognized him as the same man who used to sit begging at the temple gate called Beautiful, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ma pa Pita na Jọn na ọlọ sẹ́ma sáá Solomọn bie ma ḅụ, nnị ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá anị sị ḅara, túminị́ ma árịnyẹ n tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngim, nnị warị mangị n damaḅo.
english_text: While the man held on to Peter and John, all the people were astonished and came running to them in the place called Solomon’s Colonnade.

ibani_text: Pita túminị́ ma árị sáá, ori n ḅẹẹm, I jẹa Izirẹlịapụ, mịị nyẹ ma anị tegó ọ tọ́rụ́nẹ́ngimaarị, o tegó tọ́rụ́ findi wa dighiarị, ọ si ḅẹ́ wámịna kụrọ ḅụ anịgha wámịna opu Tamuno nimi mịẹsị mịị owitụ́wọ ma nwángịị?
english_text: When Peter saw this, he said to them: “Fellow Israelites, why does this surprise you? Why do you stare at us as if by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?

ibani_text: Wámịna Ebraham Aizik na Jekọpụ Tamuno wámịna tádọ́apụ Tamuno ori ipine pa ori fịrịnwangịḅọ Jizọs pịrịmam, kụ́ma ọmịnị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma sịbịdáapụ ma pịrịm, ọ warị ọ sịghịị Paileti tórúku, Paileti pịghị tọ́ḅọ́rọ́ma maá ḅara ḅẹẹ ori ọ wárịsóbẹm ọ sọọ.
english_text: The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus. You handed him over to be killed, and you disowned him before Pilate, though he had decided to let him go.

ibani_text: Ori tọ́ntọ́ ibi tumḅọ, kụ́ma ọmịnị ọ sịghịịm, tụ́ma bii ḅẹẹ nnị kị́nị́ ḅáḅọ́ wáriso ọ pịrịị.
english_text: You disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked that a murderer be released to you.

ibani_text: Ọ duma nyánáḅọ ma ḅám, kụ́ma Tamuno ọ sị saghịm fịị ḅụ, wamịnị sọ onyẹsẹ́ mịma pịrịm.
english_text: You killed the author of life, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses of this.

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ fịnị kụrọ anị ịnyọ pa mịị ikúléḅọ ma pịrịnyẹ, Mị́sa ọmịnị árị nimi si pịghị mịẹnyẹ ma, ọ́ minini nyáná ori ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ; minini Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ anịị mị owitụ́wọ ma gwọ́nyẹ ọmịnị mamgba pịghị árị ḅara.
english_text: By faith in the name of Jesus, this man whom you see and know was made strong. It is Jesus’ name and the faith that comes through him that has completely healed him, as you can all see.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ị́yẹ́ nángwọ́apụ, a nimim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị na ọmịna sịbịdaapụ pa Jizọs mịẹnyẹ ma, ọ mịẹm nimigha ḅụ.
english_text: “Now, fellow Israelites, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did your leaders.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọmaa sa Tamuno ori ikiakoroapụ mamgba ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dugho pághámamam ḅẹẹ, ori n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm, o mịẹm sị anị ḅo karakárányẹ sọọ mị ḅara.
english_text: But this is how God fulfilled what he had foretold through all the prophets, saying that his Messiah would suffer.

ibani_text: O sii ḅụ pịghị sị, Tamuno damaḅo sị ori ọmịna sii ḅụ ḅárási ọ pịrị.
english_text: Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord,

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọkọ mịẹmịẹ tẹ́mẹ́ju ịnyọ saghị ḅobẹm Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ toruku, anị sáá, ọ́ Jizọs nnị Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma fịrịmabẹm ọ sẹlẹakị ọ pịrịmaá ḅọ.
english_text: and that he may send the Messiah, who has been appointed for you—even Jesus.

ibani_text: O sobie fịnịbẹm sị nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹsị anị ịwọ sa láa, Tamuno ori tọ́ntọ́ ikiakoroapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dugho págháma ma ḅara ḅọlọ sáá éné éné.
english_text: Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore everything, as he promised long ago through his holy prophets.

ibani_text: Mosis ḅẹẹm ḅẹẹ, Ọmịna Nyáná Tamuno ikiakoroḅọ pa ọ fịrịmabẹm ori i fịrịma ḅara ori sọ pịghị ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅobẹm, ọ mịnị ọ dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹẹ ọ́ mịẹ ọmịnị anị mịẹ.
english_text: For Moses said, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people; you must listen to everything he tells you.

ibani_text: Anị ikiakoroḅọ ma osighaḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅọ foofomabẹm Tamuno túminị́ fịnịanga sị pịghị n guluguluma.
english_text: Anyone who does not listen to him will be completely cut off from their people.’

ibani_text: Ikiakoroapụ mamgba sị oku nyánáapụ Samuwẹlị na ori ọḅụkụ́nọma ḅoapụ na mị́sa pághárịnyẹ ma dugho pághámam.
english_text: “Indeed, beginning with Samuel, all the prophets who have spoken have foretold these days.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori ikiakoroapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ o minini ọ pịrịnyẹ ma anị fịnị ọ pịrịm ọ pịghị diekiri Nyáná Tamuno ọmịna tádọ́apụ na fị ọ ḅoo ḅụ. O dugho Ebraham pịrị ḅara, Ị furobie págháḅoapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ a tuminikiriapụ mamgba karịibimabẹm.
english_text: And you are heirs of the prophets and of the covenant God made with your fathers. He said to Abraham, ‘Through your offspring all peoples on earth will be blessed.’

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị Ebraham ḅẹẹ, i furobie págháḅo bẹ awọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, a tuminikiri gbọrụ karịibimabẹm. [
english_text: When God raised up his servant, he sent him first to you to bless you by turning each of you from your wicked ways.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi Tamuno ori fịrịnwangịḅọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm warị parị ọ pa fịrịma, sị ori ọ karịibima sị mịẹsị ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ọmịna siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ pịghị bẹ ḅara.]
Pita na Jọn na pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọ́ túminị́ ma pịrịarị sáá jẹa igwagwaapụ, Tamunoopuwarị ma kúruarịapụ sịbịdaḅọ na Sadusiiapụ ḅọ láa sáá.
english_text: The priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to Peter and John while they were speaking to the people.

ibani_text: Nnị tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹlẹgha ḅẹ́ mị mmẹẹ́ nfịrịmaapụ ma diearị ḅẹ Jizọs fịị ḅụ saghịmam dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: They were greatly disturbed because the apostles were teaching the people, proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection of the dead.

ibani_text: Anịgo warị n kuu ikólibie sua mú énéḅama, sáá opuma muu maá ḅara.
english_text: They seized Peter and John and, because it was evening, they put them in jail until the next day.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọghaapụ oku ma naapụ mininim anịgo nna kịẹbịpị sẹnị ḅo oyi mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ findi na oyia si lam.
english_text: But many who heard the message believed; so the number of men who believed grew to about five thousand.

ibani_text: Éné ḅo ḅáa sáá, Juuapụ sịbịdaapụ, nna sẹ́nịapụ na ólóghó Nyẹ́dieapụ ma kobiri nyẹ Jerusalem ḅụ.
english_text: The next day the rulers, the elders and the teachers of the law met in Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị na mị kobiri ma kọọ ḅọ anịị Anas Igwagwaalaḅọ na Kayafas, Jọn, Alegizanda na pịghị jẹapụ na Igwagwaalaḅọ ma wárịapụ.
english_text: Annas the high priest was there, and so were Caiaphas, John, Alexander and others of the high priest’s family.

ibani_text: Nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma mịẹm sị nnị sẹ́ nna tórúku, n warị nnị gbíla, Ọ tọ́rọ́ pa mịma mịẹ? Ọ tọ́rọ́fịnị kụ́rọ nyáná anịgha ọ́ tụọ ẹ́rẹ́ pa mị fịrị ma nwángịị?
english_text: They had Peter and John brought before them and began to question them: “By what power or what name did you do this?”

ibani_text: Pita Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ biiḅọ warị n págháraa ḅẹẹ, Sịbịdaapụ na sẹ́nịapụ,
english_text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them: “Rulers and elders of the people!

ibani_text: ọ ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ pa wa gbilaarị mịmgba éné wa mịẹ mị ikúléḅọ ma pịrị ibi, ọ pịghị ḅara warị gwọọ ḅara,
english_text: If we are being called to account today for an act of kindness shown to a man who was lame and are being asked how he was healed,

ibani_text: anị sáá, ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba nimi, Izirẹlịawọ mamgba, o nimi ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ogboku bie sẹ́ owitụ́wọ ma Jizọs Krais Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ anịị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ gwọọ nyẹ, ọ ḅaupálị ḅọ, Tamuno pịghị sị sághịma ḅọ fịị bie.
english_text: then know this, you and all the people of Israel: It is by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised from the dead, that this man stands before you healed.

ibani_text: Jizọs anịị Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅo ḅẹẹ,  Wárinámáapụ dighisima dapịrị ma anị ḅo nyẹsọọḅa dapịrị!
english_text: Jesus is “ ‘the stone you builders rejected, which has become the cornerstone.’

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ ngéré anịị wa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹnyẹ, tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ Tamuno na jụghọ pịrịgha wa ḅọ́rọ́ma bẹḅọ.
english_text: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved.”

ibani_text: Ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma nnị árịnyẹ n tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm nnị ḅo árị sáá Pita na Jọn nyáná tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nnị nimitẹ́lẹ́ma sáá ḅẹ́ mịnaapụ ma nnị pápátumini nnị pịghị dirinimigha. Anị ḅo nna ḅụkórom ḅẹ́ mịnaapụ ma nnị Jizọs na fịnịmaapụ.
english_text: When they saw the courage of Peter and John and realized that they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they took note that these men had been with Jesus.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị dugho bẹnyẹ ofori, tegó, nnị n gwọọ owitụ́wọ ma arịm sẹ́fịnịarị, ori Pita na pịghị Jọn.
english_text: But since they could see the man who had been healed standing there with them, there was nothing they could say.

ibani_text: Nnị warị n ḅẹẹ nnị ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ kobiri yọ ma wárịso, n warị saghị bịpị pa ogbo sua ḅẹẹ,
english_text: So they ordered them to withdraw from the Sanhedrin and then conferred together.

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́ pa mịná owiapụ ma mịẹbẹ? Anị n gbíla nyẹ, Kị́nị́mamgba Jerusalem ḅụ nimim ḅẹẹ mịnaapụ ma mị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma nwángịm, wamịnị ine anị pighibịgha.
english_text: “What are we going to do with these men?” they asked. “Everyone living in Jerusalem knows they have performed a notable sign, and we cannot deny it.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa mịẹbẹ ḅara sị mịnyẹ ma wásáma ngámámgba laagha, wa nnị birinụ́nụ́ ḅẹẹ n mịnị jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné jẹ́ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ kị́nị́ pịrịma Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: But to stop this thing from spreading any further among the people, we must warn them to speak no longer to anyone in this name.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị sima n sị suu sị ólóghó sua n pịrị ḅẹẹ jéné n jéné nnị mịnị jẹ́ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ma anịgha nyẹ́die Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita na Jọn n pagharam, ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅara na kọọ tẹ́ angaá nyẹ karakárá Tamuno tórúku ọmịna bịpị na Tamuno bịpị osii na.
english_text: But Peter and John replied, “Which is right in God’s eyes: to listen to you, or to him? You be the judges!

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ wamịnị ine wa bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ wamịnị ḅara na árịnyẹ pịghị náanyẹ ma pịrịbịgha.
english_text: As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard.”

ibani_text: Ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma warị kụrọma n birinụ́nụ́ warị n wárịso n soo. Nnị arịḅom ḅẹ anị ḅụdam nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịma, tegó túminị́ mamgba boma pa Tamuno pịrịarị pághámáa nyẹ ma gosi.
english_text: After further threats they let them go. They could not decide how to punish them, because all the people were praising God for what had happened.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅụ mịị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịma nwángịḅọ ma ọ kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ si ḅọ́rọ́mam.
english_text: For the man who was miraculously healed was over forty years old.

ibani_text: Nnị Pita na Jọn wáriso gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri nnị pịghịma ḅo nna ogboapụ laam sị dugho n pịrị, igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ dughonyẹ.
english_text: On their release, Peter and John went back to their own people and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ ma náa sáá, nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅárásua tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, so na kiri na pịghị tọ́rụ́ ma na anị bie fịnịnyẹ tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ!
english_text: When they heard this, they raised their voices together in prayer to God. “Sovereign Lord,” they said, “you made the heavens and the earth and the sea, and everything in them.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ị wámịna tádóḅọ Deviti ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ bịpị pa kọọm ọ ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ,  Juughaapụ ma nnị tẹ́ go iganịarị túminị́ ma n tegó nyẹ́ḅụ ofori ọrụ́tọ́arị?
english_text: You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of your servant, our father David: “ ‘Why do the nations rage and the peoples plot in vain?

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ámányánáapụ nna ḅụ karakárámam, táarịapụ ma sọ bịpị pa ogbo sua Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ na ori n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma pịrịm.
english_text: The kings of the earth rise up and the rulers band together against the Lord and against his anointed one.’

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ karakáráma Hẹrọd na Pọntiyọs Paileti donam mị opu ama bie nnị na Juughaapụ na Izirẹlịawọ, ị́yẹ́ tọ́ntọ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ Jizọs, ị pịghị pa nnị Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ mịẹḅọ ma sịbị gosi.
english_text: Indeed Herod and Pontius Pilate met together with the Gentiles and the people of Israel in this city to conspire against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed.

ibani_text: Nnị kobirim ḅẹẹ nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ, Ịrị ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ ḅụ tọ́ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma maá nyẹ ḅẹẹ anị mịẹ.
english_text: They did what your power and will had decided beforehand should happen.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ mị́sa, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ nna ẹ́rẹ́ma ma náa n pa wamịnị ẹ́rẹ́ma nyẹ, sị mịẹsị wamịnị ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ kụ́rọ kúkúbie nyáná sị ị́yẹ́ oku ma dugho wásáma.
english_text: Now, Lord, consider their threats and enable your servants to speak your word with great boldness.

ibani_text: Ị ḅara sụ́ghụ́ma sị obi gwọọ, pịghị mịẹsị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị kiriakị ị́yẹ́ tọ́ntọ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Stretch out your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”

ibani_text: Nnị tẹ́ghẹ̄ fama sáá n fịnịngaa ma warị jighe. Tamuno Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅụ sọọ bii, nnị warị ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa.
english_text: After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.

ibani_text: Minini ogbo ma gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ nyanam. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so amịna nyánányẹ ḅẹgha ḅẹẹ ọ́ inyee, kụ́ma nnị nyána nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị pa jụghọ jụghọ na diem.
english_text: All the believers were one in heart and mind. No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared everything they had.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma opu kụrọ pa onyẹsẹ́ Jizọs Krais fịị ḅụ sághị ma pịrịm Tamuno sọ pịghị opuma nnị karịibimam.
english_text: With great power the apostles continued to testify to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And God’s grace was so powerfully at work in them all

ibani_text: Mininiapụ ma ogbobie, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ofori nyanafịịgha ḅụ fịnịḅọ. Kiri anịgha wárị nyánáapụ anị dẹrịbẹm sị igbii ma akuoo,
english_text: that there were no needy persons among them. For from time to time those who owned land or houses sold them, brought the money from the sales

ibani_text: nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrịbẹm, nnị warị igbii ma die ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrị, n ḅo nyanagha nyẹ labiri ḅụ.
english_text: and put it at the apostles’ feet, and it was distributed to anyone who had need.

ibani_text: Ori anịị mịị Josẹf ma, Livai furotụ́wọ nnị pịghị Saiprọs ḅụ yiiḅọ, nfịrịmaapụ ma Banabas pa sịḅọ (anịị Tẹ́mẹ́ Kụ́rọmaḅọ)
english_text: Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means “son of encouragement”),

ibani_text: Ọ nyana gbẹ́rẹ́kiri dẹrịm, sị igbii ma akuoo nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the apostles’ feet.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi nnị Ananayas pa sịḅọ, ori na ọ táa Safaira na nna nyáná jẹ́anyẹ dẹrịm.
english_text: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.

ibani_text: Ori na ọ táa na bịpị ogbo sua ḅụ igbii ma gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá pa wárii, warị kọnyẹ́ ma akuoo nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrị.
english_text: With his wife’s full knowledge he kept back part of the money for himself, but brought the rest and put it at the apostles’ feet.

ibani_text: Pita warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ananayas i tẹ́ go mini Satanị pịrị sị ori ị nyánáakị, mịẹsị ịrị epeletii Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrị, ị jẹa igbii kọma ḅara i dẹrị nyánányẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Then Peter said, “Ananias, how is it that Satan has so filled your heart that you have lied to the Holy Spirit and have kept for yourself some of the money you received for the land?

ibani_text: Nịị ị́yẹ́ nyána nyẹ ma dẹrịgha sa, anị fịnị ị pịrịm, ị pịghị dẹrịfama sa igbii ma ọ inyee. Ị tẹ́ go ọkọfịnị nyẹ mịẹ? Ịrị epeletii kị́nị́ pịrịgha, kụ́ma ịrị epeletii Tamuno pịrịmam!
english_text: Didn’t it belong to you before it was sold? And after it was sold, wasn’t the money at your disposal? What made you think of doing such a thing? You have not lied just to human beings but to God.”

ibani_text: Ananayas mịma náa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị o sóóro kóró fịịnyẹ; naáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅáláfa nna ḅụ sọm.
english_text: When Ananias heard this, he fell down and died. And great fear seized all who heard what had happened.

ibani_text: Ásáawọ ma warị sọ́ḅo, ori dua fịna kubiri sị o dighi pághá mú dipi.
english_text: Then some young men came forward, wrapped up his body, and carried him out and buried him.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅọ́rọ́ sa, ọ táa pághányẹ nimigha pa nwángị sọḅom.
english_text: About three hours later his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.

ibani_text: Pita warị a gbíla, Dugho i pịrị ḅọ́rọ́ mịma anịị ịrị na i dee, ọ dẹrị nyánányẹ ḅụ nnị pa ọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ igbii gbọrụ? A warị pagharaa, Innh, mị igbii gbọrụ ma.
english_text: Peter asked her, “Tell me, is this the price you and Ananias got for the land?” “Yes,” she said, “that is the price.”

ibani_text: Pita warị a ḅẹẹ, Tegó ịrị na ị dee na bia sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa mị daádighi ma bie sua? Ị dee dipi owiapụ ma anịị nnị ḅụ́pọ́ angaá, nnị pịghị mị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ị dighi pághámabẹm.
english_text: Peter said to her, “How could you conspire to test the Spirit of the Lord? Listen! The feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out also.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị a sóóro koro fịịnyẹ ọ ḅụọ angaá. Ásáawọ ma sọḅom sị arị ḅẹẹ á fịịmam, n warị a dighiákị sị a dipi a dee ngása.
english_text: At that moment she fell down at his feet and died. Then the young men came in and, finding her dead, carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

ibani_text: Sọsị gbọrụ, mịnanyẹ ma naapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅáláfa ḅo nna ḅụ sọm.
english_text: Great fear seized the whole church and all who heard about these events.

ibani_text: Tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị anịị nfịrịmaapụ ma nwángịarị nyẹ túminị́ ma ogbobie. Mininiapụ mamgba ḅo kobiri kobirim nnị pa Solomọn ḅọ́rọ́ yọ sị ngaa.
english_text: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people. And all the believers used to meet together in Solomon’s Colonnade.

ibani_text: Nna ogbobieḅọgha ḅọ, ine kobiri ma sọḅogha, tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ túminị́ nna ibi gooarị.
english_text: No one else dared join them, even though they were highly regarded by the people.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọghaapụ ḅo nna ogbobie sọm, tọgha owiapụ na ẹ́rẹ́ na Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ mininiapụ.
english_text: Nevertheless, more and more men and women believed in the Lord and were added to their number.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ nwángịarị opu ḅụgḅẹ́rẹ́puma fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị obiapụ dighi múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ na ibila ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ mú asọogbo kórómam, sị Pita ḅọ́rọ́ bẹ sáá ọ tẹ́mẹ́ n ḅụ jẹapụ ḅụ kóróbẹm.
english_text: As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and mats so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọghaapụ Jerusalem na kikia ámá gbọrụ mamgba ḅụ sághị ḅom, obiapụ akuoarị anịgha sitẹ́mẹ́ oju bie fịnịapụ, nnị pịghị nna gwọ́ọ́famam.
english_text: Crowds gathered also from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing their sick and those tormented by impure spirits, and all of them were healed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, sịbịdaa Igwagwaalaḅọ ma ori túminị́ na pịghị Sadusiiapụ pa sị ogboapụ ma warị sághị opuma nyẹ́mọ́ni nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrị, warị ḅẹẹ nnị papa nna warịsobịgha.
english_text: Then the high priest and all his associates, who were members of the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy.

ibani_text: Nnị n kuum sị nnị pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kúrúanga sua.
english_text: They arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị dii ma bie Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sookumuḅọ ma warị mú ịkóli warị ḅụ́pọ́ ma findi sị nnị pághámaḅo warị nnị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out.

ibani_text: O mú Tamunowarị ma bie sẹ, sị ịwọ dúma gbolomanyẹ dugho nnị pịrị.
english_text: “Go, stand in the temple courts,” he said, “and tell the people all about this new life.”

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma sookumuḅọ bịpị pughum, éné ḅa nyẹ ma nnị warị Tamunowarị ma sọ sị sághị nyẹ die. Igwagwaalaḅọ ma na oria túminị́ na warị Izirẹlị sẹ́nịapụ ma sị kobiri sị kubiri ogbo ma bịpị pa ogbo sua, warị bịpị fịrịma ḅẹẹ nnị ịkóli ma bie nfịrịmaapụ pa nna tórúku ḅoo.
english_text: At daybreak they entered the temple courts, as they had been told, and began to teach the people. When the high priest and his associates arrived, they called together the Sanhedrin—the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma fịrịnwangịapụ ma anị ngaa ma la sáá, nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma arịgha ikóliwarịbie, nnị warị pịghịma ḅo sị dugho ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they went back and reported,

ibani_text: Wa ḅo ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kúru yọ ma láa sáá, ngaamamgba ikasim ámákúrúapụ ma sọ ḅụ́pọ́ angaá imii ḅụ́pọ́ kúruarị, kụ́ma wa ḅo opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma findi sa wa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ arịgha!
english_text: “We found the jail securely locked, with the guards standing at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”

ibani_text: Igwagwaalaapụ ma na Tamunoopuwárị kúrúapụ ma sịbịdaaḅọ mịma náa sáá, anị nna ḅụ́gbérépumam ḅẹẹ, tẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅụ págháma?
english_text: On hearing this report, the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests were at a loss, wondering what this might lead to.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ warị sọ́ḅo dugho n pịrị, ḅẹẹ, O pughuu! Ọ pa ikóliwarịbie suaapụ ma nnị Tamunoopuwarị ma bie imii, nyẹ pa túminị́ ma diearị.
english_text: Then someone came and said, “Look! The men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people.”

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwarị kúru sịbịdaaḅọ ma warị oria túminị́ na mú sima nna akuoo. Nnị kụrọ́ ḅara pa nnị na mịẹgha, tegó nnị ḅáláfaarị ḅẹ́ túminị́ ma ine mgbọ́lụ pa nnị gbibẹm.
english_text: At that, the captain went with his officers and brought the apostles. They did not use force, because they feared that the people would stone them.

ibani_text: Nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma akuom warị n mịẹsị nnị sẹ ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ tórúku, sị opu Igwagwaaḅọ ma nyẹ pa n gbíla.
english_text: The apostles were brought in and made to appear before the Sanhedrin to be questioned by the high priest.

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị ḅẹẹ, Wa kọkọ kụ́rọ́ma ólóghó sua ọ pịrị ḅẹẹ ọ mịnị nyẹ́die ma mịị owitụ́wọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, Dighii o dighiḅọ nyẹ, ọmịnị ọmịna dienyẹ die wásámāmam Jerusalem ḅụ, ọ pịghị ori fịị pa wámịna sịbị sẹ dọ́ghụm.
english_text: “We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name,” he said. “Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us guilty of this man’s blood.”

ibani_text: Pita na isi nfịrịmaapụ ma warị págháraa, ḅẹẹ, Tamuno anị wa pughu sị ọ tọ wa pịrịnyẹ mịẹ bẹḅọ, tumḅọgha.
english_text: Peter and the other apostles replied: “We must obey God rather than human beings!

ibani_text: Wámịna tádọ́apụ Tamuno ma Jizọs saghịm fịị ḅụ, ọmịnị ọ ḅa fama sa, ọmịnị ọ ḅaupálị sáá mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: The God of our ancestors raised Jesus from the dead—whom you killed by hanging him on a cross.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ saghị pa kuu ḅụ kórómam ori amaḅaranga sịbịdáḅọ na dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ, sị Izirẹlịawọ asọ arịị sị nna sii ḅụ pịghị bẹ ḅara, sị pịghị siiḅụḅárasi pịrị nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: God exalted him to his own right hand as Prince and Savior that he might bring Israel to repentance and forgive their sins.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ónyésẹ mịnanyẹ ma pịrịm wamịnị na Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́, Tamuno pa ori osiapụ ma pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”

ibani_text: Ámáḅẹ́rẹ́tọ ogboapụ ma mịma náa sa, nnị opuma iganim kálányẹ kọm nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅá.
english_text: When they heard this, they were furious and wanted to put them to death.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Gamalel pa sịḅọ, ólóghó nyẹ́dieḅọ, túminị́ mamgba pịghị opuma osigha pa pịrịḅọ, saghị sẹm ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma ogboku warị ḅẹẹ, nnị kẹ́lẹ́ nfịrịmaapụ ma pa nụ́ngọ angaá warịị.
english_text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ ama Izirẹlịapụ, ọ ḅáláfa nyáná ọ pa mịnaapụ ma mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: Then he addressed the Sanhedrin: “Men of Israel, consider carefully what you intend to do to these men.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ biekóróma ḅọ́rọ́ma ndẹa kụ́rá ḅụ, Tiyudas págháḅom, ḅẹ́ ori ọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ kụrọ tumḅọ, túminị́ a ndẹ́ẹ pịghị o duam, kụ́ma nnị ọ ḅám, ori ọḅụduaapụ ma so gálágálá, kị́nị́ mịnị anị asọduaapụ ma ọwụ naagha.
english_text: Some time ago Theudas appeared, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men rallied to him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.

ibani_text: Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa, Judas, Galili ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ọ ḅụ diepághámam nnị kị́nị́ kiẹarị sáá, ọ pịghị o duaapụ nyánam, ori sọ nnị pịghị ọ ḅám, ori ọḅụduaapụ pịghị gálágálá.
english_text: After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and led a band of people in revolt. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.

ibani_text: Anịgosi a dugho ọ pịrịm, mị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa nnị mịẹma, ọ mịnị nnị wáriso. Ḅọ́rọ́ mị́sa n mịẹarịnyẹ ma tumḅọ ḅara saghịḅom anị dii labịgha.
english_text: Therefore, in the present case I advise you: Leave these men alone! Let them go! For if their purpose or activity is of human origin, it will fail.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno anịị kụrọma pa nnị pịrịḅọ ọmịnị ine Tamuno sọḅabịgha. Ọmịnị árịbẹm ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị owu pa Tamuno pághámaarị. Kobiri ma warị Gamalel dugho ḅara mịẹ.
english_text: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop these men; you will only find yourselves fighting against God.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị nfịrịmaapụ ma sị wárị sọọ, warị Tamunowarị kúrúapụ ma ḅẹẹ nnị n fomu, warị n ḅẹẹ nnị mịnị jẹ́ éné jẹ́ pa Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ma pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ pịrịma, nnị warị n wáriso sị n sọọ.
english_text: His speech persuaded them. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

ibani_text: Nnị ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma fịnị angaá wáriso sa nnị opuma bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹ́ nnị nkie sua sị, tọ́rụ́siarị naibiapụ pịrịm Jizọs Krais go.
english_text: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing because they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.

ibani_text: Éné mamgba Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, pịghị túminị́ wárịbie anịị nnị Jizọs nnị Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị nyẹ pịghị anị diearị.
english_text: Day after day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Messiah.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, tọgha tọghaapụ ḅo Jizọs ḅụ mininim. Juuapụ Giriki ḅẹlẹ pa nna tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọ́arịapụ na Juuapụ Hiburu ḅẹlẹ pa nna tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọ́arịapụ ḅo kam sọm, Giriki ḅẹlẹ fiearịapụ ma ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, nna ẹrẹ, dee fịịmaapụ ma nnị n pa kịẹbịpị ḅụ sughaa nna éné bẹ fị́nyẹ die ḅụ.
english_text: In those days when the number of disciples was increasing, the Hellenistic Jewsamong them complained against the Hebraic Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.

ibani_text: Nnị fịrịma oyi mmẹapụ findi ma warị mininiapụ mamgba sị kóbiri, warị ḅẹẹ, Anị ibighaa wa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho págháma wárịso sị mú fị́nyẹ die.
english_text: So the Twelve gathered all the disciples together and said, “It would not be right for us to neglect the ministry of the word of God in order to wait on tables.

ibani_text: Anịgo, iyẹ nángwọ́apụ, ọmịna bie, ọ́ sọ́nọ́máapụ sẹlẹ pághámaḅo, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ biiapụ na pịghị ibima nyẹ nimiapụ, wa mị fịrị ma sághị ḅara suabẹapụ.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, choose seven men from among you who are known to be full of the Spirit and wisdom. We will turn this responsibility over to them

ibani_text: Wamịnị ine ibima sáá fámá tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara sị pịghị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa.
english_text: and will give our attention to prayer and the ministry of the word.”

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma dughonyẹ ma opuma mininiapụ mamgba ḅụḅẹ́lẹm, nnị warị Sitivin sẹlẹ pághámaḅo, ori míníni ibima kụrọḅọ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ sọ ọ ḅụ imi, pịghị Filipụ na Prokoros na Nikano na Timọn na Pamanas na pịghị Nikolasị Antịọkụ ḅụ saghị ḅo Juughaḅọ, kụ́ma pịghịmam sị saghị Juuapụ ḅara pa Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit; also Philip, Procorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ ma warị n pághámaḅo nfịrịmaapụ ma tórúku ḅara pa nna sịbị gbánáapụ sị tẹ́ghẹ́ẹ.
english_text: They presented these men to the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọghaapụ ibi oku ma naam sị minini. Mininiapụ ma kịẹbịpị Jerusalem ḅụ ḅo dụḅam. Tọgha tọgha igwagwaapụ ḅo Krais ḅụ mininim.
english_text: So the word of God spread. The number of disciples in Jerusalem increased rapidly, and a large number of priests became obedient to the faith.

ibani_text: Sitivin, Tamuno opuma karịibimaḅọ, pịghị kụrọ pa pịrị ḅo, ọ tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịm, túminị́ ma ogbobie.
english_text: Now Stephen, a man full of God’s grace and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa túminị́ mini ọ pịrịgha, nnị anịị nnị wárísómáa ómóniapụ Juuapụ kobiri yọ ogboapụ (anịị nnị n sị ḅara) nna bie Sirini na Alegizandiriya ḅo Juuapụ imi. Nnị na Silisiya na Esiya ḅụ sághị ḅo Juu warị Sitivin na nụná nyáná.
english_text: Opposition arose, however, from members of the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called)—Jews of Cyrene and Alexandria as well as the provinces of Cilicia and Asia—who began to argue with Stephen.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọkọfịnị níminyẹ pa Sitivin pịrịm sị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sáá nnị ine ọ pagharagha.
english_text: But they could not stand up against the wisdom the Spirit gave him as he spoke.

ibani_text: Nnị warị mú jẹ́apụ túlúma ḅẹẹ n dugho ḅẹẹ, Wa ọ naam Mosis dughosima, pịghị Tamuno dughosima.
english_text: Then they secretly persuaded some men to say, “We have heard Stephen speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.”

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma, anịị n túminị́ ma timi sághị ḅara, sẹ́nịapụ ma na ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ. Nnị Sitivin kuum, sị ọ pa ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma toruku ḅoo.
english_text: So they stirred up the people and the elders and the teachers of the law. They seized Stephen and brought him before the Sanhedrin.

ibani_text: Nnị warị jẹ́ owiapụ akuoo ḅẹẹ nnị epeletii ọ sịbị sẹ, ḅẹẹ, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma sámámgba ọ wámịna tọ́ntọ́ Tamunoopuwárị ma dughosimaarị, na pịghị Mosis ólóghó ma.
english_text: They produced false witnesses, who testified, “This fellow never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.

ibani_text: Wa naam o dugho sa ḅẹẹ, mị Jizọs ma, Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ ọ Tamunoopuwárị ma nụ́nụ́kábẹm sị pịghị Mosis pa nnị die sị n duma kọọ bẹ ḅara dimabẹm!
english_text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs Moses handed down to us.”

ibani_text: Anị angaá ámáḅẹ́rẹ́tọ ogbo ma bie kpọrọfịnịapụ ma tọ́rụ́ pa Sitivin ḅụ gbánām sị árị ḅẹẹ ọ toruku sookumuḅọ tórúku bia ḅara biam.
english_text: All who were sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

ibani_text: 4 4Opu igwagwaḅọ ma warị Sitivin gbíla, Mịná owiapụ pa i sịbị sẹ nyẹ ma karakárányẹ?
english_text: Then the high priest asked Stephen, “Are these charges true?”

ibani_text: Sitivin pághám, Mịnaapụ na daapụ na, ọmịnị i pughuu! Ḅẹẹ, ipine Nyáná Tamuno ọ ḅụ pa Ebraham wámịna tádóḅọ diem, ọ pa Mesopotamiya ḅụ ngáarị sáá, na ọ pa Haran mugha sáá.
english_text: To this he replied: “Brothers and fathers, listen to me! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Harran.

ibani_text: Warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị wárị wárịso, pịghị ị́yẹ́ ama wáriso sị a pa ị die bẹ angaá ma muu.
english_text: ‘Leave your country and your people,’ God said, ‘and go to the land I will show you.’

ibani_text: Anịgo, ọ warị ori ama Kaldiya wárịso sị muu Haran ḅụ ngaam. Ebraham daa ḅo fịị sa, Tamuno warị ọ mịẹsị o nwángị ḅo mị́sa ọmịnị ngaa ama ma ḅụ kóró.
english_text: “So he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Harran. After the death of his father, God sent him to this land where you are now living.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Tamuno gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá kiri mpara sọ na pa Ebraham pịrịgha, ọ ḅụọ kuu la kịrị sọ nyanagha, kụ́ma Tamuno mininim ḅẹẹ ọ pa ọ pịrịbẹm, ḅẹẹ anị fịnị ori na o furobie págháḅoapụ pịrịbẹm. Tamuno mịma minini sáá Ebraham na awọ nyanagha.
english_text: He gave him no inheritance here, not even enough ground to set his foot on. But God promised him that he and his descendants after him would possess the land, even though at that time Abraham had no child.

ibani_text: Mịma anị Tamuno dugho ọ pịrịnyẹ: Ị furobie págháḅoapụ mú jẹ́ ámá ngáabẹm, nnị omoni sọ́bẹm, nnị pịghị kụ́rá ndẹ́ẹ pa si ḅara pa nnị na ngáabẹm.
english_text: God spoke to him in this way: ‘For four hundred years your descendants will be strangers in a country not their own, and they will be enslaved and mistreated.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ọmịnị omoni sọ pịrịapụ ma sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ gbánabẹm, anịsáa ma ḅọ́rọ́maẹrẹ ị furobie págháḅo awọ ma susi i pịrịbẹm mịnga ma ḅụ.
english_text: But I will punish the nation they serve as slaves,’ God said, ‘and afterward they will come out of that country and worship me in this place.’

ibani_text: Tamuno warị saghị Ebraham ḅarabie sua tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́ mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma ḅẹẹ anịị nnị pa ọḅọọ ma ilíghíma suabẹnyẹ. Ebraham warị Aizik tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́ ori inine a dii láa sáá. Aizik ọ tụwọ Jekọpụ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹm. Jekọpụ ẹ́rẹ́so ḅa ḅọ, wámịna fúroawọ ḅụ ori oyi mmẹẹ́ findi awọ tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́m.
english_text: Then he gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. And Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him eight days after his birth. Later Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.

ibani_text: Jekọpụ owiapụ awọ warị ḅo tọ́rụ́akụ nyána nna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Josẹf pịrị, warị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ pa omoni dẹrị Ijipiti ḅụ. Kụ́ma Tamuno ọ nana imi
english_text: “Because the patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, they sold him as a slave into Egypt. But God was with him

ibani_text: warị ọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ori ḅụḅáláḅálá mamgba ḅụ. Josẹf Ijipiti ámányánáḅọ tórúku sẹ sáá, Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na ori níminyẹ ọ ḅụ imii, Ámányánáḅọ ma warị ọ pa Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ mịẹ sẹ ma ḅụ na pịghị ámányánáḅọ warị mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: and rescued him from all his troubles. He gave Joseph wisdom and enabled him to gain the goodwill of Pharaoh king of Egypt. So Pharaoh made him ruler over Egypt and all his palace.

ibani_text: Anị sáá ma ḅụ ḅuruḅa ḅo ḅom Ijipiti na Kenaan ḅụ sị opu tọ́rụ́siarị dighinyẹ, wámịna tádọ́apụ fị́nyẹ dọ́ghụm kụ́ma ine fị́nyẹ arịḅogha,
english_text: “Then a famine struck all Egypt and Canaan, bringing great suffering, and our ancestors could not find food.

ibani_text: Jekọpụ náa sáá ḅẹẹ n fị́nyẹ dẹrịarị Ijipiti ḅụ, ori ọrẹ awọ wámịna tádọ́apụ fịrịmam, nna parị muunyẹ anị ngaa.
english_text: When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our forefathers on their first visit.

ibani_text: Nna mmẹẹ́ kárámá sáá Josẹf ọ ḅụ pa ori a mịnaapụ diem Ijipiti ámányánáḅọ warị ḅo Josẹf wárịapụ nimi.
english_text: On their second visit, Joseph told his brothers who he was, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph’s family.

ibani_text: Josẹf warị oku pa ọ daa Jekọpụ fịrịmaa ḅẹẹ ori na ọ warị gbọrụ túminị́ tẹ́si oyi findi na sọ́nọ́ ḅẹẹ nnị kị́nị́mamgba Ijipiti ḅoo.
english_text: After this, Joseph sent for his father Jacob and his whole family, seventy-five in all.

ibani_text: Jekọpụ Ijipiti múm ori na ori awọ fịnị fịị angaá.
english_text: Then Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our ancestors died.

ibani_text: Nnị nna dua dighiákịm sị anị dipi Sikem ḅụ Ebraham igbii pa fẹ dupu Hamo ḅụ.
english_text: Their bodies were brought back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a certain sum of money.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo kikia sáá ḅẹ́ Tamuno o minini Ebraham pịrị minini nyẹ ma mịẹ, wámịna kịẹbịpị opuma duḅamam Ijipiti ḅụ.
english_text: “As the time drew near for God to fulfill his promise to Abraham, the number of our people in Egypt had greatly increased.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụkụnọma, Josẹf nimigha ámányánáḅọ saghị taám Ijipiti ḅụ.
english_text: Then ‘a new king, to whom Joseph meant nothing, came to power in Egypt.’

ibani_text: Ori oḅori pa wámịna tádọ́apụ sim, pịghị nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịma, ọ pịghị mịẹm nnị nna ịwọma yii awọ dighi tọ́rụ́si nụ́ngọbie sị awọ ma anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fịị.
english_text: He dealt treacherously with our people and oppressed our ancestors by forcing them to throw out their newborn babies so that they would die.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma, anịị nnị Mosis yii sáá, opuma ibi tụ́wọ, tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ anịị nnị ọ pa wárị wárii sị ọ didighi nyẹ.
english_text: “At that time Moses was born, and he was no ordinary child.For three months he was cared for by his family.

ibani_text: Nnị mịẹsị nnị nụ́ngọbie ọ wáriso sáá, ámányánáḅọ ndụ́ḅa obi ḅo yiim, a tụ́wọ ḅara.
english_text: When he was placed outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him and brought him up as her own son.

ibani_text: Nnị ibiḅaa dáwọnyẹ pa ọ dáwọ́mam Ijipiti ḅụ ori ọ́ kụrọ tumḅọ, pịghị ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ nyáná.
english_text: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.

ibani_text: Ọ kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ si la sa, o ḅẹm ḅẹ́ o mú ọ jẹa Izirẹlịawọ fịnị angaá muu.
english_text: “When Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his own people, the Israelites.

ibani_text: O ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ arịm Ijipiti ḅo mbasiarịḅo, ọ warị sọmamụ sughubi sị Ijipiti owitụ́wọ ma fom ḅa.
english_text: He saw one of them being mistreated by an Egyptian, so he went to his defense and avenged him by killing the Egyptian.

ibani_text: (O sim ḅẹẹ ori a túminị́ akanyaḅobẹm ḅẹẹ Tamuno ọ pa omoni ḅarabie nnị duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm, kụ́ma nnị akanyaḅogha.)
english_text: Moses thought that his own people would realize that God was using him to rescue them, but they did not.

ibani_text: Ene ḅá, o ḅo mmẹẹ́ Izirẹlịawọ arịm owusọarị ọ warị ḅoo nnị ọlọ, diin mịẹ ḅụ, ḅẹẹ, O pughu, ọmịnị mmẹapụ kọkọ Izirẹlịawọ, o tẹ́ go mị ḅara pa owusọarị?
english_text: The next day Moses came upon two Israelites who were fighting. He tried to reconcile them by saying, ‘Men, you are brothers; why do you want to hurt each other?’

ibani_text: Kuma o jẹa ḅo pụ́nụ́maarịḅọ ma Mosis suma ngaa pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Tụ́ọ ị pa wa táarịḅọ na wámịna ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ mịẹ? Ọ warị o gbíla
english_text: “But the man who was mistreating the other pushed Moses aside and said, ‘Who made you ruler and judge over us?

ibani_text: Ị́ i ḅá dọghụ, ị Ijipitiḅọ ma ḅá ḅara ma biaéné?
english_text: Are you thinking of killing me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

ibani_text: Mosis mịma náa sa, anịị o mangị so nyẹ Ijipiti ḅụ sị mú Midiyan ama ḅụ angaá, anị angaá anị ori ọrẹ mmẹẹ́ owiapuawọ yii nyẹ.
english_text: When Moses heard this, he fled to Midian, where he settled as a foreigner and had two sons.

ibani_text: Kụ́rá amẹẹ sị ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sa, gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ ọ ḅụ pa Mosis die dọghụarị piri kọ́rịfịnịbie elesiri ḅụ Sainai tụ́ndụ́ na kikia ngaa.
english_text: “After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to Moses in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.

ibani_text: Mosis árịnyẹ ma ọ ḅụ́gbérépumam, ọ warị kikia mú sị ibima anị dighi, kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pụghọ anịị o náanyẹ.
english_text: When he saw this, he was amazed at the sight. As he went over to get a closer look, he heard the Lord say:

ibani_text: Irị anịị ị́yẹ́ tádọ́apụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno ma, Ebraham, Aizik na Jekọpụ. Ḅáláfa Mosis oju sẹ́ghimam sị ori ine tọ́rụ́ saghị dighigha.
english_text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.’Moses trembled with fear and did not dare to look.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ agbaa ma sii, ḅẹẹ i sẹ́fịnị angaá ma anịị tọ́ntọ́ kiri.
english_text: “Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.

ibani_text: A dighimam pịghị árị nnị iyẹa túminị́ pa árịarị mbasị tọ́rụ́siarịma. A nna kụ́rọ owu pụghọ naamam a kóróḅomam ḅẹẹ a n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma. Mị́sa ḅoo, a sima ị pa Ijipiti fịrịmabẹm.
english_text: I have indeed seen the oppression of my people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to set them free. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.’

ibani_text: Mịị anịị Izirẹlịawọ sịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ Mosis ma, nnị o gbíla sa ḅẹẹ, Tụọ ị pa sẹ́ táaḅọ na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ mịẹ wa pịrị? Ori anịị Tamuno fịrịma sẹ́ táaḅọ pịghị dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ, ọ ḅụ pa o die sookumuḅọ ma ḅárásua ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, dọghụarị piri ma bie.
english_text: “This is the same Moses they had rejected with the words, ‘Who made you ruler and judge?’ He was sent to be their ruler and deliverer by God himself, through the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

ibani_text: O túminị́ ma táa pághámaḅom ọ ḅụ́gbérépuma na tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngịma fịrịnwangị sáá, Ijipiti bie na pịghị Áwụ Tọ́rụ́
english_text: He led them out of Egypt and performed wonders and signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea and for forty years in the wilderness.

ibani_text: Mosis anị dugho Izirẹlịapụ ma pịrịḅọ ḅẹẹ, Tamuno gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroḅọ pa ọ fịrịmabẹm, ori i fịrịma ḅara, ọmịna ama gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: “This is the Moses who told the Israelites, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your own people.’

ibani_text: Ori anịị Izirẹlịapụ elesiri ma ḅụ fịnịapụ ma na fịnịḅọ, ori anịị wámịna tádọ́apụ ma na fịnịḅọ na pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọ pịrị sookumuḅọ ma na Sainai tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ o Tamuno ḅara dumafịnị ọkụ́ ma daaḅom sị ḅọ́rọ́ma wa pịrị.
english_text: He was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our ancestors; and he received living words to pass on to us.

ibani_text: Kuma wámịna tádọ́apụ mini Mosis bịpị puughugha; nnị o suma ngaa pịrịm, biiarị ḅẹẹ nnị ine pịghịma Ijipiti mú.
english_text: “But our ancestors refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Erọn ḅẹ, Ḅara pa ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bịgha tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ wa pịrị, tórúku so wa pịrịbẹnyẹ, wa nimigha, Ijipiti wa pághámaḅo Mosis ma ọ ḅụ pághámaa nyẹ.
english_text: They told Aaron, ‘Make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who led us out of Egypt—we don’t know what has happened to him!’

ibani_text: Nnị warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bịgha obiri kịkanyẹ tẹ́mẹ́, warị igwagwaá anị pịrị, warị fị na ḅuu nyána nnị ḅara na tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma pịrị.
english_text: That was the time they made an idol in the form of a calf. They brought sacrifices to it and reveled in what their own hands had made.

ibani_text: Anịgo Tamuno n dighi tọ́rụ́sim, warị n saghị pa pịrị sị nnị saghị sobie fịnị ḅálōló ma tẹ́ghẹ̄, n gịẹ kóróma ḅara ikiakoroapụ ma diri ḅẹẹ:  Izirẹlịapụ, Irịgha, ọ nama ḅá igwagwaá pịrịḅọ kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ si elesiri ḅụ.
english_text: But God turned away from them and gave them over to the worship of the sun, moon and stars. This agrees with what is written in the book of the prophets: “ ‘Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the wilderness, people of Israel?

ibani_text: Tụ́ma ọ Moleki tẹ́ghẹ̄arị wárị ma anịị o dighiákị nyẹ, ọ pịghị ọmịna tamuno Refan dighiákịm, mịnanyẹ ma anịị, ọmịnị ḅara pa tẹ́mẹ́ si tẹ́ghẹ̄arị nyẹ, Anịgo a o deesi Babịlọn ḅọ́rọ́ ngaa mubẹm.
english_text: You have taken up the tabernacle of Molek and the star of your god Rephan, the idols you made to worship. Therefore I will send you into exile’beyond Babylon.

ibani_text: Diearị warị ma ḅẹẹ, Tamuno nnị na imi, wámịna tádọ́apụ ma anị nyanam, nnị anị namam Tamuno dugho Mosis pịrị ḅara ḅẹẹ ori anị nama, anị fịnị sị n pa Mosis die ḅara.
english_text: “Our ancestors had the tabernacle of the covenant law with them in the wilderness. It had been made as God directed Moses, according to the pattern he had seen.

ibani_text: Ọḅụkụ́nọma, wámịna tádọ́apụ warị ma daakịapụ ma nna daapụ ḅara, anị dighiákịm nnị Jọsụwa na mú sị mú kiri ma akị Tamuno deesi amaapụ ma ḅara. Anị pịghị anị angaá fịnị warịị ḅo Deviti sáá laam.
english_text: After receiving the tabernacle, our ancestors under Joshua brought it with them when they took the land from the nations God drove out before them. It remained in the land until the time of David,

ibani_text: Ori Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyánaḅom, warị Tamuno bii ḅẹẹ ori ọ wáriso si ọ wárị nama Jekọpụ Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: who enjoyed God’s favor and asked that he might provide a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

ibani_text: Kuma Solomọn, anị ḅo wárị nama ọ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Sóghólóḅa ḅọ ma túminị́ ḅara pa nama wárị ḅụ ngaa ngaagha, ikiakoroapụ ma dugho ḅara.
english_text: “However, the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says:

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅẹm, So anị ị́yẹ́ imine, kiri anịị ị́yẹ́ ḅụọ gbánā yọ. Ọ tọ́rọ fịnị wárị nama i pịrịbẹ?
english_text: “ ‘Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build for me? says the Lord. Or where will my resting place be?

ibani_text: Ịrị i ḅara na mịnanyẹ mamgba tẹ́mẹ́gha?
english_text: Has not my hand made all these things?’

ibani_text: Dighi nị ọmịna sịbịkụ́rọ la ḅara! Sitivin pa dugho tórúku muarị, Tamuno nímighaapụ Tẹ́mẹ́ fịnị ḅara anịị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ fịnị ḅara, ọmịna biri pụụ Tamun fịrịma oku ma pịrị ḅara! Ọmịna tádọ́apụ fịnị ḅara anị ọ fịnị ḅara ọ mịnị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma puughugha.
english_text: “You stiff-necked people! Your hearts and ears are still uncircumcised. You are just like your ancestors: You always resist the Holy Spirit!

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroḅọ sọ ofori, ọmịna tádọ́apụ n tọ́rụ́ pa, siiarịmagha ḅọ. Nnị Tamuno oku muapụ gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámaḅo. Mị́sa ọmịnị ọ dẹ́rịfịmam pighi ọ timiḅamam.
english_text: Was there ever a prophet your ancestors did not persecute? They even killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him—

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anịị sookumuapụ saghị kóróma Tamuno ólóghó ma dakórómaapụ, anị sọ, ọ pa mịnị anị osigha.
english_text: you who have received the law that was given through angels but have not obeyed it.”

ibani_text: Ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dugho ogboapụ ma Sitivin pughuarị ḅara, ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅo opuma nna igánimam muu nna tẹ́mẹ́bie la si nnị aka túrú ọ pịrịm.
english_text: When the members of the Sanhedrin heard this, they were furious and gnashed their teeth at him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, Sitivin Tamuno Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ biiḅọ tọ́rụ saghị so dighim sị Tamun ipine ma arịị, sị Jizọs árị ọ sẹ angaá Tamuno amaḅara ngá.
english_text: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked up to heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, O dighii! A findi so arịm, a pịghị Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma arịm sẹ́fịnịarị angaá Tamun ámáḅara ngaa.
english_text: “Look,” he said, “I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”

ibani_text: Opu owu pụghọ pa, ámáḅẹ́rẹ́tọ ogboapụ ma ḅara pa nna biripụ́ma sị ilúghum, nnị kị́nị́mamgba anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri mangị ọ ḅụ korom.
english_text: At this they covered their ears and, yelling at the top of their voices, they all rushed at him,

ibani_text: Nnị warị o suma ámá ma bie págháma, warị mgbọ́lụ pa o gbii, onyésẹapụ ma warị ọgọnọ nnị suabịtẹ pa Sọl pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅárásua.
