english_text: dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. Meanwhile, the witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.

ibani_text: Nnị pa mgbọ́lụ ma pa o gbiarị sáá, Sitivin tẹ́ghẹ̄m sị ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ Jizọs i tẹmẹ daákịị.
english_text: While they were stoning him, Stephen prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ẹkpẹrẹkị sị pụghọ saghị owu ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mị siiamịẹnyẹ ma pa nna sịbị sẹ ma. Ọ mịma dughofamam sị fịị.
english_text: Then he fell on his knees and cried out, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” When he had said this, he fell asleep.

ibani_text: Sọl dughom ḅẹẹ, nnị ọ ḅá ḅara ma karakáram. Anị éné ma ḅụ saghị, Jerusalem ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma ḅo saghị opu tọ́rụ́siarị arịm. Mininiapụ mamgba mangị galagala Judiya na Sameriya ḅụ fịnị ámá gbọrụ bie sọm, nfịrịmaapụ ma ngéré anịị mangighaapụ.
english_text: And Saul approved of their killing him. On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.

ibani_text: Tamuno nimi Juuapụ warị Sitivin dighiákị mú dipi si silé owu pụghọ pa opuma dụadu ọ pịrị.
english_text: Godly men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Sọl asọ dọ́ghụm ọ sọsị ma guluguluma, ọ wárị wárị ḅụ akị mú wárị wárị lam, mininiapụ ma nụ́nụ́ pághámaḅo owiapụ na ẹrẹ na, sị n gbi pa ịkóli bie suu.
english_text: But Saul began to destroy the church. Going from house to house, he dragged off both men and women and put them in prison.

ibani_text: Nnị galagala ma mininiapụ ma, ngámámgba sọm ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị.
english_text: Those who had been scattered preached the word wherever they went.

ibani_text: Filipụ Sameriya opu ama ma muum sị n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ dugho wásáma túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah there.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma birifama Filipụ dughonyẹ ma pughum sị pịghị aningáa ọ nwángị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma árị.
english_text: When the crowds heard Philip and saw the signs he performed, they all paid close attention to what he said.

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ tọgha túminị́ ḅụ págháḅom kụrọ owu pụghọ pa, tọgha oju fịịapụ na ikúléapụ na oju gwọọ nyánaḅom.
english_text: For with shrieks, impure spirits came out of many, and many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.

ibani_text: Anịgosi Sameriya bie opu bieḅẹlẹ kiriakịm.
english_text: So there was great joy in that city.

ibani_text: Anị ama ma ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi, nnị Saimọn pa sịḅọ ḅọlọ sa éné éné Sameriya ḅụ arịkọarịḅọ, mị árị ma sọ túminị́ ma tọ́rụ́ daam, ọ bịpịkpọarị ḅẹẹ ori gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rọ tumḅọ.
english_text: Now for some time a man named Simon had practiced sorcery in the city and amazed all the people of Samaria. He boasted that he was someone great,

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba ama ma bie, sẹnịapụ na awọamaapụ ogbiri ikelekele birifama o pughum sị dugho, Mịị owitụ́wọ ma anịị Tamuno kụ́rọ ma, nnị pa opukuro sị nyẹ.
english_text: and all the people, both high and low, gave him their attention and exclaimed, “This man is rightly called the Great Power of God.”

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ árị kọọ ma pa opuma túminị́ ma tọ́rụ́ bulubulumam gosi túminị́ sámámgba o gbiri ikelekelearị sị o pughuu.
english_text: They followed him because he had amazed them for a long time with his sorcery.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ḅo Filipụ dugho wásámaarị, Tamuno amadakiri gbolomanyẹ na pịghị Jizọs Krais ibi oku ma minini sa, nnị mingi pa n saram owiapụ na ẹ́rẹ́ na.
english_text: But when they believed Philip as he proclaimed the good news of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

ibani_text: Ori Saimọn sọ mininim, o mingi sara fama sa, ọ warị Filipụ na kikiama fịnị, n mịẹarị opu ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma warị opuma ọ tọ́rụ́ daa.
english_text: Simon himself believed and was baptized. And he followed Philip everywhere, astonished by the great signs and miracles he saw.

ibani_text: Jerusalem ḅụ fịnị nfịrịmaapụ ma naam ḅẹẹ, Sameriyaapụ ma Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma mininimam, nnị warị Pita na Jọn pa n fịrịma.
english_text: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to Samaria.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo aningáa láa sa, nnị tẹ́ghẹ̄ mininiapụ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma daakị.
english_text: When they arrived, they prayed for the new believers there that they might receive the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ, ḅụ kórógha. Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ngéré ḅụ anị n mingi sara nyẹẹ.
english_text: because the Holy Spirit had not yet come on any of them; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Pita na Jọn warị ḅara pa nna sịbị gbánā nnị warị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma daakị.
english_text: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Saimọn arịḅom ḅẹẹ, nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅara pa mininiapụ ma ḅụ gbánā sa nnị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánaḅom ọ warị igbii pa Pita na Jọn pịrịị.
english_text: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given at the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị kụ́rọ ma pa irịsọ pịrị́ị́, sị a ḅara pa ḅụ gbánā ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: and said, “Give me also this ability so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita ọ pagharam, Ịrị na ị́yẹ́ igbii gulugulu faá, I kóróma ḅara ma ḅẹẹ i ine igbii pa Tamuno dienyẹ ma fẹ́bẹm.
english_text: Peter answered: “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!

ibani_text: I diekiri nyánágha wámịna fịrị ma ḅụ tegó ị tẹ́mẹ́ karakáragha Tamuno ma tórúku.
english_text: You have no part or share in this ministry, because your heart is not right before God.

ibani_text: Ị tọ́ọ siinyẹ ma bie pịghịị sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị o sii wáriso ị pịrịị, ị go ọkọfịnị kóróma kórómanyẹ.
english_text: Repent of this wickedness and pray to the Lord in the hope that he may forgive you for having such a thought in your heart.

ibani_text: A arịm ḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ opuma jụghọ nyẹ́mọ́nịm, ị́yẹ́ siiamịẹnyẹ pịghị ịkóli pa ị suamam.
english_text: For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin.”

ibani_text: Saimọn warị Pita na Jọn ḅẹẹ páisisi, Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ i pịrị, sị ị dughonyẹ mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ịḅụ mịẹma.
english_text: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me.”

ibani_text: Krais ḅụ nnị nimi dugho págháma nyẹ dugho so sa, na pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ oku ma, Pita na Jọn na pịghịma Jerusalem ḅom. Asọogbo nnị ibi oku ma dugho wásámám tọgha tọgha káláma, Sameriya ḅụ fịnịnyẹ.
english_text: After they had further proclaimed the word of the Lord and testified about Jesus, Peter and John returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many Samaritan villages.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno sookumuḅọ warị Filipụ ḅẹẹ, Ịḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị tere koro suu ju angaá ma mú, Jerusalem ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Gaza mú asọ ma. (Mịị asọ ma nnị mịnị anị nwángịgha.)
english_text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Go south to the road—the desert road—that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.”

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Etiyopiya opu tumḅọ anị angaá ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́arị ọmụgbịi árụ́ ọgọ́nọ́, ori anịị sịbịdá igbii koko Kandaee Etiyopiya Amanyáná ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịm, opu tumḅọ ma Jerusalem ḅom sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ,
english_text: So he started out, and on his way he met an Ethiopianeunuch, an important official in charge of all the treasury of the Kandake (which means “queen of the Ethiopians”). This man had gone to Jerusalem to worship,

ibani_text: sị mị́sa pịghịma soarị, ori ọrẹ árụ́ ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnịm sị ikiakoro Aizaya diri ma goarị.
english_text: and on his way home was sitting in his chariot reading the Book of Isaiah the prophet.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Filipụ ḅẹẹ, Kikia nyẹ́ dighi árụ́ ma dámámuu.
english_text: The Spirit told Philip, “Go to that chariot and stay near it.”

ibani_text: Filipụ mangị ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ọ naam ori Aizaya diri bie goarị sa, ọ warị o gbíla, Ị akanyaḅo ị goarịnyẹ?
english_text: Then Philip ran up to the chariot and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. “Do you understand what you are reading?” Philip asked.

ibani_text: Opu tumḅọ ma warị ọ págháraa, A tọ́rọ́pa akanyaḅo bẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ anị puu findi i pịrịgha? Ọ warị ọ ḅẹ́ ọ tándị ḅo ọ nana árụ́ ma bie kpọrọfịnịị.
english_text: “How can I,” he said, “unless someone explains it to me?” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

ibani_text: O goo yọ ma Tọ́ndiri ma ḅụ, mị anịị, Ori nnị pa ḅa yọ muarị ánáná kịkam oju osuka kọrọsiarị ánáná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha ḅara, anịị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọ kọgha ḅara.
english_text: This is the passage of Scripture the eunuch was reading: “He was led like a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he did not open his mouth.

ibani_text: Nnị o dighisimam, nnị pịghị karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọgha ọ sịbị. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine o furobie págháḅo bẹapụ gbolomanyẹ dughobịgha tegó, ori duma tuminikiri ḅo kunemamam.
english_text: In his humiliation he was deprived of justice. Who can speak of his descendants? For his life was taken from the earth.”

ibani_text: Etiyopiya opu tumḅọ ma warị Filipụ gbíla, ḅẹẹ, Dugho i pịrị, Ikiakoroḅọ ma ọ tụọ ḅẹarị ori ọ ḅụ ḅẹarị múno sị o jụghọ ḅẹarị?
english_text: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?”

ibani_text: Filipụ saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́m, warị mịị diri ma ḅụ saghị, sị Jizọs gboloma ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ọ pịrị.
english_text: Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị pa muarị sa, nnị ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá lam nnị mingi árị ngaa, opu tumḅọ ma warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị mingigha mịnga. Bẹḅọ imi ḅẹẹ, i ine mingi pa i sarabịgha? [
english_text: As they traveled along the road, they came to some water and the eunuch said, “Look, here is water. What can stand in the way of my being baptized?”

ibani_text: Filipụ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ị ḅọ́rọ́ ị tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa minini minini, ị inebẹm. Ọ warị págháraa ḅẹẹ, A mininim ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ori anịị Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma.]
english_text: Philip replied, "You can be baptized if you believe with all your heart." The man answered, "I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God."

ibani_text: Ọ warị árụ́ ma ḅẹ́ anị mịnị nwángịma, Filipụ na opu tumḅọ ma warị mingi ma koro, Filipụ warị mingi pa ọ sara.
english_text: And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him.

ibani_text: Nnị iwóo kiri ḅo sáá, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị Filipụ sị akị, opu tumḅọ ma mịnị Filipụ arịgha kụ́ma ọ pa o muarị angaá muum opu bieḅẹlẹ na ori na.
english_text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.

ibani_text: Filipụ ọḅụkụ́nọma mú Azọtọs ḅụ págháḅom ọ warị ḅọ́rọ́ mú Sizariya láa, o muarị sa ori ibi oku ma dugho wásámam ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Philip, however, appeared at Azotus and traveled about, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he reached Caesarea.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ Sọl pa ḅaá ẹ́rẹ́ma, ẹ́rẹ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọḅụduaapụ ma pịrịarị. O mú opu igwagwaḅọ ma dámámum ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord’s disciples. He went to the high priest

ibani_text: ori ábálálá gịẹ ọ pịrị o gbolomanyẹ dugho Juuapụ kobiri yọ sịbịdaapụ pịrịbẹnyẹ Damasikọs ḅụ, sị aningáa ori arịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ọḅụduaḅọ ori ine n ḅọ kuu bẹ ḅara ẹ́rẹ́ na ama na sị n pa so Jerusalem ḅo.
english_text: and asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any there who belonged to the Way, whether men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Sọl ḅo Damasikọs na kikia sa, buapághá ḅara ḅụ tọndọ warị sobie kóróḅo ọ biaikéléma.
english_text: As he neared Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.

ibani_text: Ọ warị sóghóro koro kiri sị pụghọ náa dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Sọl, Sọl! I tẹ́ go i pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị?
english_text: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him,“Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị o gbíla, Ịrị tụọ? Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ? Pụghọ ma warị págháraa, Irị Jizọs ị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị ḅọ.
english_text: “Who are you, Lord?” Saul asked. “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,”he replied.

ibani_text: Kuma saghị sị opu ama ma mú, anị ngaa n dugho ị pịrịbẹm ị mịẹbẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

ibani_text: Ori na nyẹ ma muarịapụ ma mịnị nwángịgha gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọ kọọgha, nnị pụghọ ma naam kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ arịgha.
english_text: The men traveling with Saul stood there speechless; they heard the sound but did not see anyone.

ibani_text: Sọl warị kiri ma ḅụ saghị sẹ, sị ọ tọ́rụ findi kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ori arịgha. Nnị warị ḅara ḅụ ori ọlọ mú Damasikọs láa.
english_text: Saul got up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes he could see nothing. So they led him by the hand into Damascus.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ori ine nyẹ́ arịgha ọ pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ fịgha pịghị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅugha.
english_text: For three days he was blind, and did not eat or drink anything.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ mininiḅọ imi Damasikọs ḅụ Ananayas anị ori ẹrẹ, o múnogha dáwọkọm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọ ḅẹ́ sáá Ananayas! Ọ warị pagharaa, Mị irị Inyanaḅọ.
english_text: In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord called to him in a vision,“Ananias!” “Yes, Lord,” he answered.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Ịḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị Gbụ́nụ́nụ́ asọ pa sị asọ ma muu, sị Judas wárị gbíla, Tasọs ḅụ saghị ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ, Sọl anị ori ẹrẹ, ọ tẹ́ghẹ́arị.
english_text: The Lord told him,“Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, o múnogha dáwọkọm, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Ananayas pa sịḅọ arịị, ḅara pa ọ tọ́rụ gbánam sị ọ jẹ́ pa nyẹ árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight.”

ibani_text: Ananayas warị pagharaa, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, tọghaapụ mị owitụ́wọ ma gbolomanyẹ dugho i pịrịmam, ọ pịghị pa ịyẹa túminị́ tọ́rụ́siarịmáa ma tọ́rụ́siarị Jerusalem ḅụ.
english_text: “Lord,” Ananias answered, “I have heard many reports about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị opu igwagwaḅọ ḅara kụrọ daákịm sị pa Damasikọs ḅoom sị ori susi ị pịrịarịapụ mamgba kuuakị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: And he has come here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị ọ pagharaa: Mú, tegó, a o sẹ́lẹ́akịmam sị ori ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ sọọ, sị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásáma Juughaapụ ma pịrị, na pịghị áláápụ́ na, na pịghị Izirẹlịapụ.
english_text: But the Lord said to Ananias,“Go! This man is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles and their kings and to the people of Israel.

ibani_text: Ịrị pịghị pa o diebẹm ori árị bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị i sịbị goo.
english_text: I will show him how much he must suffer for my name.”

ibani_text: Ananayas warị Sọl fịnị angaá ma sọọ, warị ḅara pa ori ọgọ́nọ́ gbánā, warị ḅẹẹ, Mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Sọl, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ i fịrịmamam Jizọs ọ ḅụ gbọrụ, ọ ḅụ pa ị die ḅo asọogbo ị mịnga ḅoarị sa, ori i fịrịmam sị ị sima nyẹ́ árị bẹ ḅara, sị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅo ị́yẹ́ oju sọ bii bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then Ananias went to the house and entered it. Placing his hands on Saul, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord—Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here—has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri nji ẹ́fẹ́fẹ́rẹ Sọl tọ́rụ́bie saghị sóghóro págháḅom, ọ warị sima saghị nyẹ́ árị. Ọ saghị sẹm sị n mingi pa ọ sara.
english_text: Immediately, something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized,

ibani_text: Ọ nyẹ́fị faáma sa ịnyọ warị ḅo ọ ḅụ sọọ. Sọl na mininiapụ ma Damasikọs ḅụ tọgha dii fịnịm.
english_text: and after taking some food, he regained his strength. Saul spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.

ibani_text: Ọ warị sáá ngúmágha pa nna kobiri yọ ma muu, si dugho wásáma ḅẹẹ, Jizọs ori anịị Tamuno Tụ́wọ.
english_text: At once he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God.

ibani_text: O naáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị n tọ́rụ daam, warị saghị gbíla, Mịị anị Jerusalem ḅụ, susi Jizọs pa sịḅọ ma pịrịarịapụ ma ḅaarị ḅogha? Ori anịgosi mịnga ma ḅogha sị o túminị́ ma kuu sị ikólinaapụ ḅara pa nna akuo igwagwaalaapụ ma pịrị?
english_text: All those who heard him were astonished and asked, “Isn’t he the man who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?”

ibani_text: Sọl ori kụrọ pa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámaarị ḅara ma warị tọgha tọghaapụ mịẹsị minini; ọ pịghị diepágháma ḅara ḅẹẹ, Jizọs ori anịị Mesaya ma, mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma opuma nna ḅụ korom sị Juuapụ, Damasikọs ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine dughonyẹ nyánágha.
english_text: Yet Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah.

ibani_text: Tọgha dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Juuapụ ma warị kobiri bịpịakị n ḅára warị ọ ḅáa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After many days had gone by, there was a conspiracy among the Jews to kill him,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n dugho ọ pịrịm nnị mịẹ dọghụnyẹ, dii na ḅá na nnị ama ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ kúruarị n ḅọ́rọ́ o ḅáa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: but Saul learned of their plan. Day and night they kept close watch on the city gates in order to kill him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ éné dii, ori ọḅụduaapụ ọ pa nkanabie suam sị ọ saghị ḅọ́rọ́ma, findi gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá n nama pa ama ma ikelekele ma nyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall.

ibani_text: Sọl pịghịma Jerusalem múm sị ọ Krais ọḅụduaapụ ma na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ. Kụ́ma nnị mininigha ḅẹ́ ori Krais duaḅọ sọmam, nnị mamgba o dighi ḅáláfaarị gosi.
english_text: When he came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he really was a disciple.

ibani_text: Banabas warị ḅo ḅárásua ọ pịrị sị ọ pa nfịrịmaapụ ma fịnịngaa muu ọ warị dughofindi n pịrị Sọl Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ árị ḅara asọogbo, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sọ pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọ ọ pịrịmaá ḅara ọ pịghị dugho nnị pịrịm Sọl ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Jizọs ẹ́rẹ pa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásáma ḅara Damasikọs ḅụ.
english_text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.

ibani_text: Sọl warị nnị na fịnị sị Jerusalem mú ikelekele ma ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Jizọs ẹrẹ pa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásáma.
english_text: So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị Giriki fiearị Juuapụ na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́m pịghị nnị na ḅẹ́rẹ́ nụ́ná, kụ́ma nnị asọ dọ́ghụm nnị ọ ḅaá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: He talked and debated with the Hellenistic Jews,but they tried to kill him.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ ma dọghụ pághámaḅo sa nnị Sọl ḅọ́rọ́ma Sizariya múm sị anị ngaa ḅọ́rọ́ ọ pa Tasọs fịrịma.
english_text: When the believers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

ibani_text: Anịị anị pághá ḅara ḅẹ́ Judiya gbọrụ fịnị mininiapụ na Galili na Sameriya diin arịm, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅárásua ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nna kịẹbịpị ḅo dụḅam nnị ịnyọ suam pịghị ḅáláfa nyána Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrị.
english_text: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.

ibani_text: Pita ngámámgba múm, gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá biri ọ warị muu mininiapụ dighi Lida ḅụ.
english_text: As Peter traveled about the country, he went to visit the Lord’s people who lived in Lydda.

ibani_text: Anị angaá anịị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Aneyas pa sịḅọ na dona nyẹ, ḅụọ fịị ḅara fịịḅọ, pịghị ine na ibila ḅụ saghịghaḅọ ḅọ́rọ́maa inine a kụ́rá ḅụ.
english_text: There he found a man named Aeneas, who was paralyzed and had been bedridden for eight years.

ibani_text: Pita warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Aneyas, Jizọs Krais mị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri igwọọarị, saghị si ị́yẹ́ múnonyẹ i kọọ. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị Aneyas Saghị nyẹẹ.
english_text: “Aeneas,” Peter said to him, “Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your mat.” Immediately Aeneas got up.

ibani_text: Lida na Saron ḅụ ngaapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori arịm warị pịghị sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ ma dua.
english_text: All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.

ibani_text: Jọpa ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imi, Tabita anịị árị ẹ́rẹ́, árị ọ́ mininiḅọ, árị ẹrẹ Giriki ḅụ anịị Dọkas (mịma dughoarị, tụ́ḅara kịka nama). A sáá ngúmá sámámgba ḅárásua igonyinapụ pịrịarị pịghị ibinyẹ mịẹarị.
english_text: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (in Greek her name is Dorcas); she was always doing good and helping the poor.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ, a warị ḅo obi koro si fịị, nnị warị árị dua siri pa ẹdẹ ọgọ́nọ́ ḅụ kóróma ọgọ́nọ́ wárị ḅụ.
english_text: About that time she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room.

ibani_text: Jọpa akị mú Lida láa, ḅọlọgha, mininiapụ ma náa sáá ḅẹ́ Pita Lida ḅụ imii, nnị mmẹẹ́ owiapụ fịrịma ọ pịrịm ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ, Páisisi álála wa damaḅo.
english_text: Lydda was near Joppa; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him and urged him, “Please come at once!”

ibani_text: Pita warị anị kirikiri tẹ́lẹ́ma sị nnị na muu, ori anị ngaa láa sáá, nnị ọ pa ọgọnọ fịnịbie ma múm, dee fịịmáa ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma o gbiriikélékélé sị owuarị, pa ọ diearị Dọkas dumafịnị sáá, a gbi bịtẹ mamgbaa.
english_text: Peter went with them, and when he arrived he was taken upstairs to the room. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.

ibani_text: Pita warị nnị kị́nị́mamgba deepágháma, warị ẹkpẹrẹkị tẹ́ghẹ̄, warị tọ́rụ pịghị dua ma daa si ḅẹẹ, Tabita, saghịị! A warị a tọ́rụ findi, a Pita árị sa, a warị saghị kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: Peter sent them all out of the room; then he got down on his knees and prayed. Turning toward the dead woman, he said, “Tabitha, get up.” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.

ibani_text: Pita warị sọma mú ḅárásua a pịrị sị a sẹ́fịnị, ọ warị anịsa mininiapụ mamgba na dee fịịmaá ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ mamgba si gboloma, warị a saghị nnị pịrị duma ḅụ.
english_text: He took her by the hand and helped her to her feet. Then he called for the believers, especially the widows, and presented her to them alive.

ibani_text: Mị́sa pághányẹ ma warị wásáma mú biri gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ láa Jọpa ḅụ, tọghaapụ warị ḅo pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ mininii.
english_text: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.

ibani_text: Pita warị kẹ́lẹ́ dii fịnị Jọpa ḅụ, ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ nama apara pa fịrịnwangịarịḅọ na fịnị Saimọn anịị ori ẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi Sizariya ḅụ, Kọnịlọsị pa sịḅọ sịbịdá Rom sọ́nọ́ a sị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ pịrịḅọ. Ịtalị ḅụ sághị ḅo ọ́mụ́gbi ogboapụ anịị nna ẹrẹ.
english_text: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment.

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno nimim pịghị o dighi ḅáláfaa, ọ wárị gbọrụ sọ susi Tamuno pịrịm ọ pịghị opuma ḅárásua nyána Juu igonyiapụ ma pịrịm, ọ pịghị sámámgba tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno pịrịarị.
english_text: He and all his family were devout and God-fearing; he gave generously to those in need and prayed to God regularly.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ biri énéḅaa, ọ múnogha dáwọkọm sị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno sookumuḅọ arịm, sọ ḅo sị, ori ẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịị ḅọ, Kọnịlọsị!
english_text: One day at about three in the afternoon he had a vision. He distinctly saw an angel of God, who came to him and said, “Cornelius!”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅáláfa ḅụ tọ́rụ sághị o dighi, warị o gbíla, Ọ tẹ́ nyẹ mọ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ? Sookumuḅọ ma warị ọ págháraa ḅẹ́, Ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ na ị́yẹ́ ibifịrị Tamuno tórúku lámam, pa biekórómáarị agba ḅara.
english_text: Cornelius stared at him in fear. “What is it, Lord?” he asked. The angel answered, “Your prayers and gifts to the poor have come up as a memorial offering before God.

ibani_text: Mị́sa túminị́ fịrịma Jọpa muu sị nnị mú Saimọn n pịghị Pita pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ sịị ị pịrị.
english_text: Now send men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon who is called Peter.

ibani_text: Ori mị kiri igoniḅọ, nama apara pa fịrịnwangịarịḅọ ma wárị, Saimọn anị ori ẹrẹ, posie aka anịị ori ngaa nyẹ.
english_text: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.”

ibani_text: Ori na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ ma soo sa, Kọnịlọsị warị ori mmẹẹ́ a fịrịnaapụ sịị na gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiḅọ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaḅọ, pịghị dada fịrịnwangị ọ pịrịarịapụ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier who was one of his attendants.

ibani_text: O dugho n pịrịm pághányẹ warị nnị fịrịma Jọpa muu.
english_text: He told them everything that had happened and sent them to Joppa.

ibani_text: Éné ḅá sáá, nnị ḅo Jọpa na kikia sa, Pita, wárị osu ma tándịm éné ogbo biri sị, o tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: About noon the following day as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray.

ibani_text: Fị́nyẹ ḅo ọ tarịm sị ori ọ fị bẹnyẹ dọ́ghụm, nnị fị́nyẹ ma mịẹarị sa, o múnogha dáwọkọm.
english_text: He became hungry and wanted something to eat, and while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.

ibani_text: Warị findi so, arịị, nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ dụḅa bịtẹ pa kórómaarị tuminikiri, so ḅọ́rọ́ anị ínia ọkọlọbị ḅụ árị diri pa anị kpọm.
english_text: He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.

ibani_text: Anị bie tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ínia ḅụọ nyáná nama, tuminikiri furo pa ikiriarị nyẹ, na pịghị fíní na.
english_text: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals, as well as reptiles and birds.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Pita saghị sị ḅa pẹẹ́.
english_text: Then a voice told him,“Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita ḅẹm, Inyanaḅọ ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori, ḅẹẹ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné na a tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnịgha nyẹẹ anịgha fíafía ḅụ fịnịgha nyẹ fịgha.
english_text: “Surely not, Lord!” Peter replied. “I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.”

ibani_text: Pụghọ ma pịghị sima dugho ọ pịrịm, Mịnị ịlọ́lị nyẹ pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ nyẹ ḅẹẹ anị fiafiam sịị ma.
english_text: The voice spoke to him a second time,“Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.”

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma tẹ́rẹ́ sa pa kiriakịm, nnị warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri bịtẹ ma nụ́nụ́ so muu.
english_text: This happened three times, and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven.

ibani_text: Pita pa sịbịbie Kịẹ ori arị nyẹ pịrịarị sáá ḅẹẹ anị tẹ́ dughoarị, Kọnịlọsị fịrịmaapụ ma gbíla pághámaḅomam Saimọn wárị fịnị angaá, sị mị́sa sẹ́fịnịarị opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma tórúku.
english_text: While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon’s house was and stopped at the gate.

ibani_text: Nnị warị kị́nị́ sị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Saimọn n pịghị Pita pa sịḅọ mịngáá imii?
english_text: They called out, asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there.

ibani_text: Pita pa asọ dọghụarị ori múnogha dáwọ ḅụ árịnyẹ ma akanyaḅo Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Tẹ́rẹ́ owiapụ mịnga imi, ị dọghụarịapụ.
english_text: While Peter was still thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Simon, threemen are looking for you.

ibani_text: Anịgo, ịḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị nnị na muu, sáá ngúmá ma, irị nnị fịrịmam.
english_text: So get up and go downstairs. Do not hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them.”

ibani_text: Pita warị mú owiapụ ma na dona, warị n ḅẹẹ, Irị anị́ị́ ọ dọghụarị ḅọ ma. Ọ tẹ́ go ḅo?
english_text: Peter went down and said to the men, “I’m the one you’re looking for. Why have you come?”

ibani_text: Nnị warị págháraa ḅẹẹ, Sọ́nọ́ a si ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ Kọnịlọsị wa fịrịmam ori anịị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ pịghị Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarịḅọ, Juuapụ mamgba pịghị opuma osigha pa ọ pịrịm. Gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, ori ị́ sịị ọ wárị ḅoo, sị ori ị dugho ḅẹnyẹ náa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: The men replied, “We have come from Cornelius the centurion. He is a righteous and God-fearing man, who is respected by all the Jewish people. A holy angel told him to ask you to come to his house so that he could hear what you have to say.”

ibani_text: Pita warị túminị́ ma ḅẹẹ nnị sọḅo, sị anị ngaa múno énéḅama. Éné ḅá sáá anị́ị́ ọ tẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ sị nnị na muu, Jọpa ḅụ fịnị jẹ́ mininiapụ sọ nnị na múm.
english_text: Then Peter invited the men into the house to be his guests. The next day Peter started out with them, and some of the believers from Joppa went along.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅáa anị́ị́ o ḅo Sizariya láanyẹ sị muu Kọnịlọsị árị ori o kuruarị ngaa, ori na ọ sị kobiri mịna na págháa na.
english_text: The following day he arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.

ibani_text: Pita wárị ma sọ sa, anịị Kọnịlọsị ọ nana dona sị sóghóro koro nyẹ ọ ḅụọ osigha ḅụ.
english_text: As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita ọ saghịmam, Saghị sẹ. Pita ọ ḅẹm, Irị papa tumḅọ.
english_text: But Peter made him get up. “Stand up,” he said, “I am only a man myself.”

ibani_text: Pita pa Kọnịlọsị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá, ọ wárị ma sọ́mum sị mú tọgha túminị́ árị n kobiri ngaa.
english_text: While talking with him, Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho n pịrị, Ọmịnị sọ kọkọ ibima nimi ḅẹ́ anị ólóghó ḅụ imi ḅẹ́ Juu na Juughapụ ḅo mịẹ gbolomanyẹ nyána ma. Kụ́ma Tamuno pa i diemam ḅẹ́ a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ árị ma ḅẹẹ n ḅọ ịlọlịm anịgha n ḅọ pilem.
english_text: He said to them: “You are well aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile. But God has shown me that I should not call anyone impure or unclean.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị fịrịma ị sịị sa, a nyẹ gbilagha pa álála ḅom. A mị́sa i gbilaarị, ị tẹ́ go fịrị ma i sịị?
english_text: So when I was sent for, I came without raising any objection. May I ask why you sent for me?”

ibani_text: Kọnịlọsị warị ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa biri ḅọ́rọ́maa tẹ́rẹ́ a dii, a tẹ́ghẹ́arị i wárịbie, tẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ éné ḅáa, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri gbẹ́rẹ́ pị́napị́na bịtẹ sua owitụ́wọ warị ḅo itọrụku sẹ
english_text: Cornelius answered: “Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me

ibani_text: sị ḅẹẹ, Kọnịlọsị, Tamuno ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ naamam ị pịghị ḅara sụghụma igonyiapụ pịrịarị ḅara ma sọ ọ tórúku láamam.
english_text: and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́ fịrịma Jọpa muu sị nnị muu gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Saimọn n pịghị Pita pa sịḅọ sị ị pịrị, ḅẹẹ ori mị́sa igoniḅọ Saimọn nama apara pa fịrị nwangịarịḅọ wárị, posie aka anịị ori ngaa nyẹ.
english_text: Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.’

ibani_text: Anịgo, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri a fịrịma ị sịịm, ị pịghị ibiḅara mịẹm i ḅoo ḅara ma. Mị́sa wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba mịnga imii Tamuno tórúku, kúruarị wa náa bẹ ḅara Tamuno ị fịrịma sị ị dugho wa pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us.”

ibani_text: Pita warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́, ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa arịm bẹ Tamuno tọ́rụ́ dighi nyẹ mịẹmịẹḅọgha
english_text: Then Peter began to speak: “I now realize how true it is that God does not show favoritism

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ o dighi ḅáláfaapụ sị pịghị karakárányẹ mịẹ mịnaapụ ma anịị ọ daakịarịapụ, ọ balagha nnị saghị ḅo angaá.
english_text: but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right.

ibani_text: O nimim ọ pa Izirẹlịawọ fịrịma oku, diin ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị, Jizọs Krais kị́nị́mamgba Nyánáḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.

ibani_text: O nimim Judiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ gbọrụ ḅụ págháanyẹ, Galili ḅụ saghị, Jọn ori mingi sara oku ma dugho wásáma sáá.
english_text: You know what has happened throughout the province of Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached—

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ Jizọs, Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ nimi, Tamuno ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ na kụrọ pa ọ ḅụ sua ḅara, ọ pịghị ngaamamgba muu ḅara sị ibinyẹ mịẹarị ḅara, si pịghị ẹ́kpẹ́dua kụrọ bie fịnịapụ mamgba gwọarị ḅara tegó Tamuno ọ nana imim gosi.
english_text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power, and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil, because God was with him.

ibani_text: Wamịnị sọ onyẹsẹ́ o nwángị fịrị mamgba pịrịm Juuapụ sẹ bie na Jerusalem ḅụ, n warị ḅo ọ ḅá, nnị ọ ḅaupálị sa mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ,
english_text: “We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a cross,

ibani_text: kụ́ma tẹ́rẹ́ dii ḅọ́rọ́ sa, Tamuno fịị ḅụ ọ saghịmam, sị mịẹ ori ọ ḅụ pa wa die.
english_text: but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgbagha ori ọ ḅụ pa dieapụ, kụ́ma Tamuno ọ ḅara na sẹlẹakịapụ ma, anịị wamịnị ọ nana fị pịghị ọ nana ḅuuapụ, ọ fịị ḅụ saghị fama sáá.
english_text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen—by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

ibani_text: Ọ warị tọ́ọ wa pịrị ḅẹ́, wa ori ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa túminị́ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, ori anịị Tamuno pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ tọ́ọ duma na fịịapụ pị́rị́máaḅọ.
english_text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead.

ibani_text: Ikiakoroapụ mamgba o gbolomanyẹ dughom ḅẹ́ ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ siiḅụḅárasi pịrị nyánábẹm, Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”

ibani_text: Pita pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sáá Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị kóróḅo o pughuuarịapụ mamgba ḅụ sọọ.
english_text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all who heard the message.

ibani_text: Pita na Jọpa ḅụ saghị ḅo sị mininiapụ, anị n tọ́rụ́ daam bẹ Tamuno ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ dienyẹ ma, mịẹm sị Juughaapụ ma sọ anị nyáná.
english_text: The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on Gentiles.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ nnị n naam, nnị jẹ́ ḅẹlẹ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị sị, Tamuno ma túminíarị. Pita warị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: For they heard them speaking in tonguesand praising God. Then Peter said,

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáḅomam wamịnị sọ nyáná ḅo ḅara gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mị́sa ine nnị kikibịgha ḅẹ́ nnị mingi pa n sara ma?
english_text: “Surely no one can stand in the way of their being baptized with water. They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹ́ nnị mingi pa n sara Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ḅụ. Anịsáa nnị warị Pita ḅẹẹ ọ kẹ́lẹ́ nnị na kálá dii nyẹ fịnịị.
english_text: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for a few days.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma na isi mininiapụ na Judiya gbọrụ naamam ḅẹ́ Juughaapụ ma sọ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma daákịmam.
english_text: The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

ibani_text: Pita Jerusalem láa sa Krais ḅụ minini Juuapụ, ḅẹarịapụ ḅẹ́ Juughaapụ tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́, warị saghị o dughosima ḅẹẹ,
english_text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers criticized him

ibani_text: Ịrị ḅara warị mú igoniḅọ sọ ḅara nnị tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́gha Juughaapụ wárị, pịghị nnị na nyẹ́fị ḅara.
english_text: and said, “You went into the house of uncircumcised men and ate with them.”

ibani_text: Pita warị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ saghị pághá ḅara dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ,
english_text: Starting from the beginning, Peter told them the whole story:

ibani_text: A tẹ́ghẹ̄arị sáá Jọpa ama bie, a múnogha dáwọkọm, warị nyẹ arịị nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ dụḅa bịtẹ pa sobie saghị kórómaarị, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ínia ọkọlọbị ḅụ árị diri pa anị kpọm, anị warị kóróḅo a fịnịngaa.
english_text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision. I saw something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to where I was.

ibani_text: A sọma muu anị bie dighi sáá, a tuminikiri ínia ḅụọ nyána nama arịm, pírí bie nganyẹ na piri bie ofori nganyẹ.
english_text: I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles and birds.

ibani_text: A warị pụghọ náa, i ḅẹ́arịnyẹ ḅẹẹ, Pita, saghị si ḅa pẹẹ́!
english_text: Then I heard a voice telling me,‘Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.’

ibani_text: A warị ḅẹẹ, ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori, Inyanaḅọ, ḅẹẹ, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ịlọ́lị anịgha pile nyẹ na i bịpịbie sọgha.
english_text: “I replied, ‘Surely not, Lord! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’

ibani_text: Pụghọ ma pịghị sima dughom ḅẹẹ, Mịnị ịlọ́lị pa Tamuno mịẹ fiafiama ma nyẹ sịma.
english_text: “The voice spoke from heaven a second time,‘Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.’

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma tẹ́rẹ́ sáá pa kiriakịm, nnị warị anịsáa anị nụ́nụ́ so muu.
english_text: This happened three times, and then it was all pulled up to heaven again.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ma ḅụ tẹ́rẹ́ owiapụ, nnị Sizariya ḅụ saghị fịrịma i damaḅoapụ ḅo laam, a fịnịarị angaá.
english_text: “Right then three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ị ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, a nnị dua muu sáá ngúmágha ḅara ḅụ. Mịná suene a mịnaapụ ma sọ, Jọppa ḅụ saghị i nana Sizariya múm wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịghị Kọnịlọsị warị sọm.
english_text: The Spirit told me to have no hesitation about going with them. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s house.

ibani_text: Ọ warị dugho wa pịrị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ árị ḅara ọ wárị, sẹ́fịnị sị ọ bẹḅọ ḅẹ́, Kị́nị́ fịrịma Jọpa mú sị mú Saimọn nnị pịghị Pita pa sịḅọ sị́ị́.
english_text: He told us how he had seen an angel appear in his house and say, ‘Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ị pịrịbẹm mịẹsị ịrị na ị wárị gbọrụ mịẹbẹnyẹ sị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma nyána.
english_text: He will bring you a message through which you and all your household will be saved.’

ibani_text: A saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sáá, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị ḅo n koro anị wa kóró ḅara parị parị sáá.
english_text: “As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came on them as he had come on us at the beginning.

ibani_text: A warị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa biekóróma, dughonyẹ bẹ, Jọn mingi pa mingi saram, kụ́ma nnị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ mingi pa ọ sárábẹm.
english_text: Then I remembered what the Lord had said:‘John baptized withwater, but you will be baptized withthe Holy Spirit.’

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno pa wa pịrị dienyẹ ma wa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ minini sáá, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ dienyẹ ma, anịị ọ pa mị Juughaapụ ma pịrịnyẹ. Anịsáa, irị tụọ, kóróma bẹḅọ ḅẹ́ a ine Tamuno kikibẹm.
english_text: So if God gave them the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to think that I could stand in God’s way?”

ibani_text: Nnị mịma náa sáá, nnị mịnị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha, kụ́ma Tamuno bomam ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa ori Tamuno ma sọ asọ findi Juughaapụ ma pịrịmam sị nnị so sii ḅụ pịghị sị duma.
english_text: When they heard this, they had no further objections and praised God, saying, “So then, even to Gentiles God has granted repentance that leads to life.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa nnị gálágálámamaapụ ma nna ḅụ koro opu tọ́rụ́siarị ma gosi, anịị nnị Sitivin ḅá faá ma sáá, nna ḅụ jẹapụ muu Fonisiya, Saiprọs na Antịọkụ ḅọlọ ḅara pa ḅọlọ ngaa múm sị oku ma pa Juuapụ ngéré fịrịmaa.
english_text: Now those who had been scattered by the persecution that broke out when Stephen was killed traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus and Antioch, spreading the word only among Jews.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa mininiapụ, Saiprọs na Sirini ḅụ saghị ḅo owiapụ, Antịọkụ muum warị oku ma dugho wásáma pa Juughaapụ sọ pịrịị, anịị Jizọs Krais gboloma ibi oku ma.
english_text: Some of them, however, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also, telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ kụ́rọ n nana imi, tọgha túminị́ mininim sị pịghị nna ḅụ saghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: The Lord’s hand was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.

ibani_text: Pághárịnyẹ ma muu Jerusalem ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma biri laam, nnị warị Banabas pa Antịọkụ fịrịma.
english_text: News of this reached the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

ibani_text: Ori anị ngaa láa sáá, ori arịm Tamuno ma túminị́ ma bomamáa ḅara, o bieḅẹlẹm, warị n ḅẹ́ nnị sẹ kụ́rọ pịghị karakárá ḅụ fịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị n Tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ mamgba.
english_text: When he arrived and saw what the grace of God had done, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts.

ibani_text: Banabas, ori ibi tumḅọ, minini na Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ biiḅọ, tọghaapụ pịghị ḅo Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ mininim.
english_text: He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.

ibani_text: Banabas warị Tasọs mú sị mú Sọl dọghụ,
english_text: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,

ibani_text: ori, ori arị sáá, ori ọ pa Antịọkụ ḅoom. Gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rá gbọrụ nnị mmẹapụ ma igoniapụ sọ, sị pịghị nyẹ pa tọghaapụ diem, Antịọkụ ḅụ anịị parị mininiapụ ma parị Krais fịnị ḅara fịnịapụ pa n sị nyẹ.
english_text: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch.

ibani_text: Anịsáa biri ma jẹa ikiakoroapụ Jerusalem ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Antịọkụ múm.
english_text: During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Agabọs pa sịḅọ saghị sẹ́m sị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụrọ ḅụ dugho pághámam tuminikiriapụ ḅụ kóró bẹ opu ḅuru ḅá. Mịma kiriakịm Klaudiosi sẹ táarị sáá.
english_text: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world. (This happened during the reign of Claudius.)

ibani_text: Krais ọḅụduaapụ ma tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́m ḅẹ́ nna ḅụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n ḅo ineḅara mịẹbẹm sị nyẹ pa nna jẹa mininiapụ fịrịma Judiya ḅụ.
english_text: The disciples, as each one was able, decided to provide help for the brothers and sisters living in Judea.

ibani_text: Nnị mịma mịẹm warị igbii ma pa sọsị sẹ́nịapụ ma fịrịma Sọl na Banabas ḅara.
english_text: This they did, sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

ibani_text: Mị́sa biri ma Ámányánáḅọ Hẹrọd warị sághị sọsị ma ḅụ jẹapụ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma.
english_text: It was about this time that King Herod arrested some who belonged to the church, intending to persecute them.

ibani_text: Ọ bịpị pịrịmam ḅẹ́ nnị áláápụ́-ágidi pa Jems, Jọn numboru owitụ́wọ timi ḅáa.
english_text: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.

ibani_text: Ori árị sáá ḅẹẹ, mị mịẹnyẹ ma Juuapụ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam anịị ọ pịghị muu Pita Kuu nyẹ (mịma kiriakịarị nnị Sughúugha Fịtúrú Álálị ma fịarị sáá).
english_text: When he saw that this met with approval among the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.

ibani_text: Nnị oku faá ma sáá, nnị o pa ịkóli bie suam sị ọ saghị pa ikólinaapụ kúru, ínia ọ́mụ́gbi ogboapụ pịrị, gbẹ́rẹ́ ogbo ínia ọ́mụ́gbiapụ. Hẹrọd tọọm ḅẹ́ ori ọ pa kị́nị́mamgba tórúku ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅobẹm, Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma ḅọ́rọ́maẹrẹ.
english_text: After arresting him, he put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Pita pa ịkóli wárị ma bie wárị, kụ́ma sọsị opuma tụ́ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ Tamuno pịrịm ọ sịbị goo.
english_text: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was earnestly praying to God for him.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd mú Pita pághámaḅo túminị́ ma pịrị dọghụ éné, dii ma ḅụ éné na ḅagha sáá, ori kúru mmẹẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ogboku bie múnoarị, nnị mmẹẹ́ ịkóli suanyẹ pa ọ ḅụọ na kúrúapụ ḅụọ ḅụ kpọm, ọ́mụ́gbiapụ pịghị ikóliwarị ma ópu ḅụ́pọ́ kúruarị.
english_text: The night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries stood guard at the entrance.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ warị ḅo anị ngaa sẹ nyẹ, baá warị bia ịkóli wárị ma bie, sookumuḅọ ma warị Pita jighe saghịma ori abána ḅụ, warị ḅẹ́, Álála saghị! Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ịkóli suanyẹ ma pẹlẹ korom ọ ḅara.
english_text: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up. “Quick, get up!” he said, and the chains fell off Peter’s wrists.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị Pita ḅẹẹ, Ị́yẹ́ bịtẹ sua pịghị ị́yẹ́ agbaa kpọọ, Pita ọkọ mịẹm, sookumuḅọ ma warị ọ ḅẹ́, ị́yẹ́ opu bịtẹ sua sị i dua.
english_text: Then the angel said to him, “Put on your clothes and sandals.” And Peter did so. “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me,” the angel told him.

ibani_text: Pita o dua pághám ịkóli warị ma bie, o nimigha sookumuḅọ ma mịẹarịnyẹ ma ọ tụ́manyẹ o, anịgha o siim ḅẹ́ o múnogha dáwọ kọarị.
english_text: Peter followed him out of the prison, but he had no idea that what the angel was doing was really happening; he thought he was seeing a vision.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅo parị kúrúapụ ma sẹ angaá ḅọ́rọ́, mmẹẹ́ kárámá angaá ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo kunema ngaa nyẹ ma láa mú ikúlélu opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma la findi ama bie sọ angaá nyẹ. Ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅara na findim, nnị warị ḅọ́rọ́ pághá, nnị nwángị gbẹ́rẹ́ asọ ḅụ téré korom, sookumuḅọ ma warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri Pita wáriso.
english_text: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city. It opened for them by itself, and they went through it. When they had walked the length of one street, suddenly the angel left him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa anị Pita ḅo nimiḅo nyẹ ọ ḅụ págháarị nyẹ, warị ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa, a nimim ḅẹẹ anị tụ́mányẹẹ, ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọrẹ sookumuḅọ fịrịmam sị o ḅo i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma Hẹrọd ḅarabie na pịghị Juuapụ mịẹ dọghụnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I know without a doubt that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod’s clutches and from everything the Jewish people were hoping would happen.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅo ọ ḅụkoro sáá, o daá daá soo Meri warị múm, Jọn n pịghị Mak pa sịḅọ nyingi, tọghaapụ kobiri sị tẹ́ghẹ̄arị angaá.
english_text: When this had dawned on him, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered and were praying.

ibani_text: Pita warị ḅụ́pọ́ ma gbolo, nna wárị tụwọ Roda warị ḅo págháraa.
english_text: Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant named Rhoda came to answer the door.

ibani_text: A Pita pụghọ lighilighim sị pịghị opuma bieḅẹlẹm, a warị ḅụ́pọ́ ma findigha pa mangị mú dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ Pita nụ́ngọbie sẹ́fịnịarị.
english_text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed she ran back without opening it and exclaimed, “Peter is at the door!”

ibani_text: N warị a págháraa ḅẹẹ, I nomum. Kuma a minighaa, a pa dughoarị ḅẹẹ, karakárányẹ, nnị warị á págháraa ḅẹ́ didigha, Pita Tẹ́mẹ́ anị árị árịnyẹ.
english_text: “You’re out of your mind,” they told her. When she kept insisting that it was so, they said, “It must be his angel.”

ibani_text: Pita paá gbólóarị, kunema n ḅo findi ọ pịrịm, n ḅoo ori árị sáá, anị opuma nna tọ́rụ́ daam.
english_text: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅara pa n fọ́ngụ ma ḅẹ́ nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma, ọ warị dughofindi nnị pịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara warị ọ pághámaḅo ḅara ịkóli warị bie. Ọ warị n ḅẹ́, Ọ mịma dugho pa Jems na mininiapụ ma pịrị. Anịsáa, ọ warị n wáriso sị jẹ́ ngaa muu.
english_text: Peter motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and described how the Lord had brought him out of prison. “Tell James and the other brothers and sisters about this,” he said, and then he left for another place.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáa sáá, opu nụná warị koro kúrúapụ ma ogbobie bẹ Pita ọ tẹ́ nwángị kọọ.
english_text: In the morning, there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị ọ dọghụ, kụ́ma nnị ine ọ dọghụ pághámaḅogha, ọ warị ibima nyẹ pa kúrúapụ ma gbíla warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị n ḅá. Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Hẹrọd Judiya warisom sị Sizariya ḅụ kẹ́lẹ́ fịnịm.
english_text: After Herod had a thorough search made for him and did not find him, he cross-examined the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

ibani_text: Hẹrọd, Taya na Sidọnapụ na kam koroarị n warị túminị́ ogbo ḅara pa muu Hẹrọd na irịa. Parị ma nnị arịm ḅẹ́ nnị Ḅlatus akuoo nna ju sua, tegó ori anịị ọrụtọḅọ ámányánáḅọ warị ma bie. Nnị warị anịsa mú diin bii Hẹrọd ḅara. Tegó ámányánáḅọ ma ama ḅụ anị nna fị́fị́ fị́nyẹ sághị ḅoarị angaá.
english_text: He had been quarreling with the people of Tyre and Sidon; they now joined together and sought an audience with him. After securing the support of Blastus, a trusted personal servant of the king, they asked for peace, because they depended on the king’s country for their food supply.

ibani_text: Bịpị ákị gbẹ́rẹ́ éné, Hẹrọd warị ori áláápụ́ bịtẹ sua sị pịghị ori imine ḅụ kpọrọfịnị warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: On the appointed day Herod, wearing his royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people.

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị ilúghú ḅẹẹ, Mị pụghọ ma tumḅọ pụghọ kịkagha kụ́ma tamuno pụghọ.
english_text: They shouted, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sookumuḅọ warị Hẹrọd fom gbi, tegó ọ fịnị Tamuno pịrị kuu ma pa ọ ḅụ pịrịm, ngúle ori oju bie sọm sị ọ pẹẹḅa, ọ warị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fịị.
english_text: Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

ibani_text: Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma warị yii kamam.
english_text: But the word of God continued to spread and flourish.

ibani_text: Banabas na Sọl na n mịẹ bẹnyẹ miẹfamam Jerusalem ḅụ, warị pịghịma ḅo, nnị na Jọn n pịghị Mak pa siiḅọ na.
english_text: When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission, they returned fromJerusalem, taking with them John, also called Mark.

ibani_text: Antịọkụ ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma ḅụ, ikiakoroapụ na nyẹ́dieapụ imi. Nna ẹrẹ anịị Banabas, Simion (n kụ́rụ́kụ́rúḅọ pa sịḅọ), Lusiyọs Sirini ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, Manayen (n Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Hẹrọd na didighi pághámaḅoḅọ), na Sọl.
english_text: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch) and Saul.

ibani_text: Nnị susi Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrị si, ḅurukụ́ma ḅụ tẹ́ghẹ́arị sáá, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho nnị pịrịm, Banabas na Sọl sighima i pịrịị, A nnị sị, sị nnị nwángị i pịrịbẹ fịrị ma gosi.
english_text: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅurukụmam pịghị tẹ́ghẹ̄m, warị n ḅara pa nna ḅụ gbánā sị n fịrịma pághámá.
english_text: So after they had fasted and prayed, they placed their hands on them and sent them off.

ibani_text: Banabas na Sọl na, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma n fịrịma ma ḅara, kóró Selusiya múm, warị anị ngaa ḅọ́rọ́ mú Saiprọs ogbosúányẹ ama láa.
english_text: The two of them, sent on their way by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Salamis la sáá, nnị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma dugho wásámam nna Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ, nnị pịghị Jọn Mak akị nna ḅụ suam si ọ ḅárásua nnị pịrị.
english_text: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. John was with them as their helper.

ibani_text: Ogbosúányẹ ama ma ḅụ, nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅọ́rọ́ mú jẹ́ angaá lam ákị muu nnị ḅo Pafọs pa sị ama ma láa, anị angaá anịị nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ egberi ikiakoroḅọ na dona nyẹ Ba-Jizọs pa sịḅọ, pịghị bẹḅọ ḅẹ́ ori ikiakoro ḅoo,
english_text: They traveled through the whole island until they came to Paphos. There they met a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,

ibani_text: ori na ama ma ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Sajiosi Pọlọs na nnị nangwọapụ, Sajiosi Pọlọs ma, ori opuma nyẹ́nimiḅọ. Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma warị Banabas na Sọl si ọ toruku ḅo, ori Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa dọ́ghụm gosi.
english_text: who was an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, an intelligent man, sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma egberi ikiakoroḅọ ma Elimas (anịị ori Giriki ẹ́rẹ́) opuma n daa sẹ́mam, ori asọ dọ́ghụm ọ mịẹsị ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma nna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ minini ma.
english_text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Sọl, nnị pịghị Pọl pa sịḅọ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ bii ḅo tọ́rụ́ pa Elimas egberi ikiakoroḅọ ma dighim
english_text: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked straight at Elymas and said,

ibani_text: warị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ẹ́kpẹ́dua tụwọ, ịrị ibinyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ iruonaḅọ, epele tọrụkịrikị́rị́ ịḅụ bim, i pịghị Tamuno karakáráma pịghị epele sọmaarị.
english_text: “You are a child of the devil and an enemy of everything that is right! You are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery. Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord?

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara ịḅụ kóróbẹm mị́sa, ị tọ́rụ pụụbẹm ị mịnị pịghị ịrụa baá ma arịbịgha mị kálá sáá tụwọ. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri itita na kánákáná ọ tọ́rụ́ ma gbẹm, ọ warị saghị ikelekelé kị́nị́ dọghụarị ḅara ḅụ ori ọlọọ bẹḅọ.
english_text: Now the hand of the Lord is against you. You are going to be blind for a time, not even able to see the light of the sun.” Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma mininim ọ pághányẹ árị sáá, tegó Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ gboloma dienyẹ ma o tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm.
english_text: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was amazed at the teaching about the Lord.

ibani_text: Pọl na ọ nana nwángịapụ Pafọs ḅụ sua págháma sị mú Pega lam, Pamfiliya ḅụ fịnịnyẹ, kụ́ma Jọn Mak anị ngaa nnị warị sọm sị pịghịma Jerusalem ḅoo.
english_text: From Paphos, Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Pega ḅụ akị mú Pisidiya Antịọkụ ḅụ fịnịnyẹ láa sị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ mú Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnị.
english_text: From Perga they went on to Pisidian Antioch. On the Sabbath they entered the synagogue and sat down.

ibani_text: Nnị Mosis ólóghó diri ma bie goo faá ma sáá na pịghị ikiakoroapụ diri ma, kobiri yọ ma sịbịdáḅọ warị oku fịrịma ḅẹẹ, Wámịna Daá awọ, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ dughonyẹ nyána ọ pa túminị́ ma tẹ́mẹ́bie mịẹ kụ́rọ́ma, a bim ọmịnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ nnị pịrị.
english_text: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the leaders of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have a word of exhortation for the people, please speak.”

ibani_text: Pọl warị saghị sẹ, warị ḅara pa mịẹbẹ nnị bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄, o warị saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́: Ị́yẹ́ amịna Izirẹlịapụ na pịghị mịnga fịnị Juughaapụ Tamuno ḅụ mininiapụ ọmịnị i pughuu.
english_text: Standing up, Paul motioned with his hand and said: “Fellow Israelites and you Gentiles who worship God, listen to me!

ibani_text: Izirẹlị tẹ́ghẹ́arị Tamuno ma, wámịna tádọ́apụ sẹ́lẹ́akịm warị pịghị mịẹsị n dụḅa sẹ sọ, nnị igoniapụ ḅara pa Ijipiti ḅụ fịnị sáá Tamuno ori kụ́rọ pa n pághámaḅom Ijipiti bie;
english_text: The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors; he made the people prosper during their stay in Egypt; with mighty power he led them out of that country;

ibani_text: kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ sị ori ngịrịma nyána n pịrịm nna nyẹ́ mịẹ ḅara ḅụ elesiri ma ḅụ;
english_text: for about forty years he endured their conductin the wilderness;

ibani_text: ọ sọ́nọ́ma sẹ gulugulumam Kenaan ḅụ, warị ámányánáapụ pa ori a túminị́ mịẹ.
english_text: and he overthrew seven nations in Canaan, giving their land to his people as their inheritance.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakịm kụ́rá ndẹ́ẹ na mmẹsi oyi findi. Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa ọ ḅo ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ pa n pịrị akị mú ikiakoro Samuwẹlị sa láa.
english_text: All this took about 450 years. “After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.

ibani_text: Nnị ámányánáḅọ bii sáá, Tamuno Sọl, Kish tụwọ Benjamin warị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ pa nnị pịrịm, sị ori nna ámányánáḅọ sọ kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ sị ḅụ.
english_text: Then the people asked for a king, and he gave them Saul son of Kish, of the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.

ibani_text: Tamuno Sọl sịị́ sa, ọ Deviti pa ámányánáḅọ mịẹm. Mị o gboloma sị Tamuno dughonyẹ: A dọghụ pághámaḅomam ḅẹ́ Deviti, Jesi tụwọ anịị a ḅẹlẹma tumḅọ ḅara, a binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹ tumḅọ.
english_text: After removing Saul, he made David their king. God testified concerning him: ‘I have found David son of Jesse, a man after my own heart; he will do everything I want him to do.’

ibani_text: Mịị owitụ́wọ, Deviti furobie págháḅo ḅọ ḅụ Tamuno o minini Izirẹlị pịrị dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Jizọs akuomam.
english_text: “From this man’s descendants God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as he promised.

ibani_text: Jizọs náa ọrẹ fịrị saghịgha sáá, Jọn Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámam ḅẹ́ Izirẹlịapụ nna sii ḅụ pịghị sị mingi sara.
english_text: Before the coming of Jesus, John preached repentance and baptism to all the people of Israel.

ibani_text: Jọn ori fịrịnwangị famaarị biri, ori ọrẹ a túminị́ gbilam, Ọ si ḅẹ́ irị tụọ? Irịgha o kúruarị ḅo kụ́ma o dighi! Ori iyẹ ọḅụju ḅoarị, a pịghị laagha sị ọ suaarị agbaa fima ọ ḅụọ.
english_text: As John was completing his work, he said: ‘Who do you suppose I am? I am not the one you are looking for. But there is one coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.’

ibani_text: I jẹa mịnaapụ, Ebraham furoawọ, na pịghị ọmịnị Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarị Juughaapụ, wamịnị anịị nnị mị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma oku ma pa fịrịmaapụ.
english_text: “Fellow children of Abraham and you God-fearing Gentiles, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.

ibani_text: Jerusalem ḅụ ngaapụ na nna sịbịdaapụ Jizọs lighilighiḅogha, anịsọ nnị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pẹ́lẹ́arị sa ọ sịbị, nnị mịẹm sị Ịnyọ́sárá Éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ nnị goarị ikiakoroapụ diri ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọọ.
english_text: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.

ibani_text: Tụ́mányẹẹ ḅẹ́ n pa ḅara ọlọ ḅẹnyẹ ofori nnị goo fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹnyẹ ọ sịbị, nnị Paileti ḅẹm ḅẹ́ ori arịị ḅẹ́ nnị ọ ḅám.
english_text: Though they found no proper ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma o gboloma sị dughonyẹ mịẹ faáma sáá, nnị osii kórómam mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ḅụ, warị dupu bie ọḅụlọlọma.
english_text: When they had carried out all that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno fịị ḅụ ọ sághịmam,
english_text: But God raised him from the dead,

ibani_text: tọgha éné ọ pịghị ọ ḅụ pa ọ nana Galili ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Jerusalem muuarịapụ diem. Nnị mị́sa onyẹsẹ́ ọ pịrị Izirẹlịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: and for many days he was seen by those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now his witnesses to our people.

ibani_text: Wa mịnga ibi oku ma akuoo, ọ pịrị, Tamuno minini wámịna tádọ́apụ pịrịnyẹ ḅẹ́ ọ mịẹbẹm,
english_text: “We tell you the good news: What God promised our ancestors

ibani_text: Tamuno mịma mịẹ wamịnị nna awọ pịrịmam o Jizọs saghị duma ḅụ sua ḅara. Nnị gịẹ ḅara mmẹẹ́ kárámá Núme diri ḅụ ḅẹẹ:  Ịrị anịị i tụwọ, mịmgba a Daa sọ ị pịrịmam.
english_text: he has fulfilled for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm: “ ‘You are my son; today I have become your father.’

ibani_text: Tamuno fịị ḅụ ọ saghịmam sị ori oju ḅụrụbịghaa ḅara. Tamuno dugho ḅara ḅụ,  A pa ị pịrịbẹm tọ́ntọ́ na pịghị gbarịbịgha karịibima, a minini Deviti pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: God raised him from the dead so that he will never be subject to decay. As God has said, “ ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.’

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dugho ḅara jẹa ngaa,  Ị minibịgha sị ị́yẹ́ Tọ́ntọ́ fịrịnwangịḅọ oju ḅụrụ.
english_text: So it is also stated elsewhere: “ ‘You will not let your holy one see decay.’

ibani_text: Mị́sa Deviti Tamuno tọ́ọ ọ pịrị fịrịnwangị fama sáá, ọ ḅụọ ḅụ, ọ fịịm; nnị warị ori tádọ́apụ dipi ngá o dipi, ori oju warị ḅụrụ.
english_text: “Now when David had served God’s purpose in his own generation, he fell asleep; he was buried with his ancestors and his body decayed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno fịị ḅụ sághịma ḅọ ma jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné oju ḅụrụ arịbịgha.
english_text: But the one whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.

ibani_text: Anịgo ịyẹa mịnaapụ, a bim o nimi ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị siiḅụḅarasi oku ma ḅo ọ laarị nyẹ.
english_text: “Therefore, my friends, I want you to know that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you.

ibani_text: O nimibẹm ḅẹ́ ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị n ḅo duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm n ḅọ sii ḅụ, Mosis ologho ḅụ nnị ine nyánaḅogha dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: Through him everyone who believes is set free from every sin, a justification you were not able to obtain under the law of Moses.

ibani_text: Anịgo, ịḅụ kiẹma, sị ikiakoroapụ ma dughonyẹ ịḅụ pághághaa:
english_text: Take care that what the prophets have said does not happen to you:

ibani_text: Dighii ọmịnị kị́nị́ komboarịapụ! Ọ ḅụgbérépu sị fịị, ḅẹẹ, ọmịna sáá ma ḅụ a nyẹ mịẹbẹm, ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ dugho ọ pịrị sọ o minibịgha nyẹẹ.
english_text: “ ‘Look, you scoffers, wonder and perish, for I am going to do something in your days that you would never believe, even if someone told you.’”

ibani_text: Pọl na Banabas kobiri yọ ma warịsoarị sa, túminị́ n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ nnị pịghịma ḅo jẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné sị nnị mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ dugho nnị pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people invited them to speak further about these things on the next Sabbath.

ibani_text: Kobiri ma kunema, tọgha Juuapụ na tọgha Juughaapụ, Juuapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara ogbo sọmaapụ Pọl na Banabas duam nnị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́apụ sị n tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ kụ́rọ́ma ḅẹẹ nnị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ sẹrẹrẹ toruku muu.
english_text: When the congregation was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who talked with them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma kálányẹ kọọm kị́nị́mamgba ámá ma bie págháaḅo ḅo Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa.
english_text: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.

ibani_text: Juuapụ túminị́ kpo ma árị sáá, nnị saghị nyẹ́mọ́nịm warị Pọl wiri pịghị ọ nana nụná o dughonyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: When the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy. They began to contradict what Paul was saying and heaped abuse on him.

ibani_text: Kuma Pọl na Banabas ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámam; ḅẹẹ, Anị karakáram ḅẹ́ wa parị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ ọ pịrị. Kụ́ma ọmịnị anị sịghịị ḅara ma pịghị ọmịna ḅụ arịgha ḅẹ́ o duma gbámásó nyána naibim, wamịnị ọ wáriso sị Juughaapụ ma dámámubẹm.
english_text: Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly: “We had to speak the word of God to you first. Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we now turn to the Gentiles.

ibani_text: Mịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tọ́ọ wa pịrị ológhó:  A asọ pa Juughaapụ ma die bẹ tọndọ pa ọ mịẹmam, sị ọmịnị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma akuoo tuminikiri gbọrụ pịrị.
english_text: For this is what the Lord has commanded us: “ ‘I have made youa light for the Gentiles, that youmay bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma mịma náa sáá, nnị bieḅẹlẹm, nnị warị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminí anịgo nnị tọghaapụ ḅẹ́ nnị duma gbámásó nyáná ḅo mininim.
english_text: When the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and honored the word of the Lord; and all who were appointed for eternal life believed.

ibani_text: Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma warị anị ngaa ḅẹrẹtọ yọ mamgba ḅụ wásáma.
english_text: The word of the Lord spread through the whole region.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Juuapụ ma mú ama ma bie opu kiri ḅụ fịnị sị Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarị ẹ́rẹ́ na ama ma bie sịbịdáapụ ma timi sághịm. Nnị warị Pọl na Banabas pa tọ́rụ́siarịma warị n deesi anị ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ngaa.
english_text: But the Jewish leaders incited the God-fearing women of high standing and the leading men of the city. They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them from their region.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma warị nna ḅụọ fịnị onwo gugu kóróma n pịrị diearị ḅẹ́ mịnaapụ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma sịghịm nnị warị ḅọ́rọ́ Aikoniyọm mú.
english_text: So they shook the dust off their feet as a warning to them and went to Iconium.

ibani_text: Antịọkụ ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ ma bieḅẹlẹ nna ḅụ bim na pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma.
english_text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Pisidiya ḅụ fịnị Antịọkụ bie kiriakịnyẹ anị pịghị kiriakịnyẹ Aikoniyọm ḅụ: Pọl na Banabas Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma muum sị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásáma, nnị anị dugho wásáma ḅara ma mịẹm sị tọgha Juuapụ na Juughaapụ ḅo mininiapụ sọm.
english_text: At Iconium Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue. There they spoke so effectively that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mininigha Juuapụ ma warị Juughaapụ ma timi saghị sị, sisịbịbie pa n sua Pọl na Banabas pịrị.
english_text: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the other Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

ibani_text: Pọl na Banabas aningáa fịnị ḅọlọm, pịghị ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámam, ọ pịghị diem ḅẹẹ nna oku, ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ gbolomanyẹ, karakárányẹ o kụrọ pa nnị pịrị sị nnị ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ na tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngị fịrị nwángịị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ogbo ma ḅo mmẹẹ́ angaá diem, jẹ́apụ Juuapụ ju imi, isiapụ nfịrịmaapụ ma ju.
english_text: The people of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews, others with the apostles.

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma na Juuapụ na nna sịbịdaapụ warị tọ́pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹẹ nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma mbasịbẹm sị mgbọ́lụ pa nnị gbii.
english_text: There was a plot afoot among both Gentiles and Jews, together with their leaders, to mistreat them and stone them.

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma mịma nimiḅo sáá, nnị mangị Listira na Dẹẹbụ múm, Likoniya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, na pịghị anị párángáa fịnị ama mamgba,
english_text: But they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding country,

ibani_text: anị a ngaa nnị ibi oku ma dugho wásámam.
english_text: where they continued to preach the gospel.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ imi Listira ḅụ ngaaḅọ, ọ ḅụọ ikúlém; nnị oyi sa éné éné ori ikúlém, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné na ori ine nwángịgha.
english_text: In Lystra there sat a man who was lame. He had been that way from birth and had never walked.

ibani_text: Kpọrọfịnịarị sa aningáa, ọ Pọl ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pughum. Pọl arịḅom ḅẹẹ, o mininim ḅẹ ọ pịghị ine gwọbẹm ọ warị dada ma o dighi jẹ́ angaá dighigha pa
english_text: He listened to Paul as he was speaking. Paul looked directly at him, saw that he had faith to be healed

ibani_text: warị ilúghú pụghọ pa dugho, Ị ḅụọ pa tụ́ghụ́ sẹ! Owitụ́wọ ma warị dosi sẹm sị sághị nwángị ikelekelé.
english_text: and called out, “Stand up on your feet!” At that, the man jumped up and began to walk.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma árị sa Pọl mịẹnyẹ n saghị nna Likoniya ama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa saghị ilúghum, Ḅẹ́ tamuno ma nnị túminị́ dighi sị kóró wa dámáḅómam!
english_text: When the crowd saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in human form!”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ẹ́rẹ́ pa Banabas pịrị, Zeus, warị Pọl sị Harmes, tegó, ori anịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọarị ḅo.
english_text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes because he was the chief speaker.

ibani_text: Zeus orualaḅọ ma, oru warị ama ma bie ofori, kụ́ma kọ́rọ́náma na ngóngó akuoo ama ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ ḅoo. Ori na túminị́ kpo ma igwagwaá nfịrịmaapụ ma pịrị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates because he and the crowd wanted to offer sacrifices to them.

ibani_text: Banabas na Pọl náa sáá, n mịẹ binyẹ nnị nna bịtẹ kaam warị mangị túminị́ kpo ma ogbobie sọ sị ilúghuarị.
english_text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of this, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, shouting:

ibani_text: O tẹ́ go nwọfịnị nyẹ mịẹarị, wamịnị sọ ọ jẹa túminị́ ọmịnị sọ fịnị ḅara. Wa ḅom sị wamịnị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ọ pịrị, sị ọ pịghị sịị, mị ofori ofori nyẹ ma ḅụ ḅụ sii sị o tọ́rụ́ pa dumafịnị Tamuno ma daá, so na kiri na, na pịghị tọ́rụ́ ma tẹ́mẹ́ ḅo, na pighi nna bie fịnịnyẹ mamgba.
english_text: “Friends, why are you doing this? We too are only human, like you. We are bringing you good news, telling you to turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá, ọ túminị́ mamgba warịsom sị nnị nna tẹ́mẹ́ bi ḅara mịẹ.
english_text: In the past, he let all nations go their own way.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sámámgba o diepágháma nyẹ nyanam, ọ mịẹarị ibinyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́: o sobie iti pa ọ pịrịm pịghị duasughu sa pa ọ pịrị anị karakárá sa, ọ fị́nyẹ pa ọ pịrịm sị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹsị anị bieḅẹlẹ.
english_text: Yet he has not left himself without testimony: He has shown kindness by giving you rain from heaven and crops in their seasons; he provides you with plenty of food and fills your hearts with joy.”

ibani_text: Mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mamgba nfịrịmaapụ ma ine túminị́ ma daa sẹ́maghaa ḅẹẹ nnị igwagwaá nnị pịrịma.
english_text: Even with these words, they had difficulty keeping the crowd from sacrificing to them.

ibani_text: Jẹa Juuapụ, Pisidiya ḅụ fịnị Antịọkụ na Aikoniyọm ḅụ saghịḅom, nnị inem sị túminị́ ma nụ́nụ́ nna ju sọ, warị mgbọ́lụ pa Pọl gbi, warị ọ nụ́nụ́ ama ma bie págháma, sịarị ḅẹẹ ọ fịmam.
english_text: Then some Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and won the crowd over. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, thinking he was dead.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mininiapụ ma o kobiri sa, ọ saghị sẹ́m sị nwángị ama bie sọ. Éné ḅáa sáá ori na Banabas warị Dẹẹbụ múu.
english_text: But after the disciples had gathered around him, he got up and went back into the city. The next day he and Barnabas left for Derbe.

ibani_text: Pọl na Banabas ibi oku ma dugho wásámam Dẹẹbụ ḅụ warị tọgha ọḅụduaapụ nyánáḅọ. Nnị warị anị ngaa ḅọ́rọ́ Listira múu, Aikoniyọm na pịghị Pisidiya ḅụ fịnịị Antịọkụ.
english_text: They preached the gospel in that city and won a large number of disciples. Then they returned to Lystra, Iconium and Antioch,

ibani_text: Nnị ịnyọ pa mininiapụ ma ḅụ suam ḅẹẹ nnị karakárá ḅụ sẹ nna minini ma pịrị. Warị pa n die ḅẹẹ, Wa tọgha tọgha ḅụḅáláḅálá ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́bẹm sị Tamuno amadakiri ma sọọ.
english_text: strengthening the disciples and encouraging them to remain true to the faith. “We must go through many hardships to enter the kingdom of God,” they said.

ibani_text: Sọsị gbọrụ gbọrụ, n sẹnịapụ tọ́ọ n pịrịm; tẹ́ghẹ̄ na ḅurukụ́ma na, nnị n saghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara suam, n ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánáḅọ.
english_text: Paul and Barnabas appointed eldersfor them in each church and, with prayer and fasting, committed them to the Lord, in whom they had put their trust.

ibani_text: Nnị Pisidiya ikelema fama sa nnị ḅo Pamfiliya lam.
english_text: After going through Pisidia, they came into Pamphylia,

ibani_text: Anị ngaa nnị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámam Pega ḅụ, warị so Ataliya múu.
english_text: and when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa ḅọ́rọ́ nnị dọghụ so Antịọkụ ḅom, nnị n saghị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ sua ngaa, mị́sa n nwángị kárámá ma fịrị.
english_text: From Attalia they sailed back to Antioch, where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work they had now completed.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Antịọkụ láa sa, nnị sọsịapụ ma kobirim sị dugho n pịrị Tamuno nnị pa nwángịmáa fịrị, ọ pịghị asọ findi Juughaapụ pịrịmaá ḅara sị n mininii.
english_text: On arriving there, they gathered the church together and reported all that God had done through them and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.

ibani_text: Nnị warị mininiapụ ma na fịnị ḅọlọ.
english_text: And they stayed there a long time with the disciples.

ibani_text: Jẹa owiapụ Judiya ákị muu Antịọkụ láa, warị saghị mininiapụ ma die bẹ, nnị ḅọ́rọ́ Tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́gha pẹ́lẹ́gha Mosis ólóghó ma dugho ḅara nnị ine ḅọrọma nyánábịgha.
english_text: Certain people came down from Judea to Antioch and were teaching the believers: “Unless you are circumcised, according to the custom taught by Moses, you cannot be saved.”

ibani_text: Pọl na Banabas warị mịma go, nnị na opuma nụná nnị warị Pọl na Banabas na pịghị jẹ́apụ Antịọkụ ḅụ fịnịapụ tọ́ọ ḅẹ́ nnị Jerusalem muu sị muu nfịrịmaapụ ma na sẹnịapụ ma arịị mị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma go.
english_text: This brought Paul and Barnabas into sharp dispute and debate with them. So Paul and Barnabas were appointed, along with some other believers, to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question.

ibani_text: Sọsị ma, anịị mị fịrị ma pa nnị fịrịma nyẹ nnị warị Fonisiya na Sameriya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dughoarị Juughaapụ ma pịghị Tamuno asọ duamaa ḅara, mị dughonyẹ ma warị opu bieḅẹlẹ akuoo mininiapụ ma ogbobie.
english_text: The church sent them on their way, and as they traveled through Phoenicia and Samaria, they told how the Gentiles had been converted. This news made all the believers very glad.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Jerusalem la sa, mininiapụ ma na nfịrịmaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma n datérémam mịnaapụ ma anịị nnị Tamuno nnị pa nwángị fịrị mamgba dugho pịrịapụ.
english_text: When they came to Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and elders, to whom they reported everything God had done through them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa mininiapụ Farisii ogbo ma bie fịnịapụ ma, warị saghị sẹ sị ḅẹẹ, Juughaapụ ma tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́ nyánam, nnị pịghị dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị Mosis ólóghó ma koko.
english_text: Then some of the believers who belonged to the party of the Pharisees stood up and said, “The Gentiles must be circumcised and required to keep the law of Moses.”

ibani_text: Nfịrịmaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma kobirim ḅẹ́ nnị sịbịbie kịẹ anị pịrị.
english_text: The apostles and elders met to consider this question.

ibani_text: Opu nụ́ná kiriakịfama sa nna ogbobie, Pita warị saghị sẹ, ḅẹẹ, Mịnaapụ ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹ́ Ḅọlọmaa sa éné éné Tamuno i sẹ́lẹ́akịm ọmịnị ogboku bie ḅẹ́ a mịị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma Juughaapụ ma pịrị, sị nnị sọ náa sị minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: After much discussion, Peter got up and addressed them: “Brothers, you know that some time ago God made a choice among you that the Gentiles might hear from my lips the message of the gospel and believe.

ibani_text: Tamuno, ori sọ kị́nị́mamgba kóróma nimiḅọ onyẹ́sẹ n pịrịm, ori ọrẹ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa nnị pịrị ḅara, o pịghị pa wa pịrị ḅara.
english_text: God, who knows the heart, showed that he accepted them by giving the Holy Spirit to them, just as he did to us.

ibani_text: Ọ kịrịnyẹ mịẹghaa wamịnị na nna ogbobie; ori nna siiḅụḅarasi n pịrịm, nnị mininim gosi.
english_text: He did not discriminate between us and them, for he purified their hearts by faith.

ibani_text: Anie go, ị tẹ́ go Tamuno daádighi dọghụ, ọmịnị opuma ikúnyẹ pa mininiapụ kuku gbánāarị, wámịna tádọ́apụ na wamịnị ine dighigha ikúnyẹ.
english_text: Now then, why do you try to test God by putting on the necks of Gentiles a yoke that neither we nor our ancestors have been able to bear?

ibani_text: Ọkọ fịnịgha, anịma karakáragha, wa mininim ḅẹ́ wa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, nnị sọ pịghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: No! We believe it is through the grace of our Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ mamgba mịnị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha, nnị Pọl na Banabas náa n dugho págháma sáá, Tamuno n pa nwángịmáa opuma tọ́rụ daa nyẹ na ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị Juughaapụ ma bie.
english_text: The whole assembly became silent as they listened to Barnabas and Paul telling about the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.

ibani_text: Nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́fáma sáá, Jems warị nnị págháraa ḅẹẹ, I Daa awọ Ọmịnị i pughuu.
english_text: When they finished, James spoke up. “Brothers,” he said, “listen to me.

ibani_text: Saimọn mị kirikiri dughofindi wá pịrịmam Tamuno parị Juughaapụ ma na irịa ḅara, sị nna bie túminị́ sẹlẹ́akị ọ ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: Simonhas described to us how God first intervened to choose a people for his name from the Gentiles.

ibani_text: Ikiakoroapụ ma kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ na mịma na ọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ,
english_text: The words of the prophets are in agreement with this, as it is written:

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ,  Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, a pịghịma ḅobẹm. Si Deviti wárị bịghịmáa nyẹ ma sima anị nama, kaá kọsi nyẹ ma, a sima námábẹm si mịẹsị anị ibima kụrọ,
english_text: “ ‘After this I will return and rebuild David’s fallen tent. Its ruins I will rebuild, and I will restore it,

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ tuminikiri gbọrụ i dọghụbẹm na pịghị Juughaapụ mamgba, a sịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị ịyẹa túminị́ sọọ.
english_text: that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord, even all the Gentiles who bear my name, says the Lord, who does these things’—

ibani_text: Anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dugho ḅara, mịnanyẹ ma mịẹsị wa nimiḅo ḅọlọmaa sa éné éné.
english_text: things known from long ago.

ibani_text: Jems warị ḅẹẹ, Ịrị, a sị ḅara, wa ḅụḅáláḅálá pa Juughaapụ ma pịrịbịgha, pịghị sị, saghị Tamuno duaarịapụ.
english_text: “It is my judgment, therefore, that we should not make it difficult for the Gentiles who are turning to God.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha wa ábálálá gịẹ nnị pịrịbẹm ḅẹ́ nnị nna ḅụ fófóoma túminị́ pa igwagwaá oru pịrị fị́nyẹ ḅụ, tegó nnị anị pa igwagwaá oru pịrịm gosi, n pịghị nna ḅụ si yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị ḅụ, ḅẹẹ nnị pịghị n nụ́nụ́ḅa nama pẹẹ́ ma, anịgha pulo ḅuu.
english_text: Instead we should write to them, telling them to abstain from food polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from the meat of strangled animals and from blood.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ n Mosis ologho ma dugho wásámāmam opu ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, saghị ḅọlọma sa éné éné nnị pịghị anị googom nna kobiri yọ ḅụ, nna Ịnyọ́sárá Éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
