english_text: For the law of Moses has been preached in every city from the earliest times and is read in the synagogues on every Sabbath.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, nfịrịmaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma na sọsị gbọrụ warị nna ogbobie jẹa túminị́ sẹlẹakị warị nnị pa Antịọkụ fịrịma, nnị na Pọl na Banabas. Nnị mmẹẹ́ a túminị́ sẹ́lẹ́akịm, mininiapụ ma opuma osigha nyáná pịrịapụ, Judas nnị Basabas pa sịḅọ na Sailas.
english_text: Then the apostles and elders, with the whole church, decided to choose some of their own men and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas (called Barsabbas) and Silas, men who were leaders among the believers.

ibani_text: Nnị warị mị ábálálá ma pa nnị na fịrịmaa: Wamịnị nfịrịmaapụ na sẹ́nịapụ, ọmịnị a mịnaapụ, sịbịpị pa wámịna Juughaapụ mịnaapụ ma sim Antịọkụ ḅụ, Siriya na Silisiya ḅụ ngaapụ.
english_text: With them they sent the following letter: The apostles and elders, your brothers, To the Gentile believers in Antioch, Syria and Cilicia: Greetings.

ibani_text: Wa naam ḅẹ́ wamịnị ḅụ bẹ jẹapụ ḅo ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịmam, pịghị nna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ jẹapụ igánimam. Kụ́ma, wa bịpị pa n pịrị sáá ofori sị nnị n mịẹarịnyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: We have heard that some went out from us without our authorization and disturbed you, troubling your minds by what they said.

ibani_text: Anịgo, wa kobiri ọlọmam, wa pịghị bịpị pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹm ḅẹ́ wa oku múuapụ dọghụ pa ọ fịrịma, nnị na wámịna ibi mịnaapụ Banabas na Pọl,
english_text: So we all agreed to choose some men and send them to you with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul—

ibani_text: nna duma pa nyẹ́sịghaapụ, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais fịrị ma gosi.
english_text: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Wa Judas na Sailas pa ọ fịrịmaarị, n bịpị na diri bie wa gịẹnyẹ ma dugho ọ pịrịbẹapụ.
english_text: Therefore we are sending Judas and Silas to confirm by word of mouth what we are writing.

ibani_text: Anị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅara pịghị wa ḅụ ḅẹ́lẹm ḅẹẹ, wa mịma nẹ́ngịma ikúnyẹ pa opụ́nụ́mámá.
english_text: It seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us not to burden you with anything beyond the following requirements:

ibani_text: Ọmịnị nnị pa igwagwaá oru pịrị nama pẹẹ́ ma, pulo oju ḅụ págháḅoarị nama pẹẹ́ ma, n pịghị nnị nụ́nụ́ḅa nama pẹẹ́ ma, ọ pịghị ọ ḅụ si yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị ḅụ. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ ḅụ warị warịị mịnanyẹ ma ḅụ, ọmịnị ibiḅara mịẹbẹm. Ọmịnị ibima fịnị.
english_text: You are to abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality. You will do well to avoid these things. Farewell.

ibani_text: Oku ḅoapụ ma nnị n fịrịma sọm, n warị Antịọkụ muu, nnị warị mininiapụ mamgba kobiri, warị ábálálá ma pa n pịrịị.
english_text: So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch, where they gathered the church together and delivered the letter.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma diri ma goo sáá, anị bieḅẹlẹ pa n pịrịm anị bie fịnị tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ gosi.
english_text: The people read it and were glad for its encouraging message.

ibani_text: Judas na Sailas nnị ḅụgbọrụ ikiakoroapụ, sáá faá ma nnị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọm sị pịghị ịnyọ pa nna ḅụ suam.
english_text: Judas and Silas, who themselves were prophets, said much to encourage and strengthen the believers.

ibani_text: Nnị kẹ́lẹ́ anị angaá fịnị fama sa, mininiapụ ma diin ḅụ n fịrịma sọm, nnị warị pịghịma so n fịrịmaapụ damamu.
english_text: After spending some time there, they were sent off by the believers with the blessing of peace to return to those who had sent them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị Silas ḅụ na ibim ḅẹ́ ori anị ngá pa fịnịị.
english_text: However, Silas decided to stay there.

ibani_text: Pọl na Banabas Antịọkụ ḅụ kẹ́lẹ́ sáá fámam Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma diearị pịghị anị dugho pághámaarị nnị na tọgha jẹapụ na.
english_text: But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, where they and many others taught and preached the word of the Lord.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Pọl warị Banabas ḅẹẹ, Ḅo wa mú sima mininiapụ ma dighi ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, wa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma dugho wásáma pịrịmáapụ, sị nimiḅo nnị nwángikọarị ḅara.
english_text: Some time later Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the believers in all the towns where we preached the word of the Lord and see how they are doing.”

ibani_text: Banabas dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ ọ Jọn nnị pịghị Mak pa sịḅọ, sị n ḅụ sua,
english_text: Barnabas wanted to take John, also called Mark, with them,

ibani_text: kụ́ma Pọl sim ḅẹ́ anị karakáragha, tegó ori n warịsom Pamfiliya ḅụ, pịghị nnị na fịnị fịrị ma nwángị mú sịbịlamáaḅọ akị muu.
english_text: but Paul did not think it wise to take him, because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not continued with them in the work.

ibani_text: Opu nụ́ná nna ogboku bie korom anịgo nnị warị n ḅụ fófóoma, Banabas warị Mak akị warị Saiprọs muu.
english_text: They had such a sharp disagreement that they parted company. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,

ibani_text: Pọl, Sailas sẹlẹakịm sị soo, mininiapụ ma warị n saghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ sua.
english_text: but Paul chose Silas and left, commended by the believers to the grace of the Lord.

ibani_text: O Siriya na Silisiya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́m ịnyọ pa sọsị ma ḅụ suaarị.
english_text: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

ibani_text: Pọl nyẹ́mu mú Dẹẹbụ lam sị anị ngá ḅọ́rọ́ mú Listira láa, gbẹ́rẹ́ Krais ọḅụduaḅọ Timoti ngá angaá, o nyingi, árị sọ mininiḅọ pịghị Juu ḅo, kụ́ma ọ daa Girikiḅọ.
english_text: Paul came to Derbe and then to Lystra, where a disciple named Timothy lived, whose mother was Jewish and a believer but whose father was a Greek.

ibani_text: Mininiapụ mamgba Listira na Aikoniyọm ḅụ Timoti ḅụ ibi dughom.
english_text: The believers at Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him.

ibani_text: Pọl Timoti akị mú dọ́ghụm anịgo, ori ọ tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́m. O go mịma mịẹnyẹ, anị ngaa ngaa Juuapụ mamgba nimim ḅẹ́ Timoti daa ori Girikiḅọ.
english_text: Paul wanted to take him along on the journey, so he circumcised him because of the Jews who lived in that area, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

ibani_text: Nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ ama wáriso mú isi ngányẹ láa sáá, nnị nfịrịmaapụ ma na sọsị sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ bịpị Jerusalem ḅụ dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ, n mịná ologho ma wárii.
english_text: As they traveled from town to town, they delivered the decisions reached by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma sọsị ma minini ḅụ ḅo sẹ kụrọm pịghị saghị sẹ́nị kịẹbịpị ḅụ éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Frigiya na Galesia párángáa ḅọ́rọ́ nna mú nyẹ ma muu, tegó Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma minigha sị nnị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ.
english_text: Paul and his companions traveled throughout the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been kept by the Holy Spirit from preaching the word in the province of Asia.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Misiya na dama dama sa, nnị asọ dọ́ghụm bẹ nnị ine ḅọ́rọ́ Bitiniya sọọ, kụ́ma Jizọs Tẹ́mẹ́ mini n pịrịgha.
english_text: When they came to the border of Mysia, they tried to enter Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus would not allow them to.

ibani_text: Anịgo n gbẹ́rẹ́sa Misiya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mú Troas lam.
english_text: So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.

ibani_text: Anị éné dii ma ḅụ Pọl múnogha dáwọkọm gbẹ́rẹ́ Masidoniya ḅo, sẹ́fịnị sị o tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅo ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ Masidoniya ḅoo sị ḅárásua wa pịrịị.
english_text: During the night Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and begging him, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”

ibani_text: Pọl mị múnogha dáwọ ma a árịfáma gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, wamịnị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri tẹ́lẹ́mam sị sághị Masidoniya muum tegó wa tọpẹ́lẹ́m ḅẹ́ Tamuno wa sịmam ḅẹ́ wa ḅo ori ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa anị ngaa.
english_text: After Paul had seen the vision, we got ready at once to leave for Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

ibani_text: Wa vála árụ́ pa wámịna muunyẹ ma muum, warị Troas ḅụ sáḅá kóró mú Samotarase láa, warị mmẹẹ́ kárámá éné mú Niapolis láa.
english_text: From Troas we put out to sea and sailed straight for Samothrace, and the next day we went on to Neapolis.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa wa ḅọ́rọ́ mú Filipai lam, Masidoniya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ ama, ama ma so Rom sughubie imii, wa tọgha dii fịnịm anị ngaa.
english_text: From there we traveled to Philippi, a Roman colony and the leading city of that districtof Macedonia. And we stayed there several days.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅụ wamịnị ama bie ma warịsom sị mingi aka muu, wa sị ngaa ḅẹ́ wa Juuapụ árịbẹm nnị kobiri sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ angaá, Wamịnị anị ngaa kpọrọfịnị sị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ anị ngaa kobiri ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate to the river, where we expected to find a place of prayer. We sat down and began to speak to the women who had gathered there.

ibani_text: Lidiya, Tiyatira ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ anịị wa naáapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, opu igbii láa bịtẹ anịị a dẹrịarị nyẹ. Mịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma anịị susi Tamuno pịrịarị ọ́rụ́ḅọ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị a kúkúbie findi sị a birifama Pọl dugho pághámaarị oku ma pịrịm
english_text: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

ibani_text: Arị na a wárịbieapụ mingi sara fama sáá, a warị nnị sịị, O ḅo i wárịbie fịnị, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mininimam ḅẹ́, ịrị karakárá mininiḅọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ. Á warị bịpị pa wa tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ wa sọọ ḅoo.
english_text: When she and the members of her household were baptized, she invited us to her home. “If you consider me a believer in the Lord,” she said, “come and stay at my house.” And she persuaded us.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné wa tẹ́ghẹ̄ yọ muarị sáá, wa gbẹ́rẹ́ omoni ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ na donam, sitẹ́mẹ́ nyánáḅọ, mịẹsị árị ine tórúku mịẹbẹnyẹ dugho págháma, a pịghị opu igbii mịẹ a nyánáapụ pịrịm, a tórúku mịẹbẹnyẹ dugho pághámarị ḅara.
english_text: Once when we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a female slave who had a spirit by which she predicted the future. She earned a great deal of money for her owners by fortune-telling.

ibani_text: A Pọl na wamịnị duaarị, ilúghuarị ḅẹẹ, Mịná túminị́ ma anịị Sóghólóḅa Tamuno ma fịrịnwangịapụ! Nnị dugho ọ pịrịarị ọmịnị ine ḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: She followed Paul and the rest of us, shouting, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who are telling you the way to be saved.”

ibani_text: A pa mịnyẹ ma mịẹnyẹ, anị tọgha dii ákịm anị warị ḅo Pọl tẹ́mẹ́ iganima, ọ warị pịghị sị igani a ḅụ fị́nị sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrị ḅẹẹ, Jizọs Krais ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ a tọ́ọ ị pịrịm págháḅo árị oju bie. Tẹ́mẹ́ ma árị oju bie págháḅom anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri.
english_text: She kept this up for many days. Finally Paul became so annoyed that he turned around and said to the spirit, “In the name of Jesus Christ I command you to come out of her!” At that moment the spirit left her.

ibani_text: Á nyánáapụ árị sáá ḅẹ́ nna igbii mịẹ asọ pụụmam, nnị Pọl na Sailas kuum sị nnị fọ́nọ́ nna sịbịdaapụ tórúku mú nna ámáogbo ḅụ.
english_text: When her owners realized that their hope of making money was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace to face the authorities.

ibani_text: Nnị n pa Rom ḅẹrẹkọọapụ ma tórúku ḅom warị ḅẹẹ, Mịnaapụ ma nnị Juuapụ, nnị pịghị opu ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighiarị wamịna opu ama bie.
english_text: They brought them before the magistrates and said, “These men are Jews, and are throwing our city into an uproar

ibani_text: Nnị wámịna ologho na kuragha mịẹmịẹnyẹ anịị n diearị nyẹẹ. Wamịnị Romapụ wamịnị ine mịnanyẹ ma daákịbịgha, anịgha anị pa fịrị ḅụ suu.
english_text: by advocating customs unlawful for us Romans to accept or practice.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma warị kundu sua sị owu pa Pọl na Sailas pághámam, sịbịdaapụ ma warị Pọl na Sailas bịtẹ nụ́nụ́ka, warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị n fomu.
english_text: The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas, and the magistrates ordered them to be stripped and beaten with rods.

ibani_text: Nnị ibiḅara pa n fomu fama sáá, nnị n pa ịkóli wárịbie gbi suam, warị ikóliwarị kuruḅọ ma ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ ori ibima nnị ikasii.
english_text: After they had been severely flogged, they were thrown into prison, and the jailer was commanded to guard them carefully.

ibani_text: Ikóliwarị kuruḅọ ma, o ḅo mịma náa sáá ori nnị pa biebẹ ikóliwarị ma bie gbii suam, warị nna ḅụọ pa opu dapịrị ogbobie kpọọ warị.
english_text: When he received these orders, he put them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.

ibani_text: Dii ogbo Pọl na Sailas tẹ́ghẹ̄arị pịghị boma núme suu Tamuno pịrịarị ikólinaapụ ma sọ n pughuarị.
english_text: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri tuminikiri jighe kiriakịm opuma, mú ikóliwarị ma sughu isé jighema nyẹ. Anị kirikiri ḅụ́pọ́ mamgba findim, nnị pịghị pa ikólinaapụ mamgba kpọ suenị ma pịghị pẹlẹ kóróm.
english_text: Suddenly there was such a violent earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken. At once all the prison doors flew open, and everyone’s chains came loose.

ibani_text: Ikóliwarị kuruḅọ ma múno ḅụ naáḅo sa sị árị ḅẹẹ ikóliwarị ḅụ́pọ́ ma findimam, o sim ḅẹ́ ikólinaapụ ma mangimam, ọ warị ori afaragada nụnụ pághámaḅo sị ọ ḅụ timi ḅa dọ́ghụm.
english_text: The jailer woke up, and when he saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself because he thought the prisoners had escaped.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl pụghọ gbéréma ilúghum ọ sịbị, ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa ịḅụ mịẹma, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba mịnga wamịnị imii.
english_text: But Paul shouted, “Don’t harm yourself! We are all here!”

ibani_text: Ikóliwarị kúrúḅọ ma tọndọ gbilam, warị mangị ikóliwarị ma sọọ, jighe jighearị ḅáláfaa ḅụ ọ warị bịghịkoro Pọl na Sailas ḅụọ.
english_text: The jailer called for lights, rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas.

ibani_text: Ọ warị n pághámaḅo warị gbíla ḅẹẹ, Nyẹ́dieapụ, a tẹ́ mịẹbẹ sị ḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná?
english_text: He then brought them out and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pagharam, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ minini sị i ḅọrọma nyánábẹm ịrị na ị wárị na.
english_text: They replied, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved—you and your household.”

ibani_text: Nnị wárị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ ọ pịrị, na pịghị kọọ wárị ma bie fịnịapụ mamgba pịrị
english_text: Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all the others in his house.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ dii ma bie, ikóliwarị kúrúḅọ ma nna akịm sị nna ịnọ siri, ori na ọ wárị gbọrụ anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri mingi saram.
english_text: At that hour of the night the jailer took them and washed their wounds; then immediately he and all his household were baptized.

ibani_text: Ọ warị Pọl na Sailas si akị ọ warị ḅo, warị fị́nyẹ pa n pịrị fịị. Ori na ọ wárị gbọrụ ḅo opuma bieḅẹlẹm, tegó ḅẹ́ mị́sa nnị Tamuno ḅụ mininimam.
english_text: The jailer brought them into his house and set a meal before them; he was filled with joy because he had come to believe in God—he and his whole household.

ibani_text: Anị éné ḅa, dedebie Rom sịbịdaapụ ma Oḅoroasawọ ma fịrịmam, Ḅẹẹ nnị n wáriso sị nnị soo.
english_text: When it was daylight, the magistrates sent their officers to the jailer with the order: “Release those men.”

ibani_text: Ikóliwarị kúrúḅọ ma warị dugho Pọl pịrị, ḅẹẹ, Sịbịdaapụ ma fịrịmamam ḅẹ́ wamịnị ịrị na Sailas wáriso sị o soo. Anịgo ọ págháḅo sị soo diin ḅụ.
english_text: The jailer told Paul, “The magistrates have ordered that you and Silas be released. Now you can leave. Go in peace.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl Oḅoroasawọ ma ḅẹm, Nnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa wámịna ḅara ḅẹ́rẹ́ simagha, anịsọ n pa ámáogbo ḅụ wa fomum, wamịnị sọ pịghị Romapụ, nnị warị pịghị wa pa ikólibie gbi sua. Mị́sa nnị ḅọghu ḅara pa wa wáriso dọ́ghụm wa soo? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori, nnị Rom sịbịdaapụ ma ḅara na ḅo wa pághámaḅo.
english_text: But Paul said to the officers: “They beat us publicly without a trial, even though we are Roman citizens, and threw us into prison. And now do they want to get rid of us quietly? No! Let them come themselves and escort us out.”

ibani_text: Oḅoroasawọ ma mịma dugho Rom sịbịdaapụ ma pịrịm, n ḅo pịghị náa sáá ḅẹ́, Pọl na Sailas nnị Romapụ opu ḅáláfa nna bie sọm.
english_text: The officers reported this to the magistrates, and when they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens, they were alarmed.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅo nnị tẹ́ghẹ̄ẹ̄ sị, n pághámaḅo ikóliwarị ma bie, nnị warị dugho n pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị ama ma wárịso.
english_text: They came to appease them and escorted them from the prison, requesting them to leave the city.

ibani_text: Pọl na Sailas ikóliwarị ma warịsom sị Lidiya wárị muu. Anị ngá nnị mininiapụ ma na donam sị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ nnị pịrị sị soo.
english_text: After Paul and Silas came out of the prison, they went to Lydia’s house, where they met with the brothers and sisters and encouraged them. Then they left.

ibani_text: Pọl na Sailas nna muunyẹ múm Amfipolis na Apoloniya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sị ḅoo Tẹ́salonaika lam nnị Juuapụ kobiri yọ árị ngaa.
english_text: When Paul and his companions had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

ibani_text: Ori nyẹ́ mịẹmịẹ ḅara Pọl kobiri yọ ma sọm. Anị angaá tẹ́rẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ọ pa túminị́ ma na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ nyánam Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ́ dughoarị,
english_text: As was his custom, Paul went into the synagogue, and on three Sabbath days he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,

ibani_text: anị dugho findiarị, pịghị die pághámaarị ḅẹẹ n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm sị pịghị fịị ḅụ saghị. Pọl warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị Jizọs ma, a o gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámaarịḅọ ma, ori anịị Tamuno Pulo pa Sịbị Sara ḅo.
english_text: explaining and proving that the Messiah had to suffer and rise from the dead. “This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Messiah,” he said.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ jẹapụ mịnyẹ ma n ḅụ́koróm, n warị Pọl na Sailas dua, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị sịbịdá ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma na pịghị Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarị Girikiapụ ma sọ n dua ḅara.
english_text: Some of the Jews were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, as did a large number of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few prominent women.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa Juuapụ ḅo nyẹ́mọ́nịm, warị ḅẹ́rẹ́dọghu dii túminị́ kobiri, nnị warị ama ma pịghị silé na kam sọ yọ mịẹsị Jasọn pa sịḅọ wárị fomu kaá, n pa Pọl na Sailas dọghụ pághámaḅo túminị́ ma pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: But other Jews were jealous; so they rounded up some bad characters from the marketplace, formed a mob and started a riot in the city. They rushed to Jason’s house in search of Paul and Silas in order to bring them out to the crowd.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ine nna arịgha ḅara ma, nnị warị Jasọn na jẹ́ mininiapụ fọ́nọ́ mú ámá sịbịdaapụ ma tórúku kóróma, sị ilúghuu ḅẹẹ, Mịná owiapụ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́dighimam angaá mamgba ḅụ! Mị́sa nnị wámịna opu ama sọ ḅomam,
english_text: But when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some other believers before the city officials, shouting: “These men who have caused trouble all over the world have now come here,

ibani_text: Jasọn pịghị mịná túminị́ ma dátérémámam ọ wárị. Nnị Siza ma ológhó mamgba kaarị pịghị dughoarị ḅẹ́ jẹ́ ámányánáḅọ imii Jizọs pa sịḅọ.
english_text: and Jason has welcomed them into his house. They are all defying Caesar’s decrees, saying that there is another king, one called Jesus.”

ibani_text: Mịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma n túminị́ kpo ma na opu ama sịbịdaapụ ma suma silé na kam ḅụ suam.
english_text: When they heard this, the crowd and the city officials were thrown into turmoil.

ibani_text: Sịbịdaapụ ma mịẹm sị Jasọn na isiapụ ma n pẹ́lẹ́ igbii ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ sị nna ḅụ pághámaḅo sị n warị nnị wáriso sị soo.
english_text: Then they made Jason and the others post bond and let them go.

ibani_text: Dii bie láa gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anịị mininiapụ ma Pọl na Sailas fịrịma Beriya muu nyẹ́. Nnị anị ngaa láa sáá, nnị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọm.
english_text: As soon as it was night, the believers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea. On arriving there, they went to the Jewish synagogue.

ibani_text: Mịnga fịnị túminị́ ma tẹ́mẹ́ sárásárá Tẹ́salonaika ḅụ fịnịapụ ma nẹngịm. Nnị birifama oku ma pughum éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, nnị pịghị Tọ́ndiri ma dáwọm sị nimidọghu Pọl pa n dienyẹ́ ma ḅọ́rọ́ karakárá.
english_text: Now the Berean Jews were of more noble character than those in Thessalonica, for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if what Paul said was true.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ tọghaapụ mininim, nna ẹrẹ opu kiri ḅụ fịnịapụ na pịghị Giriki owiapụ sọ mininim.
english_text: As a result, many of them believed, as did also a number of prominent Greek women and many Greek men.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tẹ́salonaika ḅụ fịnị Juuapụ náa sáá ḅẹ́ Pọl Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámaarị Beriya ḅụ, nnị anị ngaa ḅom sị túminị́ ma timi saghị n ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighi bẹ ḅara.
english_text: But when the Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was preaching the word of God at Berea, some of them went there too, agitating the crowds and stirring them up.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri mininiapụ ma Pọl fịrịma posie aka múm; kụ́ma Sailas na Timoti Beriya ḅụ ọḅụkọ fịnịm.
english_text: The believers immediately sent Paul to the coast, but Silas and Timothy stayed at Berea.

ibani_text: Pọl ḅọ́rọ́maarị owiapụ ma, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma mú Atensi lam sị pịghịma Beriya ḅo, warị Pọl ḅara oku akuoo ḅẹẹ Sailas na Timoti ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ ḅo ọ damaḅo.
english_text: Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and then left with instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as soon as possible.

ibani_text: Pọl Atensi ḅụ Sailas na Timoti kúruarị sáá, ọ ḅo árị ḅom n kárá tamuno ámá ma bie bi ḅara, anị warị opuma ọ tẹ́mẹ́ iganima.
english_text: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, he was greatly distressed to see that the city was full of idols.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ warị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ, Juuapụ na Juughaapụ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaarịapụ ma na dughonyẹ́ nyána ọ pịghị éné gbọrụ gbọrụ ámáogbo ma ḅoapụ na dughonyẹ́ nyánáarị.
english_text: So he reasoned in the synagogue with both Jews and God-fearing Greeks, as well as in the marketplace day by day with those who happened to be there.

ibani_text: Epikuriya na Stoyiki, opu nyẹ́dieapụ ọ nana nụnam, nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ o gbilam ḅẹẹ, Mịị tẹ́ nyẹ́nimigha dughonyẹ? Jẹapụ pagharam ḅẹ́ jẹ́ ámá oru gbólómanyẹ anịị o dughoarị nyẹ. Nnị mịma dughom Pọl Jizọs Krais gboloma ibi oku na fịị ḅụ saghị dugho wásámaarị gosi.
english_text: A group of Epicurean and Stoic philosophers began to debate with him. Some of them asked, “What is this babbler trying to say?” Others remarked, “He seems to be advocating foreign gods.” They said this because Paul was preaching the good news about Jesus and the resurrection.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Pọl akuoo pa nna ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ kobiri ogbo ma ḅo, nnị pa Ariyopagọs sị nyẹ warị ḅẹẹ, Wa nimi dọ́ghụm mị ịwọ dienyẹ ma, ịrị anị gbolomanyẹ dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: Then they took him and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus, where they said to him, “May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting?

ibani_text: Wa náa sị ị dughoarị jẹa nyẹ́ ma, jẹ́ éné na wa naagha, wa nimi dọ́ghụm anị fiearị nyẹ.
english_text: You are bringing some strange ideas to our ears, and we would like to know what they mean.”

ibani_text: (Ḅẹ́ Atensi amaapụ na pịghị anị angaá ngaa igoniapụ mamgba jẹ́ nyẹ mịẹgha, kụ́ma nna sáá ngúmá sị mị ịwọ nyẹ ma dughoarị pịghị anị naarị.)
english_text: (All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there spent their time doing nothing but talking about and listening to the latest ideas.)

ibani_text: Pọl warị Ariyopagọs ogboku ḅụ sẹ, warị ḅẹẹ, Atensiapụ! A arịm ḅẹ́, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ Tamuno nimiapụ kịkam.
english_text: Paul then stood up in the meeting of the Areopagus and said: “People of Athens! I see that in every way you are very religious.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, a ámá ma bie nwángị ḅọ́rọ́ sáá sị ọmịna tẹ́ghẹ̄ angaá dighi, a gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ arịm, nnị mịnyẹ ma gịẹnyẹ:
english_text: For as I walked around and looked carefully at your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription:to an unknown god. So you are ignorant of the very thing you worship—and this is what I am going to proclaim to you.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ tuminikiri ná nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ Tamuno ma, Ori pịghị so na kiri ma Nyánáḅọ, túminị́ ḅara pa nama wárịbie ngaa ngaagha.
english_text: “The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples built by human hands.

ibani_text: Anịgha o bi sị wamịnị ine pa ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ imii, anị túminị́ fịrịnwangị kị́nị́ pịrịarị ḅara. Wa nimi sáá ḅẹ́ ori anịị duma na ịnyọ pịrịarịḅọ, na pịghị tumḅọ binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: And he is not served by human hands, as if he needed anything. Rather, he himself gives everyone life and breath and everything else.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ tẹmẹm, sị mịẹsị n tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ ngaa. Ori ma pịghị sáá pẹ́lẹm pịghị nnị ngaa kunema bẹ ngaa tọ wárịmam ḅọlọ sa éné éné.
english_text: From one man he made all the nations, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and he marked out their appointed times in history and the boundaries of their lands.

ibani_text: Tamuno mịma mịẹm nnị o dọghụ bẹ ḅara, sị pịghị ine ọ dọghụ pághámaḅo pịghị nnị ngámámgba ḅụ ọ dọghụ ḅara, tụ́manyẹ Tamuno wámịna ḅụ ọ ḅọlọ́ angaá ḅụ oforii.
english_text: God did this so that they would seek him and perhaps reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from any one of us.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅụbie anịị wa duma kọọ nyẹ, pịghị nwángị kọọ ikéle, ọ ḅụbie anịị wa túminị́ sọnyẹ. Ọmịna jẹa núme gịẹapụ dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ, Wámịnị sọ ori awọọ.
english_text: ‘For in him we live and move and have our being.’As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are his offspring.’

ibani_text: Wamịnị Tamuno awọ gosi, anị ibighaa ḅẹ́ wa kóróma ḅẹ́ Tamuno fịnị ḅara anịị nnị odoḅala anịgha pị́naḅala pa tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ anịgha túminị́ opu níminyẹ na túminị́ ḅara fịrị mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: “Therefore since we are God’s offspring, we should not think that the divine being is like gold or silver or stone—an image made by human design and skill.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá, túminị́ Tamuno nimigha sáá ori n dighi tọ́rụ́sim, warị tọ ḅẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna sii ḅụ pịghịị.
english_text: In the past God overlooked such ignorance, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent.

ibani_text: Tegó ọ sáá pẹ́lẹ́mam o tuminikiri sịbị gbọrụ ori ọ ḅara na sẹlẹakịḅọ ma pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹnyẹ karakárá ḅụ. Ọ mịma diepágháma kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm ọ fịị ḅụ ọ saghịma ḅara.
english_text: For he has set a day when he will judge the world with justice by the man he has appointed. He has given proof of this to everyone by raising him from the dead.”

ibani_text: Nnị náa sáá Pọl fịị ḅụ saghị gbólómanyẹ dugho sáá jẹapụ ọ kpọtim, kụ́ma jẹapụ ḅẹ́ẹ́m ḅẹẹ, Wa sima ị bịpị mịma náa dọ́ghụm.
english_text: When they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some of them sneered, but others said, “We want to hear you again on this subject.”

ibani_text: Pọl warị kubiri ogbo ma wáriso.
english_text: At that, Paul left the Council.

ibani_text: Jẹa owiapụ ḅo o duam sị pịghị mininii, Dionisiosi pịghị nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, pịghị ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, nnị Damaris pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nna bie imii, na pịghị jẹapụ na.
english_text: Some of the people became followers of Paul and believed. Among them was Dionysius, a member of the Areopagus, also a woman named Damaris, and a number of others.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Pọl Atensi warịsom sị Kọrịntị muu.
english_text: After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ Juuḅọ, Akwila pa sịḅọ, Pọntus ḅụ nnị yiiḅọ na donam, na ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ ori na ọ táa Pirisiliya Ịtalị ḅụ saghịḅom, tegó Sẹ́ Táaḅọ Klaudiosi tọ́ọ́ḅọ́rọ́mam ḅẹ́ Juuapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Rom warịsoo. Pọl múm ḅẹ́ ori nna arịị.
english_text: There he met a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to see them,

ibani_text: Ori nnị na fịnịm pịghị nnị na fịrịnwangịị tegó bịtẹ pa wárị nama fịrị anịị ọ nwángị sị pa ọ ḅụ siḅearị nyẹ nnị ma sọ nwángịarị ḅara.
english_text: and because he was a tentmaker as they were, he stayed and worked with them.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá Éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori nnị na dughonyẹ nyáná nyánam asọ dọghụarị ọ mịẹsị Juuapụ na Juughaapụ minini bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Every Sabbath he reasoned in the synagogue, trying to persuade Jews and Greeks.

ibani_text: Sailas na Timoti ḅo Masidoniya láa sáá, Pọl ori sáá fámam, Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámaarị, pịghị dugho págháma Juuapụ ma pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, Jizọs ori anịị n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma.
english_text: When Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself exclusively to preaching, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Messiah.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma ọ nana jine jine sáá pịghị wirinumo pa ọ wiri nna ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa siinyẹ fie ọ pịrị, ori ọ ḅụ suaḅịtẹ́ ḅụ fịnị fọọ gugu kórómam sị warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọmịna pulo ọmịna sịbị gbánaá! Irị i ḅara fiafiam. Mị́sa sághị bịpị muu, a Juughaapụ ma dámámubẹm.
english_text: But when they opposed Paul and became abusive, he shook out his clothes in protest and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am innocent of it. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n wáriso sị so mú gbẹ́rẹ́ Juughaa ḅọ n Taitọs Jọstọs pa sịḅọ na ngaa, Tamuno nimi tumḅọ, ịrị ọ wárị ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma lam.
english_text: Then Paul left the synagogue and went next door to the house of Titius Justus, a worshiper of God.

ibani_text: Krispus, Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sịbịdáḅọ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ mininim, ori na ọ warị gbọrụ, tọgha jẹapụ Kọrịntị ḅụ Pọl dugho wásáma oku ma naam, anị ḅụ mininim n pịghị mingi pa n saram.
english_text: Crispus, the synagogue leader, and his entire household believed in the Lord; and many of the Corinthians who heard Paul believed and were baptized.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dugho Pọl pịrịm múnogha dáwọ ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Ḅáláfama, pa ị dughoarị nyẹ ma dugho, anị ḅụ ḅarasima.
english_text: One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision:“Do not be afraid; keep on speaking, do not be silent.

ibani_text: A ị nana imi, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine nyẹ́ pa ị lámábịgha, ḅẹ́ a tọgha túminị́ nyanam mịị ámá bie.
english_text: For I am with you, and no one is going to attack and harm you, because I have many people in this city.”

ibani_text: Pọl warị anị ngaa gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rá na mpara fịnịị Tamunoẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pa túminị́ ma diearị.
english_text: So Paul stayed in Corinth for a year and a half, teaching them the word of God.

ibani_text: N Galileo pa Rom ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ miẹsa Akaya ḅụ, anị ngaa fịnị Juuapụ ma nna ḅụ kobirim sị Pọl kuu ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ yọ muu.
english_text: While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews of Corinth made a united attack on Paul and brought him to the place of judgment.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ori asọ dọghụarị ọ mịẹsị túminị́ susi Tamuno pịrị wámịna ológhó na karakáragha ḅara!
english_text: “This man,” they charged, “is persuading the people to worship God in ways contrary to the law.”

ibani_text: Pọl ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ dọ́ghụm, Galileo Juuapụ ma ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ ọ tumḅọ miẹsima nyẹ, anịgha tumḅọ koro opu ologho gosi nḅẹḅẹ́, anị ibibẹm a ọmịnị Juuapụ ma pughuu tumḅọ ine ngịrịma nyána ọmịnị Juuapụ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Just as Paul was about to speak, Gallio said to them, “If you Jews were making a complaint about some misdemeanor or serious crime, it would be reasonable for me to listen to you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, mị́sa, anị ḅo nụnanyẹ sọmaá ḅara ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, na pịghị ọmịnị ólóghó, ọmịnị ọ ḅara na anị tẹ́lẹ́ma, a ọkọfịnịnyẹ ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ sọbịgha!
english_text: But since it involves questions about words and names and your own law—settle the matter yourselves. I will not be a judge of such things.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị n deesi ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ wárị ma bie.
english_text: So he drove them off.

ibani_text: Nnị wárị Sostines, kobiri yọ ma sịbịdaḅọ kuu sị ibima o fomu ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ wárị ma tórúku, kụ́ma mịma Galileo oju jighémagha.
english_text: Then the crowd there turned on Sosthenes the synagogue leader and beat him in front of the proconsul; and Gallio showed no concern whatever.

ibani_text: Pọl mininiapụ ma náa tọgha dii fịnịm Kọrịntị ḅụ, ọ warị n wáriso, ori na Pirisiliya na Akwila warị vála sua dọghụ so Siriya muu. Na ọ Sẹnkiriya ḅụ dọghụ pághámagha sáá, ori ọ sịbị ịsẹm, o minini nyẹ gosi.
english_text: Paul stayed on in Corinth for some time. Then he left the brothers and sisters and sailed for Syria, accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila. Before he sailed, he had his hair cut off at Cenchreae because of a vow he had taken.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ sọmám, Pọl, Pirisiliya na Akwila warịsom sị Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọ sị mú Juuapụ ma na dughonyẹ nyána.
english_text: They arrived at Ephesus, where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila. He himself went into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma ọ ḅẹm ḅẹ́ ọ kẹ́lẹ́ fịnị ḅọlọọ, kụ́ma, ọmịnị n puughaa.
english_text: When they asked him to spend more time with them, he declined.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma, ori n ḅẹm o soarị sáá ḅẹẹ, Anị ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ḅụ́ḅẹ́lẹ́ḅẹlẹ, a pịghịma ọ dámáḅobẹm. Anịị ọ warị suasi Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ.
english_text: But as he left, he promised, “I will come back if it is God’s will.” Then he set sail from Ephesus.

ibani_text: O ḅọ Sizariya láa sáá, o ḅọ́rọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ soo Jerusalem múm sị ori anị ngaa fịnị sọsị ma kule ọ warị anị ngaa kóró mú Antịọkụ láa.
english_text: When he landed at Caesarea, he went up to Jerusalem and greeted the church and then went down to Antioch.

ibani_text: Ọ kẹ́lẹ́ anị ngaa sáá ngúmá fama sáá, ori anị ngaa ma warịsom sị ámá ámá muu Galesia na Frigiya parangáa fịnị ámá gbọrụ, sị mininiapụ mamgba tẹ́mẹ́bie kụ́rọ́máarị.
english_text: After spending some time in Antioch, Paul set out from there and traveled from place to place throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ Juu owitụ́wọ nnị Apọlọs pa sịḅọ, Alegizandiriya ḅụ n yiiḅọ Ẹ́fịsọs ḅom. Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọ́ọdim, pịghị ibiḅara pa Tọ́ndiri ma nimii.
english_text: Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, came to Ephesus. He was a learned man, with a thorough knowledge of the Scriptures.

ibani_text: Nnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ ma pa o diemam, ọ pịghị ịnyọsua ḅara pa Jizọs gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámam pịghị karakárá ḅara pa anị die. Anị fịnị ḅara, Jọn mingi sara ngéré anịị o niminyẹẹ.
english_text: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord, and he spoke with great fervorand taught about Jesus accurately, though he knew only the baptism of John.

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Pirisiliya na Akwila ḅo ọ náa sáá, nnị ọ sị wárị ḅom, warị ibiḅara pa Tamuno asọ ma dughofindi ọ pịrị.
english_text: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they invited him to their home and explained to him the way of God more adequately.

ibani_text: Apọlọs warị ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́ sị warị ḅọ́rọ́ Akaya muu, Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ ma ḅárásua ọ pịrịm, nnị ábálálá gịẹ pa Akaya ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị ọ daa kórómaa. Ori anị ngaa láa sáá, o ḅo opu ḅárásua ḅo sọ, Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo mininimáapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: When Apollos wanted to go to Achaia, the brothers and sisters encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there to welcome him. When he arrived, he was a great help to those who by grace had believed.

ibani_text: Ori kụrọ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ nụ́náarị ḅara ọ Juuapụ ma kọọḅam, kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, ọ Tọ́ndiri ma bie saghị die pághámaarị ḅara ḅẹẹ Jizọs Krais ori anịị n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma.
english_text: For he vigorously refuted his Jewish opponents in public debate, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Messiah.

ibani_text: Apọlọs pa Kọrịntị ḅụ fịnịarị sáá. Pọl Galesia na Frigiya parangáa ḅọ́rọ́ Ẹ́fịsọs múm. Anị ngaa anịị o jẹa Krais ọḅụduaapụ árịnyẹ,
english_text: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul took the road through the interior and arrived at Ephesus. There he found some disciples

ibani_text: warị n gbíla ḅẹẹ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, anị ọmịna bie sọ sị ọmịnị anị nyánáakị o minini sáá? Nnị warị pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Jẹ́ éné na wa naagha ḅẹ́ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa siinyẹ imim.
english_text: and asked them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit whenyou believed?” They answered, “No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”

ibani_text: Pọl warị n gbíla, Tọrọ́ fịnị mingi sara nnị pa ọ sara nyẹ? Nnị warị ọ pagharaa Jọn mingi sara.
english_text: So Paul asked, “Then what baptism did you receive?” “John’s baptism,” they replied.

ibani_text: Pọl ḅo ḅẹẹ, Jọn mingi sára ma fịnị pịrịapụ anịị nna sii ḅụ pịghịmaapụ. Ọ pịghị dugho Izirẹlịapụ pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị ori ọ ḅụ kunema ḅoo bẹḅọ ma ḅụ minini, anịị Jizọs ḅụ.
english_text: Paul said, “John’s baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.”

ibani_text: Nnị mịma náa sa, n warị mingi pa n sárá Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ḅụ.
english_text: On hearing this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Pọl ọ ḅara pa nna ọgọnọ gbánam, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị n koro; sị nnị warị kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sị pịghị ikiakoro.
english_text: When Paul placed his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke in tonguesand prophesied.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba túminị́ oyi mmẹapụ findi.
english_text: There were about twelve men in all.

ibani_text: Pọl Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma sọm, sị tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ sịbị, ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọ wásáma, tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara pa asọ dọghụ sị anị nna ḅụ koro Tamuno amadakiri ma gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: Paul entered the synagogue and spoke boldly there for three months, arguing persuasively about the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nna ḅụ jẹapụ sịbị kụrọm, sị mịnị mininigha, pịghị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, nnị si ḅẹ́lẹ̄ fie Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ ma pịrịm. Pọl warị n wárịso, warị mininiapụ ma sị ọ ḅụ pịrịm, sị éné gbọrụ nnị na dughonyẹ nyáná Tiranọs nyẹ́die wárịbie.
english_text: But some of them became obstinate; they refused to believe and publicly maligned the Way. So Paul left them. He took the disciples with him and had discussions daily in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.

ibani_text: Mịị nyẹ ma anịị n mịẹma mú nyẹ mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá ḅụ, anịgo Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá ḅụ ngaapụ mamgba Juuapụ na Juughaapụ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naam.
english_text: This went on for two years, so that all the Jews and Greeks who lived in the province of Asia heard the word of the Lord.

ibani_text: Tamuno opu ḅụgḅẹ́rẹ́puma fịrị nwángịm Pọl ḅara pa,
english_text: God did extraordinary miracles through Paul,

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ ọ pa ḅárási ákịsị na ọ pa kúkúbie gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ n daakị muu obiapụ pịrịm, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ obi tọ́rụ́ kirikiri deesim, sitẹ́mẹ́ pịghị nna bie págháḅom.
english_text: so that even handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched him were taken to the sick, and their illnesses were cured and the evil spirits left them.

ibani_text: Jẹa Juuapụ, nyẹ mú ikelekelé sị sitẹ́mẹ́ deesiarịapụ asọ dọghụ sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs ẹrẹ ma sịịarị sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnịapụ ma sịbị mịnyẹ ma mịẹm. Nnị dugho sitẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm, A ḅẹrẹtọ i pịrịm Pọl dugho págháma Jizọs Krais ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ págháḅo.
english_text: Some Jews who went around driving out evil spirits tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who were demon-possessed. They would say, “In the name of the Jesus whom Paul preaches, I command you to come out.”

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ma mịnaapụ opu igwagwaḅọ Skiva pa sịḅọ, owiapuawọ anịị mịnyẹ ma mịẹarịapụ.
english_text: Seven sons of Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tẹ́mẹ́ ma n pagharam, A Jizọs nimim, a pịghị Pọl nimim, kụ́ma Ịrịị, Ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ tụọ?
english_text: One day the evil spirit answered them, “Jesus I know, and Paul I know about, but who are you?”

ibani_text: Sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ fịnị owitụ́wọ ma warị owu pa n págháma sị pịghị nnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅara nẹngịma. Nnị warị wárị ma bie mangị págháḅo, pápá ḅụ na ọmbịnyẹ́ nna oju págháḅoarị.
english_text: Then the man who had the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all. He gave them such a beating that they ran out of the house naked and bleeding.

ibani_text: Juuapụ mamgba na pịghị Juughaapụ mamgba Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ ngaapụ mịma náa sáá, opu ḅáláfa ḅo nna oju bie sọm, anị warị mịẹsị nnị opu kuu nyáná Jizọs ẹrẹ ma pịrị.
english_text: When this became known to the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus, they were all seized with fear, and the name of the Lord Jesus was held in high honor.

ibani_text: Tọgha mininiapụ ḅom sị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku minini akị pịghị diepágháma nnị mịẹmáa nyẹ.
english_text: Many of those who believed now came and openly confessed what they had done.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ tọghaapụ dirikọ́rịmaapụ nna dirikọ́rị diri akuom kị́nị́mamgba tórúku sị anị dọ́ghụ́ma gboloma. Nnị mịná diri mamgba la nyẹ kịẹ gboloma sa, anị ḅo pị́naḅala igbii suéné a pughu na sọ́nọ́ a ndẹ́ẹ lam.
english_text: A number who had practiced sorcery brought their scrolls together and burned them publicly. When they calculated the value of the scrolls, the total came to fifty thousand drachmas.

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma anịị Tamunoẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kụrọma kaá wasa ḅara.
english_text: In this way the word of the Lord spread widely and grew in power.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma kiriakịfama sáá, Pọl warị ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹ́ ọ Masidoniya na Akaya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ muu Jerusalem láabẹm. O warị ḅẹẹ, A anị ngaa mú faá ma sáá, a pịghị Rom sọ árịbẹm.
english_text: After all this had happened, Paul decidedto go to Jerusalem, passing through Macedonia and Achaia. “After I have been there,” he said, “I must visit Rome also.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị Timoti na Erastọs, ḅárásua ọ pịrịarị mmẹapụ fịrịma Masidoniya muu, ori ma warị kẹ́lẹ́ sáá ngúmá Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá.
english_text: He sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, while he stayed in the province of Asia a little longer.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ anịị opu ḅụḅáláḅálá ḅo kórónyẹ Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ ma gosi.
english_text: About that time there arose a great disturbance about the Way.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ pị́naḅala tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ Demetirọs pa sịḅọ imii pị́naḅala pa oru warị tẹ́mẹ́ Atemas pịrịḅọ, mị tumḅọ ma opu sọ́nyẹ akuoo ọrẹ fịrịḅaraapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: A silversmith named Demetrius, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought in a lot of business for the craftsmen there.

ibani_text: Ọ warị kị́nị́mamgba sị kobiri, jẹapụ nnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ fịrị ḅara nyánáapụ, warị n ḅẹẹ, Owiapụ ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹ́ wámịna ngọ mị fịrị ma ḅụ sághị ḅom.
english_text: He called them together, along with the workers in related trades, and said: “You know, my friends, that we receive a good income from this business.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọ kọkọ arịị pịghị ọ ḅara na náa, mị Pọl pa sịḅọ ma mịẹarịnyẹ. O dughom ḅẹ́ n ḅara pa tẹ́mẹ́ tamuno ma tamunogha, ọ pịghị mịẹmam tọghaapụ o minini, mịnga na pịghị Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ na pịghị Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: And you see and hear how this fellow Paul has convinced and led astray large numbers of people here in Ephesus and in practically the whole province of Asia. He says that gods made by human hands are no gods at all.

ibani_text: Mị́sa fịnị ḅáláfama nyẹ, anị diearị ḅẹ́ wa pa wa furo dọghụarị fịrị ma si ẹ́rẹ́ nyánábẹm. Anịma ngéréghaa, kụma jẹ́ ḅáláfama nyẹ anị ḅẹ́ Atemas opu oru warị ma ḅo ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ sọbịgha, árị opu sọ pápá gulugulubẹm, Esiya na tuminikiri gbọrụ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị oruu!
english_text: There is danger not only that our trade will lose its good name, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be discredited; and the goddess herself, who is worshiped throughout the province of Asia and the world, will be robbed of her divine majesty.”

ibani_text: Kobiri ogbo ma mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa sáá, anị opuma n tẹ́mẹ́ igánimam sị n saghị ilúghuu. Dụḅa ḅo anịị Ẹ́fịsọsapụ Atemas.
english_text: When they heard this, they were furious and began shouting: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

ibani_text: Mịị silé ma ámá gbọrụ ikélémam. Túminị́ ma warị Gayọs na Aristakọs, Pọl na nyẹ muarị Masidoniyaapụ ma fọ́nọ́ ámáogbo ma ḅoo.
english_text: Soon the whole city was in an uproar. The people seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia, and all of them rushed into the theater together.

ibani_text: Pọl bim ḅẹ́ ọ tarị túminị́ kpọọ ma tórúku sẹ́, kụ́ma mininiapụ ma mini ọ pịrịgha.
english_text: Paul wanted to appear before the crowd, but the disciples would not let him.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ma ḅụ sịbịdáapụ, pịghị Pọl nángwọ́apụ, oku pa ọ fịrịmam ọ tẹ́ghẹ́arị ḅẹ́ ori ọ ḅụ diema ámáogbo ma ḅụ.
english_text: Even some of the officials of the province, friends of Paul, sent him a message begging him not to venture into the theater.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ opu galagala kubiri ogbo ma bie sọmam: jẹapụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ilúghuarị, isiapụ jẹ́nyẹ ilúghuarị, tegó nna ḅụ tọghaapụ nimigha nnị goo kobiri ma ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: The assembly was in confusion: Some were shouting one thing, some another. Most of the people did not even know why they were there.

ibani_text: Juuapụ túminị́ kpo ma warị tọ pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹ́ Alegizanda anịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma dighiarị ḅo tegó Juuapụ ọ pa tórúku sọmam. Alegizanda warị ḅara pa túminị́ ma mịẹsị nnị bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ sị ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ pa ọ ḅụ pighíí.
english_text: The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander to the front, and they shouted instructions to him. He motioned for silence in order to make a defense before the people.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ḅo árị ḅo sáá ḅẹ́ ori Juuḅọ nnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ḅụ ilúghum ine énékịẹnyẹ nangwọ ḅara mmẹẹ́ sa pa ikéléma koro, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Dụḅa ḅo anịị Ẹ́fịsọs Atemas!
english_text: But when they realized he was a Jew, they all shouted in unison for about two hours: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

ibani_text: Kunemaá, ámá ma diri gịẹḅọ diin akuom nna bie ḅẹẹ, I jẹa Ẹ́fịsọsapụ! Ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹ́ Ẹ́fịsọs opu ama ma anịị opu Atemas oru warị ma kúruarịapụ, na pịghị anị tọ́ntọ́ dapịrị sobie saghị sóghóóró kórónyẹ.
english_text: The city clerk quieted the crowd and said: “Fellow Ephesians, doesn’t all the world know that the city of Ephesus is the guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image, which fell from heaven?

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma pighíí bẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ofori, anịma goo ịḅụ diinmaa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ sịbịbie karagha gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ so mịẹma.
english_text: Therefore, since these facts are undeniable, you ought to calm down and not do anything rash.

ibani_text: Ọ mịná túminị́ ma akuomam mịnga, anịsọ nị ḅẹ́ na nnị oru warị bie nyẹ furughaa, anịgha sị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ wámịna oru pịrị.
english_text: You have brought these men here, though they have neither robbed temples nor blasphemed our goddess.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Demetirọs na ori fịrịnwangịapụ ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa sịbị sẹ bẹḅọ nyáná nyáná, wa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ nyánam pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné nyáná, n ḅọ ḅẹ́rẹ́si bẹ angaá.
english_text: If, then, Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a grievance against anybody, the courts are open and there are proconsuls. They can press charges.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mịma nẹ́ngị nyẹ bi bi, nnị anị dugho pẹ́lẹ́bẹm, ámá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ kubiri ogbo.
english_text: If there is anything further you want to bring up, it must be settled in a legal assembly.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mịmgba págháma nyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ḅáláfa imi ḅẹ́ n ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa wámịna sịbị sẹbẹm ḅẹ́ wamịnị ólóghó kokogha nyẹ mịẹm. Wa nyẹ nyanagha wa dugho bẹnyẹ wa go mị silé ma silényẹ.
english_text: As it is, we are in danger of being charged with rioting because of what happened today. In that case we would not be able to account for this commotion, since there is no reason for it.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sa ọ warị kobiri ma gálágálá ma.
english_text: After he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.

ibani_text: Silé ma yaghúu fama sáá, Pọl mininiapụ ma sị kobirim, sị biekụ́rọ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ n pịrị ḅẹ́, ọmịnị ibima fịnịị ọ warị nnị wáriso sị soo Masidoniya muu.
english_text: When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples and, after encouraging them, said goodbye and set out for Macedonia.

ibani_text: Ori anị párángáa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́m warị tọgha biekụ́rọ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ ma tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́maá. Ọ warị anịsáa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo Akaya láa,
english_text: He traveled through that area, speaking many words of encouragement to the people, and finally arrived in Greece,

ibani_text: ọ tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ fịnịngaa. Ọ tẹ́lẹ́maarị ọ ḅara warị Siriya muu bẹ ḅara, o ḅo nimiḅo sáá ḅẹ́ Juuapụ imi diatughu ọ pịrịmáapụ ọ warị Masidoniya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghịma sọọ.
english_text: where he stayed three months. Because some Jews had plotted against him just as he was about to sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia.

ibani_text: Sopata, Piirus tụwọ, Beriya ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ọ nana múm, anịị pịghị Tẹ́salonaika ḅụ saghị ḅoapụ Aristakọs na Sekondọs, Gayọs Derbe ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, Tisikọs na Trofimọs Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá ḅụ sághị ḅoapụ, na pịghị Timoti nnị na muu ḅara.
english_text: He was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, Timothy also, and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia.

ibani_text: Nnị tárị múm wámịna ḅụ sị mú Troas ḅụ wa kúru.
english_text: These men went on ahead and waited for us at Troas.

ibani_text: Wa Filipai ḅụ árụ́ sim, n Yisti bie Ofori Fịturu Álálị ma fị so sáá, sọ́nọ́ a dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, wa ḅo nnị na donam Troas ḅụ, warị anị angaá sọ́nọ́ma dii fịnịị.
english_text: But we sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread, and five days later joined the others at Troas, where we stayed seven days.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá Éné ma ḅupiri, wa kobirim mịẹgbólóma fị́nyẹ ma gosi, Pọl ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọ túminị́ ma pịrịm, warị pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ warịị dii ogbo láa, tegó ori anị ama ma warịsoarị anị ḅụ éné ḅáa.
english_text: On the first day of the week we came together to break bread. Paul spoke to the people and, because he intended to leave the next day, kept on talking until midnight.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọndọ kọrịarị ọgọnọ wárị ma ḅụ, wa kobiri fịnịbie ma bie.
english_text: There were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ásátụ́wọ Utikọs pa sịḅọ wándere ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnịarị, Pọl pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị sa Utikọs warị sághị singi, múno warị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ o dighiákị, ọ warị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá ọ́gọ́nọ ma ḅụ sághị sóghóró kóró kiri. Nnị oku saghị sáá, ọ fịịmam.
english_text: Seated in a window was a young man named Eutychus, who was sinking into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on. When he was sound asleep, he fell to the ground from the third story and was picked up dead.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl kóró mú ọ ḅụ pa ọ ḅụ gbim sị o ḅolo, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Ọ báláma, duma pa ó ḅụ imii!
english_text: Paul went down, threw himself on the young man and put his arms around him. “Don’t be alarmed,” he said. “He’s alive!”

ibani_text: Ọ warị tándị ọgọnọ mú, sị fịtúrú puu fịị. Ọ sa fama wamịnị na ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ fama sáá, akị muu ịrụa saghị saghị sa láa, Pọl anị ngaa ma warịsom.
english_text: Then he went upstairs again and broke bread and ate. After talking until daylight, he left.

ibani_text: Nnị warị owitụ́wọ ma dighi so duma ḅụ na opuma bie diin ḅụ.
english_text: The people took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted.

ibani_text: Wamịnị, wa sịbị pa árụ́ ma fịnịngaa dam, warị anị ngaa sua págháma Asọs muu, wa muu Pọl sẹ akị angaá. O dugho wa pịrịm ḅẹ́ wa ọkọ mịẹ tegó ori ḅụọ pa ḅọ́rọ́ anị ngaa ma múumam.
english_text: We went on ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos, where we were going to take Paul aboard. He had made this arrangement because he was going there on foot.

ibani_text: Ọ wamịnị na dona sáá Asọs ḅụ, wamịnị ọ sẹakim sị ọ nana mú Mitilene láa.
english_text: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene.

ibani_text: Wamịnị anị ngaa suapagham sị anị ḅụ énéḅa mú Sios na dama dama angaá sọmaa. Anị duama éné anịị wa ḅo Samọs láanyẹ, anị ḅụ jẹ́ éné ḅa, wa ḅo Milẹtọs láa.
english_text: The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Chios. The day after that we crossed over to Samos, and on the following day arrived at Miletus.

ibani_text: Pọl ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie tọ ḅọ́rọ́mamam ḅẹ́ nnị Ẹ́fịsọs agbabịgha, ọ sa ngumabịgha ḅara Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ, tegó ori álálaarị o Jerusalem láa bẹ ḅara, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ inéné ori anị ngaa láa, Sịmgbọlụ Sughu Álálị ma éné ma na kiriakịgha sáá.
english_text: Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in the province of Asia, for he was in a hurry to reach Jerusalem, if possible, by the day of Pentecost.

ibani_text: Milẹtọs ḅụ Pọl oku fịrịma Ẹ́fịsọs múm ḅẹẹ sọsị sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅo ọ nana dona.
english_text: From Miletus, Paul sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo láa sáá, ori n ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, O nimim a ị sáá fámá ḅara a ọ nana fịnị sáá ma ḅụ, a tarị ḅo láa éné Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá ma ḅụ.
english_text: When they arrived, he said to them: “You know how I lived the whole time I was with you, from the first day I came into the province of Asia.

ibani_text: Ḅụ sitéréma mamgba na pịghị tọ́rụ́ owu mingi anị a pa fịrịnwangị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrịarịnyẹ, a árịarị kụ́rọ daádighi bie, anị iyẹ Juuapụ biaḅọ́rọ́mamaá nyẹ nnị pa iyẹ mbasị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: I served the Lord with great humility and with tears and in the midst of severe testing by the plots of my Jewish opponents.

ibani_text: O nimim ḅẹ́ a gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa ọḅọghumagha a níminyẹ ḅẹ́ anị sọnyẹ ḅụ sọọ ọ pịrịbẹm, a Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho wásámaarị ḅara pịghị anị diearị ḅara túminị́ mamgba tórúku na pịghị ọmịna wárị wárị ḅụ.
english_text: You know that I have not hesitated to preach anything that would be helpful to you but have taught you publicly and from house to house.

ibani_text: Juuapụ akị mú Juughaapụ láa a ibima nna biri nụ́nụ́m ḅẹẹ nnị nna sii ḅụ pịghị sị Tamuno dua, sị minini nyánáa Wányánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ.
english_text: I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma osii ḅụ, a so Jerusalem muarị, a nimigha anị ngaa ịḅụ pághá bẹnyẹ.
english_text: “And now, compelled by the Spirit, I am going to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma a láa opu ama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma i biri nụ́nụ́arị ḅẹ́ ịkóli na ḅụḅáláḅálá na i kúruarị.
english_text: I only know that in every city the Holy Spirit warns me that prison and hardships are facing me.

ibani_text: Iyẹ duma iḅụ sọ́nyẹ sọ́gha, a binyẹ a pa ine iyẹ fịrị ma nwángị sịbị láama, si pịghị ine Wányánáḅọ Jizọs Krais pa i fịrịma fịrị ma nwángị fama, fịrịị ma anịị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ibi oku ma dugho wásáma.
english_text: However, I consider my life worth nothing to me; my only aim is to finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me—the task of testifying to the good news of God’s grace.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba a bie ikelekelé Tamuno amadakiri oku ma dugho wásáma pịrịmáapụ mịnị jẹ́ pa i tórúku arịbịghaa.
english_text: “Now I know that none of you among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom will ever see me again.

ibani_text: Anịgo mị́sa a dughofindi ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́, faá bẹ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmịna bie n ḅo ọmbịnyẹ́ i sịbị sẹbịgha.
english_text: Therefore, I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of any of you.

ibani_text: Tegó a pa ọ ḅọghuma nyẹ ofori Tamuno dọghụnyẹ mangba sị o nimii.
english_text: For I have not hesitated to proclaim to you the whole will of God.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ́ pa kiri lama ọmịna ḅụ pịrị, na pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma saghị ọ ḅarabie sua ánáná awọ ma pịrị. Ọmịnị ánánákúrúapụ dighi Tamuno sọsị ma pịrị, ori ọ tụwọ ọmbịnyẹ́ pa fẹ nyẹ.
english_text: Keep watch over yourselves and all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers. Be shepherds of the church of God,which he bought with his own blood.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹ́ iyẹ ọḅụgbi anịị piri obiri ọmịnị ogbobie sọ bẹnyẹ, nnị pịghị ánáná áwọ ma warịsobịgha.
english_text: I know that after I leave, savage wolves will come in among you and will not spare the flock.

ibani_text: Sáá ḅobẹm, jẹa túminị́ ọmịna ogbobie saghị epele tiibẹm sị mininiapụ tọ́rụ́ daa n ḅụ pịrịị.
english_text: Even from your own number men will arise and distort the truth in order to draw away disciples after them.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ tọ́rụ́ kiri láa, sị biekóróma ḅẹ́ tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá gbọrụ, a dii na ḅá na, a owutọ́rụ́ pa nyẹ pa o diem.
english_text: So be on your guard! Remember that for three years I never stopped warning each of you night and day with tears.

ibani_text: Anịgo, mị́sa, a ọ saghị Tamuno ḅara suam na pịghị ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ oku, ine ọ sẹ́nịma bẹnyẹ pịghị Tamuno nyáná ori a túminị́ pịrị karịibima pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: “Now I commit you to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.

ibani_text: Na a jụghọ pị́naḅala anịgha jụghọ odoḅala anịgha jụghọ suabịtẹ mọnịghaa.
english_text: I have not coveted anyone’s silver or gold or clothing.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị kọkọ ibima nimii ḅẹ́ a mị ḅara ma pa fịrịnwangịmam sị pa a binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na i duaapụ binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm.
english_text: You yourselves know that these hands of mine have supplied my own needs and the needs of my companions.

ibani_text: Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ a pa o diemam, o ḅara warị ịnyọ pa fịrịwangi sị ḅárásua ịnyọ ḅụ oforighaapụ ma pịrị, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa biekórómáarị, o dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Anị opuma Karịiḅi nyánam nyẹ pa kị́nị́ pịrị, tụ́ma kị́nị́ ḅara nyẹ nyánáḅọ.
english_text: In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said:‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”

ibani_text: Pọl mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ faá ma sa, ọ warị ẹkpẹrẹkị si tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: When Paul had finished speaking, he knelt down with all of them and prayed.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba owuarị nnị o ḅolo sáá warị pịghị bịpị pa o lughu nọnju, sị ibima fịnị pa ọ ḅẹẹ.
english_text: They all wept as they embraced him and kissed him.

ibani_text: Nna tẹ́mẹ́ opuma siim, o dughom gosi ḅẹẹ nnị mịnị jẹ́ pa ori arịbịghaa. Nnị warị ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma árụ́ ma muu.
english_text: What grieved them most was his statement that they would never see his face again. Then they accompanied him to the ship.

ibani_text: Wa ọmịnị ibima fịnị pa n ḅẹm warị sua págháma. Wa kẹ́lẹ́ dọghụ tórúku múm sị sáḅá kóró sị ḅo Kọs láa. Anị ḅụ éné ḅa sáá wa ḅo Rodis laam, anị ngaa wa warị ḅọ́rọ́ Patara muu.
english_text: After we had torn ourselves away from them, we put out to sea and sailed straight to Kos. The next day we went to Rhodes and from there to Patara.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa anịị wa gbẹ́rẹ́ árụ́ arịị nyẹ Fonisiya muarịnyẹ, wa warị anị ḅụlọ sị suapágháa.
english_text: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, went on board and set sail.

ibani_text: Wa ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa lam wa Saiprọs arị ngaa, wa warị sua sughu ju daa sị ḅoo Siriya láa. Wa muu kiri sọ́mam Taya ḅụ, árụ́ ma anị dighinyẹ sẹkóróma ngaa.
english_text: After sighting Cyprus and passing to the south of it, we sailed on to Syria. We landed at Tyre, where our ship was to unload its cargo.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa wa jẹa mininiapụ arịm warị nnị ná sọ́nọ́ma dii fịnị. Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọ ḅụ n dugho Pọl pịrịm ḅẹ́ o Jerusalem muu ma.
english_text: We sought out the disciples there and stayed with them seven days. Through the Spirit they urged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa nyáná nnị pịrị sáá kara sáá, wamịnị n warịsom sị wa muarịnyẹ múm. Nnị kị́nị́mamgba nnị nna taa na awọ na wa ḅọ́rọ́maa ámá ma bie págháḅo posie áká ma ḅom, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba ẹkpẹrẹkị sị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ngaa.
english_text: When it was time to leave, we left and continued on our way. All of them, including wives and children, accompanied us out of the city, and there on the beach we knelt to pray.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, wa warị ibima fịnị pa jụghọ jụghọ bẹ sị árụ́ ma ḅụlọ, nnị warị pịghịma wárị muu.
english_text: After saying goodbye to each other, we went aboard the ship, and they returned home.

ibani_text: Wa warị wámịna muunyẹ muu, Taya ḅụ akị mú Tolemayas láa wa sịbịpị pa mininiapụ ma sịị angaá, warị nnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ éné fịnị.
english_text: We continued our voyage from Tyre and landed at Ptolemais, where we greeted the brothers and sisters and stayed with them for a day.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅáa, wa suapághám sị ḅo Sizariya láa. Anị angaá Filipụ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho wásáma ḅo wárị, anịị wa fịnịnyẹ, Jerusalem ḅụ nnị sẹlẹakị sọ́nọ́ma ḅárásúapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Leaving the next day, we reached Caesarea and stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist, one of the Seven.

ibani_text: Ori ínia ẹ́rẹ́awọ nyanam náa dee yaghaapụ, Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáarịapụ.
english_text: He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied.

ibani_text: Wa tọgha éné fịnịmam gbẹ́rẹ́ Agabọs pa sị ikiakoroḅọ Judiya ḅụ saghị ḅo sáá.
english_text: After we had been there a number of days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

ibani_text: Ọ wa dámáḅom warị Pọl kundu kpọ árị́dírí pa o ḅụọ na o ḅara kpọọ, warị ḅẹẹ, Mị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dughonyẹ: Mị kundu kpọ árị́dírí ma nyánáḅọ ma mịị ḅara ma anịị Jerusalem ḅụ fịnị Juuapụ ma ọkpọ bẹ ḅara, sị ọ saghị pa Juughaapụ ma ḅarabie sua.
english_text: Coming over to us, he took Paul’s belt, tied his own hands and feet with it and said, “The Holy Spirit says, ‘In this way the Jewish leaders in Jerusalem will bind the owner of this belt and will hand him over to the Gentiles.’ ”

ibani_text: Wa mịma náa sáá wamịnị na anị ngaa fịnịapụ ma Pọl tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́ ọmịnị Jerusalem muu ma.
english_text: When we heard this, we and the people there pleaded with Paul not to go up to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Kuma ọ wa pagharam ḅẹẹ, Ọ tegósi owu i tẹ́mẹ́ nainnainmaarị? Ḅẹẹ a tẹ́lẹ́mámam ḅẹẹ ịkóli ngéréghaa nnị i pa suabẹnyẹ; kụ́ma pịghị fịị Jerusalem ḅụ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs ma ẹrẹ́sị.
english_text: Then Paul answered, “Why are you weeping and breaking my heart? I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

ibani_text: Wamịnị ine mịẹgha ọ tẹ́mẹ́ dima, anịgo, wa warị ọ warịsó ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị tọ́nyẹ mịẹẹ.
english_text: When he would not be dissuaded, we gave up and said, “The Lord’s will be done.”

ibani_text: Wa kẹ́lẹ́ sáá fámá sị anị ngaa fịnị fámá sa wa wámịna nyẹ taákim sị Jerusalem muu.
english_text: After this, we started on our way up to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Krais ọḅụdua jẹapụ Sizariya ḅụ saghịḅom mị anịị wamịnị na mú sị wa fịnị bẹḅọ ma wárị pa wa die nyẹ, Minason Saiprọs ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ Ḅọlọmaa sáá éné éné minini maá ḅo.
english_text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea accompanied us and brought us to the home of Mnason, where we were to stay. He was a man from Cyprus and one of the early disciples.

ibani_text: Wa mú Jerusalem láa sáá, mininiapụ ma ibiḅara pa wa daa kórómam.
english_text: When we arrived at Jerusalem, the brothers and sisters received us warmly.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅáa, Pọl warị wamịnị na mú Jems arịị, sọsị sẹ́nịapụ mamgba sọ anị ngaa imii.
english_text: The next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James, and all the elders were present.

ibani_text: Pọl sịbịpị pa n siim warị ḅo nyẹ fịnị ḅara mamgba dugho nnị pịrị Tamuno ọ ḅara pa nwángịmáa fịrị mamgba Juughaapụ ogbobie.
english_text: Paul greeted them and reported in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.

ibani_text: Nnị o pughu fama sáá, nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị Tamuno túminim. Nnị warị ḅẹẹ, Mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Pọl, i kọkọ arịị tọgha mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi, Juuapụ, ḅo mininimáapụ, ólóghó ma pa nyẹ sị pịghị anị ḅẹlẹmaapụ.
english_text: When they heard this, they praised God. Then they said to Paul: “You see, brother, how many thousands of Jews have believed, and all of them are zealous for the law.

ibani_text: Nnị dugho n pịrịmam ḅẹẹ, ị Juughaapụ bie ngaa Juuapụ mamgba diearị ḅẹ́ nnị mịnị Mosis ólóghó ma pa nyẹ́sị ma, pịghị nnị diearị ḅẹẹ n mịnị nna owiapụ awọ tọ́ngọ pẹlẹ ma, ḅẹẹ nnị mịnị pịghị Juuapụ mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma dua ma.
english_text: They have been informed that you teach all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to turn away from Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wa tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? Gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ n naábẹm ḅẹ́ i ḅomam.
english_text: What shall we do? They will certainly hear that you have come,

ibani_text: Mịma anịị wa dọghụ bẹnyẹ sị i mịẹ. Mịnga ínia owiapụ imii nyẹ mininimáapụ.
english_text: so do what we tell you. There are four men with us who have made a vow.

ibani_text: Nnáná mú gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá sị nnị na oju mịẹ fiafiama igwa ma gwáa, pịghị igwáa ma láanyẹ láanyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄ anịsáa nnị ine nna sịbị sẹbẹm. Mị ḅara ma kị́nị́mamgba nimibẹm ḅẹ́ ị gboloma sị n dugho nnị pịrịnyẹ ma karakárányẹ anị bie ofori, kụ́ma ịrịsọ pịghị Mosis ologho koko ḅọ.
english_text: Take these men, join in their purification rites and pay their expenses, so that they can have their heads shaved. Then everyone will know there is no truth in these reports about you, but that you yourself are living in obedience to the law.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅo mininimaa Juughaapụ ma wa ábálálá pa nnị fịrịmamam ḅẹ́ n jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné nnị n pa igwagwaá oru pịrị fị́nyẹ fị ma, anịgha pulo táḅa, anịgha n ḅa sị pulo anị bie sara págháa nama pẹẹ́, ḅẹ́ n pịghị nna ḅụ fófóoma yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị ḅụ.
english_text: As for the Gentile believers, we have written to them our decision that they should abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality.”

ibani_text: Pọl túminị́ ma akịm warịị anị ḅụ éné ḅáa nna oju mịẹ fiafiama igwa ma gwaa. Anị sáá ọ warị Tamunowarị ma sọọ sị bịpị pịrị oju mịẹ fiafiama igwa éné ma káarabẹ sáá, sị nnị igwa ma igwa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịbẹ sáá.
english_text: The next day Paul took the men and purified himself along with them. Then he went to the temple to give notice of the date when the days of purification would end and the offering would be made for each of them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Sọ́nọ́ma dii ma kara bẹ sáá, jẹa Juuapụ Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ angaá saghị ḅoapụ Pọl arịm Tamunoopuwarị ma bie nnị warị túminị́ kpo ma timi saghị nnị warị Pọl kuu,
english_text: When the seven days were nearly over, some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul at the temple. They stirred up the whole crowd and seized him,

ibani_text: n warị ilúghú, Izirẹlịapụ, ọ ḅárásua! Mịị ngaa mamgba muu sị Izirẹlị na kuraghaa nyẹ́diearị ḅọ, ólóghó ma na kuraghaa nyẹ na pịghị mị Tamunoopuwárị ma. Ḅẹẹ mị́sa sọ o jẹa Juughaapụ pa Tamunoopuwárị ma sóḅomam, sị mị tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma pilemam.
english_text: shouting, “Fellow Israelites, help us! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people and our law and this place. And besides, he has brought Greeks into the temple and defiled this holy place.”

ibani_text: (Nnị mịma dughom tegó nnị Trofimọs, Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ saghị ḅo ḅo na Pọl arịm opu ama ma bie nnị siim ḅẹ́ Pọl ọ pa Tamunowarị ma sọmam.)
english_text: (They had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul and assumed that Paul had brought him into the temple.)

ibani_text: Galagala warị ama gbọ́rụ́ ma ikelema, túminị́ ma warị gbẹ́rẹ́sa mangị sị Pọl kuu sẹ́ma sị ọ nụ́nụ́ pághámaḅo Tamunoopuwarị ma bie. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri Tamunoopuwarị ma ḅụ́pọ́ gbẹm.
english_text: The whole city was aroused, and the people came running from all directions. Seizing Paul, they dragged him from the temple, and immediately the gates were shut.

ibani_text: Túminị́ kpo ma asọ dọghụarị n Pọl ḅáa bẹ ḅara, anịị bịpị mú Rom ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma sịbịdáaḅọ biri láa nyẹ ḅẹ́ Jerusalem gbọrụ gálágálá nna bie imi.
english_text: While they were trying to kill him, news reached the commander of the Roman troops that the whole city of Jerusalem was in an uproar.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ma ḅụ opu sịbịdaaḅọ ma jẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ na jẹ́ sịbịdáapụ pa álála túminị́ kpo ma fịnị angaá ma muu. Nnị sịbịdáapụ ma na ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma árị sáá, nnị mịnị Pọl fomugha.
english_text: He at once took some officers and soldiers and ran down to the crowd. When the rioters saw the commander and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

ibani_text: Sịbịdáaḅọ ma warị Pọl dama mú sị o kuu, warị ḅẹ́ nnị mmẹẹ́ ịkóli pa Pọl kpọọ, ọ warị anịsáa gbíla ḅẹẹ, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ọ tụọ? Ọ ḅẹ́ ọ tẹ́ mịẹm?
english_text: The commander came up and arrested him and ordered him to be bound with two chains. Then he asked who he was and what he had done.

ibani_text: Jẹapụ túminị́ kpo ma bie ilúghú gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ dughom, isiapụ jẹ́nyẹ dughom ọkọ fịnị gálágálá kiri imi sị opu sịbịdáḅọ ma ine nimiḅogha pághányẹ. Ọ warị ori a túminị́ ḅẹ́ sị nnị Pọl akuoo nna ọ́mụ́gbiapụ wárị ḅoo.
english_text: Some in the crowd shouted one thing and some another, and since the commander could not get at the truth because of the uproar, he ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅoo ọ nana ọgọ́nọ́ tándị angaá ma láa sáá, dighii anịị nnị o dighinyẹ, túminị́ ma tọ́rụ pulo biaarị gosi.
english_text: When Paul reached the steps, the violence of the mob was so great he had to be carried by the soldiers.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba ori ọḅụju ḅoarị siléarị ḅẹ́ nnị O fom ḅá.
english_text: The crowd that followed kept shouting, “Get rid of him!”

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma Pọl pa nna ọ́mụ́gbiapụ wárị sọọ bẹ sáá, ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sịbịdaaḅọ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Páisisi a ine kẹ́lẹ́ nyẹ́ dugho ị pịrị? Sịbịdaaḅọ ma warị Pọl gbíla ḅẹẹ, I kọkọ Giriki ḅẹ́lẹ̄ fiearị, anịgha.
english_text: As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the barracks, he asked the commander, “May I say something to you?” “Do you speak Greek?” he replied.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ịrị anị Ijipitiḅọ magha gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri bịpị puugha ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹ, sị túminị́ oyia ndẹ́ẹ, ḅẹ́rẹ́ dọghụapụ, mini sịbị tughu Rom kọnsịn pịrịghaapụ daa elesiri bie sọọ?
english_text: “Aren’t you the Egyptian who started a revolt and led four thousand terrorists out into the wilderness some time ago?”

ibani_text: Pọl pagharam, Irị Juuḅọ, Tasọs Silisiya bie fịnị káláama bie nnị i yiim, nyẹ láa opu ama bie ḅọ, páisisi a kẹ́lẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ ma pịrị.
english_text: Paul answered, “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no ordinary city. Please let me speak to the people.”

ibani_text: Sịbịdaaḅọ ma asọ pa ọ pịrịm, Pọl warị wárị ọ́gọ́nọ tándị yọ ḅụ sẹ warị ḅara pa túminị́ fọngụma ḅẹ́ nnị bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄, nnị bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ sa Pọl warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ nnị pịrị Hiburu ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅụ.
english_text: After receiving the commander’s permission, Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the crowd. When they were all silent, he said to them in Aramaic:

ibani_text: I jẹa Juuapụ ọmịnị i pughu a ịḅụ pighíí.
english_text: “Brothers and fathers, listen now to my defense.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅoo náa sáá ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ n pịrịarị Hiburu ḅẹlẹ ḅụ nnị ibima diin kóróm, Pọl warị o dughoárị nyẹ dugho.
english_text: When they heard him speak to them in Aramaic, they became very quiet. Then Paul said:

ibani_text: Ịrị Juuḅọ, Tasọs, Silisiya bie fịnịnyẹ ḅụ anịị nnị ị yii angaá. Jerusalem ḅụ anịị nnị ị dighi pághámaḅo nyẹ, Gamalel ḅụọ sughu anịị a pịghị nyẹ dáwọnyẹ. Nnị ibiḅara pa wámịna tádọ́apụ ólóghó ma pa i diem, a pịghị ibiḅara pa Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄arị, ọmịnị mịnga fịnịapụ ma mịmgba ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅara.
english_text: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. I studied under Gamaliel and was thoroughly trained in the law of our ancestors. I was just as zealous for God as any of you are today.

ibani_text: Mị Tamuno asọ ma duaapụ ma a nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịma mú nna fịị lam. A ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na owiapụ kuu ịkóli bie suam.
english_text: I persecuted the followers of this Way to their death, arresting both men and women and throwing them into prison,

ibani_text: Opu igwagwaḅọ ma na ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ mamgba sọ ine onyẹ́sẹ mịma pịrịbẹm ḅẹ́ a dughoarị nyẹ ma karakárányẹ. A nna ḅara ábálálá daaḅom n gịẹ pa ijẹa Juuapụ pịrịnyẹ Damasikọs ḅụ, a warị anị ngaa mú ḅẹ́ a nnị kuu bẹ ḅara sị ịkóli pa nna ḅárásua si Jerusalem ḅo si nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịma.
english_text: as the high priest and all the Council can themselves testify. I even obtained letters from them to their associates in Damascus, and went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

ibani_text: Iyẹ muunyẹ ḅụ a ḅo Damasikọs na kikiam éné ogbo, sobie saghị ḅo opuma bia baá warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri bia a fịnị angaá ma ikelekele ma.
english_text: “About noon as I came near Damascus, suddenly a bright light from heaven flashed around me.

ibani_text: A warị bịghị kiri koro warị pụghọ náa i ḅẹarị ḅọ ḅẹẹ, Sọl! Sọl! I tegó i pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị?
english_text: I fell to the ground and heard a voice say to me,‘Saul! Saul! Why do you persecute me?’

ibani_text: A warị gbíla, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, Ịrị tụọ? Ori warị i pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Irị anịị Jizọs Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ, anịị ị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị ḅo.
english_text: “ ‘Who are you, Lord?’ I asked. “‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are persecuting,’he replied.

ibani_text: I nana fịnịapụ ma baá ma arịm, kụ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrịarịḅọ ma pụghọ naagha.
english_text: My companions saw the light, but they did not understand the voice of him who was speaking to me.

ibani_text: A warị gbíla, Inyanaḅọ, i dọghụ ḅẹ́ a tọ́rọ mịẹ? Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị i ḅẹẹ, Saghị sẹ si Damasikọs mú, anị ngaa n dugho ị́ pịrịbẹm Tamuno tọ́ọ i pịrị si ị mịẹ na i binyẹ mamgba.
english_text: “ ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ I asked. “‘Get up,’the Lord said,‘and go into Damascus. There you will be told all that you have been assigned to do.’

ibani_text: I tọ́rụ pụụm, i tọ́rụ biakoro baá ma gosi iyẹ ogboapụ warị ḅara ḅụ iyẹ ọlọọ Damasikọs muu.
english_text: My companions led me by the hand into Damascus, because the brilliance of the light had blinded me.

ibani_text: Anị opu ama ma bie, gbẹ́rẹ́ Ananayas pa sịḅọ imii, Tamuno nimiḅọ ibi ma wámịna ólóghó osii ḅo, anị ngaa fịnị Juuapụ mamgba, pịghị opuma osigha nyáná pịrịḅọ.
english_text: “A man named Ananias came to see me. He was a devout observer of the law and highly respected by all the Jews living there.

ibani_text: Ori ị damaḅom sị iyẹ ngása sẹ, warị ḅẹ́, Numboru owitụ́wọ Sọl ị tọ́rụ saghị nyẹ́ arịị! Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ, a saghị nyẹ arịm, a warị pịghị tọ́rụ́ pa o dighi.
english_text: He stood beside me and said, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ And at that very moment I was able to see him.

ibani_text: Warị dugho: Wámịna tádọ́apụ Tamuno ma, ị sẹ́lẹ́akịmam ḅẹ́ irị ọ tọ́nyẹ nimi, ḅẹ́ irị ọrẹ karakárá ómóniḅọ árị, sị pịghị ọ náa ori ọ pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị ḅara.
english_text: “Then he said: ‘The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will and to see the Righteous One and to hear words from his mouth.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, irị onyẹ́sẹ ọ pịrịbẹm sị dugho kị́nị́mamgba pịrị iyẹ árịmaá pịghị naamaá nyẹ mamgba.
english_text: You will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị pịghị tẹ́ go sáá ngumaarị? Saghị sị mingi sara, sị ị́yẹ́ sii siri si bẹ ḅara ịrị ori ẹ́rẹ́ ma sị tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅara.
english_text: And now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized and wash your sins away, calling on his name.’

ibani_text: A pịghịma Jerusalem múm, a Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ́arị sa Tamunowarị ma bie, a múnogha dáwọkọm.
english_text: “When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying at the temple, I fell into a trance

ibani_text: A Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ arịm ori i ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ, Álála mịẹsị Jerusalem wáriso mị kirikiri, tegó mịnga fịnịapụ ma i gboloma onyẹsẹ́ naabịgha ị bịpị.
english_text: and saw the Lord speaking to me.‘Quick!’he said.‘Leave Jerusalem immediately, because the people here will not accept your testimony about me.’

ibani_text: A warị págháraa, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, mịnaapụ ma nimitẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹ́ a Juuapụ kobiri yọ kobiri yọ ma múm si ịḅụ mininiapụ ma kuu pịghị n fom.
english_text: “ ‘Lord,’ I replied, ‘these people know that I went from one synagogue to another to imprison and beat those who believe in you.

ibani_text: Nnị ị́yẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ Sitivin ḅáa sáá, ị ḅụgbọrụ anị ngaa imi, mini n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị ọ ḅáa, pịghị ọ ḅáapụ ma suabịtẹ didighi.
english_text: And when the blood of your martyrStephen was shed, I stood there giving my approval and guarding the clothes of those who were killing him.’

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị i ḅẹ́, Muu a ị pa ḅọlọ angaá fịrịmabẹm Juughaapụ ma fịnịngaa.
english_text: “Then the Lord said to me,‘Go; I will send you far away to the Gentiles.’”

ibani_text: Túminị́ ma Pọl pughu wárii o ḅo mịma dughom. Nnị warị pụghọ saghị sị ilúghum, ọmịnị ọ pa soo! Ọ mịnị ọ ḅá, ọ duma na ibighaa.
english_text: The crowd listened to Paul until he said this. Then they raised their voices and shouted, “Rid the earth of him! He’s not fit to live!”

ibani_text: Nnị ikerearị, n bịtẹ waghịarị si fu gugu sághịarị.
english_text: As they were shouting and throwing off their cloaks and flinging dust into the air,

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma bịpị pịrịm ḅẹ́ n Pọl pa ọ́mụ́gbiapụ wárị ma muu, ọ warị ḅẹ́ nnị o fom sị n nimiḅo bẹ ḅara Juuapụ ma tegó ikere ọ pịrịarị nyẹ.
english_text: the commander ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks. He directed that he be flogged and interrogated in order to find out why the people were shouting at him like this.

ibani_text: Kụma nnị ọkpọ sẹ́ma sị o fom dọghụ sáá Pọl warị anị ngaa sẹ́fịnị owitụ́wọ ma ḅẹ́, Anị karakárá mọ ḅẹẹ, ịrị Rom amaḅọ fom, na i ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ḅara simagha ḅo?
english_text: As they stretched him out to flog him, Paul said to the centurion standing there, “Is it legal for you to flog a Roman citizen who hasn’t even been found guilty?”

ibani_text: Sịbịdáḅọ ma mịma náa sáá, ọ warị opu ọ́mụ́ sịbịdáḅọ ma dámámum warị ọ gbíla, Ị tẹ́ mịẹarị anị owitụ́wọ ma ori Rom amaḅọ!
english_text: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commander and reported it. “What are you going to do?” he asked. “This man is a Roman citizen.”

ibani_text: Opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma warị Pọl dámámuu sị ogbila, Dugho i pịrị, ịrị Rom amaḅọ? Pọl pagharam Innh.
english_text: The commander went to Paul and asked, “Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?” “Yes, I am,” he answered.

ibani_text: Opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma warị ḅẹ́, Irị a opu igbii gbẹm sị Rom amaḅọ sọọ. Pọl pagharam, Ịrị anị ngaa nnị i yiim.
english_text: Then the commander said, “I had to pay a lot of money for my citizenship.” “But I was born a citizen,” Paul replied.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, mú nyẹ pa Pọl gbíla dọghụapụ ma ọḅụdam ọ fịnị angaá; ḅáláfa warị opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma bie sọọ o ḅo nimiḅo sáá ḅẹ́ Pọl Rom amaḅọ ḅẹẹ ọ pịghị ịkóli pa ọ ḅara suamam.
english_text: Those who were about to interrogate him withdrew immediately. The commander himself was alarmed when he realized that he had put Paul, a Roman citizen, in chains.

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ dọghụ pághámaḅo bim karakáráma Juuapụ ma pa Pọl sịbị sẹ nyẹ, anịgo éné ḅáa sáá, ori ịkóli ma siim Pọl ḅara, warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹẹ igwagwaalaapụ na ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma donaa. Ọ warị Pọl akuoo sị ori n tórúku sẹ.
english_text: The commander wanted to find out exactly why Paul was being accused by the Jews. So the next day he released him and ordered the chief priests and all the members of the Sanhedrin to assemble. Then he brought Paul and had him stand before them.

ibani_text: Pọl dada ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma dighim warị ḅẹẹ, I jẹa Izirẹlịawọ! I tẹ́mẹ́bie ibima kpaim a ị́yẹ́ duma kọọ maá ḅara Tamuno tórúku ḅo mịmgba éné láa.
english_text: Paul looked straight at the Sanhedrin and said, “My brothers, I have fulfilled my duty to God in all good conscience to this day.”

ibani_text: Mịma gosi, opu igwagwaḅọ Ananayas bịpị pịrịm ḅẹẹ Pọl na kikiama sẹapụ ọ bịpị ọ ḅụrọọ.
