english_text: At this the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth.

ibani_text: Pọl warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Tamuno gbarị gbarịgha ḅụ, i ḅụ́rọbẹm, ịrị sịrị agbā pa táá wárị oju! Ọ mịngáá kpọrọfịnị sị i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, kụ́ma ọmịnị ólóghó ma koroarị, ọ bịpị pịrị sáá ḅẹ́ nnị i ḅụrọọ!
english_text: Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! You sit there to judge me according to the law, yet you yourself violate the law by commanding that I be struck!”

ibani_text: Pọl na kikiaapụ warị Pọl ḅẹẹ, Ị tegósi Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ ma wiriarị?
english_text: Those who were standing near Paul said, “How dare you insult God’s high priest!”

ibani_text: Pọl pagharam ḅẹẹ, I jẹa Izirẹlịawọ, a nimigha ḅẹ́ ori anịị Tamuno opu igwagwaḅọ. Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹ́, Ịrị ị́yẹ́ túminị́ táarịḅọ ma dughosimabịgha.
english_text: Paul replied, “Brothers, I did not realize that he was the high priest; for it is written: ‘Do not speak evil about the ruler of your people.’”

ibani_text: Pọl ḅo árị sáá ḅẹ́ nna ḅụ jẹapụ Sadusiiapụ isiapụ Farisii, ọ warị pụghọ saghị ilúghú ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma ogbobie, ḅẹẹ, I jẹa Izirẹlịawọ, Irị Farisiiḅọ, pịghị Farisiiḅọ tụ́wọ, Mịị ngaa a ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ siri ḅụ imi a nyáná tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ḅẹ́ fịịapụ fịị ḅụ sághị dumaapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: Then Paul, knowing that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees, called out in the Sanhedrin, “My brothers, I am a Pharisee, descended from Pharisees. I stand on trial because of the hope of the resurrection of the dead.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri, Farisiiapụ ma na Sadusiiapụ ma warị saghị kamkoro puama warị túminị́ ma ogboku bie sọọ.
english_text: When he said this, a dispute broke out between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Sadusiiapụ ma dughom ḅẹẹ túminị́ fịị ḅụ saghịbịgha, ḅẹ́ sookumuapụ ofori, tẹ́mẹ́ sọ ofori, kụ́ma Farisiiapụ mamgba nnị tẹ́rẹ́ mamgba ḅụ mininim.
english_text: (The Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, and that there are neither angels nor spirits, but the Pharisees believe all these things.)

ibani_text: Sile ma, warị parị ḅara ma nẹngịma, jẹa ólóghó nyẹ́dieapụ Farisiiapụ ma ju fịnịapụ ma sághị sẹm sị kụ́rọ ḅara pa igani ḅẹ́ Wa bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ arịgha o mịẹ sima nyẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ anịgha sookumuḅọ anịị karakáráma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịnyẹ!
english_text: There was a great uproar, and some of the teachers of the law who were Pharisees stood up and argued vigorously. “We find nothing wrong with this man,” they said. “What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?”

ibani_text: Nụ́ná ma ḅo opuma kụrọ sáá, Rom opu ọ́mụ́ sịbịdáḅọ ma ḅo ḅáláfam ḅẹ́ nyẹ́ ma muarị ḅara nnị ine Pọl kiẹnị kọ́sịbẹm. Ọ warị ọrẹ a ọ́mụ́gbiapụ fịrịma ḅẹ́ nnị túminị́ ma ogbobie sọọ sị Pọl págháma ḅoo nna ḅarabie sị ọ pa ọ́mụ́gbiapụ wárị ma bie sua.
english_text: The dispute became so violent that the commander was afraid Paul would be torn to pieces by them. He ordered the troops to go down and take him away from them by force and bring him into the barracks.

ibani_text: Anị dii ma ḅụ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma Pọl angásá ḅụ sẹm sị ḅẹẹ, Ḅáláfáma! Ị onyẹsẹ́ i pịrịmam mị Jerusalem ḅụ, ị pịghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹ i pịrịbẹm Rom ḅụ.
english_text: The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said,“Take courage! As you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.”

ibani_text: Éné ḅáa sáá jẹa Juuapụ warị dona sị tọ́ọ n mịẹbẹnyẹ. Nnị nyẹ minini nna ḅụ pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ fịbịghaa akị mú nnị Pọl ḅá sáá láa.
english_text: The next morning some Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul.

ibani_text: Mịị sii bịpị ogbosuapụ ma túminị́ a mmẹẹ́ si ḅọ́rọ́m.
english_text: More than forty men were involved in this plot.

ibani_text: Anị sáá n warị ḅo igwagwaalaapụ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma dámámuu, sị ḅẹ́, Wa kụrọnyẹ minini wámịna ḅụ pịrịmam ḅẹ́ wa bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ fịbiegha, wa pịghị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅuubịgha akị muu wa Pọl ḅá sáá láa.
english_text: They went to the chief priests and the elders and said, “We have taken a solemn oath not to eat anything until we have killed Paul.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ịrị na ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma bịpị fịrịma Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaaḅọ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ ọ Pọl akuoo ọ pịrị, oḅori pa ọ sị ḅẹ́ ọ jẹ́ nyẹ gbilapaghama ḅo dọ́ghụm ọ bịpị. Kụ́ma wa tárị ọ ḅáabẹm na ori anị ngaa ma laagha sáá.
english_text: Now then, you and the Sanhedrin petition the commander to bring him before you on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about his case. We are ready to kill him before he gets here.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ nna sii bịpị ogbo suama naam warị mú dugho Pọl pịrị, ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma wárị.
english_text: But when the son of Paul’s sister heard of this plot, he went into the barracks and told Paul.

ibani_text: Pọl warị sịbịdaaḅọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịị, warị dugho ọ pịrị, Mịị ásátụ́wọ ma pa Rom ọ́mụ́gbi áláḅọ ma fịnịnga mú, ọ nyẹ nyánam o dugho ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: Then Paul called one of the centurions and said, “Take this young man to the commander; he has something to tell him.”

ibani_text: Sịbịdáḅọ ma warị ori akịị sị ọ nana mú Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ fịnịngaa láa si ḅẹẹ, Pọl ikólinaḅọ i siim ḅẹ́ a mị ásátụ́wọ ma pa ị fịnịngaa ḅo ḅẹ́ ọ nyẹ nyánam ọ dugho ị pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: So he took him to the commander. The centurion said, “Paul, the prisoner, sent for me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you.”

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma, ḅara ḅụ, ori ọlọ warị ó nana fóofóo, warị o gbíla ḅẹẹ, Ị tẹ́ nyáná ị dugho ị pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: The commander took the young man by the hand, drew him aside and asked, “What is it you want to tell me?”

ibani_text: Ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Juuapụ sịbịdaapụ ma bịpị ákịmam ḅẹ́ ḅáa nnị ị ḅẹẹbẹm ị Pọl akuoo ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma pịrị, oḅori pa ị sị ḅẹ́ nnị bim ḅẹ́ nnị jẹ́ nyẹ́ nimiḅo dọ́ghụm o gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: He said: “Some Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul before the Sanhedrin tomorrow on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma n pughu ma, tegó nnị túminị́ mmẹsi ḅọ́rọ́m ḅọghu fịnị si okuru bẹapụ. Nnị nyẹ́ minini nna ḅụ pịrịmam ḅẹ́ nnị nyẹ́fịbịgha n pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ḅuubịgha akị n Pọl ḅáá sáá láa. Mị́sa nnị tẹ́lẹ́mamam n mịẹbẹ ḅara, nnị kuruarị i dugho bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Don’t give in to them, because more than forty of them are waiting in ambush for him. They have taken an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him. They are ready now, waiting for your consent to their request.”

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma ḅẹm, Dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịma ḅẹ́ ị nwọfịnị nyẹ dugho i pịrịmam. O warị ásátụ́wọ ma fịrịma sọọ.
english_text: The commander dismissed the young man with this warning: “Don’t tell anyone that you have reported this to me.”

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma warị ọrẹ mmẹẹ́ a sịbịdaapụ sịị, warị n ḅẹẹ, O muu oyia si ọ́mụ́gbiapụ tẹ́lẹ́ma sị nnị Sizariya muu, nnị na ásụ dọghụapụ tẹ́sị oyi findi, sụḅagbiapụ túminị́ oyia si, ọ pịghị árị ḅẹ́ ésẹ́nie énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ mị dii ọ nwángịm.
english_text: Then he called two of his centurions and ordered them, “Get ready a detachment of two hundred soldiers, seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmento go to Caesarea at nine tonight.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị ásụ dọghụ Pọl pịrị ọ ḅụlọ, sị, árị ḅẹ́ ọ diin ḅụ muu Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Fẹlis láa.
english_text: Provide horses for Paul so that he may be taken safely to Governor Felix.”

ibani_text: Rom opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ ma warị ábálálá gịẹ, mị ọ gịẹ ábálálá ma dughonyẹ,
english_text: He wrote a letter as follows:

ibani_text: Mị ábálálá ma Klaudiosi Lisayas ḅara anịị anị saghị ḅo, Ori Opuu, Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Fẹlis pịrịnyẹ: a sịbịpị pa i sim.
english_text: Claudius Lysias, To His Excellency, Governor Felix: Greetings.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma mị owitụ́wọ ma kuu sị ọ ḅáá dọ́ghụm. A ḅo nimiḅom ḅẹ́ ori sọ Rom sẹkiriḅọ a warị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma pa mú ọ duapághámaḅom.
english_text: This man was seized by the Jews and they were about to kill him, but I came with my troops and rescued him, for I had learned that he is a Roman citizen.

ibani_text: A nimi dọ́ghụm nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ anịgo a warị ọ pa ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma dámámuu.
english_text: I wanted to know why they were accusing him, so I brought him to their Sanhedrin.

ibani_text: A ḅo dọghụ pághámaḅom ḅẹẹ ọ mịẹ sima nyẹ ofori ọ go fịị na ibinyẹ, anịgha n go ọ pa ịkóli ḅụ suabẹnyẹ. Ḅẹ́ nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma nna ólóghó gbolomam.
english_text: I found that the accusation had to do with questions about their law, but there was no charge against him that deserved death or imprisonment.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo dugho i pịrị sáá ḅẹ́ nnị biamam nnị ọ ḅáa bẹ ḅara, anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri a asọ dọ́ghụm sị ọ pa ị fịrịmaa. A dugho ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹapụ ma pịrịmam ḅẹẹ, nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma nnị anị akuoo ị tórúku.
english_text: When I was informed of a plot to be carried out against the man, I sent him to you at once. I also ordered his accusers to present to you their case against him.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma warị n ḅẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹ, nnị Pọl ákịm anị dii ma ḅụ sị ọ pa mú Antipatris láa.
english_text: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul with them during the night and brought him as far as Antipatris.

ibani_text: Éné ḅáanyẹ ma ḅụọ pa nwángịarị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma pịghịmaa nna fịnị yọ ḅom, ásụ ọgọnọ dọghụapụ ma warị ọ nana muu.
english_text: The next day they let the cavalry go on with him, while they returned to the barracks.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ pa Sizariya fịnịanga muum, warị diri ma ḅọ́rọ́ma Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma ḅárásua, pịghị Pọl saghị ọ ḅárásua.
english_text: When the cavalry arrived in Caesarea, they delivered the letter to the governor and handed Paul over to him.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma diri ma goom warị Pọl gbíla ḅẹ́ ori ọ tẹ́ parangáa ḅụ saghị ḅoo. O ḅo nimi ḅoo sáá ḅẹ́ Silisiya anịị o saghị ḅo ngaa,
english_text: The governor read the letter and asked what province he was from. Learning that he was from Cilicia,

ibani_text: Ori ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, A i naábẹm ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ị sịbị sẹapụ mịnga láa sáá. Ọ warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị Pọl pa ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ọ kúru bẹ angaá wárii, anịị Ámányánáḅọ Hẹrọd áláwarị.
english_text: he said, “I will hear your case when your accusers get here.” Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod’s palace.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ a dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sa, Ananayas opu igwagwaḅọ Siza dámámum ori na jẹa sẹ́nịapụ na pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ ólóghókieḅọ Tetulọs pa sịḅọ nnị warị n nyáná Pọl pịrị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma pa Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ Fẹlis tórúku kórómaa.
english_text: Five days later the high priest Ananias went down to Caesarea with some of the elders and a lawyer named Tertullus, and they brought their charges against Paul before the governor.

ibani_text: Nnị warị Pọl sị suu, Tetulọs wárị nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma kọ́rọ́ma Fẹlis tórúku. Ị́yẹ́ Pẹ́rẹ́! Ị́yẹ́ ibi ámátaḅara mịẹsị mị́sa wa nángwọ diin nyánam pịghị ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mị sẹ ma pịghị tọgha ibinyẹ na tọgha ịwọ nyẹ árịmam.
english_text: When Paul was called in, Tertullus presented his case before Felix: “We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation.

ibani_text: Wa mịma arịm ngámámgba pịghị sámámgba ḅụ, wa pịghị opuma bieḅẹlẹm sị ịmịẹḅam pa ị ḅẹm.
english_text: Everywhere and in every way, most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this with profound gratitude.

ibani_text: Á bigha a opuma ị́yẹ́ sáá ngúma, anịgo a tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ ị kẹ́lẹ́ birifama wa pughu wa dugho bẹ kálányẹ ma náa.
english_text: But in order not to weary you further, I would request that you be kind enough to hear us briefly.

ibani_text: Wa mị owitụ́wọ ma arịm ḅẹẹ ori opu ḅẹ́rẹ́náḅọ tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ anịị ọ pịghị ḅẹrẹ dighiarị ḅara Juuapụ ma ogbobie, ori ma anị pịghị sịbịdá Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ duapụ ogboapụ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: “We have found this man to be a troublemaker, stirring up riots among the Jews all over the world. He is a ringleader of the Nazarene sect

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ ọ Tamunoopuwárị ma pilema: anịị wamịnị ọ kuunyẹẹ.
english_text: and even tried to desecrate the temple; so we seized him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaḅọ ma Lisayas ḅom sị warị kụrọ ḅara pa wámịna ḅárabie ọ pughọakị.
english_text: But the commanding officer, Lysias, came and violently took him away from us,

ibani_text: Lisayas opu ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáḅọ warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹarịapụ ma ị damaḅo. Ị ḅọ́rọ́ mịị owitụ́wọ ma gbíla gbíla ịrịsọ pịghị dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm wa pa ọ sịbị sẹarịnyẹ mamgba.
english_text: By examining him yourself you will be able to learn the truth about all these charges we are bringing against him.”

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma sọ bịpị suam ḅẹ́ n pa ọ sịbị sẹarịnyẹ ma karakárá nyẹẹ.
english_text: The other Jews joined in the accusation, asserting that these things were true.

ibani_text: Ḅẹrẹtọḅọ ma warị ḅara pa Pọl fọngụma ḅẹ́ ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ẹ́, Pọl warị ọ ḅẹẹ: A nimim ḅẹ́ tọgha kụ́rá ḅụ ịrị anịị mị sẹ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ, anịgo i bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹ́ a ịḅụ pighíí i tórúku.
english_text: When the governor motioned for him to speak, Paul replied: “I know that for a number of years you have been a judge over this nation; so I gladly make my defense.

ibani_text: Ị ine ị ḅara na dọghụ pághámaḅo bẹ ḅara, na oyi mmẹẹ́ a dii ḅọ́rọ́gha a Jerusalem ḅo nyẹ ḅẹ́ a ḅo tẹ́ghẹ̄ẹ̄.
english_text: You can easily verify that no more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ma nnị ị́yẹ́ arịịgha a gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ na nụ́náarị sáá Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, anịgha nnị pịghị ị́yẹ́ arịị a túminị́ timi sághịarị sa Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ anịgha jẹa ngaa ámá ma bie.
english_text: My accusers did not find me arguing with anyone at the temple, or stirring up a crowd in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city.

ibani_text: Anịgha ḅẹ́ mị́sa nnị ine ḅara ḅụ ọlọ bẹnyẹ imi si pa die, mị́sa nnị pa i sịbị sẹarịnyẹ ma.
english_text: And they cannot prove to you the charges they are now making against me.

ibani_text: A mịma mininiakim i tórúku ḅẹẹ: a wámịna tádọ́apụ Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄m, pịghị anị asọ ma dua, nnị ḅẹ́arịnyẹ ma ḅẹẹ karakáragha. Kụ́ma a pịghị Mosis ólóghó diri bie n gịẹnyẹ mamgba mininim na pịghị ikiakoroapụ ma diri.
english_text: However, I admit that I worship the God of our ancestors as a follower of the Way, which they call a sect. I believe everything that is in accordance with the Law and that is written in the Prophets,

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma nyáná tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ anịị ịrị ma sọ nyáná nyẹ́ẹ́, ḅẹẹ túminị́ mamgba ibiapụ na siiapụ na fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: and I have the same hope in God as these men themselves have, that there will be a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked.

ibani_text: Anịgo a ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ la ḅárá mịẹm sị árị ḅẹ́ a fíafía kúkúbie nyánam Tamuno tórúku na pịghị túminị́ tórúku.
english_text: So I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa tọgha kụ́rá ḅụ a Jerusalem ḅụ ofori, a anị ngaa muum ḅẹ́ a kálá igbii nyẹ akị mú ịyẹa túminị́ pịrị pịghị igwagwaá.
english_text: “After an absence of several years, I came to Jerusalem to bring my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings.

ibani_text: A mịma mịẹarị sáá anịị nnị ị́yẹ́ árịnyẹ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie, a ojusiri igwaa ma gwafama sáá tọgha túminị́ i nana oforii anịgha, mangị na silé na sọ kiriakịgha.
english_text: I was ceremonially clean when they found me in the temple courts doing this. There was no crowd with me, nor was I involved in any disturbance.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma jẹa Juuapụ Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ párángáa ḅoapụ anị ngaa imii, nnị ḅo na ibim sị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa i sịbị sẹ, nnị árị sị a mịẹnyẹ imi nḅẹḅẹ́.
english_text: But there are some Jews from the province of Asia, who ought to be here before you and bring charges if they have anything against me.

ibani_text: Anịgha, mịngáá fịnịapụ ma dugho nnị árị sị a mịẹ siinyẹ, a sẹ sáá ámáḅẹ́rẹ́dughoapụ ma tórúku.
english_text: Or these who are here should state what crime they found in me when I stood before the Sanhedrin—

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ngéré anịị a ilúghú dughonyẹ a sẹ sáá nna tórúku ḅẹẹ: Ọmịnị i pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ḅom a mininim gosi ḅẹ́ fịịapụ ma fịị ḅụ sághị duma bie sọbẹm.
english_text: unless it was this one thing I shouted as I stood in their presence: ‘It is concerning the resurrection of the dead that I am on trial before you today.’ ”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, Fẹlis ibima asọ ma gbolomanyẹ nimiḅọ warị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ma gbẹ́ẹ̄. Ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, Rom ọ́mụ́gbi áláḅọ Lisayas ḅoo láa sáá, a ḅẹ́rẹ́ pẹ́lẹ́bẹm.
english_text: Then Felix, who was well acquainted with the Way, adjourned the proceedings. “When Lysias the commander comes,” he said, “I will decide your case.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị nnị Pọl pa ḅárásua ọ́mụ́gbiḅọ ma ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ, o mú Pọl pa kúru ngaa warị kụ́ma ọ kẹ́lẹ́ dii wọwọọma ọ pịrị, ọ pịghị ọrẹ nangwọapụ wáriso sị nnị o binyẹ pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: He ordered the centurion to keep Paul under guard but to give him some freedom and permit his friends to take care of his needs.

ibani_text: Éné ḅo kẹ́lẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Fẹlis na ọ taa Durusila Juu ọ́rụ́ḅọ warị ḅo ḅoo. Ọ warị fịrịma Pọl sii warị o pughu ọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ minini gbolomanyẹ dugho.
english_text: Several days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla, who was Jewish. He sent for Paul and listened to him as he spoke about faith in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl saghị ibiamịẹnyẹ, na ine ḅụ ọlọ, na pịghị ḅoarị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma dughoarị sáá, ḅáláfaa warị Fẹlis ḅụ sọọ, ọ warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa ị ine soobẹm. A jẹ́ pa sáá nyáná sáá a i sịbẹm.
english_text: As Paul talked about righteousness, self-control and the judgment to come, Felix was afraid and said, “That’s enough for now! You may leave. When I find it convenient, I will send for you.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie dighiarị ḅẹ́ Pọl kẹ́lẹ́ igbii nyẹ pa ọ pịrịbẹm anịma go, sáá ḅụ akị mú sáá láa, ori ọ sịbẹm sị ori ọ nana ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: At the same time he was hoping that Paul would offer him a bribe, so he sent for him frequently and talked with him.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Pọsiosi Fẹstọsị ḅo Fẹlis kiriakịm ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ḅara. Kụ́ma Fẹlis ibi pa Juuapụ ma mịẹbẹ goo, warị Pọl wáriso ịkóli wárịbie.
english_text: When two years had passed, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, but because Felix wanted to grant a favor to the Jews, he left Paul in prison.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Fẹstọsị ḅo anị ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ma láa sáá, o Sizariya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Jerusalem muum,
english_text: Three days after arriving in the province, Festus went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem,

ibani_text: igwagwaalaapụ na Juu sịbịdaapụ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa Pọl sịbị ḅụ sẹ angaá. Nnị warị Fẹstọsị tẹ́ghẹ̄
english_text: where the chief priests and the Jewish leaders appeared before him and presented the charges against Paul.

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ ọ mị ibi ma mịẹ n pịrị sị Pọl wáriso sị o Jerusalem ḅoo, tegó n biamam nnị ḅara warị ọ ḅáá bẹ ḅárá asọogbo.
english_text: They requested Festus, as a favor to them, to have Paul transferred to Jerusalem, for they were preparing an ambush to kill him along the way.

ibani_text: Fẹstọsị warị n págháraa ḅẹẹ, Pọl nnị ọ pa ikólibie suam Sizariya ḅụ irịsọ pịghịma anị ngaa muubẹm ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ.
english_text: Festus answered, “Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.

ibani_text: Ọmịna sịbịdáapụ i nana Sizariya ḅoo sị anị ngaa ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹ ọ mịẹ irimamaa nyẹ imi nḅẹḅẹ́.
english_text: Let some of your leaders come with me, and if the man has done anything wrong, they can press charges against him there.”

ibani_text: Fẹstọsị nnị na inine a dii anịgha oyia dii fịnịm, anị sáá maẹrẹ anịị o ḅo soo Sizariya mú nyẹ. Anị ḅụ éné ḅáá anịị o mú ori ịkasị akị nyẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ yọ ma ḅụ, warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị Pọl akuoo ḅo.
english_text: After spending eight or ten days with them, Festus went down to Caesarea. The next day he convened the court and ordered that Paul be brought before him.

ibani_text: Pọl anị ngaa láa sáá, Jerusalem ḅụ saghị ḅo Juuapụ ma ọ gbiri ikélekélem warị saghị kirikiri nyẹ dugho ọ sịbị sẹ, kụ́ma nnị ḅara pa ọlọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ofori ḅẹ́ mị ọ mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: When Paul came in, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him. They brought many serious charges against him, but they could not prove them.

ibani_text: Kuma Pọl ọ ḅụ pighim ḅẹẹ: A miẹsima Juuapụ ólóghó ofori, anịgha Tamunoopuwarị ma, anịgha Rom sẹ táarịḅọ.
english_text: Then Paul made his defense: “I have done nothing wrong against the Jewish law or against the temple or against Caesar.”

ibani_text: Kụma Fẹstọsị ibi pa Juuapụ ma mịẹbẹ gosi, warị Pọl gbíla ḅẹ́, Ị mini Jerusalem ḅo bẹ sị aningáa i tórúku sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kiri ḅụ nnị pa ị sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅụ?
english_text: Festus, wishing to do the Jews a favor, said to Paul, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and stand trial before me there on these charges?”

ibani_text: Pọl warị ḅẹẹ, A sẹ ma táarịḅọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ yọ ḅụ imii, nnị i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ na ibi ngaa, a gbẹ́rẹ́ siinyẹ sọ pa Juuapụ ma mịẹgha, ọmịnị sọ ibima nimiḅara.
english_text: Paul answered: “I am now standing before Caesar’s court, where I ought to be tried. I have not done any wrong to the Jews, as you yourself know very well.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ ólóghó kórómam pịghị nyẹ mịẹsimamam mịẹsị n fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ i sịbị, a bibịẹgha ḅẹ́ ọ mịnị papa i wáriso. Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ karakárányẹ ofori anị bie, nnị pa i sịbị sẹarịnyẹ ma, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine i saghị nna ḅarabie suabịgha. A ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma pa Sẹ Táaḅọ ma tórúku ḅom.
english_text: If, however, I am guilty of doing anything deserving death, I do not refuse to die. But if the charges brought against me by these Jews are not true, no one has the right to hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, Fẹstọsị, ori ọ daatụ́ghụ́maapụ ma na bịpịakị fama sáá pagharam ḅẹẹ, Ị koko ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅọ́rọ́ma Sẹ Táaḅọ tórúku ḅo ma, Sẹ Táaḅọ ma anịị ị pịghị dama mú bẹḅọ.
english_text: After Festus had conferred with his council, he declared: “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you will go!”

ibani_text: Kálá sáá tụwọ ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa na Benisi o numboru ọ́rụ́ḅọ Sizariya ḅom sị nnị ị ḅoma pa Fẹstọsị ḅẹẹ.
english_text: A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus.

ibani_text: Nnị tọgha dii fịnị fama sáá, Fẹstọsị wárị Pọl ḅẹ́rẹ́ dugho Ámányánáḅọ ma pịrị, Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ mịnga imi Fẹlis ikólibie warịsó ḅọ.
english_text: Since they were spending many days there, Festus discussed Paul’s case with the king. He said: “There is a man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.

ibani_text: A Jerusalem muu sáá Juuapụ igwagwaalaapụ ma na Juuapụ sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighi ḅo ọ sịbị sẹm warị i ḅara bi ḅẹẹ a fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ ọ sịbị.
english_text: When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a dugho n pịrịm ḅẹ́ wamịnị Romapụ anịị wámịna nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅaragha ḅẹ́, wa nnị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa sịbị sẹ ḅọ saghị ḅara ḅụ sua suagha n ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa sịbị sẹ ḅọ ma, ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọ sịbị sẹapụ ma na tọ́rụ donnagha tọ́rụ́ na tọ́rụ́ náa pịghị ine asọ arịm sị nna ḅụ pighíí nnị pa nna sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma gosi.
english_text: “I told them that it is not the Roman custom to hand over anyone before they have faced their accusers and have had an opportunity to defend themselves against the charges.

ibani_text: Nnị mịngáá ḅo sáá, a sáá ngúmágha, anị ḅụ éné ḅa a iyẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ yọ ḅụ kpọrọfịnịm warị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́, nnị owitụ́wọ ma akuoo.
english_text: When they came here with me, I did not delay the case, but convened the court the next day and ordered the man to be brought in.

ibani_text: Ori irunaapụ saghị sẹm, kụ́ma nnị ine a kóróma sị nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ bẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma pa ọ sịbị sẹgha.
english_text: When his accusers got up to speak, they did not charge him with any of the crimes I had expected.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kálá nụná nyẹ anịị n nyánányẹ, nna Tamuno nimi gbolomanyẹ na pịghị Jizọs pa sị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ fịịmaá ḅọ, Pọl ḅẹẹ ḅọ ḅẹẹ o dumafịnịm.
english_text: Instead, they had some points of dispute with him about their own religion and about a dead man named Jesus who Paul claimed was alive.

ibani_text: I tẹ́mẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá sẹghaa, a ḅara warị mịná ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma gbolomanyẹ nyáná ḅo bẹ ḅara, a warị Pọl gbíla ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mini sị Jerusalem ḅo bẹ sị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kiri sẹ sị n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ọ sịbị.
english_text: I was at a loss how to investigate such matters; so I asked if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem and stand trial there on these charges.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅọ́rọ́ma jẹa ngaa múm, o bim ḅẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma o kúru sị Sẹ Táaḅọ ma ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́. Anịgo a bịpị pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị ọ pa kúrúapụ ḅara warị ákị mú a ine ọ pa Siza, Sẹ́ Táaḅọ fịrịma bẹ sa láa.
english_text: But when Paul made his appeal to be held over for the Emperor’s decision, I ordered him held until I could send him to Caesar.”

ibani_text: Agiripa warị Fẹstọsị ḅẹẹ, A i biri náa mị owitụ́wọ ma naábim. Fẹstọsị warị ọ pagharaa ḅẹẹ, Ḅáa ịrị ọ naábẹm.
english_text: Then Agrippa said to Festus, “I would like to hear this man myself.” He replied, “Tomorrow you will hear him.”

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅáa Agiripa na Benisi warị ḅoo ḅo yọngọ na pịghị nnị ála diepágháma ḅụ, wárị túminị́ ma fịnịngaa ma sọọ, ori na ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáapụ na, na pịghị ama ma bie sịbịdáapụ. Fẹstọsị warị bịpị pịrị nnị warị Pọl akuoo.
english_text: The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience room with the high-ranking military officers and the prominent men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.

ibani_text: Fẹstọsị warị ḅẹẹ, Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa na mịnga wamịnị na fịnịapụ mamgba ḅẹ́, ọ kọkọ mịị owitụ́wọ ma arịị! Ọ sịbị goo Juuapụ mamgba mịnga na Jerusalem ḅụ fịnịapụ ma dighiḅọ i tórúku kóróma ḅẹ́rẹ́. Nnị warị ilúghú ḅẹẹ, ọmịnị pa duma na ibighaa.
english_text: Festus said: “King Agrippa, and all who are present with us, you see this man! The whole Jewish community has petitioned me about him in Jerusalem and here in Caesarea, shouting that he ought not to live any longer.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a ine arịḅogha ọ mịẹsị nnị fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ na gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ. Ori ma pịghị bi ḅara ma ḅẹ́ nnị ọ pa Sẹ́ Táaḅọ ma tórúku ḅoo. A warị anịgo ọ fịrịma.
english_text: I found he had done nothing deserving of death, but because he made his appeal to the Emperor I decided to send him to Rome.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a nyáná sị gịẹ Sẹ́ Táaḅọ ma fịrịma bẹnyẹ ofori. Anịgo a ori akuomam ọmịna tórúku, karakáráma i tórúku Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa ḅẹẹ ị́ ibima tọ́rụ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅụ suu fama sa a ine a gịẹ bẹnyẹ nyánábẹm.
english_text: But I have nothing definite to write to His Majesty about him. Therefore I have brought him before all of you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that as a result of this investigation I may have something to write.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, anị ịḅụ karakáragha ḅẹ́ a ịkóli na ḅo pa ị fịrịma ḅọ́rọ́ a ine gịẹ kórómagha, nnị pa ọ sịbị sẹ siiamịẹnyẹ.
english_text: For I think it is unreasonable to send a prisoner on to Rome without specifying the charges against him.”

ibani_text: Agiripa warị Pọl ḅẹẹ, A asọ pa ị pịrịm ị́ ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bẹm ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ. Pọl warị ọ ḅara sụghụma tórúku muu, warị mị ḅara ma pa ọ ḅụ pighíí:
english_text: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You have permission to speak for yourself.” So Paul motioned with his hand and began his defense:

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa, a akịm ḅẹ́ a ibifúḅara nyánam ḅẹẹ mịmgba éné a ị tórúku sẹ sị ịḅụ pighíí Juuapụ ma pa i sịbị sẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: “King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate to stand before you today as I make my defense against all the accusations of the Jews,

ibani_text: Ị pịghị ibima Juuapụ nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara na nna nụná nụná nyẹ nimitẹ́lẹ́mam, anịgo a i tẹ́ghẹ̄m kẹ́lẹ́ birifama i pughuu.
english_text: and especially so because you are well acquainted with all the Jewish customs and controversies. Therefore, I beg you to listen to me patiently.

ibani_text: Juuapụ mamgba nimim a ị́yẹ́ duma kọọ maá ḅara a ásátụ́wọ ḅụ fịnị sa éné éné. Nnị nimim parị a ị́yẹ́ duma gbọrụ gulugulumam ị́yẹ́ ama bie na pịghị Jerusalem bie.
english_text: “The Jewish people all know the way I have lived ever since I was a child, from the beginning of my life in my own country, and also in Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị inimimam ḅọlọmaa sa éné éné, pịghị ine dugho pághámabẹm ḅọ́rọ́ nnị dugho págháma dọ́ghụ́ ḅẹ́, irị Farisiiḅọ, pịghị wámịna tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara ḅụ, a duma kọmam ologho ma na karakárá ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: They have known me for a long time and can testify, if they are willing, that I conformed to the strictest sect of our religion, living as a Pharisee.

ibani_text: Anịgo mị́sa a ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ḅụ sẹm a nyáná tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ, Tamuno minini wámịna tádọ́apụ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: And now it is because of my hope in what God has promised our ancestors that I am on trial today.

ibani_text: Mị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma anịị wámịna oyi mmẹẹ́ sẹ findi ma binyẹ ḅẹ́ nnị árịbẹm, nnị Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ́arị ḅara ḅá na dii na. Mị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma gosi, Ị́yẹ́ Pẹ́rẹ́, anị mị Juuapụ ma go ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa i sịbị sẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: This is the promise our twelve tribes are hoping to see fulfilled as they earnestly serve God day and night. King Agrippa, it is because of this hope that these Jews are accusing me.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị mịnga fịnịapụ ma, anị tegó ọ ḅụdaarị minini ḅẹ́ Tamuno fịịapụ sị saghịmaarị fịị ḅụ.
english_text: Why should any of you consider it incredible that God raises the dead?

ibani_text: Irịsọ a kórómam ḅẹ́ a ine nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ pa asọ mgbẹsẹ Jizọs Krais Nazarẹtị ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ ma pịrịm.
english_text: “I too was convinced that I ought to do all that was possible to oppose the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

ibani_text: Anịị a mịẹnyẹ Jerusalem ḅụ. A kụrọ nyánaḅom igwagwaalaapụ ma ḅara sị tọgha Tamuno túminị́ pa ịkóli bie sua, n pịghị fịị ḅẹrẹ pẹ́lẹ́ sáá n sịbị a kundu sua fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ n pịrịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: And that is just what I did in Jerusalem. On the authority of the chief priests I put many of the Lord’s people in prison, and when they were put to death, I cast my vote against them.

ibani_text: Tọgha a sáá ḅụ, a nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam Juuapụ kobiri yọ ma ḅụ, pịghị árị ḅẹ́ nnị nna minini pighíí, nnị opuma ị́yẹ́ igánimam ḅẹ́ a ine n dua mú jẹ́ ámá lam a nnị mbasị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Many a time I went from one synagogue to another to have them punished, and I tried to force them to blaspheme. I was so obsessed with persecuting them that I even hunted them down in foreign cities.

ibani_text: Mịma go anịị a Damasikọs muunyẹ igwagwaalaapụ ma ḅara a nyánáḅọ kụ́rọ na n saghị i ḅárásua fịrị.
english_text: “On one of these journeys I was going to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ Pẹ́rẹ́, asọogbo, énéḅa so ogbo ogbo anịị a ḅo baá arịị nyẹ bia ịrụa nẹngịma baá sobie saghị ḅoarị nyẹ, bia ikelekele nyẹ na pịghị i nana nyẹ ma muarịapụ ma.
english_text: About noon, King Agrippa, as I was on the road, I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, blazing around me and my companions.

ibani_text: Wa bịghị kiri koro sáá, a pụghọ naam ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrịnyẹ Hiburu ḅẹlẹ ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Sọl! Sọl! I tegó i pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị? Ịḅụ anịị i nyẹ pa lamarịnyẹ ị ḅụọ ma tẹ́ pịghị sáá, ásụ ḅụọ pa anị nyánáḅọ sị tẹ́ ḅara ma.
english_text: We all fell to the ground, and I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic,‘Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’

ibani_text: A warị gbíla, Ịrị tụọ, Inyanaḅọ? Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma warị i pagharam, Irị anịị Jizọs í pa tọ́rụ́siarịmáarịḅo.
english_text: “Then I asked, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ “‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,’the Lord replied.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma saghị sị ị ḅụọ ḅụ sẹ. A ịḅụ pa i diemam sị pịghị i tọ ḅẹ́ ịrị ị́yẹ́ ómóniḅọ sọọ. I dugho jẹapụ pịrịbẹm mịmgba ị́ ịḅụ arịmáa nyẹ, a pịghị tórúku ju pa i diebẹnyẹ.
english_text: ‘Now get up and stand on your feet. I have appeared to you to appoint you as a servant and as a witness of what you have seen and will see of me.

ibani_text: A ị dụapághámaḅobẹm Izirẹlịawọ ma ḅara na pịghị Juughapụ ma ḅarabie a ị pa fịrị ma bẹapụ.
english_text: I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles. I am sending you to them

ibani_text: Ịrị nna tọ́rụ findibẹm sị pịghị kánákánábie nna akuoo ḅo baá bie soo, pịghị Satanị kụrọ bie nna akuoo ḅo Tamuno bie sua, sị nnị siiḅụḅarasipịrị nyáná bẹ ḅara, sị nnị ịḅụ nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, sị pịghị nna kiri nyáná Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma ogbobie.
english_text: to open their eyes and turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’

ibani_text: Anịgo, Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa, a mịnị biri inighima sobie a kọọ múnogha dáwọ ma pịrịgha.
english_text: “So then, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the vision from heaven.

ibani_text: Parị parị Damasikọs ḅụ na pịghị Jerusalem na pịghị Judiya gbọrụ, na pịghị Juughaapụ ma bie, a dugho wásáma n pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị nna sii ḅụ pịghịị, n pịghị sị Tamuno ma damaḅo sị nyẹ mịẹ diepágháma bẹnyẹ ḅẹ́ karakáráma nnị nna sii ḅụ pịghịmam.
english_text: First to those in Damascus, then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and then to the Gentiles, I preached that they should repent and turn to God and demonstrate their repentance by their deeds.

ibani_text: Mịma go anịị mị Juuapụ ma go i kuu nyẹ a Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịnị sáá, n pịghị asọ dọ́ghụm nnị i ḅáá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: That is why some Jews seized me in the temple courts and tried to kill me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma akị ḅo mịmgba éné ma láa a Tamuno ḅárásua nyánaḅom, anịgo a mịngáá sẹ sị onyẹsẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba pịrị, káláapụ na opuapụ na. A dughonyẹ ma anịị ikiakoroapụ ma na Mosis dughonyẹ ḅẹ́ pághábẹm:
english_text: But God has helped me to this very day; so I stand here and testify to small and great alike. I am saying nothing beyond what the prophets and Moses said would happen—

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ, Krais ma opuma tọ́rụ́siarịbẹm pịghị parị ḅọ fịị ḅụ saghị bẹḅọ, sị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma baá ma dugho págháma Juuapụ na Juughaapụ pịrị.
english_text: that the Messiah would suffer and, as the first to rise from the dead, would bring the message of light to his own people and to the Gentiles.”

ibani_text: Pọl mị ḅara pa ọ ḅụ pighíí sáá, Fẹstọsị warị ọ sịbị ilúghú ḅẹẹ, Ị nọmụarị Pọl, ị́yẹ́ opu diridáwọ anị nọmụ ḅara pa i mịẹarị!
english_text: At this point Festus interrupted Paul’s defense. “You are out of your mind, Paul!” he shouted. “Your great learning is driving you insane.”

ibani_text: Pọl warị ọ págháraa, A nọmugha Ị́yẹ́ Pẹ́rẹ́ akụ karakárá ma anịị a dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: “I am not insane, most excellent Festus,” Paul replied. “What I am saying is true and reasonable.

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa, a ine ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ị pịrịbẹm tegó ị mịnanyẹ mamgba nimim. A pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ mịnanyẹ mamgba ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ịḅụ sáámágháá, tegó mịnanyẹ ma kiri akịịghaa ḅọghu angaá ḅụ.
english_text: The king is familiar with these things, and I can speak freely to him. I am convinced that none of this has escaped his notice, because it was not done in a corner.

ibani_text: Ámányánáḅọ Agiripa, ikiakoroapụ ma ị nnị mininigha? A nimim ḅẹẹ ịrị n mininim.
english_text: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know you do.”

ibani_text: Agiripa warị Pọl ḅẹẹ, Ị sị ḅẹ́ mị kálá sáátụọ ma ḅụ, i ine ị pịghịma Krais ọḅụduaḅọ sọ bẹ?
english_text: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “Do you think that in such a short time you can persuade me to be a Christian?”

ibani_text: Pọl warị págháraa, Ḅọ́rọ́ gbulu kálá sáá, anịgha nángwọ kálá sáá, a tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno pịrịarị ḅẹ́ ịrị na i pụghọ naarịapụ mamgba mịmgba, ḅo a fịnị ḅara fịnịbẹm, kụ́ma mị i ḅara fịnị ịkóli maagha.
english_text: Paul replied, “Short time or long—I pray to God that not only you but all who are listening to me today may become what I am, except for these chains.”

ibani_text: Anị sáá, Ámányánáḅọ ma, Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma na Benisi na pịghị isiapụ mamgba warị saghịị so.
english_text: The king rose, and with him the governor and Bernice and those sitting with them.

ibani_text: Nnị saghị so fama sáá, n warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mị owitụ́wọ ma, na ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹgha fịị na gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ, anịgha n goo ọ pa ikólibie suabẹnyẹ.
english_text: After they left the room, they began saying to one another, “This man is not doing anything that deserves death or imprisonment.”

ibani_text: Agiripa warị Fẹstọsị ḅẹẹ, Wa mị owitụ́wọ ma warisodọghụm o so, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọrẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma pa Sẹ Táaḅọ ma tórúku ḅogha.
english_text: Agrippa said to Festus, “This man could have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅo minini sáá ḅẹ́ wa sua pághá Ịtalị muu, n jẹ́ ikólinaapụ na Pọl na sághị Juliọsi ḅarabie suam, ori anịị, Sịbịdá sẹ táarịḅọ ọ́mụ́gbiapụ pa sịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: When it was decided that we would sail for Italy, Paul and some other prisoners were handed over to a centurion named Julius, who belonged to the Imperial Regiment.

ibani_text: Wa muu árụ́ ḅụ́lọm Adramitiyum ḅụ lụḅa sii sị Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ ngása fịnị ámá tọ́rụ́aka ḅụ fịnị ámá agbáá, wa wárii suasi. Aristakọs Masidoniya bie fịnị Tẹ́salonaika ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ wamịnị ná imii.
english_text: We boarded a ship from Adramyttium about to sail for ports along the coast of the province of Asia, and we put out to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian from Thessalonica, was with us.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụ éné ḅáā wa Sidọn ḅụ dọghụ sọmam, Juliọsi Pọl ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, ọ warị o wáriso sị ọ muu ọrẹ nángwọ́apụ dighii, sị nnị o binyẹ dọghụ ọ pịrịị.
english_text: The next day we landed at Sidon; and Julius, in kindness to Paul, allowed him to go to his friends so they might provide for his needs.

ibani_text: Wa warị anị ngaa árụ́ si, kụ́ma fọ́rụ ma wamịnị na kuragha gosi, wa warị Saiprọs ogbosúányẹ ámá ma, isi párángáa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fọ́rụ ma kụrọgha ngaa.
english_text: From there we put out to sea again and passed to the lee of Cyprus because the winds were against us.

ibani_text: Wa warị Silisiya na Pamfiliya tọ́rụ́ saḅa sị ḅo Mira láa, Lisiya ama bie.
english_text: When we had sailed across the open sea off the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we landed at Myra in Lycia.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa anịị ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaaḅọ ma warị Alegizandiriya saghị ḅo árụ́ árịnyẹ Ịtalị múuarị nyẹ, ọ wárị wa pa árụ́ ma bie sẹ.
english_text: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy and put us on board.

ibani_text: Kẹ́lẹ́kẹlẹ anịị árụ́ ma nwángị nyẹ tọgha dii ḅụ, wamịnị opuma tụ́ḅụrụ dam gosi kunema wa ḅo Knidọs tọ́rụ́aka lam, fọ́rụ ma mịnị minigha wa tórúku muu, wa warị Krete ogbosúányẹ ama ma ọḅụju ḅọ́rọ́ fọ́rụ ma opuma kụrọgha angaá, warị anị ngá ḅọ́rọ́ mú Salmọnị pa sị ogbosúányẹ ámá ngása ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: We made slow headway for many days and had difficulty arriving off Cnidus. When the wind did not allow us to hold our course, we sailed to the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

ibani_text: Wa kiri na kikia fịnịm, ḅụ́da ḅara ḅụ anị wa ine ḅo Árụ́ fafagha árụ́ sọma ngaa pa sị ngaa láa, anị ḅọlọgha Lasiya ama ḅụ.
english_text: We moved along the coast with difficulty and came to a place called Fair Havens, near the town of Lasea.

ibani_text: Wamịnị anị ngaa opuma sáá ngúmá wárii sị anị ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́sa lam sị mú nyẹ ma mịnị tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́maágha, ḅurukụ́ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ sị Igwagwaá Sii Pịrị Éné ma sọọ ḅọ́rọ́mam. Pọl warị mị againma ma pa nnị againma.
english_text: Much time had been lost, and sailing had already become dangerous because by now it was after the Day of Atonement.So Paul warned them,

ibani_text: Owiapụ a arịḅom ḅẹ́ wámịna muunyẹ mịnga saghị, anị opuma tẹ́mẹ́ nainaimabẹm, árụ́ bie wa dighi tọgha nyẹ sibẹm, árụ́ ma sọọ, túminị́ duma sọ fabẹm.
english_text: “Men, I can see that our voyage is going to be disastrous and bring great loss to ship and cargo, and to our own lives also.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaaḅọ ma, ọ Pọl dughonyẹ ma pughu bẹ nakaragha, árụ́ nyánáḅọ ma na árụ́ ma sịbịdáaḅọ pịrị againma duam.
english_text: But the centurion, instead of listening to what Paul said, followed the advice of the pilot and of the owner of the ship.

ibani_text: Árụ́sọ́ma angaá ma ibi ngaghaa tumḅọ fịnị o ḅuu sáá, anịgo kị́nị́mamgba dughoarị ḅẹ́ wamịnị árụ́ ma dọghụ tórúku muu sị wa pịghị ine ine mú Fonisi láa, sị wa ḅọ́rọ́ ine ine oḅuu bie ma ḅụ anị ngaa fịnịị. Fonisi anị Krete ḅụ fịnị árụsọma ngaa na dama dama nyẹ, sughu bie ẹ́rẹ́ḅáranga daá pịghị ọ́gọ́nọ ẹ́rẹ́ḅáranga.
english_text: Since the harbor was unsuitable to winter in, the majority decided that we should sail on, hoping to reach Phoenix and winter there. This was a harbor in Crete, facing both southwest and northwest.

ibani_text: Diin fọ́rụ warị saghị ofuro sughu ju, túminị́ ma pịghị siim ḅẹ́ nnị ine n tọ́nyẹ mịẹbẹm, n warị lụḅa ma nụ́nụ́ sẹ warị kẹ́lẹ́kẹlẹ Krete posie aka angaá ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: When a gentle south wind began to blow, they saw their opportunity; so they weighed anchor and sailed along the shore of Crete.

ibani_text: Kuma anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri gbẹ́rẹ́ kụrọ́ fọ́rụ ofurom amaḅara sịbịju pa sị ngaa nyẹ, kiri ḅụ anị saghị ofurom.
english_text: Before very long, a wind of hurricane force, called the Northeaster, swept down from the island.

ibani_text: Anị ḅo árụ́ ma ḅaghu, árụ́ ma ine fọ́rụ ma dagha ḅara ma, anịị wamịnị árụ́ ma wáriso nyẹ sị mingi anị dighi.
english_text: The ship was caught by the storm and could not head into the wind; so we gave way to it and were driven along.

ibani_text: Wa kẹ́lẹ́ sịbị ḅọghu angaá arịm, wa Kauda pa sị ogbosúányẹ ámá ọḅụdụ ḅọ́rọ́ sáá. Anị ngaa, anị wa n pa sịbị keke kálá árụ́, n pa opu árụ́ ma ọḅụju kpọ nyẹ saghị árụ́ bie sẹ nyẹ.
english_text: As we passed to the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were hardly able to make the lifeboat secure,

ibani_text: Nnị kálá árụ́ ma saghị opu árụ́ ma bie sẹ sị anị kpọ fama sáá, ḅáláfa pa nna bie imi ḅẹẹ nnị ine mú Libiya mụ́mọ ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ gbánabẹm, n warị vála ma kọ́rọ́ma sị fọ́rụ ma árụ́ ma dighi.
english_text: so the men hoisted it aboard. Then they passed ropes under the ship itself to hold it together. Because they were afraid they would run aground on the sandbars of Syrtis, they lowered the sea anchorand let the ship be driven along.

ibani_text: Kụrọ fọ́rụ ma pa fiearị, anịgo éné ḅa sáá, nnị warị saghị árụ́ ma dighi ngọ nyẹ ma dighi ḅuu ma.
english_text: We took such a violent battering from the storm that the next day they began to throw the cargo overboard.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ éné ḅáá sáá, n pịghị árụ́ dighi jẹa ngwongwo dighi ḅuu ma.
english_text: On the third day, they threw the ship’s tackle overboard with their own hands.

ibani_text: Tọgha éné ḅụ, wamịnị ine ịrụa anịgha sobie fịnị ḅálōló arịgha fọ́rụ ma pa kụrọ ḅara pa ofuroarị. Kunema, wa tẹ́mẹ́ sim ḅẹ́ wa dumabẹm.
english_text: When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and the storm continued raging, we finally gave up all hope of being saved.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba tọgha dii ḅụ nyẹ́fịgha pa fịnị fama sáá Pọl nna tórúku sẹm warị ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ i bịpị pughu sị árụ́ ma wáriso Krete ḅụ, wa mị faá mamgba fabịgha.
english_text: After they had gone a long time without food, Paul stood up before them and said: “Men, you should have taken my advice not to sail from Crete; then you would have spared yourselves this damage and loss.

ibani_text: Anịgo mị́sa a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ọ tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so amịna duma famabịgha, árụ́ ma ngéré anịị faá bẹnyẹ.
english_text: But now I urge you to keep up your courage, because not one of you will be lost; only the ship will be destroyed.

ibani_text: Bia dii, i Nyáná Tamuno ma pịghị a tẹ́ghẹ̄arị Tamuno ma sookumuḅọ, fịrịma a fịnị ngása ḅom.
english_text: Last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, Pọl ḅáláfama, ḅẹ́ i sẹbẹm Sẹ Táaḅọ ma tórúku, Tamuno pịghị ọ nyáná ị pịrị ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, i nana nyẹ ma muarịapụ mamgba duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: and said, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul. You must stand trial before Caesar; and God has graciously given you the lives of all who sail with you.’

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná, owiapụ awọ! A Tamuno ḅụ mininim ḅẹ́ n dugho i pịrị ḅara ma anịị anị pághá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: So keep up your courage, men, for I have faith in God that it will happen just as he told me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị wa suma mú gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ọgọnọ ḅụ kọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Nevertheless, we must run aground on some island.”

ibani_text: Dii dii, mị oyi ínia dii findi irisé wa pa ikelekelearị nyẹ Meditaraniya tọ́rụ́ ma ḅụ. Anị dii ogbo lámam, árụ́ ma bie fịrịnwangịapụ ma saghị ọwụ ma sáá ḅẹẹ wa kiri na kikiamam.
english_text: On the fourteenth night we were still being driven across the AdriaticSea, when about midnight the sailors sensed they were approaching land.

ibani_text: Nnị warị ikúnyẹ pa árị́dírí sịbị kpọ sị anị kóróma, nnị anị nụ́nụ́ sághị sáá n ḅo arịḅom ḅẹẹ anị angaá ma póghóló rula suéné a sị lam, kẹ́lẹ́ sáá ḅọ́rọ́ n pịghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịẹm, mị́sa anị ḅo ínia si oyi findi lam anị póghóló.
english_text: They took soundings and found that the water was a hundred and twenty feetdeep. A short time later they took soundings again and found it was ninety feetdeep.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅáláfam ḅẹ́ árụ́ ma mú okpo dapịrị ḅụ kóróbẹm, n warị nune ju ínia lụḅa kóróma, warị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ éné álála ḅáá.
english_text: Fearing that we would be dashed against the rocks, they dropped four anchors from the stern and prayed for daylight.

ibani_text: Árụ́fịrịnwangịapụ ma warị asọ dọghụ nnị árụ́ ma bie mangị sọ bẹ ḅara, n warị kálá árụ́ ma terema mingi daá, warị mbasị ḅẹ́ n muu lụḅa kórómadoghum árụ́ kụ́lọ́ angaá ma ḅụ.
english_text: In an attempt to escape from the ship, the sailors let the lifeboat down into the sea, pretending they were going to lower some anchors from the bow.

ibani_text: Pọl warị ọmụsịbịdaḅọ ma na ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ árụ́fịrịnwangịapụ ma árụ́ ma bie fịnịgha fịnịgha, anị ḅụdaabẹm ọmịna duma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: Then Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers, “Unless these men stay with the ship, you cannot be saved.”

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma warị nnị pa árụ́ ma kpọ árị́dírí ma pẹ́lẹ́ sị árụ́ ma wáriso.
english_text: So the soldiers cut the ropes that held the lifeboat and let it drift away.

ibani_text: Ḅáásó ḅụ, Pọl warị n tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma fị́nyẹ fịị, ḅẹẹ mị oyi ínia dii ọ ḅụrụ pa ọḅụ ḅáma sị mini nyẹ fịgha.
english_text: Just before dawn Paul urged them all to eat. “For the last fourteen days,” he said, “you have been in constant suspense and have gone without food—you haven’t eaten anything.

ibani_text: Anịgo a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m, ọ kẹ́lẹ́ nyẹ́fịị, sị anị ịnyọ pa ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara. Sịbịnumo gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịbị sọ sóghóro fabịgha.
english_text: Now I urge you to take some food. You need it to survive. Not one of you will lose a single hair from his head.”

ibani_text: Ọ mịma dugho fama sáá, Pọl fịtúrú akịm warị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ́ nnị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, ori anị puum warị saghị fịị.
english_text: After he said this, he took some bread and gave thanks to God in front of them all. Then he broke it and began to eat.

ibani_text: Nnị warị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná, nnị kị́nị́mamgba warị fị́nyẹ kálányẹ fịị.
english_text: They were all encouraged and ate some food themselves.

ibani_text: Wamịnị árụ́ ma bie fịnịiapụ túminị́ oyia si tẹ́si oyi findi na suene.
english_text: Altogether there were 276 of us on board.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ́fị n furo bi fama sáá, n warị árụ́ ma mịẹ sara sara ma, nnị fịtúrú mịẹ sịmgbọlụ ma sara ḅuuma fama ḅara tọ́rụ́bie.
english_text: When they had eaten as much as they wanted, they lightened the ship by throwing the grain into the sea.

ibani_text: Énéḅa sáá, mingi árụ́fịrịnwangịarịapụ ma mịnị kiri bịpị lighlighiḅogha, kụ́ma tọ́rụ́ arịm ogbosúányẹ nyánányẹ, n warị ḅẹ́ nnị árụ́ dọghụ anị angaá kiri sọmabẹm.
english_text: When daylight came, they did not recognize the land, but they saw a bay with a sandy beach, where they decided to run the ship aground if they could.

ibani_text: Nnị warị lụḅa ma pẹ́lẹ́ si anị warị tọ́rụ ma ḅụ bile, nnị warị pịghị n pa vála ma kpọ árị́dírí ma fiima, warị vála ma saghị árụ́kụ́lọ ma ḅụ sẹ ma, fọ́rụ vála ma ofuro sị nnị dighi nwángị kiri muu.
english_text: Cutting loose the anchors, they left them in the sea and at the same time untied the ropes that held the rudders. Then they hoisted the foresail to the wind and made for the beach.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma árụ́ mú mụ́mọ ọgọnọ gbánam kụlọ angaá ma muu piem sị mịnị ine nwángịgha, nune ju ma warị pughu kọsi anị ḅụ fomuarị kụ́rọ dinọ́ngụ gosi.
english_text: But the ship struck a sandbar and ran aground. The bow stuck fast and would not move, and the stern was broken to pieces by the pounding of the surf.

ibani_text: Ọ́mụ́gbiapụ tọọm ḅẹẹ nnị ikólinaapụ mamgba ḅá famabẹm, nnị oki kiri ọ́gọ́nọ muu si mangị sọbịgha ḅara.
english_text: The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners to prevent any of them from swimming away and escaping.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmụgbisịbịdaḅo ma Pọl dụaḅọ́rọ́ma dọ́ghụm, ọmịnị ḅo mini n pịrịgha, tụ́ma ori n ḅẹ́m ḅẹ́ ineḅọ ineḅọ tarị fighi kóró si oki mú kiri láa.
english_text: But the centurion wanted to spare Paul’s life and kept them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land.

ibani_text: Kọapụ n duabẹm, dụpọ ọlọ anịgha kaamaa árụ́ mpárá ọlọọ. Mị ḅara ma anịị wa ḅọ́rọ́ mú kiri ọgọnọ láa ḅara.
english_text: The rest were to get there on planks or on other pieces of the ship. In this way everyone reached land safely.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ wa laagha pa wa kiri ọgọnọ tándị sáá, wa ḅo nimiḅom ḅẹ́ Malita anịị ogbosúányẹ ámá ma ẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: Once safely on shore, we found out that the island was called Malta.

ibani_text: Ánị ngá fịnị túminị́ ma opu ḅẹlẹma pa wa diem. Iti saghị kórómam, éné ma sọ́ pịghị oḅuum, nnị warị fịnị tọnọ wa pịrị sị wa timi.
english_text: The islanders showed us unusual kindness. They built a fire and welcomed us all because it was raining and cold.

ibani_text: Pọl sanga kobirịarị ọ pa fịnị ma bie sua, anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ sii ododó fịnị ọwụ ma go págháḅo sị ọ gbọ ḅólo ọ ḅara.
english_text: Paul gathered a pile of brushwood and, as he put it on the fire, a viper, driven out by the heat, fastened itself on his hand.

ibani_text: Anị ngá ngaapụ ma ododó ma arịm ọ ḅara ọgọ́nọ́ sololo fịnịarị, n warị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹẹ, Mị owitụ́wọ ma ori kị́nị́ ḅá ḅáḅọ́ gbarịbịgha, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ ọ tọ́rụ́ ḅarabie págháḅomam, kụ́ma ọ mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ minibịgha sị o duma arị so ma pa oduaarị.
english_text: When the islanders saw the snake hanging from his hand, they said to each other, “This man must be a murderer; for though he escaped from the sea, the goddess Justice has not allowed him to live.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pọl ododó ma gugu fịnị ma bie suam gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ọ laagha ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: But Paul shook the snake off into the fire and suffered no ill effects.

ibani_text: Nnị warị saghị kúru ọ sughu bẹ ḅara, anịgha sóghóro kóró fịị, kụ́ma nnị opuma kúru fama sáá, nnị arịm ḅẹ́ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ọ laagha, anịị n tẹ́mẹ́ dima nyẹ, n warị saghị dugho ḅẹ́ mị ḅọ ma, Ori ọ́ oru.
english_text: The people expected him to swell up or suddenly fall dead; but after waiting a long time and seeing nothing unusual happen to him, they changed their minds and said he was a god.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa ma ḅọlọgha Pubiliyọs ámá ma Amadaḅọ ma nyáná jẹ́ kiri ḅụ. Ọ warị ibiḅara pa wa dakóróma, tẹ́rẹ́ a dii gbọrụ wamịnị ori igoniapụ.
english_text: There was an estate nearby that belonged to Publius, the chief official of the island. He welcomed us to his home and showed us generous hospitality for three days.

ibani_text: Pubiliyọs daá múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ imii, obikiri, ọfịrị na fúro sara na. Pọl warị ọ fịnịbie ma somuu, warị tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị ḅara pa ọ ḅụ gbánā sị ọ gwọọ.
english_text: His father was sick in bed, suffering from fever and dysentery. Paul went in to see him and, after prayer, placed his hands on him and healed him.

ibani_text: Nwọfịnị nyẹ pághá sáá, obiapụ mamgba ogbosúányẹ ama ma bie ọ damaḅom sị pịghị oju gwọọ nyáná ḅo.
english_text: When this had happened, the rest of the sick on the island came and were cured.

ibani_text: Nnị tọgha tọgha nyẹ die wa pịrịm, wa ḅo pịghị árụ́ si sáá, wa binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ wámịna muunyẹ ma ḅụ nnị pá árụ́ ma bie suam.
english_text: They honored us in many ways; and when we were ready to sail, they furnished us with the supplies we needed.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, wa sua sim Alegizandara bie, Nnị kịka mmẹẹ́ a tamuno, pa si árụ́ bie, sọma sị oḅuu sáá ma fama.
english_text: After three months we put out to sea in a ship that had wintered in the island—it was an Alexandrian ship with the figurehead of the twin gods Castor and Pollux.

ibani_text: Wa Sirakuse opu ama lam, warị anị ngaa tẹ́rẹ́ a dii fịnị.
english_text: We put in at Syracuse and stayed there three days.

ibani_text: Anị ngaa wa sua pághá muu Regiyum opu ama lam. Éné ḅáanyẹ ma anịị fọ́rụ saghị fie nyẹ ọḅụdụ, mmẹẹ́ a dii ḅụ wa ḅo Putioli ama lam.
english_text: From there we set sail and arrived at Rhegium. The next day the south wind came up, and on the following day we reached Puteoli.

ibani_text: Wa ḅo anịị ngaa jẹ́ mininiapụ na dona, ḅẹapụ ḅẹẹ, wamịnị nnị ná sọ́nọ́ma dii la nyẹ fịnịị. Anịị wa warị ḅọ́rọ́ Rom láa ḅara.
english_text: There we found some brothers and sisters who invited us to spend a week with them. And so we came to Rome.

ibani_text: Rom ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ ma, wa gbolomanyẹ naam, warị anị ḅọlọ angaá ma ḅoo Apiyọs Fẹ ama ma, na pịghị Tẹ́rẹ́ Ịnyọ́sárá Wárị saghị ḅo wamịnị na dona. Pọl nna árị sáá, ori ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹm, anị warị opuma ịnyọ pa ọ ḅụ sua.
english_text: The brothers and sisters there had heard that we were coming, and they traveled as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us. At the sight of these people Paul thanked God and was encouraged.

ibani_text: Wa Rom láa sáá, n Pọl warisom sị ori ngéré ọ ḅara na ngaa, gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbi ḅo ngéré okuru.
english_text: When we got to Rome, Paul was allowed to live by himself, with a soldier to guard him.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, Pọl ámá má bie Juu sịbịdaapụ ma sii kobirim, nnị kobiri fama sáá, ọ warị n ḅẹẹ, I jẹa Izirẹlịapụ, tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ, a ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa wámịna túminị́ mịẹgha, anịgha wámịna mịẹ mịẹnyẹ, wa daḅonyẹ wámịna tádọ́apụ ḅara, nnị i pa ikólinaḅọ mịẹm Jerusalem ḅụ nnị warị i saghị Romapụ ma ḅárábie sua.
english_text: Three days later he called together the local Jewish leaders. When they had assembled, Paul said to them: “My brothers, although I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors, I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ị gbíla fama sáá, Romapụ ma i wárịso dọ́ghụm, tegó nnị arịḅom ḅẹ́ a mịẹnyẹ ofori fịị na gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ.
english_text: They examined me and wanted to release me, because I was not guilty of any crime deserving death.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Juuapụ ma minigha gosi, anị a ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma pa Sẹ Táaḅọ Siza tórúku ḅo nyẹ, tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ a gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ so nyánágha a dugho pa ịyẹa túminị́ bịpị pụ́nụ́ma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The Jews objected, so I was compelled to make an appeal to Caesar. I certainly did not intend to bring any charge against my own people.

ibani_text: Anị a go bii nyẹ ḅẹ́ a ọmịnị arịị sị ọ nana ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ. Karakárányẹ nwọpa anịị nnị ịkóli pa i ḅárásua nyẹ, ori ma gosi, wámịna túminị́ Izirẹlịapụ ọ ḅụ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánáḅọ.
english_text: For this reason I have asked to see you and talk with you. It is because of the hope of Israel that I am bound with this chain.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị ọ ḅẹẹ, Na wa ị gboloma ábálálá nyánaḅogha Judiya ḅụ, anịgha wámịna túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ anị ngaa saghị ḅo sị ị gboloma sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ḅo sọ ofori.
english_text: They replied, “We have not received any letters from Judea concerning you, and none of our people who have come from there has reported or said anything bad about you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wamịnị ị bịpị náa dọ́ghụm, ị tọ́rọ́ pa anị arịị, ḅẹ mị ogboapụ ma gbólómanyẹ, wa nimim ḅẹ́ ngaamamgba anị dughosima anịị nnị anị dughosimaarị nyẹ.
english_text: But we want to hear what your views are, for we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.”

ibani_text: Nnị warị pịghị éné pẹ́lẹ́ ọ pịrị, nnị pẹ́lẹ́ éné ma ḅụ n pịghị ibiḅara pa ḅom ọ fịnịngaa ma ḅụ sị dedebie akị mú ḅupiri láa, ọ sanguma so amadakiri ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughofindi n pịrịm, ọ pịghị asọ dọ́ghụm nnị Jizọs gbolomanyẹ akanyaḅo o Mosis ólóghó diri ma na ikiakoroapụ ma gịẹnyẹ goo n pịrị ḅara.
english_text: They arranged to meet Paul on a certain day, and came in even larger numbers to the place where he was staying. He witnessed to them from morning till evening, explaining about the kingdom of God, and from the Law of Moses and from the Prophets he tried to persuade them about Jesus.

ibani_text: Jẹapụ tẹ́mẹ́ dimam ọ kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma gosi, kụ́ma jẹapụ mịnị anị mininigha.
english_text: Some were convinced by what he said, but others would not believe.

ibani_text: Nnị warị sọọ, nụná nna bie ḅu, Pọl mị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dugho fama sáá ḅẹẹ, Dighi Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ikiakoro Aizaya ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọmịna tádọ́apụ pịrịm, ọ ḅẹ́ sáá ḅẹẹ,
english_text: They disagreed among themselves and began to leave after Paul had made this final statement: “The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your ancestors when he said through Isaiah the prophet:

ibani_text: Mú dugho mịnaapụ ma pịrị: O pughubẹm kụ́ma ọmịnị akanyaḅobịgha; ọ tọ́rụ́ pa dighibẹm, kụ́ma ine arịbịgha.
english_text: “ ‘Go to this people and say, “You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.”

ibani_text: Tegó, mịnaapụ ma tẹ́mẹ́ mịnị nyẹ akanyaḅogha. Nnị pịghị nyẹ pa nna biri timi pụ́mámam, pịghị n tọ́rụ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄. Nnị ọkọ fịnịgha, nna tọ́rụ́ nyẹ árịbẹm, nna biri nyẹ naábẹm nna tẹ́mẹ́bie akanyaḅo nyánábẹm, nnị pịghị i dámáḅobẹm. Mị Tamuno dughonyẹ, ḅẹ́ a pịghị nnị gwọọbẹm.
english_text: For this people’s heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.’

ibani_text: Pọl dughofamam warị ḅẹẹ, O nimim ḅẹẹ, Tamuno dụaḅọ́rọ́ma oku ma, nnị pa Juughaapụ ma fịrịmam. Nnị pịghị anị pughubẹm! [
english_text: “Therefore I want you to know that God’s salvation has been sent to the Gentiles, and they will listen!”

ibani_text: Ọ mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ faá ma sa, Juuapụ ọ wáriso sọm sị opuma nụná nyána nna ogboku bie.]
english_text: After Paul said this, the Jews went away, arguing fiercely among themselves.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ a kụ́rá ḅụ Pọl ori ḅara na ọkọọ wárị ḅụ ngaam, anị ngaa anị ọ fịnị sị ọ damaḅoapụ mamgba dakórómáarị ngaa.
english_text: For two whole years Paul stayed there in his own rented house and welcomed all who came to see him.

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno so amadakiri gbolomanyẹ dugho pághámam, pịghị Jizọs Krais gbolomanyẹ pa túminị́ die, pịghị ḅáláfaghaa ḅara na kikigha ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọm.
english_text: He proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ—with all boldness and without hindrance!

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma irị Pọl Jizọs Krais ómóniḅọ ḅara saghịḅom, ịrị anịị Tamuno sịị́ pịghị sẹlẹakị nfịrịmaḅọ ḅẹẹ, a ori ibi oku ma dugho wásáma.
english_text: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle and set apart for the gospel of God—

ibani_text: Tamuno ori ikiakoroapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mị ibi oku ma mini ori a túminị́ pịrịm ḅọlọmaa sáá énéné, n gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie.
english_text: the gospel he promised beforehand through his prophets in the Holy Scriptures

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma gbolomam, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais. Ojumẹnị ḅụ ori ma anịị Deviti furotụ́wọ.
english_text: regarding his Son, who as to his earthly lifewas a descendant of David,

ibani_text: Ori ḅo ḅara gbolomanyẹ Tamuno ma ḅara, na pịghị ori tọ́ntọ́, Tamuno opu kụrọ ḅụ diem bẹ ori anị Tamuno ma Tụ́wọ ma ori fịị ḅụ ọ saghịma sáá, Jizọs Krais wámịna Nyánáḅọ.
english_text: and who through the Spirit of holiness was appointed the Son of God in powerby his resurrection from the dead: Jesus Christ our Lord.

ibani_text: Tamuno Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná wa pịrịm sị wa sị ḅẹ́ wamịnị ḅo nfịrịmaapụ sọọ Krais ma ẹrẹ́sị, sị sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ wa túminị́ daá bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́ nnị ọḅụụ minini pịghị ọ bịpị pughu.
english_text: Through him we received grace and apostleship to call all the Gentiles to the obedience that comes fromfaith for his name’s sake.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Rom ḅụ fịnịapụ ma nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́apụ, Tamuno sịmáapụ ḅẹ́ nnị ḅo Jizọs Krais túminị́ sọọ.
english_text: And you also are among those Gentiles who are called to belong to Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Anịgo a mịị diri ma gịẹ pa ọmịnị Rom ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba fịrịmam Tamuno ma ḅẹlẹmaapụ pịghị sịmáapụ bẹ nnị ḅo ori a túminị́ sọọ. Tamuno wámịna Daḅọ na Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: To all in Rome who are loved by God and called to be his holy people: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Parị a ịmịẹḅam pa ị Tamuno ma ḅẹm, Jizọs Krais ma ẹrẹ ḅụ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba sịbị go, tegó tuminikiri gbọrụ ọmịna minini gbolomanyẹ naarị.
english_text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, because your faith is being reported all over the world.

ibani_text: Tamuno, a itẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa susi pịrịarịḅọ, anịị ọ Tụwọ ma gboloma ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ḅụ, ori ma anịị ị́yẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ a sámámgba ọ pa biekórómáarị ḅara
english_text: God, whom I serve in my spirit in preaching the gospel of his Son, is my witness how constantly I remember you

ibani_text: a tẹ́ghẹ̄ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́. A Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄arị mị́sa ḅẹ́ ọ tọ ḅara ḅụ, kunema a ine ḅo tọ́rụ pa ọmịnị arịịbẹm.
english_text: in my prayers at all times; and I pray that now at last by God’s will the way may be opened for me to come to you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị arịị ma opuma i pụghọ tárịm, sị a ine Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅara sághị ḅo karịibima die ọ pịrị, mịẹbẹnyẹ sị ọ kurosẹ tẹ́mẹ́ju ọ kụrọma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: I long to see you so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to make you strong—

ibani_text: A dughoarị nyẹ anịị, wa dona sa, ọmịna minini mịẹbẹm sị a kurosẹ, ị́yẹ́ minini pịghị mịẹbẹm sị ọ kụrọ sẹ.
english_text: that is, that you and I may be mutually encouraged by each other’s faith.

ibani_text: A dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ sị o nimi ị́yẹ́ amịnáapụ, ḅẹẹ, tọgha sa a tọmam ḅẹ́ a ḅo ọmịnị arịị, kụ́ma nyẹ sámamgba ị́kíkímam. A dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ ọmịna ogbobie a mininiapụ nyáná ḅo bẹ ḅara, a nyáná ḅara jẹ́ Juughaapụ ma ogbobie.
english_text: I do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters,that I planned many times to come to you (but have been prevented from doing so until now) in order that I might have a harvest among you, just as I have had among the other Gentiles.

ibani_text: A Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ibi oku dugho wásáma sáá ọlọm kị́nị́mamgba ḅara, tọ́rụ́ findimaapụ ḅara na pịghị tọ́rụ́ findighaapụ ḅara, dirinimiapụ na pịghị diri nímighaapụ.
english_text: I am obligated both to Greeks and non-Greeks, both to the wise and the foolish.

ibani_text: Anịgo anị kpọma i tárịm ḅẹ́ a ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ọmịnị Rom ḅụ fịnịapụ ma sọ pịrị.
english_text: That is why I am so eager to preach the gospel also to you who are in Rome.

ibani_text: Krais ibi oku ma i ḅụgịrịrịmagha, tegó anịma anịị Tamuno kụ́rọ ma, mininiapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ duaḅọ́rọ́maarị nyẹ, parị Juuapụ ma na pịghị Juughaapụ.
english_text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes: first to the Jew, then to the Gentile.

ibani_text: Tegó ibi oku ma die pághámaarị Tamuno túminị́ akuo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ su ori na nnị na, mịma anịị minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ parị ákị mú kunema láa, tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ma dumabẹm ori minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: For in the gospel the righteousness of God is revealed—a righteousness that is by faith from first to last,just as it is written: “The righteous will live by faith.”

ibani_text: Tamuno sobie bieoḅu túminị́ pịrịarị n mịẹrị sii gosi, n pịghị kuu pa ọ pịrịgha ḅara n pịghị nna sii pa Tamuno ma karakárá gbẹarị ḅara.
english_text: The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of people, who suppress the truth by their wickedness,

ibani_text: Tamuno n dighi bieoḅum tegó Tamuno gboloma sị tumḅọ ine nimibẹnyẹ, anị ibima n tọ́rụ́ pághám, tegó Tamuno ma mịẹm sị anị n tọ́rụ́ pághá.
english_text: since what may be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it plain to them.

ibani_text: Tamuno tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́ sa éné éné, o gboloma sị túminị́ ine tọ́rụ́ pa arịbịgha nyẹ, mị́sa ḅo pághámam túminị́ tọ́rụ́ ḅụ, mịnanyẹ ma anịị Tamuno ma gbámásó kụ́rọ na pịghị ori fịnị ḅara. Anịgosi n ḅara pụ́nụ́nyẹ nyánágha n mịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: For since the creation of the world God’s invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse.

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno ma nimim kụ́ma nnị ọ láa kuu pa ọ pịrịgha anịgha Tamuno ma ḅẹẹ ịmịẹḅam. Anịmanakaragha, nnị nyẹ kórómaarị sa nna kóróma mịnị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, kánákáná warị nna oḅori kúkúbie ma bii.
english_text: For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened.

ibani_text: Nnị dughoarị ḅẹẹ nnị nyẹ nimim kụ́ma nnị ọḅọrisọmaapụ
english_text: Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools

ibani_text: nnị susi fịịfịịgha Tamuno ma pịrịbẹ nakaragha, nnị susi fịị bẹ túminị́ kịka sị nnị kárányẹ pịrịm anịgha a fíní kịkanyẹ anịgha nama kịkanyẹ anịgha furo pa ikiri nwángịarị nyẹ.
english_text: and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like a mortal human being and birds and animals and reptiles.

ibani_text: Anịgosi Tamuno warị nna ḅụ ḅárási, sị nnị nna tẹ́mẹ́bie biiarị ịlọ́lị nyẹ ma mịẹ, sị nnị jụghọ jụghọ na oju ma dighi terema yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọ.
english_text: Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another.

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno gboloma karakárányẹ ma mini dọghụgha nnị mú epele miniakịm, nnị susi nnị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma pịrịm pịghị anị osii Tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ma nakaragha, n túminí mú gbámásó la bẹḅọ. Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: They exchanged the truth about God for a lie, and worshiped and served created things rather than the Creator—who is forever praised. Amen.

ibani_text: Túminị́ mịma mịẹm gosi Tamuno nna ḅụ ḅárásim sị nnị nna oju ma tarịarị ḅụ́gịrịrịmanyẹ pịrịm. Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma sọ nna jẹa ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ na múnoarị.
english_text: Because of this, God gave them over to shameful lusts. Even their women exchanged natural sexual relations for unnatural ones.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma owiapụ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ mangima mú nna jẹa owiapụ na múnoarị. Owiapụ jụghọ jụghọ na ḅụ́gịrịrịma nyẹ mịẹarị, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nlá na ibi fomḅara akuo nna ḅụ pịrị nna irima mịẹnyẹ gosi.
english_text: In the same way the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed with lust for one another. Men committed shameful acts with other men, and received in themselves the due penalty for their error.

ibani_text: Mịná túminị́ ma Tamuno gboloma sị tumḅọ ine nimibẹnyẹ, nnị anị sịghịm gosi nna kóróma ḅụ, Tamuno nna ḅụ ḅárási mịnị tụghụgha kóróma pịrịmam, na nnị mịẹna ibighaa nyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: Furthermore, just as they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, so God gave them over to a depraved mind, so that they do what ought not to be done.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nyẹ pa kịnịlama, siiamịẹnyẹ, oputọrụ, kịnịtárigha, jughonyẹ mọnị, anịị nna duma bie bii nyẹ, kị́nị́ḅáa, owu soo, oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị, na jẹ́apụ sii dọghụ. Nnị jụghọ jụghọ pa bịpị ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị,
english_text: They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil, greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit and malice. They are gossips,

ibani_text: jụghọ jụghọ dughosima, Tamuno lila, jụghọ jụghọ wiri, opuamịẹnyẹ, bịpịkpọ, sámámgba n kórómaarị nnị ḅọ́rọ́ siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹ ḅẹ́ jẹ́ jẹ́ asọ, nyingi na daa na osigha,
english_text: slanderers, God-haters, insolent, arrogant and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey their parents;

ibani_text: nnị sịbịbie nyánágha, nnị n dughonyẹ mịẹgha, nna kúkúbie nna ọḅụdụ, nnị lolomakúkúbie nyanagha.
english_text: they have no understanding, no fidelity, no love, no mercy.

ibani_text: Nnị nimim Tamuno ologho ma dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, nwọfịnị duma kọọapụ fịị anịị nnị na gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ, anị so n pa anịma nẹ́ngịma siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarị, pịghị anị siiamịẹnyẹ ma miẹrịapụ túminíarị.
english_text: Although they know God’s righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them.

ibani_text: Ịrị, ị jẹ́apụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị? Ị ḅara pụnụ nyẹ nyanagha, Ịrị tụọ tụọ o, ị jẹ́apụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị sa warị pịghị n mịẹrị nyẹ ma mịẹ, ị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́mam ị sịbị.
english_text: You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgment on someone else, for at whatever point you judge another, you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment do the same things.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno ọ karakáram ọ mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarịapụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị sa.
english_text: Now we know that God’s judgment against those who do such things is based on truth.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarịapụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarịḅọ, ị sị ḅẹ́ ị́ ịḅụ fọ́nyá págháma ḅo bẹ Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅụ?
english_text: So when you, a mere human being, pass judgment on them and yet do the same things, do you think you will escape God’s judgment?

ibani_text: Anịgha ị Tamuno opu ibi na ori inema tẹ́mẹ́ na ori ngịrịma pa papanyẹ mịẹbẹ, Tamuno ori ibim, ori ibi ma ọ daa mú sii ḅụ pịghị ḅụ súúarị.
english_text: Or do you show contempt for the riches of his kindness, forbearance and patience, not realizing that God’s kindness is intended to lead you to repentance?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ kụ́rọ kúkúbie na kụ́rọ sịbịbie nyánam gosi, ọmịnị ọmịna fomḅara mịẹm anị gborogboroḅáa, anị éné ma Tamuno ori igani diepágháma bẹ éné sị pịghị karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart, you are storing up wrath against yourself for the day of God’s wrath, when his righteous judgment will be revealed.

ibani_text: Tamuno Gbẹfịnyẹ pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́bẹm, n ḅọ nwángị fịrị la ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: God “will repay each person according to what they have done.”

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ibinyẹ mịẹmịẹ tórúku mú ḅụ boma na kuu na gbámásó duma bim, nnị ma Tamuno duma gbámásó pa n pịrịbẹm.
english_text: To those who by persistence in doing good seek glory, honor and immortality, he will give eternal life.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nna ḅụ nna ḅụ balaarịapụ sị karakáráma sịghị sị nnị ine irima nyẹ ma mịẹbẹ ḅara, anịapụ ma Tamuno n dighi iganịbẹm sị nna sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ.
english_text: But for those who are self-seeking and who reject the truth and follow evil, there will be wrath and anger.

ibani_text: Oju akụ na tọ́rụ́siarị fịnị siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarịapụ mamgba pịrịbẹm, Juuapụ parị na pịghị Juughaapụ.
english_text: There will be trouble and distress for every human being who does evil: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile;

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ibinyẹ mịẹarịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno boma na kuu na diin pa nnị pịrịbẹm, Juuapụ ma parị na pịghị Juughaapụ.
english_text: but glory, honor and peace for everyone who does good: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.

ibani_text: Tegó Tamuno tọ́rụ́kúkúgha ori ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅụ.
english_text: For God does not show favoritism.

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma, ólóghó ma nyánágháapụ siinyẹ mịẹ sa, nnị nna sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm ólóghó ma nyánágháapụ ḅara, Juuapụ ma ólóghó ma nyánáapụ siinyẹ mịẹ sa, nnị ólóghó ma pa nna sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm.
english_text: All who sin apart from the law will also perish apart from the law, and all who sin under the law will be judged by the law.

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma naapụgha Tamuno toruku karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ, kụ́ma ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹapụ.
english_text: For it is not those who hear the law who are righteous in God’s sight, but it is those who obey the law who will be declared righteous.

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma, nnị Mosis ólóghó ma nyanagha kụ́ma nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅọ́rọ́ ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹmịẹ, n diepághámamam ḅẹ́ n nimim nnị mịẹna ibi nyẹ na nnị mịẹna ibighaa nyẹ, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ nnị ólóghó ma nyanagha mḅẹ́sọ.
english_text: (Indeed, when Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature things required by the law, they are a law for themselves, even though they do not have the law.

ibani_text: Nna mịẹnyẹ diearị ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma dughonyẹ n gịẹ kórómam nna kúkúbie. Nna tẹ́mẹ́bie sọ onyesẹ́arị ḅẹ́ mịma tụ́manyẹ, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie jẹ́ sa ḅẹ́rẹ́si pa n pịrị sa pịghị jẹ́ sa ḅẹ́rẹ́ ibima.
english_text: They show that the requirements of the law are written on their hearts, their consciences also bearing witness, and their thoughts sometimes accusing them and at other times even defending them.)

ibani_text: A dugho wásáma ibi oku ma dugho ḅara ḅụ, mịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara anị éné ḅụ Tamuno Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ ḅọ́ghụ́ kóróma ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ sa.
english_text: This will take place on the day when God judges people’s secrets through Jesus Christ, as my gospel declares.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọmịnị, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ pa ọ ḅụ sị warị ólóghó ma ḅụ sẹrẹrẹ sị bịpịkpọarị ḅẹ́ Tamuno fịnị ọ pịrịm;
english_text: Now you, if you call yourself a Jew; if you rely on the law and boast in God;

ibani_text: warị nimi Tamuno dọghụnyẹ ḅẹẹ, ọ mịẹ, ọ pịghị ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ karakáráma nimimam irima nyẹ ḅụ;
english_text: if you know his will and approve of what is superior because you are instructed by the law;

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ibima nimim ḅẹ́, ọmịnị anịị Tọ́rụ́pụ́apụ daa karakárámaariapụ, ọmịnị anị pịghị kánákánábie fịnịapụ tọndọ,
english_text: if you are convinced that you are a guide for the blind, a light for those who are in the dark,

ibani_text: nyẹ́nimighaapụ nyẹ́dieapụ, dọghụdọghụ awọ nyẹ́dieapụ, tegó o nimitẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma bie níminyẹ na karakárá anị bie bifụ́fụ́m.
english_text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of little children, because you have in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth—

ibani_text: Ịrị anịsa nyẹ pa jẹ́apụ diearịḅọ, ị nyẹ pa ịḅụ diegha? Ịrị dugho wásaámaarịḅọ ḅẹ́ kị́nị́ fúrúma, ịrị ị fúrú fúrú?
english_text: you, then, who teach others, do you not teach yourself? You who preach against stealing, do you steal?

ibani_text: Ịrị dugho ḅọ ḅẹ́ túminị́ amadọghụma, Ịrị ị́ amadọghụgha? Ị dọghụgha túminị́ susi nkára tamuno pịrị, anịsa nkára tamuno bie fịnị tamunowarị bie ị fúrú fúrú?
english_text: You who say that people should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Tamuno ologho ma pa bịpịkpọarịapụ, ọ Tamuno ólóghó ma kaagha si ḅụ́gịrịrị akuoo Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: You who boast in the law, do you dishonor God by breaking the law?

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị Juuapụ ma gosi, Juughaapụ ma Tamuno dughosimaarị.
english_text: As it is written: “God’s name is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ ólóghó ma koko koko, ị́yẹ́ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ ma sọ́nyẹ ḅụ sọ́bẹm; kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ólóghó ma kokogha kokogha, anị fịnị ḅárá sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ị́yẹ́ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹlẹ so pẹ́lẹ́gha.
english_text: Circumcision has value if you observe the law, but if you break the law, you have become as though you had not been circumcised.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Juughaḅọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ghaḅọ, ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹm, Tamuno ori ákị́bịgha sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ori tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹm.
english_text: So then, if those who are not circumcised keep the law’s requirements, will they not be regarded as though they were circumcised?

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọmịnị Juuapụ ma, Juughaapụ ma ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm tegó ọmịnị ólóghó ma kaam, anịsọ nị ḅẹẹ, ólóghó ma nnị gịẹ kóróma ọ pịrịm, pịghị ọmịna tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ Juughaapụ ma ólóghó ma kokom anịsọ nị ḅẹẹ, nnị ḅara pa nna tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha.
english_text: The one who is not circumcised physically and yet obeys the law will condemn you who, even though you have thewritten code and circumcision, are a lawbreaker.

ibani_text: Mịmámgba dughoarị ḅẹ́ túminị́ pa Juuapụ sịapụ mamgba Juuapụgha, tumḅọ pịghị Juuḅọgha, nnị n ḅọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́mam gosi,
english_text: A person is not a Jew who is one only outwardly, nor is circumcision merely outward and physical.

ibani_text: tụ́ma karakárá Juuḅọ anịị dada Juuḅọ biebẹ, anịḅọ ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ fịrị ma nwángịmam n ḅọ tẹ́mẹ́bie nnị gịẹ kóróma ólóghó ma anị fịrị ma nwángịgha. Ọkọfịnị tumḅọ Tamuno ḅara ḅo túminí nyanaḅoarị, túminị́ ḅara ḅo nyẹ́gha.
english_text: No, a person is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is circumcision of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the written code. Such a person’s praise is not from other people, but from God.

ibani_text: Juuḅọ sọ ma anị tẹ́ asọ ḅụ ibiḅaa Juuḅọ sọgha ma nẹ́ngị? Anịgha anị tẹ́ sọọ nyẹ so ḅẹ́ tumḅọ tumḅọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́m?
english_text: What advantage, then, is there in being a Jew, or what value is there in circumcision?

ibani_text: Asọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ anị opuma ḅárasuam, ḅẹ́ Tamuno parị ori ibi oku ma saghị Juuapụ ma ḅarabie suam.
english_text: Much in every way! First of all, the Jews have been entrusted with the very words of God.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ minini nyanagha, nna minini nyánágha ma anị mịẹbẹ sị Tamuno mịnị sẹ́kụrọghaḅọ sọ?
english_text: What if some were unfaithful? Will their unfaithfulness nullify God’s faithfulness?

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori! Tamuno anịị o dughonyẹ mịẹarịḅọ, tuminikiri gbọrụ iruonyẹ dughoapụ sọ. Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara: Ịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba árịbẹm ḅẹ́ ị karakáram, nnị ị sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ị ḅara ibibẹm.
english_text: Not at all! Let God be true, and every human being a liar. As it is written: “So that you may be proved right when you speak and prevail when you judge.”

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna mịẹ irima Tamuno ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ma die pághámaḅoarị, wamịnị ine dugho bẹ ḅẹ́, Tamuno irimam o fomḅara pa wa fom sa? (A tumḅọ ḅara pa gbilaarị.)
english_text: But if our unrighteousness brings out God’s righteousness more clearly, what shall we say? That God is unjust in bringing his wrath on us? (I am using a human argument.)

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori! Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno karakáragha, ọ tọrọ́ pa ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ?
english_text: Certainly not! If that were so, how could God judge the world?

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ine dughobẹm ḅẹẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ irima nyẹ ma mịẹm Tamuno karakárá ma ḅo báapagha, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dụḅaḅá kuu warị o nyẹ sọọ, n tegósi pa sị tumḅọ ḅara pa i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị?
english_text: Someone might argue, “If my falsehood enhances God’s truthfulness and so increases his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?”

ibani_text: Anịsa, o tegósi dughogha ḅẹẹ, O ḅo wa siinyẹ mịẹsị ibinyẹ ḅo ḅẹ́ ḅara? Jẹ́apụ i ḅara ḅẹ́rẹ́simaarị sa ḅẹ́ a mịma dughom, Nnị n láa na ibi ḅẹrẹ kọbẹm nna sịbị.
english_text: Why not say—as some slanderously claim that we say—“Let us do evil that good may result”? Their condemnation is just!

ibani_text: Anịsa, wamịnị Juuapụ ma wámịna anganyẹ ibiḅaa Juughaapụ ma nganyẹ nẹ́ngị? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori! A parị dieḅọ́rọ́mamam ḅẹ́ Juuapụ na Juughaapụ na nnị kị́nị́mamgba sịị kụrọ ma sughubie imi.
english_text: What shall we conclude then? Do we have any advantage? Not at all! For we have already made the charge that Jews and Gentiles alike are all under the power of sin.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ sọ ofori,
english_text: As it is written: “There is no one righteous, not even one;

ibani_text: Akanyaḅo nyáná gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ofori, pịghị Tamuno ma dọghụarịḅọ so ofori.
