english_text: there is no one who understands; there is no one who seeks God.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba ọḅụ pa Tamuno ma gbimam, Nnị kị́nị́mamgba irimamam; Karakárányẹ ma mịẹarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ofori, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ofori.
english_text: All have turned away, they have together become worthless; there is no one who does good, not even one.”

ibani_text: Nna bịpịbie págháḅoarị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kịnịḅaarị; Nnị nna ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịm; Sii ododó lakpo nna bịpị mpara sughubie imii.
english_text: “Their throats are open graves; their tongues practice deceit.” “The poison of vipers is on their lips.”

ibani_text: Si gbonyẹ na tẹ́mẹ́ ákụ anịị nna bịpịbie bii nyẹ.
english_text: “Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”

ibani_text: Nnị sáá ngúmágha ọmbịnyẹ́ ọsụụ ḅụ;
english_text: “Their feet are swift to shed blood;

ibani_text: nnị mú ngá mú ngá nnị túminị́ gulugulumam pịghị nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịma,
english_text: ruin and misery mark their ways,

ibani_text: nnị pịghị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha sị diin akuoo nna jẹ́apụ ogboku.
english_text: and the way of peace they do not know.”

ibani_text: Tamuno ḅáláfa sọ nna ḅụbie ofori.
english_text: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa wa nimim ḅẹ́ ólóghó diri ma bie nnị gịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n gịẹ pa nnị go ólóghó ma suaapụ pịrịm, túminị́ ḅara ọlọnyẹ nyánábịgha ḅara, sị tuminikiri gbọrụ Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ma sughubie fịnị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world held accountable to God.

ibani_text: Tamuno toruku gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ karakáragha ólóghó ma koko ḅụ, ólóghó ma mịẹarịnyẹ anịị mịẹsị túminị́ nimi ḅẹ́ nnị siinyẹ mịẹmam.
english_text: Therefore no one will be declared righteous in God’s sight by the works of the law; rather, through the law we become conscious of our sin.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa Tamuno diepághámamam túminị́ ḅara warị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ ḅẹ́ ḅara nnị anị diepághámamam. Anị ólóghó ma na mịẹnyẹ nyanagha, anịsọnị Mosis ólóghó ma na ikiakoroapụ ma onyẹsẹ́ anị pịrịm.
english_text: But now apart from the law the righteousness of God has been made known, to which the Law and the Prophets testify.

ibani_text: Tamuno túminị́ mịẹm nnị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ, nna minini Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Tamuno mịma mịẹ Jizọs Krais ḅụ mininiapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm, tegó kịrịnyẹ sọ ofori,
english_text: This righteousness is given through faith inJesus Christ to all who believe. There is no difference between Jew and Gentile,

ibani_text: kị́nị́mamgba siinyẹ mịẹmam anịgosi Tamuno ipine nna ḅụ ḅọlọ angaá ḅụ imii.
english_text: for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ ḅụ na wa mịẹ karakárámamam Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna dụapághámaḅo, ọ papa die wa pịrịnyẹ. Túminị́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọm Krais Jizọs ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, nna duapághámaarịḅọ.
english_text: and all are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ saghị pịrịm, ḅẹ́ ori ọ sụụ ọmbịnyẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, na pịghị túminị́ ọ ḅụ nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, n siiḅụḅarasi nyáná bẹ ḅara. Tamuno mịma mịẹm pa die ḅẹ́ ori karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ. Ḅọ́rọ́maa sa ori inema nyánam sị nna sii dighi tọ́rụ́si; kụ́ma mị́sa ma ḅụ mịnị nna sii dighi tọ́rụ́sigha sị ori karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ma diepágháma.
english_text: God presented Christ as a sacrifice of atonement,through the shedding of his blood—to be received by faith. He did this to demonstrate his righteousness, because in his forbearance he had left the sins committed beforehand unpunished—

ibani_text: Ọ mịma mịẹm pa ori ibi ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ die mịị sa ma ḅụ, ọ karakárá bẹ ḅara ori ma anị pịghị Jizọs ḅụ mininiapụ mịẹ karakárámaarịḅọ.
english_text: he did it to demonstrate his righteousness at the present time, so as to be just and the one who justifies those who have faith in Jesus.

ibani_text: Anịsa, wa tẹ́ pa bịpịkpọ bẹ? Bẹnyẹ ḅẹ́ nyẹ́gha! Wa tẹ́ go mịma mịẹarị? Anịị ḅẹ́ wamịnị ólóghó ma kokoarị? Ọkọ fịnịgha, kụ́ma wa mininim.
english_text: Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded. Because of what law? The law that requires works? No, because of the law that requires faith.

ibani_text: Wa dughoarị bẹ tumḅọ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ sọm minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ólóghó bịpị ma warịgha ḅụ.
english_text: For we maintain that a person is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma ori Juuapụ ma ngéré Tamuno? Ori ma Juughaapụ ma sọ ori nna Tamunogha.
english_text: Or is God the God of Jews only? Is he not the God of Gentiles too? Yes, of Gentiles too,

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ngéré anịị fịnịnyẹ, ọ mịẹm si Juuapụ ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ nna minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị Juughaapụ ma pa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ so nna minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: since there is only one God, who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through that same faith.

ibani_text: Mịma anị dugho ḅẹ́ mị minini ma gosi wa ólóghó ma gbibuuma? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori; anịmanakaragha wamịnị ólóghó ma mịẹ kụ́rọ́máarị.
english_text: Do we, then, nullify the law by this faith? Not at all! Rather, we uphold the law.

ibani_text: Anịsa wa tẹ dugho bẹ Ebraham wámịna tádóḅọ gbolomanyẹ? Tẹ ọ ḅụ págháa.
english_text: What then shall we say that Abraham, our forefather according to the flesh, discovered in this matter?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ karakáráma Ebraham ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅárasighaḅọ sọm ọ nwángị fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọ pa bịpịkpọ bẹnyẹ nyánábẹm kụ́ma Tamuno ma tọ́rụ́kụ́ghaa.
english_text: If, in fact, Abraham was justified by works, he had something to boast about—but not before God.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom, Ebraham Tamuno mininim, ori Tamuno ma minini gosi Tamuno ori ákịm ḅẹ́ ori karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ.
english_text: What does Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịapụ nnị n nwángị fịrị igbii pa n gbẹm, tumḅọ dughobịgha ḅẹ́ ọ́ n die nnị pịrịnyẹ; nnị fịrịnwangị anị pịrịm.
english_text: Now to the one who works, wages are not credited as a gift but as an obligation.

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịghaḅọ ma, kụ́ma Tamuno ma ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánáḅọ, siiamịẹnyẹ ḅọ mịẹsị n ḅọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅarasighaḅọ sọọ, anị tumḅọ ma nnị ori ákịm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ori minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: However, to the one who does not work but trusts God who justifies the ungodly, their faith is credited as righteousness.

ibani_text: Deviti anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dughom, ọ Tamuno karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara pa ákịḅọ ma bieḅẹlẹ dughoarị sa, n ḅọ fịrị pa kịẹbịpị suugha pa:
english_text: David says the same thing when he speaks of the blessedness of the one to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:

ibani_text: Deviti dughom Karịiḅi fịnị nnị nna irima nyẹ warịsó pịrịapụ, nnị nna siiḅụḅárasi pịrịapụ.
english_text: “Blessed are those whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nna sii pa kịẹbịpị ḅụ suughaapụ ma pịrị.
english_text: Blessed is the one whose sin the Lord will never count against them.”

ibani_text: Deviti ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹarị karịibima ma, anị fịnị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́apụ ma ngéré pịrịị? Ọkọ fịnịgha! Anị pịghị fịnị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ghaapụ sọ pịrịm. Wa Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ dughom, Ebraham Tamuno mininim, ori minini gosi Tamuno karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara pa ori ákịm.
english_text: Is this blessedness only for the circumcised, or also for the uncircumcised? We have been saying that Abraham’s faith was credited to him as righteousness.

ibani_text: Mịma tẹ́ sa kiriakịị na nnị Ebraham tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha sa, anịgha nnị o tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́máa sáá! Anị kiriakịm na nnị ọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha sa, ọ tọ́ngọ̄ ma pẹ́lẹ́ma sagha.
english_text: Under what circumstances was it credited? Was it after he was circumcised, or before? It was not after, but before!

ibani_text: Ọḅụkụ́nọma nnị o tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́m, mịị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ma anịị pa ilíghíma sua die ḅẹ́, ori minini gosi Tamuno ori ákịm karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara, na nnị o tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha sa. Anịgo Ebraham anị Tamuno ḅụ mininiapụ mamgba daa, Tamuno pịghị nna ákịm karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ḅara, na nnị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha n ḅẹ́sọ.
english_text: And he received circumcision as a sign, a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised. So then, he is the father of all who believe but have not been circumcised, in order that righteousness might be credited to them.

ibani_text: Ori ma anị pịghị nnị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́apụ ma daa, ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ nnị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́m gosi, kụ́ma nnị wámịna daa Ebraham dua minini duma ma kọm, na nnị o tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha sa.
english_text: And he is then also the father of the circumcised who not only are circumcised but who also follow in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham had before he was circumcised.

ibani_text: Tamuno minini Ebraham na o furobie págháḅoapụ pịrị sa ḅẹ́ tuminikiri ma o nyẹ́ sọ́bẹm, ori ọkọ mịẹm ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ Ebraham ólóghó ma kokom, kụ́ma o mininim Tamuno warị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara pa ori ákị.
english_text: It was not through the law that Abraham and his offspring received the promise that he would be heir of the world, but through the righteousness that comes by faith.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno minini nyẹ́ ma n pa ólóghó ma kokoapụ pịrịm, anịsa minini bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, Tamuno ma minini nyẹ́ ma pịghị sọnyẹ ḅụ oforibịgha.
english_text: For if those who depend on the law are heirs, faith means nothing and the promise is worthless,

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma Tamuno igani dighi kórómaarị; kụ́ma ólóghó ma ófórigha angaá, ologho kóró so ofori.
english_text: because the law brings wrath. And where there is no law there is no transgression.

ibani_text: Mịma go mini pịrịnyẹ́ ma minini ḅụ saghịḅom, túminị́ árị bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́ mini pịrịnyẹ́ ma anịị Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo diepịrịnyẹ, ọmịnị pa Ebraham furobie págháḅoapụ mamgba pịrịm, ólóghó ma kokoapụ ngéréghaa, kụ́ma Ebraham minini ḅara pa mininiapụ. Tegó Ebraham anịị wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba daa.
english_text: Therefore, the promise comes by faith, so that it may be by grace and may be guaranteed to all Abraham’s offspring—not only to those who are of the law but also to those who have the faith of Abraham. He is the father of us all.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, A ị pa tọgha tọgha sẹ daḅọ mịẹmam. Ori anịị wámịna daa, Tamuno ma tórúku, ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ, fịịḅọ mịẹsị n ḅọ dumaḅọ sọ, ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ófórigha ngá ḅụ nyẹ tẹ́mẹ́ pághámaḅoḅọ.
english_text: As it is written: “I have made you a father of many nations.”He is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed—the God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.

ibani_text: Ebraham mininim pịghị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyáná, ọ pa ḅara ọlọ sị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyáná bẹnyẹ ofori so, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọgha tọgha sẹ daḅọ sọọ. Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Lolia ma bii ḅara anịị ị furobie págháḅoapụ bii bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Against all hope, Abraham in hope believed and so became the father of many nations, just as it had been said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”

ibani_text: Anịsa ma, kálányẹ kọm ori kụ́rá sọ́nọ́ a si láa, ori minini pa kụ́rọ bịpị múm, ọ pịghị ḅo árị sa ḅẹ́ ori oju fịịfịịḅara fịnịm, táaḅọ Sira so ine fura awọ yiigha.
english_text: Without weakening in his faith, he faced the fact that his body was as good as dead—since he was about a hundred years old—and that Sarah’s womb was also dead.

ibani_text: Tamuno mini ọ pịrịnyẹ́ ma ḅụ, ori minini anị ḅụ jighegha, ori minini ịnyọ pa ọ ḅụ suam sị o boma pa Tamuno pịrịm.
english_text: Yet he did not waver through unbelief regarding the promise of God, but was strengthened in his faith and gave glory to God,

ibani_text: Ori ibima nimitẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹ́ Tamuno kụrọ nyáná pa o minini nyẹ́ ma mịẹbẹm.
english_text: being fully persuaded that God had power to do what he had promised.

ibani_text: Anịị, Tamuno go Ebraham ákị nyẹ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara ori minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: This is why “it was credited to him as righteousness.”

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́, Karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ pa ori ákịm, nnị gịẹ pa ori ngéré pịrịgha.
english_text: The words “it was credited to him” were written not for him alone,

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ pa wamịnị sọ pịrịm Tamuno ákị bẹapụ ḅẹ́ wamịnị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ. Wa Tamuno ma ḅụ mininim wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs saghịma ḅọ fịị ḅụ.
english_text: but also for us, to whom God will credit righteousness—for us who believe in him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead.

ibani_text: Wámịna sii gosi nnị ọ saghị fịị ḅarabie suam warị pịghị duma ḅụ ọ saghịma, sị ọ wa pa Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ warị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: He was delivered over to death for our sins and was raised to life for our justification.

ibani_text: Mị́sa, minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ n karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ pa wa mịẹmam Tamuno bie, wa Tamuno na diin nyánam wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: Therefore, since we have been justified through faith, wehave peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

ibani_text: O minini ḅụ wamịnị akuoo mịị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma bie suam, wa bie mị́sa duma kọarị nyẹ. Anịgosi wa bịpịkpọm wa tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánam ḅẹ́, Tamuno ma ipine ḅụ wa diekiri nyánábẹm.
english_text: through whom we have gained access by faith into this grace in which we now stand. And weboast in the hope of the glory of God.

ibani_text: Anị ḅara ma ngéréghaa kụ́ma wa pịghị dụrụkụ tọ́rụ́siarị pịrịm, tegó wa nimim ḅẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị mịẹm tumḅọ ngịrịma nyáná,
english_text: Not only so, but wealso glory in our sufferings, because we know that suffering produces perseverance;

ibani_text: ingịrịma mịẹm tumḅọ Tamuno ḅara pụ́nụ́ pịrịnyẹ mịẹḅara nyáná, Tamuno ḅara pụnụ pịrịnyẹ mịẹḅara tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ akuom.
english_text: perseverance, character; and character, hope.

ibani_text: Mịị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma wa gbarịgbarịgha, Tamuno ori ḅẹlẹma pa wámịna kúkúbie saramam ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa, anịị wa ọ ḅara nyáná ḅo diepịrịnyẹ.
english_text: And hope does not put us to shame, because God’s love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit, who has been given to us.

ibani_text: Ọ́ kọ́kọ́ arịị ḅẹ́ sa ma karakárá sa, ịnyọ wámịna ḅụ ófórigha sa, Krais fịị siiamịẹnyẹapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly.

ibani_text: Anị ḅụdam kóróma tumḅọ go fịị karakáráma mịẹarịḅọ pịrịbẹnyẹ, anịsọnị tumḅọ ine fịị ibiamịẹnyẹ nyánáḅọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous person, though for a good person someone might possibly dare to die.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno diepághámamam ọ wa ḅẹlẹma láa ḅara: wa pa siinyẹ bie fịnị sa Krais fịị wa pịrịm.
english_text: But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

ibani_text: Ori ọrẹ ọmbịnyẹ́ pa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ pa wa mịẹmam Tamuno fịnịngaa, mịẹ nẹ́ngị nyẹ, ọ wa duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm Tamuno ma igani ḅụ!
english_text: Since we have now been justified by his blood, how much more shall we be saved from God’s wrath through him!

ibani_text: Wamịnị áyá sa Tamuno iruonaapụ, kụ́ma ori oyẹ nángwọ́apụ pa wa mịẹm ọ Tụ́wọ ma fịị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Mị́sa wa Tamuno nángwọ́apụ sọmaa ḅara ma, tẹ́ pịghị kọọ Krais ori duma pa wa duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: For if, while we were God’s enemies, we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son, how much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved through his life!

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anịma ngéréghaa, tego wa dụrụkụ Tamuno mịẹmáa nyẹ ma pịrịm wa Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, Tamuno nangwọapụ pa wa mịẹmáa ḅo.
english_text: Not only is this so, but we also boast in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.

ibani_text: Sii gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri ma sọm, ori sii ma pịghị fịị akuom. Anịgosi fịị tuminikiri gbọrụ mamgba agbam, tegó kị́nị́mamgba siinyẹ mịẹmam.
english_text: Therefore, just as sin entered the world through one man, and death through sin, and in this way death came to all people, because all sinned—

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma na ḅogha sa, sii tuminikiri imi; kụ́ma ólóghó ófórigha angaá, n kịẹbịpị nyáná ólóghó pịrịgha.
english_text: To be sure, sin was in the world before the law was given, but sin is not charged against anyone’s account where there is no law.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Adam sa ḅụ ákị mú Mosis sa ma ḅụ ngaapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịịm, Adam sịbị gánágánáma Tamuno ólóghó ma pịrị ḅara pa siinyẹ miẹghapụ sọ fịịm, Adam anịị ḅo bẹḅọ ma kịkaanyẹ, anịị Jizọs Krais.
english_text: Nevertheless, death reigned from the time of Adam to the time of Moses, even over those who did not sin by breaking a command, as did Adam, who is a pattern of the one to come.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mmẹẹ́ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara fịnịgha, tegó igbii pa fẹ́ghaa Tamuno dienyẹ ma, anị Adam sii fịnị ḅára fịnịgha. Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ tọgha túminị́ fịịm anị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ma sii gosi. Kụ́ma Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma duḅaḅam, anị ḅara ma anịị diepịrịnyẹ ma so fịnị ḅara, Tamuno pa tọghaapụ pịrịnyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, anịị Jizọs Krais.
english_text: But the gift is not like the trespass. For if the many died by the trespass of the one man, how much more did God’s grace and the gift that came by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, overflow to the many!

ibani_text: Kịrịnyẹ́ imi Tamuno dienyẹ na gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ sii. Adam siinyẹ mịẹ sa Tamuno ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm ḅẹ́, ḅẹ́rẹ́ ọ ḅárásim; kụ́ma tọghaapụ ḅo siinyẹ mịẹ sa Tamuno ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ pa n diem dughoarị ḅẹ́, Ḅẹ́rẹ́ ọ́ ḅárasigha!
english_text: Nor can the gift of God be compared with the result of one man’s sin: The judgment followed one sin and brought condemnation, but the gift followed many trespasses and brought justification.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ sii ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, fịị saghị ámá kánámam sị sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ taa, gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ma gosi. Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ Jizọs Krais ine anịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ mịẹm. Tamuno mánámāná tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma daakịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, igbii gbẹ́gha ḅụ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọm, mịnaapụ ma duma ḅụ sọ́ḅáapụ sọ́bẹm Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: For if, by the trespass of the one man, death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who receive God’s abundant provision of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man, Jesus Christ!

ibani_text: Anịsa gbẹ́rẹ́ sii ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ dighiḅọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrị ḅara, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma gbẹ́rẹ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ fịrị kị́nị́mamgba ḅara ḅẹ́rẹ́ibimam sị duma pa nnị pịrịị.
english_text: Consequently, just as one trespass resulted in condemnation for all people, so also one righteous act resulted in justification and life for all people.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ bịpịpúghúgháa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọgha túminị́ ma ḅo siiamịẹnyẹapụ sọm, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma gbẹ́rẹ́ tumḅọ bịpị púghú ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọgha túminị́ ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one man the many will be made righteous.

ibani_text: Nnị ólóghó ma pághámaḅom irima mịẹnyẹ sẹ́nị bẹ ḅara. Kuma siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo sẹ́nị sa, Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ warị sẹ́nị anị nẹngịma,
english_text: The law was brought in so that the trespass might increase. But where sin increased, grace increased all the more,

ibani_text: kunema, sii fịị kụ́rọ pa túminị́ taa ḅara ma, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Tamuno ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma taám, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ, sị wamịnị akuoo duma gbámásó bie suu wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: so that, just as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to bring eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

ibani_text: Anịsa, wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Wa siinyẹ mịẹ bịpịmú bẹ si Tamuno ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ sẹnị?
english_text: What shall we say, then? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may increase?

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori! Wa fịị sii pịrịmam, wa tegósi pa anị bie duma kọ bẹ?
english_text: By no means! We are those who have died to sin; how can we live in it any longer?

ibani_text: Ọ́ kọ́kọ́ ibima nimi ḅẹ́ wa mingi sara sa, wa ọkọ mịẹm wa Krais Jizọs na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹbẹ ḅara, wa mingi sara sa wa ọkọ mịẹm pa die ḅẹ́ wamịnị ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imi ori fịị ḅụ.
english_text: Or don’t you know that all of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

ibani_text: Wamịnị mingi sára ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị wamịnị na ori na dipi gbolomam wa pịghị ori na fịịm, anịgosi Daḅọ ma Krais saghịma ḅara ori ḅụ́gbérépuma kụ́rọ ḅụ, wamịnị sọ anị ḅara pa ịwọ duma kọbẹm.
english_text: We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.

ibani_text: Wa mịị ḅara ma pa ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ mịẹmáa ḅara ma ori fịị ḅụ, wa pịghị gbarịgha ḅụ ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ fịnịbẹm sị saghị duma bie sọ ori saghị duma bie sọ ḅara.
english_text: For if we have been united with him in a death like his, we will certainly also be united with him in a resurrection like his.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ wámịna olom ojumẹnị ma nnị anị na Krais ḅaupálịm mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ, sị n siiamịẹnyẹ ojumẹnị ma guluguluma bẹ ḅara, sị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wamịnị jẹ́ pa siiamịẹnyẹ ómóniapụ sọbịgha ḅara
english_text: For we know that our old self was crucified with him so that the body ruled by sin might be done away with,that we should no longer be slaves to sin—

ibani_text: tegó fịịmaá ḅọ sii mịnị kụ́rọ nyanagha n ḅọ oju.
english_text: because anyone who has died has been set free from sin.

ibani_text: Wa Krais dua fịịmaá ḅara ma, wa mininim ḅẹ́ wa pịghị ori na duma fịnịbẹm.
english_text: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.

ibani_text: Wa kọkọ nimi ḅẹ́ nnị Krais sághịmamam fịị ḅụ ọ pịghị mịnị jẹ́ pa fịịbịgha; fịị mịnị ọ ḅụ kụ́rọ nyanagha.
english_text: For we know that since Christ was raised from the dead, he cannot die again; death no longer has mastery over him.

ibani_text: Ọ kọ fịị ma, ọ fịị sii pịrịm gbẹ́rẹ́sa ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa, kụ́ma mị́sa ọkọarị duma ma, o duma Tamuno ma pịrịm.
english_text: The death he died, he died to sin once for all; but the life he lives, he lives to God.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị sii gboloma sa ọmịnị ọḅụ arịị ḅẹ́ ọ fịịmam, kụ́ma dumafịnị sị Tamuno na mịẹgbólóma nyáná Krais Jizọs ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ minima sị sii kụ́rọ nyáná ọmịna fịị bẹ ojumẹnị ma pịrị, sị anị tarị siinyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ.
english_text: Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its evil desires.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna oju gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá sọ saghị sii pịrịma ḅẹ́ nnị anị pa sii fịrị nwángị. Anịmanakaragha ọmịnị nnị fịị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ma duma bie suaapụ, ọmịnị ọ ḅụ pa Tamuno pịrị, ọmịnị ọmịna oju gbọrụ mamgba saghị Tamuno pịrị sị nnị anị pa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ fịrịnwangị.
english_text: Do not offer any part of yourself to sin as an instrument of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life; and offer every part of yourself to him as an instrument of righteousness.

ibani_text: Sii mịnị ọmịna nyánáḅọ sọbịgha, tegó ọmịnị ólóghó ma sughubie ofori kụ́ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ bie.
english_text: For sin shall no longer be your master, because you are not under the law, but under grace.

ibani_text: Anịsa, wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Wa pa siinyẹ mịẹbẹ, wa ólóghó sughubie ofori gosi kụ́ma Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori!
english_text: What then? Shall we sin because we are not under the law but under grace? By no means!

ibani_text: Ọmịnị o nimigha ḅẹ́, ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ pa jụghọ pịrị sa soḅọ́rọ́ n ḅọ ómóniḅọ sị n ḅọ bịpị pughu, ọmịnị omoni sọ ọ bịpị pughu nyánáḅọ ma pịrịmam ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị omoni sọ sii pịrị, fịị dighiḅoarị nyẹ anịgha Tamuno bịpị pughu mịẹsị tumḅọ na Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: Don’t you know that when you offer yourselves to someone as obedient slaves, you are slaves of the one you obey—whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wamịnị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹbẹm! Tegó gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri ọmịnị omoni sọ sii pịrịm, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ nyánáḅọ karakárá dienyẹ ma ọ tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa anị dughonyẹ mịẹm.
english_text: But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin, you have come to obey from your heart the pattern of teaching that has now claimed your allegiance.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ duaḅọ́rọ́mam sii ḅarabie sị ọ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ómóniapụ sọ.
english_text: You have been set free from sin and have become slaves to righteousness.

ibani_text: A éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ naarị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa nyẹ pa o diem ọmịna pologha akanyaḅo gosi. Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ saghị pa ómóniapụ mịẹ ịlọ́lị duma na ólóghó bịpị pughugha duma pịrịm, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ saghị pa ómóniapụ mịẹ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ pịrị, tumḅọ dighi mú tọ́ntọ́ duma bie súúarị nyẹ.
english_text: I am using an example from everyday life because of your human limitations. Just as you used to offer yourselves as slaves to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer yourselves as slaves to righteousness leading to holiness.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị omoni sọ sii pịrị sa, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ọmịna duma bie ofori.
english_text: When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of righteousness.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ sọnyẹ nyánáḅọ, mị́sa ọ ḅụgịrịrịmaarị nyẹ ma ḅụ? Ọḅụkụ́nọma fịị anị mịnanyẹ ma dighiḅoarị nyẹ!
english_text: What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are now ashamed of? Those things result in death!

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa n sii ḅárabie ọ duapághámaḅomam sị ọmịnị Tamuno ómóniapụ sọ. Ọmịna sọnyẹ anịị n gbẹ́rẹ́sa saghị ḅọrọma Tamuno pịrị duma, anị kunema anịị duma gbámásó.
english_text: But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves of God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life.

ibani_text: Fịị anịị sii gbẹfịnyẹ, kụ́ma Tamuno diepịrịnyẹ anịị duma gbámásó wámịna Nyánáḅọ Krais Jizọs bie.
english_text: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life inChrist Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa amịnáapụ, a dugho dọghụnyẹ ma ọmịnị akanyaḅobẹm tegó ọmịnị ólóghó ma nimim, ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma kụ́rọ nyánam tumḅọ dumafịnị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: Do you not know, brothers and sisters—for I am speaking to those who know the law—that the law has authority over someone only as long as that person lives?

ibani_text: Pa tọ́ma ḅụ, ólóghó ma deeyaa ọ́rụ́ḅọ pa a dee ḅụ kpọm, o dumafịnị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, kụ́ma ọ fịị n ḅẹḅẹ n pa nnị mmẹapụ fịna ólóghó ma ḅụ nnị a fiimamam.
english_text: For example, by law a married woman is bound to her husband as long as he is alive, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law that binds her to him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a mú jẹ́ owiḅọ na fịnịfịnị, deḅọ ma pa dumafịnị sa, nnị amadọghụḅọ pa a sịbẹm; kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ deeḅọ fịị nḅẹḅẹ́ a kpọwarị ólóghó ma ḅụ a fiimamam árị mịnị amadọghụḅọgha a ḅọ́rọ́ jẹ́ owiḅọ yaa yaa.
english_text: So then, if she has sexual relations with another man while her husband is still alive, she is called an adulteress. But if her husband dies, she is released from that law and is not an adulteress if she marries another man.

ibani_text: Anịị anị pịghị ọ nana fịnị ḅara ị́yẹ́ amịnáapụ, anị ólóghó ma gboloma ḅara ḅụ ọmịnị so ọ fịịmam tegó ọmịnị ma anịị Krais ma oju bẹ gbẹ́rẹ́apụ; ọmịnị anị mị́sa n fịị ḅụ saghịma ḅọ ma nyẹẹ wa sọnyẹ sọ bẹ ḅara Tamuno ma fịrịkiri.
english_text: So, my brothers and sisters, you also died to the law through the body of Christ, that you might belong to another, to him who was raised from the dead, in order that we might bear fruit for God.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ojumẹnị ḅụ duma kọ sa, ojumẹnị ma tarịarị siinyẹ, ólóghó ma timi saghị nyẹ, fịrịnwangịarị wámịna oju bie, fịị anị mịnanyẹ mamgba dighiḅọ nyẹ.
english_text: For when we were in the realm of the flesh,the sinful passions aroused by the law were at work in us, so that we bore fruit for death.

ibani_text: Mị́sa, anị fịnị ḅara, ólóghó ma ḅárabie wa pághámaḅomam, tegó wa fịị parị ịkóli pa wa suanyẹ ma pịrịmam. Anịgosi wamịnị olom asọ ma duagha n gịẹ kóróma ólóghó ma bịpịsụ́ụ́ angaá, kụ́ma wamịnị ịwọ asọ ma duam Tẹ́mẹ́ ma bịpịsụ́ụ́ angaá.
english_text: But now, by dying to what once bound us, we have been released from the law so that we serve in the new way of the Spirit, and not in the old way of the written code.

ibani_text: Anịsa wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ, wa dugho bẹ ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma ibighaa? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori! Kụ́ma ólóghó ma anị mịẹsị a sii pa sị nyẹ níminyẹ. Ḅọ́rọ́ ólóghó ma dughogha ḅẹ́, Jughonyẹ mọnịma, a nimibịghaa ḅẹ́ jụghọ nyẹ́mọ́ni ólóghó ma na kuragha.
english_text: What shall we say, then? Is the law sinful? Certainly not! Nevertheless, I would not have known what sin was had it not been for the law. For I would not have known what coveting really was if the law had not said, “You shall not covet.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sii asọ dọghụ sị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ojumẹnị tarịarị kuragha nyẹ timi saghịmam ị́yẹ́ duma bie. Ólóghó ma ofori sii kụ́rọ nyanagha.
english_text: But sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, produced in me every kind of coveting. For apart from the law, sin was dead.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri a dumafịnịm na a ólóghó bịpị ma nimigha sáá, kụ́ma a ḅọ ólóghó ma nimiḅọ sa, sịị warị saghị kụ́rọ nyáná ịḅụ,
english_text: Once I was alive apart from the law; but when the commandment came, sin sprang to life and I died.

ibani_text: anị ḅara ma a fịịm. A ḅo arịḅom ḅẹ́ duma akuodum ólóghó bịpị ma, tụ́ma fịị dighiḅọ i pịrịm.
english_text: I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life actually brought death.

ibani_text: Sii warị ólóghó bịpị ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ asọ arịị sị oḅori pa i sị warị pịghị ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅaá.
english_text: For sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, deceived me, and through the commandment put me to death.

ibani_text: Anịgo ólóghó ma ḅụgbọrụ tọ́ntọ́, ólóghó bịpị ma tọ́ntọ́, karakáram, pighi ibim.
english_text: So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous and good.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma anị die ḅẹ́, ibinyẹ ma ị́yẹ́ fịị dighiḅom? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori. Sịị anịị anị mịẹnyẹ, sii ibinyẹ ma pa fịị dighiḅọ i pịrịm, sị túminị́ anị karakárá fịnị ḅara árị bẹ ḅara. Anịgosi, ólóghó bịpị ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, sii anị ḅụ diem anị sii láa ḅara.
english_text: Did that which is good, then, become death to me? By no means! Nevertheless, in order that sin might be recognized as sin, it used what is good to bring about my death, so that through the commandment sin might become utterly sinful.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ imi; kụ́ma irị a Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ofori, nnị pa sii dẹrị ómóniḅọ ḅara.
english_text: We know that the law is spiritual; but I am unspiritual, sold as a slave to sin.

ibani_text: A akanyaḅogha a mịẹarịnyẹ; tegó a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ a ine mịẹgha, kụ́ma a mịẹ dọghụgha nyẹ anịị a mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do.

ibani_text: A a mịẹdoghugha nyẹ ma mịẹarị sa, anị dughoarị ḅẹ́ a minim ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma karakáram.
english_text: And if I do what I do not want to do, I agree that the law is good.

ibani_text: Ịrị anịị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹarịḅọgha; tụ́ma ị́yẹ́ oju bie ngáarị sii ma.
english_text: As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin living in me.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹ́ ibi ibiebẹ ngagha, anịị ị́yẹ́ duma bie.
english_text: For I know that good itself does not dwell in me, that is, in my sinful nature.For I have the desire to do what is good, but I cannot carry it out.

ibani_text: A mịẹ dọghụ ibi ma a ine mịẹgha, anịmanakaragha a mịẹ dọghụgha siinyẹ ma anịị a mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: For I do not do the good I want to do, but the evil I do not want to do—this I keep on doing.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ a mịẹ dọghụgha nyẹ ma mịẹmịẹ, anị dughoarị ḅẹ́ mịnị irịgha nyẹ ma mịẹarịḅọ; anịmanakaragha anị mịẹarịnyẹ anịị ị́yẹ́ duma bie ngáarị sii ma.
english_text: Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it.

ibani_text: Anịgo a arịḅom ḅẹ́ mịị ólóghó ma fịrị ḅụ imi: a ibinyẹ mịẹ dọghụ sa, siinyẹ anị torukudaarị nyẹ.
english_text: So I find this law at work: Although I want to do good, evil is right there with me.

ibani_text: Bẹ ị́yẹ́ duma bie Tamuno ólóghó ma koko i pụghọ tárịm.
english_text: For in my inner being I delight in God’s law;

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a jẹ́ ólóghó arịm fịrịnwangịarị nyẹ ị́yẹ́ oju bie, owu pa ikúkúbie miniakị ólóghó ma pághámaarị nyẹ. Anị i mịẹm a ikólinaḅọ sọ pa sii ólóghó ma pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ oju bie fịrịnwangịarị nyẹ.
english_text: but I see another law at work in me, waging war against the law of my mind and making me a prisoner of the law of sin at work within me.

ibani_text: Irị anịị bieḅẹlẹgha owitụ́wọ! Tụọ i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ, mịị fịị dighiḅọ i pịrịarị oju ma ḅụ?
english_text: What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body that is subject to death?

ibani_text: Imiẹḅa fịnị Tamuno pịrịị, i duaḅọ́rọ́maarịḅọ wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́! Anịgo mị́sa ịrị ịḅụgḅọrụ kúkúbie ngéré anị a pa ine Tamuno ólóghó ma koko bẹnyẹ, ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị warị sii dighiḅoarị ólóghó ma koko.
english_text: Thanks be to God, who delivers me through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God’s law, but in my sinful naturea slave to the law of sin.

ibani_text: Anịgo Krais Jizọs na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnịapụ ma, ḅẹ́rẹ́ mịnị nna ḅárasigha.
english_text: Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus,

ibani_text: Tegó, Krais Jizọs ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, Tẹ́mẹ́ ólóghó ma duma pịrịarịḅọ, i dụaḅọ́rọ́māmám, sii na fịị ólóghó ma ḅárabie.
english_text: because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit who gives life has set youfree from the law of sin and death.

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma ine mịẹgha nyẹ, tegó ojumẹnị ma mịẹmam sị anị mịnị kụ́rọ nyanagha Tamuno mịẹm ori ọ Tụwọ fịrịma sa, ojumẹnị suaḅọ sị o sii sịrịsii bẹ ḅara. Anị ḅara ma ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọsima sii pịrịm ojumẹnị ma bie.
english_text: For what the law was powerless to do because it was weakened by the flesh,God did by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh to be a sin offering.And so he condemned sin in the flesh,

ibani_text: Tamuno mịma mịẹm sị ólóghó ma bi karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ fịrị ma bí ḅara pa anị ḅụ die bẹ ḅara wámịna ḅụ, ojumẹnị dua duma kọghaapụ kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dua duma kọapụ.
english_text: in order that the righteous requirement of the law might be fully met in us, who do not live according to the flesh but according to the Spirit.

ibani_text: Nna ojumẹnị dugho ḅara pa duma kọ́arịapụ, nna ojumẹnị bii nyẹ anịị nna kúkúbie ḅẹrẹtọ nnị pịrịarịnyẹ. Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho ḅara pa duma kọ́arịapụ, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma binyẹ anịị nna kúkúbie ḅẹrẹtọ nnị pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: Those who live according to the flesh have their minds set on what the flesh desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.

ibani_text: Ojumẹnị ma ḅẹrẹtọ pịrị fịị dighiḅọ ḅom; Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅẹrẹtọ pịrị duma na diin dighiḅọ dighiḅom.
english_text: The mind governed by the flesh is death, but the mind governed by the Spirit is life and peace.

ibani_text: Anịgo túminị́ ḅo Tamuno iruonaapụ sọm nna ojumẹnị ḅẹrẹtọ n pịrịarị sa; mịnaapụ ma Tamuno ólóghó ma kokogha, n pịghị ine anị kokobịgha.
english_text: The mind governed by the flesh is hostile to God; it does not submit to God’s law, nor can it do so.

ibani_text: Nna ojumẹnị dughonyẹ mịẹarịapụ ine Tamuno kúkúbie mịẹḅẹ́lẹ́mabịgha.
english_text: Those who are in the realm of the flesh cannot please God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị ị́ ị́yẹ́ ojumẹnị dugho ḅara pa duma kọgha, anịmanakaragha ị́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho ḅara pa duma kọm, ḅọ́rọ́ tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọmịna biebẹ ngam. Krais Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Krais tumḅọgha.
english_text: You, however, are not in the realm of the flesh but are in the realm of the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, they do not belong to Christ.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Krais ọmịna biebẹ imi nḅẹḅẹ́, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma duma pa ọ pịrịbẹm, tegó nnị ọmịnị na Tamuno na pa karakárá ḅụ ḅụ wárịmam, ojumẹnị ma fịị bẹ sọ sii gosi.
english_text: But if Christ is in you, then even though your body is subject to death because of sin, the Spirit gives lifebecause of righteousness.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ fịị ḅụ Jizọs Krais saghịma Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọmịna biebẹ ngam, anịsa ori Krais saghịma ḅọ fịị ḅụ pịghị duma pa ọmịna fịị bẹ ojumẹnị ma pịrịbẹm. Ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ọmịna oju bie ngáarị nyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mịma mịẹbẹm.
english_text: And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies because ofhis Spirit who lives in you.

ibani_text: Anịsọ, iyẹ́a mịnaapụ, wa sáá ọlọm wa duma kọ́be ḅara, wa duma kọbịgha wámịna ojumẹnị bi ḅara.
english_text: Therefore, brothers and sisters, we have an obligation—but it is not to the flesh, to live according to it.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ọ duma kọ ọmịna ojumẹnị ma dọghụarị ḅara, ọ fị́ị́bẹm; kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ọmịnị ojumẹnị siiamịẹnyẹ ma ḅa nḅẹḅẹ́ o dumabẹm.
english_text: For if you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, you will live.

ibani_text: Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma datụ́ghụ́maarịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị ma anị Tamuno awọ.
english_text: For those who are led by the Spirit of God are the children of God.

ibani_text: Tegó Tamuno pa ọ pịrịmaá Tẹ́mẹ́ ma omoni pa ọ mịẹgha, mịẹsị ọ ḅáláfa bẹnyẹ; anịmanakaragha, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma Tamuno awọ pa ọ mịẹm, pịghị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wamịnị owu Tamuno pịrịarị, Daa! I Daa!
english_text: The Spirit you received does not make you slaves, so that you live in fear again; rather, the Spirit you received brought about your adoption to sonship.And by him we cry, “Abba,Father.”

ibani_text: Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ anị ḅụ pa wámịna tẹ́mẹ́ na gbólomaarị si dugho págháma ḅẹ́ wamịnị Tamuno awọ.
english_text: The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are God’s children.

ibani_text: Wa Tamuno ma awọ sọmaá ḅara ma, wa pịghị o kóróma ori a túminị́ pịrị karịibima ma nyánábẹm, wa pịghị Krais na nyánábẹm Tamuno kóróma ọ pịrịnyẹ; wa ḅọ́rọ́ Krais ma tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ diekiri nyánam, wa pịghị ori ipine ḅụ diekiri nyánábẹm.
english_text: Now if we are children, then we are heirs—heirs of God and co-heirs with Christ, if indeed we share in his sufferings in order that we may also share in his glory.

ibani_text: A arịḅom ḅẹ́ wa mị́sa árịarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma, nnị pa ine toruku n pa wa die bẹ ipine ma na tọ́mábịgha.
english_text: I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba tọ́rụ́ asọ ḅụ fịnị ḅara pa kúruarị Tamuno ori awọ ma diepágháma bẹ sa.
english_text: For the creation waits in eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed.

ibani_text: Tamuno n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm sị nnị mịnị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, nnị dọghụ ḅáragha kụ́ma Tamuno ma tọ́ḅára. Anịsọ mịị tọ́rụdighinyẹ ma imii
english_text: For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ tuminikiri n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma dụapaghama ḅobẹm nnị anị pa sua ḅụrụ omoni ḅarabie, sị nnị diekiri nyáná Tamuno awọ ma nyáná ḅụ́gbérépuma dụapághámaḅo ma ḅụ.
english_text: thatthe creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the freedom and glory of the children of God.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ ákị ḅo mị́sa ma láa tuminikiri n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba ákụ ḅụ inighiarị sọ ḅọ́rọ́ yii ọlọḅọ.
english_text: We know that the whole creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time.

ibani_text: Nnị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma ngéréghaa inighiarị nyẹ; kụ́ma wamịnị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáapụ sọ, anịị Tamuno parị pịrị dienyẹ ma nyánápụ so inighiarị wámịna biebẹ, wa pịghị kúruarị si Tamuno ori awọ pa wa mịẹsị wámịna oju gbọrụ págháraa pághámaḅo.
english_text: Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption to sonship, the redemption of our bodies.

ibani_text: Mịị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánam; kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ wa tọ́rụ́ pa wa tọ́rụdighinyẹ ma árịmam anị mịnị tọ́rụdighinyẹ́gha. Tụọ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyáná n ḅo nyanamaá nyẹ pịrị pịrị?
english_text: For in this hope we were saved. But hope that is seen is no hope at all. Who hopes for what they already have?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ wa tọ́rụdighinyẹ nyáná wamịnị arịgha nyẹ ḅụ, wa ingịrịma nyáná sị anị kurubẹm.
english_text: But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma sọ ḅo ḅárásua wa pịrịm wámịna ịnyọ ófórigha ḅụ. Ḅẹẹ, wa nimigha wa ḅara warị tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara; Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọ ḅụgbọrụ ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọbịgha inighi pa Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄arị wámịna sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us through wordless groans.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie arịarịḅọ, nimim Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kóróma; tegó Tẹ́mẹ́ ma oria túminị́ sịbị go Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄arị, ori Tamuno ma tọ́warị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for God’s people in accordance with the will of God.

ibani_text: Wa nimim bẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ Tamuno ibinyẹ mịẹ ọ ḅẹlẹmaapụ pịrịpịrịm, ọ sịị́apụ ọ mịẹ dọghụnyẹ gosi.
english_text: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, whohave been called according to his purpose.

ibani_text: Tamuno sẹlẹakịmaapụ ma, ọ pịghị n fófóoma wárim sị n ḅo ọ Tụwọ fịnị ḅara fịnịị, o Tụ́wọ ma parị nnị yiiḅọ sọ bẹ ḅara tọgha mịnaapụ ogboku.
english_text: For those God foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: Anịgo Tamuno fófóoma wárịapụ, ori na nnị na ọ pịghị ori ipine ma pa n ḅụ sarám.
english_text: And those he predestined, he also called; those he called, he also justified; those he justified, he also glorified.

ibani_text: Anị nwọfịnị sa, wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ma sẹ wa pịrị nḅẹḅẹ́, tụ́wọ asọ mgbẹsẹ wa pịrịbẹ?
english_text: What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

ibani_text: Ori ọ Tụwọ ma ọlọ ọ ḅụ pịrịghaḅọ, kụ́ma ọ saghị pa wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm. Ọ pịghị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅara findi nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa wa pịrịbịgha?
english_text: He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all—how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?

ibani_text: Tụọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma sịbị gbánā bẹ? Tamuno anị ḅẹ́arịḅọ, ḅẹ́rẹ́ nna ḅárasigha!
english_text: Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen? It is God who justifies.

ibani_text: Tụọ anịsa ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa nna ḅarasima bẹ? Krais Jizọs fịịḅọ ma, pịghị fịị ḅụ n saghịma ḅọ ma, ọ pịghị Tamuno ma amaḅara angaá imi, wa sịbị go ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị.
english_text: Who then is the one who condemns? No one. Christ Jesus who died—more than that, who was raised to life—is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us.

ibani_text: Tụọ anịsa, wa fófóoma bẹ Krais ma ḅẹlẹma ḅụ? Ḅẹ́rẹ́ ine bẹ, anịgha nyẹ ḅụ kụrọ́ anịgha tọ́rụ́siarị anịgha ḅurutarị anịgha ịgónyí anịgha nyẹ pa kịnịlámányẹ anịgha fịị?
english_text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword?

ibani_text: Tọ́n diri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara ḅẹẹ, Ọ sịbị go wa fịị na tọ́rụ́donam éné mamgba ḅụ; nnị wamịnị ákịm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ n kọngọ pẹlẹ bẹ ánáná.
english_text: As it is written: “For your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.”

ibani_text: Ofori, mịnanyẹ mamgba ḅụ wa sọḅaapụ nẹngịm wa ḅẹlẹma ḅọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.

ibani_text: A nimitẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ wa fófóomabịgha ori ḅụ fịnịnyẹ, anịgha ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́: fịị sọ anịgha duma, anịgha sookumuapụ, anịgha sobie ẹ́kpẹ́dua, anịgha mị́sa ma túminị́ kụrọnyanáapụ, mịị sa ma ḅụ anịgha ḅo bẹ sa,
english_text: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons,neither the present nor the future, nor any powers,

ibani_text: anịgha ọgọnọ ju anịgha póghóló yọ, anịgha tuminikiri nnị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine wa fófóomabịgha Tamuno ma ḅẹlẹma ḅụ, wa nyánányẹ Krais Jizọs wámịna Nyánáḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: A tụ́manyẹ ma dughoarị Krais ḅụ mininiḅọ ḅara ḅụ a iruonyẹ dughogha, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅẹrẹtọ pịrịarị i tẹ́mẹ́bie pịghị onyẹsẹ́ i pịrịarị ḅẹ́ a iruonyẹ dughogha.
english_text: I speak the truth in Christ—I am not lying, my conscience confirms it through the Holy Spirit—

ibani_text: Opu tẹ́mẹ́sii ịḅụ imii na mịnị kunemagha ḅụakụ i tẹ́mẹ́bie.
english_text: I have great sorrow and unceasing anguish in my heart.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa túminị́ ma gosi, i nana gbẹ́rẹ́ pulo mịná na gbẹ́rẹ́ ojumẹnị. A bibẹm ḅẹ́ a Tamuno si fị́lā pa pịrịḅọ sọ anịị Krais ḅụ, nnị kiẹsiḅọ sọ nna sịbị gosi.
english_text: For I could wish that I myself were cursed and cut off from Christ for the sake of my people, those of my own race,

ibani_text: Nnị anịị Tamuno ma túminị́; ori oyẹ awọ pa nnị mịẹm pịghị ori ipine pa n die, ori nnị na ọḅọọ fịm sị ólóghó ma pa pịrị, nnị karakárá tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅárá ma nyánam pịghị Tamuno minini nyẹ ma nyánámam.
english_text: the people of Israel. Theirs is the adoption to sonship; theirs the divine glory, the covenants, the receiving of the law, the temple worship and the promises.

ibani_text: Nnị anịị ẹ́rẹ́so Hiburu tádọ́apụ ma furoawọ, Krais sọ ojumẹnị ḅụ pịghị nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ. Tamuno ori ngámámgba ḅụ táarịḅọ túminí fịnị ọ pịrị ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa! Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of the Messiah, who is God over all, forever praised!Amen.

ibani_text: A dughogha ḅẹ́ Tamuno o minini nyẹ ma mịẹgha; tegó Izirẹlị furoawọ mamgbagha Tamuno awọ gosi.
english_text: It is not as though God’s word had failed. For not all who are descended from Israel are Israel.

ibani_text: Pịghị jẹ́ Ebraham furoawọ mamgbagha Tamuno awọ. Tamuno dugho Ebraham pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Aizik ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị a minini ị pịrị awọ ma ḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Nor because they are his descendants are they all Abraham’s children. On the contrary, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”

ibani_text: Mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́ ojumẹnị ḅụ n ḅọ́rọ́ yiiapụ ma nnị Tamuno awọgha anịmanakaragha nnị yiiapụ ma Tamuno minini nyẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị anị tụmasi furoawọ.
english_text: In other words, it is not the children by physical descent who are God’s children, but it is the children of the promise who are regarded as Abraham’s offspring.

ibani_text: Mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anị ọ pa nyẹ minini nyẹ: Anị karakárá sa a pịghịma ḅobẹm, anịsa Sira owitụ́wọ yiibẹm.
english_text: For this was how the promise was stated: “At the appointed time I will return, and Sarah will have a son.”

ibani_text: Anịma ngéréghaa, kụ́ma Ribeka mmẹẹ́ owiapụ awọ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ daa nyánam, wámịna tádóḅọ Aizik.
english_text: Not only that, but Rebekah’s children were conceived at the same time by our father Isaac.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mmẹẹ́ awọ ma na kiri laagha sáá ḅụ anịgha ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹ ibinyẹ anịgha siinyẹ mịẹ, a warị Tamuno ḅara oku nyánáḅọ. Mịị oku ma diearị ḅẹ́ Tamuno túminị́ sẹlẹakiarị, ori tọ warị ḅara ḅụ;
english_text: Yet, before the twins were born or had done anything good or bad—in order that God’s purpose in election might stand:

ibani_text: o túminị́ sịsịm kụ́ma ori nnị mịẹ ibinyẹ anịgha nna siinyẹ dighidighigha. Tamuno Ribeka ḅẹm, Sẹnịḅọ ma omoni sọ káláḅọ ma pịrịbẹm.
english_text: not by works but by him who calls—she was told, “The older will serve the younger.”

ibani_text: Tọ́n diri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara ḅẹ́, Jekọpụ anịị a ḅẹlẹma ḅọ, Esọ anịị a ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ.
english_text: Just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”

ibani_text: Anịsa wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ, Tamuno ọ karakáragha? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori.
english_text: What then shall we say? Is God unjust? Not at all!

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ dugho Mosis pịrị, A lolomakúkúbie nyáná a lolomakúkúbie nyáná pịrịbẹḅọ pịrịbẹm, a pịghị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná a tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná pịrị bẹḅọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: For he says to Moses, “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”

ibani_text: Anịma go, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịnị ḅara, tumḅọ dọghụ ḅáragha anịgha mịẹḅara, kụ́ma Tamuno ma lolomakúkúbie ngéré.
english_text: It does not, therefore, depend on human desire or effort, but on God’s mercy.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma Fero pịrịm, A ámányánáḅọ pa ị mịẹm sị a ị pa iyẹ kụ́rọ diepágháma ḅẹ́ ḅara, sị iyẹ ẹrẹ ẹ́rẹ́so bẹ ḅárá tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ.
english_text: For Scripture says to Pharaoh: “I raised you up for this very purpose, that I might display my power in you and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”

ibani_text: Anịgo Tamuno lolomakúkúbie nyáná ọ lolomakúkúbie nyáná pịrị dọghụḅọ pịrịbẹm, ọ pịghị mịẹ dọghụḅọ n ḅọ kụ́rọ kúkúbie nyáná ori ọkọ mịẹm.
english_text: Therefore God has mercy on whom he wants to have mercy, and he hardens whom he wants to harden.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ i ḅẹbẹm, Ḅọ́rọ́ anị ọkọfịnịm, Tamuno ọ pa tegósi tumḅọ mịẹ irima nyẹ árịarị? Tụọ ine asọkiki Tamuno tọ́nyẹ pịrịbẹ?
english_text: One of you will say to me: “Then why does God still blame us? For who is able to resist his will?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị ḅọ́rọ́ tụọ, I nangwọ, Tamuno ma bịpị págháraarị ḅọ? Árịama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ine dugho anị tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ pịrịbịgha, I tegó mịị ḅara pa i tẹ́mẹ́?
english_text: But who are you, a human being, to talk back to God? “Shall what is formed say to the one who formed it, ‘Why did you make me like this?’ ”

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ma kụ́rọ nyáná sị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma pa ọ mịẹ dọghụ ḅara mịẹ pịghị mmẹẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ tẹ́mẹ́ pághámá ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ urọ atụma kpo ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ álálị sa, isi nganyẹ sámámgba ḅụ.
english_text: Does not the potter have the right to make out of the same lump of clay some pottery for special purposes and some for common use?

ibani_text: Mịị anị pịghị fịnị ḅara Tamuno mịẹnyẹ ḅụ. Ori ọra bieoḅu die dọ́ghụm, túminị́ pịghị ori a kụ́rọ árị, kụ́ma ori ngịrịma nyáná ọ bieoḅu pịrịarịapụ ma pịrịm, n tọ guluguluma pịrịapụ.
english_text: What if God, although choosing to show his wrath and make his power known, bore with great patience the objects of his wrath—prepared for destruction?

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dọ́ghụm ori ọrẹ opu ipine diepágháma, ọ pa wamịnị ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná pịrịapụ ma sịbị sara nyẹ, ọ tẹ́lẹ́maapụ ḅẹ́ wamịnị ori ipine nyáná.
english_text: What if he did this to make the riches of his glory known to the objects of his mercy, whom he prepared in advance for glory—

ibani_text: Wamịnị anịị ọ sịapụ ma, Juuapụ ma bie ngéréghaa kụ́ma Juughaapụ ma bie so.
english_text: even us, whom he also called, not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles?

ibani_text: Mịị o dughonyẹ Hosiya diri ḅụ: A ị́yẹ́ tuminighaapụ ma, A ị́yẹ́ túminị́ pa nnị sibẹm, a ḅẹlẹmagha sẹ ma, a a ḅẹlẹmaapụ pa nnị sịbẹm.
english_text: As he says in Hosea: “I will call them ‘my people’ who are not my people; and I will call her ‘my loved one’ who is not my loved one,”

ibani_text: Anị pịghị nnị dugho nnị pịrịnyẹ ḅẹ́, Ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ tuminigha,  Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ yọ ma anịị pịghị ọkọ pághábẹm ḅẹẹ n dugho nnị pịrị ngá ma ḅẹẹ.
english_text: and, “In the very place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’ there they will be called ‘children of the living God.’ ”

ibani_text: Aizaya owu pághámam Izirẹlị gbolomanyẹ ḅẹẹ: Ḅọ́rọ́ Izirẹlịawọ ma dụḅa sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́ angaá fịnị onwo, nna ḅụ boghaapụ ngéré anịị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Isaiah cries out concerning Israel: “Though the number of the Israelites be like the sand by the sea, only the remnant will be saved.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Tamuno ma sáá ngúmágha pa tuminikiriapụ mamgba sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá.
english_text: For the Lord will carry out his sentence on earth with speed and finality.”

ibani_text: Anịị parị sa Aizaya dugho ḅara: Ḅọ́rọ́ Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ wa furobie págháḅoapụ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ kọmagha nwọfịnị sáá wa Sodom fịnị ḅara fịnịmam, nwọfịnị sáá wa Gomora fịnị ḅara fịnịmam.
english_text: It is just as Isaiah said previously: “Unless the Lord Almighty had left us descendants, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah.”

ibani_text: Anịsa wa tẹ́ dugho bẹ? Juughaapụ ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ duaghaapụ ma, anị nyanaḅomam, anịị minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ;
english_text: What then shall we say? That the Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have obtained it, a righteousness that is by faith;

ibani_text: kụ́ma Izirẹlịapụ ma ologho ma duaarịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ asọ ine nnị dọghụarị nyẹ nyánaḅogha.
english_text: but the people of Israel, who pursued the law as the way of righteousness, have not attained their goal.

ibani_text: Tegósi? Nnị minini ḅụ anị duagha gosi kụ́ma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ nwángị fịrị ḅụ. Anịgo n ḅụọ pa Ḅụ́ọ́da dapịrị ma gbólom sị pumbu.
english_text: Why not? Because they pursued it not by faith but as if it were by works. They stumbled over the stumbling stone.

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara: Dighi Zayọn ḅụ a dapịrị kórómam, túminị́ ḅụọ daa sị nnị pumbuma bẹnyẹ. Pịghị nnị bịghịma bẹ okpo dapịrị kóróma, Kụ́ma ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụgịrịrịbịgha.
english_text: As it is written: “See, I lay in Zion a stone that causes people to stumble and a rock that makes them fall, and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame.”

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ, tẹ́mẹ́bie a bii nyẹ na a tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno pịrịarị tẹ́ghẹ̄ Izirẹlịawọ gosi ánị ḅẹ́, nnị ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for the Israelites is that they may be saved.

ibani_text: A onyẹsẹ́ n pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị ibima dọghụarị nnị Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄, kụ́ma nna ibima Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ dọghụma anị tụ́ma níminyẹ ḅụ gbánāgha.
english_text: For I can testify about them that they are zealous for God, but their zeal is not based on knowledge.

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ma nimigha sa warị asọ dọghụ nna nganyẹ pụ́úpágháma ḅo, anị ḅara ma nnị mịnị sịbị tughú Tamuno ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ pịrịgha.
english_text: Since they did not know the righteousness of God and sought to establish their own, they did not submit to God’s righteousness.

ibani_text: Krais anịị ólóghó ma kunema sị minini ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ sọ.
english_text: Christ is the culmination of the law so that there may be righteousness for everyone who believes.

ibani_text: Mịma anị Mosis gịẹ kórómanyẹ ólóghó ma ḅụ saghị ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ gbolomanyẹ: Ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹ, n ḅọ ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dumabẹm.
english_text: Moses writes this about the righteousness that is by the law: “The person who does these things will live by them.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómanyẹ, minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ma gbolomanyẹ: Mịnị ị tẹ́mẹ́bie dugho ma ḅẹẹ, Tụọ iwóo so mú ḅẹ́? (Anịị mú Krais akuo ḅo.)
english_text: But the righteousness that is by faith says: “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ”(that is, to bring Christ down)

ibani_text: Anịgha gbíla, Tụọ koro duaama mú bẹ? (Anịị Krais ma saghịma fịị ḅụ).
english_text: “or ‘Who will descend into the deep?’ ”(that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị tẹ́ dugho: Tamuno oku ma i nana kikiam; ị bịpịbie na ị tẹ́mẹ́bie imi, anịị wa dugho pághámaarị minini ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma.
english_text: But what does it say? “The word is near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart,”that is, the message concerning faith that we proclaim:

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ḅọ́rọ́ ị bịpị ḅụ dugho págháma ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịghị minini ị tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅẹ́ Tamuno ọ saghịmam fịị ḅụ, ị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm.
english_text: If you declare with your mouth, “Jesus is Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

ibani_text: Wámịna minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị wa ḅọ́rọ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọnyẹ Tamuno tórúku; wámịna bịpị ḅụ dugho pághámá nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị wa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánányẹ.
english_text: For it is with your heart that you believe and are justified, and it is with your mouth that you profess your faith and are saved.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ, Ọ ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụgịrịrịbịgha.
english_text: As Scripture says, “Anyone who believes in him will never be put to shame.”

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ kịrịnyẹ ofori Juuapụ na Juughaapụ bie Tamuno ori anịị kị́nị́mamgba Nyánáḅọ ọ pịghị ibiḅara pa ọ sịapụ mamgba boma bomam.
english_text: For there is no difference between Jew and Gentile—the same Lord is Lord of all and richly blesses all who call on him,

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ sịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm.
english_text: for, “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.”

ibani_text: Nnị tọ́rọ́ pa na nnị ḅụ mininighaḅọ ma sị bẹ? Nnị pịghị tọrọ́ pa na nnị o gbolomanyẹ naaghaḅọ ma ḅụ minini bẹ? Nnị pịghị tọ́rọ́ pa náa bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ oku ma dugho wásáma nnị pịrịgha?
english_text: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?

ibani_text: Nnị tọ́rọ́ pa oku ma dugho wásáma bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị n fịrịmagha? Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie, Anị opuma ḅụ́gbérépumam ḅẹ́ ibi oku ma akuoarịapụ ma ḅoarị.
english_text: And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

ibani_text: Izirẹlịawọ mamgbagha ibi oku ma daákịmáapụ. Aizaya kọkọ dugho ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, tụọ wámịna oku ma minini ma?
english_text: But not all the Israelites accepted the good news. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our message?”

ibani_text: Anịgo, minini ḅo ḅom oku ma náa ḅụ, oku ma ḅo ḅom Krais gboloma oku ma dugho wásáma ḅụ.
english_text: Consequently, faith comes from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word about Christ.

ibani_text: Kuma a gbilam: Anị tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ nnị oku ma naagha? Karakárányẹ dugho ḅụ n nam: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹ: Nna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ ma tuminikiri gbọrụ mamgba lam; Nna ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ tuminikiri kunema ngaa ma lam.
english_text: But I ask: Did they not hear? Of course they did: “Their voice has gone out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world.”

ibani_text: A sima gbilaarị, Izirẹlịawọ ma nnị akanyaḅogha? Mosis anị parị pagharaa ḅọ: A nyẹ ḅụ ófórigha sẹ pa ọ mịẹbẹm sị ọ nyẹ́mọ́ni; A akanyaḅo nyanagha sẹ pa ọ mịẹbẹm ọ bieoḅu.
english_text: Again I ask: Did Israel not understand? First, Moses says, “I will make you envious by those who are not a nation; I will make you angry by a nation that has no understanding.”

ibani_text: Aizaya ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa dughom o dugho sa, I dọghụghaapụ anịị i dọghụ pághámaḅoapụ; I gbilaghaapụ anịị a ḅụ pa dieapụ.
english_text: And Isaiah boldly says, “I was found by those who did not seek me; I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Izirẹlị gbolomanyẹ o dughom ḅẹẹ, Éné gbọrụ a i ḅara sụghụma bịpị pughugha na sịbị kụrọapụ pịrịm.
english_text: But concerning Israel he says, “All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and obstinate people.”

ibani_text: A warị anịsa gbíla: Tamuno ori ọrẹ a túminị́ sịghịma? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori! Ịḅụgḅọrụ Izirẹlịḅọ, Ebraham bie págháḅo ḅọ, pịghị Benjamin furotụ́wọ.
english_text: I ask then: Did God reject his people? By no means! I am an Israelite myself, a descendant of Abraham, from the tribe of Benjamin.

ibani_text: Tamuno na oria túminị́ sịghịgha ọ sẹlẹakịapụ sughúsaghị sa. O nimigha Elaija gboloma sị Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómanyẹ ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ dugho Tamuno suam Izirẹlịawọ gosi.
english_text: God did not reject his people, whom he foreknew. Don’t you know what Scripture says in the passage about Elijah—how he appealed to God against Israel:

ibani_text: Elaija dughom: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ nnị ị́yẹ́ ikiakoroapụ ma ḅasomam pịghị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́bẹ mamgba fomkákọ́sịma; ịrị ngéré anịị kọọ ḅọ, n pịghị i ḅaá dọghụarị.
english_text: “Lord, they have killed your prophets and torn down your altars; I am the only one left, and they are trying to kill me”?

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ tẹ́ pa ọ pagharaa? A túminị́ tẹ́rẹ́fa si a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si (7,000) kokowarị ịḅụ pịrịm na súsi Baali pịrịghaapụ.
english_text: And what was God’s answer to him? “I have reserved for myself seven thousand who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị anị fịnị ḅara mị́sa, kọọ káláapụ imi, Tamuno ori a tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sẹlẹakịapụ.
english_text: So too, at the present time there is a remnant chosen by grace.

ibani_text: Tamuno túminị́ sẹlẹakiarị ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, nnị nwángị fịrị ḅụ ofori, anị ḅọ́rọ́ nna fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ mịnị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́bịgha.
english_text: And if by grace, then it cannot be based on works; if it were, grace would no longer be grace.

ibani_text: Tẹ́ nyẹ anịsa? Izirẹlịapụ dọghụarị nyẹ ma n dọghụḅogha. Tamuno sẹlẹakị káláapụ ma ngéré anịị dọghụḅọ nyẹ; isiapụ ma biripụ́ma pa Tamuno n sị oku ma pịrịm.
english_text: What then? What the people of Israel sought so earnestly they did not obtain. The elect among them did, but the others were hardened,

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara, Tamuno akanyaḅo nyanagha tẹ́mẹ́ pa n pịrịm, tọ́rụ́ ine nyẹ arịgha nyẹ, biri ine nyẹ́ naagha biri, anị ọkọfịnịm ḅo mịmgba éné ma laam.
english_text: as it is written: “God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that could not see and ears that could not hear, to this very day.”

ibani_text: Deviti warị dugho: Nnị fị na ḅụ, dia sọ n pịrị si n kuu; anị pịghị n bịghịma bẹ ḅụọdaa dapịrị so, mịẹbẹnyẹ nnị fomunyẹ́ daa!
english_text: And David says: “May their table become a snare and a trap, a stumbling block and a retribution for them.

ibani_text: Nna tọ́rụ́pụụ́ sị nnị ine nyẹ́arịbịgha ḅara; mịẹsị nna kuku n dama nna iku ḅụḅáláḅálá súghúbie ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa.
english_text: May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever.”

ibani_text: A sima gbilam: Juuapụ ma nyẹ nna ḅụọ daa sa, nnị ine mịnị saghịbịgha ḅara pa bịghị? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori! Kụ́ma nna siiamịẹnyẹ gosi, dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ḅo Juughapụ ḅara lámam, sị n mịẹsị Juuapụ nyẹ́mọ́ni.
english_text: Again I ask: Did they stumble so as to fall beyond recovery? Not at all! Rather, because of their transgression, salvation has come to the Gentiles to make Israel envious.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ nna siiamịẹnyẹ ma opu karịiḅi akuo tuminikiri pịrịm nna faá opu karịiḅi akuo Juughaapụ pịrịm. Anịsa karịibima ma anị dụḅa tọrọ́ láa bẹ Juuapụ ma kịẹbịpị ma káara sa!
english_text: But if their transgression means riches for the world, and their loss means riches for the Gentiles, how much greater riches will their full inclusion bring!

ibani_text: A ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ pịrịarị ọmịnị Juughapụ: ịrị ma Juughaapụ ma nfịrịmaḅọ ḅara ma, a ị́yẹ́ fịrị pa bịpịkpọm,
english_text: I am talking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I take pride in my ministry

ibani_text: dighidighigha a ine ị́yẹ́ jẹ́ Juuapụ mịẹsị nnị nyẹ́mọ́ni, si anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma.
english_text: in the hope that I may somehow arouse my own people to envy and save some of them.

ibani_text: Tamuno n sịghị sa, tuminikiriapụ mamgba Tamuno iruonaapụ ḅụ fịnịapụ pịghị ḅo ori nángwọ́apụ sọm, anị tọ́rọ́ pa fịnị bẹ anịsa, nnị n daakị sa? Anị fịnị bẹ ḅara anịị fịị ḅụ saghị sị dumaapụ.
english_text: For if their rejection brought reconciliation to the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ parị fịtúrú mpara ma n pa Tamuno pịrịm, anịsa fịturu kpo gbọrụ ma onyẹẹ; ḅọ́rọ́ sị kune ma n pa Tamuno pịrịm, sị ḅara ma pịghị onyẹẹ.
english_text: If the part of the dough offered as firstfruits is holy, then the whole batch is holy; if the root is holy, so are the branches.

ibani_text: Nnị dipi olivu ma ḅụ n jẹa sị ḅara anyịmasim, n warị owi olivu sị ḅara pa anị na ḅọlọ gboloma. Ọmịnị Juughaapụ ma ọmịnị owi olivu sị ḅara ma kịkam, ọ warị mị́sa saghị Juuapụ tẹ́mẹ́ju ibi fị́nyẹ ma fịarị.
english_text: If some of the branches have been broken off, and you, though a wild olive shoot, have been grafted in among the others and now share in the nourishing sap from the olive root,

ibani_text: Anịgo nnị ányịmasi sị ḅara ma dighisima ma, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ mịẹmịẹ mịma pa biekóróma, ọmịnị kune ma ọlọsẹmagha kụ́ma kune ma anịị ọmịnị ọlọsẹma nyẹ.
english_text: do not consider yourself to be superior to those other branches. If you do, consider this: You do not support the root, but the root supports you.

ibani_text: Anịsa ọ dọghụbẹm ḅẹẹ, Nnị sị ḅara ma anyịmasim sị nnị i suma suú bẹ ḅara.
english_text: You will say then, “Branches were broken off so that I could be grafted in.”

ibani_text: Mịma karakárányẹ. Nnị nna anyịmasim nnị mininigha gosi, nnị warị ọ pa nna kiri ḅụ warị, ọ mininim gosi. Kụ́ma anịma pa bịpịkpọ ma; anịmanakaragha ḅáláfaa.
english_text: Granted. But they were broken off because of unbelief, and you stand by faith. Do not be arrogant, but tremble.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno papa Juuapụ ma warịsogha karakárá sị ḅara fịnị ḅara fịnịapụ, ọ papa ọ warịsobịgha.
english_text: For if God did not spare the natural branches, he will not spare you either.

ibani_text: Mịnga wamịnị arịm Tamuno ma ibi láa ḅara na pịghị ori ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kụ́rọ ḅara. Ori ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kụrọm bịghịmaapụ ma ḅụ, kụ́ma ibim ọ fịnị angaá, ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị ori ibi ma ḅụ sẹ toruku muu. Kụ́ma ọmịnị ọkọ mịẹgha mịẹgha, ọmịnị sọ nnị ọmịnị ányịmásibẹm.
english_text: Consider therefore the kindness and sternness of God: sternness to those who fell, but kindness to you, provided that you continue in his kindness. Otherwise, you also will be cut off.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ ma nna mininigha ọlọ tórúku mugha mugha, nnị n sima n pa warịbẹm nna fịnịkiri; tegó Tamuno ine anị mịẹbẹm.
english_text: And if they do not persist in unbelief, they will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Juughaapụ ma fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ányịmasii owi olivu sị ḅara, warị nyẹ́ dipi ólóghó na kuragha ḅụ anị pa karakárá olivu sị ḅụ pẹ́lẹ́suú. Juuapụ ma fịnị ḅára sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị dipi olivu sị ma, anị opuma Tamuno ḅụ sárásárábẹm nnị anyịma sị ḅara ma pa anị ngá sị ḅụ sima pẹ́lẹ́suú.
english_text: After all, if you were cut out of an olive tree that is wild by nature, and contrary to nature were grafted into a cultivated olive tree, how much more readily will these, the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree!

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅọghu tụ́manyẹ imi, a dọghụnyẹ sị o nimi ị́yẹ́ amịnáapụ, anị minibịgha ọ kọ́rọ́ma ọmịna nyẹ́nimi láa ḅara. Mịị Izirẹlị kụrọ kúkúbie ma fịnị mú kunema láabịgha, kụ́ma anị fịnịbẹm ákị mú Juughaapụ ma kịẹbịpị Tamuno damaḅo bẹapụ kara sa láa.
english_text: I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brothers and sisters, so that you may not be conceited: Israel has experienced a hardening in part until the full number of the Gentiles has come in,

ibani_text: Mịị anịị Izirẹlịapụ mamgba dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná bẹ ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ ḅara: Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ ma Zayọn ḅụ saghị ḅobẹm; warị siiamịẹnyẹ sịịbẹm Jekọpụ furoawọ ḅụ.
english_text: and in this wayall Israel will be saved. As it is written: “The deliverer will come from Zion; he will turn godlessness away from Jacob.

ibani_text: A nnị na mịị ọḅọọ ma fị́ị́bẹm a nna sii siakịị sa.
english_text: And this ismy covenant with them when I take away their sins.”

ibani_text: Nnị ibi oku ma sịghịm gosi, Juuapụ ma nnị Tamuno iruonaapụ sọmam Juughaapụ ma gosi. Kụ́ma Tamuno ma ori nyẹ sẹ́lẹ́akị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ori nángwọ́apụ nna tádọ́apụ osii.
english_text: As far as the gospel is concerned, they are enemies for your sake; but as far as election is concerned, they are loved on account of the patriarchs,

ibani_text: Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ dima dimagha ọ sẹlẹakiarị ḅọ na ọ karịibimaarịḅọ.
english_text: for God’s gifts and his call are irrevocable.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Juughaapụ, ọ Tamuno bịpị puughugha parị sa, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyanaḅomam tegó Juuapụ ma bịpị puughugha gosi.
english_text: Just as you who were at one time disobedient to God have now received mercy as a result of their disobedience,

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọ nyanamaá lolomakúkúbie gosi, Juuapụ ma mị́sa Tamuno bịpị pughugha, nnị sọ ine mị́sa Tamuno lolomakúkúbie nyánáḅọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: so they too have now become disobedient in order that they too may nowreceive mercy as a result of God’s mercy to you.

ibani_text: Tamuno túminị́ mamgba mịẹm nnị bịpị pughugha ikólinaapụ sọ, sị ọ lolomakúkúbie nyáná kị́nị́mamgba pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: For God has bound everyone over to disobedience so that he may have mercy on them all.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine Tamuno ngọ dụḅa láa ḅara nimiḅobịgha, Ori opu níminyẹ na ori níminyẹ pịghị opuma dụḅam! Tụọ ine nimi bẹ Tamuno kóróma fịnị ḅara? Tụọ ine ori nyẹ́ mịẹ ḅara nimiḅọ bẹ?
english_text: Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom andknowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments, and his paths beyond tracing out!

ibani_text: Nnị gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie: Tụọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma kúkúbie fịnịnyẹ nimi? Tụọ ine againma pa ọ pịrịbẹ?
english_text: “Who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor?”

ibani_text: Tụọ jẹ́ éné nyẹ pa Tamuno pịrịma, ori anị ḅụ sima n ḅọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ ḅẹ nyẹ?
english_text: “Who has ever given to God, that God should repay them?”

ibani_text: Tegó Ori nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹmẹm, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dumam pịghị duma ọ pịrịm. Boma fịnị Tamuno ma pịrị ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa! Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be the glory forever! Amen.

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị, mịnaapụ, Tamuno ma nyáná wa pịrị opu lolomakúkúbie gosi, a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ pa duma igwagwaá Tamuno pịrị, n fófóoma ori fịrị pịrịnyẹ na pịghị ọ ḅẹlẹma nyẹ. Mịma anịị ọmịnị pa ọ pịrịbẹ tụ́ma susi.
english_text: Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God’s mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.

ibani_text: Mịnị tuminikiriapụ dua nnị nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹma, kụ́ma wárịso Tamuno biebẹ ọ dima, anịị káara ḅara pa ọmịna kúkúbie dima. Anịsa, o nimibẹm Tamuno ma tọ́nyẹ, ibi nyẹẹ, ọḅụ ḅẹ́lẹ́nyẹ pịghị kpain nyẹ.
english_text: Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pa die i pịrịnyẹ gosi, a dugho ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịarị ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ kóróma ma ḅẹ́ n ḅọ opuma duḅamam, n ḅọ ọkọ fịnịgha sa, anịmanakaragha ḅụsímínímá ị́yẹ́ kóróma ḅụ, pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ịḅụ pịrị Tamuno ma pa ị pịrị minini láa ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: For by the grace given me I say to every one of you: Do not think of yourself more highly than you ought, but rather think of yourself with sober judgment, in accordance with the faith God has distributed to each of you.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ oju nyanam oju ma pịghị mụmbụ mụmbụ nyanam, mụmbụ mụmbụ ma pịghị nna kịrịkị́rị́ fịrị nyanam.
english_text: For just as each of us has one body with many members, and these members do not all have the same function,

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ, wamịnị mánámánáapụ, kụ́ma wamịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ imii Krais bie, wa jụghọ jụghọ na ḅolom, gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ma mụmbụ mụmbụ ḅụ.
english_text: so in Christ we, though many, form one body, and each member belongs to all the others.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n ḅọ nyáná dienyẹ ma pa fịrịnwangị, Tamuno ma ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pa n pịrịnyẹ. Tumḅọ dienyẹ ḅọ́rọ́ ikiakoro, ikiakoro ị́yẹ́ minini láa ḅara.
english_text: We have different gifts, according to the grace given to each of us. If your gift is prophesying, then prophesy in accordance with yourfaith;

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ pa fịrịnwangị, n ḅọ fịrịnwangịị, ḅọ́rọ́ pa nyẹ́die n ḅọ nyẹ́die;
english_text: if it is serving, then serve; if it is teaching, then teach;

ibani_text: ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọma, n ḅọ ọkọ mịẹ. Nyẹ die jẹapụ pịrịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅara findi ma pịrị, ḅọ́rọ́ sịbịdá anị ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ i Tẹ́mẹ́ mamgba pa anị mịẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ lolomakúkúbie bieḅẹlẹ pa anị mịẹ.
english_text: if it is to encourage, then give encouragement; if it is giving, then give generously; if it is to lead,do it diligently; if it is to show mercy, do it cheerfully.

ibani_text: Karakárá ḅẹlẹma nyáná, siinyẹ ḅẹlẹmama, ibinyẹ ma ọlọ sẹ maá.
english_text: Love must be sincere. Hate what is evil; cling to what is good.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnaapụ ḅara pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma, osigha pa jụghọ jụghọ pịrị ọ́ ḅụ nẹ́ngịma.
english_text: Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ faá mịẹma, kụ́ma ịnyọ pa fịrịnwangịị. Ị tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa fịrịnwangị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: Never be lacking in zeal, but keep your spiritual fervor, serving the Lord.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ịbieḅẹ́lẹ́ma, ingịrịma nyáná ị́yẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá mamgba ḅụ, tẹ́ghẹ̄ sámámgba ḅụ.
english_text: Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer.

ibani_text: Ị nyánányẹ pa nyẹ́ḅụ kụ́rọ mịnaapụ ma na die, pịghị ḅụ́pọ́ findi igoniapụ pịrị.
english_text: Share with the Lord’s people who are in need. Practice hospitality.

ibani_text: Tamuno ḅara bii ḅẹ́ ori ị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarịapụ ma karịibima, bii ori nnị karịibima, sị ori nnị gbo ma.
english_text: Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.

ibani_text: Bieḅẹlẹ́arịpụ dua bieḅẹlẹ, owuarịapụ dua owuú.
english_text: Rejoice with those who rejoice; mourn with those who mourn.

ibani_text: Diin ḅụ kị́nị́mamgba na ngaa. Opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹma, kụ́ma mịẹkụ oforiapụ ma na nangwọ mịẹ. Nyẹ́nimiḅọ ḅara pa ịḅụ arịma.
english_text: Live in harmony with one another. Do not be proud, but be willing to associate with people of low position.Do not be conceited.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ ị mịẹ irimam, irima nyẹ pa n ḅọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ ma. Arịị ḅẹẹ, ị karakárányẹ ma mịẹm kị́nị́mamgba toruku.
english_text: Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everyone.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị kị́nị́mamgba na diin ḅụ fịnịị.
english_text: If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.

ibani_text: Súghúbima, ị́yẹ́ nangwọapụ, kuma wárịso Tamuno ma igani anị mịẹ, n gịẹ kóróma ḅara tọ́ndiri ma bie, Súghúbi inyee, a nna gbẹfịnyẹ pa pịrịbẹm, anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dugho ḅara.
english_text: Do not take revenge, my dear friends, but leave room for God’s wrath, for it is written: “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,”says the Lord.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha, Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅuru ị́yẹ́ iruonaḅọ tarịarị, fị́nyẹ pa ọ pịrị fịị; Ḅọ́rọ́ ọ pụghọ sámụ́nọ́m, nyẹ pa ọ pịrị ḅuu; Ị mịma mịẹarị sa, ị dọghụarị anyị mgbọ́lụ pa ọ sịbị gbánāarị.
english_text: On the contrary: “If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head.”

ibani_text: Minima siiamịẹnyẹ ị sọ́ḅa, anịmanakaragha ibi pa siinyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

ibani_text: Fịnịḅọ fịnịḅọ táarịapụ ma bịpị pughu, tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine taá kụrọ ma nyánábịgha ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno anị pa n ḅọ pịrịgha, pịghị mị́sa táarịapụ ma Tamuno anịị nnị pa anị kiri ma ḅụ kóróma ḅọ.
english_text: Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God.

ibani_text: Anịgosi táarị kụrọ ma osigha ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, Tamuno tọ kórómanyẹ osigha, ọkọ mịẹḅọ Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ akuoo n ḅọ ḅụ pịrịarị.
english_text: Consequently, whoever rebels against the authority is rebelling against what God has instituted, and those who do so will bring judgment on themselves.

ibani_text: Táarịapụ ḅáláfanyẹ́ dighi karakárányẹ ma mịẹarịapụ pịrịgha, kụ́ma irima nyẹ ma mịẹarịapụ. Ị dọghụ ḅẹẹ, ị ịḅụ fọ́nyá pághámaḅo táarịḅọ ma ḅáláfa ḅarabie? Anịsa karakárányẹ ma mịẹ, n pịghị ị túmíníbẹm.
english_text: For rulers hold no terror for those who do right, but for those who do wrong. Do you want to be free from fear of the one in authority? Then do what is right and you will be commended.

ibani_text: Tegó nnị ma anịị Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ ị́yẹ́ ibi go. Kụ́ma ị siinyẹ mịẹmịẹ á tegó nnị papa áláápụ́-ágidi ma dighigha. Nnị anịị Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹapụ pa tọ́rụ́siarịma.
english_text: For the one in authority is God’s servant for your good. But if you do wrong, be afraid, for rulers do not bear the sword for no reason. They are God’s servants, agents of wrath to bring punishment on the wrongdoer.

ibani_text: Anịgo anị ḅụ́gbẹm ị ḅụsímínímá táarịapụ ma pịrị, Tamuno ma ḅara saghị ḅo bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị ngéréghaa kụ́ma ị kúkúbie ịḅụ na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ gosi.
english_text: Therefore, it is necessary to submit to the authorities, not only because of possible punishment but also as a matter of conscience.

ibani_text: Mịma go anịị o go ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ́arị nyẹ, tegó táarịapụ ma nnị anịị Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ, nna sa mamgba pa taa fịrị ma pịrịmáapụ.
english_text: This is also why you pay taxes, for the authorities are God’s servants, who give their full time to governing.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅara ịrị ọlọnyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄; ị ḅárákū ósó igbii na ị́yẹ́ ngọ ósó igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄, osigha na kuu pa nnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrị.
english_text: Give to everyone what you owe them: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅara sọ sáá ọlọ ma, ọmịnị ọlọ sáá anịị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma toruku mú. Jẹ́apụ ḅẹlẹmaapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹmam.
english_text: Let no debt remain outstanding, except the continuing debt to love one another, for whoever loves others has fulfilled the law.

ibani_text: Ólóghó bịpị ma, dughonyẹ ḅẹ́, Amadọghụ ma, Kị́nị́ ḅáama, Fúrúma, Jụghọ nyẹ mọnịma, mịị mamgba na pịghị jẹ́ jẹ́ na n pa sua gbolomam mịị gbẹ́rẹ́ ólóghó bịpị ma ḅụ, Ị jẹa tumḅọ ḅẹlẹma ịrị ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara.
english_text: The commandments, “You shall not commit adultery,” “You shall not murder,” “You shall not steal,” “You shall not covet,”and whatever other command there may be, are summed up in this one command: “Love your neighbor as yourself.”

ibani_text: I ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ḅẹlẹma jẹ́ ene jẹ́ ene ị siinyẹ pa n ḅọ mịẹbịgha, kị́nị́ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị ḅọ, ólóghó mamgba kokomam.
english_text: Love does no harm to a neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.

ibani_text: Ọ mịma mịẹnyanam, tegó ọ nimim ḅẹẹ, sa ma láamam ọ múno ḅụ saghị, tegó wámịna dụaḅọ́rọ́ma anị kikiaḅaá wa parị minini sa nẹngịm.
english_text: And do this, understanding the present time: The hour has already come for you to wake up from your slumber, because our salvation is nearer now than when we first believed.

ibani_text: Díi ma ḅọlọ ju lámam, énéḅa ḅárákúu imi, anịgo o ḅo wa kánákáná fịrị ma pa angaá ḅọ́rọ́ma sị warị baá ọ́mụ́gbinyẹ ma ákị sua.
english_text: The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.
