ibani_text: O ḅo wa karakárá ḅara pa wámịna duma kọọ, éné bie baá ḅụ duma kọọarịapụ ḅara, fị na ḅụ na ḅugha anịgha iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ḅáma, sẹfị duma anịgha yáakuu ḅụ ófórigha nwángị, bịpị ogbosogha na tọ́rụ́akụ,
english_text: Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma bịtẹ sua ḅara Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ma sua si mịnị sịbịbie kiẹma ị ḅara warị ojumẹnị ma biiarị siinyẹ pa anị pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: Rather, clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not think about how to gratify the desires of the flesh.

ibani_text: Ori minini kụrọghaḅọ ma daá ḅụ pịrị, kụ́ma ori na nyẹ nụná ma ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ na ọ mịẹbịgha nyẹ.
english_text: Accept the one whose faith is weak, without quarreling over disputable matters.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ minini nḅọ warisom nḅọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fị, kụ́ma amịna minini kụrọghaḅọ pẹdiri ngéré pẹm.
english_text: One person’s faith allows them to eat anything, but another, whose faith is weak, eats only vegetables.

ibani_text: Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịarịḅọ nyẹ sẹ́lẹ́ḅọ dighi álịmáma, pẹdiri ngéré pẹ́arịḅọ sọ pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ pẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pẹ́arịḅọ sịbị; tegó Tamuno n ḅọ daa ákịmam.
english_text: The one who eats everything must not treat with contempt the one who does not, and the one who does not eat everything must not judge the one who does, for God has accepted them.

ibani_text: Ịrị tụọ jụghọ fịrịnwangịḅọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị ḅo? Ómóniḅọ ma nyánáḅọ anịị ine dugho bẹḅọ ḅọ́rọ́ ori fịrịnwangịḅọ ibifịrị nwángị anịgha o sii fịrịnwangị nwángịị. Nnị ibifịrị nwángịbẹm tegó Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ine mịẹbẹm sị nnị ibifịrị nwángị.
english_text: Who are you to judge someone else’s servant? To their own master, servants stand or fall. And they will stand, for the Lord is able to make them stand.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ákịm ori tọ́ntọ́ éné, jẹ́ owitụ́wọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ákịm. Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ine dugho amịna ḅụ pịrịbẹm, mịma anị karakárányẹ ma.
english_text: One person considers one day more sacred than another; another considers every day alike. Each of them should be fully convinced in their own mind.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ákịḅọ ḅẹ́ anị éné ma éné mamgba nẹngịm, ọkọ mịẹm pa kuu pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrị, n ḅọ árịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fị ḅọ, ọkọ mịẹm pa kuu pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrị, tegó nnị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ma pịrịm fị́nyẹ ma gosi. Mini jẹa fị́nyẹ fịghaapụ ọkọ mịẹm pa kuu pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị, sị pịghị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ma ḅẹẹ.
english_text: Whoever regards one day as special does so to the Lord. Whoever eats meat does so to the Lord, for they give thanks to God; and whoever abstains does so to the Lord and gives thanks to God.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ duma n ḅọ ḅụ ngéré pịrịgha, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ fịị n ḅọ ḅụ ngéré pịrịgha.
english_text: For none of us lives for ourselves alone, and none of us dies for ourselves alone.

ibani_text: Wa duma duma wa duma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrịm, wa fịịfịị, wa fịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrịm. Anịgo, ḅọ́rọ́ wa duma o wa fịị o, wamịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nyẹẹ.
english_text: If we live, we live for the Lord; and if we die, we die for the Lord. So, whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.

ibani_text: Mịma ẹrẹ́sị anịị Krais go fịịnyẹ sị pịghị saghị duma ḅụ, ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sọ duma na fịịapụ ma pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: For this very reason, Christ died and returned to life so that he might be the Lord of both the dead and the living.

ibani_text: Ịrị anịsa, pẹdiri ngéré pẹ́arịḅọ, ị tegó ḅẹ́rẹ́kọpẹlẹ ị mị́naḅọ sịbị? Ịrị árịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịarịḅọ ị tegó ị́yẹ́ jẹ́ mịnaapụ dighialịmaarị? Wamịnị Kị́nị́mamgba Tamuno tórúku ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ḅụ sẹ́bẹm.
english_text: You, then, why do you judge your brother or sister? Or why do you treat them with contempt? For we will all stand before God’s judgment seat.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ ḅara: A dumafịnị ḅara ma, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọkọ dughom, ḅụ́ọ́sịbị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i toruku ẹkpẹrẹkịbẹm; ḅẹ́lẹ̄ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dugho pághámabẹm ḅẹ́ Irị Tamuno.
english_text: It is written: “ ‘As surely as I live,’ says the Lord, ‘every knee will bow before me; every tongue will acknowledge God.’ ”

ibani_text: Anịgo, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba wámịna bịpị dugho Tamuno pịrịbẹm n ḅọ mịẹnyẹ, nḅọ pịghị go anị mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: So then, each of us will give an account of ourselves to God.

ibani_text: Anịgo, o ḅoo wa jụghọ jụghọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọpẹlẹ ma sẹ́ma. Anịmanakaragha ị kúkúbie mịẹ karakáráma ḅẹ́, ị nyẹ mịẹbịgha mị́naḅọ bịghịma bẹnyẹ anịgha mịẹsị nḅọ siinyẹ bie sọ.
english_text: Therefore let us stop passing judgment on one another. Instead, make up your mind not to put any stumbling block or obstacle in the way of a brother or sister.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs ma asọduaḅọ ḅara, a ibi ma mininim ḅẹ́ anị ḅụ na kị́nị́ pilemaarị fị́nyẹ ofori; kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ minini minini ḅẹ́ jẹa fị́nyẹ imi kị́nị́ pịlemaarị nyẹ, anịsa anị fị́nyẹ ma warị ḅo kị́nị́ pịlema fị́nyẹ sọ anịḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: I am convinced, being fully persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, then for that person it is unclean.

ibani_text: Ị nyẹ pa ị mị́naḅọ lama ị fị́fị́nyẹ gosi, anịsa ị mịnị ḅẹlẹma ḅụ nyẹ́miẹgha. Minima sị ị fịarị fị́nyẹ gosi Krais sịbị go fịịḅọ ma ịrị nḅọ guluguluma.
english_text: If your brother or sister is distressed because of what you eat, you are no longer acting in love. Do not by your eating destroy someone for whom Christ died.

ibani_text: Minima ịrị ibi go mịẹnyẹ, n si ẹ́rẹ́ pa anị sịị.
english_text: Therefore do not let what you know is good be spoken of as evil.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma kọnsịn ma fị na ḅụ na ḅụghaa, kụ́ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ, diin ḅụ, na bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking, but of righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Túminị́ mị ḅara pa fịrịnwangị Krais pịrị sa, n Tamuno mịẹm o bieḅẹlẹ túminị́ pịghị ḅara pụ́nụ́ anị pịrị.
english_text: because anyone who serves Christ in this way is pleasing to God and receives human approval.

ibani_text: Anịma go, wamịnị wámịna ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị diin akuo bẹnyẹ ma mịẹ, pịghị jụghọ jụghọ kụrọma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Let us therefore make every effort to do what leads to peace and to mutual edification.

ibani_text: Mịnị ma sị ị́yẹ́ fị́nyẹ gosi Tamuno nwángịmáa fịrị ma guluguluma. Tumḅọ ine fị́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịbẹm, kụ́ma anị karakáragha ḅẹ́ tumḅọ fị́nyẹ fịị mịẹbẹnyẹ sị jụghọ bịghị siinyẹ bie sọ.
english_text: Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All food is clean, but it is wrong for a person to eat anything that causes someone else to stumble.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ mịẹbẹ karakárányẹ anịị n ḅọ nama pẹẹ́bịgha, iru ḅubịgha, anịgha bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹsị amịna mịnaapụ bịghị siinyẹ bie sọ.
english_text: It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else that will cause your brother or sister to fall.

ibani_text: I minini nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịnanyẹ ma gbolomanyẹ pa ịrị na Tamuno ogboku wárii. Karịiḅi fịnịị ọ pịrị amịna tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ sịrị pa pịrịghaḅọ, anị n ḅọ árị sị mịẹnyẹ ḅẹ́ karakáram.
english_text: So whatever you believe about these things keep between yourself and God. Blessed is the one who does not condemn himself by what he approves.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ nḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹm nḅọ fị́fị́nyẹ ḅụ, Tamuno ọ sịbị sii ḅẹ́rẹ́kọpẹlẹm ori anị fị sa, tegó ọ mịẹnyẹ ma minini ḅugha. Minini ḅụ tumḅọ mịẹgha nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sii nyẹẹ.
english_text: But whoever has doubts is condemned if they eat, because their eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come from faith is sin.

ibani_text: Wamịnị kụ́rọ sẹapụ wámịna minini ḅụ ḅárásua nna minini kụrọghaapụ ma pịrị na ibim sị nna ikúnyẹ ma dighi. Wamịnị wámịna bie ngéré mịẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabịgha.
english_text: We who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak and not to please ourselves.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna mị́naḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma bẹnyẹ mịẹ nna ibi ḅụ, mịẹsị n sẹ́nịbẹnyẹ minini ḅụ.
english_text: Each of us should please our neighbors for their good, to build them up.

ibani_text: Krais ọ ḅụ go ọ mịẹnyẹ mịẹgha o bieḅẹlẹ bẹ ḅará, anịmanakaragha, n gịẹ kóróma ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie, O wiriapụ ma pa o wiri wirinumo ma ịḅụ ọgọnọ saramam.
english_text: For even Christ did not please himself but, as it is written: “The insults of those who insult you have fallen on me.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa sa n gịẹnyẹ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n gịẹm pa nyẹ pa wa die bẹ ḅara, sị wamịnị tọ́ndiri ma bie saghị ḅo inema na tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ, wamịnị ine tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For everything that was written in the past was written to teach us, so that through the endurance taught in the Scriptures and the encouragement they provide we might have hope.

ibani_text: A Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ́arị ingịrịma na tẹ́mẹ́kụrọ ḅára saghị ḅoarịḅọ mịẹsị ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ bịpịfie ọ Krais Jizọs ma duarị ḅara,
english_text: May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you the same attitude of mind toward each other that Christ Jesus had,

ibani_text: sị ọmịnị ine gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́bie na gbẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ pa Tamuno ma túminị́, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais Daá ma.
english_text: so that with one mind and one voice you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Ọ jụghọ jụghọ daakị, Krais ma sọ anịsa ọ daákịmaá ḅara sị túminị́ Tamuno ma túmíní.
english_text: Accept one another, then, just as Christ accepted you, in order to bring praise to God.

ibani_text: A dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Krais o Juuapụ ómóniḅọ dighimam Tamuno karakáráma ḅụ, pa die ḅẹẹ, o minini nna tádọ́apụ ma pịrịnyẹ ori anị mịẹbẹm.
english_text: For I tell you that Christ has become a servant of the Jewson behalf of God’s truth, so that the promises made to the patriarchs might be confirmed

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma Tamuno ma túmíní bẹ ḅara ori lolomakúkúbie gosi, Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ ḅara: Anịgosi a ị túmíníbẹm Juughaapụ ma ogbobie; A núme suu pa ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ túmíníbẹm.
english_text: and, moreover, that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy. As it is written: “Therefore I will praise you among the Gentiles; I will sing the praises of your name.”

ibani_text: Anị pịghị jẹ́ pa dughom, Ọmịnị Juughaapụ, ọmịnị Tamuno túminị́ na dụrụkụụ.
english_text: Again, it says, “Rejoice, you Gentiles, with his people.”

ibani_text: Pịghị jẹ́, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma túmíní ọmịnị Juughaapụ mamgba, si pịghị núme suu o túmíní, ọmịnị sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: And again, “Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles; let all the peoples extol him.”

ibani_text: Aizaya pịghị jẹ́ pa dughom, Jesi furotụ́wọ págháḅobẹm, Saghị sị sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ma taá bẹḅọ; Juughaapụ ma ọ ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánabẹm.
english_text: And again, Isaiah says, “The Root of Jesse will spring up, one who will arise to rule over the nations; in him the Gentiles will hope.”

ibani_text: A tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅẹ́, Tamuno ma, tọ́rụ́dighi nyẹ ḅara saghị ḅoḅọ opu bieḅẹlẹ na diin pa ọ pịrị, ọmịnị ọ ḅụ nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sị ọmịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ sẹnị tórúku tórúku mú Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụrọ ḅụ.
english_text: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: I jẹa minini mịnaapụ, ịrị ịḅụgḅọrụ mininim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị opuma ibim, ọ pịghị níminyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyanam, ọ pịghị ine nyẹ pa jụghọ jụghọ diebẹm.
english_text: I myself am convinced, my brothers and sisters, that you yourselves are full of goodness, filled with knowledge and competent to instruct one another.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma bie a ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa jẹa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sịbị kọmam, pa sima anị pa ọmịna biekóróma. Tamuno nyáná i pịrị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ gosi, a ḅáláfá nyánágha
english_text: Yet I have written you quite boldly on some points to remind you of them again, because of the grace God gave me

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ a Krais Jizọs fịrịnwangịḅọ sọọ Juughaapụ ma pịrị sị Tamuno ma igwagwaḅọ ḅara a Tamuno ma ibi oku dugho wásámaarị, Juughaapụ ma warị ḅo Tamuno daakị bẹ agba sọ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ fófóoma ọ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles. He gave me the priestly duty of proclaiming the gospel of God, so that the Gentiles might become an offering acceptable to God, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: A Krais Jizọs na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ fịnị ḅara ma, a ine bịpịkpọ ị́yẹ́ Tamuno fịrị ma pịrịm.
english_text: Therefore I glory in Christ Jesus in my service to God.

ibani_text: A bịpị findi jẹ́nyẹ gobịgha, kụ́ma Krais i pa nwángịmáa fịrị ngéré gbólómanyẹ anịị a dugho bẹnyẹ, anịị asọ pa Juughaapụ ma die ḅẹ́ nnị Tamuno ma osii. A mịma mịẹmam ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị fịrị ḅara ḅụ,
english_text: I will not venture to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me in leading the Gentiles to obey God by what I have said and done—

ibani_text: kụ́rọ ilíghíma na ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Jerusalem ákị mú Ilirikum párángáa mamgba láa, a bii ḅara pa Krais ma ibi oku ma dugho wásámāmam.
english_text: by the power of signs and wonders, through the power of the Spirit of God. So from Jerusalem all the way around to Illyricum, I have fully proclaimed the gospel of Christ.

ibani_text: I pụghọ tarị sị a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ anịị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma jẹ́ éné na nnị Krais gbolomanyẹ naagha angaá, sị a jụghọ súghúise angaá námabịgha ḅara.
english_text: It has always been my ambition to preach the gospel where Christ was not known, so that I would not be building on someone else’s foundation.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara: Nnị o gbolomanyẹ dugho pịrịghaapụ árịbẹm, na o gbolomanyẹ naaghaapụ akanyaḅobẹm.
english_text: Rather, as it is written: “Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi, tọgha sa nnị i kikimam sị a ọ damaḅo ma.
english_text: This is why I have often been hindered from coming to you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa a ị́yẹ́ fịrị nwangisómaá ḅara ma mịị párángáa, a pịghị ḅọ́rọ́maa tọgha kụ́rá ḅụ dọghụmam ḅẹ́ a ḅo ọmịna arịị
english_text: But now that there is no more place for me to work in these regions, and since I have been longing for many years to visit you,

ibani_text: mị́sa a ọkọ mịẹbẹm. A dọghụbẹm a ọmịnị arịị a ḅọ́rọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ Spaini múuarị sa, a pịghị dọghụbẹm ọ ḅárásua ị pịrị sị a ine mú anị ngá ma láa, mịma anịị a kálá sa pa ọmịnị na fịnị fama sa.
english_text: I plan to do so when I go to Spain. I hope to see you while passing through and to have you assist me on my journey there, after I have enjoyed your company for a while.

ibani_text: Mịị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri anị fịnị ḅara, a Jerusalem muarị si a ḅárásua akuoo Tamuno túminị́ ma pịrịbẹ ḅara anị ngá.
english_text: Now, however, I am on my way to Jerusalem in the service of the Lord’s people there.

ibani_text: Masidoniya na Akaya bie fịnị sọsị ma bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ nyẹ ósó pa ḅárásua Jerusalem bie fịnị sị minini igonyiapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: For Macedonia and Achaia were pleased to make a contribution for the poor among the Lord’s people in Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Nnị bieḅẹlẹ ḅụụ anị mịẹm, anịị nnị nna ḅara ọlọ sa. Ḅọ́rọ́ Juughaapụ ma Juuapụ ma tẹ́mẹ́ju karịibima ma ḅụ diekiri nyanam, nnị Juuapụ nna ḅara sa ọlọm sị nna tuminikiri ngọ pa nnị na die.
english_text: They were pleased to do it, and indeed they owe it to them. For if the Gentiles have shared in the Jews’ spiritual blessings, they owe it to the Jews to share with them their material blessings.

ibani_text: Mịị fịrị ma i ḅara faá sa a pịghị n sịbị go daa ḅo igbii ma saghị n ḅárabie sua fama sa, a ḅọ́rọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ Spaini mubẹm sị agbā túlúma o dighi.
english_text: So after I have completed this task and have made sure that they have received this contribution, I will go to Spain and visit you on the way.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹ́ a ḅo ọ fịnịnga láa sa a bifụfụ Krais karịibima na ḅobẹm.
english_text: I know that when I come to you, I will come in the full measure of the blessing of Christ.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ, a wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ẹ́rẹ́ na pịghị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịarị ḅẹlẹma pa ọ tẹ́ghẹm: ḅẹ́ ọ ḅárásua sị Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ kụrọma i sịbị go.
english_text: I urge you, brothers and sisters, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, to join me in my struggle by praying to God for me.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ ori i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma mininighaapụ ma ḅárabie Judiya bie, ḅẹẹ, Tamuno túminị́ Jerusalem ḅụ fịnịapụ ma a akuoo ḅárásua ma daákịbẹm.
english_text: Pray that I may be kept safe from the unbelievers in Judea and that the contribution I take to Jerusalem may be favorably received by the Lord’s people there,

ibani_text: Mịma gosi, a opu bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ ọ dámáḅobẹm, ḅọ́rọ́ anị Tamuno ma ḅụ ḅẹlẹḅẹlẹ, i bieḅẹlẹ bẹ ḅara sị ịnyọ́sárá.
english_text: so that I may come to you with joy, by God’s will, and in your company be refreshed.

ibani_text: A tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ Tamuno, diin pa wa pịrịarịḅọ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba na fịnịị. Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: The God of peace be with you all. Amen.

ibani_text: A wámịna mị́naḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ Fiibi, gbolomanyẹ dugho ọ pịrịarị, árị anịị Sẹnkiriya sọsị ma ḅụ fịrịnwangịarịḅọ.
english_text: I commend to you our sister Phoebe, a deaconof the church in Cenchreae.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị a daakị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ẹrẹ ḅụ, Tamuno túminị́ mịẹ na ibiḅara sị a bi ḅárásua gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa a pịrị, tegó a ḅárásua nyáná wámịna ḅụ tọghaapụ pịrịmam ịrịsọ nna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: I ask you to receive her in the Lord in a way worthy of his people and to give her any help she may need from you, for she has been the benefactor of many people, including me.

ibani_text: Pirisiliya na Akwila bii i pịrị, i jẹa fịrịnaapụ Krais Jizọs bie.
english_text: Greet Priscillaand Aquila, my co-workers in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Nnị nna duma balagha i sịbị go. Irị ngéréghaa kụ́ma Juughaapụ mamgba sọsị gbọrụ nnị dighi bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: They risked their lives for me. Not only I but all the churches of the Gentiles are grateful to them.

ibani_text: Nna warị dona dona sọsị ma bii i pịrị. Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ Epenitọs bii, Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ma ḅụ ori anị parị Krais ḅụ mininiḅọ.
english_text: Greet also the church that meets at their house. Greet my dear friend Epenetus, who was the first convert to Christ in the province of Asia.

ibani_text: Meri bii, opuma fịrịnwangị ọ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: Greet Mary, who worked very hard for you.

ibani_text: Andronikọs na Juniyas bii, i jẹa Juuapụ i nana ikólibie fịnị fịnịapụ. Nfịrịmaapụ ma ogbobie nnị ibima n nimim, nnị pịghị parị ịḅụ Krais asọ duam.
english_text: Greet Andronicus and Junia, my fellow Jews who have been in prison with me. They are outstanding amongthe apostles, and they were in Christ before I was.

ibani_text: Ampiliyatọsi bii, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie a ḅẹlẹma ḅọ.
english_text: Greet Ampliatus, my dear friend in the Lord.

ibani_text: Ubanusi sọ bii, wámịna jẹa fịrịnwangịḅọ Krais bie, na pịghị ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ Stasis.
english_text: Greet Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ, and my dear friend Stachys.

ibani_text: Apelesi bii, mị ḅọ ma diemam ori bịpị pughu láa ḅara Krais bie. Aristobulọsi wárịapụ bii i pịrị.
english_text: Greet Apelles, whose fidelity to Christ has stood the test. Greet those who belong to the household of Aristobulus.

ibani_text: Hẹrọdiọn i jẹa Juuḅọ bii. Na pịghị Krais asọ duaarịapụ Nasisọs wárịbie.
english_text: Greet Herodion, my fellow Jew. Greet those in the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.

ibani_text: Tịraifịna na Trifosa bii, opuma fịrịnwangị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ. Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ Pesis bii, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie opuma fịrịnwangịmaá jẹa ọ́rụ́ḅọ.
english_text: Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, those women who work hard in the Lord. Greet my dear friend Persis, another woman who has worked very hard in the Lord.

ibani_text: Rufọs bii i pịrị, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma sẹlẹakịḅọ, na pịghị o nyingi bii, pịghị nyingi sọ i pịrịmaá ọ́rụ́ḅọ,
english_text: Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother, who has been a mother to me, too.

ibani_text: Asinkiritọs na Fẹlịgọn na Hemisi na Patirobas na Hamas na pịghị nnị na fịnị Krais asọ duaarị mịnaapụ.
english_text: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas and the other brothers and sisters with them.

ibani_text: Fịlologọ na Juliya bii, Nẹrẹus na ọ mị́naḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ, Olimpas na aningáa nnị na fịnị Tamuno túminị́ mamgba.
english_text: Greet Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas and all the Lord’s people who are with them.

ibani_text: Ọ Krais ḅẹlẹma pa jụghọ jụghọ bii. Krais bie fịnị sọsị mamgba fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii.
english_text: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ send greetings.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ, a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́ ọ tọ́rụ́ pa puama dighiḅoarịapụ ma ḅụ gbánā, mininiapụ mịẹarịapụ sị n bịghị pighi asọ mgbẹsẹ dighiḅọ ọ dáwọ ḅomaá dienyẹ ma pịrịarịapụ. Ḅụ kile nna ḅụ!
english_text: I urge you, brothers and sisters, to watch out for those who cause divisions and put obstacles in your way that are contrary to the teaching you have learned. Keep away from them.

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ma mịẹarịapụ fịrịnwangị wámịna Nyánáḅọ Krais pịrịgha kụ́ma nna opu furo. Nna ḅẹ́lẹ̄ bịpị na túminị́ kombo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ nnị oḅori pa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nímighaapụ sịarị.
english_text: For such people are not serving our Lord Christ, but their own appetites. By smooth talk and flattery they deceive the minds of naive people.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba namam ọmịnị ibi oku ma ọlọ kụrọmamaá ḅara, anịgo a ị dighi bieḅẹlẹm. A dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ ọmịnị akanyaḅo nyáná ibinyẹ ma ḅụ kuma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nimi ma siinyẹ gboloma sa.
english_text: Everyone has heard about your obedience, so I rejoice because of you; but I want you to be wise about what is good, and innocent about what is evil.

ibani_text: Tamuno, wámịna diin ḅara saghị ḅoḅọ, ḅọlọgha sa Satanị nánga kọsịmabẹm ọmịna ḅụọ sughu. Wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọ nana fịnịị.
english_text: The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you.

ibani_text: Timoti ị jẹa fịrịnaḅọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii, Lusiyọs, Jasọn na Sosipata i jẹa Juuapụ sọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii.
english_text: Timothy, my co-worker, sends his greetings to you, as do Lucius, Jason and Sosipater, my fellow Jews.

ibani_text: Ịrị, Tẹtius, Pọl dughonyẹ ma gịẹ diri bie suaḅọ o biim Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie.
english_text: I, Tertius, who wrote down this letter, greet you in the Lord.

ibani_text: Gayọs, a ọ wárị ngáarị ḅo, sọsị ma sọ ọ wárịbie donaarị ḅọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii. Ẹratọs, ama igbii koko ḅọ na pịghị wámịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Kuatọs fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii. [
english_text: Gaius, whose hospitality I and the whole church here enjoy, sends you his greetings. Erastus, who is the city’s director of public works, and our brother Quartus send you their greetings.

ibani_text: Wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị mamgba na fịnịị.]
english_text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.

ibani_text: O ḅo wa Tamuno ma saghị sóghólóma, ori ine ọ mịẹ bẹḅọ sị ọ kụrọ sẹ ọmịna minini ḅụ, Jizọs Krais gboloma sị a dugho wásáma ibi oku ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, na pịghị nnị ḅọghuma karakáráma nnị ḅọghuma nyẹ ḅọlọ sáá ene ene, mị́sa nnị anị diepághámamam.
english_text: Now to him who is able to establish you in accordance with my gospel, the message I proclaim about Jesus Christ, in keeping with the revelation of the mystery hidden for long ages past,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa ikiakoroapụ ma gịẹ kórómanyẹ ma mịẹmam tọghaapụ ḅo karakáráma nimi, Gbámásó Tamuno ma pịghị bịpị pịrịmam ḅẹ́ sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị karakárá ma nimii si kị́nị́mamgba minini bẹ ḅara pịghị ọkọ mịẹ.
english_text: but now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings by the command of the eternal God, so that all the Gentiles might come to the obedience that comes fromfaith—

ibani_text: Boma fịnị ori Tamuno ma ngéré pịrị, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ níminyẹ nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ákị mú ḅẹsá láa. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: to the only wise God be glory forever through Jesus Christ! Amen.

ibani_text: Irị Pọl, anị Tamuno ma ḅụḅẹlẹ si ọ sịḅọ ḅẹẹ o ḅoo Krais Jizọs nfịrịmaḅọ sọọ, ịrị na wámịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Sostines mị diri ma fịrịmam,
english_text: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,

ibani_text: wa gịẹ pa ọmịnị Kọrịntị ḅụ fịnị Tamuno sọsị ma pịrịm. Tamuno ọ mịẹm sị o ḅo ori tọ́ntọ́apụ sọọ, Krais Jizọs ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọ pịghị mịẹ kị́nị́mamgba pịrị ḅara ngaa mamgba ḅụ, Krais Jizọs ẹrẹ ma sịapụ ḅẹ́ anị ẹ́rẹ́ ma nna Nyáná ḅo pịghị wámịna Nyánáḅọ:
english_text: To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be his holy people, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ—their Lord and ours:

ibani_text: Wámịna Dáḅọ Tamuno na pịghị Wányánáḅọ Jizọs Krais, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa i Tamuno ḅẹarị sámámgba, ọ nyáná ọ́ pịrị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ gosi Krais Jizọs ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: I always thank my God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ o ḅoo áláápụ́ sọmam, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị níminyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: For in him you have been enriched in every way—with all kinds of speech and with all knowledge—

ibani_text: Mịma diem ḅẹ́ ọ daakị Krais oku ma ọmịna bie kune nyanam.
english_text: God thus confirming our testimony about Christ among you.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ókụ́rụ́arị sáá ḅẹẹ Krais Jizọs ḅoo ọ ḅụ die, Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ pịrị dienyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ọ gbarịghaa.
english_text: Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị́ ọ mịẹbẹm bịpị ọ ḅụ laagha mú kunema láa, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais pịghịma ḅo bẹ éné.
english_text: He will also keep you firm to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Tamuno anịị ọ ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā na ibi ḅoo, Tamuno ori anịị ọ sịḅọ ḅẹẹ o ḅoo wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais, ọ Tụwọ na mịẹgbólóma nyáná.
english_text: God is faithful, who has called you into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

ibani_text: I jẹa mininiapụ a ọ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄m wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ḅụ ḅẹẹ ó gbẹ́rẹ́ bịpịfie si puama ọmịna ogboku bie fịnịbịgha ḅara. Ọ ḅụ pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ ọmịna kúkúbie na ọmịna kóróma ḅụ.
english_text: I appeal to you, brothers and sisters,in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another in what you say and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly united in mind and thought.

ibani_text: Jẹapụ, Kiloe wárịbieapụ nyẹ ḅọghughaa ḅara ḅụ dugho i pịrịm ḅẹẹ kamkoro ọmịna ogboku bie imi.
english_text: My brothers and sisters, some from Chloe’s household have informed me that there are quarrels among you.

ibani_text: Kúru a mị ḅara pa anị dugho; ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ jẹ́ kịrịnyẹ dughoarị. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dughoarị ḅẹẹ, N ḅo Pọl duarị, jụghọ dughoarị, Irị Apọlọs, jụghọ ḅẹẹm Irị a Pita duarị. Jụghọ pịghị ḅẹm, Irị a Krais duam.
english_text: What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas”; still another, “I follow Christ.”

ibani_text: Nnị Krais die ogbo ogbo ḅụ kóróma ma? Pọl anịị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ fịị ọ́ pịrịḅọ? Nnị Pọl ẹrẹ ḅụ mingi pa ọ́ sara?
english_text: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized in the name of Paul?

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ a mingi pa ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ saraghaa kụ́ma Krispus na Gayọs ngéré.
english_text: I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dughobịgha ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ḅụ mingi pa n ḅọ saram.
english_text: so no one can say that you were baptized in my name.

ibani_text: (Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ a mingi pa Stefanasi na ọ wárịapụ saram, anịma sima a sịgha ḅẹẹ a pịghị mingi pa jụghọ saram).
english_text: (Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don’t remember if I baptized anyone else.)

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Krais i fịrịmagha ḅẹẹ a ḅo mingi saraa kụ́ma ori i fịrịmam ḅẹẹ a ḅo ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa, tuminikiri opu nyẹ́nimiapụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa anị dugho wásámaghaa, sị arịị ḅẹẹ Krais fịị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ ḅoo kụrọ nyanagha nyẹ sọbịgha ḅara.
english_text: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel—not with wisdom and eloquence, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.

ibani_text: Krais fịị mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọ́gọ́nọ oku ma anị oḅori nyẹ sọm faarịapụ ma fịnị angaá, kụma wamịnị ḅọrọma nyánáarịapụ ma anịị Tamuno ma kụrọ.
english_text: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ, A opu nyẹ́nimiapụ níminyẹ ma gulugulumabẹm a pịghị opu dirinimiapụ opu níminyẹ ma pa papanyẹ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: For it is written: “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise; the intelligence of the intelligent I will frustrate.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa opu nyẹ́nimiapụ ma n tẹ́ angaá imii opu dirinimiapụ ma n tẹ́ angaá imii, mịị tuminikiri nyẹ gbilaapụ ma n tẹ́ angaá imii? Tamuno diemam ḅẹ́ mịị tuminikiri níminyẹ ma anị papa oḅori nyẹẹ!
english_text: Where is the wise person? Where is the teacher of the law? Where is the philosopher of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?

ibani_text: Tamuno ori opu nyẹ́nimi ḅụ mịẹm ḅẹ́ anị opuma ḅụdáa ḅẹ́ túminị́ nna níminyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ḅoo o nimi. Tụ́ma wa dugho wásámaarị oḅori oku ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno anị ọ ḅụḅẹlẹ ḅara ḅụ mininiapụ ma duaḅọ́rọ́mam.
english_text: For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.

ibani_text: Juuapụ ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ árị dọ́ghụm mịẹbẹnyẹ sị n mini, kụma Girikiapụ níminyẹ dọ́ghụm.
english_text: Jews demand signs and Greeks look for wisdom,

ibani_text: Wamịnị ma, wa n ḅaupálị Krais ma dugho wásámaarị, mị oku ma anị Juuapụ iganịmaarị, Juughaapụ ma anị nyẹ ḅụ oforighaa nyẹ sọm;
english_text: but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,

ibani_text: kụma Tamuno sịmáapụ ma, Juu na Juughaapụ mịị oku ma anịị Krais Tamuno ma kụrọ na pịghị Tamuno níminyẹ.
english_text: but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Tamuno mịẹsị oḅorisọ kịkanyẹ ma anịị tuminikiri opu níminyẹ nẹ́ngị tẹ́lẹ́mam, Ḅẹ́ pịghị Tamuno ịnyọ nyanagha nyẹ kịkanyẹ, kụrọ tuminikiri ịnyọ nyáná nẹngịm.
english_text: For the foolishness of God is wiser than human wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than human strength.

ibani_text: I jẹa mininiapụ a dọ́ghụm ḅẹẹ ọ́ pa biekóróma parị ọ́ fịnị ḅara Tamuno ma ọ́sị sáá. Tuminikiriapụ nyẹ arịarị ḅara ḅụ, tọghaapụ nyẹ́nimigha anịgha kụrọnyana anịgha pịghị opu kiri ḅụ imii.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth.

ibani_text: Tamuno tuminikiriapụ pa oḅorisọ sị nyẹ ma sẹlẹakịm sị pa opu nyẹ́nimiapụ ma ḅụ́gịrịrịma, ọ pịghị tuminikiriapụ pa ịnyọ nyánágha sị nyẹ ma sẹ́lẹ́akịm sị pa ịnyọ nyánáapụ ma ḅụ́gịrịrịma.
english_text: But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong.

ibani_text: Tamuno mị tuminikiri téré nyẹ ma na túminị́ dighisima nyẹ ma na pịghị túminị́ pa nyẹ́sịghaa nyẹ ma sẹ́lẹ́akịm sị ọ pa túminị́ pa nyẹ sị nyẹ ma guluguluma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are,

ibani_text: Tamuno mịma mịẹm, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine bịpịkpọbịgha ḅara ọ toruku.
english_text: so that no one may boast before him.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno Krais Jizọs bie ọmịnị akuomam, Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ori opu níminyẹ pa wa pịrịmam, karakárá Tamuno tórúku, wa ḅoo Tamuno tọ́ntọ́apụ sọm n pịghị wa ḅọ́rọ́mamam.
english_text: It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God—that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.

ibani_text: Anịsáa tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ, Bịpịkpọ bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mịẹmáa nyẹ pa bịpịkpọ.
english_text: Therefore, as it is written: “Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.”

ibani_text: A ọ damaḅoo sáá ị́yẹ́ mịná owiapụ, si a ḅọghu Tamuno karakáráma dugho wásámáa, a kporo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ na opu nyẹ́nimi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọgha.
english_text: And so it was with me, brothers and sisters. When I came to you, I did not come with eloquence or human wisdom as I proclaimed to you the testimony about God.

ibani_text: A ọ́ nana fịnị sáá, a tẹ́mẹ́bie dighim ḅẹẹ a ị́yẹ́ kóróma pa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ warịbịgha kụ́ma, Jizọs Krais na pịghị ori fịị, mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.

ibani_text: A ọ damaḅo sáá, ịnyọ ịḅụ ofori ḅáláfa mịẹm si ị́yẹ́ oju mamgba sẹ́ghịm.
english_text: I came to you in weakness with great fear and trembling.

ibani_text: Iyẹ dienyẹ ma na ị́yẹ́ oku a tuminikiri níminyẹ ḅẹlẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa anị kọọgha, kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anị kụ́rọ diem anị túminị́ ḅụ koro bẹ ḅara.
english_text: My message and my preaching were not with wise and persuasive words, but with a demonstration of the Spirit’s power,

ibani_text: Anịsáa, ọmịna minini túminị́ nyẹ́nimi ḅụ sẹrẹrẹgha kụ́ma Tamuno ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ.
english_text: so that your faith might not rest on human wisdom, but on God’s power.

ibani_text: Wa opu nyẹ́nimi oku ma dugho wásáma minini ḅụ sẹ́nịmaapụ ma pịrịm. Kụ́ma mị opu níminyẹ ma anị mị tuminikiri opu niminyẹgha anịgha mị tuminikiri táarịapụ opu níminyẹ nna kụ́rọ ḅoo papanyẹ soarị nyẹ.
english_text: We do, however, speak a message of wisdom among the mature, but not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa dugho wásámaarị opu níminyẹ ma anịị Tamuno ḅọghu opu níminyẹ ma, n pa tuminikiriapụ ḅọghuma nyẹ, ọ sẹlẹakị nyẹ nịị n tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́gha sáá wámịna ipine goo.
english_text: No, we declare God’s wisdom, a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri táarịapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mị níminyẹ ma nimim, n ḅọ́rọ́ nimi ọkụma nnị ipine nyáná Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅaupálịbịgha.
english_text: None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara, anịị Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ na arịgha, gbẹ́rẹ́ biri sọ na naagha, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ na kórómagha ine mịẹbẹnyẹ anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma anị Tamuno tẹ́lẹ́ma warị ọ ḅẹlẹmaapụ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: However, as it is written: “What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived”— the things God has prepared for those who love him—

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wamịnị anịị Tamuno, ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mịnanyẹ ma diepágháma pịrịapụ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dọghụ pághámaḅoarị Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnị póghóló ḅọghunyẹ.
english_text: these are the things God has revealed to us by his Spirit. The Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.

ibani_text: Tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine tumḅọ tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ nimibịghaa, tumḅọ ma tẹ́mẹ́ sima, Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ngéré anịị Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ nimiḅọ.
english_text: For who knows a person’s thoughts except their own spirit within them? In the same way no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.

ibani_text: Na wa mị tuminikiri tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánaḅogha; tụ́ma wa Tamuno fịrịma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyanaḅomam, si wa Tamuno igbii ákịgha pa, pa wa pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nimi bẹ ḅara.
english_text: What we have received is not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may understand what God has freely given us.

ibani_text: Anịgosi wa tuminikiriapụ pa wa die níminyẹ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọgha, kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa wa die ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́, wa tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma karakárá puu findi Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáapụ pịrịị.
english_text: This is what we speak, not in words taught us by human wisdom but in words taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅara ḅoo dienyẹ ma daákịbịgha. Ọkọfịnị tumḅọ ine nnị akanyaḅogha, n ḅo ḅụ anị ofori ofori nyẹ kịkam, tegó Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ngéré anịị wamịnị ine dienyẹ ma akanyaḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness, and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáḅọ anịị ine nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ bẹnyẹ, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine ọ ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha.
english_text: The person with the Spirit makes judgments about all things, but such a person is not subject to merely human judgments,

ibani_text: N gịẹ kórómam Tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Tụọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ nimii? Tụ́ọ ori againma bẹ? Kụ́ma wamịnị Krais Tẹ́mẹ́ nyánáapụ wámịna bie.
english_text: for, “Who has known the mind of the Lord so as to instruct him?” But we have the mind of Christ.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅụ, ịyẹa nángwọ́apụ a ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịbịgha a ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáapụ pịrịbẹ ḅara; a ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịbẹm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị mị tuminikiriapụ na pịghị káláawọ ọmịna minini Krais ḅụ.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, I could not address you as people who live by the Spirit but as people who are still worldly—mere infants in Christ.

ibani_text: A ndomingi pa ọ siḅebẹm, tụ́ma fị́nyẹghaa tegó na ọ tẹ́lẹ́ma anị pịrịgha, mị́sa sọ na ọ tẹ́lẹ́ma anị pịrịgha,
english_text: I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed, you are still not ready.

ibani_text: Tegó, ọ pa duma kọọarị mị tuminikiriapụ duma kọọarị ḅara. Nyẹ́mọ́ni ọmịna ogboku bie fịnị sáá, ọ pịghị jụghọ jụghọ na kamkoro sáá, anị diegha ḅẹẹ ọmịnị mị tuminikiri bẹapụ, duma kọọarị n duma kọọarị ḅara?
english_text: You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you, are you not worldly? Are you not acting like mere humans?

ibani_text: Ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dughoarị sáá ḅẹẹ, A Pọl duaarị, jụghọ dughoarị A Apọlọs duaarị, ọ tuminikiriapụ nyẹ mịẹḅara pa nyẹ mịẹghaa?
english_text: For when one says, “I follow Paul,” and another, “I follow Apollos,” are you not mere human beings?

ibani_text: Anịsáa tụọ ḅọ́rọ́ Apọlọs, Pọl ori tụọ? Wamịnị papa Tamun fịrịnwangịapụ Tamuno pa ọ daa tụụma sị o goo minini nyẹ. Wamịnị papa Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ, pịghị mị fịrị ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị ḅo Krais ḅụ minimam.
english_text: What, after all, is Apollos? And what is Paul? Only servants, through whom you came to believe—as the Lord has assigned to each his task.

ibani_text: Ịrị mgbọ́lụ ma dipim, Apọlọs mingi pa anị saram, kụ́ma Tamuno anị mịẹḅọ sị anị senị́ị́.
english_text: I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God has been making it grow.

ibani_text: Dipiḅọ na mingi saraḅọ na nyẹ́ḅụ ofori Tamuno ori anị nyẹ́ḅụ fịnịḅọ, tegó ori anị mịẹsị dipinyẹ ma sẹ́nịarịḅọ.
english_text: So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow.

ibani_text: Dipiḅọ na mingi saraḅọ ma ogboku kịrịnyẹ ofori; Tamuno ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ pa n ḅọ gbẹ́bẹm.
english_text: The one who plants and the one who waters have one purpose, and they will each be rewarded according to their own labor.

ibani_text: Wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba wamịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ fịrịnaapụ fịrịnwangị Tamuno pịrịarị, ọmịnị ma anịị Tamuno duakiri. Ọmịnị anị pịghị Tamuno wárị ma.
english_text: For we are co-workers in God’s service; you are God’s field, God’s building.

ibani_text: Tamuno pa i pịrị dienyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ a opuma nyẹ́nimi wárịnámáḅọ fịrị nwángịm. A kiri sughum sị sughu isé sị jụghọ anị ọgọnọ námáarị. Kụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna ḅụ ẹbị n ḅọ námáarị ḅara.
english_text: By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as a wise builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should build with care.

ibani_text: Tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine jẹ́ súghúisebịgha Tamuno isemaa anganyẹ ma sima. Anị súghúise ma anịị Jizọs Krais.
english_text: For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ odoḅala anịgha pị́naḅala anịgha nyẹ́la onwo pa kiri sughu sị ine súghúise dapịrị ma ọ́gọ́nọ namabẹm, isiapụ sịị anịgha osuka anịgha ányị́nyá pa anị ọgọnọ námabẹm.
english_text: If anyone builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw,

ibani_text: Tumḅọ nwángị fịrị fịnị ḅara, kị́nị́ anị árịbẹm Krais ḅo ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ éné. Anị éné ma ḅụ fịnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ fịrị ḅara diepághámabẹm; fịnị ma anị daádighibẹm sị tụ́ma sị anị fịnị ḅara die.
english_text: their work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each person’s work.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ súghúise nyẹ ma ọ́gọ́nọ n nama nyẹ ma fịnị ma daatulutulu, nyẹ ma namaḅọ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ nyánáḅobẹm.
english_text: If what has been built survives, the builder will receive a reward.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ nama ḅọ ma fịrị dọ́ghụdọ́ghụ, anịsáa n ḅọ faá kọọbẹm; kụ́ma ori ma wárịnámáḅọ ma ḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm, soḅọ́rọ́ ọ fịnị ḅarabie sághị págháḅom.
english_text: If it is burned up, the builder will suffer loss but yet will be saved—even though only as one escaping through the flames.

ibani_text: Tụ́mányẹẹ ọ nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị Tamunowarị Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ pịghị ọmịna ḅụbie ngam.
english_text: Don’t you know that you yourselves are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in your midst?

ibani_text: Tamunowarị gulugulumaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno n ḅọ gulugulumabẹm Tamunowarị ma tọ́ntọ́m; ọmịnị anịị Tamunowarị ma.
english_text: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy that person; for God’s temple is sacred, and you together are that temple.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị oḅori pa ọmịna ḅụ sị ma. Ḅọ́rọ́ o kórómam mḅẹ́ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ tuminikiri asọ ḅụ ọ nyẹ́nimim ọ tụ́ma oḅori sọọ sị ọmịnị ibima nyẹ́nimi bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Do not deceive yourselves. If any of you think you are wise by the standards of this age, you should become “fools” so that you may become wise.

ibani_text: Tegó mị tuminikiriapụ pa nyẹ́nimi nyẹ sị nyẹ anịị papanyẹ Tamuno tórúku tegó, Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Nyẹ́nimiapụ ma Tamuno dia pa n kuuarị nna nyẹ́nimi ḅụ.
english_text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God’s sight. As it is written: “He catches the wise in their craftiness”;

ibani_text: Jẹ́ tọ́ndiri pịghị dughom ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nimim ḅẹẹ nyẹ́nimiapụ ma kóróma nyẹ ḅụ ofori.
english_text: and again, “The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ bịpịkpọ ma tumḅọ ine mịẹbẹnyẹ ḅụ. Karakárányẹ ḅụ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ́ ọmịna nyẹ.
english_text: So then, no more boasting about human leaders! All things are yours,

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Pọl, Apọlọs, Pita, mị tuminikiri, duma na fịị na, mị́sa biri nyẹ na pịghị tórúku ju nyẹ mịnanyẹ mamgba ọmịna nyẹẹ.
english_text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephasor the world or life or death or the present or the future—all are yours,

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Krais túminị́, Krais sọ pịghị Tamuno nyẹẹ.
english_text: and you are of Christ, and Christ is of God.

ibani_text: Túminị́ Krais fịrịnwangịapụ ḅara pa wamịnị akị na ibim, n Tamuno ori ḅọghu karakáráma pa pịrịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị anị pa túminị́ die.
english_text: This, then, is how you ought to regard us: as servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed.

ibani_text: Fịrịnwangịapụ nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ amịna nyánáḅọ ori nyánányẹ saghị ḅárasúamáa ḅọ, anịị ori ine ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā bẹ fịrịnwangịḅọ.
english_text: Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị ọkụma, a balagha ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị anịgha jẹapụ i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị tuminikiriapụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ́wárị; irịsọ a pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ịḅụ pịrịgha.
english_text: I care very little if I am judged by you or by any human court; indeed, I do not even judge myself.

ibani_text: I tẹ́mẹ́bie fiafiam, kụ́ma anị dughoghaa ḅẹẹ na a jẹ́ éné siinyẹ mịẹghaa. Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ori anịị i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ
english_text: My conscience is clear, but that does not make me innocent. It is the Lord who judges me.

ibani_text: Anịgosi gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sịbị sọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ma sáá ma na laagha sáá. Kúruu, ákị múu Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅoo sáá láa, ọ kánákánábie ḅọghunyẹ ma pa baá bie pághámaḅobẹm, túminị́ kúkúbie fịnị ḅọghunyẹ ma. Anịsáa anị túminị́ nna ḅụ gbẹ́ẹ̄ túminí nyánáḅọ bẹnyẹ Tamuno ḅara.
english_text: Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time; wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart. At that time each will receive their praise from God.

ibani_text: Anịgo, i jẹa miniapụ, ọmịna sịbị goo, a mịị nyẹ ma pa ịḅụ na Apọlọs mịẹm, wamịnị mmẹapụ pa anị kịkamanyẹ pa ọ dáwọ́ ma sị ọmịnị ine mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ nimi bẹ ḅara, Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma ólóghó ma ọmịnị anị saḅama. Ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ isiḅọ pa bịpịkpọ ma sị isi ngaḅọ dighisimaa.
english_text: Now, brothers and sisters, I have applied these things to myself and Apollos for your benefit, so that you may learn from us the meaning of the saying, “Do not go beyond what is written.” Then you will not be puffed up in being a follower of one of us over against the other.

ibani_text: Tụọ imie sị ị ibiḅaa jụgho nẹ́ngị? Ị nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno pa i pịrịghaa? Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ pa ị pịrị pịrịị, ị tegósi bịpịkpọ bẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ i nyánányẹ ma n die i pịrịnyẹ́gha?
english_text: For who makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not?

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọ binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ nyáná? Mị́sa ọmịnị ámányánáapụ sọmam? Wamịnị ámányánáapụghaa n ḅẹ́sọ. Dighi anị ịḅụ ḅẹ́lẹ bẹ ḅara ḅọ́rọ́ mị́sa ọmịnị ámányánáapụ, sị wamịnị sọ ọ́ nana ámányánáapụ sọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Already you have all you want! Already you have become rich! You have begun to reign—and that without us! How I wish that you really had begun to reign so that we also might reign with you!

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mị́sa anị ịḅụ fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno wamịnị nfịrịmaapụ ma pa kunema angaá ma ḅụ wárim, n sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́máapụ ḅara ḅẹẹ nnị n kpọ ḅáabẹm kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, sị tuminikiri gbọrụ sookumuapụ na tuminikiriapụ árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For it seems to me that God has put us apostles on display at the end of the procession, like those condemned to die in the arena. We have been made a spectacle to the whole universe, to angels as well as to human beings.

ibani_text: Krais goo, wamịnị oḅoriapụ sọọm; kụ́ma ọmịnị nyẹ́nimiapụ sọọm Krais ḅụ! Wamịnị ịnyọ wa ḅụ ofori, kụ́ma ọmịnị ọ kụrọm! Nnị wa dighisimam kụ́ma nnị o dighi sóghólomam!
english_text: We are fools for Christ, but you are so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honored, we are dishonored!

ibani_text: Ḅo mị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma láa, ḅuru wa tarịarị, wámịna pụghọ pịghị sámụ́nọm; káákáá bịtẹ anị wa suarị nyẹ; n wa fomum; wa ngá angaá nyánágha;
english_text: To this very hour we go hungry and thirsty, we are in rags, we are brutally treated, we are homeless.

ibani_text: Wa wámịna ḅara pa ịnyọsua fịrị nwángịm. Nnị nyẹ karị wa pịrị sáá, wamịnị n karịibimam; nnị wa pa tọ́rụ́siarị ma sáá, wa ngịrịma nyánam;
english_text: We work hard with our own hands. When we are cursed, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure it;

ibani_text: Nnị wa wiri sáá, wamịnị ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa n pagharam. Wa tuminikiriapụ ịlọ́lị kpo nẹngịgha; ḅoo mị́sa ma láa, wamịnị anị tuminikiri nyẹ́ḅụ ófórigha nyẹ!
english_text: when we are slandered, we answer kindly. We have become the scum of the earth, the garbage of the world—right up to this moment.

ibani_text: A mịma gịẹ ọ pịrịarị ḅẹẹgha ḅẹ́ a ọ ḅụ́gịrịrịma dọ́ghụm kụ́ma a againma pa ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara a ḅẹlẹma awọ ḅara.
english_text: I am writing this not to shame you but to warn you as my dear children.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Krais bie, ọ túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ pughu na sọ́nọ́a ndẹ́ẹ nyanam dighidighiapụ ḅara, ọ tọgha daapụ nyanagha Krais Jizọs ḅụ, a dugho wásáma ọ pịrị ibi oku ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ a daá sọ ọ pịrịmam.
english_text: Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel.

ibani_text: Anịgosi a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ ọmịnị i daa a nyẹ mịẹ ḅara mịẹ.
english_text: Therefore I urge you to imitate me.

ibani_text: Anịma gosi a Timoti pa ọ fịrịmaarị a ibima ḅẹlẹma tụwọ, ibima kụrọ sẹ ḅo Krais asọ ma ḅụ, ọ pa o biekórómabẹm ị́yẹ́ dumafịnị ḅara Krais Jizọs ḅụ mịma anịị a pịghị diearịnyẹ sọsị gbọrụ pịghị ngámámgba ḅụ.
english_text: For this reason I have sent to you Timothy, my son whom I love, who is faithful in the Lord. He will remind you of my way of life in Christ Jesus, which agrees with what I teach everywhere in every church.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ḅụ jẹapụ sághị opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹarị tegó ọ siim ḅẹẹ a mịnị ọ fịnị angaá ḅobịgha.
english_text: Some of you have become arrogant, as if I were not coming to you.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mini mini, a ọ fịnị angaá ḅoobẹm ḅọlọghaa sáá ḅụ, anịsáa a i ḅara pa dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm, mịná opuamịẹnyẹapụ ma nyáná kụrọ, mịnị n dughonyẹ ngéréghaa.
english_text: But I will come to you very soon, if the Lord is willing, and then I will find out not only how these arrogant people are talking, but what power they have.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno amadakiri ma, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ngéré ḅụ ofori, kụ́ma kụrọ ḅụ.
english_text: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power.

ibani_text: I tẹ́ angaá nyẹ ḅẹlẹma? Ị́yẹ́ ḅoo ma a fom nyẹ́ akuoo anịgha ḅẹlẹma na diin tẹ́mẹ́?
english_text: What do you prefer? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline, or shall I come in love and with a gentle spirit?

ibani_text: Mị́sa nnị opuma anị dughoarị ḅẹẹ yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọma opuma kiriakịarị ọmịna ogboku bie, ọmịnị sọsị bie fịnịapụ, anị si láa ḅara, Tamuno nímighaapụ ma sọ ine ọkọfịnị nyẹ miẹbịẹghaa. Nnị dugho i pịrịm ḅẹẹ jẹa owiapụ nna daa taa na múnoarị!
english_text: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate: A man is sleeping with his father’s wife.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ị́yẹ́ opuamịẹnyẹ anị tegósi sughuu? Anịmanakaragha biesii ịḅụ biibiegháa? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ma mịẹḅọ ma ọmịnị n ḅọ deesi ọmịna mịẹgbólóma ḅụ.
english_text: And you are proud! Shouldn’t you rather have gone into mourning and have put out of your fellowship the man who has been doing this?

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ a ọ́ nana ofori ojumẹnị ḅụ kụ́ma tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ a ọ nana imi, Jizọs Krais ẹrẹ ḅụ a pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ pẹ́lẹ́mam mịma mịẹḅọ sịbị, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ a aningáa imim.
english_text: For my part, even though I am not physically present, I am with you in spirit. As one who is present with you in this way, I have already passed judgment in the name of our Lord Jesus on the one who has been doing this.

ibani_text: O kobirimaẹrẹ wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ a pịghị ọ nana imi ḅara tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs kụ́rọ ma sọ imi,
english_text: So when you are assembled and I am with you in spirit, and the power of our Lord Jesus is present,

ibani_text: anị tumḅọ ma sághị Satanị pịrị sị ori ojumẹnị ma guluguluma sị tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅọrọma nyána bẹ ḅara Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs pịghịma ḅo bẹ éné.
english_text: hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh,so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ bịpịkpọ ma ibighaa, ọ mịị kaḅụ ma nimigha dughonyẹ ḅẹẹ, kálá yisti tụ́wọ anịị fịtúrú kpo ma gbọrụ sughumaarị nyẹ?
english_text: Your boasting is not good. Don’t you know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch of dough?

ibani_text: Olom yisti ma inwima si, anịị siiamịẹnyẹ ma, anịsáa i ḅo ịwọḅọ dighibẹm yisti nyanagha nyẹ ọ su karakáráma fịnị ḅara. Tegó n Krais pa igwagwaá wa pịrịmam wámịna Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ ánáná ḅara.
english_text: Get rid of the old yeast, so that you may be a new unleavened batch—as you really are. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.

ibani_text: Anịgosi o ḅo wa álálị ma wárị, mịnị olom yisti ma pa anị warịgha anịgha siiamịẹnyẹ na sii sịbịbie nyẹ́gha, kụ́ma fíafía na karakárá fịtúrú yisti bie ófórigha fịtúrú.
english_text: Therefore let us keep the Festival, not with the old bread leavened with malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

ibani_text: A gịẹ ọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ ọmịnị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọarịapụ na gbolomanyẹ nyáná ma.
english_text: I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people—

ibani_text: A Tamuno nímighaapụ ḅẹẹgha ḅẹ́ nnị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọarị anịgha oputọ́rụ́apụ nyáná anịgha fúrúapụ anịgha n kárányẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ mịná túminị́ ma ḅụ ḅụ sighima bẹ mḅẹ́ḅẹ́, mịma ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá mị tuminikiri ma wárịsóbẹm.
english_text: not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters. In that case you would have to leave this world.

ibani_text: A dughoarịnyẹ anị ḅẹẹ ịrịị ọ nana mịẹgbólómanyẹ nyánáma, Krais ḅụ mininiḅọ pa amịna ḅụ sịḅọ. Kụ́ma n ḅọ yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọarị anịgha opu tọ́rụ́ nyánam anịgha n ḅara pa kárányẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị, anịgha n ḅọ kị́nị́ dughosima ḅọ, anịgha iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ ḅáma ḅọ, anịgha fúrúḅọ. Anị tumḅọ ma anị ibighaa ịrị ọ nana kpọrọfịnị sị nyẹ́fịị.
english_text: But now I am writing to you that you must not associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sisterbut is sexually immoral or greedy, an idolater or slanderer, a drunkard or swindler. Do not even eat with such people.

ibani_text: A tẹ́ fịrị nyána mú sọsị ma bie oforighaapụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ? Anị ọmịnị fịrị bẹ ọ sọsị ma bie fịnịapụ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm.
english_text: What business is it of mine to judge those outside the church? Are you not to judge those inside?

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómam, Si tumḅọ ma deesi ọmịna ogboku bie.
english_text: God will judge those outside. “Expel the wicked person from among you.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ jụghọ amịna jẹ́ Krais asọduaḅọ na ḅẹ́rẹ́ nyánam, nnị tegó Tamuno nímighaapụ ma dama mú bẹ ḅẹẹ n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ n sịbị anịmanakaragha Tamuno tọ́ntọ́apụ ma wárịso sị n ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ.
english_text: If any of you has a dispute with another, do you dare to take it before the ungodly for judgment instead of before the Lord’s people?

ibani_text: Ó nimigha ḅẹẹ ọmịnị Tamuno túminị́ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm? Anị ọkọfịnị sáá, ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị tuminikiri ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm, mị nyẹ́ ḅụ ófórigha nyẹ́ ma anịị ọmịnị ine anị sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha nyẹ?
english_text: Or do you not know that the Lord’s people will judge the world? And if you are to judge the world, are you not competent to judge trivial cases?

ibani_text: Ó nimigha mọ ḅẹẹ wamịnị sookumuapụ ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm? Anịsáa, mị tuminikirinyẹ ma ḅụ anịị wamịnị ine ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha nyẹ!
english_text: Do you not know that we will judge angels? How much more the things of this life!

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọfịnị ḅẹ́rẹ́ koro koro, o mú sọsị ma bie fịnịkiri nyánágháapụ ḅẹẹ ma ḅẹ́ nnị anị ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ?
english_text: Therefore, if you have disputes about such matters, do you ask for a ruling from those whose way of life is scorned in the church?

ibani_text: A mịma dugho pa ọmịna ḅụgịrịrịmamam. Ḅẹẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ nyẹ́nimiḅọ sọ ofori mọ ọmịna kobiri ogbo ine ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹḅọ ori amịnáapụ Krais asọ duarịapụ ma ogbobie?
english_text: I say this to shame you. Is it possible that there is nobody among you wise enough to judge a dispute between believers?

ibani_text: Kụma anịmanakaragha, ị jẹa mininiḅọ mú jụghọ pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ́wárị múm, mịma kiriakịarị angaá anịị mininighaapụ ma tórúku!
english_text: But instead, one brother takes another to court—and this in front of unbelievers!

ibani_text: Bẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ ọ jụghọ jụghọ na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ wárị ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́ nyánam, anịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá bịghịmam, Anịmanakaragha anị ibi ḅábịgha ḅẹẹ nnị ị́yẹ́ irimam? Anị ibi ḅábịgha ḅẹ́ ị́ inoma fịịm?
english_text: The very fact that you have lawsuits among you means you have been completely defeated already. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?

ibani_text: Tụ́ma ọmịnị jụghọ jụghọ miẹsimaarị pịghị jụghọ jụghọ inomáarị, ọmịna mịnaapụ ma sọ ọ pa nnị mịẹm.
english_text: Instead, you yourselves cheat and do wrong, and you do this to your brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: O nimigha ḅẹẹ siinyẹ mịẹarịapụ ma Tamuno amadakiri ma nyánáḅobịgha, ọmịnị oḅori pa ọ ḅụ sima, n kárányẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ, anịgha yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọ́arịapụ anịgha amịna jẹ́ owiapụ na munoarịapụ
english_text: Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: Neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men

ibani_text: anịgha furuapụ anịgha oputọ́rụ́apụ anịgha iru ḅụụ tọ́rụ́ ḅámaapụ, anịgha jẹ́apụ dughosimaapụ anịgha ngarafịapụ mịnaapụ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ Tamuno amadakiri ma nyánáḅobịgha.
english_text: nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ anịị ọ fịnị ḅara; kụ́ma nnị ọ mịẹ fiáfiámamám sii ḅụ; nnị o fóofóo ma Tamuno pịrịmam; Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ma ẹ́rẹ ḅụ nnị o mịẹ karakárámamam; na pịghị wamịna Tamuno ma Tẹ́mẹ́ pa.
english_text: And that is what some of you were. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.

ibani_text: A ine a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹm, kụ́ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sọ́nyẹ ḅụ ofori. A ine dughobẹm ḅẹẹ, a ine a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹm kụ́ma a minibịgha gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ i pa anị ómóniḅọ mịẹ.
english_text: “I have the right to do anything,” you say—but not everything is beneficial. “I have the right to do anything”—but I will not be mastered by anything.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹẹbẹm ḅẹẹ, Fị́nyẹ fịnị furo ma pịrịm, furo ma sọ fịnị fị́nyẹ pịrịm. Kụ́ma Tamuno mịná mmẹẹ́ ma gulugulumabẹm, ojumẹnị ma anịị tumḅọ pa yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọ bẹ nyẹ́gha, kụ́ma nnị anị pa fịrịnwangị Tamuno pịrịị. Tamuno anịị pịghị oju ma siḅearị ḅọ
english_text: You say, “Food for the stomach and the stomach for food, and God will destroy them both.” The body, however, is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori kụrọ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma saghịmam fịị ḅụ. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ọ pịghị wa sághịmabẹm fịị ḅụ.
english_text: By his power God raised the Lord from the dead, and he will raise us also.

ibani_text: O nimigha ḅẹ́ ọmịna oju ma anịị Krais oju ma bẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá? A Krais oju ma gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá akị bẹ sị anị pa sẹfịḅọ ma oju gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá mịẹbẹ? Jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné!
english_text: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ himself? Shall I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute? Never!

ibani_text: Anịgha o nimigha ḅẹẹ amịna ḅụ pa sẹfịḅọ na gbolomaḅọ, n ḅọ á nana gbẹ́rẹ́ oju nyánámam? Tọ́ndiri ma dughom, tọ́rụ́ ḅuruḅurumagha ḅara ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Mmẹapụ ma ḅo gbẹ́rẹ́ oju nyánábẹm.
english_text: Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body? For it is said, “The two will become one flesh.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma amịna ḅụ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ na gboloma ḅọ ọ nana gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọọm tẹ́mẹ́bie.
english_text: But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit.

ibani_text: Mangịị soo yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị ḅụ. Tumḅọ mịẹarị sii mamgba nna oju na mịẹnyẹ nyanagha, kụ́ma yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọḅọ siinyẹ pa amịna oju mịẹm.
english_text: Flee from sexual immorality. All other sins a person commits are outside the body, but whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body.

ibani_text: O nimigha mọ ḅẹ́ ọmịna oju anị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma Tamuowárị, ọmịna bie ngaaḅọ, Tamun pịghị pa ọ pịrịḅọ? Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ nyánágha kụ́ma Tamuno anịị ọ nyánányẹ.
english_text: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;

ibani_text: Ori igbii bịpị pa ọ fẹm, anịgo ọmịna oju ḅụ ọ Tamuno boma.
english_text: you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ḅo tọ́rụ́ pa ọ gịẹ i pịrịnyẹ ma ḅụ su. Anị ibim ḅẹẹ owitụ́wọ táa yagha.
english_text: Now for the matters you wrote about: “It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángịma opuma bim gosi, owitụ́wọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ amịna táa nyáná, ọ́rụ́ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sọ amịna dee nyánáa.
english_text: But since sexual immorality is occurring, each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband.

ibani_text: Deeḅọ amịna fịrị nwángịbẹm deeḅọ ḅara, táaḅọ ma sọ árị fịrị nwángịbẹm táaḅọ ḅara.
english_text: The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband.

ibani_text: Táaḅọ ma árị oju ma fịnị árị ngéré pịrịgha kụ́ma fịnị deeḅọ ma sọ pịrịm, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma deeḅọ ma ori oju ma fịnị ori ngéré pịrịgha kụ́ma fịnị táaḅọ ma sọ pịrịm.
english_text: The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife.

ibani_text: Ḅuru ḅara ma, o ḅuru pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅáma ma, ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị mmẹapụ mininigha ḅẹẹ mịẹ kálá sáátụọ ḅụ ọ fofoobẹm sị ọmịnị sáá ngúmá sị ine tẹ́ghẹ̄ anịsáa ma ḅọ́rọ́maẹrẹ ọ sághị deeḅọ na táaḅọ fịrịnwangị. Mị ḅara ma Satanị ọ dadighibịgha ḅara ọmịnị ine ḅụ ọlọgha gosi.
english_text: Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.

ibani_text: A mịma dughoarị ólóghó ḅara ḅụghaa, kụ́ma nnị i wárịso sị a dughonyẹ.
english_text: I say this as a concession, not as a command.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ, anị iḅụḅẹ́lẹ́bẹm ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba a fịnị ḅara fịnịị. Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna dienyẹ nyánam Tamuno ḅara, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ mị dienyẹ ma, jụghọ anị dienyẹ ma.
english_text: I wish that all of you were as I am. But each of you has your own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọmịnị ẹ́rẹ́ yaagha anịgha ama yaaghaapụ na dee fịịmaá ẹ́rẹ́, a ḅẹm ḅẹẹ anị ibibẹm ḅọ́rọ́ nnị a fịnị ḅara fịnị, yaagha ḅụ.
english_text: Now to the unmarriedand the widows I say: It is good for them to stay unmarried, as I do.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ine ḅụ ọlọgha mḅẹ́ḅẹ́ nnị mú yaa, anị ibiḅam nnị yaa tụ́ma mịnị ine ḅụ ọlọgha ma ḅụ fịnị oju dọ́ghụ́ma ḅara pa n dọ́ghụ́ma nakaragha.
english_text: But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with passion.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ na ama yáapụ, a ólóghó nyána ọ pịrịm, i ḅara sághịḅogha, kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara; ọ́rụ́ḅọ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné a dee warịsobịgha.
english_text: To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband.

ibani_text: Kụma á ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ mịẹmịẹ a dee yaághaḅọ sọọ, anịgha mú a dee na ḅẹ́rẹ́fáma. Deeḅọ sọ amịna táa sịghịbịgha.
english_text: But if she does, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.

ibani_text: A dugho isiapụ ma pịrịm (irị, ḅụgbọrụ, Kịnịnyánáḅọgha): ḅọ́rọ́ Krais asọ duaarị mịná owitụ́wọ táa nyanam mininighaḅọ sị pa mịnị sị ọ nana ngáarị, ori jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné a sịghịbịgha.
english_text: To the rest I say this (I, not the Lord): If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Krais asọ duarị mịná ọ́rụ́ḅọ mininigha owitụ́wọ yaa yaa, ọ warị mịnị sị pa ánáná ngáarị, a jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ọ sịghịma.
english_text: And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her, she must not divorce him.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mininigha deeḅọ ma nnị Tamuno pa n daakị bẹ ḅara ḅụ wárịm nna minini taa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị mininigha táaḅọ ma nnị Tamuno pa a daakị bẹ ḅara ḅụ wárịm nna minini deeḅọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Ḅọ́rọ́ mịma ọkọ fịnịgha, nna awọ Tamuno nímighaapụ fịnị ḅara anịị n fịnị bẹ ḅara; kụma mị́sa anị fịnị ḅara ma nnị Tamuno n daakị bẹ ḅara ḅụ imi.
english_text: For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ma, ḅọ́rọ́ Krais ḅụ mininigha taáḅọ ma anịgha deeḅọ ma ḅẹẹm n ḅọ so dọ́ghụm, anị wárịso anị ọkọ fịnị. Anị ọkọ koro sáá, minini ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma, ḅọ́rọ́ deeḅọ anịgha táaḅọ, ólóghó n ḅo ọlọgha. Tamuno wa sịmam ḅẹẹ wa ḅo diin ḅụ ngaa.
english_text: But if the unbeliever leaves, let it be so. The brother or the sister is not bound in such circumstances; God has called us to live in peace.

ibani_text: Ị tọ́rọ́ pa nimi, Krais asọ duarị táaḅọ ḅẹẹ ị dee ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábịgha? Anịgha ị tọ́rọ pa nimi Krais asọ duarị deeḅọ ḅẹẹ ị itáa ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábịgha.
english_text: How do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or, how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pa mú duma kọọ Tamuno die n ḅo pịrịnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, n ḅọ pịghị fịnị ḅara Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma n ḅọ sị sáá. Mịị a tọ kọ́rọ́ma ólóghó sọsị gbọrụ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: Nevertheless, each person should live as a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them, just as God has called them. This is the rule I lay down in all the churches.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ n tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́máa owitụ́wọ, Tamuno sịbịpị ma mini ákịmam, ọ mịnị asọ dọghụma ọ ḅara warị tọ́ngọ pẹ́lẹ́ ilíghíma ma si bẹ ḅara, Ḅọ́rọ́ n tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́gha owitụ́wọ Tamuno sịbịpị ma miniakịmam, ori asọ dọghụma ọ ḅara warị tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Was a man already circumcised when he was called? He should not become uncircumcised. Was a man uncircumcised when he was called? He should not be circumcised.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ n tumḅọ tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́m anịgha n pịghị anị pẹ́lẹ́gha, anị mịẹnyẹ ofori; nyẹ mịẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ tumḅọ Tamuno ólóghó kokom.
english_text: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Keeping God’s commands is what counts.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n ḅọ fịnị ḅara fịnị n ḅọ Tamuno ma oku ma miniakị sáá.
english_text: Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

ibani_text: Ịrịị ómóniḅọ, Tamuno i sị sáá? Báláma kụma ịrị asọ árị sị ịḅụ nyáná ḅo bẹ nḅẹḅẹ́ ọkọ mịẹ.
english_text: Were you a slave when you were called? Don’t let it trouble you—although if you can gain your freedom, do so.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sị maá ómóniḅọ ma n ḅo anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ ḅụ nyánámáaḅọ, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma amịna ḅụ nyánámáaḅọ sị Krais sịḅọ, n ḅọ anịị Krais ómóniḅọ.
english_text: For the one who was a slave when called to faith in the Lord is the Lord’s freed person; similarly, the one who was free when called is Christ’s slave.

ibani_text: Tamuno nyẹ́la nyẹ pa ọ fẹm; anịgosi ọmịnị omoni sọọ túminị́ pịrịma.
english_text: You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of human beings.

ibani_text: I jẹa mininiapụ, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ Tamuno na fịnịị nnị ḅo fịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Tamuno ma n ḅọ sị sáá, pa Tamuno na mịẹgbólóma nyánáarị.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, each person, as responsible to God, should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

ibani_text: Mị́sa o gịẹnyẹ ma owiḅọ nimigha anịgha ọ́rụ́ḅọ nimigha gbolomanyẹ. A Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara saghị ḅo ólóghó nyanagha, Kụ́ma a i tẹ́mẹ́ dughom Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ lolomakúkúbie ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ ine ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā bẹḅọ ḅara.
english_text: Now about virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord’s mercy is trustworthy.

ibani_text: Mị́sa págháarị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma gosi, a siim ḅẹ́ anị ibiḅam ḅẹẹ owitụ́wọ fịnị ọ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Because of the present crisis, I think that it is good for a man to remain as he is.

ibani_text: Ị taa yaa yáá? A sịghịị dọghụma, i taa yaagha yaagha? Anịsáa taa dọghụma.
english_text: Are you pledged to a woman? Do not seek to be released. Are you free from such a commitment? Do not look for a wife.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma i yaa yáá i mịẹ siinyẹ ofori; owiḅọ nimigha ọ́rụ́ḅọ dee yaa yaa a gbẹ́rẹ́ siinyẹ sọ mịẹghaa. Kụ́ma yáapụ tọgha tuminikiri ḅụḅáláḅálá árịbẹm, mịma anị a binyẹ anị ḅárábie a ọ dụapághámaḅo.
english_text: But if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. But those who marry will face many troubles in this life, and I want to spare you this.

ibani_text: I jẹa mininiapụ, a dughoarị nyẹ anịị ḅẹẹ, sáá ma ịrụm, mị́sa sághị bịpị muu, taa nyánáapụ duma kọọ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ n táa nyanagha;
english_text: What I mean, brothers and sisters, is that the time is short. From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not;

ibani_text: kururuapụ duma kọọ sọ ḅọ́rọ́ n kururugha, bieḅẹlẹapụ duma kọọ sọ ḅọ́rọ́ nna bieḅẹlẹgha; nyẹ fẹapụ duma kọọ sọ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị fẹ nyẹ ma nna nyẹ́gha,
english_text: those who mourn, as if they did not; those who are happy, as if they were not; those who buy something, as if it were not theirs to keep;

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ngọ pa fịrịnwangịarịapụ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mịnanyẹ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá nna sáá mamgba akịịghaa. Ḅẹẹ mị tuminikiri ma anị fịnị ḅara ma, mịnị fịnị ḅọlọbịgha.
english_text: those who use the things of the world, as if not engrossed in them. For this world in its present form is passing away.

ibani_text: A bibẹm ḅẹẹ i mịnị ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ịḅụ pịrịma. Taa yaagha owitụ́wọ ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịrị ma anị ọ pa ọḅụ ḅáláḅálámáarị nyẹ, tegó ori asọ dọghụarị ọ ḅara warị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ bie mịẹ ḅẹlẹma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I would like you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord’s affairs—how he can please the Lord.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma táa yaa owitụ́wọ tuminikirinyẹ anị ọ pa ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ ḅụ pịrịarịnyẹ, tegó o biim ḅẹẹ ori ọ taa bie mịẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́maa;
english_text: But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world—how he can please his wife—

ibani_text: anịgo mmẹẹ́ angaá ọ nụ́nụ́arị. Dee yaagha ọ́rụ́ḅọ anịgha owitụ́wọ nimigha ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịrị ma anịị a pa ḅụḅáláḅálá pa a ḅụ pịrịarịnyẹ; tegó a biim ḅẹẹ a nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ saghị Tamuno pịrị árị oju na a tẹ́mẹ́ na; kụma deeyaa ọ́rụ́ḅọ tuminikirinyẹ anịị a pa a ḅụ́ḅáláḅálámaarị nyẹ tegó árị a dee tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma dọ́ghụm.
english_text: and his interests are divided. An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord’s affairs: Her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world—how she can please her husband.

ibani_text: A mịma dughoarị tegó a ḅárásua ọ pịrị dọ́ghụm, A asọkiki ọ pịrị dọghụgha. Tụ́ma a biim ḅẹẹ ọ karakárá pịghị mịẹna ibi nyẹ mịẹsị ọ pịghị nyẹ kọmagha ḅara ḅụ ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịrị ma pịrịị.
english_text: I am saying this for your own good, not to restrict you, but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord.

ibani_text: Yaa pa nna ḅụ ọlọmaapụ deeḅọ na táaḅọ ḅara; kụ́ma na mininigha ḅẹẹ nnị nwọgha sáá ḅụ yaabẹm: ḅọ́rọ́ owitụ́wọ ma arịḅom ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ine ọ ḅụ ọlọgha ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ ma fịnị angaá, warị árị ḅo ḅẹẹ nnị yaa na ibim, nnị mú yaa ọ bii ḅara, siinyẹ ofori anị bie.
english_text: If anyone is worried that he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and if his passions are too strongand he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.

ibani_text: Kụma ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ tumḅọ o sumaagha pa ḅẹẹ ori ọkọ mịẹ, ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́mam ḅẹẹ ọ yaabịgha, ọ pịghị ine ibima ḅẹrẹtọ ori oju gbọrụ pịrị pịrị, si pịghị tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́mam ọ mịẹ dọghụnyẹ, ori ibiḅara mịẹm, ḅọ́rọ́ ọ ḅẹẹ ori ọ́rụ́ḅọ tụwọ ma yaabịgha.
english_text: But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind, who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will, and who has made up his mind not to marry the virgin—this man also does the right thing.

ibani_text: Anịgo mú taa yaa ḅo ibima mịẹm kụma mini taa yaaghaḅọ ibima miẹḅam.
english_text: So then, he who marries the virgin does right, but he who does not marry her does better.

ibani_text: Deeyaa ọ́rụ́ḅọ a dee dumafịnị sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a ḅara na a sịbị nyánágha kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ a deefịị fịị, anịsáa árị ine a yaa dọghụḅọ yaabẹm anịị ori Krais asọ duarịḅọ mḅẹ́ḅẹ́.
english_text: A woman is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but he must belong to the Lord.

ibani_text: Anị i tẹ́mẹ́ fịnị ḅara a bieḅẹ́lẹ́ḅabẹm, a ḅọ́rọ́ á fịnị ḅara fịnịị, a pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ mịị againma ma Tamuno ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅara sághị ḅom.
english_text: In my judgment, she is happier if she stays as she is—and I think that I too have the Spirit of God.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọ gịẹnyẹ ma gbolomanyẹ anịị nnị pa igwagwaá n kárá tamuno pịrị fị́nyẹ. Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ́nimim, n dugho ḅara, anị fịnị ḅara ọkọ fịnị níminyẹ mịẹ mịẹm jẹ́apụ sághị opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹ; kụ́ma ḅẹlẹma tumḅọ mịẹm n ḅọ sẹnị.
english_text: Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that “We all possess knowledge.” But knowledge puffs up while love builds up.

ibani_text: Sịḅọ ḅẹẹ ọ nyẹ nimim, karakárá ma nimigha ọ nimi na ibiḅara.
english_text: Those who think they know something do not yet know as they ought to know.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno ḅẹlẹma ḅọ Tamuno sọ pịghị n ḅo nimim.
english_text: But whoever loves God is known by God.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, n pa igwagwaá n kara tamuno ma pịrị fị́nyẹ ma fịị gbolomanyẹ, wa nimim ḅẹ́ n kárá tamuno sẹ tuminikiri ófórigha nyẹ pịrịm; wa nimim ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ngéré anịị iminyẹ.
english_text: So then, about eating food sacrificed to idols: We know that “An idol is nothing at all in the world” and that “There is no God but one.”

ibani_text: Tọgha nyẹ n pa tamuno pa sị nyẹ ine imibẹm sobie na kiribie tọgha tọgha tamuno na tọgha tọgha kị́nị́nyánáapụ bii ḅara ma,
english_text: For even if there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as indeed there are many “gods” and many “lords”),

ibani_text: kụ́ma wamịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ngéré anịị wa nyánányẹ, Daḅọ ma, ori nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ, wa pịghị duma ọ pịrịm, wa pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ nyanam Jizọs Krais, ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ, ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị wa pịghị dumanyẹ.
english_text: yet for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom all things came and for whom we live; and there is but one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom all things came and through whom we live.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kị́nị́mamgba mị karakárányẹ ma nimigha jẹapụ n kárá tamuno ma opuma nkeḅemam gosi, nnị ọkọfịnị fị́nyẹ ma fịarị sáá, n siim ḅẹẹ nnị n pa igwagwaá fị́nyẹ fịarị, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie kụrọgha gosi, nnị siim ḅẹẹ nnị pilemam.
english_text: But not everyone possesses this knowledge. Some people are still so accustomed to idols that when they eat sacrificial food they think of it as having been sacrificed to a god, and since their conscience is weak, it is defiled.

ibani_text: Fị́nyẹ, anị fịnị ḅara ine wa kikiama Tamuno fịnị angaá ḅobịgha, wa ḅuuma nyẹ ofori wa ḅọ́rọ́ fịghafịgha, anịgha wa ḅọ́rọ́ fịfị wa anị bie sọnyẹ́ nyanagha.
english_text: But food does not bring us near to God; we are no worse if we do not eat, and no better if we do.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ ẹbị minima sị ọ nyáná ḅara na sịbị nyána ma mịẹsị minini ma ḅụ kụrọghaapụ bịghịkoro.
english_text: Be careful, however, that the exercise of your rights does not become a stumbling block to the weak.

ibani_text: Didigha ḅọ́rọ́ tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọghaḅọ mịnyẹ ma ḅụ ị́yẹ́ arịị, ịrị mịnanyẹ ma nimiḅo, nyẹ́fịarị oru warị bie; mịma anị mịẹbịgha sị n ḅo sághị n pa igwagwaá fị́nyẹ fịị?
english_text: For if someone with a weak conscience sees you, with all your knowledge, eating in an idol’s temple, won’t that person be emboldened to eat what is sacrificed to idols?

ibani_text: Anịsáa mịị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọgha mịná owitụ́wọ ma Krais ọ sịbị goo fịịḅọ ma, warị fịị faabẹm ịrị ma níminyẹ gosi!
english_text: So this weak brother or sister, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge.

ibani_text: I mịị ḅara ma pa siinyẹ pa ị jẹa mininiḅọ miẹsima sáá sị mịẹsị nna tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuú, Krais anịị ị mịị sii ma pa mịẹarịḅọ.
english_text: When you sin against them in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.

ibani_text: Mịma goo, ḅọ́rọ́ a fịarịnyẹ mịẹbẹm sị i jẹa mininiḅọ siinyẹ bie sọọ a mịnị jẹ́ pa nama pẹẹ́bịgha, sị a mịnị jẹ́ pa mịẹbịgha sị i jẹa mininiḅọ ma bịghị.
english_text: Therefore, if what I eat causes my brother or sister to fall into sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I will not cause them to fall.

ibani_text: Irị i ḅara na i sịbị nyáná owitụwọgha? Irị nfịrịmaḅọghaa? Na a Jizọs Krais wámịna Nyánáḅọ arịgha? Ọmịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie a nwángị fịrị ma bie sághị ḅo sọ́nyegha?
english_text: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not the result of my work in the Lord?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ jẹ́apụ ị́yẹ́ ákịịgha nfịrịmaḅọ ḅara, ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ákịm! Ọ nyáná duma ma gosi Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie ọmịnị ma anịị túminị́ pa ḅara ọlọ bẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ irị nfịrịmaḅọ.
english_text: Even though I may not be an apostle to others, surely I am to you! For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.

ibani_text: Túminị́ i sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị sáá, mịị a ịḅụ pighiarị ḅara.
english_text: This is my defense to those who sit in judgment on me.

ibani_text: Wa kụrọ nyanagha ḅẹẹ n fị́nyẹ na iru pa wa pịrị wámịna fịrị ma ḅụ?
english_text: Don’t we have the right to food and drink?

ibani_text: Wa kụrọ nyanagha sị isi nfịrịmaapụ ma mịẹ ḅara mịẹ, na pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mịná owiapụ na Pita mịẹḅara mịẹsị Krais asọ duarị táaḅọ akị wa múuarị nyẹ ma ḅụ?
english_text: Don’t we have the right to take a believing wife along with us, as do the other apostles and the Lord’s brothers and Cephas?

ibani_text: Ịrị na Banabas ngéré anịị fịrịnwangị bẹapụ sị pa nna ḅụ siḅe?
english_text: Or is it only I and Barnabas who lack the right to not work for a living?

ibani_text: Tọ́rọ fịnị ọ́mụ́gbiḅọ, ọ ḅárákū igbii pa ọ ḅụ siḅe siḅe? Ọ tọrọ́ fịnị dụadipiḅọ ọ dipi sị ma sịmgbọ́lụ fịbịghaa? Tụọ ánáná didighiḅọ ánáná ma ḅụ saghị ḅo indomingi pa nyẹ miẹbịghaḅọ?
english_text: Who serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its grapes? Who tends a flock and does not drink the milk?

ibani_text: A tuminikiri opu níminyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mịma dughoarị? Ólóghó ma sọ anị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dughogha?
english_text: Do I say this merely on human authority? Doesn’t the Law say the same thing?

ibani_text: Wa kọkọ goo Mosis ólóghó diri ma bie ḅẹẹ, Mbiakpa isimaarị kọ́rọ́náma ma bịpị fịna ma. Mịnga, Tamuno ma anịị kọ́rọ́náma gosi anịị o goo dughoarị nyẹ?
english_text: For it is written in the Law of Moses: “Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.”Is it about oxen that God is concerned?

ibani_text: Wamịnị goo anịị ọ goo anị dugho nyẹ́gha? Karakárányẹ n mịnyẹ ma gịẹm wa sịbị goo. Kiri tẹ́lẹ́maarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na pịghị duasughuarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị mịẹ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma nyánam ḅẹ́ n ḅo diekiri nyánábẹm n sughu dua ma ḅụ.
english_text: Surely he says this for us, doesn’t he? Yes, this was written for us, because whoever plows and threshes should be able to do so in the hope of sharing in the harvest.

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́mẹ́ sịmgbọ́lụ dipimaa ḅara ọmịna bie, anịsáa anị nyẹ́ sima, wa ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna ḅárabie mị tuminikirinyẹ ma nyánáḅo.
english_text: If we have sown spiritual seed among you, is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ jẹapụ ọmịna ḅárábie mịma biiarị, wamịnị wa kọkọ mịma nẹ́ngịma kụ́rọ nyáná? Kụ́ma wa mị kụ́rọ ma pa nyẹ́ mịẹgha. Tụ́manyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ wamịnị ngịrịma nyánam, sị wamịnị asọ mgbẹsẹ nyẹ dighi Krais gboloma ibi oku ma pịrịbịgha ḅara.
