english_text: If others have this right of support from you, shouldn’t we have it all the more? But we did not use this right. On the contrary, we put up with anything rather than hinder the gospel of Christ.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹẹ Tamunowárịbie fịrịnwangịarịapụ nna fị́nyẹ nyanaḅoarị Tamunowarị ma bie, ẹ́bẹ ọgọnọ agbaa mịẹarịapụ ma sọ diekiri nyánam n mịẹarị agbaa ma bie.
english_text: Don’t you know that those who serve in the temple get their food from the temple, and that those who serve at the altar share in what is offered on the altar?

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ bịpị pịrịmam ḅẹẹ ibi oku ma dugho wásámáarịapụ ma, sọ nna fị́fị́nyẹ nyánáḅọ ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ḅụ.
english_text: In the same way, the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should receive their living from the gospel.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma náa a mị kụ́rọ ma ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ pa fịrị ḅụ suugha, a pịghị mịma gịẹgha ḅẹẹ a anị ḅárásua nyáná ḅo ịḅụ pịrị. Tegó a biighaa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ i mịẹsị a go bịpịkpọ biegha nyẹ ákịị i ḅarabie, anịmanakaragha a fịịfịị anị ibiḅam.
english_text: But I have not used any of these rights. And I am not writing this in the hope that you will do such things for me, for I would rather die than allow anyone to deprive me of this boast.

ibani_text: A a goo bịpịkpọ bẹnyẹ arịgha tegó a ibi oku ma dugho wásámam gosi, mị ibi oku ma n tọ́ọ ị pịrịm ḅẹẹ a anị dugho wásámáa. Dighi anị si i pịrị láa bẹ ḅara a ḅọ́rọ́ ibi oku ma dugho wásámagha!
english_text: For when I preach the gospel, I cannot boast, since I am compelled to preach. Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel!

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ i tẹ́mẹ́bie fịrị ma nwángị kị́nị́ i sumagha pa a gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ nyánábẹm; kụ́ma a fịrị ḅara pa anị nwángịm tegó Tamuno mị fịrị ma saghị i pịrịmam ḅẹ́ a anị nwángịị.
english_text: If I preach voluntarily, I have a reward; if not voluntarily, I am simply discharging the trust committed to me.

ibani_text: A tọrọ́ fịnị gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ nyáná bẹ anịsáa? A nyáná gbẹ́nyẹ anịị a nyáná asọ sị ibi oku ma dugho págháma igbii tuḅọgha pa anị ḅụ pịghị ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ fọnyagha pa ị́yẹ́ fịrị ibi oku ma ḅụ.
english_text: What then is my reward? Just this: that in preaching the gospel I may offer it free of charge, and so not make full use of my rights as a preacher of the gospel.

ibani_text: Irị ḅara na i sịbị nyánáḅọ; irị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ómóniḅọgha; kụma a ịḅụ pa kị́nị́mamgba ómóniḅọ mịẹm sị a ineapụ akuoo Krais nimii.
english_text: Though I am free and belong to no one, I have made myself a slave to everyone, to win as many as possible.

ibani_text: A Juuapụ ma na fịrịnwangịarị sáá, a duma kọọm Juuapụ ḅara sị a ine a ineapụ akuoo Krais pịrịbẹ ḅara; karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ ịrị a Mosis ólóghó ma sughubie ofori a ólóghó ma suughu bie fịnịapụ ḅara pa duma kọọm sị a ine nnị akuoo Krais pịrịị.
english_text: To the Jews I became like a Jew, to win the Jews. To those under the law I became like one under the law (though I myself am not under the law), so as to win those under the law.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma a Juughaapụ ma na fịrịnwangịarị sáá, a Juughaapụ ma ḅara pa duma kọọm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ ólóghó ma ịḅụ kụrọ nyanagha nyẹ, sị a ine Juughaapụ ma akuoo Krais pịrịbẹ ḅara. Mịma anị dieghaa ḅẹẹ a Tamuno ólóghó ma kokogha; a karakáráma Krais ólóghó ma sughubie imi.
english_text: To those not having the law I became like one not having the law (though I am not free from God’s law but am under Christ’s law), so as to win those not having the law.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ kụrọghaapụ ma ogbo, a ḅo minini ḅụ kụrọghaḅọ dighim sị a ine pa nna akuoo Krais pịrịị. Anịgosi a ḅo nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm sị a ine jẹapụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ḅo bẹ ḅara a árị asọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all people so that by all possible means I might save some.

ibani_text: A mịná nyẹ mamgba mịẹm ibi oku ma gosi, sị a diekiri nyána bẹ ḅara anị ḅụ fịnị karịibima ḅụ.
english_text: I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹẹ mangị ti ma ḅụ, tọghaapụ mangịm kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ anịị dienyẹ ma nyánákịarịḅọ. Anịgosi mangịị sị i dienyẹ ma nyánáakị ḅo bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma mangị ti ma pịrịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ ḅụ pa opu ḅụọ dáwọ ḅụ suabẹm, ọ mịma mịẹm dii láabịgha ogunu gosi; kụ́ma wamịnị wa mịẹarị si wa ine fịnị gbámásó ogunu nyáná ḅo.
english_text: Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever.

ibani_text: Anị a go mangịarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ a mangị mú sịbị láama, a pịghị oḅoli pa fọ́rụ ḅaghuḅọ ḅara pa ḅaghugha.
english_text: Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air.

ibani_text: A oḅoli pa ị́yẹ́ oju ma ḅaghu kụ́rọ́mam sị a ibima anị ḅụ ḅẹrẹtọ bẹ ḅara, sị a ibi oku ma dugho wásáma jẹapụ pịrị faá ma sa nnị i suma sibịgha ḅẹẹ a gbụnụ́nụ́ ḅara pa ị́yẹ́ mangị ma kọọgha.
english_text: No, I strike a blow to my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.

ibani_text: I jẹa miniapụ, a dọ́ghụm ọ pa biekóróma, wámịna tádọ́apụ Mosis duaapụ ma ḅụ pághányẹ. Oḅuto ma nnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹm n warị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ n laagha ḅara ḅụ Ányị́nyá tọ́rụ́ ma sáḅá.
english_text: For I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers and sisters, that our ancestors were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị oḅuto ma na tọ́rụ́ ma na pa mingi pa n saram Mosis ọḅụduaapụ ḅara.
english_text: They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ fịtúrú ma fịịm
english_text: They all ate the same spiritual food

ibani_text: pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ iru ma ḅuu. Nnị n duanwángi tẹ́mẹ́ okpodapịrị ma ḅụ mingi ḅuum, anị okpodapịrị ma anịị Krais ḅụgbọrụ.
english_text: and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, anịsọ Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹlẹ nyáná n ḅụ tọghaapụ pịrịgha, anịgo nna dua elesiri ma ḅụ galagala famam.
english_text: Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered in the wilderness.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba kiriakị pa wa diem birinụ́nụ́ ḅara ḅụ ḅẹẹ siinyẹ wa pụghọ tárị ma anị ánị túminị́ ma tárị ḅara,
english_text: Now these things occurred as examples to keep us from setting our hearts on evil things as they did.

ibani_text: anịgha mú n kárá tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄, nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ mịẹḅara ma. Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ma ḅẹẹ, Túminị́ ma kpọrọfịnị fịị na ḅuu na pịrịm sị sághị sii sẹ́ghị kọọ.
english_text: Do not be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written: “The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in revelry.”

ibani_text: Wamịnị ama nwángị duma kọọbịgha, nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ kọọ ḅara, anịgosi gbẹ́rẹ́ éné túminị́ a mmẹẹ́ pughu tẹ́rẹ́ faá si a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si sóghóró korom sị fịị.
english_text: We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did—and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died.

ibani_text: Wa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma daádighibịgha, jẹ́apụ ọ daádighi ḅara sị ododó ma warị n gbọḅáa.
english_text: We should not test Christ,as some of them did—and were killed by snakes.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị saghị n búrúnbúrúbịgha jẹ́apụ nbúrúnbúrú ḅara sị fịị sookumuapụ ma warị n guluguluma.
english_text: And do not grumble, as some of them did—and were killed by the destroying angel.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma n ḅụ págháam sị jẹ́apụ anị pa nyẹ dáwọ bẹ ḅara, n pịghị gịẹ kórómam pa wámịna biri nụ́nụ́m. Tegó wa dúma kọọarị sáá ma kunema sa biri.
english_text: These things happened to them as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the culmination of the ages has come.

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ sị ḅẹẹ ị́ ibima sẹ́fị́nịarị ịḅụ ẹbị, sị ịbịghịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: So, if you think you are standing firm, be careful that you don’t fall!

ibani_text: Ị arịmáa daádighi gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị túminị́ sámámgba arịarị daádighi ma. Tamuno o minini nyẹ mịẹbẹm, o minibịgha sị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ ine daabịgha daádighi ḅoo ị láa. O wáriso sị anị daádighi ma ḅo ọ laarị sáá ọ pịghị ịnyọ pa ọ pịrịbẹm ọ pa ine anị inema, ọ pịghị asọ findibẹm ọ pa ine mangị págháaḅo.
english_text: No temptationhas overtaken you except what is common to mankind. And God is faithful; he will not let you be temptedbeyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted,he will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ ọmịnị ọ ḅụ fófóoma nkára tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.

ibani_text: A ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sịbịbie nyánáapụ pịrịm ọmịnị ḅara na ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ ḅụ pịrị a dughonyẹ ma ḅụ.
english_text: I speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.

ibani_text: Wamịnị iru ḅụ sá, n pa Tọ́ntọ́ fị́nyẹ pịrịarị ọmọngọ ma bie, warị imiẹḅa pa Tamuno ḅẹ́, wa diekiri nyánáarị Krais ọmbịnyẹ́ ma ḅụ. Wa pịghị fịtúrú ma puu fị sá, wa pịghị diekiri nyánáarị Krais oju ma ḅụ.
english_text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ?

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ fịtúrú kpo ma imi gosi, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ wa dụḅam wamịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ oju, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ fịtúrú ma diem.
english_text: Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all share the one loaf.

ibani_text: O kóróma nyána Izirẹlịawọ pịrị, n pa igwagwaá fị́nyẹ ma fịịapụ ma diekiri nyánam ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ n nwángị Tamuno pịrị fịrị ma ḅụ.
english_text: Consider the people of Israel: Do not those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?

ibani_text: A mịma dugho ḅara ma anị dugho ḅẹẹ n gwaa pa n kárá tamuno pịrị igwaa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ imi anịgha ḅẹ́ n kárá tamuno ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ imii?
english_text: Do I mean then that food sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?

ibani_text: Ọkọ fịnịgha! Mị a dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹ́ Tamuno nímighaapụ ma ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ n gwáa igwáa ma, n gwaa pa sitẹ́mẹ́ pịrịm, n gwaa pa Tamuno pịrịgha. A pịghị bigha ḅẹẹ ọmịnị na sitẹ́mẹ́ na mịẹgbólóma nyẹ nyána.
english_text: No, but the sacrifices of pagans are offered to demons, not to God, and I do not want you to be participants with demons.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ine Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọmọ́ngọ ḅụ ḅuubịgha pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ ọmọ́ngọ ḅụ ḅuu, ọmịnị ine Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ nyẹ́fị ịkasị ḅụ nyẹ́fịbịgha na pịghị oru nyẹ́fị ịkasị ḅụ nyẹ́fị.
english_text: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you cannot have a part in both the Lord’s table and the table of demons.

ibani_text: Wa dọghụ ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅoo nyẹ́mọ́ni? Wa sị ḅẹẹ wa kụ́rọ ọ nẹ́ngị?
english_text: Are we trying to arouse the Lord’s jealousy? Are we stronger than he?

ibani_text: Anịị n dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ, A ine a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹm. Anịma karakáram, kụ́ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sọ́nyẹ ḅụ sọ́gha
english_text: “I have the right to do anything,” you say—but not everything is beneficial. “I have the right to do anything”—but not everything is constructive.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ amịna ḅụ ibi dọ́ghụ́ma kụ́ma jẹ́apụ ḅụ ibi dọghụ.
english_text: No one should seek their own good, but the good of others.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ine nama dẹrị fẹ ḅụ ọmịnị árị nama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pẹébẹm, nyẹ gbiláagha pa, i biebẹ tẹ́mẹ́ gosi.
english_text: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience,

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ, Tuminikiri ma Tamuno nyẹ na pịghị anị bie fịnịnyẹ mamgbaa.
english_text: for, “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ mininighaḅọ i siim ḅẹ́ ḅoo nyẹ́fị, i warị mini sị muu, n pa gbánā ị pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịị, ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ị tẹ́mẹ́ pịrịbẹnyẹ gbíla ma.
english_text: If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ dugho ị pịrị pịrịị ḅẹẹ, Mịị fị́nyẹ ma n pa i igwagwaá n kárá tamuno pịrịm. Anịsáa, ị anị fị́nyẹ ma fịbịghaa nyẹ dugho ị pịrịḅọ ma gosi, na pịghị ị biebẹ tẹ́mẹ́ gosi
english_text: But if someone says to you, “This has been offered in sacrifice,” then do not eat it, both for the sake of the one who told you and for the sake of conscience.

ibani_text: Anịma anị i biebẹ tẹ́mẹ́gha, kụ́ma isi tumḅọ ma biebẹ tẹ́mẹ́. Anịsáa kị́nị́ gbilabẹm tegósi jụghọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ ị́yẹ́ ḅara na sịbị nyáná ma gosi?
english_text: I am referring to the other person’s conscience, not yours. For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience?

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno pịrị iyẹ fị́nyẹ gósi, tumḅọ tegósi i dughosima bẹ a ịmịẹḅam pa pịrị fị́nyẹ gósi?
english_text: If I take part in the meal with thankfulness, why am I denounced because of something I thank God for?

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ mịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ḅọ́rọ́ ọ nyẹ́fị anịgha ọ nyẹ ḅụụ, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ Tamuno boma ḅụ.
english_text: So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.

ibani_text: Duma kọọ ị ḅụḅáláḅálá dighi gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịbịgha ḅara Juuapụ anịgha Juughaapụ anịgha Tamuno sọsị ma.
english_text: Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews, Greeks or the church of God—

ibani_text: Pa a mịẹḅara mịẹ, a asọ dọ́ghụm sị a kị́nị́mamgba tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹlẹma, a mịẹarịnyẹ, gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, ị́yẹ́ angaá ibi pa biekoromagha pa, kụ́ma kị́nị́mamgba ibi sị n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyána bẹ ḅara.
english_text: even as I try to please everyone in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị i ḅụọ dua, irịsọ Krais ḅụọ duaarị ḅara.
english_text: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.

ibani_text: A o túminim tegó sáá mamgba ọmịnị i pa biekórómáarị, ọ pịghị a sághị ọ pịrị dienyẹ ma duaarị.
english_text: I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a biim ḅẹẹ sị ọmịnị akanyaḅo ḅẹẹ Krais ma, ori ma sịbịdá owitụ́wọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm, deeḅọ ma sịbịdá ọ taá pịrịm, Tamun ma ori ma pịghị sịbịdá Krais pịrịm.
english_text: But I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man,and the head of Christ is God.

ibani_text: Anịgo tẹ́ghẹ̄arị owitụ́wọ anịgha ikiakoroarịḅọ susi Tamuno pịrịarịḅọ sị ọ sịbị gbẹ́ẹ̄ Krais ḅụgịrịrịmaarị.
english_text: Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head.

ibani_text: Susi Tamuno kubiri ogbo ḅụ amịna sịbị findi sị tẹ́ghẹ́arị ọ́rụ́ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịgha ikiakoroarị, ọkọfịnị ḅo a dee pa ḅụ́gịrịrị ḅụ suuarị, kịrịnyẹ ofori árị na n sịbị koro ọ́rụ́ḅọ.
english_text: But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head—it is the same as having her head shaved.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ a sịbị gbẹẹgha, anị ibiḅam ḅẹẹ a gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá sịbị ma kịrịm. Anị kọkọ ḅụ́gịrịrịma nyẹ ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ a sịbị kọọrọm anịgha a sịbị kịrịị, anịgosi árị a sịbị gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: For if a woman does not cover her head, she might as well have her hair cut off; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, then she should cover her head.

ibani_text: Owitụ́wọ ọ sịbị gbẹ́ẹ̄ na ibighaa tegó, ọ Tamuno fíafía náa ori fịnị ḅara diearị. Kụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ owitụ́wọ fiafiama diearị.
english_text: A man ought not to cover his head,since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅụ owitụ́wọ tẹ́mẹ́gha kụ́ma owitụ́wọ ḅụ anịị nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ nyẹẹ.
english_text: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man;

ibani_text: Anịgha nnị owitụ́wọ tẹ́mẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ goo kụ́ma nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ tẹmẹm owitụ́wọ gosi.
english_text: neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.

ibani_text: Sookumuapụ ma gosi anị ibim ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ a sịbị gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ nyána, sị pa die ḅẹẹ árị a dee sughubie imii.
english_text: It is for this reason that a woman ought to have authority over her ownhead, because of the angels.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ owitụ́wọ ófórigha ọ́rụ́ḅọ ófórigha, ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịghị ofori ofori, owitụ́wọ ofori.
english_text: Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ owitụ́wọ ḅụ anịị nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ pághámaḅo nyẹ anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ anị pịghị owitụ́wọ yii nyẹ; Tamuno anị pịghị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅara saghị ḅoarịḅọ.
english_text: For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅára na kọọ anị karakárá ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄arị warị a sịbị findi warị anị gbẹ́gha pa.
english_text: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

ibani_text: Tegó, tuminikiri nyẹ fịnị ḅara kọkọ pa o die ḅẹẹ nángwọ sịbị núme owitụ́wọ sịbị ó ḅụ́gịrịrịma nyẹ.
english_text: Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace to him,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅụ, anịị a mịẹ fiafiama árịnyẹ, Árị nángwọ sịbị núme ma n pa a pịrịm ḅẹẹ a pa a ḅụ gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For long hair is given to her as a covering.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma na nụná bẹḅọ, a dugho ọ pịrị sị ọ mịẹbẹnyẹ anị ḅẹẹ, wamịnị anịgha Tamuno sọsị mamgba jẹ́ Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara nyanagha.
english_text: If anyone wants to be contentious about this, we have no other practice—nor do the churches of God.

ibani_text: Mị́sa a pa ọ pịrị dọghụ againma ma ḅụ, a ọ tuminigha tegó ọmịna susi Tamuno pịrị kobiri anị mịẹarị siinyẹ anị ibi nẹngịm.
english_text: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good.

ibani_text: Párị nyẹ, n dugho ọ pịrịmam ḅẹẹ puama ọmịnị ogboku bie imi o ḅo kobirimaẹrẹ sọsị ḅara ḅẹẹ ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄, mịma a pịghị kálá ḅara pa anị mininim.
english_text: In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it.

ibani_text: (Pighi bẹnyẹ anị bie ofori, puama ọmịna ogboku bie fịnịbẹm sị karakáráma ḅụ fịnịapụ ma nnị ibima nna árị bẹ ḅara).
english_text: No doubt there have to be differences among you to show which of you have God’s approval.

ibani_text: Ó ḅo kobiri sáá, Tọ́ntọ́ fị́nyẹ ma anịị ọ fịarị nyẹ́gha,
english_text: So then, when you come together, it is not the Lord’s Supper you eat,

ibani_text: ọ nyẹ ma fịarị sáá, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna fị́nyẹ fịịarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ kurugha pa, mịma gosi jẹ́apụ ḅurutarị ḅụ imi, jẹ́apụ ịrụ ḅuu tọ́rụ́ḅáma.
english_text: for when you are eating, some of you go ahead with your own private suppers. As a result, one person remains hungry and another gets drunk.

ibani_text: Ọ́ warị nyánágha ọ fị sị pịghị ḅuu bẹ angaá ọ Tamuno sọsị ma dighisima bẹ sị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ nyánágháapụ ma pa ḅụ́gịrịrị bie sua bẹ? A tẹ́ dugho ọ pịrịbẹ mịma gbolomanyẹ? A ọ túminị́ bẹ? A ọkọ mịẹbịgha!
english_text: Don’t you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God by humiliating those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you? Certainly not in this matter!

ibani_text: A Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara daaḅom, a pịghị ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ pịrịarị dienyẹ ma, ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs nnị ọ dẹrịfị éné dii ma ḅụ, ọ fịturu mpara akịm.
english_text: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you: The Lord Jesus, on the night he was betrayed, took bread,

ibani_text: Ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ma pịrị, anị puu warị ḅẹẹ, Mị ị́yẹ́ oju ma, n pa pịrịm ọmịna sịbị go. Ọ mịma mịẹsị pa i pa biekóróma.
english_text: and when he had given thanks, he broke it and said,“This is my body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of me.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma n fị́nyẹ ma fị sọọ sáá ori ọmọngọ ma sághị akịm warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị ọmọngọ ma anịị Tamuno ịwọ ọḅọọ ma, ori ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ pa miẹtẹ́lẹ́ma nyẹ ị́ anị ḅuu sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa i pa biekóróma.
english_text: In the same way, after supper he took the cup, saying,“This cup is the new covenant in my blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of me.”

ibani_text: Mịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ ị mị fịtúrú ma fị sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị mị ọmọngọ ma ḅụ ḅụụ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ i Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma fịị dugho pághámaarị akị mú o ḅo bẹ sáá láa.
english_text: For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịtúrú ma fịfị na pịghị ori ọmọngọ ma bie ḅuu ḅuu anị ḅụgbẹ́gha ḅara i siinyẹ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ oju ma na ọmbịnyẹ́ mịẹm.
english_text: So then, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị, ibima párị ịḅụ peele dighi, anịsáa fịtúrú ma fị pịghị ọmọngọ ma bie ḅụụ.
english_text: Everyone ought to examine themselves before they eat of the bread and drink from the cup.

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma oju sẹ́pịrịnyẹ ma lighilighiḅogha lighilighiḅogha i fịtúrú ma fịarị sa na pịghị ọmọngọ ma bie ḅuuarị sáá, i ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ akuoo ịḅụ pịrịarị i fịị pịghị ḅụụ sáá.
english_text: For those who eat and drink without discerning the body of Christ eat and drink judgment on themselves.

ibani_text: Anị ọ ḅụ tọghaapụ goo obikiri ḅụ iminyẹ jẹapụ ịnyọ ḅụ oforighaapụ sọnyẹ, tọghaapụ pịghị fịịmam.
english_text: That is why many among you are weak and sick, and a number of you have fallen asleep.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ párị wa ḅụ peele dighi bẹ ọkụ́ma, wa Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ siri ḅụ sọbịgha.
english_text: But if we were more discerning with regard to ourselves, we would not come under such judgment.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ wa sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm pịghị fomḅara pa wa fom, sị n tuminikiriapụ na wa sua ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅárásiapụ sọmabịgha ḅara.
english_text: Nevertheless, when we are judged in this way by the Lord, we are being disciplined so that we will not be finally condemned with the world.

ibani_text: Anịgo, i jẹa mininiapụ okobirimaere ḅẹẹ ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅupiri fị́nyẹ ma fịị, o jụghọ jụghọ kúru
english_text: So then, my brothers and sisters, when you gather to eat, you should all eat together.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie fị́nyẹ táarịarịḅọ imi imi n ḅo tarị nyẹ fị wárị, sị Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ ma n ḅo sịbị gbanabịgha ḅara o kobirimaẹrẹ. Isi angaá ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma a ḅo láa sáá a ọ daatụ́ghụ́mabẹm.
english_text: Anyone who is hungry should eat something at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Tẹ́mẹ́ dienyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ i jẹa mininiapụ a bighaa ḅẹ́ ọ nimigha ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: Now about the gifts of the Spirit, brothers and sisters, I do not want you to be uninformed.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ nimi ḅẹẹ na ọ Tamuno nimigha sáá, n tọgha tọgha asọ ḅụ ọ daá irimam sị o muu duma nyánágha n kárányẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: You know that when you were pagans, somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to mute idols.

ibani_text: A dọ́ghụm o nimi ḅẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarị ḅo jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné dughobịgha ḅẹẹ, Jizọs wiri núme ịnyee, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ḅẹẹbịgha ḅẹẹ, Jizọs ịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma n ḅo daatụ́ghụ́magha.
english_text: Therefore I want you to know that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus be cursed,” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ Tẹ́mẹ́ dienyẹ imi; kụma gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anịị anị pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: There are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit distributes them.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ fịrịnwangị ḅara imi; kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma anịị anị n fịrịnwangị pịrịarịḅọ.
english_text: There are different kinds of service, but the same Lord.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ fịrịnwangị ḅara imi n pa fịrịnwangịarị nyẹ; kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ma anịị ịnyọ pịrị sị n pa nna fịrị ma nwángịarị nyẹ.
english_text: There are different kinds of working, but in all of them and in everyone it is the same God at work.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm ḅẹẹ anị anị ḅụ diepágháma, sị kị́nị́mamgba anị ḅụ sọ́nyẹ nyáná.
english_text: Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pịrịarị opu níminyẹ oku, mị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma níminyẹ oku pa jụghọ pịrịm,
english_text: To one there is given through the Spirit a message of wisdom, to another a message of knowledge by means of the same Spirit,

ibani_text: mị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma minini pa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pịrịm ọ warị pa jụghọ pịrị kị́nị́ gwọọ kụ́rọ,
english_text: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by that one Spirit,

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pịrịm sị n ḅọ ine ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịị, jụghọ ikiakoro, jụghọ tẹ́mẹ́ kịrịkị́rị́ ma nimiḅo, jụghọ ine kịrị ama ḅẹlẹ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ, jụghọ ine nimi Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅara sághị ḅo dienyẹ na Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅara sághịḅogha dienyẹ, jụghọ n ḅo kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma daadugho.
english_text: to another miraculous powers, to another prophecy, to another distinguishing between spirits, to another speaking in different kinds of tongues,and to still another the interpretation of tongues.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ngéré anịị mịnanyẹ mamgba mịẹarịnyẹ anị ọ ḅụ́ḅẹlẹḅara, ọ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ dienyẹ pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịm.
english_text: All these are the work of one and the same Spirit, and he distributes them to each one, just as he determines.

ibani_text: Nganga ma gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ḅara ma kụ́ma nganga nyánam, ḅẹ́ oju mamgba karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ n dụḅam nnị pa gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ma, anịị Krais sọ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Just as a body, though one, has many parts, but all its many parts form one body, so it is with Christ.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅọ́rọ́ Juuapụ anịgha Juughaapụ, ómóniapụ anịgha ḅara na nna sịbị nyánáapụ, mị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma mingi pa wa sara mị gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ma ḅụ suumam, Tamuno anị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba tẹ́mẹ́bie suamam.
english_text: For we were all baptized byone Spirit so as to form one body—whether Jews or Gentiles, slave or free—and we were all given the one Spirit to drink.

ibani_text: Oju ma anị ḅụgbọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ngéré anị mịẹghaa, kụ́ma tọgha angaá.
english_text: Even so the body is not made up of one part but of many.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅụọ ma ḅẹẹbẹm ḅẹẹ, Ịrị ḅaragha gosi, ịrị oju ma ḅụ ḅọgha, anịma mịẹbịgha sị anị mịnị oju ma ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha.
english_text: Now if the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ biri ma ḅẹẹbẹm ḅẹẹ, Ịrị tọ́rụ́gha gosi ịrị mịnị oju ma ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha, anịma mịẹbịgha sị anị mịnị oju ma ḅụ gbẹrẹḅọgha.
english_text: And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ oju gbọrụ ma anịị tọ́rụ́ ngéré, anị tọrọ́ pa nyẹ náa bẹ? Ḅọ́rọ́ anị biri ngéré nyánam anị tọrọ́ pa fụrụnyẹ náa?
english_text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be?

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ma, Tamuno kịrịkị́rị́ angaá ma suam oju ma bie, ori anị dọghụ ḅara.
english_text: But in fact God has placed the parts in the body, every one of them, just as he wanted them to be.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ nnị mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá, oju ma tẹ́ angaá fịnị bẹ?
english_text: If they were all one part, where would the body be?

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ma, anị ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ nyánam, kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ma.
english_text: As it is, there are many parts, but one body.

ibani_text: Anịgo, tọ́rụ́ ma ine ḅara ḅẹẹbịgha ḅẹẹ, A ị bigha! Anịgha sịbị ma anị ine ḅụọ ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹ́, a ị bigha!
english_text: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I don’t need you!” And the head cannot say to the feet, “I don’t need you!”

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha oju ma ḅụ ịnyọ nyánágha nyẹ ma anịị opuma nyẹ ḅụ sọ́nyẹ.
english_text: On the contrary, those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable,

ibani_text: Oju ma ḅụ wa pa nyẹ́sịghaapụ ma anị wamịnị opuma sáá nyána pịrịnyẹẹ anịsáa oju ma ḅụ tọ́rụ ḅụ ibighaa angaá nyẹ ma wamịnị ibiḅara pa anị didighim,
english_text: and the parts that we think are less honorable we treat with special honor. And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty,

ibani_text: opuma fíafía párángáa ma bigha nyẹ. Tamuno sọ ọ ḅara na oju ma pa sua gbólómamam sị o kuu nẹ́ngị kuu pa oju ma ḅụ, kuu biiapụ pịrị.
english_text: while our presentable parts need no special treatment. But God has put the body together, giving greater honor to the parts that lacked it,

ibani_text: Anịgosi puama ofori oju ma ḅụ, kụ́ma mị kịrịkị́rị́ angaá ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹlẹma nyána jụghọ jụghọ pịrịm.
english_text: so that there should be no division in the body, but that its parts should have equal concern for each other.

ibani_text: Oju ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá tọ́rụ́siarịarị isi párángáa ma anị na tọ́rụ́siarị ma arịm n ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá túminim, isi angaá apụ ma anị na bieḅẹlẹm.
english_text: If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored, every part rejoices with it.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba anịị Krais oju ma, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ anịị gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá oju ma ḅụ.
english_text: Now you are the body of Christ, and each one of you is a part of it.

ibani_text: Sọsị ma bie Tamuno túminị́ tọọmam, párị nfịrịmaapụ, mmẹẹ́ kárámáapụ ikiakoroapụ, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámáapụ nyẹ́dieapụ; anịsáa ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangịapụ, mịnaapụ ma duaapụ anịị n kị́nị́ gwọọ kụrọ pa pịrịapụ anịgha ḅárásua jẹapụ pịrịapụ, túminị́ daatụ́ghụ́ma, tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅẹ́lẹ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọariapụ.
english_text: And God has placed in the church first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healing, of helping, of guidance, and of different kinds of tongues.

ibani_text: Nnị kị́nị́mamgba nfịrịmaapụ? Nnị kị́nị́mamgba ikiakoroapụ? Anịgha nnị kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ́dieapụ? Nnị kị́nị́mamgba kụrọ nyáná sị pa ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị?
english_text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Do all work miracles?

ibani_text: Anịgha pa obi gwọọ anịgha kịrị ama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ fie, anịgha kụrọ nyána pa n ḅo fie nyẹ daadugho.
english_text: Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues? Do all interpret?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ mamgba pa ibiḅaa dienyẹ ma igbanịị. Mị́sa, a pịghị ibiḅaa mị mamgba nẹ́ngịma nyẹ pa ọ diebẹm.
english_text: Now eagerly desire the greater gifts. And yet I will show you the most excellent way.

ibani_text: A ine túminị́ ḅẹlẹ fiebẹm na pịghị sookumuapụ ḅẹlẹ, kụ́ma a ḅẹlẹma nyanagha nyanagha, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anị papa biripụ́ma akwa anịgha opuma fiearị gbom dighimam.
english_text: If I speak in the tonguesof men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal.

ibani_text: A ine ikiakoro dienyẹ ma nyánábẹm, a ine akanyaḅo nyánábẹm, sị ḅọghunyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ akanyaḅo; a ine minini mamgba nyánábẹm a pa ine opu tụ́ndụ́ sumasi bẹnyẹ, kụ́ma a ḅẹlẹma nyanagha nyanagha, ịrị papanyẹ.
english_text: If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.

ibani_text: A ine a nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ die gálágálámabẹm pịghị ị́yẹ́ oju saghị pịrị ḅẹẹ nnị anị dọ́ghụ́ma, kụ́ma a ḅẹlẹma nyanagha nyanagha anị mịẹ i pịrị ibi ófóri.
english_text: If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast,but do not have love, I gain nothing.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma nyánáḅọ ngịrịma nyánam, anị pịghị kị́nị́ balam, anị kị́nị́ nyẹ mọnịghaa, anịgha ḅụ sághị sóghólóma anịgha bịpịkpọ.
english_text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma sị ḅara pa duma kọ kọgha anịgha anị ḅụ anị ḅụ nimi, álála iganịgha, anị n pa anị mịẹsị gịẹ kórómagha.
english_text: It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma, bieḅẹlẹ nyáná siinyẹ pịrịgha, kụ́ma bieḅẹlẹ nyána karakáráma pịrịm
english_text: Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma ngịrịma nyána nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mininim, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánam, inema nyána nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm.
english_text: It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma fịnị gbámásom, ikiakoro imi, kụ́ma mịnanyẹ mamgba fịnị gbámásogha, kịrị ọwụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ dienyẹ imi, kụ́ma mịma sọ bibẹm níminyẹ imi kụ́ma anị ḅo ḅọ́rọ́bẹm.
english_text: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will cease; where there are tongues, they will be stilled; where there is knowledge, it will pass away.

ibani_text: Wámịna níminyẹ dienyẹ ma na ikiakoro dienyẹ ma mpara mpara ḅụ imi,
english_text: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kpain kárámá angaá nyẹ ma ḅo sáá anịsáa mpara mpara angaá nyẹ ma ẹmẹẹ́fábẹm.
english_text: but when completeness comes, what is in part disappears.

ibani_text: A ị́rụ́ sáá, a kálátụwọ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹkọm, a kálátụwọ ḅara pa sịbịbie kiẹm, pịghị kálátụwọ ḅara pa nyẹ akanyaḅo. Mị́sa a ḅo tumḅọ láa sáá, a mịnị kálátụwọ ḅara pa duma kọọgha
english_text: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I put the ways of childhood behind me.

ibani_text: kụ́ma mị́sa wa tẹ́mẹ́ dighinyẹ ḅụ ḅuruḅuru ma árịarị, anịsáa, wa ḅo árịbẹm tọ́rụ́ na tọ́rụ́ na. Mị́sa a níminyẹ mpara mpara ḅụ imi; anịsáa anị ḅo karabẹm, Tamuno káara ḅara pa ị nimiḅara.
english_text: For now we see only a reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known.

ibani_text: Mị́sa mịná tẹ́rẹ́anyẹ ma imi: minini, tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ na ḅẹlẹma, kụ́ma nna ḅụ nyẹ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ anịị ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma asọ ma dua, pịghị ibima Tẹ́mẹ́ dienyẹ ma dọghụ, kụ́ma ẹ́rẹ́so ḅa nyẹ ma anịị ikiakoro dienyẹ ma.
english_text: Follow the way of love and eagerly desire gifts of the Spirit, especially prophecy.

ibani_text: Kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ pịrịgha kụ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno pịrịm, tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ori akanyaḅogha. Ori ḅọghu karakárányẹ dughoarị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: For anyone who speaks in a tonguedoes not speak to people but to God. Indeed, no one understands them; they utter mysteries by the Spirit.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ikiakoroarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ túminị́ pịrịarị sị pa ịnyọ pa nna ḅụ sua, nna tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́ma na pịghị nna bie diinma.
english_text: But the one who prophesies speaks to people for their strengthening, encouraging and comfort.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ịnyọ pa n ḅọ ḅụ ngéré ḅụ suarị, kụ́ma ikiakoroarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ịnyọ pa sọsị gbọrụ ma ḅụ suarị.
english_text: Anyone who speaks in a tongue edifies themselves, but the one who prophesies edifies the church.

ibani_text: A biibẹm ḅẹẹ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ kụ́ma anị i ḅụḅẹ́lẹ́ḅabẹm ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ikiakoro. Ḅẹẹ ikiakoroarịḅọ ma nyẹ ḅụ sọ kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa kọọarịḅọ ma nẹngịm ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ofori sị n ḅoo kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughofindi sị pa sọsị gbọrụ ma mịẹ sẹnịmaa.
english_text: I would like every one of you to speak in tongues,but I would rather have you prophesy. The one who prophesies is greater than the one who speaks in tongues,unless someone interprets, so that the church may be edified.

ibani_text: Anịgoo i jẹa mininiapụ, a ọ damaḅo ḅo a tẹ́ sọnyẹ sọ ọ pịrịbẹ a ḅọ sághị kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sáá? Ḅọ́rọ́ a ine diepágháma nyẹ anịgha akanyaḅo anịgha ikiakoronyẹ anịgha againma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ akuogha.
english_text: Now, brothers and sisters, if I come to you and speak in tongues, what good will I be to you, unless I bring you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or word of instruction?

ibani_text: Dúma ḅụ ófóri núme suu nyẹ ma dighi ipilepile anịgha ọdụ, tumḅọ tọ́rọ pa núme pụghọ ma nimi bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ofurogha sị nnị ibima anị pụghọ náa?
english_text: Even in the case of lifeless things that make sounds, such as the pipe or harp, how will anyone know what tune is being played unless there is a distinction in the notes?

ibani_text: Ọdụ ma anị tụ́ma ḅara pa fieghaa sáá tumḅọ tọ́rọ́ pa tẹ́lẹ́ma ọ́mụ́gbi pịrịị bẹ?
english_text: Again, if the trumpet does not sound a clear call, who will get ready for battle?

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, tumḅọ tọ́rọ́ pa ị́yẹ́ akanyaḅo bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ i kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ nnị anị nagha, ị́yẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ẹmẹẹ́fábẹm fọ́rụ́ bie.
english_text: So it is with you. Unless you speak intelligible words with your tongue, how will anyone know what you are saying? You will just be speaking into the air.

ibani_text: Tọgha tọgha ama ẹ́gẹ́rẹ imi tuminikiri ma bie nna bie, anịsọ oku nyanagha nyẹ oforii.
english_text: Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world, yet none of them is without meaning.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ a n fiearị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma nagha nagha anị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹlẹ ma pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọ́ọ́arịḅọ ma ịrị ọ ḅụ biaḅọ dighibẹm ori sọ ịḅụ biaḅọ dighibẹm.
english_text: If then I do not grasp the meaning of what someone is saying, I am a foreigner to the speaker, and the speaker is a foreigner to me.

ibani_text: Anịị tarịarị ḅara ma, sị ị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịarị dienyẹ ma nyána, árị ḅẹẹ i ibima n pa fịrị ḅụ suam ḅárásua sị sọsị ma mịẹ sẹ́nịma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: So it is with you. Since you are eager for gifts of the Spirit, try to excel in those that build up the church.

ibani_text: Kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarịḅọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ na ibim ḅẹẹ n ḅo ine n ḅọ kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma daadugho.
english_text: For this reason the one who speaks in a tongue should pray that they may interpret what they say.

ibani_text: A ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ tẹ́ghẹ̄, i tẹ́mẹ́ anịị tẹ́ghẹ́arị nyẹ, kụ́ma ikúkúbie gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ mịẹgha.
english_text: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, a tẹ́ mịẹbẹ? A ị tẹ́mẹ́ pa tẹ́ghẹ̄bẹm; a ị tẹ́mẹ́ pa núme suubẹm; kụ́ma a pịghị ị kúkúbie pa núme suubẹm.
english_text: So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my understanding; I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my understanding.

ibani_text: Í ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹarị sáá tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ngéré, anịsáa pápáapụ ọ nana tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ ma n tọ́rọ pa ine Anị ọkọ fịnị ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ ịmịẹḅam tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma pịrịbẹ? Asọ ofori n ḅara warị nimi bẹ ḅara i dughoarị nyẹ.
english_text: Otherwise when you are praising God in the Spirit, how can someone else, who is now put in the position of an inquirer,say “Amen” to your thanksgiving, since they do not know what you are saying?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ dii ḅẹẹ ị́yẹ́ ịmịẹḅam tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma i tẹ́ghẹ̄ Tamuno pịrịarịnyẹ ma opuma ibii sọ, isiḅọ ma anị sọ ọ pịrị sọnyẹ oforii.
english_text: You are giving thanks well enough, but no one else is edified.

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹm ḅẹ́ a kịrị ama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọmịnị mamgba nẹngịm.
english_text: I thank God that I speak in tongues more than all of you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sọsị bie, a biibẹm a sọ́nọ́ a ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ túminị́ akanyaḅo bẹnyẹ sị pa nyẹ pa jẹ́apụ die, sị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi kọọ nakaragha.
english_text: But in the church I would rather speak five intelligible words to instruct others than ten thousand words in a tongue.

ibani_text: Ị jẹa mininiapụ ọmịnị awọamaapụ kịkama ọmịna kóróma ḅụ, siinyẹ gbolomanyẹ ḅụ ọmịnị awọamaapụ kịka, kụ́ma ọmịna kóróma ḅụ ọ sẹnịapụ dighi.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, stop thinking like children. In regard to evil be infants, but in your thinking be adults.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómam ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dughom ḅẹẹ, Kịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ kọọarị túminị́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, na pịghị biapụ bịpị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, a ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ mịná túminị́ ma pịrịbẹm, kụ́ma anịsọ ịyẹa túminị́ mini ị pughubịgha.
english_text: In the Law it is written: “With other tongues and through the lips of foreigners I will speak to this people, but even then they will not listen to me, says the Lord.”

ibani_text: Anịgo kịrị ama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ anịị ọ́ pa ilíghíma sua mininighaapụ ma pịrịnyẹ, mininiapugha, ikiakoro ma anịị mininiapụ nyẹ, mininighaapụ nyẹ́gha.
english_text: Tongues, then, are a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers; prophecy, however, is not for unbelievers but for believers.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ sọsị gbọrụ ma ḅo kobirim, sị kị́nị́mamgba warị sághị kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ, ḅọ́rọ́ jẹ́ pápáapụ anịgha mininighaapụ wárị sọ ḅo, nnị n ḅẹẹbịgha ḅẹ́ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ọ nọmụarị?
english_text: So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in tongues, and inquirers or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?

ibani_text: Kuma ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́mamgba ikiakorom sị jẹ́ mininighaapụ sọ ḅo sáá anịgha pápáapụ, n naarị nyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nna siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo pághábẹm nnị pịghị nna sịbị ḅụ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm n náanyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: But if an unbeliever or an inquirer comes in while everyone is prophesying, they are convicted of sin and are brought under judgment by all,

ibani_text: Nna tẹ́mẹ́bie n kórómanyẹ ma ḅo pághábẹm, n pịghị sịbị tuubẹm sị Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ nna sii kiẹarị angaá sị dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Tụ́manyẹ Tamuno mịnga ọmịna ogboku bie imi.
english_text: as the secrets of their hearts are laid bare. So they will fall down and worship God, exclaiming, “God is really among you!”

ibani_text: Mịị a dughoarị nyẹ ị́yẹ́ amịnáapụ. O kobirimaẹrẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ núme nyánam, jụghọ oku nyanam kịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅụ, jụghọ pa n dughonyẹ ma dughofindi. Nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹbẹm pa sọsị ma mịẹ sẹnịmaa.
english_text: What then shall we say, brothers and sisters? When you come together, each of you has a hymn, or a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue or an interpretation. Everything must be done so that the church may be built up.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ kịrị ama ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọarị mmẹapụ anịgha siḅaá tẹ́rẹ́apụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ẹ́, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, kị́nị́ pịghị daadugho nyánam.
english_text: If anyone speaks in a tongue, two—or at the most three—should speak, one at a time, and someone must interpret.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ daadughoḅọ ofori oforii, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arịḅọ ma bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ sọsị ma bie sịị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọḅụ na Tamuno pịrịị.
english_text: If there is no interpreter, the speaker should keep quiet in the church and speak to himself and to God.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ anịgha tẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoroapụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ẹ́, isiapụ warị anị sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ diepágháma nyẹ ḅo kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ pịrị pịrị, parị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arịḅọ ma bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄.
english_text: And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ine ikiakorobẹm, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ́dáwọ bẹ ḅara sị pịghị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná.
english_text: For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged.

ibani_text: Ikiakoroapụ ma tẹ́mẹ́ ikiakoroapụ ma sughubie imi.
english_text: The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori galagalaḅọgha kụ́ma diin Tamuno. Anị fịnị ḅara Tamuno túminị́ sọsị mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: For God is not a God of disorder but of peace—as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ sọsị sọsị bie. Nnị kụ́rọ pa n pịrịgha ḅẹẹ nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ẹ́, kụ́ma sughubie fịnị, ólóghó ma dugho ḅara.
english_text: Womenshould remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the law says.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ gbíla pághámaḅo dọghụ nnị nna dee gbilaa wárị, tegó anị ḅụ́gịrịrịmanyẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọsị bie.
english_text: If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.

ibani_text: Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma anị ọmịna ḅara sághị ḅoo? Anịgha ọmịnị ngéré anịị anị ḅo ḅụ láapụ?
english_text: Or did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached?

ibani_text: Siḅọ fịnịfị́nị́ị́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ ikiakoroḅọ anịgha ibima tẹ́mẹ́ dienyẹ ma nyánam, anị tumḅọ ma nimi ḅẹ́ a gịẹárị nyẹ ma anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma tọ ólóghó.
english_text: If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit, let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command.

ibani_text: Mịma dighi tọ́rụ́siḅọ, ori ma sọ nnị o dighi tọ́rụ́sibẹm.
english_text: But if anyone ignores this, they will themselves be ignored.

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị, i jẹa mininiapụ, ikiakoro ọ pụghọ tarị, pịghị kịrị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọọ tọ ma.
english_text: Therefore, my brothers and sisters, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ gbụ́nụ́nụ́ma na pịghị karakárá ḅara.
english_text: But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.

ibani_text: Mị́sa i jẹa mininiapụ, a pá o biekóróma, a dugho wásáma ọ́ pịrị ibi oku, ọ daákịnyẹ, anị ḅụ anịị ọmịna minini pịghị sẹ nyẹ.
english_text: Now, brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you, which you received and on which you have taken your stand.

ibani_text: Mịị ibi oku ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánam, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ a dugho wásáma ọ pịrị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ọ́lọ́ kụ́rọ́ma kụ́rọ́maá. Ọkọgha nḅẹḅẹ́, ọ pápá mininimam.
english_text: By this gospel you are saved, if you hold firmly to the word I preached to you. Otherwise, you have believed in vain.

ibani_text: A dáaḅonyẹ a ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ pịrịmam parị nyẹ́la ḅa nyẹ ḅara, ḅẹ́ Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹẹ, Krais wa sịbị go fịm,
english_text: For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ nnị o dipim, tẹ́rẹ́ a dii kárámá éné nnị ọ saghịmam Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara,
english_text: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

ibani_text: ọ pịghị ọ ḅụ pa Pita diem, anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa ori ọ ḅụ pa oyi mmẹapụ findi ma die.
english_text: and that he appeared to Cephas,and then to the Twelve.

ibani_text: Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ori ọḅụ pa i jẹa mininiapụ ndẹ́ẹ sọ́nọ́ a si findi nẹ́ngịapụ diem gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá, nna ḅụ tọghaapụ pa dumafịnịm, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ sọ fịịmam.
english_text: After that, he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers and sisters at the same time, most of whom are still living, though some have fallen asleep.

ibani_text: Anịsáa o ḅo ọḅụ pa Jems die, anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ori ọḅụ pa nfịrịmaapụ mamgba die.
english_text: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,

ibani_text: Kunemaá ori ọḅụ pa i diem n kịrị ḅara pa yiiḅọ.
english_text: and last of all he appeared to me also, as to one abnormally born.

ibani_text: Irị anị ịrụḅaḅọ nfịrịmaapụ mamgba ḅụ anịgo nnị nfịrịmaḅọ pa isi na ibighaa, tegó a Tamuno sọsị ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam.
english_text: For I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ a mịị fịnị ḅara ma fịnịm, ọ nyáná i pịrị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ papa faghaa, ọkọgha, a ịnyọsua fịrịnwangị nnị kị́nị́mamgba nẹngịm, anịsọ irịgha kụ́ma Tamuno ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ iḅụbie fịrịnwangịarị nyẹ.
english_text: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not without effect. No, I worked harder than all of them—yet not I, but the grace of God that was with me.

ibani_text: Anị ọkọ fịnị sáá, ḅọ́rọ́ i ḅara sághị ḅo anịgha nna ḅara sághị ḅo o, mị gbẹ́rẹ́ ibi oku ma anịị wa dugho wásámaarị nyẹ ọ pịghị minini nyẹ.
english_text: Whether, then, it is I or they, this is what we preach, and this is what you believed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ n dugho wásámāmam ḅẹ́ n Krais sághịmamam fịị ḅụ, ọmịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ tegó dughoarị ḅẹ́ fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghị ofori?
english_text: But if it is preached that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ fịị ḅụ saghị ofori fịịapụ pịrịm, anịsáa Krais so nnị ọ saghịmagháa fịị ḅụ.
english_text: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ na n pa Krais saghịmagha, wámịna dugho wásáma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mịnị nyẹ́ ḅụ ofori, anị ḅara ma anị pịghị ọmịna minini.
english_text: And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is your faith.

ibani_text: Anịma nẹ́ngị nyẹ, anị diem ḅẹ́ wamịnị Tamuno iruo onyésẹapụ, wa kọkọ fịị ḅụ Krais saghịma Tamuno ma dugho págháma. Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ori ọ saghịmagha, anịị fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghịgha.
english_text: More than that, we are then found to be false witnesses about God, for we have testified about God that he raised Christ from the dead. But he did not raise him if in fact the dead are not raised.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ fịịapụ fịị ḅụ saghịgha, anịsáa Krais sọ na fịị ḅụ saghịgha.
english_text: For if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised either.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Krais na fịị ḅụ saghịgha, ọmịna minini ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori; ọ pa ọmịna sii ḅụ imi.
english_text: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins.

ibani_text: Anịsáa Krais bie fịnị sị fịịmaapụ nnị fáamam.
english_text: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ mịị tuminikiri ngéré ḅụ anịị wa tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánányẹ Krais ḅụ, wamịnị anịị túminị́ mamgba ḅụ túminị́ dighi ḅụjiirịbeapụ.
english_text: If only for this life we have hope in Christ, we are of all people most to be pitied.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma karakáráma n Krais sághịmamam fịị ḅụ, pa die ḅẹ́ gbarịgha ḅụ ọ fịịapụ mamgba saghịmabẹm fịị ḅụ.
english_text: But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

ibani_text: Kụma fịị tumḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅo ḅara, fịị ḅụ saghị ma pịghị tumḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅom.
english_text: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man.

ibani_text: Adam ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́mamgba fịị ḅara, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Krais bie kị́nị́mamgba ḅo dumaapụ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ n ḅo karakárá sáá, Krais ori ma anịị párị, anịsáa ọ pịghịma ḅomaẹrẹ, ọ ḅụ mininiapụ fịị ḅụ saghịbẹm.
english_text: But each in turn: Christ, the firstfruits; then, when he comes, those who belong to him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa kunema ma ḅobẹm, ori amadakiri ma ḅọ́rọ́ma Tamuno Daḅọ ma pịrị sáá, anịị ọ táa kụ́rọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na ḅẹrẹtọ kụ́rọ na kụrọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ guluguluma fama sáá.
english_text: Then the end will come, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father after he has destroyed all dominion, authority and power.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Krais táa nyánam gosi ori ọrẹ iruonaapụ pa ọ ḅụọ sughu sua sa láa.
english_text: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

ibani_text: Kunema n guluguluma bẹ iruonaḅọ anịị fịị.
english_text: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Ọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ọ ḅụọ sughu suamam. Mị́sa anị ọkọ dugho sáá ḅẹ́, Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ọ sughubie suamam. Anị tọ́rụ́ bulubulumagha ḅẹ́ n Tamuno ḅụgbọrụ suagha anị bie, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa Krais sughubie suaḅọ.
english_text: For he “has put everything under his feet.”Now when it says that “everything” has been put under him, it is clear that this does not include God himself, who put everything under Christ.

ibani_text: Ọ mịma mịẹfáma sáá, Tụwọ ma sọ ọ ḅụ pa Tamuno ma sughubie suabẹm, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa o sughubie suaḅọ, anịsáa Tamuno ma káara ḅara pa taábẹm nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: When he has done this, then the Son himself will be made subject to him who put everything under him, so that God may be all in all.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ḅọ́rọ́ fịị ḅụ saghị ofori, mịnaapụ ma n tẹ́ mịẹbẹ n fịịmaapụ gosi mingi pa saraapụ? Ḅọ́rọ́ fịịapụ nnị n saghịma duma ḅụ suugha, n tegósi nna sịbị go mingi pa kị́nị́ sáraarị?
english_text: Now if there is no resurrection, what will those do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptized for them?

ibani_text: Wamịnị anịsáa, wa tegó wámịna duma pa ine fịị dighiḅọ bẹnyẹ ḅụ súúarị sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ?
english_text: And as for us, why do we endanger ourselves every hour?

ibani_text: Ijẹa mininiapụ, a fịị na tọ́rụ́ donaarị éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ. A bịpịkpọ ḅara pa mịma dughom wa nyáná duma gosi Krais Jizọs wámịna nyánáḅọ bie, wa ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ mịẹ sáá.
english_text: I face death every day—yes, just as surely as I boast about you in Christ Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ pirinama na mgbáa sọmam Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ anịị túminị́ ḅara ḅụ, a tẹ́ sọnyẹ nyanamaá? Ḅọ́rọ́ fịịapụ ma nnị n saighịma duma bie suabịgha, O ḅo wa fị pịghị ḅuu, ḅáa wa fịị.
english_text: If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus with no more than human hopes, what have I gained? If the dead are not raised, “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”

ibani_text: Minima nnị oḅori pa ị́ sị, Siiapụ na mịẹgbólóma nyẹ nyáná, ibiamịẹnyẹ sima simam.
english_text: Do not be misled: “Bad company corrupts good character.”

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ akanyaḅo sima ịḅụ ḅoo anị ḅo na ibiḅara, siinyẹ mịẹ kunema, ḅẹ́ jẹapụ imi Tamuno nímighaapụ. A mịma dughom pa ọ ḅụ́gịrịrịma.
english_text: Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God—I say this to your shame.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma kị́nị́ gbilabẹm, Fịịapụ ma nnị tọ́rọ pa n saghịma? Nnị tọ́rọ fịnị́ oju pa ḅo bẹ?
english_text: But someone will ask, “How are the dead raised? With what kind of body will they come?”

ibani_text: Ịrị oḅorisọ ḅara! Kiri ị dipinyẹ ma anị sópaghábịgha ḅọ́rọ́ anị parị fịịgha nḅẹḅẹ́.
english_text: How foolish! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies.

ibani_text: I nyẹ dipiarị sáá ịrị oju ma dipigha kụ́ma mgbọ́lụ ma, didigha fịtúrú mịẹ sịmgbọlụ anịgha jẹ́ kịrịnyẹ.
english_text: When you sow, you do not plant the body that will be, but just a seed, perhaps of wheat or of something else.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno ọ ḅụḅẹlẹ oju pa anị pịrịm, sịmgbọlụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ori warị anị oju pa anị pịrịị.
english_text: But God gives it a body as he has determined, and to each kind of seed he gives its own body.

ibani_text: Ojumẹnị mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara fịnịgha, túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ oju ḅara nyánam, nama jẹ́ oju ḅara nyánam, fíní jẹ́ oju, nji pịghị jẹ́ oju.
english_text: Not all flesh is the same: People have one kind of flesh, animals have another, birds another and fish another.

ibani_text: Sobie oju sọ imi, tuminikiri oju sọ imim, kụ́ma sobie oju ma fíafía ḅara imi, tuminikiri oju ma fíafía ḅara sọ imii.
english_text: There are also heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies; but the splendor of the heavenly bodies is one kind, and the splendor of the earthly bodies is another.

ibani_text: Ịrụa ma gbẹ́rẹ́ fíafía nyanam, akalụ́ ma sọ jẹ́ nyẹẹ, ḅálōló ma sọ pịghị jẹ́ nyẹẹ, ḅálōló ma so nnị kirikịrịm nna fíafía ḅụ.
english_text: The sun has one kind of splendor, the moon another and the stars another; and star differs from star in splendor.

ibani_text: Mịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara n fịịapụ saghịma bẹ sáá fịị ḅụ. Nnị dipi oju ma ḅụrụ́bẹm, nnị anị saghịma sáá anị mịnị ḅụrụbịghaa.
english_text: So will it be with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is sown is perishable, it is raised imperishable;

ibani_text: Nnị anị dipi sáá kuu nyanagha, nnị anị saghịmam ipine ḅụ, ịnyọ ḅụ ofori ḅụ nnị anị dipim, ịnyọ ḅụ nnị anị saghịmam.
english_text: it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;

ibani_text: Papa oju nnị anị dipim, tẹ́mẹ́ oju nnị anị saghịmam. Ḅọ́rọ́ papa oju imii, anịsáa tẹ́mẹ́ ngá oju ma sọ imiịbẹm.
english_text: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom, Parị Adam ma ḅo duma fịnịḅọ sọm, kunema Adam ma anịị duma pịrịarị tẹ́mẹ́ ma.
english_text: So it is written: “The first man Adam became a living being”; the last Adam, a life-giving spirit.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ nganyẹ ma tárị ḅogha, kụ́ma papanyẹ ma, anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, tẹ́mẹ́ nganyẹ maá.
english_text: The spiritual did not come first, but the natural, and after that the spiritual.

ibani_text: Parị Adam ma tuminikiri átụ́ma anịị n pa ọ tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ, mmẹẹ́ kárámá Adam ma sobie saghịḅom.
english_text: The first man was of the dust of the earth; the second man is of heaven.

ibani_text: Fịnị tuminikiri pịrịapụ ma, nnị tuminikiri n tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ma kịkam; fịnị sobie pịrịapụ ma pịghị sobie saghị ḅoḅọ ma kịkam.
english_text: As was the earthly man, so are those who are of the earth; and as is the heavenly man, so also are those who are of heaven.

ibani_text: Wa tuminikiri n tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ma kịká ḅara ori fịnị ḅara, anị wa sobie saghị ḅoḅọ ma kịká bẹ ḅara ori fịnị ḅara.
english_text: And just as we have borne the image of the earthly man, so shall webear the image of the heavenly man.

ibani_text: A dugho págháma ọ pịrịm, i jẹa mininiapụ, ojumẹnị na ọmbịnyẹ́ Tamuno amadakiri ma nyánáḅobịgha, anịgha ḅụrụ́ bẹ angaá nyẹ ma ine ḅụrụbịghaa nganyẹ ma nyánáḅobịgha.
english_text: I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

ibani_text: Pughu, a ḅọghunyẹ dugho ọ pịrị: wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịbịgha, kụ́ma n wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba dimabẹm
english_text: Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed—

ibani_text: anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ findi ḅụ, kunema ọdụ ma fie sáá. Ọdụ ma fiebẹm, fịịapụ ma nnị n saghịmabẹm mịnịfịbịgha oju ḅụ, wamịnị sọ dimabẹm.
english_text: in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.

ibani_text: Ḅụrụ́ bẹ oju ma ḅụrụbịghaa oju suabẹm, n pịghị fịị bẹnyẹ ma dima fịịbịgha nyẹ ḅụ suabẹm.
english_text: For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.

ibani_text: Ḅụrụ́ bẹ oju ma ḅụrụbịghaa oju ma sua sáá, pịghị fịị bẹnyẹ fịịbịgha oju ma sua sáá, anịsáa Tọ́ndiri ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọ́bẹm, dughonyẹ ḅẹ́, N sọ́ḅá ḅụ fịị mẹnịakịmam.
english_text: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”

ibani_text: Fịị ị́yẹ́ sọ́ḅa tẹ́ ngá imii? Fịị ị́yẹ́ kị́nị́ tẹ́ kụ́rọ tẹ́ ngá imii?
english_text: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”

ibani_text: Fịị anị kị́nị́ tẹ́ kụrọ nyánaḅom sii ḅara, sii pịghị anị kụ́rọ nyánaḅom ólóghó ma ḅara.
english_text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma imiẹḅa fịnị Tamuno pịrị mịẹsị wa sọḅaarịḅọ wámịna nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, ibi ijẹa mịnaapụ, ọ sẹ kụrọ, minima gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ọ jighema ma. Sámamgba ọ mịnị ọmịna ḅụgbọrụ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịrị ma pịrị, tegó o nimim ḅẹ́ ọmịna tọ́rụ́siarị Tamuno fịrị ma ḅụ papa faghaa.
english_text: Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.

ibani_text: Mị́sa a dugho ọ pịrị nnị daa Tamuno túminị́ pịrị daaigbii ma gbolomanyẹ: Galesia ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma, ọmịnị a dugho n pịrị ḅara mịẹ.
english_text: Now about the collection for the Lord’s people: Do what I told the Galatian churches to do.

ibani_text: Párị éné wiki gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii bịpị si warịị, n ḅọ nyáná igbii láa ḅara ḅụ, sị anị keke warị, sị a ḅo bẹ sa ọmịnị jẹ́ daaigbii daabịgha ḅara.
english_text: On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with your income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will have to be made.

ibani_text: A ḅo láa sáá, a nnị gboloma ábálálá gịẹ pa ọ tọ pághámaḅoapụ ma pịrịbẹm, si nnị ọmịna diepịrịnyẹ ma na pa Jerusalem fịrịma.
english_text: Then, when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem.

ibani_text: Anị ḅọ́rọ́ i nana sụsụ ḅẹ́ a muu, nnị i nana muubẹm.
english_text: If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me.

ibani_text: A Masidoniya bie ḅọ́rọ́ muu so sa, a sima ọ dámáḅobẹm tego Masidoniya bie anịị a ḅọ́rọ́ muu bẹnyẹ.
english_text: After I go through Macedonia, I will come to you—for I will be going through Macedonia.

ibani_text: Didigha, a kẹ́lẹ́ ọ nana dii fịnịbẹm anịgha ọ nana oḅuu sáá ma fama, ọmịnị ine ḅárásua ị pịrịbẹ ḅara a muu bẹ angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Perhaps I will stay with you for a while, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me on my journey, wherever I go.

ibani_text: A mị́sa tọ́rụ́ pa ọmịnị arịị dọghụgha, sị ḅụọ sẹgha kị́nị́ árị pa ọmịnị arịị, a bim a sááfáma kẹ́lẹ́ ọmịnị na fịnị, ḅọ́rọ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mini minii.
english_text: For I do not want to see you now and make only a passing visit; I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a mịnga Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ fịnịbẹm ákị muu Pẹntịkọs
english_text: But I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost,

ibani_text: tegó opu ḅụ́pọ́, pa ibifịrị nwángị bẹ ḅụ́pọ́ findi i pịrịmam, kụ́ma tọgha asọ mgbẹsẹapụ imii.
english_text: because a great door for effective work has opened to me, and there are many who oppose me.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Timoti ḅọ ḅoo, árị ḅẹ́, ori ọmịnị na fịnị samamgba ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅáláfama nyẹ arịbịgha, ḅẹ́ ọ Tamuno fịrị ma nwángịarị ịrịsọ nwángịarị ḅara.
english_text: When Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is carrying on the work of the Lord, just as I am.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ o dighisima ma, kụ́ma ọ ḅárásua ọ pịrị sị ori ọrẹ munyẹ muu diin ḅụ, ọ pịghịma i damaḅo bẹ ḅara, a ori na i jẹa mininiapụ ma tọ́rụ dighiarị.
english_text: No one, then, should treat him with contempt. Send him on his way in peace so that he may return to me. I am expecting him along with the brothers.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wámịna jẹa mininiḅọ Apọlọs gbolomanyẹ: A kụrọma dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ ori na isi mininiapụ ḅo ọmịnị arịị. Mị́sa ma o muu dọghụgha, kụ́ma o muubẹm ori asọ árị sáá.
english_text: Now about our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers. He was quite unwilling to go now, but he will go when he has the opportunity.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ́ kiri láa, sẹ kụrọ minini ma ḅụ, ọ tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọapụ sọ; ọ kụrọ fịnịị.
english_text: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be courageous; be strong.

ibani_text: Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ, ḅẹlẹma ḅụ.
english_text: Do everything in love.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ Stefanasi na ọwarịapụ gbolomanyẹ nimi, nnị anịị parị mininiapụ Akaya ḅụ, n pịghị nna ḅụ saghịm fịrịnwangị Tamuno túminị́ ma pịrịmam. A ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m, mịná owiapụ
english_text: You know that the household of Stephanas were the first converts in Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the service of the Lord’s people. I urge you, brothers and sisters,

ibani_text: ọ nwọfịnị túminị́ sịbịdá ma dua, na pịghị nnị na mịị fịrị ma nwangịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: to submit to such people and to everyone who joins in the work and labors at it.

ibani_text: I bieḅẹlẹm Stefanasi, Fotunatọs na Akaikosi ḅo láa sáá, wa pálịma sị ọmịnị ine pa wa pịrịgha nyẹ, nnị pa wa pịrịmam.
english_text: I was glad when Stephanas, Fortunatus and Achaicus arrived, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị wámịna tẹ́mẹ́ sị suumam nnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ sị warị suu ḅara. Nwọfịnị owiapụ ọmịnị nnị pa kuu soma.
english_text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours also. Such men deserve recognition.

ibani_text: Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnị sọsị mamgba nna sịbịpị fịrịmam. Akwila na Pirisiliya na pịghị nna wárị donaarị sọsị ma tẹ́mẹ́ láa sịbịpị fịrịmam.
english_text: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Priscillagreet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.

ibani_text: Mịnga fịnị wa jẹa mininiapụ mamgba fịrịmam ḅẹ a o bii. Ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅolo Tamuno ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: All the brothers and sisters here send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

ibani_text: Irịị Pọl i ḅara na mịná sịbịpị ma gịẹm.
english_text: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gbonyẹ n ḅọ sịbị ọgọnọ. Yei Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Ḅoo!
english_text: If anyone does not love the Lord, let that person be cursed! Come, Lord!

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị na fịnị.
english_text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ọmịnị Krais Jizọs bie fịnịapụ ma na fịnịị. Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.

ibani_text: Irị Pọl, Jizọs Krais fịrịmaḅọ, na pịghị wámịna numboru owitụ́wọ Timoti anịị mị diri ma gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarịapụ, ọmịnị Tamuno sọsị ma Kọrịntị ma bie fịnịapụ na pịghị Tamuno awọ mamgba Akaya gbọrụ ḅụ fịnịapụ.
english_text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, To the church of God in Corinth, together with all his holy people throughout Achaia:

ibani_text: Tamuno wámịna Daḅọ na pịghị wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Túminí fịnị Tamuno ma pịrịị na pịghị wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais Daḅọ, lolomakúkúbie nyáná Daḅọ, biedịịnma mamgba sághị ḅara ḅoarị Tamuno,
english_text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort,

ibani_text: biedịịnma pa wa pịrịarịḅọ wámịna ḅụḅáláḅálá mamgba ḅụ, wamịnị sọ pịghị ine tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅụḅáláḅálá bie fịnịapụ bie diinma bẹ ḅara, wa Tamuno ḅara nyáná ḅo biedịịnma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.

ibani_text: Wa diekiri nyáná ḅara ma Krais mánámāná tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ, anị ḅara ma anị wa pịghị Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, diekiri nyána ḅara Tamuno opu biedịịnma ḅụ.
english_text: For just as we share abundantly in the sufferings of Christ, so also our comfort abounds through Christ.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́siarịrị, anịị ọmịna biedịịnma pịghị ọmịna dụaḅọ́rọ́ma, wa ḅọ́rọ́ biedịịnma nyáná nyáná, ọmịnị sọ biedịịnma nyanam n pịghị mgịrịma ịnyọ ma pa ọ pịrịm sị ọmịnị sọ ine wamịnị arịarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma daa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: If we are distressed, it is for your comfort and salvation; if we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you patient endurance of the same sufferings we suffer.

ibani_text: Anịgo wámịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ọ fịnị angaá jéné n jéné jighegha, wa nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị wa mịná tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ diekiri nyáná ḅara ma anịị ọmịnị sọ wa nyáná ḅo biedịịnma ḅụ diekiri nyáná ḅara.
english_text: And our hope for you is firm, because we know that just as you share in our sufferings, so also you share in our comfort.

ibani_text: I Daa awọ, wa dọ́ghụm o nimi wa la ḅụḅáláḅálá Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ. N dighi wamịnị ọgọnọ kóróma ikúnyẹ ma, opuma dụḅam pịghị opuma ikum ḅẹẹ wa sịgha ḅẹ́ wa dumabẹm.
english_text: We do not want you to be uninformed, brothers and sisters,about the troubles we experienced in the province of Asia. We were under great pressure, far beyond our ability to endure, so that we despaired of life itself.

ibani_text: Anị wa ḅụ fịnị ḅara anị n fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ pịrịapụ nna sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ. Mịma go kiriakịnyẹ ọ́ wa wámịna ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánábịgha ḅara, kụ́ma Tamuno ḅụ ori ngéré fịịapụ sághịmaarịḅọ.
english_text: Indeed, we felt we had received the sentence of death. But this happened that we might not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.

ibani_text: Kụ́rọ ḅáláfama fịị kụ́rọ ḅụ ọ wa ḅọ́rọ́mam ọ pịghị wa ḅọ́rọ́mabẹm, wa pịghị wámịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ pa ọ ḅụ gbánām ḅẹ ọ pịghị sima wa ḅọ́rọ́mabẹm,
english_text: He has delivered us from such a deadly peril, and he will deliver us again. On him we have set our hope that he will continue to deliver us,

ibani_text: ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́ghẹ̄ pa ḅárásua wa pịrịarị gosi. Tọghaapụ Tamuno túmíníbẹm wámịna sịbị, ọ nyána wa pịrị ibi gosi, anịị tọgha túminị́ wa sịbị go tẹ́ghẹ́arị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma gosi.
english_text: as you help us by your prayers. Then many will give thanks on our behalf for the gracious favor granted us in answer to the prayers of many.

ibani_text: Wa bịpịkpọm ḅẹẹ wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie kụ́rọ kúkúbie pa wa pịrịm ḅẹẹ wámịna duma mị tuminikiri wa pịghị ibima ó nana nyáná gboloma mịẹnyẹ ma, ọ́ Tamuno ḅara sághị ḅo karakárá, na gbụ́nụ́nụ́ na Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ nyẹ́nimi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́gha pa.
english_text: Now this is our boast: Our conscience testifies that we have conducted ourselves in the world, and especially in our relations with you, with integrityand godly sincerity. We have done so, relying not on worldly wisdom but on God’s grace.

ibani_text: Wa jẹ́ ịwọ diri gịẹ ọ fịrịmagha kụ́ma ọ́ o goo sị akanyaḅo bẹnyẹ, a mininim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị akanyaḅo mú kunema lábẹm.
english_text: For we do not write you anything you cannot read or understand. And I hope that,

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sọ pịghị kálá ḅara pa wamịnị akanyaḅo ḅara, ḅẹ́ wamịnị go anị o go bịpịkpọ na ibii nyẹ, ọmịnị ma pịghị wámịna nyẹ ḅara ma Wányánáḅọ Jizọs Krais sima ḅo bẹ éné.
english_text: as you have understood us in part, you will come to understand fully that you can boast of us just as we will boast of you in the day of the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: I tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ mịnanyẹ mamgba pịrịm anị a go ọrụtọ nyẹ parị ma ḅụ sị á ọ fịnịanga ḅo sị mmẹẹ́ karịiḅi ọmịna nyẹ sọọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Because I was confident of this, I wanted to visit you first so that you might benefit twice.

ibani_text: A tọọm ḅẹ́ a ọ fịnịanga ḅobẹm, a ḅọ́rọ́ Masidoniya múuarị sa, a pịghị ḅọ́rọ́ sooarị sa, sị a ọ ḅara ḅárásua nyánábeḅara a ḅọ́rọ́ Judiya muu bẹ sa.
english_text: I wanted to visit you on my way to Macedonia and to come back to you from Macedonia, and then to have you send me on my way to Judea.

ibani_text: A mịma tọarị sa, a sárásárá ḅara pa ịḅụ warịị́? A iyẹ nyẹ tọarị sa a tuminikiriapụ ḅara pa anị tọ́ọ, sị tẹ́lẹ́ma fịnị sị Innh, innh na Errnh, errnh ḅẹ́ anị gbẹ́rẹ́sa ma ḅụ?
english_text: Was I fickle when I intended to do this? Or do I make my plans in a worldly manner so that in the same breath I say both “Yes, yes” and “No, no”?

ibani_text: Tamuno karakárá ḅụ fịnị ḅára ma a minini ọ pịrịnyẹ ma Innh na Errnh errnhgha.
english_text: But as surely as God is faithful, our message to you is not “Yes” and “No.”

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais Tamuno Tụwọ, Sailas na Timoti na ịrị ma dugho wásáma ọ pịrịḅọ ma, ori Innh na Errnh errnhḅogha, kụ́ma ọ ḅụ Tamuno Innh ngéré ḅẹm.
english_text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us—by me and Silasand Timothy—was not “Yes” and “No,” but in him it has always been “Yes.”

ibani_text: Ori anị Innh ma sị pa Tamuno minini nyẹ mamgba pịrị. Mịma go Tamuno Jizọs Krais ḅụ sámámgba Innh ḅẹm, wa anị ḅẹ́ pa Tamuno bomaarị.
english_text: For no matter how many promises God has made, they are “Yes” in Christ. And so through him the “Amen” is spoken by us to the glory of God.

ibani_text: Wamịnị na ọ́ nana miẹgbolomaarịḅọ anịị Tamuno ori ma anị pịghị pulo pa wa sịbị saramaá ḅọ.
english_text: Now it is God who makes both us and you stand firm in Christ. He anointed us,

ibani_text: Ori anịị ọrẹ ilíghíma suamaá ḅọ wámịna ḅụ, pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa wa pịrịmaá ḅo wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie, mịma anị ọ pa wa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọma ọ nyáná kóróma wa pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: set his seal of ownership on us, and put his Spirit in our hearts as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.

ibani_text: A Tamuno siim ị́yẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ ori i tẹ́mẹ́bie nimim! A ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrị dọghụgha ḅara gosi, anị a goo mịnị Kọrịntị ḅogha nyẹ.
english_text: I call God as my witness—and I stake my life on it—that it was in order to spare you that I did not return to Corinth.

ibani_text: Ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ wa dugho ọ pịrịarị ḅẹ́ ọ minini, wa nimim ḅẹ́ ọ sẹ kụrọm ọmịna minini ḅụ, Anịmanakaragha wamịnị ó nana nwángị gbólomaarị ọmịna bieḅẹlẹ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Not that we lord it over your faith, but we work with you for your joy, because it is by faith you stand firm.

ibani_text: Anịgo a kọọpẹ́lẹ́mam ị tẹmẹbie ḅẹ́, a mịnị sima ọ dámáḅobịgha a ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ simabịgha ḅara.
english_text: So I made up my mind that I would not make another painful visit to you.

ibani_text: A ọ tẹ́mẹ́ miẹsima sa, tụọ kọọ bẹ sị i tẹmẹ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma? Kụ́ma ọmịnị a tẹ́mẹ́ miẹsimaapụ ma.
english_text: For if I grieve you, who is left to make me glad but you whom I have grieved?

ibani_text: Anị a go anị ábálálá ma gịẹ ọ pịrịnyẹ. A bigha ḅẹ́ a ọ damaḅo, sị i tẹmẹ miẹḅẹ́lémaapụ ma, ḅo i tẹ́mẹ́ miẹsima. A itẹ́mẹ́bie mininim ḅẹ́ ị bieḅẹlẹarị sa, ọmịnị mamgba sọ bieḅẹ́lẹ́bẹm.
english_text: I wrote as I did, so that when I came I would not be distressed by those who should have made me rejoice. I had confidence in all of you, that you would all share my joy.

ibani_text: Opu ḅụḅáláḅálá na tọ́rụ́siarị bie fịnị tẹ́mẹ́ na tọgha owu mingi, anị a pa mị ábálálá ma gịẹ ọ pịrịarịnyẹ. A gịẹgha ḅẹ́ a pa ọ tẹ́mẹ́ sima, kụ́ma ọ́ pa diepágháma a ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅẹlẹma lama ḅará.
english_text: For I wrote you out of great distress and anguish of heart and with many tears, not to grieve you but to let you know the depth of my love for you.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ jụghọ tẹ́mẹ́ simamam, n ḅọ i mịẹgha, kụ́ma ọ mịnị kị́nị́mamgba anị n ḅo mịẹnyẹ anịgha ọmịna ḅụ jẹapụ. A go mịma dughonyẹ, a bigha a kụ́rọ na tumḅọ ma na mịẹ.
english_text: If anyone has caused grief, he has not so much grieved me as he has grieved all of you to some extent—not to put it too severely.

ibani_text: Anị ibimam ḅẹ́ tọghaapụ mị tumḅọ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam mị ḅara ma.
english_text: The punishment inflicted on him by the majority is sufficient.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ mị́sa, o siiḅụḅárasi ọ pịrị sị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ kụ́rọ́ma sị opu tẹ́mẹ́sii gbẹ́rẹ́sa o dighiákị so bigha ḅara.
english_text: Now instead, you ought to forgive and comfort him, so that he will not be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow.

ibani_text: Anịgo a ọ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ọ mịẹsị o nimi ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ibima ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: I urge you, therefore, to reaffirm your love for him.

ibani_text: A go mị diri ma gịẹ ọ pịrịnyẹ a nimi dọ́ghụm ọ mịnị ine sẹ daádighi ma pịrị ḅara, ọ pighi bịpịpúghúu ḅara nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Another reason I wrote you was to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in everything.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị siiḅụḅarasi siinyẹ pa ọmieapụ pịrị sa, irịsọ pịghị siiḅụḅárasi n pịrịm. Ḅọ́rọ́ karakáráma, a siiḅụḅarasi ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pịrịm, a anị mịẹarị Krais tórúku ọmịna sịbị gosi.
english_text: Anyone you forgive, I also forgive. And what I have forgiven—if there was anything to forgive—I have forgiven in the sight of Christ for your sake,

ibani_text: Satanị kụ́rọḅa ḅara nyánábịgha ḅara wámịna ḅụ tegó? Wamịnị ọrẹ aka na ọrẹ egberi nimim.
english_text: in order that Satan might not outwit us. For we are not unaware of his schemes.

ibani_text: A ḅo Troas la sa ḅẹ́ a Krais gboloma ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa, a arịḅom ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ asọ findi i pịrịmam ḅẹẹ a fịrị nwángịị anị ngaa.
english_text: Now when I went to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ and found that the Lord had opened a door for me,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Ikúkúbie opuma ḅụḅáláḅálá pa i pịrịm, a ine ị́yẹ́ mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Taitọs arịgha go. A warị anị ngaa fịnị túminị́ ma ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ibima fịnịị, a warị anị angaá ḅọ́rọ́ Masidoniya muu.
english_text: I still had no peace of mind, because I did not find my brother Titus there. So I said goodbye to them and went on to Macedonia.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹm. Ḅẹ́, wamịnị na Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ ḅụ, Tamuno Krais ḅụ, ḅọ́rọ́ sọọḅa pa wa pịrịarị, ọ pịghị wámịna ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mịẹsị Krais níminyẹ ma kụ́nụ́ pulo kụ́nụ́ ḅara pa kụ́nụ́ ngámámgba saama.
english_text: But thanks be to God, who always leads us as captives in Christ’s triumphal procession and uses us to spread the aroma of the knowledge of him everywhere.

ibani_text: Wamịnị, wa fịnị ḅara anị kụ́nụ́ insẹnsị fịnị ḅara, Krais tọndi Tamuno pịrịnyẹ kụ́nụ́ wasa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánáarịapụ mamgba pịrịarị na pịghị faarịapụ ma sọ pịrị.
english_text: For we are to God the pleasing aroma of Christ among those who are being saved and those who are perishing.

ibani_text: Faarịapụ ma anịị, fụ́rụ kị́nị́ḅa bẹ fụ́rụ, kụ́ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánáarịapụ anịị duma pịrị kụ́nụ. Tụọ anịsa ine ọkọfịnị fịrịnwangị bẹ.
english_text: To the one we are an aroma that brings death; to the other, an aroma that brings life. And who is equal to such a task?

ibani_text: Wamịnị wa isi tọghaapụ fịnị ḅara fịnịgha, Tamuno oku ma pa fẹ́ dẹrị sị sọnyẹ mịẹ, kụ́ma Tamuno wa fịrịmamam gosi, ọrẹ fịrịnwangịapụ ḅara, wa karakárá ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọm Tamuno tórúku.
english_text: Unlike so many, we do not peddle the word of God for profit. On the contrary, in Christ we speak before God with sincerity, as those sent from God.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ mịẹarị ḅara ma, wa wámịna mịẹnyẹ gboloma diri akuo ọ pịrị ḅẹ́, wamịnị ọ damaḅo sáá, anịgha wa ọmịna ḅara diri mpara bii, kụ́rọ pa wa pịrịarịnyẹ ḅẹ́ wamịnị ọ damaḅo.
english_text: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we need, like some people, letters of recommendation to you or from you?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anịị wámịna diri wa gịẹnyẹ wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie, kị́nị́mamgba árị sị pịghị anịgoo.
english_text: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone.

ibani_text: Ḅọghugha, ọmịnị anịị Krais ọ ḅara na gịẹ diri sị pa wamịna ḅara ḅụ fịrịma, Nyẹ́gie ḅuruma pa anị gịẹgha, kụ́ma dumafịnị Tamuno ma Tẹ́mẹ́, n pịghị dapịrị ọ́gọ́nọ anị gịẹgha kụ́ma túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́bie.
english_text: You show that you are a letter from Christ, the result of our ministry, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts.

ibani_text: Wa go mịma dughonyẹ, Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, wa Tamuno ḅụ biekpọ nyanam.
english_text: Such confidence we have through Christ before God.

ibani_text: Wámịna ḅụbie ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ofori, mịẹsị wa go ine dughoarịnyẹ ḅẹẹ, wa ine mị fịrị ma nwángịbẹm. Wa nyáná ịnyọ ma Tamuno ḅara anị́ị́ anị sághị ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: Not that we are competent in ourselves to claim anything for ourselves, but our competence comes from God.

ibani_text: Ori anị wa mịẹ kụrọma sị wamịnị ine fịrịnwangị ịwọ ọ ḅoo ma pịrịnyẹ, mị ịwọ ọḅọọ ma, anịị n gịẹ kóróma ịwọ ólóghó nyánágha, kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma angaánye, n gịẹ kóróma ólóghó ma, fịị dighiḅom; kụ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma duma pịrịm.
english_text: He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant—not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma dapịrị ọ́gọ́nọ anị́ị́ nnị anị sughu kórómanyẹ, Tamuno ipine pịghị anị ḅụ diem, nnị ólóghó ma ḅọ́rọ́ma pịrị sa, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ Mosis tórúku gbẹ́ẹ̄ ipine ma sághị ẹmẹfaarị, anị pa opuma kụrọm, sị Izirẹlịawọ ine nna tọ́rụ́ pa Mosis tọ́rụ́ ogbo dighigha. Ḅọ́rọ́ fịị dighi ólóghó ma ọkọfịnị ipine akuom anị fịrịnwangịarị sa.
english_text: Now if the ministry that brought death, which was engraved in letters on stone, came with glory, so that the Israelites could not look steadily at the face of Moses because of its glory, transitory though it was,
