ibani_text: Anịsa fịnị Tẹ́mẹ́ fịrị ma pịrịbẹ ipine, anị dụḅa tọrọ́ láa bẹ?
english_text: will not the ministry of the Spirit be even more glorious?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ fịị ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ akuoarị nyẹ ma ipine nyanam, anịsa mịẹsị Tamuno wa daákịarị ọḅọọ ma anị ipine tọrọ́ fịnị bẹ?
english_text: If the ministry that brought condemnation was glorious, how much more glorious is the ministry that brings righteousness!

ibani_text: Parị sa opuma ipine nyánányẹ pa mị́sa kụrọma biaarị ipine ma na tọ́ma sa, tumḅọ ine dughobẹm ḅẹ́ parị nyẹ ma ipine nyanagha.
english_text: For what was glorious has no glory now in comparison with the surpassing glory.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ẹmẹẹfáarị nyẹ ma ipine na ḅom, anịsa fịnị gbámásó ọḅọọ ma anị ipine dụḅa tọrọ́ la bẹ!
english_text: And if what was transitory came with glory, how much greater is the glory of that which lasts!

ibani_text: Wa mị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma nyánam gosi, wa kị́nị́ dighigha.
english_text: Therefore, since we have such a hope, we are very bold.

ibani_text: Wamịnị wa Mosis fịnị ḅara fịnịgha tórúku gbẹbịtẹ pa ọ tórúku gbẹẹḅọ sị Izirẹlịawọ ọrẹ baá ma árị anị ḅuruḅuru si pịghị ẹmẹẹfáa.
english_text: We are not like Moses, who would put a veil over his face to prevent the Israelites from seeing the end of what was passing away.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, nna kóróma pụ́ụ́m, sị ḅo mịmgba éné ma láa, n pa bịtẹ pa nna kóróma gbẹm, nnị olom ọḅọọ ma diri gooarị sa. Nnị bịtẹ ma nụ́nụ́ sịbẹm tumḅọ amịna ḅụ pa Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ sa ngéré.
english_text: But their minds were made dull, for to this day the same veil remains when the old covenant is read. It has not been removed, because only in Christ is it taken away.

ibani_text: Mịmgba éné sọ, n Mosis ólóghó ma goo sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, tọ́rúkugbe bịtẹ ma pa nna kóróma gbẹarị.
english_text: Even to this day when Moses is read, a veil covers their hearts.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tumḅọ amịna sii ḅụ pịghị sị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma dua sa, tórúku gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ ma nnị anị nụ́nụ́siim.
english_text: But whenever anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ori anịị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, Kịnịyánáḅọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma fịnị angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ asọ pụ́ma nyẹ oforiofori.
english_text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

ibani_text: Wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku gbẹ́gha pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ipine ma arịm anị bia wámịna tọ́rụ́bie sọọ ḅara, wa pịghị dima dima si pịghị okịkaarị ḅara, sámámgba ḅụ sẹnịarị ipine Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara saghị ḅo nyẹ ori anịị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma.
english_text: And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplatethe Lord’s glory, are being transformed into his image with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọrẹ lolomakúkúbie ḅụ mị fịrị ma pa wa pịrịmam ḅẹ́ wa nwángị, anịgo gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ mịẹbịgha si wámịna tẹ́mẹ́ oḅudáa.
english_text: Therefore, since through God’s mercy we have this ministry, we do not lose heart.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọghu na pịghị ḅụ́gịrịrịma fịrị mamgba sịghịmam, anịmanakaragha wa karakárá mamgba dughom túminị́ tórúku anị fịnị na ibiḅara, sị túminị́ wa nimi bẹ ḅara, pịghị nimi nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅẹ́ wa kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma karakárányẹ Tamuno tórúku.
english_text: Rather, we have renounced secret and shameful ways; we do not use deception, nor do we distort the word of God. On the contrary, by setting forth the truth plainly we commend ourselves to everyone’s conscience in the sight of God.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wa dugho pághámaarị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅọghu angaá imi, anị ḅọghu angaá fịnị faarịapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing.

ibani_text: Mịị tuminikiri tamuno ma mininighaapụ ma kóróma tọ́rụ́pụ́mamam anịgo nnị ine baá ma arịgha anịị Krais ipine gboloma sị ibi oku ma ḅụ sághị ḅoarị baá, ori ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́sa Tamuno ma na kịkaḅọ.
english_text: The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they cannot see the light of the gospel that displays the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

ibani_text: Wa wámịna ḅụ dugho wásámagha, kụma wa Krais dugho wásámaarị ḅẹ́ ori anị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ sị wamịnị, ọmịna fịrịnwangịapụ Jizọs ẹrẹ́sị.
english_text: For what we preach is not ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus’ sake.

ibani_text: Dugho Tamuno ma ḅẹẹ, Kánákáná ma bie baá bia pághábẹm! Mịị gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ma anị mịẹsị ọri baá bia wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie sọọ nyẹ. Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, wa Tamuno ipine nimi ḅụ sághị ḅoarị baá ma nyanam biarị nyẹ Krais tọ́rụ́ ogbo.
english_text: For God, who said, “Let light shine out of darkness,”made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wamịnị mị ngọ ma nyánam ọ́rọ átụ́ma ḅẹlẹbie pa diepágháma ḅẹ́ kụrọmamgba nẹ́ngị kụ́rọ Tamuno ḅara sághị ḅom, wámịna ḅara sághịḅogha.
english_text: But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.

ibani_text: Sa ḅụ akị mú sa la, ḅụḅáláḅálá wa lam asọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ kụ́ma ḅụḅáláḅálá ma wa gbẹḅagha, jẹ́ sa wa tẹ́mẹ́bie mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹm; kụ́ma wa jighegha wámịna biekpọ ḅụ.
english_text: We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair;

ibani_text: Nnị wa pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam kụ́ma Tamuno wa dighi tọ́rụ́sigha; nnị wa fomu gbim kụ́ma wa gulugulumagha.
english_text: persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.

ibani_text: Sámámgba wa wámịna mẹnị oju ḅụ Jizọs fịị ma dighi ikelekelearị, Jizọs duma ma anị ḅụ diepágháma bẹ ḅara wámịna ḅụbie.
english_text: We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body.

ibani_text: Wámịna duma éné mamgba fịị wamịnị na imi Jizọs gosi, sị túminị́ ori duma árị bẹ ḅara wámịna mẹnị oju ma ḅụ.
english_text: For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus’ sake, so that his life may also be revealed in our mortal body.

ibani_text: Mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́ fịị fịrịwangịarị wámịna duma bie, kụ́ma duma fịrịwangịarị ọmịna bie.
english_text: So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in you.

ibani_text: Tamuno diri ma dughoarị ḅẹ́, A ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọm a mininim gosi. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ minini ma, wamịnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọm wa mininim gosi.
english_text: It is written: “I believed; therefore I have spoken.”Since we have that same spirit offaith, we also believe and therefore speak,

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹẹ, Tamuno, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs sághị duma bie suaḅọ pịghị wamịnị na Jizọs saghịmabẹm, n pịghị wamịnị na ọ́ nana kobirịbẹm ọ tórúku.
english_text: because we know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus from the dead will also raise us with Jesus and present us with you to himself.

ibani_text: Mịị mamgba ọ ọmịna sịbị go, sị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ mú tọgha tọghaapụ la sa, nnị tọgha tẹ́ghẹ̄ ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹbẹm ọrẹ ipine ḅụ.
english_text: All this is for your benefit, so that the grace that is reaching more and more people may cause thanksgiving to overflow to the glory of God.

ibani_text: Mịma go anị wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie kụrọmagha sọ, wamịnị ọkọ minighaa, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ wámịna ojumẹnị kẹ́lẹ́kẹlẹ ḅụrụarị, kụ́ma wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie duma ma anịị ene gbọrụ gbọrụ ḅụ nnị anị mịẹ iwomaarị.
english_text: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ mị kálá sáátụọ ḅụ wámịnị arịarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma, dụḅa wásáma gbámásó boma akuoo wa pịrịbẹm wamịnị árị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma nẹ́ngịbẹm.
english_text: For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all.

ibani_text: Wa wámịna tọ́rụ́ pa wamịnị arịarị nyẹ ḅụ gbánāgha kụ́ma tọ́rụ́ arịgha nyẹ ḅụ, tọ́rụ́ arịarị nyẹ ma fịnị ḅọlọgha kụ́ma tọ́rụ́ arịgha nyẹ ma fịnị gbámásom.
english_text: So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but on what is unseen, since what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wa nimim ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ wa bie angaá wárị ma mịẹ tuminikiri kaaka, wa Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo wárị nyánam sobie, túminị́ ḅara pa namaghaa nyẹ, sị fịnị mú gbámásó la bẹnyẹ.
english_text: For we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wamịnị inighiarị, wa pụghọ tarịarị ḅẹ́ nnị wámịna sobie wárị ma pa wa suaa.
english_text: Meanwhile we groan, longing to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling,

ibani_text: Tegó nnị mịị wárị ma pa wa sua sa, wa mịnị pápáḅụ ḅụ fịnịbịgha.
english_text: because when we are clothed, we will not be found naked.

ibani_text: Wa mị tuminikiri wárị ma ḅụ fịnịarị sa wamịnị iniigharị nnị pụ́nụ́maarịapụ ḅara ma, ḅẹgha ḅẹ́, wa mị tuminikiri ojumẹnị ma wárịso dọ́ghụm, kụ́ma wa bim ḅẹ́ nnị sobie anganyẹ ma pa wámịna ọgọnọ sua, sị duma fịị bẹnyẹ ma dima.
english_text: For while we are in this tent, we groan and are burdened, because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

ibani_text: Tamuno anị wa tẹ́lẹ́ma mị dima ma pịrịarịḅọ ọ pịghị ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa wa pịrịm sị anị sẹpịrịḅọ sọ wa pịrị, ọ nyáná kóróma wa pịrịnyẹ mamgba pịrị.
english_text: Now the one who has fashioned us for this very purpose is God, who has given us the Spirit as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.

ibani_text: Anịgo sámámgba wa biekpọ nyánam, wa nimim bẹ wa tuminikiri ojumẹnị ḅụ fịnị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, wa ḅọlọ angaá ḅụ imi Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ wárị ma ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore we are always confident and know that as long as we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord.

ibani_text: Wa minini pa dúmakọm, wa tọ́rụ́ pa arịnyẹgha.
english_text: For we live by faith, not by sight.

ibani_text: Wamịnị opuma biekpọ nyánam tụ́ma biiarị ḅẹ́, wa mị tuminikiri ojumẹnị wárị ma wáriso sị mú ámáọ́gọ́nọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ na fịnị
english_text: We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ, wa bim ḅẹ́, wa ọ tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma mịnga oju ma bie anịgha fịị sị so oju ma bie.
english_text: So we make it our goal to please him, whether we are at home in the body or away from it.

ibani_text: Wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ Krais ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ḅụ sẹbẹm, sị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ amịna fịrị fịnị ḅara ḅụ gbẹ́ẹnyẹ nyánábẹm, anị ibii-o, anị sii-o, n ḅo duma bie.
english_text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each of us may receive what is due us for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad.

ibani_text: Wa nimim Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dighi ḅáláfa dughoarịnyẹ, anịgo, wa ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma túminị́ tẹ́ghẹ̄m. Tamuno káara ḅara pa wa nimim, ọmịnị sọ pịghị wa nimim.
english_text: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade others. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your conscience.

ibani_text: Wa pịghị mị́sa sima wa ḅụ túminí ọ pịrịgha, tụ́ma wa pa ọ pịrịarị ọ go wa pa bịpịkpọ bẹnyẹ. Si ọmịnị sọ ine n pagharaa bẹ ḅara, bịpịkpọ nnị tọ́rụ́ pa árịarị nyẹ pịrịarịapụ, sị túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnịnyẹ wárịso.
english_text: We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna sịbịbie karakáragha? Tamuno gosi anịị anịgo karakáragha nyẹ, anịgha ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna sịbịbie karakárá? Anị karakáram, ọmịna sịbị go.
english_text: If we are “out of our mind,” as some say, it is for God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.

ibani_text: Krais ḅẹlẹma anịị wa sumaarịnyẹ tegó anị wa ḅụ korom ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ fịị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́ nnị kị́nị́mamgba fịịm.
english_text: For Christ’s love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died.

ibani_text: Ọ fịị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịm, sị dumaapụ mịnị duma nna ḅụ pịrịbịgha, kụ́ma n duma ọ pịrịbẹm, fịị sị pịghị fịị ḅụ saghị ḅo nna sịbị go.
english_text: And he died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised again.

ibani_text: Wa mịnị kị́nị́ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọgha tuminikiri ólóghó ḅara ḅụ karakárányẹ bẹ gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri wa tuminikiriapụ ólóghó pa Krais sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm, wamịnị jẹ́ pa ọkọ mịẹbịgha.
english_text: So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view. Though we once regarded Christ in this way, we do so no longer.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n ḅọ ịwọma nnị tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ sọmam olom nyẹ ma somam, iwọnyẹ ma ḅomam.
english_text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come:The old has gone, the new is here!

ibani_text: Mịmámgba, Tamuno anịị Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị mịẹarịḅọ, iruonaapụ ḅọ́rọ́ma ọrẹ a nángwọ́apụ pa wa mịẹḅọ fịrị ma pa wa ḅárábie sua.
english_text: All this is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation:

ibani_text: Wámịna oku dughoarị ḅẹẹ Tamuno Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri gbọrụ pa ọrẹ nángwọ́apụ mịẹarị Tamuno nna sii kịẹ kubirigha, kụ́ma ori oku ma pa wa pịrịmam, dugho pághámaarị nyẹ ọ ḅara warị nangwọapụ pa nnị mịẹarị ḅara.
english_text: that God was reconciling the world to himself in Christ, not counting people’s sins against them. And he has committed to us the message of reconciliation.

ibani_text: Wamịnị anị mị́sa sẹ Krais pịrịarịapụ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno wa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị. Wa Krais sịbị go ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị; ḅẹẹ Tamuno iruonaapụ ḅụ ọ pịghị mú ọrẹ nangwọapụ sọọ.
english_text: We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.

ibani_text: Krais, sii ḅụ ofori ḅọ, Tamuno mịẹm o siiḅọ sọọ wa pịrị sị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wa ḅo Tamuno karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: God made him who had no sin to be sinfor us, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

ibani_text: Wamịnị na Tamuno na nwángị gbólomaarị fịrị ma, wamịnị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m, ọmịnị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyánámaapụ ḅẹẹ ọmịnị anị guluguluma ma.
english_text: As God’s co-workers we urge you not to receive God’s grace in vain.

ibani_text: Ọ náa Tamuno dughonyẹ, Sáá la sa ḅẹ́ a tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná ọ pịrịị a o naam, a ọ ḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ éné ma láa sáá, a ḅárásua ọ pịrịm. O pughu mị́sa anịị ọ Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná na ibi sáá; mịmgba éné anịị ḅọ́rọ́ma éné ma.
english_text: For he says, “In the time of my favor I heard you, and in the day of salvation I helped you.” I tell you, now is the time of God’s favor, now is the day of salvation.

ibani_text: Wa bigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ irima nyẹ árị wámịna fịrị ḅụ, anịgo wamịnị sọ wa ḅụ́kọ́rọ́maarị wamịnị asọ mgbẹsẹnyẹ sọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pịrịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: We put no stumbling block in anyone’s path, so that our ministry will not be discredited.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, wamịnị wa ḅụ diearị ḅẹ́ wamịnị Tamunofịrị nwángịapụ, wa ḅụḅáláḅálá na ḅụ́kụro na ḅụdányẹ ngịrịmaarị ḅara.
english_text: Rather, as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way: in great endurance; in troubles, hardships and distresses;

ibani_text: Nnị fom nyẹ pa wa fomam, nnị wa pa ikólibie suam, túminị́ wa gbiri ikelema sị wa fom nnị ịnyọfama fịrị pa wa fịrịmam, wa múno pa wa tọ́rụ́ḅámam pịghị ḅuru pa wa ḅáma.
english_text: in beatings, imprisonments and riots; in hard work, sleepless nights and hunger;

ibani_text: Wa wámịna ḅụ fiafiama ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna níminyẹ, ngịrịma na ibiamịẹnyẹ wa wámịna ḅụ diemam ḅẹẹ wamịnị Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ Tamuno Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị wámịna karakárá ḅẹlẹma,
english_text: in purity, understanding, patience and kindness; in the Holy Spirit and in sincere love;

ibani_text: Wámịna karakárá oku na pịghị Tamuno kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Wa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ nyánam wa pa ọ́mụ́gbinyẹ, amaḅara ḅụ na pịghị ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: in truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left;

ibani_text: Nnị wa sághị sóghólomam pịghị wa ḅụ́gịrịrịma, nnị wa wirim pịghị wa túminí, nnị epeletiapụ pa wa siim, anịsọ wa pa karakárányẹ ma dughom.
english_text: through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine, yet regarded as impostors;

ibani_text: Wa túminị́ nímighaapụ fịnị ḅara fịnịm, anịsọ kị́nị́mamgba wánimim, wa fịịmaapụ kịkam kụ́ma ọmịnị árị ḅara ḅụ, wa pa dumafịnịm, nnị wa pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam kụ́ma nnị wa ḅagha.
english_text: known, yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten, and yet not killed;

ibani_text: Nnị wa biesimam, wa pa sámámgba bieḅẹlẹarị, wa igonyinapụ kịkam, kụ́ma wa tọgha tọghaapụ pa álásọ́maarị, wa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyánágháapụ kịkam, anịsọ wa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyánam.
english_text: sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having nothing, and yet possessing everything.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ Kọrịntị ibi nangwọapụ wa karakárá ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịmam, wa pịghị wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie findimam.
english_text: We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians, and opened wide our hearts to you.

ibani_text: Wa minigha wa tẹ́mẹ́bie gbẹ́ẹ̄ ọ pịrịapụ, kụ́ma ọmịnị anị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ịkasị wa pịrịapụ.
english_text: We are not withholding our affection from you, but you are withholding yours from us.

ibani_text: A ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrịarị soḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị furobie a yii awọ: pa wa die wa nyáná ọ pịrị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ma, ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ findi wásámáa.
english_text: As a fair exchange—I speak as to my children—open wide your hearts also.

ibani_text: Mini mininighaapụ na fịrịnwangị gboloma ma bẹ ọmịnị nnị na gbasịm, anị ine ọkọfịnịbịgha. Karakárányẹ na irima nyẹ na tọrọ́ pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹbẹ. Baá na kánákáná na n tọrọ́ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ngaa bẹ?
english_text: Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?

ibani_text: Krais na Ẹ́kpẹ́dua na nna bịpị tọrọ́ pa gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ fie bẹ? Mininiḅọ na mininighaḅọ ntẹ́ nyẹ nyáná gboloma?
english_text: What harmony is there between Christ and Belial? Or what does a believer have in common with an unbeliever?

ibani_text: Tamuno wárị na nkára tamuno nnị tẹ́ mịẹnyẹ nyáná gboloma bẹ. Wamịnị anị dúmagbámásó Tamuno ma wárị: Tamuno ọ ḅụgbọrụ ḅẹ́ ḅara ma ḅẹẹ. A nnị na ngábẹm pịghị nna ogbobie nwángị ikelekelé, a Tamuno sọ n pịrịbẹm nnị sọ ịyẹa túminị́ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God has said: “I will live with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be my people.”

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ warị nnị ḅẹẹ, Págháḅo nna bie sị fóofóo. Ḅara pa ịlọ́lị nyẹ ma lama ma, anịsáa a warị i daákịbẹm.
english_text: Therefore, “Come out from them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you.”

ibani_text: Kụrọmamgba nyáná Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dugho ḅara, a Daa sọọ ọ pịrịbẹm ọmịnị sọ pịghị ị́yẹ́ owiapụ awọ na ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́awọ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: And, “I will be a Father to you, and you will be my sons and daughters, says the Lord Almighty.”

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nángwọ́apụ mịnanyẹ mamgba n minini pa wa pịrịm, anịgo wa wámịna ḅụ mịẹ fiafiama, wámịna oju anịgha wámịna tẹ́mẹ́ ịlọlịma bẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, wa pịghị káara ḅara ḅụ tọ́ntọ́ duma kọọ Tamuno ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma wa pịrị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie. Na wa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so irimagha, wa pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mbasịgha, anịgha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ inoma.
english_text: Make room for us in your hearts. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have exploited no one.

ibani_text: A mịma dughogha ḅẹẹ a ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa ọmịna ḅarasima, a parị dughomaaḅara ma ḅẹ́ ọmịnị opuma wámịna ḅụ nyẹ́lam ḅẹ́ sámamgba wamịnị na ọmịnị na imi, wa duma o wa fịị o.
english_text: I do not say this to condemn you; I have said before that you have such a place in our hearts that we would live or die with you.

ibani_text: A opu biekpọ nyanam ọmịna ḅụ, a pịghị ó pa opuma bịpịkpọm, wámịna ḅụḅáláḅálá mamgba ḅụ, a opu biekụ́rọ nyánam, ị́yẹ́ bieḅẹlẹ kunema nyanagha.
english_text: I have spoken to you with great frankness; I take great pride in you. I am greatly encouraged; in all our troubles my joy knows no bounds.

ibani_text: Wa ḅo Masidoniya la sa, sọ, wa ịnyọ́sárá nyanagha, ḅụḅáláḅálá ngámámgba ḅụ, jẹ́apụ na kamkoro, ḅáláfa wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie.
english_text: For when we came into Macedonia, we had no rest, but we were harassed at every turn—conflicts on the outside, fears within.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno biesííapụ biediinmaḅọ, wa biedịịnmam Taitọs ḅo la sa.
english_text: But God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus,

ibani_text: Ori ḅo ma ngéré wa bieḅẹ́lẹ́magha kụ́ma o dugho sị ọmịnị ọ tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ ma ḅara, o dugho wa pịrịm ọ dọghụ ḅara sị ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ arịị. Anị ọ ḅụ mịẹḅara, ọ pịghị sẹ kụ́rọ ḅara sị isibi fọ́nyá, anịma go mị́sa ị́yẹ́ bieḅẹlẹ ma parị angaá nyẹ ma nẹngịm.
english_text: and not only by his coming but also by the comfort you had given him. He told us about your longing for me, your deep sorrow, your ardent concern for me, so that my joy was greater than ever.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ a gịẹ ọ pịrị diri ma o biesimam, a balagha ḅẹ́ a anị gịẹm, a baladọghum a arịḅo sa ḅẹẹ anị ọmịna biesimam gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá sa tụọ ḅụ.
english_text: Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it. Though I did regret it—I see that my letter hurt you, but only for a little while—

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa i bieḅẹ́lẹ́arị, ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ ọmịna biesiimam gosi, kụ́ma ọmịna biesii ma Tamuno anị pa fịrị nwángịm anịgo wa nyẹ pa ọ lamagha.
english_text: yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry, but because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us.

ibani_text: Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo biesii sii ḅụ pịghị dighiḅọ dighiḅom mịẹsị tumḅọ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyána, nyẹ́mọ́ni ofori anị bie, kụ́ma tuminikiri biesii fịị dighiḅọ dighiḅom.
english_text: Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.

ibani_text: Dighi Tamuno ọmịna biesii ma pa mịẹnyẹ, anị mịẹsị ọ saghị nyẹ́ pa nyẹ́ simam anị ọ pụghọ tárịarị ḅara ḅẹẹ o die ḅẹẹ ọmịna ḅara fiafiam, ọkọfịnị igani, ọkọfịnị silé ọkọfịnị pụghọ tárịarị nyẹ, ọkọfịnị fịrịnwangị ịnyọ, ọkọfịnị tọ́rụ́ pa siiarịma irima nyẹ pịrị. Nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ diemam ḅẹẹ irima ọmịna ḅụ ofori ḅẹ́rẹ́ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. At every point you have proved yourselves to be innocent in this matter.

ibani_text: Anịsọnị ḅẹ́, a mị diri ma gịẹm, irima ḅo gosigha anịgha kị́nị́ irima ḅo gosi. Anịmanakaragha a anị gịẹm pa mịẹ findi Tamuno tórúku, ọmịna fịrịnwangị ịnyọ wámịna ḅụ póghóló la ḅara.
english_text: So even though I wrote to you, it was neither on account of the one who did the wrong nor on account of the injured party, but rather that before God you could see for yourselves how devoted to us you are.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba mịẹm wa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná. Wa ḅụbie saghị ḅo tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ ḅụ sua, anị opuma wa tọ́rụ́ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, wamịnị árị sa Taitọs bieḅẹlẹ láa ḅara, ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ḅárásua sị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ sághịma ḅara.
english_text: By all this we are encouraged. In addition to our own encouragement, we were especially delighted to see how happy Titus was, because his spirit has been refreshed by all of you.

ibani_text: A i pa bịpịkpọ ọ pịrịm, ị pịghị ḅụgịrịrịmaghaa. Sámámgba wa karakárá ma dugho ọ pịrịmam, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, wámịna bịpịkpọ Taitọs tórúku ḅo karakárányẹ sọmam.
english_text: I had boasted to him about you, and you have not embarrassed me. But just as everything we said to you was true, so our boasting about you to Titus has proved to be true as well.

ibani_text: Anịma go ọ nyáná ọ pịrị ḅẹlẹma warị sághị sẹnị kụ́rọ, o biekóróma sa ḅẹ́ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba ọmịnị ori againma akị bim, ọ pịghị ḅáláfama na osigha ḅara pa ọ daa kóróma ḅara.
english_text: And his affection for you is all the greater when he remembers that you were all obedient, receiving him with fear and trembling.

ibani_text: Ị bie opuma ḅẹlẹm ḅẹ́ a ine ọmịna ḅụ káara biekpọ nyánábẹm.
english_text: I am glad I can have complete confidence in you.

ibani_text: I Daa awọ, wa bim ḅẹ́ o nimi Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nwángịmáa fịrị mamgba Masidoniya ḅụ fịnị sọsị mamgbabie.
english_text: And now, brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the grace that God has given the Macedonian churches.

ibani_text: Nnị tụ́ma daádighi arịm, nnị n pa tulu ḅọ́rọ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá gosi, kụ́ma nna bieḅẹlẹ nna ḅụ nẹngịm mịẹsị nnị nna nyánányẹ pịrịm balagha ḅara ḅụ, karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ nnị siminiapụ.
english_text: In the midst of a very severe trial, their overflowing joy and their extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity.

ibani_text: A onyẹ́sẹ n pịrịm, nnị, nnị ineḅara pa pịrịm, n pịghị nna ịnyọ nẹ́ngịma ḅara pa pịrịm, kị́nị́ n sumágha pa.
english_text: For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

ibani_text: Nnị wa tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, nnị sọ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́apụ sọ, diekiri nyáná bẹapụ, anịị ḅárásua Tamuno túminị́ ma pịrị Judiya ḅụ fịnịapụ ma.
english_text: they urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in this service to the Lord’s people.

ibani_text: Nnị wa tọ́rụ́ pa dighi ḅara mịẹghaa, kụ́ma parị nnị nna ḅụ pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịrịm, n pịghị n ḅụ pa wamịnị sọ pịrịm anịị Tamuno tọ́ḅára ḅụ.
english_text: And they exceeded our expectations: They gave themselves first of all to the Lord, and then by the will of God also to us.

ibani_text: Anịgo wa Taitọs tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ ori fịrị ma sághịḅọ ma, ori anị nwángị tórúku mú, sị ọ ḅárásua ọ pịrị sị ọ mị tụ́ma ḅẹlẹma fịrị ma nwángị fama.
english_text: So we urged Titus, just as he had earlier made a beginning, to bring also to completion this act of grace on your part.

ibani_text: Ọmịna nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ mịnị opuma anị nyanam; minini ḅụ, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ ḅụ, na pịghị níminyẹ ḅụ, ọ mịnị ịnyọ pa ḅárásua dọghụ ḅara, ọ pịghị pa wa ḅẹlẹma ḅara. Wa pịghị bim ḅẹ́ mị ḅẹlẹma fịrị ma ḅụ ọ ḅara findi balagha ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: But since you excel in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in complete earnestness and in the love we have kindled in you—see that you also excel in this grace of giving.

ibani_text: A ólóghó sua ọ pịrịgha, kụ́ma pa o die jẹapụ kụrọma biiarị ḅara sị n ḅárásua. A ḅụ́kọ́rọ́maarị a pa nimi ḅẹ́ ḅara ọmịna ḅẹlẹma anị karakárá fịnị ḅara.
english_text: I am not commanding you, but I want to test the sincerity of your love by comparing it with the earnestness of others.

ibani_text: Ọ kọkọ wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nimi; ori ọrẹ opu láa ḅara balagha kụ́ma ọ ḅụ siminimam ọmịna sịbị go, sị ọrẹ simini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ori ngọ pa ọkọọma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sake he became poor, so that you through his poverty might become rich.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma gbolomanyẹ mịị ị́yẹ́ againma, anị ibiḅaa ọ pịrị ḅara. Ḅọ́rọ́maa kụ́rá ọmịnị anịị parị nyẹ pịrịapụ, anịma ngéréghaa kụ́ma anị pịghị ọ pụghọ tárịm ḅẹ́ ọ nyẹ pịrịị.
english_text: And here is my judgment about what is best for you in this matter. Last year you were the first not only to give but also to have the desire to do so.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị anị mịẹ tórúku mú sị fịrị ma nwángị famáa! Ḅẹ́ anị kụrọma ọ tarị anị mịẹfáma ọḅụ fịnị ḅara ọmịnị anị ọrụtọarị sa, ḅẹ́ ọ pịghị mị́sa ọ nyánányẹ pa fịrị ma nwángị.
english_text: Now finish the work, so that your eager willingness to do it may be matched by your completion of it, according to your means.

ibani_text: Anị ḅọ́rọ́ ọ́taárịarị ḅẹẹ ọ nyẹ pịrị, Tamuno ọmịna pịrịnyẹ ma daákịbẹm, ọmịnị nyáná sị pịrị bi ḅara, ọ nyanagha nyẹ ḅụghaa.
english_text: For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what one does not have.

ibani_text: Wa binyẹ mịmagha anịị ḅẹẹ a ikúnyẹ dighi sií jẹ́apụ sịbị, sị pa ọmịna ọgọ́nọ́ gbánā, kụ́ma ọmịnị pịrịarịnyẹ na jẹ́apụ pịrịarịnyẹ gbasi bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed, but that there might be equality.

ibani_text: Anịsa nyẹ ọ ḅụ kụ́rọ sa, nnị sọ warị nyáná bima, nnị sọ warị ḅárásua ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara. Mị ḅara ma ọmịnị ine karakárá ḅara pa ḅárásua ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: At the present time your plenty will supply what they need, so that in turn their plenty will supply what you need. The goal is equality,

ibani_text: Tọ́n diri ma dugho ḅara bẹ, Opuma kóbirịḅọ opuma duḅanyẹ nyanagha ḅẹ́ kálányẹ kóbirịḅọ sọ opuma ịrụ nyẹ nyanagha.
english_text: as it is written: “The one who gathered much did not have too much, and the one who gathered little did not have too little.”

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹm, anị pa Taitọs tẹ́mẹ́bie suaḅọ anị i tẹ́mẹ́bie fịnị ḅara anịị ḅárásua ọ pịrị ḅụ.
english_text: Thanks be to God, who put into the heart of Titus the same concern I have for you.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ọ ḅara binyẹ ngéréghaa o mịẹnyẹ, kụ́ma kị́nị́ osumagha pa, anị ọ tarịarị bẹ ọ ḅárásua anị o go ọ damaḅo nyẹ.
english_text: For Titus not only welcomed our appeal, but he is coming to you with much enthusiasm and on his own initiative.

ibani_text: Wa ori na, wámịna gbẹ́rẹ́ mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ fịrịma ḅoarị sọsị mamgba opuma osigha nyáná pịrịḅọ, ọrẹ fịrị ḅụ, ọ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ wásámaarị ḅara.
english_text: And we are sending along with him the brother who is praised by all the churches for his service to the gospel.

ibani_text: Anịma pa angásá warị, sọsị gbọrụ ma ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịmam pịghị ọ tọ ḅẹ́ ọ wamịnị na munyẹ ma muu, wa ḅẹlẹma dienyẹ ma dighi sị Tamuno fịrị ma nwángịarị ḅara na pịghị die ḅẹẹ wa ḅárásua dọ́ghụm.
english_text: What is more, he was chosen by the churches to accompany us as we carry the offering, which we administer in order to honor the Lord himself and to show our eagerness to help.

ibani_text: Wa pịghị wámịna ḅụ ẹ́biarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dughonyẹ nyánábịgha ḅara wa ḅara warị mị opu diepịrịnyẹ ma na nwángikọarị ḅara.
english_text: We want to avoid any criticism of the way we administer this liberal gift.

ibani_text: Wa biiarị ḅẹẹ, wa karakárányẹ ma mịẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tórúku ngéréghaa, kụ́ma túminị́ tórúku sọ.
english_text: For we are taking pains to do what is right, not only in the eyes of the Lord but also in the eyes of man.

ibani_text: Pa anị ḅụ sua, wa wámịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ na nnị na fịrịmaarị, wa pịghị dọghụ pághámaḅomam tọgha sa na pịghị asọ kirikiri ḅụ, arịḅo ḅẹẹ sámámgba anị ọ tarịarị ọ ḅara warị ḅárásua bẹ ḅara. Bẹ mị́sa ọ pịghị opuma biekpọ nyána ḅara ma ọmịna ḅụ, anị ọ tarị mị ḅara nẹ́ngimamam ori ine ḅárásua bẹ ḅara.
english_text: In addition, we are sending with them our brother who has often proved to us in many ways that he is zealous, and now even more so because of his great confidence in you.

ibani_text: Ori Taitọs ori ị́yẹ́ árụ́ḅọ, ori i nana nwángịarị wa ḅárásua ọ́ pịrịbẹ ḅara, isi mịná owiapụ ma ọ nana muarịapụ ma nnị sẹ sọsị gbọrụ ma pịrịm n pịghị boma akuoo Krais pịrịarị.
english_text: As for Titus, he is my partner and co-worker among you; as for our brothers, they are representatives of the churches and an honor to Christ.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma pa n die, anị sọsị sọsị mamgba ḅụkoro sị pịghị nimi ḅẹ́, wamịnị ọmịnị pa bịpịkpọ ma karakáram.
english_text: Therefore show these men the proof of your love and the reason for our pride in you, so that the churches can see it.

ibani_text: Nnị pa Tamuno túminị́ ma fịrịmaarị ḅárásua ma Judiya ḅụ, a arịgha a go diri gịẹ ọ fịrịma bẹnyẹ anị sịbị go.
english_text: There is no need for me to write to you about this service to the Lord’s people.

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ọ biarị ḅẹẹ ọ ḅárásua, a pịghị ọ pa bịpịkpọ Masidoniyaapụ ma pịrịmam. A ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Akaya ḅụ fịnịapụ ma, mịná owiapụ ma ḅárásua dọ́ghụm saghị ḅọ́rọ́maa kụ́rá éné éné. Anị ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie álála ḅara ma, mú nna ḅụ tọghaapụ timi sághịmamam.
english_text: For I know your eagerness to help, and I have been boasting about it to the Macedonians, telling them that since last year you in Achaia were ready to give; and your enthusiasm has stirred most of them to action.

ibani_text: Mị́sa amịna owiapụ awọ ma fịrịmaarị, sị wamịnị ọ pa kpọ bịpịkpọ ma papanyẹ sọbịgha ḅara, kụ́ma a dugho ḅara ḅụ, o tẹ́lẹ́ma fịnịbẹ ḅara ọmịna ḅárásua ḅụ.
english_text: But I am sending the brothers in order that our boasting about you in this matter should not prove hollow, but that you may be ready, as I said you would be.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara ḅọ́rọ́ Masidoniyaapụ ma ịnáná ḅo ḅo sị arịḅo ḅẹẹ nịị ọ tẹ́lẹ́maghaa, anị tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅụ́gịrịrị dighiḅọ wa pịrịbẹ, anị pịghị dighiḅọ ọ pịrịbẹ ḅụ́gịrịrị wa biekpọma nyána ḅara ma ọmịna ḅụ.
english_text: For if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we—not to say anything about you—would be ashamed of having been so confident.

ibani_text: Anịgo a sịbịbie kịẹ anị pịrịm ḅẹẹ anị ibibẹm ḅẹ́, mịná mininiapụ ma tarị tarị ọ damaḅo ịḅụ, sị mú ọ ḅárafindi pịrịdọ́ghu nyẹ ma tẹ́lẹ́ma warị sị a ḅo láa ḅẹ́ sáá anị tẹ́lẹ́ma fịnịbẹm, mịma diebẹm ḅẹẹ ọ pịrị bim, mịnị ologho ḅara ḅụghaa.
english_text: So I thought it necessary to urge the brothers to visit you in advance and finish the arrangements for the generous gift you had promised. Then it will be ready as a generous gift, not as one grudgingly given.

ibani_text: Biekóróma ḅẹ́ bogha sịmgbọlụ dipiḅọ pịghị bogha sịmgbọlụ sughubẹm; opuma sịmgbọ́lụ dipi ḅo pịghị tọgha sịmgbọlụ sughubẹm.
english_text: Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịị tẹ́mẹ́bie n ḅo tọ́ọ pẹ́lẹ́máa ḅara, nyẹ́mọ́ni ḅugha, anịgha ḅẹẹ a anị mịẹ nyánam gosi, tegó Tamuno bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ nyẹ pịrịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma pịghị ine o bi ḅara nẹ́ngị nyẹ mịẹ ọ pịrịbẹm. Si o bii nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sámámgba ọmịnị anị nyáná ọ ḅụ pịrịbẹ ḅara, pịghị anị nyáná wásáma sị pa ibifịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nwángị.
english_text: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara, Ori ọrẹ diepịrịnyẹ ma diegálágáláma igonyiapụ pịrịmam, ori ibi akị mú gbámásó lam.
english_text: As it is written: “They have freely scattered their gifts to the poor; their righteousness endures forever.”

ibani_text: Tamuno ori sịmgbọlụ pa dụadipiḅọ pịrịarịḅọ na pịghị fịtúrú pịrị fị́nyẹ ḅụ, pịghị pa ọ pịrịbẹm o bi sịmgbọlụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọ mịẹbẹm anị sẹ́nị sị opuma nyẹsua ọ ḅara findi pịrịarị ḅara ma gosi.
english_text: Now he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the harvest of your righteousness.

ibani_text: Ọ mịẹbẹm ọmịnị opuma ngọ nyána sámámgba ḅụ, sị ị ine ḅara findi sị nyẹ pịrịbẹm sị tọghaapụ anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹbẹm, n wámịna ḅara nyána ḅo dienyẹ gosi.
english_text: You will be enriched in every way so that you can be generous on every occasion, and through us your generosity will result in thanksgiving to God.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ mị́sa ọ nwángị fịrị ma Tamuno túminị́ ngéréghaa ọmịnị nnị pálịma nyẹ mịẹ pịrịapụ, kụ́ma anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọgha boma ḅọ́rọ́ mú Tamun laarị.
english_text: This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of the Lord’s people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks to God.

ibani_text: Ọ nwángị fịrị ma nyána sị die pághámaarị nyẹ gosi tọghaapụ boma pa Tamuno pịrịbẹm ọmịnị Krais ibi ọkụ́ ma osii ḅara, ọ pịghị dugho pághámaarị nyẹ, ọ pịghị ḅara findi nnị na diearị ḅara na pịghị kị́nị́mamgba na.
english_text: Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves, others will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession of the gospel of Christ, and for your generosity in sharing with them and with everyone else.

ibani_text: Anịgo opuma póghóló ḅẹlẹma ḅụ, nnị tẹ́ghẹ̄ ọ pịrịbẹm Tamuno diepághámamaá kịrị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịna ḅụ.
english_text: And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you, because of the surpassing grace God has given you.

ibani_text: Túmíní fịnị Tamuno pịrịị, ọ pa wa pịrị sị tumḅọ ine anị dughofindi bigha dienyẹ!
english_text: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!

ibani_text: Krais ḅụ fịnị diin na ḅụsímínímá, irị Pọl, anịị mị tẹ́ghẹ̄ bịpị ma pa ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị nyẹ, ịrị anịị túminị́ ḅẹ́ sị tọ́rụ́kụ́kụ́ḅọ a ọ nana gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá fịnị sáá, kụ́ma tọ́rụ kụ́rọ a ọ nana gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ófórigha sáá.
english_text: By the humility and gentleness of Christ, I appeal to you—I, Paul, who am “timid” when face to face with you, but “bold” toward you when away!

ibani_text: Anịgo a ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m, ọmịnị i mịẹma sị a kụrọ pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ a anị ngá láa sáá. A nimim ḅẹẹ a kụ́rọ pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọbẹm a bịpị pa obiarịapụ ma na dona sáá, dughoapụ ḅẹ́ wa tuminikiriapụ nyẹ́ mịẹ ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹm.
english_text: I beg you that when I come I may not have to be as bold as I expect to be toward some people who think that we live by the standards of this world.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ, wa tuminikiri imi, wa tuminikiriapụ ḅara pa ọ́mụ́gbịgha.
english_text: For though we live in the world, we do not wage war as the world does.

ibani_text: Wa pa owusọarị ọ́mụ́gbinyẹ ma, tuminikiri ọ́mụ́gbi nyẹ́gha, kụ́ma Tamuno kụrọ ọ́mụ́gbinyẹ sị wa pa ine iruonaapụ ma kụ́rọ yọ gúlúgúlúmaarị nyẹ, wa pịghị epele nyẹ́nụ́na gúlúgúlúmaarị.
english_text: The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. On the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.

ibani_text: Na opuamịẹnyẹapụ pa asọ mgbẹsẹ karakárá Tamuno nimi ma pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nụ́nụ́ kiri gbi, sii kóróma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ akị ịkóli ḅụ sua sị anị Krais bịpị pughu bẹ ḅara.
english_text: We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.

ibani_text: O die gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ḅẹẹ ọmịnị karakárá ḅara pa wámịna bịpị pughum, anịsáa wamịnị ine bịpị puughugha gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm.
english_text: And we will be ready to punish every act of disobedience, once your obedience is complete.

ibani_text: Ọ nyẹ dighiarị anị fịnị ḅara ọgọnọ ọgọ́nọ́. Ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ biekpọma nyánam ḅẹ́ n ḅọ Krais nyẹẹ, anịḅọ ma pịghị sima akanyaḅo ḅẹ́, wamịnị sọ Krais nyẹẹ, n ḅọ ma so Krais nyẹẹ ḅara ma.
english_text: You are judging by appearances.If anyone is confident that they belong to Christ, they should consider again that we belong to Christ just as much as they do.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ sárásárá ḅara pa bịpịkpọ bẹ, anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pa wa pịrịmaá kụ́rọ sị wa pa ọmiẹ sẹnịmaa, tụ́ma ọ nụ́nụ́ kiri kóróma bẹ nakaragha, mịma ị ḅụ́gịrịrịmabịgha.
english_text: So even if I boast somewhat freely about the authority the Lord gave us for building you up rather than tearing you down, I will not be ashamed of it.

ibani_text: A bigha ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ árị ḅẹẹ a gịẹárị diri ma a anị pa ọmịna ḅáláfáma dọ́ghụm.
english_text: I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you with my letters.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ ḅẹbẹm ḅẹẹ, Pọl ori diri pụghọ kụrọm pịghị ikum, tọ́rụ ḅụ o dighi sáá ọ kụrọḅọ kịkagha, ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori.
english_text: For some say, “His letters are weighty and forceful, but in person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing.”

ibani_text: Anị tumḅọ ma nimi ḅẹẹ kịrịnyẹ ofori wa gịẹ diri wamịnị ófórigha sáá na pịghị wa mịẹbẹnyẹ wamịnị ọ́náná fịnị sáá.
english_text: Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ, wa wámịna ḅụ pa opuma nna ḅụ sághị sóghólomaapụ na tụ́mabịgha. Mịná oḅoriapụ ma nnị n ḅụ na kụ́rá ólóghó suam, nnị warị n sua ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ nna ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves. When they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they are not wise.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, wamịnị, wámịna bịpịkpọ anị la kunema bẹ angaá imi anị ikelekele kunemabẹm Tamuno tọ wa pịrị fịrịma ḅụ. Wa nwángịarị fịrị ọmịna bie sọ imii.
english_text: We, however, will not boast beyond proper limits, but will confine our boasting to the sphere of service God himself has assigned to us, a sphere that also includes you.

ibani_text: Wa ọmịnị pa bịpịkpọarị sa, wa bịpịkpọ wamịnị bịpịkpọ na ibiḅara nẹ́ngịgha, tegó wamịnị anịị Krais ibi oku ma akuoo ọ pịrịapụ.
english_text: We are not going too far in our boasting, as would be the case if we had not come to you, for we did get as far as you with the gospel of Christ.

ibani_text: Wamịnị wa bịpịkpọ jẹ́apụ nwángị famamaá fịrị pịrịgha. Kụ́ma wa tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánam ḅẹẹ fịrị ma anị opuma sẹ́nị mị ḅara ḅọ́rọ́bẹm. Anịsọ a árịbẹm ḅẹ́ a ịḅụ wárim Tamuno tọ́ọ i pịrị yọ ma ḅụ.
english_text: Neither do we go beyond our limits by boasting of work done by others. Our hope is that, as your faith continues to grow, our sphere of activity among you will greatly expand,

ibani_text: Anị ọkọ koro koro, Kọrịntị ngéréghaa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa bẹnyẹ kụ́ma wa mú ibi oku ma dugho wásáma jẹ́ sẹapụ pịrịbẹm, wa túminí daákịbịgha Tamuno tọ́ọ kọ́rọ́ma jẹ́apụ pịrị fịrịkiri ḅụ.
english_text: so that we can preach the gospel in the regions beyond you. For we do not want to boast about work already done in someone else’s territory.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ma ḅẹẹ, Bịpịkpọ dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ nwángifámamáa fịrị pa bịpịkpọ.
english_text: But, “Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.”

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, Tamuno ibi kóróma nyána pịrịapụ ma anịị ọ pịghị ḅọ́rọ́marịapụ, ibi kóróma nyáná nna ḅụ pịrịapụgha.
english_text: For it is not the one who commends himself who is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

ibani_text: A bibẹm ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ngịrịma nyáná ị pịrị a kẹ́lẹ́ pịghị oḅori ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹ sáá, Páisisi ngịrịma nyáná i pịrị.
english_text: I hope you will put up with me in a little foolishness. Yes, please put up with me!

ibani_text: A ọmịna ibi dọ́ghụm Tamuno sọ ọmịna ibi dọghụ ḅara, ọ́ fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ na deeyagha pịghị owitụ́wọ nimighaḅọ, a pịghị ọ minini pa gbẹ́rẹ́ deḅọ ngéré pịrịmam, ori ma anịị Krais.
english_text: I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy. I promised you to one husband, to Christ, so that I might present you as a pure virgin to him.

ibani_text: A ḅáláfa nyánam, ḅẹ́ ododó ma aka ḅara pa oḅori pa Ivu sị ḅara ọmịna kóróma gbisiribẹm ọmịna Krais ḅẹlẹma na pịghị ọmịnị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: But I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by the serpent’s cunning, your minds may somehow be led astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ.

ibani_text: A mịma dughoarị tegó a arịḅom bẹ ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ọdámáḅom warị jẹ́ Jizọs dugho wásámáa, wamịnị na dugho wásámagha ḅọ, anịgha ọ jẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ daákịm kịrịnyẹ parị ọ daakị nyẹ ma ḅụ, anịgha kịrị ibi oku na ọ daákịgha nyẹ, ọ ḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma nnị daákịbẹm.
english_text: For if someone comes to you and preaches a Jesus other than the Jesus we preached, or if you receive a different spirit from the Spirit you received, or a different gospel from the one you accepted, you put up with it easily enough.

ibani_text: Ịrị a arịḅogha ḅẹẹ, a opuma ịrụm ọ pa nfịrịmaapụ sịịapụ ma ḅụ ḅẹẹ nnị ibiḅam.
english_text: I do not think I am in the least inferior to those “super-apostles.”

ibani_text: Didigha ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ ḅụ ịrị kálátụwọ, kụ́ma níminyẹ ḅụghaa; sámámgba wa mịma mịẹmam sị o nimi tọgha tọgha asọ ḅụ.
english_text: I may indeed be untrained as a speaker, but I do have knowledge. We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way.

ibani_text: A Tamuno ibi oku ma dugho wásáma ọ pịrị sáá, a gbẹ́rẹ́ igbii so túḅo ọ pịrịgha. A tere yọ akịm sị nnị ọ sághị sóghólo yọ ḅụ kóróma bẹ ḅara, mịma anịị a mịẹ siinyẹ?
english_text: Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching the gospel of God to you free of charge?

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ fịrị nwángịarị sáá, ọmịna ogbobie, jẹ́ jẹa sọsị anịị igbii pa igbẹarịapụ, mịma fịnị ḅara, a n fúrú pa ḅárásua ọ pịrịarị.
english_text: I robbed other churches by receiving support from them so as to serve you.

ibani_text: A ọ nana fịnị sáá ma ḅụ, sị nyẹ i palịmaa, a anị pa ọḅụ ḅáláḅálámagha, Masidoniya ḅụ sághị ḅo Krais mịná owiapụ ma, a binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa i pịrịm. Mị́sa ma ḅụ sọ, a ipalima nyẹ pa ọ ḅụḅáláḅálámaghaa. A pa mịị ḅara ma mịẹ tórúku muubẹm.
english_text: And when I was with you and needed something, I was not a burden to anyone, for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I needed. I have kept myself from being a burden to you in any way, and will continue to do so.

ibani_text: Krais karakárá ibie fịnịnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ a mịnị ọ pịrịmam ḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ bịpịkpọ ma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ anị yaghúmabịgha Akaya sẹ́ gbọrụ ḅụ.
english_text: As surely as the truth of Christ is in me, nobody in the regions of Achaia will stop this boasting of mine.

ibani_text: A mịma dughogha ḅẹẹ a ọ ḅẹlẹmagha gosi? Tamuno nimim ḅẹẹ a ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do!

ibani_text: A pa a mịẹarịnyẹ ma mịẹbẹm mị́sa, sị isi nfịrịmaapụ ma n go pa bịpịkpọ ḅẹnyẹ nyánábịgha ḅara, sị dugho ḅẹ́ wa fịrị ma nwángịarị ḅara anịị nnị sọ nwángịarị ḅara.
english_text: And I will keep on doing what I am doing in order to cut the ground from under those who want an opportunity to be considered equal with us in the things they boast about.

ibani_text: Mịná owiapụ ma nnị tụ́ma nfịrịmaapụghaa nnị mḅụ pa nfịrịmaapụ sị ḅara, kụ́ma nnị ọkọ fịnịgha, nnị nna fịrị ma pa oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịịarị, nnị nna ḅụ dimam sị túminị́ ḅẹẹ bẹ ḅara ḅẹẹ nnị karakárá Krais fịrịmaapụ.
english_text: For such people are false apostles, deceitful workers, masquerading as apostles of Christ.

ibani_text: Mịma tọ́rụ́ bulubulumagha tegó Satanị sọ, ọ ḅụ dima sị baá sookumuḅọ fịnị ḅara fịnịmam.
english_text: And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light.

ibani_text: Anịgo anị iwọnyẹ sọbịgha ḅọ́rọ́ ori fịrịnaapụ n ḅụ dima sị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ fịrịnaapụ fịnị ḅára fịnịị. Ọḅụkụ́nọma, nnị n ḅara la na ibi gbẹfịnyẹ nyánábẹm.
english_text: It is not surprising, then, if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness. Their end will be what their actions deserve.

ibani_text: Kúru a sima dugho: gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ sị ma ḅẹẹ irị oḅoriḅọ. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ sị sị, ị́yẹ́ akị nị ḅẹẹ ịrị oḅoriḅọ, irịsọ pịghị ine kẹ́lẹ́ bịpịkpọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I repeat: Let no one take me for a fool. But if you do, then tolerate me just as you would a fool, so that I may do a little boasting.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ mị́sa a dughoarị nyẹ ma anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ biibẹnyegha ḅẹẹ a dugho; mị bịpịkpọ nyẹ ma oḅoriḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị a ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị ḅara.
english_text: In this self-confident boasting I am not talking as the Lord would, but as a fool.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tọghaapụ bịpịkpọ tuminikirinyẹ pịrịarị sa, irịsọ pịghị bịpịkpọbẹm.
english_text: Since many are boasting in the way the world does, I too will boast.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ma, ọmịnị opuma nyẹ́nimim, sị ọmịnị ine ngịrịma nyána oḅoriapụ pịrịm.
english_text: You gladly put up with fools since you are so wise!

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ngịrịma nyáná omoni pa o mịẹapụ pịrịm anịgha ọmịnị mbasịapụ, anịgha dia tuú ọ pịrịapụ pịrịm, anịgha ọ dighi teremáapụ, anịgha pịghị ḅara findi ọ ḅụ́rọ́apụ ọmịna tórúku.
english_text: In fact, you even put up with anyone who enslaves you or exploits you or takes advantage of you or puts on airs or slaps you in the face.

ibani_text: Anị i ḅụgịrịrịmaarị dugho ḅẹẹ, wamịnị ine tọ́rụ́ nyanagha sị mịnanyẹ ma mịẹ! Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ bịpịkpọ pịrịbẹnyẹ fịnịfịnị a oḅoriḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị irịsọ a pịghị ọkọfịnị bịpịkpọbẹm.
english_text: To my shame I admit that we were too weak for that! Whatever anyone else dares to boast about—I am speaking as a fool—I also dare to boast about.

ibani_text: Nnị Hiburuapụ? Irịsọ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ. Nnị Izirẹlịawọ? Irịsọ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ. Nnị Ebraham furoawọ? Irịsọ pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they Abraham’s descendants? So am I.

ibani_text: Nnị Krais ómóniapụ? A nọmḅọ ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị kụ́ma a ibii nnị nẹngịm! A fịrịnwangị nnị nẹngịmam, nnị i pa ịkóli bie sua nnị nẹngịmam, a fomḅara daá nnị nẹngịmam, a pịghị tọgha sáá ḅụ fịị na kikiamam.
english_text: Are they servants of Christ? (I am out of my mind to talk like this.) I am more. I have worked much harder, been in prison more frequently, been flogged more severely, and been exposed to death again and again.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ a sáá, anịị a ngịẹfa mmẹẹ́ si fomḅara daa nyẹ Juuapụ ma ḅara;
english_text: Five times I received from the Jews the forty lashes minus one.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá, Romapụ ma i fomum; gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá nnị mgbọ́lụ pa i gbiim. A tẹ́rẹ́ a sáá, pa tọ́rụ ḅụ bilem, gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá a gbẹ́rẹ́ dii na gbẹ́rẹ́ éné gbọrụ pa póghóló tọ́rụ́bie ngam.
english_text: Three times I was beaten with rods, once I was pelted with stones, three times I was shipwrecked, I spent a night and a day in the open sea,

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ tọgha muunyẹ mamgba ḅụ, a opu mingi tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain ma ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sọmam, na pịghị furuapụ ḅarabie, a tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain ma ḅụ sọmam i jẹa Juuapụ na pịghị Juughaapụ ḅarabie, tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain opu ama bie, tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain elesiri ḅụ, tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain opu tọ́rụ́ ḅụ, tẹ́mẹ́ nain nain oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị mininiapụ ḅarabie.
english_text: I have been constantly on the move. I have been in danger from rivers, in danger from bandits, in danger from my fellow Jews, in danger from Gentiles; in danger in the city, in danger in the country, in danger at sea; and in danger from false believers.

ibani_text: Fịrị na tọ́rụ́siarị, jẹ́ sa imi a múno pa tọ́rụ́ḅáma sáá; ḅuru i pụghọ tarịmam mingi so i pụghọ tarịmam, jẹ́ sáá imi, a tụ́ma fị́nyẹ arịgha, a tụ́ma sịbị kóróma yọ anịgha tụ́ma suabịtẹ arịgha.
english_text: I have labored and toiled and have often gone without sleep; I have known hunger and thirst and have often gone without food; I have been cold and naked.

ibani_text: Jẹa nyẹ jẹa nyẹ pa angaá ḅụ warị, éné gbọrụ gbọrụ sọsị sọsị ma ibi ḅẹ́ ḅara ḅụḅáláḅálá ikuipụnụmaarị.
english_text: Besides everything else, I face daily the pressure of my concern for all the churches.

ibani_text: Túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuu gbẹ́rẹ́kiri i tẹ́mẹ́ sọ n dua óḅúghum, tumḅọ siinyẹ bie soo gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, ịrịsọ ị́yẹ́ oju mịnị diingha.
english_text: Who is weak, and I do not feel weak? Who is led into sin, and I do not inwardly burn?

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ bịpịkpọ bẹ, a bịpịkpọ mịẹsị i tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuumaarị nyẹ ma pịrịbẹm.
english_text: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.

ibani_text: Wámịna nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais Daa, pịghị ọ Tamuno, n túminí bẹḅọ ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá la, nimim ḅẹẹ a epeletigha.
english_text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, who is to be praised forever, knows that I am not lying.

ibani_text: A Damasikọs ḅụ fịnị sáá, Ḅẹ́rẹ́tọ́ḅọ ma, Ámányánáḅọ Aretọs sughubie, kúrúapụ sẹ́ma wárim ama sọ opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ ḅẹ́ nnị ikuú.
english_text: In Damascus the governor under King Aretas had the city of the Damascenes guarded in order to arrest me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nkana anịị nnị pa ámá ma gbiri ikéléma dapịrị ma ḅụ fịo yọ ḅụ i túlúma ḅọ́rọ́mam.
english_text: But I was lowered in a basket from a window in the wall and slipped through his hands.

ibani_text: Anị pa i mịẹibi ofori, kụ́ma a pa bịpịkpọbẹm, mị́sa a múnogha ḅụ kọ dáwọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọ ḅụ gboloma sị ọ pa i dienyẹ.
english_text: I must go on boasting. Although there is nothing to be gained, I will go on to visions and revelations from the Lord.

ibani_text: A gbẹ́rẹ́ Krais asọ duarị owitụ́wọ nimim, ḅọ́rọ́maa oyi ínia kụ́rá findi ḅụ, nnị dighi akị sóghóloḅa so ma múm, mịma duma ḅụ anị kiriakị-o, múnogha dáwọ ḅụ kiriakị-o, a nimigha, Tamuno ngéré anịị nimiḅọ.
english_text: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was caught up to the third heaven. Whether it was in the body or out of the body I do not know—God knows.

ibani_text: Kúru a sima dugho, a nimim ḅẹ́ mị owitụ́wọ ma nnị ọ dighi akị paradaisị múm, anịị Tamunofịnịkiri ma, mịma duma ḅụ kiriakị-o múnogha dáwọ ḅụ kiriakị-o a nimigha Tamuno ngéré anị nimiḅọ,
english_text: And I know that this man—whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, but God knows—

ibani_text: anị ngá a nyẹ́ naam tumḅọ dughobịgha nyẹ n mịnị túminị́ pịrịgha sị nnị anị dugho.
english_text: was caught up to paradise and heard inexpressible things, things that no one is permitted to tell.

ibani_text: A ọkọfịnị tumḅọ pa bịpịkpọbẹm, kụ́ma a ịḅụ pa bịpịkpọbịgha, tụ́ma diearịnyẹ ma sima ḅẹ́ i tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuum.
english_text: I will boast about a man like that, but I will not boast about myself, except about my weaknesses.

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ bịpịkpọ dọghụ, a oḅoriḅọ sọbịgha tegó a karakárányẹ ma dughobẹm. Kụ́ma a bịpịkpọbịgha tegó a bigha túminị́ jẹ́ tụ́ma ḅara pa i dighi, nnị árịnyẹ na pịghị i bịpị nnị náanyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: Even if I should choose to boast, I would not be a fool, because I would be speaking the truth. But I refrain, so no one will think more of me than is warranted by what I do or say,

ibani_text: I mịẹsị a opuma opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha ḅara, a árị tọgha ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ ma ḅụ. Nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ nangi pa i pịrịm ị́yẹ́ oju bie, Satanị oku muu ḅọ, ori i fom sị a mịnị opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹbịgha ḅara.
english_text: or because of these surpassingly great revelations. Therefore, in order to keep me from becoming conceited, I was given a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me.

ibani_text: A tẹ́rẹ́ a sa pa Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, ori anị si ị́yẹ́ oju bie.
english_text: Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori i pagharam ḅẹẹ; Ị́yẹ́ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ anịị ị bii nyẹ, ḅẹ́ iyẹ kụrọ anị ḅụ die kụrọma kụ́rọ́mam, ị́yẹ́ kụ́rọ ịrụ sáá. Anịgo i bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹ́ a bịpịkpọ ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ ịrụ la ḅara pịrị sị Krais kụ́rọ i gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: But he said to me,“My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.”Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ’s power may rest on me.

ibani_text: Anịgo, Krais sịbị go i bieḅẹlẹm ị́yẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuu ḅụ, wirinumo daa, ḅụ́kụro árị, tọ́rụ́siarị arịị, ḅụḅáláḅálá arịị, Krais gosi. Ḅẹẹ i tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuu sáá, anịsáa anịị a kụrọnyẹ.
english_text: That is why, for Christ’s sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.

ibani_text: A oḅori ḅara pa nyẹ mịẹarị, kụ́ma ọmịnị anịị ị mịẹnyẹ, ọmịnị anịị i túminí na ibinyẹ, a ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori sọ, ọmịnị pa opuma Sẹ́nịḅa nfịrịmaapụ, sịapụ ma, nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ asọ ḅụ sọ ibi inẹ́ngịgha.
english_text: I have made a fool of myself, but you drove me to it. I ought to have been commended by you, for I am not in the least inferior to the “super-apostles,”even though I am nothing.

ibani_text: A ọmịnị na fịnị sa a tọgha pághányẹ mịẹm, ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ na ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrịnwangị, inema ḅara ḅụ. Mịma diem ḅẹẹ, ịrị nfịrịmaḅọ.
english_text: I persevered in demonstrating among you the marks of a true apostle, including signs, wonders and miracles.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọmịna ḅụ gbánāgha sima, a tẹ́ sii ḅara pa ọ́ nana ngaa kịrịnyẹ, a pa isi sọsị sọsị ma na ngagha nyẹ?
english_text: How were you inferior to the other churches, except that I was never a burden to you? Forgive me this wrong!

ibani_text: A tẹ́lẹ́mamam ḅẹẹ a ḅo ọ nana dona, mị tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sáá, a ọ ḅarabie ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ bibịẹgha, kụ́ma ọmịnị anịị a binyẹ, ọ nyáná nyẹ́ghaa, ọ́ kọ́kọ́ nimi ḅẹẹ awọamaapụ nna nyingiapụ siḅe na ibighaa, kụ́ma nyingiapụ anịị nna awọ siḅe ḅẹnyẹ.
english_text: Now I am ready to visit you for the third time, and I will not be a burden to you, because what I want is not your possessions but you. After all, children should not have to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.

ibani_text: I bieḅẹlẹbẹm a nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fama pighi ị ḅụgbọrụ, sị a pa ine ḅárásua ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara. Mịma anị mịẹbẹ sị ọ kálá ḅara pa i ḅẹlẹma a opuma ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam gosi?
english_text: So I will very gladly spend for you everything I have and expend myself as well. If I love you more, will you love me less?

ibani_text: Ọ́ kọ́kọ́ i nana minini ḅẹ́ a ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịgha, kụ́ma jẹ́apụ ḅẹbẹm ḅẹẹ a aka ḅara pa oḅori pa ọ́ sịm.
english_text: Be that as it may, I have not been a burden to you. Yet, crafty fellow that I am, I caught you by trickery!

ibani_text: A mịnaapụ ma fịrịma ọ damaḅo sa, o sii ḅẹẹ a n fịrịmaḅom a ọ ḅarabie mịẹ dọghụ sọnyẹ go?
english_text: Did I exploit you through any of the men I sent to you?

ibani_text: A Taitọs tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ ori ọ damaḅo, a pịghị isi mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ fịrịma ọ ḅụ suam. Anịsáa, o ḅẹ́ bẹ ḅẹẹ Taitọs ọ ḅarabie sọ́nyẹ mịẹm? Ịrị na ọ nana wa gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ pa nyẹ́ mịẹgha? Pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa asọ nwángị.
english_text: I urged Titus to go to you and I sent our brother with him. Titus did not exploit you, did he? Did we not walk in the same footsteps by the same Spirit?

ibani_text: O sị ḅẹẹ mị́sa mamgba wa wámịna ḅụ pighiarị ọmịna toruku. Anị ọkọ fịnịgha Tamuno ị́yẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ ḅara, a karakáráma dugho ọ pịrịm Krais ómóniḅọ ḅara. Wa pịghị mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịnaapụ, anịị pa ḅárásua ọ pịrị!
english_text: Have you been thinking all along that we have been defending ourselves to you? We have been speaking in the sight of God as those in Christ; and everything we do, dear friends, is for your strengthening.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfa ịḅụ imi ḅẹẹ a aningáa láa bẹ sa a bi ḅara ọmịnị ọkọfịnịbịgha, ọmịnị sọ pịghị dọghụ ḅara a ọkọfịnịbịgha. Ḅáláfa ịḅụ imi, bẹ kam sọ, na jụghọ nyẹ mọnị, na ọfịrị kúkúbie, na ngéré fịị, jẹ́apụ dughosima, na opu ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ na nyẹ mịẹ gálágálá ma, anịị a árị bẹnyẹ.
english_text: For I am afraid that when I come I may not find you as I want you to be, and you may not find me as you want me to be. I fear that there may be discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, slander, gossip, arrogance and disorder.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfa ịḅụ imii ḅẹẹ, a aningáa la bẹ sa parị sáá mịẹnyẹ, pịghị sima mịẹbẹm Tamuno i siminimabẹm ọmịna toruku. Ḅáláfa ịḅụ imi ḅẹ́ a owubẹm parị sa pa ịlọ́lị duma kọ́arịapụ gosi, na pịghị ḅụ́gịrịrịma duma kọ́arịapụ gosi.
english_text: I am afraid that when I come again my God will humble me before you, and I will be grieved over many who have sinned earlier and have not repented of the impurity, sexual sin and debauchery in which they have indulged.

ibani_text: Mịị ị́yẹ́ tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sa, a ḅo o dighinyẹ. Tọ́ndiri ma bie n gịẹ kórómam ḅẹẹ, Ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa jụghọ sịbị sẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mmẹẹ́ anịgha tẹ́rẹ́ onyésẹ̄ḅọ nyánábẹm, anịsa, anịị anị kundu nyáná bẹnyẹ.
english_text: This will be my third visit to you. “Every matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.”

ibani_text: A ọ birinụ́nụ́ dọ́ghụm ọmịnị ḅọ́rọ́maa sa siinyẹ mịẹapụ, na pịghị jẹ́apụ jẹ́apụ, a parị ḅo sáá a anị gbolomanyẹ dughom, ị́yẹ́ mmẹẹ́ kárámá ḅo, a pịghị sima anị dughobẹm mị́sa a mịnga ofori sáá: ḅẹ́ a jẹ́ pa ḅo bẹ sáá fomḅara ọ gbarịbịgha.
english_text: I already gave you a warning when I was with you the second time. I now repeat it while absent: On my return I will not spare those who sinned earlier or any of the others,

ibani_text: Ọ dọghụ ilíghíma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmịnị árịbẹm ḅẹ́ Krais i bịpị pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọarị, ori ọ nana mịẹarị sáá, ori kụ́rọ nyanagha ḅọ kịkagha, anịmanakaragha ori ọrẹ kụ́rọ diearị ọmịnị ogboku bie.
english_text: since you are demanding proof that Christ is speaking through me. He is not weak in dealing with you, but is powerful among you.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ Krais kụ́rọ ḅụ faá ḅụ nnị ọ ḅaupálịm, kụ́ma mị́sa Tamuno kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Krais dumafịnịm. Wamịnị sọ ọ nana gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ ḅụ, wa ḅo kụ́rọ nyánágháapụ dighim. Kụ́ma wamịnị na ọ nana mịẹgbólóma ḅụ wa Tamuno kụ́rọ ma nyánábẹm ori duma bie.
english_text: For to be sure, he was crucified in weakness, yet he lives by God’s power. Likewise, we are weak in him, yet by God’s power we will live with him in our dealing with you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ pa daádighi ma ḅụ sua ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ọmịna ḅụ pịrị, sị o nimi bẹ ḅara ọ ḅọ́rọ́ pa minini ma ḅụ duma kọọarị. Ọmịnị árịbẹm ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ọmịna bie ḅụ imii, ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị epeletigha tigha ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ọ ḅụ mininim.
english_text: Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Do you not realize that Christ Jesus is in you—unless, of course, you fail the test?

ibani_text: A tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánam ḅẹẹ ọ dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm ḅẹẹ wa bịghịgha:
english_text: And I trust that you will discover that we have not failed the test.

ibani_text: Wa Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ́arị ḅẹ́ ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ irima nyẹ sọ mịẹma. Wa mịma mịẹghaa pa die ḅẹ́ wamịnị sáḅá ḅọ́rọ́mam, kụ́ma ọ karakárányẹ ma mịẹbẹ ḅara, tụ́manyẹ ḅẹẹ túminị́ tórúku, wa bịghịmaapụ dighi sọọ.
english_text: Now we pray to God that you will not do anything wrong—not so that people will see that we have stood the test but so that you will do what is right even though we may seem to have failed.

ibani_text: Tegó wamịnị ine gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ mịẹ karakárányẹ ma pụ́nụ́mabịgha, kụ́ma wa nyẹ mịẹ karakárányẹ ma pịrịbẹm.
english_text: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.

ibani_text: Wa bieḅẹlẹm ḅẹẹ wámịna tẹ́mẹ́ oḅuu sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, ọmịnị kụrọm. Anịgo wa pịghị tẹ́ghẹm ḅẹẹ, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ kpain.
english_text: We are glad whenever we are weak but you are strong; and our prayer is that you may be fully restored.

ibani_text: Anịị a go mị diri ma gịẹnyẹ a ọmịna ḅụ ḅọlọanga fịnị sáá; sị a ḅo láabẹ sáá, a mịnị kụ́rọ na ọmịnị na mịẹbịgha ḅara. Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ mịị kụ́rọ ma pa i pịrị pa ọ mịẹ sẹnịmaa, pa ọnụ́nụ́ka bẹ nyẹ́gha.
english_text: This is why I write these things when I am absent, that when I come I may not have to be harsh in my use of authority—the authority the Lord gave me for building you up, not for tearing you down.

ibani_text: Kunemaá, i Daa awọ, ọmịnị ibima fịnịị, asọ nwángịị kpain ḅụ, ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ẹ̄ bịpị ma pughuu, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ nyáná, o diin ḅụ ngaa, diin na ḅẹlẹma nyáná Tamuno ma ọmịnị na fịnịị.
english_text: Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice! Strive for full restoration, encourage one another, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love and peace will be with you.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅoloo.
english_text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.

ibani_text: Tamuno túminị́ mamgba fịrịmam ḅẹ́ wamịnị o bii.
english_text: All God’s people here send their greetings.

ibani_text: Wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́, Tamuno ḅẹlẹma, na Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma mịẹgbólóma, ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba na fịnịị.
english_text: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

ibani_text: Irị Pọl, n sịḅọ ḅẹẹ o ḅo mị nfịrịmaḅọ ma fịrị nwangịị, ị́yẹ́ sị ma, tumḅọ ḅara saghị ḅogha anịgha túminị́ mịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, kụ́ma Jizọs Krais ḅara na pịghị Tamuno Daḅọ ma ḅara saghịḅom, fịị ḅụ ọ saghịma ḅọ.
english_text: Paul, an apostle—sent not from men nor by a man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead—

ibani_text: Mịnga fịnị mịná owiapụ mamgba bịpị suam ḅẹẹ, a Galesia bie fịnị Tamuno kubiri ogbo mamgba bii.
english_text: and all the brothers and sisterswith me, To the churches in Galatia:

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Tamuno wámịna Daḅọ na pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

ibani_text: Krais ori duma pa igwagwaá wa pịrịm wámịna sii gosi, Tamuno Daḅọ ma bi ḅara.
english_text: who gave himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,

ibani_text: Boma fịnị Tamuno ma pịrị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá la. Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: Anị i tọ́rụ́ nẹngịm ḅẹ́ ọmịnị álála Tamuno ma sịghịmam, Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ọ sịḅọ ma sị pịghị jẹ́ oku daákịarị ọ sị nyẹ ḅẹ́ anịị ibi oku ma.
english_text: I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you to live in the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel—

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ibi oku ofori, a mịma dughoarị tegó jẹ́apụ imi ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ pịrịarịapụ n pịghị asọ dọghụ Krais ibi oku ma dima dọ́ghụm.
english_text: which is really no gospel at all. Evidently some people are throwing you into confusion and are trying to pervert the gospel of Christ.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wamịnị anịgha sobie sághị ḅo sookumuḅọ ḅo jẹ́ ibi oku dugho wásáma ọ pịrị, kịrịnyẹ wa dugho ọ pịrịmaá nganyẹ ma ḅụ, Tamuno si fị́lā pa n ḅọ sịbị ọgọnọ ḅụ gbánabẹm mú gbámásó láa.
english_text: But even if we or an angel from heaven should preach a gospel other than the one we preached to you, let them be under God’s curse!

ibani_text: Wa sima dughobẹm, wa parị dugho ḅara ḅẹ́; ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ jụghọ ḅo jẹ́nyẹ dugho ọ pịrị, ọ daákịmaá nganyẹ ma ḅụ kịrịnyẹ, si fị́lā nḅọ sịbị ọgọnọ gbánabẹm mú gbámásó láa.
english_text: As we have already said, so now I say again: If anybody is preaching to you a gospel other than what you accepted, let them be under God’s curse!

ibani_text: Mịma anị die ḅẹ́ a túminị́ ḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ mịẹarị? Ọkọ fịnịgha, a binyẹ anịị Tamuno ḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ. Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ a túminị́ go pa iḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ mịẹarị, anịsáa a ine Krais fịrịnwangịḅọ ẹrẹ fịbịghaa.
english_text: Am I now trying to win the approval of human beings, or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.

ibani_text: O kúru a dugho ọ pịrị ị́yẹ́ a mịnaapụ, a dugho wásámaarị ibi oku ma kị́nị́ ḅara sághị ḅogha.
english_text: I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel I preached is not of human origin.

ibani_text: A kị́nị́ ḅara anị nyánáḅoghaa, anịgha kị́nị́ anị pa i die, Jizọs Krais ọ ḅara na anị diefindi i pịrịm.
english_text: I did not receive it from any man, nor was I taught it; rather, I received it by revelation from Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Ọ naamam, a pa ngá ḅara a Juuapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma kọọarị sáá, a ọḅụdighigha ḅara pa Krais asọduaapụ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịma ḅara, a pịghị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹm árị ḅẹ́ a Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma gulugulumam.
english_text: For you have heard of my previous way of life in Judaism, how intensely I persecuted the church of God and tried to destroy it.

ibani_text: A Juuapụ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma kọọ i bịrịapụ i jẹa Juuapụ mamgba nẹngịm, a ine ḅara, a wámịna tádọ́apụ saghị ḅọ́rọ́ma wa pịrị ámá mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma ọlọ sẹ́mam.
english_text: I was advancing in Judaism beyond many of my own age among my people and was extremely zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọrẹ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ tarị i sẹ́lẹ́akịm nịị nnị i yiigha sa ḅẹ́ a ḅo fịrịnwangị ọ pịrị. Ọ dọghụ sa ḅẹ́ ori ọ Tụ́wọ ma pa i die
english_text: But when God, who set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me by his grace, was pleased

ibani_text: a ine o gboloma ibi oku dugho wásáma bẹ ḅara pa Juughaapụ pịrị, a mangị mú kị́nị́ gbilaghaa a mịẹbẹnyẹ.
english_text: to reveal his Son in me so that I might preach him among the Gentiles, my immediate response was not to consult any human being.

ibani_text: A iwóo Jerusalem mugha mú tarị nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅara nyẹ gbíla, anịmanakaragha a Arebiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ múm, miẹfamaa sa a so Damasikọs ama ḅoo.
english_text: I did not go up to Jerusalem to see those who were apostles before I was, but I went into Arabia. Later I returned to Damascus.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, anịị a so Jerusalem mú nyẹ mú Pita na irịa, warị ọ nana aningáa jie a dii fịnị.
english_text: Then after three years, I went up to Jerusalem to get acquainted with Cephasand stayed with him fifteen days.

ibani_text: A jẹ́ nfịrịmaḅọ arịgha tụ́ma Jems ngéré Kịnịnyáná Jizọs numboru.
english_text: I saw none of the other apostles—only James, the Lord’s brother.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ anịị a gịẹárị nyẹ, Tamuno nimim ḅẹ́ a iruoghaa.
english_text: I assure you before God that what I am writing you is no lie.

ibani_text: Mịẹfáma sáá a tọgha angaá múm Siriya na Silisiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ.
english_text: Then I went to Syria and Cilicia.

ibani_text: Anịsa ma ḅụ Krais kubiri ogbo mamgba Judiya ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ yọ bie fịnịnyẹ na nnị inimigha ịrị tụọ.
english_text: I was personally unknown to the churches of Judea that are in Christ.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ dughoarị nyẹ ngéré anịị n níminyẹ: Ḅẹ́ parị wa pa tọ́rụ́siarịma ḅọ ma mị́sa ọ fama dọghụ minini ma dugho wásámaarị.
english_text: They only heard the report: “The man who formerly persecuted us is now preaching the faith he once tried to destroy.”

ibani_text: Anịgo, nnị Tamuno túminim i sịbị gosi.
english_text: And they praised God because of me.

ibani_text: Oyi ínia kụ́rá ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ịrị na Banabas iwóo Jerusalem múm, a Taitọs pa wámịna ḅụ suam.
english_text: Then after fourteen years, I went up again to Jerusalem, this time with Barnabas. I took Titus along also.

ibani_text: A aningáa ma múm tegó, Tamuno ị tọ́rụ́ findim ḅẹ́ a muu. A aningáa fịnị sáá, ngaḅụ, a Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma sịbịdaapụ na ẹ́gẹ́rẹm. Á bim nnị akanyaḅo a dugho wásáma Juughaapụ pịrịarị ibi oku ma, a bigha ị́yẹ́ fịrịị parị sáá, na mị́sa na ḅo papanyẹ sọọ.
english_text: I went in response to a revelation and, meeting privately with those esteemed as leaders, I presented to them the gospel that I preach among the Gentiles. I wanted to be sure I was not running and had not been running my race in vain.

ibani_text: I nana nwángịḅọ Taitọs, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ ori Girikiḅọ, n kụ́rọ ḅara pa ọ nana mịẹgha ḅẹ́ ori tọ́ngọ̄ pẹlẹ.
english_text: Yet not even Titus, who was with me, was compelled to be circumcised, even though he was a Greek.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ jẹ́apụ ọkọ dọ́ghụm, oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịarịapụ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị sọ mininiapụ, mịnaapụ wámịna ogbobie sọḅom ḅọghu ḅara ḅụ, sị n dọghụ pághámaḅo bẹ ḅara wa nyáná ḅụ́nyana wa ḅo Krais Jizọs na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ sáá, nnị Juuapụ ólóghó ómóniapụ pa wa mịẹ dọ́ghụm.
english_text: This matter arose because some false believers had infiltrated our ranks to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus and to make us slaves.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ kịsị kálá sa sọ, wa n dughoarị nyẹ puugha. Wa ibi oku ma karakárá kokowarị ọ pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: We did not give in to them for a moment, so that the truth of the gospel might be preserved for you.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ fịnịapụ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị sịbịdaapụ a mịma dughoarị tegó a jẹ́ kịrịnyẹ arịgha nna ḅụ na pịghị jẹ́apụ ḅụ; Tamuno ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọkọgha túminị́ tọ́rụ́ pa árịarị nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Nna sịbịdaapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nyanagha n ḅárị bẹnyẹ a dugho pághámaarị ibi oku ma ḅụ.
english_text: As for those who were held in high esteem—whatever they were makes no difference to me; God does not show favoritism—they added nothing to my message.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha, nnị arịḅom ḅẹ́, ibi oku ma dugho wásáma Juughaapụ ma pịrị fịrị ma nníị sághị i ḅárabie suamam, nnị ibi oku ma dugho wásáma Juuapụ pịrị fịrị ma sághị Pita pịrị ḅara.
english_text: On the contrary, they recognized that I had been entrusted with the task of preaching the gospel to the uncircumcised,just as Peter had been to the circumcised.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma kụ́rọ ḅụ nnị i pa nfịrịmaḅọ mịẹ Juughaapụ ma pịrịm, nnị Pita pa nfịrịmaḅọ mịẹ Juuapụ pịrị ḅara.
english_text: For God, who was at work in Peter as an apostle to the circumcised, was also at work in me as an apostle to the Gentiles.

ibani_text: Jems, Pita na Jọn kubiri ogbo ma ákịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị sịbịdaapụ arịḅom ḅẹ́ Tamuno mịị opu fịrị ma pa i pịrịmam, nnị ịrị na Banabas ḅara dam, pa die ḅẹ́ wamịnị mamgba fịrị ma nwángị gbólomaarị, n minim ḅẹ́ ịrị na Banabas Juughaapụ ma ogbobie fịrịnwangị, nnị warị Juuapụ ma ogbobie fịrịnwangị.
english_text: James, Cephasand John, those esteemed as pillars, gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship when they recognized the grace given to me. They agreed that we should go to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcised.

ibani_text: Nnị bii nyẹ ngéré anị ḅẹ́, wa igonyiapụ ma pa samangba biekóróma nna ogbobie, mịma anị pịghị a mịẹ dọghụnyẹ.
english_text: All they asked was that we should continue to remember the poor, the very thing I had been eager to do all along.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Pita ḅo Antịọkụ láa sáá, a gbọ ọ tọ́rụ́ suam ḅẹ́ ori irimam.
english_text: When Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he stood condemned.

ibani_text: Jems fịrịmaapụ ma na ḅo anị ngá ma laagha sa, Pita, ọ Juughaapụ ma na nyẹ́fị fịm. Kụ́ma mịná túminị́ ma anị ngá láa sa, ori ọ ḅụ nụ́nụ́ákịm si mịnị Juughaapụ ma na nyẹ́fịgha, tegó, ḅẹapụ ḅẹ́ Juughaapụ ma tọ́ngọ̄ pẹ́lẹ́ ori n dighi ḅáláfaarị.
english_text: For before certain men came from James, he used to eat with the Gentiles. But when they arrived, he began to draw back and separate himself from the Gentiles because he was afraid of those who belonged to the circumcision group.

ibani_text: Isi Juu mịnaapụ ma warị Pita dua nyẹ mịẹ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ́ agidi, nna mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ́ agidi ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Banabas irimam.
english_text: The other Jews joined him in his hypocrisy, so that by their hypocrisy even Barnabas was led astray.

ibani_text: A árị sa ḅẹ́ nnị ibi oku ma karakárá dua gbụ́nụ́nụ́ asọ nwángịgha, a dugho Pita pịrịm nnị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku, Ịrị Juuḅọ kụ́ma ị duma kọarị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị Juughaḅọ. I Juuḅọ ḅara pa duma kọghaa. Anịsa, ị tọ́rọ́ pa ine Juughaapụ ma mịẹbẹ sị n duma kọọ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị Juuapụ?
english_text: When I saw that they were not acting in line with the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas in front of them all, “You are a Jew, yet you live like a Gentile and not like a Jew. How is it, then, that you force Gentiles to follow Jewish customs?

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅụ, wamịnị nnị wa yiim Juuapụ, Siiamịẹnyẹ Juughaapụgha.
english_text: “We who are Jews by birth and not sinful Gentiles

ibani_text: Anịsọ wa nimim ḅẹ́ tumḅọ ḅo Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ fịnịm, anị tumḅọ ma Krais ḅụ nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹgha ḅụ. Wamịnị sọ Krais Jizọs ḅụ mininimam sị nnị wa pa Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ warị, Krais Jizọs ḅụ wa nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ólóghó ma dughonyẹ mịẹgha ḅụ. Ḅẹ́ nnị ólóghó ma ngéré dughonyẹ mịẹarịḅọ pa Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ warịbịgha.
english_text: know that a person is not justified by the works of the law, but by faith in Jesus Christ. So we, too, have put our faith in Christ Jesus that we may be justified by faith inChrist and not by the works of the law, because by the works of the law no one will be justified.

ibani_text: Dighi mị́sa wa dọghụarị wamịnị ine Tamuno kuu karakárá ḅụ sẹ bẹ ḅara Krais ḅụ wa nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ nnị wamịnị arịm ḅẹ́ wamịnị siiapụ Juughaapụ ma fịnị ḅara, anịma dugho ḅẹ́ Krais siinyẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam? Ọkọfịnịnyẹ ofori.
english_text: “But if, in seeking to be justified in Christ, we Jews find ourselves also among the sinners, doesn’t that mean that Christ promotes sin? Absolutely not!

ibani_text: A ḅọ́rọ́ sima nama ḅọ́rọ́maa sa a nụ́nụ́kamaá nyẹ, a ịḅụ pa ólóghó kaaḅọ mịẹm.
english_text: If I rebuild what I destroyed, then I really would be a lawbreaker.

ibani_text: Anị ólóghó ma gboloma ḅara ḅụ, a fịị ólóghó ma pịrịm sị a duma Tamuno ma pịrịbẹ ḅára.
english_text: “For through the law I died to the law so that I might live for God.

ibani_text: Nnị ịrị na Krais na ḅaupálịmam a pịghị mịnị dúmaghaá, kụ́ma Krais i biebẹ dumafịnịm. Ojumẹnị ma ḅụ a kọarị duma ma, a anị kọm Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma ḅụ a nyáná minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, i ḅẹlẹma ḅọ pịghị i sịbị gosi fịịḅọ.
english_text: I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

ibani_text: A Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ sịghịghaa, ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ ḅo Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ fịnị ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́ Krais papa fịịm!
english_text: I do not set aside the grace of God, for if righteousness could be gained through the law, Christ died for nothing!”

ibani_text: Ọmịnị oḅorisọ Galesiaapụ, tụọ diri pa ọ mịẹ? Ọmịna tórúku, anị ọ ḅụ koro ḅẹ́ ḅara, n dugho ọ pịrịm Jizọs Krais ḅara warị fịị ḅara mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọgọnọ.
english_text: You foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you? Before your very eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed as crucified.

ibani_text: Ọ mịị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ ma dugho i pịrị, ọ Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyáná ḅo ólóghó ma warị ḅụ anịgha ibi oku ma náa sị pịghị anị minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: I would like to learn just one thing from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by believing what you heard?

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rọ́ pa ọkọfịnị oḅorisọ bẹ ọmịnị Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ pa sághịm, ọ sị ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ine ọmịna ịnyọ pa mị duma kọọ mú kunema láa bẹ?
english_text: Are you so foolish? After beginning by means of the Spirit, are you now trying to finish by means of the flesh?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị árị tọ́rụ́siarị mamgba ḅụ, ọ dawọḅo nyẹ ofori? Ọkọfịnị nyẹ ofori, ọ nyẹ dawọḅom.
english_text: Have you experiencedso much in vain—if it really was in vain?

ibani_text: Tamuno ori ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa ọ pịrị, pịghị ọmịna ogboku bie ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịị, ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ólóghó ma wárim gosi? Anịgha ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ibi oku ma naam sị anị ḅụ minini?
english_text: So again I ask, does God give you his Spirit and work miracles among you by the works of the law, or by your believing what you heard?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị Ebraham dighi nị, tọ́ntọ́ diri ma dugho ḅara, Ọ Tamuno ḅụ mininim, Tamuno pịghị ọ daákịm ḅẹ́ ori karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ori minini gosi.
english_text: So also Abraham “believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”

ibani_text: O nimiḅo ḅẹẹ, karakárá Ebraham furoawọ anịị minini nyánáapụ ma.
english_text: Understand, then, that those who have faith are children of Abraham.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma pághá bẹnyẹ ma dugho kórómamam ḅẹ́ Tamuno Juughaapụ ma pa ọ ḅụ na karakárá ḅụ ḅụ warịbẹm, minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Anịgo ibi oku ma dugho Ebraham pịrịmam ḅẹẹ, Ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno tuminikiri sẹ gbọrụ karịibimabẹm.
english_text: Scripture foresaw that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, and announced the gospel in advance to Abraham: “All nations will be blessed through you.”

ibani_text: Anịgo wamịnị arịm ḅẹẹ, minini nyánáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ karịibima nyánábẹm nnị Ebraham karịibima ḅara ori minini gosi.
english_text: So those who rely on faith are blessed along with Abraham, the man of faith.

ibani_text: Kórómáarịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị ine Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ fịnịbẹm ólóghó ma koko ḅụ, mịnaapụ ma sifịla ḅụ anịị nnị duma kọọarị nyẹ. Ḅẹẹ, n gịẹ kórómamam ḅẹ́, si fị́lā fịnị kị́nị́mamgba pịrị, Ólóghó Diri ma dughonyẹ mamgba mịẹgha ḅo.
english_text: For all who rely on the works of the law are under a curse, as it is written: “Cursed is everyone who does not continue to do everything written in the Book of the Law.”

ibani_text: Mị́sa wa ḅo nimiḅom ḅẹ́ ólóghó ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ pa Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ ḅụ warịgha, Tegó tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹ́, n minini ḅụ Tamuno na karakárá ḅụ ḅụ warịḅọ ma ngéré anịị duma bẹḅọ.
english_text: Clearly no one who relies on the law is justified before God, because “the righteous will live by faith.”

ibani_text: Ólóghó ma anị minini na ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyanagha tụ́ma Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Ólóghó ma binyẹ mamgba mịẹ ḅo anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dumabẹm.
english_text: The law is not based on faith; on the contrary, it says, “The person who does these things will live by them.”
