ibani_text: A gịẹ pa ị fịrịmam Timoti, minini ma ḅụ ị́yẹ́ karakárá tụwọ: Tamuno Daḅọ ma na Krais Jizọs wámịna Nyánáḅọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́, lolomakúkúbie na diin pa ị pịrị.
english_text: To Timothy my true son in the faith: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: A bim ḅẹ́ ịrị Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ fịnị, a dugho ị pịrị ḅara ma a Masidoniya múuarị sáá. Jẹa túminị́ Ẹ́fịsọs ma ḅụ iruonyẹ anịị nnị diearịnyẹ, asọ dọghụ sị n kikii.
english_text: As I urged you when I went into Macedonia, stay there in Ephesus so that you may command certain people not to teach false doctrines any longer

ibani_text: Dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị mịnị sáá ngúmá nyẹ ḅụ ofori lughu ma na n gịẹ kóróma mánámāná tádọ́apụ ẹrẹ ma pịrịma, mịma nụná ngéré anịị anị dighiḅoarị nyẹ, mịná nụná ma minigha tumḅọ ine Tamuno fịrị ma nwángị, mịma anịị tumḅọ ine mịẹbẹnyẹ ḅọ́rọ́ n ḅọ Tamuno ma ḅụ minini nyáná ọkụma.
english_text: or to devote themselves to myths and endless genealogies. Such things promote controversial speculations rather than advancing God’s work—which is by faith.

ibani_text: A mị bịpị ma pịrịm túminị́ ine karakárá kúkúbie ḅụ sághị ḅo ḅẹlẹma pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma bẹ ḅara, fíafía tẹ́mẹ́bie na pịghị karakárá minini ḅụ.
english_text: The goal of this command is love, which comes from a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith.

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ asọ irimam mịná dienyẹ ma ḅụ, warị ofori ofori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa nna ḅụ sukama.
english_text: Some have departed from these and have turned to meaningless talk.

ibani_text: Nnị dọ́ghụm nnị Tamuno ologho ma nyẹ́dieapụ sọọ, kụ́ma nnị akanyaḅo nyána n dughoarị nyẹ ma pịrịgha, anịgha nnị kụrọkiri ḅụ sẹ sị dughoarị nyẹ ma.
english_text: They want to be teachers of the law, but they do not know what they are talking about or what they so confidently affirm.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno ólóghó ma anị ibim ḅọ́rọ́ nnị anị pa fịrị ḅụ sua anị karakárá ḅara.
english_text: We know that the law is good if one uses it properly.

ibani_text: Wa pịghị nimim ḅẹẹ, Tamuno mịná ólóghó ma suagha karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ gosi, kụ́ma ólóghó kaapụ na kụrọsịbịbẹapụ gosi, ọ sua pa Tamunonimighaapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ pịrịm, ọ sua pa tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnịghaapụ na Tamuno gbolomanyẹ dighisimaarịapụ pịrịm, ọ sua pa nyingiapụ na daapụ ḅáapụ pịrịm, ọ pịghị sua pa kị́nị́ ḅa ḅáapụ mamgba pịrịm,
english_text: We also know that the law is made not for the righteous but for lawbreakers and rebels, the ungodly and sinful, the unholy and irreligious, for those who kill their fathers or mothers, for murderers,

ibani_text: ọ sua pa yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọarịapụ, amịna jẹ́ owiapụ na munoarịapụ, kịnịfuru igbii daapụ, iruo nyẹ́dughoapụ na nyẹ́karịfị si iruonyẹ dughoapụ na pịghị Tamuno karakárá dienyẹ ma na kuraghaa nyẹ mịẹarịapụ pịrịm.
english_text: for the sexually immoral, for those practicing homosexuality, for slave traders and liars and perjurers—and for whatever else is contrary to the sound doctrine

ibani_text: Anị dienyẹ ma tumḅọ ine anị árịbẹm n sághị i ḅárabie sua ibi oku ma ḅẹ́ ịrị anị dugho wásámáa, ibi oku ma anịị túminí mamgba ḅụ́gbẹ́ Tamuno ipine diepágháma nyẹ.
english_text: that conforms to the gospel concerning the glory of the blessed God, which he entrusted to me.

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa wámịna Nyánáḅọ Krais Jizọs ḅẹm, ịnyọ pa i pị́rị́máaḅọ sị a ine ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangị. A ịmịẹḅam pa ọ ḅẹm ori ị́yẹ́ árị ḅara ma ḅẹ́ ori ine ịḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánabẹm, anịgo ori tọọm ḅẹẹ a fịrịnwangị ọ pịrị.
english_text: I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me strength, that he considered me trustworthy, appointing me to his service.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá a ọ ḅụ siinyẹ dughom, ọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam pịghị ọ wiri, kụ́ma Tamuno lolomakúkúbie nyáná i pịrịm, tegó na a minini nyanagha gosi a pịghị nimigha a mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: Even though I was once a blasphemer and a persecutor and a violent man, I was shown mercy because I acted in ignorance and unbelief.

ibani_text: Wámịna Nyáná ḅo pịghị opuma ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ pa opuma ịḅụ sara wásámam. Ọ Krais Jizọs ḅara saghị ḅo minini na ḅẹlẹma pa i pịrị bimam.
english_text: The grace of our Lord was poured out on me abundantly, along with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Mịị karakárá dughonyẹ, túminị́ gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá daakị si pịghị anị minini: Krais Jizọs tuminikiri ma ḅom sị o siiamịẹnyẹapụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma. Ị́yẹ́ angaá sii ma pịghị kị́nị́mamgba nyẹ nẹ́ngii.
english_text: Here is a trustworthy saying that deserves full acceptance: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners—of whom I am the worst.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma gosi Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná i pịrịm, sị ịḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ siiapụ mamgba ḅụ siiḅáapụ, Krais Jizọs ọrẹ kunema nyanagha ngịrịma ma diepághámam pa ọ ḅụ ḅoo minini bẹapụ ma die ọ ḅụ minini sị gbámásó duma nyáná.
english_text: But for that very reason I was shown mercy so that in me, the worst of sinners, Christ Jesus might display his immense patience as an example for those who would believe in him and receive eternal life.

ibani_text: Mị́sa kuu na ipine fịnị Gbámásó Ámányánáḅọ ma pịrị Fịịfịghaḅọ, Tọ́rụ́arịghaḅọ, ori ma ngéré anịị Tamuno ma, akị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa! Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: Timoti, i tụwọ a mị againma ma pa ị pịrịm, ị sịbị kóró ikiakoro ma koro ḅara ḅụ, ḅẹẹ ịrị mịị againma ma dua sa, ị tụ́ma ọmụgbiḅọ ḅara pa ọmụ́gbibẹm.
english_text: Timothy, my son, I am giving you this command in keeping with the prophecies once made about you, so that by recalling them you may fight the battle well,

ibani_text: Pịghị ị́yẹ́ minini ọlọsẹma pịghị fíafía tẹ́mẹ́bie warị, jẹ́apụ jẹ́ sa nna tẹ́mẹ́bie pughugha anịgosi nnị nna minini gulugulumamam.
english_text: holding on to faith and a good conscience, which some have rejected and so have suffered shipwreck with regard to the faith.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ anịị Himeniyọs na Alegizanda, a Sátanị warisom si ori nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmáa; mịma n kikibẹm Tamuno karakáráma na kuragha nyẹ die ḅụ.
english_text: Among them are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan to be taught not to blaspheme.

ibani_text: Nyẹ mamgba ḅụ parị nyẹ, a dugho kụ́rọ́mam ḅẹ́, kubiri ogbo nyẹ́bii, tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọ, jẹ́apụ sịbị tẹ́ghẹ̄, pịghị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba sịbị,
english_text: I urge, then, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercession and thanksgiving be made for all people—

ibani_text: ámányánáapụ na pịghị sịbịdaapụ mamgba sịbị, si wamịnị ine yaghúu na diin duma kọọ bẹ ḅara osigha nyáná Tamuno pịrị na pịghị karakárá mịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: for kings and all those in authority, that we may live peaceful and quiet lives in all godliness and holiness.

ibani_text: Mịma anị ibim pịghị Tamuno wámịna Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ ma ḅụ ḅẹ́lẹm,
english_text: This is good, and pleases God our Savior,

ibani_text: biḅọ ḅẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná sị n ḅoo pịghị karakárá ma nimii.
english_text: who wants all people to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ngéré anịị iminyẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́ ogboku sẹ ḅọ anịị Tamuno na túminị́ na akuo gbólómáarịḅọ, anị tumḅọ ma anịị n Krais Jizọs pa sịḅọ ma,
english_text: For there is one God and one mediator between God and mankind, the man Christ Jesus,

ibani_text: ọ ḅụ pa pịrịḅọ túminị́ mamgba dụaḅọ́rọ́ma goo. Mịma anị Tamuno pa tuminikiri gbọrụ fịrịma oku ma anị karakárá sáá ma ḅụ.
english_text: who gave himself as a ransom for all people. This has now been witnessed to at the proper time.

ibani_text: Anịị Tamuno goo i sẹlẹakị sị i fịrịma nyẹ ori oku dugho wásámā ḅọ ḅara na pịghị nfịrịmaḅọ ḅara ḅẹ́, a mịị minini na tụ́manyẹ ma oku ma pa Juughaapụ ma die! A karakárányẹ ma dughoarị a iruo kọgha.
english_text: And for this purpose I was appointed a herald and an apostle—I am telling the truth, I am not lying—and a true and faithful teacher of the Gentiles.

ibani_text: Tamuno kobiri gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, a bim ḅẹ́ owiapụ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ kọọ, tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ ḅara sághị so daa sị tẹ́ghẹ̄, bie akụgha ḅụ anịgha kị́nị́ na kamsọgha ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore I want the men everywhere to pray, lifting up holy hands without anger or disputing.

ibani_text: A pịghị bim ḅẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ḅụ́gbẹ́ ḅara pa nna bịtẹ sua; fíafía na pịghị akanyaḅo nyáná ḅara ḅụ, nna ḅụ́birima sịbị kpeebịegha, anịgha odoḅala nyẹ sua anịgha áwụ áwụ bia ọkụta anịgha opuma nyẹ́laa bịtẹ sua.
english_text: I also want the women to dress modestly, with decency and propriety, adorning themselves, not with elaborate hairstyles or gold or pearls or expensive clothes,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ibiamịẹnyẹ fịrị pa nna ḅụ́birima, anịị anị karakárá n pịrị ḅara dughoapụ ma ḅẹ́ nnị Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ẹrẹ.
english_text: but with good deeds, appropriate for women who profess to worship God.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ḅụdiinma ḅara pa nyẹ dáwọ pịghị karakárá ḅara pa ḅụ sitéréma.
english_text: A womanshould learn in quietness and full submission.

ibani_text: A mịnị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ pịrịgha ḅẹ́ nnị nyẹ́die anịgha sịbịdá owiapụ pịrị, nnị n bịpị gbẹ́ẹ̄ warị.
english_text: I do not permit a woman to teach or to assume authority over a man;she must be quiet.

ibani_text: Tegó Adam anịị n parị tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ, anịsáa ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Ivu.
english_text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve.

ibani_text: Adamugha nnị oḅori pa sịḅọ, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma anịị nnị oḅori pa siiḅọ sị a muu Tamuno ologho kóóró.
english_text: And Adam was not the one deceived; it was the woman who was deceived and became a sinner.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábẹm awọ yii ḅụ, a ḅọ́rọ́ minini ḅụ sẹ kụ́rọ bịpị muu ḅẹlẹma ḅụ, tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ na pịghị bịpị ḅụ laagha ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: But womenwill be saved through childbearing—if they continue in faith, love and holiness with propriety.

ibani_text: Mịị tụ́ma dughonyẹ: ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ tẹ́mẹ́bie ibima dọ́ghụm ḅẹ́ nḅọ Tamuno kubiri ogbo sịbịdáḅọ sọọ, nḅọ túminị́ osigha pa pịrịbẹ fịrị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: Here is a trustworthy saying: Whoever aspires to be an overseer desires a noble task.

ibani_text: Tamuno kubiri ogbo sịbịdaḅọ ori fiesima nẹ́ngị na fiam; gbẹ́rẹ́ táaḅọ ngéré nyáná, ori álála bieoḅughaa, ine ḅụ ọlọ ḅo, kị́nị́ osigha nyáná pịrịḅọ, ine igoniapụ datéréma n ḅo wárị; ine nyẹ́die bẹḅọ;
english_text: Now the overseer is to be above reproach, faithful to his wife, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach,

ibani_text: N ḅo iru ḅuu tọ́rụ́ ḅámábịgha, owitẹ́mẹ́bie pa nyẹ́ mịẹgha, kụ́ma tẹ́mẹ́ ọfịrịgha tumḅọ, kamsọsọghaḅọ; ori igbii ḅẹ́lẹ́mabịgha;
english_text: not given to drunkenness, not violent but gentle, not quarrelsome, not a lover of money.

ibani_text: Ori ine ibima ọ wárị tákúbiri na fiam mịẹsị ori awọ osigha ḅụ ọ bịpị púghú.
english_text: He must manage his own family well and see that his children obey him, and he must do so in a manner worthy of fullrespect.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, ḅọ́rọ́ tumḅọ ine amịna wárị tákúbirigha nḅọ tọrọ́ pa ọrụtọ Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma pịrịbẹ?
english_text: (If anyone does not know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God’s church?)

ibani_text: Ori ịwọma Krais nimiḅọ na fiagha, ori opu ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ mịẹbịgha ḅara sị abana findii sị sóóró kóró ẹ́kpẹ́dua sóóro kóró ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ma ḅụ.
english_text: He must not be a recent convert, or he may become conceited and fall under the same judgment as the devil.

ibani_text: Ori ibi ẹ́rẹ́ nyáná na ibim nụ́ngọ bieapụ fịnịanga, nnị ọ ḅụ́gịrịrịmabịgha ḅara sị ori ẹ́kpẹ́dua dia ma bie sóóro kóró.
english_text: He must also have a good reputation with outsiders, so that he will not fall into disgrace and into the devil’s trap.

ibani_text: Tamuno kubiri ogbo ḅárásúapụ anịị túminị́ osigha nyáná pịrị na fịaapụ, oḅori pa kị́nị́ sịịghaapụ; nnị opuma iru ḅuubịgha anịgha ngara ḅụ ḅo igbii ḅẹlẹma;
english_text: In the same way, deaconsare to be worthy of respect, sincere, not indulging in much wine, and not pursuing dishonest gain.

ibani_text: Minini ma ḅụ n pa n diepágháma póghóló tụ́manyẹ ma nnị fíafía tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅụ anị ọlọọ sẹ́ma na fiam.
english_text: They must keep hold of the deep truths of the faith with a clear conscience.

ibani_text: Nnị parị n daádighibẹm, nnị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ dọghụḅogha n bẹ ḅẹẹ nna ḅụ, nnị n wáriso n fịrịnwangịị ḅárásúapụ ḅara.
english_text: They must first be tested; and then if there is nothing against them, let them serve as deacons.

ibani_text: Nna taapụ sọ anịị túminị́ osigha pa pịrị na ḅụ́gbẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́, nnị jẹ́apụ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bịgha; tọ́rụ́ diinapụ, túminị́ pịghị nna ḅụ biegbana nyánam nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: In the same way, the womenare to be worthy of respect, not malicious talkers but temperate and trustworthy in everything.

ibani_text: Tamuno kubiri ogbo ḅárásuaḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ táaḅọ ngéré anịị n ḅo nyáná bẹnyẹ, n ḅo pịghị ine n ḅọ awọ taa kubiribẹm pịghị ibima n ḅo warị táa kubiri na fiam.
english_text: A deacon must be faithful to his wife and must manage his children and his household well.

ibani_text: Anị ḅárásúapụ ma, ibima nna fịrị ma nwángịarịapụ ibi ẹ́rẹ́ nyánáḅoo n ḅụ pịrịm, n pịghị ine ḅáláfaghaa ḅara pa nna minini dugho pághámabẹm Krais Jizọs ḅụ.
english_text: Those who have served well gain an excellent standing and great assurance in their faith in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: A mịị ábálálá ma gịẹ ị pịrịarị, tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā ḅẹ́ ḅọlọgha sa a ḅoo ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm.
english_text: Although I hope to come to you soon, I am writing you these instructions so that,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a ḅọ́rọ́ sáá ngúma ngúma, mịị ábálálá ma pa o diebẹm túminị́ ḅara warị nyẹ́ mịẹ na ibiḅara Tamuno túminị́ ma kubiri ogbo, anịị dumafịnị Tamuno ma Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma, agalaba sị na anị sughusághị, Tamuno karakárá ma dighinyẹ.
english_text: if I am delayed, you will know how people ought to conduct themselves in God’s household, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅụ, wámịna minini ma ḅụ fịnị ḅọghunyẹ opuma dụḅam, Krais mẹnịsua tuminikiri ḅom, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma diepághámam ḅẹ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ọ ḅụ ofori, sookumuapụ ori arịm, sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ ḅụ nnị o gbolomanyẹ dugho wásámam, tuminikiriapụ ọ ḅụ mininim, nnị ipine ḅụ ọsịakị sọ́mum.
english_text: Beyond all question, the mystery from which true godliness springs is great: He appeared in the flesh, was vindicated by the Spirit, was seen by angels, was preached among the nations, was believed on in the world, was taken up in glory.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅọghugha ḅara pa dugho pághámam ḅẹ́ kunema sáá biri ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ minini ma wárịsóbẹm; si epele ti tẹ́mẹ́ ma pughu sị pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ diearịnyẹ ma dua.
english_text: The Spirit clearly says that in later times some will abandon the faith and follow deceiving spirits and things taught by demons.

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị nyẹ́die ma dugho wásámáarịapụ anịị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ agidi epeletiapụ, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie fịịmam sọ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ọfịrị ikúlélu pa dọ́ghụ́ma nyẹ.
english_text: Such teachings come through hypocritical liars, whose consciences have been seared as with a hot iron.

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị túminị́ diearị bẹ anị karakáragha tumḅọ taa yaa, pịghị jẹa fị́nyẹ fịị. Kụ́ma Tamuno anị fị́nyẹ ọrụ ma tẹ́mẹm ḅẹ́ tumḅọ imiẹḅa tẹ́ghẹ̄ẹ̄ kọọ sọ sáá n ḅo anị fịị, mịma miẹbẹapụ anịị mininiapụ ma pịghị karakárá ma nimimaapụ.
english_text: They forbid people to marry and order them to abstain from certain foods, which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and who know the truth.

ibani_text: Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ibim; tumḅọ sịghị na ibi nyẹ ofori, kụ́ma nnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ daákịbẹm ịmịẹḅam tẹ́ghẹ̄ bịpị ḅụ,
english_text: For everything God created is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving,

ibani_text: tegó Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma na tẹ́ghẹ̄ na mịẹm si anị Tamuno daakị ibinyẹ sọọ.
english_text: because it is consecrated by the word of God and prayer.

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ mịnanyẹ ma pa mininiapụ ma biekóróma kóróma, anịị a dugho kórómanyẹ ma, ịrị Krais Jizọs ibi fịrịnwangịḅọ sọ́bẹm, minini ma karakárá ḅụ n dighi pághámaḅoḅọ na pịghị ị́ duamaa karakárá dienyẹ ma.
english_text: If you point these things out to the brothers and sisters,you will be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished on the truths of the faith and of the good teaching that you have followed.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ fófóoma tumḅọ dugho naibigha tamuno osigha olom lughu ma ḅụ, ọmịnị ọmịna ojumẹnị pa dawọnyẹ ḅụ sua Tamuno tọ́ọ ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives’ tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.

ibani_text: Oju jighema ti ma sọnyẹ nyánam, kụ́ma tẹ́mẹ́ju fịrịnwangị ma sọnyẹ sọ́ḅám asọ kịrịkị́rị́ ḅụ tegó anị duma pa wa pịrịbẹm, mị́sa na pịghị ḅoarị sáá.
english_text: For physical training is of some value, but godliness has value for all things, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.

ibani_text: Mị tụ́ma dughonyẹ tumḅọ karakáráma ákịbẹnyẹ pịghị anị minini.
english_text: This is a trustworthy saying that deserves full acceptance.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ịnyọ pa tụ́ma fịrị nwángịm tegó wamịnị wámịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ pa dumafịnị Tamuno ma ḅụ gbánam, kị́nị́mamgba Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ nyẹ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ anịị mininiapụ.
english_text: That is why we labor and strive, because we have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, and especially of those who believe.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma pa n die pịghị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅẹẹ nnị ị dughonyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: Command and teach these things.

ibani_text: Minima gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so idighialima ḅẹ́ ịrị ásátụ́wọ, kụ́ma mininiapụ ma ogbo arịị ḅẹ́ ịrị anịị nnị tọ́rụ́ saghị dighi bẹḅọ, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ḅụ, ị́yẹ́ mịẹmịẹnyẹ ḅụ, ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma ḅụ, ị́yẹ́ minini ḅụ na pịghị ị́yẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́bie fíafía ḅụ.
english_text: Don’t let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith and in purity.

ibani_text: A fịnị wárii si ḅoo bẹ sáá láa, sáá ngúmá tọ́ndiri ma goo págháma kubiri ogbobie, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásáma pịghị nyẹ́die.
english_text: Until I come, devote yourself to the public reading of Scripture, to preaching and to teaching.

ibani_text: Iḅụbie fịnị tẹ́mẹ́ju dienyẹ ma, ị nyánáḅọ nyẹ nnị ị sịbị ikiakoro sa, na pịghị sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅara pa ị sịbị gbánā sáá, anị dighitọ́rụ́si ma.
english_text: Do not neglect your gift, which was given you through prophecy when the body of elders laid their hands on you.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma pa fịrị ḅụ sua; ịḅụ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá anị bie suu, sị kị́nị́mamgba ị́yẹ́ bịpị muu árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Be diligent in these matters; give yourself wholly to them, so that everyone may see your progress.

ibani_text: Ḅụ ẹbị, i duma kọọarị ḅara na pịghị ị nyẹ́diearị ḅara. Pa ị mịẹarịnyẹ ma mịẹ tegó ị́ ọkọmiẹmiẹ ị́ ịḅụ na ị naarịapụ ma duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm.
english_text: Watch your life and doctrine closely. Persevere in them, because if you do, you will save both yourself and your hearers.

ibani_text: Kụrọ pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ dii pa i nẹ́ngị owitụ́wọ pịrịma, kụ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ọ pịrị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ori anịị ị daá. Ị dii pa nẹ́ngị owiapụ awọ ma akịị ị́yẹ́ owiapụ mịnaapụ ḅara.
english_text: Do not rebuke an older man harshly, but exhort him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as brothers,

ibani_text: Dii pa ịnẹ́ngi ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma akịị ị́yẹ́ nyingiapụ ḅara, i nẹ́ngị ẹ́rẹ́awọ ma akịị ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́mịnaapụ ḅara, fíafía tẹ́mẹ́ pa.
english_text: older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with absolute purity.

ibani_text: I tọ́rụ́ dee fịịmáa ẹrẹ ma ḅụ kiri láa, ḅárásua nyánágháapụ ma sị ị́ ine ḅárásua n pịrịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: Give proper recognition to those widows who are really in need.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ dee fịịmáa ọ́rụ́ḅọ awọ nyánam anịgha taa awọ nyánam, n Tamuno tọ́ọ n pịrị fịrị nwángịị anị nna nyingi na daa na gboloma ḅara, mị ḅara ma nnị nna nyingi na daapụ na opu nyingiapụ na opu daapụ ma sáá pa n gbẹarị, tegó mịma anịị Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị nyẹ.
english_text: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, these should learn first of all to put their religion into practice by caring for their own family and so repaying their parents and grandparents, for this is pleasing to God.

ibani_text: Deefịị si ngéré fịnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ sị ḅárásua pịrịḅọ nyánághaḅọ a ḅụ pa Tamuno ḅụ gbánam sị dii na ḅáa na tẹ́ghẹ́arị ḅẹ́ Tamuno ḅárásua a pịrị.
english_text: The widow who is really in need and left all alone puts her hope in God and continues night and day to pray and to ask God for help.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma deefịị sị a ḅụ pa tuminikiri ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pịrịmaá ọ́rụ́ḅọ, fịịmam a ḅọ́rọ́ pa duma sọọ.
english_text: But the widow who lives for pleasure is dead even while she lives.

ibani_text: Mịná bịpị kóróma warị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrị si n karakárányẹ ma mịẹbẹ ḅára sị n bịpị dighiḅobịgha ḅara.
english_text: Give the people these instructions, so that no one may be open to blame.

ibani_text: Ine amịna mịnaapụ siḅegha ḅọ, anịị taa na awọ pa tórúku tarị, anị tumḅọ ma ọḅụ pa minini ma gbimam, mininighaḅọ ibi anị tumḅọ ma nẹngịm.
english_text: Anyone who does not provide for their relatives, and especially for their own household, has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ deefịịmaaḅọ ẹrẹ pa deefịịmaaapụ ma ábálálá bie suama ḅọ́rọ́ anị ḅo ma na kụ́rá tẹ́si ḅọ́rọ́gha nḅẹḅẹ́. Pịghị jẹ́, ḅẹẹarị a ḅụ warị a dee ngéré pịrịm,
english_text: No widow may be put on the list of widows unless she is over sixty, has been faithful to her husband,

ibani_text: túminị́ pịghị ibima a nimim árị ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ, ibiḅara pa árị awọ didighi págháma ḅooḅọ, igonyiapụ datéréma ḅọ a wárịbie, ḅụ sitéréma fịrịnwangị jẹ́ mininiapụ pịrị, ḅárásua ḅụ́ḅáláḅálábie fịnịapụ pịrị, pịghị a ḅụ sághị ibifịrị nwángị pịrị.
english_text: and is well known for her good deeds, such as bringing up children, showing hospitality, washing the feet of the Lord’s people, helping those in trouble and devoting herself to all kinds of good deeds.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma dee fịịmáa ẹrẹawọ suama ábálálá ma bie; tegó owiapụ n tarimaẹrẹ n Krais wáriso mangị sọ́bẹm,
english_text: As for younger widows, do not put them on such a list. For when their sensual desires overcome their dedication to Christ, they want to marry.

ibani_text: anị ḅara ma nnị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅárásiapụ sọ́bẹm tegó n parị minini ọ pịrịnyẹ ma nnị anị mịẹgha.
english_text: Thus they bring judgment on themselves, because they have broken their first pledge.

ibani_text: Nnị mịnị ḅụ pa fịrị ḅụ suu dọghụgha ḅara ma, nnị ikelekelearị wárị wárị muarị; kụ́ma pịghị anị ḅụ siḅaá nyẹ, n saghị kị́nị́ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́apụ sọbẹm na pịghị tọ́rụ́ pa jẹ́apụ nyẹ bie suuapụ, nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ na ibighaa nyẹ ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: Besides, they get into the habit of being idle and going about from house to house. And not only do they become idlers, but also busybodies who talk nonsense, saying things they ought not to.

ibani_text: Anịgoo a biibẹm ḅẹ́ dee fịịmaá ẹ́rẹ́awọ ma deeyaa, awọ yii sị nna wárị táakúbirii sị wámịna iruonaapụ asọ arịbịgha ḅara sị wa dughosima.
english_text: So I counsel younger widows to marry, to have children, to manage their homes and to give the enemy no opportunity for slander.

ibani_text: Jẹa dee fịịmaá ẹ́rẹ́ imi, pịghịmaapụ sị sághị Satanị dua.
english_text: Some have in fact already turned away to follow Satan.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ Krais ḅụ minini ọ́rụ́ḅọ dee fịịmaá ḅọ nyánam árị wárị, árị á táa kubiri, anị ḅara ma, anị ikúnyẹ ma mịnị Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma sịbị ọgọnọ gbanabịgha, anịsáa Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma ine ḅárásua nyanagha dee fịịmaapụ ma táakúbiribẹm.
english_text: If any woman who is a believer has widows in her care, she should continue to help them and not let the church be burdened with them, so that the church can help those widows who are really in need.

ibani_text: Ibifịrị nwángịarị sẹ́nịapụ ma sịbịdaapụ ḅara ma anị ḅụ́gbẹm ḅẹ́ nnị mmẹẹ́ kiri kuu pa n pịrị, nyẹ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ, anịị ịnyọsua fịrị nwángịarịapụ ma oku ma dugho wásáma na nyẹ́die ḅụ.
english_text: The elders who direct the affairs of the church well are worthy of double honor, especially those whose work is preaching and teaching.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ; Ásụ ma bịpị fịna ma ị́ anị pa mbiakpa isimaarị sáá, ḅẹẹ, Fịrịnwangịarịapụ ma nna gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ nyáná na ibim.
english_text: For Scripture says, “Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain,”and “The worker deserves his wages.”

ibani_text: Túminị́ akuoo sẹ́nịḅọ sịbị sẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́ pughu ma ḅọ́rọ́ anị mmẹapụ na tẹ́rẹ́ onyésẹapụ nyanagha nyanagha.
english_text: Do not entertain an accusation against an elder unless it is brought by two or three witnesses.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba tórúku igani siinyẹ mịẹapụ pịrị sị kọọapụ anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅáláfaa.
english_text: But those elders who are sinning you are to reprove before everyone, so that the others may take warning.

ibani_text: Wámịna Tamuno tórúku na pịghị Krais Jizọs tórúku na pịghị tọ́ntọ́ sookumuapụ ma tórúku. A dugho kụrọma ọ pịrịm ḅẹ́ ọ mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pa nyẹ si, ḅẹ́ ma ḅẹ́ mingaḅọ ibim, mingaḅọ ibighaa, ị mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: I charge you, in the sight of God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, to keep these instructions without partiality, and to do nothing out of favoritism.

ibani_text: Mangị pa nyẹ mịẹma, anịị ḅara pa kị́nị́ sịbị gbánā ḅụ ị n ḅo sághị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ fịrị ma pịrịarị sáá. Diekiri nyáná ma jẹ́apụ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ; ịḅụ kpainma wárii.
english_text: Do not be hasty in the laying on of hands, and do not share in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.

ibani_text: Mịnị mingi ngéré ḅuu ma, kụ́ma kálá iru nyẹ ḅuu, ị furo gosi na pịghị i álála koroarị obi ma gosi.
english_text: Stop drinking only water, and use a little wine because of your stomach and your frequent illnesses.

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ siiamịẹnyẹ ma ekeke siri ogbo imii nna sii pịghị tórúku sọ n pịrịm ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ siri ḅụ; jẹ́apụ nna siiamịẹnyẹ ọḅụkụ́nọma anịị nnị anị árịarị nyẹ.
english_text: The sins of some are obvious, reaching the place of judgment ahead of them; the sins of others trail behind them.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma túminị́ nwángị ibifịrị ma ḅọghugha ḅara ḅụ kị́nị́ anị arịm, kị́nị́ ine arịgha angaá nyẹ ma sọọ ine ḅọghubịgha.
english_text: In the same way, good deeds are obvious, and even those that are not obvious cannot remain hidden forever.

ibani_text: Ómóniapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ́gbẹ́ osigha pa nna nyánáapụ pịrịị, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ Tamuno ẹrẹ ma anịgha wámịna dienyẹ ma dughosimabịgha ḅara.
english_text: All who are under the yoke of slavery should consider their masters worthy of full respect, so that God’s name and our teaching may not be slandered.

ibani_text: Ómóniapụ, Krais ḅụ mininiapụ nyánáapụ nna nyánáapụ ḅara, osigha nyanagha ḅara pa nnị na ngaa ma ḅẹ́ nnị sọ mịnaapụ gosi. Tụ́ma nnị ibiḅaa ḅara pa fịrịnwangị n pịrị tegó nna fịrị ma ḅụ sọnyẹ fịarịapụ nnị sọ mininiapụ na n pịghị ḅẹlẹmaapụ. Mịnanyẹ ịrị anị diebẹm pịghị anị dugho wásámáa n pịrịị.
english_text: Those who have believing masters should not show them disrespect just because they are fellow believers. Instead, they should serve them even better because their masters are dear to them as fellow believers and are devoted to the welfareof their slaves. These are the things you are to teach and insist on.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ kịrị dienyẹ dieḅọ fịnịfịnị sị pịghị wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma na kuragha nyẹ na pịghị wámịna Tamuno minini dienyẹ ma diegha ḅọ
english_text: If anyone teaches otherwise and does not agree to the sound instruction of our Lord Jesus Christ and to godly teaching,

ibani_text: opuamịẹnyẹ anị n ḅọ sịbị kpórómáarịnyẹ n ḅọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nimigha. Nnị kụ́rọ pụghọ nyánam sị nyẹ ḅụ ófórigha nyẹ gosi nyẹ nụná pịghị kam sọọ, mịma warị tẹ́mẹ́ akụ, nụná, wiri núme, si ẹ́rẹ́ pa kị́nị́ sị, sitẹ́mẹ́ biegbáná nyanagha jẹ́apụ ḅụ,
english_text: they are conceited and understand nothing. They have an unhealthy interest in controversies and quarrels about words that result in envy, strife, malicious talk, evil suspicions

ibani_text: pịghị sámámgba nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ịlọlịapụ na ḅẹrẹ kpángịrị, mịnị tọ́ntọ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma karakárá nyánágháapụ. Nnị kórómaarị ḅẹ́ Tamuno nimi ma anịị ḅọ́rọ́ igbii nyána asọ.
english_text: and constant friction between people of corrupt mind, who have been robbed of the truth and who think that godliness is a means to financial gain.

ibani_text: Tamuno nimi na tumḅọ nyánányẹ fúrōbi anịị opu sọnyẹ.
english_text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

ibani_text: Wa ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ pa tuminikiri ma ḅogha, wa pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ dighi sobịgha.
english_text: For we brought nothing into the world, and we can take nothing out of it.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, wa ḅọ́rọ́ fị́nyẹ na sua bẹ bịtẹ nyána anịma wa fúrōbii.
english_text: But if we have food and clothing, we will be content with that.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma igbii nyána biiapụ daádighi bie sọsọm n warị pịghị mánámāná ojumẹnị tarịarị oḅori nyẹ na nyẹ pa túminị́ láama bẹ dia ḅụ koro, n nụ́nụ́ kiri kórómaarị nyẹ sị pịghị n guluguluma.
english_text: Those who want to get rich fall into temptation and a trap and into many foolish and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, igbii ḅẹlẹma anịị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ siinyẹ mamgba dighiḅoarị nyẹ. Jẹ́apụ igbii pụghọ tarị ma mịẹmam nnị asọ ịrị minini ma ḅụ, n warị pịghị tọgha tọgha tẹ́mẹ́ sima nyẹ pa nna kúkúbie fom kaamam.
english_text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrịị, Tamuno tumḅọ ịḅụ darịma mịnanyẹ mamgba ḅụ, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ dọghụ pa sịbị sághị, Tamuno nimi, minini, ḅẹlẹma, ngịrịma na diin mịẹnyẹ.
english_text: But you, man of God, flee from all this, and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance and gentleness.

ibani_text: Minini ibi owu ma sọọ, gbámásó duma ma ọlọ sẹ́ma ịḅụ pịrị, mị duma ma goo anị Tamuno goo ị siinyẹ ị́ ị́yẹ́ minini dugho wásáma sáá tọgha onyésẹapụ tórúku.
english_text: Fight the good fight of the faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called when you made your good confession in the presence of many witnesses.

ibani_text: Tamuno ma tórúku, duma pa nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịarị ḅo na pịghị Krais Jizọs tórúku, ori sẹ sị ori minini dugho pághámaḅo Pọntiyọs Paileti tórúku, a tọ́ọ ị pịrịm
english_text: In the sight of God, who gives life to everything, and of Christ Jesus, who while testifying before Pontius Pilate made the good confession, I charge you

ibani_text: ḅẹẹ ị mịị ologho ma warị, fu ịḅụ gbologha anịgha bịpị ịḅụ laagha pa, akị mú wámịna Nyanaḅọ Jizọs Krais ọ ḅụ die sáá láa,
english_text: to keep this command without spot or blame until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,

ibani_text: Tamuno mịẹbẹnyẹ anị ḅoo kiriakị ori sáá ma láa sáá n boma ḅọ pịghị Táarịḅọ ma ngéré, ámányánáapụ mamgba ḅụ Ámányánáḅọ, kị́nị́nyánáapụ mamgba ḅụ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ,
english_text: which God will bring about in his own time—God, the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords,

ibani_text: ori ngéré anịị fịịbịgha Tamuno ma ori anịị tumḅọ ine sọma mú láabịgha baá ma bie angaá ḅoo. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọọ na jẹ́ éné ori arịgha, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọọ ine ori arịbịgha. Kuu na ịnyọ fịnị ọ pịrị mú gbámásó láa! Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: who alone is immortal and who lives in unapproachable light, whom no one has seen or can see. To him be honor and might forever. Amen.

ibani_text: Kụrọ ḅara pa dugho mị tuminikiri ngọ ma nyánáapụ pịrịị ḅẹ́ nnị opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹma, anịgha tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā dima dima koroarị nyẹ ḅụ, anịị tuminikiri ngọ kụma Tamuno ḅụ, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa wásáma wa pịrịḅọ sị wamịnị anị pa wa ḅụ tii.
english_text: Command those who are rich in this present world not to be arrogant nor to put their hope in wealth, which is so uncertain, but to put their hope in God, who richly provides us with everything for our enjoyment.

ibani_text: Kụ́rọ ḅara pa dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị ibi nyẹ mịẹ, nnị opuma ibifịrị nwángị, n ḅara findi wásáma, sámámgba n tẹ́lẹ́ma jẹ́apụ na nyẹ die ḅụ.
english_text: Command them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, and to be generous and willing to share.

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma nnị tụ́ma ngọ koko nna ḅụ pịrịarị, karakárá sughu isé nyẹ so n pịrịbẹnyẹ ḅoarị sáá ma ḅụ. Anịsáa anịị nnị ine tụ́ma duma nyáná ḅo bẹnyẹ anịị duma ma.
english_text: In this way they will lay up treasure for themselves as a firm foundation for the coming age, so that they may take hold of the life that is truly life.

ibani_text: Timoti, pa ibima wárị n pa ị ḅárabie suanyẹ ma. Ịḅụ sií kuu pa Tamuno pịrịgha ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị oḅori nyẹ nụná ḅụ, túminị́ irima ḅara pa Níminyẹ sị nyẹ.
english_text: Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to your care. Turn away from godless chatter and the opposing ideas of what is falsely called knowledge,

ibani_text: Jẹ́apụ bịpịkpọman ḅẹẹ nnị mịị níminyẹ ma nyánam anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị minini asọ ma ḅụ irimamam. Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnịkịnị mamgba na fịnị.
english_text: which some have professed and in so doing have departed from the faith. Grace be with you all.

ibani_text: Ịrị Pọl, Krais Jizọs fịrịmaḅọ, Tamuno tọ warị ḅara ḅụ, ḅẹ́ a ḅo Tamuno mini wa pịrị duma wa Krais Jizọs ḅụ minini sáá dugho wásámáa.
english_text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, in keeping with the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,

ibani_text: A gịẹ pa ị́ pịrịm Timoti ị́yẹ́ ibi tụwọ: Tamuno Daḅọ na Krais Jizọs wámịna Nyánáḅọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́, lolomakúkúbie na diin pa ị pịrịị.
english_text: To Timothy, my dear son: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: A ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ́m a fíafía tẹ́mẹ́bie pa fịrịnwangị pịrịarịḅọ ị́yẹ́ tádọ́apụ ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅara. A ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹ́m dii na ḅá na ḅụ a ọ pa biekórómáarị ḅara ị́yẹ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅụ.
english_text: I thank God, whom I serve, as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience, as night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ owu mingi pa biekóróma sáá, anị opuma i pụghọ tárịm ḅẹ́ a ị́yẹ́ arịị, sị a bieḅẹlẹ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Recalling your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ karakárá minini ma pa biekórómam, ị́yẹ́ opu nyingi Loisi bie parị fịnịnyẹ na i nyingi Unisi nyáná minini ḅara. A mininim ḅẹẹ mịma so ịḅụ imim.
english_text: I am reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.

ibani_text: Mị ẹrẹ́sị a pa ị biekórómáarị ḅẹ́ Tamuno pa ị pịrị dienyẹ ma a ḅara pa ị sịbị gbánā sa, mịẹsị anị duma.
english_text: For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ Tamuno pa wa pịrịmaá Tẹ́mẹ́ ma minigha wa ḅáláfaapụ sọọ; tụ́ma ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ịnyọ pa wa ḅụ suam, ḅẹlẹma na pịghị ḅụ ọlọọ.
english_text: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love and self-discipline.

ibani_text: Anịgosi, ḅụ́gịrịrịma sị wámịna Nyánáḅọ ma gbolomanyẹ dugho págháma; anịgha i dighi ḅụ́gịrịrị ịrị ikólinaḅọ Krais sịbị goo. Anịmanakaragha ị́yẹ́ diekiri ákịị si tọ́rụ́siarị ibi oku ma pịrị Tamuno ịnyọ pa ịḅụ sua lama ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner. Rather, join with me in suffering for the gospel, by the power of God.

ibani_text: O wa duaḅọ́rọ́mam pịghị wa sị ḅẹ́ wa ḅoo ori a túminị́ sọọ, wa mịẹmáa nyẹ gosigha, kụ́ma ori mịẹ dọghụnyẹ gosi na ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́. O mịị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma pa wa pịrịm tuminikiri na saghịgha sa éné éné Krais Jizọs sịbị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: He has saved us and called us to a holy life—not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa nnị anị diepágháma wa pịrịmam wámịna Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Krais Jizọs ḅoo ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. O fịị kụrọ ma kunemamam sị ibi oku ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ duma gbámásó diepághámamam.
english_text: but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who has destroyed death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.

ibani_text: Tamuno nfịrịmaḅọ na nyẹ́dieḅọ pa i tọọmam ḅẹ́ a ibi oku ma dugho wásámáa.
english_text: And of this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.

ibani_text: Mịma goo anịị a go mịná tọ́rụ́siarị ma árịarị nyẹ kụ́ma a pa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyanam, tegó a nimim a tẹ́mẹ́ pa ḅụ gbánáḅọ a pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ ọ pa i ḅárabie sua warị nyẹ ma ori ine anị koko warịbẹm akị muu anị ene ma láa.
english_text: That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet this is no cause for shame, because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him until that day.

ibani_text: A pa ị die karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ibima anị ọlọọ kụ́rọ́ma sị anị ịrị arị sị duabe nyẹ sọọ, pịghị Krais Jizọs ḅụ wa nyána minini na wa nyáná ḅẹlẹma ḅụ fịnịị.
english_text: What you heard from me, keep as the pattern of sound teaching, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Wa bie fịnị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụrọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị pa ị ḅárabie sua ibi nyẹ ma ibima anị wárii.
english_text: Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you—guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.

ibani_text: I kọ́kọ́ nimi ḅẹ́ Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ma ḅụ fịnịapụ mamgba ikoromasomam, Figelọs na Hemojenesi sọ.
english_text: You know that everyone in the province of Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

ibani_text: Tamuno lolomakúkúbie nyána Onesiforọs wárị pịrị, tegó tọgha sáá ori i tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ saghịmam, anị pịghị ọ ḅụgịrịrịmagha ḅẹ́ a ikólibie imii.
english_text: May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o ḅoo Rom láa gbẹ́rẹ́kirikiri ọ saghị i dọghụ wárii o ḅoo ị́yẹ́ arịm.
english_text: On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma lolomakúkúbie nyáná ọ pịrị anị éné ma ḅụ! I kọkọ pịghị ibima nimi ọ mịẹ i pịrịnyẹ láa ḅara Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ.
english_text: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! You know very well in how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.

ibani_text: Mị́sa, irị i tụwọ, sẹ kụ́rọọ́ wa Krais Jizọs ḅụ nyáná tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: You then, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: I bịpị ị náa sị a die dienyẹ ma tọgha tọgha onyésẹapụ tórúku anị sághị pa tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā na ibiapụ ḅárabie sua, pịghị ine anị pa jẹ́apụ die bẹapụ.
english_text: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

ibani_text: Krais Jizọs ibi ọmụ́gbiiḅọ ḅara, wamịnị na wamịnị árịarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma arịị.
english_text: Join with me in suffering, like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́mụ́gbii fịrị nwangịarịḅọ ofori amịna ḅụ pa papa túminị́ mịẹmịẹnyẹ ḅụ susuḅọ tegó o bibẹm ḅẹ́ ori ọrẹ ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́ma.
english_text: No one serving as a soldier gets entangled in civilian affairs, but rather tries to please his commanding officer.

ibani_text: Mangị ti ma ḅụ, mangịarịḅọ ma, n kóróma warị ngọ ma nyánáḅobịgha n ḅọ́rọ́ ólóghó bịpị ma dua mangịgha.
english_text: Similarly, anyone who competes as an athlete does not receive the victor’s crown except by competing according to the rules.

ibani_text: Anị fiam ḅẹ́ kụrọfịrị ma nwángịmáa dụadipiḅọ ma parị duasughu ma ḅụ sọnyẹ fịị.
english_text: The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.

ibani_text: Sịbịbie kịẹ a dugho ị pịrịarịnyẹ ma pịrị tegó Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma mịẹbẹm ị mịnanyẹ mamgba akanyaḅo.
english_text: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.

ibani_text: Jizọs Krais pa biekóróma, Deviti furo tụwọ, n fịị ḅụ saghịma ḅo nnị anị die ḅara a dugho wásáma ibi oku ma ḅụ.
english_text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David. This is my gospel,

ibani_text: A ibi oku ma dugho wásámam gosi a tọ́rụ́siarịm n pịghị ịkóli pa i ḅara suam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrị ologho kaa ḅo, kụ́ma Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ịkóli anị ḅụ ofori.
english_text: for which I am suffering even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But God’s word is not chained.

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị a ngịrịma nyáná nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma sịbị gosi, nnị sọ Krais Jizọs ḅara ḅoo dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ma nyáná bẹ ḅara Gbámásóḅọ ma akuoarị nyẹ.
english_text: Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.

ibani_text: Mịị anị tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā na ibi dughonyẹ: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ori na fịịmam, wa pịghị ori na dumabẹm.
english_text: Here is a trustworthy saying: If we died with him, we will also live with him;

ibani_text: Wa pa ngịrịma nyáná nyáná, wamịnị na ori na taábẹm. Wa ḅọ́rọ́ o pighi pighi, ori sọ wa pighibẹm.
english_text: if we endure, we will also reign with him. If we disown him, he will also disown us;

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ sẹ kụrọgha, ori o sẹ́kụ́rọm samamgba, tegó ori ine ọ ḅụ pighibịgha.
english_text: if we are faithless, he remains faithful, for he cannot disown himself.

ibani_text: Pa mịnanyẹ ma pa nna biekóróma; Tamuno tórúku ibiḅara pa n birinụ́nụ́ ḅẹ́ nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ goo owusọma. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ibinyẹ sọ mịẹgha, kụ́ma anị púghúarịapụ ma gulugulumaarị.
english_text: Keep reminding God’s people of these things. Warn them before God against quarreling about words; it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị árị ḅẹ́ Tamuno ḅara pụ́nụ́ ị pịrịm, ibifịrị nwángịḅọ ḅara ḅụgịrịrịgha fịrịnwangịḅọ amịna fịrị ḅụ, kuma ibiḅara pa dua muu Tamuno karakáráma láa bẹ oku ma diearị.
english_text: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.

ibani_text: Ịḅụ sii dárímaá Tamuno osigha na oḅori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ḅụ, túminị́ dee ḅọlọanga mumu nyẹ Tamuno fịnị angaá.
english_text: Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị dienyẹ anịị tọ́rụ́ na gbẹ́gha ịnọ fịnị ḅara anịị anị fịnị ḅara ojumẹnị ma pẹ́arị nyẹ. Mịnanyẹ ma dieapụ nna ḅụ mmẹapụ anịị Himeniyọs na Filetọs.
english_text: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,

ibani_text: Nnị dua muu karakárá ma láa bẹ asọ ma warisomam dughoarị ḅẹ́ fịị ḅụ sághị ma kiriakịmam. Anị ḅara ma n mịẹm sị jẹ́apụ minini saghị jighe jighe.
english_text: who have departed from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, and they destroy the faith of some.

ibani_text: Tamuno kụrọ sughu isé ma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ anị jighe jighemabịgha; anị ọgọnọ anịị n mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma gịẹnyẹ: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ori a túminị́ nimim, pịghị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ma goarị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅárásii.
english_text: Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”

ibani_text: Opu wárịbie tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ẹ́fẹ́rẹ na bọlị anịị fịnịnyẹ: jẹa nyẹ pị́naḅala jẹ́anyẹ odoḅala anịị n pa anị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ, jẹa nyẹ sị anịị n pa anị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ, jẹa nyẹ urọ átụ́ma anịị nnị pa anị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ; jẹ́anyẹ álálị ḅụ anịị nnị anị pa fịrị ḅụ súúarị nyẹ, jẹ́anyẹ papa sáá anịị nnị anị pa fịrị ḅụ suuarị nyẹ.
english_text: In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for special purposes and some for common use.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụ sịrịpághámaḅo ḅọ mịnanyẹ mamgbabie, anịḅọ ma nnị nḅọ pa sosighima fịrị nwángịbẹm, tegó anịḅọ ma nḅọ fịrị pa nyẹ́sim pịghị sọnyẹ sọọ nḅọ Nyánáḅọ pịrịm, pịghị tẹ́lẹ́ma ibifịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kúruarị.
english_text: Those who cleanse themselves from the latter will be instruments for special purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ si ásáawọ na ẹ́rẹ́maawọ ojumẹnị tarịarịnyẹ ma ḅụ, sị ịnyọ pa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ dua, minini, ḅẹlẹma na diin na. Ị mịma mịẹbẹm ịrị na tẹ́mẹ́ fíafía ḅụ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma sịarịapụ mamgba ḅẹ́ ọ ḅárásua n pịrị.
english_text: Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

ibani_text: Ịḅụ si akị oḅoriapụ na nyẹ́nimighaapụ nụná nyẹ ḅụ; i kọkọ nimi ḅẹ anị kunema anịị kam sọọ.
english_text: Don’t have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma fịrịnwangịḅọ ḅara ị kam sọọbịgha. I ibiamịẹnyẹ nyáná kị́nị́mamgba pịrị, ibii pịghị ngịrịma nyáná nyẹ́dieḅọ,
english_text: And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful.

ibani_text: diin ḅara pa i nana nụnaapụ ma daatụ́ghụ́ma, tegó Tamuno ine mịẹbẹm si nnị asọ árị sị sii ḅụ pịghị sị karakáráma nimii.
english_text: Opponents must be gently instructed, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,

ibani_text: Anịsáa nnị ḅoo nna ḅụ nyánáḅobẹm sị n ḅụ si akị ẹ́kpẹ́dua tuú dia ma ḅụ, n pa ikólibie suamaaḅọ ḅẹ nnị ọ tọ́ọ nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, who has taken them captive to do his will.

ibani_text: O nimiḅo ḅẹ́ kunema sa biri ma nyẹ ibima ḅụdáa sáá ḅobẹm.
english_text: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days.

ibani_text: Túminị́ nna ḅụ ngéré ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm, igbii ḅẹlẹma, bịpịkpọ, opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹ, kị́nị́ wiri, nyingiapụ na daapụ na osigha, nyẹ tọ́rụ́sọgha, tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ ofori,
english_text: People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,

ibani_text: ḅẹlẹma bie ofori, siiḅụ́ḅárasipịrịdigha, kị́nị́ dughosima, ine ḅụ ọlọgha pa, nyẹ́ sima, ibinyẹ ḅẹlẹmagha,
english_text: without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,

ibani_text: aka ḅara pa túminị́ túlúma ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ suu, sịbịbie kiẹgha pa nyẹ mịẹ, nọmụ ḅara pa opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹ, fị na ḅuu na ḅẹlẹma tụ́ma Tamuno ḅẹlẹma nakaragha.
english_text: treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God—

ibani_text: Tamuno kịkama duma nyáná kụ́ma ori kụ́rọ ma pighi. Nnị na ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nyáná ma.
english_text: having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ epele ḅara pa túminị́ wárị sọsọm sị nna epele dienyẹ ma pa ḅẹrẹtọ amịna minini kụrọgha ẹ́rẹ́maawọ ma pụ́nụ́ma. Mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma anịị nna sii n tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅẹ́rẹ́si pa n pịrịapụ ofori ofori sị nyẹ pịghị pụghọ tarịarịapụ.
english_text: They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,

ibani_text: Mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma sámámgba nyẹ dawọarị kụ́ma ine ḅoo karakárá ma nimiḅogha.
english_text: always learning but never able to come to a knowledge of the truth.

ibani_text: Janesi na Jamberesi, Mosis na nụ́ná ḅara ma anịị mịnaapụ ma karakáráma nụná ḅara, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie mịnị karakárányẹ kórómagha, mịnaapụ anị minini ma gboloma ḅara ḅụ nnị n sịghịmam.
english_text: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these teachers oppose the truth. They are men of depraved minds, who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma n ḅọlọanga labịgha, tegó kị́nị́mamgba árịbẹm nna oḅori sọ láa ḅara. Mịma anịị Jems na Jamberesi ḅụ pághá nyẹ.
english_text: But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, their folly will be clear to everyone.

ibani_text: Ịrị kọkọ ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ mamgba nimi, ị́yẹ́ duma ḅara, a goo a mịẹarịnyẹ mịẹnyẹ, ị́yẹ́ minini, ị́yẹ́ inéma, ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma, ị́yẹ́ ngịrịma.
english_text: You, however, know all about my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,

ibani_text: I pịghị nimim nnị ị́yẹ́ mbasị ḅara na ị́yẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị. I kọkọ ịḅụ pághá nyẹ mamgba nimi Antịọkụ, Aikoniyọm ḅụ na Listira ḅụ a inema nyáná pịrị si n pa ị́yẹ́ mbasị opu mbasị! Kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma i dụapághámaḅo famam anị ḅarabie.
english_text: persecutions, sufferings—what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra, the persecutions I endured. Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.

ibani_text: Tụ́manyẹ ḅụ Tamuno kịka duma kọọdoghuḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Krais Jizọs bie nnị nḅọ pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm.
english_text: In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sị a túminị́ na oḅori pa kịnịsịapụ gbẹ́rẹ́ sii ḅụ akị muu siḅaá angaá nyẹ ḅụ sọọbẹm, oḅori pa jẹ́apụ sịarị jẹ́apụ pịghị oḅori pa nna ḅụ sịarị.
english_text: while evildoers and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị nnị pa ị die karakárá ma ị pịghị ibima minini nyẹ ma ọlọọ tórúku muu. I kọkọ níminyẹ pa i die nyẹ́dieapụ.
english_text: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it,

ibani_text: Ịrị pịghị biekóróma ḅẹ sághị ị́ ịrụ sáá éné éné i Tọ́ndiri ma nimimam ine níminyẹ pa ị pịrịbẹnyẹ si ị daa muu dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná Krais Jizọs ḅụ fịnị minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: and how from infancy you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno anịị sịbịbie pa pịrịnyẹ anị pịghị sọnyẹ ḅụ sọm karakárányẹ die ḅụụ, igani irima nyẹ pịrị, irima nyẹ datụ́ghụ́ma, pịghị pa bịpị kóróma pịrị pa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ duma kọọ.
english_text: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

ibani_text: Mịị ḅárá ma fịrịnwangị Tamuno pịrịarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyẹ́dáwọ ḅụ karakárámabẹm sị ori ine ibifịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nwángị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: so that the servant of Godmay be thoroughly equipped for every good work.

ibani_text: Tamuno na Krais Jizọs tórúku, ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ dumaapụ na fịịapụ pịrịbẹḅọ tegó ḅẹ ọ pịghị sima ḅoarị sị ḅoo taa ámányánáḅọ ḅara, a kụrọma i ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ,
english_text: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:

ibani_text: oku ma dugho wásáma, arịị ḅẹ́ ị anị dugho wásámaarị sáá ma karakárá o karakáragha o mịẹsị nnị akanyaḅo, iganịị pịghị nna tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ kụ́rọ́maá, ị pịghị ngịrịma ḅara pa nyẹ́diearị ḅara.
english_text: Preach the word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage—with great patience and careful instruction.

ibani_text: Sáá ma ḅoarị túminị́ mịnị birifama karakárá dienyẹ ma pịrịbịgha sáá, nnị nna ḅụ tarị nyẹ duabẹm, sị nyẹ́dieapụ táa tụndụrụma nna ḅụ pịrị, nna biri náa dọghụnyẹ pa n die bẹapụ.
english_text: For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.

ibani_text: Nnị nna biri pa jẹ́ angaá wárim nnị karakárányẹ ma náa dọghụgha gosi, tụ́ma birifama lụghụ pughubẹm.
english_text: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, ịrị ịḅụ pa gbẹ́rẹ́ ngaa sẹ́ma warị asọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, inema nyána tọ́rụ́siarị pịrị, ibi oku ma dugho wásámaarị ḅo fịrị ma nwángịị, pịghị ị́yẹ́ fịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nwángịị Tamuno ómóniḅọ ḅara.
english_text: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị ma, ị́yẹ́ duma nnị ọsụ saramam sọ ḅọ́rọ́ igwagwaá iru, sáá láamam a mị tuminikiri warisoo bẹ sáá.
english_text: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time for my departure is near.

ibani_text: A ibi owu sọmam, mangị ma a mangị mú sịbị lámam, a pịghị minini ma wárịmam.
english_text: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

ibani_text: Mị́sa sághị bịpị muu karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ogunu fịnị ikuruarị anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma pa ị pịrịbẹnyẹ anị éné ma, ịrị ngéréghaa, kụma ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ori ḅoo ma kúruarịapụ mamgba.
english_text: Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day—and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing.

ibani_text: I ine ḅara mịẹsị álála i damaḅoo.
english_text: Do your best to come to me quickly,

ibani_text: Demas mị tuminikiri ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam gosi ori i kọ́rọ́ma soó Tẹ́salonaika múm. Kresensi soó Galesia múm, Taitọs warị Dalimasia muu.
english_text: for Demas, because he loved this world, has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.

ibani_text: Luk ngéré anịị ịrị na fịnịḅọ. Mak akị sị ori na ḅoo tegó ori ine ḅárásua ị pịrịbẹm ị́yẹ́ fịrị ḅụ.
english_text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.

ibani_text: A Tisikọs fịrịmaa Ẹ́fịsọs múm.
english_text: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

ibani_text: I ḅo bẹ sáá, a suarị ọgọnọ bịtẹ a wáriso nyẹ Kapọs ḅarabie Troas ḅụ akuoo i pịrị, ị́yẹ́ diri mamgba akuoo, dada nnị nama apara pa mịẹ angaá nyẹ ma.
english_text: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, and my scrolls, especially the parchments.

ibani_text: Alegizanda tinpotery fịrịnwangịarịḅọ ma kpọma siinyẹ pa ị mịẹm; Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọ gbẹ́bẹm ọ mịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Alexander the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done.

ibani_text: Ịrị sọ ibima ịḅụ ẹbị ọ fịnị angaá tegó o kụ́rọ ḅara pa wámịna oku ma dasẹ́mam.
english_text: You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.

ibani_text: A tarị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅụ sẹ sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ i nana sẹgha, a ḅara na ịḅụ pighim; kị́nị́mamgba i kóróma soom. Tamuno anị kịẹ ọ pịrịmaá!
english_text: At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ịrị na fịnịm sị pighi ịnyọ pa i pịrịm, anịgosi a ine bifụfụụ́ oku ma dugho wásáma juughaapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm ḅẹ́ n náa; n pịghị i duapághámaḅom ọkụ nama ma bịpịbie.
english_text: But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. And I was delivered from the lion’s mouth.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ i dua pághámaḅobẹm siinyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ bie, si diin ḅụ ị́yẹ́ akị sobie ori amadakiri ma muubẹm. Boma ma fịnị ori ma pịrị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: A sịbịpị fịrịma Pirisiliya na Akwila siim na pịghị Onesiforọs wárịapụ.
english_text: Greet Priscillaand Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.

ibani_text: Erastọs Kọrịntị ḅụ fịnịm, a warị Trofimọs wáriso Milẹtọs ḅụ ori obikiri ḅụ imim gosi.
english_text: Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick in Miletus.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị ḅoo oḅuu sáá ma na kiri laagha sáá. Eubulusiii, Pudensi, Lainusi na Kilọdia fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a obii, mininiapụ mamgba sọọ obifamam.
english_text: Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ị tẹ́mẹ́ na fịnịị. Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba na fịnịị.
english_text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma ịrị Pọl ḅara saghịḅom, ịrị anịị Tamuno ma ómóniḅọ pịghị Jizọs Krais fịrịmaḅọ, ori i tọọm ḅẹ́ a mú Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ ma daa karakáráma sị n minini nyáná bẹ ḅara sị pịghị karakárá ma nimi mịẹsị nnị ine ibima Tamuno ma dua,
english_text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ to further the faith of God’s elect and their knowledge of the truth that leads to godliness—

ibani_text: mịị karakárá ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánam gbámásó duma nyáná ḅụ, Tamuno ine epeletibịghaḅọ ma mị duma minini wa pịrịm tuminikiri na saghịgha sa,
english_text: in the hope of eternal life, which God, who does not lie, promised before the beginning of time,

ibani_text: anị karakárá sa ori anị diepághámam ori oku ḅụ. Mịma anị ọ saghị i ḅarabie suanyẹ a pịghị dugho wásámam Tamuno wámịna Ḅọ́rọ́maḅọ tọ́ọ i pịrị ḅara.
english_text: and which now at his appointed season he has brought to light through the preaching entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior,

ibani_text: Mị diri ma a gịẹ pa Taitọs fịrịmaarị ị́yẹ́ karakárá tụ́wọ wamịnị mamgba nyáná minima ma ḅụ. Tamuno Daḅọ na Jizọs Krais wámịna Ḅọ́rọ́maḅọ ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin pa ọ pịrịị.
english_text: To Titus, my true son in our common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.

ibani_text: Mịma go anịị a go ị wáriso nyẹ Krete ogbosúányẹ ḅụ, sị ị kọọ sị mịẹ na ibinyẹ mamgba mịẹ fama bẹ ḅara, sị pịghị Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma ḅụ sẹ́nịapụ tọ́ọ ámá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ. A dugho ị pịrịnyẹ ma pa biekóróma ḅẹ́,
english_text: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appointelders in every town, as I directed you.

ibani_text: Tamuno kubiri ogbo sẹnịḅọ anị bịpị ḅụ lánaibịgha tumḅọ, gbẹ́rẹ́ taa ngéré nyánáḅọ, ori awọ pịghị Krais ḅụ mininiapụ. Nnị n nimibịghaa ḅẹ́ nnị kụ́rọ sịbịbie awọ anịgha bịpị pughugha awọ.
english_text: An elder must be blameless, faithful to his wife, a man whose children believeand are not open to the charge of being wild and disobedient.

ibani_text: Tamuno kubiri ogbo sịbịdáḅọ anịị Tamuno fịrị ma ḅara fịnịḅọ, ori ma anịị bịpị ḅụ lánaibighaḅọ, opuamịẹnyẹ tumḅọgha, owi tẹ́mẹ́ nyánágha, iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ḅamaghaḅọ, ama owu ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ anịgha igbii pụghọ nyánághaḅọ.
english_text: Since an overseer manages God’s household, he must be blameless—not overbearing, not quick-tempered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not pursuing dishonest gain.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma igoniapụ datérémadi, ibinyẹ ḅẹlẹma ḅọ, ine ḅụ ọlọḅọ, karakárányẹ mịẹarịḅọ, oju pa tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ warịḅọ, ḅụ ọlọ karakárányẹ pịrịḅọ.
english_text: Rather, he must be hospitable, one who loves what is good, who is self-controlled, upright, holy and disciplined.

ibani_text: Ọ karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọlọ kụ́rọ́mabẹm nnị pa o die ḅara, ori ine ọ dawọḅo karakárányẹ ma pa jẹ́apụ die pịghị irimaarịapụ daá tụ́ụ́ma.
english_text: He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it has been taught, so that he can encourage others by sound doctrine and refute those who oppose it.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ tọghaapụ imi osigha nyáná kụrọnyanáapụ pịrịghaapụ, sị ofori ofori nyẹ dughoarịapụ pịghị mịẹsị jẹ́apụ n minini. Mịma anị jẹa Juuapụ Krais ḅụ ḅo mininimáapụ mịẹarịnyẹ.
english_text: For there are many rebellious people, full of meaningless talk and deception, especially those of the circumcision group.

ibani_text: Mịná túminị́ ma árị ḅẹ́ sị n bịpị gbẹm nnị diearịnyẹ ma ḅụ, tegó nnị tọgha wárị gbọrụ daá irimaarị, nnị die na ḅụgbẹ́gha dienyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Nnị mịma mịẹarị ḅụ́gịrịrị igbii pụghọ gosi.
english_text: They must be silenced, because they are disrupting whole households by teaching things they ought not to teach—and that for the sake of dishonest gain.

ibani_text: Nna ikiakoroapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ dughom ḅẹ́, Kreteapụ ma nnị sámámgba epeletiapụ. Sịbị kụrọ pirinama fịnị ḅárá anịị n fịnị ḅára, fịrị ịnyọ nyanagha opufịnyẹ fị́fị́apụ.
english_text: One of Crete’s own prophets has said it: “Cretans are always liars, evil brutes, lazy gluttons.”

ibani_text: Mịị dugho págháma nyẹ ma tụ́manyẹ, anịgo kụrọma igani n pịrị sị nna minini kpain fịnị bẹ ḅara
english_text: This saying is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, so that they will be sound in the faith

ibani_text: sị n mịnị sa nyána ofori ofori Juuapụ lụghụ pịrịbịgha ḅara na pịghị karakárá ma sịghịmaapụ tọ́ọ warị ologho.
english_text: and will pay no attention to Jewish myths or to the merely human commands of those who reject the truth.

ibani_text: Siiamịẹnyẹ kóróma nyánágháapụ nna tẹ́mẹ́bie nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ibima fiafiam. Kụ́ma ịlọ́lị kóróma nyánáapụ pịghị Krais ḅụ mininighaapụ, nna tẹ́mẹ́bie na nna kóróma gbẹ́rẹ́sa pilemam.
english_text: To the pure, all things are pure, but to those who are corrupted and do not believe, nothing is pure. In fact, both their minds and consciences are corrupted.

ibani_text: Nnị bịpị ḅụ dughoarị ḅẹ́ n Tamuno nimim, kụ́ma nna mịẹnyẹ ḅụ nnị o pighiarị. Mịị túminị́ ma nnị Tamuno ḅụ siiapụ, nnị pịghị ọ bịpị pughugha, nnị ibi pịrị gbẹ́rẹ́ fịrị sọ ofori.
english_text: They claim to know God, but by their actions they deny him. They are detestable, disobedient and unfit for doing anything good.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ịrị Tamuno karakárá dienyẹ ma na kura dienyẹ ma die.
english_text: You, however, must teach what is appropriate to sound doctrine.

ibani_text: Sẹnị owiapụ ma die ḅẹẹ, n tẹ́mẹ́ ọlọ, osigha nyáná nna ḅụ pịrị, ine ḅụ ọlọ, kụ́rọ sẹ nna minini ḅụ, nna ḅẹlẹma ḅụ na pịghị nna ngịrịma ḅụ.
english_text: Teach the older men to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love and in endurance.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma dugho sẹnị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị nna ḅụ pa tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ warị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ duma kọọ na ibiḅara, n kị́nị́ dughosima ma anịgha omoni sọ iru pịrị kụ́ma nnị ibi nyẹ pa jẹ́apụ die.
english_text: Likewise, teach the older women to be reverent in the way they live, not to be slanderers or addicted to much wine, but to teach what is good.

ibani_text: Anịsa nnị ine ẹ́rẹ́awọ ma dighipághámaḅobẹm ḅẹ nnị nna deeapụ na nna awọ ḅẹlẹma,
english_text: Then they can urge the younger women to love their husbands and children,

ibani_text: nnị ine ḅụ ọlọ, bie fíafía ḅụ fịnị, ibima nna wárị tákubiri, ibitẹ́mẹ́ nyáná, ḅụ sitéréma nna dee pịrịapụ, sị túminị́ sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo oku ma pịrịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: to be self-controlled and pure, to be busy at home, to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, so that no one will malign the word of God.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ásáawọ ma ḅẹẹ, nnị nna ḅụ ọlọ.
english_text: Similarly, encourage the young men to be self-controlled.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, ịḅụ die ḅẹ́ ị sẹ ibiamịẹnyẹ pa tọ́ma bẹnyẹ pịrịm, ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ḅụ, sẹ karakárá pịrị, pịghị i diearịnyẹ ma pa nyẹ́sị.
english_text: In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness

ibani_text: I nyẹ́diearị sáá, túminị́ ine ị dughosimabịgha ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma die si ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ ḅụ́gịrịrị bẹ ḅárá. Tegó nnị ḅara pụnụ nyẹ nyánágha nnị go wa dughosima bẹnyẹ.
english_text: and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us.

ibani_text: Ómóniapụ die ḅẹ́ nnị ḅụsímínímá nna nyánáapụ pịrị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ pịghị n tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹlẹma bẹnyẹ mịẹ. Nnị n bịpị pághárabịgha
english_text: Teach slaves to be subject to their masters in everything, to try to please them, not to talk back to them,

ibani_text: anịgha n fúrú. Anịmanakaragha, nnị nna ḅụ die ḅẹ́ nna nyánáapụ ine nna ḅụ biegbánábẹm, mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno wámịna Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ dienyẹ ma kị́nị́mamgba anị ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm asọ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: and not to steal from them, but to show that they can be fully trusted, so that in every way they will make the teaching about God our Savior attractive.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma akuoarị nyẹ anị ḅụ pa túminị́ mamgba diemam.
english_text: For the grace of God has appeared that offers salvation to all people.

ibani_text: Anị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma diearị ḅẹ́, Tamuno bie ófórigha duma sịghị pịghị tuminikiri ma tọ́rụ ḅẹlẹ sịghị warị ḅụ ọlọ duma kọọ, tụ́ghụ́ sẹ na Tamuno dighi ḅáláfa duma kọọ mị tuminikiri ma ḅụ,
english_text: It teaches us to say “No” to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,

ibani_text: wa boma éné ma kúruarị sa, wámịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyáná éné ma anịị wámịna opu Tamuno na wámịna Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Jizọs Krais ipine na ḅo bẹ sa.
english_text: while we wait for the blessed hope—the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ,

ibani_text: Ori ọḅụ pa wa pịrịm sị ori wa duapághámaḅoo bẹ ḅara siiamịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ sị mịẹsị wa fíafía, fịnị ori ngéré pịrị túminị́, sị sámámgba dọghụarị ḅẹ́ wa ibifịrị nwángị.
english_text: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all wickedness and to purify for himself a people that are his very own, eager to do what is good.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma die, ị́yẹ́ sịbịdaa kụ́rọ ma pa n tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọma pịghị igani ị naarịapụ pịrị. Minima gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so idighisima.
english_text: These, then, are the things you should teach. Encourage and rebuke with all authority. Do not let anyone despise you.

ibani_text: Pa mininiapụ biekóróma ḅẹ́ nnị ḅụ sitéréma táarịapụ na sịbịdaapụ pịrị, ḅẹ́ nnị n bịpị pughu, n pịghị tẹ́lẹ́ma sị ibifịrị nwángị asọ kịrịkị́rị́ ḅụ.
english_text: Remind the people to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready to do whatever is good,

ibani_text: Dugho n pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dughosima ma, kụ́ma diin dọghụ, nangwọ mịẹ, pịghị ḅụ́sitéréma ḅara pa kị́nị́mamgba na ngaa.
english_text: to slander no one, to be peaceable and considerate, and always to be gentle toward everyone.

ibani_text: Wamịnị sọ gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri pịghị oḅorisọm, bịpị osigha, nnị wa daa asọ irima. Wa pịghị omoni sọ wámịna ojumẹnị binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm. Wa pịghị wámịna duma kọarị sisịbịbie sua ḅụ, jughonyemọni, jẹapụ imi wa ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaapụ, wamịnị sọ n ḅẹlẹmagha.
english_text: At one time we too were foolish, disobedient, deceived and enslaved by all kinds of passions and pleasures. We lived in malice and envy, being hated and hating one another.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno wámịna ḅọ́rọ́maḅọ ori ibi tẹ́mẹ́ na ori ḅẹlẹma pa wa die sa,
english_text: But when the kindness and love of God our Savior appeared,

ibani_text: ọ wa duaḅọ́rọ́mam, ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ wa mịẹ ọ pịrị ibinyẹ gosi kụ́ma ori lolomakúkúbie ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ wa ḅọ́rọ́mam. Ọ wa duaḅọ́rọ́mam Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, sii ḅụ wa sịrị siḅọ sị ịwọma wa yii na pịghị ịwọ duma pa wa pịrị.
english_text: he saved us, not because of righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He saved us through the washing of rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Tamuno Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa bifụfụụ́ ḅara ḅụ wa pịrịm,
english_text: whom he poured out on us generously through Jesus Christ our Savior,

ibani_text: sị ori tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ sọ́bẹm Tamuno ma fịnị angaá, sị ḅo wa tọ́rụ́dighi gbámásó duma ma nyáná.
english_text: so that, having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs having the hope of eternal life.

ibani_text: Mịị karakárá dughonyẹ, a bim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị anị dugho, anị dugho ḅarị, sị Tamuno ma ḅụ mininimáapụ nimi bẹ ḅara sị nnị nna sa fama ibifịrị nwángị bẹ ḅara. Mịnanyẹ ma opuma ibim, anị pịghị sọ́nyẹ sọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrịbẹm.
english_text: This is a trustworthy saying. And I want you to stress these things, so that those who have trusted in God may be careful to devote themselves to doing what is good. These things are excellent and profitable for everyone.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori nụ́nányẹ kile, n gịẹ kóróma nangwọ tádọ́apụ ẹrẹ, ólóghó ma gboloma kam na owu na, mịnanyẹ ma sọnyẹ ḅụ ofori pịghị fịrị ḅụ ofori.
english_text: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels about the law, because these are unprofitable and useless.

ibani_text: Puama dighiarịapụ ma, n birinụ́nụ́, pịghị jẹ́ pa nna birinụ́nụ́, anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sa mịnị nnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ mịẹnyẹ sọ nyána ma.
english_text: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn them a second time. After that, have nothing to do with them.

ibani_text: Ị nimim ḅẹ́ mịnaapụ ma n nimim sị n mịẹarị siiamịẹnyẹ ma mịẹarị, nna si ma pịghị diearị ḅẹ́ nnị irimamam.
english_text: You may be sure that such people are warped and sinful; they are self-condemned.

ibani_text: A Atemas anịgha Tisikọs pa ọ fịrịma gbẹ́rẹ́kiri, ọmịnị ọmịna ịnyọ la ḅara mịẹsị ḅoo i nana dona Nikopolis ḅụ tegó mịị a bii ngaa a fịnị mịị oḅuu sáá.
english_text: As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, because I have decided to winter there.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ la ḅara mịẹsị, Zenas ologho kiẹḅọ ma na Apọlọs fịrịma nna Muunyẹ ḅụ, árị ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ npalịmagha.
english_text: Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way and see that they have everything they need.

ibani_text: Wámịna mịnaapụ Krete ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ ma ibifịrị nwángị ma pa nna mịẹmịẹnyẹ mịẹ, nnị ine éné éné ḅụ npalịma nyẹ nyáná nna ḅụ pịrịbẹ ḅara. Nnị sọ́nyẹ bie ofori duma kọọma.
english_text: Our people must learn to devote themselves to doing what is good, in order to provide for urgent needs and not live unproductive lives.

ibani_text: I nana mịnga fịnịapụ mamgba fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a o bii, pịghị wámịna nángwọ́apụ minini ma ḅụ fịnịapụ ma bii. Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba na fịnịị.
english_text: Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma irị Pọl ḅara anịị anị sághị ḅoo nyẹ, irị ikólinaḅọ Krais Jizọs fịrị ma gosi. Timoti wámịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ minini ma ḅụ i nana mị diri ma pa Fịlẹmọn wámịna nángwọ pịghị fịrịnwangị ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ fịrịmaarị.
english_text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker—

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma anị pịghị ḅó wámịna mị́naḅọ ẹ́rẹ́ḅọtụ́wọ Áfiya na pịghị wámịna ibi oku ma ọ́mụ́gbi gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ Akipọs na pịghị Fịlẹmọn wárịbie kobirikobiri sọsị ma pịrịm.
english_text: also to Apphia our sister and Archippus our fellow soldier—and to the church that meets in your home:

ibani_text: Wámịna Tamuno Daḅọ na wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ọrẹ ḅẹlẹma na diin pá ọ pịrịị.
english_text: Grace and peace to youfrom God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Fịlẹmọn, a tẹ́ghẹ̄ sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a i goarị sị ịmịẹḅam pa i Tamuno ḅẹarị,
english_text: I always thank my God as I remember you in my prayers,

ibani_text: a náa sị, ị́ nyána Tamuno túminị́ mamgba pịrị ḅẹlẹma gosi, na pịghị ị́yẹ́ míníni wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs ḅụ.
english_text: because I hear about your love for all his holy people and your faith in the Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Á tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅẹ́ wamịnị na ọ́ nana nyána mịẹgbólóma kobiri mininiapụ ḅara póghóló akanyaḅo pághámaḅobẹm wámịna duma bie, wa nyána karịiḅi mamgbá wa ḅọ Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ mịẹ sa.
english_text: I pray that your partnership with us in the faith may be effective in deepening your understanding of every good thing we share for the sake of Christ.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma wámịna mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ, opu bieḅẹlẹ na ịwọ ịnyọ pá ịḅụ suamam ị Tamuno túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́mamam.
english_text: Your love has given me great joy and encouragement, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the Lord’s people.

ibani_text: Mịma go ị́yẹ́ Krais mị́naḅọ ḅárá, a íné ḅáláfaghaa ḅara í ḅẹbẹm si ị́ mịẹna ibinyẹ ma mịẹ.
english_text: Therefore, although in Christ I could be bold and order you to do what you ought to do,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, a nyáná ị pịrị ḅẹlẹma go, tẹ́ghẹ̄ anị a ị tẹ́ghẹ̄arị nyẹ. Á mịma mịẹarị irị Pọl mḅẹ́sọ, olom owitụ́wọ pịghị mị́sa ma ḅụ Jizọs Krais ikólinaḅọ.
english_text: yet I prefer to appeal to you on the basis of love. It is as none other than Paul—an old man and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus—

ibani_text: Á ị tẹ́ghẹ́arị Onisimọs sịbị ọgọ́nọ́, mị́sa tụwọ sọọ i pị́rị́máaḅọ Krais bie, a pa ịkóliwárị ma bie fịnị sa, a ḅo Krais bie daa sọọ ọ pịrịmam.
english_text: that I appeal to you for my son Onesimus,who became my son while I was in chains.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri, ọ sọnyẹ sọ ị pịrịgha, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ sọ́nyẹ sọ ị́ pịrịm, pịghị sọ́nyẹ sọ i pịrịị.
english_text: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

ibani_text: A ọ fịrịma ḅọ ị pịrịarị, ori ịḅụ nyẹ́lam.
english_text: I am sending him—who is my very heart—back to you.

ibani_text: A biibẹm ḅẹ́ a ọ pa mịnga warị, a ikólibie fịnịarị sa ibi oku ma go, si ori ị nwángị i pịrịarị fịrị ma nwángị.
english_text: I would have liked to keep him with me so that he could take your place in helping me while I am in chains for the gospel.

ibani_text: A bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹbiegha ḅọ́rọ́ ị minigha, kụ́ma a biibẹm ḅẹ́ ị́ ịtemeḅie pa anị mịẹ anịḅọ kụrọ tọ́rụ́ nyẹ diighibieghaa ḅara.
english_text: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that any favor you do would not seem forced but would be voluntary.

ibani_text: Didigha, mịma go anịị nnị ị́ ḅarabie Onisimọs fófóoma nyẹ mị kálásatụwọ ma ḅụ, sị ị sima ó nyánáakị mú gbámásó la.
english_text: Perhaps the reason he was separated from you for a little while was that you might have him back forever—

ibani_text: Mịnị ómóniḅọ ḅaraghá, kụ́ma ómóniḅọ nẹngịḅọ, a ḅẹlẹma mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Krais bie. Ori ịḅụ nyẹ́lam, kụ́ma ọ pịghị ịḅụ nyẹlaḅam ómóniḅọ ḅara, na pịghị mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma bie.
english_text: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a dear brother. He is very dear to me but even dearer to you, both as a fellow man and as a brother in the Lord.

ibani_text: Anị ẹrẹ́sị, ị ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ ákị ị́ jẹa fịrịwangiḅọ ḅara, pịghị anị ḅara ma pa ọ si akị ị ị́yẹ́ ákị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ị́ mịẹsimama nḅẹḅẹ́, anịgha ọ pịghị ị ḅara sa ọlọ́lọ́ pa ị́ sịbị sẹ.
english_text: If he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge it to me.

ibani_text: Mịnga nyẹ ma, a ị́ ḅara na gịẹbẹm, ḅẹ́ irị Pọl ị́ gbẹ́bẹm. Á pa i biekórómanaibịgha ḅẹ́ ịḅụgḅọrụ ọ ị́ ḅárabie ị́rị ọlọ sáá.
english_text: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay it back—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ, mịị ibi ma pa i mịẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ gosi. Ị́ mị́naḅọ owitụ́wọ ḅara Krais bie, mịẹsị i tẹmẹ bieḅẹlẹ.
english_text: I do wish, brother, that I may have some benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

ibani_text: Á mị diri ma gịẹárị ḅara, a tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánam ḅẹ́ ị a ị ḅara bii nyẹ ị mịẹbẹm, ị pịghị mịẹ a ḅiiḅara nẹ́ngimabẹm.
english_text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ḅụ, múno yọ tẹ́lẹ́ma í pịrịị, a mininim ḅẹẹ, Tamuno ị sịbị ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ tẹghẹ̄ mamgba naábẹm sị sima ị́ pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: And one thing more: Prepare a guest room for me, because I hope to be restored to you in answer to your prayers.

ibani_text: Epafras i jẹa ikólinaḅọ Jizọs Krais fịrị ma go ḅẹm a obifama.
english_text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings.

ibani_text: Mak, na Aristakọs, na Demas na pịghị Luk í jẹa fịrịnwangịapụ ḅẹm a o bii.
english_text: And so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow workers.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị na fịnịị.
english_text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa saa Tamuno tọgha sáá ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ wámịna tádọ́apụ pịrịm ọrẹ ikiakoroapụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ asọ ḅụ.
english_text: In the past God spoke to our ancestors through the prophets at many times and in various ways,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị kunema éné ma, ori ọ Tụ́wọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ wa pịrịmam. Ori anị ọ tọ́ọ ḅọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyánáákịbẹḅọ. Ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị o so na kiri na tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ.
english_text: but in these last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, and through whom also he made the universe.

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma anịị Tamuno ipine ma bia ḅára diepághámaarịḅọ, Ọ Tamuno na kịkam asọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, ọ pịghị ori kụ́rọ nyáná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa so na kiri ma dighi sẹ́mam, ọ wámịna sii sịrị si faá ma sáá, ọ kpọrọfịnịm Tamuno ámáḅara angaá, kụrọmamgba nyánáḅọ sobie.
english_text: The Son is the radiance of God’s glory and the exact representation of his being, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After he had provided purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma dụḅaḅá sookumuapụ ma nẹngịm, tegó Tamuno ma pa o sị ẹrẹ, Tụwọ, dụḅaḅá nna ngá ẹ́rẹ́ nẹ́ngị ḅara.
english_text: So he became as much superior to the angels as the name he has inherited is superior to theirs.

ibani_text: Tamuno na jẹ́ éné sookumuapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹgha ḅẹ́, Ịrị i Tụwọ; mịmgba a Daa sọ ị pịrịmam. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Tamuno na jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné sookumuapụ ma gboloma ḅara ḅụ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ḅẹgha ḅẹ́, A Daa sọọ ọ pịrịbẹm, ori pịghị Tụwọ sọọ i pịrịbẹm?
english_text: For to which of the angels did God ever say, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father”? Or again, “I will be his Father, and he will be my Son”?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno ori tarị yii Tụwọ fịrịma tuminikiri ḅoo dọghụ sa, o dughom ḅẹẹ, Tamuno sookumuapụ mamgba susi ọ pịrịị.
english_text: And again, when God brings his firstborn into the world, he says, “Let all God’s angels worship him.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sookumuapụ ma gbolomanyẹ Tamuno ḅẹm, Ori ọrẹ sookumuapụ ma mịẹm n fọ́rụ dighi, Ori fịrịnwangịapụ kọrịfịnị.
english_text: In speaking of the angels he says, “He makes his angels spirits, and his servants flames of fire.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ Tụwọ gbolomanyẹ Tamuno ḅẹm, Yei Tamuno, Ị́yẹ́ imine fịnị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá lábẹm, I karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ pa ịyẹa túminị́ taábẹm.
english_text: But about the Son he says, “Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.

ibani_text: I karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, kụ́ma irima nyẹ ma ị́ ḅẹlẹmagha. Anịma go anịị Tamuno, ị́yẹ́ Tamuno, i dighi sóghólóma ị jẹ́apụ nẹngịmam, o bieḅẹlẹ dighiarị pulo pa ị sịbị sara ḅara.
english_text: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; therefore God, your God, has set you above your companions by anointing you with the oil of joy.”

ibani_text: O pịghị ḅẹm, Ịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, súghú saghị sa, súghúise tuminikiri ma pịrịm, ị pịghị ị ḅara na so ma tẹmẹm.
english_text: He also says, “In the beginning, Lord, you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

ibani_text: Nnị ẹmẹẹ́fafámabẹm, Kụ́ma ịrị ị fịnịbẹm; Nnị bịtẹ olom ḅara pa olombẹm.
english_text: They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment.

ibani_text: I bịtẹ ikoḅára ma pa nnị ikobẹm; bịtẹ ḅara ma nnị dimabẹm. Sámámgba ị fịnị ḅára anịị ị fịnịnyẹ. Ị́yẹ́ duma kunema nyanagha.
english_text: You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But you remain the same, and your years will never end.”

ibani_text: Tamuno jéné na ọrẹ sookumuapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹgha, Iyẹ amaḅara angaá kpọrọfịnị ákị mú a ị́yẹ́ iruonaapụ pa ị́yẹ́ ḅụ́ọ́gbána ịkasị mịẹ ị ḅụọ sughubie?
english_text: To which of the angels did God ever say, “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet”?

ibani_text: Anịsa sookumuapụ ma, nnị ọ tẹ́apụ? Sookumuapụ ma nnị anịị fịrịnwangị Tamuno pịrịarị tẹ́mẹ́, ọ fịrịma sị nnị ḅo fịrịnwangị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánábeapụ pịrị.
english_text: Are not all angels ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation?

ibani_text: Mịma go anị wa go ibiḅara pa wa namaa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ọlọ bẹnyẹ, sị wa ḅụọ gbisiribịgha ḅara.
english_text: We must pay the most careful attention, therefore, to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ sookumuapụ ma pa wámịna tádọ́apụ fịrịma oku ma ḅo kiriakị nḅẹḅẹ́, anịị mịẹ irimaapụ pịghị anị osighaapụ nna karakárá fomḅara nyánaḅom.
