english_text: For since the message spoken through angels was binding, and every violation and disobedience received its just punishment,

ibani_text: Anịsa, wa tọ́rọ́ pa fomḅarabie wa ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ma ḅẹ́, ḅọ́rọ́ wamịnị mịị opu dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ma dighi tọ́rụ́sim? Wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs anịị parị mịị oku ma dugho págháma ḅọ, ọ bịpị anị naapụ onyẹ́sẹ wa pịrịm ḅẹ́ oku ma karakárányẹ.
english_text: how shall we escape if we ignore so great a salvation? This salvation, which was first announced by the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard him.

ibani_text: Tamuno pịghị onyẹ́sẹ anị pịrịm ọ nwángị íkia fịrị, buapághá fịrị na tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ḅụ, ọ pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dienyẹ die túminị́ pịrịị anị ọ ḅụḅẹlẹ ḅara.
english_text: God also testified to it by signs, wonders and various miracles, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his will.

ibani_text: Tamuno náa sookumuapụ ma pa ḅoarị ịwọ tuminikiri ma taa ḅẹapụ mịẹgha, anịị wa ḅẹarị tuminikiri ma.
english_text: It is not to angels that he has subjected the world to come, about which we are speaking.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma n dugho ḅara gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá Tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹ, Tumḅọ tụọ mọ, sị i kóróma nyáná ọ pịrịarị, papa tumḅọ si ị́ o dighi dighiarị?
english_text: But there is a place where someone has testified: “What is mankind that you are mindful of them, a son of man that you care for him?

ibani_text: Ịrị ọ tẹmẹm sị ọ kálá ḅara pa tere sookumuapụ ma nẹngịm kálá sa tụọ ḅụ; Kụ́ma mị́sa ị pịghị ipine na kuu pa o birimamam,
english_text: You made them a littlelower than the angels; you crowned them with glory and honor

ibani_text: warị pịghị ọ pa táaríḅọ mịẹ, ị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba ḅụ. Anị dughom ḅẹ́ sị Tamuno ọ pa táarịḅọ mịẹm nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ. Mịma nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gbólómam, kụ́ma mị́sa wa tuminikiriapụ arịgha táarị ngá nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: and put everything under their feet.” In putting everything under them,God left nothing that is not subject to them.Yet at present we do not see everything subject to them.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa Jizọs arịm ori gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá sa tụ́wọ ḅụ, nnị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ terema sookumuapụ ma nẹngịm, ori ine Tamuno ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ fịị kị́nị́mamgba pịrịbẹ ḅara. Mị́sa wamịnị ori arịm, n kuu na ipine pa obirimamam ọrẹ tọ́rụ́siarị na ọrẹ fịị ma gosi.
english_text: But we do see Jesus, who was made lower than the angels for a little while, now crowned with glory and honor because he suffered death, so that by the grace of God he might taste death for everyone.

ibani_text: Anị karakáram ḅẹẹ Tamuno nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ sị pịghị anị kokoarịḅọ tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ Jizọs mịẹ kpaima, sị tọghaapụ ḅo diekiri nyáná bẹ ḅara ori ipine ma bie, Tegó Jizọs anịị n daa pa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bie suuarịḅọ.
english_text: In bringing many sons and daughters to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through what he suffered.

ibani_text: Ori túminị́ mịẹarịḅọ sị n fíafía, na pịghị ọ miẹmaapụ sị n fíafía nnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ Daḅọ nyáná bẹ ḅara. Anịgosi Jizọs ḅụ́gịrịrịgha nnị sị yọ ḅẹ́ nnị ori a minaowiapụ.
english_text: Both the one who makes people holy and those who are made holy are of the same family. So Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno ḅẹm ḅẹẹ: A ị nwángịmáa fịrị gbólómanyẹ dugho ịyẹa túminị́ pịrịbẹm; A ị túmíníbẹm nna kubiri ogbo ḅụ.
english_text: He says, “I will declare your name to my brothers and sisters; in the assembly I will sing your praises.”

ibani_text: O pịghị ḅẹm, A ị́yẹ́ biekpọ pa Tamuno ḅụ gbánabẹm. Ọ pịghị sima dughom, Mị ịrị, ịrị na Tamuno pa i pịrị awọ mamgba na.
english_text: And again, “I will put my trust in him.” And again he says, “Here am I, and the children God has given me.”

ibani_text: Awọamaapụ ma, mẹnị na ọmbịnyẹ́, sua ḅara ma, Jizọs ḅoo n fịnị ḅara fịnịm pịghị nnị ojumẹnị sua ḅo sọ, ọ go mịma mịẹnyẹ, ori ọrẹ fịị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọ fịị kụrọ ma nyánáḅọ ma guluguluma bẹ ḅara anịị, Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma,
english_text: Since the children have flesh and blood, he too shared in their humanity so that by his death he might break the power of him who holds the power of death—that is, the devil—

ibani_text: sị n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma fịị ḅáláfa bie, mịẹsị nnị omonisọmaapụ nna duma éné mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by their fear of death.

ibani_text: Ọ tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ ọ ḅárásua sookumuapụ pịrịgha kụ́ma ọ ḅárásua Ebraham furobie saghị págháḅoapụ pịrịm.
english_text: For surely it is not angels he helps, but Abraham’s descendants.

ibani_text: Mịma dughoarị ḅẹẹ, ori ọrẹ a mịnaapụ fịnị ḅára fịnịbẹm asọ mamgba ḅụ si ori ine nna tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná sẹ kụrọ igwagwaá áláḅọ sọ bẹ ḅara ọ nwángị Tamuno pịrịarị fịrị, sị ori ine túminị́ ma sii sịrị si bẹ igwagwaá bẹ ḅara.
english_text: For this reason he had to be made like them,fully human in every way, in order that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, and that he might make atonement for the sins of the people.

ibani_text: Ori so tọ́rụ́siarị ḅára ma ọ sọọ daádighi gosi, ori ine ḅárásua nyáná daádighi bie sọapụ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị́yẹ́ tọ́ntọ́ mịnaapụ, Tamuno pịghị ọ ḅara na sịapụ, o Jizọs gboloma kóróma ngéré nyáná nnị nfịrịmaḅọ pa sịḅọ pịghị Tamuno igwagwaá áláḅọ.
english_text: Therefore, holy brothers and sisters, who share in the heavenly calling, fix your thoughts on Jesus, whom we acknowledge as our apostle and high priest.

ibani_text: Ọ sẹ́ kụ́rọ Tamuno pịrịm, ọ sẹlẹakịḅọ ḅẹ́ ọ mị fịrị ma nwángịị, Mosis sọ sẹ kụ́rọ ḅara Tamunowarị ma bie.
english_text: He was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all God’s house.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs dụḅaḅá kuu nyáná Mosis nẹngịm, wárị namaḅọ ma dụḅaḅá kuu nyáná wárị ma nẹ́ngị ḅara.
english_text: Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.

ibani_text: Wárị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tumḅọ anịị anị nama nama ḅọ. Kụ́ma Tamuno anịị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ namaḅọ
english_text: For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.

ibani_text: Mosis Tamuno fịrịnwangịḅọ ḅara, ọ sẹ́ kụrọm Tamuno wárị ma bie ọ pịghị dugho túminị́ ma pịrịm Tamuno tórúku dugho ḅẹnyẹ gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: “Moses was faithful as a servant in all God’s house,”bearing witness to what would be spoken by God in the future.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Krais Tamuno Tụ́wọ, ọ sẹ kụrọm Tamuno wárị ma bie, ori anịị sịbịdáḅọ, wamịnị anịị wárị ma, wa ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna biekpọ na tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ ọlọsẹma nḅẹḅẹ́, wa pa ine bịpịkpọ ḅẹnyẹ.
english_text: But Christ is faithful as the Son over God’s house. And we are his house, if indeed we hold firmly to our confidence and the hope in which we glory.

ibani_text: Anịgo Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́: Mịmgba, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno pụghọ náa nḅẹḅẹ́,
english_text: So, as the Holy Spirit says: “Today, if you hear his voice,

ibani_text: Ọ kụ́rọ kúkúbie suama ọ kụ́rọ kúkúbie sua ḅara ọ Tamuno bịpị pughughaa sa, ọmịna daádighi sa elesiri ma ḅụ.
english_text: do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion, during the time of testing in the wilderness,

ibani_text: Anị angaá ọmịna tádọ́apụ ḅara pa i tọ́rụ́ tọmam, nnị i daádighim nnị amịẹnyẹ mamgba árị sọ kụ́rá mmẹsi findi ma ḅụ.
english_text: where your ancestors tested and tried me, though for forty years they saw what I did.

ibani_text: Anịị a goo anị ḅụ́ọ́apụ ma dighi igani nyẹ, sị ḅẹ́, Mịnaapụ ma mịnị ị́yẹ́ asọ ma duagha, n pịghị mịnị ị́yẹ́ ólóghó ma kokogha.
english_text: That is why I was angry with that generation; I said, ‘Their hearts are always going astray, and they have not known my ways.’

ibani_text: Anịgo a ọḅọọ fịịm ị́yẹ́ igani ḅụ ḅẹ́, Nnị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ́sárá yọ ma sọbịghaa.
english_text: So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ”

ibani_text: I jẹa mininiapụ, ọ ḅụ ẹḅịị sị ọmịna bie gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mininigha sị kúkúbie nyánábịgha ḅara sị n ḅọ ọḅụ pa dumafịnị Tamuno ma gbiibiegha ḅara.
english_text: See to it, brothers and sisters, that none of you has a sinful, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha ọmịnị ịnyọ pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅụ sua éné gbọrụ. Anịị nnị pa Mịmgba éné sị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị sii oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị mịẹbịgha ḅara sị wa kụ́rọ kúkúbie sua.
english_text: But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called “Today,” so that none of you may be hardened by sin’s deceitfulness.

ibani_text: Wa ḅo Krais bie diekiri nyánámam, wa ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna tarị minini ma ọlọ kụrọma mú kunema ma láa.
english_text: We have come to share in Christ, if indeed we hold our original conviction firmly to the very end.

ibani_text: Mịị anị Tọ́ndiri ma dughonyẹ: Mịmgba ọ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno pụghọ náa nḅẹḅẹ́, ọmịnị kụ́rọ kúkúbie suama o kụ́rọ kúkúbie sua ḅara ọ Tamuno bịpị pughugha sáá.
english_text: As has just been said: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́apụ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma náa, sị mịnị anị pughugha? Mosis Ijipiti bie taa págháapụ ma, n niigha?
english_text: Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those Moses led out of Egypt?

ibani_text: Tẹ́apụ kụ́rá mmẹsi pa Tamuno iganima? Siinyẹ mịẹsị fịịapụmagha elesiri ma ḅụ?
english_text: And with whom was he angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose bodies perished in the wilderness?

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ tẹ́apụ ḅẹ́ ḅẹẹ nnị jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ọrẹ ịnyọ́sárá yọ sọbịgha osigha pa ọ pịrịghaapụ ma nnigha?
english_text: And to whom did God swear that they would never enter his rest if not to those who disobeyed?

ibani_text: Anịgo, wamịnị arịm ḅẹẹ nnị ine ori ịnyọ́sárá sọgha n minini nyanagha gosi.
english_text: So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.

ibani_text: Mị́sa Tamuno minini wa pịrịmam ḅẹẹ ori anị gbolomanyẹ dugho ịnyọ́sárá ma, wa anị nyánáḅobẹm. Anị ibibẹm wa ḅụ ẹḅịị sị, Tamuno mini wa pịrịnyẹ ma anị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ gbarịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: Therefore, since the promise of entering his rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ibi oku ma naamam, nnị sọ náaḅara. Nnị oku ma naam, kụ́ma anị pa nnị mịẹibi ofori, nnị anị náa sa nnị minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị akịịghaa.
english_text: For we also have had the good news proclaimed to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because they did not share the faith of those who obeyed.

ibani_text: Anịsa wamịnị mininiapụ Tamuno minini ịnyọ́sárá ma nyánaḅom. Anịgo o dugho ḅara ḅụ, A ọḅọọ fịịm ị́yẹ́ igani ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Nnị iyẹ ịnyọsára yọ ma sọbịgha.  Tamuno mịma dughom ori fịrị famam mḅẹ́sọ, o tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́fáma sa.
english_text: Now we who have believed enter that rest, just as God has said, “So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ” And yet his works have been finished since the creation of the world.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá Tọ́ndiri ma bie, n mịma dughom sọ́nọ́ma dii ma gbolomanyẹ: Tamuno ịnyọsáram sọ́nọ́ma dii ma ḅụ ọrẹ fịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: For somewhere he has spoken about the seventh day in these words: “On the seventh day God rested from all his works.”

ibani_text: Mịị ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma n pighi sima anị dughom, Nnị ị́yẹ́ ịnyọsára yọ ma sọbịgha.
english_text: And again in the passage above he says, “They shall never enter my rest.”

ibani_text: Tarị ibi oku ma naapụ, ịnyọ́sárá ma nyánaḅogha, tegó nnị mininigha. Kụ́ma jẹ́apụ imi nnị warisoapụ ḅẹẹ nnị anị daákịị.
english_text: Therefore since it still remains for some to enter that rest, and since those who formerly had the good news proclaimed to them did not go in because of their disobedience,

ibani_text: Tamuno pịghị jẹ́ éné wárịmam, ọ pa mịmgba éné sị nyẹ. Sáá ḅo ibima ḅọ́rọ́ sáá Tamuno Deviti bịpị pa dughom, n gịẹ ḅọ́rọ́ma maá ḅara Tọ́ndiri ma bie ḅẹ́: Mịmgba ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ pụghọ náa nḅẹḅẹ́, o kụ́rọ kúkúbie suama.
english_text: God again set a certain day, calling it “Today.” This he did when a long time later he spoke through David, as in the passage already quoted: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹẹ Jọsụwa Tamuno minini ịnyọsára ma pa túminị́ ma pịrịm Tamuno mịnị jẹ́ ịnyọ́sárá éné dughobịgha.
english_text: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day.

ibani_text: Ịnyọ́sárá pa fịnị Tamuno túminị́ ma kúruarị; Tamuno ịnyọ́sárá ḅara sọ́nọ́ma dii éné ma ḅụ.
english_text: There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God;

ibani_text: Tamuno minini n pịrị ịnyọ́sárá ma daakịapụ, ịnyọsárábẹm nna fịrị ḅụ Tamuno sọ ịnyọ́sárá ḅara ọrẹ fịrị ḅụ.
english_text: for anyone who enters God’s rest also rests from their works,just as God did from his.

ibani_text: Anịgo wamịnị wa ine ḅara mamgba mịẹsị árị ḅẹẹ wamịnị anị ịnyọ́sárá ma nyánam sị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so bịghịbịgha ḅara isiapụ bịghị ḅara nnị minini nyanagha gosi.
english_text: Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will perish by following their example of disobedience.

ibani_text: Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anị dumam pighi i bịrịm anị oḅú mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ́ nyáná áláápụ́-ágidi nẹngịm, anị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pẹ́lẹ́ mú tumḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ na biebẹ duma dona angaá lam, pịghị mú mgbe na mgbe mẹnị dona ngaa láa. Anị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ tumḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ kórómaarị nyẹ na tumḅọ tẹ́mẹ́ tarịarịnyẹ mamgba pịrịpịrịm.
english_text: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.

ibani_text: Nnị pa Tamuno ḅọghuma ḅẹnyẹ ofori nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tuminikiri, anị findi gbẹ́ẹ́rẹ́m ọ tórúku. Ori ma anị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịghị amịna duma kịẹnyẹ go pịrịbẹḅọ.
english_text: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God’s sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of him to whom we must give account.

ibani_text: Wamịnị dụḅa Igwagwaá Áláḅọ nyánam, sobie sọọmaaḅọ ori anịị Jizọs Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma. Anị wa go wa dugho págháma minini ma ọlọ sẹ́ma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Therefore, since we have a great high priest who has ascended into heaven,Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to the faith we profess.

ibani_text: Wamịnị igwagwaá áláḅọ nyanagha wa ḅụ fịnị ḅara ḅụ kóróghaḅọ, kụ́ma wa gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ nyánam daádighi bie ḅọ́rọ́máaḅọ ngaa mamgba ḅụ, wamịnị sọ fịnị ḅara, kụ́ma ọ bịghịị sii pịrịgha.
english_text: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to empathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are—yet he did not sin.

ibani_text: Wa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyáná sị sọma Tamuno imine ma fịnị angaá ḅo, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ fịnị angaá. Anị angaá wa lolomakúkúbie nyánáḅobẹm pịghị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ dọghụḅọ pa ḅárásua wa pịrị wamịnị anị dọghụ sa.
english_text: Let us then approach God’s throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

ibani_text: Igwagwaá áláḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno n ḅọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm ọ jẹa túminị́ ogbo ḅẹẹ o fịrịwangi Tamuno pịrị nna sịbị, sị ori agba mịẹ pịghị igwagwaá sii pịrị.
english_text: Every high priest is selected from among the people and is appointed to represent the people in matters related to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins.

ibani_text: Ori, ori itilam gosi ọ tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána níminyẹ nyánágháapụ na pịghị siinyẹ mịẹarịapụ pịrịm.
english_text: He is able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and are going astray, since he himself is subject to weakness.

ibani_text: Ori ma so itila ḅara, ma, ori igwa gwaabẹm, túminị́ ma sii ngéréghaa kụ́ma ori igwagwaá ọrẹ a sii sọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: This is why he has to offer sacrifices for his own sins, as well as for the sins of the people.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine mịị kuu pa amịna ḅụ pịrịbịgha, kụ́ma Tamuno ọ ḅara na sị ḅo, ori Erọn sị ḅara.
english_text: And no one takes this honor on himself, but he receives it when called by God, just as Aaron was.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, Krais ori igwagwaá áláḅọ kuu ma pa ọ ḅụ pịrịgha kụ́ma Tamuno anị ọ ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹ, Ịrị anị i Tụwọ, mịmgba a Daa sọ ị pịrịmam.
english_text: In the same way, Christ did not take on himself the glory of becoming a high priest. But God said to him, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father.”

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị dughom jẹ́ angaá ḅẹ́, Ị́ igwagwaá áláḅọ fịrị ma nwángị gbámásóbẹm Melkịzedek ḅụọ duaarị.
english_text: And he says in another place, “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”

ibani_text: Jizọs mị tuminikiri fịnị sáá ọ kụ́rọ owu pụghọ pa ọrẹ tẹ́ghẹ̄ na obiarị nyẹ bim, ine o dụapághámaḅo bẹḅọ fịị ḅarabie, ori ọḅụ siteremam gosi Tamuno sughubie Tamuno o naam.
english_text: During the days of Jesus’ life on earth, he offered up prayers and petitions with fervent cries and tears to the one who could save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission.

ibani_text: Ori Tamuno Tụwọ n ḅẹ́sọ ọ tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ bịpị osiḅara nimim.
english_text: Son though he was, he learned obedience from what he suffered

ibani_text: Nnị o mịẹ kpainma sa, ọ warị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ gbámásó dụaḅọ́rọ́ma pa ọ dughonyẹ mịẹapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrị.
english_text: and, once made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him

ibani_text: Tamuno igwagwaá áláḅọ pa osim, Melkịzedek ḅụọ ḅara.
english_text: and was designated by God to be high priest in the order of Melchizedek.

ibani_text: Wamịnị opuma dughonyẹ nyánábẹm, mịnyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ, kụ́ma anị ḅụdam dughofindi ọ pịrị ọmịna akanyaḅo gbulum gosi.
english_text: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to make it clear to you because you no longer try to understand.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ ọ nyẹ́dieapụ sọ naibim, kụ́ma ọ pa dọghụarị n pa parị parị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dawọ nyẹ́ pa o die, ọ kụ́rọ fị́nyẹ fị na ibi sa, ọfịgha, kụ́ma ndomingi anị obiarị nyẹ.
english_text: In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God’s word all over again. You need milk, not solid food!

ibani_text: Ndomingi ḅụarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nḅọ pa kálátụwọ, nḅọ akanyaḅo nyanagha Tamuno karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ gboloma dáwọnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma mbgọlụ fị́nyẹ fịnị sẹ́nịapụ pịrịm, nnị sámámgba anị fịarị sa, nnị ine ibinyẹ na siinyẹ na nimim.
english_text: But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.

ibani_text: Anịgo o ḅoo wa tórúku mú sị kpọtẹ́lẹ́ma dáwọ́ nyẹ dawọ, mịnị sii ḅụ pịghị súghúise dawọ nyẹ ma dawọgha túminị́ dighi mú fịị bie suarị nyẹ na Tamuno ḅụ minini nyáná dáwọnyẹ.
english_text: Therefore let us move beyond the elementary teachings about Christ and be taken forward to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death,and of faith in God,

ibani_text: Pịghị mingi sara dáwọ́ nyẹ, pịghị ḅara pa sịbị ḅụ gbánā, pịghị fịị ḅụ saghị, na pịghị gbámásó ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ dawọ nyẹ ma wáriso.
english_text: instruction about cleansing rites,the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.

ibani_text: Wa saghị tórúku mú! Mịma anị wa mịẹbẹnyẹ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno mini mini.
english_text: And God permitting, we will do so.

ibani_text: Nnị tọ́rọ́pa ọḅụ pa nna minini gbiapụ akuoo bẹ, sị n sima nna sii ḅụ pịghị? Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri n Tamuno baá ma ḅụ imi n ḅẹ́lẹ pa sobie dienyẹ ma lámámam pịghị nna diekiri akịm Tọ́ntọ́ ibitẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ.
english_text: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, who have shared in the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Nnị ḅara na árịnyẹ ḅụ n nimim bẹ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ibim, n pịghị ḅoarị sa ma kụ́rọ nimimam.
english_text: who have tasted the goodness of the word of God and the powers of the coming age

ibani_text: Anị ḅụdam mịị bịghịmáa túminị́ ma akuoo sị, n sima sii ḅụ pịghịị, nna mịẹnyẹ ma diearị ḅara ḅẹ́, nnị mmẹẹ́ kárámá sáá ḅụ, Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma báupálịarị, warị pịghị ọ pa opu ḅụ́gịrịrị bie sua.
english_text: and who have fallenaway, to be brought back to repentance. To their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting him to public disgrace.

ibani_text: Tamuno kiri ma boma bomam anị ḅụ koroarị iti ma menịarị nyẹ, pịghị mịẹsị dipinyẹ sẹnị págháḅo nyẹ dipiapụ pịrị.
english_text: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma anị ḅọ́rọ́ nangi na owi ányị́nyá pághámaḅo nḅẹḅẹ́, anị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, anị Tamuno si fị́lā pa pịrị ḅẹnyẹ sọ́bẹm si kunema nnị fịnị pa anị dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi mịnaapụ wa ḅọ́rọ́ nwọpa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ sọ, wa biekpọ nyánam ọ fịnị angaá wa nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ibi mịma nẹ́ngị boma nyanam, ọmịna dụaḅọ́rọ́ma na ḅo nyẹ.
english_text: Even though we speak like this, dear friends, we are convinced of better things in your case—the things that have to do with salvation.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori anịị karakárá ḅo ma. Ori ọmịna fịrị pa bieḅáramabịgha anịgha ọ nyána ọ pịrị ḅẹlẹma, ọ pịghị nyáná, pịghị pa nyánáarị ḅárásua pa Krais asọ duaarịapụ ma pịrịarị.
english_text: God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them.

ibani_text: Wamịnị opuma biarị nyẹ anịị ḅẹẹ ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie o binyẹ ma ọmịnị anị ḅụ sẹ́ mú kunema la si ọmịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma ḅo karakárá nyẹ́sọ́beḅara.
english_text: We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, so that what you hope for may be fully realized.

ibani_text: Wa bighaa o ḅo ịnyọfaapụ sọ, kụ́ma o ḅo mininiapụ kịkáa, inema na minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno minini n pịrịnyẹ ma nyáná ḅo bẹapụ.
english_text: We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

ibani_text: Tamuno nyẹ minini Ebraham pịrị sa ọ karakáráma nyẹ mininim ḅẹ́ o minini nyẹ ma ori anị mịẹbẹm. Ọ nẹngịḅọ ófórigha sa, ori ọrẹ ẹ́rẹ́ pa ọḅọọ fịịm,
english_text: When God made his promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for him to swear by, he swore by himself,

ibani_text: Warị ḅẹẹ, A mini ị pịrịm ḅẹ́ a ị karịibimabẹm, pịghị tọgha awọ pa ị pịrịbẹm.
english_text: saying, “I will surely bless you and give you many descendants.”

ibani_text: Ebraham inema nyanam anịgosi ori ine Tamuno minini o pịrịnyẹ ma nyánaḅom.
english_text: And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.

ibani_text: Túminị́ ọḅọọ fị sáá, nnị n nẹ́ngị ẹ́rẹ́ pa ọḅọọ ma fị fịịm tumḅọ fị ọ ḅoo ma anị ḅẹ́rẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pẹ́lẹ́arị nyẹ.
english_text: People swear by someone greater than themselves, and the oath confirms what is said and puts an end to all argument.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọrẹ dima dimagha duma diepágháma ọrẹ awọ o minini nyẹ nyánáakị bẹapụ pịrị dọ́ghụm gosi o minini n pịrịnyẹ ori ọḅọọ fị pa anị mịẹ kụ́rọ́mam.
english_text: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of his purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, he confirmed it with an oath.

ibani_text: Tamuno minini nyẹ na o fị ọḅọọ ma anịị mmẹẹ́ nyẹ ine dima bigha nyẹ, mịma diearị ḅẹ́ Tamuno ine epeletibịgha. Tamuno mịị mmẹẹ́ nyẹ ma pa wa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọmam ḅẹ́ wamịnị mangị o bie sọ́maapụ ma, ine ọlọ kụrọma bẹ ḅara wámịna tórúku fịnị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma.
english_text: God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope set before us may be greatly encouraged.

ibani_text: Wa mị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma nyánam biebẹ duma lụḅa ḅara, kụ́rọ pịghị kokofịnịm. Anị wa daá ḅụ́pọ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sobie Tamunowarị ma sọọ, sị mú biebẹ opu tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma sọ.
english_text: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,

ibani_text: Wámịna sịbị go Jizọs parị anị angaá ma sọmam si pịghị gbámásó igwagwaá áláḅọ sọ wa pịrị Melkịzedek igwagwaḅọ ma ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: where our forerunner, Jesus, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.

ibani_text: Mịị Melkịzedek ma ori anịị Salem ámányánáḅọ pịghị opuma sóghólóḅa Tamuno igwagwaḅọ. Ebraham ọ́mụ́gbi ḅụ saghị sọḅoarị, anịị ori ínia ámányánáapụ sọ́ḅá sa, Melkịzedek ọ nana donam warị ọ karịibima.
english_text: This Melchizedek was king of Salem and priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the defeat of the kings and blessed him,

ibani_text: Ebraham warị ori akuonyẹ mamgba pa oyia angaá die si gbẹ́rẹ́kiri pa ọ pịrịị. Ẹ́rẹ́ ma, Melkịzedek parị ḅẹarị Karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ Ámányánáḅọ. Ori salem Ámányánáḅọ ẹrẹ́sị, ẹ́rẹ́ ma pịghị ḅẹarị Diin Ámányánáḅọ.
english_text: and Abraham gave him a tenth of everything. First, the name Melchizedek means “king of righteousness”; then also, “king of Salem” means “king of peace.”

ibani_text: Melkịzedek ma ọ daa na o nyingi nimiḅọ ofori, anịgha ọrẹ tádọ́apụ, nnị o yii sa, anịgha ọ fịị sa nimiḅọ ofori o Tamuno Tụ́wọ kịkam, ori gbámásó igwagwaḅọ.
english_text: Without father or mother, without genealogy, without beginning of days or end of life, resembling the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ arịgha ọduḅa la ḅara? Ebraham sọ wa ibima nimi tádọ́ ḅo ọ́mụ́ bie ọ nyánáḅonyẹ mamgba ọ pa oyia kiri diem sị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri pa ọ pịrịm.
english_text: Just think how great he was: Even the patriarch Abraham gave him a tenth of the plunder!

ibani_text: Ólóghó diri ma dughom ḅẹ́ Livai fúroawọ, nna ḅụ igwagwaapụ n gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá daakị oyia kiri ma ḅụ nna mịnaapụ Izirẹlịawọ ḅara, nnị sọ Ebraham fúroawọ mḅẹ́sọ.
english_text: Now the law requires the descendants of Levi who become priests to collect a tenth from the people—that is, from their fellow Israelites—even though they also are descended from Abraham.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara Melkịzedek, Livai furoḅọgha, kụ́ma oyia kiri ma ḅụ ọ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri daákịm Ebraham ḅárabie sị Ebraham karịibima, ori ma anịị Tamuno minini pịrịnyẹ ma nyáná ḅoḅọ
english_text: This man, however, did not trace his descent from Levi, yet he collected a tenth from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́ bomaarịḅọ dụḅaḅá boma ma daakịarịḅọ nẹngịm, mịma nụ́nányẹ anị bie ofori.
english_text: And without doubt the lesser is blessed by the greater.

ibani_text: Igwagwaapụ ma gbolomanyẹ, oyia ngaa ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri daakịarịapụ ma anịị fịị bẹ túminị́, kụ́ma ori Melkịzedek oyia ngaa ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri daákịḅọ ma ọ́ dumafịnịbo tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara.
english_text: In the one case, the tenth is collected by people who die; but in the other case, by him who is declared to be living.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ ine dughobẹm ḅẹ́ Livai mị́sa oyia kiri ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́kiri daakịarịḅọ ma túminị́ ḅara, oyia kiri gbẹ́rẹ́ ngá gbẹm Ebraham ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́,
english_text: One might even say that Levi, who collects the tenth, paid the tenth through Abraham,

ibani_text: tegó Melkịzedek Ebraham na dona sa, Livai pa ori tádóḅọ Ebraham ḅụbie imi.
english_text: because when Melchizedek met Abraham, Levi was still in the body of his ancestor.

ibani_text: Livai furoawọ Igwagwaá fịrị ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị Tamuno go mị ólóghó ma pa Izirẹlịawọ pịrịnyẹ. Ḅọ́rọ́ Livai fúroawọ igwagwaá fịrị ma kpain ọkụ́ma, jẹ́ kịrị igwagwaḅọ ḅo na ibighaa Melkịzedek fịnị ḅara fịnịḅọ mịnị Erọn fịnị ḅara fịnị ḅọgha Livai furobie saghị ḅoḅọ.
english_text: If perfection could have been attained through the Levitical priesthood—and indeed the law given to the people established that priesthood—why was there still need for another priest to come, one in the order of Melchizedek, not in the order of Aaron?

ibani_text: Nnị igwagwaapụ ḅụọ ma dima sa, n pịghị ólóghó ma dima naibim.
english_text: For when the priesthood is changed, the law must be changed also.

ibani_text: Wányánáḅọ n go mịnanyẹ ma dughoarịḅo. Ori jẹ́ túminị́ ọrụ ḅụ saghị ḅoḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so náa igwagwaḅọ soghaa ori túminị́ ọrụ ḅụ.
english_text: He of whom these things are said belonged to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba nimim ḅẹ́ o Juda fúroawọ ḅụ saghịḅom. Mosis ori igwagwaapụ ḅẹ́rẹ́ dughoarị sáá o dughogha ḅẹ́ igwagwaḅọ mị fúro ma ḅụ saghị ḅobẹm.
english_text: For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.

ibani_text: Baá mị́sa ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅụ sọmam ḅẹẹ, kịrị igwagwaḅọ ọ ḅụ diepághámamam Melkịzedek fịnị ḅara fịnịḅọ.
english_text: And what we have said is even more clear if another priest like Melchizedek appears,

ibani_text: Nnị igwagwaḅọ pa ọ mịẹm, mị igwagwaá ma anị túminị́ ólóghó na túminị́ nyẹ mịẹmịẹ ḅara duagha, kụ́ma anị kunema nyanagha duma ịnyọ ḅụ saghịḅom.
english_text: one who has become a priest not on the basis of a regulation as to his ancestry but on the basis of the power of an indestructible life.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹẹ, Ị gbámásó igwagwaḅọ sọ́bẹm, Melkịzedek fịnị ḅara fịnịḅọ.
english_text: For it is declared: “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”

ibani_text: Olom ólóghó ma n sumaa ngása wárim tegó anị ịnyọ nyanagha pịghị nyẹ́ḅụoforị.
english_text: The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless

ibani_text: Mosis ólóghó ma bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ mịẹ kpainmagha. Kụ́ma mị́sa, ibiḅaa tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ imi wa ḅọ́rọ́ ine sọma Tamuno damaḅo bẹnyẹ.
english_text: (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.

ibani_text: Jẹ́nyẹ, Tamuno ọḅọọ fịịm, kụ́ma ọkọfịnị ọḅọọ ofori nnị isiapụ pa igwagwaapụ mịẹ sa.
english_text: And it was not without an oath! Others became priests without any oath,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, Jizọs igwagwaá ma, anị ọ ḅoo na ḅom, Tamuno ọ ḅẹẹ sa ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọḅọọ fịmam ori anị ḅụ ọḅụ daabịgha. Ị gbámásó igwagwaḅọ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: but he became a priest with an oath when God said to him: “The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: ‘You are a priest forever.’ ”

ibani_text: Mị ọḅọọ ma gosi, Jizọs ori ọḅụsẹ́ḅọ sọ ibiḅaa ọ́ḅọọ ma pịrịmam.
english_text: Because of this oath, Jesus has become the guarantor of a better covenant.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ kịrịnyẹ pịghị imi, isi igwagwaapụ ma n fịịm go, n mịnị ine fịrịnwangịgha.
english_text: Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office;

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Jizọs duma gbámásom ọrẹ igwagwaá fịrị ma pịghị ḅọ́rọ́ mú jụghọ sịbị gbánāgha.
english_text: but because Jesus lives forever, he has a permanent priesthood.

ibani_text: Anịma go ori ine mị́sa pịghị sámámgba ọḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno damaḅoapụ ma duaḅọ́rọ́mam o duma gbámásom gosi Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄m nna sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Therefore he is able to save completelythose who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.

ibani_text: Jizọs Krais anị wa bii igwagwaalaḅọ, ọ tọ́ntọ́m; sii ọ ḅụ ofori, nnị o fófóomam siiamịẹnyẹapụ bie pịghị ọ saghị sóghólóma so ma nẹ́ngị.
english_text: Such a high priest truly meets our need—one who is holy, blameless, pure, set apart from sinners, exalted above the heavens.

ibani_text: Ori isi opu igwagwaapụ ma kịkagha, éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ parị igwagwaá ọri sii pịrịbịgha, sị pịghị igwagwaá túminị́ ma pịrị, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ igwagwaá sámámgba pịrịm ori ọrẹ ojumẹnị pa pịrị sa.
english_text: Unlike the other high priests, he does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when he offered himself.

ibani_text: Mosis ólóghó itilaapụ tọọm ḅẹẹ nnị igwagwaalaapụ sọọ, kụ́ma Tamuno mini nyẹ ori ọḅọọ ma na ḅoo nyẹ, ólóghó ma ọḅụju, o Tụ́wọ ma tọọm, n mịẹ kpainma ḅo ákị mú gbámásó láa.
english_text: For the law appoints as high priests men in all their weakness; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever.

ibani_text: Wa dughoarị nyẹ́mámgba ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ wa ọkọfịnị igwagwaalaḅọ nyánam Opu Tamuno opu imine ma ámáḅara ḅụ kpọrọfịnị ḅo sobie.
english_text: Now the main point of what we are saying is this: We do have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,

ibani_text: Ori Opu Igwagwaḅọ fịrị nwángịarị tọ́ntọ́ḅa yọ ma ḅụ, anịị tụ́ma tọ́ntọ́ Tamunowarị, Tamuno ọ ḅara na nama nyẹ, túminị́ ḅara pa nama nyẹ́gha.
english_text: and who serves in the sanctuary, the true tabernacle set up by the Lord, not by a mere human being.

ibani_text: Opu Igwagwaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n tọ nḅọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ori agbā mịẹ pịghị nama pa igwagwaá Tamuno pịrị. Wámịna opu igwagwaaḅọ ma anị ḅụ́gbẹm si ori sọ nyáná o pa pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: Every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices, and so it was necessary for this one also to have something to offer.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri imi, ori igwagwaḅọ fịrị nwángịbịgha, igwagwaapụ imi sa, Juuapụ ólóghó tọghaapụ ḅẹẹ nnị mị agbā ma mịẹ.
english_text: If he were on earth, he would not be a priest, for there are already priests who offer the gifts prescribed by the law.

ibani_text: Nnị nwángịarị fịrị agbamieapụ ḅara, anị dada sobie fịnịnyẹ ma fịnị ḅara fịnịgha kụ́ma anị anịị kịkam. Anị n go Mosis birinụ́nụ́nyẹ ọ tọ́ntọ́ tẹ́ghẹ̄ wárị ma nama dọghụ sáá ḅẹ́ ori, Arịị ḅẹ́ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ịrị anị mịẹm n pa ị die ḅara opu tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ ma ḅụ.
english_text: They serve at a sanctuary that is a copy and shadow of what is in heaven. This is why Moses was warned when he was about to build the tabernacle: “See to it that you make everything according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa nnị igwagwaḅọ fịrị pa Jizọs pịrịmam, nna angaá nyẹ ma nẹ́ngị nyẹ, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Jizọs sua gboloma ọḅọọ ma Tamuno na ori a túminị́ ogboku ibiḅam tegó nnị ibiḅaa mini nyẹ ḅụ anị wárim.
english_text: But in fact the ministry Jesus has received is as superior to theirs as the covenant of which he is mediator is superior to the old one, since the new covenant is established on better promises.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ parị ọḅọọ ma ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ anị laagha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mmẹẹ́ kárámá ọḅọọ ma dọghụbịgha.
english_text: For if there had been nothing wrong with that first covenant, no place would have been sought for another.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno irima nyẹ dọghụ pághámaḅom ọrẹ a túminị́ ḅụ, ọ ḅẹ́ sa ḅẹ́, Éné ma ḅoarị Tamuno dugho ḅara, a ịwọ ọḅọọ gịẹ bẹnyẹ irị na Izirẹlịawọ na pịghị Juda awọ.
english_text: But God found fault with the people and said: “The days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the people of Israel and with the people of Judah.

ibani_text: Anịị a nnị na tádọ́apụ na gịẹ ọḅọọ fịnị ḅara fịnịbịgha. A ḅara ḅụ n saghị pághámaḅo sa Ijipiti bie, nnị sẹ́ kụ́rọ a nnị ná fị ọḅọọ ma pịrịgha, anị ẹrẹ́sị irịsọ a tọ́rụ waghisim n fịnị angaá.
english_text: It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they did not remain faithful to my covenant, and I turned away from them, declares the Lord.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ mị́sa mị anị a Izirẹlịawọ na fị bẹ ọḅọọ, ḅoarị sáá, a ị́yẹ́ ólóghó pa nna kúkúbie suabẹm. A pịghị nna tẹ́mẹ́bie ḅụ gịẹ kórómabẹm. Ịrị nna Tamuno sọ́bẹm nnị pịghị ịyẹa túminị́ sọ́bẹm.
english_text: This is the covenant I will establish with the people of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put my laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ amịna mịnaḅọ diebịgha, anịgha dugho n ḅo na kikiama angaá ḅo pịrị, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma nimii. Nnị Kị́nị́mamgba i nimibẹm, nna ḅụ ịrụḅa ḅo akị mú dụḅaḅá ḅo láa.
english_text: No longer will they teach their neighbor, or say to one another, ‘Know the Lord,’ because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest.

ibani_text: A nna sii ḅụ ḅara sị n pịrịbẹm, a pịghị mịnị nna mịẹ irima pa biekórómabịgha.
english_text: For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.”

ibani_text: Ori ịwọ ọḅọọ ḅẹ́rẹ́ dughoarị sa, Tamuno parị ọḅọọ ma mịẹmam anị olom sị pịghị olom nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅọlọgha sa ḅụ pịghị ẹmẹ fabẹm.
english_text: By calling this covenant “new,” he has made the first one obsolete; and what is obsolete and outdated will soon disappear.

ibani_text: Parị ọḅọọ ma susi ólóghó nyanam anị pighi susi yọ nyanam tuminikiri.
english_text: Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and also an earthly sanctuary.

ibani_text: Nnị Tamunowarị namam tórúku anga ma ḅụ anịị Tọ́ntọ́ Yọ pa sị ngaa. Parị bie ma anịị tọndọ gbananyẹ ma fịnị angaá na pịghị n pa agbā mịẹ Tamuno pịrị fịtúrú gbánā ịkasị sọ fịnị ngaa.
english_text: A tabernacle was set up. In its first room were the lampstand and the table with its consecrated bread; this was called the Holy Place.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá sị n pa Tamunowarị ma ḅụ́pọ́ gbẹ́ẹ̄ bịtẹ ma ọḅụju gbẹ́rẹ́ bie imi anị n pa Opu Tọ́ntọ́ḅa Yọ sị ngaa.
english_text: Behind the second curtain was a room called the Most Holy Place,

ibani_text: Anị bie anịị nnị odoḅala pa nama ẹdẹ ọgọ́nọ́ n pa insẹnsị dọghụma dọghụma nyẹ na pịghị ọḅọọ igbe, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pịghị odoḅala pa gbẹm anị bie manna ma bie fịnị odoḅala ọmọngọ imi. Erọn agbara ányị́nyá suamaa nyẹ na pịghị mmẹẹ́ dapịrị nnị ólóghó ma gịẹ kórómanyẹ anị ọgọnọ.
english_text: which had the golden altar of incense and the gold-covered ark of the covenant. This ark contained the gold jar of manna, Aaron’s staff that had budded, and the stone tablets of the covenant.

ibani_text: Igbe ma ọgọ́nọ́ anị pamba sua sị n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma anị diearị ḅẹ́ Tamuno anị ngaa imi mịná tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma nna pamba findi sara n siiḅụḅárasi pịrị angaá ma ḅụ wárim, kụ́ma, mị́sa anị tumḅọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dughofindi bẹ sagha.
english_text: Above the ark were the cherubim of the Glory, overshadowing the atonement cover. But we cannot discuss these things in detail now.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anịị n nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dẹghẹ warị ḅara, igwagwaapụ ma tórúku bie ma sọmu sọmum Tamunowarị ma bie éné gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ si mú nna fịrị nwángịị.
english_text: When everything had been arranged like this, the priests entered regularly into the outer room to carry on their ministry.

ibani_text: Opu Igwagwaaḅọ ma ngéré anị biebẹ ju fịnị yọ ma sọ sọ ḅọ, o mịma mịẹarị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ngéré kụ́rá bie. Ori (ọmbịnyẹ́) ákịkịm ọ pa igwagwaá Tamuno pịrị ọ sịbị ọgọ́nọ́ na pịghị túminị́ ma nimigha si n mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ.
english_text: But only the high priest entered the inner room, and that only once a year, and never without blood, which he offered for himself and for the sins the people had committed in ignorance.

ibani_text: Mịnga nnị dẹẹ kórómanyẹ mamgba ḅụ Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ibima diearị ḅẹ́, Opu Tọ́ntọ́ḅa Yọ ma asọ na findigha, parị tọ́ntọ́ wárị ma pa sẹ́fịnịarị sa.
english_text: The Holy Spirit was showing by this that the way into the Most Holy Place had not yet been disclosed as long as the first tabernacle was still functioning.

ibani_text: Mịma anị ḅara tughuma mị́sa ma pịrịarị ilíghíma, anị dughoarị ḅẹ́ n mịẹ Tamuno pịrị agbā na nama igwa n gwanyẹ ine tẹ́ghẹ̄arị tẹ́mẹ́bie mịẹ kpainmagha.
english_text: This is an illustration for the present time, indicating that the gifts and sacrifices being offered were not able to clear the conscience of the worshiper.

ibani_text: Mịná mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma fị́nyẹ na iru na pịghị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ oju sịrị nyẹ ngéré gbólómam, mịnanyẹ mamgba anịị ojumẹnị ólóghó, anị kụrọ nyánam ákị mú Tamuno ḅo ịwọ nyẹ akuoo bẹ sa la.
english_text: They are only a matter of food and drink and various ceremonial washings—external regulations applying until the time of the new order.

ibani_text: Krais Opu Igwagwaḅọ ḅara ḅụ ḅoo mị́sa wamịnị árịarị ibinyẹ ma pịrịmam, ọ fịnị fịrịnwangịarị Tọ́ntọ́ warị ma ibiḅaa, pịghị kpainm. Túminị́ ḅara pa nama warịịgha anị dughoarị ḅẹẹ anị mịị tuminikiri ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ nyẹ́gha, Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ.
english_text: But when Christ came as high priest of the good things that are now already here,he went through the greater and more perfect tabernacle that is not made with human hands, that is to say, is not a part of this creation.

ibani_text: Krais Tamunowarị ma bie ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ngéré anị ọ pa Opu Tọ́ntọ́ḅa Yọ ma so nyẹ ori oḅori na nambulo pulo pa mugha sị mú igwagwaá kụ́ma ọrẹ pulo anịị ọ pa mú sị gbámásó dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná ḅo wa pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but he entered the Most Holy Place once for all by his own blood, thus obtainingeternal redemption.

ibani_text: Oḅori pulo na nambulo pulo na pịghị n dọ́ghụ́ma nambulo tụ́wọ fọọ anị n pa túminị́ ma sánị si, ọgọnọ n mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ ma sịrịsii.
english_text: The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so that they are outwardly clean.

ibani_text: Mịma karakárányẹ sáá, Krais pulo mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ́ mịẹbịgha? Ori gbámásó Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọrẹ oju pa kpain agbā mịẹ Tamuno pịrịm. Ọrẹ pulo wa sịrịbẹm ofori ofori mịẹmịẹnyẹ, ḅụ sị wamịnị ine dumafịnị Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself unblemished to God, cleanse our consciences from acts that lead to death,so that we may serve the living God!

ibani_text: Krais anị ịwọ ọḅọọ ma ḅara saghị ḅoḅọ, sị Tamuno simaapụ ine o minini gbámásó boma ma nyáná bẹ ḅara. Mịma ine kiriakịbẹm ọ fịịmam go, sị siiamịẹnyẹapụ ḅọ́rọ́ma nna siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ, parị ọḅọọ ma sọ pa imi sa.
english_text: For this reason Christ is the mediator of a new covenant, that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance—now that he has died as a ransom to set them free from the sins committed under the first covenant.

ibani_text: Tumḅọ ábálálá gịẹ sa n ḅara warị ori ngọ die bẹ ḅara, anị karakáram n die ḅẹ́ ngọ ma nyánáḅọ ma fịịmam tẹrẹmẹ nnị ori ngọ die.
english_text: In the case of a will,it is necessary to prove the death of the one who made it,

ibani_text: Tumḅọ diri bie gịẹ kóróma ma ḅara nnị ori ngọ die bẹ ḅara ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori, anị gịẹḅọ ma pa dumafịnị sa, anị ḅo kiri ákịbẹm diri ma gịẹḅọ ma fịịmaá sa.
english_text: because a will is in force only when somebody has died; it never takes effect while the one who made it is living.

ibani_text: Anịị parị ọḅọọ ma go kụ́rọ nyánányẹ anị ọmbịnyẹ́ ngéré pa fịrịwangịm gosi.
english_text: This is why even the first covenant was not put into effect without blood.

ibani_text: Mosis parị goo págháma túminị́ ma pịrịm ólóghó mamgba anị fịnị ḅara ólóghó diri ma bie. Anịsáa ọ warị nambulo tụ́wọ pulo na oḅori pulo akị sị mingi pa anị na gwaa na hesop sị ḅara na áwụ bia ánáná osuka pa su su sị pa ólóghó diri ma na anị angaá fịnị túminị́ ma sánị.
english_text: When Moses had proclaimed every command of the law to all the people, he took the blood of calves, together with water, scarlet wool and branches of hyssop, and sprinkled the scroll and all the people.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị ọmbịnyẹ́ ma ọḅọọ ma, Tamuno tọ́ọ ọ pịrịnyẹ ḅẹ́ o kókó.
english_text: He said, “This is the blood of the covenant, which God has commanded you to keep.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma Mosis ọmbịnyẹ́ ma sanim tọ́ntọ́ Tamunowarị ma ḅụ, na pịghị n pa fịrịwangịarị nyẹ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: In the same way, he sprinkled with the blood both the tabernacle and everything used in its ceremonies.

ibani_text: Karakáráma, ólóghó ma dua, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ anị n pa anị siri fịafịamarịnyẹ, nnị ọmbịnyẹ́ osugha osugha tumḅọ ine siiḅụḅarasi nyánábịgha.
english_text: In fact, the law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma, sobie fịnị karakárá nyẹ́ ma kịkanyẹ ma, ibibẹm ḅẹẹ nnị ọkọfịnị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma igwaa pa anị mịẹ fiafiama, kụ́ma sobie nyẹ ma ibiḅaa igwaa bim.
english_text: It was necessary, then, for the copies of the heavenly things to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

ibani_text: Krais o tumḅọ ḅara pa nama Tọ́ntọ́ yọ sọgha, mị anị karakárányẹ ma kịkányẹ, kụ́ma o so sobie múm si mú Tamuno tórúku fịnị wámịna sịbị go.
english_text: For Christ did not enter a sanctuary made with human hands that was only a copy of the true one; he entered heaven itself, now to appear for us in God’s presence.

ibani_text: Juuapụ opu igwagwaalaḅọ ma Opu Tọ́ntọ́ḅa Yọ ma sọsọm kụ́rá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọmbịnyẹ́ nama pa. Kụ́ma Krais ori aningáa ma sọgha sámámgba sị ọḅụ pa igwagwaá.
english_text: Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, the way the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood that is not his own.

ibani_text: Anị ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ ọkụ́ma, ọ tọgha tọgha igwa gwamam saghị tuminikiri saghị sa éné éné. Tụ́ma, mị́sa, anịsa mamgba kunema ḅụ, o ḅomam sị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá, samamgba sii sịrị si, ori ọrẹ oju pa igwagwaá sii pịrị ḅara.
english_text: Otherwise Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. But he has appeared once for all at the culmination of the ages to do away with sin by the sacrifice of himself.

ibani_text: N tọ́ọ wárịmam ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́sa pa fị́ị́bẹm, anịsa ma ḅọ́rọ́maẹrẹ, nḅọ Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri daa.
english_text: Just as people are destined to die once, and after that to face judgment,

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma n Krais pa igwa gwam gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá sị ọ tọgha tọghaapụ sii sịrị si. O pịghịma ḅobẹm mmẹẹ́ kárámá sa, sii gosigha, kụ́ma ori o kúruarịapụ ma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: so Christ was sacrificed once to take away the sins of many; and he will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are waiting for him.

ibani_text: Mosis ólóghó ma anị ḅoarị nyẹ ma tẹ́mẹ́ kịkam mị nyẹ ma ibinyẹ ma anịgha, tegó anị ine túminị́ duaḅọ́rọ́magha nna sii ḅụ. Kụ́rá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ n gwarị igwaa ma anị pịghị ine Tamuno damaḅoapụ ma mịẹ fịafịamagha.
english_text: The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming—not the realities themselves. For this reason it can never, by the same sacrifices repeated endlessly year after year, make perfect those who draw near to worship.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ ma nnị n sịrị simam nna sii ḅụ sii mịnị ḅẹ́rẹ́si pa n pịrịbịgha, igwagwaá ma so kunemabẹm.
english_text: Otherwise, would they not have stopped being offered? For the worshipers would have been cleansed once for all, and would no longer have felt guilty for their sins.

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ḅara, kụ́rá kụ́rá igwaa ma mịẹsị túminị́ nna sii pa biekórómáarị.
english_text: But those sacrifices are an annual reminder of sins.

ibani_text: Nambulo na oḅori ọmbịnyẹ́ jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ine sii sịrị sibịgha.
english_text: It is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.

ibani_text: Mịma go Krais tuminikiri ḅo dọghụ sáá, o dugho Tamuno pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Ịrị igwagwaá na agbā mịẹbịgha tụ́ma ịrị ojumẹnị tẹ́lẹ́ma i pịrịmam.
english_text: Therefore, when Christ came into the world, he said: “Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but a body you prepared for me;

ibani_text: Nnị dọ́ghụ́ma igwaa ịḅụ ḅẹlẹgha anịgha sii sịrị si bẹ igwaa.
english_text: with burnt offerings and sin offerings you were not pleased.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, a warị ḅẹẹ, Mịị irị, a ḅo ị tọ́nyẹ miẹbim ị Tamuno, n pịghị anị gịẹ kóróma i pịrị ḅara ologho ábálálá ma bie.
english_text: Then I said, ‘Here I am—it is written about me in the scroll— I have come to do your will, my God.’ ”

ibani_text: Parị o dughom ḅẹẹ, Ịḅụ ḅẹlẹgha, I pighi igwaa na agbā mịẹ anịgha n dọ́ghụ́ma igwaa na pịghị sii sịrị si bẹ igwaa ḅẹlẹmagha. Ọ mịma dughom nimitẹ́lẹ́ma bẹ́ mị igwaa ma nnị anị gwam ólóghó ma bie anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: First he said, “Sacrifices and offerings, burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not desire, nor were you pleased with them”—though they were offered in accordance with the law.

ibani_text: Anịsa ọ warị ḅẹ, Mịị ịrị, ị Tamuno, a ḅo ị tọ́nyẹ miẹbim. Tamuno warị olom igwaa ma kaasi, sị Krais gwaa igwaa ma pa nna kiriakị.
english_text: Then he said, “Here I am, I have come to do your will.” He sets aside the first to establish the second.

ibani_text: Jizọs Krais Tamuno o ḅara binyẹ mịẹm gosi wámịna sii ḅụ, n wa sịrị simam, ori ọḅụ pa gwaa igwaa gbẹ́rẹ́sa, sámámgba pịrị.
english_text: And by that will, we have been made holy through the sacrifice of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

ibani_text: Juuapụ igwagwaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọrẹ fịrịnwangị nwángịm éné mamgba sị pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́ igwa ma gwaa tọgha tọgha sáá ḅụ kụ́ma mịná igwaa ma sii sịrị siigha.
english_text: Day after day every priest stands and performs his religious duties; again and again he offers the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.

ibani_text: Krais gbẹ́rẹ́ igwagwaá sii gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrịm, kụrọ sẹ mú ḅẹ sa ḅẹ sa la, anịsa ọ warị kpọrọfịnị Tamuno ma ámáḅara angaá.
english_text: But when this priest had offered for all time one sacrifice for sins, he sat down at the right hand of God,

ibani_text: Anị angaá ọ warị saghị kúru sị Tamuno ọrẹ a iruonaapụ pa ọri ḅụọ gbananyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: and since that time he waits for his enemies to be made his footstool.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ igwa ma anịị o pa nnị mịẹ fiafiama mú gbámásó la nyẹ n sii sịrịsiapụ nna ḅụ.
english_text: For by one sacrifice he has made perfect forever those who are being made holy.

ibani_text: Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịghị ọri onyẹ́sẹ wa pịrịarị parị ọ ḅẹ́m ḅẹẹ,
english_text: The Holy Spirit also testifies to us about this. First he says:

ibani_text: Mịị anịị a nnị na fị bẹ ọḅọọ ḅoarị sa ḅụ anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ dugho ḅara. A ị́yẹ́ ólóghó pa n tẹ́mẹ́bie suabẹm pịghị anị gịẹ nna kúkúbie.
english_text: “This is the covenant I will make with them after that time, says the Lord. I will put my laws in their hearts, and I will write them on their minds.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị pịghị ḅẹ́, A mịnị nna sii na nna siiamịẹnyẹ pa biekórómabịgha.
english_text: Then he adds: “Their sins and lawless acts I will remember no more.”

ibani_text: Nnị siiḅụḅárási mịnaapụ ma pịrịmaá sáá tumḅọ mịnị siiḅụḅarasipịrị igwaa bibieghaa.
english_text: And where these have been forgiven, sacrifice for sin is no longer necessary.

ibani_text: Anịgo, ịyẹa mịnaapụ wamịnị mị́sa ine Opu Tọ́ntọ́ḅa Yọ ma sọmubẹm Jizọs fịị ma gosi, bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ wamịnị ọ́lọ́gha pa.
english_text: Therefore, brothers and sisters, since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus,

ibani_text: Ori ịwọ asọ findi wa pịrịm, dumafịnị asọ, ḅụpọgbe bịtẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, anịị ori ojumẹnị.
english_text: by a new and living way opened for us through the curtain, that is, his body,

ibani_text: Wamịnị opu igwagwaḅọ nyánam Tamuno wárị ma bie sịbịdaḅọ.
english_text: and since we have a great priest over the house of God,

ibani_text: Anịgo wa ibi kúkúbie na karakárá minini pa sọma Tamuno fịnị angaá ḅo, pịghị nnị ibima sịrị maá ḅẹ́rẹ́ḅarasi kúkúbie na pịghị n fíafía mingi pa sịrịmaa oju.
english_text: let us draw near to God with a sincere heart and with the full assurance that faith brings, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water.

ibani_text: Wa ibiḅara pa wa dugho págháma tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma ọlọ, wa nimi sa ḅẹẹ Tamuno ọ minini nyẹ ọ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for he who promised is faithful.

ibani_text: Wa jụghọ jụghọ bala pịghị ḅárásua jụghọ jụghọ pịrị, ḅẹlẹma diepágháma pịghị ibinyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds,

ibani_text: Wamịnị wámịna kobiri ma pa ọḅụ gbima, jẹ́apụ mị́sa mịẹarị ḅara, kụ́ma anị ibim ḅẹ́ wa jụghọ jụghọ mịẹ kụrọma tẹ́lẹ́ma, wa nimi sa ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma éné kịkịaarị.
english_text: not giving up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging one another—and all the more as you see the Day approaching.

ibani_text: Sii siri si bẹ́ igwaa mịnị oforibịgha, wa karakárá ma nimifama sa, wa warị pa biri inighima sị siinyẹ mịẹarị.
english_text: If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left,

ibani_text: Tụ́ma kọnyẹ́, mamgba wa ḅáláfa ḅụ ḅoarị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri ma pịghị Tamuno osighaapụ dọ́ghụ́ma bẹ gbagba kọrịfịnị ma kúru.
english_text: but only a fearful expectation of judgment and of raging fire that will consume the enemies of God.

ibani_text: Mosis ólóghó ma kóró ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị mmẹapụ na tẹ́rẹ́ onyésẹapụ nyáná nyáná n ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹlẹm n sịbị sị n timiḅá tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyanagha ḅara.
english_text: Anyone who rejected the law of Moses died without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.

ibani_text: Anị tọ́rọ fịnị n pịrịbẹ, Tamuno Tụ́wọ ma dighisima ḅọ? Si ori ọmbịnyẹ́ ọḅọọ ma pa papanyẹ mịẹ, sii ḅụ n siri pághámaḅo nyẹ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma wiri ḅọ. Sịbịbie kịẹ anị pịrị n ḅo árị bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị la bẹ ḅara.
english_text: How much more severely do you think someone deserves to be punished who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, who has treated as an unholy thing the blood of the covenant that sanctified them, and who has insulted the Spirit of grace?

ibani_text: Wa kọkọ nimi dugho ḅo, Sughubi inyee, a sima gbẹ́bẹm, pighi ḅẹẹ ḅo ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ọrẹ a túminị́ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm.
english_text: For we know him who said, “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,”and again, “The Lord will judge his people.”

ibani_text: Mịị opu ḅáláfama nyẹ ḅẹ́ tumḅọ bịghị dumafịnị Tamuno ma ḅarabie sọ.
english_text: It is a dreadful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

ibani_text: Biekóróma, parị anị ọ́ nana fịnị ḅara, anịsáa ma ḅụ Tamuno baá bia ḅo o láa sáá, o tọgha tọ́rụ́siarị arịm, kụ́ma mịnanyẹ mamgba o fughugbigha.
english_text: Remember those earlier days after you had received the light, when you endured in a great conflict full of suffering.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ sáá imi, ámáogbo anịị nnị o wiri sị pịghị ọmịnị mbasị, jẹ́ sáá ọ pịghị ọ ḅụ pa nwọfịnị sii árịarịapụ ma na gbolomam.
english_text: Sometimes you were publicly exposed to insult and persecution; at other times you stood side by side with those who were so treated.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị ikólinaapụ dua tọ́rụ́siarịm nnị pịghị ọmịna ngọ kaakị sa, ọ pịghị bieḅẹlẹ ḅara pa ọmịna faá ma akịm, tegó o nimim ḅẹ́, ọmịna nyẹ ma nẹ́ngị nyẹ nyánam, pịghị fịnị mú gbámásó láa ḅẹnyẹ.
english_text: You suffered along with those in prison and joyfully accepted the confiscation of your property, because you knew that you yourselves had better and lasting possessions.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị ọmịna biekpọma pa ngúmá ma tegó anị opu gbẹ́nyẹ pa ḅo ḅom.
english_text: So do not throw away your confidence; it will be richly rewarded.

ibani_text: Í ingịrịma nyáná na ibim, si ị ine Tamuno tọ́nyẹ mịẹbẹ ḅara, si o minini nyẹ mamgba nyánáḅoo.
english_text: You need to persevere so that when you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅụ ḅẹẹ, Kálá sáátụọ kọọm, si ḅoarị ḅo ma ḅobẹm, ọ sa ngumabịgha.
english_text: For, “In just a little while, he who is coming will come and will not delay.”

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ túminị́ minini pa dumabẹm, kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ọḅụda ḅọ fịnịfịnị i tẹ́mẹ́ n ḅo dighi ḅẹlẹbịgha.
english_text: And, “But my righteousone will live by faith. And I take no pleasure in the one who shrinks back.”

ibani_text: Wamịnị pịghị ọḅụdada sị mú faá bẹ apụgha, tụ́ma wa minini nyánam si dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánáḅoo.
english_text: But we do not belong to those who shrink back and are destroyed, but to those who have faith and are saved.

ibani_text: Minini anịị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyána wa ḅụ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ḅụ, wa tẹ́mẹ́ jighe jighegha wamịnị arịgha nyẹ ma ḅụ.
english_text: Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ olom sáapụ ma Tamuno boma nyánaḅom.
english_text: This is what the ancients were commended for.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị wa akanyaḅo nyẹ ḅẹ́ tuminikiri gbọrụ ma Tamuno ọrẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pa anị tẹmẹm, si mị́sa tuminị árịarị nyẹ ma, nnị tọ́rụ́ pa árịgha nyẹ ma pa anị tẹmẹm.
english_text: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God’s command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ anịị Ebẹl ḅọ́rọ́ ibiḅaa agbaa mịẹ Tamuno pịrị o numboru owitụ́wọ Keni nẹ́ngị nyẹ. Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ori ákịm karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ ḅara. Tamuno o dugho ibimam ori agbaa gosi. Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Ebẹl pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị, ọ fịịmam mḅẹ́sọ.
english_text: By faith Abel brought God a better offering than Cain did. By faith he was commended as righteous, when God spoke well of his offerings. And by faith Abel still speaks, even though he is dead.

ibani_text: Minini anị mịẹsị Enọkụ fịị arịgha nyẹ. Tụ́ma Tamuno o saghị akịm, ori árị ḅo ofori Tamuno osiakịmam gosi. Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹ, tẹrẹmẹ nnị ori akị, o Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ miẹḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death: “He could not be found, because God had taken him away.”For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.

ibani_text: Minini ofori gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ mịẹḅẹ́lẹ́mabịgha, Tamuno damaḅoarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mininibẹm ḅẹ́ Tamuno imi, ori o pịghị ịnyọsua ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arịapụ gbẹgbẹm.
english_text: And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.

ibani_text: Minini anị Nuwa mịẹsị ọ Tamuno birinụ́nụ́ náanyẹ, tórúku ju fịnịnyẹ gbolomanyẹ, ori arịgha nyẹ ọ Tamuno bịpị pughum si mú árụ́ nama, ori na ọ wárị gbọrụ ḅọ́rọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ma nyána ḅara. Anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiri gbọrụ gulugulumam, minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Nuwa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ nyánaḅom Tamuno ḅara.
english_text: By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that is in keeping with faith.

ibani_text: Minini anị Ebraham mịẹnyẹ sị ọbịpị pughu nyẹ, Tamuno osii sa ḅẹ́ ori ọrẹ sẹ wáriso sị o minini ọ pịrị ama ma mú. Ori ọrẹ ámá warịsom nimigha o muarị anga.
english_text: By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even though he did not know where he was going.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ ọ Tamuno minini ọ pịrị ámá ma ḅụ ngam igoniḅọ ḅara. O dii laagha warị ḅụ ngáarị, Aizik na Jekọpụ ngá ḅara, mị gbẹ́rẹ́ mini nyẹ ma nyánáḅoapụ Tamuno ḅara.
english_text: By faith he made his home in the promised land like a stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise.

ibani_text: Ebraham anị ama ma kúruarị anị fịnị ḅara, Tamuno anịị anị fịnị ḅara mịẹḅọ pịghị anị nama ḅo, si gbámásó dapịrị pa anị sughu i sẹm.
english_text: For he was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God.

ibani_text: Minini anị Ebraham mịẹsị o ḅo daḅọ sọ nyẹ ori opuma olomfáma sa, Sira sọ mịnị ine awọ yiigha. O mininim ḅẹẹ Tamuno ọ mini nyẹ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: And by faith even Sarah, who was past childbearing age, was enabled to bear children because sheconsidered him faithful who had made the promise.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ Ebraham fịịmaaḅọ kịkam, mị gbẹ́rẹ́ owitụ́wọ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị tọghaapụ saghị págháḅo nyẹ ḅálōló sobie bii ḅara, sọ ḅọ́rọ́ posie aka fịnị onwo túminị́ ine kịẹbịgha nyẹ.
english_text: And so from this one man, and he as good as dead, came descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and as countless as the sand on the seashore.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ mamgba fịịm pa mininiarị Tamuno mini n pịrịnyẹ ma nyánaḅogha sọ, kụ́ma ḅọlọanga nnị anị arịm sị anị datéréma warị dughopágháma kị́nị́mamgba tórúku bẹ nnị ọ́ igoniapụ na asọnwángiapụ tuminikiri.
english_text: All these people were still living by faith when they died. They did not receive the things promised; they only saw them and welcomed them from a distance, admitting that they were foreigners and strangers on earth.

ibani_text: Ọkọfịnị nyẹ dughoarịapụ diearị ḅẹ́ nnị nna ḅárákū ama dọghụarị.
english_text: People who say such things show that they are looking for a country of their own.

ibani_text: Nnị sịbịbiekiẹ n wáriso sẹ ma pịrịgha n ḅọ́rọ́ sịbịbiekiẹ anị pịrị ọkụ́ma nwọfịnị nnị asọ dọghụ pịghịma sọmam.
english_text: If they had been thinking of the country they had left, they would have had opportunity to return.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma ibiḅaa ama anị n tọ́rụ́ pa dighiarị nyẹ sobie ama ma. Anịma go Tamuno ḅụgịrịrịgha ḅẹ́ nnị nna Tamuno pa osim, tegó ori ama tẹ́lẹ́ma n pịrịmam.
english_text: Instead, they were longing for a better country—a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

ibani_text: Minini anị Ebraham mịẹsị ori o tụ́wọ Aizik pa agbā mịẹ Tamuno pịrị, Tamuno ọrẹ daádighi pa o daa sáá. Ebraham anị Tamuno nyẹ mini pịrị ḅo anị so ọ pa ọrẹ Kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ tụ́wọ pa agbā mịẹ dọ́ghụm.
english_text: By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac as a sacrifice. He who had embraced the promises was about to sacrifice his one and only son,

ibani_text: Tamuno dugho ọ pịrịmam, ḅẹẹ, Aizik ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị a dugho ị pịrị awọ ma ḅọ́rọ́ págháḅo ḅẹnyẹ.
english_text: even though God had said to him, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”

ibani_text: Ebraham mininim bẹ Tamuno ine fịị ḅụ Aizik saghịmabẹm. Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ ḅara ḅụ Ebraham fịị ḅụ pịghị Aizik nyánaḅom.
english_text: Abraham reasoned that God could even raise the dead, and so in a manner of speaking he did receive Isaac back from death.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ Aizik Jekọpụ na Esọ karịibimam tórúku ḅoarị nyẹ gbólómanyẹ gosi.
english_text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to their future.

ibani_text: Minini anị Jekọpụ mịẹsị o Josẹf awọ mamgba karịibimanyẹ, nimi sa ḅẹ́ ọrẹ fịị sa kikiamam, ori ọrẹ mgbara ḅụ sẹghẹrẹrẹm sị Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄m.
english_text: By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of Joseph’s sons, and worshiped as he leaned on the top of his staff.

ibani_text: Minini anị Josẹf mịẹnyẹ ori fịị kikia sa, ọ warị Izirẹlịawọ nna soo Ijipiti ḅụ gbolomanyẹ dugho, ọ pịghị bịpị pịrịm nnị ori mgbe mịẹbẹ ḅara.
english_text: By faith Joseph, when his end was near, spoke about the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt and gave instructions concerning the burial of his bones.

ibani_text: Minini anị Mosis nyingiḅọ na daḅọ mịẹnyẹ, nnị o yii fama sa tẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ nnị ọ pa ḅọghum nnị arịm ḅẹ́, ori ọ́ ibi tụ́wọ, anịma go n balagha sị ámányánáḅọ ma ólóghó ma kaa.
english_text: By faith Moses’ parents hid him for three months after he was born, because they saw he was no ordinary child, and they were not afraid of the king’s edict.

ibani_text: Minini anị Mosis mịẹ nyẹ́, o ḅo sẹnị sa, o minigha sị n Fero ndụ́ḅa tụ́wọ pa ọ sịị.
english_text: By faith Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be known as the son of Pharaoh’s daughter.

ibani_text: Ọ balagha Tamuno túminị́ na tọ́rụ́siarị, tụ́ma ọ kẹ́lẹ́ sii ḅẹ́lẹ fịị bẹ na karagha.
english_text: He chose to be mistreated along with the people of God rather than to enjoy the fleeting pleasures of sin.

ibani_text: O mininim ḅẹ́ wirinumo daa Mesaya ma ẹ́rẹ́, sọ́nyẹ so Ijipiti ḅụ fịnị ngọ mamgba nẹngịm. O tọ́rụ́ pa tórúku ḅoarị sọ́nyẹ ma dighiarị.
english_text: He regarded disgrace for the sake of Christ as of greater value than the treasures of Egypt, because he was looking ahead to his reward.

ibani_text: Minini anịị Mosis mịẹsị ori Ijipiti wáriso nyẹ ámányánáḅọ ma bieoḅu dighi ḅáláfagha pa. Ọ mini ọḅụdagha sọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ tọ́rụ́ pa n tọ́rụ́ pa árịrịgha Tamuno ma arịm.
english_text: By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the king’s anger; he persevered because he saw him who is invisible.

ibani_text: Minini anị ọ mịẹsị Sáḅáḅọ́rọ́ Álálị ma kórómanyẹ, sị bịpị pịrị ḅẹ́ nnị ọmbịnyẹ́ ma pa ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ sánị sị fịị sookumuḅọ ma Izirẹlị parị owiapụ awọ ḅábịgha ḅara.
english_text: By faith he kept the Passover and the application of blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn would not touch the firstborn of Israel.

ibani_text: Minini anị Izirẹlịawọ ma mịẹsị nnị Ányị́nyá tọ́rụ́ ma saḅa nyẹ, sámụ́nọ́ kiri ọgọnọ ḅara. Ijipitiapụ ma ḅụọ sua dọ́ghụm kụ́ma mingi ma nnị mẹnị akịm.
english_text: By faith the people passed through the Red Sea as on dry land; but when the Egyptians tried to do so, they were drowned.

ibani_text: Minini anị mịẹsị Jeriko gbiri ikelekelé onu ma soghoro kórónyẹ Izirẹlịawọ anị nwángị ikelekele sáá sọ́nọ́ma dii.
english_text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell, after the army had marched around them for seven days.

ibani_text: Minini anịị Rahab sẹfị́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ warị sị nnị a ḅagha nyẹ, Tamuno bịpị pughughaapụ ma ogbobie tegó árị ámá ma furuapụ ma datérémam.
english_text: By faith the prostitute Rahab, because she welcomed the spies, was not killed with those who were disobedient.

ibani_text: A pa dugho ma dugho ma muu, sáá ofori sị a ḅo Gidiyọn, na Barak, na Samsin na Jefta, na Deviti, na Samuwẹlị na pịghị ikiakoroapụ ma.
english_text: And what more shall I say? I do not have time to tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson and Jephthah, about David and Samuel and the prophets,

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ọ́mụ́ pa sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ gbim sị pịghị n sọọḅa, n karakárá nyẹ́ ma mịẹm si Tamuno minini nyẹ ma nyánaḅom, n ḅara pa ọkụ nama bịpị gbẹm.
english_text: who through faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, and gained what was promised; who shut the mouths of lions,

ibani_text: Nnị gbagba kọrịfịnị biimam, ḅara pẹ́lẹ́ma mangị so sị áláápụ́-ágidi fịị gosi n ḅo ịnyọfaapụ dighim, kụ́ma ḅo kụ́rọsẹm, n kụrọm ọ́mụ́gbi ḅụ, n pịghị jẹ́ ámá ọ́mụ́gbiapụ Sọ́ḅa.
english_text: quenched the fury of the flames, and escaped the edge of the sword; whose weakness was turned to strength; and who became powerful in battle and routed foreign armies.

ibani_text: Minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ nna awọ fịịapụ nyánaḅom fịị ḅarabie, isiapụ mịnị ḅụ́nyana daákịgha gosi tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ fịịm, sị nnị saghị tụ́ma duma sọ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Women received back their dead, raised to life again. There were others who were tortured, refusing to be released so that they might gain an even better resurrection.

ibani_text: Nnị n ḅụ jẹ́apụ kombom, jẹ́apụ fom, jẹ́apụ nnị nna ḅụọ na n ḅara fịnam sị jẹ́apụ pa ịkóli bie sua.
english_text: Some faced jeers and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment.

ibani_text: Nnị mgbọ́lụ pa n gbim, nnị akanị kọapụ agidi pa n pa mmẹẹ́ diem, nnị áláápụ́-ágidi pa n gbogboḅam, n nwángị ikelekelearị ánáná anịgha oḅori apara sua oju ḅụ, simini, nnị n pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam pịghị nna mbásịm.
english_text: They were put to death by stoning;they were sawed in two; they were killed by the sword. They went about in sheepskins and goatskins, destitute, persecuted and mistreated—

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ma nnị na ibighaa, nnị ikélekélem biaapụ ḅara, elesiri ḅụ, na pịghị tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ, olulu tụ́ndụ́ bie na olulu kiribie.
english_text: the world was not worthy of them. They wandered in deserts and mountains, living in caves and in holes in the ground.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma n túminí nyánaḅom nna minini ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, kụ́ma Tamuno minini n pịrịnyẹ ma n nyánaḅogha.
english_text: These were all commended for their faith, yet none of them received what had been promised,

ibani_text: Tegó Tamuno ibi mịma nẹ́ngịma nyẹ warị wa pịrịmam, ḅẹ́ wamịnị na nnị ná anị nnị nna ḅụ mịẹ kpainmabẹnyẹ.
english_text: since God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect.

ibani_text: Wamịnị, wa mị tọgha túminị́ nyanam, wa gbiri ikelekelé si onyẹ́sẹ wa pịrịapụ, anịgo anị ibim ḅẹẹ wa pa ngása, warịị wa pụ́nụ́marịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na pịghị wa fángálámaarị sii ma, sị wa pịghị ingịrịma nyána si wámịnị ine kụ́rọ́ma si wámịna tórúku fịnị mangị ma mangịị.
english_text: Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us,

ibani_text: Wamịnị wámịna tọ́rụ́ pa Jizọs ḅụ gbánā, wámịna minini ḅára fịnịḅọ, saghị sị mú kunema la. Ori ọḅụ daagha mgbẹsẹ sị ma go, kụ́ma tórúku fịnị o kuruarị bieḅẹlẹ gosi, ori ingịrịma nyáná mgbẹsẹ sị ma pịrịm, ori mgbẹsẹ sị́ ọgọ́nọ́ fịị ma ḅụ́gịrịrị balagha. Mị́sa ọ Tamuno imine ma ámáḅara ngá kpọrọfịnịarị.
english_text: fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith. For the joy set before him he endured the cross, scorning its shame, and sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

ibani_text: Ọ kóróma dighi siiamịẹnyẹapụ pa ọ nana ngaa si ḅara. Anịgo ọmịnị ma anị ịnyọ pa ọ ḅụ fama sị mịẹ ọmịnị ọḅụdaa.
english_text: Consider him who endured such opposition from sinners, so that you will not grow weary and lose heart.

ibani_text: O sii na soarị owu, na ọ pa pulo osu nyẹ laagha.
english_text: In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.

ibani_text: O bieḅárámá ma, Tamuno kọọ ọ pịrị tẹ́mẹ́ kụ́rọ́ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ori awọ ḅara ḅẹẹ, I tụ́wọ birifama pughu Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ị datụ́ghụ́maarị sa anị pịghị i tẹ́mẹ́ simama ori iganiopịrịarị sa.
english_text: And have you completely forgotten this word of encouragement that addresses you as a father addresses his son? It says, “My son, do not make light of the Lord’s discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you,

ibani_text: Tegó, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ o ḅẹlẹma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ datụ́ghụ́ma tụ́ghụ́mam pighi o pa tụ́wọ mịẹ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fomfom.
english_text: because the Lord disciplines the one he loves, and he chastens everyone he accepts as his son.”

ibani_text: O mịnị ingịrịma nyáná ọmịnị árịarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma pịrị, o nimi sa ḅẹẹ anị ọmịna daa ḅara ḅom. Ị́yẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị diearị bẹ Tamuno awọ ḅara pa ọ́ nana ngam. Tẹ́ angaá tụ́wọ imi Daḅọ fomfomugha ḅo?
english_text: Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as his children. For what children are not disciplined by their father?

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ́rọ́ awọ datụ́ghụ́ma ḅara pa o datụ́ghụ́maa nḅẹḅẹ́, anị duarị bẹ ọmịnị karakárá awọgha kụ́ma daa nyánágháapụ.
english_text: If you are not disciplined—and everyone undergoes discipline—then you are not legitimate, not true sons and daughters at all.

ibani_text: Wámịna tuminikiri daapụ, nnị wa daatụ́ghụ́mam wa pa nnị osim, wa tegó ine tẹ́mẹ́bie wa yii Daḅọ ma osiibịgha si duma!
english_text: Moreover, we have all had human fathers who disciplined us and we respected them for it. How much more should we submit to the Father of spirits and live!

ibani_text: Wámịna tuminikiri daapụ kálá sáá tụ́wọ ḅụ wa datụ́ghụ́mam anị nna tọ́rụ́ karakárá ḅara, kụ́ma Tamuno mịẹarị angaá nyẹ ma ọ́ wámịna ibi gosi. Wamịnị ine ọrẹ tọ́ntọ́ duma ḅụ diekiri nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: They disciplined us for a little while as they thought best; but God disciplines us for our good, in order that we may share in his holiness.

ibani_text: Datụ́ghụ́ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị kálá sa tụọ ma ḅụ ḅẹ́lẹḅẹ́legha, kụ́ma anị akụkụm, kụ́ma anịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́maapụ, anịsáa ma ḅọ́rọ́maẹrẹ anị saghị diin karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ pághámaḅoḅom.
english_text: No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna kọrịkọrị ḅara ma saghị si pịghị ịnyọ pa ịnyọfa ḅụ́ọ́sịbị ma pịrị.
english_text: Therefore, strengthen your feeble arms and weak knees.

ibani_text: Gbụ́nụ́nụ́ asọ nwángị si ikúlá ḅụọ ma ikúlá fịnịbịgha ḅara, tụ́ma anị gwọbẹ ḅara.
english_text: “Make level paths for your feet,”so that the lame may not be disabled, but rather healed.

ibani_text: Ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma diin pa kị́nị́mamgba na fịnị pịghị ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma tọ́ntọ́ duma kọọ mịma ofori, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ arịbịgha.
english_text: Make every effort to live in peace with everyone and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị árị ḅẹẹ, ọ Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ pa ọḅụgbigha. Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ si lakpo nyánáma sị anị wáriso anị sẹnị ḅo opuma ḅẹ́rẹ́ dighi kị́nị́mamgba pịrị.
english_text: See to it that no one falls short of the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so sẹ́fịma, anịgha Tamuno nimighaḅọ dighi Esọ o kiri dẹ́rịḅọ parị tụwọ ḅara gbẹ́rẹ́ fị́nyẹ bọlị gosi.
english_text: See that no one is sexually immoral, or is godless like Esau, who for a single meal sold his inheritance rights as the oldest son.

ibani_text: Ọ́ kọ́kọ́ nimi bẹ, anịsa ma ḅọ́rọ́ sa, ọ pịghị ḅo ọ daa karịibima dọghụ sa ọ mịnị anị nyánaḅogha, ori ine asọ arịgha parị ọ mịẹmáa nyẹ ma dima bẹ ḅara, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ ori owu mingi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị dọ́ghụm.
english_text: Afterward, as you know, when he wanted to inherit this blessing, he was rejected. Even though he sought the blessing with tears, he could not change what he had done.

ibani_text: Na o ḅo ọmịnị ine ḅara pa lama bẹnyẹ laagha, kụ́ma Izirẹlịawọ sinai tụ́ndụ́ ọgọnọ mú sa, opu ḅáláfa na kọrịfịnị na kánákáná na irisé pa dọghụarị nyẹ.
english_text: You have not come to a mountain that can be touched and that is burning with fire; to darkness, gloom and storm;

ibani_text: Furoarị ọdụ na pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị pụghọ, túminị́ ma pụghọ ma náa sáá, n tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́ nnị mịnị jẹ́ pụghọ nama.
english_text: to a trumpet blast or to such a voice speaking words that those who heard it begged that no further word be spoken to them,

ibani_text: Nnị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ ma daagha ẹrẹ́sị bẹnyẹ bẹ, Ḅọ́rọ́ nama ḅụọ pa tụ́ndụ́ ma gbolo gbolo, nnị mgbọ́lụ pa anị gbi ḅabẹm.
english_text: because they could not bear what was commanded: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned to death.”

ibani_text: Tụ́ndụ́ ma fịnị ḅara opuma ḅáláfámam si Mosis warị bẹ, Ḅáláfa I jighemaarị.
english_text: The sight was so terrifying that Moses said, “I am trembling with fear.”

ibani_text: Tụ́ma Zayọn tụ́ndụ́ anị o tándị ḅo nyẹ dumafịnị Tamuno ma opu ama, sobie Jerusalem na pịghị tọgha tọgha mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi sookumuapụ bieḅẹlẹ kubiri ogbo.
english_text: But you have come to Mount Zion, to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem. You have come to thousands upon thousands of angels in joyful assembly,

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno parị yii awọ ma kobiri ḅom, n sobie nnị ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹapụ, o Tamuno dámáḅómam kị́nị́mamgba ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ, na pịghị n mịẹ kpainma ma karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ tẹ́mẹ́.
english_text: to the church of the firstborn, whose names are written in heaven. You have come to God, the Judge of all, to the spirits of the righteous made perfect,

ibani_text: O Jizọs dámáḅómam, ịwọ ọḅọọ ma dẹghẹ karakárámaḅọ, na pịghị n sanị ọmbịnyẹ́ ibinyẹ mini Ebẹl ọmbịnyẹ́ nẹ́ngị nyẹ.
english_text: to Jesus the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks a better word than the blood of Abel.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ ẹḅịị anịgha ọmịnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arị ḅo ma naabịgha. Mini sị Tamuno oku ma naaghaapụ tuminikiri, n ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ siri gbarịgha, wamịnị wa tọ́rọ pa anị gbarị bẹ, wa ḅọ́rọ́ oḅu pa sobie saghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́arịḅọ ma gbigbi.
english_text: See to it that you do not refuse him who speaks. If they did not escape when they refused him who warned them on earth, how much less will we, if we turn away from him who warns us from heaven?

ibani_text: Ọ pụghọ tuminikiri ma jighemam, anịsa ma ḅụ. Kụ́ma mị́sa o mininimam ḅẹ́, A pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́sa ḅụ tuminikiri ngéré jighemabịgha kụ́ma sobie so.
english_text: At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, “Once more I will shake not only the earth but also the heavens.”

ibani_text: Mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma, jẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́sa gbụ́nụ́nụ́ ḅara pa diearị ḅẹẹ, nnị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ ma, nnị anị jighebẹm sị anị sii, sị nnị ine jighebịgha nyẹ na fịnịbẹ ḅara.
english_text: The words “once more” indicate the removing of what can be shaken—that is, created things—so that what cannot be shaken may remain.

ibani_text: Wamịnị ịmịẹḅam pa Tamuno ḅẹẹ, ḅẹẹ wa nnị ine jighemabịgha amadakiri nyánáakịarị. Wa bieḅẹlẹ sị susi Tamuno pịrị anị ọ tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹlẹma bẹ ḅara, osigha na ḅáláfa na, ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us be thankful, and so worship God acceptably with reverence and awe,

ibani_text: Tegó wámịna Tamuno ori anịị kị́nị́ dọ́ghụ́ma dọ́ghụ́ma fịnị.
english_text: for our “God is a consuming fire.”

ibani_text: Ọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma bịpịmú Krais asọ duaarịapụ ḅara.
english_text: Keep on loving one another as brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: O biekóróma igoniapụ daasu ọmịna wárịbie. Jẹ́apụ imi ọkọ mịẹapụ warị anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sookumuapụ daa wárị su nimigha pa.
english_text: Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers, for by so doing some people have shown hospitality to angels without knowing it.

ibani_text: Ikólibie fịnịapụ pa biekóróma, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị na nnị na ikólibie ma ḅụ imii, ọ tọ́rụ́siarịarịapụ ma pa biekóróma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị na nnị na tọ́rụ́siarị ma árịarị.
english_text: Continue to remember those in prison as if you were together with them in prison, and those who are mistreated as if you yourselves were suffering.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́yáa anị kị́nị́mamgba opu osigha pa pịrị na ibinyẹ, deeapụ na taapụ na jụghọ jụghọ ḅụ minini na ibim, Tamuno ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbẹm ama dọghụapụ ma sịbị na pịghị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọ́arịapụ ma sịbị.
english_text: Marriage should be honored by all, and the marriage bed kept pure, for God will judge the adulterer and all the sexually immoral.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị ọmịna duma fófóoma igbii ḅẹlẹma ḅụ, ọnyana nyẹ ọ tọ́rụ́ bi, Tamuno kọkọ ḅẹ́, A jéné n jéné ọ warịsobịgha a pịghị jéné n jéné ọ pa ọḅụ gbibịgha.
english_text: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, “Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.”

ibani_text: Wamịnị anịsa kụrọ tọ́rụ́ nyáná sị dughobẹm, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma anị ị́yẹ́ ḅárásuaḅọ, i ḅáláfabịghaa. Tumḅọ ine tẹ́ pa i mịẹbẹ?
english_text: So we say with confidence, “The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?”

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅọ́rọ́maa sịḅidaapụ pa biekóróma, Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ ọ pịrịapụ, okórómaḅo, n ḅárá warị duma kọ ḅara na pịghị n fịị ḅara sị nna minini daa nyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: Remember your leaders, who spoke the word of God to you. Consider the outcome of their way of life and imitate their faith.

ibani_text: Jizọs Krais anị biaéné ḅọ ma mịmgba éné ḅọ pịghị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá la.
english_text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.

ibani_text: O minima tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ dienyẹ ọ daa irima karakárá asọ ma ḅụ. Anị ibim ḅẹẹ tumḅọ biebẹ ịnyọ nyáná ḅo Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅụ, mịnị saghị fị́nyẹ ólóghó kokogha, ọmịna bie mị ólóghó ma kokoapụ, mị ólóghó ma so ḅárásua n pịrịgha.
english_text: Do not be carried away by all kinds of strange teachings. It is good for our hearts to be strengthened by grace, not by eating ceremonial foods, which is of no benefit to those who do so.

ibani_text: Igwagwaapụ ma Tamuno wárị ma bie fịrịnwangịarị ḅo ma kụrọ nyanagha sị ẹ́bẹ ma ọgọ́nọ́ fịnị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ fịị.
english_text: We have an altar from which those who minister at the tabernacle have no right to eat.

ibani_text: Juuapụ Opu Igwagwaḅọ ma nama pulo ma akuoo opu tọ́ntọ́ yọ ma ḅo si, anị pa igwagwaá sii pịrị, kụ́ma nama ma ojumẹnị ma nụ́ngọbie nnị anị dọghụmam.
english_text: The high priest carries the blood of animals into the Most Holy Place as a sin offering, but the bodies are burned outside the camp.

ibani_text: Mịma go, Jizọs sọ ama bie fịịgha, ori ine ori ọmbịnyẹ́ pa n sịrị si bẹ ḅara nna sii ḅụ.
english_text: And so Jesus also suffered outside the city gate to make the people holy through his own blood.
