ibani_text: Anịgo, wamịnị o dama mú nụ́ngọbie ma ḅụ sị ọ́ nana ḅụ́gịrịrị ma daa.
english_text: Let us, then, go to him outside the camp, bearing the disgrace he bore.

ibani_text: Bẹ mị tuminikiri wa fịnị gbámásó bẹ ama ofori, wa tọ́rụ́ pa ḅoarị ámá ma dighiarị.
english_text: For here we do not have an enduring city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.

ibani_text: Anịgo wa sámámgba túminí igwagwaá pa Tamuno pịrị Jizọs ẹrẹ ḅụ. Mịma anịị wa dugho págháma igwaa ḅẹẹ Jizọs anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ.
english_text: Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that openly profess his name.

ibani_text: O bieḅárámá ma ibi mịẹsị pịghị ḅárásua jụghọ jụghọ pịrị, tegó, mị Tamuno tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị igwaa.
english_text: And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna sịbịdaapụ osii, pịghị n dughonyẹ mịẹ. Nnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ kúruarị ịnyọsáragha pa, n pịghị dugho Tamuno pịrịbẹ ḅara n ḅárá warị o didighi ḅara. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ nnị osisii, n bieḅẹlẹ ḅara pa nna fịrị nwángịbẹm, anịgha n sitẹ́mẹ́ pa nna fịrị nwángịbẹm. Anịma sọ́nyẹ sọọ ọ pịrịbịgha.
english_text: Have confidence in your leaders and submit to their authority, because they keep watch over you as those who must give an account. Do this so that their work will be a joy, not a burden, for that would be of no benefit to you.

ibani_text: Ọ pa tẹ́ghẹ̄ wa pịrị. Wa nimim ḅẹẹ wa fíafía tẹ́mẹ́ nyanam, wa pịghị karakárá nyẹ́ ma mịẹ dọghụm sámámgba.
english_text: Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience and desire to live honorably in every way.

ibani_text: A opuma ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹẹ, o tẹ́ghẹ̄ sị Tamuno ḅọlọgha sa ḅụ, i pa ọ fịrịma.
english_text: I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to you soon.

ibani_text: Mị́sa diin nyáná Tamuno ma gbámásó ọmbịnyẹ́ ma ọḅọọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs saghịma ḅo fịị ḅụ, opu ánánákúrúḅọ ma,
english_text: Now may the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the sheep,

ibani_text: ibi gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ḅárásua ọ pịrị, ọmịnị o binyẹ mịẹarị sáá ọ pịghị wámịna duma bie o tẹ́mẹ́ ḅẹlẹma nyẹ mịẹ Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, Boma fịnị pịrịḅọ akị mú ḅẹ́ sa láa. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: equip you with everything good for doing his will, and may he work in us what is pleasing to him, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: A ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ị́yẹ́ mịnaapụ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ingịrịma nyáná a gịẹḅọ ọ pịrị tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọma ábálálá ma pịrị. Mị́sa a gịẹ ábálálá ma opuma nángwọgha.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, I urge you to bear with my word of exhortation, for in fact I have written to you quite briefly.

ibani_text: A dọ́ghụm o nimi wámịna numboru owitụ́wọ Timoti, ori ikólibie págháḅomam ori álála ḅo ḅo, a ọ nana ḅobẹm sị ọmịnị ori arịị.
english_text: I want you to know that our brother Timothy has been released. If he arrives soon, I will come with him to see you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna sịbịdaapụ bii wa piri, na pịghị Tamuno túminị́ mamgba, Ịtalị ḅụ fịnị mininiapụ oku fịrịmam ḅẹ́ nnị obii.
english_text: Greet all your leaders and all the Lord’s people. Those from Italy send you their greetings.

ibani_text: Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ọmịnị mamgba na fịnị.
english_text: Grace be with you all.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma, Tamuno ómóniḅọ na pịghị Jizọs Krais ómóniḅọ Jems ḅara anịị anị sághị ḅo nyẹ. A sịbịpị pa Tamuno túminị́ mamgba sịarị nnị gálágálámáapụ tuminikiri gbọrụ.
english_text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, To the twelve tribes scattered among the nations: Greetings.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ anị o bieḅẹlẹma, tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ daádighi ọmịna asọ mgbẹsẹ sa.
english_text: Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters,whenever you face trials of many kinds,

ibani_text: Ọmịna míníni ine mị daádighi ma sọ́ḅa sa ọ nimim ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ngịrịma nyánámam.
english_text: because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị árị ḅẹ́ ọmịna ngịrịma ọ dighi mú kunema lam, si, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ọ́ káarábẹḅara, ibima sẹ, pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ bibịẹgha ḅara.
english_text: Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịna bie opu níminyẹ nyánághaḅọ imii, n ḅo Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄, ori ibima biiapụ mamgba pịrịbẹm nyẹ́kọ́magha pa.
english_text: If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma i tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ sa mịnị mmẹẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ nyánáma. Mmẹẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ nyánáarị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tọ́rụ́bie fịnị dinọngụ anị n ḅo kịkanyẹ, mingi dighi pịghị fọ́rụ́ ofuro ma ḅọ́rọ́arị nyẹ.
english_text: But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind.

ibani_text: Anị tumḅọ ma n ḅọ sị ma ḅẹ́ n ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ nyánáḅobẹm Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara.
english_text: That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹarịḅọ ọrẹ asọ sọ gbụ́nụ́nụ́gha.
english_text: Such a person is double-minded and unstable in all they do.

ibani_text: O kúru a dugho ọ pịrị Krais asọ duaarị siminiapụ bieḅẹ́lẹ́bẹm, Tamuno n dighi sóghóloma sa.
english_text: Believers in humble circumstances ought to take pride in their high position.

ibani_text: Ngọ nyáná Krais duaarịapụ so bieḅẹlẹ naibim Tamuno n sitéréma sa. Ngọ nyánáapụ ma sọ ḅọ́rọ́ sọ́bẹm piri ngóngó ḅara.
english_text: But the rich should take pride in their humiliation—since they will pass away like a wild flower.

ibani_text: Ịrụa ma saghị sị anị ọfịrị pa dipinyẹ ma dọ́ghụ́maarị ḅara, anị ngóngó sóghóro koroarị, anị ibii sọ mịnị tọ́rụ́sọgha. Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị ngọ nyánáapụ ma sọ gulugulubeḅara, nnị ikelekelé nna éné bie fịrị nwángịarị sa.
english_text: For the sun rises with scorching heat and withers the plant; its blossom falls and its beauty is destroyed. In the same way, the rich will fade away even while they go about their business.

ibani_text: Daádighi ḅụ kụrọ sẹapụ, bieḅẹlẹ nna nyẹ sọọbẹm. Ọ daádighi ma sáḅá kórómaẹrẹ nḅọ Tamuno míníni ọ ḅẹlẹmaapụ ma pịrị duma nyánábẹm.
english_text: Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love him.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ fịnị daádighi bie sọ sọ wa dughobịgha ḅẹ́, Mịị daádighi ma Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom. Tamuno siinyẹ pa ọrẹ a túminị́ daádighibịgha ori sọ pịghị kị́nị́ daádighi daádighigha.
english_text: When tempted, no one should say, “God is tempting me.” For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone;

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa daádighi ḅụ sọarị, wamịnị ojumẹnị wa nụ́nụ́ sị pa ofori ofori pughotarịarị siinyẹ ḅụ suamaẹrẹ.
english_text: but each person is tempted when they are dragged away by their own evil desire and enticed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa wa pughotarịarị siinyẹ ma fura sa anị sii yiim; sii ḅo sẹ́nị sa, anị fịị dighiḅọ ḅom.
english_text: Then, after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is full-grown, gives birth to death.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi mịnaapụ ọ minima nnị oḅori pa ọ sịị.
english_text: Don’t be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: Tamuno pịrịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ibim pịghị kpainm, sobie saghị ḅo nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ibim pịghị kpainm Tamuno ḅara anịị anị saghị ḅoarị nyẹ.
english_text: Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ ḅara ḅụ ọ duma pa wa pịrịm, ori karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ sị wa tarị kiri nyánábeḅara ọ tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba ḅụ.
english_text: He chose to give us birth through the word of truth, that we might be a kind of firstfruits of all he created.

ibani_text: Ọ mịma pa biekóróma ị́yẹ́ ibi mịnaapụ! Ibim ḅẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba álála nyẹ náa, kụ́ma álála ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́gha, pịghị álála bieoḅugha.
english_text: My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

ibani_text: Bieoḅu, Tamuno karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ pághámaḅoḅogha.
english_text: because human anger does not produce the righteousness that God desires.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị ọ ḅụ sighima ịlọ́lị duma na siiamịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ. Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ pa Tamuno bie suu, sị ọ pa ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie sua ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma daakị, anịma anịị ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma pa ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ.
english_text: Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị oḅori pa ọ ḅụ suama ḅẹ́, ọmịnị ọrẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naábẹm, kụ́ma ọmịnị anị pa fịrị ḅụ suabịgha.
english_text: Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma naam, kụ́ma anị pa fịrị ḅụ suaghaa, ọ kịkanyẹ ọ tẹ́mẹ́ dighinyẹ bie amịna ḅụ árị anị fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like someone who looks at his face in a mirror

ibani_text: Nnị ibiḅara pa nna ḅụ arịm, kụ́ma n tẹ́mẹ́ dighinyẹ ma wáriso gbẹ́rẹ́kiri n warị pa bieḅárámá n fịnị ḅara.
english_text: and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ ị kikiama túminị́ fiimaarị ólóghó ma dighi sị pịghị sa ngúma anị pịrị, ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ ị anị pughu fama sị warị pa bieḅárámá, kụ́ma anị pa fịrị ḅụ sua, Tamuno ị bomabẹm ị mịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: But whoever looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, and continues in it—not forgetting what they have heard, but doing it—they will be blessed in what they do.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie sịḅọ imi ḅẹ́ nḅọ Tamuno nimim, kụ́ma ine nḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ọlọgha, anị tumḅọ ma Tamuno nimi ọ́ papanyẹ, n ḅo oḅori pa n ḅo ḅụ siim.
english_text: Those who consider themselves religious and yet do not keep a tight rein on their tongues deceive themselves, and their religion is worthless.

ibani_text: Tamuno Daḅọ árị sị kpain pịghị karakárá Tamuno nimi, ọ́ nyingi na daa ófórigha awọ ma tákubiri, na pịghị dee oforighaapụ ma nna tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ, pịghị minigha sị tuminikiri ma n ḅọ sima.
english_text: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa mịnaapụ, mininiapụ ḅara wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais ḅụ, ipine nyáná Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅara pa nyẹ́ mịẹ túminị́ pịrịma nna fịnị ḅara gosi.
english_text: My brothers and sisters, believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ must not show favoritism.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ igbii nyáná owitụ́wọ, odoḅala na fíafía bịtẹ suaḅọ, ọmịna kubiri ogbo ḅom, sị gbẹ́rẹ́ simini ḅọ, káákáá bịtẹ suaḅọ sọ pịghị ḅom.
english_text: Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in filthy old clothes also comes in.

ibani_text: Ị warị tụ́ma osigha nyána fíafía bịtẹ ma suaḅọ pịrị, warị ọ ḅẹ́, Mịnga tụ́ma ịkasị ḅụ kpọrọfịnị, warị siminiḅọ ma ḅẹ́, Ịrí anị angaá sẹ́fịnị, anịgha kpọrọfịnị kiri ma ḅụ ị ḅụọ angaá,
english_text: If you show special attention to the man wearing fine clothes and say, “Here’s a good seat for you,” but say to the poor man, “You stand there” or “Sit on the floor by my feet,”

ibani_text: anịsa ị ólóghó kórómam. Ị kị́rị́ma pupághámaḅoarị ọmịnị ogbobie, pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ pẹ́lẹ́arị ọmịna sitẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?

ibani_text: O pughu, ị́yẹ́ ibi mịnaapụ, Tamuno mị tuminikiri siminiapụ ma sẹ́lẹ́akịm sị nnị opuma minini nyánáapụ sọ sị nnị ma pịghị amadakiri ma nyáná bẹapụ sọ, Tamuno minini ọ ḅẹlẹmaapụ ma pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters: Has not God chosen those who are poor in the eyes of the world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised those who love him?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị siminiapụ dighisimam. Tẹ́apụ ọ pụ́nụ́marị pịghị ọ nụ́nụ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọapụ dámámụarịapụ, ngọ nyánápụ magha?
english_text: But you have dishonored the poor. Is it not the rich who are exploiting you? Are they not the ones who are dragging you into court?

ibani_text: Nnị anị pịghị n pa ọ sii ibi ẹ́rẹ́ ma dughosimaarị nyẹ.
english_text: Are they not the ones who are blaspheming the noble name of him to whom you belong?

ibani_text: Ọ karakárányẹ ma mịẹarị ọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ so amadakiri ólóghó ma kokoarị dughonyẹ mịẹ diri ma bie nnị árịnyẹ, I nana kikiaḅọ ḅẹlẹma, ị́ ịḅụ ḅẹlẹma ḅara.
english_text: If you really keep the royal law found in Scripture, “Love your neighbor as yourself,”you are doing right.

ibani_text: Ị ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́ kụkụ ị siinyẹ mịẹarị.
english_text: But if you show favoritism, you sin and are convicted by the law as lawbreakers.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ólóghó koro ḅọ, ólóghó mamgba kórómam.
english_text: For whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.

ibani_text: Dugho gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ma ḅẹ́, Amadọghụma, pịghị ḅẹm bẹ, Kị́nị́ ḅáma. Ị ḅọ́rọ́ amadọghụgha, kụ́ma ị́ ólóghó kórómam i ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ḅa ḅa.
english_text: For he who said, “You shall not commit adultery,”also said, “You shall not murder.”If you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a lawbreaker.

ibani_text: Anịgoo ọmịnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ pịghị anị ḅara pa duma kọọ, ólóghó ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ si pịghị ḅọ́rọ́ma bẹapụ ḅara.
english_text: Speak and act as those who are going to be judged by the law that gives freedom,

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyána amịna jẹa ḅọ pịrịghaḅọ Tamuno so tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyáná n ḅọ pịrịbịgha ọrẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅụ, kụ́ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ nẹngịm.
english_text: because judgment without mercy will be shown to anyone who has not been merciful. Mercy triumphs over judgment.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa mịnaapụ, anị tẹ́ ibi mịẹ ọ pịrịbẹ, ọmịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹ́ a minini nyánam, ḅọ́rọ́ ị́yẹ́ mịẹnyẹ anị diegha? Anị minini ma anị ine i dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹ?
english_text: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but has no deeds? Can such faith save them?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ mịná owiapụ imi na mịná ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ, suabịtẹ biiapụ pịghị fị́fị́nyẹ nyanagha.
english_text: Suppose a brother or a sister is without clothes and daily food.

ibani_text: Anị tẹ́ ibi mịẹ n pịrịbẹ? Ị́ n ḅẹ́ sa, Tamuno ọ boma! Oju ọfịrịma sị ibima nyẹ́fị, kụ́ma n bii nyẹ ma ị pa n pịrịgha.
english_text: If one of you says to them, “Go in peace; keep warm and well fed,” but does nothing about their physical needs, what good is it?

ibani_text: Anị minini fịnị ḅara, anị ḅọ́rọ́ papa fịnị, fịrị ḅụ sọgha pa, anịsa, fịị anịị anị fịịmaá nyẹ.
english_text: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ḅẹẹbẹm ḅẹ́, Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ minini nyánam, jụghọ ḅẹẹbẹm a mịẹnyẹ nyánam. A pagharaa bẹnyẹ, pa i die, tumḅọ minini nyáná si anị pa fịrị ḅụ suabịgha ḅara. A ị́yẹ́ minini pa i diebẹm ị́yẹ́ fịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: But someone will say, “You have faith; I have deeds.” Show me your faith without deeds, and I will show you my faith by my deeds.

ibani_text: Ị mininim ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ngéré anị fịnịnyẹ, anịma ibim! Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma sọ mininim sị pịghị jighe jighem ḅáláfa ḅụ.
english_text: You believe that there is one God. Good! Even the demons believe that—and shudder.

ibani_text: Oḅoriḅọ i dọghụ n pa i die ḅẹ́ n pa fịrị ḅụ sugha minini nyẹ ḅụ ofori?
english_text: You foolish person, do you want evidence that faith without deeds is useless?

ibani_text: Wámịna tádóḅọ Ebraham, ọ tọ́rọ pa Tamuno karakárá ḅo sọ, anịị ọrẹ mịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ori ọ tụ́wọ Aizik pa agbā mịẹ sa ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Was not our father Abraham considered righteous for what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ arịgha ọrẹ minini na ọrẹ mịẹnyẹ nwángị gbólómam, ọrẹ minini anị ḅụ mịẹ kpainmam ọrẹ mịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: You see that his faith and his actions were working together, and his faith was made complete by what he did.

ibani_text: Tọ́n diri ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅo karakárányẹ sọm, dughonyẹ ḅẹ́, Ebraham Tamuno ḅụ mininim, anịgo Tamuno ọrẹ akịm karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ. Anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ n warị Tamuno nangwọ pa Ebraham sịị.
english_text: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,”and he was called God’s friend.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ arịgha ḅẹ́ wámịna mịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị wa karakáráapụ sọọ nyẹ Tamuno tórúku wámịna minini ngéréghaa.
english_text: You see that a person is considered righteous by what they do and not by faith alone.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anị, Rahab sẹfị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma, a karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ sọ ḅara, Tamuno tórúku, árị ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ árị ḅo amafuru Izirẹlịawọ ma dakóróma ḅara sị jẹ́ asọ pa n die sị nnị mangị.
english_text: In the same way, was not even Rahab the prostitute considered righteous for what she did when she gave lodging to the spies and sent them off in a different direction?

ibani_text: Anịgo tẹ́mẹ́ nyanagha ojumẹnị fịịmaá ḅara anị mịẹnyẹ nyanagha minini fịịmaá ḅara.
english_text: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead.

ibani_text: Iyẹa mịnaapụ, ọmịna ḅụ tọghaapụ nyẹ́dieapụ sọ ma. O nimiḅara ma ḅẹ́, wamịnị nyẹ́dieapụ kụ́rọḅa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ nyánábẹm.
english_text: Not many of you should become teachers, my fellow believers, because you know that we who teach will be judged more strictly.

ibani_text: Wamịnị mamgba nyẹ mịẹ irima irimam, kụ́ma irimaghaḅọ amịna dugho bịpị ḅụ anị tumḅọ ma anịị kpain ḅo, n ḅọ pịghị n ḅọ oju gbọrụ ma ọlọbẹm.
english_text: We all stumble in many ways. Anyone who is never at fault in what they say is perfect, able to keep their whole body in check.

ibani_text: Wa ikúlélu pa ásụ bịpịbie suam sị anị wamịnị osii bẹ ḅara, sị wamịnị anị daa wa mú bi ngaa muu.
english_text: When we put bits into the mouths of horses to make them obey us, we can turn the whole animal.

ibani_text: Dighi onwiarụ dụḅa la ḅara, kụ́rọ fọ́rụ́ anịị anị dighi nwángịarị nyẹ, n dụpọ pa kárá gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ anị n pa anị daa amaḅara na ẹ́rẹ́ḅara daarịnyẹ, árụ́ dọghụḅọ ma bi ḅara bi ḅara.
english_text: Or take ships as an example. Although they are so large and are driven by strong winds, they are steered by a very small rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.

ibani_text: Anịị ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma fịnị ḅara, anị ịrụm kụ́ma anị opuma bịpịkpọ kpọm. Pa dighi kálá fịnịnyẹ ine opu pịrị dọ́ghụ́ma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Likewise, the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes great boasts. Consider what a great forest is set on fire by a small spark.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma sọ fịnị kịkam. Anị ọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ sii tuminikiri, gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅụ fịnịarị wámịna oju bie, pịghị anị sii die wásámaarị wamịnị oju gbọrụ ḅụ. Anị fịnị pa wámịna duma gbọrụ ḅụ sua suam anịị kọrịfịnị bie saghị anị damaḅo fịnị.
english_text: The tongue also is a fire, a world of evil among the parts of the body. It corrupts the whole body, sets the whole course of one’s life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell.

ibani_text: Nama gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, fíní, furo pa ikiriarị nama na nji na tumḅọ nnị na ngáman,
english_text: All kinds of animals, birds, reptiles and sea creatures are being tamed and have been tamed by mankind,

ibani_text: kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so na ine ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ma ọlọgha, anịma anịị ịnyọfagha siinyẹ, Kị́nị́ḅa lakpo anịị anị bie bii nyẹ.
english_text: but no human being can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.

ibani_text: Anị wa pa wámịna Nyánáḅọ Daḅọ ịmịẹḅam pa ọ pịrịarịnyẹ, anị wa pịghị pa kị́nị́ wiriarị nyẹ, Tamuno ọ ḅụ dighi tẹ́mẹ́apụ ma.
english_text: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God’s likeness.

ibani_text: Ịmịẹḅam na gboonyẹ na mị gbẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ma bie saghị págháḅoarị. Ịyẹa mịnaapụ mịma ọkọfịnịbịgha.
english_text: Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ ésiḅe ála mingi na ḅụ mingi pághámaḅoḅogha.
english_text: Can both fresh water and salt water flow from the same spring?

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ mịnaapụ ile sị ine ẹ́lẹlẹ́ndẹ suabịgha, grepụ sị ine ile suabịgha anịgha ála bie fịnị ésiḅe ḅẹlẹ mingi pághámaḅo.
english_text: My brothers and sisters, can a fig tree bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? Neither can a salt spring produce fresh water.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie opu nyẹ́nimi pịghị akanyaḅo nyánáapụ imi? Ọmịnị ọkọọ fịnị ibi duma ḅụ pa anị die, ọ ḅụ sitéréma na opu nyẹ́nimi pa ọ mịẹarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹ.
english_text: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let them show it by their good life, by deeds done in the humility that comes from wisdom.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ i tẹ́mẹ́bie i nyẹ́mọnịarị, pịghị ákụ nyáná pịghị ịḅụ ịḅụ nimi, epele ti karakárá ma sịbị sẹ ma ḅẹ́, ị opu nyẹ́nimim.
english_text: But if you harbor bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast about it or deny the truth.

ibani_text: Ọkọ fịnị opu nyẹ́nimi ma sobie saghị ḅogha, ọ́ mị tuminikiri nyẹ, ojumẹnị nyẹ pịghị sitẹ́mẹ́ nyẹ.
english_text: Such “wisdom” does not come down from heaven but is earthly, unspiritual, demonic.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́mọ́ni na ịḅụ ịḅụ fịnị angaá, galagala na tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ siinyẹ, anịị anị angaá ma ḅụ fịnịfịnị nyẹ.
english_text: For where you have envy and selfish ambition, there you find disorder and every evil practice.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ́gọ́nọ saghị ḅo opu nyẹ́nimi ma parị anị kpainm, anị pịghị diin ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, sárásárám, nangwọmiẹdim, anị pịghị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ nyánam, ibi ibiamịẹnyẹ nyánam, anịị anị dipiapụ sughuarị nyẹ. Anị pịghị tọ́rụ́kúkúgha pịghị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ kingigha.
english_text: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.

ibani_text: Diin miẹmiẹapụ sị diin dipi pịghị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ sughu sughum túminị́ ma ogbobie.
english_text: Peacemakers who sow in peace reap a harvest of righteousness.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́ go jụghọ jụghọ na owusọarị pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́fángálámáarị? Ọmịna ojumẹnị ḅẹlẹma nyẹ anịị sámámgba owusọarị nyẹ́gha ọmịna bie?
english_text: What causes fights and quarrels among you? Don’t they come from your desires that battle within you?

ibani_text: Ị nyẹ dọ́ghụm, kụ́ma ine anị nyanagha, anịgo kị́nị́ sọ ị ḅáa dọ́ghụm, i kụ́rọ́ma pa nyẹ ma dọ́ghụm, kụ́ma í ine nyánaḅogha, anịgo i kam sọm, pịghị owusọ ị́ i dọghụnyẹ nyanagha tegó? I Tamuno ḅara anị bigha.
english_text: You desire but do not have, so you kill. You covet but you cannot get what you want, so you quarrel and fight. You do not have because you do not ask God.

ibani_text: Ị pịghị gbíla sa, i nyánaḅogha, tegó i karakárá tẹ́mẹ́bie pa anị bigha, i biiarị nyẹ ma ọ́ pa ịḅụ ngéré na dụrụkụ́.
english_text: When you ask, you do not receive, because you ask with wrong motives, that you may spend what you get on your pleasures.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ine Tamuno na sẹghaapụ, o nimigha ḅẹ́ tuminikiri ma na nangwọ sọọ anịị Tamuno na iruonaḅọ mịẹ? Dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ tuminikiri na nangwọ sọọ, Tamuno iruonaḅọ sọmam.
english_text: You adulterous people,don’t you know that friendship with the world means enmity against God? Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

ibani_text: Ọ tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹ dugho Tọ́ndiri ma ḅẹẹ, Tamuno karakáráma ọ pa wámịna bie sua tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: Or do you think Scripture says without reason that he jealously longs for the spirit he has caused to dwell in us?

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Tamuno nyáná wa pịrị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ kụrọm anị Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Tamuno opuamịẹnyẹapụ daa sẹ́mam, warị ọrẹ ḅẹlẹma pa nna ḅụ siminimáapụ pịrị.
english_text: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: “God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble.”

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ sịghị Tamuno ma súghúbie sua, ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma daá sẹmáa anịsáa ọ pịghị mangị sọ́bẹm ọ fịnịanga.
english_text: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

ibani_text: Kikia Tamuno damaḅo, ori sọ kikia ọ dámáḅobẹm. Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅara sịrị si siinyẹ bie, ọ pịghị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie mịẹ fiafiama ọmịnị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ kingi.
english_text: Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

ibani_text: Ọ dụadu, ọ mịnị owuú, ọmịna dẹrị anị pịghị owuú nyẹ sọ, ọmịna bieḅẹlẹ ḅo pịghị tẹ́mẹ́sii ḅụ sọọ
english_text: Grieve, mourn and wail. Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom.

ibani_text: Ịḅụ siterema Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịrị, ori sọ i sághị sóghólómabẹm.
english_text: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.

ibani_text: O jụghọ jụghọ dughosima ma, ịyẹa mịnaapụ, ḅọ́rọ́ o jụghọ jụghọ dughosima anịgha ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ jẹ́ Krais duaarị mị́naḅọ pịrị, ọmịnị ólóghó ma dughosimaarị pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ólóghó ma pịrịarị. Ịrị mịnị ólóghó ma koko ḅogha, kụ́ma ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ólóghó ma pịrịarịḅọ.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, do not slander one another. Anyone who speaks against a brother or sisteror judges them speaks against the law and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, but sitting in judgment on it.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori ngéré anịị ólóghó pịrịḅọ pịghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ori ngéré anịị ine dụaḅọ́rọ́ma bẹḅọ pịghị tumḅọ guluguluma bẹḅọ, kụ́ma ịrị tụọ jụghọ gúlúgúlúmaarị ḅọ?
english_text: There is only one Lawgiver and Judge, the one who is able to save and destroy. But you—who are you to judge your neighbor?

ibani_text: Ọmịnị i pughuu, ọmịnị ḅẹarịapụ ḅẹ́, Mịmgba anịgha ḅáa éné a gbẹ́rẹ́ opu ama mubẹm sị anị ngaa gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rá fịnị sị fẹ́ túḅo sị opu igbii mịẹ.
english_text: Now listen, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money.”

ibani_text: Ị nimigha sa, ị́yẹ́ dumafịnị bẹ ḅara ḅáāẹnẹ, onwi fịnị ḅara ma anịị ọmịna dumafịnị ḅara, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ kálábiri págháḅom, warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri ẹmẹẹfáa.
english_text: Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes.

ibani_text: Mịị o dugho ḅẹnyẹ, ḅẹ́ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno mini mini, wa dumafịnị si mịma, anịgha i siinyẹ mịẹbẹm.
english_text: Instead, you ought to say, “If it is the Lord’s will, we will live and do this or that.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa ọmịnị opu ibiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarị pịghị bịpịkpọarị, anị bịpịkpọ mamgba karakáragha.
english_text: As it is, you boast in your arrogant schemes. All such boasting is evil.

ibani_text: Anịma ẹrẹ́sị, wa nimi sị miẹnaibi ibinyẹ ma mịẹgha sa, anị warị mịẹsị wa siiapụ sọọ.
english_text: If anyone, then, knows the good they ought to do and doesn’t do it, it is sin for them.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọmịnị ngọ nyánáapụ ọmịnị i pughu, o silé, ọmịnị owuú, ọ ḅụ pághá bẹ opu ḅụḅáláḅálá go.
english_text: Now listen, you rich people, weep and wail because of the misery that is coming on you.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ngọ ḅụrụfáfámamam, ọbịọfịnyẹ sọ ọmịna bịtẹ fífámamam.
english_text: Your wealth has rotted, and moths have eaten your clothes.

ibani_text: Ọmịna odoḅala na pị́naḅala pịghị ajarị mịẹmam, mị ajarị ma pịghị onyẹ́sẹ ọ pịrịbẹm, anị pịghị ọmịna ojumẹnị dọghụmabẹm fịnị ḅara ma, ọmịnị ngọ kọọ bima wárịmam, mị kunema éné ma.
english_text: Your gold and silver are corroded. Their corrosion will testify against you and eat your flesh like fire. You have hoarded wealth in the last days.

ibani_text: Ọmịna dua bie fịrịwangiarịapụ, nna akalụ́ igbii na ọ pa n gbẹ́gha. Ọmịnị nna minigha ma pughuu, ị́yẹ́ dipi nyẹ ma tákubiriapụ ma owuú mú Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno ma biri láamam.
english_text: Look! The wages you failed to pay the workers who mowed your fields are crying out against you. The cries of the harvesters have reached the ears of the Lord Almighty.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ duma mị tuminikiri, ọ ḅụḅáláḅálá ófórigha fị na ḅụ na duma, ị ịḅụ mịẹ kpooro ma nnị i ḅáa bẹ éné ma pịrịmam.
english_text: You have lived on earth in luxury and self-indulgence. You have fattened yourselves in the day of slaughter.

ibani_text: Ị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọpẹ́lẹ́mam pịghị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ nímighaapụ ḅáfámamam n pịghị i nana nụnaghaa.
english_text: You have condemned and murdered the innocent one, who was not opposing you.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa mịnaapụ ọmịnị ingịrịma nyáná sị mú Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅo bẹ sa la. Ọ dighi duadipiapụ ingịrịma nyáná ḅara nna dipinyẹ pịrị sị mú duasughu bẹ sa la, áyá iti akị mú duasughu sa kúrúkúrúm.
english_text: Be patient, then, brothers and sisters, until the Lord’s coming. See how the farmer waits for the land to yield its valuable crop, patiently waiting for the autumn and spring rains.

ibani_text: Ịrịsọ ingịrịma nyánábẹm, ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie mịẹ kụ́rọ́ma, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ḅo ma kikiamam.
english_text: You too, be patient and stand firm, because the Lord’s coming is near.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị gunugunu jụghọ jụghọ pịrịma ị́yẹ́ a mịnaapụ sị Tamuno ọ sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọbịgha ḅara, ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma o kikia ngaa imi kúruarị ori ọḅụ diepágháma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Don’t grumble against one another, brothers and sisters, or you will be judged. The Judge is standing at the door!

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ mịnaapụ ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ikiakoroapụ ma pa biekóróma, ọ mịnị nna árị ḅẹ, nnị ọ́ inema nyánáapụ tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ.
english_text: Brothers and sisters, as an example of patience in the face of suffering, take the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.

ibani_text: Wamịnị n karịibimaapụ pa n siim nnị ingịrịma nyánam gosi, ọ kọkọ Jobu ingịrịma gbolomanyẹ naamá, ọ kọkọ pịghị nimi Tamuno sua ọ pịrị ḅara kunema ma ḅụ. Ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na lolomakúkúbie ọ ḅụ bim.
english_text: As you know, we count as blessed those who have persevered. You have heard of Job’s perseverance and have seen what the Lord finally brought about. The Lord is full of compassion and mercy.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́mámgba nẹ́ngịma nyẹ ịyẹa mịnaapụ ị nyẹ mininiarị sa, ọḅọọ fị ma, so karịfị ma, anịgha kiri karịfị, anịgha ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ gbọrụ, Innh ḅẹ́ i innh ḅẹ́ na ibi sa, pịghị Errnh errnh ḅẹ́ ị errnh errnh ḅẹ́ na ibi sa. Anịsa anịị ine Tamuno ólóghó kóróbịgha ḅara.
english_text: Above all, my brothers and sisters, do not swear—not by heaven or by earth or by anything else. All you need to say is a simple “Yes” or “No.” Otherwise you will be condemned.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie ḅụḅáláḅálá bie sọapụ imi? Nnị tẹ́ghẹ̄, ọmịna bie bieḅẹlẹapụ imi? Nnị boma núme sughu.
english_text: Is anyone among you in trouble? Let them pray. Is anyone happy? Let them sing songs of praise.

ibani_text: Ọmịna bie obiarịapụ imi? N fịrịma sọsị sẹ́nịapụ ma sị́ị́, tẹ́ghẹ̄ n pịrịbẹapụ pịghị pulo ma pa n sara Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: Is anyone among you sick? Let them call the elders of the church to pray over them and anoint them with oil in the name of the Lord.

ibani_text: Nnị minini ḅụ kọọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma obiapụ gwọbẹm. Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ pịghị mịẹbẹm nna oju kụ́rọ, n pịghị mịẹmáa siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ n siiḅụḅarasi n pịrịbẹm.
english_text: And the prayer offered in faith will make the sick person well; the Lord will raise them up. If they have sinned, they will be forgiven.

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị ọmịna sii kịẹ jụghọ jụghọ pịrị pịghị tẹ́ghẹ̄ jụghọ jụghọ pịrị, ọmịna obi gwọbẹ ḅara, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ tumḅọ kọọ tẹ́ghẹ̄ opuma kụrọfịrị nwángịarị.
english_text: Therefore confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective.

ibani_text: Elaija sọ, wa fịnị ḅara fịnịm. Ọ warị kụ́rọ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ ḅẹ́ iti kóróbịgha, iti pịghị kórógha tuminikiri tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá na mpara.
english_text: Elijah was a human being, even as we are. He prayed earnestly that it would not rain, and it did not rain on the land for three and a half years.

ibani_text: O pịghị sima tẹ́ghẹ̄m iti warị saghị koro, tuminikiri n dipi nyẹ ma warị pịghị saghị sẹ́nị.
english_text: Again he prayed, and the heavens gave rain, and the earth produced its crops.

ibani_text: Ịyẹa mịnaapụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọmịna ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ karakárá asọ ma wáriso sị mú ikelekelearị, sị jụghọ warị o daatụ́ghụ́ma karakárá asọ ma ḅụ,
english_text: My brothers and sisters, if one of you should wander from the truth and someone should bring that person back,

ibani_text: ọ mịma pa biekóróma: siiamịẹnyẹ ḅo daa, karakárá asọ ma sọ ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị sii tumḅọ ma tẹ́mẹ́ duaḅọ́rọ́mabẹm fịị ḅarabie, n ḅọ pịghị tọgha tọgha siiḅụḅarasipịrị akuobẹm.
english_text: remember this: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of their way will save them from death and cover over a multitude of sins.

ibani_text: Irị Pita, Jizọs Krais fịrịmaḅọ anịị mị diri gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarịḅọ. Tamuno sẹlẹakịapụ, n gálágáláma kóróma igoniapụ Pọntus ḅụ, Galesia, Kapadosiya, Esiya na Bitiniya ama gbọrụ bie.
english_text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, To God’s elect, exiles scattered throughout the provinces of Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia and Bithynia,

ibani_text: Nnị ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịm, Tamuno Daḅọ ma níminyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ pịghị ọ pa tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ wárị, si ọ Jizọs Krais osii, ọrẹ ọmbịnyẹ́ pịghị ọmịnị sịrị fiafiamaa. Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin, bí ḅara pa ọmịna nyẹ sọ.
english_text: who have been chosen according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, to be obedient to Jesus Christ and sprinkled with his blood: Grace and peace be yours in abundance.

ibani_text: Túmíní fịnị Tamuno wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais Daa ma pịrịị! Ori opu lolomakúkúbie ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ori ịwọ duma pa wa pịrịm ọ Jizọs Krais saghị ḅara ma fịị ḅụ, mịma dumafịnịarị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ pa wa pịrịarị,
english_text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! In his great mercy he has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

ibani_text: anịma gosi, wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno kóróma warị ori a túminị́ pịrị dumafịnị tọ́rụdighinyẹ ma wámịnị anị nyánáḅobẹm. Ọ pa warị ọ́ pịrịm sobie, n ḅụrụbịghaa angaá anịgha síí, anịgha sịghịrị faá.
english_text: and into an inheritance that can never perish, spoil or fade. This inheritance is kept in heaven for you,

ibani_text: Anị fịnị ọ pịrịm, minini ḅụ nnị Tamuno kụ́rọ pa koko wárịapụ pa mị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ma pịrị, tẹ́lẹ́mamaá nyẹ si anị ḅụ die bii nyẹ sa kunema ḅụ.
english_text: who through faith are shielded by God’s power until the coming of the salvation that is ready to be revealed in the last time.

ibani_text: Bieḅẹlẹ mịma pịrị, anị ḅọ́rọ́ o biesima mḅẹ́sọ mị́sa, ọmịnị árịarị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ daádighi gosi.
english_text: In all this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while you may have had to suffer grief in all kinds of trials.

ibani_text: Mịị daádighi ma anịị pa diepágháma ḅẹ́ ọmịna minini ma anịị karakárányẹ ma. Odoḅala sọ, tumḅọ ine sima ḅẹnyẹ, fịnị anị n pa anị daádighi dighinyẹ. Anịma go, ọmịna minini nyẹ́la odoḅala nẹ́ngị nyẹ, n pa daádighi bie sua nyanam sị nimi anị ibi láa ḅara. Anịsa ọ túmíní na ipine na kuu nyánábẹm Jizọs Krais ọ ḅụ die bẹ éné.
english_text: These have come so that the proven genuineness of your faith—of greater worth than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire—may result in praise, glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅẹlẹmam, na ọmịnị ori arịgha so, ọmịnị ọ ḅụ mininim na mị́sa ọmịnị ori arịgha sọ, mị́sa ọdurụkụarị opu bieḅẹlẹ na ipine ḅụ bii nyẹ, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ine anị dugho pághámabịgha nyẹ,
english_text: Though you have not seen him, you love him; and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy,

ibani_text: ọmịnị ọmịna biebẹ duma dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánáarị gosi, anịma mịẹm sị ọ minini nyáná ọ ḅụ.
english_text: for you are receiving the end result of your faith, the salvation of your souls.

ibani_text: Olom sáá Ikiakoroapụ ma, Tamuno ḅara ọ nyáná ḅo bẹ mịị tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma gboloma ikiakoroapụ ma, sáá ákịm pịghị tọ́rụ́ pa kiri lama dọghụm nnị nimiḅo bẹ ḅara, mịị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: Concerning this salvation, the prophets, who spoke of the grace that was to come to you, searched intently and with the greatest care,

ibani_text: Nnị warị ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma dọghụ, sa ma láa bẹ sa, anị pịghị tọrọ́ pa ḅo bẹ. Mị́sa ma anị n ḅụ fịnị Krais Tẹ́mẹ́ ḅara tụ́ghụ́máarị, die pághámaarị Krais árị bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị pịghị anị dua bẹ ipine.
english_text: trying to find out the time and circumstances to which the Spirit of Christ in them was pointing when he predicted the sufferings of the Messiah and the glories that would follow.

ibani_text: Tamuno diepágháma mịná ikiakoroapụ ma pịrịm ḅẹ́, nna fịrị ma anị nna ḅárákū sọ́nyẹ sọ n pịrịbịgha kụ́ma anị sọọ nyẹ sọ ọmịnị pịrịbẹm, n pịghị dugho sị ọ náa maá oku ma ókumuuapụ ma bịpị, anịị n sobie saghị fịrịma ḅo Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa dugho ibi oku. Mịnanyẹ ma anị sookumuapụ ma so bii nyẹ nnị akanyaḅo.
english_text: It was revealed to them that they were not serving themselves but you, when they spoke of the things that have now been told you by those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven. Even angels long to look into these things.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna kúkúbie karakáráma warị fịrị pịrị, ọ tẹ́lẹ́ma, pịghị ọmịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ pa n pa ọ pịrịbẹ boma ma ḅụ gbánā, n Jizọs Krais diepágháma bẹ sa.
english_text: Therefore, with minds that are alert and fully sober, set your hope on the grace to be brought to you when Jesus Christ is revealed at his coming.

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno bịpị pughu, o minima si ọ Tamuno nimigha sa ọ kọmaá olom duma ḅara ma pa ḅẹrẹtọ ọmịna duma pịrị mị́sa.
english_text: As obedient children, do not conform to the evil desires you had when you lived in ignorance.

ibani_text: Mịma na karagha, ọ tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnị omiẹarị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ, ọ sịị Tamuno ma sọ tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: But just as he who called you is holy, so be holy in all you do;

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom bẹ, Tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnị tegó ịrị ma sọ Tọ́ntọ́ ḅụ fịnịm.
english_text: for it is written: “Be holy, because I am holy.”

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄arị sa, ọ Daḅọ pa ọ sim. Ori anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrịarịḅọ, ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ mịẹnyẹ labiri ḅụ. Anịma go, ị́yẹ́ duma éné kọnyẹ́ ma tuminikiri, árị bẹ, ịrị anị pa opu osigha nyáná pa ọ pịrịm.
english_text: Since you call on a Father who judges each person’s work impartially, live out your time as foreigners here in reverent fear.

ibani_text: Ọ nimim ọ sịbị mgbe sáá sị pa ọ dụapághámaḅo ọmịna tádọ́apụ ḅọ́rọ́ma ọ pịrị ofori ofori duma bie. Anị odoḅala anịgha pị́naḅala fịnị ḅara fịnịgha, tumḅọ ine álála sima bẹnyẹ.
english_text: For you know that it was not with perishable things such as silver or gold that you were redeemed from the empty way of life handed down to you from your ancestors,

ibani_text: Krais nyẹ́la ọmbịnyẹ́ ma anịị ị sịbị igbii n gbẹ́ẹ̄ si pa ị dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyẹ. Krais anịị agbaa mịẹ ánáná ma, pilegha pịghị ikúlágha ánáná.
english_text: but with the precious blood of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọ sẹ́lẹ́akịmam na n tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́gha sáá kụ́ma n warị ọmịnị go ọ diepágháma mị kunema sáá ma.
english_text: He was chosen before the creation of the world, but was revealed in these last times for your sake.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ḅụ mininim, fịị ḅụ ọ sị saghịma ḅọ sị pịghị ipine pa ọ pịrị, anịma gosi ọmịna minini na ọmịna tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ Tamuno ḅụ gbánāarị.
english_text: Through him you believe in God, who raised him from the dead and glorified him, and so your faith and hope are in God.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ mị́sa ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ mịẹ yóriyórimamáa ḅara ma karakárányẹ ma mịẹ ḅụ, ọ pịghị mị́sa karakárá ḅẹlẹma nyáná jẹ́ mininiapụ ma pịrịmam, ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie gbọrụ pa ibiḅara pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: Now that you have purified yourselves by obeying the truth so that you have sincere love for each other, love one another deeply, from the heart.

ibani_text: Nnị sima o yiimam, dumafịnị pịghị gbámásó Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, n sima o yiigha fịị bẹ tumḅọ duma pághámaḅoarị sịmgbọlụ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: For you have been born again, not of perishable seed, but of imperishable, through the living and enduring word of God.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Túminị́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ osuka fịnị ḅára anịị n fịnị ḅára, piri ngóngó fịnị ḅára anịị nna fiafiama sọ fịnị ḅára, Osuka sámụ́nọ́ sámụ́nọ́m, ngóngó sóghóro sóghóróm.
english_text: For, “All people are like grass, and all their glory is like the flowers of the field; the grass withers and the flowers fall,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma fịnị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá lam. Mị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anị n dugho págháma ọ pịrị ibi ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma.
english_text: but the word of the Lord endures forever.” And this is the word that was preached to you.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ siiamịẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa angaá ḅọ́rọ́, mịnị epele ti ma anịgha mmẹẹ́ tọ́rụ agidi duma kọọ anịgha jughonyẹ mọnị anịgha wirinumo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: Therefore, rid yourselves of all malice and all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and slander of every kind.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị nnị ịwọma yii awọ fịnị ḅara fịnị, sámámgba karakárá tẹ́mẹ́ju ndomingi ma ọ pụghọ tarị, tegó ọmịnị anị ḅụarị sáá ọmịnị ine sẹ́nị págháḅobẹm ọmịna dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ḅụ,
english_text: Like newborn babies, crave pure spiritual milk, so that by it you may grow up in your salvation,

ibani_text: mị́sa ọ dọghụ pághámaḅomam ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma ori ibim.
english_text: now that you have tasted that the Lord is good.

ibani_text: Ọ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma damaḅo, túminị́ dighisima ḅẹ́ nyẹ́ḅụoforị dumafịnị dapịrị, Kụ́ma Tamuno ọ ḅara na sẹlẹakị sị nyẹ́ḅụ sọ́nyẹ.
english_text: As you come to him, the living Stone—rejected by humans but chosen by God and precious to him—

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọ fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ dumafịnị dapịrị nnị pa tẹ́mẹ́ju warị námáarị nyẹ. Ọmịnị sọ pịghị tọ́ntọ́ igwagwaapụ, Jizọs Krais ḅárásua ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ Tamuno ḅẹ́lẹ́maarị igwaa gwaabẹm.
english_text: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual houseto be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dughom ḅẹ́: A nyẹ ḅụ sọ dapịrị sẹ́lẹ́akịm, a pa Zayọn bie warịarị ngádapịrị, ọ ḅụ minini ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụgịrịrịbịgha.
english_text: For in Scripture it says: “See, I lay a stone in Zion, a chosen and precious cornerstone, and the one who trusts in him will never be put to shame.”

ibani_text: Mị dapịrị ma anị opuma nyẹ́la ọmịnị mininiapụ ma pịrịm, kụ́ma mininighaapụ ma: Mị Wárinámáapụ ma sịghị dapịrị ḅẹ́ anị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ ḅụ ofori anị ḅo mị́sa; ngádapịrị sọ́nyẹ.
english_text: Now to you who believe, this stone is precious. But to those who do not believe, “The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone,”

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri pịghị dughom ḅẹ́, Mị túminị́ ḅụọ pa fom si peele bẹ dapịrị, mịẹsị n bịghị bẹ okpo dapịrị. Nnị peelem, nnị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma minini akịịghaa gosi, mịma anị Tamuno ma tọ n pịrị ḅara.
english_text: and, “A stone that causes people to stumble and a rock that makes them fall.” They stumble because they disobey the message—which is also what they were destined for.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị anịị n sẹlẹakịmaapụ ma, Ámányánáḅọ ma igwagwaapụ, Tọ́ntọ́ sẹ, Tamuno ḅárákúu túminị́, n sẹlẹakị sị nnị Tamuno ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma dugho págháma, ọ sị ákịḅọ kánákánábie sị o ḅo ọrẹ ḅụ́gbérépuma baá ma bie so.
english_text: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God’s special possession, that you may declare the praises of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri imi o túminị́ ḅụ ofori, kụ́ma mị́sa ọmịnị ori a túminị́, gbẹ́rẹ́sa biri ọ Tamuno lolomakúkúbie nimigha kụ́ma mị́sa ọmịnị ọrẹ lolomakúkúbie nyanaḅomam.
english_text: Once you were not a people, but now you are the people of God; once you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.

ibani_text: A ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ịyẹa nángwọ́apụ igoniapụ na biaapụ na mị tuminikiri, ọmịnị sa nyána oju bie mẹnị tarịarịnyẹ ma pịrịma, owu pa sámámgba biebẹ duma ma pághámaarị nyẹ.
english_text: Dear friends, I urge you, as foreigners and exiles, to abstain from sinful desires, which wage war against your soul.

ibani_text: O mịná mịẹnyẹ mininighaapụ ma tórúku gbụ́nụ́nụ́ na ibim, si, nnị ẹ́rẹ́ pa o sịarị sáá ḅẹ́ ọ siinyẹ mịẹm, nnị ọmịna ibifịrị lighilighiḅobẹm si Tamuno ma boma o ḅo bẹ éné.
english_text: Live such good lives among the pagans that, though they accuse you of doing wrong, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day he visits us.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma go, ọ ḅụsímínímá túminị́ pa sịbịdaapụ mịẹapụ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịrị, ḅọ́rọ́ ámányánáḅọ ma anịị sóghólóḅa kụ́rọ nyánáḅọ,
english_text: Submit yourselves for the Lord’s sake to every human authority: whether to the emperor, as the supreme authority,

ibani_text: pịghị ọ tọ ḅẹ́rẹ́tọapụ ma, ḅẹ́ n siinyẹ mịẹapụ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịma pịghị ibinyẹ mịẹapụ ma túminí.
english_text: or to governors, who are sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to commend those who do right.

ibani_text: Tamuno bim ḅẹ́, ọmịnị ọmịna ibifịrị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ o nyẹ ḅụ ófórigha oḅoriapụ ma bịpị pụ́ma nna oḅori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: For it is God’s will that by doing good you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish people.

ibani_text: O duma kọọ furoawọ ḅara, kụ́ma ọmịnị ọmịna furoawọ kiri ma pa ọ mịẹarị siiamịẹnyẹ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ ma. Kụ́ma ọ duma kọọ Tamuno fịrịnwangịapụ ḅara.
english_text: Live as free people, but do not use your freedom as a cover-up for evil; live as God’s slaves.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị osigha nyáná kị́nị́mamgba pịrị, ị jẹa mininiapụ ma ḅẹlẹma, ọ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaa, kuu pa ámányánáḅọ ma pịrị.
english_text: Show proper respect to everyone, love the family of believers, fear God, honor the emperor.

ibani_text: Ómóniapụ ọ ḅụsímínímá ọmịna nyánáapụ pịrị, pịghị karakárá osigha nyáná n pịrị, ibi pịghị diin ḅara pa ọ nana ngaapụ ngéréghaa kụ́ma ọmịnị mbasịariapụ sọ.
english_text: Slaves, in reverent fear of God submit yourselves to your masters, not only to those who are good and considerate, but also to those who are harsh.

ibani_text: Tamuno bieḅẹlẹarị tegó, ḅọ́rọ́ ori ẹrẹ́sị tumḅọ árị na ibighaa tọ́rụ́siarị arịị sa.
english_text: For it is commendable if someone bears up under the pain of unjust suffering because they are conscious of God.

ibani_text: Anị tẹ́ sọ́nyẹ sọ ọ pịrịbẹ, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ fomḅara daá ọ mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ gosi, warị ngịrịma nyáná anị pịrị? Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ o fomḅara dam o karakárányẹ ma mịẹ sáá sị ngịrịma nyáná anị pịrịị, Tamuno o dighi bieḅẹlẹbẹm.
english_text: But how is it to your credit if you receive a beating for doing wrong and endure it? But if you suffer for doing good and you endure it, this is commendable before God.

ibani_text: Mịma sịbị go anịị Tamuno go ọ sị nyẹ ḅẹ́ Krais ọ ḅụgbọrụ tọ́rụ́siarị ọ pịrịm ọ pa ọ ḅarabie nyẹ dáwọ sị ọ ḅụọ dua.
english_text: To this you were called, because Christ suffered for you, leaving you an example, that you should follow in his steps.

ibani_text: Ọ mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ sọ ofori anịgha ọ bịpị págháḅo epele naaḅọ sọ ofori.
english_text: “He committed no sin, and no deceit was found in his mouth.”

ibani_text: Nnị o wiri sa, ori jẹ́ wirinumo pa n pagharagha, ọ tọ́rụ́siarị sa, o kam kórógha, kụ́ma ọ ḅụ saghị Tamuno ma ḅárásua, karakárá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọḅọ ma.
english_text: When they hurled their insults at him, he did not retaliate; when he suffered, he made no threats. Instead, he entrusted himself to him who judges justly.

ibani_text: Krais o ḅụgbọrụ wámịna sii ma dighiákịm ori oju mgbẹsẹ sị́ ma ọgọnọ, si wa fịị́ siiamịẹnyẹ pịrị, sị duma karakárányẹ ma pịrị, ori oju kii ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anị ọ ḅụ gwọọ nyanamaá nyẹ.
english_text: “He himself bore our sins” in his body on the cross, so that we might die to sins and live for righteousness; “by his wounds you have been healed.”

ibani_text: Asọ irimáa ánáná fịnị ḅara anị ọ fịnị ḅára, kụ́ma mị́sa ọ pịghịma ḅo ọmịnị Ánánákúrúḅọ na pịghị o mịná biebẹ duma Kokoarịḅọ ma pịrịmam.
english_text: For “you were like sheep going astray,”but now you have returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅárá ma ọmịnị taapụ ḅụsímínímá ọmịna deeapụ pịrị, ḅọ́rọ́ nna ḅụ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mininigha ḅo imi, ị́yẹ́ ibiamịẹnyẹ warị mịẹbẹm sị n minini, mịma ị gbẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ so kọọ na ibighaa.
english_text: Wives, in the same way submit yourselves to your own husbands so that, if any of them do not believe the word, they may be won over without words by the behavior of their wives,

ibani_text: Tegó nnị árịbẹm ị́yẹ́ mịẹnyẹ kpainm ḅara, ị pịghị osigha nyáná ḅara.
english_text: when they see the purity and reverence of your lives.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị oju birima nyẹ pa ọmịna ḅụ birimama pa die ḅẹ́ ọ fiafiam, anịị ọ sịbị mịẹḅara, sua ḅụ́birimaarị odoḅala, na pịghị o suaarị bịtẹ.
english_text: Your beauty should not come from outward adornment, such as elaborate hairstyles and the wearing of gold jewelry or fine clothes.

ibani_text: Anịmanakaragha ọmịna ibi anị ḅụ die ọmịna kúkúbie fịnị ḅára, tumḅọ tọ́rụ pa arịgha nyẹ, sịrịfa faghaa ibii, ḅụ́sitéréma na diin tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ saghị ḅo nyẹ anịị Tamuno tórúku nyẹ́la ḅa nyẹ.
english_text: Rather, it should be that of your inner self, the unfading beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is of great worth in God’s sight.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa sa, tọ́ntọ́ ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ ma, pịghị Tamuno ḅụ tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ nyánáapụ ma, nna ibi diepághámam, n ḅụsímínímá nna deeapụ sughubie sua ḅara.
english_text: For this is the way the holy women of the past who put their hope in God used to adorn themselves. They submitted themselves to their own husbands,

ibani_text: Sira ọkọfịnịm, árị Ebraham o siim warị pịghị Inyanaḅọ pa ọ sịị, ọmịnị mị́sa árị ẹ́rẹ́maawọ, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ibifịrị nwángị pịghị ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ dighi ḅáláfagha.
english_text: like Sarah, who obeyed Abraham and called him her lord. You are her daughters if you do what is right and do not give way to fear.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, ọmịnị deeapụ akanyaḅo pa ọmịna taapụ na ngaa, nimi ḅẹ́ nnị kụrọ ọ́ nana gbasịgha, osigha pa n pịrị, tegó nnị sọ pịghị ọ́ nana Tamuno ḅara ọ nyánáḅọ duma ma nyáná bẹ ḅara. Ọ mịma mịẹsị bẹnyẹ bẹnyẹ ọmịna tẹ́ghẹ̄ mgbesẹbịgha ḅara.
english_text: Husbands, in the same way be considerate as you live with your wives, and treat them with respect as the weaker partner and as heirs with you of the gracious gift of life, so that nothing will hinder your prayers.

ibani_text: A kunemaarị: ọmịnị kị́nị́mamgba gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ nyáná, ḅụnjịrị nyáná, jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma mịnaapụ ḅara, ọmịnị ibiamịẹnyẹ nyáná pịghị ḅụ siterema jụghọ jụghọ pịrị.
english_text: Finally, all of you, be like-minded, be sympathetic, love one another, be compassionate and humble.

ibani_text: Ọ mịnị siinyẹ pa siinyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄ ma anịgha wirinumo pa wirinumo gbẹ́ẹ̄, anịmanakaragha ọ karịibima pa o wiriapụ gbẹ́ẹ̄. Tegó Tamuno ma osị sa boma anị o minini ọ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: Do not repay evil with evil or insult with insult. On the contrary, repay evil with blessing, because to this you were called so that you may inherit a blessing.

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara bẹ: Duma ḅẹ́lẹ árị dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị pịghị tuminikiri ibi sa arị́, nḅọ ḅẹlẹ ọlọ sị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ pịghị epele ti ḅụ.
english_text: For, “Whoever would love life and see good days must keep their tongue from evil and their lips from deceitful speech.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọ siinyẹ ḅụ pịghị si ibinyẹ mịẹ, nnị nna tẹ́mẹ́ gbọrụ pa diin asọ ma dua.
english_text: They must turn from evil and do good; they must seek peace and pursue it.

ibani_text: Tegó Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tọ́rụ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹapụ ma didighiarị, ọ pịghị nna tẹ́ghẹ̄ ma nanaam. Kụ́ma siiamịẹnyẹapụ ori ọḅụ pa mgbigbim.
english_text: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous and his ears are attentive to their prayer, but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”

ibani_text: Tụọ nyẹ pa ọ lama bẹ, o ḅọ́rọ́ ibinyẹ ma mịẹ dọghụ?
english_text: Who is going to harm you if you are eager to do good?

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ bẹ ọ tọ́rụ́siarịm mḅẹ́sọ karakárányẹ mịẹ ḅụ, o karịibima nyánam, ọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ dighi ḅáláfama, ọ pịghị ḅụḅáláḅálá pa ọ ḅụ pịrịma.
english_text: But even if you should suffer for what is right, you are blessed. “Do not fear their threats; do not be frightened.”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie, ọ susi Krais pịrị, pịghị kuu pa ọ pịrị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅara, sámámgba, ọ tẹ́lẹ́ma ọmịnị ine n ḅo pagharaa bẹ ḅara, o gbíla ḅo ḅẹ́ o dughofindi ọmịna bie ọ nyáná tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ.
english_text: But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect,

ibani_text: O diin ḅara na osigha ḅara pa anị mịẹ, ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie mịẹ fiafiama, sị sii ẹ́rẹ pa ọsịarịapụ ọmịna ibi duma Krais bie mịẹbẹm nna ḅụ́gịrịrị n kọọarị si ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ go.
english_text: keeping a clear conscience, so that those who speak maliciously against your good behavior in Christ may be ashamed of their slander.

ibani_text: Anị ibiḅam ḅẹ́ tumḅọ tọ́rụ́siarị ibifịrị ḅụ, ḅọ́rọ́ mịma anịị Tamuno tọ ḅara, sị siinyẹ mịẹsị tọ́rụ́siarị nakaragha.
english_text: For it is better, if it is God’s will, to suffer for doing good than for doing evil.

ibani_text: Tegó Krais fịị sii pịrịm gbẹ́rẹ́sa ngéré, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ siiapụ sịbị go fịịm ori ọmịnị akuoo Tamuno pịrịị bẹ ḅara. Túminị́ ojumẹnị ḅụ ọ ḅám, kụ́ma Tamuno mịẹm o duma fịnịị tẹ́mẹ́ju,
english_text: For Christ also suffered once for sins, the righteous for the unrighteous, to bring you to God. He was put to death in the body but made alive in the Spirit.

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ju ma ḅụ ọ mú Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma kọọ n pa ịkóli bie sua tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịrịm.
english_text: After being made alive,he went and made proclamation to the imprisoned spirits—

ibani_text: Mịị anịị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma osigha túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅọlọ sa énéné, Tamuno ọ sa ngúmá kúrúapụ, Nuwa ọrẹ árụ́ ma námáarị sa. Árụ́ ma bie fịnịapụ duḅaghaa, inineapụ ngéré. Mịnaapụ ma ngéré anịị Tamuno mingi ma pa duaḅọ́rọ́maapụ.
english_text: to those who were disobedient long ago when God waited patiently in the days of Noah while the ark was being built. In it only a few people, eight in all, were saved through water,

ibani_text: Mị́ị́ mingi ma sẹ mingi sara pịrịm anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị mị́sa dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánam. Mingi sara ma anị pápá ịlọ́lị sịrịsigha oju ḅụ. Anịma anịị ọmịnị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie pa mini Tamuno pịrịnyẹ, ịlọ́lị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie ófórigha ḅụ. Túminị́ mingi sara ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyánam Jizọs Krais fịị ḅụ saghị gosi.
english_text: and this water symbolizes baptism that now saves you also—not the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a clear conscience toward God.It saves you by the resurrection of Jesus Christ,

ibani_text: Krais iwóo sobie mumam ọ pịghị Tamuno amaḅaranga imii, sookumuapụ na tẹ́mẹ́ju táarịapụ mamgba táarị, na pịghị sobie kụrọnyanáapụ mamgba.
english_text: who has gone into heaven and is at God’s right hand—with angels, authorities and powers in submission to him.

ibani_text: Krais ojumẹnị ḅụ tọ́rụ́siarị ḅara, ọmịnị so ọmịna ḅụ mịẹ karakáráma warị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma, tegó ojumẹnị ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịmáa ḅo sii mịnị n ḅọ ḅụ kụrọ nyanagha.
english_text: Therefore, since Christ suffered in his body, arm yourselves also with the same attitude, because whoever suffers in the body is done with sin.

ibani_text: Ḅẹ́ mị́sa saghị bịpịmú, ọmịnị ọmịna duma kọnyẹ́ ma kọọ tuminikiri Tamuno tọ ḅara, mịnị duma kọma tuminikiriapụ sii duma kọarị ḅara.
english_text: As a result, they do not live the rest of their earthly lives for evil human desires, but rather for the will of God.

ibani_text: Ọ tọgha sa ngumamam ḅọ́rọ́maa sa, ọ Tamuno nímighaapụ ma dua n mịẹarịnyẹ mịẹ sa, ọmịnị ọmịna duma famam, ḅụ ọlọgha ámánwángị, kuraghaa nyẹ pụghọ tarị, iru ḅụ tọ́rụ́ḅáma, fị na ḅụ bieḅẹlẹ, iru ḅụ ti kóróma, pịghị oḅori pa kị́nị́ sị, opuma ḅụ pa n kara tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ pịrị.
english_text: For you have spent enough time in the past doing what pagans choose to do—living in debauchery, lust, drunkenness, orgies, carousing and detestable idolatry.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ma ḅụ Tamuno nímighaapụ ma anị n tọ́rụ́ bulubulumaarị o go mịnị n dua ḅara la ḅara la ḅara duma ma kọgha nyẹ, anịma go n warị o dugho simam.
english_text: They are surprised that you do not join them in their reckless, wild living, and they heap abuse on you.

ibani_text: Nnị nna duma kọọ ḅárá gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ n dugho Tamuno pịrịbẹm, ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ dumaapụ na fịịapụ pịrịbẹḅọ.
english_text: But they will have to give account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.

ibani_text: Anị n go ibi oku ma dugho pa fịịmaapụ ma so pịrịnyẹ n dumafịnị sáá, anị ḅara ma ḅụ, nnị n sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ mḅẹ́so tuminikiri nnị mịẹnyẹ ḅụ, n kị́nị́mamgba sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ ḅara. Nnị dumabẹm tẹ́mẹ́ju Tamuno ma dọghụ ḅara.
english_text: For this is the reason the gospel was preached even to those who are now dead, so that they might be judged according to human standards in regard to the body, but live according to God in regard to the spirit.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kunema kikiamam, anịgosi ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ ọlọbẹm, ọ pịghị tọ́rụ́ findiwarịbẹm sị ọmịnị ine tẹ́ghẹ̄ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: The end of all things is near. Therefore be alert and of sober mind so that you may pray.

ibani_text: Nyẹ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ, ọmịnị ibiḅara pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma, tegó, ḅẹlẹma tọgha siinyẹ gbẹgbẹm gosi.
english_text: Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ́pọ́ findi jụghọ jụghọ pịrị gunugunugha pa.
english_text: Offer hospitality to one another without grumbling.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ, n ḅo nyáná ḅo dienyẹ ma pa fịrịnwangị jụghọ jụghọ pịrị, ibi fịrịnwangịapụ ḅara ine Tamuno ma pa n pịrị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ dienyẹ pa ibiḅara pa fịrịnwangịarịḅọ.
english_text: Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God’s grace in its various forms.

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ dugho wásaámaarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámáa, fịrịnwangịapụ Tamuno pa n pịrị ịnyọ mamgba pa fịrịnwangị, sị nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ túmíní fịnị Tamuno pịrịbẹ ḅara Jizọs Krais ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́. Ipine na kụ́rọ na fịnị pịrịḅọ mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá la. Anị ọkọ fịnị.
english_text: If anyone speaks, they should do so as one who speaks the very words of God. If anyone serves, they should do so with the strength God provides, so that in all things God may be praised through Jesus Christ. To him be the glory and the power for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, anị ọ tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngimama ọmịnị árịarị oju akụ ma daádighi ma, soḅọ́rọ́ jẹ́ kịrịnyẹ ọmịna ḅụ págháarị.
english_text: Dear friends, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal that has come on you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you.

ibani_text: Tụ́ma o bieḅẹlẹ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị sọ diekiri nyánam Krais tọ́rụ́siarị ma ḅụ, sị ori ipine anị ḅụ diepágháma bẹ sa, ọmịnị so opuma bieḅẹlẹ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: But rejoice inasmuch as you participate in the sufferings of Christ, so that you may be overjoyed when his glory is revealed.

ibani_text: Bieḅẹlẹ ọmịnị a nyẹ, n ḅọ́rọ́ ọ dughosima ḅẹ́ ọmịnị Krais asọduaapụ ẹrẹ́sị, mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́ ipine Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anịị Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ọmịna ḅụbie ngáarị.
english_text: If you are insulted because of the name of Christ, you are blessed, for the Spirit of glory and of God rests on you.

ibani_text: Ọ́ ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́siarịarị, ọ tọ́rụ́siarị ma ḅẹ́, ọmịnị kị́nị́ ḅa ḅáapụ, anịgha ọmịnị furuapụ, anịgha siiamịẹnyẹapụ, anịgha jẹ́apụ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ n ḅụ dighi suaarịapụ.
english_text: If you suffer, it should not be as a murderer or thief or any other kind of criminal, or even as a meddler.

ibani_text: I ḅọ́rọ́ tọ́rụ́siarị ịrị Krais asọduaḅọ gosi, anịị ị ḅụgịrịmama, kụ́ma boma pa Tamuno pịrị ḅẹ́, ị Krais ẹ́rẹ́ ma dighiarị.
english_text: However, if you suffer as a Christian, do not be ashamed, but praise God that you bear that name.

ibani_text: Sa lámam ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ saghị bẹ sa. Tamuno awọ ma sịbị anịị n saghị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹnyẹ; anị ḅọ́rọ́ wamịnị na saghị saghị, anị tọrọ́ pa Tamuno ibi oku ma mininighaapụ ma na kunema bẹ.
english_text: For it is time for judgment to begin with God’s household; and if it begins with us, what will the outcome be for those who do not obey the gospel of God?

ibani_text: Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ anị ḅụdam ibiapụ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyána, Anịsa Tamuno nimighapụ na siiamịẹnyẹapụ anị tọrọ́ fịnị n pịrịbẹ?
english_text: And, “If it is hard for the righteous to be saved, what will become of the ungodly and the sinner?”

ibani_text: Anịgo tọ́rụ́siarịarịapụ ḅẹ́ anịị Tamuno tọ́ọ warị n pịrị ḅara, nnị nna ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, n ḅụ saghị nna Tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ ḅarabie sua, ori sámámgba ọrẹ minini nyẹ warịarị ḅọ.
english_text: So then, those who suffer according to God’s will should commit themselves to their faithful Creator and continue to do good.

ibani_text: Irị ịḅụ gbọrụ sẹnịḅọ, ọmịna bie fịnị sọsị sẹ́nịapụ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄m. Ḅẹ́ ịrị a tọ́rụ́ na Krais tọ́rụ́siarị ma arịm, a pịghị diekiri nyánábẹm ori ipine ma ḅụ, anị ḅụ diepágháma bẹnyẹ.
english_text: To the elders among you, I appeal as a fellow elder and a witness of Christ’s sufferings who also will share in the glory to be revealed:

ibani_text: A ọ tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́, ọmịnị ánánákúrúapụ sọ Tamuno pa ọ pịrị ánánáawọ́ ma pịrị, ọmịnị ọ tẹ́mẹ́bie gbọrụ pa n siḅe Tamuno ma bi ḅara. Ọ mịẹma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị pa ọ kọngọ kpọm ọ pịghị mịẹma igbii go. Kụ́ma kúkúbie fịrịnwangị Tamuno ma pịrị dọghụ tẹ́mẹ́.
english_text: Be shepherds of God’s flock that is under your care, watching over them—not because you must, but because you are willing, as God wants you to be; not pursuing dishonest gain, but eager to serve;

ibani_text: Ọ kị́nị́nyánáapụ dighi Tamuno pa ọ pịrị ánánáawọ́ ma pịrịma, kụ́ma n siḅe sị nnị ọ duma kọọ ḅara pa duma kọọ.
english_text: not lording it over those entrusted to you, but being examples to the flock.

ibani_text: Sị sịbịda Ánánákúrúḅọ ma ḅo sa ọmịnị ipine ogunu nyáná bẹ ḅara anị baá jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné sịrịfabịgha nyẹ.
english_text: And when the Chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the crown of glory that will never fade away.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma ọmịnị ásáawọ ọmịnị ọ tórúku sẹ́nịapụ ma osii. Ọ ḅụ́sitéréma fịrịnwangị jụghọ jụghọ pịrị. Tọ́ndiri ma dugho ḅara ḅẹ́, Tamuno opuamịẹnyẹapụ ma daá sẹ́ma sẹ́mam kụ́ma ọrẹ ḅẹlẹma pa ḅụ sitérémaapụ ma die.
english_text: In the same way, you who are younger, submit yourselves to your elders. All of you, clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because, “God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble.”

ibani_text: Anịgo ọmịnị ọmịna ḅụ sitéréma Tamuno ma opu ḅara sughubie fịnị, si ọrẹ karakárá sa ḅụ ori ọ saghị sóghóloma bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Humble yourselves, therefore, under God’s mighty hand, that he may lift you up in due time.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ḅụḅáláḅálá mamgba pa ọḅụ gbii, tegó ori ma anịị o sịḅẹarịḅọ
english_text: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.

ibani_text: Tẹ́lẹ́ma, ọ tọ́rụ́ findi warị! Ọmịna iruonaḅọ Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma, ikelekelema ḅọ́rọ́arị o kuu kaa pẹẹ́ bẹḅọ dọghụarị.
english_text: Be alert and of sober mind. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.

ibani_text: Ọ sẹ́kụrọ ọmịna minini ḅụ, ọ daa sẹ́ma ọ kọkọ nimi bẹ ọmịna jẹ́ mininiapụ tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ nnị sọ mị gbẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị ma árịarị.
english_text: Resist him, standing firm in the faith, because you know that the family of believers throughout the world is undergoing the same kind of sufferings.

ibani_text: Ọ kẹ́lẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị so sáá, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ mamgba nyáná Tamuno ma, ọ sị ḅo bẹ ọ ḅo diekiri nyáná ọrẹ gbámásó ipine ma ḅụ Krais bie, ori ma pịghị ọ mịẹ kpaimabẹm, pịghị ọ sẹ kụ́rọ́mabẹm pịghị ịnyọ, na pịghị karakárá súghúise pa ọ pịrị.
english_text: And the God of all grace, who called you to his eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered a little while, will himself restore you and make you strong, firm and steadfast.

ibani_text: Kụ́rọ ma fịnị ọ pịrị gbáso. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: To him be the power for ever and ever. Amen.

ibani_text: Sailas a minini akị ḅo ḅẹ́ ori karakáráma Krais asọduaḅọ, ori anị ḅárásua si a mị kálá ábálálá ma gịẹ ọ fịrịma ḅọ. A ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọma dọ́ghụm sị ị́yẹ́ dugho págháma nyẹ ma dugho ḅẹ́, mị anị Tamuno karakárá tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ ma anị ḅụ sẹ kụrọ.
english_text: With the help of Silas,whom I regard as a faithful brother, I have written to you briefly, encouraging you and testifying that this is the true grace of God. Stand fast in it.

ibani_text: Babịlọn ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma, Tamuno pịghị ọmịnị na sẹlẹakịapụ, oku fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a obíí, Mak i tụwọ sọ ḅẹm a obii.
english_text: She who is in Babylon, chosen together with you, sends you her greetings, and so does my son Mark.

ibani_text: Ọ Krais ḅẹlẹma ma pa jụghọ jụghọ ḅolo. Ọmịnị Krais bie fịnịapụ ma diin ọmịnị mamgba na fịnịị.
english_text: Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace to all of you who are in Christ.

ibani_text: Irị Saimọn Pita, Jizọs Krais fịrịnwangịḅọ pịghị Jizọs Krais fịrịmaḅọ anịị mị dii ma gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarịḅọ. A gịẹ pa ọ fịrịmam wamịnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ nyẹ́la minini nyánáapụ, wámịna Tamuno na wámịna dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Jizọs Krais karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who through the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ have received a faith as precious as ours:

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin bii ḅara pa ọmịna nyẹ sọọ, o ḅo Tamuno na wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais nimiḅara ma.
english_text: Grace and peace be yours in abundance through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.

ibani_text: Tamuno ori kụ́rọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, wa binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa wa pịrịmam mịẹsị wamịnị ine kuu pa Tamuno pịrịbẹ duma kọọ. Ori wa sịḅọ ma ori ipine na ori ibi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mịnanyẹ ma pa wa pịrịm wamịnị ori ma nimi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: His divine power has given us everything we need for a godly life through our knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and goodness.

ibani_text: Mịná ipine na mịná ibi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ori ọmịnị wa pịrị opuma dụḅa na nyẹ́la dienyẹ ma pa wa pịrịmam. Mịná diepịrịnyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ọ tuminikiri bie fịnị sị tuminiḅaarị pụghọ tarịarịnyẹ ma ḅarabie mangị págháḅobẹm, sị ori tọ́ntọ́ duma ma nyáná.
english_text: Through these he has given us his very great and precious promises, so that through them you may participate in the divine nature, having escaped the corruption in the world caused by evil desires.

ibani_text: Mịma go, ọmịnị ọmịna ịnyọ la ḅara mịẹsị ọmịna minini ḅụ ibiamịẹnyẹ pa anị ḅụ sua, ibiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ níminyẹ pa anị ḅụ sua.
english_text: For this very reason, make every effort to add to your faith goodness; and to goodness, knowledge;

ibani_text: Ọmịna níminyẹ ḅụ, ḅụ ọlọ pa anị ḅụ sua, ḅụ ọlọ ḅụ ingịrịma pa anị ḅụ sua, ingịrịma ḅụ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaa pa anị ḅụ sua.
english_text: and to knowledge, self-control; and to self-control, perseverance; and to perseverance, godliness;

ibani_text: Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaa ḅụ, ibitẹ́mẹ́ nyáná mịnaapụ pịrịị, ibitẹ́mẹ́ nyáná mịnaapụ pịrị ḅụ ḅẹlẹma pa anị ḅụ sua.
english_text: and to godliness, mutual affection; and to mutual affection, love.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma anịị o binyẹ ọmịna duma bie, ọ ḅọ́rọ́ nyáná bima ọmịna duma bie, anị mịẹbẹm ọ gárágárá pịghị sọọ nyẹ ḅụ sọ, ọmịna níminyẹ Jizọs Krais wámịna Nyánáḅọ ḅụ.
english_text: For if you possess these qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅọ́rọ́ mịnanyẹ ma nyanagha mininiḅọ imi imi, anị dughoarị ḅẹ, anị tumḅọ ma tọ́rụ́ kẹ́lẹ́ pụụm, ine nyẹ arịgha, nḅọ pịghị bieḅárámámam ḅẹ́ nnị n ḅọ sii ḅụ nḅọ sịrị simam.
english_text: But whoever does not have them is nearsighted and blind, forgetting that they have been cleansed from their past sins.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị́yẹ́ ibi mịnaapụ, ọmịnị ibima ḅụ́kọ́rọ́ma árị ḅẹ́, Tamuno pa ọ sị́ sị ma, na pịghị ọ pa ọ sẹ́lẹ́akị sẹ́lẹ́ ma, anị ọ nana fịnị gbámásom. Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọkọ mịẹmịẹ, jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné ọmịnị ọmịna minini pa ọḅụ gbibịgha.
english_text: Therefore, my brothers and sisters,make every effort to confirm your calling and election. For if you do these things, you will never stumble,

ibani_text: Mị ḅara ma, nnị kụrọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ọ pịrịbẹm sị ọmịnị ine wámịna Nyánáḅọ na wámịna Ḅọ́rọ́máḅọ Jizọs Krais gbámásó amadakiri ma sọ.
english_text: and you will receive a rich welcome into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Anịgo a sámámgba mịnanyẹ ma pa o biekórómabẹm, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ ọmịnị ibiḅara pa anị nimim, ọ nyanaḅo maá karakárá ma ḅụ ọ pịghị sẹ kụrọm.
english_text: So I will always remind you of these things, even though you know them and are firmly established in the truth you now have.

ibani_text: A pa dumafịnị sa, anị ḅụ́gbẹm ḅẹ́ a mịnanyẹ ma pa ọmịna biekóróma.
english_text: I think it is right to refresh your memory as long as I live in the tent of this body,

ibani_text: A nimim ḅẹ́ ḅọlọgha sa ḅụ a mị ojumẹnị ma síkórómabẹm, wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais dughofindi i pịrị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: because I know that I will soon put it aside, as our Lord Jesus Christ has made clear to me.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ ịnyọ la ḅara mịẹbẹm si asọ dọghụ ọ ḅara warị mịnanyẹ mamgba pa biekóróma bẹ ḅara sámámgba, a fịị ḅọ́rọ́maa sa.
english_text: And I will make every effort to see that after my departure you will always be able to remember these things.

ibani_text: Wa Krais ma kụ́rọ na ori ḅoo gbolomanyẹ dugho ọ pịrị sa, wa túminị́ gbáa wa pịrị papa lụghụ gba ọ pịrịgha. Wamịnị wámịna tọ́rụ́ pa ori opu ma arịm.
english_text: For we did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told you about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ in power, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

ibani_text: Wamịnị anị ngaa imim Tamuno Daḅọ kuu na ipine pa ọ pịrịarị sa. Pụghọ kóróḅo ọ pịrị sa Sóghóloḅa Ipine ma bie, ḅẹ́, Mịị i Tụwọ, a ḅẹlẹma ḅọ i biekpọma ọ ḅụ ḅẹlẹm.
english_text: He received honor and glory from God the Father when the voice came to him from the Majestic Glory, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.”

ibani_text: Wamịnị wa biri pa mị pụghọ ma naam anị saghị koro sa sobie, wamịnị ọ nana tọ́ntọ́ tụ́ndụ́ ma ọgọnọ imi.
english_text: We ourselves heard this voice that came from heaven when we were with him on the sacred mountain.

ibani_text: Wámịna ḅụ, mịma dugho kụ́rọmamam ikiakoroapụ ma dughonyẹ olomsa biri, anị ibim ḅẹ́ ọ birifama anị pughu tegó anị kánákánábie kọrịarị tọndọ kịkam, kọrịarị nyẹ ákị mú énéḅama, dede ḅálōló baá ma sọ ḅo kọrị ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie sọ.
english_text: We also have the prophetic message as something completely reliable, and you will do well to pay attention to it, as to a light shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ mamgba nẹ́ngị nyẹ, biekóróma ḅẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine nḅọ níminyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ Tọ́ndiri ma bie Tamuno gbẹ́rẹ́ ikiakoro puu findibịgha.
english_text: Above all, you must understand that no prophecy of Scripture came about by the prophet’s own interpretation of things.

ibani_text: Tegó ikiakoro okú ma anị tumḅọ ḅara saghị ḅogha, kụ́ma Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anịị túminị́ dighi si n Tamuno pa n pịrị oku ma fịrịmaarị nyẹ.
english_text: For prophecy never had its origin in the human will, but prophets, though human, spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá iruo ikiakoroapụ págháḅom túminị́ ma ogbobie, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị iruo nyẹ́dieapụ so págháḅo bẹ ḅara ọmịna ogboku bie. Nnị ḅọghu ḅara ḅụ kị́nị́ḅáa bẹ na iruo dienyẹ akuo ḅobẹm, n pịghị n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma Nyánáḅọ ma pighibẹm, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ buapághá ḅara ḅụ kị́nị́ḅáa dighiḅọ nna ḅụ pịrị.
english_text: But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the sovereign Lord who bought them—bringing swift destruction on themselves.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ tọghaapụ nna yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị asọ ma nwángịbẹm, n pịghị mịẹarịnyẹ ma gosi, jẹapụ saghị si ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ tụ́manyẹ ma asọ ma gbolomanyẹ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Many will follow their depraved conduct and will bring the way of truth into disrepute.

ibani_text: Nna opu pụghọ gosi, mị iruo nyẹ́dieapụ ma ọ ḅụ sọ́nyẹ mịẹbẹm n gba ọ pịrịbẹ ofori ofori lụghụ gosi. Ḅọlọmaa sa ḅụ, nna ḅẹ́rẹ́pẹ́lẹ́ tẹ́lẹ́ma wárịmam, n ḅa bẹḅọ ma so tọ́rụ́ findi fịnịarị.
english_text: In their greed these teachers will exploit you with fabricated stories. Their condemnation has long been hanging over them, and their destruction has not been sleeping.

ibani_text: Siinyẹ mịẹ sookumuapụ ma Tamuno nnị warisogha, ori nnị pa ẹ́kpẹ́duaama fịrịmam, ịkóli suanyẹ na n ḅara na pa kánákáná póghóló kiribie gbii ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ éné ma kúruarị.
english_text: For if God did not spare angels when they sinned, but sent them to hell,putting them in chains of darknessto be held for judgment;

ibani_text: Tamuno olom tuminikiri ma warisogha kụ́ma opu mingi akuoo pa Tamuno nimigha tuminikiribieapụ ma famam, ọ ḅọ́rọ́maapụ ngéré anịị Nuwa karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ oku dugho wásáma ḅọ na jẹ́ sọ́nọ́maapụ.
english_text: if he did not spare the ancient world when he brought the flood on its ungodly people, but protected Noah, a preacher of righteousness, and seven others;

ibani_text: Tamuno Sodom na Gomora gulugulumam, sị fịnị pa n dọ́ghụ́ma, mịma anịị pa ilíghíma sua Tamuno nímighaapụ ḅụ pághá bẹnyẹ.
english_text: if he condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah by burning them to ashes, and made them an example of what is going to happen to the ungodly;

ibani_text: Ọ Lọti duaḅọ́rọ́mam ibi tumḅọ, túminị́ ma sẹfị duma na ólóghó warịgha duma ḅụḅáláḅálá pa pị́rị́máaḅọ.
english_text: and if he rescued Lot, a righteous man, who was distressed by the depraved conduct of the lawless

ibani_text: Anị ibi tumḅọ ma nnị na ngam éné ḅụ akị mú jẹ́ éné la, ọ pịghị tọ́rụ́siarị na ákụ daam, ori árị sị pịghị náa si n mịẹarị mịná siiamịẹnyẹ ma.
english_text: (for that righteous man, living among them day after day, was tormented in his righteous soul by the lawless deeds he saw and heard)—

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ mamgba diearị ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma so nimim ọ Tamuno dighi ḅáláfaapụ ma duaḅọ́rọ́maarị ḅara nna daádighi ḅụ, sị pịghị sii túminị́ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ kóróma ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ éné la.
english_text: if this is so, then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trials and to hold the unrighteous for punishment on the day of judgment.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ anị ịlọ́lị si ojumẹnị tarị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịẹarịapụ si Tamuno kụrọ pa nyẹ́sịghaa. Mị iruo nyẹ́dieapụ ma nnị kụrọ tọ́rụ́ nyánam, pịghị kị́nị́ osigha opuamịẹnyẹ nyáná nnị pịghị ḅáláfagha sị sobie opu sịbịdaapụ ma dughosima.
english_text: This is especially true of those who follow the corrupt desire of the fleshand despise authority. Bold and arrogant, they are not afraid to heap abuse on celestial beings;

ibani_text: Sookumuapụ so ịnyọ nyánáḅáa pịghị kụrọḅáa mị iruo nyẹ́dieapụ ma nẹ́ngịapụ wirinumo pa mịná opu sịbịdaapụ ma wirigha Tamuno ma tórúku.
english_text: yet even angels, although they are stronger and more powerful, do not heap abuse on such beings when bringing judgment on them fromthe Lord.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma, mịná nyẹ́dieapụ ma fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ pirinama, kóróma nyánágháapụ. Nnị n yiim ḅẹ́ nnị nku si n ḅáa. Nnị wirinumo pa nnị akanyaḅogha nyẹ wirim. Nnị pirinama ḅáa ḅara pa n ḅáabẹm.
english_text: But these people blaspheme in matters they do not understand. They are like unreasoning animals, creatures of instinct, born only to be caught and destroyed, and like animals they too will perish.

ibani_text: Nnị dighiḅọ tọ́rụ́siarị ma pịghị tọ́rụ́siarị pa n gbẹ́bẹm. Nna ḅụ, tuminikiri tọ́rụ́ ḅẹlẹ anịị nna ojumẹnị tarị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa anị pịrị kị́nị́mamgba tórúku n ḅara sụụma ọ nana nyẹ́fịarị sa n ḅụ́gịrịrị na kpọti dighiḅọ ọ pịrịm. Sámámgba nnị oḅori pa kị́nị́ si asọ n ḅụ ḅẹlẹarị.
english_text: They will be paid back with harm for the harm they have done. Their idea of pleasure is to carouse in broad daylight. They are blots and blemishes, reveling in their pleasures while they feast with you.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ́rụ́ḅọ árị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị ánáná gboloma dọ́ghụm, nna siiamịẹnyẹ pụghọ ma jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné bibịẹgha, nnị ine ḅụ ọlọghaapụ daa mú diabie suaarị, nnị nna tẹ́mẹ́bie nnị n diemam ḅẹ́ nnị opu tọ́rụ́ nyánam. Tamuno si fị́lā nna sịbị ọgọnọ imim.
english_text: With eyes full of adultery, they never stop sinning; they seduce the unstable; they are experts in greed—an accursed brood!

ibani_text: Nnị gbụ́nụ́nụ́ asọ ma warisomam si asọ ịrị. Nnị Balaam, Beza tụwọ asọ duamam, irima nyẹ ḅụ ọnyanaḅobe igbii ḅẹlẹma ḅo.
english_text: They have left the straight way and wandered off to follow the way of Balaam son of Bezer,who loved the wages of wickedness.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori ikúnyẹ dighidighi ásụ igani ọ pịrịm ori siiamịẹnyẹ gosi. Anị tumḅọ pụghọ pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọ pịrịm si ọ daa sẹ́ma ori oḅori amịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: But he was rebuked for his wrongdoing by a donkey—an animal without speech—who spoke with a human voice and restrained the prophet’s madness.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma fịnị ḅára sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mingi anị bie ófórigha siḅe, n pịghị fịnịm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ irisé ofuro sịarị oḅuto. Tamuno yọ tẹ́lẹ́ma n pịrịmam póghólóḅa kánákánábie.
english_text: These people are springs without water and mists driven by a storm. Blackest darkness is reserved for them.

ibani_text: Nnị bịpịkpọ na oḅori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ kọọm, pịghị ojumẹnị tarịarị siinyẹ ma pa diatughu irima asọ ma bie fịnịapụ ogbobie págháḅoarịapụ pịrị.
english_text: For they mouth empty, boastful words and, by appealing to the lustful desires of the flesh, they entice people who are just escaping from those who live in error.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅara na ḅụ nyáná mini mịná túminị́ ma pịrịm, kụ́ma nnị omoni so kị́nị́ḅáa duma pịrịm. Ine tumḅọ sọ́ḅányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị ḅo omoni sọ anị nyẹ ma pịrịm.
english_text: They promise them freedom, while they themselves are slaves of depravity—for “people are slaves to whatever has mastered them.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Jizọs Krais nimi ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, túminị́ pịonị pághámam tuminikiri kị́nị́ pilemaarị nyẹ ma ḅárabie, mịná kụ́rọ ma sima n kuu pịghị n sọ́ḅa sọ́ḅa, anịapụ ma fịnị ḅára kunema siḅaá, nna fịnị ḅára nẹ́ngịbẹm parị sa.
english_text: If they have escaped the corruption of the world by knowing our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and are again entangled in it and are overcome, they are worse off at the end than they were at the beginning.

ibani_text: Anị opuma ibiḅaabẹm, n ḅọ́rọ́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ asọ ma nimigha, sị ḅo nimifama sa, warị ḅo n pa n pịrị tọ́ntọ́ ólóghó ma ḅụ pịghịị.
english_text: It would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than to have known it and then to turn their backs on the sacred command that was passed on to them.

ibani_text: Nna ḅụ pághányẹ dughoarị ḅẹ́ kaḅụ ma karakárányẹ: Obiri pịghị mú anị ọsụnyẹ ma fịarị, pịghị jẹ́, Nnị sịrị fiafiama oporopo mú pịghị mú mgbẹpẹ́lẹ́arị átụ́ma bie.
english_text: Of them the proverbs are true: “A dog returns to its vomit,”and, “A sow that is washed returns to her wallowing in the mud.”

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, mị mị́sa a gịẹ ọ fịrịma ma mmẹẹ́ kárámá ábálálá. Mịná mmẹẹ́ ábálálá ma ḅụ, a ḅụ́kọ́rọ́mamam si fíafía kóróma timi saghịma ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́bie, a mịnanyẹ ma pa ọmịna biekórómáarị ḅara.
english_text: Dear friends, this is now my second letter to you. I have written both of them as reminders to stimulate you to wholesome thinking.

ibani_text: A biim ḅẹ́ Ḅọlọmaa sáá tọ́ntọ́ ikiakoroapụ ma kọọ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ọ pa biekóróma, na pịghị wámịna Nyánáḅọ na Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ pa wa pịrị ólóghó ọmịna nfịrịmaapụ ma ḅara ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: I want you to recall the words spoken in the past by the holy prophets and the command given by our Lord and Savior through your apostles.
