ibani_text: Parị nyẹ, a bim ọ kanyaḅo ḅẹ́ kunema sa ma ḅụ, jẹ́apụ págháḅobẹm nna duma bie n dighi nwangịarịnyẹ anịị nna ojumẹnị tárịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ n pịghị ọ kombobẹm.
english_text: Above all, you must understand that in the last days scoffers will come, scoffing and following their own evil desires.

ibani_text: Warị pịghị gbíla, Jizọs kọkọ minini ḅẹ́ ọ ḅobẹm, ọ mininigha? Ọ tẹ́ angaá imi, wámịna tádọ́apụ fịị famamam, nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa anị fịnị ḅára fịnịm saghị n tuminikiri tẹ́mẹ́ sa éné éné.
english_text: They will say, “Where is this ‘coming’ he promised? Ever since our ancestors died, everything goes on as it has since the beginning of creation.”

ibani_text: Nnị nimitẹ́lẹ́mam sị dighi tọ́rụ́ sị ḅẹ́ ḅọlọmaa sáá Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọm so na kiri na warị tẹmẹm. Tamuno tuminikiri ma tẹ́mẹ́ pághámaḅom mingi bie pịghị mingi pa.
english_text: But they deliberately forget that long ago by God’s word the heavens came into being and the earth was formed out of water and by water.

ibani_text: Ọ pịghị mingi, anịị opu mingi, pa olom tuminikiri ma famam.
english_text: By these waters also the world of that time was deluged and destroyed.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mị́sa fịnị so ma na kiri ma, gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma anịị nnị pa anị ọlọ warị anị dọ́ghụ́ma bẹ fịnị pịrịnyẹ. Nnị nnị pa ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ éné ma kuruarị, nnị Tamuno nímighaapụ ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ si pịghị n guluguluma.
english_text: By the same word the present heavens and earth are reserved for fire, being kept for the day of judgment and destruction of the ungodly.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ị́yẹ́, ibi nangwọapụ, ọ mịị gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ pa bieḅárámá ma: ḅẹ Tamuno tórúku gbẹ́rẹ́ éné sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ andẹẹ́ oyia si findi, kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ éné.
english_text: But do not forget this one thing, dear friends: With the Lord a day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like a day.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma o sa ngumabịgha o minini nyẹ mịẹ, jẹ́apụ si ḅara. Tụ́ma ori ngịrịma nyáná ọ pịrịm, dọghụgha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ papa fịịfaa, o bim ḅẹ́ kị́nị́mamgba nna sii ḅụ pịghịị.
english_text: The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. Instead he is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma pịghịma ḅoo bẹ éné ḅobẹm fúrúḅọ ḅara ma. Anị éné ma ḅụ, so ma ẹmẹẹ́fábẹm, sobie fịnị a nyẹ ma kọrịfịnị ḅụ dọghụfámabẹm, tuminikiri ma na anị bie fịnịnyẹ mamgba paghaḅụ pa fịnịbẹm.
english_text: But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. The heavens will disappear with a roar; the elements will be destroyed by fire, and the earth and everything done in it will be laid bare.

ibani_text: Mịnanyẹ ma mị ḅara pa gulugulufama bẹ ḅara ma, ọmịnị anịị tọ́rọ fịnị túminị́ ḅara? Ọ tọ́ntọ́ duma kọọ, pịghị ọmịna ḅụ saghị Tamuno ḅárásua,
english_text: Since everything will be destroyed in this way, what kind of people ought you to be? You ought to live holy and godly lives

ibani_text: ọ pa Tamuno ene ma kúruarị sa, ọ mịẹnyẹ mịẹsị anị álála ḅoo. Anị éné ma, sotọrụ ma dọghụbẹm fịnịbie pịghị guluguluma, sotọrụ fịnịnyẹ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịnị ọwụ ma anị sanimabẹm.
english_text: as you look forward to the day of God and speed its coming.That day will bring about the destruction of the heavens by fire, and the elements will melt in the heat.

ibani_text: Kuma wa Tamuno minini nyẹ ma kurum, ịwọ so ma na ịwọ tuminikiri ma, karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ taa bẹ angaá.
english_text: But in keeping with his promise we are looking forward to a new heaven and a new earth, where righteousness dwells.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, ọmịnị anị éné ma kúruarị sáá, ọmịnị ọmịna ịnyọ láa ḅara mịẹsị ọmịna ḅụ mịẹ kpainma warị, bịpị ḅụ laagha pa Tamuno tórúku, pịghị ọ nana diin ḅụ fịnị.
english_text: So then, dear friends, since you are looking forward to this, make every effort to be found spotless, blameless and at peace with him.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ingịrịma ma ákị, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ o findi ị pịrị ḅụ́pọ́ ọ pa ḅọ́rọ́ dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyáná, wámịna ibi mị́naḅọ Pọl, Tamuno pa ọ pịrị níminyẹ pa ábálálá gịẹ ọ fịrịma ḅara.
english_text: Bear in mind that our Lord’s patience means salvation, just as our dear brother Paul also wrote you with the wisdom that God gave him.

ibani_text: Pọl mịị ḅara ma pa gịẹ gịẹm ọrẹ ábálálá mamgba ḅụ, mịnanyẹ ma gbólómanyẹ ḅụ. Jẹa nyẹ imi ọrẹ a diri ḅụ, ḅụdáa nyẹ akanyaḅo ḅụ, ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ nímighaapụ na pịghị kụrọ sẹghaapụ Krais gboloma dienyẹ, irima ḅara pa mịnanyẹ ma daa dughoarị, n Tọ́ndiri ma bie jẹa nyẹ na mịẹarị ḅara, mịị ḅara ma n guluguluma dighiḅọ nna ḅụ pịrịarị.
english_text: He writes the same way in all his letters, speaking in them of these matters. His letters contain some things that are hard to understand, which ignorant and unstable people distort, as they do the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ibi nángwọ́apụ ọ tarị mịma nimimáa sáá, ọmịnị ọ tọ́rụ́ findi si ólóghó kokoghaapụ ma ọ daa irimagha, si o sóórókoro ọ sẹ ibi ngaa ḅụ.
english_text: Therefore, dear friends, since you have been forewarned, be on your guard so that you may not be carried away by the error of the lawless and fall from your secure position.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọ pa senị́ị́ Wányánáḅọ na wámịna Ḅọ́rọ́maḅọ Jizọs Krais tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na ori níminyẹ ḅụ. Ipine fịnị ọ pịrị mị́sa akị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá la. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and forever! Amen.

ibani_text: Súghú saghị sa fịnịnyẹ ma, wa pịghị namaa nyẹ ma, wa pịghị wamịna tọ́rụ́ pa arịmáa nyẹ ma, wa tọ́rụ́ pa dighim pịghị ḅara pa anị lama, mịma anịị duma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma wa gịẹ pa ọ fịrịma nyẹ.
english_text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked at and our hands have touched—this we proclaim concerning the Word of life.

ibani_text: Mịị duma ma anị ḅụ die sa, wamịnị anị arịm pịghị anị gbolomanyẹ dughom, pịghị Daḅọ ma na fịnị duma gbámásó gbolomanyẹ dugho ọ pịrị, mịma anịị n pịghị mịẹsị wa níminyẹ.
english_text: The life appeared; we have seen it and testify to it, and we proclaim to you the eternal life, which was with the Father and has appeared to us.

ibani_text: Wamịnị árị pịghị namaa nyẹ ma anị wa pịghị dugho págháma ọ pịrịnyẹ, ọmịnị wamịnị na miẹgbolomáa nyáná bẹ ḅara, mị miẹgbolomáa ma, wa Daḅọ ma na anị nyanam na pịghị ọ Tụwọ Jizọs Krais.
english_text: We proclaim to you what we have seen and heard, so that you also may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Wa mịma gịẹárị wámịna bieḅẹlẹ bii bẹ ḅara.
english_text: We write this to make ourjoy complete.

ibani_text: Mị́sa wamịnị ọ Tụ́wọ bịpị náa sị dugho págháma ọ pịrị oku ma mịị anị: ḅẹ́ Tamuno anịị baá ma, ọ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ kánákáná sọ ofori.
english_text: This is the message we have heard from him and declare to you: God is light; in him there is no darkness at all.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wa ḅẹ́ wa ọ nana miẹgbolomáa nyánam, kụ́ma pa kánákánábie ngaa, epele anị wa tiarị nyẹ, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ pụghọ ḅụ na pịghị fịrị ḅara ḅụ.
english_text: If we claim to have fellowship with him and yet walk in the darkness, we lie and do not live out the truth.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma wa ḅọ́rọ́ baá ma bie asọ nwángị, ori ma sọ baá ma bie fịnị ḅara, anịsáa wa jụghọ jụghọ na mịẹgbólóma nyánam, ọ Tụwọ Jizọs Krais ọmbịnyẹ́ sii gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ wa sịrịsịarị.
english_text: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from allsin.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wa ḅẹ́ sii wámịna ḅụ ofori, wamịnị oḅori pa wa ḅụ sịarị, karakáráma sọ wámịna bie ofori.
english_text: If we claim to be without sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna sii kịẹ Tamuno pịrị, ori ọrẹ minini nyẹ warịbẹm, pịghị karakárányẹ ma mịẹ, ọ wámịna sii ḅụ ḅárási wa pịrịbẹm pịghị wa sịrị fiafiama wámịna irima fịrị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wa ḅẹ́, na wa siinyẹ mịẹgha, wamịnị epeletiḅọ pa Tamuno sịarị, ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma sọ wámịna bie ofori.
english_text: If we claim we have not sinned, we make him out to be a liar and his word is not in us.

ibani_text: A mịị diri ma gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, ị́yẹ́ awọ, o siinyẹ mịẹbịgha ḅara, kụ́ma siinyẹ mịẹḅọ fịnịfịnị wa sẹ sị Daḅọ tẹ́ghẹ̄arị ḅọ nyanam wámịna sịbị ọgọnọ, ori anịị Jizọs Krais karakáráḅọ ma.
english_text: My dear children, I write this to you so that you will not sin. But if anybody does sin, we have an advocate with the Father—Jesus Christ, the Righteous One.

ibani_text: Krais, ọḅụ anị wa ḅọ́rọ́ sị siiḅụḅarasipịrị nyánáarị nyẹ, wámịna sii ngéréghaa, kụ́ma tuminikiri gbọrụ sii.
english_text: He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only for ours but also for the sins of the whole world.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ologho ma koko, wa biekụ́rọ nyánábẹm ḅẹ́ wamịnị o nimim.
english_text: We know that we have come to know him if we keep his commands.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ ḅẹ́ wa o nimim, kụ́ma wa ọrị ologho ma kokogha, wamịnị epeletiapụ, karakárá ma sọ wámịna biebẹ ofori.
english_text: Whoever says, “I know him,” but does not do what he commands is a liar, and the truth is not in that person.

ibani_text: Ori ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ mịẹ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, n ḅọ ḅụ anịị wa nyáná Tamuno pịrị ḅẹlẹma ma káara nyẹ. Wa pa nimi bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́ wa Tamuno na bịpị ogbo sua nyanam anịị:
english_text: But if anyone obeys his word, love for Godis truly made complete in them. This is how we know we are in him:

ibani_text: Bẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ n ḅọ Tamuno na bịpị pa ogbo sua nyanam, duma kọọ Jizọs Krais duma kọọ ḅara.
english_text: Whoever claims to live in him must live as Jesus did.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, a ịwọ ólóghó gịẹ ọ fịrịmagha, kụ́ma sughu saghị sa éné éné ọ namaa olom ólóghó ma. Mịị olom ólóghó ma anịị ọ namaa oku ma.
english_text: Dear friends, I am not writing you a new command but an old one, which you have had since the beginning. This old command is the message you have heard.

ibani_text: Anịsọ a pa jẹ́ ịwọ ólóghó gịẹ ọ pịrịarị; anị karakárá nnị anị arịm Krais ḅụ na pịghị ọmịna ḅụ, tegó kánákáná ma kááfaarị, karakárá baá ma saghị biamam.
english_text: Yet I am writing you a new command; its truth is seen in him and in you, because the darkness is passing and the true light is already shining.

ibani_text: Dughoapụ ḅẹ́ n baá bie imi, anịsọ pa nna mị́naḅọ na tarịgha ḅụ fịnị, pa kánákánábie imi ḅo mị́sa ma laam.
english_text: Anyone who claims to be in the light but hates a brother or sisteris still in the darkness.

ibani_text: Amịna mị́naḅọ ḅẹlẹma ḅọ baá ma bie ngaam, anịgo gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ anị tumḅọ ma ḅụ ofori mịẹbẹnyẹ si n ḅọ siinyẹ mịẹ.
english_text: Anyone who loves their brother and sisterlives in the light, and there is nothing in them to make them stumble.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma amịna mị́naḅọ tarịghaḅọ fịnịfịnị n ḅọ kánákáná ma bie imii, pịghị kánákáná ma bie nwángị ikelekelearị, n ḅo nimigha n ḅọ muarị angaá, tegó kánákáná ma n ḅọ tọ́rụ́pụ́mamam.
english_text: But anyone who hates a brother or sister is in the darkness and walks around in the darkness. They do not know where they are going, because the darkness has blinded them.

ibani_text: A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, tegó nnị ọmịna sii ḅụ ḅárási ọ pịrịmam Krais sịbị gosi.
english_text: I am writing to you, dear children, because your sins have been forgiven on account of his name.

ibani_text: A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, daapụ, tegó ọmịnị súghú saghị sa éné éné ḅọ ma nimimam. A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, ásáawọ, tegó ọmịnị siiḅọ ma sọḅamam. A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, tegó ọ Daḅọ ma nimimam.
english_text: I am writing to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one.

ibani_text: A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, daapụ, tegó ọmịnị súghú saghị sa éné éné ḅọ ma nimimam. A gịẹ ọ fịrịmaarị, ásáawọ, tegó ọ kụrọm, Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma pịghị ọmịna bie imim, ọ pịghị siḅọ ma sọḅamam.
english_text: I write to you, dear children, because you know the Father. I write to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I write to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God lives in you, and you have overcome the evil one.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ma ḅẹlẹma ma, anịgha tuminikiri ma bie fịnịnyẹ, tuminikiri ma ḅẹlẹma ḅọ fịnịfịnị Daḅọ ma ḅẹlẹma n ḅọ ḅụbie ofori.
english_text: Do not love the world or anything in the world. If anyone loves the world, love for the Fatheris not in them.

ibani_text: Tegó tuminikiri ma bie fịnịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ siiḅọ tarịarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, tọ́rụ́ ma tarịarịnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, túminị́ mịị tuminikiri nyáná sị pa bịpịkpọarị nyẹ na n mịẹarịnyẹ mamgba, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ Daḅọ ma ḅara saghị ḅogha, kụ́ma tuminikiri ma bie.
english_text: For everything in the world—the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life—comes not from the Father but from the world.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ma na anị bie fịnị sị túminị́ tarịarịnyẹ ma, káaḅọ́rọ́arị; kụ́ma Tamuno ma tọ́nyẹ mịẹapụ duma gbámásóbẹm.
english_text: The world and its desires pass away, but whoever does the will of God lives forever.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ awọ, kunema ma kikiamam; n koko dugho ọ pịrị ḅẹ́ Krais iruonaḅọ ma ḅobẹm; mị́sa tọgha Krais iruonaapụ págháḅomam, anị wa ḅọ́rọ́ pịghị nimi angaá ḅẹ́ kunema ma kikiamam.
english_text: Dear children, this is the last hour; and as you have heard that the antichrist is coming, even now many antichrists have come. This is how we know it is the last hour.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma wámịna mịẹgbólóma kubiri ogboapugha, anị n go wa wáriso nyẹ; ḅọ́rọ́ nnị wámịna mịẹ gbolomaa kubiri ogboapụ, nnị wamịnị na fịnị dọghụbẹm. Kụ́ma nnị sọm kị́nị́mamgba árị bẹ ḅara ḅẹ́ karakáráma nnị wámịna ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́apụgha.
english_text: They went out from us, but they did not really belong to us. For if they had belonged to us, they would have remained with us; but their going showed that none of them belonged to us.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma Krais ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pa ọ sịbị saramam, anị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọmịnị mamgba karakáráma nimim.
english_text: But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and all of you know the truth.

ibani_text: A mị diri ma gịẹ ọ pịrịarị ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ ọ karakáráma nimigha; kụ́ma ọmịnị anị nimim go, ọ pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ epele karakáráma ḅụ saghị ḅobịgha.
english_text: I do not write to you because you do not know the truth, but because you do know it and because no lie comes from the truth.

ibani_text: Tụọ mị́sa iruonyẹ dughoḅọ? Anịị dughoḅọ ma ḅẹ́ Jizọs ori Duaḅọ́rọ́maḅọgha. Anị tumḅọ ma anịị Krais iruonaḅọ ma ori Daḅọ ma na Tụwọ ma na pighim.
english_text: Who is the liar? It is whoever denies that Jesus is the Christ. Such a person is the antichrist—denying the Father and the Son.

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma sịghịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Daḅọ ma sọ sịghịm; Tụwọ ma daakịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Daḅọ ma nyánam.
english_text: No one who denies the Son has the Father; whoever acknowledges the Son has the Father also.

ibani_text: Árị ḅẹ́, ị pa tẹ́mẹ́bie suam parị sa ma ḅụ i náa oku ma, ị ḅọ́rọ́ anị oku ma pa ị tẹ́mẹ́bie warị warịị, anịsa i Tụwọ ma na Daḅọ ma na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ fịnịbẹm.
english_text: As for you, see that what you have heard from the beginning remains in you. If it does, you also will remain in the Son and in the Father.

ibani_text: Mịma anị Krais minininyẹ ḅẹ́ ọ pa wa pịrịbẹm duma gbámásó.
english_text: And this is what he promised us—eternal life.

ibani_text: A mịị diri ma gịẹ ọ pịrịarị, oḅori pa ọ si dọghụapụ ma go.
english_text: I am writing these things to you about those who are trying to lead you astray.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị, Krais ori Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa ọmịna ḅụ saramam. Ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ ọ nana fịnị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ o biigha gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so nyẹ pa o die. Ọ Tẹ́mẹ́ nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa o diebẹm, ọ pa ọ dienyẹ ma karakárányẹ, iruonyẹ anị bie ofori, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dienyẹ bịpị pughu, anịsa i Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ fịnịbẹm.
english_text: As for you, the anointing you received from him remains in you, and you do not need anyone to teach you. But as his anointing teaches you about all things and as that anointing is real, not counterfeit—just as it has taught you, remain in him.

ibani_text: Pịghị mị́sa, ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, ọmịnị ọ nana gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ fịnị, si ori ọ ḅụ diepágháma bẹ sa, wa tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánábẹm si téghelébịgha ḅara sị mú ḅọghu ori ḅo ma ḅụ.
english_text: And now, dear children, continue in him, so that when he appears we may be confident and unashamed before him at his coming.

ibani_text: O nimim ḅẹ́ Krais ori karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹḅọ, o nimibẹm anịsa ḅẹ́, karakárányẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị Tamuno tụwọ.
english_text: If you know that he is righteous, you know that everyone who does what is right has been born of him.

ibani_text: Dighii Daḅọ ma wa ḅẹlẹma láa ḅara! Ori ḅẹlẹma opuma dụḅam sị túminị́ wa sịarị Tamuno awọ wamịnị ma anị karakáráma Tamuno ma awọ! Tuminikiri ma wa nimigha nnị Tamuno ma nimigha gosi.
english_text: See what great love the Father has lavished on us, that we should be called children of God! And that is what we are! The reason the world does not know us is that it did not know him.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, mị́sa wamịnị Tamuno awọ, kụ́ma túminị́ na nimigha wa kịka bẹnyẹ, kụ́ma wa nimim ḅẹ́ Krais ọ ḅụ die sa, wamịnị ọ fịnị ḅara fịnịbẹm, tegó wamịnị ori árịbẹm ọ fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Dear friends, now we are children of God, and what we will be has not yet been made known. But we know that when Christ appears,we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is.

ibani_text: Mịị tọ́rụ́ dighinyẹ ma nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Krais ḅụ amịna ḅụ pa fiafiama wárị wárim, Krais so fíafía fịnị ḅara.
english_text: All who have this hope in him purify themselves, just as he is pure.

ibani_text: Siinyẹ mịẹḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno ólóghó korom tegó siiamịẹnyẹ anịị Tamuno ólóghó bịpị kokogha.
english_text: Everyone who sins breaks the law; in fact, sin is lawlessness.

ibani_text: O nimim ḅẹ́ Krais ḅom sị ọ sii dighi si bẹ ḅara, kụ́ma ọ ḅụ sii ofori.
english_text: But you know that he appeared so that he might take away our sins. And in him is no sin.

ibani_text: Krais na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ fịnịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sámámgba ḅụ siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹmịẹgha kụ́ma sámámgba siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na Krais arịgha anịgha Krais ma nimi.
english_text: No one who lives in him keeps on sinning. No one who continues to sin has either seen him or known him.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, o minima si gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ oḅori pa ọ sị, karakárányẹ ma mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ tumḅọ, Krais ma sọ karakárá fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Dear children, do not let anyone lead you astray. The one who does what is right is righteous, just as he is righteous.

ibani_text: Sámámgba ḅụ fịnị sị siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịnị ẹ́kpẹ́dua pịrịm, tegó ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma Sughu saghị sa éné éné siinyẹ mịẹarị. Mịma go anịị Tamuno Tụwọ ma go ḅo nyẹ sị ori ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma fịrị mamgba sima bẹ ḅara.
english_text: The one who does what is sinful is of the devil, because the devil has been sinning from the beginning. The reason the Son of God appeared was to destroy the devil’s work.

ibani_text: Tamuno tụ́wọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sámámgba siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹmịẹgha, tegó Tamuno ma fị́nị́ ḅára nna ḅụbie imi, Tamuno ma pịghị nna Daa gosi, nnị ine sámámgba ḅụ siinyẹ mịẹbịgha.
english_text: No one who is born of God will continue to sin, because God’s seed remains in them; they cannot go on sinning, because they have been born of God.

ibani_text: Mịị wa ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno awọ na ẹ́kpẹ́dua awọ nimi bẹ ḅara: karakárányẹ ma mịẹghaapụ anịgha jẹ́apụ ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaapụ, nnị Tamuno awọgha.
english_text: This is how we know who the children of God are and who the children of the devil are: Anyone who does not do what is right is not God’s child, nor is anyone who does not love their brother and sister.

ibani_text: Mịị Sughu saghị sa éné éné wa náa oku ma ḅẹ́, wa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: For this is the message you heard from the beginning: We should love one another.

ibani_text: Wa Keni fịnị ḅára fịnịbịgha; ori sii tumḅọ ma nyẹẹ, ori o numboru Ebẹl fomḅam. O tegó o fomḅáa? Tegó ori amịẹnyẹ karakáragha gosi kụ́ma o numboru owitụ́wọ mịẹnyẹ karakáram.
english_text: Do not be like Cain, who belonged to the evil one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his own actions were evil and his brother’s were righteous.

ibani_text: Anịgo anị ọ́ tọ́rụ́ nẹ́ngimama, ịyẹa mịnaapụ ḅọ́rọ́ tuminikiriapụ ma ọ tarịgha.
english_text: Do not be surprised, my brothers and sisters,if the world hates you.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ wa fịị ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ mú duma bie sọmam; wa mịma nimim tegó wa mịnaapụ ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mam. Amịna mị́naḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ fịị kụ́rọ ma sughubie imii.
english_text: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love each other. Anyone who does not love remains in death.

ibani_text: Amịna mị́naḅọ tarịghaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịḅọ ma kị́nị́ ḅá ḅáḅọ, ọ pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ kị́nị́ ḅá ḅáḅọ duma gbámásó nyanagha nḅọ duma bie.
english_text: Anyone who hates a brother or sister is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life residing in him.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anịị wa ḅẹlẹma pa sị nyẹ nimibẹnyẹ: ḅẹ́ Krais ori duma pa igwagwaá wa pịrịm, wamịnị so wámịna duma pa igwagwaá mịnaapụ ma pịrị.
english_text: This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ngọ ma nyánáḅọ fịnịfịnị si nyẹ́ pálịma mị́naḅọ árị, kụ́ma mịnị dighi ḅụ́jịrịrị nyáná ọ pịrịgha, ine dughobịgha ḅẹ́ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma n ḅọ ḅụ imi.
english_text: If anyone has material possessions and sees a brother or sister in need but has no pity on them, how can the love of God be in that person?

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, wámịna ḅẹlẹma anị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ na ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅụ kunema ma, kụ́ma wámịna ḅẹlẹma anị ḅụ die mịẹnyẹ ḅụ na pịghị karakárá ḅụ.
english_text: Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma anị wa pa nimiḅo ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹ́ wa karakárá ma bie saghịḅom; mịị wa ḅọ́rọ́ biekpọ nyáná bẹ ḅara Tamuno tórúku.
english_text: This is how we know that we belong to the truth and how we set our hearts at rest in his presence:

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie wa dighi igani igani, wa nimibẹm ḅẹ́ Tamuno wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie nẹngịm, ọ pịghị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nẹngịm.
english_text: If our hearts condemn us, we know that God is greater than our hearts, and he knows everything.

ibani_text: Anịgo ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, ḅọ́rọ́ wámịna tẹ́mẹ́bie wa dighi iganịgha wa biekpọ nyánam Tamuno ma tórúku.
english_text: Dear friends, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence before God

ibani_text: Wa nyanaḅoarị, wamịnị ọ ḅara binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, tegó wamịnị ori ologho kokom pịghị ọḅụ ḅẹ́lẹ́nyẹ mịẹarị.
english_text: and receive from him anything we ask, because we keep his commands and do what pleases him.

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ọ tọ́ọ wa pịrị ólóghó, ḅẹ́ wamịnị ọ tụwọ Jizọs Krais minini, sị jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma, Krais tọ́ọ wa pịrị ḅara ma.
english_text: And this is his command: to believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and to love one another as he commanded us.

ibani_text: Tamuno ólóghó ma kokoarịapụ, nnị na Tamuno na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii, Tamuno pịghị nnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii. Tamuno ma pa wa pịrịmaá Tẹ́mẹ́ gosi wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno wamịnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii.
english_text: The one who keeps God’s commands lives in him, and he in them. And this is how we know that he lives in us: We know it by the Spirit he gave us.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, ọ tẹ́mẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ minini ma, kụ́ma tẹ́mẹ́ mamgba daádighi pa nimi ḅọ́rọ́ nnị Tamuno ḅara saghị ḅo, tegó tọgha tọgha epele ikiakoroapụ tuminikiri ma sọmam.
english_text: Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

ibani_text: Mịị anịị ị Tamuno Tẹ́mẹ́ ma lighilighiḅo bẹ ḅara: dugho tẹ́mẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ojumẹnị sua sị tuminikiri ḅomam, anị tẹ́mẹ́ ma Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom.
english_text: This is how you can recognize the Spirit of God: Every spirit that acknowledges that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God,

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mininigha tẹ́mẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ojumẹnị sua tuminikiri ḅomam, anị tẹ́mẹ́ ma Tamuno ḅára saghị ḅo Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyanagha. Nnị ḅọ nyáná tẹ́mẹ́ anịị Krais iruonaḅọ tẹ́mẹ́. Ọ kọkọ náa ḅẹ́ anị ḅobẹm, anị mị́sa tuminikiri imii.
english_text: but every spirit that does not acknowledge Jesus is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist, which you have heard is coming and even now is already in the world.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ, ọ Tamuno ju saghịḅom, ọ pịghị epele ikiakoroapụ ma sọḅamam, tegó ọmịna bie fịnị Tẹ́mẹ́ ma anị kụ́rọ tuminikiri ma bie fịnị túminị́ bie fịnị tẹ́mẹ́ ma nẹngịm.
english_text: You, dear children, are from God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.

ibani_text: Mịị epele ikiakoroapụ ma tuminikiri gboloma ḅẹ́rẹ anịị n dughoarị nyẹ, tuminikiriapụ ma warị pịghị nnị pughu, tegó nnị anịị tuminikiri bẹapụ.
english_text: They are from the world and therefore speak from the viewpoint of the world, and the world listens to them.

ibani_text: Wamịnị Tamuno ju saghịḅom, Tamuno nimiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ wa pughu pughum, Tamuno ju saghị ḅoghaapụ wa púghú pughugha. Mịị ḅara ma anịị wa karakárá ma Tẹ́mẹ́ lighilighi ḅoarị ḅara epeleti tẹ́mẹ́ ḅụ.
english_text: We are from God, and whoever knows God listens to us; but whoever is not from God does not listen to us. This is how we recognize the Spiritof truth and the spirit of falsehood.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, o ḅo wa jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma, tegó ḅẹlẹma Tamuno ḅara saghịḅom. Kị́nị́ ḅẹ́lẹ́maarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị Tamuno Tụwọ ma pịghị Tamuno ma nimim.
english_text: Dear friends, let us love one another, for love comes from God. Everyone who loves has been born of God and knows God.

ibani_text: Ḅẹlẹma ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno nimigha, tegó Tamuno ori anịị ḅẹlẹma.
english_text: Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love.

ibani_text: Tamuno ọrẹ ḅẹlẹma diepágháma wa pịrịm, ori ọrẹ kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tụwọ pa tuminikiri ma fịrịmam sị wamịnị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ duma nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị ḅẹlẹma sẹ́pịrịnyẹ: ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ wa Tamuno ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mamam, kụ́ma ori wa ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, warị ọ Tụwọ fịrịma sị ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ wa siiḅụḅarasi nyáná bẹ ḅara.
english_text: This is love: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as an atoning sacrifice for our sins.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọapụ, ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno mị ḅara ma pa wa ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, wamịnị sọ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma na ibim.
english_text: Dear friends, since God so loved us, we also ought to love one another.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so na Tamuno arịgha, kụ́ma wa ḅọ́rọ́ jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma, wamịnị na Tamuno na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imi. Ori ḅẹlẹma pịghị anị ḅụ mịẹ kpainmamam wámịna bie.
english_text: No one has ever seen God; but if we love one another, God lives in us and his love is made complete in us.

ibani_text: Wa ibima nimim ḅẹ́ wamịnị ori na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imi, ori sọ pịghị wamịnị na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii, ori ọrẹ Tẹ́mẹ́ pa wa pịrịmam gósi.
english_text: This is how we know that we live in him and he in us: He has given us of his Spirit.

ibani_text: Wa pịghị árịmam, pịghị dugho págháma ḅẹ́ Daḅọ ma ọ Tụwọ fịrịmamam ḅẹ́ o ḅo tuminikiri Dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ sọ.
english_text: And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent his Son to be the Savior of the world.

ibani_text: Dugho págháma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ Jizọs ori anị Tamuno Tụwọ ma, Tamuno na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii, Tamuno ma sọ pịghị nḅọ na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii.
english_text: If anyone acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God, God lives in them and they in God.

ibani_text: Wa nimim pịghị minini Tamuno nyáná wa pịrị ḅẹlẹma. Tamuno ori anị ḅẹlẹma. Ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ngaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ imii, Tamuno sọ nḅọ na gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ ḅụ imim.
english_text: And so we know and rely on the love God has for us. God is love. Whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in them.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅara ma, ḅẹlẹma anị ḅụ mịẹ kpainmamam wámịna bie, wa pịghị ine tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ nyánábẹm ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné ma, tegó mị tuminikiri ma ḅụ, ọ fịnị ḅára anịị wa fịnị ḅara.
english_text: This is how love is made complete among us so that we will have confidence on the day of judgment: In this world we are like Jesus.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfa ofori ḅẹlẹma ḅụ; kụ́ma kpain ḅẹlẹma ḅáláfa kaa sịsịm. Mịma dughoarị ḅẹ́, ḅáláfaarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹlẹma na anị ḅụ mịẹ kpainmagha n ḅọ duma bie, tegó ḅáláfa fomḅara ḅụ saghịḅom.
english_text: There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. The one who fears is not made perfect in love.

ibani_text: Wa ḅẹlẹma nyanam tegó Tamuno parị wa ḅẹ́lẹ́mam.
english_text: We love because he first loved us.

ibani_text: Bẹḅọ fịnịfịnị ḅẹẹ, A Tamuno ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, anịsọ n ḅọ mị́naḅọ na tarịgha ḅụ fịnị, anị tumḅọ ma epeletiḅọ. Tegó ine amịna mị́naḅọ, n ḅọ tọ́rụ́ pa árịarịḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́maghaḅọ ine n ḅọ na arịgha Tamuno ma ḅẹ́lẹ́mabịgha.
english_text: Whoever claims to love God yet hates a brother or sister is a liar. For whoever does not love their brother and sister, whom they have seen, cannot love God, whom they have not seen.

ibani_text: Mịị Krais tọ́ọ wa pịrị ólóghó ḅẹ́ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị amịna mị́naḅọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm.
english_text: And he has given us this command: Anyone who loves God must also love their brother and sister.

ibani_text: Mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅẹ́ Jizọs ori anịị n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ, anịḅọ ma anịị Tamuno Tụwọ, Daḅọ ma ḅẹlẹma ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ọ Tụwọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mabẹm.
english_text: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves the father loves his child as well.

ibani_text: Wa ḅọ́rọ́ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma nḅẹḅẹ́ sị ori ólóghó koko, mị ḅara ma wa nimibẹm ḅẹ́ wamịnị Tamuno ma awọ.
english_text: This is how we know that we love the children of God: by loving God and carrying out his commands.

ibani_text: Wámịna Tamuno ḅẹlẹma dughoarị ḅẹ́ wamịnị ori ólóghó ma kokoarị. Ori ólóghó pịghị opuma wámịna ḅụ ikugha,
english_text: In fact, this is love for God: to keep his commands. And his commands are not burdensome,

ibani_text: ḅẹ́ Tamuno tụwọ sọmáaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tuminikiri ma sọḅasọḅam. Wámịna minini anị mịẹsị wamịnị ine tuminikiri ma sọḅaarị nyẹ.
english_text: for everyone born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world, even our faith.

ibani_text: Tụọ ine tuminikiri ma Sọ́ḅa bẹ? Anịị mininiḅọ ngéré ḅẹ́ Jizọs anị Tamuno Tụwọ.
english_text: Who is it that overcomes the world? Only the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God.

ibani_text: Jizọs Krais anịị ori mingi sara mingi ma na ori fịị ọmbịnyẹ́ pa ḅoḅọ. O mingi ḅụ ngéré ḅogha, kụ́ma mingi ma na ọmbịnyẹ́ ma na, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pịghị dugho pághámaarị ḅẹẹ mịma karakárányẹ tegó Tẹ́mẹ́ ma karakáram.
english_text: This is the one who came by water and blood—Jesus Christ. He did not come by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́apụ anị onyẹ́sẹ nyẹ:
english_text: For there are three that testify:

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, mingi ma, na ọmbịnyẹ́ ma na, mịná tẹ́rẹ́ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ dugho págháma nyẹ nyánam.
english_text: theSpirit, the water and the blood; and the three are in agreement.

ibani_text: Wa túminị́ dugho págháma nyẹ mininim, kụ́ma Tamuno dugho págháma nyẹ ma kụrọḅam, tegó mịma anịị Tamuno dugho págháma nyẹ ọ Tụwọ gbolomanyẹ.
english_text: We accept human testimony, but God’s testimony is greater because it is the testimony of God, which he has given about his Son.

ibani_text: Anịgo Tamuno Tụwọ ma ḅụ mininiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịị dugho págháma nyẹ ma nyánam nna tẹ́mẹ́bie, kụ́ma Tamuno mininighaapụ ọ pa epeletiḅọ sọmam, tegó na nnị mininigha Tamuno dughonyẹ ọ Tụwọ ḅụ.
english_text: Whoever believes in the Son of God accepts this testimony. Whoever does not believe God has made him out to be a liar, because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.

ibani_text: Dugho págháma nyẹ ma anịị: ḅẹ́ Tamuno gbámásó duma pa wa pịrịmam, mịị duma ma ọ Tụwọ bie anịị anị pịghị fịnịnyẹ.
english_text: And this is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

ibani_text: Tụwọ ma nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mịị duma ma nyánam; Tamuno Tụwọ ma nyánághaḅọ duma nyanagha.
english_text: Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.

ibani_text: A mịị diri ma gịẹ ọ pịrịarị, ọ mịnị Tamuno Tụwọ ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ mininiapụ ḅẹ́, ọ nimi bẹ ḅará ḅẹ́ ọ gbámásó duma nyánam.
english_text: I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God so that you may know that you have eternal life.

ibani_text: Mịị wa nyáná tẹ́mẹ́kụ́rọ wamịnị Tamuno fịnị ngaa ḅoarị sa ḅẹ́, ọ tọ́ọ kọ́rọ́ma sị wa binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ pa wa pịrịbẹm.
english_text: This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.

ibani_text: Ọ wa náa nam wamịnị ọ ḅara nyẹ bi sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, wa pịghị nimiḅara ma ḅẹ́ mịma karakárányẹ, wa pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ wa binyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ọ pa wa pịrịpịrịm.
english_text: And if we know that he hears us—whatever we ask—we know that we have what we asked of him.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ amịna mị́naḅọ árị, siinyẹ mịẹ, kụ́ma mị siinyẹ ma fịị dighiḅogha, anị ibim ị Tamuno tẹ́ghẹ̄ n ḅọ pịrị, ine duma pa nḅọ pịrịbẹḅọ. Mịma gbolomaapụ anịị nna sii n dighi mú fịị bie suughaapụ kụ́ma fịị dighiḅọ bẹ sii imi, a ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ ị Tamuno ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ anịma gbólómanyẹ.
english_text: If you see any brother or sister commit a sin that does not lead to death, you should pray and God will give them life. I refer to those whose sin does not lead to death. There is a sin that leads to death. I am not saying that you should pray about that.

ibani_text: Irima nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị sii, kuma sii imi tumḅọ dighi mú fịị bie suabịgha nyẹ.
english_text: All wrongdoing is sin, and there is sin that does not lead to death.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno Tụwọ sọmaaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sámámgba siinyẹ mịẹ mịẹbịgha, Tamuno Tụwọ ma n kokowarịarị, sii tumḅọ ma sọ ine nyẹ pa n lámábịgha.
english_text: We know that anyone born of God does not continue to sin; the One who was born of God keeps them safe, and the evil one cannot harm them.

ibani_text: Wa nimim ḅẹ́ wamịnị Tamuno awọ, tuminikiri gbọrụ ma sọ sii tumḅọ ma sughubie imi.
english_text: We know that we are children of God, and that the whole world is under the control of the evil one.

ibani_text: Wa pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ Tamuno Tụwọ ma ḅomam sị akanyaḅo pa wa pịrịmam, si wa karakárá Tamuno ma nimi, wa karakárá Tamuno ma na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imii ọ Tụwọ Jizọs Krais ma na gbẹ́rẹ́ḅụ ḅụ imi. Mịị karakárá Tamuno ma, mịị pịghị duma gbámásó.
english_text: We know also that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding, so that we may know him who is true. And we are in him who is true by being in his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi awọ ọmịnị ọḅụ fóofóoma n kárá tamuno ḅụ.
english_text: Dear children, keep yourselves from idols.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma sẹnịḅọ ma ḅara saghịḅom. A gịẹ pa n sẹlẹakị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma na árị awọ fịrịmam, a karakárá ḅara pa ḅẹlẹmaapụ. Irị ngéréghaa, kụ́ma karakárányẹ ma nimiapụ mamgba ị ḅẹ́lẹ́mam,
english_text: The elder, To the lady chosen by God and to her children, whom I love in the truth—and not I only, but also all who know the truth—

ibani_text: karakárá ma wámịna bie ngam gosi anị pịghị wamịnị na fịnị mú gbámásó lábẹm.
english_text: because of the truth, which lives in us and will be with us forever:

ibani_text: Tamuno Daḅọ ma na pịghị Jizọs Krais Daḅọ ma Tụwọ, tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́, na lolomakúkúbie na diin na pa wa pịrị; mịnanyẹ ma wamịna nyẹ sọ karakárá ḅụ na pịghị ḅẹlẹma ḅụ.
english_text: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and from Jesus Christ, the Father’s Son, will be with us in truth and love.

ibani_text: Anị opu bieḅẹlẹ pa i pịrịm a dọghụpágháma ḅọ sa ḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ awọ ma ḅụ jẹ́apụ karakárá ma ḅụ asọ nwángịarị, Daḅọ ma tọ́ọ wa pịrị ḅara.
english_text: It has given me great joy to find some of your children walking in the truth, just as the Father commanded us.

ibani_text: Anịgo, mị́sa ibi ọ́rụ́ḅọ, a ị tẹ́ghẹ̄m wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba jụghọ jụghọ ḅẹlẹma. Mịma ḅẹgha ḅẹ́ a jẹ́ ịwọ ólóghó gịẹ pa ọ fịrịmaarị, kụ́ma parị sa éné éné wa nimi ólóghó ma.
english_text: And now, dear lady, I am not writing you a new command but one we have had from the beginning. I ask that we love one another.

ibani_text: Mịma anịị ḅẹlẹma, ḅẹ́ wa Tamuno ólóghó ma warị. Ọ pịghị sughu saghị sa éné éné namaa ḅara ma ḅẹ́, ori ólóghó anịị, wa ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ngaa.
english_text: And this is love: that we walk in obedience to his commands. As you have heard from the beginning, his command is that you walk in love.

ibani_text: Tọgha oḅori pa kịnịsịapụ tuminikiri gbọrụ sọmam, mininighaapụ ḅẹ́ Jizọs Krais ojumẹnị sua tuminikiri ḅom. Ọkọfịnị tumḅọ anịị oḅori pa kịnịsịḅọ pịghị Krais iruonaḅọ.
english_text: I say this because many deceivers, who do not acknowledge Jesus Christ as coming in the flesh, have gone out into the world. Any such person is the deceiver and the antichrist.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́ findi warị, sị ị tọ́rụ́siarị gbálanyẹ i ḅara fabịgha ḅara, kụ́ma nnị bii ḅara pa ị gbẹ bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Watch out that you do not lose what wehave worked for, but that you may be rewarded fully.

ibani_text: Krais dienyẹ ma wáriso ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ sị jẹ́ asọdua, nḅọ Tamuno nyanagha, kụ́ma dienyẹ ma ḅụ fịnịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Daḅọ ma na Tụ́wọ ma na nyánam.
english_text: Anyone who runs ahead and does not continue in the teaching of Christ does not have God; whoever continues in the teaching has both the Father and the Son.

ibani_text: Anịgo, ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ ọ damaḅom sị mị dienyẹ ma akuogha, anị tumḅọ ma daa ị wárị suu ma, pịghị ọ ḅẹ́ ma ḅẹ́ diin ị nana fịnị.
english_text: If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not take them into your house or welcome them.

ibani_text: Ọ daá wárị suu ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ diekiri nyánam nḅọ siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Anyone who welcomes them shares in their wicked work.

ibani_text: A tọgha nyẹ nyánam a dugho ọ pịrị bẹnyẹ kụ́ma a ábálálá na nyẹ gịẹ ḅuruma pa gịẹbịgha, anịmanakaragha a ọ fịnị angaá ḅobẹm, si ọ nana tọ́rụ́ na tọ́rụ́ na ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́, si wámịna bieḅẹlẹ bii bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I have much to write to you, but I do not want to use paper and ink. Instead, I hope to visit you and talk with you face to face, so that our joy may be complete.

ibani_text: Ọmịna ibi mị́naḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ, Tamuno sẹ́lẹ́akị ḅọ ma awọ fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a obíí.
english_text: The children of your sister, who is chosen by God, send their greetings.

ibani_text: Irị Jọn sẹnịḅọ ma anịị mị diri ma gịẹ ọ fịrịmaḅọ. A gịẹ pa ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ Gayọs, a karakárá ḅara pa ḅẹlẹma ḅọ fịrịmam.
english_text: The elder, To my dear friend Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ, a tẹ́ghẹ̄m ḅẹ́ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ị nana loghuloghu ị pịghị oju kụrọ ḅụ fịnị, a nimiḅara ḅụ ḅẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ju ịḅụ kụrọm.
english_text: Dear friend, I pray that you may enjoy good health and that all may go well with you, even as your soul is getting along well.

ibani_text: Anị opuma ibieḅẹ́lẹ́mam jẹ́ mininiapụ ḅo dugho sa, ị karakárá ma ḅụ sẹ́kụrọ ḅara, ị pa pịghị sámámgba karakáráma ḅụ asọ nwángịarị ḅara.
english_text: It gave me great joy when some believers came and testified about your faithfulness to the truth, telling how you continue to walk in it.

ibani_text: Mịma nẹ́ngịma bieḅẹlẹ ofori a ḅo náa sa ḅẹ́ ị́yẹ́ awọ karakáráma ḅụ asọ nwángịarị.
english_text: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọ, ịrị opuma kụ́rọsẹm ị nwángị Krais ọḅụduaapụ pịrịarị fịrị, karakárányẹ ḅẹ́ nna ḅụ jẹ́apụ igoniapụ ị fịnịngaa.
english_text: Dear friend, you are faithful in what you are doing for the brothers and sisters,even though they are strangers to you.

ibani_text: Nnị ị́yẹ́ ḅẹlẹma dugho págháma mịnga fịnị Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma pịrịmam. Páisisi ḅárásua n pịrị sị nnị muarịnyẹ ma mú anị Tamuno ma ḅụ́ḅẹlẹḅara.
english_text: They have told the church about your love. Please send them on their way in a manner that honors God.

ibani_text: Nnị muarịnyẹ ma muarị Krais fịrị ma gosi, ḅárásua pịrị daákịgha ḅụ mininighaapụ ma ḅarabie.
english_text: It was for the sake of the Name that they went out, receiving no help from the pagans.

ibani_text: Anịgo wamịnị mininiapụ ḅárásua mịị túminị́ ma pịrị na ibim, wamịnị nnị na fịrịnwangị karakárá ma pịrịbẹ ḅárá.
english_text: We ought therefore to show hospitality to such people so that we may work together for the truth.

ibani_text: A gbulu ábálálá gịẹ Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma fịrịmam kụ́ma Diyotirifes dọghụḅọ bẹ ọ sịbịdaa n pịrịm, biri pa ị́yẹ́ dughonyẹ náa dọghụgha.
english_text: I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first, will not welcome us.

ibani_text: A ḅo sa, anịsa, a pa o biekórómabẹm ọ mịẹmáa nyẹ mamgba, ọ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅara pa wa dughosima ḅara na pịghị o dugho iruonyẹ! Anịma o furobịgha, mịnaapụ ma ḅo sa sọ ori n dakórómagha, n dakóróma dọghụapụ ori n kikim pịghị n deepágháma Tamuno kubiri ogbo ma bie.
english_text: So when I come, I will call attention to what he is doing, spreading malicious nonsense about us. Not satisfied with that, he even refuses to welcome other believers. He also stops those who want to do so and puts them out of the church.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ ibi nangwọḅọ, Gayọs siiamịẹnyẹ daa nyẹ mịẹma, kụ́ma ibinyẹ daa nyẹ mịẹ. Ibinyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Tamuno ju saghịḅom. Siinyẹ mịẹarịḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na Tamuno nimigha.
english_text: Dear friend, do not imitate what is evil but what is good. Anyone who does what is good is from God. Anyone who does what is evil has not seen God.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba Demetirọs ibi dughoarị, karakárá ma so ọ ḅụ ibi dughoarị, wamịnị so ọ ḅụ ibi dughom, ọ pịghị nimim ḅẹ́ wámịna dugho págháma nyẹ ma karakárányẹ.
english_text: Demetrius is well spoken of by everyone—and even by the truth itself. We also speak well of him, and you know that our testimony is true.

ibani_text: A tọgha nyẹ nyánam a dugho ọ pịrịbẹnyẹ, kụ́ma a dugho dọghụgha ábálálá gịẹnyẹ na ábálálá gịẹ ḅuruma ḅụ.
english_text: I have much to write you, but I do not want to do so with pen and ink.

ibani_text: Ḅọlọgha sa ḅụ a ị́yẹ́ árịbẹm, anịsa wa tọ́rụ́ na tọ́rụ́ na ḅụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́bẹm.
english_text: I hope to see you soon, and we will talk face to face.

ibani_text: Diin ọmịnị na fịnịị. Ọmịna nangwọapụ mamgba fịrịmam ḅẹ́ a obii. Ḅara na nangwọapụ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ bii.
english_text: Peace to you. The friends here send their greetings. Greet the friends there by name.

ibani_text: Irị Judu, Jizọs Krais fịrịnwangịḅọ na pịghị Jems numboru owitụ́wọ, mịị diri ma gịẹ pa ọ fịrịmam Tamuno sịmáapụ, pịghị Tamuno Daḅọ ma ḅẹlẹma bie duma kọọapụ, pịghị Jizọs Krais ọ ḅara na kokoapụ.
english_text: Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and a brother of James, To those who have been called, who are loved in God the Father and kept forJesus Christ:

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ, lolomakúkúbie, diin na ḅẹlẹma bifụfụụ́ ḅara ḅụ ọmịna nyẹ sọọ.
english_text: Mercy, peace and love be yours in abundance.

ibani_text: A opuma kórómaarị a diri gịẹ ọ fịrịma wamịnị kị́nị́mamgba nyáná dụaḅọ́rọ́ma gbólómanyẹ ḅụ. Kụ́ma anị ḅoo ịḅụ korom ḅẹ, a ábálálá gịẹ pa ọmịna tẹ́mẹ́ kụrọma, ḅẹẹ ọmịnị owusọọ tórúku mú Tamuno gbẹ́rẹ́sa pa ori a túminị́ pịrị sị pịrị fama minini.
english_text: Dear friends, although I was very eager to write to you about the salvation we share, I felt compelled to write and urge you to contend for the faith that was once for all entrusted to God’s holy people.

ibani_text: Jẹa túminị́ Tamuno nímighaapụ ḅọghu ḅara pa ikirisọḅomam ọ mịnị ogboku bie sị Tamuno tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ oku ma dima, nnị pa nna yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị ma kọ, pịghị Jizọs Krais wámịna kpọ́kpọ́ Daḅọ na wámịna Nyánáḅọ sịghị. Ḅọlọmaa sáá Tọ́ndiri ma dugho kórómamam nnị nyanamaá ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ.
english_text: For certain individuals whose condemnation was written aboutlong ago have secretly slipped in among you. They are ungodly people, who pervert the grace of our God into a license for immorality and deny Jesus Christ our only Sovereign and Lord.

ibani_text: Karakárányẹ ḅẹẹ ọ mị mamgba nimim, a papa ọ biekóróma ḅẹ́ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Izirẹlịapụ dụapághámaḅo ḅara Ijipitiapụ ḅarabie kụ́ma anịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sa, mininighaapụ ma gulugulumam.
english_text: Though you already know all this, I want to remind you that the Lordat one time delivered his people out of Egypt, but later destroyed those who did not believe.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị sookumuapụ ma pa biekóróma, mịnị nna ḅụ pa nna kụrọ láa kunema angaá ḅụ warighaapụ, kụ́ma nna fịnị yọ warisom: n gbámásó ịkóli pa n suamam sughubie fịnị kánákáná ma bie, Tamuno n pa warị pa anị opu éné ma kúru nna ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ éné nnị n guluguluma bẹ sáá.
english_text: And the angels who did not keep their positions of authority but abandoned their proper dwelling—these he has kept in darkness, bound with everlasting chains for judgment on the great Day.

ibani_text: O Sodom na Gomora na nnị na kikia ama gbọrụ, pa biekóróma mịná sookumuapụ ma dua yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị na ḅụrụamịẹnyẹ mịẹapụ, n kọrị gbámásó fịnị ma tọ́rụ́siarị arịm, mịma warị birinụ́nụ́nyẹ sọ kị́nị́mamgba pịrị.
english_text: In a similar way, Sodom and Gomorrah and the surrounding towns gave themselves up to sexual immorality and perversion. They serve as an example of those who suffer the punishment of eternal fire.

ibani_text: Pịghị anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma mịị túminị́ ma kịrị dáwọkọm mịẹsị n siinyẹ mịẹ nna oju pilemaarị nyẹ, nnị Tamuno kụ́rọ dighisimam warị pịghị ọgọnọ fịnị ipineapụ ma dughosima.
english_text: In the very same way, on the strength of their dreams these ungodly people pollute their own bodies, reject authority and heap abuse on celestial beings.

ibani_text: Maikel sookumuapụ ma sịbịdá oku muḅọ sọ mịma mịẹgha, ori ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma na nụ́nányẹ nyáná sáá ḅẹ tụọ Mosis dua akị bẹ, Maikel ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma dughosimagha kụ́ma dughom ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ igani ị pịrịị.
english_text: But even the archangel Michael, when he was disputing with the devil about the body of Moses, did not himself dare to condemn him for slander but said, “The Lord rebuke you!”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịnaapụ ma nnị akanyaḅogha nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dughosimaarị, nnị fịnị ḅara so ḅọ́rọ́ pirinama, nnị ine sịbịbie kiẹgha tẹrẹmẹ n ḅẹnyẹ ḅẹnyẹ mịẹ. Samangba ḅụ n tẹ́mẹ́bie sọọ nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị n mịẹarịnyẹ. Nnị kọarị mịẹnyẹ mamgba sịarị ḅẹẹ n nimim n mịẹarịnyẹ, anịị n ḅaarị nyẹ.
english_text: Yet these people slander whatever they do not understand, and the very things they do understand by instinct—as irrational animals do—will destroy them.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sii n pịrịbẹm! Nnị Keni asọ duamam, igbii gosi nnị n ḅụ pa Balaam mịẹ irima nyẹ ma ḅụ suumam. Nnị Kora kụrọsịbịbie mịẹḅara pa nyẹ mịẹm, anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma anịị n pịghị n guluguluma ḅara.
english_text: Woe to them! They have taken the way of Cain; they have rushed for profit into Balaam’s error; they have been destroyed in Korah’s rebellion.

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ kpọ koro sị ọ pilemaarị ịlọ́lị ọ sọsị kubiri ogbo fị́nyẹ ma fịị gbólomaarị sáá. Nna ḅụ ngéré siḅearị ánáná siḅeapụ. Nnị anịị fọ́rụ dighiákị nwángịarị oḅuto kụ́ma iti kórómagha. Nnị fịnị ḅara anịị anịsáa ḅụ sọ ine sịmgbọlụ suagha sị, n kune ḅụ saghị sughu pághámaḅo sịmgbọlụ fịịfamamaa nyẹ fịnị ḅara anịị n fịnị ḅara.
english_text: These people are blemishes at your love feasts, eating with you without the slightest qualm—shepherds who feed only themselves. They are clouds without rain, blown along by the wind; autumn trees, without fruit and uprooted—twice dead.

ibani_text: Nnị kụ́rọ dinọngụ kịkam tọ́rụ́ ḅụ. Nna ḅụ́gịrịriị́ma fịrị anị ḅụ diearị, dinọngụ anị ọ kọkọ die ḅara. Nnị ikelekelé ma ḅọ́rọ́arị lolia kịkam, Tamuno gbámásó yọ tẹ́lẹ́ma pịrịmáapụ póghólóḅa kánákánábie.
english_text: They are wild waves of the sea, foaming up their shame; wandering stars, for whom blackest darkness has been reserved forever.

ibani_text: Enọkụ, ḅụọ ḅụọ ḅụ sọ́nọ́ma kárámáḅọ Adam ḅụọ ḅụ, anị mị íkia ma kórónyẹ Ḅọlọmaa sáá, anị mgbọloma ḅara ḅẹẹ, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅoobẹm ori na ọrẹ tọ́ntọ́ sookumuapụ kịẹbịpị ḅọ́rọ́nyẹ,
english_text: Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied about them: “See, the Lord is coming with thousands upon thousands of his holy ones

ibani_text: si ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹ ḅara kị́nị́mamgba sịbị ọgọnọ, Tamuno gbarịgha ḅara ḅụ mịná sii túminị́ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm n nwángịmáa Tamuno nimigha fịrị na pịghị ọ sịbị n kọmaá sii ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ gosi.
english_text: to judge everyone, and to convict all of them of all the ungodly acts they have committed in their ungodliness, and of all the defiant words ungodly sinners have spoken against him.”

ibani_text: Mịná túminị́ ma sáá mamgba nnị gụ́nụ́gụ́nụ́arị ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa jẹ́apụ sịbị sẹ, nnị nna ojumẹnị biiarị siinyẹ duaarị, nnị opuamịẹnyẹ mịẹarị sị jẹ́apụ gbolomanyẹ ḅụ ibi bịpịfie sị n binyẹ n ḅara la bẹ ḅara.
english_text: These people are grumblers and faultfinders; they follow their own evil desires; they boast about themselves and flatter others for their own advantage.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma o biekóróma, ị́yẹ́ nangwọapụ nfịrịmaapụ ma dughonyẹ ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá wámịna Nyánáḅọ Jizọs Krais gbolomanyẹ,
english_text: But, dear friends, remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ foretold.

ibani_text: Nnị dugho ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ kunema éné ma ḅomaẹrẹ, túminị́ págháḅobẹm ọ kpọtibẹapụ, Tamuno nimigha sị nna ojumẹnị binyẹ duabẹapụ.
english_text: They said to you, “In the last times there will be scoffers who will follow their own ungodly desires.”

ibani_text: Mịnaapụ ma, anịị puama dighiapụ, nnị nna ojumẹnị tarịarịnyẹ anịị n sumaarịnyẹ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánágháapụ.
english_text: These are the people who divide you, who follow mere natural instincts and do not have the Spirit.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ nangwọapụ ọ pa jụghọ jụghọ mịẹ sẹ́nịma ọmịna tọ́ntọ́ḅa minini ma ḅụ, Tọ́ntọ́ Tẹ́mẹ́ ma kụrọ pa tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: But you, dear friends, by building yourselves up in your most holy faith and praying in the Holy Spirit,

ibani_text: Ọ Tamuno ḅẹlẹma ḅụ ọmịna ḅụ warị ọmịnị Wányánáḅọ Jizọs Krais kụ́rụ́arịsa ḅẹ́ o ḅọ sị duma gbámásó pá ọ́ pịrị ori lolomakúkúbie ḅụ.
english_text: keep yourselves in God’s love as you wait for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to bring you to eternal life.

ibani_text: Lolomakúkúbie nyáná tẹ́mẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mmẹẹ́ mịẹarịapụ pịrị,
english_text: Be merciful to those who doubt;

ibani_text: fịnị ma bie isiapụ nụnụ pághámaḅo sị n dụaḅọ́rọ́maa, isiapụ lolomakúkúbie nyáná n pịrị ḅáláfa anị na gwanyẹ, kụ́ma ḅẹlẹma nyáná nna suabịtẹ pịrịma nna siiamịẹnyẹ mịẹsị anị ịlọ́lị nyẹ.
english_text: save others by snatching them from the fire; to others show mercy, mixed with fear—hating even the clothing stained by corrupted flesh.

ibani_text: Ori ma, ine ọ warịị sị ọ bịghịbịgha ḅọ ma, pịghị ọmịnị akuoo sii ḅụ ófórigha ḅụ, na pịghị opu bieḅẹlẹ ḅụ ọ tọ́rụ́kuu, ipine bii yọ,
english_text: To him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you before his glorious presence without fault and with great joy—

ibani_text: wámịna Kpọ́kpọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ Tamuno pịghị wámịna dụaḅọ́rọ́maḅọ, Jizọs Krais wámịna Nyánáḅọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́, ipine na, pẹrẹ na ịnyọ na kụ́rọ na, ḅọ́rọ́maa kụ́rá gbọrụ mamgba, na pịghị mị́sa akị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa! Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: to the only God our Savior be glory, majesty, power and authority, through Jesus Christ our Lord, before all ages, now and forevermore! Amen.

ibani_text: Mịị diri ma bie fịnịnyẹ anịị Jizọs Krais diepágháma nyẹ́. Tamuno mịị diepágháma nyẹ ma pa ọ pịrịm sị ọ pa ori fịrịnwangịapụ die pághá bẹnyẹ ḅọlọghaa sáá ḅụ. Krais mịẹm sị ori a fịrịnwangịḅọ Jọn mịnanyẹ ma nimii ori ọrẹ sookumuḅọ fịrịma ọ pịrị ḅara.
english_text: The revelation from Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants what must soon take place. He made it known by sending his angel to his servant John,

ibani_text: Jọn warị ori árị nyẹ́ mamgba dugho págháma anịma anịị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma na pịghị Jizọs Krais dugho págháma nyẹ.
english_text: who testifies to everything he saw—that is, the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ.

ibani_text: Nnị karịibimaapụ anịị mị diri ma gooapụ, nnị karịibimaapụ anị pịghị mịị ikiakoro oku ma pughuapụ sị pịghị anị bie n gịẹnyẹ ma koko! Ḅẹẹ sáá ma kikiamam nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ kiri ákị bẹ sáá.
english_text: Blessed is the one who reads aloud the words of this prophecy, and blessed are those who hear it and take to heart what is written in it, because the time is near.

ibani_text: Sịbịpị ma Jọn ḅara anịị anị saghị ḅo Esiya ḅẹrẹtọ yọ ḅụ fịnị sọ́nọ́ma sọsị ma pịrị nyẹ́ẹ́: Tamuno, mị́sa fịnịḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá fịnịḅọ na pịghị ḅo bẹ sa fịnịḅọ pịghị ori imine tórúku fịnị sọ́nọ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma ḅara saghị ḅo tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ na diin fịnị ọ pịrịị.
english_text: John, To the seven churches in the province of Asia: Grace and peace to you from him who is, and who was, and who is to come, and from the seven spiritsbefore his throne,

ibani_text: Na pịghị Jizọs Krais ḅara, karakárá onyésẹ̄ḅọ ma, parị fịị ḅụ saghị ḅọ ori anịị pịghị tuminikiri ámányánáapụ ma táarịḅọ. Ọ wa ḅẹ́lẹ́mam, ori ọrẹ ọmbịnyẹ́ pa wa dụaḅọ́rọ́māmám wámịna sii ḅụ.
english_text: and from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us and has freed us from our sins by his blood,

ibani_text: Warị pịghị igwagwaapụ amadakiri pa wa mịẹsị wa fịrịnwangị ọ Daa na Tamuno ma pịrịị. Boma na ịnyọ fịnị Jizọs Krais pịrị ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa! Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: and has made us to be a kingdom and priests to serve his God and Father—to him be glory and power for ever and ever! Amen.

ibani_text: Dighi, ori oḅuto na ḅoarị! Fịnịḅọ fịnịḅọ ori árịbẹm, sụḅa pa o gbiapụ ma sọọ; tuminikiri fịnị túminị́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dụadu ọ pịrịbẹm. Anịị anị fịnị bẹ ḅara!
english_text: “Look, he is coming with the clouds,” and “every eye will see him, even those who pierced him”; and all peoples on earth “will mourn because of him.” So shall it be! Amen.

ibani_text: Kụrọmamgba nyáná Kịnịnyáná Tamuno mị́sa fịnịḅọ, ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá fịnịḅọ na pịghị ḅoo bẹ sa fịnịḅọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Irị anị Parị na pịghị Kunema ma.
english_text: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” says the Lord God, “who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.”

ibani_text: Irị anịị Jọn, ọmịna mịnaḅọ owitụ́wọ, pịghị Jizọs duaarị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ irị ọ́ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ngịrịma pa ori ásẹ́mẹ́kiriapụ laarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma arịarịḅọ. Nnị i pa Patmọs ogbosúányẹ ḅụ kórómam a Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámam na pịghị Jizọs diepágháma karakárá gosi.
english_text: I, John, your brother and companion in the suffering and kingdom and patient endurance that are ours in Jesus, was on the island of Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ éné ma ḅụ, a tẹ́mẹ́ju imi, a warị ọdụ fịnị ḅara fịnị opu pụghọ náa ị́yẹ́ ọḅụju.
english_text: On the Lord’s Day I was in the Spirit, and I heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet,

ibani_text: Anị i ḅẹm, Ịrị árịnyẹ ma gịẹ kórómaa, sị diri ma fịrịma mịná opu ama bie fịnị sọsị mamgba pịrị: anịị Ẹ́fịsọs, Samaina, Pegamọm, Tiyatira, Sadis, Filadelfiya na Laodisiya.
english_text: which said:“Write on a scroll what you see and send it to the seven churches: to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia and Laodicea.”

ibani_text: A pịghị ikelekelé sị dighim ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrịarịḅọ a warị nnị odoḅala pa tẹ́mẹ́ sọ́nọ́ma tọndọ́gbana nyẹ arịị.
english_text: I turned around to see the voice that was speaking to me. And when I turned I saw seven golden lampstands,

ibani_text: Nna ogbokúbie gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ imii tumḅọ kịkamanyẹ, ḅoo ọ ḅụọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ opu bịtẹ suaḅọ, ọ pịghị odoḅala mpara bịtẹ pa ọ kúkúbie ọgọ́nọ́ kpọm.
english_text: and among the lampstands was someone like a son of man,dressed in a robe reaching down to his feet and with a golden sash around his chest.

ibani_text: Ọ sịbị núme woolu bia ḅara biam anịgha sunoo, ọ tọ́rụ́ warị fịnị kọrị ḅara pa kọrị;
english_text: The hair on his head was white like wool, as white as snow, and his eyes were like blazing fire.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụọ n fịnịbie dọ́ghụ́ma sị ibima mụ́nụ́mụ́nụ́máa ḅala bia ḅara pa biarị, ọ pụghọ fiearị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọgọ́nọ́ saghị sóghóró mingi silé ḅara.
english_text: His feet were like bronze glowing in a furnace, and his voice was like the sound of rushing waters.

ibani_text: Ọ sọ́nọ́ma ḅálōló ọlọm ori amaḅara na mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ nyáná oḅu áláápụ́-ágidi ọ bịpịbie saghị págháḅom. O tórúku éné ogbo ịrụa biarị ḅara pa biarị.
english_text: In his right hand he held seven stars, and coming out of his mouth was a sharp, double-edged sword. His face was like the sun shining in all its brilliance.

ibani_text: A ori árị sáá, a ọ ḅụọ sughu bị́ghị korom fịịmaaḅọ ḅara ori ọrẹ ámáḅara pa ị́yẹ́ ọ́gọ́nọ gbánam warị ḅẹẹ, Ḅáláfama! Irị anịị Parị ma Irịị anịị pịghị Kunema ma.
english_text: When I saw him, I fell at his feet as though dead. Then he placed his right hand on me and said:“Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last.

ibani_text: Irịị anịị duma fịnịḅọ ma! A fịị sáá imii, kụ́ma mị́sa a duma muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá lam. A kụ́rọ nyáná ḅo fịị pịrịm na fịịmaapụ ma tuminikiri.
english_text: I am the Living One; I was dead, and now look, I am alive for ever and ever! And I hold the keys of death and Hades.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ị́yẹ́ árịnyẹ ma gịẹ kórómaa, mị́sa págháarị nyẹ na pịghị pághá bẹnyẹ mị́sa biri ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá.
english_text: “Write, therefore, what you have seen, what is now and what will take place later.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅọghu sị túminị́ nimigha nyẹ, ị́yẹ́ amaḅara bie fịnị sị ọmịnị árị sọ́nọ́ma ḅálōló ma sẹ́pịrịnyẹ, na pịghị odoḅala pa tẹ́mẹ́ tọndọ gbananyẹ ma sẹ́pịrịnyẹ: Sọ́nọ́ma ḅálōló ma anịị sọ́nọ́ma sọsị ma sookumuapụ, Sọ́nọ́ma tọndọ gbananyẹ ma anịị Sọ́nọ́ma sọsị ma.
english_text: The mystery of the seven stars that you saw in my right hand and of the seven golden lampstands is this: The seven stars are the angelsof the seven churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven churches.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Ẹ́fịsọs ḅụ fịnị sọsị ma sookumuḅọ fịrịma: Mịị oku ma sọ́nọ́ma ḅálōló ma ọlọ ḅọ ma ori amaḅara bie saghịḅom sị pịghị odoḅala pa tẹ́mẹ́ tọndọ gbananyẹ ma ḅụ nwángị ikelemáarịḅọ.
english_text: “To the angelof the church in Ephesus write: These are the words of him who holds the seven stars in his right hand and walks among the seven golden lampstands.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ mịẹ́nyẹ nimim i kọmaá duma; a nimim ịrị ịnyọsua fịrịnwangịmaá ḅara ị pịghị ngịrịma nyanamaá ḅara. A nimim ḅẹẹ ịrị ine sii túminị́ dighi tọ́rụ́sibịgha, ị pịghị nfịrịmaapụ pa nna ḅụ sịịapụ ma dáadighiman, kụ́ma nnị ọkọ fịnịgha, sị warị dọghụ pághámaḅom ḅẹẹ nnị iruonyẹ dughoapụ.
english_text: I know your deeds, your hard work and your perseverance. I know that you cannot tolerate wicked people, that you have tested those who claim to be apostles but are not, and have found them false.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị ngịrịma nyánam, ori ẹrẹ go tọ́rụ́siarịmam ọ pịghị minigha ịnyọ ọ́ḅụ faá.
english_text: You have persevered and have endured hardships for my name, and have not grown weary.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma anịị a nyáná pa ọ pụ́nụ́manyẹ: parị ọmịnị ị ḅẹlẹma ḅara ọmịnị ọkọ pa ị ḅẹlẹmagha.
english_text: Yet I hold this against you: You have forsaken the love you had at first.

ibani_text: Biekóróma ọ bịghị kóró lama ḅara! Ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ pịghị sị parị ọ mịẹmịẹnyẹ ma mịẹ. Ọ sii ḅụ pịghịgha pịghịgha, a ọ dámáḅobẹm sị ọmịna tọndọ gbananyẹ ma ákị anị fịnịkiri.
english_text: Consider how far you have fallen! Repent and do the things you did at first. If you do not repent, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma anịị a pa ọ túminí bẹnyẹ; ḅẹẹ ọ Nikolasị duarịapụ ma mịẹarịnyẹ ḅẹlẹmagha.
english_text: But you have this in your favor: You hate the practices of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

ibani_text: Biri nyanaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho pa sọsị ma pịrịarịnyẹ! Sọḅaapụ a kụrọ pa n pịrịbẹm sị nnị dúma pịrị sị ma sịmgbọlụ fịị, paradaisị ḅụ fịnị Tamuno onu ma.
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who is victorious, I will give the right to eat from the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Samaina ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịma: Mịị oku ma párịḅọ ma na pịghị kunemaḅọ ma, fị́ị sị pịghị sima duma fịnịḅọ ma ḅara sághị ḅom.
english_text: “To the angel of the church in Smyrna write: These are the words of him who is the First and the Last, who died and came to life again.

ibani_text: A ọmịna ḅụḅáláḅálá nimim; a pịghị ọmịna ịgónyí nimim anịsọ ọ pa ngọ nyánam! A nimim nnị ọ ḅụ ḅụ dugho síí ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́, ḅẹ́eapụ ḅẹẹ nnị Juuapụ kụ́ma nnị Juuapụgha; nnị anịị Satanị kubiri ogbo!
english_text: I know your afflictions and your poverty—yet you are rich! I know about the slander of those who say they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfama ọmịnị árịdụmaarị tọ́rụ́siarị ma gosi. Pughu! Ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma ọ pa daádighi ma bie suubẹm ori ọ́ḅụ jẹ́apụ pa ikóliwarịbie gbi sua bẹ sa, ọmịna ḅụḅáláḅálá fịnị mú oyia dii láabẹm. Sẹ́kụrọ i pịrị, anị ḅọ́rọ́ fịị bii sọ, anịsáa a dúma ogunu ma pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Do not be afraid of what you are about to suffer. I tell you, the devil will put some of you in prison to test you, and you will suffer persecution for ten days. Be faithful, even to the point of death, and I will give you life as your victor’s crown.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho sọsị ma pịrịarịnyẹ! Sọḅaapụ mmẹẹ́ kárámá fịị ma ḅara pa n lámábịgha.
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches. The one who is victorious will not be hurt at all by the second death.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Pegamọm ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịmam: Mịị anịị mmẹẹ́ a tọ́rụ́ áláápụ́-ágidi ma ọlọḅọ ma ḅárá saghị ḅoo oku.
english_text: “To the angel of the church in Pergamum write: These are the words of him who has the sharp, double-edged sword.

ibani_text: A nimim ọmịnị ngaa angaá, anịị Satanị ma ori imine nyáná ngaa. Anịsọ ọ pa sẹ́kụrọ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ma pịrịm ọ pa ịḅụ mininim nnị Antipasi ị́yẹ́ karakárá onyésẹ̄ḅọ ma ḅá sa ọmịna opu ama bie anịị Satanị ma ngaa angaá.
english_text: I know where you live—where Satan has his throne. Yet you remain true to my name. You did not renounce your faith in me, not even in the days of Antipas, my faithful witness, who was put to death in your city—where Satan lives.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma a jẹ́ kálányẹ nyánam a pa ọmịnị ọlọọ bẹnyẹ: ọmịna ḅụ jẹ́apụ Balaam dienyẹ ma duaarị Balak dieḅọ nnị Izirẹlịawọ daa mú siinyẹ bie suu bẹ ḅara, ori n suma ḅara ḅẹẹ nnị n pa igwagwaá nkára tamuno pịrị fị́nyẹ fịị sị pịghị yáakuu ḅụ ófórigha nwángị kọọ.
english_text: Nevertheless, I have a few things against you: There are some among you who hold to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to entice the Israelites to sin so that they ate food sacrificed to idols and committed sexual immorality.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅara ma jẹ́apụ imi ọmịna ogbobie Nikolasị ọḅụduaapụ dienyẹ ma duaarịapụ.
english_text: Likewise, you also have those who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

ibani_text: Mị́sa ọmịnị ọmịna sii ḅụ pịghị! Ọ ḅọ́rọ́ minigha, a ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ ọ́ dámáḅobẹm sị i bịpịbie saghị págháḅo áláápụ́-ágidi ma pa owu pa n págháma.
english_text: Repent therefore! Otherwise, I will soon come to you and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho sọsị ma pịrịarịnyẹ! Sọḅaapụ anịị a ḅọghu jẹa manna ma pịrịbẹapụ. A pịghị pị́na dapịrị pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrịbẹm nnị ịwọ ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹnyẹ anị ọ́gọ́nọ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ nimigha nyẹ anị daakịarịḅọ ma sighima.
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who is victorious, I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give that person a white stone with a new name written on it, known only to the one who receives it.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Tiyatira ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịma: Mị oku ma Tamuno Tụwọ ḅara anịị anị saghị ḅoo nyẹ, ọ tọ́rụ fịnị kọrị ḅara pa kọrịarị, ọ ḅụọ biaarị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị mụ́nụ́mụ́nụ́ma ḅala.
english_text: “To the angel of the church in Thyatira write: These are the words of the Son of God, whose eyes are like blazing fire and whose feet are like burnished bronze.

ibani_text: A ọmịna mịẹnyẹ nimim. A ọmịna ḅẹlẹma nimim, ọmịna minini, ọmịna fịrị ḅara na ọmịna ngịrịma. A nimim ḅẹẹ mị́sa ọ fịrịnwangị parị ọ nwángị ḅara nẹngịm.
english_text: I know your deeds, your love and faith, your service and perseverance, and that you are now doing more than you did at first.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma mịma anịị a pa ọmịna ọlọọ nyẹ: o Jesibẹl pa siḅọ ma daákịm, a ḅụ sịḅọ ḅẹẹ árị ikiakoro ọ́rụ́ḅọ. A diearịnyẹ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ árị ị́yẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ daá irimaarị si nnị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọarị sị pịghị n pa igwagwaá nkára tamuno pịrị fị́nyẹ fịarị.
english_text: Nevertheless, I have this against you: You tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophet. By her teaching she misleads my servants into sexual immorality and the eating of food sacrificed to idols.

ibani_text: A sáá pa a pịrịmam ḅẹ́ árị arị sii ḅụ pịghị, kụ́ma a pịghị dọghụgha árị yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị duma ḅụ.
english_text: I have given her time to repent of her immorality, but she is unwilling.

ibani_text: Anịgo a á pá múnonyẹ ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ gbíbẹm árị na árị ama dọghụapụ na ibima tọ́rụ́siarị bẹ angaá. A mịma mịẹbẹm ḅọ́rọ́ nnị árị na mịẹ siiamịẹnyẹ ma ḅụ pịghịgha pịghịgha.
english_text: So I will cast her on a bed of suffering, and I will make those who commit adultery with her suffer intensely, unless they repent of her ways.

ibani_text: A pịghị árị awọ ḅaabẹm, anịsáa sọsị mamgba minibẹm ḅẹẹ ịrị anịị kị́nị́mamgba kóróma na n biiarị nyẹ nimiḅọ. A pịghị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́bẹm n ḅo fịrị ḅara láa ḅara.
english_text: I will strike her children dead. Then all the churches will know that I am he who searches hearts and minds, and I will repay each of you according to your deeds.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị kọọapụ ma Tiyatira ḅụ mịnị mịị sii dienyẹ ma duagha; na ọ pa dáwọ ḅogha jẹ́apụ pa Satanị póghóló ḅọghunyẹ sị nyẹ. (A dugho ọ pịrịarị a mịnị jẹ́ ikúnyẹ pa ọmịna sịbị gbanabịgha).
english_text: Now I say to the rest of you in Thyatira, to you who do not hold to her teaching and have not learned Satan’s so-called deep secrets, ‘I will not impose any other burden on you,

ibani_text: Pa ị nyánányẹ ma ọlọ sẹ́ma ákị muu a ḅoo sáá láa.
english_text: except to hold on to what you have until I come.’

ibani_text: Sọḅaḅọ sị pịghị i tẹ́mẹ́ binyẹ mịẹ mú kunema láa ḅọ, a sẹ taa kụrọ ma pa n pịrịbẹm,
english_text: To the one who is victorious and does my will to the end, I will give authority over the nations—

ibani_text: a kụrọ nyánáḅoo maá ḅara Daḅọ ma ḅara sị tọgha sẹ táarị. Anị ḅoo ma ikúlélu kụrọ pa n taábẹm; ori árịamaḅẹlẹ gbi kọ́sịma ḅara pa nnị gbikọsimabẹm.
english_text: that one ‘will rule them with an iron scepter and will dash them to pieces like pottery’—just as I have received authority from my Father.

ibani_text: A pịghị dedeḅálōlo ma pa ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: I will also give that one the morning star.

ibani_text: Biri nyanaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho sọsị mamgba pịrịarịnyẹ!
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Sadis ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịma: Mịị anịị Tamuno sọ́nọ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma nyánáḅọ ma na sọ́nọ́ma ḅálōló ma nyánáḅọ ma ḅara ḅoo oku. A ọmịna mịẹnyẹ nimim; túminị́ ọmịnị árịarị ḅẹẹ o dumam kụ́ma ọ fịịmam!
english_text: “To the angelof the church in Sardis write: These are the words of him who holds the seven spiritsof God and the seven stars. I know your deeds; you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead.

ibani_text: Saghị sẹ! Ịnyọ pa kọnyẹ́ ma ḅụ sua anị fịịfamabịgha ḅara. Ḅẹẹ a arịḅom ḅẹ́ ọ nwángịmáa fịrị ma na káaragha ị Tamuno tórúku.
english_text: Wake up! Strengthen what remains and is about to die, for I have found your deeds unfinished in the sight of my God.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, biekóróma, n pa ọ dienyẹ na ọ pịghị náanyẹ, anị osii, sị pịghịị ọmịna sii ḅụ. Kụ́ma ọ múno ḅụ saghị sẹgha sẹgha a ḅo ọ ḅụ korobẹm fúrúḅọ ḅara ma, ọ pịghị ine nimibịghaa a ḅoo bẹ sáá ma.
english_text: Remember, therefore, what you have received and heard; hold it fast, and repent. But if you do not wake up, I will come like a thief, and you will not know at what time I will come to you.

ibani_text: Anịsọ ọ pa jẹ́apụ nyánam Sadis ḅụ na nna bịtẹ ịlọlịmáapụ. Nnị pị́na ḅusụ́anyẹ sua sị irị na asọ nwángịbẹm. Tegó anị nna ḅụ́gbẹm ọkọ mịẹ yọ.
english_text: Yet you have a few people in Sardis who have not soiled their clothes. They will walk with me, dressed in white, for they are worthy.

ibani_text: Sọḅaapụ ma n pị́na bịtẹ pa mịị ḅara ma pa nnị suabẹm, a pịghị nna ẹrẹ sibịgha dumaapụ ma ẹrẹ diri bie. I Daa ma tórúku na ori sookumuapụ ma tórúku a dugho findibẹm ḅẹẹ nnị i nyẹẹ.
english_text: The one who is victorious will, like them, be dressed in white. I will never blot out the name of that person from the book of life, but will acknowledge that name before my Father and his angels.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho sọsị ma pịrịarịnyẹ!
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Filadelfiya ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịma: Mịị Tọ́ntọ́ pịghị karakáráḅọ ma ḅara sághị ḅoo oku. O Deviti igbe findinyẹ ma nyánam. Ọ pịghị findimáa ḅụ́pọ́ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine anị gbẹ́bịgha, ọ pịghị gbẹmáa nyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine anị findibịgha.
english_text: “To the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: These are the words of him who is holy and true, who holds the key of David. What he opens no one can shut, and what he shuts no one can open.

ibani_text: A ọ ọmịna mịẹnyẹ nimim, a ḅụ́pọ́ findi ọ pịrịmam gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ine ikásịbịgha nyẹ. A nimim ḅẹẹ ọ kálá ịnyọ nyánam; ọmịnị ị́yẹ́ dienyẹ ma duamam, ọ pịghị sẹ kụrọ ị́yẹ́ ẹrẹ ma pịrịmam.
english_text: I know your deeds. See, I have placed before you an open door that no one can shut. I know that you have little strength, yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.

ibani_text: Pughu! Mịị Satanị kubiri ogboapụ ma, ḅẹarịapụ ḅẹ́ nnị Juuapụ tụ́manyẹ ḅẹ́ nnị Juughaapụ, kụ́ma nnị iruonaapụ. A nnị mịẹbẹm sị n ḅoo sóghórókoro i ḅụọ angaá. Nnị kị́nị́mamgba nimibẹm ḅẹẹ a ọ ḅẹ́lẹ́mamam.
english_text: I will make those who are of the synagogue of Satan, who claim to be Jews though they are not, but are liars—I will make them come and fall down at your feet and acknowledge that I have loved you.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị a sua ọ pịrị ólóghó ma kokomam gosi sị ngịrịma nyáná, irịsọ pịghị ọ koko warịbẹm tuminikiri ḅoarị ḅụḅáláḅálá sáá ma ḅụ, ḅoo tuminikiri fịnịapụ ma daádighi bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Since you have kept my command to endure patiently, I will also keep you from the hour of trial that is going to come on the whole world to test the inhabitants of the earth.

ibani_text: A álála ḅoarị, ibima ị nyánányẹ ma ọlọ warịị gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ị́yẹ́ ogunu ákịbịgha ḅara.
english_text: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have, so that no one will take your crown.

ibani_text: Sọḅaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị a pa warị ọkọlọbị pie sị mịẹbẹnyẹ ị́yẹ́ Tamunoopuwarị, ọ pịghị jẹ́ pa anị warịsobịgha. A nna ḅụ i Tamuno ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹbẹm náa i Tamuno ma opuámá ẹrẹ, ịwọ Jerusalem ma, sobie i Tamuno ḅara sághị kóróḅo bẹnyẹ. A pịghị ọ ḅụ ị́yẹ́ ịwọ ẹrẹ gịẹbẹm.
english_text: The one who is victorious I will make a pillar in the temple of my God. Never again will they leave it. I will write on them the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which is coming down out of heaven from my God; and I will also write on them my new name.

ibani_text: Biri nyanaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho sọsị ma pịrịarịnyẹ!
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

ibani_text: Mịị oku ma gịẹ pa Laodisiya ḅụ fịnị sookumuḅọ ma fịrịma: Mịị anịị Anị ọkọ fịnị ma ḅara sághị ḅoo oku, sẹ kụrọ pịghị karakárá onyésẹ̄ḅọ, Tamuno ọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ọ tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mamgba tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: “To the angel of the church in Laodicea write: These are the words of the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the ruler of God’s creation.

ibani_text: A ọmịna mịẹnyẹ nimim, a nimim ḅẹẹ ọmịnị oḅúghúgha anịgha ọfịrịịgha! A bibẹm ọ ḅọ́rọ́ ọfịrịị anịgha oḅughu.
english_text: I know your deeds, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were either one or the other!

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ọmịnị ngaringarim gosi, ọmịnị ọfịrịịgha ọ pịghị oḅúghúgha a ọmịnị osirosibẹm i bịpịbie!
english_text: So, because you are lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am about to spit you out of my mouth.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅẹm ḅẹẹ, Ọmịnị igbii nyanam; ọmịnị ngọ kọmam, ọ dọghụnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nyánámam! Kụ́ma o nimigha ọmịna duma galagala ḅara na pịghị nnị ọ dighi ḅụ́jịrịrị ḅara! Ọmịnị igónyim, ọ papa ḅụ ḅụ imii, ọ tọ́rụ́ pịghị pụụm.
english_text: You say, ‘I am rich; I have acquired wealth and do not need a thing.’ But you do not realize that you are wretched, pitiful, poor, blind and naked.

ibani_text: A ọmịnị againmam, ḅẹ́ ọmịnị i ḅara odoḅala fẹ́ẹ, n fịnịbie dọ́ghụ́ma yóri yóri odoḅala sị ọmịnị ála sọọ bẹ ḅara. Pịghị pị́na pị́na bịtẹ fẹ́ẹ sị pa ọmịna ḅụ sua sị ọmịna ḅụ́gịrịrịma papa ḅụ ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹ ḅara. Pịghị pulo fẹ́ẹ sị pa ị tọ́rụ taa, si i ine nyẹ árị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I counsel you to buy from me gold refined in the fire, so you can become rich; and white clothes to wear, so you can cover your shameful nakedness; and salve to put on your eyes, so you can see.

ibani_text: A ḅẹlẹmaapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a igani n pịrịm pịghị n fomu. Anịgosi ịnyọsua sị pịghịị ọmịna sii ḅụ
english_text: Those whom I love I rebuke and discipline. So be earnest and repent.

ibani_text: Dighi! A ḅụ́pọ́ ḅụ sẹ sị gbólom, i pụghọ náa sị ḅụ́pọ́ findi i pịrịḅọ fịnịfịnị, a n ḅọ warị sọḅobẹm sị n ḅọ na nyẹ́fịị, nḅọ sọ irị na nyẹ́fịbẹm.
english_text: Here I am! I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in and eat with that person, and they with me.

ibani_text: Sọ́ḅa ḅọ anịị a kụrọ pa pịrịbẹḅọ sị nḅọ irị na kpọrọfịnị ị́yẹ́ imine ọ́gọ́nọ. A Sọ́ḅa ḅara sị i Daa na ori imine ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnịị.
english_text: To the one who is victorious, I will give the right to sit with me on my throne, just as I was victorious and sat down with my Father on his throne.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa, Tẹ́mẹ́ ma dugho pa sọsị mamgba pịrịarịnyẹ!
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear what the Spirit says to the churches.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá a tọ́rụ sághị dighim, a warị jẹ́ múnogha dáwọ kọọ, warị sobie findi ḅụ́pọ́ arị. A náa pụghọ ma sị ọdụ fieḅára pa fie sị parị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrịarịnyẹ ma ḅẹ́m, Tándị mịnga ma ḅoo, sị a pa i die pághá bẹnyẹ mịị sáá ma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá.
english_text: After this I looked, and there before me was a door standing open in heaven. And the voice I had first heard speaking to me like a trumpet said,“Come up here, and I will show you what must take place after this.”

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́kiri Tẹ́mẹ́ i korom. Anị ngaa sobie, a imine arịm sị kị́nị́ árịị anị ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnịarị.
english_text: At once I was in the Spirit, and there before me was a throne in heaven with someone sitting on it.

ibani_text: Ori anị ngaa kpọrọfịnịarịḅọ ma jaspa na kanelian nyẹ́la dapịrị kịkam, soodum, emeraldi bia ḅara pa biarị nyẹ́la dapịrị imine ma ikelekelemam.
english_text: And the one who sat there had the appearance of jasper and ruby. A rainbow that shone like an emerald encircled the throne.

ibani_text: Imine ma ikelekelema nyẹ anịị jẹ́ imine si inifindi, anị ọ́gọ́nọ si inifindi sẹ́nịapụ kpọrọfịnịm pị́na bịtẹ sua pịghị odoḅala ogunu suaa.
english_text: Surrounding the throne were twenty-four other thrones, and seated on them were twenty-four elders. They were dressed in white and had crowns of gold on their heads.

ibani_text: Imine ma ḅụ sọ kọrịfịnị kọrịkọrị biiarị, so dárịarị na pịghị so alágbā fiearị. Imine ma tórúku sọ́nọ́ma tọndọ kọrịarị mịma anịị Tamuno sọ́nọ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma.
english_text: From the throne came flashes of lightning, rumblings and peals of thunder. In front of the throne, seven lamps were blazing. These are the seven spiritsof God.

ibani_text: Pịghị imine ma tórúku gịlassi kịka tọ́rụ́ imii, yóri yóri sị tumḅọ anị bie árịbẹm. Imine ma ikelekelema nyẹ ọkọlọbị mamgba ḅụ anịị ínia dumafịnị nyẹ, tọ́rụ́ tọ́rụ́ tọ́rụ́ anị ikelekelemam tórúku na pịghị ọḅụju.
english_text: Also in front of the throne there was what looked like a sea of glass, clear as crystal. In the center, around the throne, were four living creatures, and they were covered with eyes, in front and in back.

ibani_text: Dumafịnị nyẹ ma parị ngaa nyẹ ma ọkụ nama kịkam, mmẹẹ́ kárámá nyẹ ma owi kọ́rọ́náma kịkam, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá nyẹ ma tumḅọ tórúku nyanam; ini kárámá nyẹ ma fighiarị ogbólílo kịkam.
english_text: The first living creature was like a lion, the second was like an ox, the third had a face like a man, the fourth was like a flying eagle.

ibani_text: Mịná ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma, gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ suene a pamba nyánam tọ́rụ́ pịghị nna ḅụ gbiri ikélekélem pamba ma ọ́gọ́nọ na anị sughubie. Dii na ḅáā na n bịpị gbẹ́gha núme suuarị: Tọ́ntọ́, Tọ́ntọ́, Tọ́ntọ́, anịị Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno ma, ḅọ́rọ́maa sa fịnịḅọ, mị́sa fịnịḅọ na tórúku ḅoarị sáá.
english_text: Each of the four living creatures had six wings and was covered with eyes all around, even under its wings. Day and night they never stop saying: “ ‘Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty,’ who was, and is, and is to come.”

ibani_text: Mịná ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma boma núme na kuu núme na ịmịẹḅam núme suu pa imine ma ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma pịrị sa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, pịghị dumafịnị sị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa ḅo ma,
english_text: Whenever the living creatures give glory, honor and thanks to him who sits on the throne and who lives for ever and ever,

ibani_text: sị ínia sẹ́nịapụ ma sóórókoro imine ma ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma pịrịbẹm sị susi duma muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa ḅọ ma pịrịị. Nnị nna ogunu gbi kórómam imine ma tórúku warị ḅẹẹ.
english_text: the twenty-four elders fall down before him who sits on the throne and worship him who lives for ever and ever. They lay their crowns before the throne and say:

ibani_text: Wa Nyánáḅọ pịghị wámịna Tamuno, i ḅụ́gbẹm, sị boma na kuu na ịnyọ daakị, Ḅẹẹ ị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ sọmam, ị tọ́ọ ḅara ḅụ ị́ n tẹmẹm sị duma pa nnị pịrịm.
english_text: “You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they were created and have their being.”

ibani_text: A nnị iko diri ma arịm imine ọ́gọ́nọ fịnịḅọ ma ámáḅara; nnị anị ḅụ nyẹ gịẹ bimam mmẹẹ́ angaá mamgba ḅụ n warị sọ́nọ́ma angaá ḅụ agbā pa anị gbẹpalị.
english_text: Then I saw in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a scroll with writing on both sides and sealed with seven seals.

ibani_text: A warị gbẹ́rẹ́ opu sookumuḅọ arịị opu pụghọ pa dugho pághámaḅo ḅẹẹ, Tụọ anị ḅụ́gbẹ́ sị n gbẹpalị agbā ma si sị diri ma findi?
english_text: And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming in a loud voice, “Who is worthy to break the seals and open the scroll?”

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ofori sobie anịgha tuminikiri ḅụ anịgha kiribie ine nnị iko diri ma findi bẹḅọ si anị bie dighi.
english_text: But no one in heaven or on earth or under the earth could open the scroll or even look inside it.
