ibani_text: A warị opuma owuú tegó n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ arịgha ḅụ́gbẹ́ sị ine nnị iko diri ma findi bẹḅọ anịgha anị bie dighii.
english_text: I wept and wept because no one was found who was worthy to open the scroll or look inside.

ibani_text: Sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ warị i ḅẹẹ, Mịnị owuma! Dighi! Juda ḅụ sághị ḅoo Ọkụ nama, Deviti furobie págháḅo Tụwọ ma, sọḅamam. Ori anịị ine sọ́nọ́ma angaá ḅụ nnị gbẹpalị agbaa ma si bẹḅọ sị diri ma findi.
english_text: Then one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep! See, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and its seven seals.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ánáná tụwọ arịị sẹ́fịnịarị nyẹ imine ma ogboku, dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma anị ikelekelemam. Ánáná tụwọ ma fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị anị ḅaamam, anị sọ́nọ́ma ikpangi na sọ́nọ́ma tọ́rụ́ nyanam anịị Tamuno sọ́nọ́ma Tẹ́mẹ́ ma, n pa tuminikiri gbọrụ fịrịma maá nyẹ.
english_text: Then I saw a Lamb, looking as if it had been slain, standing at the center of the throne, encircled by the four living creatures and the elders. The Lamb had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spiritsof God sent out into all the earth.

ibani_text: Ánáná Tụwọ ma muu nnị iko diri ma daákịm imine ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma amaḅara bie.
english_text: He went and took the scroll from the right hand of him who sat on the throne.

ibani_text: Ori ọkọ mịẹ sa, dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma na si ínia sẹ́nịapụ ma sóórókórom, Ánáná Tụwọ ma tórúku. Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ hapụ pa sị núme suu nyẹ na odoḅala bọlị ọlọm Insẹnsị bie bii nyẹ, mịma anịị Tamuno túminị́ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄.
english_text: And when he had taken it, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb. Each one had a harp and they were holding golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of God’s people.

ibani_text: Nnị ịwọ núme sum ḅẹẹ: Anịị ḅụ́gbẹm si iko diri ma ákị si n pa anị gbẹpalị agbā ma si, Tegó nnị ị ḅám, pịghị ị́yẹ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ pa túminị́ fẹ́ Tamuno pịrịm, túminị́ ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ ḅụ na pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ sẹ sẹ sẹ ḅụ na pịghị túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́.
english_text: And they sang a new song, saying: “You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals, because you were slain, and with your blood you purchased for God persons from every tribe and language and people and nation.

ibani_text: I mịẹmam nnị igwagwaapụ amadakiri sọọ sị n fịrịnwangị wámịna Tamuno pịrị, n pịghị tuminikiri ma ḅụ taábẹm.
english_text: You have made them to be a kingdom and priests to serve our God, and they will reignon the earth.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, a warị dighi si tọgha tọgha pughu sookumuapụ pụghọ naam túminị́ ine kịẹbịgha nyẹ! Nnị imine ma ịkélémam, ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma na sẹ́nịapụ ma na.
english_text: Then I looked and heard the voice of many angels, numbering thousands upon thousands, and ten thousand times ten thousand. They encircled the throne and the living creatures and the elders.

ibani_text: Nnị warị pụghọ saghị núme súúarị, Nnị ḅáa Ánáná Tụwọ ma ḅụ́gbẹm, sị ọ kụrọ na ngọ, níminyẹ na ịnyọ, kuu, boma na túminí daákịị!
english_text: In a loud voice they were saying: “Worthy is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and praise!”

ibani_text: A warị sobie dumanyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa tuminikiri, sughubie fịnịnyẹ mamgba náa, pịghị tọ́rụ́bie, tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ dumafịnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ núme suarị: Boma, túminí na kuu na, ịnyọ na, fịnị ọ pịrị Ori imine ma ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma na Ánáná Tụwọ ma pịrị, ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa!
english_text: Then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and all that is in them, saying: “To him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be praise and honor and glory and power, for ever and ever!”

ibani_text: Dúmafịnị nyẹ ma warị pagharaa Anị ọkọ fịnịị! Sẹ́nịapụ ma warị bịghịkoro sị susi Tamuno pịrịị.
english_text: The four living creatures said, “Amen,” and the elders fell down and worshiped.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị Ánáná Tụwọ ma arịị n gbẹpalị sọ́nọ́ma nyẹ ma ḅụ parị nyẹ ma si, warị ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pụghọ náa so alágbā fieḅára pa fie nyẹ, Ḅoo.
english_text: I watched as the Lamb opened the first of the seven seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures say in a voice like thunder, “Come!”

ibani_text: A dighim, warị i tórúku pị́na pị́na ásụ arịị! Anị dọghụarịḅọ ẹbẹlẹ ọlọm, n wárị pịghị ogunu pa ọ pịrị, ọ dọghụ pághám sọ́ḅáḅọ ḅara sị ọ sọ́ḅa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I looked, and there before me was a white horse! Its rider held a bow, and he was given a crown, and he rode out as a conqueror bent on conquest.

ibani_text: Ánáná Tụwọ ma mmẹẹ́ kárámá agbā ma si sáá, a mmẹẹ́ kárámá ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma naam anị ḅẹẹ sáá, Ḅoo!
english_text: When the Lamb opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come!”

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ásụ págháḅom áwụ bia nyẹ. Anị dọghụarịḅọ ma nnị kụrọ pa ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ ọ diin si ákị tuminikiri si túminị́ mịẹsị nnị nna ḅụ ḅá. Nnị opu áláápụ́-ágidi pa ọ pịrịm.
english_text: Then another horse came out, a fiery red one. Its rider was given power to take peace from the earth and to make people kill each other. To him was given a large sword.

ibani_text: Ánáná Tụwọ ma tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá agbā ma sii sáá. A tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma naam anị ḅẹẹ sáá Ḅoo! A dighim warị i tórúku kúrúkúrú ásụ arịị! Anị dọghụarịḅọ nyẹ́tọ nyẹ ọlọm ọ ḅarabie.
english_text: When the Lamb opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come!” I looked, and there before me was a black horse! Its rider was holding a pair of scales in his hand.

ibani_text: A warị dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pụghọ kịkamanyẹ náa ḅẹarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Bọlị bii witi pa sị mbiakpa anịị n pa éné bẹ fịrị igbii gbẹ bẹnyẹ, tẹ́rẹ́ a bọlị bii mbiakpa n baali pa sị nyẹ anịị n pa éné bẹ fịrị igbii gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹnyẹ, kụ́ma arịị ḅẹẹ i pulo ma na iru ma simagha!
english_text: Then I heard what sounded like a voice among the four living creatures, saying, “Two poundsof wheat for a day’s wages,and six poundsof barley for a day’s wages,and do not damage the oil and the wine!”

ibani_text: Ánáná Tụwọ ma ini kárámá agbā ma sii sáá. A ini kárámá dumafịnị nyẹ ma naam bẹnyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ḅoo!
english_text: When the Lamb opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Come!”

ibani_text: A dighim warị oju fọọ bia ḅara pa bia ásụ arịị! Anị dọghụarị ḅọ ẹrẹ anịị Fịị, Duaama kikiama ori ọḅụju o duarịḅọ. Nnị tuminikiri ma pa ínia ngaa diem sị kụrọ pa n pịrị n ḅẹẹ n gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá nnị áláápụ́-ágidi, ḅuruḅa, obikpo na pịghị tuminikiri pirinama pa túminị́ ḅáa.
english_text: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him. They were given power over a fourth of the earth to kill by sword, famine and plague, and by the wild beasts of the earth.

ibani_text: Ánáná tụ́wọ ma sọ́nọ́ kárámá agbā ma si sáá, a Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma na nna sẹ kụrọ dugho págháma nyẹ ma gosi n ḅá túminị́ ma biebẹ duma arịm ẹ́bẹ ma sughu.
english_text: When he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain because of the word of God and the testimony they had maintained.

ibani_text: Nnị warị kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghú, Kụ́rọ mamgba Nyánáḅọ, Tọ́ntọ́ na karakáráḅọ! I kúru mú tẹ́ sáá lama bẹ sị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ tuminikiriapụ ma sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ sị sughubi wamịna sịbị ọmbịnyẹ́ gosi?
english_text: They called out in a loud voice, “How long, Sovereign Lord, holy and true, until you judge the inhabitants of the earth and avenge our blood?”

ibani_text: Anịsáa n warị pị́na koro bịtẹ pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ pịrị, warị n ḅẹẹ n kálá sáátụọ pa kúru sị nna jẹ́ fịrịnwangịapụ na owiapụ mịnaapụ kịẹbịpị ma kara nnị n ḅáa ḅara ma pa ḅáa bẹapụ.
english_text: Then each of them was given a white robe, and they were told to wait a little longer, until the full number of their fellow servants, their brothers and sisters,were killed just as they had been.

ibani_text: A Ánáná Tụwọ ma arịm ori suéné kárámá agbā ma sịarị sa. Kiri ḅo opuma jighem. Ịrụa ma warị pịghị kúrúkúrú sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ dụadu kúrúkúrú bịtẹ nnị oḅori osuka pa mịẹnyẹ, akalụ́ ma sọ pịghị sághị áwụ áwụ bia sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọmbịnyẹ́ bia ḅara.
english_text: I watched as he opened the sixth seal. There was a great earthquake. The sun turned black like sackcloth made of goat hair, the whole moon turned blood red,

ibani_text: Tọgha ḅálōló sághị sobie sóórókórom tuminikiri, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ sii sáá ḅụ págháḅo fịgị sịmgbọlụ sóóró koroarị ḅara kụrọ fọ́rụ anị ofuro maẹrẹ.
english_text: and the stars in the sky fell to earth, as figs drop from a fig tree when shaken by a strong wind.

ibani_text: So ma ẹmẹẹfaam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nnị ikosi ibila, tụ́ndụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na ogbosúányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị fịnịkiri warisom.
english_text: The heavens receded like a scroll being rolled up, and every mountain and island was removed from its place.

ibani_text: Anịsáa tuminikiri ámányánáapụ, na táarịapụ, na ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdaapụ, na igbii nyánáapụ na kụrọapụ na pịghị jẹ́apụ, omoniapụ na furoawọ nna ḅụ ḅọghum tụ́ndụ́ angaá sa fịnị olulu bie, okpo dapịrị sughu na opu tụ́ndụ ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Then the kings of the earth, the princes, the generals, the rich, the mighty, and everyone else, both slave and free, hid in caves and among the rocks of the mountains.

ibani_text: Nnị warị okpo dapịrị ma na tụ́ndụ ma ḅẹẹ, Bịghị wa pụ́nụ́ma sị wa gbẹ́ẹ̄ imine ma ọ́gọ́nọ fịnịḅọ ma tọ́rụ́ ḅụ na pịghị Ánáná Tụwọ ma igani ḅụ!
english_text: They called to the mountains and the rocks, “Fall on us and hide usfrom the face of him who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb!

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ nna igani ma opu éné ḅoomam, tụọ ine sẹ bẹ?
english_text: For the great day of theirwrath has come, and who can withstand it?”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá a ínia sookumuapụ arịm tuminikiri ma ínia ọkọlọbị ḅụ sẹ́fịnịnapụ, nnị tuminikiri ínia fọ́rụ ma ọ́lọm sị gbẹ́rẹ́ fọ́rụ sọ ofurobịgha ḅara kiri ọgọnọ anịgha tọ́rụ́ ḅụ anịgha sị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth to prevent any wind from blowing on the land or on the sea or on any tree.

ibani_text: A pịghị jẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịm ịrụa ma sághịarị ngá sághị ḅooḅọ dumafịnị Tamuno ilíghíma suanyẹ ọ́lọ́ḅọ. Ori kụrọ pụghọ pa ínia sookumuapụ ma sịm, Tamuno kụrọ pa pịrịmáapụ ḅẹẹ nnị tuminikiri ma na tọ́rụ́ ma simaa.
english_text: Then I saw another angel coming up from the east, having the seal of the living God. He called out in a loud voice to the four angels who had been given power to harm the land and the sea:

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma ḅẹm, Na nyẹ pa tuminikiri ma lama ma, tọ́rụ́ ma anịgha sị mamgba na ákị mú wa ilíghíma pa wámịna Tamuno ma fịrịnwangịapụ fụ́ḅára ogbo sua sa láa.
english_text: “Do not harm the land or the sea or the trees until we put a seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God.”

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị dugho i pịrịm, Tamuno ilíghíma ma nyánáapụ ma kịẹbịpị anịị túminị́ mmẹẹ́ fa si púghú. Nnị Izirẹlị oyi mmẹẹ́ a túminị́ ọrụ ma ḅụ sághị ḅoom.
english_text: Then I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000 from all the tribes of Israel.

ibani_text: Juda túminị́ ọrụ ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ anị n ḅụ ilíghíma suaapụ. Rubẹn túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Gad túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ,
english_text: From the tribe of Judah 12,000 were sealed, from the tribe of Reuben 12,000, from the tribe of Gad 12,000,

ibani_text: Asaa túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ Naftalai túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Manasị túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ,
english_text: from the tribe of Asher 12,000, from the tribe of Naphtali 12,000, from the tribe of Manasseh 12,000,

ibani_text: Simioni túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Livai túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Isaka túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ,
english_text: from the tribe of Simeon 12,000, from the tribe of Levi 12,000, from the tribe of Issachar 12,000,

ibani_text: Zebulọn túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Josẹf túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ, Benjamin túminị́ ọrụ gbẹ́rẹ́ púghú na oyia ndẹ́ẹ.
english_text: from the tribe of Zebulun 12,000, from the tribe of Joseph 12,000, from the tribe of Benjamin 12,000.

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, a dighim warị tọgha tọgha túminị́ arịị tumḅọ ine kịẹbịgha túminị́! Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ túminị́, ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ, sẹ sẹ sẹ ḅụ na pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ bịpị ḅụ! Nnị pị́na koro bịtẹ suam sị Ánáná Tụwọ ma tórúku sẹ́fịnịarị na pịghị imine ma tórúku n pịghị dim ḅara ọlọm n ḅárabie.
english_text: After this I looked, and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands.

ibani_text: Nnị warị kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghú: Dụaḅọ́rọ́ma fịnị wámịna Tamuno pịrịị, imine ma ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ, na pịghị fịnị Ánáná Tụwọ ma pịrịị!
english_text: And they cried out in a loud voice: “Salvation belongs to our God, who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb.”

ibani_text: Sookumuapụ mamgba sẹ imine ma ikelekelemam sẹ́nịapụ ma na pịghị dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma. Nnị nna fụ́ḅárá pa kiri iḅom imine ma tórúku susi Tamuno pịrịm.
english_text: All the angels were standing around the throne and around the elders and the four living creatures. They fell down on their faces before the throne and worshiped God,

ibani_text: Si ḅẹarị ḅẹẹ: Anị ọkọ fịnịị! Túminí na boma na níminyẹ na ịmịẹḅam ḅẹẹ, na kuu, na kụrọ na ịnyọ fịnị wamịna Tamuno pịrị akị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa. Anị ọkọ fịnịị!
english_text: saying: “Amen! Praise and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and power and strength be to our God for ever and ever. Amen!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa sẹ́nịapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ igbilam, Mịnaapụ ma tẹ́apụ pị́napị́na bịtẹ suapụ ma, n pịghị tẹ́ angaá sághị ḅoo?
english_text: Then one of the elders asked me, “These in white robes—who are they, and where did they come from?”

ibani_text: A pagharam ḅẹẹ, Inyanaḅọ ịrị anịị nimiḅọ. Ọ warị i ḅẹẹ, Mịnaapụ ma anịị opu ḅụḅáláḅálá ma bie sághị tulupágháḅoapụ; nnị nna bịtẹ sịrịmam sị mịẹsị anị pị́na Ánáná Tụwọ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ bie.
english_text: I answered, “Sir, you know.” And he said, “These are they who have come out of the great tribulation; they have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

ibani_text: Anịị n goo, Tamuno imine ma tórúku sẹ nyẹ si dii na ḅáa ḅụ fịrịnwangị ọ pịrịarị ori Tamunoopuwarị bie. Ori imine ma ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma ọ tórúku n koko warịbẹm.
english_text: Therefore, “they are before the throne of God and serve him day and night in his temple; and he who sits on the throne will shelter them with his presence.

ibani_text: Ḅuru mịnị jẹ́ pa n tarịbịgha, n pụghọ mịnị jẹ́ pa sámụ́nọ́bịgha. Ịrụa mịnị jẹ́ pa n fọọbịgha, Gbẹ́rẹ́nyẹ sọ mịnị n dọ́ghụmabịgha.
english_text: ‘Never again will they hunger; never again will they thirst. The sun will not beat down on them,’ nor any scorching heat.

ibani_text: Tegó Ánáná Tụwọ ma imine ma ogboku fịnịḅọ ma anịị nna Ánánákúrúḅọ; ori n ḅọ́rọ́ma duma mingi siḅe muubẹm. Tamuno pịghị owu mingi gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ síbẹm nna tọ́rụ́ ḅụ.
english_text: For the Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd; ‘he will lead them to springs of living water.’ ‘And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.’”

ibani_text: Ánáná Tụwọ ma sọ́nọ́ma kárámá sị n gbẹpalị agbā ma sii sáá, sobie yaghúu fịnịm ákị mú gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ mpara láa.
english_text: When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a wárị sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ arịị Tamuno tórúku sẹapụ, n warị sọ́nọ́ma ọdụ pa n pịrịị.
english_text: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ sookumuḅọ, odoḅala Insẹnsị suanyẹ ọlọḅọ ḅoo ẹ́bẹ ma angásá sẹm. Nnị tọgha Insẹnsị pa ọ pịrịm ḅẹẹ sị ori anị dọ́ghụ́ma imine ma tórúku fịnị odoḅala ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ, Insẹnsị ma kụ́nụ́ Tamuno túminị́ mamgba tẹ́ghẹ̄ na gwaa bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Another angel, who had a golden censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given much incense to offer, with the prayers of all God’s people, on the golden altar in front of the throne.

ibani_text: Insẹnsị ma onwi ma na Tamuno túminị́ ma tẹ́ghẹ̄ sookumuḅọ ma ḅara sághị iwóo Tamuno tórúku múm.
english_text: The smoke of the incense, together with the prayers of God’s people, went up before God from the angel’s hand.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sookumuḅọ ma warị Insẹnsị suanyẹ ma ákị warị ẹ́bẹ ma ọ́gọ́nọ fịnị fị́nị ma pa anị sua bima, warị anị pa tuminikiri ma gbii. Tuminikiri warị sághị dari so alágbā fiem, sofịnị kọrịkọrị bim, tuminikiri warị jighe.
english_text: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and hurled it on the earth; and there came peals of thunder, rumblings, flashes of lightning and an earthquake.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma ọdụ ma ọlọapụ ma warị nna ḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma nnị ọdụ ma ofuro bẹ ḅára.
english_text: Then the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared to sound them.

ibani_text: Parị sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofurom, onwo mgbọ́lụ kịkama itii, na fịnị, ọmbịnyẹ́ pa gwaa nyẹ, anịị págháḅo nyẹ n warị anị pa tuminikiri ma gbii. Tuminikiri ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá dọ́ghụm, sị ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá dọ́ghụm, osuka gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ dọghụ fámam.
english_text: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was hurled down on the earth. A third of the earth was burned up, a third of the trees were burned up, and all the green grass was burned up.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofurom n warị dọghụarị opu tụ́ndụ kịkamanyẹ pa tọ́rụ́ ma bie gbii. Tọ́rụ́ ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá pịghị ọmbịnyẹ́ sọm.
english_text: The second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain, all ablaze, was thrown into the sea. A third of the sea turned into blood,

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́ ma bie dumafịnị nyẹ pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá fịfámam. Onwi árụ́ ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá gulugulum.
english_text: a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori ọdụ ofuroo. Opuma dụḅa ḅálōló fịnịtuu kọrị ḅara pa kọrịarị nyẹ sobie sághị sóórókórom warị tọ́rụ́ mamgba pa tẹ́rẹ́ a kiri die anị ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅụ koro, na pịghị mingi sághị págháḅo págháḅo angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ koro.
english_text: The third angel sounded his trumpet, and a great star, blazing like a torch, fell from the sky on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water—

ibani_text: Ḅálōló ma ẹ́rẹ́ anịị, Akụụ. Mingi ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá sághị akụụm, mingi ma ḅuu tọghaapụ fịịm tegó mingi ma sághị akụ́mam.
english_text: the name of the star is Wormwood.A third of the waters turned bitter, and many people died from the waters that had become bitter.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ini kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori ọdụ ofuroo. Ịrụa ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá n nyẹ pa anị láamam, akalụ́ pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá n nyẹ pa anị láamam, ḅálōló pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá n nyẹ pa anị láamam, anịgo nna baá mamgba pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá mịnị kọrịgha; éné ma pa gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá baá nyanagha dii ma sọ pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅo kánákánám.
english_text: The fourth angel sounded his trumpet, and a third of the sun was struck, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of them turned dark. A third of the day was without light, and also a third of the night.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, a warị dighi, a ọ́gọ́nọ ju fiighiarị ogbólílo ọwụ naam kụrọ pụghọ pa ilúghuarịnyẹ, Tọ́rụ́siarị! Tọ́rụ́siarị! Opu tọ́rụ́siarị anị fịnị tuminikiriapụ pịrịbẹnyẹ! Kọọ tẹ́rẹ́ a sookumuapụ ma nna ọdụ ma ofuro bẹ sáá!
english_text: As I watched, I heard an eagle that was flying in midair call out in a loud voice: “Woe! Woe! Woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the trumpet blasts about to be sounded by the other three angels!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofurom, a warị gbẹ́rẹ́ ḅálōló arịị sobie sághị tuminikiri sóórókórómáa nyẹ. Nnị warị sughu nyanagha póghóló kiri ḅụ́pọ́ igodo findinyẹ pa anị pịrịị.
english_text: The fifth angel sounded his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from the sky to the earth. The star was given the key to the shaft of the Abyss.

ibani_text: Ḅálōló ma sughu nyanagha póghóló kiri ma findi sáá, onwi warị anị angaá sághị págháḅo sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mánámāná fịnị dọghụarị angaá págháḅoarị onwi; póghóló kiri ma bie págháḅoarị onwi ma warị ịrụa ma na so ma kánákáná ma.
english_text: When he opened the Abyss, smoke rose from it like the smoke from a gigantic furnace. The sun and sky were darkened by the smoke from the Abyss.

ibani_text: Onwi ma bie nyẹ́ sima ápịrịgbánị sághị págháḅo tuminikiri bie sọm n warị ámánẹ́ngịa nyáná kụrọ pa nnị pịrị.
english_text: And out of the smoke locusts came down on the earth and were given power like that of scorpions of the earth.

ibani_text: Nnị dugho nnị pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị nyẹ́ pa tuminikiri osuka ma láma ma anịgha ḅẹ́ jẹ́ sị; anịgha n dipinyẹ; nnị nyẹ pa lama bẹapụ anịị Tamuno ilíghíma ma nyánágháapụ nna fụ́ḅára ogbo.
english_text: They were told not to harm the grass of the earth or any plant or tree, but only those people who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads.

ibani_text: Nnị kụrọ pa nyẹ́ sima ápịrịgbánị ma pịrịgha ḅẹ́ anị mịná túminị́ ma ḅá, kụ́ma sọ́nọ́ akalụ́ pa túminị́ ma pa tọ́rụ́siarịma. Nnị árị ḅụakụ ma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ámánẹ́ngịa tumḅọ tẹ́ angaá.
english_text: They were not allowed to kill them but only to torture them for five months. And the agony they suffered was like that of the sting of a scorpion when it strikes.

ibani_text: Mịná sọ́nọ́ akalụ́ ma ḅụ, n fịị dọghụbẹm, kụ́ma n fịị arịbịgha, n pịghị dọghụbẹm ḅẹẹ n fịị, kụ́ma fịị nna ḅụ mangịbẹm.
english_text: During those days people will seek death but will not find it; they will long to die, but death will elude them.

ibani_text: Nyẹ́ sima ápịrịgbánị ma fịnị ḅara anịị tẹ́lẹ́ma sị ọ́mụ́gbi dọ́ghụ́ ásụ fịnị ḅara; nna sịbị n suanyẹ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ odoḅala pa mịẹ ogunu, nna toruku sọ túminị́ tórúku kịkam.
english_text: The locusts looked like horses prepared for battle. On their heads they wore something like crowns of gold, and their faces resembled human faces.

ibani_text: Ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ sịbị núme fịnị ḅara anịị nna sịbị núme fịnị ḅara ọkụ nama aka fịnị ḅara anịị nna aka fịnị ḅara.
english_text: Their hair was like women’s hair, and their teeth were like lions’ teeth.

ibani_text: Nnị pa nna kúkúbie gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ anịị nnị ikúlélu pa tẹ́mẹ́ kúkúbie gbẹ́nyẹ, nna pamba ma ḅụ ḅoarị ọwụ soḅọ́rọọ́ n tọgha ásụ, tọgha ọmụgbi árụ́ nụnụ pa ọ́mụ́gbi múuarị nyẹ.
english_text: They had breastplates like breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the thundering of many horses and chariots rushing into battle.

ibani_text: Nnị otume nyanam ámánẹ́ngịa tẹ́arị ḅara pa tẹ́arị nyẹ, nna otume ma bie fịnị árị ma ine mịẹbẹm sị túminị́ sọ́nọ́ akalụ́ pa obii.
english_text: They had tails with stingers, like scorpions, and in their tails they had power to torment people for five months.

ibani_text: Nnị ámányánáḅọ nyánam n táarịḅọ, anịị sughu nyanagha póghóló kiri ma didighiarịḅọ. Ori ẹ́rẹ́ Hiburu ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ anịị Abadon: Giriki ḅụ ori ẹrẹ anịị Apoliyọn dughoarị nyẹ bẹ ori, Nyẹ gulugulumaḅọ.
english_text: They had as king over them the angel of the Abyss, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon and in Greek is Apollyon (that is, Destroyer).

ibani_text: Parị opu ḅáláfama nyẹ ma ḅọ́rọ́mam; mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, jẹ́ mmẹẹ́ opu ḅáláfama nyẹ tórúku ḅoarị.
english_text: The first woe is past; two other woes are yet to come.

ibani_text: Anịsáa suene kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofurom. A warị pụghọ naam odoḅala ẹ́bẹ ma ikpangi ḅụ sághị ḅoarị nyẹ. Tamuno ma tórúku fịnịnyẹ.
english_text: The sixth angel sounded his trumpet, and I heard a voice coming from the four horns of the golden altar that is before God.

ibani_text: Pụghọ ma ọdụ ma ọlọ suene kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ḅẹ́m, Ufretis opu tọ́rụ́ ḅụ nnị ịkasị ínia sookumuapụ ma wáriso!
english_text: It said to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.”

ibani_text: Ínia sookumuapụ ma, n tẹ́lẹ́ma pa mịị sáá ma pịrịapụ mịị éné ma, mịị akalụ́ ma na mịị kụ́rá pịrịapụ ma, nnị n fịịmam sị túminị́ ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ a kiri die n gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅá.
english_text: And the four angels who had been kept ready for this very hour and day and month and year were released to kill a third of mankind.

ibani_text: Nnị dugho i pịrịm ḅẹ́ nnị tẹ́lẹ́ma warị ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ma anịị túminị́ púghú suene a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi.
english_text: The number of the mounted troops was twice ten thousand times ten thousand. I heard their number.

ibani_text: Múnogha dáwọ ḅụ arịị ásụ ma na ásụ dọghụarịapụ ma mịị nnị fịnị ḅara: nna kúkúbie kikima nyẹ áwụ biam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ fịnị, buluu biam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ safaya, odoḅala bia ḅára biam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọpọlịḅuruma. Ásụ ma sịbị akụ nama sịbị kịkam, nna bịpịbie fịnị na onwi na ọpọlịḅuruma sághị págháḅom.
english_text: The horses and riders I saw in my vision looked like this: Their breastplates were fiery red, dark blue, and yellow as sulfur. The heads of the horses resembled the heads of lions, and out of their mouths came fire, smoke and sulfur.

ibani_text: Mịị tẹ́rẹ́ a tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma anịị fịnị ma, onwi ma, na pịghị ọpọlịḅuruma ma ásụ ma bịpịbie sághị págháḅoarị nyẹ, tuminikiri gbọrụ ma pa tẹ́rẹ́ a kiri die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá ḅáfamam.
english_text: A third of mankind was killed by the three plagues of fire, smoke and sulfur that came out of their mouths.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ ásụ ma nna kụrọ nna bịpịbie na nna otume ḅụ anịị anị fịnịnyẹ, nna otume fịnị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ sịbị nyáná ododó ine nyẹ pa kị́nị́ láama bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The power of the horses was in their mouths and in their tails; for their tails were like snakes, having heads with which they inflict injury.

ibani_text: Mịị tẹ́rẹ́ tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma ḅaghaapụ sị kọapụ ma, n mịnị nna mịẹnyẹ ḅụ pịghịgha, n pa susi oru pịrịarị, na pịghị nnị odoḅala pa kara nyẹ na pị́naḅala nyẹ, ọjọ bala nyẹ, dapịrị na sị na, mịnanyẹ anịị n kárányẹ, ine nyẹ arịgha nyẹ, nyẹ naagha nyẹ anịgha ine nwángịgha nyẹ.
english_text: The rest of mankind who were not killed by these plagues still did not repent of the work of their hands; they did not stop worshiping demons, and idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone and wood—idols that cannot see or hear or walk.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị mịnị nna kị́nị́ḅáa sii ma ḅụ pịghịgha nna kirikiri egberi ikiakoro ḅụ pịghịgha nna yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị anịgha nna fúrú duma ḅụ.
english_text: Nor did they repent of their murders, their magic arts, their sexual immorality or their thefts.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị jẹ́ opu sookumuḅọ arịị sobie sághị kóróḅoarịḅọ. Oḅuto ọ gbẹ́ẹ̄ ikélekélem so sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ suabịtẹ, ọdum warị ọ sịbị ikelekelema; o tórúku sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ịrụa ma, ọ ḅụọ sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ n fịnị ḅụ fịnịkiri pie sị.
english_text: Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven. He was robed in a cloud, with a rainbow above his head; his face was like the sun, and his legs were like fiery pillars.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅarabie o findi gbẹ́rẹ́ kálá iko diri ọlọm. Ori ọrẹ amaḅara ḅụọ pa tọ́rụ́ ḅụ gbánam warị ori ẹ́rẹ́ḅara ḅụọ pa kiri ọ́gọ́nọ gbánāa.
english_text: He was holding a little scroll, which lay open in his hand. He planted his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,

ibani_text: Warị opu pụghọ pa ilúghú págháma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọkụ nama ikerearị ngaa. Ori ilúghú sáá, soalagba sọ́nọ́ma sa pa pagharam.
english_text: and he gave a loud shout like the roar of a lion. When he shouted, the voices of the seven thunders spoke.

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ma so alágbā ma ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sáá, a sághị gịẹ dọ́ghụm, kụ́ma a pụghọ naam sobie sághị ḅoo nyẹ, ḅẹẹ, Pa ḅọ́ghu ḅara ḅụ wárị sọ́nọ́ma so alágbā ma dughonyẹ; anị gịẹ kóróma ma!
english_text: And when the seven thunders spoke, I was about to write; but I heard a voice from heaven say, “Seal up what the seven thunders have said and do not write it down.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a árịị sookumuḅọ ma tọ́rụ ḅụ na kiri ọ́gọ́nọ sẹ́fịnịḅọ ma wárị ọ ḅara sághị so daa.
english_text: Then the angel I had seen standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven.

ibani_text: Warị nyẹ karịfị duma gbámásó Tamuno ma ẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ, so na kiri ma tẹ́mẹ́ ḅoo na tọ́rụ́ ma na, na pịghị anị bie fịnịnyẹ mamgba. Anịma ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, ọ warị ḅẹẹ, Sáá ngúmá mịnị oforibịgha!
english_text: And he swore by him who lives for ever and ever, who created the heavens and all that is in them, the earth and all that is in it, and the sea and all that is in it, and said, “There will be no more delay!

ibani_text: Kụ́ma sọ́nọ́ma kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofuroo sáá, anịsáa Tamuno o tọ́ọ si ḅọghu warị nyẹ mịẹbẹm, o pịghị dugho ori fịrịnwangị ikiakoroapụ ma pịrị ḅara.
english_text: But in the days when the seventh angel is about to sound his trumpet, the mystery of God will be accomplished, just as he announced to his servants the prophets.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa sobie a parị naamaá pụghọ ma sima ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrịm ḅẹẹ, Muu n findi diri ma ákịị, tọ́rụ́ ḅụ na kiri ọ́gọ́nọ ḅụ sẹ́fịnịarị sookumuḅọ ma ḅara.
english_text: Then the voice that I had heard from heaven spoke to me once more: “Go, take the scroll that lies open in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land.”

ibani_text: A sookumuḅọ ma damamum ḅẹẹ ori nnị iko kálá diri ma pa i pịrịị. Ori i ḅẹ́m, Anị ákịị sị fịị, anị angịbẹm i furobie kụ́ma i bịpịbie anị akamapulo ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅara pa ḅẹ́lẹ́bẹm.
english_text: So I went to the angel and asked him to give me the little scroll. He said to me, “Take it and eat it. It will turn your stomach sour, but ‘in your mouth it will be as sweet as honey.’”

ibani_text: A kálá iko diri ma ákịm ọ ḅarabie sị anị fịị, anị warị akamapulo ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅara pa ḅẹ́lẹ̄ i bịpịbie, kụ́ma a anị mẹnị sáá anị ḅo i furobie angịmam.
english_text: I took the little scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it. It tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I had eaten it, my stomach turned sour.

ibani_text: Nnị warị jẹ́ pa dugho i pịrị ḅẹẹ, Ị Tamuno ibi oku ma dugho wásámabẹm tọgha tọgha sẹ gbolomanyẹ, tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ túminị́ gbolomanyẹ, na kirikiri ama ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ fiearịapụ gbolomanyẹ na pịghị tọgha ámányánáapụ gboloma nyẹ.
english_text: Then I was told, “You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages and kings.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa n warị sị́ị́ pa i pịrị kiri tọ́nyẹ kịkanyẹ n warị i ḅẹẹ, Muu Tọ́ntọ́ Tamunoopuwarị ma tọ́ọ na pịghị igwagwaá ẹ́bẹ ma tọ́ọ, sị pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie susi ọ pịrịarịapụ ma kịẹ.
english_text: I was given a reed like a measuring rod and was told, “Go and measure the temple of God and the altar, with its worshipers.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ẹpẹlẹ́ ma tọ́ọ ma, tegó nnị anị pa Juughaapụ ma pịrịmam, akalụ́ a mmẹẹ́ si na mmẹẹ́ akalụ́ pa ḅụọ pa tọ́ntọ́ opuámá ma nánga bẹapụ.
english_text: But exclude the outer court; do not measure it, because it has been given to the Gentiles. They will trample on the holy city for 42 months.

ibani_text: A ị́yẹ́ mmẹẹ́ onyésẹapụ fịrịmabẹm duadubịtẹ sua bẹapụ, nnị Tamuno oku ma dugho wásámabẹm dii tẹ́rẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ na tẹ́rẹ́ a si (1,260).
english_text: And I will appoint my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, clothed in sackcloth.”

ibani_text: Mịị mmẹẹ́ a onyésẹapụ ma anịị mmẹẹ́ olivu pa sị sị́ị́ ma na pịghị mmẹẹ́ tọndọ gbananyẹ. Mịná mmẹẹ́ owiapụ ma tuminikiri ma Nyánáḅọ ma tórúku sẹm.
english_text: They are “the two olive trees” and the two lampstands, and “they stand before the Lord of the earth.”

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ pa n láama bi ḅo fịnịfịnị, fịnị nna bịpịbie sághị págháḅobẹm sị nna iruonaapụ gulugulumabẹm. Mịị ḅara ma nyẹ pa n lama biḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị nḅọ ḅáabẹm.
english_text: If anyone tries to harm them, fire comes from their mouths and devours their enemies. This is how anyone who wants to harm them must die.

ibani_text: Nnị kụrọ nyanam sị ine so ma gbẹpalị ḅẹẹ iti kóróma, n mịị Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma dugho pághámaarị sáá. Nnị pịghị kụrọ nyanam si mingi fịnịanga gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị si anị ọmbịnyẹ́ sọọ; n pịghị kụrọ nyanam sị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá pa tuminikiri ma gbii, n dọghụ sáá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́.
english_text: They have power to shut up the heavens so that it will not rain during the time they are prophesying; and they have power to turn the waters into blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they want.

ibani_text: Nnị nna oku dugho wásáma fama sáá sughu nyanagha póghóló kiri sághị págháḅoarị pirinama ma owu pa n pághámabẹm. Ori n sọḅabẹm sị n ḅáa,
english_text: Now when they have finished their testimony, the beast that comes up from the Abyss will attack them, and overpower and kill them.

ibani_text: nna ojumẹnị gbikóró fịnịbẹm opuámá ma asọ ḅụ, nnị nna Nyánáḅọ ḅaupálị angaá. Mịị ámá ma ti ẹ́rẹ́ anịị Sodom anịgha Ijipiti.
english_text: Their bodies will lie in the public square of the great city—which is figuratively called Sodom and Egypt—where also their Lord was crucified.

ibani_text: Túminị́ sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ mamgba, túminị́ ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ mamgba, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ mamgba na túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅoo tẹ́rẹ́ a dii na mpara pa nna dua ma dighibẹm sị pịghị minibịgha sị nnị anị dipii.
english_text: For three and a half days some from every people, tribe, language and nation will gaze on their bodies and refuse them burial.

ibani_text: Tuminikiriapụ bieḅẹlẹbẹm mị mmẹapụ ma fịị gosi. Nnị álálị fịbẹm sị nyẹ die jụghọ jụghọ pịrịị, tegó mịná mmẹẹ́ a ikiakoroapụ ma opu tọ́rụ́siarị pa tuminikiriapụ pa tọ́rụ́siarịmam.
english_text: The inhabitants of the earth will gloat over them and will celebrate by sending each other gifts, because these two prophets had tormented those who live on the earth.

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ a dii na mpara ḅo ḅọ́rọ́ sáá, duma pịrị fọ́rụ Tamuno ḅárábie sághị ḅoo nna ḅụ sọọm, n warị sághị sẹ; nna árịịapụ mamgba warị ḅáláfaa.
english_text: But after the three and a half days the breathof life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet, and terror struck those who saw them.

ibani_text: Anịsáa mmẹẹ́ a ikiakoroapụ ma warị opu pụghọ náa sobie sághị n ḅẹẹarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Iwóo mịngáá ḅoo! Nna iruonaapụ pa dighiarị sáá nnị oḅuto bie ḅọ́rọ́ sobie múm.
english_text: Then they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, “Come up here.” And they went up to heaven in a cloud, while their enemies looked on.

ibani_text: Anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá ma ḅụ opu kirijighe warị kiri ákị; opuámá ma pa oyia kiri die gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá gulugulum n warị pịghị túminị́ tẹ́rẹ́ faá sị a ndẹ́ẹ na oyia si ḅáa. Kọọapụ ḅáláfa ḅoo nna ḅụ bẹ sọọm n warị sobie Tamuno ma opu túmíní.
english_text: At that very hour there was a severe earthquake and a tenth of the city collapsed. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the survivors were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá opu ḅáláfama nyẹ ma ḅọ́rọ́mam, kụ́ma tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá nyẹ ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ ḅoobẹm!
english_text: The second woe has passed; the third woe is coming soon.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ma kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori ọdụ ofurom, sobie tọgha opu pụghọ warị sághị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹẹ, Tuminikiri gbọrụ ma taá kụrọ mị́sa fịnị wámịna Nyánáḅọ na ori n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ma pịrịmam, ọ pịghị taábẹm ákị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láabẹm.
english_text: The seventh angel sounded his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven, which said: “The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Messiah, and he will reign for ever and ever.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa, si ínia sẹ́nịapụ ma Tamuno tórúku nna imine ḅụ kpọrọfịnịapụ ma warị nna ḅụ pa kiri gbi warị fụ́ḅára pa kiri i ḅoo sị susi Tamuno pịrị.
english_text: And the twenty-four elders, who were seated on their thrones before God, fell on their faces and worshiped God,

ibani_text: Dughoarị ḅẹẹ: Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno, mị́sa duma fịnịḅọ na pịghị ḅọ́rọ́maa sa énéné duma fịnịḅọ! Wa ịmịẹḅam pa i ḅẹm, ḅẹ́ ị ị́yẹ́ opu kụrọ ákịmam, i pịghị sághị táamam!
english_text: saying: “We give thanks to you, Lord God Almighty, the One who is and who was, because you have taken your great power and have begun to reign.

ibani_text: Juughaapụ ma opu tẹ́mẹ́ ákụ ḅoo nna bie sọọm; tegó ị́yẹ́ igani sa ḅoo láamam. Nnị fịịapụ ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ bẹ sáá láamam, Ị́ ịyẹa fịrịnwangịapụ, ikiakoroapụ ma gbẹ́nyẹ pa n gbẹ́ẹ̄ bẹ sa, na pịghị ị́yẹ́ túminị́ mamgba, na ị́yẹ́ ẹ́rẹ́ osiapụ mamgba opuapụ na káláapụ na. Sáá ma láamam ị tuminikiri ma gulugulumaapụ guluguluma bẹ sáá!
english_text: The nations were angry, and your wrath has come. The time has come for judging the dead, and for rewarding your servants the prophets and your people who revere your name, both great and small— and for destroying those who destroy the earth.”

ibani_text: Nnị sobie Tamunoopuwarị ma findim, nnị warị Ọḅọọ Igbe ma arịị anị ngaa. Anịsáa n warị sofịnị arịị kọrịkọrị biiarị, so dárịarị so alágbā fiearị, kirijighe, na pịghị opu mgbọ́lụ iti kóróarị ḅara pa koroarị nyẹ.
english_text: Then God’s temple in heaven was opened, and within his temple was seen the ark of his covenant. And there came flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder, an earthquake and a severe hailstorm.

ibani_text: Anịsáa opuma ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma anị ḅụ diem sobie. Gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ imii, árị suabịtẹ anịị ịrụa ma, a warị akalụ́ ma nyáná a ḅụọ sughu warị oyi mmẹẹ́ a ḅálōló nyáná ogunu nyáná a sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: A great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet and a crown of twelve stars on her head.

ibani_text: A fúram, tụwọ yii ḅụakụ ma warị mịẹsị árị owu págháma, yii biri láa sa.
english_text: She was pregnant and cried out in pain as she was about to give birth.

ibani_text: Jẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma ilíghíma anị ḅụ diem sobie gbẹ́rẹ́ opuma dụḅa áwụ bia sị ḅụọ nyáná ododó imii, anị sọ́nọ́ma sịbị nyánam na oyia ikpangi na pịghị sọ́nọ́ma ogunu nyánam anị sịbị ọ́gọ́nọ.
english_text: Then another sign appeared in heaven: an enormous red dragon with seven heads and ten horns and seven crowns on its heads.

ibani_text: Sobie fịnị ḅálōló pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá die anị ótume gbẹ́rẹ́ angaá nụ́nụ́ ákịm warị n pa tuminikiri gbii. Ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma yii ọlọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma tórúku sẹm sị ori tụwọ ma pẹẹ́ bẹ ḅara árị anị yii gbẹ́rẹ́kiri.
english_text: Its tail swept a third of the stars out of the sky and flung them to the earth. The dragon stood in front of the woman who was about to give birth, so that it might devour her child the moment he was born.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị ḅoo owitụ́wọ yii, ikúlélu agbara pa sẹ gbọrụ ma táa bẹḅọ. Kụ́ma n tụwọ ma pughosim sị anị pa Tamuno na ori imine pịrịị.
english_text: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who “will rule all the nations with an iron scepter.”And her child was snatched up to God and to his throne.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma mangị elesiri múm, Tamuno tẹ́lẹ́ma warị a pịrịmaá angaá nnị a táa kubiri bẹ angaá dii tẹ́rẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ na tẹ́rẹ́ si.
english_text: The woman fled into the wilderness to a place prepared for her by God, where she might be taken care of for 1,260 days.

ibani_text: Anịsáa owu warị ḅoo koro sobie, gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuapụ sịbịdaḅọ Maikel pa sịḅọ na ori sookumuapụ warị owu pa ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma págháma, ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma na ori sookumuapụ warị pịghị sima owu pa n págháma.
english_text: Then war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nnị ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma na ori sookumuapụ ma sọḅam, nnị warị n deepágháma si mịnị jẹ́ pa minigha si ori na ori sookumuapụ sobie fị́nị.
english_text: But he was not strong enough, and they lost their place in heaven.

ibani_text: Opuma dụḅa ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma nnị anị gbi pághámam, anị olom kiri nwángị ododó ma ẹ́kpẹ́dua anịgha Satanị pa sịḅọ, oḅori pa tuminikiri mamgba sịḅọ. Nnị o gbi kórómam tuminikiri, ori na ori sookumuapụ.
english_text: The great dragon was hurled down—that ancient serpent called the devil, or Satan, who leads the whole world astray. He was hurled to the earth, and his angels with him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị sobie opu pụghọ náa dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Mị́sa Tamuno dụaḅọ́rọ́ma ḅomam! Mị́sa Tamuno ori kụrọ diemam ḅẹẹ ori anịị Ámányánáḅọ! Mị́sa ori n Pulo pa Sịbị Saraḅọ ori kụ́rọ diemam! Wámịna Tamuno tórúku sẹ́fịnị si ḅẹ́rẹ́ pa dii na ḅáa na wámịna mịnaapụ sịbị sẹarịḅọ ma nnị sobie o gbi pághámamam.
english_text: Then I heard a loud voice in heaven say: “Now have come the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Messiah. For the accuser of our brothers and sisters, who accuses them before our God day and night, has been hurled down.

ibani_text: Ánáná tụ́wọ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ na, nna dugho págháma karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ anịị n pa ọ sọ́ḅa nyẹ. Nnị tẹ́lẹ́ma sị nna duma kóróma fịị pịrịm.
english_text: They triumphed over him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony; they did not love their lives so much as to shrink from death.

ibani_text: Anịgosi ọ bieḅẹlẹ ọmịnị so na anị bie ngaapụ! Kụ́ma anị opuma sii tuminikiri na tọ́rụ́ ma na pịrịm! Ḅẹẹ ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma ọ dámáḅómam! Ọ pịghị opuma iganịarị, tegó o nimim ḅẹẹ kálá sáá tụwọ anịị kọọ ọ pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: Therefore rejoice, you heavens and you who dwell in them! But woe to the earth and the sea, because the devil has gone down to you! He is filled with fury, because he knows that his time is short.”

ibani_text: Ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma árị́ḅoo sáá ḅẹẹ nnị anị gbi pa tuminikiri pịrịmam, ọ warị sághị owitụ́wọ yii ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma dua.
english_text: When the dragon saw that he had been hurled to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child.

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹẹ́ opu ogbólílo pamba pa a pịrịm sị a fiighi n tẹ́lẹ́ma warị a pịrị ngaa muu elesiri ḅụ, nnị a siḅe bẹ angaá tẹ́rẹ́ a kụ́rá na mpara, ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma ine ḅara pa a gbọbịgha angaá.
english_text: The woman was given the two wings of a great eagle, so that she might fly to the place prepared for her in the wilderness, where she would be taken care of for a time, times and half a time, out of the serpent’s reach.

ibani_text: Anịsáa ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma warị ọ bịpịbie opu mingi ọsụ pághámaḅo opu mingi ma a dighiákị bẹ ḅara.
english_text: Then from his mouth the serpent spewed water like a river, to overtake the woman and sweep her away with the torrent.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma tuminikiri ma ḅárásua ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pịrịm, anịị anị bịpị findim sị ḅụọ nyáná ododó bịpị págháḅo mingi ma menịm.
english_text: But the earth helped the woman by opening its mouth and swallowing the river that the dragon had spewed out of his mouth.

ibani_text: Ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma warị ḅoo opuma bieoḅu ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma pịrị warị pịghị sị sághị owu pa a furobie págháḅoapụ mamgba págháma, Tamuno ólóghó kokoarịapụ mamgba pịghị karakárá ma ḅụ sẹ kụrọ Jizọs dugho págháma nyẹ ma pịrịapụ.
english_text: Then the dragon was enraged at the woman and went off to wage war against the rest of her offspring—those who keep God’s commands and hold fast their testimony about Jesus.

ibani_text: Ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma warị posie aka ma ḅụ sẹ.

Anịsáa a ḅáláfama nama arịm tọ́rụ́ ma bie sághị iwóo ḅoarị nyẹ. Anị oyia ikpangi nyánam na sọ́nọ́ma sịbị, ikpangi gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ ogunu imii, anị sịbị gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ anị ẹ́rẹ́ nyánam Tamuno dughosimaarị nyẹ.
english_text: The dragonstood on the shore of the sea. And I saw a beast coming out of the sea. It had ten horns and seven heads, with ten crowns on its horns, and on each head a blasphemous name.

ibani_text: Mịị ḅáláfama nama ma anị sị́rị kịkam, anị ḅụọ bear pa si nama ḅụọ kịkam anị bịpị ọkụ nama bịpị kịkam. Ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma anị ịnyọ na anị imine na anị mánámāná kụrọ pa ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịm.
english_text: The beast I saw resembled a leopard, but had feet like those of a bear and a mouth like that of a lion. The dragon gave the beast his power and his throne and great authority.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfáma nama ma, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ nyẹ opuma anị gbẹ́rẹ́ sịbị laam, kụ́ma anị ḅo gwọmam. Tuminikiri gbọrụ tọ́rụ́ ḅo bulubulum sị n warị ḅáláfama nama ma dua.
english_text: One of the heads of the beast seemed to have had a fatal wound, but the fatal wound had been healed. The whole world was filled with wonder and followed the beast.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́mamgba susi ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma pịrịm tegó ori ọrẹ kụrọ pa ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịmam gosi. Nnị sọ pịghị susi ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịm, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Tụọ ḅáláfáma nama ma kịka? Tụọ ine owu pa anị pághámá bẹ?
english_text: People worshiped the dragon because he had given authority to the beast, and they also worshiped the beast and asked, “Who is like the beast? Who can wage war against it?”

ibani_text: Nnị ḅáláfama nama ma warisom sị anị Tamuno dughosima, opuamịẹnyẹ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ, n pịghị anị warisom sị anị akalụ́ a mmẹẹ́ si na mmẹẹ́ akalụ́ pa kụrọ nyáná.
english_text: The beast was given a mouth to utter proud words and blasphemies and to exercise its authority for forty-two months.

ibani_text: Anị warị sághị Tamuno wirii, ori ẹrẹ wirii, Ori ngaa ngaa wirii, na pịghị sobie ngaapụ wirii.
english_text: It opened its mouth to blaspheme God, and to slander his name and his dwelling place and those who live in heaven.

ibani_text: Nnị anị warisom sị anị owu pa Tamuno túminị́ págháma sị n sọ́ḅa n pịghị kụrọ pa anị pịrịm túminị́ ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ ḅụ, sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ ḅụ, ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹlẹ ḅụ na túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́.
english_text: It was given power to wage war against God’s holy people and to conquer them. And it was given authority over every tribe, people, language and nation.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri dumafịnịapụ mamgba susi anị pịrịbẹm, tuminikiri ma na saghịgha sáá nnị ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹ kórómaapụ dumafịnịapụ ma diri bie anịị susi anị pịrịbịghaapụ, mịị diri ma nyánáḅọ anịị n ḅáa Ánáná Tụwọ ma.
english_text: All inhabitants of the earth will worship the beast—all whose names have not been written in the Lamb’s book of life, the Lamb who was slain from the creation of the world.

ibani_text: Biri nyánáḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ náa!
english_text: Whoever has ears, let them hear.

ibani_text: Nnị kuunaiḅiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anịị n kuu bẹḅọ; Nnị áláápụ́-ágidi pa ḅaanaibiapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị áláápụ́-ágidi pa n ḅaabẹm. Mịma biiarị ḅẹ́ Tamuno túminị́ ngịrịma na, minini nyánáa.
english_text: “If anyone is to go into captivity, into captivity they will go. If anyone is to be killedwith the sword, with the sword they will be killed.” This calls for patient endurance and faithfulness on the part of God’s people.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a jẹ́ ḅáláfama nama arịm tuminikiri sághị págháḅo nyẹ. Anị mmẹẹ́ a ikpangi nyanam sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ánáná tụwọ, anị warị ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma ḅara pa ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́kọọ.
english_text: Then I saw a second beast, coming out of the earth. It had two horns like a lamb, but it spoke like a dragon.

ibani_text: Anị parị ngá ḅáláfama nama ma mánámāná kụrọ pa fịrịnwangịm, parị ḅáláfama nama ma tórúku. Anị kụrọ ḅara pa mịẹm sị tuminikiri na anị bie fịnịapụ mamgba susi parị ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịị, fịịfịịḅara pa anị láanyẹ ma gwọmáa nyẹ.
english_text: It exercised all the authority of the first beast on its behalf, and made the earth and its inhabitants worship the first beast, whose fatal wound had been healed.

ibani_text: Mịị mmẹẹ́ kárámá ḅáláfama nama opuma ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịm, anị mịẹm sị fịnị sághị sobie koro ḅoo tuminikiri, kị́nị́mamgba tórúku.
english_text: And it performed great signs, even causing fire to come down from heaven to the earth in full view of the people.

ibani_text: Anị oḅori pa tuminikiri ngáarịapụ mamgba siim anịị, nnị anị wáriso si anị nwángịarị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma gosi, parị ḅáláfama nama ma tórúku. O dugho n pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị n tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ mịẹ sẹ maá, pa nyẹ láa ḅáláfama nama ma pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ mịẹ. Nnị áláápụ́-ágidi pa nyẹ́ pa anị lama nyẹ sị pa dumafịnị nyẹ.
english_text: Because of the signs it was given power to perform on behalf of the first beast, it deceived the inhabitants of the earth. It ordered them to set up an image in honor of the beast who was wounded by the sword and yet lived.

ibani_text: Nnị mmẹẹ́ kárámá ḅáláfama nama ma warisom sị anị duma ịnyọ pa n tẹ́mẹ́ warị parị ḅáláfama nama ma pịrị sị anị ine ẹ́gẹ́rẹm sị pịghị mini susi anị pịrịghaapụ mamgba ḅá.
english_text: The second beast was given power to give breath to the image of the first beast, so that the image could speak and cause all who refused to worship the image to be killed.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfáma nama ma kụrọ pa mịẹm sị túminị́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, káláapụ na opuapụ, áláápụ́ na siminiapụ ómóniapụ na furoawọ ilíghíma nyáná nna amaḅara anịgha nna fụ́ḅára ogbo ḅụ.
english_text: It also forced all people, great and small, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hands or on their foreheads,

ibani_text: Mịị ilíghíma ma nyánághaḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ nnị mini nḅọ pịrịgha nḅọ nyẹ fẹ́ anịgha ine nyẹ dẹ́rị, mịị ilíghíma ma anịị ḅáláfama nama ma ẹrẹ anịgha sẹ anị ẹrẹ ma pịrị kịẹnyẹ.
english_text: so that they could not buy or sell unless they had the mark, which is the name of the beast or the number of its name.

ibani_text: Mịma níminyẹ biim. Nyẹ́nimiḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ine ḅáláfama nama ma ẹ́rẹ́ ma sẹ́pịrịnyẹ dọghụ pághámaḅobẹm, ḅẹẹ anị sẹ tumḅọ ẹrẹ pịrịm. Anị kịẹnyẹ anịị ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi na ini fa tẹ́rẹ́ si oyi findi (666).
english_text: This calls for wisdom. Let the person who has insight calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man.That number is 666.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a dighim, sị aningáa Ánáná ma arịị Zayọn tụ́ndụ ọ́gọ́nọ sẹ́fịnịarị; ori na fịnịapụ anịị túminị́ mmẹẹ́ faá si púghú (144,000) nnị ori na ọ Daa ẹrẹ gịẹ kórómaapụ nna fụ́ḅára ogbo.
english_text: Then I looked, and there before me was the Lamb, standing on Mount Zion, and with him 144,000 who had his name and his Father’s name written on their foreheads.

ibani_text: A pịghị pụghọ naam sobie anị fiearị ḅara sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ tụ́ndụ ọ́gọ́nọ sághị sóórókoro mingi fiearị ḅara, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ opuma fie sóalagba. A náa akwa pụghọ ma sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ hapụ tiapụ núme ti pụghọ.
english_text: And I heard a sound from heaven like the roar of rushing waters and like a loud peal of thunder. The sound I heard was like that of harpists playing their harps.

ibani_text: Túminị́ mmẹẹ́ faá si púghú ma (144,000) na ínia dumafịnị nyẹ ma na pịghị sẹ́nịapụ ma imine ma tórúku sẹm, nnị ịwọ núme suuarị nnị ngéré ine nimi núme. Tuminikiri gbọrụ ma ḅụ nnị ngéré anịị n parapághámaḅoapụ.
english_text: And they sang a new song before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders. No one could learn the song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.

ibani_text: Nnị anịị nna ḅụ pa kpainma warịmaapụ sị mịnị ẹ́rẹ́ámáapụ pa nna ḅụ pilemaapụ, nnị anịị na ẹ́rẹ́ anịgha owiapụ nímighaapụ. Nnị Ánáná Tụwọ ma duaarị o muu angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́. Tuminikiriapụ bie anịị nnị n dụaḅọ́rọ́ma nyẹ, nnị anịị parị n fófóoma Tamuno na Ánáná Tụwọ ma pịrịnyẹ.
english_text: These are those who did not defile themselves with women, for they remained virgins. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among mankind and offered as firstfruits to God and the Lamb.

ibani_text: Nnị iruo ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ kọọapụ ḅara pa n nimigha, nnị anịị bịpị ḅụ láaghaapụ.
english_text: No lie was found in their mouths; they are blameless.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị jẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịị ọ́gọ́nọ ju fiighiarịḅo ori gbámásó ibi oku ma dugho wásáma tuminikiri fịnịapụ ma pịrịarị o dugho sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, túminị́ ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ, túminị́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ kịrịkị́rị́ na túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ pịrịarị.
english_text: Then I saw another angel flying in midair, and he had the eternal gospel to proclaim to those who live on the earth—to every nation, tribe, language and people.

ibani_text: Ori kụrọ pụghọ pa dughom, Kuu pa Tamuno pịrịị si o túmíní ori opu ḅụ! Ḅẹẹ sáá ma láamam ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọ bẹnyẹ túminị́ mamgba sịbị. O susi ọ pịrịị so na kiri ma tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ opu tọ́rụ́ ma na mingi saghị págháḅo págháḅo angaá gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ma tẹ́mẹ́ḅọ.
english_text: He said in a loud voice, “Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judgment has come. Worship him who made the heavens, the earth, the sea and the springs of water.”

ibani_text: Mmẹẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ parị sookumuḅọ ma duam dughoarị ḅẹẹ, A bị́ghị́mam! Opu Babịlọn ma Bị́ghị́mam! A mịẹm sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ árị iru ma ḅuuarị kị́nị́ nọmụma amadọghụ ọfịrị iru ma!
english_text: A second angel followed and said, “ ‘Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great,’which made all the nations drink the maddening wine of her adulteries.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma parị mmẹẹ́ ma duam sị kụrọ pụghọ pa dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Susi ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ na n tẹ́mẹ́ sị pa anị pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ, sị pịghị anị ilíghíma ma ákị nna fụ́ḅára ogbo anịgha n ḅara kọngọ,
english_text: A third angel followed them and said in a loud voice: “If anyone worships the beast and its image and receives its mark on their forehead or on their hand,

ibani_text: nnị Tamuno igani iru ma ḅuubẹm nnị pa ori igani ọmọngọ ma bie gwagha ḅara pa suabiimamáa nyẹ, nnị tọ́ntọ́ sookumuapụ ma tórúku na pịghị Ánáná Tụwọ ma tórúku nnị fịnị na dọghụarị ọpọlịḅuruma pa nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm.
english_text: they, too, will drink the wine of God’s fury, which has been poured full strength into the cup of his wrath. They will be tormented with burning sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and of the Lamb.

ibani_text: Nnị pa nnị pa tọ́rụ́siarịmaarị fịnị ma onwi ma iwóo ákị mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá lam. Susi ḅáláfáma nama ma pịrịapụ na n tẹ́mẹ́ sị pa anị pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́, nnị ịnyọ́sárá nyánábịgha dii na ḅáa na, na pịghị anị ẹrẹ ma ilíghíma nyánáakịapụ.
english_text: And the smoke of their torment will rise for ever and ever. There will be no rest day or night for those who worship the beast and its image, or for anyone who receives the mark of its name.”

ibani_text: Mịma biiarị ḅẹ́, Tamuno túminị́ inema nyánáa anịị Tamuno ologho ma kokoarịapụ na pịghị sẹ́kụrọ Jizọs pịrịapụ.
english_text: This calls for patient endurance on the part of the people of God who keep his commands and remain faithful to Jesus.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị sobie sághị pụghọ náa dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Mịma gịẹ: Mị́sa sághị bịpị muu bieḅẹlẹ fịnị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ḅụ minini sị fịịapụ ma pịrịm! Tẹ́mẹ́ ma pagharam karakárá nyẹẹ, nnị ịnyọsárábẹm nna kụrọfịrị ḅụ, tegó nna fịrị ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ n duaarị.
english_text: Then I heard a voice from heaven say, “Write this: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.” “Yes,” says the Spirit, “they will rest from their labor, for their deeds will follow them.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a dighim warị pị́na oḅuto arịị oḅuto ma ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ, Tumḅọ yii Tụwọ ma kịkam, odoḅala ogunu ọ sịbị imim, oḅu sị iko agidi pịghị ọ ḅara imii.
english_text: I looked, and there before me was a white cloud, and seated on the cloud was one like a son of manwith a crown of gold on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.

ibani_text: Anịsáa, jẹ́ sookumuḅọ warị Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sághị págháḅo warị opu pụghọ pa owu págháma pa oḅuto ma ḅụ kpọrọfịnịarịḅọ ma pịrị, Ị́yẹ́ oḅu iko agidi ma pa dua ma sughu tegó dua ma sughu bẹ sa lámam, tuminikiri dipinyẹ ma kpọmam.
english_text: Then another angel came out of the temple and called in a loud voice to him who was sitting on the cloud, “Take your sickle and reap, because the time to reap has come, for the harvest of the earth is ripe.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa oḅuto ma ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma warị ori oḅu iko agidi ma sánị tuminikiri. Tuminikiri dua sughuu ma wárị kiriakị.
english_text: So he who was seated on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the earth was harvested.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a jẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịm Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sághị págháḅo ḅọ sobie, ori sọ pịghị oḅu iko agidi ọlọm.
english_text: Another angel came out of the temple in heaven, and he too had a sharp sickle.

ibani_text: A pịghị jẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịm fịnị ma ḅụ kụ́rọ nyanaḅọ, ori ẹ́bẹ ma párángáa sághị ḅom. Ọ warị opu pụghọ pa ilúghú oḅu iko piompio agidi ma ọlọḅọ ma pịrị, Ị́yẹ́ óḅū iko agidi ma pa grepụ ma pẹ́lẹ́ tuminikiri duakiri ma ḅụ, tegó grepụ ma biamam!
english_text: Still another angel, who had charge of the fire, came from the altar and called in a loud voice to him who had the sharp sickle, “Take your sharp sickle and gather the clusters of grapes from the earth’s vine, because its grapes are ripe.”

ibani_text: Anịgosi sookumuḅọ ma warị ori oḅu iko agidi ma sánị tuminikiri, grepụ ma pẹ́lẹ́ sí anị sua dii ḅụ, sị anị gbi pa Tamuno bieoḅu iru pọnjị pọnjị angaá ma ḅụ sua.
english_text: The angel swung his sickle on the earth, gathered its grapes and threw them into the great winepress of God’s wrath.

ibani_text: Grepụ ma nnị anị inwimam nnị iru pọnjị pọnjị pághámaḅo angaá, mịma ámábiegha, ọmbịnyẹ́ warị opu mingi dighi sị iru pọnjị pọnjị angaá ma ḅụ sághị págháḅo sị nangwọ jẹ́ a si kilomita láa, anị póghóló mmẹẹ́ a mita.
english_text: They were trampled in the winepress outside the city, and blood flowed out of the press, rising as high as the horses’ bridles for a distance of 1,600 stadia.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a jẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma nyẹ arịm sobie, anị dụḅam pịghị tọ́rụ́ bulubulumam, sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ sọ́nọ́ma tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ọlọm, mị anị kunema nyẹ ma tegó mịnga nyẹ ma Tamuno iganima kúnémam.
english_text: I saw in heaven another great and marvelous sign: seven angels with the seven last plagues—last, because with them God’s wrath is completed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a arịm gilasi gilasi kịka tọ́rụ́ sị n fịnị pa gwagboloma nyẹ. A pịghị ḅáláfáma nama ma na n tẹ́mẹ́ sị pa anị pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ ma sọḅamaapụ arịm, na pịghị sẹ ḅáláfáma nama ẹrẹ ma pịrị kịẹbịpị ma sọḅaapụ. Nnị gilasi gilasi tọ́rụ́ ma aka ḅụ sẹ́fịnịm, nnị Tamuno pa n pịrị hapụ ọlọm
english_text: And I saw what looked like a sea of glass glowing with fire and, standing beside the sea, those who had been victorious over the beast and its image and over the number of its name. They held harps given them by God

ibani_text: si Mosis Tamuno fịrịnwangịḅọ núme ma na pịghị Ánáná Tụwọ ma núme súúarị: Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno, Ịyẹa fịrị opuma ḅụ́gbérépumam! Ḅụọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Ámányánáḅọ. Ị́yẹ́ asọ gbụ́nụ́nụ́m pịghị karakáram!
english_text: and sang the song of God’s servant Moses and of the Lamb: “Great and marvelous are your deeds, Lord God Almighty. Just and true are your ways, King of the nations.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ tụọ i dighi ḅáláfābịgha? Tụọ minibịgha sị ị́yẹ́ opu dugho págháma? Ịrị ngéré anịị Tọ́ntọ́ ḅọ. Sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅoo susi ị pịrịbẹm, túminị́ mamgba ị́yẹ́ karakárá fịrị arịm gosi.
english_text: Who will not fear you, Lord, and bring glory to your name? For you alone are holy. All nations will come and worship before you, for your righteous acts have been revealed.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá a dighim warị árị ḅẹ́ nnị Tọ́ntọ́ḅa angaá ma findimam Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịnịnyẹ sobie.
english_text: After this I looked, and I saw in heaven the temple—that is, the tabernacle of the covenant law—and it was opened.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́siarị dighiarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma ọlọ sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sághị págháḅom sị pị́na sánị sánị bịtẹ sua warị odoḅala fanti pa nna kúkúbie kpọọ.
english_text: Out of the temple came the seven angels with the seven plagues. They were dressed in clean, shining linen and wore golden sashes around their chests.

ibani_text: Anịsáa dumafịnị ínia nyẹ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ, sọ́nọ́má odoḅala bọlị, duma mú ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa Tamuno igani bie bii nyẹ pa sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma pịrịm.
english_text: Then one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls filled with the wrath of God, who lives for ever and ever.

ibani_text: Tamunoopuwarị ma, bie Tamuno ipine ma onwi na ori kụrọ ḅụ saghị ḅo onwi wárị ma biim, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ so ine Tamunoopuwarị ma sọgha ákị mú sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma akuoo sọ́nọ́ma tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma ḅoo kunema sáá láa.
english_text: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from his power, and no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ḅoo opu pụghọ naam Tamunoopuwarị ma bie sághị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma pịrịarị ḅẹẹ, Muu sọ́nọ́ma bọlị ma bie fịnị Tamuno igani ma osụsara tuminikiri ma bie!
english_text: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, “Go, pour out the seven bowls of God’s wrath on the earth.”

ibani_text: Parị sookumuḅọ ma múm sị ori bọlị ma ọ́sụ́sara tuminikiri ma ḅụ. Kịnịḅụfị sị opuma ákụ ịnọ ḅáláfama nama ma ilíghíma akịapụ ma ḅụ pághám na pịghị susi n tẹ́mẹ́ pa anị pa biekóróma nyẹ pịrịapụ.
english_text: The first angel went and poured out his bowl on the land, and ugly, festering sores broke out on the people who had the mark of the beast and worshiped its image.

ibani_text: Anịsáa mmẹẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori bọlị ọ́sụ́sara tọ́rụ́bie. Mingi ma warị sághị fịịmaaḅọ ọmbịnyẹ́ bia ḅara bia, dumafịnị nyẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ anị bie warị fịị.
english_text: The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea, and it turned into blood like that of a dead person, and every living thing in the sea died.

ibani_text: Anịsáa tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori bọlị ọ́sụ́sara okolobie na mingi saghị págháḅo págháḅo a ngaa gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ anị warị pịghị ọmbịnyẹ́ dighi.
english_text: The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and springs of water, and they became blood.

ibani_text: A mingi ḅụ kụrọ nyáná sookumuḅọ naam dugho ḅẹẹ, I kọọ pẹ́lẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́ ma anị karakáram, Tọ́ntọ́ḅo Ịrị anịị mị́sa na pịghị ḅọ́rọ́maa sáá!
english_text: Then I heard the angel in charge of the waters say: “You are just in these judgments, O Holy One, you who are and who were;

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno túminị́ ma na ikiakoroapụ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ ọsụsaram, anịgosi ịrị ọmbịnyẹ́ pa n pịrịmam si n ḅuu. Nnị n láa na ibi gbẹfịnyẹ nyanaḅoarị!
english_text: for they have shed the blood of your holy people and your prophets, and you have given them blood to drink as they deserve.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ẹ́bẹ ọ́gọ́nọ sághị pụghọ naam dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno! Ị́yẹ́ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ gbụ́nụ́nụ́m pịghị opuma karakáram!
english_text: And I heard the altar respond: “Yes, Lord God Almighty, true and just are your judgments.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa ini kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori bọlị ọ́sụ́sara ịrụa ma ḅụ, n warị kụrọ pa ịrụa ma pịrị sị anị anị gágá ọfịrị pa túminị́ dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and the sun was allowed to scorch people with fire.

ibani_text: Anị gágá ọfịrị ma n dọghụmam, n warị Tamuno ẹ́rẹ dughosima kụrọ nyáná mịná tọ́rụ́siarị dighiarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma nẹngịḅọ, kụ́ma n mịnị nna sii ḅụ pịghịgha sị ori opuu ma túmíní.
english_text: They were seared by the intense heat and they cursed the name of God, who had control over these plagues, but they refused to repent and glorify him.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori bọlị ọsụsaram ḅáláfama nama ma imine ọ́gọ́nọ. Kánákáná warị ḅáláfáma nama amadakiri ma gbẹ́ẹ̄ túminị́ warị sághị n ḅẹlẹ túrú nna ákụ gosi.
english_text: The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and its kingdom was plunged into darkness. People gnawed their tongues in agony

ibani_text: Nnị warị so Tamuno ma dughosima nna ịnọ ma na nna akụụ gosi. Kụ́ma n mini nna sii asọ warisogha.
english_text: and cursed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, but they refused to repent of what they had done.

ibani_text: Anịsáa suene kárámá sookumuḅọ ma ori bọlị ọ́sụ́sara opu Ufretis okolo ma ḅụ, anị mingi warị kụ́lụ́kụ́lụ́ sị asọ tẹ́lẹ́ma pa ịrụa saghị saghị angaá sághị ḅoarị ámányánáapụ ma pịrị.
english_text: The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates, and its water was dried up to prepare the way for the kings from the East.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a tẹ́rẹ́ a sitẹ́mẹ́ arịm ngụngụ kịkanyẹ. Nnị ḅụọ nyáná ododó ma bịpịbie na ḅáláfama nama ma bịpịbie na iruo ikiakoroapụ ma bịpịbie sághị págháḅoarị.
english_text: Then I saw three impure spirits that looked like frogs; they came out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

ibani_text: Nnị anịị ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwángịarị ẹ́kpẹ́dua tẹ́mẹ́. Mị tẹ́rẹ́ a tẹ́mẹ́ ma tuminikiri ámányánáapụ mamgba damamum, sị n kobiri pa ọ́mụ́gbi ma pịrị kiriakị bẹnyẹ Kụrọmamgba Nyáná Tamuno ma opu éné.
english_text: They are demonic spirits that perform signs, and they go out to the kings of the whole world, to gather them for the battle on the great day of God Almighty.

ibani_text: Dighi! A fúrúḅọ ḅara pa ḅoarị! Bieḅẹlẹ fịnị múno pa amịna tọ́rụ́ ḅamaḅọ sị amịna suabịtẹ pa ori angásá warịḅọ pịrịm. Sị ọ pápáḅụ pa nwángị ikelekelebịgha ḅara kị́nị́mamgba tórúku sị ḅụgịrịrịị!
english_text: “Look, I come like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays awake and remains clothed, so as not to go naked and be shamefully exposed.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị ámányánáapụ ma táa kubiri gboloma nnị Hiburu ḅẹlẹ ḅụ nnị pa Amagidon sị angaá ḅoo.
english_text: Then they gathered the kings together to the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ma kárámá sookumuḅọ ma warị ori bọlị ọ́sụ́sara fọ́rụ ma bie. Opu pụghọ Tamunoopuwarị ma bie fịnị imine ḅụ sághị fiem dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Anị kárámam!
english_text: The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and out of the temple came a loud voice from the throne, saying, “It is done!”

ibani_text: Sofịnị pa kọrịkọrị biiarị, so dárịarị, pụghọ sághị fiem sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ so alágbā na pịghị ḅáláfama kirijighe, ọkọfịnị kirijighe na kiriakịgha sághị n túminị́ tẹ́mẹ́ sáá éné éné tuminikiri; mịma anịị siḅáá kirijighe mamgbaa!
english_text: Then there came flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder and a severe earthquake. No earthquake like it has ever occurred since mankind has been on earth, so tremendous was the quake.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma n pa tẹ́rẹ́ angaá diem, a warị sẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ opu ama mamgba guluguluma. Tamuno opu Babịlọn pa biekórómam warị mịẹsị árị ọmọngọ ma bie fịnị iru ma ḅuu, anịị ori opu igani ma iruu.
english_text: The great city split into three parts, and the cities of the nations collapsed. God remembered Babylon the Great and gave her the cup filled with the wine of the fury of his wrath.

ibani_text: Ogbosúányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ẹmẹẹfam n pịghị mịnị gbẹ́rẹ́ tụ́ndụ sọ arịgha.
english_text: Every island fled away and the mountains could not be found.

ibani_text: Mgbọ́lụ iti, anị iku kilogram mmẹẹ́ si oyi findi, sobie sághị túminị́ ógọ́nọ sóórókórom. N warị Tamuno dughosima nna ḅụ koroarị mgbọ́lụ iti ma gosi, tegó anịma anịị opuma tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá.
english_text: From the sky huge hailstones, each weighing about a hundred pounds,fell on people. And they cursed God on account of the plague of hail, because the plague was so terrible.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sọ́nọ́ma sookumuḅọ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ́nọ́ma bọlị ma nyánáḅọ ma i damaḅom sị ḅẹẹ, Ḅoo, a pa ị diebẹm opu sẹfịḅọ ma árị bẹ tọ́rụ́siarị, anịị tọgha tọ́rụ́ aka ḅụ nnị nama opu ama.
english_text: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and said to me, “Come, I will show you the punishment of the great prostitute, who sits by many waters.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ámányánáapụ árị na sẹfịmam, tuminikiriapụ ma pịghị árị amadọghụ iru ma ḅuu tọ́rụ́ḅámam.
english_text: With her the kings of the earth committed adultery, and the inhabitants of the earth were intoxicated with the wine of her adulteries.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma warị ikoro, sookumuḅọ ma warị i dighiákị pa elesiri mú. Anị ngaa a gbẹ́rẹ́ ọ́rụ́ḅọ arịm áwụ áwụ biarị ḅáláfáma nama ọgọnọ kpọrọfịnịarị, Tamuno ẹ́rẹ́ dughosima nyẹ anịị n gịẹnyẹ anị oju gbọrụ ḅụ, ḅáláfama nama ma sọ́nọ́ma sịbị nyanam na pịghị oyia ikpangi.
english_text: Then the angel carried me away in the Spirit into a wilderness. There I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was covered with blasphemous names and had seven heads and ten horns.

ibani_text: Ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma tọrụsọgha áwụ bịtẹ na áwụ bịtẹ suam warị odoḅala na kiri sághị ḅoo nyẹ láa dapịrị na mingi bie saghị ḅoo nyẹ́laa dapịrị pa a ḅụ́birima. A ḅárabie árị odoḅala ọmọngọ ọlọm pile nyẹ na pịghị túminị́ tọ́ọ nyẹ anịị bie biim, árị amadọghụ dighiḅọ nyẹ.
english_text: The woman was dressed in purple and scarlet, and was glittering with gold, precious stones and pearls. She held a golden cup in her hand, filled with abominable things and the filth of her adulteries.

ibani_text: A fụ́ḅára ogbo árị ẹrẹ nyánam n túminị́ ḅọghuma nyẹ:
english_text: The name written on her forehead was a mystery: babylon the great the mother of prostitutes and of the abominations of the earth.

ibani_text: A pịghị arịm ḅẹẹ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma a Tamuno túminị́ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ ḅuu tọ́rụ́ḅámam na pịghị n ḅáapụ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ tegó n sẹ́kụrọ Jizọs pịrịm gosi. A árị arịị sáá, anị opuma i tọ́rụ́ bulubulumam.
english_text: I saw that the woman was drunk with the blood of God’s holy people, the blood of those who bore testimony to Jesus. When I saw her, I was greatly astonished.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma warị i gbíla, Anị tegó ị tọ́rụ́ bulubulumaarị? A dughofindi ị pịrịbẹm ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma sẹ́pịrị ḅọghunyẹ na pịghị a díghíarị ḅáláfáma nama ma ḅọghunyẹ sẹ́pịrịnyẹ, anịị sọ́nọ́ma sịbị na oyia ikpangi nyánányẹ ma.
english_text: Then the angel said to me: “Why are you astonished? I will explain to you the mystery of the woman and of the beast she rides, which has the seven heads and ten horns.

ibani_text: Ịrị arị ḅáláfama nama ma anị dumafịnị sáá imii, kụ́ma ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ anị págháḅobẹm sughu nyanagha póghóló kiri ma ḅụ sị nnị anị guluguluma. Tuminikiri ngaapụ ma na nnị nna ẹrẹ gịẹghaapụ dumaapụ ma diri bie, anịị tuminikiri ma na saghịgha sa éné éné, n tọ́rụ́ bulubulubẹm nnị ḅáláfama nama ma arị sáá, tegó anị dumafịnị sáá imi: mị́sa anị mịnị dumagha kụ́ma anị pịghị sima págháḅobẹm.
english_text: The beast, which you saw, once was, now is not, and yet will come up out of the Abyss and go to its destruction. The inhabitants of the earth whose names have not been written in the book of life from the creation of the world will be astonished when they see the beast, because it once was, now is not, and yet will come.

ibani_text: Mịma akanyaḅo na níminyẹ biim. Sọ́nọ́ma sịbị ma anịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma kpọ́rọ́fịnịfịnị sọ́nọ́ma kálá tụ́ndụ.
english_text: “This calls for a mind with wisdom. The seven heads are seven hills on which the woman sits.

ibani_text: Nnị sọ pịghị sọ́nọ́ma ámányánáapụ. Nna ḅụ sọ́nọ́apụ bị́ghị́mam, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ pa táarị, isi angáḅọ na ọ pa ḅogha; o ḅoo sáá kálá sáátụọ ngéré anị ọ pa táa bẹnyẹ.
english_text: They are also seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; but when he does come, he must remain for only a little while.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfáma nama parị dumafịnị nyẹ mị́sa mịnị dumagha nyẹ ma, anịị inine kárámá ámányánáḅọ ma ori pịghị sọ́nọ́ma ámányánáapụ ma ḅụ gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ ọ muarị nnị o guluguluma.
english_text: The beast who once was, and now is not, is an eighth king. He belongs to the seven and is going to his destruction.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ árị oyia ikpangi ma anịị oyia ámányánáapụ na sághị táagháapụ, kụ́ma n kụrọ pa pịrịbẹ ámányánáapụ sị n gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ pa ḅáláfáma nama ma na taá.
english_text: “The ten horns you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but who for one hour will receive authority as kings along with the beast.

ibani_text: Mịná oyia ámányánáapụ ma gbẹ́rẹ́ tẹ́mẹ́ anịị nnị nyánányẹ, n pịghị nna ịnyọ na nna kụrọ pa ḅáláfáma nama ma pịrịm.
english_text: They have one purpose and will give their power and authority to the beast.

ibani_text: Nnị owu pa Ánáná Tụwọ ma pághámabẹm, kụ́ma Ánáná Tụwọ ma na ori osiiapụ ma na ọ sẹlẹakịapụ na sẹ́kụrọ ọ pịrị asọduaapụ n sọḅábẹm tegó ori anịị kị́nị́nyánáapụ ma Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ na pịghị ámányánáapụ ma ḅụ Ámányánáḅọ.
english_text: They will wage war against the Lamb, but the Lamb will triumph over them because he is Lord of lords and King of kings—and with him will be his called, chosen and faithful followers.”

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma pịghị i ḅẹm, Ị́yẹ́ arịị mingi ma, sẹfịḅọ ma kpọrọfịnị kpọrọfịnị angaá ma anịị sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́, túminị́ tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́, túminị́ ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ na pịghị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ ḅẹ́lẹ̄ pịrịm.
english_text: Then the angel said to me, “The waters you saw, where the prostitute sits, are peoples, multitudes, nations and languages.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ árị ḅáláfama nama ma na oyia ikpangi ma, sẹfịḅọ ma dighi tọ́rụ́ akụbẹm, nnị a nyánányẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ákịbẹm sị papa ḅụ ḅụ a warịị, nnị árị ojumẹnị pẹébẹm sị fịnị pa a dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: The beast and the ten horns you saw will hate the prostitute. They will bring her to ruin and leave her naked; they will eat her flesh and burn her with fire.

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ Tamuno pa n tẹ́mẹ́bie suamam sị nnị ọ tọ́nyẹ mịẹ, n minibẹm sị nyáná kụrọ ḅọ́rọ́ma pa ḅáláfáma nama ma pịrị sị n táá ámányánáapụ ḅara. Nnị ḅáláfama nama ma osiibẹm ákị mú Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ mamgba kiriakị sáá láa.
english_text: For God has put it into their hearts to accomplish his purpose by agreeing to hand over to the beast their royal authority, until God’s words are fulfilled.

ibani_text: Ị́yẹ́ árị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma anịị tuminikiri ámányánáapụ ma táarị opu ama ma.
english_text: The woman you saw is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá a jẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịm sobie sághị kóróḅoarịḅọ. Ori opuma kụ́rọ nyánam ori ipine warị tuminikiri ma mịẹsị anị fíafía sị ibima bia.
english_text: After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven. He had great authority, and the earth was illuminated by his splendor.

ibani_text: Ori opu pụghọ pa owu ilúghum: Á bịghịmam! Opu Babịlọn ma bịghịmam! Mị́sa sitẹ́mẹ́, ịlọ́lị tẹ́mẹ́ pile na pịghị túminị́ tọ́ọ tọ́ọ fíní anị mị́sa a bie ngáarịapụ.
english_text: With a mighty voice he shouted: “ ‘Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!’ She has become a dwelling for demons and a haunt for every impure spirit, a haunt for every unclean bird, a haunt for every unclean and detestable animal.

ibani_text: Sẹ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ árị iru ma ḅuumam árị amadọghụ ọfịrị iru ma. Tuminikiri ámányánáapụ ánáná amadọghụm, tuminikiri tuḅokọọapụ a pa ngọ kọọm árị furobịgha ngọ opuma pụghọ tarị ma gosi.
english_text: For all the nations have drunk the maddening wine of her adulteries. The kings of the earth committed adultery with her, and the merchants of the earth grew rich from her excessive luxuries.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a jẹ́ pụghọ naam sobie, dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Ọ págháḅo, ịyẹa túminị́! Ọmịnị a bie sághị págháḅo! O diekiri nyánábịgha árị siiamịẹnyẹ ḅụ; A daa bẹ fomḅara ḅụ sọ ọ dienyẹ nyánábịgha ḅara!
english_text: Then I heard another voice from heaven say: “ ‘Come out of her, my people,’ so that you will not share in her sins, so that you will not receive any of her plagues;

ibani_text: Ḅẹẹ árị sii tunduru muu so na biamam, Tamuno pịghị árị siiamịẹnyẹ pa biekórómamam.
english_text: for her sins are piled up to heaven, and God has remembered her crimes.

ibani_text: Ọmịnị a pa ọ́ mịẹḅara pa a mịẹ, mmẹẹ́ sáá pa sáá pa a gbẹ́ẹ̄ a mịẹ nyẹ́ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅụ. Mmẹẹ́ sáá pa opuma ọfịrị iru pa árị ọmọ́ngọ bie sua a mịẹ ọ pịrị iru ma fịnị ḅára.
english_text: Give back to her as she has given; pay her back double for what she has done. Pour her a double portion from her own cup.

ibani_text: Tọ́rụ́siarị na opu ḅụakụ pa a pịrị a pa a ḅụ pịrị opu na loghuloghu dumafịnị ḅara. A pa dugho a ḅụ pịrịarị: Mịnga ámányánáḅọ taa ḅara anịị a kpọrọfịnị ḅara; ịrị deefị ọrụḅọgha, A dụadu ḅụoakụ nimibịghaa!
english_text: Give her as much torment and grief as the glory and luxury she gave herself. In her heart she boasts, ‘I sit enthroned as queen. I am not a widow; I will never mourn.’

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ éné ngéré ḅụ n tọ́rụ́siarị dighiarị ḅụḅáláḅálá árịbẹm obi dighi dighi nyẹ, dụadu ḅụakụ na ḅuru ḅá, Nnị fịnị pa a dọghụmabẹm, tegó a sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị Kịnịnyáná Tamuno ma ori opuma dụḅam.
english_text: Therefore in one day her plagues will overtake her: death, mourning and famine. She will be consumed by fire, for mighty is the Lord God who judges her.

ibani_text: Tuminikiri ámányánáapụ árị na amadọghụ, na loghuloghu duma kọọapụ, nnị opu ámá ma dọ́ghụ́maarị onwi ma árị sáá, nnị owubẹm pịghị dụadu a pịrịbẹm.
english_text: “When the kings of the earth who committed adultery with her and shared her luxury see the smoke of her burning, they will weep and mourn over her.

ibani_text: Nnị ḅọlọanga sẹfịnịbẹm, tegó n ḅáláfaarị n bigha ḅara ma ḅẹ́ nnị árị tọ́rụ́siarị ma ḅụ diekiri nyáná. Nnị ḅẹẹm ḅẹẹ,  Mịị tọ́rọ fịnịnyẹ, tọ́rọ fịnị siinyẹ, Mịị opuma dụḅa pịghị kụrọ opu ama Babịlọn! Gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ngéré ḅụ ị́yẹ́ fomḅara ḅoomam!
english_text: Terrified at her torment, they will stand far off and cry: “ ‘Woe! Woe to you, great city, you mighty city of Babylon! In one hour your doom has come!’

ibani_text: Tuminikiri tuḅokọapụ pịghị owu sị dụadu a pịrịm tegó gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mịnị nna ngọ fẹghaa.
english_text: “The merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her because no one buys their cargoes anymore—

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ mịnị nna odoḅala, pị́naḅala, kiri sághị ḅoo nyẹ́laa dapịrị, na mingi bie sághị ḅoo nyẹ́la dapịrị fẹghaa, nna asamịna alo tọrụsọgha áwụ́bite, silik na, áwụ sánị bia ḅara bia áwụ́bite, tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ kụ́nụ́ sị, nnị ọdụ pa kara tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nyẹ na pịghị nyẹ láa si, áwụ́ ḅala; ikúlélu na mabulu;
english_text: cargoes of gold, silver, precious stones and pearls; fine linen, purple, silk and scarlet cloth; every sort of citron wood, and articles of every kind made of ivory, costly wood, bronze, iron and marble;

ibani_text: na nyẹ́sọ ḅẹlẹma sị apara; sinamọn, nyẹ́sọ kụ́nụ́ma mgbọ́lụ; insẹnsị, maya, farankisensi; iru na pulo, filawa na witi sịmgbọlụ; kọ́rọ́náma na ánáná, ásụ, ásụ dighi mangịarị nyẹ, ómóniapụ na pịghị túminị́ duma.
english_text: cargoes of cinnamon and spice, of incense, myrrh and frankincense, of wine and olive oil, of fine flour and wheat; cattle and sheep; horses and carriages; and human beings sold as slaves.

ibani_text: Tụ́ḅonaapụ ma a ḅẹbẹm, I pụghọ tarị sị ị nyáná bii ibi nyẹ mamgba ị kọ́rọ́ma mangị somam, ị́yẹ́ ngọ na ị́yẹ́ ibii ẹmẹẹ́famam, ị pịghị mịnị jẹ́ pa anị arịbịgha!
english_text: “They will say, ‘The fruit you longed for is gone from you. All your luxury and splendor have vanished, never to be recovered.’

ibani_text: Ngọ kọọ Tụ́ḅonaapụ ḅẹẹ n túḅo kọm gosi opu ámá ma bie, ḅolo angaá sẹfịnịbẹm, tegó n ḅáláfaarị nnị dọghụgha sị nnị árị na diekiri nyáná árị tọ́rụ́siarị ḅụ. Nnị owubẹm pịghị duadubẹm,
english_text: The merchants who sold these things and gained their wealth from her will stand far off, terrified at her torment. They will weep and mourn

ibani_text: si ḅẹẹ: mịị tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅáláfama nyẹ!  Tọ́rọ́fịnị siinyẹ mịị opu ama ma ḅụ! Asamịna alo na tọrụsọgha áwụ́bite, sánị bia ḅara bia áwụ bịtẹ anịị a sua suanyẹ sị warị odoḅala, kiri sághị ḅoo nyẹ láa dapịrị na mingi bie sághị ḅoo nyẹ́laa dapịrị anịị a pa a ḅụ birimabirima nyẹ.
english_text: and cry out: “ ‘Woe! Woe to you, great city, dressed in fine linen, purple and scarlet, and glittering with gold, precious stones and pearls!

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ a mịị ngọ mamgba ḅuumamam! Onwiarụ sịbịdaapụ mamgba na onwiarụ pa nyẹ mú muapụ na árụ́ ásáawọ na pịghị tọ́rụ́bie nna furo dọghụarịapụ mamgba, a ḅụ ḅọlọanga ḅụ sẹm,
english_text: In one hour such great wealth has been brought to ruin!’ “Every sea captain, and all who travel by ship, the sailors, and all who earn their living from the sea, will stand far off.

ibani_text: nnị a dọ́ghụ́maarị onwi ma árị sáá, n pụghọ sághị ilúghum, Jẹ́ ene mịma kịkama jẹ́ opu ama na ofori!
english_text: When they see the smoke of her burning, they will exclaim, ‘Was there ever a city like this great city?’
