ibani_text: Nnị fọọ taa nna sịbị saram, nnị owúm pịghị dụadu anị pịrị dughoarị ḅẹẹ,  Tọ́rọ́fịnị ḅáláfama nyẹ! Tọ́rọ́fịnị siinyẹ mịị opu ama ma! Árị ngọ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ anịị onwi árụ́ nyánáapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ tọ́rụ́ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ ngọ kọọ angaá! A pịghị nyẹ mamgba ḅuumam gbẹ́rẹ́ énékịẹnyẹ ḅụ!
english_text: They will throw dust on their heads, and with weeping and mourning cry out: “ ‘Woe! Woe to you, great city, where all who had ships on the sea became rich through her wealth! In one hour she has been brought to ruin!’

ibani_text: So bieḅẹlẹ, árị guluguluma gosi! O bieḅẹlẹ, Tamuno túminị́, nfịrịmaapụ ma na ikiakoroapụ ma! Ḅẹẹ Tamuno, a sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọmam a pa ọ mịẹnyẹ gosi.
english_text: “Rejoice over her, you heavens! Rejoice, you people of God! Rejoice, apostles and prophets! For God has judged her with the judgment she imposed on you.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa gbẹ́rẹ́ opu sookumuḅọ warị gbẹ́rẹ́ dapịrị sághị ákị opu nyẹgbẹẹ dapịrị láa ḅara anịị anị láanyẹ, warị anị pa tọ́rụ́ ma bie gbii sua, dughoarị ḅẹẹ, Mịị kụ́rọ ḅara ma anịị nnị ịrị opu ama Babịlọn dighi gbi bẹ ḅara sị n mịnị pịghị jẹ́ pa ị́yẹ́ arịbịgha.
english_text: Then a mighty angel picked up a boulder the size of a large millstone and threw it into the sea, and said: “With such violence the great city of Babylon will be thrown down, never to be found again.

ibani_text: Hapụ suuarị nyẹ na túminị́ pụghọ na sị pa kara kálá ọdụ ofuroarịapụ na ọdụ ofuroarịapụ Nnị mịnị jẹ́ pa ibie anị naabịgha. Tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ ḅárafịrị nwángịarịapụ n gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ arịbịgha ịbie! Nyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄ dapịrị ma ọwụ n mịnị jẹ́ pa naabịgha ịbie!
english_text: The music of harpists and musicians, pipers and trumpeters, will never be heard in you again. No worker of any trade will ever be found in you again. The sound of a millstone will never be heard in you again.

ibani_text: Nnị mịnị jẹ́ pa tọndọ baá arịbịgha ịḅụ. Nnị mịnị deeyaa dọghụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ na ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa dọghụ owitụ́wọ pụghọ naabịgha ị bie. Ị́yẹ́ Tụ́ḅonaapụ nnị anịị kụrọ ḅa nyẹ tuminikiri gbọrụ, Ị́yẹ́ ḅụ́gbérépuma iruo na aka na ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ i oḅori pa túminị́ sim tuminikiri sẹ mamgba ḅụ!
english_text: The light of a lamp will never shine in you again. The voice of bridegroom and bride will never be heard in you again. Your merchants were the world’s important people. By your magic spell all the nations were led astray.

ibani_text: Babịlọn fomḅara dam tegó anị bie anịị nnị ikiakoroapụ ma na Tamuno túminị́ ọmbịnyẹ́ árịnyẹ, na pịghị tuminikiri n ḅámaapụ mamgba ọmbịnyẹ́.
english_text: In her was found the blood of prophets and of God’s holy people, of all who have been slaughtered on the earth.”

ibani_text: Mịma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá a pụghọ naam sobie sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ túminị́ kpo silé pụghọ, ilúghuarị: Aleluya! Dụaḅọ́rọ́ma na boma na ịnyọ wámịna Tamuno nyẹ!
english_text: After this I heard what sounded like the roar of a great multitude in heaven shouting: “Hallelujah! Salvation and glory and power belong to our God,

ibani_text: Gbụ́nụ́nụ́ pịghị karakárá anịị ọrẹ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ Tamuno opu sẹfịị ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọmam árị árịị sẹfịị pa tuminikiri ma pilemáa ḅara gosi. Tamuno a ḅụ sughubimam ori fịrịnwangịapụ ọmbịnyẹ́ gosi.
english_text: for true and just are his judgments. He has condemned the great prostitute who corrupted the earth by her adulteries. He has avenged on her the blood of his servants.”

ibani_text: Nnị pighi jẹ́ pa ilúghum, Aleluya! Opu ámá ma dọ́ghụ́ma onwi ma pa ọ́gọ́nọ mubẹm ákị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa!
english_text: And again they shouted: “Hallelujah! The smoke from her goes up for ever and ever.”

ibani_text: Si ínia sẹ́nịapụ ma na dumafịnị iniapụ ma sóórókórom sị susi Tamuno pịrị, imine ma ọgọnọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ. Nnị warị ilúghú, Anị ọkọ fịnị, Aleluya!
english_text: The twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God, who was seated on the throne. And they cried: “Amen, Hallelujah!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa imine ma ḅụ pụghọ sághị korom dughoarị nyẹ ḅẹẹ, Wámịna Tamuno túmíní, ọmịnị ori a fịrịnwangịapụ, na túminị́ mamgba duḅaapụ na káláapụ na, o dighi ḅáláfaapụ!
english_text: Then a voice came from the throne, saying: “Praise our God, all you his servants, you who fear him, both great and small!”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a warị ḅoo náa sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ tọgha túminị́ pụghọ, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ọgọnọ sághị sóóróarị mingi, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ so alágbā. A naam n dugho sáá, Aleluya! Ḅẹẹ Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma, wámịna Tamuno, Kụrọmamgba nyánáḅọ, ori anịị Ámányánáḅọ.
english_text: Then I heard what sounded like a great multitude, like the roar of rushing waters and like loud peals of thunder, shouting: “Hallelujah! For our Lord God Almighty reigns.

ibani_text: Ḅoo wa dụrụkụ́ bieḅẹlẹ, wamịnị ori opuẹ́rẹ́ túmíní! Ḅẹẹ Ánáná Tụwọ ma ọ́rụ́ḅọ yaa sa láamam, ọ yaa dọghụ ọ́rụ́ḅọ ma sọ a ḅụ tẹ́lẹ́ma wárịmam.
english_text: Let us rejoice and be glad and give him glory! For the wedding of the Lamb has come, and his bride has made herself ready.

ibani_text: Nnị pịghị fíafía, sánị sánị asamịna alo pa a pịrịmam, ḅẹẹ a suaa. (Asamịna alo ma anịị Tamuno túminị́ karakárá ibiamịẹnyẹ).
english_text: Fine linen, bright and clean, was given her to wear.” (Fine linen stands for the righteous acts of God’s holy people.)

ibani_text: Anịsáa sookumuḅọ ma warị i ḅẹẹ, mịma gịẹ: Karịiḅi fịịnị n sịị pa Ánáná Tụwọ ma ẹ́rẹ́yáa ma fị na ḅụ na ḅoapụ ma pịrị. Sookumuḅọ ma warị jẹ́ dugho, Mịnanyẹ ma anịị Tamuno ma karakárá ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́.
english_text: Then the angel said to me, “Write this: Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding supper of the Lamb!” And he added, “These are the true words of God.”

ibani_text: A ọ ḅụọ sughu sóórókórom ḅẹẹ a susi ọ pịrị, kụ́ma ori i ḅẹm, Ọkọ mịẹma! Irị fịrịnwangịḅọ, ịrị na jẹ́ mininiapụ ma fịnị ḅara, Jizọs diepágháma karakárá ma ọlọapụ. Susi Tamuno pịrị! Jizọs diepágháma karakárá ma anịị ịnyọ pa ikiakoroapụ ma pịrịarịnyẹ.
english_text: At this I fell at his feet to worship him. But he said to me, “Don’t do that! I am a fellow servant with you and with your brothers and sisters who hold to the testimony of Jesus. Worship God! For it is the Spirit of prophecy who bears testimony to Jesus.”

ibani_text: A so arịm findi sị pị́napị́na ásụ árịị, n pa anị dọghụarịḅọ ma sịịnyẹ anịị Karakárá na Sẹ́kụrọ. Ọ ḅẹ́rẹ́kọarị pịghị ọ́mụ́gbiarị karakárá asọ ḅụ.
english_text: I saw heaven standing open and there before me was a white horse, whose rider is called Faithful and True. With justice he judges and wages war.

ibani_text: Ọ tọ́rụ fịnị kọrị ḅara pa kọọrịarị, ọ pịghị tọgha ogunu suam ọ sịbị, ori ẹ́rẹ́ nyanam nnị ọ ḅụ gịẹnyẹ, gbẹ́rẹ́ḅọ sọ ofori anị níminyẹ ori ngéré anịị anị níminyẹ.
english_text: His eyes are like blazing fire, and on his head are many crowns. He has a name written on him that no one knows but he himself.

ibani_text: Ọ sua opu bịtẹ ma ọmbịnyẹ́ anị gbẹm, ori ẹrẹ anịị, Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma.
english_text: He is dressed in a robe dipped in blood, and his name is the Word of God.

ibani_text: Sobie ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ori ọḅụju o duam, pị́napị́na ásụ dọghụarị sị pịghị fíafía pị́napị́na asamịna alo sua.
english_text: The armies of heaven were following him, riding on white horses and dressed in fine linen, white and clean.

ibani_text: Ọ bịpịbie anịị áláápụ́-ágidi sághị págháḅo nyẹ, ọ pa sẹ ma sọ́ḅa bẹnyẹ. Ikúlélu mgbara anịị ọ pa n táa bẹnyẹ. Ọ Tamuno, Kụrọmamgba nyánáḅọ ma opu igani sarapágháma ḅobẹm sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ n grepụ mingi sarapágháma ḅoarị ḅara grepụ pọnjị pọnjị ịrụ mịẹarị angaá.
english_text: Coming out of his mouth is a sharp sword with which to strike down the nations. “He will rule them with an iron scepter.”He treads the winepress of the fury of the wrath of God Almighty.

ibani_text: Ori koro bịtẹ ma ḅụ na pịghị ọ ḅụ́ọ́ẹlẹẹ ḅụ nnị ẹ́rẹ́ ma gịẹm,
english_text: On his robe and on his thigh he has this name written: king of kings and lord of lords.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a gbẹ́rẹ́ sookumuḅọ arịm sẹfịnịarịḅọ ịrụa ma ọ́gọ́nọ. Ori opu pụghọ pa ilúghú ọ́gọ́nọ ju fiighiarị fíní mamgba pịrịm: O ḅoo kubiri gboloma Tamuno opu álálị ma pịrị!
english_text: And I saw an angel standing in the sun, who cried in a loud voice to all the birds flying in midair, “Come, gather together for the great supper of God,

ibani_text: O ḅoo ámányánáapụ ojumẹnị pẹẹ́, ọ́mụ́gbi sịbịdáapụ na ọ́mụ́gbiapụ, ásụ na anị dọghụapụ ojumẹnị, túminị́ mamgba ojumẹnị ómóniapụ na furoawọ, duḅaapụ na káláapụ na!
english_text: so that you may eat the flesh of kings, generals, and the mighty, of horses and their riders, and the flesh of all people, free and slave, great and small.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ḅáláfama nama ma na tuminikiri ámányánáapụ arịm nnị na nna ọ́mụ́gbiapụ kobiri yọ ḅẹ́ nnị ọ́mụ́ pa ásụ ma dọghụarịḅọ ma, na ori ọ́mụ́gbiapụ gbii.
english_text: Then I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies gathered together to wage war against the rider on the horse and his army.

ibani_text: Ḅáláfáma nama ma nnị ikólinaḅọ ḅara ḅụ okuakịm ori na iruo ikiakoroḅọ, ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị nwangimaaḅọ ọ tórúku. (Mịná ḅụ́gbérépuma fịrị ma anịị ọ pa ḅáláfáma nama ma ilíghíma nyánáapụ ma oḅori pa n sịị nyẹ, na pịghị susi n tẹ́mẹ́ sị anị pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ pịrịmáapụ) Ḅáláfáma nama ma na iruo ikiakoroapụ ma duma ḅụ anịị nnị n pa kọrịfịnị ésiḅe ma bie gbi suanyẹ ọpọlịḅuruma pa kọrịarị nyẹ.
english_text: But the beast was captured, and with it the false prophet who had performed the signs on its behalf. With these signs he had deluded those who had received the mark of the beast and worshiped its image. The two of them were thrown alive into the fiery lake of burning sulfur.

ibani_text: Ásụ ma dọghụarịḅọ ma bịpịbie págháḅo áláápụ́-ágidi anịị nnị pa nna ọ́mụ́gbiapụ ḅáfama nyẹ; fíní mamgba warị nnị ine ḅara pa nna ojumẹnị pẹ́ẹ́m.
english_text: The rest were killed with the sword coming out of the mouth of the rider on the horse, and all the birds gorged themselves on their flesh.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a sookumuḅọ arịm sobie sághị kóróḅoarịḅọ, ọ ḅárabie ori sughu nyánágha póghóló kiri ma igodo findinyẹ ọlọm na pịghị iku ikólina nyẹ.
english_text: And I saw an angel coming down out of heaven, having the key to the Abyss and holding in his hand a great chain.

ibani_text: Ọ ḅụọ nyáná ódódó ma kuum, olom sáá ódódó ma anị́ị́ ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma anịgha Satanị. Warị ịkóli suanyẹ pa o sua, kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi.
english_text: He seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the devil, or Satan, and bound him for a thousand years.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma o gbi pa sughu nyánágha póghóló kiri ma bie suam ori ikasii pịghị ọ gbẹpalị, sị ọmịnị ine jẹ́ pa oḅori pa sẹ ma sịbịgha ḅara; ákị muu kụ́rá mmẹẹ́ a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi ma kara sáá láa. Anịsáa nnị ọ fị́ma ḅẹm kálá satuo ḅụ.
english_text: He threw him into the Abyss, and locked and sealed it over him, to keep him from deceiving the nations anymore until the thousand years were ended. After that, he must be set free for a short time.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a tọgha imine arịm, anị ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfịnịapụ nnị kụrọ pa n pịrịm ḅẹẹ nnị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọọ. A pịghị n sịbị pẹ́lẹ́apụ ma biebẹ duma arịm ḅẹẹ nnị Jizọs diepágháma karakárá ma na Tamuno ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dugho wásámam. Na nnị susi ḅáláfama nama ma pịrịgha anịgha n tẹ́mẹ́ sị pa anị pa biekóróma bẹnyẹ, anịgha anị ilíghíma nyáná nna fụ́ḅára ogbo anịgha nna ḅara. Nnị pịghị ḅoo dumam sị Krais na taa ámányánáapụ ḅara kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi.
english_text: I saw thrones on which were seated those who had been given authority to judge. And I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded because of their testimony about Jesus and because of the word of God. Theyhad not worshiped the beast or its image and had not received its mark on their foreheads or their hands. They came to life and reigned with Christ a thousand years.

ibani_text: (Mịnaapu ma sima, isi fịịapụ mamgba fịị ḅụ sághịgha ákị muu kụ́rá a mmẹẹ́ ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi ma kara sáá láa.) Mịma anịị parị fịị ḅụ sághị ma.
english_text: (The rest of the dead did not come to life until the thousand years were ended.) This is the first resurrection.

ibani_text: Karịiḅi na tọ́ntọ́ fịnị parị fịị ḅụ sághị ma bie sọapụ pịrịm, Mmẹẹ́ kárámá fịị ma nna ḅụ kụ́rọ nyanagha; nnị Tamuno na Krais igwagwaapụ sọbẹm, nnị pịghị ori na taábẹm kụ́rá a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi.
english_text: Blessed and holy are those who share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them, but they will be priests of God and of Christ and will reign with him for a thousand years.

ibani_text: Kụ́rá a ndẹ́ẹ oyia si findi ma ḅọ́rọ́fáma sáá, nnị Satanị ma fímabẹm ori ikóliwarịbie,
english_text: When the thousand years are over, Satan will be released from his prison

ibani_text: ọ pịghị pághábẹm sị muu oḅori pa tuminikiri gbọrụ ḅụ n gálágáláma sẹ ma sịị, mịná sẹ ma anịị Gọgu na Magọgu. Satanị nnị kị́nị́mamgba akuoo kobiri pa ọ́mụ́gbi ḅoobẹm. Nna kịẹbịpị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ posie aka fịnị onwo.
english_text: and will go out to deceive the nations in the four corners of the earth—Gog and Magog—and to gather them for battle. In number they are like the sand on the seashore.

ibani_text: Nnị tuminikiri ma nwángị ikélémam na pịghị Tamuno ḅẹlẹma opu ama ma. Kụ́ma fịnị sághị sobie kóróḅom sị n dọ́ghụ́ma.
english_text: They marched across the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of God’s people, the city he loves. But fire came down from heaven and devoured them.

ibani_text: Anịsáa oḅori pa n sị ẹ́kpẹ́dua ma nnị ọ pa ọpọlịḅuruma pa dọghụarị kọrịfịnị ésiḅe bie gbi suam, n ḅáláfama nama ma na iruo ikiakoroapụ ma gbi suamaa ngaa, nnị n pa tọ́rụ́siarịmabẹm dii na ḅáa na ákị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa.
english_text: And the devil, who deceived them, was thrown into the lake of burning sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet had been thrown. They will be tormented day and night for ever and ever.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ḅoo opuma dụḅa pị́na imine arịm na pịghị anị ọ́gọ́nọ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ. Tuminikiri na so na mangịm ọ fịnị angaá n pịghị mịnị jẹ́ pa fịnịngaa nyanagha.
english_text: Then I saw a great white throne and him who was seated on it. The earth and the heavens fled from his presence, and there was no place for them.

ibani_text: A pịghị fịịapụ ma arịm, duḅaapụ na káláapụ na sẹ́fịnịarị imine ma tórúku. Nnị tọgha diri findim anịsáa n pịghị jẹ́ diri findim, duma diri. Fịịapụ ma nnị n sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm n mịẹmáa nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ diri mamgbabie n gịẹ kóróma ḅara.
english_text: And I saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and books were opened. Another book was opened, which is the book of life. The dead were judged according to what they had done as recorded in the books.

ibani_text: Anịsáa tọ́rụ́ ma anị bie fịnị fịịapụ mamgba pághámaḅom, fịị na duaama nna bie fịnị fịịapụ mamgba pághámaḅom. Nnị nnị kị́nị́mamgba sịbị ḅẹ́rẹ́kọm nnị mịẹ maá nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: The sea gave up the dead that were in it, and death and Hades gave up the dead that were in them, and each person was judged according to what they had done.

ibani_text: Anịsáa fịị na duaama ma nnị n gbi pa kọrịfịnị ésiḅe ma ḅụ gbi suam (Mịị kọrịfịnị ésiḅe ma anịị mmẹẹ́ kárámá fịị ma).
english_text: Then death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire. The lake of fire is the second death.

ibani_text: Nnị nna ẹrẹ gịẹghaapụ dumaapụ ma diri bie nnị n pa kọrịfịnị ésiḅe ma ḅụ gbi suam.
english_text: Anyone whose name was not found written in the book of life was thrown into the lake of fire.

ibani_text: Anịsáa a ịwọ so na ịwọ tuminikiri arịm. Parị so ma na parị tuminikiri ma ẹmẹẹ́famam tọ́rụ́ sọ mịnị oforii.
english_text: Then I saw “a new heaven and a new earth,”for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and there was no longer any sea.

ibani_text: A warị Tọ́ntọ́ Opu ámá ma arịị, ịwọ Jerusalem, sobie sághị Tamuno fịnị angaá ḅụ kóróḅoarị, yáá bi ọ́rụ́ḅọ ḅara nnị bịtẹ pa suaá sị a birima pịghị a tẹ́lẹ́ma warị sị a deeḅọ na dona bẹ ḅara.
english_text: I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband.

ibani_text: A opu pụghọ naam imine ma ḅụ sághị ẹ́gẹ́rẹ kọarị nyẹ: Mị́sa Tamuno ngaá angaá túminị́ ogbobie imii! Ori nnị na ngáabẹm, nnị ori a túminị́ sọbẹm. Tamuno o ḅụgbọrụ nnị na fịnịbẹm ori so nna Tamuno sọọbẹm.
english_text: And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Look! God’s dwelling place is now among the people, and he will dwell with them. They will be his people, and God himself will be with them and be their God.

ibani_text: Ori owu mingi mamgba sibẹm nna tọ́rụ́ ḅụ. Fịị mịnị oforibịgha, dụadú mịnị oforibịgha, owu anịgha akụ́ụ mịnị oforibịgha. Olom sáá nyẹ ma ẹmẹẹ́famam.
english_text: ‘He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death’or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.”

ibani_text: Anịsáa imine ma ḅụ kpọrọfị́nị́ḅọ ma dughom, Mị́sa a pịghị nyẹ mamgba mịẹarị anị ịwọ! Ọ pịghị i ḅẹ́ẹm, Mịma gịẹ, tegó mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma karakárá nyẹẹ n pịghị ine anị ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánabẹm.
english_text: He who was seated on the throne said, “I am making everything new!” Then he said, “Write this down, for these words are trustworthy and true.”

ibani_text: Ọ warị i ḅẹẹ, Anị kárámam! Irị anịị Alịfa ma na pịghị Omega ma, Sughu sághị ma na pịghị anị Kunema ma. Mingi pụghọ tarị ḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ a kụ́rọ pa n ḅọ pịrịbẹm sị n ḅọ duma pịrị ésiḅe mingi ma ḅuu igbii gbẹ́gha pa.
english_text: He said to me: “It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. To the thirsty I will give water without cost from the spring of the water of life.

ibani_text: Sọḅaapụ mịma nyánáḅobẹm i ḅárabie. A Tamuno sọọ n pịrịbẹm nnị sọ awọ sọọ i pịrịbẹm.
english_text: Those who are victorious will inherit all this, and I will be their God and they will be my children.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ḅáláfaapụ, mininighaapụ, pilemaapụ, kị́nị́ ḅáapụ, yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọarịapụ, tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ dirikọ́rịapụ, susi n kárányẹ pịrịrịarịapụ, na iruonyẹ dughoapụ mamgba nna fịnị yọ anịị ọpọlịḅuruma pa dọghụarị kọrịfịnị ésiḅe ma, anịị mmẹẹ́ kárámá fịị ma.
english_text: But the cowardly, the unbelieving, the vile, the murderers, the sexually immoral, those who practice magic arts, the idolaters and all liars—they will be consigned to the fiery lake of burning sulfur. This is the second death.”

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ma sookumuapụ ma bie, sọ́nọ́ma bọlị ma dighiarịapụ, kunema sọ́nọ́ma tọ́rụ́siarị dighiarị ḅụḅáláḅálá bie bii nyẹ, nna ḅụ́gbẹrẹḅọ damaḅom sị ḅẹ́, Ḅoo, a pịghị dee yaaḅọ ma pa ị diebẹm, Ánáná Tụwọ ma taa.
english_text: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came and said to me, “Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ i korom, sookumuḅọ ma warị i dighiákị pa opuma sóghóló tụ́ndụ ọgọnọ gbánā. O Jerusalem Tọ́ntọ́ Opu ama ma pa i diem, sobie Tamuno ḅụ sághị kóróḅoarị.
english_text: And he carried me away in the Spirit to a mountain great and high, and showed me the Holy City, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma anị Tamuno ipine ma pa sánị sanịarị, opu ámá ma nyẹ́la onwo mgbọ́lụ kọrị ḅara pa kọrịarị, sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ Jaspa, yóriyórim sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mgbọ́lụ iti.
english_text: It shone with the glory of God, and its brilliance was like that of a very precious jewel, like a jasper, clear as crystal.

ibani_text: Anị opuma sóghólo onu nyanam pịghị oyi mmẹẹ́ opu ḅụ́pọ́ nyáná, oyi mmẹẹ́ sookumuapụ ma pịghị opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ imi. Opu ḅụ́pọ́ mamgba ḅụ nnị ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹm, Izirẹlị oyi mmẹẹ́ a túminị́ ọrụ.
english_text: It had a great, high wall with twelve gates, and with twelve angels at the gates. On the gates were written the names of the twelve tribes of Israel.

ibani_text: Gbẹ́rẹ́ párángáa tẹ́rẹ́ a opu ḅụ́pọ́ imii. Tẹ́rẹ́ ịrụa saghị saghị angaá, tẹ́rẹ́ ịrụa ma tere tere angaá, tẹ́rẹ́ abaji sughu, tẹ́rẹ́ ọ́gọ́nọ ju.
english_text: There were three gates on the east, three on the north, three on the south and three on the west.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma onu ma oyi mmẹẹ́ a sughu isé dapịrị anịị n pa anị nama nyẹ, anị ḅụ nnị Ánáná Tụwọ ma oyi mmẹapụ findi nfịrịmaapụ ma ẹrẹ gịẹm.
english_text: The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

ibani_text: Ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ i pịrị sookumuḅọ ma odoḅala nyẹ tọ́ọ sị ọlọm ọ pa opu ámá ma tọ́ọ anị opu ḅụ́pọ́ na anị onu.
english_text: The angel who talked with me had a measuring rod of gold to measure the city, its gates and its walls.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma anị nangwọ na anị findi kpainma ḅara pa gbasịm. Sookumuḅọ ma ori nyẹ tọ́ọ sị pa opu ama ma tọọm: anị nangwọ kilomita suene a ndẹ́ẹ, anị finji na anị sóghólo na pịghị anị nangwọ gbasịm.
english_text: The city was laid out like a square, as long as it was wide. He measured the city with the rod and found it to be 12,000 stadiain length, and as wide and high as it is long.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma onu ma sọ tọọm, anị sóghólo mita tẹ́rẹ́ a si, anịị tuminikiriapụ nyẹ tọ́ọ ḅara anịị sookumuḅọ ma tọọarị ḅara.
english_text: The angel measured the wall using human measurement, and it was 144 cubitsthick.

ibani_text: Onu ma jaspa anịị n pa anị tẹ́mẹ́nyẹ, opu ámá ma tụ́ma yóri yóri odoḅala anị n pa anị nama nyẹ, gilasi yóri yóri ḅara anịị anị yóri yóriarị ḅara.
english_text: The wall was made of jasper, and the city of pure gold, as pure as glass.

ibani_text: Nnị pa suu isé opu ama ma onu pịrị dapịrị ma anịị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ nyẹláa dapịrị anị nnị pa anị birima nyẹ. Nnị pa parị suu isé dapịrị anịị jaspa, mmẹẹ́ kárámá nyẹ safaya, tẹ́rẹ́ kárámá nyẹ agate ini kárámá nyẹ emeraldi (kọrịarị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ ẹ́lẹlẹ́ndẹ.)
english_text: The foundations of the city walls were decorated with every kind of precious stone. The first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third agate, the fourth emerald,

ibani_text: Sọ́nọ́ kárámá nyẹ onizi, suene kárámá nyẹ kanelia anị sọ́nọ́ma kárámá nyẹ odo kuartz, inine kárámá nyẹ beril, ésẹ́nie kárámá nyẹ topaz, oyi kárámá nyẹ kalsidoni, oyi ngịẹ findi kárámá nyẹ tokwoisi, oyi mmẹẹ́ findi kárámá nyẹ ametisiti.
english_text: the fifth onyx, the sixth ruby, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth turquoise, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.

ibani_text: Oyi mmẹẹ́ opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma anị oyi mmẹẹ́ findi mingi ḅụ saghị ḅo nyẹ́la mgbọ́lụ, opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ mingi bie sághị ḅo nyẹ́la mgbọ́lụ anịị n pa anị miẹye. Opu ámá ma asọ ibima yóri yóri odoḅala anịị n pa anị mịẹnyẹ n gilasi bie árịarị ḅara anịị nnị anị árịarị ḅara.
english_text: The twelve gates were twelve pearls, each gate made of a single pearl. The great street of the city was of gold, as pure as transparent glass.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma bie a Tamunoopuwarị arịgha tegó anị Tamunoopuwarị ma anịị Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ ma, Tamuno, Kụrọmamgba Nyánáḅọ ma na pịghị Ánáná Tụwọ ma.
english_text: I did not see a temple in the city, because the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma ịrụa biigha anịgha akalụ́ ḅẹ́ nnị anị ḅụ bia tegó Tamuno ipine ma baá pa anị pịrịarị, Ánáná Tụwọ ma sọ pịghị anị tọndọ.
english_text: The city does not need the sun or the moon to shine on it, for the glory of God gives it light, and the Lamb is its lamp.

ibani_text: Tuminikiriapụ anị baá pa asọ nwángịbẹm, tuminikiri ámányánáapụ nna ngọ akuoo ḅobẹm anị bie.
english_text: The nations will walk by its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their splendor into it.

ibani_text: Opu ámá ma opu ḅụ́pọ́ findi fịnịbẹm éné gbọrụ; n jẹ́ éné jẹ́ éné anị gbẹ́bịgha tegó dii fịnịbịgha anị ngaa.
english_text: On no day will its gates ever be shut, for there will be no night there.

ibani_text: Sẹ́ sẹ́ sẹ́ ma opu na anị ngọ nnị akuoo opu ámá ma bie ḅoobẹm.
english_text: The glory and honor of the nations will be brought into it.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma gbẹ́rẹ́ ịlọ́lị nyẹ sọ anị bie sọbịgha anịgha ḅụ́gịrịrịma nyẹ mịẹarịḅọ anịgha iruonyẹ dughoarịḅo, kụ́ma nnị nna ẹ́rẹ́ gịẹapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ Ánáná Tụwọ ma duma diri bie anịị opu ámá ma sọ bẹnyẹ.
english_text: Nothing impure will ever enter it, nor will anyone who does what is shameful or deceitful, but only those whose names are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

ibani_text: Sookumuḅọ ma pịghị duma mingi pịrị tọ́rụ́ ma pa i diem, yóri yóriarị sọ́ḅọ́rọ́ mgbọ́lụ iti, Tamuno ma na Ánáná Tụwọ ma imine ḅụ saghị ḅo,
english_text: Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, as clear as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb

ibani_text: opu ámá asọ ogboku ḅụ sághị siriḅoarị, okolo ma ẹ́rẹ́ḅara na amaḅara ḅụ duma pịrịarị sị ma imii, mgbọ́lụ suarị oyi mmẹẹ́ sa findi gbẹ́rẹ́ kụ́rá bie, gbẹ́rẹ́ sáá gbẹ́rẹ́ akalụ́ bie, anị ányị́nyá ma anịị n pa sẹ ma gwọarị nyẹ.
english_text: down the middle of the great street of the city. On each side of the river stood the tree of life, bearing twelve crops of fruit, yielding its fruit every month. And the leaves of the tree are for the healing of the nations.

ibani_text: Nnị Tamuno sii fị́lā ḅụ fịnịḅọ arịbịgha opu ámá ma bie. Tamuno na Ánáná Tụwọ ma imine anịị nnị árị ḅẹnyẹ opu ámá ma bie, ori fịrịnwangịapụ sọ susi ọ pịrịbẹm.
english_text: No longer will there be any curse. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be in the city, and his servants will serve him.

ibani_text: Nnị ọ tórúku árịbẹm, n pịghị ori ẹrẹ gịẹbẹm nna fụ́ḅára ogbo.
english_text: They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.

ibani_text: Dii mịnị oforibịgha, n pịghị tọndọ baá anịgha ịrụa baá dọghụbịgha, tegó Kịnịnyáná Tamuno ma nna baá sọọbẹm, n pịghị ámányánáapụ ḅara pa taábẹm ákị muu ḅẹsá ḅẹsá láa.
english_text: There will be no more night. They will not need the light of a lamp or the light of the sun, for the Lord God will give them light. And they will reign for ever and ever.

ibani_text: Anịsáa sookumuḅọ ma warị i ḅẹ́, Mịná ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma karakárányẹ pịghị ine ḅụ tẹ́mẹ́ gbánā bẹnyẹ. Kịnịnyáná Tamuno ma ori a Tẹ́mẹ́ pa ori ikiakoroapụ ma pịrịarịḅọ, ori a sookumuḅọ fịrịmamam ḅẹ́ ọ ḅoo pa ori a fịrịnwangịapụ die ḅọlọgha sáá ḅụ pághá bẹnyẹ.
english_text: The angel said to me, “These words are trustworthy and true. The Lord, the God who inspires the prophets, sent his angel to show his servants the things that must soon take place.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹm, Dighii! A álála ḅoarị! Bieḅẹlẹapụ, anịị mịị diri ma ikiakoro ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma dughonyẹ mịẹarịapụ!
english_text: “Look, I am coming soon! Blessed is the one who keeps the words of the prophecy written in this scroll.”

ibani_text: Irị Jọn anị mịnanyẹ mamgba naaḅọ pịghị anị arịị. A náa fama pịghị árị fama sáá, a mịná nyẹ ma pa i die sookumuḅọ ma ḅụọ angaá sóórókórom, kálányẹ kọọm a susi ọ pịrịị.
english_text: I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. And when I had heard and seen them, I fell down to worship at the feet of the angel who had been showing them to me.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma ori i ḅẹ́m, Mịnị mịẹma! Irị fịrịnwangịḅọ, ịrị na jẹ́ mininiapụ ma fịnị ḅara, anịị ikiakoroapụ ma na pịghị mị diri ma ikiakoronyẹ ma náa sị anị mịẹarịapụ mamgba. Susi Tamuno pịrị!
english_text: But he said to me, “Don’t do that! I am a fellow servant with you and with your fellow prophets and with all who keep the words of this scroll. Worship God!”

ibani_text: Ọ warị i ḅẹẹ, Mịị diri ma ikiakoro ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma pa ḅọghunyẹ mịẹma, tegó sáá ma kikiamam mịnanyẹ ma kiriakị bẹ sáá.
english_text: Then he told me, “Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this scroll, because the time is near.

ibani_text: Siinyẹ mịẹarị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa fịnị siinyẹ mịẹ, ịlọlịfịnị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa ịlọ́lị fịnịị, ibi tumḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa fịnị ibinyẹ mịẹ, tọ́ntọ́ fịnị ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pa tọ́ntọ́ fịnịị.
english_text: Let the one who does wrong continue to do wrong; let the vile person continue to be vile; let the one who does right continue to do right; and let the holy person continue to be holy.”

ibani_text: Jizọs ḅẹ́m, Dighii, a álála ḅoarị! A iyẹ gbẹ́ẹ̄ nyẹ na ḅobẹm, a pa ọ́rụ́ḅọ ọ́rụ́ḅọ gbẹ́bẹm nḅọ mịẹmáa nyẹ ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́.
english_text: “Look, I am coming soon! My reward is with me, and I will give to each person according to what they have done.

ibani_text: Irị anịị Alịfa na Omega, Parị parị ma pịghị Kunema ma, Sughu Sághị pịghị anị Kunema.
english_text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.

ibani_text: Karịiḅi fịnị nna koro bịtẹ siri fiafiamamáapụ ma pịrị, nnị anịị kụrọnyanáapụ sị sịmgbọlụ ma fịị duma pịrị sị ma ḅụ, sị pịghị opu ḅụ́pọ́ ma ḅụ ḅọ́rọ́ opu ámá ma sọọ.
english_text: “Blessed are those who wash their robes, that they may have the right to the tree of life and may go through the gates into the city.

ibani_text: Kụ́ma nụ́ngọbie anịị obiri na pịghị tọ́rụ́kịrịkị́rị́ egberi ikiakoroapụ, yáakuu ḅụ ofori nwángị kọọapụ, susi n kárányẹ pịrịarịapụ na pịghị iruonyẹ ḅẹlẹmaapụ ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ḅụ na pịghị mịẹnyẹ ḅụ.
english_text: Outside are the dogs, those who practice magic arts, the sexually immoral, the murderers, the idolaters and everyone who loves and practices falsehood.

ibani_text: Irị Jizọs ị́yẹ́ sookumuḅọ fịrịmam ḅẹẹ, o ḅoo mịnanyẹ ma dugho wásámáa ọ pịrị sọsị mamgbabie, Deviti furobie anịị a saghị págháḅo nyẹ; irị anịị baá pịrị dede ḅálōló ma.
english_text: “I, Jesus, have sent my angel to give youthis testimony for the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, and the bright Morning Star.”

ibani_text: Tẹ́mẹ́ ma na deeyaa biiḅọ ma ḅẹẹm, Ḅoo! Mịma náa ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ pịghị ḅẹẹbẹm, Ḅoo! Pụghọ sámụ́nọ ḅo gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ ḅoo; dọghụḅọ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ duma pịrị mingi ma daakị, igbii gbẹ́gha pa.
english_text: The Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” And let the one who hears say, “Come!” Let the one who is thirsty come; and let the one who wishes take the free gift of the water of life.

ibani_text: Irị Jọn mị diri ma ikiakoro ẹ́gẹ́rẹ ma naapụ gonyẹ́ gonyẹ́ biri nụ́nụ́arị; ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ anị ḅụ nyẹ sua sua, Tamuno nna fomḅara ḅụ nyẹ suabẹm anịị mịị diri ma bie n gịẹ kóróma tọ́rụ́siarị díghíarị ḅụḅáláḅálá ma.
english_text: I warn everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this scroll: If anyone adds anything to them, God will add to that person the plagues described in this scroll.

ibani_text: Ḅọ́rọ́ kị́nị́ nyẹ si ákị ákị mịẹ diri ma ikiakoro ẹ́gẹ́rẹ́ ma bie, Tamuno nna diekiri siakịịbẹm duma pịrị sịmgbọlụ sị ma ḅụ na pịghị Tọ́ntọ́ opu ámá ma ḅụ n gịẹ kórómanyẹ mịị diri ma bie.
english_text: And if anyone takes words away from this scroll of prophecy, God will take away from that person any share in the tree of life and in the Holy City, which are described in this scroll.

ibani_text: Ori ma onyẹ́sẹ mịnanyẹ mamgba pịrịḅọ bẹ mịnanyẹ karakárányẹ dughom ḅẹẹ, Tụ́ma nyẹẹ! A álála ḅooarị! Anị ọkọ fịnị. Ḅoo, Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs!
english_text: He who testifies to these things says,“Yes, I am coming soon.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus.

ibani_text: Kị́nị́nyánáḅọ Jizọs tọ́rụ́kụrụkụ́rụ́ kị́nị́mamgba na fịnịị. Anị ọkọ fịnịị.
english_text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with God’s people. Amen.
